reviews.review: Good fun insight on the world's largest selling beer. Lovely place that used to be the original brewery of Heineken. The tour is very informative on the history of how it all started and how beer is made. They still have everything there and there are guides showing you how it is made. There is also great 3D showing everything including you being the malt that goes in and is turned into beer. At one stage you go through all the sports that Heineken sponsors and You can take pictures and participate in scoring a goal etc. all in all a great experience.

Definitely a must-visit in Amsterdam. Recently visited Amsterdam so we couldn't not go to the Heineken Experience. The queue went around the building, so while in the queue I purchased tickets online, added them to my passbook and went to the front of the queue and we walked straight in! I don't want to give too much away, but there was plenty of history and information about Heineken, a chance to see the brewing process and of course sampling, and then the bar which was a fantastic experience. I'd go back during my next visit to Amsterdam even though I've already been!
A great couple of hours . I good tour with plenty of interactive things to do and tastings. It flows well and the horses are beautiful

Must do when in Amsterdam.. . A different and pleasant experience... Esply if ur a fan.. :)You get to learn a bit abt brewing, you get see a lot of vintage machines and stuff.. Even super cool horses that are still active in their stables... Post the tour, there is a lot of fun activities u van do including getting t drink 2free beers... :)Went with my mom n wife. Had a good time.It has toilets, place to sit, some stairs (do check for wheelchair access before u go if u need one)

Really enjoyed this . Booking in advance worth it as you basically walk straight in. The museum is really interesting and you get a small beer half way through then you get given a large beer at the end. You can get your own bottle printed with a message but they messed up the bottle after waiting for ages so would advise not doing this unless you have time to kill.

Interesting Visit. We really enjoyed our visit. There was a lot to see, huge vats, all the ingredients, informative displays and a very knowledgeable and entertaining guide. You learn a lot about beer but also about Amsterdam and it's people.The tasting was a disappointment though, a miserably small glass is given.

Great value. Good value tour with interesting history of making beer delivered in a modern way with comedy, tasters and interactive games for all ages.Especially liked making our own 'tulips from Amsterdam' video which we emailed ourselves.Great fun and would definitely recommend if you need a couple of hours out of the cold & rain and want something different to museums and art galleries.

Fun fun fun....with beer!!. I visited in the evening on a sunday and its a good thing i bought tickets in advance because the line was longggg. Luckily for me I just walked in and received my handband with 2 tokens attached to it for my 2 free beers at the end.I did not take the audio tour but did not feel lost. There were a couple short films as you enter on the history of Heineken and the family and then a live presentation on the ingredients that goes into the beer. The presenter was fun and it was interactive. No beer is actually brewed here anymore but you can see the big copper tanks that used to hold the beer and taste what beer tastes like before the fermentation is done....it wasnt too nice. Lol.Heineken horses were also there and there is a crew member with the horses who fields questions if you have any.Then we move to the 4D "ride" they have called "brew you" where you get to be a beer and see the brewing process from the inside. This was fun ride but the line was long as it was a Sunday evening. ..After that there are some interactive games that you can play and even ps4 with fifa since heineken is big on champions league. The games were fun!The last stop is the bar area where u can redeem for your 2 free beers in a semi club scene with music and ofc lots of people drinking beer!Would definitely recommend this as fun thing to do for any adult. You can also have your name printed on a bottle of Heineken for about €8 (can't remember the amt exactly ).You dont have to be a heineken fan to enjoy this experience! !

Don't waste your time. . If you have been to any other brewery tour you will be very disappointed. Lots of waiting in line with hundreds of people, lousy exhibits, a few videos to watch. You could get a better experience at home sitting on your couch with a beer and YouTube, but without the crowds and all the waiting in line. Or, take your 16E to a bar.

Boring, expensive not attraction. Until 2008 it was possible to pay a small fee and drink as much beer as you can. After 2008 the management made a discovery (!) and decided the turn the place to a tourist-milking, dull center. You go in, pay 16 EUR, get a chance to drink 2 beers, see all these old commercials and boring stuff which only praise the brand rather than the beer itself (why would I want a beer bottle that my name printed on). If you want to visit a real brewery try real breweries and small beer cafes.

Expected more, but still fun. We purchased our tickets through our hotel, which saved us from waiting in line (which can be very long). Much of the tour is self guided as you read & hear the history of the company, which is interesting. The ride/movie experience is unique and fun. The young man in the bar who explained the finished product was good and entertaining. Samples were given at this point (I got an extra sample since I correctly answered one of his questions about beer bubbles). The rest of the tour was interactive, which some people had fun with, me, not so much. At the top floor, we turned in our tokens for beers (2), then as you exit, there's a very nice gift shop. For the price of the tickets, 16Euros each, I guess I expected more, but it was still a fun way to spend the morning. I would've hated to have gone to Amsterdam and missed this.

Pleasantly surprised . As a non beer drinker the thought of doing the Heineken tour wasn't really that great. I done this tour simply to please my friend and to say I had done it and man I'm glad I did. I found the whole experience interesting and wasn't bored liked I expected with each room and section proving interesting as the last section. Things such as the simulator type experience was fun and a little surprise with the rest of the interactive sections that followed also being a pleasant surprise from the photo interactions to the Table football. Along with the fun interactive parts the last parts of the tour were great especially the drinking the beer part and as non beer drinker I'm surprised how much I actually enjoyed Heineken with the beer being tasted at the "how to drink a beer" section and the last part with the club effect with two free pints of Heineken being given out. The beer tasted pretty good and I think Its safe to say I may have been converted to a Heineken drinker. Along with the beer tasting great and the experience being great from start to finish I have to mention the staff... the majority of the staff are like extremely beautiful which is always a bonus. Especially the guy with the blonde swept back hair he was like some sort of supermodel. While they are all beautiful they also are all friendly and very helpful along with being very knowledgable on Heineken. I would 100% recommend this experience for anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Beer brewing experience . Saw this line and decided to check out...mostly lots of tourist and beer Heineken enthusiast. The tour is self guided and in english...also there is private tour available. The tour is the history of the company and interactive stuff. Also includes two glass of beer. It's cool and interesting and you get to meet people from all over the world over a good glass of beer :-)
Great!!!. Excepcional brewery full of activities and good information about one of the greatest beer in the world

Very factual experience with drinks. Firstly I've got to say that buying tickets prior to visiting is the best way of entering the experience as queues can big large otherwise. The experience guides you through the origins of Heineken, the ingredients, brewing process with a 4D short show and its sponsorships with sport etc and finishes with a couple of free samples. And if that wasn't enough there is also a gift shop with plenty of goodies.

Pales in Comparison to Other Brewery Experiences. Having been to a number of other brewery tours and visits, we came in expecting a bit more. There was very little that actually showed the building off, as half the tour consisted of lots and lots of Heineken advertising. We were expecting this, but it should have been augmented by more interesting elements of the brewing process and the history of the building itself. The rooftop bar was a nice end to the experience, but it was poorly organised, and we only got three 200ml beers out of the whole experience. Overall, I was not unhappy we went, but I was expecting something better. There are many other tours and experiences out there that are cheaper and more interesting.

Better than expected. I had reservations about this attraction and didn't believe that I would enjoy it as much as I did.I would recommend advanced booking to skip the queues because they can get fairly long sometimes

Disappointed. The museum is a very nice place, but nothing "wow". We had to wait in a row 2 times... First to buy the ticket (maybe buy online would be better) and the second one (@1hour) for heinken experience, a 4d movie... And the rest its a big bar. My personal opinion

Fun thing to do to break up the serious museums!. A fun few hours. The "beer" ride is a good idea and something a bit different. You get three tasting which is appreciated but overall it feels like they could have done more with the space - I'd have liked more explanation about the brewing and the history. There is some detail on printed boards but it feels a bit sparse. The various rooms have more interactive options, like the game to pull the perfect pint. Worth going but don't expect too much detail.
Formulaic. Bit dull really. Just a tour round a tourist attraction that exists as a staple for Asian tour groups.

Great Experience. We purchased tickets prior to going due to long queues. As I was on crutches we were given a lift key and information on where to get the lifts and a route to follow. The tour is set at your own pace and gives you information on how the brewery started, you are shown where they make the beer, there is a 3D ride which i couldn't do but could watch, you can bottle your own beer for a small fee, there is various interactive things where you can get pics and take pics, you get to taste a small glass of beer and you are given a token for 2 free drinks once you reach the top and can go out on the rooftop and see the scenic views of Amsterdam.Was very disabled friendly and worth a visit. Something different and interesting.
Good, but needs more.... It is a good attraction but is not something that will inspire awe. I had the combined boat tour and Lookout ticket; which was quite nice.

Interesting. . This was a must for my other half. We spent a good couple of hours here. Its interesting to see how its made and the history of the beer and the name, and enjoyed the beer at the end :)
It was fun . I really enjoy the Heineken experience but is a most to finish it by taking the boat ride and go to the mirador

Enjoyed more than I thought . Enjoyed this way more than I thought, my partner really wanted to go here so I treated him lol. Really good interaction and way more than just a brewery definitely worth a visit.

Very enthusiastic staff. We had a really enjoyable couple of hours here learning about the history of the Heineken family, how Heineken is brewed and how the brand has evolved throughout the years. All the staff were extremely enthusiastic and friendly and the interaction with the guests was fantastic. We even won an extra glass of beer for the end of the tour by answering one of the staffs pop questions on beer ingredients.There were interactive activities during the tour where you could sample the beer before the fermentation process, pose for photos in photo booths and scrum scenes, practice pouring the perfect pint, kick a conversion and even go on a 4d journey as if you were actually beer from start to finish and loads more. I would definitely recommend this tour.

Do the VIP Tour. We did the VIP tour based on a recommendation we got from some other travelers. It was definitely worth it. We got about 8 beers out of it, plus some fabulous cheese tasting. The beers weren't all Heineken either, there was a sampling of 5 different beers with the cheese tasting. We also got to visit the roof and get a beautiful view of Amsterdam. The final perk is that, included in the VIP tour, you receive a bottle with your name on it. Definitely would recommend.
Beer experience. This was one of the best beer self tours. It was interesting and the video at the end was very entertaining. We all enjoyed it! The drinks at the end were good too.
Heineken Experience . Good fun and can spend a couple of hours on a rainy day !! Even if you don't drink lager you can have a soft drink . Surprises round every corner! Well worth a visit .

Excellent experience . I didn't expect to but I really loved this - we did the museum tour with the canal cruise and the Adam lookout tower - the tour was really interesting and very well done - beers at the end of the tour up on the terrace was nice - we also bought bottles with a personalised label for when our teenagers have their 18th birthdays - can't look at the Heineken logo now without seeing the smiley "e"s - the canal cruise and the look out tower were great - whole experience was excellent value - would highly recommend.

Intolerable queues . The Hellish time spent queuing really spoiled our visit here, we did not know that it would have been a good idea to pre-purchace tickets and get into the place much quicker so we were in the pay on entry queue who were treated like second hand citizens with only a handful let in at a time, (grrrrrr) Anyway one in the experience was fine, going through all the usual brewery stages, very informative and some good lager at the end, so folks be warned, pre-purchace your tickets!

Very busy. Saturday evening and the queues were long. Luckily we had entry with Holland Pass which gave us preferential entry so we didn't have to wait too long.The queues inside were also long to get from one area to another. Very interesting to see the brewing process and the history of Heineken.Lots of stairs to climb but it was so crowded you only did two or three steps at a time. Once you reach the top, after already being plied with beer in the tasting area, you go to the roof terrace hospitality area where you are forced to drink two more beers (not a real hardship) Heineken are then kind enough to provide a lift to return you to the exit, just in case all that beer has affected your balance!

Great for your birthday. I visited the Heineken Experience in September 2016 on my birthday with friends. There are lots of things to do and the tour is very interactive. They like you complete the tour at your own pace which is great.The tour includes 3 free glasses of Heineken and as it was my birthday that day I was given a Happy Birthday Heineken mug (I was told I could have more beer as it was my birthday but I stuck to the 3 glasses, it was still morning!)The best thing about the tour was the 4D cinema and the interactive bike video.

Mediocre experience! Visit only if you have never visited any beer factory before. What I liked:1. Some beer-process experience if you never had one.What I didn't like:1. So-called ride of how beer is made wasn't very impressive.2. Lack of variety in beer for tasting.3. Beer hall was extremely full & noisy.4. Pricey for what is offered. Just for comparison, Stiegl-Brauwelt in Salzburg was a far better experience.

Maybe ok for Heineken aficionado's, but I was bored. Lots of information about the history of the company and how beer gets made. Many flashy marketing videos. A sensory experience of going through the brewing process, which was a giant video viewed from a shaking platform which was sprayed with water. Several times you get queued like herded cattle for the next stage. It all felt like trying too hard to make the mundane business of beer production seem interesting and exciting. It failed. I recommend you spend the 18E admission on buying some of their beer, I think you will be much happier. I know I would have been.

Fun Day in Amsterdam. Husband and I visited the Heineken experience. (we were older than most). It was actually pretty fun, they give a brief explanation of the brewing process, have museum like story boards, quirky video's, fun interactive photo activities, a small tasting then 2 glasses at the end within a club like atmosphere. This was more for my husband, he is not a museum goer, but we had a really good time as a couple. The tour lasted maybe 2 hours. We had the cute (free) photo souvenirs emailed to us.

Recommended by beer lovers. This is a must visit if you are a beer lover. They have converted the first brewery of Heineken into a museum of brewing process. Though this may seem a bit over glorified at times but I personally enjoyed the experience. As a bonus, you not only get to taste a fresh brew but also get two complementary glasses of beer.

Great "marketing" experience!. I love this place and experience. All greatly organized and prepared for the visitor and your will get a good "experience" in terms of the history, the brewing process and the spectacular branding of Heineken. One may criticize this is not really a brewery experience but again it is about the expectations you may have. Just get there and have fun!
Marketing . If you are willing to pay to let somebody to brainwash you with marketing you are free to go. From my perspective it is not worth it...

amazing afternoon. BOOK IN ADVANCE TO AVOID QUEUNG!!we went in the afternoon, and for the cost to get in you get 3 free beers in a roof tip lounge- which has amazing views! the whole experience was great, even though the history bit at the beginning we found a bit boring, after that all the fun bits happen like all the games they have, and multiple photo booths and uv rooms etc (and the drinks obvs haha). This is defiantly a great thing to do whilst in Amsterdam.

Great . This is a brilliant tour with some great interactive elements. If you are a fan of lager there is a tasting part of the tour and you also receive tokens which allow you to get a couple of Heineken at the end of the tour.

Okay but was happy to leave not exciting . There was no order of getting shown around . Pay your money then wonder around and look at things you make beer with . I would not recommend people go to . There's better thing to do in dam . I got a bit bored . I think the experience could be made more existing . Should be called heineken museum not heineken experience

Worth the trip - great with friends! . We travelled here as a group of 5 friends on Friday 7th October. The experience on a whole was good and the price of your ticket also included a few free drinks. The staff were really helpful and friendly - especially the girl with the blonde hair who was working at the front door in the afternoon!Definetly recommend - would be good for couples or groups of friends.

Really fun interactive attraction. The Heineken Experience was great fun, we had got there having pre booked tickets and a very nice girl with blonde hair directed us to a desk where we skipped the queues and got straight through. There was also a very cool interactive 5D cinema experience as well as a beer tasting session and two free drinks at the end where we were surprised to see the same girl who had directed us at the front door serving behind the bar.

Well worth a visit. A really informative and interesting few hours. We went as a group of eight - loved the fact you could go round at our own leisure and pace so as not to miss anything. Really good fun - I would definitely recommend a visit.

Worth a trip . I would recommend a visit to the Heineken brewery as part of your trip to Amsterdam. Even though I'm not a huge fan of beer I found it interesting and found that I appreciated the taste of the beer more. You can spend a couple of hours in here and then enjoy a drink in the roof terrace with great views across the city :)

Average college beer, gimmicky "tour", sexist barman . Went on a tour of good old Heineken this past week. I thought 'hey, I'm bored. Why not?". Unlike other breweries that offer a nice selection of real brews, the Heineken tour is gimmicky which is likely a ploy to distract you from the fact you'll be sampling a college party beer. Fine, I get it Heineken, you're unique, can I have a beer now? In the tasting room the bar man poured a beer and then so kindly explained to us why women don't generally like beer. Excuse me? This ought to be good, I thought. Apparently us females can't appreciate a good beer because we sip on it with our pinkies up (the bar man even demonstrated our error for us!). Oh my god, I thought to myself, he's right! I've been drinking beer like a British lady drinking tea my whole life and THAT is why Heineken tastes like p*** water to me. So after informing us ladies that we can't appreciate a good beer because we drink it wrong, he told us to inspect the beer's light yellow color. He called golden, I called it pee. Then the bar man told us to drink up "like a man". Boy am I glad I finally visited Heineken so I can at last appreciate drinking beer the right way: like a man.
Disappointing . Not the best I believe everyone just wants your money long waiting times inside for the store, bar etc...
Perfect. You will learn so many thinks about history of Heinken! Good time for man! Lovely view from the balkony

Boring. This is a money making establishment that glorifies itself on being a "Dutch experience". Well, there isn't much novelty and most is about the history of Heinechen and the brand etc etc.. boring to the hilt. The only good part is the views from the terrace of the brewery.I personally wouldn't recommend anyone to visit this place, Amsterdam has a host of other better things to do, so save your 18euros!
Great place. This was a great stop in Amsterdam! I had no idea that I liked Heineken before this tour. It was very educational and it was fun learning about the process

Great all round experience!. Having been on many Brewery tours and really being a Real Ale fan , rather than lager, I had reservations about this but how wrong could I be! A cracking tour with lots to see and very well presented with brilliant high tech' innovations along the way. Almost 2 hours in total inc 2 (small) beers at the end.
Awsome time. My partner and I had a great time here. Of course you get to sample a few beers but there is alot of interactive things inside to keep you entertained.

The best brewery tour I've had. It really is an " experience"Part brewery tour, part educational experience, part night club feel and part amusement park. It's a combination of so many elements that awaken so many senses. I'm happy we did this tour as its a certain " must see" for visitors. I recommend the hop on hop off boat tour as it lands right in front. Great job Heineken.

Overrated attraction. When you speak about Amsterdam with anybody, the Heinecken Experience attraction is always mentionned within the top attraction to do in the city. However, in my opinion, this attraction is clearly overrated. The historical part of the visit and also the technical part are not enough complete.The positive point is the end of the tour which is composed by different type of attraction like the possibility to take fake picture in certain part of the bulding and other stuff like that. In overall, it was a pleasant experience due to the fact that the last part of the show is clearly well prepared. However, if you want to learn about how beer is produced I advise you to look for a smaller company.
Must visit . Nicely created Heineken journey Good merchandise... over all a nice experience .. worth the visit truly a happy Dutch experience ..check for discounts on some cards and vouchers

Lots of fun. I don't drink beer but I had lots of fun learning the process. There was lots of interactive things to do and you could email the photos of the activities for free. Of course you get free beer or cola and there is even an opportunity to design your own bottles and glasses. The view from the roof amazing!
Great experience. Extremly interactive, beautifull view from the top. Friendly staff. Well organised. Worth of money. Will return. You get two free drinks with ticket.

Fun. It fells like you're in Disneyland + Heineken history and some free (included in the price ) beers. Recommend it only if you don't have anything else to do in the city, otherwise, don't waste your time.

Oh Yeah!!. Paid 16 Euro x2 to beat the queue and visit this marvellous attraction. It was my wife's birthday and making staff aware of this she was given a stein and more free refills! As well as the drinks we was given also. The little money we paid was for entrance was given back to us is beer! Roof top bar (Party) was amazing. Storm and his was very inviting and kept the party rocking.€6.50 each for a burger€6.50 to add text to our own Heineken Beer label. Heineken should show off this amazing brand. The Heineken ride was good also learning about the history of this brand and how it's made. We'll be back next year!

Adults only entertainment. Amazing trip through the history of Heineken beer and demonstration of how the beer is made. Even my girl freind enjoyed it and i got to drink her 2 free beers at the end too :). Option to have a bottle created with your name on it for like 6 euros 50. Would advise buying tickets in advance from one of the local tickets and tour shops. ( you will notice the shops we bought tickets the day before 4 16 euros and jumped well over an hour queue waiting for tickets.

great tour. Enjoyed the tour of brewery, all staff were very informative and always happy to answer any questions. Excellent value for money. The bars on the way round were good, the barman was excellent a very funny man would go back again. A great afternoon had.

We loved it!. A good way to experience how the beer brewing proces and the Heineken company developed itself. By seeing, doing and tasting they guide you around on this trip. At the end you'll be offered a well deserved beer!

Not even for beer lovers. Heineken Experience is a real experience. Its kind like a museum but with a lot of active tasks for the visitors. A lot to do and its bulited up nicely. For example with a 4D cinema. In the end everyone can drink two beer or coke in a nice atmosphere.

Heineken's laughing to the bank. After waiting in line for 20 minutes we each payed 18€ to visit mostly boring and run of the mill exhibits which merely serve to aggrandize the Heineken brand name. Unfortunately there is nothing unique about the Heineken "experience". Guess what, beer is made from water, barley, hops, and yeast! Perhaps most disappointing of all was Heineken's chincy allotment of beer at the end: two half-pints. Skip the tour and spend your 18€ at a café or bar where you'll get more beer and have a better selection.

Gets better as you go through. The actual museum side is a bit rubbish very little information. And the ride part dismal, really they would be better without it. After that the place improves with some of its interactive bits . The roof bar is good but busy.

Not a Working Brewery. We bundled the price of the experience with a boat tour- this is a great deal if you were planning to do both. However, the boat tour was not a hop off/on. Also, a stag party was on our boat straight from the Brewery- they drank even more on beers on the boat and were so loud we couldn't hear anything. That said- I don't blame to staff for that- they just didn't really do anything to help.The brewery itself is not a working brewery, but did offer some good history and explanation of the brewing process. In the end you get to stand around in a loud room and drink 2 free beers. It felt like a loud nightclub, and it was only 2pm.

Great. Unless you want to stand In line for a very long time make sure you pre book your tickets online. Very interesting seeing how Heineken first started and is still made. 4D film clip was funny and it's great to see they still have horses there. 3 free drinks as well.
Very nice excursion. Visit inside the old beer factory with all things explained. Nice terrace on top overlooking the city. A lot of beer to try

Interesting but avoid on a Saturday. Amsterdam is rightfully proud of the Heineken Brewery, a truly global brand. This museum gives visitors a glimpse into the history, the brewing procedure and the future for this beer.The museum itself is interesting, the little ''ride'' is a fun way of seeing the brewing process and the bar at the end serves a nice couple of drinks with a great view.But overall the museum just felt a little flat, maybe it was the volume of other visitors and avoiding the peak Saturday afternoon timeslot is advisable.

Excellant. Really enjoyed the Heineken Experience.
Excellent value for money. Really enjoyed seeing how the brewery works.
Lovely roof top bar and BBQ.
Would highly recommend this experience to friends and family.

The best experience ever. At first I wasn't so keen of going because I'm not a fan of beer but if I didn't go I would have regretted it....It was the best experience in somewhat 'museum' ever...The activities you do in there and how their history is incorporated it not boring at all. Well done Heineken

Great Tour. Tour includes information on the family (who founded and still own), the process of making the beer, the horses that worked in the factory and then a cinema experience and a tasting experience Really well done and even my wife enjoyed it - who only drinks Gin!!

Waste of money and time. We waited too much in line to enter and during the tour. The attractions inside the tour fits mainly for children. The short movie of the procedure of beer making was relatively nice, but that's it. You get beer at the end in a hall full of people with lack of place to stand and no where to sit. The experience was that Heineken getting paid for their own commercial .

The best day in Amsterdam!. I spent a all week in Amsterdam but I have to admit that I loved every minute of the Heineken Experience. All we have to know about the beer, how the logo has changed all this years, bottles and sports that Heineken sponsors. I went on Friday around 1pm and I could avoid the tickets queue because I bought them online the day before.All staff was friendly and warming, especially the guy on the horses stable. He started talking to me like was no one else there and I have to admit he was really nice to me. I just can't remember his name, unfortunately. I live on Uk for a few years and I have say that I always drink Guinness (a lot more heavier and black), but this experience make me try Heineken and I'll for sure start drinking it know. We had a bracelet in the beginning with two "coins" that you can change for two drinks in the end, don't have to be beer. They have soft drinks too. I specially loved the shirts from football, as I'm a Portuguese it make me feel so proud seeing 3 shirts in 4 from Portuguese man. All the experience it's worth it and you can make your own bottle in the end (you just can't fly with her if you only have hand luggage). I did mind and I drunk it the day before of my flight I just have to recommended for anyone that's going to Amsterdam. You will loved it!!!(The gift shop maybe will make you want to get lost there )

Very interesting. Even though I'm not a drinker this experience was fantastic. Not only was it educational but its also great fun and you get free beer!! 2 Tokens for at the end of the experience, and a taster during.
Tour of Heineken . Fun way to spend an afternoon. Good beer and interesting history on Heineken. Great roof top bar with wonderful view.
Fun experience . Went here after visiting the nearby market and it exceeded expectations! Actually learnt a lot and got to enjoy Heineken more than once! Worth a visit

Very fun place. Fun experience but LOADED with commercials.Half of the tour is explanations about the beer making process, the other half is basically commercial.Although- 2 free beers at the end! (Plus one more during the visit).For people who've been to other famous breweries, like Guinness, it depends on you- if the beer making process is your interest, you can skip this place. If you want to have some fun and beer, a MUST.

A nice visit . The Heineken experience is a good trip for all beer lovers. The history behind the making of one of the worlds most loved beer is made exciting through visuals and interactive videos ! It's topped off with a class on how to drink beer the right way, games and of course 2 free beers included in the price of your ticket ! A definite must see in Amsterdam .

Amazing slurp!. We have been to the Guinness factory in Dublin. So had to visit the Heineken experience. It thought the museum was very well laid out. You learned quickly from the videos and interactive activities, tastes etc. Great for all ages. And the Beer tasting was fun too. Cool place and lots of fun.

Fab 40th. We had a wonderful time here for my husbands 40th, would recommend the extra money for the guided tour, we got to try lots of different beers and local cheeses, learnt loads about the Heineken family history and how to pour the prefect beer.

Interesting & good value . I found the tour interesting for the history of the company & how it is now such a worldwide recognised brand. As per the lovely Dutch people are, the whole place is filled with very friendly staff whom are happy to share with you any info they know. You can spend about 2hrs in there if you wish, there is lots to see & do!
Nice. Really nice trip , but sadly we were the last ones. Everything was in a rush. You have to come not at the last moment
Mrs. Very interesting museum on the creation of of the brand Heineken and how it has sustained self through the years

Quirky Tour. Went here as it was cold and found it an interesting history of the brand. Some good use of interactive screens and the only decent Heiniken I had in Amsterdam this week! They tell you the beer should have a head, apart from the tour every bar served flat watery taking Heiniken. Sorry, I'm not a lover of Heiniken.All tour end through the gift shop and this is no different, it is not a lesson on brewing, it's targeted at a younger audience and is a lesson in marketing. At €16 it is not overpriced and a fun way to kill an hour.
Surprisingly interested . Came here not really that into beer with my boyfriend and we were both pleasantly surprised about how interested we were walking around would definitely recommend it

Pay a lill extra and get the VIP tour. I would highly recommend everyone to pay a little bit extra and get the VIP tour instead of the regular tour. The guide is very knowledgeable, friendly and is always ready to answer your questions. In the end they present you with a Heineken bottle with your name on it! Plus in the VIP bar, you get to try out the different types of beers, not only Heiniken.

wow what a giggle. first very easy to find great place tell you all about how the beer is made how the company has growen over the years and how it intends to grow in the future and then theres the beer wow you get beer and fresh made tastes diffrent but so good
Not worth it. Not worth it I thought , was a waste of money for what you had.too crowded 1 free beer,lots of interactive things if that's your thing,wouldn't bother to be honest

Interesting and amusing! . I spent very good time at Heineken experience! you can explore the old factory of the beer and find out the process to make it (there is also a very nice 3 D video!). You can taste the beer and enjoy the time also taking pictures in selfie spots or photo boots. It's very interesting and amusing, as well!I suggest you to book the ticket online in advance because it' always very crowded.
Fun experience . As a big beer fan we were looking forward to this tour. It is not a brewery tour, more of a Heineken museum, but it was still fun!
Good value for money. Nice placeThe basic tour is good.2.5 hour including the beer tasteGood for groups and friends'''''''''''''!!!!!!!!!!!!!!""""""""""""""""""

Surprisingly fun tour!. We purchased our tickets to the Heineken Experience via our Hop On/Off tour bus ($1 off) and then we had no line (and it was quite lengthy).This was a very fun, self-guided tour with 3 different tasting opportunities. It took about 1.5 hours to do the entire tour, with some extra time for our mini beers at the end.I always thought that Heineken started in Germany, but I soon learned that it was actually started in Amsterdam!

Book ahead, skip the queue!!. Got to the building and skipped the whole queue as we had booked online!The experience itself is amazing. Very interactive. You get to see many different angles. I was annoyed at first that it was not guided, but then realised its better self lead.Definitely worth a visit!!
Good tour. I did not want to visit this not being a beer drinker,but my husband wanted to, I am so glad we did, great tour, interactive and the beer, so fresh and so cold, I enjoyed it very much.

Cool Experience. The bruery is quite big. The tour startes with a general explanation of the Heineken family and the process of making the beer. There are also cool screens which you control, you can take pictures, make a bottle with your name (costs about 6€) and more. Also has a gift shop. Overall It was fun!

Great experience! . After reading the reviews on here before we went we opted for the normal tour and it was fine! Got 1 half pint during the tour and 2 after the tour which was enough. The tour was good and do make plenty of time to do it. We went at 1100 and got in straightaway however when we came out at 1330 the ques were long, so go early!

Interesting place. Very nice place with a drawback of no lift. We had a stroller which was not allowed so had to carry the baby for three hours. But still it was so informative and fun place. I found this one to be a family friendly place as well. Great beer as always.
Brewery Tour. There was no waiting. The tour took about 2 hours and was well worth the 18€ admittance fee. Be prepared to drink several glasses of beer!!! Highly recommend!!!

Nice place, but avoid going there on rainy / cold days. We visited the Heineken Experience during a cold / rainy day in Amsterdam. The concept is pretty nice with some cool attractions during the tour. In cause of the bad weather the place was totally crowded and there were waiting times up to 30 minutes without any information what will happen next. If you buy your tickets in advance at a shop of city sightseeing, you do not have to stand in line and can use the fast lane for entering the place.
Even if you don't like Heineken..... ....it's well worth visiting this. The only downside was that many of the staff couldn't answer my questions.

Fun and interesting experience. Visited with my husband and friend. We visited early which was worth it because we didn't have to queue to get in. Every other time we walked past people were queueing down the street. Overall we really enjoyed the experience and would recommend to others.

Learn how to drink beer properly!. One place you must visit when in Amsterdam is this Heineken Experience. They take you through the process of making the beer and you get to taste it at its first stage, give it a try, it's only a couple of sips and you will get some proper lager later in the tour to wash the taste away!We were taught how to taste beer properly! Take a decent gulp of beer "through" the frothy head, not a sip which will contain more head than actual beer! Who knew? And I thought it was ladylike to sip your beer! Apparently not!There are a couple of green screens where you can sing karaoke while cycling through the streets of Amsterdam, always good to capture on film to delight your family and friends!You finally end up in the bar, where the buttons on your wristband can be exchanged for beer, and now you know how to drink beer properly!There are loads of photo opportunities and the experience is very well laid out. The staff are very entertaining and knowledgeable. Prost!
Fun!. At first I didn't think this would be fun. It was fun with interactive elements like a karaoke bike ride you can email to yourself.
Must see. Great experience with very interactive displays. Great location. Friendly staff and great shop to purchase goods.

Don't like Heineken and still enjoyed this!. Super fun and interactive experience. This is a mix of high tech digital storytelling and game playing that teaches you about the history of Heineken. Experience is the perfect word for this place as that is exactly what it is. I think Heineken is awful, but I had a blast here and would certainly recommend it. I even think kids could have some fun here (although they can't drink the beer of course).

Great experience for families. We took our family to Amsterdam for the Christmas holidays. This place is great for families. It is about beer but they make it fun and make sure to include people who may not be able to or want to drink beer. Beer is offered at the end as well as Cokes for the non drinkers. It was a very thrilling and fun place to visit.

Great experience - if you take the 3in1. It's a nice museum and a nice experience, note that if you really want to feel value for money - take the 3in1 tickets. By the time I wrote this review, it costs 25 euros per person, you get museum entrance of course, a very nice 45 minutes cannal trip in a nice Heineken boat and then another ticket to the lookout tower - amazing combination

A bit long. Buy tix in advance. Go early or later. It was crowded so it took us 2 hours to complete the tour. You could do it in an hour if it wasn't so crowded. You get a small beer and then two 25cl. The brew process was cool.

Not as good as the hype. Had visited the museum on a Sunday... I will first of all say it is not the best day to visit this place as it is overly crowded.. Luckyly I and my friend had pre-booked tickets so we were able to go inside else there was a very long queue. Still there was long queue and we had to wait nearly 20-30 mins queue before we had a chance to get inside Heineken experience. This was a good 4D experience and if you have kids they would love it. There are nice games around that you could spend some time on and yes you get free bears(best part..atleast I got it with my ticket). But if you are visiting Amsterdam and have less time there are better things you can do.

Great Experience!!! . We were together for visiting Amsterdam, also Heineken Museum. First we were a little bit schocked because of the long row in the front of the museum. But then we were allowed to go inside in a spead way. The Tour was great and we all had a lot of fun. On the way throw Heineken were a lot of entertainable things. The way they explained to brew bear was very interesting and funny. We recommend this tour to other visitors and we all were very happy that we booked the Tour: You can book a Grachten Tour and Heineken for 29 Euros together and you can decide yourself whenever you want to experience. Take your money and make the booking if you love having fun together =)
Awesome Beer history!. Great history and an excellent experience of one of the historic brands of The Netherlands. The marriage of the old & the new at Heineken is unique...

Great Rock the City Ticket Experience. We bought the Rock the City ticket which provided entrance to the museum, a Grachtenfahrt as well as the LookOut tower. It was totally worthy-all three of them! Great atmosphere, amazingly friendly people and a wonderful time! Strongly recommended!

The Saturday experience !. Firstly, if you have a choice then Do Not go on a Saturday, the queues are large and the skip the line tickets still took 30 mins to get in as the Experience was full. There was also a 30 minute wait for the Beer Ride. Lots of interactive items to use during the visit so again best to choose a quieter time to be able to maximise the visit. Overall we had fun, but, regretted not going another day.

Good experience. Brought my partner here, a long time Heineken drinker and he loved it, the start was a bit crammed as it was a busy Saturday afternoon, we had bought our tickets in one of the tour offices earlier and got to skip the long queue outside. Once we got through the history of Heineken it got a bit more fun, we did the photo booth and pour your own Heineken and finished off with the free drinks.Overall it was an enjoyable few hours.

History blends with beer. You are taken in a trip through history of this family going by generations of the Heiniken family. You will see the stages of beer brewing with different tasting fases. The 2 free beers in the end are a nice bonus but the museum would still be good without them.

Great evening. Interesting and fun place. You get to know how the bear is done while following the route in the factory.You can read the history, exercise on the bike while singing karaoke and get 3D experience of "becoming a beer".And finally you get two glasses of fresh and tasty Heineken beer.
The best experience ever in the beer brewery!. It was very exciting to see how they made the beer in the past and in the present. The tour is very interactive with a lots of game.

Great experience. Oh yes a Must visit! This visit was sooo much fun a lot of interactive moments, you get to experience the making of beer and the history of how Heineken can to be, you can make your own beer and get the opportunity to taste the beer 3xs and great music is playing,you also get to buy bottles of beer with your name on it..Wonderful!!!!! Must visit
good visit. this is i think good value for money 18 euros and two drinks included, we in for about 2 and half hours, very interesting its great to visit if the weather not good, very good too vist

Well presented Heineken story. This place is well created tourist attraction, starting with stories about how brewery got started and how it expanded over a century. They also have nice demos/guides that walk through the beer making process.

Learning about a global brand and enjoying baby beers. It was a great experience to learn more about such a recognizable brand while being able to sample some of the product as well! Good value and be sure to take advantage of the student discount if you can!!!!! So cheap! :)

Loved it here!. This is a fantastic brewery tour/experience! I have previously visited the Guinness Storehouse in Dublin and although I thoroughly enjoyed it there, I must say I much preferred this experience. The whole experience was very interesting and interactive. I'd say it was more male-orientated than female due to the sports endorsements which are shown throughout although I do think everyone would enjoy it. There were interactive sections where you could 'play' rugby, play FIFA on the Playstation, take photos, do karaoke etc. You obviously get to learn how Heineken is made and the history of brewing too. Very good really. You get two free drinks at the end as long as a small glass of Heineken to taste earlier in the experience. Would definitely recommend this place!
Fabulous. Went with 2 teenagers. Had a great time and boat trip inc lots of beer. Spent 3 hrs. Probably good for bad weather although it was toastie when we went. Highly recommend

A must See.. Download the app. if you don't have a ticket and are standing in line, log on to the free WiFi and get the App.Lots of extra stuff on there and will fill you in as you go. The was really a working brewery, you can tell. They are also very proud of their heritage and development for the Heineken brand. Even if you are only mildly interested in the history, the heritage section has some interesting artifacts and images, well worth it.Then you get to the Brewery itself. Huge copper kettles, labeled and some ope to gaze into. Truly the best spot for pictures. Just the size and scope of this area is awe inspiring.Then you get to what appears to be a line up. take your time. Its a short line which move fast. catch up on stuff from the app at this time.Now you get to the interactive part with digital and multimedia displays. You can have a lot of fun in this area so don't rush it.The great reward is a roof top bar with two beer at no cost. take your time here as well enjoy the view and meet a few people.A fun afternoon!
Enjoyable Experience. The Heineken experience was great, a tour at your own pace and you finish off with a cold beer. A must do in Amsterdam.

Great Way to Fill Up Some Time. The Heineken Experience wasn't too bad. There wasn't much to the museum - it was mainly screens and videos. But it was a good way to spend a couple of hours. This is probably a good place for those in their early twenties. The selfie spots made me laugh and there is a great view of the city at the top. I thought there was going to be a beer tasting but sadly there wasn't one. I liked that we could make our own bottle design and I was tickled by the green screens and being able to make video/pictures on green screens.
Great tour. Such a fun and informative tour. Great staff and a couple of beers at the end...Some pretty walks all around the area, too.

10% History, 90% Fun. This is less a museum than an amusement centre, as anyone will be able to tell some ten minutes in; the historical content subsides and the doorway into the practicalities of the [Heineken] beer opens. This is a door you will want to open. The staff is friendly, the tour is inventive, the beer(s) is top-notch -- and the final result is a brand-oriented but ultimately very fun walk around, especially in the company of a couple beer-loving friends. For History, you'll have to walk down the road to Museumplein.

Thirsty reading. You have a lot to read on the way around, there are also the headset tours you could do. We chose to read them ourselves and go around at our pace. At first it was a little boring for me however it started to get more interesting about 10 minutes into the tour by the actual distilleries, learning about the making of the beer. They also had a simulator where you are inside all the beer making machinery which was quite fun. Finally you were taken through the end of the tour where you were greeted with two half pints of Heineken. What more could you ask for.
must visit for every tourist. I think its one of the best activities that I have done in recent pasts. each and every floor is a good information to have. Beer lovers will drool over this experience.

Nice visit but lots of queueing . Nice experience to know how the company evolved and how they produce their beer. But it's needs lots of waiting inside to go thru the simulation video. But over all it is good.

Excellent, must do . A great experience. Definitely puts a twist on the usual brewery experience. People were friendly and courteous. 1 guy went out of his way to tell us about some fun locations off the beaten path while giving directions to various places.

One of the must-do things while in Amsterdam. Fun, interactive tour. Great history lesson on this iconic beer. Nice to have a couple of beers at the end as well. No need to purchase the audio tour if you speak english as all of the staff presents in english.
Overrated. Would have had more fun enjoying a pint of Heineken at the pub next door. Super crowded, cheesy, kitschy and felt like a tourist trap.

Heineken experience. This was a great way to spend a couple of hours listening to the history of the family and how they improve the brand of Heineken. We went to the experience via the hop on hop off bus. Well worth a trip with s few drinks thrown in too!

Love the beer not the experience . Went to the Heineken experience in Amsterdam and it did not meet my expectations. The museum part of it is ok, the history of it as well. The staff were very friendly as well but the rest of it was a just a bunch of screens and walking around the building. There are two beers that come with the ticket you pay but there is no tasting. Heineken only has one beer. I thought I was going to taste different flavors but no. They added the boat cannals trip and observation tower which made it better for 25 Euros. I would have been pissed if I had paid 18 Euros just for the "experience".
Great fun!. Visited this place as a last minute itinerary. Truly an experience. Highly recommended when in amsterdam.

I loved it. We bought the standard tickets. And had a nice tour of thr old brewery. It was so much fun. You get to learn abit about the history and how the make beer and the required ingredient. It's a place full of photo op opportunities. I had alot of fun. U get ti have 2 beers to taste at the end there are alot of kool souvenir to buy. And it showcases many kool Heineken commercials and posters
Good to do . You can walk from dam square to reach there easily.you will be familier with history and production process of heineken beer and can drink 2 beers.

One time must see experience!. The whole tour took about 2 hrs and it was fun, they explain the whole process of beer brewing and it was nice. They let u smell the malted barley, hops, etc that are used as ingredients...and you get a few glasses of beer for Free!

Super cool. For 18euros you receive entry, staff at stations throughout the tour explaining the areas of the factory and the processes and also 2-3 beers!! Great value.The old factory itself is pretty cool, and there are heaps of hands on activities throughout.At the end you can choose to learn to pour your own beer to the Heineken standard or enjoy two drinks. It's a must do!
Lots of fun!. This museum is more of an experience and great to pass time when it rains. Take your time for this one, go with friends and drink enough beer.
Ok. On vacation with friends in Amsterdam and decided to go there. Was cool, a bit pricey, though. if your intention is to drink a lot of definitely that's not the place.

second time. Visited here a few years earlier oh my how it's changed, still a good tour and good value for money with a few beers thrown in for good measure the rooftop bar has fantastic views of the city and nice food too highly recommend this tour, pre book and save a few euros.

Made a Heineken drinker out of me. The Heineken experience was amazing. My group had a great time, we didn't want to leave. It's informative and fun and an over all blast. The speakers throughout are so nice and knowledgeable. Bartenders are fun! We loved the experience!
Nice place to visit . A cool way to experience beer. You will get a lot of information about the process, and will participate in beer tasting and pouring. Will take you about 1-2 hours.

Waste of time unless you need to get out of the rain . It depends what you're wanting from a beer- based tour. This building is no longer the active brewery, so they have turned it into a mega marketing Heineken self paced walk. My two highlights were the 4D movie, which was creative, and seeing the horses. The actual info about brewing beer is severely lacking in comparison to other beer tours I have done. The tour is very commercialized, I'm pretty shocked that it's rated so highly on tripadvisor. I settled on 2/5 based on this: we were there on a very rainy day. In terms of away to get out of the rain, I'd give it 3/5. In terms of my other beer based experiences around the world, this is hands down the worst. 1/5. Take it for what it's worth.

Interesting but........... An interesting tour until we came to the tasting section. A very rude Sheryl didn't do Heineken justice when she wrongly made an issue out of a non issue. What could have been a slightly better than average experience was turned into an average experience. Look to be fair you pay your money for 2 beers. That's it. There's way too much focus on advertising for this to rate above average.

Very good. Visited the Heineken Experience wilst on a short break with my wife on the recommendation of her brother. The story of the way the Heineken family have built up the business over the years and how the founder's values were observed are very interesting. During the experience you see an interactive video of the brewing process including a 'ride' using motion platform whereby you are the product in its various stages of production passing through the machinery. You also get the chance to try pouring a perfect glass of beer and to taste the product. Recommended.
Interesting. Not a bad thing to do whilst in Amsterdam. This is an old brewery where the Heineken legacy began. The tour is well put together and the beer tastes great. With a visit!

Very fun! Awesome experience!. Really good experience, I was there two times, in October 2014 and September 2016, and I enjoyed it. A lot of fun, activities and history. I Iiked too much the horses. You will learn about the taste, the smell of the beer. And will get two free beers. Amazing!

Not bad. Was interesting but disappointing to see it is not still a working factory. Roof top bar was a nice touch with bbq on terrace. 2 free beers each and a taster on the tour. Lots of integrative areas to make it more interesting.

Had a fantastic time . Went with 2 friends while on vacation. We loved every minute of the museum. One was not a beer drinker but still had a great time. The museum is very well planned out and each person follows the route and for some reason it works wonderfully and there are no queues at all. We really enjoyed being interactive and even learnt how to pull a beer. Entrance also includes 3 drinks. Possibly the best museum I have ever been to in the world and I've seen a few. Highly-rated
Fun and Interesting. Very nice and very informative tour. Many attractions to engage in and rooftop bar provides a beautiful view.

Visit to the Heineken Experience . The Heineken experience is a must do while in Amsterdam. It is fun filled, educational and loaded with historical facts. The staff were awesome, very knowledgeable and added spark to the experience. The interactive area was fantastic, I enjoyed scoring a few Rugby penalties and holding up the European Cup . The gift shop was fully stocked and items were decently priced.The certificate for pouring the perfect pint was the cherry on the top.Tip: book online to save €2 and skip the queues

Very nice - also for kids. Very amusing activity. You pay for entrance, and get your money back in Heineken beer. During the tour there are plenty of activities for all the family. It all takes about an hour and a half to two hours. Very entertaining!
Awesome . Great beer museum... Learnt a lot of interesting facts. Loved the horses. Fun filled experience with lots of games & fun activities.Dont forget the beers . Overall great experience.

So much fun! . Had so much fun and really informative. Quite hands on and good value. You get 2 1/2 pints of beer which pretty much is the coat of the admission. Fast track was great as just walked straight in

Could have been better. Its one of those things you have to do when visiting Amsterdam, so been there done it but wouldn't go again.It is very informative and interesting and nice to see the company keeping the heritage but lacks the vow factor for visitor attractions.Didn't book in advance but queue outside for a Saturday afternoon wasn't that bad but once you are inside it becomes worse particularly a 40 minute wait for the ^ride through the brewing process^ .Lacks something at the end to make you want to stay, i.e. cafe/bar.Could have been better.

Big disappointment!. Having worked in the alcohol sales industry for many years, I have been to many wineries and breweries for tours. Being the largest brewery in the Netherlands, I expected an actual working brewery. This place is geared for a very young crowd. Very crowded, very noisy and definelty not handicap friendly! Don't waste your money!

Informative and fun. Visited Monday with my husband. Shows you the way it's made, 3 half pints included in admission prices. 4d rides and interactive games makes it a great addition to a trip to Amsterdam

One of the best experiences in Amsterdam.... When i was buying the ticket, i was not sure about it but when the tour ended and i was walking out, i thought "wow!". To speak for myself, i really enjoyed the 4D experience (Brew Your Ride). There are also so many other interactive stuff inside (beer-serving, beer tasting, video montages and so on...) and lots of fun for sure. The information parts of the tour is presented in a way that draws your interest somehow. I found myself listening even the most boring information for me, all ears. An absolute must-see!

An experience for sure!. If you are a fan of beer and especially Heineken, do not give this place a miss.. This place breaks down the industrial process of making beer and will let you pour your own beer as well at the end. A historical treat for Heineken lovers.
Great experience . Loved the tour, good value, lovely staff. Don't go when you're tired, it's longer than a hungover trip to IKEA. It's definitely worth a visit though.

Waste of my money. This is geared to the 18 - 30 crowd. The noise level is insane. The beer tour is 3rd class. The price includes 3 small glasses of beer. Frankly, Heinekens is far from a good beer. Pure marketing hype.

Exceeded Expectations, Fun!!. We really enjoyed our visit to the heineken experience! It was educational, interesting but also super fun! Lots of nice activities inside and would recommend it to all! Tip to book online to save 2 EUR. Includes 2 beers at the end!

Recommend the VIP tour!. This tour is maybe a bit expensive (49 EUR), but it was so worth it. We were there on a Sunday morning at 12, which probably is a good time because most of the beer lovers are hangover, which we were as well, but it was very nice to drink beer anyway!Our tour guide Stefan was an excellent and funny guy. He knew a lot of stuff about Heineken and it was all very interesting. First we got a tour around the old brewery, then we went to a private bar for the beer tasting (five beers + refill). We also got very good cheese picked specially for the beer we were tasting.We skipped all the queue throughout our visit and got two beers in the end on the rooftop as everyone else. It was really crammed with people, and Stefan told us it is normally even busier in the weekends. So, really happy for treating ourselves with the VIP tour and I would really recommend people choosing that one.

Great way to spend an hour - fun and informative - with beer !. Book the Experience and arrive with tickets for a walk in - avoid the huge queues. Experience is a walking (3 storeys of stairs - but there is a lift ) tour of up to 1.5 hours. To get the most of the visit, interact with staff members, electronic games, videos and experiences. If you purchase a bottle of Heineken with personalised label - remember you cant take it home in your hand luggage unopened.Staff were very welcoming and informative, and with a couple of glasses of the product at the end of the tour, this is a great reasonably priced relaxing way to spend an hour or so .

'When in Rome'. You can't really come to Amsterdam without tasting Heineken really can you?
What better way to do it that this way?
Great few hours spent reading the history of the beer along with some interaction, videos etc.
See if you can pour the perfect pint at the end and of course enjoy your free beer!

Fabulous Tour. A Definite MUST DO!. The best tour we went on. Loved everything about it even although we dont drink beer!. Its a must do for all the family and pay for the cruise tour as extra as it was great too :)
Great tour!. A must for any beer drinker, one of the highlights of our trip. It really is more than just a brewery tour!

Fab experience. Thoroughly enjoyed Heineken tour, well worth the money to go and see how Heineken is made. Loved being able to go at my own pace through each stage, staff were nice and helpful. The tour itself was very interactive which I enjoyed. Also made my own bottle to take away with my name on it. Would recommend to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

A Cool Trip. Get the Ulmon City Guide Amsterdam offline map - it's a great app so you won't get lost in and around Amsterdam. I got there around 3 pm and there's no line. You get a free Heineken wristband right away as a souvenir. The videos inside were funny and informative, worth a laugh or two. Surprise, there's even a horse stable, a karaoke room, a 4-D movie, and a chill-out room for when you drink your free beer. All in all, this is a must-visit. I enjoyed my time there but wished there were chairs around to rest my tired feet.

A good experience. I went for the Heineken Experience recently along with some of my friends and it was a good experience. During the course of the experience the process of beer formation is revealed to the general public (obviously not disclosing the secret ingredient of course) and the general public is also involved in some fun games and exercises by the sporty staff. Even if urnt a beer fan than this place will obviously be worth your while.Cheers.. !!! :-D

Good tour . Pretty good tour with some cool interactive surprises and of course some beer tasting. Been to a few brewery tours and whilst you don't get to see the actual brewing process in a live production environment on this one, there are some nice little sections of the tour that you don't get on others.

Great time! . The Heineken Experience is a very good tour. There is a lot going on from the normal brewery tours where you just see the process and then get to try the beer. There is more of an entertainment aspect to this, from the photo and video booths and the champions league area. The standard tour has a small tasting beer, and then you also get two full beers in the bar. We bought our tickets at our hotel in Amsterdam and we got a discount rather than buying at the door.

Great birthday experience . My partner took me here on my birthday, although I was in charge of what we did on my birthday, I'm sure he wasn't complaining at going to Heineken! I've been to a couple of other less well known brewery tours that have lasted 45 minutes max and I was expecting much the same at Heineken... How very wrong I was! For €25 we went for the brewery tour, boat ride and Lookout tower entry. The tour of Heineken, which you do at your own pace unless you have arranged a guided tour, took about 1.5 hours and it was AMAZING. I don't really drink lager but the whole experience in the brewery was very informative, from the creators of the lager to the horses that are used and the amount of sponsorship that they carry out around the world. The staff were very friendly and attentive and provided very informed talks on their section. The normal tour includes a free sample of Heineken after the sensory experience of being the beer, a hilarious attraction as part of the tour, but our entrance fee also included 2 more halves of Heineken and a wrist band. I think a lot of people rate this attraction as a good place to go because they like lager, but I would like to recommend it to non lager drinkers as it is a very informative tour. After the tour of the brewery we left on the Heineken canal tour. This took us from Heineken to the LookOut which is based near central station. Queue more Heineken (€2.50 per bottle) on route. You can then choose to end the tour at the LookOut or return back to the Heineken Brewery and see more of the canals. As we had paid for entry to the LookOut we got off the boat. Excellent way to spend 2-3 hours in any weather.

Absolute must!!. This was such a fun and entertaining experience. It is not your usual brewery tour!! There are interactive experiences throughout and you can spend as much or as little time there as you would like. Definitely a fun place!

Worth an hour or teo. We had t planned on coming here on our visit, however we had some time so cycled down and it was well worth the money. They have don't so much with it there loads to do and see and a lovely roof top bar at the end for your two free drinks

Cheeky Beverage. We booked this as it was one of the trips we both wanted to do. We booked early as we know from friends who have been it can get busy and I would definitely advise anyone going to book as when we went people where queuing round the block. The tour itself was good and at times quite funny and informative. Definitely a way to while away a couple of with some drinks included.

Great Experience about my favorite beer. The full experience takes 2 hours and you will close with 2 cold beers included in the tour price. It includes a lost of shows, demonstrations, and games. Nice people during the shows including a live experience like Disneyword, Universal studios in LA and Orlando.

Fantastic . Wasn't what I was expecting at all worth going to have a look. If i could do it again I would definitely do the unique combo deal which is the heineken experience, canal cruise shuttle and the a'dam lookout.

If you like beer, a good place to visit. the Heineken Experience is a tour of the original Heineken brewery. It has displays on the history of their beer, up close looks at the equipment, the stables for their delivery horses, the ingredients, and, best of all, 2 beers at the end of the tour. Very tasty

Average tour but good fun . Go and visit early as it will get so busy!! Good tour, pretty average but if your into larger then it's a must see. You end up having 3 'free' drinks along the way and all staff were very friendly

Free beer. We went on a Sunday and was one of the first people in, staff know their stuff and there is free beer along the experience, on,y disappointment is we couldn't get glass engraved as the staff was not available to do so
Good!. Nice place and environment.Alot of people though ................but all we went to see was great and i love it

If you love beer, don't miss it!. Learn all about the process, drink while doing that, live the experience and buy some cool stuff in the gift shop after the tour. I recommend it for all people who enjoys a cold glass of quality beer.

If you want huge cues this is your place. There is just too much people inside. I'd rather they would have a limit of people inside.Is not much inside and they don't explain many things.And at the end there is a huge cue to get the beer.

We were 3 mins late. Well we arrived at 5:33 and were told we couldn't take the tour because the last tour leaves at 5:30 even tho we explained that it was our last day .. I guess it wasn't much to miss anyways! There are much better beers in holland than Heineken

Bad experience. Too packed. . Terrible human traffic jams inside the tour. Had to stand still for 20 min till could move. No control over amount of people they let inside. Doesn't worth the experience.

Better than Expected. First of all I wasn't sure what to expect, other than the beer sampling (2 each included in ticket price of €17 bought from one of the numerous ticket outlets). It's a self-guided tour, starting off with the history of the family who founded the brewery and some other parts. There is also a fun simulator where they transport you into the beer and you take a journey through the brewing process. They have some other nice things such as teaching you how to pour your own beer and games before you get to the main part and same 2 glasses of Heineken at the end.

Wonderful experience. The brewery tour was not guided; therefore, you walk around and read about the history. However, there are places in which the staff explain how to brew a beer and answer questions. The admission comes with 2 beers and also entertainment, such as video games, visual stimulations, 4D movie, etc. Definitely something to do in Amsterdam!

Entertaining tour.. Visited here last week with the hubby. Entertaining, fun and interactive tour around the original brewery. The guides there were friendly and answered questions happily. There was a bit of a wait for the interactive part of the tour where you "became" the beer...it was ok but don't expect anything spectacular. Would I go again...no, once was enough, but I did enjoy it and their gift shop had a gift for every budget.

A definite must in Amsterdam . We made a last minute decision to visit the Heineken experience towards the end of our trip and sooooo glad we did. Definetely one of the highlights of our trip!! Not too expensive to get in but would advise booking at the ticket offices as usually a double booking with another trip gives a decent discount. (We booked it with the ice museum and saved approx 7 euros).Nice wee educating start on the background of the Heineken family and then how the beer was made and distributed, then goes into the more modern way of Heineken ie. Sponsors with football and rugby with lots of different interactive games to participate in as u walk around the museum.At the end u also get 2 free beers person before leaving great value!!

Touristy experience. We stopped at the Heineken Experience as a hopefully refreshing break from visiting historic sites in our two-week European vacation. Visitors walk around an old (apparently inactive) brewery site, and are exposed to different videos and presentations on the history of Heineken and brewing, an old brewery site, an area with horses and delivery cart, and lots of interactive "fun"activities. The tour ends with a tasting plus two small beers in their rooftop bar with a nice view of central Amsterdam. I wanted to like it, but it came off as too touristy for my liking.

Better than the Guinness factory! . Interesting tour - really good staff who are very knowledgable and enthusiastic about Heineken. Some great photo opportunities and you get 3 glasses of Heineken and a wrist band to keep. Very relaxed - not too much walking up stairs - all in all a must if you are in Amsterdam.

Fun and learning something at the same time!. The Heineken experience is another tourist trip that is worth doing.You get to learn the history of the Heineken family as well as sample.their lager.There are lots of hands.on bits and pieces to experience at no extra cost too.Did this trip for my hubby but would.say to all to go and enjoy!

Interesting with great city views. Something different for us, the experience took you on an efficient and informative tour of the old brewery in central Amsterdam. We all enjoyed it, although the latter parts concentrated on marketing to the beer's principal market of young people. Some included tastings and a final glass on the rooftop terrace overlooking the city.
Got to see. This is 16 euros well spent. Lots of interactive things and a good couple of hours spent here. Even get to pull your own pint at the end!
good activity. good activity we went round as a group of 6 and it was a good laugh and very interesting to learn how everything works and the history if the factory, get two beers as well!

Well worth it. Great experience. Great mix between learning and fun. I learned a lot about Heineken and I love how they showed you just how worldwide they are. Plus you get beer samples so definitely worth the price
Stunning . I have no words. Friendly staff, great tour through out the factory and to top all the rooftop bar with complimentary Heineken beers. Highly recommended from Cape Town

Well worth the visit. We pre booked with the hop on hop off tours for about 16 euro each (worth it to skip lengthy cues trying to buy tickets) and you get 2 beers included in the ticket. Seeing how they make beer and the history of the place is pretty cool, but the activities after, make this place awesome. Some great photo opportunities while enjoying a tasty beverage. We spent a good 2 hours here and loved every bit of it. Broast!!!!

Unexpected!. As a group we decided to do this last minute on our last day in Amsterdam. It exceeded all expectations. It included a little bit of everything. You learnt all about the history and brewing process but in a really interesting and interactive way. You get to have tastings and learn interesting facts about beer in general. Then there is a ride and a series of interactive activities and social media opportunities before finishing up on the rooftop bar where you get to drink more beer and take in the view of Amsterdam! For an attraction of this level it was very reasonably priced and would recommend it to people of all ages.

VIP was a fun experience. Did the Heineken VIP experience and it was a lot of fun. Our group had 6 people total. Upon arrival you get a headset so that the guide can give you a more detailed narration during the walk through. Afterwards you go to a private old-timey bar to sample beers and hear more stories about the beer and the company (all while eating various cheeses). Total time was just about 2.5 hours.This was a fun experience, our host Joost (I think that's how you spell his name) was excellent as was the tour, beer, and experience. We were able to try a new concept beer (Heineken H41) that isn't wide spread yet which was also good.Would recommend doing this attraction once and going for the VIP tour, it's fun.

A great place for the whole family. This Museum is comparable to Hershey's Chocolate World in Pennsylvania as it is not an actual factory tour, but gives you a glimpse into the making of the beer and includes a ride and plenty of hands-on and interactive exhibits. It is suitable for all ages and an hour and 15 minutes is enough time to cover the museum and have a drink at the bar at the end :) Don't forget to keep the pins in your wristband until you get to the bar! Each pin is traded in for a glass at the end of the tour.

Fab!. Me and my boyfriend spent the afternoon here today and really enjoyed ourselves! We have been to the Guinness Factory in Dublin, and this was so much better! Very interactive and so much more for you to get involved in! Would definitely recommend

Just plain fun (if you don't mind getting marketed to the whole time)!. Yes, it's a marketing assault on you about how great Heineken is but look past that at the fun, goofy interactive experiences they deliver and you will really enjoy this visit. Just go with and have fun!
Great! . This was a really good and interactive experience with lots to see and do. The staff were very knowledgeable and friendly. Awesome experience.

Very good but the beer is still terrible. . The tour is one of the better Brewery tours so definitely recommendable. It does put a dagger in my bag that Heineken has one of the best Brewery tours when they have the worst beer :(

VIP tour the best!. It my first time at the Heineken experience and we took the vip tour and wow we were very impressed. The tour guide was brilliant and informative we sampled some of Heineken's new and old beers at the end of the tour which was great value for money it lasted at least two hours.

Super fun with friends or family and well worth the money!.
