This is an interactive tour and it includes a lot of free beer and an awesome rooftop view as well as the entire history of the Heineken Brewery. There were a ton of different things to see and do throughout the interactive tour and we got to take a lot of really cool pictures. It was definitely money well spent!

For a reference beer factory, was expecting much more. It explains the whole process of beer manufacturing but low to no involvement with the public. In other beer museums, it's possible for example to taste the beer after each manufacturing process. What they offer here basically is 3 normal beers and that's it.Also the security is dodgy. People were robbed during my tour and in the end, I was accused of robbing a camera just because I had a backpack with me. The security guard said that the security footage showed a guy like me, taking a camera away from another tourist... It was really an awkward situation and therefore I didn't like the experience.

Just for the heck of it. The Heineken is world renowned experience to get in Amsterdam. Though its not a very fun thing to do but then again theres not a lot to do in this city anyways so you'd rather do it and be done with it. The only good part of it is the couple of pints of fresh beer you get at the end of the tour otherwise its a pretty non-fun thing to do.

City View with Beer. You can taste at least 3 cups of beer in the Experience with your ticket. but remember to reserve a ticket online to avoid the queue. walk out to the balcony can enjoy a great Amsterdam city view with your free beer.
Best Heineken ever. Great time, great beer. Couldn't be happier after that visit. We got a bottle to remember our time there.
Impressive. It is impressive to see how the beer is done. You have several stages to visit including a tasting. You have the opportunity to bottle your own personalized Heineken!

A Little Hokey But Good Beer. We toured this place since the Anne Frank house line was way toooo long. Reasonable entrance fee. Everything in the place is a simulation since the real brewery move to another location. But there were some nice photo opportunities and a nice simulation ride. There were some live large horses - maybe to compete with the Budweiser brewery tours (all have ClydesdaleS). Best part was the end when we had the tastings. Ended up drinking 3-6 oz. drafts. No food samplings - I guess these are a thing of the past. My last beer tours trip to Munich included munchies. But I am a Heineken fan.

Great experience!. We had a really great time in the brewery. All the exhibition there were interesting and creative. It is a must see when anybody visit Amsterdam, it really gave us a good memory during our trip!

I love Heineken. Good tour and its very easy going and the samples at the end werent half bad either. We spent a couple of hours here a good chunk of which was spent in a queue for the 4D experience. Very informative and very enjoyable.

Tour and and experience for Beer Lovers. We love Heineken beer and thought this would be an interesting opportunity. Although the beer is actually made at another location, the first part of the tour is quite educational. The "experience" includes simulated rides through the beer making process, so if you have a bad back, you might consider bypassing that part of the tour. It felt a bit like a ride at Disneyland. The taste of beer at the end of the tour was most welcome.

If you like beer, you have to go!. First, i have to say that this is an absolutely innovative way of marketing! The whole experience has been so well thought through, that the word " experience" is perfect to describe it.The whole tour, takes you through the process of beer creation in such a fun/innovative way, that you dont want the experience to be over.You learn about how beer is produced, but not in a technical boring way, but rather original and cool manner.You get to learn a lot more about the brand itself, have some beer and have a good laugh!If you are in Amsterdam, I strongly recommend you do it!
What an experience. Was thinking about going on this tour and glad I did. Was definitely worth it. Even if you don't like beer, there is something for everyone.

Good if you don't know anything about beer.. It was definitely more about the giant Heineken marketing machine than the beer. Lets face it's not even brewed in Amsterdam anymore so tastes the same as everywhere else in the world. Bring on the craft beer revolution! Good way to spend a couple of hours and if your taste buds haven't developed then you will enjoy it.
Fun!. Very fun place to go, they dont give enought beer, that is the only problem I can find, a lot of walking and a very interesting history
Exactly what you would expect . Interesting trip with some friendly guides and excellent beer offered in the price of the tickets. Overall is 100% worth the money you pay .

Museum with alcohol included. A good way to spend a couple of hours with alcohol thrown in as part of the entrance fee. The only thing I would say is to shop around and get your tickets in advance because you can save a few euros and fast track the queues. It's informative and has a fun simulator during the tour.
Average place to see. Not much things to see, a commercial endeavour by Heineken to attract tourists. Rather expensive compared to what you get for the price.

Like Cadburys World for adults. The Heineken Experience is a fun, informative adventure that takes you through both the history of the company and the process of making beer, but the thing that makes it really stand out is its staff. Without fail they were all lively, enthusiastic and helpful (special thanks to Lucas on the front desk who helped us sort our tickets out). Another great addition is the 'pour your own beer' section, the guy running this room had fantastic rapport with the crowd and was a really good teacher when it came to the beer. Overall really interactive and fun, although a lot of big groups come here and it can be frustrating to get stuck behind them sometimes.

Exceeded expectations massively!. My girlfriend and I went not expecting an awful lot from it but it massively exceeded our expectations! We ended up having 3 free drinks as well which was a bonus! I would definitely recommend a visit!

Great Tour. one of the highlights of our Amsterdam visit. its really great, well done tour. explains everything in the process and history. at the end of the tour you end up in a pub with a few (or more) pints. put it on ur bucket list.

Definitely worth a visit. My husband and I both walked away from this on agreement that it was better than we expected. My husband isn't  usually into things like this but he really enjoyed it.The tour takes you through how heineken is made, how it's been developed over the years and ends in tasting the actual thing on the roof top overlooking amsterdam. There's lots of interactive things to do to keep you interested as well.Overall a very interesting and enjoyable way to spend a couple of hours, I'd recommend it.
Great even fora non lager drinker . Was a good laugh and interesting to see how lager is made. The horses were a bit pointless and you couldn't stroke tgem
Amazing!. What we thought was going to be just one more bier factory visit ended up being a INCREDIBLY experience. So simple but so interactive, organized, clean and objective. Everyone must go!

Very nice place !. The tour inside is very intresing. If you like beer this place for you. You get information about how they make ther beer with funny storys and movies. In the end you get 2 glass of heineken beer.

Don't miss the horses. So a brewery with history is fun- the roof top bar was my favorite part. The big copper boilers were stunning craftsmanship. The horses are fabulous, the interactive games hilarious. However, I'd felt like I'd done this type of brewery tour before.

Fabulous experience. It was really a great trip, worth the every penny spent. The making of world class beer and then experiencing it is something worth experiencing. The bar inside is lively and can enjoy your beer without any fuss.
Poor organisation . Enjoyed the visit but it's all a bit of a free for all with little organisation I would recommend pre booking .

Really busy but great tour. Get ready the Heineken experience is great but you need to climb stairs, will be lots of people around, will be tiny rooms and might be waiting as well.Other than that is great, interactive and fun.

Side trip. We had a couple of hour to kill before the tulip tour. Not enough time. Excellent trip through a brewery--how it works and all the artifacts. Had to rush. Could easily have spent several more hours.

Fantastic experience!. I am always a beer lover and tried Heineken experience during my visit to Amsterdam. It was nice to see history behind Heineken and loved the entire brewing process behind that. If someone don't know how to pour beer, you will get lessons here including some fun activities inside! They give 2 free beer on the ticket and lovely staff would keep you entertained with some interesting facts about Heineken. I would recommended to buy online tickets only! It will definitely save the time at the entrance with a cheaper price tag :)

Worth the price and funny. The experience started off in a slightly boring way but kicked off right away and it was very versatile. It kept on getting more lively and ended up in a beer tasting lounge.
Great fun- well worth a visit. Really enjoyed this tour, it was great fun and is certainly worth a visit whilst in Amsterdam, it is really interesting and the bars inside are really cool and quirky!

If you like beer, go. If you like Heineken or beer, then do this. You can get it for about €15 and 2 "free" beers. Self tour and then they give you a little bit of info on how to look at the colour and drink it. It's okay. I wouldn't say it's fantastic though. Good as a rainy day activity. Definitely pre-purchase your tickets as well.

Great experience even for a hater of beer!. I have to admit that I was really not looking forward to this, mainly because I hate beer (I still have the opinion that it is disgusting!), but it was a really enjoyable day for everyone in my group. The staff and the exhibits do more than enough to keep you entertained, and the rooftop bar was a real treat too (free beer and soft drinks).We booked ahead and arrived fairly early in the morning to find no queue. This seemed to be a good idea as the queue was very long when we left.

Drinks at Freddy's. Freddy's bar owned by Heineken, a classy bar with different type of Heineken beer, smart, and friendly service. Attached to the bar is also a cigar bar witch offers a wide range of fresh Cuban cigars as well as fine whisky/ brandy. Location is excellent and prices are reasonable too. A must try for Heineken lovers!

sheer beautiful view and experience. it is a must go place in amsterdam for variety of beers and good food as well as merchandise of heineken , also if oyu get the chanceto go on the top floor the view is just stunnng and beautiful

A good tour. We visited in September 2016 and it was fun. We bought the tickets that included the cruise trip and A'dam tower. the staff were very nice and helpful and the views from A'dam tower were amazing.

Great fun!. I have been on other brewery tours before but this one takes the cake! It's fun and interactive. Something to interest everyone! This is a must do while in Amsterdam...and the 2 beers at the end of the tour finished it off perfectly. The staff were friendly and entertaining too!

Brewery tour. This was one of my favorite places in Amsterdam as i like Heineken. I was surprised that my children enjoyed the tour at the brewery as well. The 2 free beers helped as well. This is a place all beer lovers cannot avoid when in Amsterdam.
Great experience . To be honest, I didn't like first part of the tour but it surprised me after brewery process room. I recommend to buy also ticket with boat and lookout included.
heineken. This was a great day at the place loved it abit worried at first because it had all changed since I was here over 10 years ago but going again in November for xmas shopping

Something for everyone. The story told about the history and brewing process is quite interesting, including learning the correct way to drink a Heineken.The tour then meanders through a series of interactive displays which was a bit of a surprise. Certainly enough to keep you entertained for quite a while.Tip: Buy your tickets online first, you will say money, and it makes entry much much faster.
Bit of fun. Definitely a silly but fun activity to go along to. Really friendly staff, two free beers at the end plus a half pint to taste test! Worth a visit

The giebels raise a glass to you. This is a very interesting look into the life of the man and family that produces one of the best beers. With all the rage of craft beers out there, sometimes the classics still remain at the top where they belong.

Great history and fun tour. I went with three friends and we all had a great time. I learned a lot about the history of the beer and the family that has kept it alive and growing. Ive toured many brewery's and former brewery's and this one is probably the best and most interactive. They even throw some random fun stuff in like photo booths which are unbelievably free. 2 beers are also included with you ticket.
Great value for money!. Last minute decision to visit this attraction. 15E which comes with 2 drinks. Very interesting story, extremely interactive, tasty beer. Highly recommended.
Must visit. The best of my Amsterdam visits. Information about beer but the best comes later when you join the....'club'
Such good fun!. A really fun experience! Lots of great activities and plenty of laughs. Enjoying beer is not even necessary!

Not just another brewery tour!. This is a great activity to do. Having been to many brewery's I wasn't too keen but glad we did. After the initial 'how we make the beer' part there are interactive activities to do and even make your own branded bottle (at a reasonable cost). The only negative part of this tour, and why it didn't get five stars, was towards the end the floor and parts of the activities became very sticky and gross as people walked around spilling the beer - my jandles were literally sticking to the floor. Pretty good activity none the less.

Wonderful History . We were excited to visit the Heineken Experience for the fresh beer but were pleasantly surprised at the level of professionalism in the whole tour. Brewing History, community support, awards, and more await you. Be Surprised. Go!

Very Educational & Interactive. This is actually a very educational place. Besides the history of Heineken, we were taught on how the beers are being produced and there is also a great lesson on how to pour and serve a proper beer. The place is fun, vibrant and I must admit that it is of great value of money.

Good brewery tour. We've been to a couple brewery tours and this is, so far, the favourite. Informative guides that tell you all about the process, and also interactive features that make the experience fun and enjoyable. You get a free half pint during the tour and then two tokens to have in the bar. If it's not raining, be sure to go out and have a look at the view from the rooftop bar.
Loved it. Free beer, great walk inside, full history tour and lots of games to play and stuff to do inside. Definitely worth your time. Even if you are traveling solo - you can make friends there :)

Tourist Trap but SO Much Fun. This is one of those things that you don't do because it's "authentic" Amsterdam you do it to have some lighthearted fun. Its 18 Euros, you tour through 6 levels of Heineken-ness. Including history, brewing, horses, marketing, tasting and bottling. You get two free beers at the top with an amazing view of Amsterdam. It's very well done and you should go!

Lot of fun. A pretty cool way to spend a couple of hours and take a look into the world that is Heineken. The beer at the basement bar is the finest Heineken you'll ever try. Especially fun with friends

Just fantastic. . We've not long returned from a long weekend in Amsterdam, and this was one of our very favourite experiences. Really good value for money - extensive tour, hands on, lots to see on your own as well as staff member presentations. Really felt like the staff wanted to impart their knowledge. Learnt so much and won't ever be able to look at beer the same way ever again. Lovely touch at the end of the tour being able to enjoy a couple of drinks in the large roof bar. Worth every penny.

Fun, Interactive, Experiential, Great for all ages. This tour is a must do in Amsterdam. They have put this tour together using brilliant multi media forms of delivering their history, their story and have expanded the tour to include fun things to do like make a video you can send home, take a picture at a sport event, the background is provided and you can email the snap shot to family and friends.The tour is well laid out, it keeps you moving, you see everything from the history to the horses ( real horses ) and you get to sample the great beer. A must do for all ages.Highly recommended.
Brilliant brewery tour. Had an excellent afternoon at the Heineken tour in Amsterdam. Staff very helpful and friendly and well worth the money

Good fun couple of hours!. Fun, informative afternoon here. Plenty to do for every age, enough to keep a 9 year old and a 15 year old occupied as well as two adults. My youngest enjoyed all the hands on stuff and the interaction. My eldest poured the perfect beer, I failed, and I used to run a bar! Three beers included per adult and the kids got one free, although the staff didn't seem too sure what to do, not charged at one point, charged at another. Bit confusing, and expensive at €2.50 for a small glass of coke! All in all a fun couple of hours and would recommend it for families.

Live the beer Experience !!!. Combination between story, science of making beer, great marketing and fun... And beers included :-) . You see how beeer is made, the old machineries from the old beer factory, taste beer, trip ends on top of the building in bar - lounge and terrace. You can enjoy the view from the top, have a beer and something to eat, take pictures, socialize, etc.

Very interesting . My husband and I visited on a Friday. It wasn't too busy when we arrived at 11am but when we left at around 1 the queue was quite long to enter. It's really interesting and we even got a few free lagers on the way around.

Very interactive. Heineken Experience was fun and interactive. You learn a lot about the history of the company, how to make a beer, what are the ingredients, etc. It takes you to a nice journey that end with fresh beers that you can poor by yourself. I would recommend it

Who can say no to this.... This is definitely an experience. It takes you through the process of how they make Heineken to the interactive areas of sports they sponsor, festivals they are involved in etc...Plus there is a tasting room at the end where you are able to sample a couple of Heinekens.We bought the ticket in conjunction with a canal tour and a visit to the A'dam Tower which was worth it.

Very fun!. The Heineken Experience is a perfect change of pace and quite fun.The Heineken Experience is located in the old Heineken brewery that is not I use anymore so it isn’t a standard factory tour. You do get to know about the history of Heineken and about the brewing process you just don’t get to see it done in front of you. It can be a bit of a Heineken advertisement at times but it still very cool.You get about 3 free beers through the tour. The first inside where they teach you how to “properly” drink a beer. The other two are given to you at the bar on the 6th floor overlooking Amsterdam, it’s really special and is worth the price of admission alone.Be aware that the place smells like horse, they have a stable on site.
Fun!. Informative and fun! We brought our 10 year old and were a little concerned she'd be bored. She did just fine. Loved the tasting on the roof and the personalized beer bottles!

A must do tour well planned and interesting. The Heineken experience was a great afternoon it made interesting with the way the tour is done. Keeps your interest all the way through. remember and take your camera for some pictures from the roof top bar. and don't forget to use the beer bike for your Karaoke session

More than the Usual Beer Tour, Very interesting !. We've been on many brewery tours in the past, but the Heineken tour is truly an experience. Without giving too much information, if you're in the area take the tour.

More than the Usual Beer Tour, Very interesting !. We've been on many brewery tours in the past, but the Heineken tour is truly an experience. Without giving too much information, if you're in the area take the tour.

Good attraction for beer lovers . The experience was a very good one for myself, I enjoy beer and learning about the processes and history behind Heineken. All the staff really seemed to have bought into it and gave it 100% as we went through the brewery. I went around with one of my friends who isn't a drinker, he still liked it. I also took their boat tour which was also enjoyable.

Such good fun!. My fiance and I spent 4 jam-packed days in Amsterdam and one of the funnest things we did was the Heineken Experience! The factory has been very cleverly converted into a museum/bar/interactive experience. Not to mention, there's plenty of opportunities to taste test the product!
Fun visit for any beer enthusiast.. Fun and interactive tour. Beer sampling during the tour and at the end is a nice touch. Food is available at the end also.

Beer lovers- this is where the magic happens. This was an interesting tour , chose to do this over Amstel. Good tour about the history of the beer and loved the beer sample. Fun place to be for 1.5 hours

Amazing tour!. One of the best brewery tours/experiences iv ever done. It's not a working brewery however is a really REALLY interactive tour with so much to do.Each section is packed with fun interactive history and highlights.....from sports to travel!2 beers on the roof terrace to finish! I really cannot recommend this tour enough!!!!Great fun for all ages. Kids were allowed in and was very safe and fun for them. No boring points to raise.
Nice morning outing. Very friendly staff. Well designed exhibits. I think it is overpriced since is is basically an advertisement.

Very Interesting. Its like Disneyland, but with beer! You learn about the history of Heineken, see the process of brewing the beer from start to finish and actually experience it first hand! Its very well laid out and lots to do. Plus you get free beer and can enjoy the views from the roof terrace. Book online to avoid the queues and save a bit of money. I'd also recommend cycling there as it's a beautiful journey and plenty of space to lock your bikes up.
Fun activity for young and old. The way this experience is presented makes it suitable and fun for all age groups. Can even recommend for families with young lids.

Enjoyable Experience - 29 Aug 2016. We had our tickets for the Heineken Museum through the Holland Pass (you need a gold ticket) and we directly entered (no queues). While the human interaction is much more felt in the Guinness Storehouse (in Dublin); there are 3 noticeable differences: 1-The interactive experience were you go through the whole brewing process.2-Stables with actual live horses3-The open and acceptable crowded terrace on the last floor (contrary to the Guinness which was a non open space and you could barely walk) With you ticket you get to taste 1 sample beer during the walk and 2 other beers when you reach the terrace. You can also buy a burger if you wish at 7.5 Euro or even additional beers.Overall: enjoyable and recommended for anyone who would like to know more about the Heineken brand.

Well done tour to demonstrate beer making. Very well organized, and even though there were lots of people there, it did not feel crowded until the end with the free samples. Even though I'm not a beer drinker I found the process interesting for this well known brew.

Very pleasant . We booked the tickets before going on our trip so that eliminated some queuing at the main doors. We joined a large queue outside the main entrance but after 2 mins realised there was a fast track entrance in front of that (for pre purchased tickets) and we were inside straight away. I drink Heineken in my local so I enjoyed sampling some proper stuff.

Nice brush with history, great beer. Being a Heineken fan, it was a easy choice for me to spend 3hours at Heineken. It is in the city, easy to access. Old factory with micro brewery. Walk through history of Heineken, how beer is made, beer tasting session, interactive games. Overall great fun. In the end got to bottle own beer with name and date printed on a bottle and carried it. Worth the visit

Great Experience. Great tour and worth the money. The tours has old parts that had been used in the past and also had interactive displays. Loved the 4d simulator which is you as the bottle and takes you on a trip of how the beer gets there.Have already recommend to friends

Enjoyed . This experience was good they had a lot of information and lots of interactive activities. They had a beautiful view from the roof top bar and the staff were very friendly. Food was expensive but other then that it was worth the money.

Lots to do. I came with my boyfriend in march and it was great for all the family. So factual and hands on, i think it is really a must. I personally don't like Heineken or beer so I didn't enjoy the drinking of it but there were games and things to do. I liked pouring the pint and learning about it and my boyfriend drank all my drinks and his.

Couple of beers and a few interesting facts. Good clean fun, rooftop beers are great and there is plenty of fun activities during the tour. pre-purchase your tickets in Amsterdam around town to skip the line and for a little discount !

Heineken Experience. Expensive but worth it. Not a working factory but a tour of some of the old parts previously used and some interactive/ audiovisual bits. Enjoyed a lot. Did tour only which includes beer and rooftop bar. Didn't do Heineken boat not sure it goes very often and plenty of other companies doing various boat trips elsewhere.
Very interactive and fun. They have made this experience quite fun especially with friends. Nice view from the terrace as well. Worth visiting to understand more about beer.Amazing time

Exceeded the expecations of someone who doesn't like beer all that much. The start was a bit dark and small and gave me trust issues, but when we got to the kettles and stables the room opened up and it was pretty. Nothing to special at that time tho, but after that it is just a big game house and fun stuff. They have always been good in giving people a good feeling in their commercials, and that is visible in this experience as well. Just a shame that the adorable pint glasses were so expensive.

Better than the Guinness Factory. I loved the Guinness Factory when I visited Dublin in October but this was so much better. The museum itself was huge with tonnes of rooms and interactive displays (the karaoke videos were really fun). There is even a 4D "ride" which takes you through the beer making process with you as the beer in the bottle. You get given half a pint during the tasting and 2 tokens for 2 more half pints in the rooftop bar. There was so much more space in the bar than at the Guinness Factory (and we were there in August which I thought would have been busier). We did not have much time to spend there but we could easily have spent another couple of hours going round and relaxing in the bar. Overall, very impressed.

Disappointing display of blatant capitalism. This was disappointing. Many native Amsterdammers told us not to go but we had to see for ourselves. A long walk, the same story told several times (not in the least but exciting) and a deeply disappointing '4D' video later we drank two tiny 'draughts' and left both tired and thoroughly bored.If you can help yourself, don't waste your valuable time.

Heineken....yes please!. We enjoyed this tour. The free beers at the end and the atmosphere made for a fun afternoon. Your is not guided , you go at your pace. Can take pictures at various areas, they have several picture booths and you can personalize and purchase a bottle of beer

Not a must see or do.. This definitely is not an Amsterdam must see or do. The tour is self guided and because of this you end up in queues and end up missing out sections because people just end up crowding round things and you just can't see. You can only walk round the brewery in one direction and when you get to the brewery ride you end up standing in a queue for ages just for a 5 minute simulation ride, which you can't skip so you have to endure. You stand in a room where the floor moves, water is sprayed at you and the room becomes really hot while you watch a video about how beer is bottled.. You then walk out into the tasting room where a bar attendant gives you a small glass of Heineken and then talks you through a script of how you're meant to drink it. There are then around 2 or 3 floors full of interactive games which are fun, but if you're not into this then you're basically skipping everything. We couldn't find the bar for our 2 free taster Heineken's and the staff were not helpful at all so we just left. The whole experience is clearly just a tourist trap. I'm not into beer at all and would happily skip this, my boyfriend who is into beer would also have happily skipped this also. We feel like we completely wasted an entire afternoon.
Fun!. Not a must see but really fun! Hamburgers are delicious! Options are beef and vegan patties. Sit on the roof top and enjoy a Heineken and a hamburger!

Not a lager lover but the experience was great. I am not a lager or beer lover but the experience was great. This is a self guided tour around the old Heineken Brewery. Through the experience there are a number of interactive experiences, such as pulling the perfect pint, bottling your own beer, tasting the not so tasty hops, and games such as kicking a rugby ball and a scrum game. Unfortunately these 2 games were not working when we visited.There is a lot of history of the advertisement of Heineken through the tour. Ranging from posters to the different bottles throughout the year. There is a talk in the middle of the experience where a guide takes you through tasting a glass of Heineken. A free glass. I don;t like lager or beer but after she told us how to drink it, it tasted 'slightly' better. The other 2 drinks that you receive you are free to drink at the end of the tour on the rooftop bar. Additional tokens are also on sale for €2.50 which is cheaper than anywhere else in Amsterdam. They also sell BBQ burgers.

Great place to visit.. This tour of the Heineken Brewery was a great experience. We were shown the brewing process from beginning to the end. Apparently they use four ingredients to brew the heineken bear. These are oats, hops, yeast and water. The yeast is special and is the yeast which was cultured by the founder of the brewery. We then saw a movie and finally went to the top floor of the building to sample the bear. Needless to say that Heineken beer tastes great. The place was very lively and we could also buy hamburgers. I highly recommend touring this venue if you are in Amsterdam.

Fun for all. A great way to spend a couple of hours. The whole experience has been really well thought out, with something for everyone. Lots of great photo and video opportunities, and the perfect rooftop location to enjoy a couple of glasses of Heineken. Great sporting section through sponsorships, and loads off fun games too.

Pretty fun experience for the whole family. I took my 4 year old son and friends to the Heineken Experience last week. The tour is as informative as you want (as it's self-guided), with some fun activities thrown in. When you enter, you're given a bracelet which entitles you to two free beers. From what I saw, it is pretty easy to get a few free extras if you want, which makes the tour a good value. The rooftop bar alone is worth the ticket price if the weather is nice!

2 visits and would go again!. I have been to the Heineken Experience twice now, and would not say no to going again!It is a fun activity, and a MUST if you are in Amsterdam.the second time we went, I even asked if he would let us in for free, and he said he couldn't (understandable) but he ended up giving us 7 beer tokens each!! Each of these get you a half pint in the bar afterwards so 3 and a half pints, a brewery tour, a boat trip and a visit to the highest point in Amsterdam for less than 20 euros, how can you possibly say no?!Never gets boring!

Very cool. We went the during our trip to Amsterdam with small children.
Yes you can bring your kids with you. It's very interesting and interactive. So many unknown and funny facts.
Even the horses you can visit there. It's really crazy. Just go there!!

A waste of time and money . A waste of time and money...We have done the Guinness & Jamesons tours when we were in Dublin & really enjoyed them, so we thought we'd give this a go despite some of the "sketchy" reviews... really wish we hadn't bothered.Great way to blow the best part of €40 & a couple of hours in Amsterdam that you could've spent doing other things.The tour is self guided, but not like the Guinness tour where you can stroll around and look at what parts you want, when you want. There's a clear direction you have to take, so any interesting parts (which is few and far between on this tour) ends up packed with people. We went monday & it was a beautiful warm day in Amsterdam... which translates to a hot, sticky day when you're stuck in a small room with 50 other people. It's more of warehouse with a bunch of Heineken memorabilia than a brewery tour. Then there's parts of the tour that are compulsory, like the simulation ride. So you end up in a massive queue. We were huddled into groups like cattle to be put into these simulators which were completely ridiculous. Basically, the floor moves a bit whilst you watch a video of beer being bottled. Then you're straight out into the tasting room where a girl was frantically trying to pour everyone a sample, run through her tasting script, & get you out of the room before the simulator stopped & the next herd of people came in. The best bit about the whole tour was the roof top bar, where you get your 2 beers... which were taster sized. But, you pay for a Heineken experience, and an experience was exactly what we got.
Stick to making beer. Heineken beer is a really good beer shame they can't say the Same about the tour, it's overpacked with people and it's very unorganised

Nothing amazing . My friends loved it but I thought it was quite boring. Very much a tourist trap, would not have chosen this myself. Only good thing is you get 3 free glasses (half pints) of Heineken.

Better than expected! . Really good fun and only 18 euros (17 with a discount flyer). Good way to spend a couple of hours and you get to learn a lot, take some fun pictures and drink 2 beers. Perfect fun with friends. Only downside was that the roof bar wasn't open but that was due to a corporate booking. If that had been open I'd have given 5 stars!

A must see if in Amsterdam. The Heineken museum was full of things to see. Not bad for the price, but if you want to knock a few euros off, get yourself a voucher from the ticket shops or purchase a couple of places to visit at once and the shop usually discount you more. The ride which involves you becoming the beer, was interesting/hilarious but if you don't expect the world it's a good experience. The bar at the top was good gets very crowded so the sightseeing opportunities are limited.At the end of the day you get two free beers included in the price and learn about how they make it! Get in there early to avoid the crowds.

A MEH activity. Although it's a long (maybe too much) and informative tour that tries to stimulate your senses. I won't recommend this to anyone who is not from the beer's fan-base. They do try to entertain but they mainly advertise themselves. They do offer 2 free beers on the nice rooftop of the brewery and a chance to buy a nice hamburger.

So much fun!. who says you cannot learn while drinking and having fun! interesting to know how beer is made plus did you know their is a drinking technic???? well, they will teach you how to drink beer and get the best out of it.

It's exactly what you expect. Get in, get out.. Not that great of an experience. Self guided tour with a couple exhibits with employees explaining things (how to pour the perfect beer). Very similar to many beer tours of major manufacturers/brands. The VIP tour may be worth the price if it's anything like the Guinness one.

lager and learnin'. i went here solo while my fellow traveller went to the rijksmuseum (different strokes, eh?)it's an interactive learning experience with lots of things to entertain: videos, lager tasting, a little ride where you become a lager, 2 lagers at the rooftop bar (amazing views), and loads more.if you like lager and learnin', it's for you.it may just be a bit more fun if you go with another person. there weren't many lone wolves like me.
Good time. They do a nice job at the tour. Go as fast or slow as you wish but having a good time is the point here.

So much advertising! But still fun . The experience is pretty much advertising in every media form possible. They even have horses on site that do promotions. Still really fun to experience. The beer ride, the various picture props and games, and the beer make it worth a visit.

Free beer. The Heineken experience was made all the better with the free samples on your way around. Made learning the history of Heineken interesting lots of interaction sections! A great afternoon top off with a view over Amsterdam and a beer in your hand! Found the shop to be slightly expensive though

Not an Amsterdam must-do. The Heineken Experience is okay. I enjoyed learning the history of the company and the view from rooftop bar, but was not as impressed with other exhibits. If you're only in Amsterdam for a day, I wouldn't make this a priority. Also, if you're visiting in the colder months, the rooftop bar is closed and thus you miss the great view.
Great experience! . Totally worth the tour plus cruise price. Go in the afternoon/evening to be able to hang out at the Rooftop patio.

Mandatory for beer lovers. Mandatory for beer lovers as you discover facts about the historic building and the brewery equipment. Buy your ticket in advance to dodge a queue at the entrance. Some will describe the tour as a tad boring however a sampling at the end of the process and then 2 free beer on the rooftop. Means on a whole the tour is excellent value for the money! Do the math!

It was just ok. The self guided tour is quite quick, just reading plaques on the wall and watching a few videos. It didn't seem well organized. Staff seemed vaguely interested in pointing things out. Much of the tour involved games - karaoke, virtual football kicking, a foosball game. Extra cost for a photo booth picture and to make your own beer label. I just wasn't interested in all that. Basically I learned you take water and barley, boil it, strain it, add yeast and hops and let it age and voila- you have Heineken.

Great value & offers more than expected . We enjoyed a lovely afternoon here. There is far more than I ever expected. It starts of with a tour of the history of the Heineken family and how the brewery developed. We were given samples of the ingredients along the way and a lesson on how it should be drank. There was also lots of fun activities along the way and it finished on the top floor where we received 2 free glasses and enjoyed the spectacular view out over the city.

Short trip to the brewery. Theres not a huge amount to see in the brewery for the price you pay to get in. We did get 3 beers each in total but they were only small. Theres lots of interactive exhibits mainly designed for kids. Staff are very knowledgable but there was many people going through the day we travelled and we didn't get many opportunities to chat. The best exhibit was the horses and the view from the rooftop is lovely but not too sure its worth the high entance fee. Would skip this next time but at least we can say we have been :)

Interesting . Visited while on a weekend break with my friends. Pre booked our tickets which I would suggest everyone does in order to avoid the queues outside! Entrance was quick and fast which was good. The beginning of the tour was a little boring if I'm honest, not too interested in the history etc but if you do like this kinda thing it would be good. The rest of the experience was really good, the simulator (although waiting was around 25 mins) was worth it. The horses and hearing about the use of the horses back in the day and currently. And the over 18s get 1 beer during the tour and then 2 at the end of the tour. Not great for myself as I'm not a beer lover but my friends just used my tokens. Good experience overall!
Great trip. We had a wonderful time learning and tasting the beer from just made directly from the Brouwer enjoying the view from the top of the building you cut see almost the hold city

Amazing experience! . This was surprisingly the best museum / experience we visited. These type of beer / alcohol experiences can be quite predictable and therefore my expectations weren't great but I was completely surprised about how different this one is. Lots of history and interesting things to see, the ride is great, the interactive exhibitions are great and you get to taste the beer during the production and after! Certainly worth a visit!

Interesting ..... but. If you speak English no audio set needed since all in English.First half of tour was history and how to make beer. This was interesting and presented with flair. You get to see the stallions who all appeared sleepy with eyes closed as if they had had a few.Last half was imaginative marketing directed at young people. I liked the James Bond bit. Rest was how to play rugby and drink Heineken and similar amusement arcade stuff.Finally two beers on the roof top / was nice.Overall OK

Worth a visit. Dont expect too much. Its an ok way to spend an afternoon. After working in the bar industry its a bit of busmans holiday. But if youve no idea about how beer is made or how the process works then its ok.Couple of small beers included in the ticket price. The "ride" is mildly amusing. But creates a bottle neck.

Fun afternoon. Although there was only one beer drinker in our party of 4 we all thoroughly enjoyed our visit here!There are some really good interactive things to do, and the story of Heineken is fascinating! We would definitely recommend this - especially if you have the iamsterdam card as you get a reduction in your entry fee!
Class. had an amazing time here nice to try some fresh Heineken as well as learning about the history and process the beer goes through. Would recommend to anyone who likes a beer or two.

If you have time, don't prioritise it though. If you are not into art and museums there isn't a massive amount to do in Amsterdam however the Heineken experience is something anyone who enjoys beers can get into. The tour itself is a bit strange, there is a lot of interactive activities that have zero to do with Heineken and a gift shop (over priced) that has random junk with Heineken Printed on it. You can personally label a Heineken bottle to take home however is quiet expensive also.They have a fun interactive 3D ride that takes you on a journey of how beer is made which is cool and they teach you how to pour the perfect beer which was also cool.At the end of the tour As a part of your ticket price you can two free beers which was cool however you have to stand the whole time on a very sticky floor.I recommend buying tickets before you go there so that you can skip the line, we purchased ours from the hotel we stayed at.

Something different. Well worth a visit whether you like lager or not. at 16 Euros each it looked as if it was going to be a disappointment but by the end we agreed it was a good experience and worth the money.

Interesting, but not awesome. This visit can be seen as mandatory for beer lovers, since the historic building and the brewery original equipment, for sure. For all this, my review would be excellent. But after this inicial part, it comes a "ride that brews you" attraction, that will explain how the brewing process is made from scratch in a interactive way. I'd skip that, since the line is huge and the attraction itself is a bit silly. For that, my review would be average. After this "ride", you can start sipping few small beers (awesome), with access to the rooftop bar, what is the high point of the whole visit, I guess. Well, would be at least if the organisation was a little better, since the lift queues are not organised (tons of people cutting the queue and over excited about going up), same thing on the way down, no organisation at all meaning lots of drunk people squeezing to get into the next lift (what kind of kills the positive feeling you might still have about the experience). So, overall average review for the whole experience, unfortunately.

More than a beer museum. Visited on our honeymoon expecting a museum tour of a brewery. The heineken experience is so much more. Ignore the suggestion that it takes an hour, it is closer to two and finishes in their rooftop bar where you are treated to two free glasses of their finest golden nectar. Highly recommended afternoon.
Great experience . Great experience and kept you interested throughout the tour. Never had a fresher Heineken! They gave 3 free beers!!
Great Stop!! . Very fun. First you learn about their beer. Then you get to taste it. Next is a fun experience to enjoy the visit.
Great tour. Great to learn about the background of the company and gain some hands on experience of the process as well as the tasting,friendly staff and lots to see and do in here

So so. The visit is not spectacular, it does the job of helping to understand the history of the brand but there are much better breweries to give you insights on the beer making process. I would consider this more a branding exercise.

Fun on a rainy Sunday afternoon. I wasn't expecting a lot but was pleasantly surprised. It is an homage to all things Heineken but this is expected. The exhibits on the history of the brewery and the Heinekens were engaging and well produced. Don't expect to see beer being made but they explain how it's done. There are a lot of stairs so ask if you need an elevator. The experience where you are beer is very creative, but hold on to the rail! The host at the first tasting was very funny. After that there are several interactive exhibits where you can learn to pour beer and customize a bottle of beer. There were also sports exhibits. These you can skip to get to the roof deck where you are served your next two beers. The outside deck has great views and little stand-up tables. Inside there are more tables and a stage people sit on to enjoy their beer. Everything is very well done. We spent two hours there and enjoyed it very much. At 5 on a rainy Sunday we waited 10 minutes to buy tickets. This is not something that tends or younger would enjoy.

So much fun!. I love Heineken beer so I was immediately excited for this tour but I should say I think anybody would enjoy it. It gives you an interesting history of Heineken as a family brand, their amazing marketing history and of course how beer is made. There is even a beer simulation ride!The rooftop upstairs is amazing and we did the online ticket tour where 2 beers were included so we drank them up there.

Amazing! Interactive with rooftop bar! . Had an amazing time here we got free drinks and chance to sit on rooftop bar...we will only be drinking Heineken from now on! Even had a non beer drinking with us and they enjoyed too. Epsically bottle ride...

Fun time. I would not make this your first, must see stop for your trip to Amsterdam. However, if you have an extra day, I would recommend this place. (Esp if it is a rainy or cold day)There is a lot more to this place than meets the eye. It is a longer tour than I would have thought. It is an interesting tour with lots of hands on activities. Fun to do with friends.They do give you samples at the end of the tour.
Good fun. Good, fun thing to do in an afternoon. It's a laugh and you get two drinks at the end in a rooftop bar. You don't have to be the biggest fan of beer to enjoy yourself here.

Nice brewery expirience. Pretty nice, very public relations driven, this attraction will take you through a short tour of the Heineken making and history. Most things there are not actually genuine but it is nice...I recommend going once if you're around.

Great museum, dinamyc and cool. a must in Amsterdam, interactive and dynamic museum, you learn about the history of the company, process of brewing beer and you get some beers which actually compensate the price of the ticket, so basically your visit is almost for free. Nice activity to do it with kids as well
Super fun for everyone! (even if you don't like beer!). Well worth a visit! I don't even like beer but I had a well good time! And the rooftop bar is wicked!

Good time. Interesting history of how Heineken was made, encorporates videos and aDisney like video ride which was fun. Lots of free beer plus soft drinks for the non beer drinkers. Lovely view of Amsterdam from the upper lounge. if you have never been to a beer experience tour before this is worth going to. Get tickets on line to avoid the line ups if going in the summer!!

Good day out. This trip is good value, I'm not a Heineken drinker but the tour is still interesting, the only thing I didn't like was getting plastic glasses for drinks at the end of the tour. Great views from the roof terrace

Brilliant and plenty to do!. Absolutely loved it haven't got a bad word to say about it, even if you don't like beer or even Heineken it's still worth a visit. I had a feeling it would be a quick 30-40 mins walk around the place get your 2 drinks and be on your way but In fact that wasn't the case 2 hours later we're walking out. Would highly recommend!

Great place. I didn't want to go to this. Just another place to show you how to made beer etc.Well it was fun.Yes they show you how the beer is made.There is tastings.History on the sports that there have sponsored.They still use the horses and have the staples there.Lots of place to play around on stuff which will take photos for FEW and email them to you.We had fun here.Then we made it to the roof top bar.View is great.Must do.
Heineken Experience. Fab place, the tour of the brewery is so enjoyable, all the staff are so lovely and helpful, there's loads to do in the tour and there's free beer so what's not to love ;)
Great to get out of the rain. Interesting to see but not that exciting... not a strong recommendation, as its more of a marketing exercise that you pay for, I suppose it covers the beer cost

Good fun . Fun way to spend a couple of hours, if you listen to what's being said you can 'win' a few more beers as you go around, we won everything and ended up giving the beer away to a couple of guys who were more in the mood to drink at lunchtime than we were. I will do it again one day but it took to around our 8th visit to the city to do it the first time.

Small but good tour. The Heineken experience gives you a good insight on how they make their beer. You get a look in the history of the brew and you can get the feeling of the brewery. You walk without a guide for most part of the time. At the end you get the feel on how the beer gets brewed by joining in a little ride-along. Beer tasting follows and then you go to the rooftop to get your complimentary beers (if you bought the ticket where the beers are included.) All in all a good visit at the brewery for one of the oldest beers in the world. I recommend that you buy the fast track tickets online.

Heineken Experience - Fantastic!!. This is a great tour and takes approximately 2 hours from start to finish. Of course you learn about the process of making the Heineken Beer you also learn much more about the Heineken family. Very forward thinking people who always looked after their staff. I don't want to say too much here so as not to spoil the whole experience for you!!

Interactive and fun. Most people I know that have been to Amsterdam have visited the Heineken Experience and really enjoyed it so we were looking forward to it. We had booked our tickets online because reviews said the queues were really long if you didn't. The day we went on a Sat afternoon about 2.30pm and there was a queue for paying in on the door and prepaid tickets. The prepaid tickets queue did move quicker but neither queue was very big.It is a self guided tour that you walk around but the app is good and worthwhile downloading for some extra information. There is wifi at the experience but it is a bit slow, I would recommend downloading it before you get there.The brew you ride is just a little bit of fun and you learn about the process. After that there is a tasting room where they teach you how to drink beer properly and you get a small taster to practice with. Then it is on to some interactive exhibits about Heineken's link to sport. There are photo booths where you can take your picture and they turn it into a Heineken picture. The good thing about this is it's free and you can email the photo to yourself, there is also an option to print it out for €1.The final stop is the bar where you can get 2 free pints (of Heineken or Pepsi). There is a rooftop area but you are not able to take drinks there and we were unfortunately too late to enjoy this (it closes at 5). I would definitely recommend visiting here for a fun couple of hours.

such a great time. Spent the afternoon here after getting the boat tour that we purchased with our tickets for the experience. the place is very informative and super interactive. loads of great places to take pictures. the beer is good and you have so much fun drinking in the middle of the city on a rooftop.

Well worth doing . My partner doesn't drink and enjoyed it ! Worth the money to book online. Easy to get to via the tram station and had a lovely meal just over the bridge ! The tour is fun, interactive and made me laugh out loud at times !
The best museum!!. We like Heineken and we had to visit this museum. Its very impressive and when you are in Amsterdam must see it.

Good trip. We paid 15 euros and you get 3 halves of lager in with that it's a good tour very informative and funny in places. A great amount of merchandise is sold in the gift shop and also quite a few interactive things you can do and send to your email free of charge all in all would do it again.
Brilliant. What a great time we had. Well done everyone. We loved the interactive activities. Would definatley recomend

Worth a visit . Went to the Heineken experience with my partner during our holiday in Amsterdam, paid €17 each which included two pints at the end of the tour. Overall it was a good experience it started off well with lots to see, interesting facts, and a good layout. There is a part where they "brew you" which is something different and can be very funny if you are in with a good group during the demonstration. This was followed by a taste testing of the beer. After this section however there isn't much more too see lots of adds and selfie areas but a let down after the first part. The tour ends with pints at the rooftop bar which has outstanding scenery. Worth a visit, nice to see but would only go the once.

Rooftop 👍🏻. The tour is not that much informative but it is deifinitely fun. If you love beer, you should have that experience. At the end ouf the tour you can have a beer at rooftop while enjoying the view.

Backpacker way. If you are like me, backpacking on a budget, no euros to join the experience. Go to any Amsterdam marts, buy a bottle of Heineken and enjoy. I bought mine for 1 Euro. What's nice was I don't need a can opener to open the bottle, I just need to turn the cap and 'pop' it opens. The beer was smooth to the throat, the bubbles constantly forming, the golden liquid was cold and refreshing. I had Heineken in my home country, Malaysia, they totally are different in terms of quality. Great to taste the authentic one!?
Absolutely brilliant!. It's a must do!! Very interactive and interesting. About £16pp, includes 2 drinks (Heineken or soft drinks) fab view from the top aswell

An enjoyable morning. You'll want an hour or 2 here. Easy to get to. We took the hop on hop off boat. Had pre booked tickets so went straight in. Excellent interior and loads of pictures and cool information on the walls. It's very interective as well and loads to do. You get 3 drinks in total. A must whilst in Amsterdam

Poor place. Not interesting at all. Wast of money an time. Didn't learn a lot. I suggest you go to a near by place and drink you prefer drink instead. The people there are very polite and nice. But the attraction is so 2000. Nothing spacial (even for a rainy day)

Excellent place. Everything from making it to drinking it with some funny little distractions along the way. I had a great time learning about Heineken. With great views at the 6th floor balcony while enjoying a cold one!

Superficial experience of how to do marketing. Even though it is one of the "top" things to do in Amsterdam, I would halfheartedly recommend it. My boyfriend had fun and loved it but for me personally the 16,5 euro were basically wasted. You get a brief introduction to the company and how it was founded, followed by all the different marketing initiatives that surround Heineken. It is indeed quite a cool place, lots of games and ads however it does not feel like a brewery anymore (they don't do any brewing here anymore). In the end you get a couple of beers and a chance go hang out at their bar...So, if you're into Heineken, love advertising and games it's worth it. Otherwise, I'd spent my money going to a local Proeflokaal where you can actually learn about beer.

Definitely worth it. I thought this was a great experience.We were actually kind of drunk leaving the place. We only got 3 small free drinks but they hit the spot anyway! .The tour is really cool and there's loadsa fun things to do around the factory. If the weather is nice too its lovely to sit outside the rooftop bar with the view of the city.

Fun Tour. We did the Heineken experience and it was very informative and fun. Went at 11:30 so it wasn't too crowded. Long line when we left. At the end they give you a half beer and then you have a wrist bracelet for 2 more. There are all kinds of rooms at the end of the tour where there are lots of fun activities. We thoroughly enjoyed it!

Freebies!. This is a good tour. You learn about the history, how it's made and then onto more fun stuff (eg the relation with rugby). There's loadsss of interactive things you can do along the way. I think the only fault is that when the drinks are served it all seems rushed to finish them. However, once you reach the final part you can enjoy the rooftop bar (if you can squeeze in)

Very fun and interesting.... We had a great time exploring the start of Heineken, how they are brewing the beer and then at the end we got to drink the actual thing Buy the tickets online:- you skip the (small) line at the entrance - 2€ cheaper (16€)

Nice to see. This was just a little bit of a let down , lots of young people , the staff made is interesting and fun , so fair play to them !! We all left a little let down !!! Interesting to see how beer made but apart from that was just ok !!!

Great fun. This is a fun and interactive experience. It has some interesting history and fun things to get involved with throughout the tour. Great view from rooftop bar and good value for a few hours fun and two drinks.

Boring. Found it all quite boring. Wouldn't suggest going to see unless you enjoy taking photos. There's several games that would be entertaining to young people but overall experience was dissapointing. Would not suggest wasting your money to do it

Fantastic site to visit. We visited the Heineken Museum with hope that it will be an unforgettable experience and we were not disappointed! The museum started with a brief history of the museum, there was a little confusion as to wether we were in a tour guided group as this is not very clear so we felt like we were sort of crashing another parties tour- but we did manage to get a lot of information regarding the history of Heineken. You were then able to walk through what would've been the brewing area with huge copper vats which were used to brew the beer, after that you were escorted through an area where horses were kept! Following this was your first tasting experience where you were provided with a half pint of fresh draught heinekenl There was then specific areas where you are able to take green screen photos, play fifa and some rugby games, next you were able to personalise and buy your own bottle of heineken (which was around 15euros) and finally it ended with your second half pint where you were able to sit and relax in a sort of 'fanzone' before leaving the museum.It was a great experience, I feel like there possibly could been a lot more to the tour but fantastic none the less!

Great place to visit. We were in Amsterdam for 3 days and did around 10 of the top 25 things on trio advisor. The Heineken experience was by far the best of the lot.My girlfriend loved it despite the fact she thinks beer tastes like "cats pee" The tour gives you the chance to take lots of pictures free of charge and allows you to send them to your e-mail. You also get 3 half pints which is great! (I got 6 half pints of cats pee) Great experience since Heineken is one of my favourite beers.
Best experience. Best beer experience. Really friendly and approachable stuff with the knowledge in the field of beer production!

Value for money!. A fun and inexpensive way to spend your afternoon. We visited on a saturday afternoon so it was quite crowded and hot. The staff were super nice and provided us with water and snacks while waiting in line inside the attraction. 3 beers are included in the price. Hot tip: buy your ticket online and skip the queue.
Class. Had a great experience visiting Heineken. Great beer. Lots to see and not over in 5 minutes. The place is a must if in amsterdam. You also finish the tour with a nice little boat ride.

A barrel of fun!. My boyfriend wanted to do this experience as he likes beer and heard it was good! I am not a big drinker but wanted to see what it was like! Even though I don't drink it was so interesting to see how the beer is made, what goes into it and the process. There is a beer tasting experience, a show of how the beer is made, a lot of fun games and different experiences to do as well. including a short interactive film about the beer fermentation and bottling process! At the end of the experience you go up to the roof and are given two complimentary drinks with the token on the wristband you are given at the start! Would definitely recommend!

To beer or not to beer?. Nice museum where you can learn more about the history of your favourite drink and enjoy a cold Heineken afterwards. Buy your ticket in advance to avoid a queue at the entrance. Good souveniers shop.

Great experience . Fantastic Experience in knowing how the beer is made from start to finish...also to taste the beer fresh was brilliant only day or so old from when it was brewed...great for beer lovers..would recommend to all

Left all hopped up! . I got dragged here by my boyfriend (beer fanatic) and was not expecting much. I walked out thoroughly impressed. The first section is based upon the history of the factory but still done in an interactive way with lively video displays and a section to view the Heineken horses. Then you go on an actual ride which shows you the Heineken beer making journey from water to bottle. You then visit a bar where you have your first beer, with an fun and informative demonstration by a guy behind the bar.This is where it all ramps up! So feeling all hopped (sorry) up on your first beer, you enter light displays, karaoke, put yourself in the photo sections including World Cup soccer and rugby sections. Then finally you are on the roof top bar overlooking Amsterdam with 2 extra beers poured for you in exchange for tokens on your wrist band. All in all an awesome couple of hours and would highly recommend for all ages as crazy as that sounds!

Beer tour!. Bought the normal tickets to learn about the history of Heineken. Tour consisted of the history, science, marketing and tasting of Heineken. The 2 tokens which came included with the tour were 15cl each. The view was rather nice given the right weather.Entire tour did not take more than 2hours.

Is it advertising?. Maybe you could like this type of exibition ... of course it's a self celebrating museum, with historical information, description of facilities, interactive activities and a final taste of beer (2 glasses but with same, and only, product).Think once, or twice.

Fun fun fun!!!. We went into the Heineken Experience after it being recommended by friends as a 'must do'.The staff our front were very pleasant and genuinely jolly! The museum part of the experience we really interesting, with interactive areas and demonstrations by the staff on the beer brewing process. Once your through the museum there's a whole load of activities to the part in including photo booths and props and interactive games, it's a real laugh.Included in the entrance price you receive 3 small beers, and the view from the roof terrace is fab!!

It Varies but a must see and do for anyone that likes beer. I've been here maybe 4 times in 15 years. Twice in the last 2 years. Previous VIP visits included cheese and hot snacks and beer. now it's mainly beer and cheese. Last year we had an awesome small framed woman and she did a great tour. This year we had a man who did a fine job but we missed the food part :-) Seriously, you must do the VIP package. It's well worth it.

Great Beer - And Worth Every Euro!. Fabulous 'experience', particularly when they make us into beer! A sampling at the end of the process and then 2 free beer on the rooftop. If coupled with other tours, or with a coupon, it's €17, €5 of which covers the beers. Excellent value for the money!

If Heineken did beer factory tours .... ; ). Sorry Heineken, couldn't resist. This is a really good afternoon out while in Amsterdam.The tour is brilliantly run and well staffed throughout. A complete history of the origins of the family and beer legacy. Then how the stuff is made, some science, some interactive gadgetry and overall a very interesting few hours. We also bottled our own beer and had a custom bottle printed up! A must for Heineken and non-Heineken drinkers alupa!

best value for money, fantastic and great fun. paid 18 euros to get in but we got a couple of small glasses of beer for free, all the staff working there were helpful and friendly. the best view of amsterdam when you get on the top floor bar. you get to create your own video, take photos and you can add you email to be send to you immediately. Also there is a room with champions league theme and playstations 4 you can play for free. Amazing
Great arvo sesh. Best to pre book online to avoid the huge line. I have been to the dam several times although this was my forst visit. Good view for a beer at the end best for sunset
See what's brewing . The chance to see how Heineken beer had been introduced and made great experience visually and a great chance to enjoy the free beer

Fantastic experience . For someone who doesn't even really like Heineken this was a fantastic experience. You learn the history of how Heineken was established, how the company has changed and developed over time and even experience first hand how Heineken is made. It's a must do experience when visiting Amsterdam!!
Great fun . Take the time to go it's great also the boat trip is a must the staff are fun and helpful no rush to get around and if your good you may even get a free beer 😉

Fun visit and good value. Our family of four (including a 14 year old and 19 year old) enjoyed the Heineken Experience very much. They were pushing the Heineken brand, but the videos were amusing, the "you're being made into beer" ride was fun, and the beer and soda at the end were refreshing. The view from the rooftop was worth a few euros as well. I'd say it was a pretty good value.

A must . This is a great thing to do in Amsterdam. The history of Heineken and the values of the Heineken family are fascinating. Interactive things to do which is always fun and obviously a chance to try the beer! Learnt about beer too so educational. Really friendly and knowledgable staff. The only thing that let it down was the terrible music playing in the roof top bar but amazing burgers!!
pure fun!. the tour was informative and exciting enough for tourists. We loved the games, the lights and sounds and the free beers!

Interesting and interactive, not as good as House of bols!. Interesting experience to learn about the history of heineken. Plenty to do, even if you don't like beer! Heineken included in the entrance price. If you are thinking of doing one alcohol related visit, I would suggest House of Bols instead of here.

Yum!. The tour taught us if the origins on the company and its history then about the making of the beer. There was no tour guide so we could make our way round in our own time to read as little or as much as we wanted. Included 3 beers with two of them redeemed on the rooftop complete with a terrace.

Fun few hours. Pleasantly surprised . Admittedly I didn't expect much from a brewery tour but I was pleasantly surprised. It was my boyfriends birthday so was his choice of of attraction. Get there before midday to avoid the queues. There are discount tokens in most hotel lobbies to save you a few euros. Fun for kids also. Quite interactive but also informative. The whole experience is made by the private rooftop bar at the end where you can enjoy 2 free drinks each (250ml glasses) with a beautiful view of the city. More drinks can be purchased if you're wanting to stay longer.We spent almost 3 hours there so for the €17 each we paid it was good value for money.
A good experience . This place was interesting and fun. I'm not a massive Heineken (or beer in general) fan but this was not a bad was to spend a couple of hours and I'm glad I went.

Interesting. Nice day activity, would buy tickets in advance to queue jump. Free beer and a tasting session. Demonstrators are around at certain area's but otherwise self-guided tour. The beer simulator was the highlight. Meet the Heineken horses & learn about beer! Burgers available at the end with 2 small free glasses of beer or soda

Very well done . First I'll say, in my opinion, this experience isn't really a lot of fun for children under 14The theme is all about the history of the company, it's successes and the different ways that they sponsor events where you can enjoy their beer. They also promote responsible drinking which they should.Yes, they provide juice for kids while you get beer and there are a lot of interactive activities and professional game memorabilia that my child enjoyed, it's still an adult focused (which is appropriate) tour.So for a family of young kids, I wouldn't recommend it. For an older family it could be a good time, for an an adult group it's a great time.There's a good restaurant at the end of the tour and the live band we had was terrific. Overall the experience is very good, it's not short nor rushed or lacking. You can tell they spent some time thinking about how to present themselves and making it interesting and fun.A heads up- Try not to go on a weekend or at lunch time.

Very good!!. It is a nice & cool tour where you learn the whole family history & how each generation put in different but important things to make a good & timeless product. It has everything from tour guides, interactive parts, tastings, gift shop & the 2 beers included in the price are in the roof top bar, w/ a pretty view. Definitely worth it!!

Absolutely brilliant. This is one of my favourite attractions in Amsterdam. It is very good value and very informative. The highlight for me is the tokens they give you to use in the bar at the end of the tour to obtain the excellent Heineken beer. It is made even better by people giving you their unused tokens. You struggle to leave sober.
Must do!. If you're visiting Amsterdam, this needs to be on your to do list. I had an absolute ball.. Very interactive! It was Fun to see how my favourite beer is created.

Well worth a visit. A fun experience, somewhat informative and more importantly a chance to sample some lovely beer.The 'educational' aspects of this trip were largely brushed over and felt quite rushed but then I can't say that was a surprise.

Something to do. A very commercial experience, which I'm glad I did, but wouldn't rush to return. For the price of the ticket you get three small glasses of Heineken and a talk through how the beer is brewed. You also learn the history of Heineken and get to play some interactive games as you walk through the museum. This seemed more of a huge advertisement for Heineken rather than a real brewery tour like you get in Bruges.

Good. Directed at immersing the younger generation with games, a ride and sports. No food! Get 3 small beers with $18 euro fee. Pass all the games if you are older than 40. Enjoy the history and the rooftop bar has a fantastic view.

Lager Experience. A very interesting and enjoyable experience, including a free drink during the tour and two free drinks at the end. Not a long tour, so easily fitted in with museum and canal boat trips. Close to museums.

Cool interactive tour.. Really cool experience. Starts off a bit boring but the interactive games and the bar at the end are really cool. Definitely have a go at pouring your own pint too which is good fun.
Unreal experience and amazing Tours . This place is fun and educational. Its brilliant for all ages and alot of animation and shows. Would highly recommend
Awesome. A very enjoyable tour with an unexpected twist. Finishing on a rooftop bar with free beers and a excellent view of the city. Well worth going

An enjoyable stop for anyone. You do not have to be a beer drinker or a Heineken drinker to enjoy this place. It is very well put together with several interactive stops along the walk and it is amazing to see how it was made over the years and current day.

A must do when.... Visiting amsterdam. Only 3 stars as it is more of a commercial advertising for Heineken rather than the full brewing process. In saying that it was entertaining and worth the trip. Got 3 small glasses of Heineken with our tickets. Worth doing. Only real criticism would be that the initial history of the brand is very scattered and follows no logical timeline

Interesting experience. Me and my partner attended the heineken experience to pass time, glad we did it was incredibly interesting to find out how the beer was made, good value for money as you receive 3 beers aswell as being able to explore. Along the way there are games to play, talks from the staff and finishes in a bar where you can get 2 of the beers or you can pour your own. We attended the brew ride which is only 5 minutes long but is quite interesting to see how the beer process works. My partner is difficult to please and was very happy with our visit.

Interesting tour. If you are in Netherland you have to visit where their most known beer is made, specially is you are a beer drinker. Very interesting tour and the beer taste confirms that a recent made beer is much better than the one you get at your corner store back home.

Super experience. Huh, at first, buy a ticket on the Internet to avoid queu before the Experience. People really wait outside the building. We buy tickets, than we only entered and not need to wait in the 100 m queue.It is written, that the tour takes 2hours, but for us takes 3hours, but we was tired to stay more, than we went away. If we had more time and we are not tired, we stay more. My children love the Experience and want to stay more.There is a museum, a tasting (1 dl), a 4d cinema, interactive activities and games there, and at the end you could go to the top for a beer included in ticket price. In the terrace you had a possibility to see the all town.Than, go on time and enjoy it in pleasure.

Heineken . Skipped a lot of it to be honest, just passing time and riding around the city looking for places to drink, as I'd been drinking a lot of Heineken I thought why not go to where it is made... then skip all the history. Plenty of info however and at the end you get two glasses of Heineken so all good!

Fun place and a few beers in the price !. Great place to visit to learn a bit more about the lager and have a few . Good value as you get a beer mid way through the tour then a couple more each at the end with a wrist band !! Can personalise bottle with makes a fun gift !! Fun and well worth checking out .

fun experience. I thought it will be lame to be honest but it turned out to be really fun and cool thing.it is informative about beer making process but its not boring and in the end you even get a beer and you can hang on the roof of the place so you get a chance to see a really nice view of the city and the canal.
A big commercial. My over 18 college kids loved it. I didn't enjoy it quite as much. It's basically one giant interactive commercial for Heineken beer.

BRILL. Visited here a few days ago with my partner both late 20's and we thoughly enjoyed it. It was very informative and interesting. We made a bottle with our own choice of writing on the label which was fun. It has some interactive parts which was funny. And the rooftop terrace is lovely with your free drink

Well worth it. We booked with our hotel and got tickets for €16. It wasn't too busy and we didn't have to wait for too long to get in. This is such a cool interactive tour with loads of great features and also a nice dose of history. Worth the €16 we paid for sure! If you like Heineken I suggest you take the tour!
So much fun!. This is an informative tour and includes a humorous simulation where you get to "be the beer". The tour includes free tasting. Order your tickets online to bypass a long lineup.
Nice & interesting place to Visit when you stay in Amsterdam. If you think about a musuem for beverage. You should go there. You can learn & know how your Heineken are made.

Highlight of my trip. . My boyfriend and I loved this place! Such a range of things to do there - with hands on stuff too! The staff were attentive and kind and definitely knew there stuff. Finished the day with a freshly made burger on their rooftop terrace!

Heineken Experience. If you wanna chill, enjoy a time with your friends and also understand how beer is made, this is a must-to-go place for sure...Heineken deliveries the experience of being a beer master.

Very nice experience.
