The staff all spoke very good English and were very informative, although the tour seemed to improve throughout the middle of the experience, allowing for us to get involved more and having a really good time. There's free drinks, and at the end we were given two free Heinekens upon their rooftop terrace which made us feel like VIPs. Definitely worth a visit!

Cheesy but fun. This is an interesting tour of the brewery's old building. It is however very cheesy and layered in Heineken branding and merchandise; if you went there not expecting this however then what did you think was going to happen? It's a fun story of how beer and the brand is made and includes 3 beers as well. It's worth doing (book in advance) but don't expect the unique craft beer experience of other brewery tours.

Story told as expected plus beer party!!!. After entering the hall, the first to see is the exhibition about the history of brewery and Heineken family. Then, theingredients and beer brewing process with its factory are told. After having experienced all process, all visitors will get free 1 beer drinking together. Proost !!!!! Then the guests will be invited to the rooftop and get another 2 free beer !!!!

Just an average place..nothing worth visiting . Had heard a lot about Heineken experience from friends.... so decided to visit... but turned out to be a disappointment... nothing more than an other factory visit which u would do in high school or graduation days....Only good point was the 5 minute show where they have this 4D experience..Rest, they have just added a few games, self points and video to engage ppl...not really a worth a visit..

An experience on many levels. A visit to Heineken gives you an experience on many levels. You can easy option for the self-guided tour, as all text is available in English. You begin with the history of the brewery and all the different awards they have won. From then you continue to a place where you are told more about the ingredients and brewing process. You continue the tour by visiting the old brewery halls, with big bronze kettles and all what belongs to a brewery, at this place you can also taste how an unfiltered Heineken tastes before the hops are added. Following is a visit to the horse stables, which contains Shire horses, and you might even be lucky to see them pulling the Heineken charts around the streets of Amsterdam. After the visit to the stalls, you will enter a small movie theater, giving you some sort of virtual reality feeling of being brewed like a beer. After personally being “brewed”, you will learn how to professionally taste a quality beer and the points you should focus on. The Heineken Experience finishes with many activities connected to the activities they sponsor, including the Olympic Holland Heineken House, Rugby World Championships, Football (soccer) clubs and the like. At the end of the tour, you can option to visit the Rooftop bar, where you can get two free Heineken beers (or a selection soft drinks) – The rooftop bar gives an excellent view over Amsterdam.Some areas of the Heineken Experience has on location Heineken guides which in nicely spoken English, who are all eager to respond to any questions you may have about Heineken.I think it is important to note that this is the old Heineken factory, and not the location where the Heineken beer is brewed and bottled today.

Great beer and great learning experience. We easily spent a couple of hours at the Heineken factory. Whilst beer is no longer produced here we were able to see all the traditional workings of beer production and learnt about the ingredients and process involved. We also discovered the history of the family members and their contributions to the industry and society in general. There were videos, personal talks and interactive modules. Some were informative and others were purely for fun. We were able to see the horses in their stables, having just returned from one of their twice daily promotional walks. We were taught how to pour beer correctly and also how to drink it properly. There was a total of three beers included in the entrance fee -one for the learning and two for enjoyment. We enjoyed ours up on the sky deck with a burger. Plenty of merchandise was available to purchase and we even ordered a personalised bottle with our names and the year on it.
Heineken tour. Super fun, and great beer! This is a must do for the full Amsterdam experience. The tour is interesting and interactive, and you get two Heineken lager at the end.
High price for autocelebrating Heineken family. Too expensive and very few Interesting information. Nice for kids for social issues and games. No gluten free bier at all!

Interactive and educational . It is a fantastic place to visit no matter you are a beer lover or not. It is very educational to tell you the production of beer, the ingredient and the history. Make sure you reserve at least an hour after visiting the front part as the fun part is yet to come. They have so many interactive games that it seems to be an amusement park to me. For teenagers , you can always order soft drink for the 2 complimentary beers. And you can make a personalised bottle of beer with your name on at a reasonable fee.

Average. €16 to visit. An average type exhibition. Nothing outstanding about the visit. 2 free beers included in the price which you receive at the end of the tour where you can drink and enjoy the views over Amsterdam. A very simple "ride" which involved standing on a floor plate which moves slightly. All signs and speakers are in English which is helpful.
Fun tour! . Located a few minutes work from the main museums, so very easy to get to. Really enjoyed the tour, was fun and very interactive!! Would highly recommend a visit!!

Heineken 2016. We had a guided tour around the experience, Ellen our guide was lovely, warm and very friendly. Fun place with a range of different things to-do including selfie spots on the floor, been bottled like a beer was fun and different. Large gift shop, however in the bar area the floor was very sticky so don't leave your bags down. Overall a very good experience.

Fabulous, entertaining experience - much better than expected!. This place had been recommended and as a group of four, travelling to Amsterdam on a day trip, we decided this would be a good place to start! I'd booked our tickets online, so we walked straight in and didn't have to queue and were given our wrist bands with two tokens for two beers.The tour starts with me historical background about the heineken family and how the franchise all began, before we moved on to the ingredients and how the beer is actually produced. Throughout the tour, there were plenty of opportunities to get involved with photos, videos and games which were amusing and entertaining. I found the process of the beer making really interesting (much more than I thought I would) and I think this was down to how well executed the place was.The beer tasting stop was great and made us take pause to examine our small beer, after our 4D experience, rather than just down it! Then it was chance to use our tokens and enjoy two heinekens (or one if you wanted to put it yourself.)We thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Only gripe, would be we would have rather exchange one of our tokens either at the start or the middle of the tour, rather than both at the end.

Super fun activity!. Super fun, dynamic and complete experience. I recommend buying the tickets in advance since the line at the door could get long. The Heineken Experience teaches you about the history, composition, taste, making, and processes of the beer in a fun, modern and interactive way. We really enjoyed it. At the end you get 2 free beers that you can enjoy in a beautiful rooftop terrace. Enjoy!!

Fantastic Tour. We loved this tour. Very informative and I like how it's self guided, where we can take our time. Had plenty to drink (3 free). Balcony has a great city view. You can even personalize your own bottle for €6,50. Lots of interactive fun. Must check it out!

Unique Experience! . Different from other museums in town. Beer is waiting for you at the end. You have the option to bypass the step by step tour and head straight for the rooftop bar where the Heinies are aplenty. I was thirsty so I chose the express lane.

Fun fun fun. Really enjoyed this experience. Whilst I am not a drinker was great to get to know the background. Also great views if you go to the sky bar for the drinks afterwards. Take part I the experience of a virtual bike ride, scoring a try at the rugby and a goal at the football. It was great we could email these experiences without any extra costs as well. Go for it and enjoy
NICE. we had a very nice VIP tour:)) the guide was friendly and funny, it was interesting to tast beer, also I got some presents:)
Fun experience . Went with my boyfriend. Fun way to spend an hour or 2, lots of interactive games and very fun! Great view of the city from the bar at the top!

An exciting experience ,, friendly staff ,ma good 2 hour fun. Authentic experience , Heineken keen on showcasing the history and legacy of this company . The visit is fun , and full of facts and hands on experiences and a drink of a small Heineken glass . Price is ok at around 20 euros .

One of the better brewery tours I've been on. My cousin and I recently visited the Heineken Experience. The staff were very welcoming and the exhibits they had on were informative and engaging. The tasting was particularly welcome, and put at the right moment (we were quite thirsty at that time!).  All in all, without giving away the features, everything regarding Heineken origins and branding was explained. The other side to the experience was the actual brewing process, which in my opinion could have been better illustrated by exhibits similar to that of the Heineken history exhibit.  The beer at the end of the tour was very appreciated. Thanks to the whole team at Heineken. Proost from the UK!

Brilliant brewery . With so much to do in Amsterdam it makes it difficult to decide which attractions are best. This was definitely worth the experience. The Heineken experience let's you know about the history of Heineken, whilst entertaining you on your way through. Buy your tickets in advance that way you don't have to wait, just walk on in and enjoy your visit. A very good place to visit. Also it's close to the hard rock cafe so you can easily walk across there after to enjoy the evening.
Very interesting . Had fun with the Heineken Experience. I would definitely recommend it. It's an interactive experience that is well worth the money. Great beer tasting at the end also.

Great tour with lots to see. As far as brewery tours go it ticks the boxes. Learn about the brand, and get beer at the end! This tour however is really well thought out and has lots of interactive things to experience as well as a strange little "ride". The bar at the top has a good view over Amsterdam and clearly has plenty of beer to drink. You get two free 25cl beers, but can buy more for 2.5 Euros a pop. Good place to visit if its raining also!

Beer Beer Beer!. Wow! The Heineken Experience was the first thing I went for in Amsterdam, and I strongly recommend you do the same when you visit the Sin City. The building is just great, Brick factory feel on the outside yet very modern when you walk in. To avoid queuing outside, purchase your ticket online and just pick it up at the second door. The experience starts off with the history of Heineken, what it stands for and so on. Further on you get to see how the beer is made, the ingredients, the machines. The place is techy and visual so it creates a very interactive run-through which makes it more enjoyable. Towards the end, you can take pictures and play some games but the very best part is the two complimentary beers you get with the ticket, and that s not all; you get to enjoy those beers on the roof! amazing terrace with a wonderful view accompanied by an awesome beer. Before you finally exit, you get to visit the store where you can purchase plenty of souvenirs, but in my opinion, the best one was the personalised beer bottle with your name on it.

Entertraining and interesting. It was interesting to see the history and the manufacturing of the beer. Great idea, that they made a lot of entertraining (photo shooting with football champion area, funny karaoke video making, riding tour etc.)In the end we get 2 glasses free heinken, its included.The view is beautiful from the top bar :)

Very cool experience . I'm not a big beer drinker but this was pretty cool to see. Bought just the basic ticket that guide yourself with. The history, how they make their beer on the premises and you'll get a chance to drink 3 beers, 1 at a 'tasting' during the tour and the other 2 on the rooftop of the brewery which offers wonderful views of Amsterdam. Of course if beer isn't your thing, they'll give you pop instead when you get to the rooftop part. Near the end of the tour you can have a chance to purchase a bottle which is filled with beer with any name you want included on the label. You can get 2 for 10 euros which is very much worth it.

A lot of fun & so much good beer!. My friend's & I really loved this experience. It was interactive & fun and kept us busy for a long time with it's many things to do & see. Also, we got o much free beer, who can complain about that. World class attraction, I would recommend to anybody visiting the city!!

Amazing experience. I visited the Heineken experience on my first day in Amsterdam which I would recommend as you will appreciate the beer so much more for the rest of your trip as it is everywhere and you will drink a lot of it trust me! The experience itself was amazing, learnt so much about all aspects of the brand, from Heineken himself to how to brew the perfect Heineken beer, and there is also a stables in which I personally loved as they were beautiful! There is a section where you can print onto your own bottle, and section for football lovers, the evolvement on the design and even a virtual part which was better than I expected! The tour also included a beer tasting section which tells you how to drink Heineken the right way! The tour ended by taking you up to the rooftop bars where you can use your 2 wristband tokens to collect your Heineken beers, my brother and mum didn't want them however there was a coke option for them which they could receive with their tokens aswell! We started on the outside bar which over looked the city which was beautiful before heading into the inside bar which was lovely and played good music! At the end of the tour you end in the gift shop which sell everything and anything with the obvious Heineken name printed. Overall an excellent experience and brilliant price for what is involved, would definitely recommend this to everyone!

Overrated tour of a brewery, lots of free beer. Be sure to buy tickets ahead of time. Once we found the other line, we were able to jump the queue, that was quite long and walk right in. The experience is more like a museum, talking about the founders, then how the beer is made, they show you the horse stables, then they brew you, serve you beer and then share with you the sporting events they've sponsored. I was bored of reading all the PowerPoint presentations and was really hoping to end up in an actual factory and see beer being brewed, but that's not the case. I really felt we were being indoctrinated with Heineken marketing. We were given one free beer sample as part of the tour and on the conclusion of the tour we could have gone to the patio to have two more beers (included when you purchase online from their website ahead of time). The gift shop had some cool novel items.

Fun museum, especially the ride! . We went here on a very rainy day which was perfect. It is an interesting museum -- you learn about the history, production and get a few opportunities to taste. The exhibition is interactive with lots of games, things to look at and a brilliant ride!

AMAZING. My wife , some friends and I were in Amsterdam this year and stayed for three days.And the third and last day we decided to visit Heineken Experience that was for me one of the best places in town. For those who love beer is an amazing tourist attraction.

One of Holland's best brands worldwide!. Recently we took a few of our Italian friends to the Heineken Experience. Strangely enough while never having been there ourselves despite being Amsterdam locals. We went on a Saturday afternoon but since we bought combination tickets including also a canal tour to the A'dam tower via the Heineken Boat, we were able to skip the huge cue and truly had the full Heineken experience. And despite our initial critical position towards the 'experience' bit (how much can a museum claim to be an experience), in the end we can only say: it truly is a phenomenal experience! Definitely recommended to go there in the weekend, we had a live band playing there at the end as well. Not sure if they play during the week.Tip: buy tickets online and avoid the long cues that are always there.Tip2: buy the Rock the City Combi tickets, totally worth it!

Not really worth the 18 euros. It was 18 euros per person, it includes 3 250ml draft beers (one during the tour and 2 with coupons)The tour lasts 1h to 1h30 and explains the process for brewing the beer, the history of the foundation of the company, and shows a lot of publicity of Heineken.My money could/should have been better invested elsewhere
Beer Heer. A very cool and innovative approach to a brewery tour. Very interactive. Finishing with a couple of cold ones is the bonus.

Great experience. Really enjoyed this. I didn't want to go initially but my boyfriend did so I gave in and went. The staff were so friendly. Lots of free beer which got me a bit drink since I hadn't eaten much that day! Would definitely recommend here.

Informative History. This tour took you back to the history of the brewery. That part was very informative. Then it becomes more theme park like with interactives, selfie opportunities, so called "rides". A massive section dedicated to sponsorships and then of course your two free beers...No opportunity to get to the roof top this time! That was closed. The free drinks area is geared for the young with lots of loud music. Maybe on the roof top it may have been more appealing.
Great for beer lovers. I really enjoyed the Heineken experience. Following the journey of how the beer is made and then finally getting to taste the final product.

Perfect way to learn about Heineken!. This experience is a must do in Amsterdam. Great rooftop view, beautiful history and a lot of souvenirs. Never ever skip this when in Amsterdam. Watch out for the long queue though. So come early.
Great. Heineken beer museum visit was teaching , nice , especially structured and highly recommended for those who do not know the walk in preparing the perfect beer .
Good trip!. Cheap to go to and free beer. Theres also a free boat cruise. I would take the tram from dam square if you don't like walking though.

Great Experience . We really enjoyed our visit here. Buy your ticket from the tours and tickets places that are all over Amsterdam and save money. Extra drinks, burgers and the gift shop are all reasonably priced too. Definitely worth a visit.

If you like lager & advertising !. Having worked in the drinks sector for 40 years, and visited many breweries in that time, this is an average tour of how the product is made ( but not made at this site). After the tour of HOW the product is MADE, you then get to see HOW the product is SOLD, i.e. marketing & advertising. If you are interested in advertising then you will be right at home, as Heineken are very good at it. I would rather have seen a real brewery at work. Its not to expensive to get in, 17euro each and you do get a few small samples.

Plenty to drink. . First of all pre book your tickets as they may be a big queue if not. It is a tour of the old factory including the history and how they make the beer. You also go to a tasting room where you are taught how to drink beer. You are give 2 free half pints of Heineken with your entry band which is given when you arrive. I heard that there was a rooftop bar but this wasn't open on the day went. It wasn't the best brewery tour that I have been on, I think they could learn a lot from the Guinness tour in Dublin. Never the less myself and group did enjoy ourselves.

Excellent attraction . Very good attraction. Lots to see and do, it is a very interactive experience. The staff helping around the exhibits were very helpful and friendly.However the staff in the bar at the top of the experience were incredibly rude and unhelpful whilst offering a slow service serving drinks. At one point they ignored the very long queue of customers waiting to be served to have a gossip! (2 females and 2 males). The tour ends with this bar in which you redeem a drinks coupon however with this service the end of the tour was ruined. What a shame, as the rest of the experience was brilliant.

A fun experience. It's an interesting experience and I probably would have enjoyed it more if I was a beer lover ;) A little touristic (OK very touristic) but still a fun activity to fill an afternoon
Commercial indoctrination. The experience was alright. It was essentially a crash course in all of Heineken's marketing. Kitchy, yet fun

A must-go if you like beer.. Tells you some of the history behind Heineken. You also get a bracelet with 2 drinks included totaling 2.5 beers.Well worth a visit if you like beer or is interested in beer. You can also bring people under 18 but they get Pepsi instead of beer.
Very interesting . We loved it. We enjoyed the tour from the start to the roof where we enjoyed our beers and burgers! Definitely a must when visiting Amsterdam

Pure marketing from Heineken . This is just a glorified advert for Heineken. You wait in a long queue only to pay 18 euros to see a few beer vats, some horses and have a 'beer drinking masterclass' ( yeah, this consists of someone telling you to tip the glass when drinking but extra beer is provided here). My boyfriend came here a couple of years back and said back then it was more about the history of Heineken and how the beer is made with staff on hand to explain. That seemed to have been replaced by gimmicks like writing your name on a beer bottle and having a play station where you can play fifa. And to everyone saying there's free beer....no! You paid 18 euros for two half pints!

Very good . We really enjoyed our Heineken experience. I recommend, the trip is very fanny it shows you how the beer is made. We got 2 free beers . On the roof you can enjoy the view and eat a delicious hamburger. For kids there is soda.

It really is an experience!. I am not a beer person. I just went to the Heineken experience as my hubby dragged me there. We got a Holland pass that also enabled us with 2 free beers.But, oh my god.. The science and the history of it.. Is amazing.. The the simulation where you, yes you, get brewed and actually experience what it is to be a Heineken bottle was unparalleled. Amazing. I was a giggly happy teenager when those 5 mins were over.The photo booth and the karaoke at the end were so cute as well. I loved the experience in general. It really was mind blowing.

It was OK. They try to make it fun and interactive and if you are into beer it's a good way to learn more about the history of Heineken. The ticket price includes two free beers at the end of the tour. I thought they would have a food menu for purchase to go with the free beers, but the only thing they had were hamburgers. The view from the roof top was beautiful!

Not as impressive as other brewery tours. Pointless 4d heineken experience, being shaken around with bubbles coming from the ceiling. You just walk through yourself with no information being given.You will be given a wristband, at no time were we told that you can use this on the rooftop to get 2 free drinks! Overall, disappointing. We wouldn't visit again.

Fantastic!. Visited with my boyfriend during a short stay in Amsterdam, we went in the morning so it wasn't very busy. All of the old brewing machines are amazing to see with lots of history included in them all. Lots of interactive things to do which meant that your visit is extended, the ride that turns you into a beer is fun too! Having a few beers included is great, especially on the rooftop bar with the barbecue on! Would definitely go again!

Fun!. Some friends told us that the Heineken Experience was fun so we went there. The tickets were a little pricy but it was very informative and definitely fun! The staff is friendly with a sense of humour. The technology is amazing, there's a lot of creative and interactive spots. And the delicious beers at the end of the visit were very good too :)
Heineken. Was a very interesting visit even got to pour my own pint at the end beer tasting was nice to never tried it before and I must say I like it now ha

Fun. At times it did seem like one big paid-for advert for Heineken but there was the good mix of educational stuff, history stuff, interactive stuff and, of course, free beer stuff. Worth going for the view from the roof-top bar.

Upgrade to the VIP Experience!. We decided to upgrade to the VIP experience and I am so glad we did! We got line by pass and a private tour of the facility. As we made our way through, our guide brought us to areas to skip the crowd and areas not open to the public (Like seeing the horses up close!).The best part of the tour was our private beer tasting with paired cheeses. It was nice to sit back and relax and try beers we haven't ever tried before. After the tasting, we went to the rooftop patio (closed to the public) and enjoyed the beautiful city views, with of course, more beer! Definitely a lovely experience and would highly recommend to a group, friends, or couples.
Really fun and interactive. Loved it especially getting to pour my own beer! Only downside was the fact horses are kept there so I question how they are treated and why they are there..
Worth the try. A fun new experience in which u get to know how heineken is made with many fun games inside and a free beer at the end The staff are friendly too very helpful
fun!. I'm personally not a beer drinking but I still really enjoyed visiting here! All the staff were super friendly and it was a fun experience.

Eh..... Ok attraction. Reminded me of like any other amusement park tour. Clean and informative. A little "tourist trap". If you only have a few days in Amsterdam, don't be upset if you miss this one. 4 days or longer, yes. A good place to visit. They serve a couple of beers on the roof top to you when the tour is done. They do it in a classy fashion but the tourist trap feel (exit through the gift shop) feel is there

Not just about the beer.. I arrived here not knowing whether I would like it as I'm not a beer drinker. I left loving the place! It starts with the history of the brewery and it's brand. Taking a walk through the old brewery and a visit to the cart horses, you walk into the most amazing interactive displays you could imagine. You get to know what it feels like to be a bottle of beer, pour the perfect pint, do some green screen karaoke, play on the ps4 and buy bottles of beer with your name etched on them and much more. All this is followed by a trip to the rooftop bar to enjoy 2 free drinks and an amazing view of the city. While we were in the bar, the most amazing live band started playing so we stayed on for some extra drinks while they played. Soft drinks are also available for non drinkers and children which makes it a great day for all ages. I'd happily pay it a return visit.

Visit to Heineken . The tour is interesting but it has less in common with other brewery tours I participated. In fact is different: the idea of brewing is spoiled by the idea of being commercial. The ones who love taking pictures of themselves in a lot of different scenes, putting their names on beer bottles and playing on a console, will love it.

Not too bad. This tour was fairly average compared to some I have done. We got some cheaper tickets from a ticket office, which are easy to find around the city. It wasn't too busy when we got there so it moved along nicely. I would have preferred a guided tour as this one had a number of gimmicky sections focused on marketing and photo booths, etc. but we didn't find that there was a really prominent amount of information about the actual beer itself. 2 small glasses at the end was expected but nothing to wow us.

Great fun and "free" beer!. Really enjoyed Heineken experience. Read someone's review that said it was a glorified advert for Heineken, which I suppose it is to an extent, but there's so much interactive stuff, there's even horses! A beer tasting and beers on the roof terrace after. Great value for money, well worth doing.

Emjoyed. Had a great time here, learned a little about brewing, lots of interesting information on how the beer has grown into a worldwide brand, even had a ride where you are brewed and bottled! Which was fun! Enjoyed a free drink on the rooftop bar to boot.

Very fun and entertaining experience. I was unsure whether I wanted to do this tour and I am so happy I did. The line moved very quickly and there is a lot to see and do when you go in. First there is a self-guided tour through the history. Then a lesson from a life person on what goes into the beer. After a tour of the original beer making facility, you experience a "3D" ride of how beer is made and bottled. After that you go through lots of fun and interactive games and exhibits. Finally you end at the roof for a rock concert and your two free drinks. Very fun day for all!

The Heineken Factory. We pre-purchased tickets which saved us lining up and could walk straight in. A must as it shows the history of the brand and how it has changed during the years and what is being planned.

A must if in Amsterdam. This usually costs €18 but only costs €16 if you get the hop on/ hop off bus discount. There is an audio tour available or staff telling you about areas as you go round. Informative and well laid out. Films and tasting on the way round. There is interactive things to do on the upper floor. You end up on the roof were you have your free drinks and a view of Amsterdam. Well worth a visit
Nice decent tour. Nice tour explaining history about Heineken. Some fun stuff to do inside besides Beer History.the rooftop cafe is nice to have beer.

The VIP tour was excellent . I was very impressed with the VIP tour, the guides were very friendly and knowledgeable. The tour is well laid out and I found it very interesting. With the VIP tour you get to taste 5 extra beers which they match with a cheese, I had not come across this type of matching before but I was pleasantly surprised at how well it worked. I throughly enjoyed the tour and also the view from the rooftop bar at the end of the tour is very good.

Not worth it. Before getting in, we had to wait about 20 min, which is normal on a saturday afternoon. But what happened after that was disappointing. They let in too many people, its overcrowded, you can't stop to have a look at something because people are pushing you. Inside, we had to wait about 30 mins for watching a video then finally got 2 dcl of beer. At the end we would have to wait in a huge row again to get another glass of beer so we rather left. The only good think there was the signed shirt of Paolo Maldini... Find rather a local brewery and have an actual beer instead of heineken water :)
So good. First time in Amsterdam and I really really enjoyed the Heineken experience was so much fun and had free tokens for beer! Was a Lil tipsy!

Very tourist-y. We had a good enough time at Heineken but it has some of the most 'tourist' areas that I've seen (fake production video ride, lots of photo machines, custom beer bottle, etc...). The tastings and history were interesting. W

Fun Day Out. I'm not even a big beer drinker but joined friends for the Heineken Experience one afternoon, and I had a really great time! Loved learning about the coming abouts of Heineken and the families history, the making of the beer, a taste testing and then the interactive games and fun at the end of the tour! After the tour you get two beers if you purchase the more expensive your at reception. I would recommend to anyone visiting whether you like beer or not!

Disappointing . We visited on Saturday 13th August 2016 with a 'skip the line' ticket ordered online. The ticket was at a discount to the actual entry price. Whilst this meant we skipped the line outside it didn't mean we avoided the large queues inside.It was interesting to find out about the history of the family behind Heineken, but there were bottlenecks in certain places especially on the stairs and subsequent queues to the 4D attraction. In essence, it was a self guided tour with staff at certain points so you could ask questions.In the end we decided to skip the 4D attraction & took the lift to the rooftop. This where you can redeem your two tokens - obtained when you enter - for a couple of beers. If the weather is nice you'll be able to have your drink on the rooftop overseeing Amsterdam. This is by far the most enjoyable part of the experience.Overall, I would recommend that you skip the tour itself & find something else to do with your time in this most cosmopolitan of cities.

Waste of time and money. We wanted a canal cruise to see Amsterdam from a different perspective, away from the crowds. Seeing a trip combined with the brewery tour and savings to be made we gave it a go.The screen above the cashier showed Brewery experience, 2 beers, canal trip and lookout tower, 25 euros each.The brewery experience started with a little history and then a explanation that beer is made from 4 ingredients. If one drinks beer one should know what it is made of. After that the tour degenerated into a Heineken advert.It finished with a trip to the top of the building where there were some decent views over the city. We were also allowed 2 small glasses of Heineken.Then to the boat tour where the Heineken boat was replaced by a standard canal cruiser. There was a little notice on our table stating that earphones would be provided and could be plugged in to one of many languages. No earphone and no commentary.The trip started with the guide saying we would be travelling for 30 mins and then getting off to go up the lookout tower.Sure enough, after 25 mins the guide said that the end of the trip was approaching and we had to get off, show our tickets and we could go up the tower.To get back there was a free ferry to Central Station from where we could make our own way back to the starting point on the other side of the city.Most other canal cruises are circular and last between one and one and a quarter hours.So we got off and joined the queue for the tower. Approaching the front of the queue we could see each person being offered to have their photo taken for free.We declined and took the express lift to the viewing platform. The lift had good animations and the viewing platform was impressive. Then down the lift where surprise, surprise, the prints of the free photos were now on sale.So then, a free ferry ride (free to everyone) and then work out how to get to our starting point.I am amazed Heineken, taking into account their ethical stance, allow their name to be used in such a manner.

5* which surprised me!. I didn't think a brewery tour would be up my street but I genuinely enjoyed this well thought out, engaging museum.A particular highlight was the rooftop bar with two free heinekens to enjoy with views over amsterdam.
Huge queue before you can get in. but it's a must. Really funny experience! It's a guided tour that ends up with two free drinks! Highly recomended ♥

Used to be better!!. We came back to do the Heineken tour after we had so much fun doing it last time (about three years ago) but they have changed it so much! Dont get me wrong, it was a great tour and very well explained but it was very interactive and hands on last time and you could even try pouring a real beer! There was more computer generated stuff now and probably more family friendly. The rooftop bar now is quite good and definitely worth chilling at the end of the tour, especially with the amazing burgers they sell there. Overall pretty good, but secretly wishing it didnt change.

Totally worth it!. First of all: DO NOT BUY JUST THE TOUR! You gotta go for the "Rock the city" tour that you can purchase on Heinneken Experience website. This tour includes the tour on their old factory, a boat tour and A'dam Lookout. It's the perfect combo and it costs only €25! If you buy it separately it costs almost €40.

Must visit ! . Great fun, you learn about the hiatory of heineken itself plus about the process of making beer, very immpressive factory, very interactive, at the end you get 2 free beers which is great but even if you dont like heineken that much like myself it is still very much worth a visit!

Super cool!! . I must confess that I don't usually drink Heineken but I've decided to go. I do not regret!! :) It was a really nice experience to know more about Heineken's history and of course to have a couple of beers in the end of the visit. :) By the time I've arrived in the rooftop that was a live band which made the end even better!
Nice Experience. I have been with some friends, it is a nice experience to do. It is an interesting museum, where they explain how to make the beer and you Can taste it as well

LOUNGE AND SECURITY SERVICE TERRIBLE! . Myself and 2 friends enjoyed most of the tour of the brewery and what felt at the end like being in an advertisement for the beer until...we were in the bar! Go figure! First the tour ends in the gift shop so we had to ask how to get to the lounge...the entrance seemed hidden. We made it up to a beautiful lookout of Amsterdam and ordered our complimentary pints. The bartender served all 3 of us both at the same time. We thought that was weird until it made sense that they wanted everybody out in 15 minutes. Needless to say, we did not enjoy our beer or the scenery because the security was hurrying us and everyone out at 8pm! The staff at Heineken seemed apologetic but the security staff couldn't care less...their shift was obviously over! I work in hospitality and I've seen it all, but this rudeness of the security takes the cake! I'd understand if we were being boisterous or causing some sort of scene, but this wasn't the case. To top everything off the security guards took the elevator down to the main floor with us and a group of other visitors and patronized us by baiting us with "What's wrong ladies?" Sensing our displeasure with the treatment we received. At that point, no one in my group wanted to have words with the guards...we were in an elevator with other guests! But he wouldnt take our silence and kept badgering us to tell him "what was wrong." I am obviously more apt to write this review now instead of arguing with him. To sum up... this is a review of the Heineken Experience but more so of the security company with whom they have a contract. Heineken, I would advise either a) Do not admit guests at 7pm or near the time when security finishes their shift and/or b) do some customer service training with all staff including security. We looked forward to this excursion while visiting Amsterdam and for the price we did not expect nor enjoy the ridicule and embarassment we received.

Sure you'd have to do this.... Video / interactive tour and commentary about the history and founder of the world famous beer. Green screen / PS4 and funny activities to keep everyone happy,Brewing room/ Stables / Tasting room, finished off with a roof-top view over Amsterdam.

It's not all about the beer. Visited not knowing what lay ahead, other than 2 beers which were included in the entry price! Really interesting learning all about Heineken, how to pour, drink and enjoy! A really worthwhile afternoon visit.

Really decent tour. Went on the Heineken experience and found the 2 hours really good fun. Plenty of exhibits and staff were really enthusiastic. Interactive ride was the highlight of the trip along with the free beer. Rooftop bar was an excellent place to conclude and we came away with our own personalised beer bottle and a good feeling about the whole experience.

Amazing experience!. This is an amazing experience that anyone - even those who are not beer fanatics - should visit. Very educational and fun at the same time. I used the silver ticket that is included in the Holland Pass. The free beer at the end wraps up the experience perfectly!
Heineken experience. Got tickets from an agent on leidsestraat saving €2 each.a very informative visit. 2 free small beers too.

Really good place to visit . Enjoyed our visit here and was better than I expected! Had a lot of history regarding Heineken family and lots of information on how the beer is made and then as you walk through there are a lot of interactive stops that are all good fun and free to email yourself the end results of photos etc. Atmosphere on roof top bar is really good and staff are very quick to serve and friendly! Great views over the city

Great tour interesting and interactive . Would recommend to people who want to know more about bear making and the story behind Heineken. Great interactive tour with lots to see and do. The personalized print on the beer at the end was a bit of a rip off, plus they messed up my bottle and printed my name and not what we had written and only realized at the airport when I was emptying the beer to do the check in. Apart from that, great tour and just wish we got more to sample.

Well worth a visit. When you arrive you are given a wristband with two tokens attached, each of which can be exchanged for a glass of beer at the end of the tour. The tour shows how the beer is brewed, and how a perfect glass of beer is poured. Very interactive and the staff were very friendly and spoke great English. Well worth a visit.
Pretty good. Good fun, interesting throughout, little bit expensive but probably worth it. The rooftop cafe at the top is delightful, have a beer.

Fantastic -worth a visit. Me and a friend visited, brought the tickets through the hop on hop off bus, also didnt have go wait in que which was great! the tour was very informative, fun and interactive. great amount of free beer. Would recommend to others.

Brill. Loved all of this experience, I bought a bottle with a personalised sticker on it only to go and pick it up and be told it's not allowed in hand luggage (luckily this was resolved easily at the airport) roof bars is great who can't complain with 2 free beers and some great music would recommend and visit again
Must-see for beer lovers!. An interesting "museum"--definitely a must see, especially for beer lovers (there's beer tasting!) It was quite an experience!

Great fun. The men in our group wanted to take this tour and as a non beer drinking female of a certain age I went along thinking that this was going to be a bit of a bore. How wrong could I be. The tour was interesting, great fun and I even enjoyed the beer!
Former brewery, money machine today. Horrible experience, waiting 30 minutes in a narrow and crowded space to see an outdated 3D. The rest is OK, but overall..... a shame for such a good beer.;)

Free beer. Great afternoon, buy your tickets before you get there from Tickets and Tours works out cheaper. Lots of interesting facts, beer tasting and fun interactive activities. Get 2 free drinks at the end and 1 while doing the beer tasting where they teach you how to drink larger properly lovely roof top bar at the end of the tour with a great view.

Great for young guys. An interesting tour that is basically a combination of Heineken family history and brand promotion/marketing. The tour is largely directed at the beer market clientele of 20-30 year old males. Since I am not in that demographic much of the tour was not too appealing to me personally. You do get a couple of beers included with the price at the end of the tour and that was nice. If you're not a young guy there are probably better ways to spend limited time in Amsterdam.

'Pretend you're a bottle, bubbling along' . This was such a charming tour of the Heineken factory. The tour was interesting, the beer was fab (naturally) and it passed a few hours. If you're buying a t shirt from the gift shop, be wary- the sizes are huge!

Nice Expreience. Having beer and witnessing how its made is truly an amazing experience, The tour is beautifully organized at every level and process of Beer making, Got to learn how to really drink "BEER" :-).
The free gift and beer tasting is wonderful.
Great . We paid for the VIP tour well worth paying the extra, guide was very informative and knew what he was talking about. Lovely place and lots to do, thankyou Joost.
Nice place!. Even if you're not really into beer history, it's a cool place with attractions to almost everyone and you get some free beer :)

Fun beer tour!. At first, the tour felt like it had a lot of queues and I honestly was not loving it. You wait in a long line for what they describe as simulation where you become a beer bottle. I had no idea what they meant. In the end it was definitely worth it!! It reminded me of the honey I shrunk the kids ride in Disney world - but shorter! There are fun photo booths and other simulations later on that would be great for friends/couples. You end on the roof. There's a lot of indoor space, but the outdoor space would be ideal on a nice day. It was worth the trip!

Pretty cool!! . Everyone always talks about the Heineken Experience like its amazing and we wanted to know what all the fuss was about!We didn't have a guided tour but the museum is very well thought out. You get a bit of history, see some horses, and even a little 'theme park ride' but I won't give it away- you should see it for yourself!! Then you get to do some pretty cool things like take photos and a video singing karaoke (won't give it all away either) and I REALLY liked the 'email it to yourself ' option on the photos because not everyone can afford or wants a physical momento of the museum. The tour ends on the rooftop bar where you get two free drinks and great views of the city. The sun even came out for us!!

Fantastic. I loved it here we spent two hours enjoying learning how the beer was made and the extra fun attractions in the building also made our day. I loved the fact we got our own personalised beers too would definitely come again in the future. The roof top bar where you receive your two free beers was also amazing looking at the views over Amsterdam and enjoying a ice cold beer. The staff were very friendly and I loved the free tasters we also got as we went around.

An interesting experience . Had fun on the tour especially when they had a little quiz. Got myself an extra beer to drink!! The lights, the selfie stations and the rooftop was simply amazing...the rooftop also has an amazing view of the city.

Good fun!. There was no queue when we arrived (11am) so went straight in.It was really interesting to learn about how it's made and also had really fun things to do.A free drink to do taste testing and two free drinks in the sky bar after.Recommend!

They go all out!. There are so many things to see here and then you get to drink beer! Between the movies, the brewing experience, the virtual games and the ride--that would seem like enough fun for one day. Then the rooftop bar with your two free drink buttons!! This visit is worth the price of admission!! Lots of fun for your hard to please millennials.
Highlight!. Even though I don't drink j really enjoyed this. Lots of fun interactive things to do and take part in and I giggle all the way through the "ride". Would definitely recommend
Drunk . O my god this was a good day out. 2 free drinks plus the tester. This was a good experience of how beer was made really enjoyed this day out

Fun. It was a nice experience to understand the making and history of Heineken. The best part was a kind of simulator wherein they actually brew the audience😂.. Ofcourse the couple of fresh tap beer glasses was fun too

Very enjoyable. A really good tour but it could have done with the beers included in the tour being larger.
Well worth going but wouldn't take the kids

Feel like beer. This place is worth a visit even if you're not a crazy beer fan, they will explain you all about beer starting from the ingredients to how it is actually made, they will also put you in a room with some people and treat you like beer from mixing to heating and cooling. 🍻

If you like beer... .. then it's a must-see. I thought "yeah why not go to Heineken's tour too while we're here". But it was far better than expected. A nice tour through Heineken's history, a lot of interactive gimmicks and a really friendly staff were waiting for us! At the end of the tour we got 2 beers (or sodas for the non-beer-lovers) at the roof terasse.

Enjoyable time. Compared with other brewery tours, this one was probably better than most. Beer was great, but I was expecting to try the new "41" beer they now make. One of the workers said it was available at the bar, but it was not.We had fun, but not a 5-star experience.

Surprisingly great. I wasn't expecting much but I was pleasantly surprised. We bought tickets the day before so we got to skip the queue. Really enjoyed the history, tasting and the rooftop garden. Definitely worth going too.

Excellent day out. This is a great place to visit. Its very informative about the process of making beer and the history of Heineken, but its done in an interesting and fun way. At the end of the tour there are lots of interactive and fun things to do. The best bit is the rooftop garden, where you can enjoy a beer overlooking Amsterdam. Well worth a visit.

Pick a sunny day.. Its a brewery, nothing special, some interesting facts accompanied by a sample beer and a beer on the roof - you recieve 2 tokens for a beer and a burger on their roof top bar.The roof top bar had an amazing view of Amsterdam but is only available post the tour and you can't get more beers then you have tokens to doscourage loitering.It's also very busy so don't expect an unique experience.

An insight into beer making. A fun few hours of learning the history of Heineken, seeing how the factory used to operate and most importantly a tasting session. Worth a visit of you have 2-3hrs to spare.

Great visit. Great visit, no queues as we had pre booked. Nice self guided tour of the brewing history followed by a demonstration, interactive segments, tastings and a small 4D ride. Beautiful views from the rooftop bar with your 2 free drinks.

Not really worth the ques. Really long ques for a small walk around. Very expensive too.
I'd look at it in Google and spend your money elsewhere if I had the option again.

Getting a bit expensive. Quite expensive now, especially with the queues involved when you are inside the building. Pre booking online is an absolute must, as it will save you a lot of time to purchase the tickets. You get 3 'free' beer's, staff are fun and helpful. More fun than fact though.

Heineken Experience vs Guniness Experience. Having been to the Guniness Experience in Ireland which we did not like we were a little skeptical about doing this tour but decided to try it. It is vastly different and much better than Guininess. There are many different interactive activities that you can do as you move along the floors seeing the exhibits. Don't miss the sky top. It is a beautiful view from the top.They also had a band playing. With admission you wind up getting 3 glasses of beer. Overall we felt it was worth while. Good idea to get the ticket in advance.,
Nothing special. I didn't really enjoy my visit in Heineken Experience. Maybe it is worth visiting once, if you have enough time while visiting Amsterdam. But there is nothing special about it.

A fantastic experience!. I wasn't sure what to expect with the Heineken experience, but I was pleasantly surprised! There is a variety of activities available for people of all ages, and the exibits are very interesting and informative. It was great to see the history of the company and how they have brewed the beer over the years. There are also some fun activities to do as well including getting green screen photos and videos which can be emailed to you, and there is an activity room to keep everyone entertained. Not forgetting to mention the beer which is excellent - I recommend getting the Heineken xtra cold! Would definitely come here again but spend more time here - leave a couple of hours to enjoy it properly!

Well worth a visit. One of those must visit places in Amsterdam! Something a little different from a normal museum, plus you get 2 glasses of Heineken and access to the rooftop bar. A tip though - purchase your tickets from one of the tourist shops beforehand, you'll get the tickets for 16 euros each and you'll go straight to the front of the queue at whatever time you fancy going. It is within walking distance as are most things in the city centre but it is also on the main tram route (lines 1,2 or 5) with one arriving about every 5 mins or so. Also worth noting that it isn't just for adults, there are also interactive things for the kids to do.
Worth of visiting once.. Well. You can spend a half day here and get two beers and have some interesting time there too. It could be so much more but maybe it is ment to be a showcase more.

Funny experience. Expensive but they give you 3 beers. It is usually very crowded in the roof terrace. Staff is very polite and funny. Half of the museum is about the story and the other half is about stupid things

One hit wonder - cold beer. They do decent beer but the queus ruin the experience. Nice rooftop bar to soften the blow of the queus. Pre-book to save 15 mins at the beginning but you will then spend plenty of time in queus regardless later. Felt a bit of a ripp off at 18 Euros. Spend it on beer in the cafes instead!
Good. We enjpyed that experience and the beer tasting on roof terace. Worth to visit and explore how the beer was made.

Worth every penny!. What a fantastic and interesting place! It's value for money, interesting, beautiful and fun! Learn about the history behind the beer, sample some, have some fun memory making experiences and then sit in a rooftop bar with 2 free drinks! What I loved the most about this place is how they give you a free option for photo ops, unlike most UK places would. You can buy a print or have it emailed to you for free! Would highly recommend a visit, you'll love it.

Very insightful experience . Amidst the many things to do in Amsterdam, we weren't going to pass up not going to the Heineken brewery. We booked our ticket via our hotel. We walked straight in. After going up a couple flights of stairs, we went into a room where we were greeted by a rep' who took us through the process behind the famous Dutch beer. We then went through to the plant where they used to process the barley, hops, and water.There was also a small interactive video which was quite fun followed by the option to customise beer bottles - which I didn't pass up! Lastly, there were various rooms that offered more interactions as well as a photo booth.We finished of at the roof top bar which was a nice touch. All in all an enjoyable experience.

Expect experience, not a museum. Heineken Experience gives you more fun-like activities than actual knowledge about brewing the beer. However, there is a bit of history presented. I have mixed feelings. The burgers on the top of the building together with a beer and the view may be worth the price of getting in. I'm not fully satisfied but not disappointed either.

Dissapointing. The start of the tour is a video telling you how brilliant Heineken is (yawn), followed by all their medals and awards etcIt progesses to something more interesting, a close up of the old brewing equipment and round to see the horses, folowed by a "VR" ride, which was actually fairly enjoyable.After, you shuffle through to taste 1/3rd Pint, while being told how to drink beer (5 mins) and then go though to various money making gimmicks -print a name/label on a 330ml bottle, for £6 Euros - admittedly you see it made, but still, it seems like it would be a nice gesture to include as part of the tour)-ride a fake bike, in front of a camera, against a green screen, while doing Karaoke, then email to a friend (for several Euros)-Proceed to gift shop, opportunity to buy junk for too much moneyHow could I forget the two "free" beers, which were in a room, which a projected view of a city, like a terrace, but not.Pretty naff.

Great Sunday Activity . We arrived to Amsterdam on a Sunday afternoon and thought it would be a good idea to hit up the brewery. The line to get your ticket was short, which was nice. The history behind the brewery was interesting however the halls were croweded and narror at times. The brewery had a lot of interactive exhibits when it went into Heineken's advertising, etc. There was also a tasting portion of the tour and at the end you could redeem your 2 drinks (they likely equal less than a pint).

Worth a visit . The Heineken Experience offers an interesting & varied experience. Showing you the origin of Heineken brewing and the original equipment used the onto the history of the product, the method and finishing with some interesting games and things to try. Finally finishing your experience at the Heineken roof top bar where you enjoy your 2 free half pints, when we visited there was a bbq on offer at an extra cost.

Top experience, especially for (future) marketeers. This is about how to create a brand! And to give people a good feeling. The tour builds up to having two free beers at the top of this former Heineken brewery.This tour is popular and the lines to get in are long. A good way to get around the waiting line is to order your ticket online.

An enjoyable tour.. I have previously visited the Guinness factory in Dublin and the Old Bushmills Distillery in Northern Ireland. I thought the Heineken tour was very well set out with a few interactive displays which kept the interest of all the age ranges of people visiting. The roof top beer garden offers the 2 free pints of beer (included in the ticket price) you can also buy a burger from the outdoor BBQ. I really enjoyed the tour and getting some free samples of one of my favourite beers.
Amazing. I had an amazing experience here. Im in a wheelchair and everything is fully accessible. I even had my own guide and the staff was awsome! Thanks a lot for a fun afternoon :)

For beer lover a fun and interactive place. Buy tickets online so you won't have to wait in the line. Tickets are valid for a year and you can go any day. Leave you bags in the entrance. I could be inside the whole day playing with the interactive activities they have. They explain the history of the beer and the making process of their gold colored beer. Don't miss out and go to their rooftop bar.

Good little trip. Read some hit and miss reviews. So found ourselves unsure about going. Don't be put off. Visit was great. Staff well trained and informative. Good for all ages. Great tour and nice views of Amsterdam at the roof top bar with the free beer x 2. Would recommend.

Summer visit. My son recommended this trip to us as he had been previously and we totally agreed with him. We thought it was very interactive and the information was presented in a very varied manner. The ticket included a canal cruise and a trip to the Look out Tower and we thought the whole package was extremely good value and a brilliant opening trip for our holiday

Pretty good.. Some parts were gimmicky or a waste of time and others were very fun. The gift shop has very nice things at reasonable prices. The city skyline from the tasting room makes the whole thing worth it.
Recommend . Great day would recommendwent a few days after Xmas and even give us free Heineken experience Xmas t-shirt , Xmas Santa hats and few other bits

A bit lame, but nice view!. The tour itself is a little lame, some of the facts about the history of Heineken are interesting and there's a basic overview of the process of making beer. Most of it feels like a big commercial, one of the sports simulations was broken, which was a shame. It was fairly busy with people, which makes looking at some of the screens difficult. We got the burger on the roof included, it wasn't terrible but probably not worth the additional 7€. We would've booked ahead to save, but there was no online offer for the burger. The view was petty good though! I wouldn't say it was a must see, and although Heineken isn't that great a beer, with the burger deal and the tester, we ended up with 4 small beers, so wasn't too bad!

Learning the story of the "smiling" e's.. Great tour with lots of interactive entertainment. The tour can be very detailed but you can skip any part you don't want to attend. The personalized drinks are nice to have as well. The tour came with a few free drinks and excellent view from the skybar. Great value, make sure you get your tickets in advance.

Cheers to that!. Step 1: find yourself a discount coupon (available everywhere, just to save 1-2 Euros p.p.)Step 2: Either pre-book (short line) or wait about 10 minutes to enter. Step 3: Have the fun of your life. Short movies, interactive exhibits, helpful staff with a great sense of humor and two most lovely horses, Some stations let you send funny mails with no charge.Step 4: Free 3 250ml. glasses of beer. One is "part of the tasting" and 2 are included in the entrance fee. For kids and non-drinkers there's an option of a soft drink (although why did you come to Heiniken brewery at the first place?).Summary: Recommended.

Why would someone go here?.... I was expecting something much nicer. The ticket is expensive as it is, they waste beer left and right, but they only give you two silly beers. The worst thing is the "experimental batch" which was AWFUL. I felt like I wasted 10 euros trying it... let's be honest, there's no big secret in making beer, and there's even less to look forward to as the company basically compliments itself over and over again throughout the tour. The worst part was when an employee broke a glass in my face, getting my shoes and shirt wet with beer, said sorry and ran off... worst customer service in all of amsterdam... also the place is very dirty and sticky. Tourist trap without a doubt.

Heineken experience . What a great couple of hours. We learned a lot, bought a t shirt and we got to drink beer. Best of all was the personalized Heineken bottle souvenirs that we took home with us. The story behind this product is very interesting and I really enjoyed this visit. Both me and my fiancé enjoyed the Heineken museum

Fantastic!. This was my second time here, my partners first. Absolutely loved it. So much to see and do-the interactive parts are superb. The staff are friendly, polite and funny-the whole atmosphere is relaxed and easy going. You get 2 glasses of beer included in the price and also a taster glass as you go around. The sky bar is brilliant with great views over Amsterdam. There is also the option for a boat trip too to see another Heineken building but we didn't do this for time constraints. Definitely in the top 5 things to do in Amsterdam if you are there.

Not with the time and money but had an okay time. I think we have been spoiled with too many good brewery tours in the past and so this one was a let down. Super busy, and not going on that really gave us that "wow" factor. There are some interactive things to do towards end of tour and the patio upstairs was great at the end of with a couple small beers included in the ticket price. Overall would not highly recommended unless you have a bit of time on your hands and don't know a lot about good beer and the process of making it. If your a beer tour virgin and like Heineken, you might be okay to have a bit of fun.
Nice visit. This is a nice tour.. Very entertaining and good for +18 people.. Minors will find it boring .. The store is quite good and interesting

An experience to do . The Heineken experience is one of the most cool thing that I did in Amsterdam I really advice people that likes Heineken to visit it. The tour is really cool to see and they also offer the beers inside

Great fun!. If you like beer, this is a worthwhile stop while in Amsterdam. Tour started a little slowly, with slightly more history than the majority of our group were interested in, but midway it picked up pace and the level of engagement increased dramatically. Sure, some of it is a little cheesy, but that's to be expected. Tour finishes on the roof with great views over Amsterdam, awesome and worth visiting for this alone.

Very cool . I was expecting just to see how they make the beer but it was so much more than that I really enjoy it, and nice touch with all the interactive games that you can play Very cool place to spend a few hours and enjoy the 2 free beers you get with the entrance in their terrace which have an amazing view of Amsterdam

If you like beer, it's a must visit. If you don't, will enjoy anyway. An old brewary from Heineken, which shows the history of the brand and also how they produce it.With the entry ticket you have one beer at the tour and also 2 more beers at the end, so it's almost what you'd spend on 3 beers at the street, in a very nice spot and enjoyable visit.
Not much to see and beers were small. Exhibition was good and told the history of Heineken. Free beers were 1.5 dl. Entrance fee was quite high.
interesting history. Very interesting history behind the famous pint well worth the 16 euros paid for entry ( included a free drink).

Not interested in beer but Great visit!!. I'm not interested in beer went with the boyfriend great atmosphere, extremely friendly staff. 3 beers included in the price, interactive games and fun things to do (photo booth, video games, massive tv screens, interactive mini 4D movie was fun a great day out! The gift shop was amazing something for everyone for 3euro you can engrave on your souvenir Gift glass super fast amazing job no limit on letters. Arrived at 11:30 was decent not too busy after about 12:00-12:30 it was pretty busy. We had walked past at about 4:00 and the line was out the door. Buy your tickets on line follow the sign that says pre purchased tickets go past security and there's a girl waiting at the end hall don't line up!!

Nice Experience. The Heineken experience is very interesting as they make you go through the whole brewing process as well as the whole factory where it used to be produced. 18 Euros I think is a bit expensive but it does come with 2 free beers. At the end of the tour, the events and the movie is fun.

Family Holiday in Amsterdam . Was a great experience to visit the brewing of Heineken beer and would highly recommend even with kids. Staff all very friendly and helpful and the tour was very informative.👍

fun experience. we did this the first day.very interesting learning how beer is made and how heinekin was started.fun activities to do as well with the option of sending photos and clips to your email.

Brill. Had a great time here, a lot better than expected. There's a lot of interactive activities to do so is also child friendly. The view from the rooftop bar is excellent. Tip, prebook tickets as there was over an hour queue for on the day arrivals, and we walked straight in!

Interesting + Beer. The tour was interesting, seeing the history of the brewery, getting to know the process of beer making and the specific history of the Heineken brand.
Also, you get two tokens you can exchange for beer at the rooftop lounge :)
Good fun.

Worth doing!. We have visited Amsterdam many times but this was our first visit to the Heineken Experience. A very interesting museum worth going especially if the weather is bad. It's worth taking time to look and read about the beer brewing process.It was a shame we missed the horses who were out doing their daily rounds as I would have loved to have seen them but that was just unfortunate timing on our part.It was easy to find the location and the tram stop is very close by.

Not Guinness. I was really looking forward to this, but it was a bit of an anti-climax. I agree with a previous review, whereby if you have been to Guinness in Dublin, you may feel a tad underwhelmed. Having said that, for historic purposes it is quite interesting and well organised throughout.

Decent and interesting experience. Interesting in terms of history of the brewery and the role they have played socially in the community over the years. Free beer is always good! Entertaining enough for an afternoon!

Nice view from the top. A bit too expensive for what it is. I was expected to a glass or a coaster as a gift when you live. The basic ticket is Euro18. You can drink up to 2 beers on the top roof and admire the view over Amsterdam. Nice to go once while you are visiting Amsterdam.

Guiness tour was better. Beginnings was slower than Guiness. Guiness had the waterfall, yet later on the interactive portion was acceptable. The outside deck was sticky when you walked (like most bars I have been to). It was perfect on a rainy day...plus it stays open later than rijsmuseum.

Herded. I'm not sure about this. €18 entrance for the basic tour, this includes two free beers at the Sky Bar. Queue was outside the door when I arrived, but was delt with quickly and efficiently. There was no 'up-selling' when I ordered my basic ticket.Very little in the way of the actual brewing of the beer- the tour wouldn't last that long if it was, but more about the actual company, and what they do.Inside you can spend a lot more Euros if you wish. You can print a label on a bottle, have your picture taken with a false city-scape behind you, or bizarrely peddle a bicycle. Football memorabilia and Rugby Union get a section- and rugby is explained to those from countries where it's not so well known.I felt a little herded around the place (despite it not being a guided tour), as all anyone really wanted was the two freebies at the top. Sky Bar is popular and sells more than just Heineken, including soft drinks.There is (or was at time of visit), a barbecue (veg burgers witnessed but done on the same barbecue), at €7.50 it's fairly pricy, buy your ticket at the bar, and present it to the barbecue-istas (is that a word?). Lifts to and from the bar, one lift one direction, so expect a queue to leave.All in all, not bad, but not great either.

Heineken VIP tour. One of my favorite experiences in Amsterdam. We purchased the VIP tour for our group which was great. They brought us up to a special room where we got to try out 5 different beers with 5 different cheeses. Our guide went over the histor of Heineken in detail, showed us how to properly pour a beer, and answered all our questions. Overall an excellent experience, even for the ones in our group that do not drink a whole lot of beer.

Great day. Highly recommended. The price of this experience is more than worth it. 2-3 drinks included in the price. Me and my boyfriend loved it! Definitely worth doing if your visiting for a few days and most tourist attraction stalls sell tickets. We had such a laugh and even hitched a Rick-shaw for the journey back to our hotel after all them free beers.

Decent if a bit underwhelming. I like Heineken but to suggest it's one of the best beers in the world would be an overstatement but walking through this tour almost felt like you were being indoctrinated. To be fair, it is basically a giant advertisement for Heineken and to go in expecting anything else would be silly but compared to the Guinness tour in Dublin for example, it just felt a bit lacklustre and could have been better. It did come with a couple of beers and it was a pretty extensive tour so I while I wouldn't say it's not worth it, it certainly isn't essential.

Waste the money. My second time here and really disapointing. Remember being here 10 years ago and it was much more funny. You will pay a lot for two poor beers at the end. The only good thing the views and the music at the bar

Was only here for the beer.... Good news is there's not a big line and you can pre book a ticket at loads of places. It's pretty interactive and good for a younger crowd especially guys. There's a long line in the middle for a ride of some kind which we skipped with some difficultly. Roof top beers at the end are good- great views. It was kinda busy but apparently at weekends it's mental. You are herded into a one way system from the start and there is only one elevator to take you down at the end ( for no apparent reason ) and there is an ' up' elevator. We aren't really the Audience for this but if you like football and beer go for it !
Great trip . Amazing day at the henikien experience loved the 4d experience and the icing on the cake was the roof top bar .

Just OK. Not exactly mind blowing. If you love lager and Heineken, it's worth a visit but otherwise not worth the money. It's basically just the company giving themselves a massive pat on the back for being so great. The 2 free drinks that are advertised are pretty laughable. I'm not even sure they were 330 ml.

It was ok. I was expecting the experience to be a bit more educational but it was mostly commercial. It was fun but honestly not a must do unless you love Heineken. I am not a lager drinker so the "free" pints were also wasted on me.

Grate tour and very good understanding . The tour is a self guided tour with all the history for the past and present times the staff are very help full I would defo. Go there again just for the super bear tastes
Boring. Good for teenagers not adults .. Boring and I want my 17 euro back (: if u like beer it's nice but not amazing at all.........

Surprisingly enjoyable tour!. I was expecting the usual run of the mill tour here but I was wrong. This is what all tours should be like. From the history of the brewery to the roof top bar at the end, every detail has been thought out brilliantly. The price of the tour is really cheap for what you get. Plenty of opportunities for great photographs too. Buy the fast track tickets to beat the queues.
BEER. My old man wasn't very keen to do this but I dragged him along and we both had a great time. The free canel boat ride home that stopped right near our hotel was great too.

Went on my first date. We both now love Heineken even more and both totally enjoyed the experience. Which is exactly what it was. Expect 3 hours to complete it. I'd recommend it Highly if u drink beer or enjoy Heineken. Great history and beer manufacturing process. It is presented in English

Excellent. Didn't know what to expect, but well worth the vist, staff were very friendly and happy to chat & joke. We really enjoyed it was both interesting & fun. We went early Sunday afternoon and wasn't overcrowded. Throughly enjoyable afternoon.

A must visit!. An experience not to be missed! We really enjoyed this visit. Lots of interactive fun activities for all ages. 2 free drinks with tickets (soft drinks for kids). You can even try to pull your own draught pint!

brewery tour while in Amsterdam. great informational tour with tasting at the end, even though they don't make the beer there these days, its a great 2-3 hour experience, quite a bit of beer history, a must if your in Amsterdam.

Loved this tour!!. This tour was not was expected it was better! Very neat tour they have. Lots of things to do see, pictures to take and games to play. It also comes with a complimentary drink plus two more drinks at the end. They have a lovely rooftop over looking the city where you get your drinks. It was wonderful. Really enjoyed it and loved it!
So much fun!. Highly interactive and fun tour-beer tasted great too.. games were loads of fun and we even got to fill our own beer

Excellent and fun!!. The experience was fun, learning about the history of Heineken to tasting the product !! Make memories and email them to yourself ... Engrave your own bottle and glass and of course have a couple of glasses with friends.
Happy experience. Happy experience with this tour, very good actrattive. You are a wonderful drink . Beautiful rugby game.

Beer, yes please!. The Heineken tour was interesting and full of information about the history of beer making in Amsterdam by Heineken.
There was some fun things on the way round & the chance to design your own beer bottle for a price.
At the end you get to sample some Heineken.
A great trip for Beer Fans. A good adventure when you visit Amsterdam...from the history of Heineken, ingredients brewing & making of the Beer & other funny activities.

A bit of fun but nothing special. I was advised to give this a go as it was brilliant. I suppose it is down to personal opinion but we were a group of 5 and everyone agreed it was just alright. It wasn't boring or a complete waste of time but it just wasn't anything special. There is a canal crusie afterwards which I really enjoyed but you don't have to spend the money on Heineken Experience to get one of these!
Excellent value. Loved the Heineken Experience, flows well, lots to see and do , great value for money. nice gift shop with reasonable prices. Book ahead so that you do not need to Q

Interesting. This was much more interesting and enjoyable that I expected. The only gripe would be the very rude girl serving the burgers on the roof top. She totally ignored us, females, and was flirting with some young lads who joined the queue after us which seem to render us invisible. We left without getting burgers. This was a shame as all the staff had been very helpful.

Ok, but not more. Heineken Experience is a tour in the old Heineken brewery, where they tell "the story about Heineken" and you learn a bit about brewing beer. The tour feels a bit childish and there is no real depth, but it is a bit entertaining. The entrance includes three (very small) beers.

Very interesting & enjoying. Fabulous experience better than I expected. Lots to see, learn, and do. Fun for all the family. I don't usually drink lager BUT the experience really made me be in the zone and enjoy the Heineken very much.
Heineken . So much fun here, definitely recommend to anyone going it's a must see experience, got some great photos and some cool souvenirs.

Visit with beer included ! . Visited in a group of 4 was good fun going around and a really good tour. Got to sample 2 free drinks at the end also and could even design your own bottle label. Had a really good few days and the roof top bar at the end was lovely. Would recommend pre booking as queues are long or buy from ticket stools nearby as they are discounted and queue jumping tickets for same price ! Great rainy day activity !

A really interesting tour appealing to all of our teenage family.. The tour is reasonably priced and is full of more traditional exhibits, combined with technology based activities.
Recommend pre-booking on line as you will avoid any queue.
Highly recommend as a day trip.

General "brewing experience"?.
