Having done other brewery tours (e.g. Guiness) I did find the tour a bit familiar- wash hops, bottling process, etc. The tour did showcase Heineken's contribution to professional sports (if you care about such things) plus a little amusement park-like ride where they give you the "hop" experience in a mini-cinema. In a city full of grand museums (e.g. Rijksmuseum), this would be the last one I would visit!

Interesting and Good value. So thought why not whilst in amstadam. €16 per person which sounds a bit steep to start and you do go around the museum thinking hm is this worth it. But as you carry on there seems to be more and more things to do which I personally think ends up being extremely worth the 16 euros paid. I won't ruin it for you but I'd definately recommend!
Good beer, Interactive Museum. If you are interested in beer and want to know more about how it is produced, you shouldn't miss out on this museum.

Expensive . As I don't drink beer I didn't really enjoy myself but if you enjoy Heineken beer I would definitely consider going. If you can get the tickets before hand they are cheaper! I paid around €20-25 on the door so would recommend pre booking to avoid extra costs and queues.

A must-visit attraction!. Following visits to the Jaimeson distillery and Guinness factory in Ireland, I assumed that this visit would be exactly the same but it wasn't! You learn loads about how Heineken is made, the history of the family and the brand without there being too much overwhelming information. The tasting at the end is great to experience and you get to head up to the rooftop bar for free drinks at the end. The outdoor bar patio section gives a great view across the local area. At no point are you rushed through to make room for the next group... You could easily spend the afternoon in the bar area enjoying the experience. Staff are friendly and knowledgeable.
Trip. The experience seemed more appropriate for children but it is an adult attraction. Not a good value for the price. Would not recommend.

Interesting . I don't drink nor have I've seen a brewery from the inside before so we decided to go. It was very interesting and quite the experience. They gave free beers at their rooftop party and alot of interactive events like fifa on ps4 and a moving ride. It also gave us an understanding of the beer making process. I'd definitely go but leave the kids. They have alot of pro-alcohol propaganda that children shouldn't see putting alcohol in a good light.

Superb!. This is a second to one experience! Loved every moment of it. The brewery tour was excellent and the effort these guys put into making your Heineken experience great is very impressive. From shaking platforms to pouring your own pint!Living up to its name the Heineken experience is fresh, tasteful and exquisite. You have the opportunity to print your own labels on Heineken bottles of beer at a minimal price, they do onsite engraving of glasses and other souvenirs. It is second only to the Guinness brewery in Dublin. No other brewery in Europe comes close to these two.When in Amsterdam, make a point of going it's well worth it and if you like beer you will love it! Oh and you get a taster and two drinks free when you buy your tickets!
Heineken tour . If you enjoy beer must go. The tour was good. Nice view from the top. Staff is very good and jovial. Overall good experience. Worth every penny !

If you like beer then go! . I suggest you pre-book your tickets as it saves queuing. Very well thought out lots to do, read and see and you get free samples. There is a shop at the end but remember if you are only flying with hand luggage you can't take some things back with you. You can also drink beer on the roof which I would recommend as it has great views.

All you need to know about Heineken!. This was a fun experience, which has been well put together to give a seamless visit.Wheelchair access: there is a special tour, although you have to give a 'deposit' of a credit card or id card in exchange for the key. We seemed to miss out several sections of the tour as the staff in the lifts said we really wanted to go in a different sequence.If you possibly can, transfer out of the wheelchair for the 'brew you' part, or at least position your chair to the side. I could just hear excited squeals from behind me and didn't have a clue what was going on!
Family visit . We came here for a visit with our family ranging from 67 to 21.It was very interesting and we loved the beer on the roof terrace at the end.The staff were very good.
Brilliant . Loved the tour. 3 free beers and a little taster. Very good experience and would recommend to everyone. More than I expected.

What a lovely experience. Absolutely amazing museum by Heineken. The tour would take you through the entire process of beer making. They still have the old equipment which they used decades back. Since we were part of the larger corporate tour, we tasted variety of beer. The staff was super friendly and provided a great tour.

Go VIP!. Well worth the money for the VIP experience. We had a fantastic guide, Lucas, who was very knowledgable, friendly and funny. He showed us around the tour route, answering all of our questions as we went. Then we went for the beer tasting. I was expecting small sips of each beer but no, we were presented with a half pint glass (approx.) each time and accompanied with complimentary cheese. After that, we still had our to free drinks to claim at the roof top bar. Such a shame that the weather was not on our side otherwise the views would have been fantastic of the entire city. I would definitely recommend spending the extra and going VIP and if you get Lucas as your guide, you are on to a winner.

Nice concept. Wonderful way to market and showcase what Heineken did in past 100+ years. They have tried their best to make museum interesting and less boring for audience. I liked the simulation video. There are some fun games and activities inside museum besides the history of Heineken beer. They have also shown how beer is made. Off course , there is also an option to taste fresh brewed Heiniken beer. The attendants are polite and ready to help audience. Must go place , not to be missed. A bit expensive ticket though. I would like it to be around 10 Euros.
Good history and drinking. Great experience, knowing the history and processes of brewering, and the important thing, very good beer.

Absolutely amazing!!!. We bought our tickets from an attractions shop for €18 each. This includes 2 beers at the end on the rooftop of the building and a beer in the middle (so 3 all together!). Plus an amazing experience from learning the history, to the production process, games to play in between bits too (I don't want to give too much away!). We're both 21 years old and loved it! Great 2 hours - definitely do it!

An incredible waste of money. Negative 13 stars. There was a vague 3 minute explanation of how beer was made before we were ushered into the brewing room full of empty cauldrons with additional information provided. The rest of the tour then degenerated into the most pretentious, substance less faux night club maze which was populated with a fooseball table, photo booth, and some karaoke bike contraption which provided no entertainment. Under no circumstances come to this "museum." It if rife with frat boys, both in the clientele and service populations.

Something's Brewing!. This was a fascinating experience telling the story of Heineken since 1864.The Historical bit is interesting as you see the old copper brew kettles,the old adverts,beer mats and learn the story of the Gold Medal 1889.Then you "become a bottle of beer" and are shaken up,sprayed ,heated etc.The beer sampling, sometimes with cheese,was tasty too.The interactive amusement park feel really is stunning and sets this apart from similar attractions in Europe.
Well worth the time/money. Heineken wouldn't really be my beer of choice but this was really good fun/really interesting and definitely worth a visit.

Pass on this unless you have done it all. The Heineken experience starts strong with a nice little video and a cute bar area, but quickly just becomes half baked gimmicks and not enough substance. On top of that the tour is 18 Euros. You're better off doing almost any other museum in the city at that price.

NOT TO BE MISSED!. Phenomenal experience, even if you don't love beer. You are taught to appreciate it and you learn the step by step process of the passionate production process, with many different tastes to savour and many surprises along the way, this is one of Amsterdams best attractions!

Brilliant afternoon . My friends and I had a great afternoon in the Heineken factory. We chose to buy tickets in one of the 'attraction shops' as it was not only cheaper but also allowed us to skip the queues. All staff are more than friendly and full of energy. I would highly recommend this to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Way better than the Guiness in Dublin. My wife and I were unsure what to expect after the Guiness Beer Tour 5 years ago which was a complete waste of time. This experience is "Well" worth it. We left very impressed. The experience is informative and interactive. If you love beer, put this on your list!
Great for all ages. Interactive!. Loved it! View at top was amazing! Plus you get to sample some beers. Lots of fun stuff for the kids to do!

For those who like beer. Seems like the Heineken Experience is a must visit when in Amsterdam. Although I disagree with the place of the Heineken Experience in the list of top attractions of Amsterdam, I can say that if you're interested in beer and its history right in the heart of Amsterdam, this is the place to be. Highlights of the self guided tour is the old brewing hall and the stables. The lovely copper brew kettles breath history.Of course the tour ends with a tasting. As a Belgian I honestly can't be enthusiastic about the Heineken beer, but no tour is complete without a taste of the beer that is marketed so well by our Dutch neighbours.
Well worth a trip. Normally not overly excited by these kinds of places, but this was a nice way to spend a few hours. Informative, great interactive games and great tasting beer- whats not to love!
Really impressed . The Heineken experience exceeded my expectations, found it to be a really fun and interesting couple of hours. Definitely worth a visit.

a lovely experience especially for beer lovers. it doesn't matter if you drink or not but its a awsome experience to visit this place, up your knowledge about beer n history but d best part is the 5D show where they transform you into beer n take you through the whole process its a must try n something that you don't wanna miss on, if your in Amsterdam ;)
Don't miss this one. This is a must see once you find it. A superbly organised attraction with loads to see and do. The sampling is of course obligatory and shop is well stocked. Highly recommended.

Fun and interactive. We had a great time here and we like beer! It was a good way to spend a rainy day but it did take a lot linger than we anticipated allow 3 hours to do the experience well! We loved the interactive games etc.

Amsterdam 2016. Went on a rainy weekday and was only moderately crowded. Very interesting with lots of history as well. Interactive exhibits that the kids really enjoyed. Included two beers with the admission price.

Good fun and great way to spend a morning. . Good fun if not a little busy but it moved well and not a major issueInteresting to learn of the history and marketing skills of the family business. Tasting at the end is informative and interesting. Final bar area fun as are the photo opportunities. I would recommend this attraction

Great VIP experience . My husband loves good beer and really wanted to visit the museum, despite Heineken not being his type of beer. He convinced me that we should do the VIP experience and I am very glad we did.  The regular admission appears to be a quick tour with a short ride and some free beer at the end. The VIP experience gets you a dedicated guide, a 5 beer tasting with cheese, and access to the fun upstairs party room and balconies.  Sven was a great guide and we had a lovely time chatting to the Germans, Aussies, and Scots on our tour. Definitely worth the extra funds if you want a more in-depth experience.

Good experience . Went on this tour about the history of the Heineken brewery.. Opens at 10.30am.. Tickets can be bought at the entrance but if you buy at any of the 100s of sightseeing ticket selling places you can save a few euro and also can combine few tours and save as well.. The ticket includes 2 glasses of beer and also you can have personalised bottle for 6,50 euro.. Overall the tour takes about 1.5 - 2 hrs.. If travelling to Amsterdam it's a place you must see.. Staff is very helpful as well..

very good. they explain everything and they give free beer, dont read too much of that, if u are below 35 jears go u ll have fun, and they give 2-3 beers so u ll get ur money back, and buy tickets outside of the train station, they are cheaper and u dont have to wait

Worth seeing. My husband and i both enjoyed doing the Heineken experience its not just a brewery. It shows everything Heineken is involved in eg sports, history and gets you involved in the making of the beer. I would recommend it for everyone. It takes around and hour to do the whole thing.
Worth doing. €18 gets you a tour of the history of the Heineken brand, a quick beer tasting and two beers at the roof bar.Definitely worth doing.

Great. I'm not a lager drinker at all and only went to the Heineken experience to keep my partner happy. But it was so good!!! I was really impressed, it's fun and interesting! I even enjoyed drinking Heineken. Definitely worth a visit! X

Playground for adults!. It is a museum that interact with his visitors. the History of the factory is told in a way that is interesting with many funny stories. The staff is young, they gives a lot of information about the plant, brewing procedure. The ticket price includes two beers, but you get 3 beers because when you learn how to taste a beer they gave you one more. You can spend a few hours there, especially as the end of the 2 free beers in a bar where you can interact with many people. A place not to be missed if you're not a big fan of beer.
Fun tour, broken facilities . The tour takes on a lot of important history behind Heineken and the beer itself. However a lot of the facilities inside were out of order, which was a bit disappointing

Neat learning opportunity that ends with beer!!!. After getting your green wrist band (don't lose the two buttons) you can walk through the history of the company. There's also an opportunity to meet the horses - and learn the process of beer making. The samples are full beers, there isn't a lot of room and can't find a table plus the floor is sticky. But it's beer so yummmm.

Enjoyable experience . The Heineken Experience is informative and good fun! There's lots to see and do and it's interesting to see the brewery tanks and learn how the beer is brewed and bottled. The view from the top of the building where you can enjoy the two free Heineken is fantastic! There is also the opportunity to buy a burger if you need to soak up the beer! We booked our tickets online which meant we could skip the queue when we arrived so I would highly recommend doing that.

A must see in A'dam. This interactive museum is a very nice experience especially if you like beer.You get to know the history of Heineken and not only this.The visit will take you about a couple of hours but it will be quality time and you also get to taste some beers.

Entertaining. I thought it will be an ordinary exhibition but ended up spending about 2.5 hours here because it was really entertaining. There were a lot of virtual games, selfie spots and beer tasting.

Legit Heineken Experience. Must Visit when you're in Amsterdam and if you love Beers. You will learn the history and how Heineken is produced. The place is modern, fun and cool. Highly recommended especially if you're travelling with friends. Their souvenir shop is also great.

Heineken visit. The tour was OK - I would have expected more interaction with staff to keep the interest up. The queue outside was long and we were told to expect 20 mins. It was maybe 30 before we got to the desk - staffed by one person. Why one person? When she left at the end of her shift she passed me over to the pre-paid queue (I was seen immediately) and no-one replaced her for the time I was there. Concern for the paying Customer didn't seem to be a priority.....

Great tour and experience. My boyfriend and I loved the Heineken Experience (be aware, this is coming from the girl who also loved Coke World in Atlanta). It is the perfect mix of the Heineken history, brewing information, advertising, and fun! Plus it doesn’t hurt you get 2.5 beers! I suggest you buy your tickets ahead of time to avoid waiting in line (you get a discounted ticket online also).

So so worth a visit!. The Heineken Experience was kinda like Willy Wonka's factory for adults. The interior made me think of the classic chocolate factory as you saw the great brass vats and secret 'a yeast' under lock and key that gives Heineken its iconic flavour. The tour does cost but there's a discount if you have an IAmsterdam card and included in the price is two small Heineken beers and a third used in the tasting portion of the tour. I think the experience was done to a very high standard, showing you the step by step process, interactive games and activities and all about the evolution of Heineken as a company. This was a great way to spend a morning when in Amsterdam (plus on the next day, when we happened to be in the area we saw people enjoying their beers on the roof balcony- don't know if it was a private party or open because of the good weather, but looked like great fun). Even if you aren't into beer I think it's a cool place to visit.
Nice to visit. They explain how the beer is created. At some rooms you can activate some devices to create a beer. At the end you get 2 beers..

A superb interactive experience explaining the decades of Heineken brewing. A superb insight into the history of brewing Heineken and the extent of Heinekens influence today. I loved the modern interactive experience alongside the beautiful traditional features of brewing. There are a lot of stairs but did she a woman in a wheelchair using lift facilities. I think the entrance fee is reasonable and the free wristband is a nice addition.
Rainy day. Good activity for a rainy day. Suggest you book your tickets online in advance and skip the line! When inside, not to crowded.

Best Heineken at here !!. Amazing museum and learn a lot about the beer. I'm not a beer lover but I love the Heineken extra cold here. It has a a unique smooth taste and make me fall in love with Heineken. I tried Heineken at other places but not as good as Heineken Experience provided.

i cant remmember to much...lot of beer 😆. if you like to drink beer this is the place for you. good place to kill 2 ours in amsterdam...they have a lot of special activities and you get a free beer a also.

Take it or leave it. I'm not sure this was worth the wait. I did a self-guided tour which was fine. The first part of the tour was fine but at some point it became very commercial and felt like they were just putting things in the tour that were just not necessary. Like all the sports that Heineken is a part of, try kicking a football, a room with lots of colored lights and mirrors...if you had started drinking before the tour, all of these various things would be fun, I guess. Just seemed way to promotional and less informational. The tasting room was crowded but, the room was nice with the various pictures of places around the world, and the beer was great. Having been through the Guiness factory prior to Heineken, I felt this was just not as informative or done as well as Guiness. If you are on the younger side and are going to do the tour with a bunch of friends, I see how this could be a fun experience.

Interesting and fun. I really enjoyed this tour. Some parts of the museum was closed, but it was a fun and interesting way of learning the history of the Heineken family and their way of turning Heineken into what it is today. A long the way you get to taste beer before it's finished and compare it to how it tastes when it's done. Short queues, excellent staff, okay prices and it was overall a nice experience. I reccommend buying the ticket with Heineken canal boat after the museum, if the weather is nice. Beverages are sold on board and you get to see a lot! You also get a little gift towards the end.

Good value for money & lots to keep you entertained.. An interesting tour of the Heineken Museum with lots of interactive photo opportunities. During the tour you can follow the journey of the brewing process on a simulator, sample the beer, pour the perfect beer and have various photos taken & emailed for free. Surprisingly good couple of hours.

Brill for all! . Such a good experience, this was our favorite visit in Amsterdam, so much to do and action packed as well as learning, definitely a must for all and ladies (yes it's beer) but do not let that deter you, we were a group of 4 woman, loved it and has such a giggle, very hands on and lots of interactive fun!!! Personalized beer bottles too! X

Very good. I went here with a few friends I'm not a big Heineken drinker but was worth going to, it was €18 to get in and you get 3 beers on your way around witch is worth going just for the beer as a pint of beer in a bar in Amsterdam is €7-€8.

Brilliant. Really enjoyed doing the tour here! You forget Heineken sponsors so much ie champions league and rugby and there is attractions inside relating to this its brilliant. Get 2 or 3 wee tasters which you can enjoy on the roof overlooking the city. Would come back for a visit

Enjoyable Visit. Pros:
- Interactive and varied exhibition.
- Friendly staff.
- I enjoyed it despite not liking beer.
Cons:
- Only sell standard Heineken despite having taps for their other ranges on the rooftop terrace.
- Lots of marketing!
Info:
- 18 Euros per adult which includes 2 beers at the end of the tour.

Well worth a visit. We decided to pay a visit as we were staying near by. It was open on Sunday's, so we went after lunch. There was a long queue and it was very slow, so we just popped online and bought tickets and went in the pre-bought ticket entrance and got straight in!The tour was very informative and interesting. The entrance price included a wrist band with 2 tokens for beers at the end of the tour. There was also a small beer each to look at, smell and drink as part of the tour. We had the first drink in the bar we arrived at first, and then went up to the rooftop bar. If we went back again we would go straight to the rooftop bar and have both drinks up there. There is also a nice gift shop where you can get glasses etched with your name etc. The tour is self led for the most part so can take as little or as long as you like. We did almost everything and had the beers at the end. We spent about 3 hours there in total, but you could probably get round in an hour / an hour and a half if you were short on time.

An Experience Indeed. Came here with my sister and her Fiancé. I'm a huge fan of Heineken so the tour for me was a great source of information and super fun. My sister doesn't drink beer however she loved this tour. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful with all the questions I had. The tour divulges into the history of Heineken and beer manufacturing in general so it was great to spend an afternoon learning something new. They had fun interactive activities throughout the tour. If anyone is in Amsterdam I highly recommend this tour, beer fan or not!

weekend away. fantastic experience. you can take you time walking round and enjoy leaning how the beer is made. brilliant experience when "you get bottled" ha haafter the tour you can enjoy a beer or a soft drink up on the roof, with a lovely view of the city.great gifts as well. we got some personalised bottles of beer as well as some personalised pint glasses.a must for any couple to do.

Not all about beer . I was surprised about that fact there was so much more to this experience than beer. The first half is about the history and making of the beer, but it has much more. There have a lot of interactive things that you are able to email to yourself and keep as memories. The believe it stated you get two free drinks.. But I believe it was more like four. Only down side was the extreme lines at some points. Get tickets before hand online, it will save a ton of time!

Tourist trap. The aim of this is only to take more money possible from the visitors. From the beginning till the end. If you want another free beer, you do so: when the host ask about the color of theri famous beer if you answer "gold" they give you another beer for free. In amsterdam there are a lot of indipendent breweries where you can see and taste a so much more good beer. And in a less expensive way.

Good time . Went here after sight seeing a lot of the city. Great tour.The staff are very friendly and explain the process very well. Enjoyed the bottling video.The tour takes you through all the aspects of the brewing process and ends at the bar where you can enjoy 2 drinks, included in the price of the ticket. We had one up in the roof bar to see the sights from there.Tickets were purchased from the info booth at Centraal Station, so we saved a few euro off the door price.

Very nice journey into this building. It's been a very nice walk in the past , at he beginning , finished in a Modern place with lot of chance to interact with the other guests , as you share a place's were you can drink that lovely Heineken beer , buy lot of gadget's and take a funny pics & vids . Really enjoyed Heineken experience !!

Wonderful viait but download the app.. Awesome tour. If you download the app beforehand, or on their free Wi-Fi, you can get the audio tour for free. Was awesome to see all the stages but also to hear all about it. The brew you ride was pretty unique and you get 3 beers so quite worth the money.
Better than expected. This was quite a bit of fun. We had a great time with all the interactives and information. There are many cool things to learn, even if you are not a Heineken drinker.
Heineken! . Get exactly what you would expect. Great to see and you get a few pints on the tour. Worth the money.

Not sure I'd do it again since I don't love beer. It was entertaining and they try to make it as interactive as possible. I would suggest going earlier on in the day so you can enjoy the rooftop patio for awhile or else if you go on a rainy day it is mostly have in doors so could be saved for then as well. I wasn't totally in to all the things they showed us but it was also fairly inexpensive and is something different you wouldn't do anywhere else. The choice is yours!

Great experience. Aside from the longish wait to get in,this was a brilliant tour.very interesting and lots of interactive things to keep both adults and kids entertained.lovely beer on the roof terrace afterwards.reasonably priced too.well worth a visit.

Great visit. Sounds weird having a beer Museum but go for a fun experience. Not a long visit so time for other activities. Thoroughly enjoyed it and obviously the free Heineken went down well. Take the trip, sure you will enjoy it.

Amazing place! . We visited Heineken Brewery and really enjoyed it. Its a mixture of contemporary and traditional decor, you can see how famous Heineken is made and even get a 'Pourer Certificate' after a short lesson how to pour Heineken. Free Heineken tram will take you back to citycentre Heineken shop. Highly recommended while visiting Amsterdam

A bit of a waste of time. I get to go there because I went to a conference and the organiser hosted a dinner evening there which included the tour around the brewery. My absolute favourite bit is the view of the city on the top floor at sunset, with your Heineken. Otherwise, if I had queue for a ticket to be there, I would want my money back. There were lots of little games and a ride, none of which was very exciting. At the end you can fill your own bottle of Heineken which you have to pay extra for!!Don't bother...

Just great!!!. We saw allready may breweries. But this was the hammer. Very good education and entertaining and friendly staff. Especially the tip not to start drinking whith the foam becouse he is bitter was very usefull. Just pull your neck a little bit backwards and drink the beer which flow under the foam.

Overrated.... The only thing I really wanted was to have a beer at the roof terrace... I didn't find it instead the bar right art the and of the museum was filled with noise, people and sticky tables! They also had horses inside this museum which made some of us question if that is really humaine? Beyond that the museum is really well built and heeey you get two beers out of it!

A must-see attraction. Really nice tour about Heineken history and beer brewing. You never get bored. The standard tour gives you two free beers but you can actually have more during the visit if you attend to the "service your own beer" thing or during beer tasting. Do NOT forget to go up to the terrace. Wonderful view.

not your typical brewery tour. This really is an 'experience' and not a brewery tour! So many amazing exhibits to witness and explore. For some reason, Heineken beer tastes SO much better in Amsterdam than anywhere else. Really cool way to get enGRAINed in the history of beer making.
Great view over the city. It felt mostly like one long commercial for Heneken but still both entertaining and interesting. It would have been nice if they had still been brewing.

Does not quite live up to the hype.. I went there alone mainly to see the old brewery of one of the worlds' largest brands. It is interesting enough, but very much focused on the "party-factor" and Heineken is praised all the time as the best in the world - which is a bit exhausting, especially if you visit alone. If you are genuinely interested in brewing and beer culture, I would go somewhere else. But if you love Heineken and have a couple of friends with you, you could have a great time there! Definitely buy the ticket in advance though, as the queue was guite long without an advance ticket...

Better than expected. We didn't have high expectations, but hubby likes beer and couldn't get tix to Anne Frank Museum, so we bought combo tix with a canal cruise and gave it a try. Surprisingly interesting & fun! For those who don't drink beer, you can have Pepsi at the end instead. Lots of interactive stuff after the initial beer history & beer making stuff. A couple good photo/video ops that you can email to yourself for free after. The brief "movie" toward the end was cute:)For the price, I'd say you get a decent amount of entertainment with your two free beers.

Beer or not to beer 😜😜😜😜. very interesting place for exploring!! quite a large museum. first you find yourself in a welcoming room; the historical part where you can see old bottles, photos and awards. there are rooms that show and tell us about the varieties of hops, about how beer is created. there is also tasting room , you can also create your own behalf bottle. but the most interesting - it 4d cinema with a film about that which way goes beer from its inception, before hitting the shops. from the museum (free, included in the ticket price), you can boating by the river

It was ok. Long queues, especially for the beer. And the "make your own beer" thingy was non functioning. We went into the wrong line when we where getting beer because of horrible signing, and waited there for 20+ minutes before we understood it was a "tap your own beer" bar. The staff however was great, and the "tour" was ok. A bit dissapointed by some of the attractions that i felt was more of a filler to make the tour seem longer. We paid extra for the canal tour and that was the only thing i thouroughly enjoyed.
Funny place. The visit is simple and funny. You taste beer and the explanations are good. They have some interactive games very funny. The people there is very nice.

An Interesting Walk Down (Their) Memory Lane. It was a great experience to walk through the history of a well established, world renowned brand. It's located in its original brewery site. The horses stabled there are like the Budweiser Clydesdales, used mainly for promotional reasons. The glass engraver has been doing it for 38(!!!) years, and she engraved two steins in less than a minute, freehand! An absolutely amazing skill.

Free beer? Yes please. When visiting Amsterdam for the first time the Heineken Experience is a must, especially as a lot of bars only have Heineken! It's good to see how enthusiastic the staff are when they talk about the beer - they love it. If you don't know about the brewing process or have never seen a brewery before it's quite interesting to see the size of the machinery. Some of the history is interesting and seeing the evolution of the branding and bottles was very cool too, the first beer they give you helps keep you interested too.The things i didn't enjoy... it was so hot in there, it gets very crowded and at some points we were waiting 5-10 minutes for the people in front to finish reading the info before moving on and *spoiler alert* when they 'turn you into a beer' with the 'ride' it was quite underwhelming, you have to stand up and hold on to a rail but i nearly fell asleep and onto the floor! Also the guy speaking in the video had a northern english accent, not a dutch one and i didn't really get why... still well worth the money to visit, especially if you like beer.

Loved it!. Im not really a big beer drinker but I thought id go along as its 1 attraction my partner wanted to do whilst in Amsterdam. We had purchased our tickets from the "tours and tickets" shop which you can find on any street, this enabled us to skip the queues which were pretty long for 2pm. I found the Heineken Experience really informative. The first part is more like a museum which has many informative historical facts on how Heineken was first brewed and how it has remained in the family business. I found all the photos of the Heineken family very interesting, as well as the authentic interiors, gold medals and the differential bottles of Heineken throughout the years. Within the experience there is an interactive part where you can "play" rugby by swinging your legs in the air and scoring, there is also another interactive part where you are made to fill like you are in a Heineken bottle - be warned, you do get a bit wet. Best part of the experience was of course the free beer, and to be honest it was rather nice beer. During the experience you get 1 free beer while the bar man gives you some history about Heineken. If you have paid for a ticket which entitles you to 2 free beers you will get these at the end of the tour and I suggest drinking these on the roof top, especially on a nice sunny day, you can grab a tan as well as getting a great view of the city. Don't forget to visit the shop at the end. Great experience overall, I highly recommend.

Interesting visit. The visit starts off slowly but definitely gathers pace. The worst thing was lack of seating as you go around, having visited 2 other museums that day, we needed just somewhere to prop ourselves against whilst waiting for all the group. It is worth a visit and better than the Guinness experience in Dublin, more things to keep ages occupied

Hectic, crowded, not much fun. Did not find the Heineken Experience worth he 18 euros per person. If interested in detailed history and historical equipment (not an actual brewery any more in Amsterdam) or a Heineken gift shop, then okay. Otherwise, not even worth it for the beer (:(.

PROST. Although we are no beer drinkers and very interested in beers, the Heineken Experience is awsome. You can learn about the history and the brewing but the interactive things are most fun. You can take funny pictures, sing karaoke, play sportgames etc. It's worth a visit

Wow... Tipsy for a few euros lol. We decided to do the Heineken experience while we were in Dam and was glad that we did. We booked online before we went (This booking lasts for a year, so you can use it for 1 visit anytime within the 365 days)When you arrive you are given a bracelet with 2 tokens on. Don't lose this. It gives you 2 pints of beer or 2 soft drinks at the bar at the end of your visit.There is an interactive virtual tour where you learn how beer is made, which is fun and plenty to see and do, including seeing the dray horses and learning how to pull the perfect pint (where you get given half a pint to drink) There are a couple of funny Karaoke screens where you can record your own video on a bike with a backdrop of Amsterdam and a couple of other experiences that you can have emailed to yourself (free of charge).Once upstairs on the rooftop bar, you can relax and have your 2 free drinks, chill out and get merry. Highly recommended.

Heineken Experience. It was an extraordinary experience, my boyfriend and I have been there twice in the past two years. Highly recommend this. The beer ride was awesome & the beer tasting was excellent. The video & picture machines were fun & a memory could be kept by emailing them to us.

Good way to spend a few hours. The highlight was the roof top bar at the end. 1/2 litre of beer for 2.5€ but the views are amazing. Book online and get fast track tickets as the queues are massive. Expect to spend the day queuing once inside. You also get 2 beers included. If you want to queue and learn how to pour the perfect pint and keep the glass again expect queues. Expect long time on your feet but worthwhile

Surprisingly Great! . My Girlfriend and I aren't exactly the biggest beer lovers but we had heard that The Heineken Experience was a must see. We expected it to just be a boring tour through the factory seeing how to make beer but it was actually a lot more exciting. Particular highlights were the simulation room where you get turned into beer and the sports section where you could see Heineken's involvement in Rugby and Football. I would really recommend going to the Heineken Experience if you are going to Amsterdam, even if you aren't that interested in beer.

Such a fun experience. My husband and I have been to many breweries around the world and this was our favorite one. The Heineken Experience is very interactive and fun. They also provide a lot of beer samples!

Fun tour!. I visited this "museum" in 1976 and went back again in 2016. What a difference! It was interesting before, but now it has been turned into an interactive experience on beer making and mostly about Heineken marketing. The instructional displays in the beer kegs were very clever, and the Heineken "ride" was fun. And, of course, there's free beer. I feel it's more geared to younger people, but we had fun nonetheless.

Very good for a brewery exhibition. I have visited the Guinness brewery in Dublin before, and my fiancé has been to the Carlsberg brewery in Copenhagen. We both thought that the Heineken experience was more enjoyable and substantial than our previous brewery visits. It was interesting and quite interactive. There sure was a lot of beer included in the entry ticket price, we couldn't even drink it all...

Informative and fun . We cut the long queue with our pre-booked tickets online. The Heineken experience was informative and interactively fun. We learnt something new about the smiling "e"s :) Had great a time wefie-ing away with Heineken paraphernalia. Best part was having fresh and free beer. It can come across as a bit like a marketing campaign for Heineken, but overall, highly recommended to spend a fun time.
Definitely a party experience . Well put together! Surprising fun towards the end of the tour. Make sure you go to the roof garden for a great city view. Enjoy the beer. You get 3 pints!!!

Visit, taste, enjoy and learn. A well run attraction. Worth purchasing your tickets in advance to avoid the queues. We were there about 5pm on Friday and there was only a short queue. It's easy to manoeuvre around and the ticket allows a tasting glass, plus 2 other drinks in the bar afterwards. The roof top garden was closed whilst we were there so a littldisapoointed as I'd heard the views from the top are good. The bar at the end was a little noisy, but worth sampling there's anyway. The marketeers have a done a great job with this experience. Enjoy!

Casual and fun. No doubt a good time. Probably enjoyed more by young adults. Lots of beer drinking in the tasting room. I had low expectations but interesting tour nonetheless. Great activity for an off-day.

Lots to see and do!. Came here expecting a museum about beer - I was pleasantly surprised! After a quick explanation about the history of Heineken and how its made, you can go on "The Brew You Ride" which was good fun, then continue on to play with things from football kick simulators to pint pouring simulators! In all I had a great time
Worth a visit. The Heineken experience is definitely worth a visit. There a fun things to do throughout the tour. It was way better than I thought it would be.

Awesome. My family and I aren't big beer connoisseurs but I wanted to check out the place. What an experience!!! Not only for adults but for the kids too. I was so surprised that the kids were having a blast too. Heineken truly goes out of its way to make sure everyone can enjoy this place and have fun. We had a great time. Activities for everyone of all ages. Of course, a beer tasting at the end and two free beers at the bar before you leave. Great time -- we really enjoyed ourselves. Don't miss this experience!!

Packed house. This is definitely a popular attraction. Big crowds even on a Tuesday afternoon. It was interesting to see the process, the ride was cheesy but fun, and it is basically a long ad for Heineken. We had a fun time and the view at the end as we enjoyed our beers was spectacular. We chose to add a burger and extra beer as well when we entered, and glad we did once we were through.
Must visit for beer lovers. it was a lifetime experience to visit here and the teaching for how to pour a perfect beer was really great. I have the certifiate , will frame and keep it

A must do tour in town. Bought queue jumping tickets before we left the UK , whilst it was very busy at the entrance our tickets ensured a swift entrance without waiting
Interesting and informative tour with a taster drink half way around and two free drinks at the end
Well worth it

More than just a brewery. I enjoy a good brewery tour but this was beyond that!We got to see how Heineken is made and they we got to play video games and enjoy interactive ride! I created a custom label for my own bottle while we walked to tour and even got to pour my own beer, I daughter the perfect beer! I really enjoyed this tour. It was a great experience!

Lots of fun!. We opted for the VIP tour which provides you with a tour guide for a small group of about 10 people. The tour takes a couple of hours and includes a beer tasting of several of Heineken's brands and a trip to the roof top plaza for another beer or two and an incredible view of the city. You also get a personalized bottle of Heineken to take with you. Fun!

Barrels of laughter. "Something is always happening around a beer" - couldn't of put it better myself!Me and my partner spent around 2/3 hours in there and it was an experience! Very interesting to learn about the brewing process and they have amazing interactive facilities, even a ride! You even get two free drinks and we were lucky enough to spend it up on the roof top over looking the town (see pictures)Worth the money!

Worth a trip, even if you're not a beer drinker!. Not a big beer drinker but really enjoyed this experience. Lots of history and hands on bits to get involved with, and the interactive section later in the tour is really cool. The bar is good and you can learn first hand how to pull and drink a pint properly. I would highly recommend booking online in advance as the queue was huge when I arrived, and I was able to walk straight in.

Scam!. A building filled with advertising props, one room had some original brewery vats but no brewing is done here any more, just corridors of flashy lights and logos. A real waste of our precious time in Amsterdam, don't go there!

Improved by new rules!. As the owner of a bed&breakfast I frequently get questions about the Heineken experience, (a few times I went with my guests too)Since it's no longer 'All you can drink' at the end of the tour it has become even nicer as there are no longer people rolling on the floor ;-)It's impressive, those massive kettles and the explanation about how they used to brew the beer there. As there are many different nationalities (very likely including yours too) inside, it's a nice cultural melting pot of one of the worlds biggest and best breweries!You should try it out!

Silly Fun. There are cheaper ways to get a beer in Amsterdam. However, this was fun, mostly because of the energetic enthusiasm of the young men and women staff members. I did learn a bit about beer brewing, though I'm not sure I believe all the hype about the secret special yeast... Mostly I marveled at this company's huge capacity for self promotion. This is a good attraction to hit after you've done your "must-do" items in Amsterdam.
Great fun. Buy your tickets before you get there. Almost a party buzz through the tour. Informative and fun. Certainly worth visiting.

Enjoyed it - had everything to keep you entertained.. Enjoyed the Heineken experience. It was interesting to find out and it also had different ways to keep you entertained. If you are going to Amsterdam I would recommend this place :).

An entertaining stop for beer fans. I decided to visit the Heineken brewery while in Amsterdam (why not?) to see how it's done and sample right at the source. I purchased the VIP Tour for an in-depth experience and special tasting session: not cheap at € 49, but it's a tourist attraction after all. Our tour guide was very entertaining and knowledgeable, and first brought us through the existing exhibits with some extended commentary. Topics were interesting but it was unfortunately rather hard to hear him with all the competing noise from exhibit audio and big crowds of visitors. Too many tourists in July! The private tasting was much better. Our small group sampled four different kinds of beer which Heineken brews or licenses, with good discussion about how each style varies. Fresh Heineken beer at the brewery and on tap in Amsterdam is quite delicious and extremely refreshing. I wish I could get this in the USA, but it does not import well and tends to taste very different. Good to experience the original at last.

Best Museum Ever! A Must See!. I have visited the Heinken museum twice now and I absolutely love it and recommend it to everyone to go see! Its not a typical boring musem, its very interactive and a fun experience. I found the ticket price to be extended reasonable since it includes a couple of drinks throughout the tour. The 4D movie experience in the beer brewing process was beyond cool, as well as the rooftop bar overlooking the city at the end of the tour!
Must Visit. Being a Heineken fan. Its a great experience to visit the Heineken museum in Amsterdam. It takes you back in time and shows you the whole brewing process in detail

an experience that everyone mus have. everyone should be there, the muse offers the history of Heineken family, tradition accompanied with funny moments, such as photos, videos, cinema and a nice bar trying the fresh beer produces in right time.

Good one time visit. Its a marketers paradise...the way they have sold the brand in this tour is a lesson in itself. If you are beer drinker go for this tour....and good place to puck up souvenirs heineken personalized bottles for friends and family.

Cool and entertaining . The Heineken experience is located in an old Heineken factory. Throughout the experience you learn about the beer,it's ingredients and it's production process.Very entertaining (and tasty) to adults, but kids will also find a lot of fun things to do.

Interactive, informative and includes beer! What more could you want!. We had a great time at the Heineken experience. It was much better then I was expecting! Very hands on, and interactive made it interesting and unlike your normal museum visits. Included beer tasting and then beer at the end, you even get a chance to pour your own beer. Highly recommend tourists visit here- we loved it!

The only Heinekenexperience . With various activities in the tour, tell every stage of Heineken beer make. from ingredient to 28days brewing, from transport to it's four generation growing business. so impressive. you will have two beer taste experience to learn how to taste of a beer.

More Experience than Brewery. Having been to various brewery tours this one is definitely more experience than Brewery. The Heineken story and history is well presented, using and App to augment the exhibits. Includes a " feel" what it like to go through the brewing process which I had not seen elsewhere followed by exhibits that focus on Heineken sponsorship of sport and music. Yes you get 2.5 beers and the presentation uses great effects and technology but that just reminds me of the fact that this is just a big brewer.If you are in the area then definitely worth a visit, not one of those tours where you will "drink" the entry fee but certainly a tourist attraction.

The Disney of beer tours - highly commercial, but still good fun. Yes, the tour is touristy. Yes it's commercial and feels like Disney world. But - whatever! For 16 euro we got a couple of hours of entertainment and history about a beer we all know and drink, and got to drink three drinks included to even it out the expense. If you don't take yourself too seriously and don't mind the commercialism, then you will have a good time here.

Best brewery/ beer tour on earth. We've been to quite a bit of brewery tour BUT the Heineken experience brought the entire experience to a whole new level. The museum/ hall was filled with lots of information and interaction gadgets including games and photo ops.The ambiance in general is amazing!It is very hard to describe this tour but it is extremely FUN and I would definitely recommend anyone to visit this place when they are in Amsterdam!

Recommend for all beer lovers. The experience gets better and better as you go along... 4D beer-making movie and 2 free drinks on the top floor balcony are by far the highlights... And certainly great value for money.
It's always good to know. Even if you are not a beer fan, that's an interesting program. Lots of curiosities and activities make this exciting for everyone.

Actually Pretty Cool. I was dubious about going on an establishment-beer tour, but I was pleasantly surprised. Some of the exhibitions really didn't interest me - football and Heineken and rugby and Heineken, for example - but there was a "virtual reality" beer brewing/bottle packing when they brew you, which was pretty cool and, in addition to the two beers that you get at the end, you also get to sample another beer and try the barley/water mixture.

Cool Experience and Interactive!. I enjoyed the Heineken Experience while I was in Amsterdam. It was pretty interesting and pretty interactive. I like how they have a lot of UEFA Champions League memorabilia towards the end. After the tour they had a cool beer hall on the roof and live music!

Great brewery tour!. We really enjoyed this brewery tour. So much information is provided throughout the tour so you learn a lot about Heineken and how their beer is made. Cool things like the option to make labels for your beer, an animated bottling tour and a lounge at the end to enjoy some beer, are only some of the neat things that you can do in there. It's definitely worth going through. We bought tickets ahead of time online and I definitely recommend that so you don't have to wait at all to get in.

Very good half day out.. The Heineken museum experience is very good, it's very well done, and worth a visit. The tram stops right outside. We weren't sure what to expect, but they've done it really well.

Best time ever!. The Heineken experience was certainly an experience. The place is so interactive with lots of things to do. You get to see how the beer is made, you get free beer, and you can go party on top of the building with the view of Amsterdam just outside. Amazing place!

Something for everyone even if you don't like beer!. We really enjoyed the experience and found there was something for everyone even if you don't like beer! It starts off with the history and moves on to a more interactive modern experience! They show you how the beer and made and then there is a lot about the marketing of the brand. There is lots to do in terms of interaction. There is a beer tasting and the tour ends in the bar on the roof top where you can get 2 free drinks...there is wine and soft drinks as well as beer! There are a lot of stairs and we couldn't take out pram round but our 6month old son loved it! It was good to do on a rainy day! Lots of bars and restaurants in the area as well!

Loved it!!. For a reasonable price of €16 we enjoyed this tour as well as getting two free beers on the roof top. Atleast an hour and a half was spent here with many different things to keep you occupied. Very enjoyable experience and worth the money!!
The Whole Package. Plenty to see and do. Typical Heineken hype with a little history thrown in. At least 3 samples and there is a bar upstairs if the samples aren't enough.

Not worth it. This is a bit tacky and doesn't really tell you much apart from water+barley+hops+yeast=Heineken. It's basically just a big advert for the beer. You can buy your own branded bottle, try pouring your own and do a really tacky "4D" simulator ride which is just a wobbly platform that sprays water on you as you "experience" the making of beer. The girls are gorgeous though :) - Overall, don't bother. Find a nice cafe or bar, buy some fresh heineken and save yourself the trip!

Heinekenized. Took the tour and became Heinekenized. Bigger fan now than before. Took the VIP-tour and recommend it to all; no queing and rounds up with beer and cheese tasting and on top of that two complimantary beers after the tour.

Starts slow, but gets good - really good. This was much better than I expected. It started out slow with your standard "these ingredients make beer" spiels, but it got better and more interactive as the tour progressed. It's a good combination of history, education and, well, fun - it is about beer after all.
Heineken . Definitely recommend this for anyone visiting Amsterdam. Fun and informative with 2 free Heineken's at the end. A great couple of hours

time to learn all about this famous beer. Heineken one of the biggest names in the beer market and this tour is just amazing learning right from where it all started right till the very end. Lots to learn lots to sample cant fault the trip at all brilliant roof top terrance

Don't understand the hype. Was really really looking forward to coming here- one of our "must sees" on the trip. Had to queue a while as expected, but once we were in we had big expectations. The first I'd say 3/4 of the tour were ever so slightly boring and not informative in the slightest. Expected to see live beer brewed as on other tours. We did however really enjoy the beer simulation and the experience became better from then on. Cannot complain about the interactive elements such as photo and simulation opportunities but it just seemed to be a lot of distraction and slightly irrelevant to hide what was a slightly flat tour. Really gutted to say I was disappointed.

With Martin and Aaron. I am not really a beer drinker and was definitely not a Heineken fan.But after this Heineken Experience I believe that they are number one.The visit is very pleasant, informative and not boring. Even kids would love it.

Excellent Tour.. My wife and I and our 14 year old son walked through this experience. There was something for each of us. I was pleasantly surprised to see how forward thinking the original owner was in looking after his employees. There was a video game room with three consoles set up for Xbox Fifa play. A DJ stand and a lot of photo ops. It all culminated with two glasses of Heineken Beer in the tasting room at the end. There was also a quick demonstration on how to pour and drink your beer. The tour ends in the gift shop with a wide selection of souvenirs.

Great experience . I was apprehensive at first but in the end this was one of the highlights of our trip .Pure fun. Disabled friendly. Touring at your own pace. Many fun interactive exhibits. And of a couple of free pints of glorious beer from tap.

Really interesting, educating and fun!. Very nice experience indeed.You start with the beer making course, visit the brewery itself. Lots of movies and nice courses to learn about Heineken's way of working and secret ingredients.Then, it's time for interactive playing. You can make lots of funny pictures and movies that you can receive on your personal email. Nice and smart to keep a nice souvenir for free.Lastly, time for tasting. You have a first small glass with a speech to explain you how you should drink Heineken. With the tour, you'll also get two additional glasses (half pints). I recommend to go on the rooftop bar (also included with the tour), where you can also get your free drinks, with a very nice view and atmosphere.Fun experience, worth the price.

Brilliant and worth every penny . This was really good, it was 16 euro each and it was definitely worth it. It explains how Heineken was made, and you get 2 free beers at the end of the tour on the rooftop. It takes around 2 hours. I loved every minute of it.

super duper fun!. when in amsterdam, this is one attraction you must do! set in the old brewery of heineken, it gives you a tour of how the company came into being to its modern lineage and some really fun elements! you need to walk through a series of rooms and guided areas and then come into the brewery where you have projectors playing movies inside the huge copper vessels showing you what they were used for. clever. you get to taste beer during its process and then you go onto some beer tasting and fun games. the games are really a lot of fun and if you are a group, you can enjoy the most! the merchandise store at the exit is stocked and you can buy lots of goodies... trouble is, you won't know what to buy and what to leave.

Fun Tour. Booked this experience before we left the UK. Enjoyed the walk through the brewery and enjoyed the various games as we eventually arrived at the beer tasting hall. There are some very interesting facts and information displayed as you walk through the brewery. We had a fun time and enjoyed the Heineken Experience. Only down side was that we were offered a free canal trip associated with this visit but unfortunately for us I had booked and paid for a different canal trip which followed on from this visit so was unable to accept the free one....Doh

The Heineken Experience. Wasn't sure if this was for me - I have done other brewery tours and found them a little boring - but this was great - really relaxed atmosphere - staff were chatty and fun - you have a good wander around the brewery - lots of information on brewing if that's your thing - well worth a visit for a light hearted few hours - don't be put off by the ques outside they go down relatively quickly - you receive two free drinks with visit.

Its not all beer you can drink. You win 2 pints after the tour.(1 if you try to serve draft)The tour tells about brewing process and the history of the company. At the end, there are some media machines to take pics and make videos.

Fun experience. Overall it's a fun experience, lots of history of Heineken and learning the process of brewing, you just go at your own pace wich it's great. Has lots of funny spots for pictures, and interactive games. At the end of the experience you get two free beers. It's something fun to do either if you're alone or with friends.

Great Tour. This is great for a rainy day as I was dry & I got to drink :) The actual tour was wonderful as it was a mixture of walking, listening, watching, playing, and drinking. You could walk at your own pace. The actual crowded locations were the play rooms and at the end of the tour where you get two free drinks. I liked how you could purchase bottles with your own label. Again, great for a rainy day!

"Delight for Beer Lovers". This is a must see attraction if you are visiting Amsterdam. It is a paradise for Beer Lovers as you get to learn the entire process & ingredients involved in beer making. It is an interactive attraction where you get to taste the basic beer & also the one post the process completion.You can try & get on your hands to become a "Certified Pourer"

Simply magnificient!. Having visitet quite a frew breweries around the world already, being Dutch myself and hearing pretty much everybody say the Heineken Experience is a typical tourist trap, my expectations were set low when deciding to visit this anyway.I was blown away.The way they've set up this tour is unbelievably cool and I have never seen anything even remotely near before at any brewerey anywhere in the world.The tour starts as most typical brewery tours will start, some history, some photos, some stories being told. But this is just a tiny fragment of the tour and there's even an escape path to avoid this standard stuff if you're not interested in the history.What really made it personal was that at several places there were real human being enthusiastically telling about how the beer was brewed and how things work. And they really knew their stuff. You were allowed to smell, taste, ask questions, make jokes, take pictures, all was welcomed by the amazingly friendly staff.The way of projecting movies inside the huge copper chambers is also very original. To taste "beer" before the sugars are transformed to alcohol is also a very original experience. The story about the horses surprised me. I had never heard of this before.The movie on how beer was made was awesomely pleasantly made. Really fun to watch and experience. Far more fun than listening to a standard story being told by someone how they brew beer.The "how to drink a Heineken" was very original and fun. Awesome how they presented this. And having been a beer drinker for quite some years already, it surprised me and I learned something right there.The part that comes after the beer tasting is just superly creative. Simply brilliant. Interaction all along. Fun, games, photos, creativity, really really beautifully done.You even get a chance to tap your own beer at the end. How much fun is that?Even though I'm not much of a fan of Heineken beer, I certainly enjoyed this tour and I can definitely, without any single slightest doubt, recommend visiting this place, whether you're a tourist from abroad or tourist within The Netherlands.Small tip, if you buy your tickets online, you don't have to wait in line. Entrance fee is 18 euro per person. No difference between buying then when arriving there or online at the Heineken Experience website. There's no set time, you can just arrive whenever you want. There are other websites however which offer discounts on the tickets. Just Bing for Heineken Experience ticket discount and you'll find them. I got my tickets for 14,40 euro per adult. Not a huge difference, but still, why not. Received via e-mail within a minute after purchasing online and directly valid to be used at the Heineken Experience by having them scan the barcode from the e-mail displayed on your phone. Modern day technology at work!Last tip. visit after 6 PM. It will be a LOT less crowded by then which makes the whole experience way more fun. There's no joy of standing in line for every attraction. We didn't have to wait a minute anywhere.
worth a look. get tickets from the tourist office, cheaper and they are fast track! Is a decent tour, the free drinks are quite small but worth a go all the same.

Best Tour Ever. This tour has everything. It is interactive, inclusive and informative. There are brewery aspects of the tour, as well as historical aspects of the area and of the company. You can also take selfies in the selfie spots, get involved in 3-D games, and even bottle your own bottle of beer with your name on it! Totally worth the admission fee, totally worth your time. This is a must-do.

brill. Im not a beer drinker so wasnt really interested in doing this experiene when my partner wanted it. I loved it. it is a fun experience . it have fun thing like how to pull a pint. lots of places to take selfies and beers at the end of it. definately worht a visit. lots of interactive things in there dont miss it

Great attraction. . Another must visit when in Amsterdam.. Very informative.. Don't try the taster!!! It's the first part of the brewing. It's totally minging!!! Lol. Only downside. The ability to get your name on a bottle, when I was there, was down due to some kind of problem. Still a great place to visit.

Enjoyable Visit!. I should start by saying that I don't particularly care for beer. I went to the Heineken Experience because if I hadn't, my friends back in the US would have been disappointed. With that being said, I found this to be the most enjoyable thing I did today! I bought the tour + canal cruise ticket (€25). All of it was fantastic. The tour was interactive with fun things to do along the way, as well as have a couple beers at the end. The cruise was nice too. You could also buy more Heineken on the cruise. It dropped us off at the Lookout (across from Centraal). You could have waited for the next cruise to take you back or you could find your own way, which is what I did. Worth it!
The best!. Interactive,fun,lively I really had a lot of fun in this brewery mostly because they let you help the brewer make beer and at the end you can drink it
Buy tickets online and check out the roof top bar. Make sure to check out the roof top bar at the end of the tour for the two free beers. You can buy more for 2.50 if you want to stay longer
Excellent Marketing . Nice one time visit if you are in Amsterdam ... Excellent Marketing brains deployed to create a nice experience .. Worth a visit

Better than expected!!. One of the better tours of the bigger breweries. I personally prefer the smaller breweries as you will get closer to the actual production, but this was a nice surprise. I really enjoyed the whole experience. Nice touch with the horse stables!!!! It all ends with a fresh cold Heineken.
Missable. The experience was good but not amazing. Its just one big advertisment for Heineken. You would have to intereted in how heineken is made to enjoy it, nothing will blow your mind.

A must visit. It is a must visit for all the tourist.
Its not very far. Can be reached by Tram. We rented a tandem and went there.
Really nicely made and well explained.
The freshly brewed Beer tastes really nice after watching the whole process.

nice drinks and a good tour. i did this with friends from a local bar ,and we spend some good time there.we get a trip arround the building,and the show us the tradition of making beer.allso thy show you how it works in the past.thy have still horses there ,that take the barrels out on the car.for toerist it is a good thing on a rainy day as well.have fun and not drink to many

Interesting. A must DO! You'll know everything there is to know about heineken beer: ingredients, how to drink, etc... The staff is hot as all the guys in Netherlands are so go to the lounge, take advantage of your two free beer tokens on the bracelet that they give you once you enter and get mesmerized by looking at their faces.
good experience. nice experience, explanations about how beer is madeinteractive things to be done when in amsterdam

Not as expected. My husband wanted to visit here and I went along just to please him and was pleasantly surprised.....I was expecting a tour through a brewery with a tour guide telling the history of the brewing process.......I was so wrong, it was an absolutely fantastic place to visit.....yes I did find out about the history of the beer but in a stimulating and engaging way......then we arrived at the interactive area......I laughed and laughed so much at some of the things we got to try.......I am so happy I visited and would highly recommend it for entertainment value
Best 2 hrs of the day. Very interesting and entertaining place to visit, great staff ,when we visited everyone just seemed to be in good moods and full of excitement, even before the first sample .

Recommendable, even for a non-beer drinker. The experience is well thought-out and informational, NOT just a booze-tooze. Don't miss the photo frames on your left as you leave the first tavern area and don't be shy to try a few - quite original. Staff were severely friendly and helpful throughout even through technical difficulty. Exceeded my expectation and would take friends there again.

Bröst - Cheers! . If you love beer, this is a must! A great self guided tour to how beer has developed over the years in the Heineken factories. Plenty of tasting and interactive things to do. Would highly recommend.

History. No beer.. Think I was one of the few Dutch people at the Heineken Experience. (Made some artwork and got a free pass). It's always crowded but to my surprise only a quick look at the history and brewing process instead of a latge and lively bar.. If you are a true beer drinker pass the Experience to the Heinekenplein (Heineken Square) and order a large one. Cheers.

Fantastic Experience. Highly Recommended, We where unsure about going during our short time in "DAM" however we had a fab time, the interactive experiences are so much fun, and even my fiancée, someone who doesn't drink beer... actually enjoyed it. And the Experience too!!

A Brilliant Marketing Ploy. The tour was nothing short of incredible because of the genius of the people running Heineken. This is the best piece of advertising you will ever be a part of. By getting you to learn about the family history, and all of the prestigious awards the company has accumulated throughout the decades, they subconsciously train you to heroize Heineken beer. Not that that's a bad thing (Heineken is great). By establishing a personal connection while simultaneously intertwining it with Dutch pride and culture, it's hook/line/sinker by the time you arrive for your free beers at the end. As much admiration as it gives me for the people behind the curtain, it wasn't worth the money and time I spent on it. Far too many other things to do in Amsterdam, all of which are better.

Awesome- give yourself lots of time. I've done other brewery tours in an hour- this one took around 3. Love the interactive games and even a little ride! You get free beer throughout and the Heineken tastes SO much better than in the States. It's worth a visit and really is an overall experience. It's self-guided. Probably the best brewery tour I've ever done.*Be sure to combine the ticket with another attraction, such as the Ice Bar or Museum of Prostitution. It'll save you a few Euros.

Value for money. This tour was amazing. You practically get 3 glasses of beer which pretty much covers the cost that you pay for it.The staff at the location is very friendly and pleasant. My first brewery experience and was good.

The worst spent money and time ever. If you are not a fanatic of beer you really should go there. At the beginning you cant see anything, after that you have to wait for about 2 hours to see their "highlight" of the experience what was a total disappointment.

Fun for a while. It is a good experience . You get to see how the Heineken is made and the History of this famous beer . However there is a lot of gimmicky attractions in it which appear to be there to fill up the somewhat mediocre attraction .You do however get a free glass of Heineken mid tour and a choice of either an ice cold pint at the end or two glasses of Heineken.

Awesome . Really surprised how good this was. I was expecting the usual walk around the brewery, have a couple of beers and move on. This was so much more. Interactive games, fun picture taking and video opportunities, along with a number of other high tech fun things to do. The beer at the end wasn't to bad either

A historical experience of Heineken . A very interesting experience of how Heineken evolved. You get to see how the beer is done from one step to another. Bear in mind that this is not an actual factory and you will not see the actual procedure taking place. You see illustrations and also items used for beer making. Still a thrilling experience and above all you get to taste their good beer.

Fun experience. Very nice afternoon with friends over some nice beer stories and world of the Heineken's. I was there with 3 friends who all enjoyed the very gentle and vibrabt customer service. I recomend for a saturday afternoon with mates.
Most beautifull . Excellent journey with my Wife In her birthday . She had enjoyied a kit without any problem ... Everybody só happy ABS engated for brazinlian undécimo..

Second time around and it just gets better! . I've been to the Heineken Experience before but it surprised me again this time around. All the staff are really interactive and multilingual, had a healthy level of banter and were passionate about the brand. You get to learn a lot about the history of Heineken and you even get two free beers at the end! If you get a chance to go up to the rooftop bar then do it! You get a really nice view of the city whilst sipping on a beer!

I don't drink beer but loved it! . A really cool trip through the Heineken experience. You get to see how they make the beer, what its made from, how to pour a beer, how it's bottled, sponsors and marketing tricks and they even show you how to drink it properly... I didn't drink a drop and still loved it. Incidentally... You are able to claim your drinks from the rooftop bar... Definitely worth it.

Excellent . Amsterdam is a very crowded city... A lot of tourists. So every major tourist stop has a crowd. The Heineken experience is worth the wait. Not necessarily because of the great information on the tour, but because it includes 2 glasses of Heineken. There is roof top bar that is a must do on the tour. Heineken has a new limited edition beer N or H 41 that was available by the glass. Hands down the best tasting beer I have ever had. Along with some Amsterdam weed, I was in heaven at the roof top bar. I joked with people there that the Heineken tour should consist of an elevator ride straight to the roof and someone handing you a beer upon exit. Great tour if you are high.

Enjoyable experience. The Heineken experience is genuinely enjoyable for the price you pay. It is definitely worth paying for a ticket in advance as the queue for tickets when I went was quite long. Luckily, the rooftop bar was open when I went which had a really nice view and provided a nice end to the visit (see pictures).

Fun exoeruence. I wasn't really interested in seeing how the beer is made but I'm not sorry I went. We drank free beer at the end and I must admit that it tastes so much better than the one they serve in pubs or restaurants.

Very cool. It was an experience. It was fun and cool. And it's pretty long. There is a movie, then a bar, you get to taste some beers and after all obviously they leave you at the shop for you to spend. I would recommend.
Fun..... Fairly informative and fun for an afternoon activity. Beer at the end on the roof was nice....pretty crowded, but has a fairly large gift shop for souvenirs....

Holidaying . This was a great experience learnt a lot about beer making and tastes lots of good beer at the end of the tour The photo room was fun took lots of photos Over all i would recommend to every one whether you like beer or not to visit this place
Amazing . Next part of our Amsterdam trip was this tour,go Vip if you get the chance, really is worth it, the shop at the end is great.. This tour is for girls as well... Not just beer drinking men!

Heinekant. Heineken history was interesting and how they make it fairly hands on but it's nothing you couldn't learn from a beginners YouTube tutorial. It focuses a lot on the sports and music to fill a few floors with photo booths and other gimmicks. The wristband and coin idea is good but it's a let down when it's only a half pint for one. Would recommend going to the sixth floor to have a taste of it if it's a nice day out. Unfortunately I was expecting more about the beer and how it has developed instead of what it sponsored. Still worth a visit.

Plenty of fun, good value. A fun tour of the old brewery. Takes only about 1.5 to 2 hours, with two drinks at the end. Very light-hearted look at brewing (not in as much depth as other breweries) and history of Heineken brewery.

Good visit but gimmicky, high tech photos/videos don't come. A fun experience. Loved the ride and bottle your own beer. Each take your own photo to make a postcard and "karaoke" videos never got sent to my email. Disappointed and wondering if they wanted email for solely marketing purposes.

Great Experience. Loved the tour, it costs 16 euro and they provide you 2 beers draft of Heineken. The tour was dinamic with multimedia interaction and 4D experience (2 minutes of it). you feel che Champions Leauge experience, PSP3 games, Soccer games, rugby games. WORTH EVERY EURO!

Well worth a visit. Well worth a visit to the museum, cost us €16 including a couple drinks at the end of the tour, goes through the history of the Heineken brewery, including a clever making of the beer from an inside view.
Good value, good for adults, not much to do for kids

A lesson in beer. No someone who doesn't drink beer it wasn't wasted on me at all.It was nice to see how it all gets made. It's an amazing building and the area is stunning. Get the VIP package as you get 2 free beers with it.And during the tour you get to taste and smell the beers prior to using your tokens to get your 2 free beers.If you are not into beer take someone who is and you'll be there best friend.My other half had 6 beers as I didn't have my 3. Needless to say she was very happy for that.

Great all-round experience. I visited this place in April and thought it was such a good experience that we decided to return with the whole family when we visited Amsterdam again in July.We have done quite a few different brewery tours around the world and this one is very different to the others in a positive sense.The self guided tour starts with a lot of the typical brewery history and beer making stuff, supplemented with staff at key locations who give more interactive information. This is followed by a tour through the horse stables, where you can see the actual horses that travel throughout Amsterdam each day.The tour then changes pace dramatically and becomes more modern and interactive.
