The short simulator ride is harmless and keeps you engaged short time it takes.You then travel through a series of rooms with interactive displays with karaoke, video recording, footie kicking, rugby scrumming, foosball, etc, which is really great for the kids and their Mum and kept them very engaged.Finally the beer tasting (for the adults) and the souvenir shop, which has lots of variety. The kids get free Pepsi if they want it.The Heineken experience is centrally located and only a few hundred metres from the museum precinct and Vondelpark, and can be reached by tram or bus.I would highly recommend this experience.

Cool experience. Cool experience. My husband and I went together and learned a lot of the history of Heineken. You get two tokens to get beer at the end of the tour. I would definitely recommend it to others.
Interesting experience . Well worth the trip if you are in town. It starts promptly and it is very insightful and the staff are very friendly. A fun hung to do with friends.

So much fun. Plan at least 2 hours. Prepare to drink some beers! It is all very organised and great. Careful not to lose your friends inside, the wifi covers only inside the exhibition and once you're out you can't text anymore.

Wonderful . Truly lovely place amazing to see and learn about the history of the beer and the people behind the name You get 2 small beers and some tasting but if you want to pour your own you only get one drink and certificate takes around a hour or too and the gift shop is worth a look easy to get to you get free gifts but their is no food to eat their so take sandwich
Day out . We qued for 30 mins it's a fabulous time but it's all stairs . Quick videos ... a free pint then buybuy

Great fun!. Lots of things to do to keep you occupied, including learning how to pour the perfect pint, virtual football and two and a half free drinks! Staff were great and the information was interesting. Although highly padded out with things not even vaguely related to beer (see above), it was still worth it! However, I took a picture in the photo booth and sent it to my email address - but it never arrived :( Not sure if I put the wrong address in by accident, but might be worth having a way to check that it has gone through, as was pretty disappointed with that!

Fun couple of hours. This used to be a brewery, now its a museum or should I say the History of this particular beverage can be found here. Its a very interesting and fun 2 to 3 hours depending on if its your thing. My wife and I both enjoyed this tour, you can go at your on pace and catch up on the past history, short movies and some interactive displays near the end of the tour. You finish up by having a couple of cold ones that are included in the ticket price and visiting the gift shop of course. We enjoyed our visit here, just make sure you buy your tickets in advance(online is best) and you can walk right by any line ups and start the tour right away.

VIP Tour well worth the extra . Just returned from a VIP tour. When I booked on line I pondered on the standard or the VIP tour, I made the right decision...Our guide was Roxy who led a group of 9 guest around, Roxy did not disappoint she was very informative about the entire brewing process and Heineken history, we started in amongst the general entry and before long we were separated to the VIP areas, where were presented a number of beer tastings along with sampling different cheese and good interaction, before being lead up to the roof and other parts of the building, following this we separated and were left to explore the remaining activities on our own, the entire tour took around three hours, well worth the money.

Great interactive experience . I don't even know where to start. Heineken has hands down been the best brewery tour I've been on. You can spend time at the beginning reading and learning about the history, or skip straight to the interactive, self guided tour. The tour covers everything: explaining the brewing process, live horses, a 4D video experience movie, tasting room, how to pour, all with the theme of Heineken's involvement throughout the world through as seen in the advertising and sports. There's something for everyone!

Inqusitive ? How do they make beer ? Must visit . The experience here is good. The journey of Heineken is well illustrated and explained. The yeast which was discovered 100 years back, still is preserved and used in making Heineken Beer ! Did you know it ?? That the feel of being present amidst the beer making process

Good place. Good place to spend few hours afternoon. The self guided,self interactive and full of surprises. More than that you can keep the memory by sending to email some photos from they interactive stands

Fun museum!. Fun and creative museum, very enjoyable for those who don't like serious historical type of museums.Got to see very detail processes of beer making and explained in fun ways.Loved the interactive experience with moving vehicle and bike karaoke.Of course I also liked the free two glasses of beers which were included in the entrance fee.

Very good tour . We got the number 16 tram from dam square and it only took 5 minutes. There was no waiting just pod and got in straight away , was a very informative tour that you can walk about at your own pace with plenty of staff if you have any questions and you get 1/2 a beer during the tour and 2 more at the end . After your tour you get a free boat tour that lasts 30 minutes and drops you off in central Amsterdam ( and you can buy more Heineken on the boat for 2,5 euros would definitely recommend this tour
Very entertaining! !. It worth the experience!! Love the way they show the history and how the bier is manufacturer. Final drinks were at the terrace with a wonderful view!!

Good tour and good way to spend a few hours. Good self tour with some interactive parts, some informative parts and some good beer at the end.Not badly priced and located in a great place for other attractions.

Great morning out. The whole experience took about two hours. Top tip is buy your tickets before hand as not only can you get a pre buy discount but, you also skip the queues. Samples of beer at the end of the tour are best taken in the roof top bar if you can.

Great fun!. Heineken museum wasn't on the list of things to do but a last minute rainy day visit, no regrets it was such great fun! Understanding the history of Heineken, beer making process and ending off with 2+ drinks, well worth the time!

Great interactive visitor experience . Knocks the Guinness factory in Dunlin out of the water! What a fab couple of hours, the 4D experience certainly topped it off- very well done! Perfectly finished by a tasting session and 2 beers! The information is displayed and delivered in so many different ways to keep you interested! Great for all ages with plenty to keep you busy!
Heineken . Typical brewery tour - kind of boring...if you don't go, you're not missing anything. Maybe a good rainy day activity if you are done with all the museums?

Better to just go to a bar. The best thing about the tour is the free beer at the end (but you have to suffer for an hour walking through a maze before actually having a few beers). There are far better beers in holland than Heineken. Instead of going to this "experience", I would recommend going to a "brown bar" sitting at the bar and telling the bartender to give you 3-5 Dutch or Belgium beers and just discussing life with the bartender or other people in the bar.

Amazing! Must see!!!. If you are going to Amsterdam, go to the Heineken experience! If you know when you want to go, go on a VIP tour. Absolutely amazing tour. Very informative about beer in general. And everything you could ever want in the gift shop. If you go on the VIP tour you get a free personalised bottle of Heineken and in the tour you can get a certificate for pulling the best pint.

Best attraction in Amsterdam! . It is an attraction nobody should miss while in Amsterdam, as it is great fun for both young and old, man and women, couples, families with children or gropus of friends. The tour takes about 1 h 30, and it is very interactive. There's no need for a guide and everything is very authentic. It is worth every penny! We loved it!

Great Tour. I am not a big fan of beer, but even I enjoyed this tour. It's a fascinating insight into the story of one of the worlds most famous drink brands and a very informative tour. You get a free glass of fresh veer at the end of the tour, but then also get to visit the bar and get up to 2 more free beers (or soft drinks too). There is an extensive gift shop too. All in all a great way to spend a few hours in Amsterdam.

Informative Heineken experience. It was well organised, with lots of staff who were all happy to help. Lovely to hear about the family legacy with lots of history to the Heineken name. Well worth experiencing!!

Greatest place to spend 2-3 hours. You go though this experience and learn a lot about beer making and the story of Heineken family and it's famous beer brand. They cover a lot of aspects of beer making and consuming, lots and lots of commercials and you get to have two beers at the end of the tour. We enjoyed learning how to taste and appreciate beer and why they prefer to have a foam, two-fingers high, on top of the beer glass in Holland. A great experience and good value for money. We also got funny pictures and videos.

Pretty good tour overall. . Apart from the painfully slow reception service to get in (even at the front of the line) was a good couple of hours. Get you tickets online. Normally I would have but it was a last minute decision to go. $18 at the door and a few cold beers at the end. Was pretty good on a rainy day to kill a two hours.

Worth experiencing . We received tickets for Heineken museum as a present, so I do not know the price. It includes a visit and two free beers. The word "experience" is right one to describe the whole journey. It is not only interesting for beer lovers, but also for football fans and even kids- there are plenty of nice activities they have designed. On several locations you can make nice photos of you and you do not have to pay for them- they are sent via mail. The view from the top is also very nice and you can enjoy your free beer for some time. It is a good place to spend 2-3 hours.
Good Tour. Worth a visit. The story of how the brewing began up until the present day. Best to buy your tickets in advance, you can then get quick entry to save the ques

Fun Experience . Fun experience with friends. Very informative and interactive. Fun approach of showing the process of making beer. You get beer tasting (small) and 2 beers. Interesting merchandise. There are a few free digital souvenir booths (photo/video sent to your email).You can have your name printed on the bottles or have your name engraved.

Amazing afternoon out. This is a amazing experience. You get 3 free beers inside too. You can make a bottle with your name printed on its brilliant to see all the history on heineken and the freebies are brilliant. So much to do inside to make it fun and they have horses inside too. It's an amazing day out and I could type about it all day I would advise to have tickets before like I did to avoid a big que. It took me 3 hours in total there is a good shop at the end too.

Bit of fun and something different!. I did wonder how this visit would be as there is only so much you can say about making beer.The talks were informative and the tour interesting.The simulator and interactive games and activities made the visit fun and being able to email the photos and videos was a nice touch.My hubby got a couple of personalised items and wears his Heineken hat all the time.Was a nice fun way to pass a couple of hours.
Could be better. A 20 min visit which was stretched to a much longer 1 hour waste of time. Could have been made more interesting

Playground for adults. Lots of fun and very interactive. You get to play games, take fun pictures and videos which is mailed to you straight away. Learn how to pour draught beer and a few other interesting things. South African breweries in Cape Town had one thing this one didn't and that is that you see the actual production line. Heineken shows you the process but in small scale..only for example purposes. Still all in all this was fun and had us giggling. Great for team building I would think

History and How to make a Heineken. I always love beer and heineken is my favourite beer brand!! And this tour really make me satisfied. It gives you knowledge about the history of heineken and how to made a heineken beer. They also sell personalized heineken bottle and you can have certificate as beer pour

Reception experience...good but not spectacular.. Had a corporate reception here as part of it we did the Heineken experience. Informative but a bit tacky. The entire time felt like a history lesson about the Heineken family - which I am sure is part of the story, but got a bit boring. Once piece of advice - please get rid of the VERY cheesy "brew you ride". And please warn people in the front row they may get wet! Yes you read that right - water spurts out at you during part of the "ride". The whole thing felt very tacky and quite forced. The only reason I am giving it a "average" rating was the beer included at the end!!! Well worth enduring the tour.

Fab. Pre booked this experience through my hotel which is a must as you can skip the queue.
Full of information and well laid out.
If you didn't like beer before you will now, from the beer tasting to the pint (or ml equivalent) you do get your monies worth.
I was all beer (larger'd) out by the end.

Amazing day - better than expected . We visited here on our third day and didn't really expect to be wowed. However, It was such a great day and was more interesting than we imagined. Really recommend going here especially on a rainy day. Took us about 2 and a half hours to go round the whole thing and you even get to go through the old brewery area and pour your own mini pint. Great day, would go again :)

Great experience . This was my first experience to a brewery, and sure it was worth it. I took the VIP ticket were you are in title to 5 bears and some fresh bear tasting with some unique dutch cheese. If you are a beer drinker then this tour will make you really appreciate every sip you drink. The amount of control and details they have from the very beginning until its bottled is shows how series Heineken are.

Cheers for Beer lovers. - Ensure that you have pre-purchased your tickets ( not vouchers for the tickets) to avoid the long queues- Great history of the Heineken family and beer heritage- Well laid out route and includes beer tasting ( two beers!).- Well worth this “pilgrimage” for the beer enthusiasts.Does seem somewhat "tacky" in some parts - a promotional opportunity for Heineken.

Recommend . Went on the tour with my teenage son. He was too young to have any beer as you need to be 18 but he really enjoyed the tour. It is very interactive, all the displays are in English and there is good humour in the videos and from the staff themselves. I would recommend buying the fast track tickets from one of the ticket shops in the city centre as there was a long queue for those without tickets but we were able to walk straight in. I would recommend this tour.

Pretty tacky. . The whole experience felt forced. From the video clips depicting the brewing process instead of seeing a live demonstration, to the gimmicky "brew you ride." It was a bit of a letdown compares to other brewery/distillery tours. If you enjoy extremely busy tourist destinations without much substance then this is more your thing. That being said, Heineken does taste much better on draught than in bottle.

Great! . We came here on out travels through Holland and I have to say the amount of exhibits and the insight into the facility is great! You also get lots of sample beers and two at the end of the trip! They also offer you a free tour down the canal which is great! Would recommend strongly!
Must do in Amsterdam! . One of my absolute favorite stops in Amsterdam! The staff is great, everyone who works there makes the experience very enjoyable! So much fun, great activity for anyone!

Great Fun!. Visited today and had a really enjoyable time. Staff were helpful and the displays were informative. Nice to get a couple of cold beers at the end. Just a shame the rooftop bar is only open at weekends!
Tourist trap. Worst brewery tour I have ever been on. It's really just a museum, but in a city full of great things. Skip this, not worth two beers at end of self guided tour

Something for all those over 18 years. Variety of things to see and do. Not only is the history there but a great reality ride and to finish it off a drink or 2 of Heineken 's finest brew. Unfortunately the horses were themselves on holiday when we visited. A great deal of stairs to navigate but I did see a lift so ask.

Great Experience. -fun
-beer
-great staff
-history of company
-selfie spots
-Entertainment
-Film about how to create beer
-tasting
-Thank you!

Totally worth the money. . I needed something to do that was open after 5 pm, and this seemed like an ok option. I thought, at least I will get a beer out of it.I did not set my standards high enough by half. This was a surprisingly entertaining and informative tour. Every aspect was well timed and spaced so that it did not get to crowded in any one place. WELL DONE. Also the beer was great. You end up getting 3-4. .3L beers as part of the tour and tons of fun interactive rooms to experience at the end as well. I actually did a combo ticket that also included a canal ride and tower ticket. Together not a bad price, ($28 at the door. I believe I have seen other prices quoted elsewhere) I wouldn't suggest doing JUST the canal tour or JUST the tower, but it was lovely when tacked on to the Heineken tour.

Incredible . It was a very good experience!! The museum is really cool and you actually learn how it all works.. and you get to see how the company merchandising strategy works. Totally recommended for all ages!
Tipsy. Had a great wobble round a well thought out attraction. Leaned a few facts and sampled a few beers and some cheese thanks to the management :)
Beer fest. Great interactive experience on how Heineken is produced. Great value as entry includes 3 beers. Nice roof top bar to soak up the view at the end

Entertaining, Silly fun, Interactive. The Heineken Brewery is a closed factory once used to brew beer, but Heineken did a very good job turning it into more than another boring museum. You get to do an information but fun tour. I really enjoyed the corny, interactive movie and the digital souvenirs and of course the included beer. I'm not much of a beer drinking but I appreciated the experience and the cold beer afterwards. This stop was very close to a tram stop so if you're traveling around the city, this is easy to get to.

Beer making meets Disney World. I was expecting a brewery tour and beer tasting but as the name suggest this truly is an experience, a well produced over the top, Disney like production. Do it only if you have run out of things to in Amsterdam.

Great tour . Visited Heineken brewery and had a great tour. Have done a few brewery tours in the past at various places and this one was one of the best. Gift shop is well stocked and staff are very friendly.Tip: as you do receive 2 free beers plus more if you want, do your tour in the afternoon not morning like I did as it slowed my day down haha.

Surprisingly fun. Had a pretty good time with some friends at the brewery. They did a great job of making it an interactive experience with free photo booths and games to play while you go through. 18 euros per person is a not too bad with the hour you'll spend there and two free beers. Definitely bypass the final bar downstairs and head straight to the rooftop bar to claim your beers and get a great view of the city.

A Great Place To Visit!!!. This was our first stop on our first day in Amsterdam. The Experience is well laid out and allows you to really get a good understanding of how the Heineken brand came to be. There are lots of stairs up and down, but nothing you can't handle. There are several interactive booths to take pictures and do things, and many displays of old bottles, and logos. and be sure to check out the label illusion on the floor as you pass from room to room....its pretty cool. Don't miss the interactive ride where you become the beer!!!If you are beer drinker, you will be given some wrist bands that allow you to get a few glasses of beer. The first one in the tasting room is not large, and is just a sample. Once you pass through that room, there is an actual lounge area where you can get a much large glass of beer. I did not see anyone checking, so you may be able to get more if you like. Once you pass through the building, you exit through the gift shop, which is large and on two floors. There are some very pretty girls that work at the registers and they were very friendly and helpfulIf you are with a group of friends, looking for a night out, or are a fan of the Heineken brand, this is a must see. I will most definitely go back....

Top Shelf Museum for Beer Lovers. This attraction is located about 2kms from the Amsterdam Central Railway Station and when you come across it, it is impossible to miss.It is basically a self conducted tour but I do recommend you go with a partner or a selfie stick so as to be able to take photos of yourself at the various displays if that is your want. It is an exceptionally well put together exhibition of the history of the Heineken family right through to the beer making process. There is so much to see along the way and you become totally immersed in the surroundings. Some of the displays are quite brilliant so do yourself a favour and go along to see for yourself.There are staff explaining the processes as you move through the museum and you get to sample the beer along the way as well as at the very end. The staff at the various displays are very knowledgeable and the bar staff are very friendly also.Would consider it a must see for any beer lover and for travellers in general. Also recommend you purchase your ticket in advance at most ticket outlets around the city as it can save you a couple of Euros and avoid unnecessary delays gaining entry.
Worth it! . I'm not a fan of Heineken, but it was a nice experience! Tour is interactive, and self paced. You get 2 beers at the end. Good value. Gift shop is a bit pricey though.

A Little Educational, A Little Silly, A Lot of Fun. Even if you don't like Heineken, this tour is worth while. There is a very silly video demonstration, but it does get you in the mood not to be too serious. The tour walks you through the beer making and bottling process and teaches you how to drink a Heineken. Had know idea about the importance of that foamy head! You then get 2 beers to drink in the bar. Of course, you walk through the gift shop on your way out.

A fun break from the serious museums!. Whilst expecting little, we were pleasantly surprised to enjoy a couple of hours understanding the brewing process, and of course tasting the beer!Not really for under 18's (although some may enjoy it) but actually enjoyed some of the history and the (basic) ride experience going through the brewing process. Worth a visit.

A great job turning a typical brewery into an interactive one!. I have been on many brewery tours, and this was by far the most fun. There's of course history, but they also have photo booths, a funny bicycling activity where you make a video of you delivering Heineken around Holland, and a 4-D movie that explains the bottling process. Even kids could have fun! Admission includes 2 free beers, and you also get a 25 cl taste earlier. We answered some of the trivia questions correctly, so we got a couple of extra beers! Not sure I would go back unless I was with friends who had never been before, but it's definitely worth doing once.
18 Euro gets you the tour and 2 beers. Went on a whim. Starts as a background on the Heineken brand and ends on a bar scene. Fun but it helps if you like beer!

Great Fun!. We happened upon this as we were riding on a hop on/hop off canal tour. The sky was dripping so we weren't eager to do a lot of outdoor activities, so we decided to check it out. We were very glad we did. We had great fun. There were lots of interactive displays, including games, videos to make, photo ops, horses to see. We got to try our hand at the different steps of making and serving beer, see fun movies, including one where the floor moves and bubbles drop out of the sky. We even got to have two beers at the end, though we didn't drink both. Coke Museum in Atlanta should come visit for some fresh ideas!

Was nothing special. Me and my partner recently visited this place whilst in Amsterdam. We didn't think it was that good, it was ok to pass an hour or two but it feels a bit rushed.The beer simulator was rather amusing as was the picture booths.

Fun for engineers!. I admit that most people are drawn to the Heineken experience because of the free beers or because they think it is like the Atlanta Coca Cola Experience. Yes, it has two beers included in the fee but it is nothing like the global taste buds of Coke. I like the part where they explained the process. The simulation with the long wait was extremely funny and it was stunning to see how little plant equipment evolved from 1913 to the 1950'ies. The wait was made fun by the great photographer who was using Polariods and great personal charm to make people forget the half hour wait for no reason other than the not so optimal ticker counter. I do expect most people like the tasting, commercial and games part much better but I skipped that quickly; I prefer to choose the alcohol that floods my body during down time ;-). That does not stop me from recommending this place and its staff; I will put it on any future travel with friends and peers.

If you like beer this would be the best experience of your life if you don't its still good. This is a must in Amsterdam, they drive you through the history of the company and it fabulous beer. You will have the opportunity of try somber and experience how its feel to be brew... Super recommend.

Extremely Amazing. I never had a tour like this! Perfect line up, a lot of things to do and try! Selfie-Cams, interactive Games and Movies! Amazing! Reasonable pricing and lot of fun! Highly recommended!

It's ok. Having visited the Guinness brewery, I can honestly say that the Heineken experience doesn't really compare. You get to see a bit of history, a bit of how they manufacture and market and get a free drink. However they market the experience too much towards 20 year olds so it got a bit boring.

Beer Time. When we went to Amsterdam most of our friends who have been there told us we should do this atraction, and they where right! We didn't bought the online ticket, however we bought with the Amsterdam card, what gave us a discount, the price was 13€, and for the next hour we learned the process of making a beer as well the history of the heineken beer. The staff was very friendly and the visitors can make a lot of interactive experiences related with the beer. At the end you can take two beers included in the ticket. A very good atraction to see in my opinion!
Beer beer and more beer. . Great beer experience and interesting history. One of the better museums/attractions in Amsterdam. Would totally go there again some time!

Interesting but definitely paying for them to advertise to you. This is a bit of a pricey tour given it is mostly an advertisement for their beer, but if you are in Amsterdam and have some extra time it is still worth it. The first part is a combination of self guided tour and presentations on beer making and how to drink a beer. Parts of the tour have a carnival-type feeling as you can "green screen" yourself into various pictures and movies revolving around Heineken sponsorships. You can send the files to your email for free. One of the movies is on a moving platform so you feel like you are moving through the scenes as you see how beer is made from beginning to end.At the end, you can trade in the buttons on your wristband to two drinks (beer or soda) or you can use them to get a beer pouring certificate. If the latter is what you want, sign up immediately as a line will form and could take a while to get to you.

Don't get suckered into this!. Egad, this was a huge waste of time. If you think being herded like cattle around a museum-esque display of beer history, going on a silly, low-rent "ride" where you pretend to be a beer bottle, and only at the end getting to drink an actual cold beer, then fine, this is the attraction for you! But it was not worth the admission when we could have enjoyed 4 beers at an outdoor cafe on the canal for the same price. (Why did we do it, you ask? Because our friends did it and didn't warn us against it until it was too late!)

Enjoyable Visit to Heineken. Toured the Heineken Experience on a Saturday afternoon. Was crowded, but not as bad as expected. Most of the tour at your own pace. Two and a half beers come with the admission! Tour and all signage completely in English, which surprised me. We enjoyed the tour.

Rather disappointing. Possibly worth considering as a wet weather option although overall we were rather disappointed. Displays and graphics were quite well done, and designed to make use of all the different senses, and we came away with a better understanding of Heineken as a brand. However, the Brew You 'ride’ halfway round was a massive bottleneck, with queues of 20 minutes plus but no apparent option to skip it if you didn’t want to wait. Again there was a long queue for the beers at the end so we didn’t bother to wait – just happy to escape the horrible sticky floors !
great experience. its nice to know how the beer is made and the heritage behind the Heineken company.i enjoyed it, it was worth the time and money.
Terrible . Waste of time and money. The tour itself is pretty boring and not attractive at all. Don't expect much.
Good fun . It's well organized. A short history of the Heineken family, beer tasting x2, fun games where you can e mail photos and videos to yourself. I don't drink beer but still enjoyed it.
Awesome experience . Very interactive experience! A fresh breath of fun amongst all the museums. Extremely modern. Similar to the world of coke in Atlanta but Better!

Good experience . At first it is a bit confusing just walking into a museum or a experience ?? Then you have loads of interactive things to do. Makes the whole morning very fun. At the end we get to try the beer and perfect pour and luckily for us the food terrace bar was open and we enjoyed a couple more heinekens with the amazing view of the city .

Heineken Experience. If you have a few extra hours while in Amsterdam this is a great way to spend them- an interesting, interactive, self-guided tour of how Heineken came to be. You can probably take the tour in an hour but you could also take you 2-3 hours depending on how long you spend at each area and how long you stay at the bar at the end of the tour. The 4D movie, the bike ride video, and beer tasting are some of the highlights.
Entertaining. Don"t want to say too much as it would be spoilers. But we had a fantastic experience. Were in there fo 3 hours. Well done Heineken.

Brilliant . We visited here and really enjoyed our visit. The set up is fantastic and innovative which allows you to learn all about the history of Heineken and how the beer is brewed in a fun but informative way. We loved all the video booths etc which allows you to email these to you free of charge - great job done as most places would rip you off with these extras. The ability to create your own personalised beer bottle is brilliant too. We loved our visit and the sampling that came with this too :) I would really recommend the Heineken experience.

Beeeeeerrrr!!!. Well put together & interesting tour with a number of interactive exhibits. Shame the horses weren't there but everything else worked. Oh and of course, the beer was cold, tasty & plentiful.Gift shop reasonably priced
Gimmicky. The overall tour was good. The start was very informative. However towards the end it became veey gimmicky and it was obvious the tour was largely about selling the Heineken brand

Great Fun. This really is a terrific Experience!! Heineken does a thorough but entertaining job of telling their story. This was my second time to take the "tour" and enjoyed it just as much the second time!!

One of a Kind. Before we went to the Heineken Experience, I had some friends tell us mixed reviews, so we didnt know what to expect.
Would definitely reccomend you experience this and then decide for yourself - dont listen to anyone else!
We enjoyed it. :)

Ok for a rainy day. A bit of history about the company at the start. Pass through the stables and then you are into the interactive part of the experience. Overall I thought it was expensive for what it is. Better to use the entrance fee and go to the shop and buy some beers.

Worthwhile visit.. Similar to many brewery museums but overall well set out. You do feel a bit rushed in places and can be very busy with tourists. Go on a Saturday. The only day the roof top bar is open otherwise is a small room with few chairs is where you get to drink your pint.
Overhyped and bit too Crowded. Good for a one time visit.... Noting that great.. You can buy combination tickets at discount at other attractions or tours and ticking counters

For beer lovers. This was a bit of a let down, because we expected so much more. In itself, it's not boring or bad. But we thought we would be able to see beer being brewed for real here. Yet, it's interesting for beer lovers who get to sample beer, know more about it and at the end of it get two glasses beer to drink in a pub like atmosphere. Lots of photo ops too. But if you're on a short trip to Amsterdam, wanting to do other stuff, you can skip this.

Great Visit. Had an enjoyable time at the Heineken Experience. Arrived and went straight through. Best to get your tickets before arriving. There was an interactive area where you could learn to pull a pint and more. The cost was €16 each which was reasonable as we spent a few hours here.

Interesting tour with beer at the end. The Heineken Experience is located in the old Heineken brewing building that now hosts not only group tours but also individuals can tour on their own. Our group of 5 (ages 36-23) sprung for the Heineken Experience and I am very happy we did because I don't typically drink beer therefore am not very interested. Our tour guide was a wealth of information covering the history of the building, the family that owns it and the brewing process of Heineken. We were given samples of the beer in varies brewing stages. The building is large with lots of walking, stairs and elevators. We were able to skip the lines for a personalized Heineken glass, interactive movie and a private beer/cheese tasting with our tour guide. Then we were brought to the roof of the building for an amazing outdoor view of the Amsterdam skyline. Our tour ended with a interactive games following a party-type atmosphere to use our free beer tokens. Of course the 2 story Heineken gift shop before you leave. This place can get quite crowded and I would recommend wearing comfortable shoes but I thought this place was fun. As soon as I got back home I purchased a case of Heineken.

Great tour that includes beer!. Very informative tour. Two beers included with the low admission price. This beautiful old brewery should not be missed. The tour takes you from the creation of the brewery to present day.

Very entertaining. Knowing nothing previous from my visit, it was nice to see the whole process of making beer. Lots of activities for the visitors to interact, not to mention the final part which becames almost a hangout with friends due to the music and beers included in the ticket.
Great fun!. Very similar to the Guiness experience in Dublin but a different Beer but still worth a visit. The price includes a couple of drinks so choose your time for a visit with his in mind.
Worth seeing. I don't drink beer, but loved the Heineken Experience. They have done a remarkable job with the history of the Heineken family & their process of making their beer.

Exiting tour. Well spendt money!
Interesting history and tasting.
Big gift shop wirh all Kind of assorteries and glasses.
Cool place!

Great experience! . Very touristy but It knew it, lots of photo opportunities and quirky wee things to see and buy, we where lucky enough to be there when the sun was out, had some burgers on the roof which was amazing to see the views of Amsterdam while having a cold beer. Not to be taken to seriously just a good enjoyable wee experience, not a huge fan of beer either but enjoyed the few drinks I got in the factory after their drinking tutorial. A fun time.

OK if you like glitz not information. In the first part of the tour, you learn the company's talking points and the basic information about brewing beer. I liked seeing the old equipment they used, but the horses were not there when we went. The last half is like being at an amusement park. We went on a Saturday evening so it was really crowded and there were lines for everything and not place to sit down, even when you get the 2 beers at the end. My husband liked it but I was ready to leave half way through.
A must see place in Amsterdam. There are few men who have not heard the name of Heineken and this old building is a very nice one to visit in Amsterdam, ofcourse if you have extra time.
Amazing value for money. This was one of my favourite trips in Amsterdam,lots of fun!would definitely go again. Perfect rainy day activity.,and two beers at the end..what more could you want?

Informative and fun. Informative with quite a bit of simulation activities. Photos and videos from the photo booth can be emailed without charge.The price of the ticket includes tokens for two beers as well or alternatively one beer and the chance to pour your own beer and diploma certificate.
Beer my dear!. Great insight to know how Heineken beer is made! Lovely atmosphere with great interactive areas and games. It truly love is an experience not to be missed!

Best brewery tour. Fun and informative tour. We really enjoy it, like visiting universal studio of beer they are rides, games, photo & video booth. The Heineken tastes much much better here. Highly recommened tour, specially if you like Heineken beer.

Amsterdam weekend break. Husband really wanted to visit where I was quite reluctant as Im not into beer at all :) however, I was quite amazed of the place and the it was interesting too! :) Ended up drinking beer as well :)

It's worth a visit. I'm guessing that the popularity Heineken has gained world wide is enough to warrant a visit to the experience museum, but there's no James Bond action for you here. The tour is really interactive and informative, you'll be walked through the stages of production and the history of the company and given a first row seat to how beer is made.It is interesting and it ends with a few beers, so cheers!

Mediocre. Ok so it's a brewery tour much like any other, they do have some nice interactive touches but it's all a bit shallow with no depth! Loads of football memorabilia and you do get two small beers plus a taster. If you want to take the pour challenge though it's one beer for two tokens! Overall good for a couple of hours at most and you digger free canal boat tickets back to the centre

Fun & beer included . Informative & fun. Loads to do e.g museum info, interactive photos, computer games, football and ruby section. Follows by an interactive movie and beer tasting. You then get 2x 25 beers. God value.

Great experience. I read a lot of reviews about the Heineken experience and they had to many disagreement but i am glade that my wife made my go.It was good and we had a great time , it was funny and pleasing.

Much better than expected!. We learnt about Heineken's history and beer making in a very fun and interactive way (through a short 4D film, interactive exhibits, customising your very own bottle of beer, photo and video points etc)! Become a certified pourer (using 2 token from the given wristband) by learning how to pour the perfect Heineken from tap. It’s a cool experience that you wouldn’t want to miss. The Heineken experience is more than just beer tasting, we had lots of fun here!

Very interesting. Good activity to go on as a warm up to the night! Interesting tour and 3 free beers! What more do you want? Book your tickets in advance though, as it can get busy and you can skip the lines if you do.

Tourist Trap. My family and I visited the Heineken Experience hoping to learn about the making of beer, the company and the founding family. It was extremely crowded, and not a lot of content. After a ten minute wait in line, the tour ended with a Disney Land like simulator ride. It was really an uninformative tour for twenty year olds who want to drink beer at the end. Couldn't wait to leave.

Heineken experience tour. Fun time touring the old brewery. A bit pricey perhaps but was interesting and did a tasting during the tour and also had tickets for a couple beers at the end. Can go as slow or fast as you want.
Excellent tour. Beats Guinness and Jamesons tours hands down. Very interesting and plenty of free samples. Definitely worth prebooking as queues can be quite long if you don't

Awesome VIP tour. The VIP tour is fantastic and well worth the extra money. Our tour was guided by a very enthusiastic young man who knew everything about the Heineken history, the brewing process, and beer tasting. The VIP experience included a guided tour in areas where the self guided tour was as well as other areas in the building that were specifically for the VIP tour. It also included a private beer tasting. We tasted different types of beer pared with different kinds of cheese. Then, received two gifts! Awesome time.

Great. It was very boring first of all as i have no interest in history of heinken but as we moved on it was good. 4d movie show , bartending and games plus photo session and ambience was v good. Plus when u get an extra glass of heinken , everythng's good. Shopping can also b done in the exclusive heinken shop inside but i might say products they sell are bit handy. Overall it was v great as i had a bottle of heinken with my name on it.

Tourist Trap but you have to do it . The beer is at the end of the trip so be patient. Besides the fresh beer ( many in the world can't say they had fresh beer directly from Heineken) and the copper fermentation vats the rest was underwhelming. Reminded me of a Disney land ride for beer.
The best!. A very well organized and laid out tour, lots of fun! This is one of the best beer manufacturing facility tours ever; done with s high sense of humor.

Brewery visit. A great learning experience about your making in the early Amsterdam a completely enjoyable experience there are a lot of stairs to walk but if you have any problems you should get the key to the elevator when you check in because they do have elevators available for anyone with walking disability

Excellent experience. Having been on a few brewery tours already. Having been on a few brewery tours already, I have to say this experience has impressed me the most. The interactive and modern technology integrated here makes a superb visit and well worth the money... A definite for when you visit Amsterdam

Great Experience ! Need to visit . Better than expected, I had visit other but this one let you feel like been a beer. Also include three free heineken for the entry price. They teach about the component of the beer and also let you taste it.

Fantastic, interactive experience!. Best trip of the holiday this was!Beer sampling, 2 free drinks with a wristband, 4D ride, interactive exhibits, UEFA Champions League section, history. Would definitely recommend this to anyone, even if you don't like beer, you can get soft drinks too!Book on advance at tours and ticket shops around Amsterdam, or go before midday!
Very fun!. Great place to go with a group of friends! It was very fun but very touristy! Free beer, fun photo ops, and a great working staff. Also educational
The VIP arrangement really gives the feeling. Nice to be told about founding and growing of our famous brewer. Never new that beer taste better with the right cheeses, also holland made

So much fun!!. Glad we decided to wait in the queue as it was worth it! Really puts you in a party atmosphere with very good humoured staff! If you get the opportunity go upto the rooftop terrace. Amazing views over Amsterdam!

Wonderfull experience. I've booked the visit to see this attraction two hours before and I like so much the professionality of the staff . I have bought the tickets with taste of beer and we have tasted a lot of beer .
It was a wonderfull experience, I hope to come back very soon!

A must in Amsterdam. This is a must go attraction in Amsterdam. No matter you are a beer lover or not, Heineken Experience will for sure give you an amazing experience. There are displays about the history of Heineken, interactive activities for you to have fun with your friends, and of course bars to enjoy beer! I have paid a visit to Carlsberg brewery (in Denmark) before. Heineken Experience is quite different from Carlsberg’s in the sense that the former is far more interactive. I am sure you will enjoy!
Interesting. This is more for young people 18-30. The best part for us was the ferry ride half way around the city afterwards! Also we got to see some of the horses!

Fun!. I didn't expect to be so entertained in this visit! You learn about the Heineken family and the brewery and the beer but it is done in such a fun and entertaining manner. Lots of hands on things to do. Friendly workers. Don't miss the star Tours style ride that lets you experience being beer. It was a hoot!

Great fun for a rainy day. We pre booked our tickets online and received and email with our tickets however when trying to show these we had some technical issues, it would open one ticket but not the other. The member of staff viewing the email said not to worry and to approach the desk where they could search for your booking. When we approached the desk the member of staff was very unhelpful and had a terrible attitude. After telling us she couldn't do anything the supervisor appeared and again was very helpful and spoke to the member of staff that viewed the email initially and allowed us enter. The rest of the experience was great and the other members of staff were engaging and friendly! It's a shame that one of the first members of staff you meet leaves a bad lasting impression.
Interactive visit. What a nice surprise! Many games and interactive possibilities during our visit. No crowds, very friendly young staff . Wonderful way to spend two hours with friends.

What a Blast. I've been on my fair share of brewery tours, but this one was the most fun. Exhibits are informative and interactive. My wife and I had a blast. Make sure you do the interactive karaoke bike ride video, pretty entertaining. When all finished with the tour, we took a ride on the Heineken river boat into the city center, courtesy of Heineken!

It's a Nederland brand. Always thought, it was German. A great experience. Seeing history behind my fav drink. The 3D show, the entire process , the games, the beer tasting, pourer certificate, all first class. You can spend hours there and still not be bored of it.
Fun. Great place to visit. Entertaining, theme-park-type activities, free beer. Someone has obviously been to Disney and picked up tips on how to amuse your customers. Good, extensive, gift shop.

Proost!. We really enjoyed the tour. Very interesting and the chance for bit of fun along the way! Best part was the tasting room and of course, the two "free" beers at the end. Would recommend for adults.

Worth a visit . We visited the Heineken Experience when it opened at 10.30am. After reading a review on here we booked our tickets (€16 each) online on our way to the brewery so didn't have to queue just walked straight through when we got there. No need to print them just scanned our phones on entry. You can take as long as you want as it's a self guided tour we spent about two hours here. The initial part is the history of the company which was interesting. There are lots of interactive activities throughout the tour such as how to pour the perfect pint, try your hand at being a DJ, video yourself riding a bike through Amsterdam while singing tulips from Amsterdam on the karaoke! The 4D experience of beer being bottled was good. The sports area was fun too. You can put your name on a bottle of Heineken and collect it at the end. At the end of the tour you have two tokens on your entry wristband which you can use in the bar. One token for either a glass of Heineken or H41 or use both tokens for a large extra cold Heineken. Overall we thought this was worth visiting and enjoyed the experience.

Fun & Interesting. We booked the VIP tour, concerned initially at the start as they take you through like you would with a normal admission ticket, but once you get past that its an awesome experience. Our tour guide Carmen was cheerful and friendly, and made it all the more worth it. The best part of our trip was this tour.
Well worth a visit!. 2 free pints at the end of the tour, plus a small taster session half way through. Lots of interactive parts. Good fun!
Awesome . I have visited many brewery's but this one was definitely the best I have been to. Lots to do. Make sure pre-buy your ticket.
Amazing beer and tasting. We had an amazing time with the Heineken experience! The beer was nice an cold, the tour guides was so friendly. Any beer lovers dream!

Nice visit. Nice and pleasant visit, but can't say I'm a big Heineken fan, but the tour is great, the stuff is very nice and there are a lot of video projections that show the history of Heineken. If anyone is a beer fan, and likes Heineken than this is a must.
Beer Goggles On. if you love beer, i would certainly recommend a trip to the heineken experience. great knowledge without being boring and you get to enjoy a few drinks while you're at it.

A touristy "fun" visit. The Heineken experience was definitely created to entertain the tourist population. The experience is fun and provides you with a lot of entertainment but it's kind of cheesy and over the top. The free beer is nice and it can take you up to an hour to do the whole tour.

Great fun!. We did this on the spur of the moment and are so glad we did. A really interesting history of the family and the brewery followed by beer tasting and some fun, interactive activities plus two free beers at the end. This is a must do for fun lovers visiting Amsterdam.

Great experience . We purchased tickets as a combination with ice bar on board the hop on hop off bus, would definitely recommend this option as it works out cheaper plus you avoid a potentially lengthy que to purchase a ticket on arrival! Overall a great tour, exploring the history of Heineken, the brewing process, a visual experience going through the brewing process and finally tasting, which was personally my favourite! We got 2 drink tokens with our ticket, which have us the option of 2 small heinekens at the end or one large xtra cold Heineken. Definitely worth the visit!
Not worth the money. After being in Dublin at the beer museum I think this was nothing special. You can tell that the staff tries too much to be funny and make you have fun. Nothing special

Good value. Interresting tour.
Staff is friendly and knows their stuff.
With the entrance fee you will get 3 beers!
Cheer!

3 stars is fair. Plenty of stuff to read/watch but can see that online. Could do with some more interactive stuff and maybe a guided tour.
Stay away from the 'H41' as it tastes foul and is a waste of a drinks token.
Interesting but expensive.

Must visit. To be honest I assumed this place was going to be boring however it was such a fun experience. I came here with my girlfriend and we both had a great time. The ride where your 'in a bottle' was amazing. Worth a visit.

Happy husband means happy wife. My husband & our kids had a fabulous time at this tour today. He was impressed with how informative the sessions were, not to mention the free drinks & his perfect pour! The kids loved the interactive features, lots of selfies to share with their friends & the world of social media. Staff were friendly & helpful, very impressed!

Interactive experience. Quite enjoyed our brewey visit worked out about £10 it showed the history of heineken aswell as some modern interactive fun displays. Particularly enjoyed the heineken sports section and the interactive journey of heineken beer.
good beer tour. visited the heineken experience for an afternoon out. Nice tour and informative with a free beer. However I was expecting brewery tour or more history. More fun and games
OK Visit. Lots of people. Stood in line for about 45 minutes. Self pace tour, then waited for the "4 dimension ride".

Interesting visit . Went along with my wife and was pleasantly surprised. A great look into the history of this iconic company and the methods used in the brewing process.
Chances to taste different brews and a lot of interactive displays.
Would recommend even to those that aren't big fans of Heineken.

Don't expect to learn much about beer making. An entertaining fun experience in which you learn a little about Heineken Lager and you get, in total, three complimentary glasses of the amber/golden liquid. Just don't expect to come away with the expectations of being able to start your own beer making business.

Great fun for a small fee. The tour was excellent, no guides forcing you round etc just a walk round in your own time. Very interesting, informative and fun tour, would highly recommend. For just €16 it's well worth a visit, tasters handed out on the way round and a free pint at the end! Large but not expensive gift shop also if you fancy taking a souvenir home.

Amazing - PLUS YOU GET 2 PINTS TO DRINK FOR FREE. I can bet that at the end you will want to come here again with your friends, Its an awesome experience with the 3D show and a lot of fun games to play. To understand the history of Heineken and know how your favorite beer is made. You can also get beer bottles with your names engraved on it and you have a lot of souvenirsto buy from. So CHEERS and enjoy your PINTS at the end of the tour.

VIP Tour Recommended. Heinekin's website does not do a good job explaining the features of the VIP tour. The standard tour is self guided, while the VIP tour has a knowledgeable guide with a limit of 10 guests. The highlight of the tour is a generous tasting of 5 distinct beers accompanied with cheese to match the beer. The tour does last close to 2 hours, and concludes with a gift- your name on the label of a Heineken beer bottle. We were delighted with the value of the VIP tour.

Awesome. Best brewery tour I ever went on. Enthusiastic young people who really enjoyed talking about their employer . Modern displays..great logical explanations...some interactive things to do? Big gift shop ! Of course! Well worth 16 euros for 90 minutes. Tram 1/2 block away.BUY TICKETS ON LINE FOR NO WAIT.

Didn't think it would be so much fun. I was surprised to find how a brewery 'museum' could be so much fun. There were many interactive areas that made for a real pleasant experience and now I'm willing to finally go to the Sam Adam's 'experience' in Boston !! Plus, I appreciated how beer is made.

Fun. Different than other brewery tours - it's not actually produced here so it's much more about the history, which is still cool. You get to walk through the places they used to brew, and they still have the horses too. You get to try beers at the end, which is always a major plus. You can go at your own pace which I really like; I've been to a bunch of breweries and it's frustrating when I get the same spiel about production over and over. You can make it last an hour or make it last 15 minutes, whatever you like. I think it was worth it for the experience alone. Make sure to spend needless money on customizing a beer bottle at the end - I got one for my dad for Father's Day and he loved it!

A very worth while experience . Being a resident of Amsterdam you inevitably have a constant stream of friends and family come to visit. Finding things to do can sometimes be a struggle. But with that said, The Heineken Experience never fails to entertain. The history of the brand is very well documented as you can take your time to take in all this exhibition has to offer. You even get to sample the product! The refurbishment of this venue has been brilliantly done and doesn't fail to deliver. I have taken countless people here from business associates to close friends. They have all left having had a great immersion into one of the worlds most recognized beer brands, happy they have got to sample a drink or two and picked up a great souvenir to take home.

Interesting. We visited this place as we were in Amsterdam and it was one of the things they recommended us to do. I do not love beer and neither does my husband, but the experience itself is interesting. You get to try beer (of course!) and they even give you a certificate saying you learned how to pour beer properly on a glass! They also have some entertaining around (like how to be a DJ, or karaoke machines and other stuff). The only issue we had was to have to deal with a lot of waiting in line in order to get to the next room. Overall, it was a good experience.
It's beer for goodness sake.. Well organised and easy to get round. Be quick on the answers at the beer tasting and you might get an extra freebie. I did. Good value in my book.

Informative and Free Beer. A good, self directed tour that gives a decent understanding of the Heineken story. The "4D" movie about how the beer is made was fun.But most go for the free beer, 2 half pints and a little taster. Well worth a visit.

Terrible. Good if you like Disneyland. Dreadful queues to get in.
Expensive, (€18) lacking any authentic brewery - this place is a parody of authenticity in a land of fun fair rides & digital game shows. Best avoided if you want to keep your sanity, cash & avoid wasting half a day.

Worth Checking Out!. We visited the Heineken Experience on a rainy morning and we really enjoyed it. We bought our tickets online so we didn't have to wait in the queue - we were able to walk right in.The tour is self guided and is laid out well so that guests can experience each section adequately and traffic flows smoothly throughout. You begin the tour with a brief section on Heineken's history which took place on the very spot on which you stand. Next there is a demonstration on how Heineken is made and you are able to walk around the old copper stills. The old brewery is beautiful and the information in this room is displayed in a clever and interesting manner.The tour also includes a guided beer tasting and many other interactive exhibits. The whole experience is 1-2 hours and well worth it. Even more so because the tour ends with two beers included in the price of admission! We were lucky enough that the weather had cleared up a bit by this time and we were able to have our beers on the rooftop patio with a view of the city! Soft drinks are available for those who don't want beer.The staff all had excellent customer service and provided great presentations and guidance throughout. Highly recommend!

Make a bottle with your name on it !. There is not much to do at Heineken Experience, but the best part is that you can order a bottle of Heineken with your (of your lover's) name on it. They also engrave glasses on the spot. It is a very good place to get a souvenir from Amsterdam.

Great rainy day activity. We had a very fun afternoon at the Heineken Experience. I agree with other reviewers that it is a big advertisement, but we expected that. There was a great explanation of the history of Heineken, a fun demonstration of how the beer is made, a tour through the brewery, an interactive "ride" through the brewing process, plus a visit to the stables (an unexpected highlight). And beer. Lots of beer. You can pour your own and get a certificate as well as design your own bottle for a small fee. It was perfect for my American teens, to be sure.

Heineken Experience. If you love beer, it is a must to visit. Try their new beer H41 which is not available in the market, it is very refreshing. Interactive games are fun. You can go there by public transport. Save 1 or 2 Euros if you get a coupon from the City maps.

Interesting history. Went here couple months ago (April i think) with a group of friends from one of my class in the uni. Its interesting to listened to the history of the brewery, their motives and how it is started at first. The place is also located in a very good area where it is reachable by tram and nearby there are a lot of other museums and restaurant that you could enjoy

Outstanding customer service!!!. Upon our arrival to the Heineken Experience, Eric, the gentleman just inside the front door, noticed I was limping quite markedly. He immediately obtained a wheelchair and took me to the medical room, applied ice and wrapped my ankle. We had a fantastic tour of the Experience in a wheelchair and access to the elevators. Subsequent to our tour, he called a taxi and requested we be driven to the hospital. As it turned out, I did have a fracture. Eric's assistance was much appreciated. He should be commended. He certainly made our visit an "Experience " we will not forget.

Very good!. Very good tour, I would suggest you buy tickets online before hand as there was a huge que with 30 minutes waiting. I bought my tickets online whilst in the line and then skipped the line and scanned the ticket on my phone, worth a visit.

Thank the staff!!!. The experience is nice (although I'm not sure it's worth 16 €...). Make sure u take a voucher for the boat ride at the end (13:00-15:00 only). I lost my phone (or it was stolen by someone) and all the staff were so nice and helpful!! The phone was brought back to me thank to the staff lady who called it and made the person to give it back!!!I'm sorry I did not take your name...Watch your staff because things get stolen...

Good fun . The marketing by heineken makes you become part of the beer family even if u r not a heavy beer drinker. Been twice and still enjoyed the second visit. Suggest especially if weather is wet.

Must Visit in Amsterdam. A lot of sections and they're well organised. Love the fact that the sections are very interactive and informative at the same time. Great time spent with family and friend, must-visit in Amsterdam. Plus who'd mind some beers?

Must do, interesting and fun!. It was a great tour with such an interesting history. We could go through at our own pace to look around. Good free beer and interesting being able to taste test the water/barley mixture before hops is added. Definitely recommend.

Must go!. Definitively a must go in Amsterdam. You will have a good time and it will be very entertainment, they will show you videos and talk about the history of the Heineken beer. You will be able to see how it's made and take some good pictures.You can also "graduate" pouring beer. And have a good beer after the tour. Highly recommend it.
A must to visit!. This tour is worth the visit! It takes you through the history of Heineken while making parts interactive. There may be a wait so make sure to buy your tickets online
Excellent and highly recommended. This was an amazing experience and I would definitely recommend it, me and my husband enjoyed it so much. Lots of activities and fun to be had

Very enjoyable. Paid a visit to the experience whilst in Amsterdam. We went for the self guided tour. It was very informative, and many interactive activities. I would recommend buying a ticket before you go and make sure it includes "skip the line" entry. The day we visited, the queue for the tickets was rather long. The tickets were exchanged for a wristband which had 2 tokens on. These could be exchanged for 2 small glasses of free beer at the end. If it is busy, be prepared to wait your turn on the interactive things. Such as a photo holding the football Champions League Cup, or riding a bike through Paris. Definitely worth a visit.

Worth the money. A definite must do. Worth every penny especially if you like your beer. My husband loved it! Be prepared for a bit of walking as it lasts about 2 hours. On the plus side, you get 2 beers included in the price.
Nice for a wonder around . Didn't have high expectations but it was good mainly for the free samples. Sitting at the bar at the end with a ice cold heine was nice.

Heineken via tour!. The girl who took us on the tour was brilliant! She joined in the laughs and jokes and she got the group involved in everything! All the staff in the building were so helpful and great to talk to! Defo worth going! The beer wasn't to bad either!!

Tourist trap. The Heineken Experience might be ok, if there aren't too many visitors.It was however an experience moving from one queue to another when I visited the old brewery a Saturday afternoon in June. You could hardly stop and read the small signs before people pushed from behind.The tour ends with a beer tasting, but with only two (similar) beers to choose from it's not that exciting.In many ways it reminds me of the Carlsberg Exbeerience in Copenhagen, but I would rate the Carlsberg tour much higher.Tip: Make sure to book your tickets in advance so you don't need to stand in line outside the old Heineken brewery.

Super experience. - only small queue for tickets
- self guided tour
- interactive & really interesting
- get two tastings during the tour and can redeem tokens you get when buying the tickets for two more beers or softdrinks at the end of the tour
- reall worth a visit!

Lots on offer. We recently visited while on a short break to Amsterdam.
The price of the tour was really good for what you got,it really was good value.
There was plenty of free drinks after the tour and extra if you answered the questions correctly ;)
Would recommend to tourists.

great experience . This was a great place to visit had a good laugh and lots to do. Good look at the history and modern day. It caters for all ages but young ones cannot drink ha ha. would recommend as a must do if you go to Amsterdam.
Disorganized . A series of queues towards the absurd, punctuated by a mandatory walk through horse dung smelling barn. Absolutely not worth the wait. Spend your time on something better

Heineken Experience Worth A Visit. This was far more interesting than expected. Very well organized but buy tickets online in advance to avoid long Q line. Mid afternoon appears to be a good time or dinner hour. Tour provides an excellent overview on making beer along with multiple fun interactive exhibits. Includes beer tasting too! If you are a beer fan, definitely worth a visit.
Deadly . Absolute must do if you visit Amsterdam. This has beaten most other attractions for me. It was fun, cheap and interactive with plenty of simulations.
Cool but overrated . It was fun but it is a media campaign and throws some fun facts at you but it does come with free beer
Well worth the trip. It really is an experience from start to finish. Plenty to see and do. Guys will love the sports area. Ended up in nightclub type bar sampling the beer itself. Great fun.

Bit boring. Went through hoping for an actual factory experience and some history, but strangely it seemed to be aimed more at kids. Playstations and a "ride", some parts were okay, but I would probably have saved my time and money going elsewhere. Atleast you get two beers though.
Great . Take your time with the free beer ( you get almost three glasses for free) . A fun visit, but a little bit too commercial. Do all the interactive stuff
Beer tour. We took this Heineken beer tour and it was very interesting. They even let you have a couple of Heineken draft beer at end of tour. Wish they would let you have a couple more drinks.
Great!. This was an amazing experience. The interactive side was great well worth the money as not too expensive. A defo must!!!

Good for groups of friends. This tour through the history of the Heineken brand is interesting, but very shallow in terms of the amount of beer knowledge they discuss. Most of the exhibits are centered around marketing or branding. The interactive exhibits seemed like a blast for people who came in small to medium sized groups, and that is what I would recommend doing if you come to the Heineken Experience. The two small beers you get at the end of the exhibit are definitely not worth the price of admission, so make sure you have fun along the way!

Loved it. Funny wee ride half way through, you get to pour your own pint, lots of opportunities for photos, nice gift shop. Not exactly a must see if you come to Amsterdam, but a fun way to spend a couple of hours

Great marketing. Had a enjoyable tour yesterday different than a lot of brewery tours as not currently a working brewery thus can see inside the vats etc. This is more of a marketing tour which Heinkein has won many awards it is worth doing. A couple of suggestion is that the signage of where to go not the best. If you need elevators they are hard to find. In addition for the beer at end there are two lines one very slow as you pull your own draft with one working tap the. Other is very fast with poured beer One has to find out the hard way. The other comment during tour they tell you of a new beer they have. Introduced but when you get to try they have run out. Amazing

Brilliant tour . Just done a fantastic tour off the Heineken brewery..all th a history from start to present ...gives you an insight of how company started and how its managed to keep going after all these years ..And free beer at end of tour ..wat more can you ask for

Good tasting Tour with a Happy Heineken End. Not that I am particularly a beer-drinker (Learned to drink wine at Heineken!) but this tour is much fun and good-tasting. You'll understand a little bit more about the brewing, but specially about the brand. The tour ends in the shop with the Heineken Collection and I found a great laptop bag to give to an addicted Heineken friend, who now travel with it all around the globe. Have fun and do it!
Good beer!. A really cool experience, learn a lot about beer and the history, and of course you get to taste some as well :) a must if in Amsterdam!
Fun and enjoyable. The museum was interactive and fun! My family enjoyed the whole time and the place was very interesting. The free drink at the end in the lounge/bar was also a good way to end it.

Good day out. This was a great little day out it cost €16 each but worth it. You get a tour around the brewery and get given 3 beers along the way too. There are a lot of surprises along the way and I even got to beat my wife at a game of foosball too.

Fun Attraction. The heineken experience is a fun indoor attraction which we opted to go when the weather outside was rainy! it includes a couple of free beers! if you buy in advance you tend to get a euro or 2 off!

3rd visit and still fun. This is a museum trip really with some fun things thrown in which I won't spoil.The "Experience" bit might be setting up some sort of fairground ride but don't worry it's all very calm but incredibly informative and lots of opportunities to sample the product!We've been 3 times now and still giggle! I'd recommend this for a couple of hours in this beautiful city

A visit is a must. The Heineken Experience is one if the things to do when visiting amsterdam . The momentos and brewing instructions alone are fun to watch and afterwards you'll be though how to serve a perfect pint of beer, if not,you can get two glasses of beer .

Fun trip. We visited the Heineken Experience after a long day walking around the city in hot weather and it was a welcome break. Interesting walk around the history of Heineken, but then was treated to a couple of drinks near the end of the tour which was very nice. Fun outing and if your like your beer then worth a visit.

Excellent value. The experience is fun and the fact you get 3 drinks only makes it better! It's interesting to see how it all gets made but the fun things towards the end are good. Loads of selfie opportunities, games to play and things to do. It's very interactive with a ride to go on too. Very good value.

Brilliant museum attraction with something for everyone. So much more to do than I expected. Learn about the history of the company and how the brew is made and then take part in the many interactive activities available. There's a simulator ride where u become the brew itself, games rooms for rugby or football fans, holograms and other interactive displays, hands on practice pouring pints and of course, sampling the Heineken brew!

beer history with a tasting. A great couple of hours spent, learning the history of the beer and how it has become one of the most known brands in the world, learn how to our it then get to drink a glass or two. An added bonus is the canal boat ride back into the city, though a running commentary along the way would have been helpful.
Visit. Awesome time great experience. Must do if in Amsterdam. Interactive displays great beer and atmosphere.
For beer lovers. I am not a fan of beer, but I still found this interesting. It is a must in Amsterdam. Best part for me was to actually see the horses!

Perfect to include in your city break. The Heineken experience exceeded my expectations and I was really pleased i included this as part of my city break. I learned a thing or two at the beer tasting and the many different elements throughout the experience keep you interested and the international bar was great. We were in the experience for over 2 hours so make sure you have plenty of time to go round it. The staff were really friendly and it's a must see in Amsterdam

A pleasant surprise!. I decided to visit the Heineken Experience due to its close proximity to my hotel and because it was included in my Holland Pass. I'm not really a beer enthusiast but this attraction was pleasantly surprising.The beginning is a little mundane – standing there watching videos. But as you venture through the building you really get a sense of how their product is made. The two highlights for me was the 4D cinema experience when you are basically made into a beer. And you get a tasting as well as two full Heineken beers at the end.It's great value for money. Really engaging and fun. A beer lovers heaven!

Great fun for a couple of hours. We didn't realize that this was so close to the hotel and the central area, so we decided to go. This was a lot of fun, and learned some great facts of beer, beer making and, of course, Heineken. This tour took you through many different stages of the beer, and was a very entertaining and interactive experience. I would definitely do it again.

Blew away my expectations!. Reasonably priced, engaging and entertaining. I would recommend this attraction to ANYONE visiting Amsterdam. Simply a fun way to spend an afternoon (or better yet, a rainy day)! During our travels we also visited Guinness and Jameson (in Ireland), which were both great by Heineken takes the cake. Make time to visit and don't miss out on the free canal cruise that is INCLUDED with your ticket price.

Heiny . Me and my friend had fun being high walking around the Heineken experience. It has a lot of weird multi media ads and games to play after you walk through the historical museum part. The "make your own label" thing is pretty cool. There's also a 4D cheesy "roller coaster" thing where they turn you into a beer. In the end you get 2 free beers. All in all I'd say the Heiny experience is a pretty cool tourist spot to walk around if you want to waste a couple hours in the city.

Something different. Had read other reviews about the Heineken Experience on TripAdvisor so we decided to visit on our trip to Amsterdam. As we started the first part of the tour we thought it was going to be a let down showing films etc but it really picks up as you go around and there are lots of fun and interactive ways they show you the process and the beer tasting. You get a small glass for beer tasting and two drinks at the end where it is kind of set up like a night club. We enjoyed our visit to the Heineken Experience and for the price which includes your drinks though it was good value.

great tourist attreaction for all. This is a great tour. Great for the tourist and great for the company. It is able to put the "sell" on paying customers! Heineken does it up right and makes it a pleasant and entertaining experience. Best deal is to get the package ahead for the canal cruise and the tour.

Better than what I remembered from 34 years ago. This is my second visit. First was in 1992 when it was still 2 Gilders. We drank as much as we could and ate a lot of cheese.This time I took my wife 34 years later to rekindle my youth. This is advertised as one of the experiences to do. The advertised rate was 18 euro but you can get discounted voucher at the tour offices in town. If you book with them you can even get a deal for 16 euros.At first I was bit bewildered by the crowds but it ran very smoothly. Things have changed over the 34 years. The tour is more interactive with high-tech displays and shows. All the staff was very helpful and the souvenirs are special and personalized. Great brand awareness campaign for the Heineken company.Rather go week days than over weekends. Remember the doors close at 17h00 so they stop selling tickets 2 hour before. The beer is still a highlight of the event.

Not just a brewery. Amazing experience! Must when in Amsterdam. I didn't expect it would be so great. Whoever created the Program of the tour in Heineken Experience - is a genius with a great imagination. It is my pleasure to give a credit to all the staff whom we met on our tour. So friendly, full of energy, even in the end of the day.Except of history, beer tasting, we took part in lots of attractions. It was a realfun. Heineken Experience is an amusement park for adults! Skip the line and book tickets ahead. All you will need is to show the bar code at the entrance.

Brilliant but leave the buggy/stroller at the hotel. We bought our tickets in advance and used them directly from our Apple Wallet, nice idea!On arrival with our 10 month old we were told that due to the layout we couldn't bring our buggy into the museum but they'd look after it in the reception.We spent around 90 minutes making our way around the museum and it was very good with interesting live demonstrations with a bit of humour thrown in for good measure. All told in English.

Just do it. What clever marketing. Heineken have provided an insight into their history and beer production processes in an interesting and interactive way. We went on a Monday afternoon and it was not very busy. There were little or no queues. This was a worthwhile and fun thing to do

VIP Tour Worth The Extra. Pre booked the VIP tour. Our guide Thomas was very good. Provided plently of enthusiasm and was informative.
