Shame about the hangers on who decided to tag along for a free tour, but we lost them as soon a we went behind the scenes where they weren't allowed. Got to taste 5 different beers with cheeses in a small bar away from the hoards & got to go up on the roof. Well worth it.
Just go!! . Well worth a visit!!! Would highly recommend. Book tickets online to avoid queues. Interesting and entertaining tour. A couple of free beers too!!

Great Visit. We caught the tram to the Heineken building. We had bought tickets from an agent previously. We arrived at about 10:30. We're pleased we did as it was quiet when we went in. It got busier throughout our visit. We learnt about the process of maki g lager in an interesting and informative way. It was a really interactive visit, from being able to grind the grain to pouring your own drink from the pump (and receiving a certificate for doing so). If you do this then you forfeit a drink, only one drink instead of two. The horses hadn't arrived after their exercise. The young man who was supervising this area sensed my disappointment at not being able to see them. So he said he would come and find us later on, when the horses had arrived. He did so and took us via the back route, to see the two horses. He was great and so helpful. We had two bottles of lager specially printed for our son in law, which were ready for us to collect from the shop at the end. As we were leaving we were asked if we'd like to take the Heineken boat back to The Hermitage Museum. A lovely touch. It was free of charge too. Drinks were available to buy onboard. I would thoroughly recommend this visit, even if you're not a massive beer fan! Just interesting to see the process from start to finish.

Company Propoganda. While not a completely dreadful experience, I couldn't escape the feeling that we had just paid €18 to see a bunch of company advertisements. Despite that, there were a few interesting points to be learnt about the company history and brewing process.
Just ok. Wasnt anything to write home about. Price was fair. Only thing is the 2 free drinks you get take longer to get due to the ques than ot takes to go around the whole experiance
Good fun. Had a good time here in june. We had our free drinks as we walked around and personalised our own heineken bottles!

Loved this place! . Loved this place. Got to know the history of one of my favourite beers. Lots to do while there including tasting and shopping in the store! Make sure you buy fast track tickets online as was pretty busy when we went!

Great visit!. Great place to visit. Learning the history of the brewery & nice to know it's still in the Heineken family. The "brew you" experience was fantastic, as was the interactive section afterwards. A definite feelgood place to visit.
A club like experience . Apart from Heineken history, whole experience was fun. Especially end of the tour was awesome. Complementary drinks were added bonus. I would highly recommend this to others.

Interesting, even for non-beer lovers. This is not the main Heineken brewery but more like a museum for Heineken. The queue could build up so do allocate some time for that. Buy tickets online to save time, as recommended by the crowd controller.The self-guided tour started off with displays/exhibits of Heineken's history, followed by a short 4D show (no seats) on the beer brewing process. After the show, visitors convene at an area where Heineken staff teaches you how to see, smell and drink beer. Quite an eye-opener for a non-beer lover like me. At the end of the tour, you can trade your two tokens that come with the entrance wristband for: 1) a beer-pouring experience (and the glass of beer you poured); 2) two glasses of normal Heineken; or 3) a larger glass of Heineken Extra Cold. The drinking happens at the "bar" so this would be a good place to come with friends instead of alone.

So worth it! . Having been to the Guinness Storehouse in Dublin we thought that the Heineken Experience couldn't possibly beat it... We were wrong! This is an absolute must, included in the price you get your entry and a tasting experience and then two drinks in a bar at the end! We were in there for approximately 2 hours - there's a lot of interactive things to do and the ride is so fun! We also made a beer bottle with our names on which was only 6.50€ - would probably go again if I was to go back to Amsterdam!

Was a very good day out . My wife and I went here for a day out and we where very impressed the whole way through. There are a few steps involved though just if you hate stairs. We loved the whole experience it was so informative especially if you love beer, even if you don't it's still informative. There are loads to do and get hands on with which is fun. And give you a walk through of the history of the company. The best thing is there is free beer! Yes free beer at the end of the tour!! So if that's not an excuse to go I don't know what is. You can also name a bottle of beer and take it home which is fun. For a few of course. So go and enjoy a great day out.
Nice experience worth it. Worth to try it.informative about the beer and also fun...history and science and fun and games to try and also certificate of pourer(optional).nice souvenir shop

The Original Brewery. First, we are seniors taking the tour. The history and old equipment from the the original brewery are very interesting. Much of the tour includes interactive games that were very popular with the young adults on the tour but not of much interest to us. Beer is included in the tour price. There is a gift shop at the end of the tour. The Heineken Experience is a stop on the hop on hop off bus line so it is easy to find. It was interesting but would have been more interesting to us if it was a real functioning brewery.

Enjoy the top floor bar and balcony . It was well done and showed the history and brewing process very well - but I was slightly bored. However, I'm not sure what could have been done to make it different so perhaps "bored" is too harsh. Lovely bar at the top with great city views if the weather allows on the balcony. Make time for it.

Mixed. Takes a couple of hours so is a reasonable rainy day activity. Experience was mixed. Reasonable traditional museum about the company and how beer is brewed. We then had to queue for ages for a short "ride" that wasn't worth the wait. Final bit was the best with some pretty cool interactive stuff and a beer tasting. They need to be a bit better at filtering people through to avoid bottle necks. Overall good value for money (you get free beer). Book online to avoid the queue at the door (we were able walk straight in).
Don't bother. Problems with crowd control! Very long lines - very expensive for TSA lines. They need to give timed entries. We bypassed ticket lines, fortunately, but those were only the beginning.

A Bit Gimmicky. We booked the tour in advance but there doesn't seem any issue with turning up on the day. It's self guided, the history of the company was interesting and I enjoyed looking at the brewing equipment and the horses but after that it turns into multi-media stuff and interactive games. Not quite what I was expecting and I was left somewhat underwhelmed by the whole place. That said our 12 year old loved it but any chance to do anything vaguely involving computers and he's happy. Staff were good, very friendly but I also was so disappointed with the bar area at the end where you get your 2 free drinks - loud, no windows, a very sticky floor and seating for about 6 people - not my idea of fun at all.I wouldn't recommend this, I think there are far better things to see and do in Amsterdam.

Great fun. This is an interactive experience that is a must do in Amsterdam. Very informative as you clearly see the company pride in this Dutch company - and fun approach to gaining a beer appreciation

Both Of Us Liked This Tour. Had to talk my wife into going to the Heineken beer tour. Turns out she enjoyed it as much as I did. Of course I like beer and any time you have a chance to do one of these it's fun.Was concerned with a small line up to get in to purchase tickets and also seen several buses outside. Everything moved along well with this self guided tour. You didn't feel rushed. Enough areas within the building to keep you interested.The price was reasonable at $18 Euros. You get a free 1/2 pint of beer near the end of the tour and then two 1/2 pints at the end.If you go, word of advice, don't drink the H 41 beer. Hated the taste. But that's only my taste, you might like it.Worth the time to visit this place.

Interesting . If you want to learn and experience how one of the most famous beer in the world is made it is worth a visit otherwise do not bother. I love beer so it was interesting for me to see it production process.
Very good!. Good value for money you get couple of drinks in the price it was a hot day so was very nice!! Had a good laugh and loved the horses

An Experience for beer lovers!. The word "experience" is the operating term. Started off as a fairly typical tour of the old brewery (they now brew outside of the city). However, multimedia experiences and tasting makes this a very unique place. We planned on just "stopping by" to say we did it, and ended up spending 2 hours exploring and having fun. There are photo booths, a quirky karaoke video you can lip sync to and send to yourself or others by email, several lounges, a horse stable, foosball table, and interactive rugby games just to name a few. You get 2 tokens on your admission wristband that you can use to taste 2 Heinekens (classic or lager H41) or you can use both for a larger glass of ice cold Heineken. Highly recommend this for any beer lover!

Free beer and brewing history. This was a self guided tour through the Heineken Brewery for 18 euro. The stops along the tour had informative, enthusiastic guides giving you the beer making process and making it seem a lot more exciting than it is but still good information. Most of it, as you can imagine is marketing telling you how great Heineken is as a brand and a beer. There were a few fun interactive areas. You get 2 buttons you can use on 2 beers or to pour your own 1 beer. If you love Heineken, go for it. If you like Heineken, grab a draft nearby and look up the info online.

Underwhelming! . It was fine, interesting to learn about the history etc, but I was expecting something more, I'm not exactly sure what, I just kind of left thinking, is that it?! Roof bar was nice for a couple of drinks afterwards. I guess if I didn't do it then I'd have felt like I missed out, but I probably wouldn't do it again!

Heineken . Well worth a visit if you're in Amsterdam! Cheap at less than €20 and you get a couple of beers included. All the staff were friendly and spoke a few languages to accommodate tourists! Good way to spend a few hours!

Well worth a visit . Easy to get to via the tram system or a 20 minute walk from Dam square the Heineken Experience is value for money and an enjoyable way to spend a couple of hours. When you pay you will receive a wrist band that has two tokens on which you will need later. The tour is a walking tour that covers the history of the brand, how the Heineken is brewed, bottled and marketed. Part of the tour is a simulator where you are the beer being bottled, there is a tasting area where you are given half a pint sampler and shown how to drink it, the bar tender will ask a couple of questions and the first person to correctly answer wins another drink! From there you go into an area that covers Heineken sponsorship with many different interactive experiences. At the end of the tour you can use your tokens in one of two choices either using two tokens to pour your own drink or you can exchange one token per half pint poured by the staff. From there you exit via the gift shop which has everything you could want branded with the Heineken logo, there is also the opportunity to have your name engraved on a Heineken glass which was very popular.

Very nice. I would give a 5 except that we went on a Saturday and something broke it stopped working at the site. The lines were crazy long, way to long but besides that it was fantastic. If you go to Amsterdam try to go during the week to avoid the jam. Great place, lots of information and interaction The beers are nice and cold

Fun Beer Outing. This place is such good value. You get to drink a bunch of beer, learn about a major beer company and its really good fun. It takes about two hours to get through, and you do get to drink a bunch of beer. The different activities there are really fun, including some of the items on display in the part of the experience focused on history. Such a fun activity!

Amazing!!. I found this experience really good, being a massive fan of beer it probably wasn't going to disappoint. There were quite a few interactive stuff that you could get involved in and also a history lesson in the making of Heineken. I really enjoyed it and found the price was well worth it.

Best Beer Factory experience ever. The Heineken Experience, located in Amsterdam, is a historic brewery and corporate visitor center for the internationally distributed Dutch pilsner, Heineken beer. The industrial facility was built as the first Heineken brewery in 1867, serving as the company's primary brewing facility until 1988. inside there are different types of experience during the tour, from being brew as a beer to take pictures and serving your own heineken.

One of Kind Experience. In Amsterdam; must visit this place. It is one of a kind. You will know how the much loved beer of the world is made and you would have chance to gulp couple of glasses. Interesting visit a must see item.
Fun place. if your looking for a interesting and fun place to go I recommend the Heineken Exp. its a walking tour loaded with info on beer making with a little tasting included.

AMAZING. For only €18 each it is well worth it, there is so much packed into the tour it's a must do! With your ticket you get a medium Heineken half way round the tour then at the end you can either pour your own pint and drink it for two tokens, or use the two tokens at the other bar for two medium pints.You can also print your name on a bottle in the tour for just under €7 or two bottles for €10. The gift shop is packed full of literally anything you can think of. You can also get pint glasses engraved in the shop. A must do if you're in Amsterdam! Even if you don't like beer!

A Highlight of our Trip. VIP Tour was well worth the price of admission. The lines are long and the brewery is crowded. The VIP tour allowed our small group of 9 to enjoy the tour with a personal guide - no waiting. We had our own private viewing of the "adventure" of beer movie and a private tasting. The tasting of 5 beers, complete with snacks, was great fun. We enjoyed chatting with the others in our group and really enjoyed true VIP treatment.

VIP Experience. As a birthday treat from Friends we were given the VIP Experience as a present. Our tour guide Edin was very informative and chatty with us all. I highly recommend the tour as we would be the type of people who would walk straight past the important bits! Edin was also very educated on all the types of beer that we tried so it was great to have a guide who was also passionate about his job. We really enjoyed our gifts afterwards and thank you for being so friendly!
Insightful . Very insightful experience that ticks all the boxes when it comes to a world class brand experience touching all the senses. Can recommend the experience

Great laugh. Starts off quite slow as you wander around but it starts to get interactive further along the tour. There are some real fun things to do later on with Green screen karaoke and a nice bar at the end! Buy your tickets beforehand so you can fast pass the queues.

Great way to spend a couple of hours. . I was looking forward to going here after talking with people who had been do it can recommended. It did not disappoint! Plenty to look at, demonstrations, a ride and of course Heineken beer! When you get to the pour your own pint, if you make a mess of it they get you to do it again so you get 2 pints instead of one. Really fun. Well worth a visit. Everything is in English.
great vist. It a great visit to know a little more about the history of the company and how the do the beer also it great because you can have a few free beer during and after the tour.

Great afternoon. It was very fun and modern with lots of interactive things to do. It is more of an experience that a museum. There is a fun simulator ride. You get 2 free beers with your bracelet and there is a shop at the end. It was very very rowdy with lots of stag groups.

A great insight to a terrible beer. Not too dissimilar to the Guinness tour.. If you don't know how beer (lager) is made then its worth visiting the Heineken experience. You get to sample the pre mixture of hops and malt and stand next to the giant copper vats. A 4d experience is included as you are turned into beer and an opportunity to create your own bottle. Free pictures and dutch karaoke videos follow before the how to drink a beer properly and two free half pints of Heineken.

Thoroughly enjoyable. We booked and paid for this before we went and glad we did as it was busy. We learnt lots and was great to see how they make Heineken. English speaking tour guides which was great as was the interactive ride. We even got taught how to drink Heineken properly! Three free beers too. Great experience. Worth a visit.
Heineken. Fun! We had a good time, learned something about beer but mostly frank it :-) along with some other nice activities

It was ok. This is personal preference - although you get 2 free beers at the end of the tour this isn't something I would do again You have various simple explanations as to how the beer is made but it's not a tour whereby you have somebody showing you around

Wonderful tour, a lot of free beer and great boat tour after. The tour is interesting, but the best part is the complimentary beer at the end and the boat tour, where you get a gift. Highly recommended.

Who wouldn't want to see this!. A very different kind of tour after several museums and a lot of walking, but tasting some of the treats at the end of the tour makes this worth it. Much like a similar tour in St Louis but all inside.
Get out of the rain. We enjoyed about a 2 1/2 hour self guided tour that ended with some good samples. Was raining out when we went in, and still when we left,but gave us a chance to dry out.
A must do. Every Heineken lovers dream experience. Make sure you offer to help when asked, it's a hidden invitation to drink a little bit more. The legacy of the brewery is fascinating.

Pretty touristy. I've been on several major brewery tours, and this one by far felt the most gimmicky and touristy. They did go over the beer making and history of the brand, but otherwise it's a lot of interactive computer games and other activities to get you to spend more money. Nice gift shop, you can engrave your own bottle (costs extra) and pour your own beer (you have to use BOTH beer tokens you get though). Overall, not bad, but nothing SUPER exciting.

Great Couple of Hours Out. Had alot of fun at the Heineken Experience. It has games to play, novelty pictures to take and BEER! you get 2 half pints with your ticket. This was a little disappointing as i thought id get 2 Pints although durimg the taste test you get the chance to have those extra 2 halves. Dont let them slip away! Thoroughly enjoyed the experience! Its a must whilst in Amsterdam!

Past meets present. Though a teetotaller, a must visit for experiencing one of the most recalled beer brands.The experience is brilliant . From history to production to quality control to brand experience it reinforces a brand image and identity that we all have possibly grown up with.Not to miss the personalised mementos you can create at not too unaffordable a price.
A REAL Experience. Definitely worth a visit during your stay in Amsterdam. Heineken Experience offers a hands on look at their beer-making history with lots of interactivity and fun.

Amazing . I am not a beer drinker but the other 3 that i was with are but i can honestly say i had a great day and well worth the money paid. I would advise pre-paying for your tickets then when you go you don't have to que up

Completely worth it...Must go place in Amsterdam...!!. It's really worth it and would say a must visit place. They tell you about the brewing process and how that it evolved. Towards the end of the tour you get complimentary beers and experience the beer tasting. Great music and if time permits you can enjoy the beer in a lounge chatting with people.

A must if you're in Amsterdam. . Interesting place where you can learn about the history of Heineken and how it became such a popular beer around the world. At the end you get 2 beers with your admission but during the walk you might get a taste of you're lucky.

HeineWIN Experience!. Me and my girlfriend were in Amsterdam for the weekend and decided that this was on the to-do list! We heard all about this through other friends that had visited so it had come highly recommended and it didnt disappoint. The tour itself takes maybe 2 hours and it was very fascinating and was great fun. We had several tour guides for certain parts of the experience, one of the most memorable bits of the tour was when we learnt the science behind the beer and had an amazingly funny dutch man whose name i forget as our guide. He made it very enjoyable and humourous for the whole group and had great banter, he made us all laugh and it was brilliant. Well worth doing if you are in the city with a couple of hours to burn!

Must go. One of the highlights of our trip. Very enjoyable and fun few hours. Starts off with a tour of the old brewery then ends up in with a few Heinekens in the onsite bar. A chance to pull your own or just enjoy the complimentary beers expertly pulled for you. 3 free beers included in price

Must visit if you enjoy Heineken . We booked Heineken Experience along with Canal pizza cruise We have been given wristbands with two token each which could be exchanged for beer Lot of information about Heineken history is presented in non boring way and you could learn how the beer is made I exchanged two of my token to attend quick class of pouring beer, and got one beer which I poured and a certificate

Not what I expected, but great fun. This isn't like a regular brewery tour, it is (as the name suggests) more of a tourist experience. I did go in hoping to learn a lot about Heineken but spent most the day playing in the interactive areas - which there are a lot of! Although it was also really busy which meant we didn't get a chance to get to go on most of them.There's a simulator that turns you into a bottle which was great fun, and of course the free beer. But other than that it wasn't anything to shout about. It would have been better if it was a little quieter but we did come at a busy time! I would suggest getting there early to avoid the crowds.

Good place but very busy. Good attraction but very busy so if you want to specifically look at certain things there can be a lot of queuing.
Lots of tasting available and also has a great rooftop bar to enjoy the views of Amsterdam

Best for a younger person. I've toured a lot of breweries and the best by far is the Guinness brewery in Dublin. Heineken Experience is not a place to avoid but as an older person I didn't find it to be worth our visit. It is a well designed attraction with lots of loud music and video games and activities that 18 to 40 year old people would enjoy, me not so much. I did appreciate the creativity but it was too high keyed for my tastes.

Highly entertained . Went here with my husband and well we thought it would be similar to the basic brewery tours we had gone on before.... Well it was much more than that. Basically it is a interactive informative experience. The tour guides were entertaining and the free beer was great. We definitely feel like we got our dollars worth.We went later in the day which appeared to be a great time because there was no line and it was not too crowded!

Worth a visit. Don't go on a Monday....it's shut x worth a visit as it is informative and worth the €18 entry fee. It is generally busier in the afternoon and can be quite lively at the weeken with stag and hen parties x
Good fun. This was a good experience. It was fun and interesting. It was interactive and informative. Beware of the new H beer... not very nice. 3 glasses of beer are included in price.

Nice entertainment. Do not like alcohol, but have heard a lot about the museum so we decided to visit it. The place tells the history of the the beer making and demonstrates how its prepared. In addition, they give a beer tasting. At the end of the tour, there are lots of funny options to take pictures and to make cool videos related to the beer and the museum.Come as the place opens, so there is not lot's of people.

For Younger Visitors. My wife and I went to the Heineken experience. After a few brewery tours, this one was more akin to a theme park type experience. The "simulator" was interesting but not very good. The history of the Heineken family was a highlight as well as the dray horses. The last part of the experience involves a few beers in good company. Don't be fooled but the amount of beer you get is not what you may think. Two quarter litre glasses are included in the admission as well as a small taster. It's great for the younger visitors as its bright and has lots of flashing lights but perhaps not really related to beer as such. Overall a good experience for the price.
Very nice . I'm not really into those tours/experiences but I throughly enjoyed this one.We finished the day with a visit to the Mellow Yellow coffee shop wich is nearby.

Nice amusement place to learn Heineken beer. Renovated an old brewery of Heineken to be entertainment place. Visitors can learn how Heineken is manufactured, secret of its logo...many things about Heineken. 3 glasses of beer are included in the entrance ticket and it can be purchased online at cheaper price. Even if you go there with children or those who don't drink beers, everyone must enjoy because soft drinks are also available and there are many playing areas inside. Good place to go with friends, family and even alone:)

Experience! . I don't like alcohol, i don't drink beer but this Heineken.... Museum, experience, history, everything in one is very very good, cool and very well organised. Tells you so many things about the beer, the Heineken and not only. You can see the history of the beer from the past to the present. I read comments that is not worth it so much. I am sorry but I guess those who wrote that might be still a bit "dizzy " from the smell of Amsterdam!
A fun place to be. As a group of friends we are very satisfied of our visit. We had a great experience, but I do advise you to buy your tickets online. Enjoy!
Worth a visit. This was a good tour, turned out better than first expected. Shows how it all started straight through to pouring your own beer.
Too expensive for 30 min.. Price too high for Nothing. Short stay. A lot of visitors and a little guidance that contribute nothing to the understanding of the heineken expe.

A must see. A must see on any visit to amsterdam. See the history behind the world famous beer while u sip away on a fresh pint and even get to make ur own personalised bottle. Highly recommend getting prebooked tickets from the many tours and ticket shops throughout the city as there is usually a large queue to get in

big diappointment. there where long lines. realiy for nothingthe place is a collection of uninteresting details that one can get from a 2 minute read on wikipediayou wait and you wait and then there is nothing interesting.the ride is dullthe only thing that was good was the beerpaying 18 euroes for standing in line and drinking a pint of beer is a little too muchavoid unless you have really seen everything else
Nice place. In this place you can se how bear make ,you can drink how many bear you want,they learn you how to put bear in beer glass,enjoy your time in this place.

Heineken Fun. We went to the Heineken with no expectations but we were plesently surprised. The interactive nature of the tour is good fun and the tour itself is very interesting. My husband would be more a beer drinker than myself but I really enjoyed learning how to drink the beer right. The two free beers at the end are in a Heineken style bar which had a really fun atmosphere.I would also say the staff were very impressive. They were all bubbly, fun and were able to answer all questions asked.The only down side to the experience is how busy the place is. Rooms were cramped at times but it didn't take away from the overall experience.

Commercial but fun. We saved this for the end of the day,Nice way to relax. T is very commercial but they have some fun activities. Pour your own beer. Play games. For he end of a long day of touring we enjoyed it. Purchased tickets online so no line.

Must visit. When in Amsterdam you really must visit the Heineken Experience. Spend a little more money on the VIP tour and truly get the full experience with snacks and a beer tasting or take the self guided tour and enjoy a beer at the bar afterwards. Just make sure to buy your tickets online in advance and get a nice discount on the entrance fee and skip the line

Over all a good Afternoon. It's a bit boring in the first 20mins or so, we weren't really listening to the narration. It got more interactive later on but basically you're paying 16 euros for 3 small beers. The roof terrace was great where we had our last 2 beers and the view was great and the Sun shone, so a nice end to proceedings.

Amazing place. Went at the end of may..its an amazing place that you can learn about beer,taste it and have lots of fun really recommended😊
At the end you can also stamp your name in bottles of heineken!!

Brilliant Experience. Brilliant place and we really enjoyed ourselves. Very interactive and lots of humour. They say that Heineken is a family business and they look after their employees, this must be right as every single one of them was happy, friendly and helpful.

Fun experience. I was not thrilled about going to this but went along anyway. They have hands on things where you can brew your own beer, etc. They take you through the brewing process. They explain the history of Heineken and how they make their beer. They also teach you how to drink it properly. One doesn't just sip it. You get to see the big tanks and the stables for the Heineken horses. In the end you get to the tasting room were you get to taste. I am not a beer drinker but I was pleasantly surprised how good it was. They do have Pepsi if you are not a beer drinker.

Heineken Adventure. My sister and I did the tour, it is a self guided tour. We found out that you can pre pay and save a bit, but we were not sure if we could make it, so we had a coupon that we used at the counter, so instead of saving 2 euros we saved 1, better than pre paying and not being able to go. It was a lot of fun, everyone there is super friendly and seem to love their job, which showed during the tour, which also made it enjoyable.Lots of fun, love the bicycle song and all the other fun things you can do, the pictures and video get emailed right away, super cool:-)
Awesome. I liked very much this museum because it merges the historical content with a multimedia presentation.The best is the mobile app that allows us to listen all in our language.

I've been drinking beer wrong all this time!!. There is so much to do & learn here. The building is Beautiful, the history is very interesting and there's beer? What more could you want. It doesn't take all day to go around, it's interactive and only takes a couple of hours so it's a great experience for all. The staff are lovely and it's great value for money. Highly recommend it.

For any beer drinking couple. Such a fun museum! People really enjoy their beers in Netherlands so they are very proud of their heineken beer. It was an interactive museum with a short movie and while you walk through the whole history of this wonderful beer. At the end you get 2 free beers so be prepared to get a bit tipsy!

Do Not Go!!!. You can take a look at my other reviews to see that I am mostly positive. This was a terrible experience. I had done this tour many years ago, and I had read some not so great things about the more recent edition, but my wife, who works in branding, was curious to see it. The whole thing is terribly set up, not engaging and I have to wonder what they themselves think about it. Filled with hokey videos, a bland history section that is so cramped that even if you had interest in looking at the exhibits, you wouldn't be able to do so due to the line pushing you forward and finally a loooong wait (some of which is inside the horse stable room, smelling of, well, horse stuff) for an interactive ride which, while maybe a bit cute, was not worth the time spent in a boring corridor getting there. In the end, after all your troubles, you receive 2 small beers. We did receive an "invite" to the rooftop bar which has a nice view, but steer clear of this tourist trap. You're better off throwing your 16 Euro in the canal.

Shambolic and overrated. This tour is seriously overrated and I attach the blame to the greed of the brewery. Numbers were not limited so it ended up a free for all. By limiting numbers things could be controlled and the whole experience made tolerable. As it is I thought it was one of the worst brewery/distillery tours I have been on.Could be so much better

Great fun. Not only do you learn the history of Heineken and how it's made, there are some great interactive games and things to play with and of course, you get 2 glasses of the golden stuff to enjoy. Well worth a visit and good fun too.
Beer Beer. Interactive tour through beer giant's history in former brewery, with a tasting room finale. And finally some super music & beer

A most see. What a great attraction this is it explains the history and how they make the Heineken and with all the interaction things to do this is great even for kids. And the Heineken at the end of the trip was great too, well worth a visit.
The best experience ever!!! . We had so much fun in Heineken Experience. We loved everything about it. You get to brew your own beer, get to be a DJ. You get free beer. Staff is very nice.

Fun Unique Experience. Took the Heineken Experience during our trip to Amsterdam and found it to be an interesting and fun experience. From how the beer was brewed, how the company grew the brand and the integration of technology in the tour was very creative. This was not your typical brewery tour and we enjoyed the time we spent here. I would recommend this experience.
Average experience . I think it's overrated. I don't drink but wanted to get an experience it was good to see How's beer is made but it's not worth the price even if u get 2 beers free.

Great experience. The Heineken experience was well worth the cost. We thoroughly enjoyed this experience for only €16. It is not only just a tour there is lots of things to see and do during the experience. Well worth a try!
Heineken Experience. Would highly recommend this to anyone visiting the city, an interactive experience and the beer tastes amazing! Well worth the money

From what I remember, I loved it!. The Heineken experience was an experience, free beer and really well toured with an English speaking guide. Met some people at the bar after the tour and really enjoyed the history of the beer. Lots to learn and interactive, great price too.

Fun!. You learn about this history of the brand and how the beer is made. We had 3 drinks included with the ticket and I really enjoyed the interactive part of it. It was a really fun experience, I recommend this visit to anyone who enjoys beer!You can buy your ticket online and use it at anytime, so there is no need to wait in the queue.

Worst place we ever visited. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!. This was probably the worst venue we ever visited. It has got nothing to do with education about brewing. it is just one big commercial where you are constantly reminded that Heineken is the "best beer" in the world. Absolutely rubbish!The tasting process was one big disaster. The beer that was served was flat and was tasteless crap. Surely this must have been the rubbish that was collected at the end of the brewing process. I love my beers but only drunk half a glass of this liquid excrement.When we left the tasting room there were plenty of glasses with plenty of content in left behind.We felt betrayed and ripped off. For my son it was supposed to be the highlight of his trip to Europe but he felt exactly the same.There is absolutely nothing to see accept for some old copper scrap metal pots, who were taken out of service about 50 years ago, and adds, lots of adds.Avoid this place by all means! Actually avoid the whole of Amsterdam: It is crowded, polluted and very expensive. The whole place resembles hell on Earth! You've been warned!
Interesting tour. Its a nice tour with interactive activities in the end. Interesting to learn more about Heineken history.

Best tour we did! . This was one for the boyfriend, however I have to say I enjoyed it just as much! They have really thought of ways to make this exciting and not just about making beer! There is lots of things you can get involved with, with a few beers and tasting sessions along the way to help.We arrived 10 minutes before it opened and were let in before the pre paid tickets! Maybe just be aware pre ordered tickets don't go in first, they're just cheaper by 2 euros! There isn't such a thing of queue skipping...This was a great way to start our day, three beers later helped set us up :) would recommend!

great visit. Toured the brewery with my husband and daughter. We all thoroughly enjoyed it, very informative about the beer making process, plus had some fun activities. Lots of people but the self tour went smoothly. I'm not a beer drinker but my husband and daughter enjoyed the generous samples which are given about mid way and again at the end of the tour. Definitely recommend this.

It's OK but not mind blowing. This is an OK way to spend and hour and a half. The first part of the tour is the most interesting as it takes you through the brewing process and gives information on the ingredients and what they bring to the party. But once you have gone through the main brewing hall it starts to get a bit commercial and irrelevant. There is the "interactive" brew ride where you get bumped around and made wet on a virtual brewing tour. You then get a small taster of beer with a description of what the foam does etc. After this there is little else about beer making. There is one hall where the bottling takes place but this is simply a mock up of the filling lines and an opportunity to personalize a label for a few Euros. After that there is nothing about beer at all and the rest of the tour is centered on adverts, old bottles, a small rugby hall relating to the Heineken cup and a football area. The final area is a standard bar layout where you get your two beers or, if you want to serve it yourself and get a certificate, one beer. So in all there is about 30 - 40 mins of information on the beer itself and then it is pretty much commercial. I probably wouldn't go again in all honesty but if you haven't been and you are at a loose end give it a go.

Day out. This was a good experience, with free Heineken drinks :) you hear the history of how the brewery was started and get to see how it's brewed. There's also a 4d film which was quite fun. You get to bottle your own beer and print a personalised label for your bottles. There a various rooms with football and rugby activities and a room with ps4 computers to play. At the end you get to enjoy 2 free drinks in a bar. Very good and worth doing :)

Friends outing. I visited for the 2nd time this place and we really had fun more then my 1st time. The only thing that I didn't like is that inside it is very hot. Since we visited in a hot weather there was no AC. Also another thing I was happy to see is that it is accessible by a wheelchair. While in the beautiful city of Amsterdam this is a must visit.
Excellent. A good and fun experience. It is an interesting place and you learn about the making of the famous beer. It is also very entertaining.

Expected more. A bit of a commercial trap, not a personalized tour, but to be expected from a mass market beer company. Heineken have played on the sports sponsorship and stretched the tour out with lots of football and rugby slants.

Heineken zero is the best treat ever. Visited in 2013.Breweries are gorgeous with their copper kettles and the scents of hop. They make great subjects for pictures. I found the tour a bit too fast but the room with icecold zero Heineken beer made up for everything. Def worthwile going.
Overpriced and Not That Great. It wasn't so much a tour but more of being on a conveyor belt. It was crowded and rushed, however the drink was nice at the end. I'd give it a miss.
Great fun!. Exceeded my expectations. More than just a brewery tour, lots of opportunity to interact. Feels like a giant Heineken commercial but that's not a bad thing. Lots of fun.

Very nice attraction for beer fans. This old brewery has been transformed into very nice tourist attraction. If you did not know the history of Heineken before after this tour you know it very well. Also beer brewing process you get well informed and can be part of it yourself. Nice action games are also part of tour. Beer oh yes you get couple fresh glass (not pint) their golden delicate. For sure there is gift shop where is everything with red star and green color. You need to have at least 2 hours to spend here and buying ticket advance is highly recommend. I can recommend to beer fans.

Excellent!. Really worth a visit! Learning allAbout the history of the beer with lots of interaction etc. A bit of a queue for a particular part of the tour but worth it and an option to bypass the queue. Didn't actually get to see the production in action but a really good experience and worth the money! Staff really friendly and helpful.

Very Interesting. I am not a beer drinker but my husband wanted to visit. It was actually really interesting. I learned lots and actually enjoyed a beer! We bought our tickets online before visiting. They can be saved on your phone and scanned on arrival. It was cheaper and much quicker too.

Beer included with the tour!. Throughout my travels, I have visited many beer breweries. This one had to be one of my favorites (much better than the Dublin Guinness tour). I loved the interactive portions of the tour, especially the one that felt like a Disneyland ride! I also loved seeing the beautiful Heineken horses in their stalls. You get more than enough beer to enjoy whilst taking the tour.

Too many people, too small place . It's a Saturday afternoon. Too crowded, waited 30 mins for a short movie and drinks. The place is small and not as excited as expected. Perhaps if I come on a weekdays, my experience would be better.

Heineken Experience. Wonderfully cheesy. A pretty well done 2 hour (or so) experience that is, basically, a long commercial for Heineken. A VERY touristy locale in Amsterdam. As a marketer, it was interesting to see how they have changed their marketing over time and how the brand has evolved. If you're not into beer (or Heineken), I'd say find another of the many places in Amsterdam to spend some time. And, if you're in for a bit of fluff and a bit of a good time, it's pretty fun.
Heineken tasting. Good opportunity to view the history of this brand of beer. Worth the time and price if you are in Amsterdam. Nice facility friendly staff. Beer tatste good as well

Nice place to go, not to die for, but you'll have a nice time!. It's an interactive experience about the word of Heineken. Don't expect a huge thing around beer making, but it's really nice though. The self guided tour is cool and you get to know the history of this iconic beer brewery. By the end of the tour you'll get to do a "beer tasting" experience, and then 2 extra beers, so the price is quite good if you take into account that you have 3 includes drinks! Store is really cool as well.

enjoyable, intresting and fun Heineken Experience. Was not sure what to expect from visiting the heineken experience but did enjoy it, if you go try to pre book saves waiting in a que or remember to take discount voucher from your hotel.

Not bad. If you are not in hieneken history so this activity is not for you..
And if you like to drink beer or hieneken is your favorite beer then why not?
1 hour or 1 hour and 30 minuts tour would be not bad during ur day in amsterdam.

It's not only a museuem, it's an Expereirnce for beer lovers. I love beer and Heineken is my favourite beer, So this was on my list during my Amsterdam trip. It tells U history of Heineken, how they brew it. I mainly enjoyed wonderful simulator activities, photos n video spots. The trip covers 2 beers apart from testing beer. Instead of 2 free beers, I chose to do few minute beer pouring course for which I received certificate too :) along with the beer I poured :) :) We enjoyed drinking beer in their lounge which had great music n visual effect. Tip for tourist : Instead of buying ticket directly, combo tickets will save your money. Search on internet for various discounts and offers.

Interactive experience. The Heineken Experience really is more of an "experience" rather than a tour. You learn about its history and how its beer is made through many interactive exhibits, like a 4D ride. The part about the brewery's history is actually quite small; most of the experience is dedicated to flashing advertisements, videos, and activities catered towards a younger crowd. There was a very club-like feel at the end. With the basic admission comes two tokens which you can either spend on two beers at the bar, or a chance to pour your own draught of Heineken. You get a certificate and a tube to put it in, which is quite nice. If you like beer, this is a nice place to spend a few hours as long as you don't mind being constantly advertised at.

Great visit very hi tec presentations.. Very well organised tour system. Great fun taking part in the interactive activities and of course the beer drinking. Included in the ticket was a canal trip when the tour finished on the Heineken boat which actually stopped 100 yards from my hotel. Great end to a very worthwhile visit even if you don't like beer.

Great insight into Heineken!. The Heineken Experience is a really great way to spend a few hours in Amsterdam. We learnt how to brew beer, the history of the Heineken company and it's marketing, and enjoyed 3 beers - 1 in the tasting room, 2 in the bar. We had pre-booked tickets but there was only a small queue when we visited.Much more interactive than the Guinness Storehouse in Dublin. Would recommend!
Awesome museum. You won't get bored if you go here. The Heineken staff will tell you the story of the factory and you also get free beer at the end of the trip. It's a must!
Group event . Excellent venue for a team event, great facilities - wifi, AV, food and of course beer - helpful staff - just need to find a good reason to return again - views are also excellent

If you like beer, a great place to visit. We spent the afternoon going through, buy your tickets in advance and the rest is pure fun. You learn about Heineken's history and beer making in a very fun and interactive way. I've been on a number of brewery tours, but this one tops them all. It is amazing how many people the place handles and how enjoyable the afternoon was.
Awesome!!. Just visited with my hubby. No line and the experience was amazingly cool. Was raining this day so was nice to be walking around getting buzzed inside a working brew house.

Very interactive!. This was a good tour overall. Aome of the exhibts are interactive which is great fun. They definitely cater to their younger market as the music is extremely loud. I took my 72 year old dad and while he enjoyed it on the whole he didn't appreciate the super loud club music being pumped throughout. Most of the employees know just enough to get by. The guy doing the spiel on the horses knows about the rough facts about the Heineken horses on site but nothing about horses. The facility does not cater to the older (again the 72 yo dad) visitor as there is no where to rest or sit in the early parts of the tour and there are many stairs throughout (which you can avoid with the help of the staff but takes notifying them on arrival i believe). Anyhow, overall we all enjoyed our tour however there are some tweaks they could do to make it more universally enjoyable.

Poor Start- Fun End. Telling the truth- The first half an hour of the tour is quite boring. Not much to see and feel, and not much to get excited. The second part, the movie, the Champions League area, the drinking, the roof top bar, the gaming zone etc are all a whole different experience.Tip- Better to book online and not at the place- there is a much shorter line.

Fun and educational. The visit to Heineken Experience was much more fun then we expected. We highly recommend a visit to the Heineken Experience. It is much more then just beer tasting.Sensational interactive tour through the dynamic world of Heineken, 4D movie, souvenirs, good beer and lots more.Recommend you to book tickets online to avoid waiting in line.
A great experience . A fun adventure. It's well worth the visit if you love heinekin. But even if you do not it is still great to walk around. Two glasses of beer at the end tops it off nicely.

You Gonna Like it!! A Place to visit for sure. Worth a experience to know some science about Brewery process and of course Heineken journey in Beer business...lots of fun and interaction, pictures and above all fine and fresh Heineken beer to drink! You can spend 2 to 3 hrs easily. Book your tickets online around 16€/person(2 to 3 beers included) I won 2 beers on top in a fun interaction round ; Place is quite close to the city center ;)

Very interesting . Visited Amsterdam for a weekend and the Heineken experience was a definite must do! We spent a great couple of hours here learning how it is made, the history of Heineken and tasting the beer. The staff were very helpful and it was a great day out.

Great! . We loved the Heineken experience.Fantastic value for money - takes about two hours. We booked in a dealWith our canal Cruise and It was easy to collect tickets and visit the Heineken. Very interactive and three beers included all up. Loved it!
Loved it. There are a lot of things to do inside the heineken experience!! Enjoyed a lot!!! Super recommend!!!!!!!
Really cool experience around the Heineken Brand. All is explained about the brand, the family and the beer. Nice experience where you don't need to hurry. Nice tasting and social media experiences.

Much More Than Just Beer!!!. We could have stayed here for many hours there was so much to see and do outside of the beer experience. The four D movie experience was great fun, but even better was the souvenir "bike riding experince" you can email to yourself. Sit on a stationary bike with a film of Amsterdam behind you, and you're filmed riding a bike in Amsterdam. Great Souvenir. I'm not a beer drinker but I had a great experince here. We prebooked tickets online to avoid the wait.

Great fun and educational. Educational regarding the brewing process. Novel ways to get the points across. A fun studio with video and movement to light sensors. And at the end time for 2 beers with no-one rushing us 2 leave.

An amazing experience in Amsterdam.. We had so much fun there. That's been an interesting tripp, I've learnt so much. I can't forget the awesome taste of fresh beer yummy:)
Lovely charming staff :)
Good place to visit in Amsterdam.
Heineken Experience. It's worth a visit it gives some interesting insight into the evolution of Heineken.The dray horses are terrific .

Waiting for ages. We had bought online tickets as recommended and when we arrived to get in the lady had broken the machine to scan tickets.. We were waiting atleast twenty minutes whilst they tried to resolve this..Lady was very apologetic.. It's ok now nothing great about the experience. .
Sooooo much fun...who knew. I've toured liquor places before but none was as interactive or as fun as the Heineken experience. I didn't know what to expect and I was pleasantly surprised!

Proost!. Gonna be in Amsterdam? Enjoy your Heinekens? Take a tour of the Heineken Brewery with the Heineken Experience. Cost is about 17 Euros, takes about 90 mins, and comes with 2 tokens good for 2 decent size glasses of the good stuff

Good beer and fun.. Heineken never taste the same as before when you taste it in the brewery itself.Its was fun and the staff is very friendly.They even let you do the perfect pour by yourself and get another free beer.Very nice souvenirs shop end of the tour.What do you expec?It's a beer brewery so it's only beer there.Dont complaint.
VIP tour . We went to the VIP tour, totally worth the money... You get a tour guide go to special bars in the Heineken brewery, and get a nice gift, we recommend to eat before the tour

interesting experience. Conserved former brewery, you can see how the beer is make, you can sample a taste of each intermediary stages in the preparation of beer, you can interactively test how the grain of hops is feeling on its journey from beginning to bottle of beer. You come through rooms with many games and attractions and at the end you can taste three kinds of beer from Heineken - best choice IMHO is Heineken Gold.

You'll love it even if you don't like beer!. I'll start by saying that neither my boyfriend or I liked beer before we visited the Heineken Experience, he is now officially converted and we both loved this attraction. What a brilliant thing to do whilst in Amsterdam, very entertaining, informative and also a laugh when you are the beer as part of a simulation. I highly suggest writing your own message on a bottle for 6.50 euros, both my boyfriend and I did this and we are so happy with our bottles (although mine will stay unopened)! Don't miss out as this is a brilliant use of a few hours of your time.

nice 1 hour entertainment. stopped by the Heineken experience on our way to the flower market... it's a nice informative tour for beer lovers and the tour went pretty quickly (cause we were in a hurry). If you'r a beer lover you need to visit

You may learn something - and have fun!. We were two couples that visited in early May 2016; this was not part of our original plan for the three days we had in Amsterdam. We found ourselves with some 'spare' time and popped in and probably enjoyed it more than we may have expected.It was a very well run and polished interactive tour (60-90 minutes) that ended up including one or two beer or learning how to pour a draft from one of the hosts. A few interactive booths and some very engaged staff resulted in an overall much better experience than we expected. Also, the general consensus was that Heineken in Europe tasted much better than in Canada!
Very fun! . This tour was interesting and interactive! My husband and I thought it was a lot of fun and we'll worth the money!
weekend trip. interesting triplaces. very informative. nice beer tasting at the end. lovely eating places in the surrounding area.

Pleasantly Surprised!. I was pleasantly surprised by this tour. If you love beer, I recommend it! There are many different aspects to the tour. They really play up the whole "experience" aspect of the title which I thought was cool. Plus, you get 2 Heinekens with your entrance fee! Although I admit they could be bigger...
A great laugh. Loved seeing about the history and the method of making beer.The horses were cute too.There is also large section of games and you 2 beers
Okay. The history, information on how beer is brewed and the tasting/two included beers were all fine. Most of the rest seemed to be aimed at entertainment.

Interesting and fun for all. The Heineken Experience is relatively cheap, is fun, is interesting, and you learn and see so many things. You also get to taste the beer during your visit, so you will 100% be pleased by the time you finish your visit there.

It's not bad but bring a fold up seat . Obviously it's really busy probably because it's reasonably priced but unless it was just a hot day when I was there, me and my friends were standing around in queues in very hot corridors for 2 hours. Don't get me wrong they've got some interesting stuff in there and you get 2 free drinks (half pints) but try not to go on a busy day because it was hell
Great day out. Lots of history inside. Take plenty of pictures and the beer tasting was great. Later in the tour they teach you how to pull the perfect Heineken pint! Good day out

funny , exciting and interessting. start with the old brewery, the kettles, tasting and pass along the horsesbut have some patience in the bottle neck , the stairs up to the movie; this can last moren than 15 minutes. waiting Always looks much longer...the film is nice with a high Disney attitude; after the film you have lotts of interactive things to do and enjoy two drinks in the bar and visit the shop for lovely souvenirs.dont forget to make your personal bottles!!

Great experience!. I went to this with two of my friends. The experience was a lot of fun and very interesting! My friends who don't actually like Heineken still enjoyed it. There was lots of interactive games and three free pints. Would 100% recommend!

A Fabulous staff!. What a fun time! The staff and all of the time and effort put into this factory, makes this experience an unforgettable experience! There's always something new and interesting around each corner. Oh... and the beer is as fresh as can be, of course!
Beer bit mot more. Jes, à lot of beer. My friends liked it à lot. I throughout thought it was à bit Boeing. Line was long. Buy your ticket in avance!

Heineken Experience. This is a broad range of entertainment all at once. It starts off with a museum feel, walking through rooms learning about the history of the beer and its founders. Then you get to tour the brewing process rooms where I learned the process to brew the beer. Then you go on a ride - I won't spoil it. Then there's a tasting and a quiz about the history, but it really just tastes like regular old Heineken. Then you can get some Heineken and drink it in a very hip bar in the building. The souveneirs are pretty cool too. I don't know how much it costs because the group I am with paid for it, but personally I think there are better cultural experiences to be had in Amsterdam. The tour overall was 3 hours and I just really didn't see why it had to take so long. It could have been that Sunday is a busy day there. Overall, its's interesting but not amazing.

Fun and Informative - especially if you are a beer lover !. Plan for at least two hours. Make sure you buy your ticket in advance at any of the many tour sales outlets in Amsterdam. There are usually long lines to buy tickets at the venue and there is a fast track, skip the line for advance ticket holders. The tour includes many interactive displays, movies, exhibits, history & information, both old and new brewery machines, a 5 D movie ride experience, a beer tasting room; 3 glasses of beer included in your ticket price and of ciurse an extensive Heineken gift shop ad you exit.

Really enjoyed the tour.. Spent a nice couple of hours here. Thought the tour was a bit boring at first....self guided but as you get through it it does become a more interesting and more interactive so worth a visit in my book.

Cool museum. We got free tickets with the purchase of a pizza and beer cruise. There are a lot of really cool "hands on" features to this museum. One fun thing was the opportunity to personalize you own beer bottle - makes for great souvenirs.

Worth a visit. In all honesty, I wasn't expecting a great experience prior to the visit but luckily I was wrong! We had a great time seeing the process and the experience was enjoyable, the tasters also went down a treat!

Great Activity close to museums. The Heineken experience is a little pricey but can be easily found within walking distance of the art museums. The tour was very informative and is done in English. The only disappointment was that at the end of the tour, you have an opportunity to taste 2 beers. There also was the opportunity to lean to pour a beer from the tap. The disappointment was there was no visible indication that it would cost you both tokens to drink a single beer. The highlight, however, was the active photos and sports capability as part of the experience.

Interesting. Interesting to learn history of the company. No longer a working brewery but you can see the old brewery tanks. An interesting hour and the free beer at the end is a bonus if you like it although very busy

Cool sight for beer-lovers!. Awesome sight for beer-lovers! Booked tickets from tours and tickets, gives you a discount :)
Tip: go in early or 2h before closing to avoid all the people.

Visiting a brewery can be fun. I visited Heineken with my friends and we were amazed by it. At first is like a regular museum of beer showing how beer is prepared, bottled... But then...then the fun begins. There is a 5 D show where you can "get bottled", there is a room where you can make your own bottle, beer, places to make plenty of photos, pub, champions league hall. It cannot be explained, it can only be experienced. But once you do, the only beer you will ever want to have again is only Heineken. Tip: buy your ticket online. Don't make a great mistake to wait in lines for hours!!!

Fun journey through Heineken!!. Such a fun experience that details the history of Heineken and how beer is made!! There are a lot of fun activities along the way and in the end including photo booths, places to dance and drink, and videos to watch. All very fun and cool, we are so happy we went.

Premium beer for the discerning drinker. If you want to know the history of the beer, this is a good place to go. Won't be my top priority but good way to spend 2 hrs for some fun. I will focus on museums and canal tours and use this a filler (literally) if you have 3 days in the city
The Experience . Just loved it! We had so much fun! Bought a lot from the store there! Everyone was so nice! Very informative! Enjoyed the walking tour!

Fun, Educational and Enjoyable. Early visit is recommended as it can get crowded. There is an entrance fee. The layout for the tour is well planned. The whole experience is interesting and very educational. Lots of historical items are on display. Staffs are friendly and eager to answer with any questions from the visitors. The two free beers at the end of the tour are most refreshing and well deserved. Wear flat shoes as there are several stairs to climb.

Focus is on the "experience". If you love clubs and frat parties this is perfect. I liked the history at the beginning but the second half of the tour was way too marketing oriented for me.The tour comes with 2 beers, technically 3 because they teach you "how to drink it." The location of drinking the beer reminded me of a club, sticky floors and all.I guess if I had read reviews ahead of time I'd have been prepared but I thought it would be like other historic breweries I've been to, such as carlsberg in Denmark.

Very busy with a night ending . Stopped here on the hop on hop off bus. Long queues inside and it is a little claustrophobic. Various areas covered history and preacticalties of making lager. You get two half pints at end but due to queues you end up taking both at once. Noisy nightclub theme with little seating. We didn't hang around.

Crowded and Lame. Forget about the "experience" and just go drink a Heineken at one of the cute canal side cafes. Long lines and waits for a boring uninteresting "experience". Don't waist your time or money here.

Not so sure. As we were visiting Amsterdam for the first time everyone urged us to do this tour. While I was quite excited to do it, we found it very boring until the end when you get to experience all the interactive games and exhibitions etc. The entire tour feels very cramped and rushed until the very end. A tip if you are planning to go... Buy your tickets before you go, whether that be online or at a ticket shopIn Amsterdam. It is cheaper this way and you skip the queues once you get to the attraction.

Fun tour. Definitely worth a visit even if you don't like beer!We had pre booked tickets which I would recommend.Even early morning there was already quite a queue when we arrived and it was good to be able to avoid it and go straight in through a "pre purchase" entrance.Won't spoil the experience by detailing too fully but you learn about how the beer is made, some history behind the brand and plenty of interactive experiences along the way including being bottled (!).The expected tasting sessions are included and the chance to purchase branded merchandise as well.I am not a beer lover but I enjoyed this and thought the whole experience was well presented. Would recommend.

It costs way too much for what it offers. It is not a bad brewery visit but the entrance cost 18 euros...if is ridiculous compare to what they offer. The historical part is interesting but that's all.You get two Heineken at the end of the tour and the possibility to take a lot of selfie...18 euros for something you can read online and 2 Heineken...it is crazy!

Fab day! . This is a must when visiting Amsterdam, it's just fab! Loads of interactive things to do, especially the tour of being a bottle! You will know what I mean when you go! We were there for hours! To top it off you get to enjoy a couple of drinks after all the fun
Better than most brewery tours. It was interesting and we enjoyed ourselves. Not top of my list for activities in Amsterdam but worth a visit if you have time to kill.
Great Experience. My husband and I really enjoyed this tour! This is a must see for anyone visiting the city! We loved it. The gift shop was amazing too.

Very Entertaining. The Heineken Experience was definitely a showplace and you can see that Heineken has sunk a lot of money into this attraction. Lots of photo opportunities although you never really see the actual brewery as all of the "stages" are set up for entertainment purposes. Heineken does do a good job of explaining how their beer is brewed from start to finish.

Very informative and interesting. We pre-booked our tickets, and were glad we had as the queue to buy tickets on the day was enormous! We practically walked straight in and started the tour which was interesting and full of little moments of pride from this family business. It was a little crowded though which made some of the elements of the exhibition difficult to see or hear. The second half of the tour was a lot more interactive than the first and there were lots of things that would entertain families in this section. The opportunity to taste at the end was welcome, and there is clearly a lot of passion in the pouring and the drinking, which finished off the experience nicely!

Best ever . When e heard about it first we said it might be normal one . But when we tried it give you the real experience and all what you would like to know about. The factory is very nice and each corner have got own story . The good point you can visit it with your kids . I was having one below 3 years along with my wife . Very kind and helpfull staff. The tour is full of excitements include some activity will make you busy . Don't forget to design your own bottle with your name printed .

Best brewery experience I've had!. Surprisingly, this was a highlight of our trip to Amsterdam! Had such a great time here, learning how the beer is made and also the history behind the brand. Some great photobooths and experience after the history part. I really would spend longer towards the end of the tour (free beer!) and enjoy yourself! As it was my birthday they gave me a free mug which I got to keep and got some sneaky refills! Great visit!

Fun!. This was such a fun experience, and there were lots of fun activities to do inside the old brewery. The people who worked there were really enthusiastic and nice, and all in all it was well worth the money; at the end of the exhibit you also get two free beers.

Overpriced and not that interesting. We took this tour after reading a few reviews on Trip Advisor. We were disappointed in the venue. The tour is pricey and included two drinks along the way. the first half is the history and is self guided and a bit boring. The second half is interactive. The day we visited was quite busy with local Dutch visitors who were given priority in some areas. If you were there with a large group ie a bucks night, it would be fun as there are game areas and a very noisy interactive bar space, but wasn't what we expected and were disappointed.

Lots to see. The staff is very friendly. There are multiple area's with staff who explain the brewing process. The staff also ask the public certain questions and if you answer correctly you get a free Heineken. At the end of the excursion you can decide to get two free Heineken or learn get only one and learn how to pour the perfect beer.

Not a fan of the beer, but a fun experience. I am not a big fan of Heineken beer but I must admit that kinda enjoyed the experience. They have broken it up into several bars and an educational part as well. You can easily walk out there on your ear though, which is not a bad thing!

Ok on a rainy day....perhaps!!. If you know absolutely nothing about brewing beer and you need to kill time then this is quite a nice visitor centre.If you know anything about beer you will cringe at some of the guide's explanations and you would have more fun finding a good bar and having a drink!!The brew house, lots of copper vessels, is the highlight of the tour.

Best brewery tour so far!. This was such an awesome experience, and the price for the tour was worth it. Free beer, and free glass. Also, don't miss the included canal ride once you get out of the building. I think we made the last one around 1900. The place was interactive. It had photo/video booths that we were able to send to out emails, and save for free. Definitely worth it.
Okay tour.. Okay tour which lasted a. couple of hours, quite interesting but nothing startling, relies on the interactive machines which were good fun.
Don't bother!!. It was all about Heinekens status as a big corporation and sponsor than a brewery tour.Don't waste your money, a total rip off.

Really enjoyable experience - tour, talks, free larger !!. Visited with parents on a recent trip to Amsterdam in April 2016 - went to a few places, this being one. Purchased the 'Holland Pass' which got us into various 'gold' and 'silver' attractions as well as discounts on shopping and eating out, it also lasts twelve months.....The Heineken Experience was really good fun - well, myslef and my other half enjoyed it! Our parents perhaps not so much - the tour was interesting and informative, the best bit being able to try the larger :)After the tour there was more to enjour and explore with interactive things to do. At the end you arrived at the bar and could get further free larger and also pour your own if you exchanged the tokens.Although the experience was fun and worth doing, it only worth it once - wouldn't want or need to again.There's also a gift shop at the end......We enjoyed it thoroughly :) and would recommend it if visiting the area, at least once.

For beer lovers and more. A nice brewery tour with fun activities and photo/video ops. I did this in my second visit to Amsterdam. Visit if you like all fun, all play. We skipped some boring informatics on the Heineken journey. The souvenir shop at the end was great too. The bar however was too cramped and crowded.
Interesting. Interesting, entertaining and a bit more than just an old brewery. Spent about an hour and half there, and a must see visit in amsterdam

Wow. I cannot believe that I didn't visit here my first time. It was totally amazing. It was a 100% experience. Basically you learn about its history you learn how they brew it and you get in a simulator that puts you in position of an ingredient so you actually live it. It was wonderful. The bar at the end of the experience was so cool!!

Highlight of our trip. This was by far money well spent. Tickets cost €16. My wife and I bought our tickets online beforehand which allowed us to queue jump. We arrived at 11am which I would recommend as by the end when we were leaving it was queued up the street. The tour itself is self-guided. It includes 3 free beers. 1 whilst on the tour during the tasting and 2 at the end. You have the choice of going up to the rooftop aswell which has spectacular views of the city. This is a must whilst in Amsterdam!
Beer Lover. We loved heineken experience alot it was fabulous and we had 4 free drinks i love everything about it so if you come to amsterdam you better check it out or you will REGRET!!!

Incredible VIP Experien. We decided to upgrade to the VIP Experience and it was amazing! Our guide, Jos, was knowledgable and funny. We got to try 5 different beers matched perfectly with delicious cheeses. The entire experience was great from start to finish.

Interesting, but not a real brewery anymore. Decided to check this one off our list of things to do. Bought tickets ahead of time online. Maybe saved us 10 minutes of wait time at the door on a Saturday. History of the family, old logos, bottle types, simplified talk on how beer is made, saw the old copper vats, horses in stalls, a lame "beer ride", tasting and then basically a game room. Received two beer tokens to use at the end.I think they did a nice job of presenting the history graphically and tried to make it as interesting as possible without it being an actual brewery in this facility anymore. I was just missing the rattle of bottles being freshly filled and the smell of beer. I'm not sure if I would recommend the experience, but it is an ok rainy day activity (but so are the many wonderful pubs in Amsterdam!) Lukewarm on this one.
1 hour freee. must be tried once . the 3D is some laugh . the two beers at the end is an incentive . the event was trully intriquing . must see when in town . red light area very tasteful .

Neat place but not that great. A bit cheesy. . I was looking forward to a great visit. The tour was nice, but high level and not that informative. The ride within the experience is something you will wish you passed on. The staff is energetic and the beer is delicious. I guess knowing how to pour a Heineken is a good skill to have. Make sure you go earlier in the day or afternoon as the canal ride ends at night.

Tasty. An interesting and informative experience with a fair amount of interaction and the inevitable tasting session. If you're a beer drinker this is not to be missed, don't be fooled into thinking "I don't really like lager" this is not the rubbish we are sold in the UK, full of additives and flat!

Good but doesn't take long. This was my husbands choice because I'm not a beer fan. Even so, I quite enjoyed it but I'm glad we pre booked to save queuing! It only really took around an hour to go round though.

Great way to spend 3 to 4 hours. This is one of the best brewery experiences ever, Goes from the very beginning to present day with lots of interaction - reminded me of Willie Wanker's Chocolate Factory. You also get to taste the beer
Heineken. I can now truly say that I had the experience of a beer getting bottled. This was a very fun experience for adults.

Fun. This was much more interesting than I expected. I learnt a lot about the history of Heineken. It's a well planned 'tour-seum' that takes you through the firms varied history. Great for families with teens. All staff were bright and cheerful and knew their stuff.

Vaya experiencia . Amazing, a lot of fun! Book the tour is not very expensive, the tram leaves you right beside it, I can't remember the number of the tram but ask the locals for information they are very friendly and helpful!

May 2016. Visited here on 13th may. Had not prebooked our tickets so did have too queue for around 20 minutes. Once in you walk around unguided. There are a few staff at different stops to explain how the beer is made and to let you taste the barley and water mixture (very sweet) you are given a taster beer and the staff tell you how they keep the bubbles in and how to drink it properly (like a man) lots of fun things to do on your way round before ending up in the bar were you get your 2 free small beers.

Nice experience!. Nice experience. I have visited other beer experiences and this was almost same as others nothing new or special. We bought our tickets in advance and that was good because there was over 100m line outside for those who hasnt bought the tickets. Experience include free beer. Worth visiting.

Wonderful experince. Superrrrrrrrrrrr experience... Totally worth spending 2 hours inside.. It's not a typical boring experience .. It was full of fun activities and very interactive ..best part was when they brew u.. N u can make ur own customized bottles.. That was superb..The experience was informative and funnnI would highly recommend this place..

Disappointed. Was disappointed. We arrived quite early so we didn't have to wait long. The exhibition was OK, nothing extraordinary about it. We would like to see a bit of the processing line. Instead they focused a lot on showing off their marketing side of the business. Their attempts at humour came off dry. I love beer, visited almost a lot of beer museums however this one is the worst especially if you have to stand in line for hours. Not worth it.

An Amsterdam Must!. I was pleasantly surprised by how awesome and fun this attraction was! I loved every minute of it, and have a newfound respect for Heineken. The beginning is an audio tour of how the beer was created. You eventually make your way to the brewing process and even get to create your own customized label for a beer bottle that you can buy for about 7€. There are horse stalls too. You get to stand behind the bar and learn how to pour draft beer as well as numerous other games and things to see. Loved it and would highly recommended to anyone, even singles like myself!

Best brewery tour I've ever taken. Spent 16 euros and was it ever worth the money! The brewery is huge and it has so many things to do. You get to see articles from its history, they have a horse stable in the brewery, theres a place to take silly photos, theres also a theatre room where you can sit and watch funny heineken commercials. Halfway through the tour you get a beer and at the end of the tour you get two beers and if you don't like beer ( which I don't know why you wouldn't) they do have pop at the bar if you'd prefer that.I would also recommend taking the boat to their gift shop, its included in what you pay for your ticket to get in. They take you through the canals in Amsterdam and tell you a little bit about the city. Plus you can buy and drink more beer on the boat! It was an awesome experience.
