I would do it again and I would recommend anyone to do it.

A MUST DO in Amsterdam !. It was our first trip to Amsterdam, the day before King's day, and my birthday. The line was a bit long but moved very quickly. The staff was helpful and friendly. This place is an overall party from the start. I love how they presented the history of the beer and the brewery. Definitely an adult play house with games to play and beer to drink. They even gave me a free birthday mug! It was awesome. I highly recommend this as a stop in Amsterdam. I hope to return someday!

Great visit!. Loved this interactive experience! So much fun seeing how it all used to be done, lots to see, do and get involved in! Enjoyed the bike ride video hehe! And the sensory motion ride! And obviously the free beer!! Deffo a recommendation! And got a cool personalised glass and jumper!!
good visit. Great place to visit if you are a beer lover. Wait was a litlle long when I went, but worth the wait.

Surprisingly Awesome! . This was a blast! The exhibits, the random activities and the beer tasting were so much fun. They even have the BrewU ride - which is creative and kind of fun and you can bottle your own beer with a custom label. Your ticket also comes with two beer tokens for the end of the experience. Overall we really enjoyed!

A Fun Diversion. The Heineken Experience is one of those places that you just have to go to once if you are a tourist. I'm sure the locals steer clear. It is a relatively inexpensive tour of what is the old brewery. They don't actually make the beer on site. It's a fun, interesting ,interactive exhibit of the history of the Heineken brand. And at the end you get beer.How can that be bad? Good for a rainy day. Make sure you get a fast track ticket to avoid the lines.

Heineken Brewery Tour. I really enjoyed my trip to the Heineken Brewery. We bought tickets in advance which is great to skip the lines. It was very interesting to learn about the Heineken family history, there is an option to skip it and go straight to the brewery, but I enjoyed the history part almost more than the brewery experience. There is a 4D movie experience that teaches you about brewing and the whole experience includes 2 free drinks. Be careful about asking for water as that uses one of your drink tokens.

The History of the Famous Dutch Beer. The heineken experience is a smooth tour in the original brewery founded by Adrien Heineken. It consists of a tour through the brewery that is made into a museum of the history of this beer, very interesting and fun if you like brew...

More than I expected. I've been to quite a few breweries around Europe and after seeing the average reviews for Heineken, I didn't know what to expect. My friend and I were surprised when the tour was very interactive and informative and there was much more than just "try our beer and leave". We ended up playing games, taking free pictures in photo booths, having a little too much beer, etc. It was very modern and fun and I would highly recommend it!

Good Heineken Experience . Very interesting place. I don't like beer myself but during the tour we were given a beer and were told exactly the way it should be drunk. It tasted pretty good! Overall a good place to visit as a couple.

Crowded crowded crowded . Nice museum with ok content, but too many people entering the place at the same time. Had to wait 30 min just to get our beer from the tap........ at the beer museum, can probably be done better than that!

Best brewery experience!. We were a group of 3 girls, we don't drink beer very often but had heard the Heineken Experience was great so booked tickets. We booked online and jumped any queues, you don't have to book a particular time either, you just rock up when you want to on a specific day. This brewery tour was so much fun and exceeded my expectations. It was interactive, engaging and really interesting. It lasted about 1.5 hrs but you could take your time and and do it over 2.5 hours. Obviously we got a pint of Heineken at the end, I'm still not a massive beer fan but it was good to try it after the tour!

Fun place to visit. Not too informative but defo fun place to visit with friends.
We arrived around midday, so due to the lack of crowd half of the staff seemed very unmotivated.
I loved the cinema and my own pint from tap.
The new beer is too good!
Only the only ticket price (£13) is worth the visit.
Beer at the end of the trip. Good experience on the brewing side of the Heineken a littl expensive for the trip around for a small beer at the end been now wpuldnt go again.

Not worth the money. Granted, if I'd been in a group it would have been more fun. The "tour" felt like very little actual touring and more gimmicks and games. It was very very crowded so there was a wait of about 30 minutes to get into the interactive ride demonstrating the brewing process. Not worth the wait. After the free beer there were interactive soccer and karaoke games, plus creating your own beer bottle label, etc etc. I would probably not do this again not would I recommend it. 18 euro is a lot of money for what it was.
Great place to visit. I learned a lot on how Heineken is made. The staff were all gracious and welcoming. I had a great time. I would not miss this tour and you get 2 free beers.

Not a beer fan but insane! . Best beer museum / experience I've been too. It was so much fun from start to finish with tours, images, old footage. Really cool video at the beginning! Definitely recommend if you've got a few hours spare in Amsterdam!

Boring experience. I think that it is a boring experience. They could deliver beers during the route. The beers are delivered at the end and you don't want to spend valued time in amsterdam. For drinking a beer there are more and more interesting sites in Amsterdam

The Queueing Experience. Fancy a trip around a brewery? Fancy learning what it is that makes Heineken so bang average? Well you're in the wrong place because no alcohol has ever been created in this large warehouse. If the Heineken experience is a trip around a brewery then my house is where Anne Frank hid herself for 3 years (I.e it's not true).My three friends and I went for a trip around the Heineken Experience on a Saturday afternoon and were left wondering why it was rated so highly on TripAdvisor. This trip is not a trip around a brewery but more of a theme park. We were convinced that it must get better but every corner we turned resulted in more queueing. I suppose what made the queueing unique was that the staff insisted on saying hello to us every 3 minutes. We know you're having a great time and Heineken is the greatest beer ever made but quite frankly I didn't pay €16 to talk to you. I would argue that 70% of the tour was inaccessible unless you prepared to queue for a minimum of 15 minutes. Even trying to claim my "free beer" (that I had paid for) took 15 minutes and even then half of it was froth. We found the rooftop bar particularly amusing. Having queued to grab a beer, the staff suddenly announced that there is a rooftop bar upstairs in a way that suggested that it might be somewhere that humans might wish to hang out. After queueing to get into the lift (a scene reminiscent of Hillsborough), we arrived to find a room with a large window and 7 chairs. Having claimed my second free half-pint of froth, we were left sat on floor, dreading a second use of the lift.We left the Heineken Experience very disappointed having queued through an hour long advert. The whole layout was designed to get people in and out as soon as possible. Between the queueing and the section of the tour where one member of the staff encouraged us to all listen to our beers, the one beacon of light was the decent value for money, hence the two stars.*I may have been slightly biased as I needed a poo throughout the factory and there were no toilets.

If You Love Beer and Love Heineken. Yes, it is totally a tourist attraction but Heineken is my favorite beer. You get a bit of the history of the Heineken family and the brand's transformation over the years. You also get free beer (cheers to that) in a fun atmosphere. If you only drink craft beers or want an educational experience on the science of hops and malt, go to a beer making class. But if you appreciate Heineken I would say check it out.
Great tour to do with friends . It was a fun multimedia experience through Heineken's history and beer making - made more fun by free beer! Spent quite a fortune at the store too.

Valentinsday Trip 2013. During our valentinsday weekend trip 2013, we had been there. With the Amsterdamcard we got discount on entree ! We had fun. Interactive museum,during the walk you get 2 beers. We liked it.

Beer history with free beer. Starts of with a history tour around the brewery of how the Heineken came to be. It leads on to through the process of making the henirken with some interactive games and videos which are fun. You also get given a wrist band at the start of the tour, with two tokens which you can use for either two drinks of Heineken, or one drink and pour you're own drink with a certificate to say you're a certified pourer. It's a interesting tour with games and beer.

Real Heineken Experience.. It was really wonderful experience with digital photos and videos with Heineken. It was interesting to know how they make beer and what main ingredients they use. Kind of informative loaded with lot and lots of fun. With two free beers.

Birthday celebrations x. Definitely worth a visit. We enjoyed being made into a beer the most LOL. Offers much more than we anticipated. I have to admit that we left there steaming but it was really good fun and definitely recommend it. If you have your city card don't forget to claim 25% off the entry fee :)
Greatest Experience . It was our greatest experience in Netherlands. A lot of things to do (digital)and discover. Worth every cent. Suitable even for families.

Best beer tour!. We went just to kill some time before boarding are river cruise and it was amazing! The price includes two beers and a tour full of fun interactive experiences. Worth the visit for sure!

Spring for the VIP Tour!. My wife and I chose to do the VIP tour based on a recommendation from a friend who had done it previously. I was hesitant to spend the extra money, in the end I'm very glad I did! The VIP tour gives you everything the normal tour does plus; additional access to the many bars they have in the building, a professional beer tasting (paired with cheese which was awesome!), a much better understanding of their history, and a personalized souvenir! The whole place is busy and full of visitors, on the VIP tour you get a chance to break away from the crowd a little.

Awesome...!!. The Heineken experience is a must for beer lovers.. Apart from the history and Heineken, they explain how a beer is made and also have a short interactive show about making beer... But the best part is towards the end of the tour... Sampling of beers. And enjoying the different rooms made for entertainment..and ultimately...having a chilled glass of Heineken..!! The shop also has some nice stuff for beer lovers to buy..!

Heineken Experience . Start slowly with a lot of history details and ended big time with a lot of beer and good music. Many nice digital attractions on the way and fun memories like pictures and movie. Well recommended to free about 3 hours for a very nice tour.

Good fun and free beer. Good fun to spend a couple of hours in Amsterdam. Free beer and pint pulling experience at the end. They also give you a free voucher to use at their souvenir shop further into town for a free souvenir Heineken glass.
Awesome experience.. Interesting and informative, well organised. We bought our tickets online and did not have to stand in a queue.

Exceeded our expectations. We enjoyed the tour, learning the history and about the beer making process. It is amazing how much better this beer takes in Holland vs. the U.S.. Definitely take the free boat ride from the Experience to the store.

Underwhelming visit despite the anticipation. It was our first day in Amsterdam. We'd both been before but never made it to the Heineken Experience.After settling into our hotel, we made the 30-40 minute walk to the Heineken experience. If you're staying nearby the Damrak in the city centre, the walk is quite long but the weather was good and we were in Europe so walk!When we arrived, we had tickets to skip the queue although there's wasn't much of a queue in any case. We were arriving around 2.30/3.00pm.Upon entry, you can scan your e-ticket or use your printed ticket, all fairly standard and easy. Then you begin the experience.There are a selection of videos to watch and old artefacts from when Heineken originated. Combined with this there are some areas where you are walked through the brewing process by Heineken employees and invited to taste different glasses of the liquid throughout its brewing cycle. All of this was really interesting.And then you finish off with the more modern stuff like the various sponsorships - Champions League, rugby events, music events - and some drinks at the bar. You can get a normal 250ml of Heineken free or two 250ml glasses of the Extra Cold Heineken. And you're invited to stay around, playing some of the games and relaxing in the drinking area. And before exiting, of course, there is the merchandise store.It was all interesting stuff but I think what kind of ruined it for me was the volume of other groups of people who were there. Just as you got to something you were reading or playing with, there was either someone walking right in front of you, bumping into you, talking and shouting loudly and standing right behind you waiting for you to finish.Definitely come - it's one of those things you have to do in Amsterdam - just choose your time wisely!

Perfect tour, rude staff. The Heineken Experience is excellent tour in Amsterdam and it is well organized. The only complaint I have is a very rude bald guy at the bar when pouring Heineken at the end of the tour. He should learn his manners and working with people. His problem anyway, we've had a great time :)

Great Experience. Spent 2 hours here to view the history and process in making a good Heneiken. Loved the pouring session by the bartenders. Humourous and fun way to introduce to the brand experience.Do download the Heneiken app before commencing the tour as it helps you more in understanding the self tour.

Great value. Good mix of information with interactive activities,very well laid out and very good presentations,couple of beers at the end with some very cheap photo souvenirs made this a good couple of hours.Well worth a visit .

best part of my trip to Amsterdam!!!. I am a beer lover, couldn't miss Heineken Experience! Since I was traveling alone, I didn't had much fun expectations about the tour, but the moment I got there an excitement filled me in!! The vibe is great and the staff is very very very friendly. From the person you buy the ticket until the cashier in the gift shop (also, if you wanna hire me, I'll totally work for you!!!). The tour explains how the beer was create and it's very interactive with the guests. There are some activities and you drink a few beers! :DAnd the best part is that in the end you get your own Beer Pourer Certificated if you pour the beer correctly. I got mine and I'll totally put it on my resume! :PI loved every second of it and I truly recommend it. Ticket is 17 or 18 euros, but it's worth it.Also, if you are reading this before going, after the Heineken tour there's a free boat tour for the cannels (?), but it ends at 3 pm, so try to finish in the fabric before it :) I miss it, but I'm sure it's nice.

Best attraction i have been too. Went here a few weeks ago and really enjoyed are selfs, would go again. Museum and tour is really intresting, you get to taste beer and even buy personolized beer bottles. Really good and fun worth a visit

Surprised . Surprisingly entertaining. Having been on many brewery tours of many sizes in the past, I wasn't sure what to expect from something if this scale. The amount of activities and information made the visit very enjoyable.

Good tour for a rainy day. It wasn't the greatest weather when we visited Amsterdam, oh well. We were staying very close by in the de Pjip neighbourhood so it seemed to make sense to go to the Heineken Experience. We were in Holland for 1 week, so we had the Holland Pass(small), with that you get discounts at a variety of locations including this--when you buy your tickets just mention you have it and you get 15% off admission.We did a self guided tour (with our 20month old daughter) and found it to be just fine. The interactive "ride" is fun and would recommend it. You get 1 small tasting during the tour, and the 2 pints at the end-not bad! There even is an option to get a novelty Heineken bottle printed with your name on it if you want...I think it was about 10EURO or so.

Best experience. Once you go to Amsterdam, it is mandatory to go to Heineken Experience. Everything there inside is nice and fun.And yes, if you answer correctly their questions, you have more free beers!

Loved the experience. Thougherly enjoyed the tour especially at the end when you get a few samples of heinekein to drink. Very informative tour with plenty of interaction and fun. Well worth a vist. Make sure to by your tickets before hand either online or from a vendor if you intend going during the afternoon which is the busiest time and has the longest line to get tickets. Also the roof top bar isn't open on a Saturday.

Fun time!. This is a self guided tour ,at the beginning which you walk round the museum part of the building and read the information of the plaques on the walls and watch the videos informing you off the history of Heineken, it was quite interesting. The nearer you get to the end there is demonstrations, then you get to sample the Heinekein. There is also a lot of interactive games and things to get involved in. Some are a good laugh! At the end of the tour you can enjoy two glasses of Heinekein which was included in the price of our admission. And of course there's a souvenir shop before you leave. On leaving the building we were invited to go on the Heinekein canal boat free of charge which was a bonus and we even received a glass complimentary too when we visited the shop at the end of the trip! We had a good afternoon and would recommend.
Worth the tour! . Booked the tour in advance so paid a good price for it! Lots of fun, staff were friendly and chatty and we got a couple of free drinks!

Great place even get free beer....🍺. Very easy to find being on lots of tram lines. We had pre brought our tickets so No que straight in. You are given a wrist band with two tokens on for end if tour.You move round at your own leisure. There is a little ride in there where you are turned into a beer. Beer tasting You can create lots of fun pictures and also for €6,50 have have your own bottle with your name on it. Big gift shop and also teach you how to pour a pint the Heineken way. Plus you sit and chill drinking you're beers at the end

Great fun. Self guided tour with stops at point where guides are very interactive with you. A real fun action trip through the process. You can take pictures and create your own bottles. Lots of stairs !

Nice plan for an afternoon in Amsterdam. If you are spending more than one day in Amsterdam I definitely recommend you to go to this museum. In my opinion it is not one of the essential things to be seen in Amsterdam, that is why I recommend it only if you have spare time during your visit to the city. Specially I would recommend to go with friends and in the afternoon/evening. The entrance ticket to the museum is a bit expensive (16Euro), but it includes 3 beers inside the museum bar. In my opinion the perfect plan is to go to the museum in the evening, have a look around the museum, finish in the museum bar and then link it with a dinner in some restaurant of Amsterdam and continue the bars tour.This museum is an old Heineken factory. It is an interactive museum in which you not only see, but also you are part of it. They basically explain to you the origins of the company and Heineken family, the procedure for making beer and the particularities about the Heineken recipe for beer.
Drank beer . It was fun . They make it interesting and interactive . Lots to do . You get to drink two beers. And learn to serve draft . Worth it

Ummm. Want to go beer tasting?. As the lines can get long, buy your ticket in advance. You can also buy your ticket from the hop on hop off bus vendors. Expect to spend at least an hour touring observing how the beer is made and, of course, tasting.

Interactive!. Right from the outset this was an enjoyable and informative insight into the development of Heineken. The staff presented their lines with professionalism, tempered with just the right amount of humour. All in all an excellent experience.
Fun little tour . Was a fun little tour, filled with humour and information. Book online for discount €16 a ticket, you also get a free pint so makes the price worth it (avg pint in Amsterdam €6)

Great time . Had a great time here last week, get two drinks with the ticket and a tasted. The tour starts off a bit slow but as you get a bit further in its very interesting and there is a ride near the end that was good fun and a surprise (sorry if I spoiled the surprise)

Very good tour.. First off be aware that this is not the working brewery, it is the original brewery. We purchased the VIP tour before we left the U.S. You have a guide giving you the tour instead of wllking thru and reading the signs. There was a lot of information about Heineken.You go to places that are off limits to the general tour. There is a private tasting of different beers plus the 2 that you get with the general tour. We have done a lot of brewery tours and this was on of the best. Worth the extra money that the VIP tour cost

Interesting place. Very well organized, with some activities and games to play inside. tour is not just limited to viewing stuff, you need to enjoy the games inside. Gift shop is amazing with a lot of creative ideas with Heineken logo, enjoy 2 free beers.

Most famous brewery in the Netherlands. If you were looking to know about how beer is made, this might not be the best place to go... If you want to live a cool and fun experience around the Heineken Brand, this is the place to be! 4D video, games, karaoke, selfies, brewing diploma... a lot of fun!

A fun experience. Thank you Mr. Heineken for giving the world this excellent beer! This tour was very informative - gives you insight into the Heineken family. I learnt a great deal about the brewery process and also got to 'brew' my own beer! The cheeses accompanying the beers were of average quality - but the beers were oh so fresh and tasty. Overall, a really good experience.
Best brewery tour ever. Loved their presentation. Very informative and self paced. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The sampling at the end was delicious

This attraction is a must!!!. Loved visiting this place! For a brewery tour it's got loads going for it. Plenty of beer tasting, an interactive area following the tour, an opportunity to pour your own beer and try their ice cold beer. Following all of that you can also hop on their canal tour whilst drinking their beer (beer is at an additional price on the canal boat). Absolutely loved it, particularly after getting a free souvenir glass at the end of the tour. The price may seem steep at first but for what you get, especially when canal tours can be pricey in Amsterdam, this attraction is well worth it.

Excellent value for money. Have to say this was one of our favourite aspects of our trip to Amsterdam. A very interactive experience. You get given drinks tokens, keep hold of these tokens until you get to the roof top bar (there is a lift to this bar in the gift shop) once there you can enjoy your beer with a fab view of Amsterdam
Interesting. It was worth the time spent there. Not top on my list but interesting nonetheless... It is well organized and clean.

VIP Tour is well worth the extra cost!. I bought us the VIP Tour as my boyfriend had his heart set on tasting lots of beers while in Amsterdam and the tour certainly doesn't disappoint! We were given two free beer coins on a wrist band to begin with, this is for the end of the tour...We had 2 very friendly and decent tour guides, Marcjin and Michael. We were given a detailed tour of the process of making heineken beer and the history behind the family who built the empire... We saw a 4d short film which was pretty funny...The best part of the tour however was the private part of the tour where we got to see the roof top, where the staff have their functions, and finally the unique old school private bar where we got to taste 5 beers and accompanying cheeses and we were presented with our personalised gifts...We finished off in the final rooms with everyone else visiting that day and enjoyed our final 2 tokens to redeem for Heineken beers...By the time we left both me and my boyfriends were tipsy and had a new found appreciation for everything linked to Heineken....Would go again I enjoyed it so much...Definitely recommend...

Good experience, and very informational. I would recommend purchasing your tickets before arriving at this attraction. The tickets are 16 euro if you buy them from one of the information/ticket centers located throughout Amsterdam. This is not a brewery as I thought it would be, with that being said, the tour is interesting and you get a good sense of Heineken's history. At the end of the tour you receive two free drinks.
Amazing!. It was an amazing experience! Even if you don't like beer you'll have fun in this tour. They show you how the brewer process is done. In the end of the tour you can taste the beer.

Lots of fun . It was a little history and a lot of fun. Well worth the visit. Reasonably priced too. Not being a working facility there was less of the science and process, no brewer to talk. But it was a great time.

Fantastic! . I'm not a huge beer drinker but still wanted to do this. The Heineken family are a huge part of Amsterdam's history. You receive a snack box to have with the tasting at the end. The tour starts with the history of the company and then moves onto the beer making process. You can even 'brew your own' and put a message on the bottle. There are a few fun games on the way - rugby and soccer as Heineken sponsor teams in both. You also get to pour a virtual beer from a tap and are shown the right way to drink a beer for full flavour (good for a novice like me). Highly recommended!

Enjoyable experience . We arrived first thing Friday morning, we had already pre booked our tickets online and had them in my iPhone passbook which meant that we could bypass the queue to purchase tickets (which wasn't bad at that time tbh). The guy checking our tickets was very friendly & chatty to everyone. The tour gives you a bit of background on the Heineken family/brand, then information about brewing and then on to some fun stuff which I won't spoil! Generally enjoyed the experience and the free beers included. We got the tram 16 (could also get 24) from central station which was fairly straight forward and it drops you off across the road. Would recommend to people visiting Amsterdam.

It was better than we thought. It was really fun, doing the tour. Very informative and interactive. They give you free beer to try out through out the tour. At the end of the tour they gave us a free Heineken River boat ride back to the center of Amsterdam. Overall , it was an awesome experience.

Amusement park not a brewery. We've been to lots of breweries and distilleries where you can actually see, smell and taste the beer or liqueur. This was more of an amusement park! If you want alot of glitz and techno and just to drink 2 free small beers etc, then it's for you. I was looking for more of the history and actual brewing. I will say the staff was incredibly nice and knowledgeable!

Fun Filled Experience. It was fun filled experience. Luckily it wasn't crowded when I went, but there is some options to buy the ticket in advance from many places. Some history and many activities it was fun filled. Some beer tasting and beers drinking at the end. It was worth visiting, don't miss it.

Brilliant worth the money. My partner and i have just visited today and it was great, the history, interactive games and free heineken with the chance of pouring your own. Enjoyed the part that of the tour that made us the beer and taken us frow the experience of being brewed, such a laugh and fun day for adults. The staff was all fantastic and explained everything well in i would highly recommend this trip

Average . The tour was a bit odd. At one point you were a "bottle" getting prepared to be shipped out to drink. The horses were the best part of the tour. You could try the beer, which was kind of cool.
So much fun, even if you're not a Heineken drinker.. OMG, didn't know what to expect but wow, what an awesome experience. So much to see and do. Lots of fun. A huge 'you must do this' experience.

Amazing Experience . Whilst this wasn't high on my original list of things to do and see, I'm so glad I did. The tour itself was excellent very interactive and well thought out. Excellent wifi gives you the option to download the audio tour app fir free which is a nice touch. The tasting glass and samples at the end inc being able to personalise up your own bottle are great touches - a must do for anyone and a must for all lager fans out there!!!

Great visit . My husband and I visited the Heineken brewery great tour very interactive , would say get skip the line tickets as we lined up for about 45 mins but worth it , even get a couple of beers at the end , a lot of fun definitely recommend
Beer n history. Great day had by all here!! Really interesting- plus lots and lots of beer- even free beer to be won! Recommended to all, especially if it's a rainy day!!

Crowded but fun. I wasn't able to do the ride because there was a 25 minute wait. Fun to see and if you go with a group lot of interactive stuff to try. The top floor balcony is a little small so doesn't fit a lot of people. Burger on top floor was good.

Heineken Experience. We had a very nice time after waiting in line for 20 min to get in, but it was worth it. I was told the line gets longer so we consider ourselves lucky. Get tickets in advance to avoid the line. Once inside we opted to check in our back packs for free. This old brewery is non functional, but well maintained. There are allot of information in rooms about the brewery and you get to see the old shiny brass distilleries and there is a sections where they keep the Heineken horses. There are also photo booths that you can email to yourself with a Heineken background, which I really liked. There is a movie you get to watch in which you are the beer being made and packaged while holding onto a bar and the floor under you moves. In the tasting room you are taught how to drink the beer and possibly win another glass of beer if you answer a question correctly which I happily did! You can have a bottle of Heineken label made with your name on it. In the end you get two glasses of beer or one large one when you give them the buttons on your wrist band.
Great Tour . Great tour, very informative. Really interactive. Prepare for long queues as this is a popular attraction esp with stag groups. Pre book in advance to avoid lenghty queues

Gimmicks. This place was a fair walk outside the centre, however I'm glad we took the time to visit. The first part of the experience explains the history of Heineken. It goes into a lot of detail on the brewing process and let's you try how it tastes during the process. The second part of the experience is gimmicky - karaoke, photo booths, games etc and this was fun as well. We felt we got our money's worth especially because we were given free beers along the way! A tip to get more beer - in the talk where they go through how to drink Heineken if you answer questions correctly you might get another beer! (Hops and yeast is what you can smell)
Awesome. It's always a pleasure for me to learn about the true heritage, culture, and building blocks of businesses. This was an informative tour and of course the free drinks make it cool too!

Entertaining and educational. This was one of the attractions we'd decided to visit before we'd arrived in Amsterdam - only a few tram stops from the city centre, it was quite easy to spot, with the huge sign on the building.Although €18 sounds a lot, if you don't pre-book, the museum packs a lot into your visit, in addition to your free drinks - the wristband, with the drink tokens, is a good idea. The 'Ride the Beer' section is good fun, as are some of the interactive displays, such as the rugby kicking - the tour is described as 'self-guided' so you can take as long as you want and ask questions of the staff (sorry, Crew) who are available in most sections.It would be a good place to visit if the weather was bad - when we went, it was a hot day, but that made the drinks even more welcome!
Heineken tour. Interesting tour. Saw the Heineken horses, how the beer is made. They have a little motion ride and of course some free beer at the end of the tour

Nice experience. We booked online prior to going, but getting there I saw you could book this on every Street corner. The tour is very well organized. This site is no longer used to make beer but all the equipment is a museum to the famous industry & the family. Eat before you visit, because you could be drinking 2-3 glasses of Heineken.Something to do for a different experience.
Well worth a visit. Informative and interesting. I would suggest it's worth going to if you're in the city, even if you're not a beer drinker

Very Interesting. Not only do you learn all about the history of Heineken and how it is brewed. There are several interactive parts to the tour including being taught how to pour the perfect pint of Heineken.

Great place to visit for day out.. We had a great day out here there were a group of us & all say they had a such a laugh its not any ordinary tour you get put through virtual hopps making process then get a really nice couple of drink they are small bit there really tasty then there's a random room but really cool & if you time it right you get free boat ride tour around Amsterdam so it's worth the €17 but you can combine tour trips & save money also you can buy the Amsterdam Directory the give you freebies which is always nice it there ticket tour shops on about every block so there's no panic or drama about getting about or touring

A lot of fun!. It's worth to visit it especially if you are a bier drinker :) I would recommend to avoid crowd because some rooms are a bit small. You get a beer to try and another too in a "party" room at the end. It's interesting to learn about the history of Heineken.
Good fun. This was a lot more fun than I had imagined with plenty of interactive content and free beer! What more could you ask? Advisable to pre book.
Heineken. It was lots of fun and entertaining. There are games and photo fun stuff to do. They have a ride in which you get bottled. They present their product very creatively.

Good Value for money. Great experience showing how the beer is brewed and its history. Got free tasting and interactive experiences. The tour lasts about 1.1/2 hrs - maybe more if you want to stay and drink!
Beer. If anyone like to have a experience when the beer start and have a tested this is the place, but is better to buy the tickets before, it a little bit crowd.

Great experience . I live in Amsterdam and never do the tourist things but when my family came over we went there. And to my surprise it was awesome and I saw more than I really expected. I still recommend it to my dutch friends.

Must do in Amsterdam!. Soaked up the experience on day one of a 31 day trip. Informative Interactive and just a little over the top. Enjoyed hearing and seeing the story of the family and the history of the beer.Not to mention the tasting both during and at the end of the tour.Answer the questions right and win a free beer during the tasting. I DID! I also tried the H41 lager not too bad!

Good but not essential. Be smart, buy the ticket online and go early and during a weekday. I went on a Saturday afternoon and there were queues for everything, which made the history and brewery part quite tiring. After the en masse beer tasting, you enter the interactive part which can be entertaining if you are with friends. I really liked the bar at the top of the building which has a terrace with a nice view of the city.Don't do this only for the free beer; in that case it is cheaper to go to a bar.Taking the queues aside, the experience is entertaining but I wouldn't consider it a must.

We thought we would get to see beer being brewed! . The Heineken experience was an ok way to spend an hour or so. There is a lot of information about the history of Heineken and you get to see some empty brewing barrels. We were disappointed that we didn't actually get to see any of the beer being brewed or bottled. There were some good interactive parts - where you could try kicking rugby balls or interacting with different screens. I think for the price per person it's not great and wouldn't necessary recommend to others.

Beeeer!. The tour took a total of 2.5 hours.The staff were friendly and knowledgeable.The best bit was the simulator which even our 4year old enjoyed!And now we know the right way to pour our beer :).

Spring Vacation. Really easy to find. Totally worth the cost of ticket. Short line made for no wait. Learned all about how they make the beer then got to taste it and two beers were included at the end. Pretty awesome.
Beer me. I'm not a huge fan of Heineken beer but it was a cool experience and the tour was enjoyable. I did enjoy the experience of the 0 degree beer sample that we were able to sample.

A Good experience. For beer lovers. The place is very well assembled with videos and audiovisual great. If you do not know how the world of beer, there you find out. They have managed to put together the space very well (the former factory Heineken) and audiovisual and presentation. There is an interactive part. Staff great with a constant smile.

Great experience. In my opinion Heineken Experience is a must אםור in amsterdam for people who have ever drank beer. They let you experience the whole process from the ingredients to the product itself. The tour include 4 cups of beer as well.

Entertaining afternoon. Entertaining tour with people dotted around to talk you through the exhibition and answer questions. Get taught how to taste the beer and then get 2 free drinks at the end in a cool bar area. Good value.

Worth a look. It's worth a look but not as good as I was expecting. I've been on a couple of brewery tour and this is very different, also very busy! Buy your tickets online and save 2€ p/p! Takes about an hour to do.

Very good hour on Heineken old factory. For people who love beer it's a good tour. You can learn about the beer history and the Heineken history and after drink a(3, actually) good Beer.
The price is not bad and its not so far from Amsterdam center

Amazing!! . Really enjoyed this. It was well worth the money! Lots of beer included in the price. We went on my boyfriends birthday and they gave him a beer and souvenir tankard on the house which was a nice touch 😀 We got there early and avoided the queues
Fantastic. What an excellent attraction that was informative entertaining and involving. Well worth a visit ... Some great interaction activities ...

Disapointing & Gimmicky. We were very disapointed with the Heineken Experience. Tickets are €16 for a really short tour, followed by being herded along into a 'tasting' & then a series of interactive gimmicks & ads. You get 3 smalls glasses of beer for your fee...I wouldnt waste my money

Tacky, but fun. I wouldn't call this a must do when in Amsterdam, but if you have some time and money left to kill you could do worse. It's not overpriced but you don't really feel like you learned/experienced much. You do get a free pint at the end and some samples along the way, and there are some tacky but enjoyable interactive games and the chance to get a bottle with your custom label stuck onto it. There's a 'ride' segment which involves being shaken about a bit as you watch a video of the process of beer being brewed. Again, cheesy fun. It ultimately feels like a promotional experience that you have to pay for. I wouldn't go again, but I'm happy that I did go at least once!

Interesting and fun. A real gem of a tour. Beer making is about as dull as it gets, but with the film, the touching, feeling and tasting of the ingredients and the beer before and after fermentation brought it alive. Going early means less queue, going later on a Saturday made it more fun. You get a couple of drinks included, which are very welcome.
Poor experience.. Would not go back, not really much to do here it see. Virtual tour on you tube would have been as good. Free beer they tell you....2 small glasses lol.

Informative and fun. Little bit out of the way, but worth the walk. The first part is interesting and informative, the second part is more fun and interactive . The tour is finished off with two free beers at the bar on the roof with good views over Amsterdam .

Something for everyone.... A bit of history, family heritage, culture, amusement, humor, learning, drinking and laughter. There are some very clever photo ops and a great selection of personalized souvenirs. An enjoyable experience (even if you are not a beer drinker).

Wouldn't be first on my list of things to do.. The Heineken Experience wasn't as good as I thought it would have been, I had been advised by friends that it's not very exciting in the early stages of the tour but it would pick up as it progressed. The overall tour was average, the highlight was the free beer they provide you throughout the tour.

Well worth a visit . We had this on our to do list while in Amsterdam but didn't pre-book so after queuing for 40 minutes we were hoping it was worth it - it was!You learn everything about Heineken and get a few Heineken's included in your ticket price, 4 of us did the tour, which in unguided so you go at your own pace, we all thoroughly enjoyed it especially the interactive part, photos in booths with various Heineken backgrounds, cycling while singing Dutch karaoke was a huge hit, you then email the photos/videos to yourself free of charge which is a very clever marketing idea. I would highly recommend

So much fun!. Was so interesting to find out how Heineken is made and the history of the beer! There were lots of fun interactive parts of the experience that we loved and plenty of photo opportunities! Each admission granted you a wristband with two free beers at the end of the tour which topped it all off! Fun all round!

Interactive and Fun. This is a go at your own pace tour which is great! It is very interactive and keeps you engage. The history is at the beginning of the tour and then how the beer is made is the next part of the tour. The really neat part was seeing all the endorsements! You can attempt to pour the perfect beer! Best part...2 free beers at the end! I would recommend to get both beers right up front because sometimes there will be no one in the tasting room and the next minute it will be packed!

Better than expected . The Heineken experience was better than what I expected. It was more than just reading or being told how heineken is made as it was modern and interactive by using games, photo booth and more.

Heineken happiness. This place was well worth a visit, it's fun fun fun. I went in sober, came out a bit tipsy!! Lots of things to do, designing your own Heineken label was fun and you get to take home the bottle, with the beer, too. It's 10euro for 2 bottles. It's got loads of interaction activities and it's a thoroughly enjoyable experience.

A MUST do!. Incredible experience and fun atraction to visit during hollidays in Amsterdan... They have made it so increadible, full of details, that we fall in love in every room we enter... Really cool place to go to, heineken is so careful with the details... Really great work.

Must do. It's more of a beer museum, learn about beer history, follow the brewing process and taste it right out of the brewer, also you can make your own branded heineken bottle and get hell of souvenirs

Dreadful Experience. If you like standing in a queue for 45 minutes (this is after getting through the door) waiting to go on their 'fantastic' ride then this is for you. The ride was rubbish, you are just jiggling around on a moving platform, which doesn't really move very much! There are a few interactive things to do which others have mentioned, but by then I just wanted a beer. 16 euros for a pint which is what I felt I had paid by the end of it. I can see if you are in a group you could make a lot more of it. Best bit for me was standing on the roof drinking my cold beer. Not a fan of Heineken anyway so not sure why I went in!
Good experience . Very close to our hotel we went there around 2pm it wasn't busy . We have great time and nice drink lol

Amazing experience . We enjoyed it a lot while watching how beer gets done and drank the fresh beer for free after paying a discounted admission of 16 euros instead of 18. You will also see a photo booth and video shooting of yourself as if you are biking through the streets of Amsterdam.

Interactive and modern. A really good interactive and modern experience. Some fun I pads to play on and quirky rugby games.
Shame I didn't like the beer but def worth a trip

Overall Disappointing. I had high hopes for Heineken Experience after reading all the other reviews. I was pretty let down though. It's very crowded and you are stuck waiting behind people to move through the exhibits. To me there was barely any focus on the history and beer making process and too much focus on silly games and simulations. The main attraction, I suppose, is a motion simulator ride that explains how the beer is made. It was cool but we had to wait over 30 minutes to get through it. And there was absolutely nothing to do in the line. Then the "ride" itself was barely 5 minutes and showed us in a movie things that other breweries show you in person. The bar at the end was cool but really crowded. So yeah overall did not feel like it was worth 16 Euros or two hours of my time. Maybe I'll check out the Amstel brewery next time!

Fun but not what I expected. I expected to learn more about how beer is brewed trough years, to see some old tools which were used and stuff... but it was mostly high budget commercials and interactive games that don't have anything to do with the beer
Better than expected . We visited to escape the cold weather and it was surprisingly more fun than expectedYou get three free half pints of beer Highlight was seeing the horses which pullthe dray

Avoid if you have really young children . Not suitable if you have very young children as no lift access and stairs can be dangerous , it is a good experience though for others , very well structured and worth a visit when in Amsterdam

What a hoot - and I don't like beer!. This was a really great way of learning more about beer and even learning how to drink it properly (especially given the two glasses that come w the ticket price). Fully interactive - this was a really surprise and both myself and the beer drinking member of the family had a ball! Would recommend pre-buying tickets

Good experience - Love the free beer. Heineken Experience is near the Museumplein.Tickets costs around Eur 16. A good mix of different experiences from the history, 4d cinema and more importantly beer pouring and tasting. Will recommend.

A must in Amsterdam!. It's interesting to know the history behind this beer and to know how the Heineken family built and kept this company and their employees. The experience is well thought and organised, their staff is just amazing and you end up spending around 3 hours there without noticing it!

I don't even like Heineken. I don't drink beer or lager but my husband does and I was expecting to be dragged around the Heineken experience begrudging every step, but it was actually pretty fun!There are demonstrations and random facts about Heineken that I found quite interesting, and it was a good price so I think it was worth it!
One of The best beer in the world. Its worth knowing the history behind one of the best tasting beer in the world. You got to taste the best beer in Holland

Long Tour But Fun. This tour was recommended to us by our family. We purchased tickets in advance online so we did not have to wait in the long ticket line. Please buy your tickets online. If you forget to buy tickets, buy your tickets on your smartphone and you can have the tickets scanned from your email confirmation. The ticket line is long and ridiculous. Some parts of the tour are boring and some parts are fun. With the tour (at the very end), you get to enjoy 2 free Heineken's in the tasting room. I was able to try 2 beers before I even got to the tasting room, which my husband drank for me. The first beer that was offered during the tour was an appetizer to get you excited. An employee will ask you questions about what you learned about the beer so far on the tour. If you answer correctly, you get an extra beer!During the tour you have the opportunity to customize your own Heineken beer bottle, which was neat. We customized 2 different bottles for €10. At the end of the tour, I recommend going up to the top floor to enjoy your beer. It has a lounge/club feel along with a spectacular view of the city. This is a great photo opportunity.

So worth the money, brilliant fun!. My friend and I visited and had the best time! Not only is it a museum, but it feels like a party. There is so much to do and see...learning about marketing, beer making, how to pour (and sample) a beer, about beer sponsorship in sport and then you can kick a football...so much fun! We left a little tipsy!

Don't go on a weekend! . Myself and my husband visited here on a Saturday and it was very busy. We enjoyed the trip but we had to que a lot. The simulation was good and we enjoyed the tasters on the way around and after. Apparently the best time to go is a week day. I would have enjoyed it more had it not been so busy. A fun afternoon though!

Long lines, fun, average. It takes about two hours to get through the Heineken experience. The whole time you are in a long line of people and you wait to the very end to receive 3 small beers . It seems like there is a lot of buildup to be kind of let down in the end. There were some fun interactive parts of the experience and lots of opportunity to take selfies. There is even "beer--the ride."I'd recommend having a beer or two then going, that would be a bit more fun.

Interactive. The heineken experience is a must for anyone visiting amsterdam, well organised with plesant staff.. the price we paid was well worth it! Book online to avoid queues, free beer at the end was a nice tough, refreshing, we were lucky the rooftop bar was open.. 100% would go again.

Good fun. The Heineken Experience is very informative, has lots of interactive bits, and the beer tastes extra good. If you have travelled a lot, it is very similar to the Guiness Storehouse or any other brewery tour.
Okay but not amazing . I visit and was expecting more . It bored me a little . The only good thing was the bottle I got with my name on it . I was told that there was pubs inside . There's not

Family fun!. This was fun for the family. It isn't a must see/do in my book. If you don't have much time, skip it and head to the fabulous museums instead. If you are looking for an activity to do with your family, this is it, especially if it is raining outside. You can burn time and kids can burn off energy here. This reminds me of an American attraction that serves Americans. Be sure to buy a discount on the street.
Incredible . Done this with 6 friends while touring Europe and it was a definite highlight Out of the top 5 things to do in Amsterdam it's up there for sure

OK for the young ones. Second time I visited 10 years ago and it's changed somewhat it's very geared towards young people I think a lot of stag parties go here now it's still worth a visit , always buy a prepaid ticket before you go or you will be queing a while
Too much time to get bored. Really big queues to purchase tickets and waiting time to get the heineken tasting is awful. I wouldnt recommend the experience

Awesome self guided tour with 2 drinks included . Absolutely loved the Heineken Experience, and the beer was so fresh! Tour/history is very informative with several interactive sections along the way, including games and photo booth type activities. At €18 per person (online discount available) it's a great afternoon activity.
Great fun. Very informative and we'll worth a visit. Defo prebook for the cheaper tickets. Nice and easy to get too from central station and in a lovely area of amsterdam

Informative but where's the beer?. As a museum for Heineken and an explanation of the process of making the beer, I can't fault it. It explained everything simply, clearly and engagingly. However I was disappointed that after learning so much about the brewing process that we didn't actually see any beer being brewed, just lots of videos.
Good fun. Bought the tickets in advance which was a great idea as they allowed queue jumping. The queues were really long. Unexpected simulator ride was the best bit.

Extended expectations . Buying your tickets on-line is an absolute must to avoid the long lines. My 18 year old son and I went on a rainy cold day and the line was huge...But you breeze straight on when you buy ahead of time. Crowded but fun tour with some good interaction and extremely friendly and well trained staff. Well worth a visit although the shop is a disappointment.
Definitely something to do in Amsterdam!. Perfect rainy day activity. Very interactive and good price for a museum tour as well as 3 beer. Even fun for people who don't drink/like beer
Best tour in Amsterdam.. Visited this place when I was in Amsterdam. Really good tour if your in to beer drinking. Also you get 2 free beers in the entry fee.
Great experience. Go behind the history of Heineken family brewery and the no 1 premium international beer...dont forget to stop to get your customise bottle

beer tour...... decided to do the Heineken tour...18 euro on the day gave you a wrist band with 2 free beers at the end of the tour... great tour if done on own and also done with guides... great staff very entertaining and the beer was cold and welcoming... great experience
Beer Fun. This was brilliant. Great value for money and very interesting. Left in great form and learned a little. Free beer can never be bad especially as we got double what we should have.

Recomended for beer lovers. It surprised me, how much i enjoyed the visit. You get a sense of the history of beer and the process to get that gold liquid. Its well set up, get ready to get surprised a few times.

Great fun!!. Visited the Museum on a Sunday afternoon and it was a great way to spend a few hours. The first half was more educational about the brewing process and then interactive after that. Seemed to strike the perfect balance and I'm sure kids would find it as interesting as the adults, shame they don't get to sample the product at the end though!!Rounded off with some really great stuff to buy in the gift shop.

A must when you're in Amsterdam. We had a brilliant time in the Heineken Experience. We took loads of pictures, got to see how Heineken started and pulled our own pints of Heineken. Definitely a great choice on a rainy day!

Great - if you like being herded !. Really disappointed in this very over rated, commercial experience. It seemed as if the staff have all graduated from the "Disney college of fantasty" with very scripted commentary.I really didn't think it was worth the cost of the entrance fee to be herded along to what was actually a marketing lesson. I certainly didn't learn anything new about beer making.

Nice experience . It was one of the great experiences in Amersterdam. It's better to book the tickets online or you have to wait in line for hours especially on weekends. It's a nice place with many activities. It's a must visit.

Great experience . The Heineken Experience was far better than I'd anticipated and went on for longer than I'd expected. Interesting and fun! Ideal rainy day activity, the free drinks at the end are a bonus

A must see . Whether you are going to Amsterdam for work or leisure and even if you are not a beer lover, you should definitely visit Heineken experience. Been there with friends, found out how the beer is made, what's the proper way to drink it and drank a few glasses for free. What's more, they offer lots of animations that will make your visit and beer worth while and the roof bar is a great place to enjoy the view of Amsterdam. If you're lucky enough you could also get a free boat ride to their brand store where you can get a free souvenir glass and buy something for your friends or loved ones.

It's ok, not more. You enter a huge Heineken commercial where you keep hearing it's the best beer and mr Heineken is the best man and so on. Afterwards you get to taste half done beer and see a 4d clip about the process of making beer. From there you go through endless little cute gimmicks that are meant to make you share Heineken on social media. At the end you get 2 beers or one larger extra cold one. It's was nice and time went by fast but totally not worth the 16 euro it costs.

A Must-do if you´re in Amsterdam!. The Heineken Experience demonstrates the way beer is brewed in the most entertaining way!
If you want to skip the sometimes long queue in front of the Heineken Experience you just need to buy a ticket online or at one of the many stores in the city.
Loved it . We all loved our Heineken experience 🙌🏼🙌🏼 while waiting in the queue we had our photo taken and the staff were so nice and very welcoming 👏🏽🖖🏽

Must see in Amsterdam . Really great and fun museum. You will learn how they brew beer. They will tell you about the ingrediens and how they make the beers taste the same across the world. You will get on a journey, where you see the journey from water to a party on a beach :-)And the best part - you get to taste the beer! Don't miss out on it!
Fun time. It's good to try this tour. We gad lots of fun with friends. Had our own bottle of Heineken with our name and used the bar after tour. Loads oc good Information too.

Amazing (but remember to book online!). Had an amazing time here whilst away for New Year - definitely worth a visit if you are in the city. However the queue was huge - so glad we booked online (the night before) and skipped the huge queue right to the front. Great if you like beer (me) but also a great and informative day out if you don't (the Mrs). Also you get a free boat ride back into the city centre which saved money paying for one of the boat tours.

Too Commercial. They did talk about the beer and the history, which was what I came for. But after that was too commercial, more like trying to sell you the beer and the party atmosphere that comes with it.

Good stuff!. Great experienced! Suitable for everyone. Great way & learning experience how beers were made. You could try to be a bartender for a minute and taste fresh cold beer too.Love the experiences, enjoy the history and appreciate the facilities & Heineken achievement. Overall, amazing place to visit. Make sure you pack some snacks and have a stroll along the canal.

Boring in the beginning but speeding up!. Quite boring in the beginning (for a not-a-museum person like me...) But overall great experience. The simulation movie is worth waiting for so don't skip it!

VIP Tour is a must! Totes Amazeballs!. If you want a good trip out somewhere in Dam then the Heineken Experience is a must! Before my mates and I arrived in Amsterdam we thought we should go large and book the VIP tour, it was the best decision. We arrived on time and were made to wait a few minutes before we were seen to by our guide Micha, the guy on the advert! He was a top bloke and made sure he introduced himself to everyone in out group. The group consisted of ten people ranging from USA, Brazil, Austria and my lot from the UK. We were taken around the brewery and everything was explained perfectly and even the staff just walking past were quick to welcome us and ask us how our tour was going. Along the way we were given samples of the great beer that is Heineken and were taken to the top of the building where we could see the whole of Amsterdam, beautiful. At that point it must have been about an hour/hour fifteen and I thought, yes this was worth it until Micha said now lets taste some other beers. We were taken into what looked like an old pub setting and we sat down and had sampled different cheeses and a fair few different beers, we were hammered by the end of it. We had such a good laugh with our guide and he made the experience worthwhile explaining the tastes etc, he even went out of his way to get another beer for us to try! My mates and I aswell as the rest of our group thoroughly enjoyed it and to top it off we received a personalised bottle of the good stuff aswell as a paperweight in shape of the brewery building , talk about being spoilt!!! Also my mates told our guide it was my birthday and he gave me an extra gift in the shape of a Heineken mug. The value for money was truly unreal!! Furthermore after the tasting there was a bit at the end with all the marketing that Heineken do in the media and all that advertising and sponsorship jazz which was good to get involved in and free photos to email to ourselves. After that there was more beer for us to indulge in so by the time we were done we were wobbling to say the least. Now that is what I call a proper brewery tour. If you are into your beers then this is a must thing to do in Amsterdam!

Meh. I had a lot of expectations and was disappointed. The tour does give you some bits of information about the brewing process and a bit of Heineken history (I received more information from Wikipedia), BUT it felt like the whole place was ment for "brainwashing" you into buying Heineken beer (totaly commercialized). Part of the place was a museum and the other part was Heineken themed games. Aimed for tourists.
Great value . The Heineken experience was great. Very interactive, plenty to see and here about. Sky bar has great views. One of the best brewery tours I've done!!

Fun, fun, fun.. We really enjoyed our afternoon spent here. Much more interactive than expected. Take the opportunity to do the video and picture stations as they are fun to do. You can even get personalized beer bottles at the end of the self-guided tour.

Better than expected . The experience was so much fun and way better than I expected I was just expecting some tours to learn just about how they make the beer but it's so much more, lots of fun games and beer 😁

A fun day out. Couldn't believe how much there was to see and do in the Heineken museum from the history of how it all began, to a virtual tour of how it's made, fun and free photo booths, pouring your own free pint and being able to buy two personalised bottles for just €10.
Its a must!:). If you will visit Amsterdam then this is a place that you must see! A really nice experience that you will never forget! Lots of fun and games!!!

Thinks to do with children . The tour inside the old beer brew factory is really nice.
We were a family with three children of age 5 to 10 which also had a a lot of fun.

Good laugh . I have been to the Heineken experience twice now and both times have enjoyed myself, there is so much to do and it gives you such a good understanding of how beer is made. There are lots of parts that are modern and also lots of parts that have a lot of history I would recommend this trip to anyone.

One of the best industry related attractions. At 18 Euros per person, this turned out to be a great way to spend a morning. We didn't book in advance and had no trouble getting tickets at opening time. The staff are really great and the museum is both informative and entertaining.Without spoiling it for those yet to go, there's lots to see and plenty of interaction, a lesson in how to drink Heineken and drinks to savour. This is a must see attraction if you're in Amsterdam.

Classic Brewery Merchandise. The Heineken Experience is a very modern and chic museum that leads you through the history of Heineken and the brewing process. It's got a 4D short film which is fun, art and games and free beer at the end! Great if you haven't already seen a bunch of beer breweries!

Great time to be had!!. Definitely a must do in Amsterdam.This trip was busy when we arrived but we got through the cue very quickly.You can wonder round at your own pace and there you get free samples of Heineken in with your ticket price. You also get a free half pint glass. There is a lot to see and would recommend this trip as we thoroughly enjoyed it.

Fun but crowded . We visited on Sunday afternoon. I would definitely buy online tickets before hand to skip the line. The tour was longer than I expected, which was nice. Had many interactive rooms and fun games to play. You get two bigger glasses of Heineken and a smaller one for free during the tour. Atmosphere was upbeat and staff was friendly. Was a bit crowded but that's understandable as it was a weekend and a popular attraction.
Great experience.. In order to not spend the hall day waiting in lines try to visited during the week (online ticket if possible) And dont miss to add the audio and the burger because "worth it".
Good fun. obviously a must do for any beer lover, the museum is a fun way to spend an hour or two & with the added bonus of two beers at the end you cannot go wrong!

A great Beer. Very enjoyable and informative experience. The tour is vey engaging to the public. Tour includes 2 glasses of beer at the end. Take your time drinking the free beer and enjoy the experience
Great fun!. Really enjoyed this experience - every element is covered and the end product is excellent!! Tasting and seeing is very good!

Not What I Expected. If you are expecting to see a working factory then you can skip this tour. If you are interested in some history, interactive games and free beer at the end then this is the tour for you. Seems like those of college age will enjoy this - being in my mid 40's, been there, done that. After having already spent the day walking around the city, this just seemed like a lot more walking for me. We booked tickets online and so skipped the long queue outside - I definitely recommend booking ahead.
awesome. I have never had sooo much fun. it's great to get involved with some activities in there. Heineken is now my preferred drink

Brilliant tour!!!. Didn't really know what to expect at the start of the tour but by the end we were loving it. Very interactive with friendly staff. Lots to see and do during the tour with no shortage of pints!!

Worth the time and money. I did not know what to expect when visiting the Heineken Experience in Amsterdam- I like to check out the local beer when traveling and figured this would be a good activity. It was a blast! You walk through the building and get to learn about the beer making process- pretty standard. You then go through a simulation exercise that was a nice surprise. You end up in the Heineken Lounge were you get 2 beers with your tour! A fun afternoon activity that exceeded my expectations.

Definitely pre book your ticket. Pre book your ticket for fast track on the queue outside. Our ticket for €16 got us fast track and 2 glasses of Heineken at the end. The tour was informative but the start was very slow as everyone was shoulder to shoulder moving along. We skipped the 6 minute movie as it was a 15-20 minute. There is an option to learn how to pull your own pint and get a certificate. What made the experience was the option to go to the roof top bar at the end of the tour for our 2 glasses of Heineken. We were lucky with some sunshine and got to admire the view out over Amsterdam.

Great day out. Hubby and I went here not really knowing what to expect and we had a great time, yeah you do only get 3 half pints more if you can answer some questions correctly but I have never visited a brewery before and I thought it was quite interesting. There was a few interactive things you can do after the tour and you can get some novelty pics done free of charge they just emailed them to you which I thought was really good.The gift shop had some goods stuff and we got some glasses engraved. TIP: If you get the Iamamsterdam card you get 25% off the entry price, or go to one of the tourist shops and you pre buy your tickets as you can save a few Euro's.

From Chicago,IL to Amsterdam. Had a great time at the Heineken Tour. It was definitely a place to visit. The staff were great and the people were incredible. I felt as if I were there my whole life. I recommend everyone to go if you are visiting Ansterdam. Thank you Heineken for my great experience.

Great fun!. Really enjoyed this tour! Highly recommended! You get a few free samples and there is plenty to watch and see - they've tried to make things a bit more different and interesting as well - well worth a visit!
Really good!. Loved the Heineken experience. Lots of walking around but all the staff were lovely. Long time queueing in the shop at the end but never mind. Definitely glad we did this!

Much better than you would expect. Visiting the Heineken Experience is a very nice, absolutely pleasant experience. It first gives a short historic summary of the Heineken company. But the nicest part is the showing of the brewery process. We all know about it, but it is great to see this in reality. Simple straight forward but not less interesting. The commercial part, with some jokes and the shop, could be skipped. But it is forgiven. Last but not least, the real tasting of a fresh brewed beer is a worthy ending of a joyful 45 minutes. Do not miss it!
Good Fun!. Definitely recommended if you have extra 2-3 hours. And you would not say you lost any of your money.

We loved the experience. Its a cool place , interesting and very interactive. We had great time exploring and checking the progress that the company's had through the years. The staff is very friendly and fun, I totally recommend to visit this place .

Great Fun. Arrived early and there was no delay in getting in. Interesting explanation about the history of Heineken and the process of brewing. Many fun things to do to remember our visit- pictures, videos, exhibitions.
Beer . Fantastic fantastic x throughly recommend the place to visit worth the price tour around the factory you get to taste the beers

Worth it . I'm not a big Heineken drinker but my husband is and we both had a really good time. It's not too expensive and will take a good amount of time up. We stopped by here before going out to drink and it was a fun experience very well decorated and informed staff. I would recommend it to any beer drinker. The gift shop was good I only wish you could purchase the items online or buy there and have shipped to you. Since we didn't want to be carrying them around all night.

Fun!. Me and my partner went with my brother and his fiancé.I don't really like beer so wasn't really excited about it but when we got there I had a brilliant time. There is so much more to it than just walking round learning about beer (which I'm not a fan of!)There are little staff talks as you go round and all the staff are great; friendly, enthusiastic and knowledgeable.When you get to the end there are fun silly activities to do (we had such a good time!), such as photobooths, uv room, karaoke bikes, football room with various things to do in and even having a go at pouring the perfect pint! The photo booth and karaoke(which videos you sitting on a bike riding round various parts of amsterdam on the screen behind you) you can send both a copy of the picture and video to your email free of charge which is fab! There's also a chance for you to buy a personalised bottle of Heineken with your own text on.The drinks tokens you get entitle you 2 drinks at the bar at the end- I'm not a massive fan but ended up drinking 2 beers (they were actually nicer than usual) however they aren't full pints. You can either pay a token each for just over 250ml of just normal cold heinken or 2 tokens for extra cold Heineken (which are slightly bigger at around 375ml?).Probably would go back if we had the chance, worth every penny! Absolutely loved it!
Wonderful experinces. Me and my husband were there in April 2016. It was so enjoyable experinces for us. If you decide to go amsterdam you should visit here. Don t forget to drink heineken beers ;)
To kill time. Very easy to tour good English spoken every one was approachable, the tastings was enough half way through the tour but you get two extra drinks at the end with your entrance fee

You're paying for three beers and a show. This place can be fun if you go with friends. They offer you a brand show on how the beers are made they offer you a freshly brewed beed and a coupon for two others. They also provide funny games and activities. I won't say it's a must to do in Amsterdam but give a try.

Unplanned fun. After Van Gogh - we decided to get some beer culture. Had not planned this visit, but it turned out to be worth the time. You learn a bit about the science in beer, drink some beer, and see some beer exhibits. A surprise at the end was the offer of a free boat ride on the Amstel River in the Heiniken boat. You are offered beer on the boat for 2.50 euro per bottle, and given tickets for a free glass at a store you are lead to after the boat trip. During the tour you learn to "drink like a winner". If you have the time, it's a fun way to spend a couple hours.
Well worth a visit. The name says it all. Altogether a good experience to let you know what Heineken is about. Just wish they offered a few more beers!!!

A beer walk. This is a great tour of interest to see how your beer is made & how it started and how it has evolved over the years . You see how involved in the champions league they are and see a lot of football memorabilia .worth a trip if you like your football & a wee beer after your tour
Best day out!. So much fun and so much info about Heineken must admit we did leave a little bit tipsey haha we spent alot of pennies in the gift shop! Beware that's how they get you lol

Worth the Visit (even if you're not a beer drinker). Enjoyed the overall 'attraction'. We bought our tickets at a kiosk instead of waiting in the long queue outside. We wizzed past the queue and went straight in, only to be greeted by another loooooong queue for the actual tour. This was a bit annoying, but if you're with friends and chilled, it's fun. The brewing experience room was 'fun' if you like that kind of stuff.Overall, the beer room was 'ok'. nothing to rave about.Is the money worth it? maybe, depending on your attitude and what you want. If you want a chilled time with friends, then it's worth it. Will take friends back there any day.
Too hyped . This place is good but too hyped. Frankly i found it too boring since im not a fan of beer it was ok. They have made and decorated the place really well.

Interesting and fun . A lot of things to learn in the historical parts of the museum. The area about the very recent past and current sponsoring is very fun. Getting to taste some beer can also never be bad.
Great tour. This is one of my favorite brewery tours. It's self paced and the guides at each stop is informative. It's interactive and fun!

Pretty good tourist pastime. This was a bit of fun really. Try to look around for discount entry coupons. The staff explain the beer making process, there's some interactive displays. Towards the end you can taste some beers. It's one of those things: do you need to go? Should you pay to see this? No! Of course not, but it's a bit of fun while you're on holiday

Really enjoyed . I didn't have very high expectations for this, I thought it would be like every other brewery tour I have done, just walking round looking at stuff which doesn't really mean much apart from I like the end product! This was so much more, it takes you through the Heineken story/history which is interesting, there is lots of interactive stuff which I thought was brill. Don't want to say everything because I think it will ruin the experience for everyone but really worth a visit

Very interactive, Enjoyable day. . A great day at the Heineken experience. The entry is €16 when pre-booking online which includes Q-jump. It's better to pre-book online. The museum provides a light history of the company and the brand. There is also a 4D experience of how the beer is brewed a beer tasting session and look at all the equipment used. There is plenty of opportunities of great photos and to get interactive, including pulling your own pint. At the end of the tour there are two free beers and the Heineken shop.

SOOO MUCH FUN!!! Go here, enjoy yourself!. We came to Amsterdam and were not really planning on going here. We were so thankful we wound up doing this. The history and flow of the brewery was fantastic. it was very hands on and enjoyable to walk around to see and do different activities there was a fun little "ride" to go on. The Beer tasting is very fun and informative. if you answer correctly you get an extra beer! when the tour comes to an end you have the choice of getting a beer or two or putting your name on the list and getting a quick instructional on how to properly pour a heineiken. after you pour one you get a certificate. GOOD TIMES!!

Pretty good. . I have been to better brewery tours but it was okay. They have tried to enhance the visit with techno stuff which didn't interest us. Having the sample beer at the end was good, although the music was way too loud to have a conversation. Maybe they don't want you to linger. Worth a visit.

Great experience . The Heineken experience gives you the feeling of being a bottle of beer. There is a lot of information and in the end you get to know how it is to be a Heineken beer! At the end of te tour you can enjoy some free Heineken beers.

Kinda overrated.. Nothing really special, except for the large facilities depicted and the fully informative history of the company. It was rather a big, fancy advertisement of the brand with a lot of fan. In the end, the 2 glasses of beer for free were fine, although the 18e admission fee could perfectly justify them.

The name is correct, it's an 'experience', not a brewery tour!.
