Having been put off by the queues at the weekend, we visited on a Monday afternoon and there were no queues.To their credit, the history side of the experience is good, whilst they do take you through the bewing process quite well, but the girl at the main brewing display couldn't answer any of my pretty simple brewing questions and she asked me if I was a brewer, which I'm not!The last part of the brewing process included a sampling and explanation of the beer, which is a good premium lager!After that it became very gimikey, with sporting sponsorship displays and 'print your own beer lable'You do get a couple of small beers at the end! Another good point is it's still an indepenedent family business and not part of Interbrew!Also if you're not very agile there are a lot of stairs!Perhaps one for a wet day?

More than I expected. We took the tram to this attraction, and it was a short ride and very easy navigation from central station. The first part of the tour was a museum. It appeared that the tour was over, and then the next part started. You are shown the process of brewing beer, and even have the chance to participate in a virtual reality experience going through the brewing process. The Heineken horses are stalled and you can see them as you're passing from one part of the tour to the next. You get beer about midway through the experience (included in your admission). The last part of the tour is games and selfie photo spots. You can spend as much or as little time as you want in this area. Some games you can win discounts for the Heineken store. When you exit the tour, you might be given a voucher for a free boat ride through the canals to the Heineken store. It's a fun little ride through the canal, and you can cash in a voucher for a free beer glass at the store (the boat ride and the glass are included in your admission price). The brand store itself is rather small, but prices are reasonable.
Real Joy. Try it out, lots and lots of fun.Not too heavy, just the right amount.And obviously, one HUGE commercial;-)But that's all right, you can let it slide and enjoy the experience:)

Great Heineken Experience!. It was an excellent idea to visit the Heineken Museum. The staff was great and helpful and they walk you through the entire line of production of the world's top selling beer. In the ticket price you can drink as much heineken as you like! Had a few myself! You can even make a heineken logo with your name imprinted on the bottle!

A bit of fun, but needs to be more aware of access. We really enjoyed the Heineken experience, but I felt they could be better with accommodations for older people. My 70 year old mother struggled up three flights of stairs, as there appeared to be no other option, only to be told at the top that there are lifts. There were no signs and no one to ask. We met others who were in the same situation. I'm sure most of the customers are young people, but you should still be aware that you have a responsibility to other customers.Beyond that, it was great fun and good value.

Brewery secrets. Today we did the Heinekin Brewery Experience. It's very good, aimed more at the younger generation though. Severe lack of seats, lots of stairs. Not good for the knees, although no time limit for sitting at the end of tour, when you get 2 free beers. Recommend persevering though. I did, and enjoyed it.

Lots of fun. Won't waste your time by standing in front of the photos at the entrance there is a great atmosphere and games after that. The short movie was fantastic try to stan at the middle of the room while watching it. We enjoyed much. And also great beer.

A must go to !!. This is a must go to ! Staff really friendly, great pictures to take, so many places to chill out and drink their beer, great gift shop, if its busy might feel like your rushed a bit but had a great time !
If you wanna drink bear then join the experince. You can learn about how its done and how you gonna drink if you gonna free time then you should definetly go and enjoy the experince
Great day out. Very interactive. Too many stairs but the beer at the 2 intervals makes it worth the while. Even if you are not into beer. A good day out
I teractive. A really fun way to spend a few hours. Lots of interactive stuff and facts about Heineken's involvement with rugby and soccer.
Funny!. The first part of the show, the historical one, could be better. But the second part is more interactive and very funny! And the beers are also good!

Started out standard but ended with a bang!. I have been on many brewery tours, but this one was by far my favorite. The tour starts as most brewery tours do with a discussion of the history of the brewery, tour of the machines, etc. However, after the formalities are out of the way it turns into CLUB HEINEKAN! There was room after room of selfie stations, a karaoke area, photo booths (they email you the pictures for free), games, and 3 rooms with enough strobe lights and monitors to rival any nightclub. There was a DJ, a bar...truly awesome. All of the employees seemed to really be having a good time. Best of all, we got three beers out of the deal. Given we only paid 15euro for the ticket, I would say the beers alone certainly made it worth it. The fact that it was awesome was icing on the cake. There was one person in our tour group that had kids. Fortunately, they were not too bothersome but I will admit, I am just of the school of thought that children do not belong in breweries, wineries, etc. i would definitely consider this a nice afternoon activity while you are in Amsterdam (if you are not with children of course). Grab a coupon from one of those coupon books in the museum area of the the city to save a couple euro on your entry fee!!

Very good. Quick visit before attending work event on premises. On arrival we were ushered in to have a quick look around. Initially I wasn't enthused but it grew on me and, by the end, I wished I had paid more attention at the beginning. Very central.

Good experience and interesting. This is very good value for money! The small simulator is fun as well as the surprise of being able to see horses. There's lots to see and learn and then you have 2 free drinks included as well as more in the tasting section. I advise you take guesses at the questions the tasters ask as they give you free beer as prizes! Only downside was nowhere to sit down with the free drinks as so busy

One giant queue - waste of time . This is a touristy marketing gimmick. We thought we were smart by pre booking to avoid the ticket queue, however with had another four separate queues again during the 'experience'. Firstly at the very entrance as we stood on a staircase for 10 mins with nothing to see or read. And again at several times along the way.There is little instruction or direction and less information on the history of the place. The best bit is the 4D film however considering the price and queues it isn't worth it

Very Interesting,Informative & loads of Fun. The Brewery Experience tour was fantastic. It was more fun then I would’ve imagined. I have been on brewery tours before, but this was a tour of one of the most famous beers in the world ‘The Heineken Experience’ in the heart of Amsterdam city. I was with my wife and she saw the glee in my eyes, like a child on a bouncy castle.The tasting part was obviously a lot of fun for me and bought a bottle of Heineken beer with my name on it. At the end of the tour we got free beers in their bar (included in the experience package).Bought a fair amount of souvenirs at the end before leaving.'The Heinekin Experience' was the highlight of my Amsterdam trip and it is a ‘Must Do ‘for beer lovers.

One to tick off the list. It's a bit of a strange experience but I think still worthy the visit, you get two 25cl beers with your ticket plus a third for tasting, so for 18 euros it's not too bad considering this. There are some pretty random things to do along the way: karaoke on a bike, a strange beer ride where you become the beer and some other interactive thins around football and rugby. The bar at the end gives you the opportunity to try pouring your own beer and spend some time chilling out.

Fun experience. This is a great experience where Heineken have been very creative in bringing the brand alive. Gives you some good background, get to see how it's made and found the simulator a fun way to educate you on this. Lots of activities - photo booths, games and challenges and of course, you get a tasting beer as well as two more drinks! A great way to send the afternoon! One tip is to buy pre-booked tickets from outlets near by. Ensures you don't have to experience the long queue to get in. We had to wait over 40 mins. They create the queue by only having one person on the counter serving customers! They must do this on purpose. Worth the extra Euros to buy a pre poked one!
Great interactive museum . Great fun, very interactive. The beer was lovely. The entire experience my group would do again. Good value for money

Not a Brewery. Visited Amsterdam with our 18 yo daughter so we were focussed on activities that she would enjoy. We booked tickets to "The Experience" and it is just that. Mostly "an experience" for those who might be drunk or want to be drunk. It is mostly silly and not very informative about how beer is made. The focus of the experience is getting to the tasting room and the bar. The beer is good - probably the best Heineken I've ever had. We were in a fun mood to experience the tour, but it note it is very kitschy and touristy. I think if you travel with teens who want to drink beer, this is a great activity, but as an adult, you can probably skip it.

Really fun, insightful and you get a few beers too but queued for 40mins!. This really sets the benchmark for a big brand to inform and entertain their customers around their history and brand.They have some really good interactive things to understand the history of Heineken as well as a 4d experience which was actually quite fun.Only downside was having to wait for 30+mins to get in to find only one person on the counter!Would highly recommend!

Best Heineken I've ever tasted!. Firstly, but your tickets in advance from any of the retailers spread all over the city. We did and saved ourselves a long queue outside we literally walked straight in.Really enjoyed the tour and the interactive bit- that was a surprise and to round it all off you get to drink the final product.I also enjoyed customising a bottle which made a great gift.Not one for the kids I imagine they'd find it boring but one couple thought it would be a good idea to drag their poor child along (minus the taste test of course!)You can't really go to Amsterdam and not do the Heineken experience - partaking in the many bars doesn't count

Awesome, free beer what more could you ask for??. Myself and my partner went here for a little day trip whilst in Dam for a few days. We didn't really have much expectation of what a 'brewery museum' was about but we were pleasantly surprised. What we liked was you could take your time to go around, it wasn't a guided tour etc. The part where you pretend to be a bottle on a conveyor belt was a little tongue in cheek, but just go with it as free beer awaits afterwards. It ends with more drinks in the bar and lots of interactive games and things to do. I think you can prebook tickets online, but it was around 17 EURs each I think when purchased at the ticket office. We didn't have any hassle or queues at the ticket office but when we came out there was a long queue around the block. We would definitely go again!

Ask if the rooftop bar is open. I've been on brewery tours before which were pretty darn dull. But Heineken have really made the effort to make it as interesting, interactive and engaging as possible, and it has worked. The whole experience has been really well designed and thought out. As well as your two free drinks, you also get a third mini drink when you are taught how to taste and appreciate the beer. If the nightclub-esque, noisy, disco-lit bar at the end is too much for you, ask them if the rooftop bar is open.You can still redeem your free drinks tokens up there, but it is altogether calmer, much less busy and you can step outside onto a rooftop terrace and sit admiring the views.

A Lot Of Fun. I visited the Heineken experience a few days ago with some of my good friends. I had heard it was quite informative from other friends that had visited. I was very pleased to find it very interactive and a lot of fun! Its a bit expensive to get in but the price is worth it, we ended up spending 3hrs there and could have stayed longer! Definitely not a place to be missed in Amsterdam

Beer lovers. This is a must if you in Amsterdam, for people who enjoy beer and the history of it,but even if you don't drink beer, you won't be disappointed, very affordable, staff super friendly, so many things to see and do!! It has a souvenir shop, a bar, what else can you ask for!! Not to mention you get 2 free beers!!
Interesting and beer. A great afternoon. Fun experience learning about how heinekin is made, plenty of tasting and a 4D experience. Lots of fun with friends :)
LOVED IT!. An experience you cannot miss in Amsterdam. Lovely staff, educational, fun and enjoyable! Had such a lovely day there!

An Amsterdam must. . Very informative and so much to do in the brewery. Tastings were not only enjoyable but very interesting. If you like I good souvenir photo this is the place, so many interactive stations that make it a funny experience. Taking the tour from the lagers' point of view was the most fun part of the tour. Definitely worth a visit.

Better than I thought . It was by boyfriend that wanted to visit so I compromised and I'm actually really glad that I did. It was a beautiful building and actually rather interesting. Lots to look at and things to do. Drinks (3 each) are also included with the visit although I'm not a beer drinker so I unfortunately lost out. I also brought back a personalised bottle of Heineken which had been made there for my dad. My parter was also given a chance to try and poor the perfect beer.

Nice way to pass some time. The tour was quite good, allowed you to see the beer making process and an insight into the history of Heineken beer. You get some free beer whilst on the tour and have the option to take a canal boat to the gift shop which is a nice way of getting to see a little more of Amsterdam. Worth the visit especially on wet day

Excellent afternoon activity. After visiting most of the main attractions we decided to go to the Heineken experience. I have to admit it was a brilliant afternoon, I am not a beer drinker myself so I wasn't sure I'd enjoy it. The tickets can be purchased beforehand so you don't have to wait in a que. It was very interesting to learn about how the beer is made and the history behind it. There is also lots of fun activities to do as you get further around. We really enjoyed our time here and would defiantly recommend a visit.

Interesting and enjoyable!. Even if you're not a Heineken fan, it's definitely worth a visit of an afternoon! Really interesting and has some brilliant photo opportunities inside, the talks were informative as well as funny.
Stag do excursion . Went there as a group of 9 and we all really enjoyed, would highly recommend this, also got a free boat trip back to the city centre which was a nice touch
Varied and fun visit. There was such a variety or activities to take part in during this visit. Pouring your own drinks and the marketing areas were really good.
Loved our Heineken Experience . Wow, the Dutch really know how to put on a display. The Heineken Experience is excellent from start to finish. We even won an extra beer which was fun.

Disappointing. Not sure we knew what to expect. It's clearly a popular attraction and it has good access and entrance to attraction was well organised given the large number of visitors. The first part of the experience is about the founders of Heineken followed by a visit to the brewing room. Without giving everything away you eventually end up in a series ofrooms that really just promote the brand. I expect these are OK on a quiet day but impossible when busy and we found this section uncomfortable and hot. You get 3 small glasses of beer during the visit. Good for a rainy day

Perfect place to visit. We had a great couple of hours at the Heineken experience. We had bought tickets online in advance so skipped the queue (although) this wasn't large anyway. The brewery is basically a self guided tour through the history of Heineken and the brewing process. All really well done and interesting for those who love beer and those aren't as interested! There's a guided tasting session which was great.There's also areas looking at the branding and sports sponsorship Heineken have been involved so plenty to look at. You get 2 free beers as well! Highly recommend it

rainy day. gud attraction for a rainy day.. thought it was just going to be another boring museam but was actually good craic. staff were lovely and it was very interactive. and ya get 2 small beers or 1 pint at the end. there is a rooftop bar but you cant take ur drink up with you but theres a bar up there. was dying for a smoke so had to neck my drink. we also got a free canal ride that takes you to a megastore. wasnt a long trip but ticked off a box. was really reasonably priced. i think i would go back again if the weather was bad.

Must do . I had quite a reserved view on what this would be like and wasn't particularly looking forward to it. How wrong I was!!! This museum has spared no expense what so ever. The whole history of the Heineken name was amazingly interesting! Very interactive with the visitors, tasting experiences, interactive stations and a chance to but your very own personalised bottle of Heineken. Staff were very knowledgeable and could not fault the enthusiasm of them. Very well priced at €18 per person,having now visited if be prepared to pay double. And within this price gets you 3 drinks of Heineken... Win win!! I would highly recommend this museum to anyone visits Amsterdam absolute gem!!!

Beer Lover or Not.. You just can't miss this one!. Heineken Experience is a must visit.. whether you are a Beer lover or not.. Even if you don't drink.. you still have to visit this place. They will serve you the fresh beer right from the Brewery to your glass! They have made this experience such an enjoyable that I really don't have enough words to express what all they have done! The staff is dam friendly & will ensure that you enjoy every moment of it. They have lot of activities inside & a very informative brewery tour with a guide. They have displayed the history of the Beer & have small presentation as well. They also have different games, activities, souvenir shops & what not! The Entry Ticket costing 16 Euros include the guide tour of brewery, all the games & activities and almost 3 glasses of Beer!Guys do not miss it! You will cherish it for the lifetime!
Average. Worth a visit but not up there with some brewery tours I've done in the past! More of a Disney brewin tour but still worth it if you have a spare morning. Free beer is a very small glass!!

Interesting & Enjoyable. Great tour, great value, you can spend as long or little time you wish. Think my husband & I spent a couple of hours in there. If you have children with you, you will find some entertainment for children near the end. Included in the tour is a free sample part the way around and at the end, two free Heineken's or soft drinks.Look out for the Heineken floor, just before the bar room.Hope this helps.y

Loved it. . Visited here during our weekend away. The tour is very informative and lots of fun. The added bonus was the free shuttle boat back up to Rembrandt square. It's a must visit for everyone's trip

Must visit. Amazing tour, tell u everything about the history of the brewery. It was a lot a fun. one advice buy ticket way before so that u can avoid wasting time queuing. For me i bought my ticket at Cobra cafe next to museumplein its also a lovely place with lovely stuff
Average brewery. Very modest run through of the history and making of this brew. Not a must visit, even for the small beer at the end.

Unexpectedly good museum. I wasn't expecting to enjoy this trip. I though that basically €18 for 2 free beers was a bit steep but it was actually a really fun day out.Lots of interactive exhibits and staff were very knowledgeable and friendly.

Must do. Amazing! . We bought our tickets while we were on our break in Amsterdam. It was really worth it. There's tours and tickets stands on every street in Amsterdam centre so you'll be fine getting tickets. They're open day tickets so you have it for one day but any time. When you arrive you have you bag checked and are allowed to drop off if you don't want to carry them round. I would suggest doing this as its a walk around tour.The tour itself is brilliant. Me and my partner really enjoyed it. You're given a small quarter point to drink which they show you the correct way to drink. Then you continue the tour and depending on who you've booked with as I'm not sure what online deals are like but with us we got two free drinks. So we had our drinks at the end which were 3/4 glasses. Then we headed to the gift shop where for €6 you can make your own Heineken bottle with a message on. Me and my partner did this and it was lovely. You can also buy glasses and have messages engraved on them for around €8 all in. All in all this was a great tour and we would defiantly recommend :)

Fun with a hint of education. We have spent more than an hour on this tour and it was worth it.We were introduced to the process brewing bear and the history of Heineken brewery. At the end of the tour there is a guy who, if you want teaches you to pour beer. After we got out there was also a boat ride throug the canals all the way to the fan shop where we were given one beer glass as a gift.
Great fun . Excellent way to spend a couple of hours! Best part is the interactive trip through the brewery. Loved the bar at the top -great views. Queue moves remarkably quickly.

A nice tour if you don't get tired easy. A nice tour of the brewery, and a bit of history. Two beers is included in the tour plus a glass of Heineken to taste. Defininately worth the 18 euro it cost. Although there was a small misunderstanding with one of the staff working there, he later apologized and compensated me and my grandfather with a free glass of beer, which I thought was nice of him. Funny, professional and committed staff. Thank you again for that!However, there was one problem, which actually became quite a big problem for us since I was there with my 84 year old grandfather, and there was a lot of stairs to walk up and down in, which obviously isn't anything they can do anything about, but there's a complete lack of chairs and sofas to sit on through the whole tour, which probably went on for about an hour. The last room, which is the Heineken bar, probably held about 100 people at least, but still there was only THREE tables where 4 people could sit (which means a total of 12 places to sit). Luckily we found a nice couple who offered a seat for my grandfather, but if we wouldn't have found a place to sit we would have left right away just to find somewhere for my grandfather to sit down, and therefore miss out on the free beers that was included in the price. There was nothing wrong with the tour, the museum or the staff. It was a good mix of history of the brewery together with good information about how the Heineken beer is made. However, I would not recommend the tour if you're going with someone that's a bit older or easily get problems with their feet or legs. Even I felt a bit tired after all the steps up and down the brewery and the constant standing at all the stations, so I can only imagine what my grandfather felt. As an example, you should offer seats for people in the room where they get to taste the beer, and also in the pub at the end of the tour. This should be done not only to make it more handicap friendly, but also because in my opinion the only way to enjoy a good beer is sitting down! Maybe you should consider informing people about this before they pay for the tour (maybe you did this somewhere, but neither me or my grandfather saw any kind of warning), because if there wouldn't have been anywhere to sit at the end we would have left just because of that reason, and then it wouldn't be worth the 18 euro fee. All in all a nice experience, and I guess the most common visitor is a person my age where all of this wouldn't have been a problem at all, but don't forget the older beer enthusiasts who'd like to Experience Heineken too!

Must go attraction!!. we really enjoyed our time in Heineken Experience!I don't drink any alcoholic drink but I love seeing the brewing process,equipment and love the interactive booths esp cycling to Dutch music and scenery.Create personalized Heineken Bottles for 6.50Eu

Part capital brewery Tour-Part Amusement Experience. This was a very enjoyable experience. Although the brewery is no longer active, the brewery process is well explain and the old machinery is still present. What is exceptional is the audio visual displays, interactive activities, and rides you experience. There is also ample opportunity to drink their free beer. I didn't particularly care for Heineken beer before or after the tour, but I recommend going nevertheless. It is worth the money.

Very fun!. We spent about two hours going through the tour. It is self-guided, bu there are areas where staff guide you through (show you ingredients, tutored tasting, 4D "ride"). Included in the entrance price is two half pints of beer (not full pints as I have seen in reviews before), and a smaller beer for the tasting. You could spend longer here if you engaged in all of the interactive stations. Would recommend, although a bit pricey.

Fun way to spend a few hours.. When you first walk into the place it seems like it's just a boring museum on the history of Heineken and me and my friend were both worried it would just be a case of looking at pictures and reading writing on the walls, but we were SO wrong. This place was a lot of fun!!Not only are you given a couple of free pints, there are also loads of interactive things to play on and things to do. The football room with everyone playing games, the 4D brewing experience, the taste testing, the lounge area... It was all such a good time! (Especially the room with the karaoke bikes and the photo booth).I'd definitely recommend going if the weather is a bit rubbish or if you have a spare afternoon.

Just an excuse. Really enjoyed this. It was informative Interesting and it involved free lager. You can go round on your own. Probably need to allow two hours to enjoy at a relaxed pace. The shop is packed with logo goodies. The lager tasting session was fun. We were handed a leaflet at the end entitling us to a free gift from the Heineken shop in Amsterdam it's worth going we all received a free glass.
Don't waste your time unless you want to pay to watch Heineken ads. Don't waste your time unless you want to pay to watch Heineken ads. You don't learn much about the company or how to brew beer

Best brewery tour I have seen. More than just a brewery tour, it is an entertaining, interactive and educational event. Spent a couple of hours trying all the activities, watching the quirky videos and tasting the beers. Good value even if you didn't get the 3 beers! Can't recommend highly enough

Love this place . Tip- Book online so that you can beat the queue, just go straight past everyone and into the building and you'll be able to scan your ticket and walk straight in. I've been here twice and Yes it is slightly expensive but so is everything in Amsterdam I think! The tour gets a little boring as is mainly self guided and there is a lot of reading (booked for my boyfriend and he simply walked past everything and asked where the beer was haha) I, actually read some of the stuff and thought it was good!The real novelty is the beer tasting :)My only real gripe was that second time round, The bar at he end of the tour had gotten so much less personal. Just like cattle being moved to the bar and yelled at to hurry along- disappointing because the first time I visited it was so much more relaxed!

Something for the whole family. I expected this to be another mediocre trek through a brewery but no!! This was exciting and extremely engaging for the whole family. There's interactive activities and lights, sounds everywhere. A chance to taste fresh heineken wort before brewing. A quiz and tasting if you answers questions correct. A ride that puts you inside a virtual vat of beer! (Kids on our tour from 6-10 loved this) Lots of history if you choose to read it. Then at the end of the tour use your tokens to try some fresh ice cool beers!

Fab time. Would recommend this to anyone. Lots to see and do. Very interactive. Loved the beer that was included. Guides fab. Loved the cruise to the centre fee of charge and the free gifts at the centre shop.

Fantastic!!!. This is a really fun, interactive experience involving all things Heineken!Learn out the history of the Company from the foundations to the changing shape and design of the bottles.Experience what a Heineken bottle goes through (really).Play on the interactives and send emails of your experiences to your friends.And have a couple of beers at the end.Perfect.
Must see. Didn't expect much going into the brewery but was blown away at the attention to detail and effort put into it. Very fun experience.

Great. Really enjoyed this tour, lots of information, its interactive and you get two free beers. I wouldn't recommend taking children on this tour. I'm not sure how interested they would be in the making of beer.
Worth a visit. Enjoyed experience, interesting and many mini experiences to take part in, staff polite and informative, green beer a bonus!

If you like beer. If you like beer you will appreciate it, it is neat to see the history behind the family. They do try to make it fun but it's a lot of walking and stairs. The gift shop is cute to get monogrammed pilsner glasses.

Fantastic and very interactive . This was my 2nd visit. The 1st time I did the VIP experience which was awesome and this time I took my father and we just did the general tour. Both were fantastic experiences. Highly recommend this for anyone beer lovers or not. A great time and very entertaining and informative.

Good fun & interesting! . We pre booked and walked in without any queues close to the end of the day so Wr had the place pretty much to ourselves so it was really nice to walk around. The ride in the middle was great as well as the rugby section with hands on exhibits.

Fun tour. The history of the beer is very interesting and the history of the company and the family is the main focus of the tour. The family did an amazing job bringing Heineken into the world and making a success of it.You get a free half pint during a tasting session which is good/fun.There are a lot of interactive things after the "tour" part related to their advertising/marketing/sponsorship campaigns which are good.We bought tickets online which I think saved a good chunk of time.Allow 2 hours.About 20 min walk from the centre, also on a number of tram routes.

Nice place to visit . Nice, maybe the best place we visited on our trip to Amsterdam. The only think I'd say they could pay a bit more attention too would be, try to get a bit more organised when it comes to go to the 3D movie. We were moved from one side to the other of the room and were squished between people because it was too many people inside. Rather than that very nice, enjoyable and good fun.

We had a beeerilliant time . We had to queue as we hadn't booked online. After 30min we were on our way.
This experience was the highlight of my weekend stay in Amsterdam. The exhibits are well presented and the delivery of information is really unusual and quirky.
I loved that it was very interactive and of course, the Heineken itself! Delicious!

A nice day out!. My partner and I came here. We ordered our tickets online as its cheaper than buying on the day. With our tickets we got 2 free drinks whilst at the attraction. Engaging experience with lots to see and do. Would recommend going here!

Meh. Everyone had raved so much about the Heineken Experience, but I found it extremely average. Perhaps due to the crowds, I felt very rushed and didn't feel like I really got to learn much being shoved from room to room. The demo about how to properly drink a beer was interesting, but the bar at the end was just so ridiculously crowded, we downed our drinks and left. Perhaps more attention to capacity would make the experience more enjoyable.

A great tour. We booked the tickets online and it saved waiting. Would advise anyone to do this. The tour was well worth it to see and learn about the histrory or Heineken and learn about the secret yeast. Hands on and great movie scenes. The All Blacke were also mentioned.

Meh.... Long lines, some interesting history, but probably not worth the $$. The "4D Experience" movie was cool, and the rugby, soccer, other marketing area was neat, but overall it was not that great. The building itself is really neat, but they don't actually make beer there anymore. If you want to get better beer and see an actual brewery, head a mile down the road to Brouwerij 't I J...it's got great beer brewed on site, tasty snacks, and it's in a windmill.

Excellent . Loved this tour, very reasonable and you also get a complimentary canal trip. Staff were lovely and our tour guide was very friendly. Would recommend this place to anyone that is travelling to Amsterdam

Big queues. We visited on Easter Sunday with a group of friends. Although the I appreciate this was a busy day, the staff simply should have turned some people away, as they just let too many in and it was not an enjoyable experience. Certainly not worth 18 euros- a complete rip off. All we did was queue literally all the way round - before we went in, and throughout the "tour" was one big long queue. I would also say that if anyone elderly was visiting then it would have been very uncomfortable for them as there was not a single chair or any places to sit down. Would not recommend. Not even the beer at the end made it worth it.
Wonderful afternoon activity!. Really wonderful interactive experience that exceeded all low expectations. So many different things to try!

Something not common . Very value time. You can check how beer is done, taste it and creat own bottle. No really sure how's going VIP as didn't get special gift nor tasting five premium beers. Just regular Heineken. But for sure worth to go and see and taste

Not the typical brewery tour. The Heineken experience is very interactive. There are lots of games and stuff to do in addition to learning about the brewing process. We were especially happy to find out that there was a little cruise included with our pads that took us to the Heineken store (which is actually in a pretty convenient spot).
Must do. Great experience,so much to see and do. Background to the beer making process is fascinating, highly recommend.

Very interactive. Really well put together... Loads of interactive bits for you to get involved with and very interesting. The bar at the end could do with a few more seats, but that's the only negative.

Fun experience. Really enjoyed visiting this attraction. Definitely not what I expected as there was a lot to learn and do activities inside. Interactive, educational and just pure fun. You also get tokens that you can use for free beer after the tour.

Loved it!. Myself and my friends visited last Sunday evening when it was a bit quieter and we had a great time, the displays are so interactive and fun. The staff were brilliant, in particular Uma and Stijn, they were really helpful and friendly and made our visit even more enjoyable. Thanks for a great end to our time in Amsterdam, we'd definitely recommend The Heineken Experience.

A must tour. We loved the Heineken experience and learnt so much and was so interesting to learn how the drink is made. The staff are so friendly and knowledgeable all the activities are great to take part in ... The free sampling is a bonus ... This tour is really must do... We spent hours looking round. And will most definitely do this again. The bonus for us was the free canal boat ride we could catch back ....

Yawn!. A very boring self guided tour. A long promotional tour of an old building. The 4D experience is pointless and the 'free' beer at the end is at the most average! Very patronizing talk on how to drink a Heineken hasn't really changed my drinking habits!!! You would be better of finding a local bar!

Kids Enjoyed. My kids enjoyed the tour than I did, they were impressed with the video presentations from the beginning till the end. They enjoyed the games like the reality soccer kicks people were cheering them every time they make a goal, and photo booths, drank their Heineken cola's with gusto like beer drinkersOh my boys were only 6 and 8 years old.

Cool for beer lovers. It's great for beer lovers I guess, its possible to taste the beer when it's not ready yet and you'll get a glimpse of how its brewed. For the price I don't think it's worth as it's not actually the Heineken factory. They do give you some complimentary beers at the end, and the bar has a great view!

FUN!. My boyfriend wanted to do the Heineken experience and I was hesitant, finally I gave in and I am glad I did!What a fun, value for money experience! We spent 2 hours walking through all the different rooms, enjoying samples and of course the two freebies at the end. You go through at your own pace and there is a huge variety of things to see. Some informative, lots fun and silly. We loved the tasting and short lesson with a very friendly Dutch worker, and the experience where you are brewed was really cute. A great way to get out of the cold for a few hours and have some fun! A good price for the experience and heaps of interesting stuff in the gift shop. Be sure to grab a personalised bottle as a keep sake :)

Nothing different from other beer tours. I wish I could rate this higher, it seemed to me like a bit of a money grab. If I had never done a brewery tour I'd probably give it a 3. This is a staged demonstration, not an actual brewery site where bottling occurs. It includes a silly movie you are required to view and the horses are not accessible, neither do they offer performances of any kind. The price is high even though you get two beers that you must line up for each time. If there were an onsite restaurant or food pairing options the experience would be improved. If it was located on a real brewery site it would be more authentic. I purchased my ticket in advance which is wise as the line up is long. Even then, they herd you through the tour and you often are left waiting. I'd recommend skipping it in favour of a smaller, micro-brew shop that offers the real deal.

Really enjoyed this . I don't drink Heineken and still really enjoyed this. Book in advance as the queues are very long. We thought the prices were going to be ridiculous in the gift shop and to our surprise the prices were very reasonable. Lots of interactive games along the tour.
Nice. It is a great place, it's not Guinness and nor it should be, a lot of fun with friends and at the end you get two fresh Heinekens, what could you want more?

Fun way to spend a few hours. To start this review I want to say that I am not a beer drinker in the slightest! However I did enjoy this as it is an interactive tour.Amusements within the tour include a ride, photobooths, karaoke, goal shoot-outs, areas to sit and obviously beer tasting.You get a free beer each to taste toward the beginning of the tour, then at the end you get a further two beers each...I don't drink beer so to my boyfriend's joy he ended up with 6 free beers that afternoon!A good way to spend a couple of hours in Amsterdam.

A fun morning at the Heineken Experience. A fun morning out with lots of interactive fun. Staff are very knowledgable and helpful you will need a good 3 hr slot which was handy for us on a wet morning in Amsterdam. Great price you pay with the beer in as well and bonus for us was the free canal ride to the shop received a free glass which was all in on the experience. Well worth a visit if you like beer

Worth the money. Knew what to expect because ive been to the Guiness factory in Dublin, but this was even better. Its definately aimed at all ages and not just directed at over 18's. Very interactive and fun. Probably wouldnt do it again, now that ive done it once. But well worth the money. AND, DONT forget the free river boat trip ❤️

Not my cup of tea (beer). There was not a long line to get in so we took that as a good sign. However, once inside there were wall to wall people. You know the saying we were herded like cattle....... There were lines for everything. We waited in line 55 minutes to go on the "ride". We saw several people get out of line and just leave. A 20 minute line to get your beer, no place to sit or stand. For two 60 somethings not an enjoyable experience.
Heineken Experience. Fun way to spend a few hours !! Plenty to do and see along the way, I've been to the Guinness factory in Dublin and it's just as good
Good fun. Lots of interactive stuff to keep the teenagers happy. Free boat trip at the end was a bonus + a free gift. Tip the tickets were cheaper at the brand store.

A great diversion if you have kids. Museums for kids can become boring and their response to these museums can take away from a great vacation. Therefore, we always try to find something that the kids would be interested to do. From seeing Galileo's middle finger, in his museum in Florence to the Anne Frank House ("of course it is not museum"), I will try any trick.However, the Heineken experience they truly enjoyed. The museum is one long Heineken commercial that you walk through. However, there are interactive games, disc-jockey mixes (guitar hero style) and a ride where you are the grains made into beer. And then, mom and dad get some free beer at the end...everyone is happy!

Excellent, excellent.. Not what I expected but all in all brilliant. A historical tour through the life of Heineken in one of their old breweries, with some interesting insight into how they develop and make the brew. Then followed by lots of good interactive and fun activities before you hit the beer tasting itself. Well worth the price. And the shop is reasonably priced.In all a two hour experience that is well worth the money.

THE GREATEST THING. I know people visiting Amsterdam are all over Coffee Shops and Red Light District, but Heineken Experience is also only found in Amsterdam and it's extra funny and worth the visit. If you are an English speaker you need no audio guides or something like that, because all the visit is in English! Staff is helpful and great. Highly recommended.

Fun day out. Me and my partner spend a good couple of hours here. Fun to learn about the history and brand Heineken. Lots of interesting and interactive games to play here relating to the brand. Tickets were about €16 which includes entry, 2 Heinekens at the bar at the end and a free taster of Heineken midway. There isn't much seats in the bar at the end so best to take a seat if you feel tired from the walking mid-way through the experience. A trip definitely worth taking whilst in Amsterdam.

Amazing. This is a must for any beer lover. Although I'm sure everyone would really enjoy this. I went with my girlfriend who isn't a beer drinker and we both loved it. You learn some really cool stuff and we loved the interactive side of the experience. You get 2 free beers with your ticket.

Funny and interesting, really good experience . We were a bit reluctant to go to the Heineken Experience because we have two young children and we didn't know if it was one of that boring events were you just have to taste the beer, see the company history and so on.. It's amazing. We really had fun, all of us. We just wanted to do it again! It's interesting and entertaining and really really funny. Thank you Heineken!

Great way to spend the afternoon. My husband and I visited Amsterdam recently and spent an afternoon here. We had a great time. At first I was surprised that the tour of the actual brewery was pretty quick. The entertainment portion was what really made the experience. There was something for everyone: sports, beer pouring, pictures, beer drinking, etc. Worth a visit.

Brilliant. This is a must, brilliant exiting tour with great staff and atmosphere. The tour is about an hour with many half pints included ;) plus you get to make your own beer and a canal ride to pick up the free glass. Do it, the highlight of our trip!
Fun place to visit. A fun experience, like the guiness storehouse in Dublin. Like a disney park for adults and beer... Recommend!

An absolute shocker.. This was an experience to forget. The least personal, most corporate, shallow "tour" of a brewery that we have ever been on. The whole experience was patronising and very "hands-off". Not recommended; would suggest you go to a local bar and enjoy a couple of nicer drinks at half the cost. Give it a miss!I had to give it 1 star, because I can't give it zero!
Heineken Experience. I recomend to do this tour to finish the day, because the best part of it is the end of the tour were you get to drink some beers!

Must Do while in Amsterdam!. This was a great way to spend an afternoon. It’s a self-guided tour, so you can take your time or run through it. We ended up timing it perfectly and got to see the horses come in from a carriage drive. You also get quite a few samples, and the staff were all very nice. I would definitely recommend this!
Great Afternoon's Entertainment. What a great couple of hours. Well worth a visit. Cleverly laid out, great expedition and a couple of drinks at the end too. Such fun.

loved it. we went to Amsterdam for my partners 21st in October. as it was his birthday and he likes beer I took him to the Heineken experience.. im not a massive beer fan but I found it really interesting and really good for price. Defo worth a vist

Good experience. It was a very good tour. Nice to know a lot of things about Heineken beer.Very good in-depth knowledge behind making and manufacturing the beer. Good entertainment with rooms for karaoke, club music, a photo booth, rugby. The best was the "ride" where you stand on a platform that moves and they brew you. We virtually experienced making beer. You will get 3 glasses of beer.first one is a taste with 15 cl beer and you can get either 2 25cl at the end or 1 35cl at the end.

Not what you would expect. I don't know what I was expecting but this was an experience that went above and beyond. So much to do and get involved it. Had a great laugh and got to taste the end product which is always good. Great if you are into sports as well. I loved it!

Average. 1. I was really disappointed by the beer, was hoping to sample "experimental" types that Heineken play with. Instead they served only the dull old Heineken beer you can get anywhere...2. The experience is just OK but no more. The demonstrations for how beer is made are very basic. I was expecting to learn how DIFFERENT beers were made across history, maybe some interesting facts and trivia. It's mostly just Heineken advertising everywhere.

Fun visit! . We previously bought tickets so didn't have to queue when we arrived, had a fun couple of ours exploring the place and got a couple of free beers at the end too! There are a few fun things to get involved in, including karoeoke on a bike (in dutch!) - a couple of the girls even poured their own pints! Definitely worth it even if you don't drink beer, would definitely recommend as something to do whilst visiting Dam!

Don't bother. This wasn't our first time in Amsterdam and I had always wanted to take the tour and I was looking forward to it. It was busy and we had to wait about 45 minutes in line to get in.I realize it's busy during the Easter week, but the tour just wasn't worth our time or money. While it is interesting to learn about the history of the family and brewery, the interactive experience they are promoting was my least favorite thing I did in Amsterdam. The "making you into a beer" experience was a waste of time. There are only 3 rooms to experience it and all that did was to hold up the progress of moving through the tour and provided yet another "waiting in line" experience. AS everyone knows, the end of the tour is the best part, the beer tasting. We chose the rooftop for our tasting. You walk into this big room and there is a huge bar in the middle. Easter week is probably on of the busiest times there and you would think that after waiting in line after line to get through the "Experience", they might be able to set up more than one tap to serve the beer. I enjoyed my two small beers although the complete "Experience" left me extremely thirsty and exhausted.I am disappointed and sorry I spent this money and wasted my time.
Well worth it. Great afternoon out of the cold! Really interesting, interactive and fun! Not too quick and not too drawn out .... Highly recommended

Not the best, but if you insist go and see. It is not a must-do thing in Amsterdam. When we went, there was a long line. There is an option to buy the ticket online. If you really want to see it buy your ticket online. You don't have to wait the line. I can assure you that the experience is not good. It is all about how Heineken is the perfect beer. The best part is the film, it is like 5D, but you have to wait here for a line. At the end you can have two beers, but the place where they give is very noisy and not comfortable.
Nice. If you like beer and knowing how its made - go there. Stay a few hours, play in the interactive rooms and enjoy the beer.

I don't drink beer. I don't drink beer, but I also enjoyed the whole experience. Every hour from our 4 hour visit!We have bought some combination tickets at some central ticket office. And so having the tickets, we didn't need to stand in any row! So definitely buy the tickets in advance! They are around EUR16. You get two chips you can exchange for beer at the end of the experience.Try out the sky bar!

Great place to visit for a few hours. Enjoyed a late afternoon visit. No queue to enter. Information provided about the brewing process in short informative bursts. Plenty of opportunity to taste the beer and earn more if you've paid attention and can answer the bar tenders fun questions. Interactive games with photos and videos you can email home. Well worth the €18 per person. Good souvenir shop at the end of the tour.

Interesting and fun. No queue mid-afternoon; spent an interesting time wandering around the old brewery, learning about the brewing process etc before tasting a sample. There were several free, fun activities - the karaoke and photo booth especially - before sampling two further glasses of beer each in a noisy bar atmosphere listening to 80s hits. Lots of stairs (if you have trouble walking) but there is a lift. Reminded me of Cadbury World but with alcohol instead of chocolate!

Enjoyed this experience so much more than I thought!. Bought these tickets for my boyfriends birthday online prior to the day which was great as we didn't have to que and walked straight in! It first starts off as a typical museum with information on the history and how they make the beers etc, but after this, becomes so interactive! You get to taste some of the Ingredients mixed together which is a bit strange haha, get to see the horses and then the 4d interactive video where we go through the brewing process is so fun!! We then had a talk about the beer itself where we got to try our first glass. There was so much to do here, personalising our bottle was fun too! At the end you then had a choice of a large beer or 2 small ones and could look around the gift shop too! The ques were very confusing and very busy in the gift shop and we were waiting for about 20 mins so I'd bare that in mind. Overall both enjoyed the experience and would go again!

Amazing! . After reading reviews we were expecting huge queues. We arrived at 2pm and didn't que at all!! It was a real fun experience and quite educational. It really is worth the money, like everything, it's what you make of it. Definitely recommend if you like Heineken!

Great tour!. Really impressed with the value for money. Very informative and interesting tour, takes you right from the start of the brand to where it currently is in terms of sponsorships etc. You find out how the beer is made and take part in the making too. Lots to do and see on the visit, we had a lot of fun.
Meh. Long lines inside, not that thrilling to see. Definitely not a "must do," but also not horrible. The word "meh" comes to mind

If you love beer then you HAVE to go!. Worth every penny! Fantastic experience if you love beer. You really get to know everything and even get a couple of free beers around the experience. I cannot fault this!

Commercialized Information . We visited the Heineken Experience with our family. The brewery is no longer used for brewing beer but is now an exhibition and fun place. The given information is not very detailed concerning the brewing process and the selection of beers Heineken offers. The focus is more on having fun! If you don't mind superficial information and are patient enough to stand in line for a free beer this is the right place for you!
Fun! . We had no lines during our Friday after Easter. Don't expect this to be a museum or educational in any way, but my 3 kids and wife and I had a good time.

Great tour!. Really brilliant tour! Learnt all about the brewing process but it was actually interesting and fun. Got free samples and gift shop was great! Really enjoyed it would recommend to anyone who likes a beverage 🍻

Interesting . Would recommend but can get busy with groups ..
Only took an hour and a couple of beets included in the price
Interesting place to visit

Much better than the Guinness tour in Dublin!. Excellent trip, well worth the €16! Did not have to queue to get in and the 'Be the Beer' experience was fantastic! A tasting session during the experience and then two free drinks at the end! Made our stay in Amsterdam complete!

A must! . Very worthwhile visit, great fun. Take the Heineken experience ride. It's awesome. Sample 2 beers at the end and record yourself singing or a make a video message to friends. Super place to spend an afternoon!!

Enjoyable couple of hours! . Really great, enthusiastic and informative staff. It was all a complete marketing ploy but it was very enjoyable. Go early in the day to get the drink flowing early!! Interesting place, gets funnier and funnier as it goes on. You learn about the history of Heineken, how they brew it and finally you go through different rooms with interactive games and photo booths. Then you are taught how to appreciate a good Heineken and how to pour a good Heineken. Good day. Young kids should find it fun too.

Well worth a visit.. A very entertaining visit from beginning to end. Must have been there about two hours in total. Part of the experience is in a studio being the beer as it is brewed and bottled. Won't spoil the fun, but it involves bubbles in the air and more! You can make a short film, take various photos all which can be emailed home free of charge. The admission price also includes two drinks, beer or soft drink. Overall, we were very impressed and thought it was excellent entertainment and value for money.

Very good . Really enjoyed this tour, went with a group of friends on a stag do. Very informative and the tasting section on the way round was interesting. The ride is also good fun, couple of beers at the end was good as well. As a tip don't pay on the door get your tickets in the town beforehand its a couple of euros cheaper and you don't have to queue up.

What a surprise!. I went into it thinking I was just going to get a once over of the brewing process and then a beer, but there was so much more! Very interesting history and development of Heineken and it was cool to see its always been a family business! Loved the brew me video! There are even fun activities at the end! Only reason not 5 stars was the bartender's at the end were a bit rude.

Second half is good. The first half of the trip was pretty pointless as they crammed so many people in we couldn't actually hear or even see the tour guide and couldn't actually move much, when we got to the middle but it picked up and then progressed from the free beers where you actually learnt a bit. I bought a personalised bottle from the tour but made the mistake of forgetting that you can't bring the beer through the airport so had to empty it before going through security although they let me keep the bottle! Niiiiice

Don't bother unless you're a young beer lover.. Wasn't sure what to expect, but thought there would be more brewery and less theme park! Had a laugh in the karaoke room but that's about it really. Wouldn't recommend unless you're a young beer lover who is happy drinking the free beer at any time of day! Bit of a touristy rip off.
Overrated . Very little history and information behind the story of Heineken. It more boasts about it's modern day success and global sales. I've been to better tours in small town craft breweries

Well worth a visit!! . A really great trip! Interesting and great fun too! Don't leave Amsterdam without visiting it! Buy tickets using your smart phone and bring phone with you to avoid the q's which can be very long. Many hotels in Amsterdam also sell tickets which are cheaper and more saves time when you get there! We really enjoyed & highly recommend it!

Heineken Experience - Very Good Tour. The Heineken Experience is a very good tour and well worth the price of admission. There is much to see and to learn about the history of Heineken and their approach to brewing beer. You will see much of the brewery, listen to a brief live talk on their brewing technique, see, feel and taste their ingredients, experience a 4D ride, and if you like beer, you will also come away quite refreshed as there is beer tasting at the end of the tour. You can also buy souvenirs, including a personalized bottle of Heineken. Allow a couple of hours for this visit if you really want to enjoy the experience.
Interactive experience . Went along to this attraction it was informative / interactive - educational and interesting .Well worth it and to top it all you get two free pints of Heineken at the end

Meh, overrated. I guess I didn't know too much about this before going. I was disappointed that you don't actually see anyone brewing beer. It's all a bit gawdy and not that much information is actually provided. It's more focused on entertainment with rooms dedicated to karaoke, club music, a photo booth, rugby (or something), etc. They have a "ride" where you stand on a platform that moves and they "brew" you. It's sort of funny I guess. I went around noon on a Friday and it was packed. If you're going to go, definitely pre-purchase your ticket at any of those ticket shops that are everywhere in Amsterdam. This gets you straight in the door and saves you two euros from buying it at the brewery. (16 instead of 18 euros). The entry price also includes a tasting and then two beers at the end. I think the two beers at the end added up to one full beer.

Good experience . Enjoyed the walk about and the ride Personally not too interested in the history but there's lots of info if you are Part of the ticket gives you 4 small beers Tickets can be purchased from one of the near by stalls for €2 cheaper than on the door! Worth a visit for sure

intersting and fun. The visit at the Heineken museum has been very interesting in the first part and fun in the second part which is characterized by interactive games. Also they give you 3 free beer. It is worth going!
Very impressed!!. Very good your with in-depth knowledge behind making and manufacturing the beer. Opportunity to personalise your own bottles and get some unique souvenirs, well worth the money!
Okay.... This is your basic self-guided tour with 2 beers at the end for €18. Our 18 year old son enjoyed it. :)It was nice to go to an attraction that did not have an hour-long line to get in to!
Put a little Heineken in your life. Great tour. Excellent format, very informative. Really enjoyed the free beer part. Easy to get through.

Love Heineken, love this museum. They have the balance right here, with it not being too long and boring whilst still giving g enough information on their history and processes. The tour becomes more interactive as you move along and this ends up in drinking beer and being in something that more represents a cool Heineken themed adult theme park (although no actual roller coaster!)

Don't expect to learn anything. Tourist rip off. I've visited many breweries. From the small traditional ones in Belgium to some large industrial Anheuser Busch in the US.And this Heineken experience was the worst experience of all.Everything is so superficial. Explanation on how beer is made is covered in a couple of minutes. Don't expect any detail.History of the company is also a very short summary.There is no real data behind it, no graph showing the evolution of the production, no mention of the other brands owned by the Heineken group, no mention of the competition, ...And then there is a whole part about rugby or football. Yes, Heineken is a sponsor, so what? What's the point?And finally there is that 'brew me' simulator. Some sort of pathetic cheap copy of a theme park attraction with zero added value.Even though I don't even enjoy Heineken beer much, the only good thing about the visit are the beers!Also, if you still decide to go, go at times when there is no crowd. When it opens in the morning. Otherwise I can imagine the queue would totally ruin an already far from good experience.
Best tour!. This tour was one of the best things we done in Amsterdam, apart from the long queues inside we had such a good time and I would definitely recommend it!

Great fun and educational. We visited the Heineken Experience and absolutely loved it. From learning about the humble beginnings of Heineken to visiting the champions league room and messing around on the karaoke bicycles, it was all really interesting and great fun. Made even better with a few beers in the bar at the end of the tour. Would definitely recommend this as an activity to do in Amsterdam.

Very interesting . We timed our arrival at just the right time. We got to the Heineken experience at about 11. There was no queue and went straight in. It's mainly an independent tour however there are some great interactive opportunities- great selfie moments. With the ticket you get tokens for 2 beers at the end of the experience as well as this you get a small beer for tasting during the tour. Overall, a great experience enabling us to learn a lot of information about the history to the present company. Would definitely recommend. Enjoy.
Outing. Excellent experience. Interactive, informative and interesting. Something for everyone! Reasonably priced and fun!

Beer History. We really enjoy Heineken Experience.You have a lot to see and do.You gonna learn about beer from the start to the end.The first Heineken Factory open for you. We drink some beers and we took some degrees in a game for learning to put beer.

A Sobering Visit (not). An enjoyable experience. This museum does include a bit of drinking, for the adults of course, however it is still enjoyable for the kids seeing as the experience has a range of multi-media displays. Soft drinks are also offered at some points in the tour for the kids.

For Beer Lovers. The Heineken Experience is an interactive tour through the abandoned factory of the brewery in Amsterdam. I haven’t done, but I had friends who have and recommended. At the time, the ticket cost 16 euros buying by Ticketbar, is the best way to avoid the huge queues. The ticket has day and free time to visit, although is valid for some months. They say the tour is pretty cool, you discover the history of beer, drink a little and still get souvenir.

Its Ok....Kinda of Mehhh.. Fun way to pass an hour or two. Massive queues at the weekend so go on a weekday. The tour is ok, its not as good as the Guinness one I did in Ireland. It costs 18 euro but you can get a one euro off voucher in most hotel and tourist offices.The tour is ok. Wasnt mind blowing. It could maybe take up an hour, two hours tops. When I heard that they dont even make beer here anymore I felt a bit cheated.The queues for your free beer at the end are crazy.

An exciting todo !. A famous and popular attraction in Amsterdam is the Heineken factory tour. Very exciting and well arranged steps , good guides and multimedia shows. You may test 2-3 mugs of beers and enjoy the friendly atmosphere of tour.

Not just for beer lovers! . I'll admit I was not excited for this, it was my partners activity of choice for our trip and being a coeliac who can't drink traditional beer means beer is not my thing.We queued for about 45 minutes in the afternoon despite having purchased tickets in advance so i would recommend going earlier in hopes of dodging the queue but once Inside we were able to move around at our own pace aside from another small queue for the 4D experience. The sky bar was an added surprise which we didn't know existed until staff invited us up as we were browsing the gift shop.

Commercial and uncimmitted. Heineken bier is not the best beer... But marketing is their strong side. Alot of boring information with house music and celebrity. Young and uncommitted straff (cheap), just doing their bear minimum.... Poor horses do marketing work. I am ashamed to pay for a zoo.

It isn't a MUST. The Heineken Experience was a fairly good tour. Lots of interactive stuff to do so you don't get easily bored. It took about an hour and a half to get around. It was ok just not great. Unless you have free time I probably wouldn't bother.

Surprisingly interesting!. Definitely suggest purchasing tickets in advance especially over peak holiday periods. Even with tickets there was a 45 min queue which we managed to avoid due to one member in our party not being too well. The staff were very considerate and allowed us to jump the queue, otherwise we wouldn't have waited and would have forfeited our tickets!The Heinekin experience is an example of superb marketing. Getting the general public to pay to learn about their product. Its marketing gone mad really but it was pretty interesting although some parts of the exhibition were certainly making a bit of a mountain of a molehill and padding the experience out a bit!.A good wet weather venue for sure and the views from the top of the building from the roof top bar were worth it. You get 2 free Heinekins and even though I' m not a beer drinker - I did enjoy it!

Worth a visit!. We bought tickets at a tickets and tours shop in Amsterdam and therefore, skipped the queue which was great. The first 10-15 minutes of walking is quite crowded and rushed, involves stairs and gives a little history about Heineken. Then onto the brewing process of the beer, which smells like a farm, due to the horses. This is followed by an interactive ride 'Brew You Ride', which was quite fun with a 5 minute wait. The tour was very much focused on the marketing side of Heineken rather than the brewing, with interactive games, lots of info on sport and media, photobooths etc. There is also a tasting room where you receive a very small glass of Heineken (the two pints included in the price come at the end). The bar at the end of the experience where you receive your 2 beers is very crowded and not very well organised. I would say it is for a younger crowd as it is very loud and there is limited seating, however, I enjoyed this part of the Heineken Experience. Upon leaving, you enter the gift shop, surprise! However, we did get an engraved glass & tin for only €8 as a great keepsake. I would recommend going whilst in Amsterdam, if you have some time on your hands and I recommend pre-booking tickets in order to avoid queues (we paid €13.50 each)!

Terrible experience and huge queuing!. We visited the Heineken Experience on the Easter Weekend and the queue was terrible long! There was only 1 desk opened for tickets selling.There were also other queues that we had to sit in during the tour.This tour wants to be an entertaining tour, but we actually find it pretty boring.I would not return to this and also would not recommend as a principal attraction in Amsterdam, also very expensive !

Heinken Fun... The only place where with Holland Pass able to skip the line. Nicely explained and well done, a lot of entertainment. The worst is the bar at the top of the building, you can not eat if you do not pay with card and only card with pin????. price burgers that offer is too high, no choice...:(the quality in shop is overrated,price is too big There we only met unkind sellers of all the places where been.

Fun afternoon. I wasn't sure what to expect from this- but we had a fun afternoon, learnt how to drink beer 'properly' and enjoyed 3+ taster beers in the price! Also paid a little extra to go to the roof top bar and have another drink and a tasty burger!

Fun interactive experience!. Visited Amsterdam for the first time over New years and had to experience the Heinkeken Brewery. Although a bit crowded, we had a lot of fun nonetheless with a lot of interactive games throughout that allowed us to compete against one another.

Very Dull. Attended with a large group - the entry fee was 18 euros - and once inside you realise that there is very little to see. Included in the price of entry is 2 halves of lager. Couldn't wait to get out to be honest. Definitely would not recommend.
Great fun. . This was a really fun experience. We bought queue jumps, but it probably wasn't necessary as there wasn't a queue at all! Worth a visit.

Couldn't get to the beer fast enough.. It was a great experience, self paced and interesting. But we couldn't get to the 2 included beers fast enough..
I recommend going in the morning over the afternoon as the lines were long.

Fun and educational. We bought the tickets in another place to “avoid the lines” but there is still a line for pre-paid tickets. It was a bit shorter than the ticket line but still I wonder if it was any better. We learned about the history of Heineken. We learned how to make beer and we were inside an old copper brewery. We virtually experienced making beer. We learned how to pour a beer (optional) and we drank a lot of beer in the process (optional too).There were also a lot of video games and interactive games that you could interact with along the way.The staff was always very friendly and professional.

One of the best places I've been!. We went to the Heineken museum on the day we were leaving. And wow, we thought it was amazing! Very detailed in the history of the Heineken family which was great to 'see behind the scenes' my first thought was that was all it would be - but there was so much more! There was talk from the staff about different things, an interactive ride where you are a beer bottle, LOADS of games to play, photo booths, music... The list could go on. It was also my birthday so I got given a Heineken beer mug and had unlimited beer all afternoon which I can't complain about. Would highly recommend going, wouldn't miss it if you were in Amsterdam!
Real fun time . We had a great time what a Great experience it was truly a fun afternoon walking through the whole story and the couple cocktails really made a big difference

Goodish. Last year been to the guiness factory and maybe i was comparing the two but the heineken is very small and limited.Its a cool n fun but so small and it mainly focuses about the marketing rather than the beer. Beer is good and you get a 3 glasses of it.1st one is a taste with 15cl beer and you can get either 2 25cl at the end or 1 35cl at the end. Shop is not bad, not too manu things (again compared to the guiness) but prices are fair and items are nice.

Bit boring . Would not recommend going here as a stag do we payed 25 euros and spent most of the tour rushing round to get out, highlight of the experience was the free halves of lager and burger we got. Was very very busy and personally wasn't worth the 30 minute wait or the entrance fee. 10 euros would be more of a better entrance charge. Personally not my cup of tea.

If you like queuing.... Thought this tour was very poorly designed! Queues and bottle necks around every corner. Even with prepaid tickets we had to queue for about 45 mins to get in. Many more queues were in store for us. It doesnt compare to the Guinness Store House in Dublin.

Very Interesting. Very good self guided tour, rich in the families history with brewing the beer we all know and love. Good information, good value for money and a fun way to spend a few hours. We got the standard tickets which gave you access to the tour, beer tasting class and two free drinks in the bar at the end.

Really good, but long queues. This was pretty awesome, but the weekend queues were pretty bad. The main queue was round the corner when we arrived around 4pm on a Saturday afternoon. So we opted to find a ticket store nearby and buy tickets there for the pre-sale queue. Tickets bought elsewhere were actually 2Euro cheaper! When we returned, the presale queue was long too, and we still had to wait outside for around 45 minutes. The tour itself was really interesting, and there's plenty of beer to go round. Takes around 90 minutes to complete.
Brilliant and great to pass an afternoon . Absolutely brilliant, watch out during the film /roller coaster ride kind of for the rain shower if standing in the middle but worth it. Teenagers loved it.

Best brewery tour we've been on. . Excellent tour, best value for money attraction we had been to in Amsterdam. I would highly recommend booking through an agent to get a slight discount but mainly for the fast track which saved a lot of time. Other than the usual brewery stuff seeing how it's made etc the brewery ride and the free canal tour to take you to the brand shop made this one stand out from other well known ones we have been. Well worth a visit!
Great Place. I pre booked tickets so was able to get in quicker. The interactive displays were good. Free beer at the end of the tour is always a good thing! Horses looked well cared for.

Busy but worth it. I took my husband as he hasnt been before. The line to get on the ride was so long and you couldn't skip it. Ppl were rude n sick of lining up but the beer was delicious and the personalised bottles mean i have one happy hubby!!

Good but nothing special. Waited for hour and a half just to enter it (they give you a cookie if they see that the queue is long), museum is quite boring/not so interesting until you come in cinema room and go to beer tasting room. Nice to visit, drink some beer but don't expect a lot of fun over there.

Good fun, nothing revolutionary. A good fun tourist attraction. You get to learn about the history of the beer and have a couple of samples. There are some fun parts to it and it is worth the visit as it is not overpriced.
Perfect Solution 4 Rainy Day!. Here's a tip... get there 15min before opening! spontaneously decided, what the hay!I'm so glad I did! It was really cool! Interesting as well.

Waste of 18 euros!. There was initially a very boring museum section which had no staff easing the flow of people which creates bottlenecks similar feel of herding cattle into a cage. Once past the museum part we were crammed further into tiny cinema rooms that let you experience what it is like to be made into a Heineken, this was definitely the worst part of the entire 'experience'. Even the sections that had interactivity most weren't working which meant the bar at the end was completely rammed. Would not recommend, much better things can be found in Amsterdam!
Great. Was not looking forward to this but it turned out to be really good fun. Buy your ticket in advance and then you don't have to que, which was long.

It's ok!. The wifi wasn't working, so I couldn't use its app. The multimedia is really cool! But you must be patient because there is a huge queue (25 minutes) inside of the museum (there is an especial attraction that "transforms" you in a beer. It is really nice, but you can't skip this section even if you are rush).

Very entertained. I came early because I read would be full after lunch (as always), good choice!
I was expecting more about the brewery process and see the fabric working. They don't show it and focus more in entertainment. Very organized and a lot of creative options to see and play, videos, history etc. It's worth the visit for sure

Underwhelming and dissapointing. Me and my girlfriend went through the heiniken experience yesterday to learn some more about brewing and heiniken as a company. It started off good but quickly turned into what felt like a long queue and a waste of time. The last half is more or less like watching a tv commercial. Yes you get some beers to enjoy in the end but its very crouded. You get your moneys worth but the time it takes to get two beers is to long.

Beer experiance. We really enjoyed this place. We brought our kids with us and they had a blast in the kids area. You have the choice to have two beers or to be certified on how to pour the perfect beer. If you are a beer liver this is a place I would recommend

Great experience. Great to experience how one of the biggest beer companies in the world work! It had stables/horses, 4D cinema experience, ps4 game stations, karaoke bicycles, photo booth's, football/rugby merchandise signed by teams and players and other types of games and activities! My girlfriend who doesn't like beer in the slightest thoroughly enjoyed the experience too!

Great attraction, worth the visit!. Really great experience and would strongly recommend. We spent over two hours there as there was so much to do; the experience was interactive throughout and informative.The staff were very friendly and engaging throughout the experience. Highlights for me were the 'Brew You' ride and being able to bottle/personalise your own bottle of Heineken. This is one of the best attractions in Amsterdam and I would definitely return in the future!

Not necessary. Once you visit Belgium, the Netherlands, France or Germany you will find that there is a huge variety of beers and of small or big breweries offering beers of unique tastes and many of them have a tour in their installations. I think is much more interesting experience and much more tasteful, one to visit for example Chimay to taste its beer or Historium in Bruges to see about and taste Duvel than spend a couple of hours in a highly commercialized big brand like Heineken with nothing exceptional or unique -to my opinion- in its product. A great name does not necessarily imply great quality.

A little boring. 2nd time there first was alone and now with my girlfriend.It's nice if you don't have anything to do for an hour but the price doesn't really get it value.The souvenir was exclusive but way expansive.
