great couple of hours. Very well thought out place. Didn't,t realize how much went into making this drink, loved the horses , well worth the money
fun hour and a half. Fun, more an interactive Heineken Commercial than a brewery tour. lots to do, entertaining and BEER!
Heineken experince. Good for one time visit. The tour is nice and the information is complete. The different rooms inside the tour offer different sensations.

Great visit. Was there with my wife.
You have to order the tickets online on their site. Otherwise, you would have to wait in a long line.
Inside, it starts slow but after the movie it turns out great. Even though they had an uptight employee who pressed the red button before the movie (10 minutes wait) didn't diminish the experience.

Loved it!. This place is very recommended. Even though I don't prefer Heineken as a beer it was indeed great experience- you learn about the process of making Heineken, the history of it and you get a chance for taste. Don't forget to buy your tickets online - it'll save you money and time.

Awesome!. Really great experience, teaching people about how the beer is made was done in a fun and engaging way. It's more of a combination of a theme park and museum, with plenty of bar stops to sample the beer!
Couldn't recommend this enough, you can even get personalised bottles.

Worth the viist. When we first went through, the Heineken experience looked like it was going to be more of a museum than any sort of "experience". However, as you go along, there are more and more interactive features which get you involved and most importantly more and more beer. They have a free cloakroom too and take bags etc. Which is very useful if you're travelling. Cruising through at a comfortable speed probably took us 2 hours so it isn't bad value for money either.

Heineken experience. It lives up to its name and gives a fascinating overview of the Heineken history with some interactive things to enjoy along the way. Even if you aren't keen on Heineken I'd still recommend visiting.

Fun day out. I got dragged here by my boyfriend!! It was roughly 30 euros for both of us to get in but you did get 2 beers each. I actually enjoyed my time here even though I don't like beer. And I did learn lots too.It was very interactive and you could have a go at pouring your own pint, taking pictures with the Heineken photo booth and using the interactive screen to play rugby. At the end of the tour, there was an area where you tasted the beer and there was someone to talk to you about how the beer is made.You also got to have two small pints of beer each and there was an area to stand or sit with up to date music too!From a girls perspective I wasn't looking forward to this but I actually enjoyed myself.

Worth it!. I was really in doubt about going, but it is worth if you have time! It is very interactive, lots of fun and provides tons of information about brewing! There are two tasting places - the first is a small demonstration and the second is for really enjoying the beer for free (using the 2 pins they give in the entrance). A little bit crowdy at the beginning of the tour, but it gets better!

Brewery. Not worth the trip for one pint of free beer! All the hype is commercial, but if you want to see a brewery in the making and some nice horses and a free poncho when it's raining the go! The bar on the corner with brown Windows was a better experience, great food and lovely staff!

Very Good and entertaining. Very good tour of the Heineken factory and the story behind the Heineken name. Plenty to keep you entertained. We paid €16pp for the tickets which was good value which included 2 drinks each. Two 250ml glasses of Heineken, so basically a pint.
Heineken experience. A must seen museum... We made our own Heineken bottle with our names... Fantastic 😉 😍 Also our personal beer glass

Best visit on our city break!!. This was one of the highlights of our visit to Amsterdam. Everything and everyone was first class from start to finish. You learn about the making and brewing of the beer all in a very lighthearted way, from the water to the "A" yeast. You get to taste as well and very nice it was to! The whole atmosphere was party like and you never once felt like you had to leave in fact I think you could have stayed all night if you wanted to!! It was a real laugh at the end with all the photo booths and bikes... I would highly recommend a visit it's worth every euro.

Fun experience!. No lines when we arrived so tickets and entrance went smoothly. We walked through the history of the founder and the brewery before we entered the more fun part linked to sport and bars. Fun visit that even appealed to our teens!
Was okay. This tour was okay, shows you briefly how their beer is made from their 'special' yeast. You get a small taster of beer at the end. Disappointed not more beer for price of entry

Lots of fun & laughter & of course free beer :). Myself & partner Visited Amsterdam for 3 days and out all of our excursions Id say this one was the best & was the cheapest only 11euros each!... I must admit I was a little bored at the start of the visit but trust me it gets better & better !!... Ill not say too much, Ill upload loads of photos. It was great fun learning the history & taking part in different activities. staff were all friendly. You get 3 beers, needless to say we left a bit tipsy & went straight to the pub! Get booking!!!

First thing we done . We had a few hours to kill before we could check in to our hotel. The Heineken Experience is great, we loved it especially since we do really enjoy a good cold pint of Heineken back home! Incredibly factual, with amazing features and facilities. Great price for what you get too!
Great great great!!. A very fun experience. During the dau you get beer 3 times and its all combined with music, movies and self experience. We enjoyed it very much.

Good for a rainy day or if you have no idea how beer is made. The Heineken Experience in fact is a kind of museum. In a guided tour you walk past historical milestones of the Heineken brand. You will also see how a brewery functions and.... in the end, when you really start beining thursty: you will taste the beer!!!!

Enjoyable Visit on a rainy afternoon. Since it was a rainy day in Amsterdam, we decided to visit the Heineken Experience We arrived at lunchtime and there was no queue to get inside the Museum.The first part of the tour is about the history of the company, then it's onto the brewing of the beer and then finally you are shown the other enterprises associated with the Heineken Brand We found the experience very enjoyable with lots of fun & interaction throughout the tour and then finally you have the chance to enjoy a couple of free beers at the end.I would recommend a visit to the Heineken Experience if you get the time, it was very enjoyable and fun way to spend a few hours in the city.
Well worth a visit. My partner and I visited on Wednesday and we were stunned with what was in the experience, I would advise anyone to go and do the tour!!

This is a multimedia tour. Not factory tour.. Geared towards the 20-30 year old crowd with video games etc after the short but entertaining tour. Loud crowded drinking area at the end right before the gift shop.

Not just about the beer. The experience is located in one of the original Heineken breweries, and yes, you do get to understand and see the brewery, and the processes, but this is far more than that -the story of the Heineken family, the creation of the beer, the world wide market, and all the other enterprises associated with the name ( sponsorship, Football, Rugby etc etc) and the marketing machine are what the experience is all about, and it is awe inspiring in scale and informative.An excellent way to learn and while away a few hours.... and theres free beer at the end.
Awesome!. My husband and I did the VIP Experience and would highly recommend. Our tour guide, Ryan, was extremely knowledgeable and friendly. The VIP tour was definitely worth the ticket price.

Brilliant fun few hours.. I've been to the Heineken Experience twice now, once on my Stag Do and once with my wife. It is fun, interesting and interactive. You get 3 free drinks once inside, and it takes a couple of hours to get all the way round. When we went the sun was shining so they opened the roof top bar which gives you superb views of Amsterdam. If you can try and book your tickets online as it gives you quick entry and you won't have to wait outside in the cold.
Must see . Great time filler. Really enjoyed! You even get a free beer on the way out and we printed funny pictures for 1 euro at the end! Must do on your visit to Amsterdam!
Don't go there. Because your being ripped off. The beer is not being brewed there. It's a Disney land for beer and they over charge you.

Exceeded Expectations. My husband and I visited the Heineken Experience last September and we were impressed. We arrived late on a Wednesday and caught the last entry time. It took us about an hour to walk through and another thirty minutes to enjoy the beer samples. The experience is educational and interactive with an emphasis on fun the entire way through. The samples were more than we were able to drink, but everyone seemed to be enjoying the lounge atmosphere. I felt like I was at a private corporate party. All of the staff was very welcoming and entertaining.A bit surprise came as we were leaving and invited to take a free canal shuttle across town to the Heineken brand store. We had already done some shopping at the gift shop, but the canal shuttle was enjoyable (and free), plus it got us close to our hotel. We were even given a free glass at the brand store.Is this a must-do compared to other attractions in Amsterdam? Probably not. However, it was a very enjoyable way to spend a few hours and definitely worth the admission price. If you're a fan of Heineken, this is a worthy addition to your itinerary.Like my review? Check out my blog!

Awesome. This was a fantastic place to visit. So interactive and informative. Things you could taste like the barley and water combo. You could also stir a massive container with barley and warm water. The horses were a nice touch too. All the staff were great, learnt a lot about the beer. There was so much free beer being passed around too, and who doesn't love free beer? Deffo recommend!

A double-edged tour. When leaving this review, I must split it into two separate parts as it would be unfair to paint the whole experience with one colour (Green! Lots of Green!) Firstly, the building is wonderful, the history of how the company grew and the brewing part of the tour is excellent BUT, it then goes a little south........Enter the modern era of Heineken. History moves aside for green lit rooms, sponsorship and probably the worst experience of the day which was the 'We are going to brew you' experience. Thankfully, this was cushioned by three 25cl glasses of delicious Heineken (included in price of admission). I wanted to love this tour and I did for the first half but if like me, your interested purely in the entrepreneurial story of Mr Heineken, you may find yourself mildly disappointed.
Great fun. Couple of hours of fun and a few beers. Interesting and informative . Not sure it's fun in peak season.

Great value for money. I can't say hearing about beer brewing is the most interesting thing as I'd much rather be drinking it, which is great because you get a lot of free beer! The tour starts with the history of Heineken. A whole lot of history. Maybe. Bit too much... But then you move onto more interesting things like the brewing and who and what they sponsor!It's extremely interactive and you find yourself not wanting to leave. When you do decide to go though, ensure you grab your free ticket to the Heineken canal cruise!!! We didn't have a clue about this until a lady stopped us just before we left. You even get a free gift at the end of the cruise!Best thing I did in Amsterdam.

Fun experience! . We decided to visit the Heineken Experience whilst in Amsterdam recently, was a fun experience!We visited around lunchtime, and there was no queue at all, I did notice that it was getting busier when we were leaving. I think this was a good time to go as it didn't feel crowded when we were walking around, which meant we could take our time and didn't feel rushed. It's an interesting tour, very interactive, a lot to see and a lot of fun. Great that you end up in the bar for a few drinks at the end as well! We went as a couple but would be fun with kids as there is a lot to do and you don't have to drink the beer. All the staff we encountered were friendly, knowledgeable and informative. I would recommend a visit to the Heineken Experience if you get the time, was very enjoyable!

Start sober, finish hammered. Awesome time! Saw how the beer is brewed and also got to brew some ourselves! Very interactive also, with the chance to: customise your own beer bottles, proper beer tasting and loads of music, football and rugby based mini games!Thoroughly enjoyed this and want to do it again so so badly!!

Must-do attraction . My partner and I prebooked tickets with booking.com (saves a bit of cash). We went about midday on a Sunday and we didn't need to que. We had a great day, I wasn't expecting there to be so much to see, do and we almost spent 2 hours there. Decent value for money, really fun, interactive and virtual souvenirs were a great way of having free suveniers. We decided instead of having two drinks to have one drink and pour our own which we were rewarded with a certificate for which was a fab keepsake. Plenty to see and do I highly recommend! Easy to get to by tram.

Fun but overrated. Fun and a little bit interesting but to be honest also a little bit boring. Recommend to get a ticket in advance to avoid the long que just to get in. Naah skip this and head out to a bar for the real Heineken experience instead.

Interesting experience . We went here on Saturday afternoon. It was very busy, so I'd recommend pre buying your tickets as this saves having to queue up to get your tickets. It's a very interesting tour. You're able to go at your own pace and the drinks with the view of the city from the rooftop bar are almost worth the entry alone. Well worth a visit!

Great way to spend a couple of hours . A great way to spend a couple of hours, very informative with. Lots of things to do. Answer the questions and get more free beer! 2 beers included at the end so good value.
By far the highlight of my trip. . Very pleasantly surprised. Had a lot more than expected and loads to do there. Staff all very friendly.

Day trip. My boyfriend and I visited here on our recent trip to Amsterdam. The tour was good and the tasting samples were yummy! Staff were pleasant. We enjoyed our visit and would recommend to anybody.

Fact Filled & Full of Fun. One of the best things to do in the city. The tour takes you through a few stages, first, there is a museum part which talks about the history of Heineken. Secondly, there is a brewery tour which gives information about how the beer is made and is very informative and interactive. Thirdly, there is an interactive part where you can get involved in some pics/selfies and enjoy information about some of the sponsorship activities of Heineken (including a good area about Football and Rugby). Fourthly, the beer section...and chance to try. In this section there is a talk about how to taste the beer (including a free glass of beer) then onto a bar area where you get two beers per person. Should also mention, lastly, the shop!The activities took us about 90minutes and was a fun and enjoyable experience.TIP: You can buy tickets for this from the open top bus companies and some shops - this usually means a cheaper ticket and not having to Queue at the venue for tickets.

Interesting and enjoyable, but book your tickets in advance. We booked our tickets for the Heineken Experience through a tickets and toura place before we went as we were doing a few different things, and you got more discount for the more trips you booked. We were so glad we did this, as the queue to buy your tickets there was really long. There were a few times where we had to stop and queue during the experience, but that may be down to the time that we went, and that we went on a Saturday. We all found the experience to be interesting and fun. There was a lot if interactive things to do in there so it keeps people of all ages happy. We also got two drinks, plus a tasting glass during the tour too. If you interact with them during the tasting session though they give you an extra one!They open the rooftop bar on a Saturday too, this has a lovely view if the city and they also sell a small amount of merchandise and burgers up there to go with your beer. They also have a few ither drinks available, and you can buy aditional ones ones you have used your tokens.I really enjoyed this trip, and would definitely recommend to anybody visiting Amsterdam

VIP tour a must!. My husband and I had a great experience! Ryan was our guide and he did an amazing job. He was very well versed in Heineken history and you could tell his passion for the company. The regular tickets lines were LONG and we got to wait on the side with no line wait. I love that you can check your coat and bag so you don't have to lug it around with you. It was quite cold outside so this was a plus! I highly recommend booking the VIP tour - when we go back, we will definitely do this one again.
Great fun and nice tour. Really go there to spend a good time, walking through the history and beer process in a very easy and relaxed way. The tour is very interactive and really enjoyed it.

Interesting and fun! . Enjoyed a good walk round the Heineken factory, and found learning about the process of making the beer very interesting. You get to sample the beer as well which is obviously a bonus!!

Waste of Time. This was a complete waste of time and money. I love going on brewery tours but this felt like one huge advertisement for Heineken. The first quarter to half of it is pretty cool, but the rest of it ruins it, even the couple "free" beers aren't worth it because the ticket was so expensive (€18/person)

A great experience. I'm not a big beer drinker but I thought enjoyed the experience and the Heineken! I went with a university group as a social event and it was really fun, it's interactive bits are great and it taught just the right about of information.
Brilliant interactive experience . Great way to spend a few hours. Particularly enjoyed all the interactive activities - fun for all ages, well worth a visit
Beer history. A most go in amsterdam its the hieneken experience. They will take you everywhere trhough the beer making process and at the end they will gave you beer to sample
Beer. Got the canal boat to see this. Worth going and you get free beer! What more could you want. Very educational

Another Beer experience. Having visited the Carlsbeg experience in Copenhagen, I was keen to give the Heineken tour a try. Unfortunately, like there used to be in the UK, these are not true brewery tours, ie, not around a working Brewery but as advertised 'Museum' experiences.Anyway, sorry Carlsberg, but Heineken is closer to the actual experience than yours, brewing equipment is there to be seen with video shows inside, a stop where a member of staff gave a talk on the ingredients required for brewing. There then followed a 3D show in small groups standing on interactive platforms which took you through the brewing process, where you are shaken, rained upon, bubbles floating round, the works. Following on from this was a tasting together with a question and answer session.From here past the dray horses which still go out daily but mainly for commercial and advertising tours. Unlike Carlsberg you could not walk through the stables, but a very pleasant female member of staff spike to you about her charges, something she obviously was very proud of.To finish off the tour, it has to be a tasting , you receive an armband which allows you two drinks, nice way to round it off.

Brilliant interactive beer tour. Absolutely love the Heineken Experience.You get to do a self guided tour where you walk through areas with information on the history of Heineken and how the beer is made then there are demonstrations of various parts of the beer making process. At the end of the tour you get a taste lesson.After the tour but there are interactive exhibits which were really good. Then at the end you get to enjoy a couple of beers in a bar area. You learn how to perfectly pour a drink if you want to.Of course at the end is the Heineken shop.

Brilliant day!. Best way to spend a few hours away from the normal hustle and bustle of Amsterdam.This was 1 of the tourist attractions I was most looking forward to and it did not fail to meet my expectations. A lot of history of Heineken which was very interesting. Through the tour you are told how they brew the larger, obviously not everything. There is a virtual simulator, which brews you, so you feel like you have gone through all the process that the ingredients go through. After this you walk into a bar area with two trademark red star bars. Here you enjoy Heineken the right way. With explained beer tasting. Carry on through the tour, you see lots of what Heineken has sponsored with interactional games to do with rugby and football. You also can sit in an area which seems like a Heineken night club. If it was real I would be in this club all the time!And the end you do end up in the bar, with two tokens to get two beers. Brilliant place and would love to go back!

Nice place to visit . Lovely time some great little features such as selfie spots and video riding a bike lol. The drinks are two halves not two pints which is what I first thought. Book before you arrive online to beat queue and cheaper

Nice way to spend a couple of hours. The heineken experience was a fun tour that lasted a couple of hours and included a couple of beers throughout. The simulator was brilliant fun and I would recommend this trip as it is educational and fun at the same time!
Better than the last time. We had much more fun this time around than our last visit 10 years ago. Much more to see and a lot of interactive displays.

Okay but nothing to write home about . I was hoping to see the actual process of making beer in action, like going through the production floor. Instead we saw models of it and watched videos. Afterward, there were a lot of interactive rooms with activities, but it seemed suited toward either children or frat boys. The beer was nice and it killed a few hours, but definitely not worth the 18€.

Best brewery tour. Been to a few in different countries and this is by far the best. Im not a beer drinker but found this very interesting and fun. You pay to enter but then quite a few of the things are included in the ticket price. Def worth a visit

Very touristy. I knew this would be a touristy spot, but it was stupid. Very geared toward college kids who are only there for the two beers you get with your entrance fee. Big lines too - they did not handle a crowd well. You can definitely skip this one
Great experience!!. Very impressed with the tour and the interactive brand that Heineken promotes.Very savvy and upbeat!!! Would highly recommend to all visitors to Amsterdam!!!

Very fun experience, lots to see. The staff were super cool. They gave us free half pints if we got questions right. You're also able to get a personalised bottle engraved for you, not too expensive. Around 7 euro

BRILLIANT! . My boyfriend really wanted to do this, I was unsure! However I went along, (bought out tickets before hand for 16euros each) and I LOVED it! Really fun experience, learning how they brew beer. A fun little ride and 3 free beers! Perfect! Will take you an hour or so to see it all and enjoy your ice cold beer You can also bottle your own beer!

Really cool experience . Wow! The place is amazing , you could spend there half day. I was there with my wife and We loved this place!Of course at the end you may taste couple of fresh Heineken beers! Recommended.
Great time. Very inexpensive and you get 2 free beers & a mini beer with admission. I liked how it was so interactive in each of the different rooms.

Good but not AMAZING. . We went here as part of a boozey trip away and it was good but not amazing. It's quite expensive for what it is but you do get two free drinks at the end. The experience itself explains it well and the games at the end are quite good. A touristy thing to do.

One of the best tours I have ever done.. One of the best tours I have ever done, lots of fun stuff to do and alot of photo opportunity, the only thing I'd advise is going to the tickets places or buy online S it's cheaper.

Brilliant. Definitely a must do when in Amsterdam, it's so good - so many different activities, good fun and especially good during the colder months as indoors and nice and warm. Really enjoyed myself even though not a big Heineken fan
Great laugh . Would recommend pre booking online so you can walk straight in and avoid long waiting times. Great laugh with great atmosphere.

you're a beer bottle!!!!. Oh my gosh!! We had so much fun doing this.. learning how to pull a beer, drinking samples and the history of Heineken was really cool. Great gift shop too. You have to do it just because!!!!

Great. The Heineken Experience Tour topples the CocaCola tour in Atlanta as well as the Guinness tour in Dublin. I absolutely recommend this - even for non-beer drinkers. For me, it was value for money and we spent half a day there - be sure to go on the Heineken river cruise and have an extra-ice-cold Heineken draft.

HEINEKEN EXPERIENCE AN AVERAGE. Heineken Products Manufacturing Factory has been reviewed their business improvement only not for public.This was promoting their products and reach worldwide themselves.

Great fun, awesome bar!. We did this on our first night in AMS - got there right at 7, the last time to enter. The beginning was the history and then more interesting when they got to how they brew the beer. You walk through the horse's stable which was cute, and then a simulation! Surprisingly fun! After that, a taste test and then on to more interactive and marketing type things done by Heineken. The bar at the end was wicked cool, I would factor in an hour for this, you get two free drink tokens.

Worth a visit. We did this to kill some time, but actually it was really good. its much more then just the story of the beer. Throughout the journey you can stop and listen to the talks the staff put on (only a few mins long) You get two beers at the end which is included in the price.

Much better than expected!. I wasn't sure it was going to be time or money well spent but we decided to go for it and we were glad we did! After the expected walk through rooms with some big copper casks which did have novelty views and videos playing the history and process of brewing, we were then taken through into live demonstration rooms where presenters explained more about brewing and the Heineken legacy with enthusiasm and motivating passion. We sampled the beer and were then guided through a series of Heineken related and sponsored event replications from rugby and football to tandem cycling through Amsterdam where you could take pictures on their provided cameras and instantly email to friends and family! Finally the tour ended with a couple of included drinks of Heineken in a bar styled room with scrolling city landscapes and views, which when to include in the price makes the whole tour really great value! We had a great time and would definitely recommend it to anyone over 18 visiting Amsterdam! Under 18s I don't think would enjoy it unless they have an interest in the science or brewing of the Heineken history.

Not so good as expected. The visit and the experience was great.. They show you where and how the beer comes from... Even the horses that they used to use in the beginning of the company existence..The games towards the end were very entertaining...Specially the floor with logo games or the one where u learn how to pour the beer.Points to highlight to management:Many parts of the tour information is outdated and says 2011 (!)... We re already in 2016.

Nice experience . One of the best palaces that you can visit in Amsterdam. It is the main factory of Heineken beer where they explain to you how the it is made from the start, what ingredients they use and then they will give you a complementary fresh beer. Actually two for each one. At the end of the tour there is a gift shop if you are interested in buying some gifts. It coasted me 16 euro.
Fun . Really fun day trip , one of the best attractions me and my boyfriend visited in Amsterdam . Definitely worth the euros , you even get to pour your own pint !

2nd time in Amsterdam and enjoyed it. On my second visit to Amsterdam I finally made it to the experience. My boyfriend wanted to go so we went and I ended up loving it. Went round in our own time and got to try the extra cold beer at the end. Interesting time, liked the moveable floor!
Highly recommended . Me and my partner visited here , really enjoyed it , starts off a bit slow when you learn the history and stuff but once you get upstairs it's brilliant ,

Beer Disneyland. This is aptly named the Heineken "EXPERIENCE" because its very interactive. Selfies, motion simulator, pour your own beer, kick a virtual football, rugby scrum, ride a stationary bicycle, design your own beer label, on and on. All that and three beers- good fun!
Interesting . I went to the Heineken experience with my fiancé, I don't drink beer but found the experience interesting and actually enjoyed the beer!!

fascinating, but too many gimmicks near the end. We were looking forward to visiting this place whilst in Amsterdam.We didn't pre book tickets as we we combining with museum trips so didn't know when we would get there.We only queued for 5 mins max for tickets and were then straight in.Make sure you get the vouchers that give you a few euros discount that seem to be everywhere!This is a self guided tour with lots of historical pictures and paraphernalia. The most impressive bit was that it is housed in the original Heineken brewery, and that it has always been a family run business. I do love a successful brand that has stayed in the family.They seem to have done great work looking after their staff too by the details found on the walls.Really interesting insight into how the brand evolved.You get to to try the beer about half way round. It is a very small beer and you are told why they pour with such a big head.,I am still not convinced by this but each to their own.There is an interactive experience where you are 'Brewed'. I found that a bit random to be honest!The walk round was really fascinating, and it is a great old building. Then we came to the gimmicky bit that I really wasn't a fan of. Lots of play stations with the Fifa game on it, a rugby kicking simulator, making your own label which is then extortionately priced to purchase and so on. I suppose they are hammering home the brand, but it really didn't interest us.We got to the end for our 2 free beers. Again, these were small! You either get 2 250ml regular heinekens or 1 350ml extra cold. Not quite what I thought you would get being British!We opted for the extra cold, and it was alright.The exit was through the gift shop, which basically had the Heineken logo on everything you could want.A very interesting visit and I would recommend it just to learn about the heritage.

Experience the world famous Beer in making.... Great experience. As an Indian, where consumption of alcohol is supposed to be a bad thing, u will be amazed by seeing how many awards they have received for making such a world famous beer.U will also get to know making procedure and freeeee beer :)Just a downside is, u r charged 18 Euros for visit. I had visited Bacardi distillerry in Puerto rico, which is a guided free tour :)

Very commercial . There are parts if the tour that are interesting, and the super fresh beer that they give you is delicious, but it was the only time during my 4 days in Amsterdam that I felt like a real tourist in a real tourist trap. Go if you have time, skip it if your time in Amsterdam is short.

Best distillery I've ever been to . I've been to both the Guinness factory and the Jameson Whiskey Factory and the Heineken Factory was by far the best of the 3! Very interactive and I learnt a lot! Poured my own beer and got a bottle with my name on it! Great merchandise shop and well priced! Would definitely recommend!!

Brilliant day out altogether . Visited it with friends on a weekend away and would highly highly recommend it to anyone, one of the best laughs we had all weekend. Ten minutes on the tram from the Dam centre. The venue itself is brilliant lots of games and activities to take part in. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Very affordable and definitely worth the visit if you are in Amsterdam.

Really Enjoyed. Had mixed feelings at first but once we finished it was really enjoyable. The tour is actually quite long which was unexpected but you get a lot of information fed to you in a fun and interactive way, as well as being able to sample the product. With 2 free drinks given at the end as well. There are loads of interactive activities you can do, as a late teen id recommend this to people my age looking for something fun to do in the day.

Interesting!. Enjoyed the visit to the Heineken Brewery very interesting tour with three glasses of beer to enjoy. The history of the beer started with a film clip show telling the story of the beginning of the beer making. You can walk around at your own pace and find out how the beer bottles have changed through the years. See the shire horses in the stables. And enjoy pouring your own pint. After the tour you can go on the Heineken boat on the canal for a thirty minute ride that is very enjoyable. This is included in the price of the tour. Overall worth a visit.

Needs replanning. Our first visit was very good so we went with friends. it was very busy and the "Ride" section, which is not really a ride, you just stand and watch a screen proved to be a bottle neck. we had cued for 15 or 20 minutes for this section when we seen a sign saying 15 minutes waiting time. Apart from this the rest of it is good, even better if you book at the shop in town as you get a free boat trip there and back.

A great way to wast a couple of hours. Very interesting way to learn about beer and it's production, very interactive. It's somewhere that anyone can visit, suitable for families with children as well as there are plenty of things on the inside to keep everyone entertained. You also get to go behind the bar and pour your own beer and have a couple of pints at the end (probably not as suitable for children)Definitely would recommend visiting as it isn't that expensive for an activity to pass some time.
A great experience. The begining of the exhibition is a bit boring, but after that is just amazing and a lot of fun.. I recomend to buy tickets online instead of queueing.

Gets Very Busy. Good informative tour. Can't really understand the bad reviews of some people here saying that there's a lot of advertising. It's the HEINEKEN Experience, surely Heineken branding is to be expected. Only real down side is that it can get very busy at times, but again to be expected

Unexpected fun. I went with my grown daughter, I have been to Amsterdam many times and frankly had no desire to go. We went on a Friday afternoon, recommend buying your tickets on line first saves time . The tickets come with 2 beers in the bar at end of tour. The experience is very interactive and fun. The staff are very knowledgable and each stop is a little different, there is even what I would call Disney like event station. There is a Q&A station and if you get answer , you get a small beer, they even show you how you are supposed to drink beer ! It was a fun time!

Heineken VIP Experience. If your going to visit Heineken I highly recommend the VIP Experience. The cost is €50. You get red wrist bands this is for the VIP tour, a guided tour around Heineken, we got to go into the stables and meet the Heineken horses, brought up to the penthouse were you had great views of Amsterdam, brought around the different bars they have in Heineken. You then get brought to this fabulous bar where to guide/host will give you 5 different beers with a variety of cheeses. He will give a detailed description on all and to can enjoy and relax and most importantly drink! You are also gifted with a personalised bottle of Heineken. You get extra free beer with the wristbands. The interactive part of the factory is brilliant craic.You then go and get a free Heineken and go into the James Bond lounge, because you have the wrist bands you get an additional two more beers. We also got tickets for the Heineken boat which brings you to Rembrandt square, luckily that's were we stayed. The Heineken beer on board is €2.50. If you ate thinking about going t Heineken you HAVE to go as a VIP
Special experience. Heineken beer with a special tastevery nice place, I recommend it to everyone visiting Amsterdam. a lot of things to do
Worthless Experience!. I paid 17!! euros for a garbage 'interactive' tour. It's nothing more than a commercial tour, cheaply organized. I don't understand the hype around this.

Brilliant brewery! . Visited here with a friend on Thursday 10th March. For €17 you certainly get your money's worth as you are taken around the brewery and shown a variation of different parts of the history of Heineken starting with the founders right the way through to all of the advertising campaigns. Included in your tour ticket you get two free drinks at the end as well as one on your way around with the chance to win more if you answer some questions about what you've learned so far correctly. The main thing noted by us was the genuine enjoyment the staff seemed to have and were not afraid to answer any questions you had about the brewery or brewing process! A must do if you are visiting Amsterdam!!
Great . Very nice place with ticket about 16 euros I believe it's great for somebody to visit it ! It's in the center of Amsterdam .

Awesome experience if you're into beer. Great tour of the process and overall Heineken history. Doesn't take long, and you get free beer when you complete the tour. It is located ON the tour bus route, so not a lot of walking from the bus to the site...would take the tour again.

nice to see! Interactiveee 80%. Is a nice way to know the beer production.. and if you like beer... my god!! You have people explaining and doing short tastings.. and lots of games that has to do with it.. to help understand.Nice!!

Well run museum/exhibition . Really well organised with brilliant mix of history and interactivity. Lots of fun and good value. We spent a good couple of hours there and got a surprising amount of free beer! Even as someone who really dislikes beer, I'd highly recommend this and had so much fun!
Class!. Really good experience, definitely worth the visit, I've been on both my visits to Amsterdam and had a good time both times

Exceeded expectations. We booked this before we got to Amsterdam, cheaper tickets available online! This was incredible - starting off with the history of the company, moving into how the beer is made, and then the fun and games kick in. Definitely worth going to!
Well worth a visit . Brilliant afternoon enjoyed by all. Definitely worth a visit. Party's of four or more get a munchy box which was a nice touch

A little hokey, but a part of any amsterdam visit. Warning. If you are physically impaired, this attraction has lots of stairs. Its in the old brewery and the tour caters to english speaking tourists but has translators available for others. Walk through part of the brewery, and you get to sample two beers

Worth a visit. This tour wasn't what I was expecting but without giving it all away we spent a few hours here on a Sunday and had a lot of fun.
Pick up discount coupons which are available all over the city in shops and hotels to get 1 euro off per person.

Great experience. Its was a really nice surprise, i thought that it was just a trip to see how beer its made, but its more than that, its a very interactive visit, and in the end you can enjoy a very cold beer.

Fun visit. I actually really enjoyed this museum. It's interactive and the time flew by. While I don't actually like the drink (but the other half does) I still enjoyed the experience and would recommend a visit.
Excellent visit - exceeded expectations. Myself and my husband visited the Heineken experience and we were really impressed with the quality of the exhibit and the helpful smiley staff

Worth a visir. Entertaining morning and worth a visit, very marketing of the Heineken brand but the story behind the company, the brewing process and some games towards the end with the opportunity to try some fresh Heineken made it a worthwhile visit.

Pretty good. It was a pretty cool tour. Some of the elements were really interesting and some were kind of cheesy, but it includes beer that you get to taste and get to learn to pour the Dutch way (i.e., way to much head on the beer for an Australian) and some cool rooms showing off the advertising they've done over the years. If you have a spare hour or two and a spare €18, it's not a bad way to go

Great staff and very good beer. Had a good couple of hours here, it's about 20 mins walk from central Amsterdam and is a great way to learn about beer production. The staff were also fantastic. The only thing I didn't like was towards the end the tour it turned into a Heineken marketing orgy with endless areas for you to take selfies and post them online.I found the Guinness experience in Dublin far better with a great amount of historical information which the Heineken experience lacked.
Good Fun. We went with our 2 sons. Initially I thought it was going to be quite dull but it got better and better. It is very interactive and is a lot of fun. The drink at the end is very welcome

Great value and great experience . We spent over 2 hours finding out how Heineken came about, was made, was rebranded and became a global offering, saw where the original manufacturing was and had 2 glasses of beer each at the end of the tour, great value €16 each adult, definitely recommend as long as you're over 18

A fun day out. We booked skip the line tickets. At the time we went, roughly 11.15, this wasn't necessary. By the time we left though the queue was huge so I'd still recommend booking ahead. The tour itself was interesting and made really interactive and fun in parts. We took advantage of the bottle your own and had a bottle with a custom label made. Be wary though as it can't be put in hand luggage!

So much fun! . I did not think that I will enjoy the Heineken experience so much! Everyone left with smiles on their faces and it was not because of the 2 free beers! Heineken does a top notch job of making the tour fun and interactive throughout! You can even "ride your beer" :-) and customise printed bottles etc. It was truly a unique experience and much more fun than other similar brewery-tours Ive been on. They have a great gift shop- many of the gifts you can customise. So a great stop to even pick up some holiday gifts.

Impressive tour. The facility is beautiful and the tour is totally worth it as it gives a lot of the history of Amsterdam as well as of the famous Dutch brand. There are some interactive displays and even a 'ride'. You get to taste two small beers or one really cold one almost slushy. You can also poor your own, take cool selfies and for a few euros personalise your own bottle. Slainté

Very fun!. Would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Amsterdam. Really fun and interactive experience with 2 free drinks at the end and a drink along the way. Staff were helpful and friendly and made the experience even more fun!

Fun couple of hours!. We spent a fun couple of hours in the Heineken experience. It's quite informative and there are fun areas with photo booths and karaoke (!). Then you get a couple of (small) beers at the end. Boyfriend really enjoyed it!

Low Key Drunk. If you don't have a high tolerance for alcohol, be prepared cause you drink a fair amount of beer by the end of the tour. Besides the beer which is a highlight of the tour, it was really cool seeing the history of Heineken and how they make it. If you find any coupons for this museum use them cause the entrance fee is €18.

Got a Canal Free Ride After Museum Visit. Heineken is a worldwide brand for beer. I like this interactive and informative museum like Heineken Experience. Cost 18 euro per person, we can enjoy the history of the company, how to make beef, learn how to pour beef, shop some merchandise and got a free canal ride into Amsterdam Canal using Heineken private boat.

Fantastic . Well worth the visit . Got the ticket before I came to Amsterdam was unsure if I would like it , but what an experience it was class from start to finish . I would say give your self plenty time to enjoy it , the hole experience was very well organised , plenty fun going around .the lads that were there loved it , ruby games , soccer games and even try being a DJ ... Cycle bikes and sing a karaoke song ,all good fun . Then enjoy a pint or two at the end ..

The highlight of my trip. This is fabulous, would recommend it to anyone it's such a fun day out and the staff are all lovely. Got a slightly discounted ticket price by buying tickets before hand and didn't have to queue, it's a very unique day out would definitely go back
Loved it . After seeing Guiness store house in Dublin expected something similar but it is actually more fun, more interactive and really really great time to spend finished a glass of beer.
Interesting multi-media experience . Buy your tickets online and skip the queue. Very interesting and slick tour - good multimedia experience.

Solid Fun. This was a fun and high-energy "experience", we learned about the brewing process and history of the company, played games, watched the bottles being labeled, saw the Heineken horses, took a little "ride" inside the beer and of course sampled the wares. It was fun but I wouldn't spend a whole day here as there are so many things to see in Amsterdam!
Well worth a visit. This is certainly worth a visit. In a good location. Very informative and you get the sample the heineken!

Had a real good time. Very well structured experience. They never let you get bored with automate audio backgrounds. A lot of interaction involved .. which keeps one occupied. My partner is not a beer drinker but she still enjoyed her time at the Heineken experience. Would definitely recommend to others.
Must see . This is a must stop off when your in Amsterdam.. you get your monies worth and great fun throughout. interactive area of the your really had tou laughing
We had great fun. me and my partner came here last week we learnt alot, had fun, laugh alot and drink beer what more could you want.

So interesting and fun!. I went here with my boyfriend and considering I don't like beer I found it so interesting and extremely fun! The motion simulator ride was so much fun and learning about the beer was cool! You are able to purchase your own personalised Heineken bottle too! (Make sure you drink it before taking it home if you only have hand luggage) very good value for money and 2 free drinks each was awesome!

Amazing!!! . We stayed at dam square this was about a 20 minute walk from this area. Really easy to find - if get stuck use Google maps on smart phones. ️we had already purchased our tickets so got the queue jump which was excellent. Greeted at the venue by friendly staff - bags get searched on arrival which I did find strange.It is a tour you walk around yourself showing the history of heiniken which was shown through Sone interactive TVs and different places to stop. Certain parts were also manned such as the horse section and a little story is told. There are also little trials as you go along and not forgetting an option for Sone fun photos - which get emailed over for free and they only charge 1 euro to get them printed out there. Perfect end to the tour you get some tasters if the beer - which is Lovley especially after finding out exactly how it is made. Excellent shop then selling merchandise with very reasonable prices. Makes perfect personalised gifts with the very good value engraving that is offered. I will Defo come back to this in the future ️️Excellent morning out.

It's all about the experience.. Let's face it you're probably not going to learn a lot about brewing but we had a cracking laugh. Place had a real good buzz about it mainly generated by the enthusiastic staff and quirky features such as photo booths and green screens that you could email free. In the good old UK, how much would that cost?! Wouldn't need to go back again, once you've done it, you've done it but it was extremely enjoyable and I would have to say the beer tasted super.

Need I say more . It surely as the name goes , it's quite a experience to see the history of Heineken and how they have grown !! You can try of the fresh brewed Heineken beer ,you can put in your hands and try making the beer , lotts to do . Must experience !!

Informative and Fun Tour. It was really a pleasant experience. you get the chance to learn about the history of the company and the beer making process. Plus that it's a great place to meet people, there is a beer tasting stop during the tour and the tour ends in the lounge where you have a coupon for 2 cold beers.The staff are very very friendly. I forgot my camera at the shop and left. Went back running from 2 tram stops away to find that they already labelled and placed the cam in the lost and found. I told them that my souvenir bottle fell and broke while i was running back to the place, they immediately offered a new one for free and helped in cleaning my wounds.Great Experience and ill even do it again. Cheers

super. i think this gonna stay for ever. a very interesting visit even better than some museums. you learn the whole history from heineken and you taste some beer too. some attraction are there like virtual photos and video and you can even customise your own bottle
Fun experience . Good for entertainment. A lot of Heineken interesting history and fun. Plenty of surprises and a pleasant staff. Marketing at its best.

Learn how beer is created. This is a good place to learn on how to make a beer. They have interactive scene, great guide, and huge factory! There's also interactive room, where we can create video, photo, and even our own bottle of beer. At extra cost, of course. Then, at the end of the journey, they provide 1 glass of heer for FREE!! I'm a moslem and I don't drink, do I can't really tell how ot tasted. But from what I heard, the beer is far more better than the one that people drink at pubs, bars or in cans. You have to visit this place when you're in Amsterdam.
Loved it. Was the most interactive museum we have ever been too! Great your guides who knew their stuff. Easy to get too! Would recommend and would go again!

So crowded. We bought our ticket online while waiting on the line. So you can pass that crowd and enter the inside easily. We went Saturday therefore we waited every step to take a tour. The most enjoyable part is 5d cinema. It was built on a really big area even you see horses :) I heard that there is a show on the horse barn but you should ask before you go.

Fun time. . Loved this experience. It was extremely fun and full of activities. The whole way around the brewery is interactive. All the staff are very friendly and the free pint at the end is spot on!
Quality . 16 euros for are really interesting and first class experience. Great way to spend 1-1.5 hours and getting a couple of beers too...

Excellent!. Really good, interesting & entertaining and well worth the money. It's a trip through the ages of Heineken and it's really interactive with lots of things to have a go at (with a few free drinks along the way!). We also got the free canal trip after the tour which was good. I booked our tickets online direct on the Heineken website before we went to Amsterdam for 16 euros each, and for everything that's included it's an absolute bargain. Advance ticket holders can just walk straight through so no hanging around. Great way to spend a few hours!

Very busy. We have been here several times before but not for over 6 years. It was nice that there have been some changes and is a really enjoyable experience but it was extremely busy and felt we were pushed through some of it. Definitely worth a visit though and the beer is fab.

Stag party weekend . Went here as part of a stag party weekend trip. We had a fabulous time and was way beyond our expectations. It was great value and alot more than just looking at a few empty vats. Was very informative, loads of samples of Heineken, a fab afternoon

Fun experience. I went with my boyfriend (who is a massive beer fan) and wasn't sure what to expect. I don't like beer very much but this was a really good experience. I would definitely recommend buying tickets online beforehand because it means you can skip the queues which can be quite long. At the start you go through some galleries about the family and the history of the beer and then a member of staff explains the ingredients and brewing process. You can personalise your own bottle too which is a cool thing to do. We waited for ages to go on the ride which is a simulator that takes you on the journey of the beer with some effects and it was quite fun. There are also areas where you can take photos in booths and videos and email them to yourself. There are two bars, in the first you get a small glass of beer for free and in the second you can use your two tokens for either two small beers or one extra cold larger beer. In the bars there were no seats and the floor was so sticky. The shop at the end has a very wide variety of merchandise. I would say it is pretty good value for money and a must do for all beer lovers...and even those who aren't the biggest fans!

Definitely an experience. This was probably the best thing we did in Amsterdam. The tour was pretty good, the building inside is lovely and the brewing process was interesting, the staff knew their stuff. The good bits came after that including a virtual simulation of the making process, photo opportunities, the history of the advertising, collaborations with sports teams, dance areas and 2 free drinks (half pints).Pro Tip - If you do it on your birthday you get a free hat and more free beer

Wow. Visited 6/3/16 and I already can't wait to go back in fact I didn't want to leave! The tour is fully informative and interactive at partsome With a short 4d film. You get 2 free drinks in the bar area ☺☺☺☺☺.

A must go and see if in Amsterdam. Fantastic experience, extremely interactive and knowledgeable. Lots of free beer to be had and afterwards a canal boat trip in with the price. You are then taken to a Heineken gift shop where you will receive a free glass. Brilliant value for money and would highly recommend for everyone young and old alike

Only marginally better than a pint. This is an exercise in branding. The target audience is clearly younger drinkers, and the history of the company itself is glossed over extremely rapidly before the Tour moves you on to the interactive stuff. Some neat multi-media stuff towards the end, but it all comes at a cost, and frankly I'd rather buy a beer in a local pub than look at Heineken's history of sports sponsorship.....

Okay Experience. The Heineken Experience is an okay tour through the history of the company and the beer brewing process. They do not go into enough detail on the brewing process, and there is a lot of idle standing around waiting in line. The museum does a good job of covering Heineken sports sponsorships. On the plus side, you do get a good amount of free Heineken beer (~5 bottles) included in the ticket price. The resulting buzz is probably better than the experience itself.

Half pint. Interesting but ridiculous to lack the opportunity to sell a pint.
You only get a small drink unless you forfeit your two tokens for 1 pint as opposed to 2 smaller drinks. They simply don't want u to sit/loitre/socialise. It's 18e so a pint X2 should be standard.

Really enjoyable visit, fun and informative and free beer!. Really informative, learnt lots about the Heineken family, very good hands on stuff to do. Added bonus of lots of lovely free Heineken to drink. Good for all ages even those who are too young to drink beer.

Great day out . We visited the Heineken Experience while in Amsterdam after receiving an offer for cut price entry tickets. We weren't really sure what to expect and I'm not much of a lager drinker so wasn't sure I'd enjoy it. In fact there is so much to see and do that we ended up inside for four hours, which was excellent value for money and is testament to what an enjoyable time we had. My husband enjoyed many free samples of Heineken as he ended up with mine as well! The experience has been really well thought through so there's plenty of interactive things to do, parts where the tour is guided and parts where you can wander at your own pace. My favourite part was being able to personalise a bottle of Heineken to take home, which is a lovely souvenir of our holiday.

Cheers. An experience worth experiencing when in Amsterdam...Go thru the experience of how Heineken is brewed and than indulge your self invaluable couple of glasses of chilled beer and buy original merchandise...CHEERS!!!

Well worth a visit . Absolutely amazing! Visited there September 2015 with my girlfriend all staff are brilliant and really helpful! Not a boring at all, great experience and free beer too! Don't forget to take the free Heineken boat back to the centre of Amsterdam after the whole thing! If you get a chance to visit, DO IT!!

Better than expected.... Staff were all super friendly, we managed to sneak in at 10pm before there were any crowds, but by the time we left it was pretty busy, be warned!Loved that the tour starts like you're in a pub, lots of cool historic memorobilia before hitting the factory areas. There's quite a few presentations and things to learn before hitting up the taste test, a cool lounge and all the interactions and games before ending up at a bar at the end.Very enjoyable, well worth a visit.

Well worth the money. We were there for around 3 hours. It was a very enjoyable and informative experience. Everyone seemed to enjoy themselves and the glass of beer half way round was a nice surprise. There were lots of activities to try and the shop was not too expensive
Highly recommend . Very fair price for a good 2 hour or so entertainment. Had a wicked time, plenty of free beer. Just dont go around lunch time it was mobbed!!

Good trip. Don't let the start deter you - it gets netter. To start with it was a self guided tour with various information on the company/family. It wasn't very engaging and a little boring for us. Once we got to the section where staff were talking about the production of the beer etc it was a lot more enjoyable. There were also some machines where you could take pictures etc and have it emailed though to you which is a nice memory of the experience. Good trip. Don't let the start deter you - it gets better.

Good way to spend a couple of hours and get a couple of beers. This was much more of a piece of 'experiential marketing' than I'd anticipated - a bit of museum piece up front about the history, then a bit of looking at the old equipment, but from there on it was very much about the brand, it's advertising and marketing etc. Cool to find out how it's made and have a couple of nice cold beers at the end, but I wouldn't prioritise it over some of the other major attractions this great city has to offer.

Weekend away . We decided to take a trip around the Heineken Experience. We really enjoyed it tasting the beer as you was going around. It shows you all about the history and how the beer it's made I do recommend it. A good trip whilst u are in Amsterdam

Quite okay :)). First of all should be mentioned that Heineken museum must be on your list !
Definetely it was fun/ good experience. Probably we could spend whole day there.
The problem was, that we waited in line too long, but it worth it.
Very enjoyable . We went and enjoyed it a lot not to much boring stuff but more fun stuff if you go to amsterdam you should go its fun

Fun way to spend a wet afternoon. This is a good attraction. A bit of education and a bit of technology and fun to distract you. No longer a working brewery but there is a working bar for a glass at the end of the tour.
Heineken museum beer. It's a good experience to know how to make the best beer, i love this place it's fun many games and photo booth and you can drink the best Heineken beer very tasty and fresh 👍.
Canny little day out. Was better than I expected. Lots of interaction and even a ride! Few drinks at the end and boy can you taste the difference!

It was...okay . It was very busy when we went so we had to queue a lot even inside. It seemed to be more catered towards football fans, which we are not so we couldn't really interact with much. Supposed to have free WiFi inside too but that didn't work, so the queuing was extremely tedious. Overall, I would recommend it only for avid football fans, if you're just interested in the beer itself then just go to a bar and save yourself some money.

Bear with it!. As a travelling party of two older adults and 4 late teen/ early twenties, we all thought a visit to the Heineken Experience would be good. It isn't cheap! When we went, some of the site tour magazines had discounts off entrance fee plus you do get two free drinks!When you first go in the museum, it is labels and posters and pictures telling a story. It does go on a bit. In fact it goes on to a point where you think, 'have I really paid to see this'! However you suddenly come to a room with brewing vats and the whole thing becomes far more interactive. The second part of the tour was far more enjoyable to us than the first part. I'm still not convinced it was worth the entrance fee we paid however, having said that, I'm glad we visited it,

Heineken fun with friend. Had a really enjoyable visit here, staff were great. Had a good giggle at being a bottle!Also enjoyed pouring our own drink, making a video of us biking through Amsterdam. Definitely recommend it. However it was more of a walk out of the centre so may need to get a tram.

Mainly aimed at young lads. The experience has lots of videos and interactive games but in the main it is focussed at young lads ie football games and videos so don't really learn that much. All in English apart from a view information boards in Dutch. Bit of a laugh for a group of friends but otherwise would not bother.

Husband loved it. Nice day out, better for the men I guess. Good value for money as you get free beers included in the price. Took a while to get round it all, was in there for a good few hours. There's a lot of fun things to do there as well as learning about the history of Heineken.
Great day. Had a great time in here, would have been a 5/5 simply had there been more alcohol. Great staff, great little tour! Lots of interactive stuff and a very impressive venue.

Great Experience! . Had an amazing day at the Heineken Experience, would definitely recommend to anyone who is visiting! Great day out caters for all. Staff very friendly and helpful! You even get 2 small beers per person!

Great tour, well worth a visit.. As a publican and Heineken drinker then this tour was a no-brainer for me, I was impressed with the whole set up, the art work and the history of Heineken, including a brief explanation into the brewing process etc. My girlfriend has a wheat allergy and can't drink beer but she enjoyed the whole experience too, so it's not a necessity to like beer. One disappointment was I didn't find the beer to be exceptional, I find a Heineken at home is just as good if not better, also the Heineken in the bars was awful too..
I love it!!!. Visited the factory & the way how Heineken was made. I designed my own mug which is cost 10 euro for 2 with my name on it. They also have free engravings. I miss Amsterdam!!!
Good time. Took the family and learned how to poor draft beer, kids loved seeing the horses and games. I liked the beers and learning about Heineken Beer.
Must Visit!!. It was a great experience. we had lots of fun in our tour and off course just can not leave without our personalized bottle.

Totally worth the visit. I thought it was quite expensive after I saw the ticket price but in the end I think was totally worthed. Is is very good organized, a lot of sections to visit, very interactive and drinks and music in the end.

Highlight of our holiday. The Heinken experience was the highlight of our holiday. Being a young couple that aren't particularly interested in seeing the museums in Amsterdam, the Heinken experience was a great afternoon out for us.The design of the building and the overall experience is modern, quirky and very attractive. There were many different rooms filled with historic tales of Heinken all designed in funky, artistic and unique ways. Some of the rooms also contained interactive games which were fun and suitable for all ages.The staff were excellent, super confident and friendly, being very informative and I thoroughly enjoyed learning about the Heinken story.

Very Fun!. The experience is nicely planned and organized. The staff is great. You will learn about the Heineken history and brewing process on a fun interactive way. The tour is very fun and nice, you can make some pretty cool shots in their rooms.After the tour you will even get 2 small pints of Heineken, so it ends up being a fairly cheap attraction. I highly recommend it!
Afternoon trip. €18 for the standard tour, worth a visit to find out more about how the brew the beer and the history behind it. Good gift shop & roof top terrace bar was a nice touch!
Cool experience . We've beed here in a short visit to Amsterdam ...it's an awesome experience that you need to have ...nice story and good beer ...you should not miss this if you have the occasion

Great fun. . My girlfriend and I really enjoyed the Heineken Experience. It was a nice change from walking the streets of the city. It is priced reasonably. The free beer we received was a bonus and it was delicious. Good fun to be had here.

Heineken Experience. The Heineken Expierence is a must for Amsterdam. We booked our skip the line tickets ahead of time so getting in was a breeze. The first leg is a bit underwhelming and there is a bit of a wait to get to the main attractions. Once you get to the good part though it is fabulous!

BE THE BEER. My friend who had been here before gave us the recommendation and we were glad that we came. The staff was friendly, energetic, and passionate about Heineken. You get to learn about the beer and taste it during different steps in the making, of course the final product as well! You travel on a unique journey, where you are the beer. See it for yourself! The custom beer bottles was cool! I have already recommended this to a friend who is traveling to Amsterdam soon.
Interesting & interactive. An interesting visit about Heineken and beer production. You get a chance to taste beer along the process - and of course the perfect pint of Heineken at the end.
Heineken Tour. This is a must see experiences, a very informative tour with loads of fun for all. There is plenty to see and do for all ages. And yes, you get to taste the beer!

Fun, worth a trip if you have time. Fun place, thought it was going to be really boring but it has loads of things to do the whole way round. Is not just a boring museum and has things for kids too even though its about beer

A great tour, interactive and fun! . We bought combined tickets for the Heineken experience and a blue boat tour and saved 3euros each. The tour was well laid out, easy to navigate and very informative whilst being fun as well. The history of the brewery is very interesting and thanks to interactive displays and features such as being taught how to pull the perfect pint, was a very interesting experience. The shop was quite expensive I thought but overall a good was to spend a rainy day
Queues. Went with my friends, spent most of the time there in queues waiting to see small exhibits for a few minutes before joining another queue, but you do get 2 free small beers

Surprised me!!. Went along to this not expecting much as it was my boyfriend that desperately wanted to go to this. I can safely say that this was one of my highlights of visiting Amsterdam. I'd recommend it to both groups and couples. The tour starts off with telling you a little about how the beer is made and the history of the Heineken name. Then it moves into some more interactive sections which were really great fun. You get to learn how to pour the perfect beer and you also get some free beers included with your ticket. We also purchased some personalised beer bottles which are now pride of place on our mantlepiece. Very interesting and very fun place to visit, they also offer a free complimentary canal cruise after the tour which was great although it does take you to the Heineken shop near Rembrandtplein to try get you to buy more stuff! Very good value for €20 each.

Excellent. Wasn't sure what to expect but was pleasantly surprised. Been to many tours off this kind but really enjoyed this one, it has been brought up to date with a lot off new tech used in displays. Well worth a visit.

Great start to an evening out in Amsterdam. I'm not a big fan of beer, but found the tour pretty fun and interactive. We got it a little cheaper with the I Amsterdam city card and we went just before closing and by the time we'd got through our free beers (and a few from extra tokens given to us by strangers) in the bar area, we were very much in the mood to enjoy the Amsterdam nightlife. All in all a pretty fun experience.

fun experience. as avid beer drinkers we planned to visit here during our stay in amsterdam, glad we did it was a really fun experience and interesting to see how heineken is brewed. a beer half way through was good then two beers at the end but if you choose to learn how to pour your perfect pint they take both tokens out so you only get the one drink you poured but then a certificate to say you poured a perfect pint. i of course wanted to pour my own but when seeing my friends two tokens taken away i opted for my two beers in the bar!all in all a really good couple hours in there and it makes you appreciate heineken much more!

Good Experience. Awesome experience, very interesting and the booze was great!! Awesome start to a day out for me and the missus, the staff were friendly and very knowledgable about the site and the product. ❤️
Great day! . Had lots of fun here. Loads to do within the experience even a little stimulator ride! Lots of history too. Can have a tour guide or go by your self. Defo worth the visit

Fun day out. Visited today more for my boyfriend then me but enjoyed it a lot more then expected. Lots of interesting information, great friendly staff and 2 free drinks at the end but you do actually get one as you walk around. Great adult day out.

Brew your ride. . The overall experience was very good; interesting history and captivating material. However the staff tolerated the crowd and didn't seem to be genuinely enthusiastic. The product material was presented very well in a good chronological order of the history of the company - I felt like some of the displays were empty shelled and were only there because of contractual reasons (the horses and stables for example). Overall good; free beer, good atmosphere and worth the price. It's simply something that you've got to do whilst in Amsterdam. Background information: aged 21, group of 5, all love beer.

Really good morning out, with free beer!. I surprised my husband with a trip to Amsterdam for his Birthday, and pre-booked tickets to the Heineken Experience beforehand. The tickets aren't for specific dates so you can just slot it in whenever you like. It's right near the Museumplein, and is a lot bigger than I was expecting! There's several floors where you can explore the brewing process, and ride rides and play games that get you involved in the experience. You can also learn to pull the perfect pint (and take away a certificate to say that you can) - and drink it afterwards! There are tasters included, as well as a lesson on how to properly taste your beer! It was a great day out (and the tasters were exactly the hair of the dog we needed after two days hanging around the Red Light District....) The only thing I would say is if you don't like flagrant self promotion (or Heineken) then perhaps give it a miss!

PROOST!!. Excellent, fun and very interactive, laughed quite a lot on the tour, for free beer. What more could you want?!?! Takes a few hours to get through so don't expect to be in and out in an hour, you walk through on your own, tour guides are in places but you don't follow.

Not a "must go". Apart from the 2 glasses of heineken you can have at the of the tour, the place is not worthy of your time.
Very "Disney" like, with 4D simulations and the history of the company.
The ticket to get in is outrageous. 18 euros!

Worth a visit just for the tasting!. Having been to the Guinness Factory in Ireland, I was prepared for the same type of exhibit and I was not disappointed. It doesn't take very long to get around the beer museum, learning the history and the facts of brewing Heineken, including the 'thrill ride' or 3D movie on how the beer is made which is interactive and fun. Of course, the tasting is every ones highlight with a full three beers inclusive in the ticket price, you are bound to enjoy your time regardless!Great for adults but I would say kids would get bored and wouldn't appreciate the visit.

Interesting but rushed. Very good but not in the same league as the Guinness brewery in Dublin. It felt that you were being pushed around due to the number of people following. The trip took about two hours, which included the 2 drinks included with your entrance fee 16 Euros adult, 12.5 Euros for children.Remember, if you flew in with hand luggage only then you cant take and beer presents back with you. We were told this after we had ordered a labelled bottle present and completed the payment process.. it appeared on the Good Bye screen.If you are on the city Hopper bus or boat cruise then you can be dropped off to do your tour and then continue by catching one of the subsequent tours.

History + Manufacturing + fresh beer. It all starts with the old Heineken delivery cart loaded with barrel's of beer at the entrance. Evolution of the Heineken beer bottle, logo and the history. A brief of how a beer is made. A view on how they were dependant on horses those time. Few innovative brand building areas and finally fresh glasses of beer. Think, Heineken became my favourite right after this drink. A few souvenirs to buy at the exit is worth it.
Really good and interactive.. Well worth a visit, great for all ages, don't mind if you take your baby too. Well worth the money. We were there for a good couple of hours and you get free beer!!

Good afternoon activity. We spent a rainy afternoon at the Heineken experience, we weren't sure what to expect but it is really good fun. The experience itself does offer good value for money as you get a lot of beer! There are lots of different fun activities/selfie opportunities throughout the tour. On entry you are given a wrist band that you can redeem for two beers but at parts of the tour there are opportunities for more including a beer tasting session! I would recommend it to anyone looking for a fun afternoon, I wasn't keen on beer when I went in but I really enjoyed the experience.

A must for drinkers!. The place is well designed for a drinkers experience. Information about how the brewery came about, see the big tanks they brew the lager in, see shire horses. Onto the games room, where you can pretend to be on screen in a sporting event or karaoke video. Finally on to the bar, where the staff informed us how to drink beer and then you could have an opportunity to either pull a pint yourself or get served by their staff, using your tokens However as I don't drink much at all. I did not enjoy the experience as much as someone who does. Also I felt the cost of the ticket which included two lager tokens was overpriced, especially as I didn't drink any of it.
2nd visit and great. Love this factory such a great experience, got personal bottles made and sent to Ireland using the Albert heijn supermarket, deff worth a visit

Amazing and interactive!. There is so much to do at this museum! You learn lots about how they make beer and how to drink the beer! (Which I won't ruin for you! But it opened my eyes!) You can even play Fifa!! We went on Valentine's Day and they took free photos of us holding love hearts! Just amazing! You get tokens for beer and you get a little tester when you are learning how to drink beer! They even have horses there! A must see if you're in Amsterdam! X

What a rip off. Avoid . After paying the ridiculous fee to get in me and my fiancée spent our time hearing about how great Heineken beer is and how important their brewing process etc is. We had a whole talk on the importance of beer being fizzy and frothy etc. We were funnelled through corridors of commercial nonsense and over to a bar at the end for our much anticipated 2 free drinks.The queue was huge and I was shoved two beers by the lady at the bar. When I went to sit down I realised they had given me a dead one, with no froth or fizz. No problem I thought and took it back only to be told by the bartender that i couldn't have a replacement because it was my fault and I must have stood there for too long with it. She then turned her back and served somebody else. I don't think I've ever been treated in such an arrogant way when buying a beer, let alone when in a brewery.I wrote an email complaint to Heineken to give them an opportunity to respond and they didn't bother. Says it all really. Total waste of money and a shambles. Avoid avoid avoid like the plague.

I don't even drink beer!!!!. I did the Heineken Experience tour when I visited Amsterdam on a one day trip with friends and I loved every minute of it, though I don't even like beer. The tour is very popular with a long queue to enter so I'll advice to purchase your ticket online prior to going so that you can skip the ticket queue and just go right in. The whole staff are amazing and active - they are very good at keeping the tour exciting especially for someone who did not care about doing the tour in the first place. If you are visiting Amsterdam, please make this one of your places to visit. You will thank me later...oh and the gift shop is just the icing on the cake.

FREE BEER!. It was a bit of a distance from my hotel and is not exactly in the centre but was worth it when I got there. The history behind it all was interesting and the virtual ride thing was pretty good.
