There is plenty of things to do in there such as play the PS4, rugby kicking game and a scrum game as well.We got talking to the guys/girls that worked there and got plenty of free beers which certainly help the experience haha. It was 100% worth it.

Fun Time. I was pleasantly surprised by this. It was longer than I thought and nicely interactive. We got three beers in total (one in the tasting room and two at the end)We came on Sunday afternoon and there was no queue whether you pre bought tickets or not. Definitely worth the money if you like to drink Heineken!!

Classic must do in Amsterdam . Had some really nice features in this tour, old school brewery, they don't look like that anymore. Don't want to spoil it all but it is worth it. Only warning, if you are a light weight drinker like me, steer clear of the small taster, very strong. Nice feature, learn to pour the perfect Heineken with sexy trainer. My only issue was the queues, traffic could be better directed.
Far better than expected.. Great experience and well worth a visit. Far better than a lot of brewery tours I have been in before and you get at least 3 beers with your entrance fee

Fab couple of hours. Firstly get discount coupons before you visit, there everywhere in the city. Had a brill time, factual and interactive fun, we had a giggle. There's a 3D show, sample beer to show the correct way to drink, games, photo opportunities and they will e mail over photos and videos. And then 2 more beers in the bar at the end. As we were leaving the gift shop we were offered a canal cruise and after go to other gift shop and get a free glass...what a bargain!!

Fantastic experience . This is so much more then we expected. Of course there is the informative tour, historical memorabilia and tasting sessions. But what we didn't expect was the horses, 4D experience though the bottling process and interactive displays. All the staff were fantastic, each and everyone friendly and helpful.I completely recommend this to everyone. If you are even thinking of grabbing a beer in a nearby bar, go here first. The entrance fee includes 2 free beers/soft drinks per person.There were even a few kids around who seemed to really enjoy the experience.

You will be buzzed ! . The Heineken experience was awesome ! You get two drinks included with your admission. A lot of walking but you will see many cool things including how the famous beer is made. It's definitely tastier here, the last part of the tour is pretty fun. My friends and I had an amazing time here

More promising that it seems, overall OK. The first part of the tour is technical, about how they make the beer. The second part has interactive games, some of which are nice, others are a bit lame.The experience includes a beer tasting in the middle, and at the end, an option for 2 250ml beers or one ice cold 350ml beer. I went with my 18 year old son (at his request). I think the only lasting impression he has is that beer is better when it is ice cold... Oh, and buy tickets online, save a couple of Euro and a wait on line.

Cool to see. Definitely a cool place to see. I highly recommend buying your tickets ahead of time at the Heineken experience website, otherwise you will be waiting for a long time to get in. We went on a Saturday at 3 pm and waited only 20 minutes with our pre bought tickets. Please know that there are two lines to get in; pre bought tickets are to the left and everyone else to the right. Once the tour is over you go to the tasting room. The line for the tasting room was crazy long. By luck we happened to take the elevator up to the 6th floor rooftop bar. Now THAT was cool! Not crowded at all, great view of the city, and the bartenders were really fun! Cheers!

Heineken know how to have fun!. This is a great experience. Lots of fun, especially in a group! The tour is good, but the free beer and fun Dutch tour guides make it great. A very modern brewery, which takes you through its history, great beer and its ingredients. Very much recommended!

Presently surprised. I had been to Amsterdam before and made a point to stay away from the generic touristy things. However on my second trip to Amsterdam I decided to visit this tour as many of my friends had said good things. We purchased our tickets from a stall in the middle of town beforehand which helped us skip the long line. The tour itself was interactive and interesting. You also get around 3 drinks included in the ticket price so this is a bonus.

The queuing experience. I was rather disappointed with my experience with the brewery tour. Displays were rather dull, smalls rooms rapidly became overcrowded, and I quickly began to loose interest. There were a lot queues, so be prepared to wait. The staff were excellent though, very friendly, and engaging.The best part was the tasting at the end. You will get two tokens which buys you two 250ml glasses, which I would recommend using in the upstairs bar. Great views over Amsterdam...providing you get a clear day!

Always ask about the canal ride!. Couple of hints before I review.Get the tickets online or at one of the attraction shops where it's a reduced price. We went straight there then after walking around saw at least 4 shops selling tickets at a discount!On the way out of the experience ask for canal ride tickets. It's a free tour on a Heineken canal boat where they show you buildings and tell you some history. Also bottles of Heineken on board are €2.50. The ride takes you to the Heineken store and you get a free mini Heineken glass! Definitely worth it.The experience itself was great. We had a lot of fun wandering around the rooms, taking our time to really read and enjoy it. It was very busy and felt rushed at times by other groups coming in but honestly, it's worth taking the time. We had a go at most things it has to offer, it's really interactive so can see why kids are allowed in.The staff who did the tastings and presentations were great, a good laugh and we thoroughly enjoyed the time we spent there!
Fun!. This started off like any brewery tour but the addition of the "Brew You" ride and the walk through the horse stables was different and fun!

Good morning out. Visited Feb 2016, purchased tickets online before leaving for trip. Lovely helpful staff , spotlessly clean facilities, cloak room to leave hats,coats etc(no charge). The tour was very informative, with a couple of glasses of Heniken thrown in.Great morning out. Enjoy.

Just a little dull. The first half of the experience is a bit dull. The second half gets better as it becomes more interactive with beer pulling, tasting and so on,a very sensory experience. Liked it.

Interactive experience . Highly recommended if you aren't the type who likes to read static signs to get information. Entrance fee comes with 2 free beers. If you want more, pay attention to info because you will get one more for each question correctly answered.

The great experience in Amsterdam. If you are alcohol lover, especially beer, you have no reason to miss this place. They show you the history of Heineken and all the products such as bottles and advertisements appearing in their long history. You may know more about the processing of beer and taste the unfinished beer. Finally, the ticket including two beer for you to try their premium beer. I really recommend people to visit there and have fun.
Amazing place. One of the most unique and most interesting museums I've ever visited. The experience is amazing, it's very nicely organized, lots of facilities and things to see and do.
Excellent tour. Worth doing. . Excellent tour and informative. Purchase tickets online to avoid the Q. Few beers thrown in with the ticket price. Definitely do this when in Amsterdam

Heineken know how to do advertising!. Really cool factory tour. They teach you a fair amount about the process. Most impressive is their marketing and advertising sections towards the end of the tour. We went at 3pm on a Saturday and there were a few queues but avoid this time and apparently the queues are nonexistent. We started queuing outside to get in but managed to book tickets online on a phone so jumped the queue. Save your wristbands at the first bar and use them at the sky bar instead!

Lots of fun especially in a group . Good place to spend a couple of hours in. The entry fee includes two 25cl beers (or one 35cl 'extra cold' beer) but you can easily get a few more glasses in the 'tasting room'. Pity the building isn't actually a brewery any more but the interactive displays and fun activities (PS4 games, karaoke, beer pouring etc) more than compensate. Children under 12 go in for free and even get tokens for soft drinks.

Good for a rainy day.. Went here with my boyfriend for the afternoon when the weather wasn't great. I am not a big beer drinker but still enjoyed walking around the experience and there are plenty of things to do and see whilst you are there. You get a wrist band with 2 tokens on which allows you to exchange these for free beers at the end or a soft drink if you'd prefer. All around had a good time but as I personally don't drink beer didn't enjoy it as much as those who do. If you like Heineken though definitely worth a visit.

Fun morning out. Visited on Saturday morning and arrived about 11.30am. We didn't have to queue for that long but we noticed the queue started to grow behind us so wouldn't have wanted to get there much later. The experience is very interactive which made it fun. They also email photos and videos to you for free rather than charging extra! You also get three beers to drink which is good. Very close to the tram stop. This is the second time I have done the experience and didn't find it boring the second time. Would recommend :)

Great tour! . My other half and I pre booked this tour before going to Amsterdam. We didn't have to wait in any que's and enjoyed the tour, I ended up received four free drinks while I was there, so be sure to answer the questions in the tasting room for extra ;)

Touristy but fun. You would assume this tour to be a bit hoaky with all of the gimmicks but it's actually a great look into the brewing process and actually a lot of fun. The beer definitely tastes great straight from the source and the tour is well laid out with something for everyone. I recommend booking your ticket in advance so you can skip the long line to get in.

Good to kill an hr or so. Came here on the wknd as it had been recommended. Overall it was a fun and informative experience and most importantly the free beer at the end (which isnt really free as you have already paid for it!). Lots of merchandise to purchase if your a die hard fan, otherwise a good experience to kill a couple of hours.

A full on Heineken Experience. Very enjoyable, well laid out museum which tells you how the beer is made, with an innovative moving interactive experience showing the journey of the beer through to bottling. One free sample plus two 25cl of Heineken or one 35cl Heineken cold per person could be included.Some of the exhibit is a bit tenuous as relates to marketing links including football and rugby as well as Amsterdam's nightlife!Very enjoyable, well worth a visit

Nothing special but enjoyable.. Its not that cheap at €17 each but you do get a 'free' pint at the end (or 2 half pints). Thre are some fun interactive zones and games and you can go through it at your own pace as its not a guided tour, so we spent about 1hr 40 mins here including having our drink at the end.Its not terribly interesting or surprising and I have heard from others they had to queue for long periods of time to enjoy he interactive zones, thank fully there was no queuing at the time we went in (1.30pm on a Thursday) as it is not worth that.

great fun. my boyfriend and i went and we are both keen beer drinkers. we found the heineken tour a great mix of informative and fun. we went on a friday and it wasn't too busy at all so would recommend going on a week day if possible. would highly recommend to go here and you get a good couple of beers included in the ticket

nice nice nice!. very particular experience! a mix of museum, history, factory, cinema and pub!i really suggest to download on your phone the free tour guide which helps understanding everything!the price is 16 euro if bought on the internet, 18 there.

A Big Advertisement. Learning about the history and how Heineken make beer is very interesting however it turns into a laughable advertisement with their name and logo sprayed everywhere and pointless interactive things you could play with. Still an enjoyable experience but not quite what I was expecting.

Just Okay. I found this to be ok but not really anything to rave about, however my husband very much enjoyed it but I think what he enjoyed was the free glass of beer at the end or two, as I don't drink beer. Yes a free glass of beer is included for every one except minors but soft drink is also available.
Fun for all not just beer drinkers. Informative... Well thought out, capable and engaging staff members. The PS4 and other interactive games also a bit hit for teenage kids...

Great!. What good value for money! We paid €16 as we pre booked tickets day before. The experience is modern bright and keeps you interested at all stages!. You get 2 free beers at the end which were really nice!. As we left we were given a free ticket for a boat ride on the heineken boat this took us back to the center as no cost. It took half an hour and was lovely and informative. Then they show you the heineken shop for your free gift. Would recommend this !

Fantastic experience . This was such a fun experience. Learned some cool facts, enjoyed the interactive side of the visit. We left in great form, the energy in the place is great and the drinks along the way are much appreciated!! It was definitely one of the highlights of our trip. Highly recommended!!

Lots to learn and do!. I don't like lager, but thought this would be an interesting place to visit. You find out all about the history of Heineken and how it is made. There's some good quiz questions at the end and some free lager is up for grabs! I found it useful when they teach you how to drink lager - it actually tasted better! You can buy your own beer bottles with stickers etc and there's loads of cool activities to do inside! Well worth the visit.
Great wAy to spend 2-3 hours. Really nice tour with couple of beers thrown in. Lots of interactive stuff to do and helpful guides who impart interesting information. Definitely worth a visit !

Well worth a visit. Went today €16 per person buy a ticket before you get there and miss the queues as can get extremely busy easy to see why. The 1st few sections are nothing special but then it becomes more interactive the whole experience can take anything from half hour upto a couple of hours you get 2 drinks free at the end but u also get a half for a tasting session and answer a couple of questions and win an extra beer to be honest you can pay €6.80 in a bar or spend €16 go here learn a bit have some fun and get upto 4 drinks really enjoyed it. This has to be Austin do in Amsterdam and well worth combining the ticket with a boat tour ticket saves few euros as well

Enjoyable experience. My boyfriend and I visited the Heineken Experience Amsterdam in December 2015 and we really enjoyed it! From the moment we stepped inside we were immersed in the history surrounding the Heineken family, including their family three and how exactly they began brewing the now famous Heineken beer. There were lots of things to do while inside the Heineken experience, so the €32 entry fee wasn't such a rip off after all. Some things to do inside include learning how to pull the perfect beer, learning how beer SHOULD be drank and plenty of interactive games and activities (I quite enjoyed the DJ'ing)! All in all this was a great day out and would recommend it if visiting Amsterdam.

Even for people who don't like beer. I don't like beer but that didn't matter. It was very interesting and quite interactive and took you through everything from the brewing to the advertising across the years and there were even horses which made my girlfriend very happy. The staff were very knowledgeable and clearly cared about their job and the company. Also free beer at the end. The shop was alright too. Worth the money and a few hours.
Interactive and fun. Not your typical brewery tour, I love the interactive displays you learn so much more. You get your money's worth. Would only do it once though.

Fun Experience. We really enjoyed this tour. It's a self-guided tour, but it's very well structured, and guides you through the museum with short, interesting facts around every corner. Get to know the history and development of the beer and brand, and get some free beer with it :) There are lots of activities to do in the building - lots of games and photo opportunities, so it can be a lot of fun. If you enjoy that sort of thing, plan to spend at least two hours here.

A place for everyone to see . I am a beer drinker and fan of Heineken so it was only fitting that I visit the original brewery. First and foremost purchase your tickets online before you arrive to avoid the queues. The Heineken Experience tells the history of the family and brand. The Heineken Experience combines photos, displays, explanation of the beer making process, interactive ride, and the opportunity to customize your own bottle of beer. Overall it was an interesting and fun experience. The glass of beer at the end is an added bonus.

Rubbish. We visited the Heineken experience after it was recommended to us. I'm afraid we all thought it was rubbish. Extremely busy and hours of queuing. In fact the best bit for all of us was the shop. I would say though go and try it as you might like it! It just wasn't for us

I'm probably not the best person to ask. I don't like beer. But one thing I can say is that they could put a little more history to the tour. Maybe start you off with a drink if you have to walk threw and then listen to the little show... It probably would have been more enjoyable with a drink first. Not my cup of tea but it seemed that most males liked the end, where you could have a drink and hang out in the bar/lounge area. It cost 18 euros a person....I don't know you would think they would pay you to see the history and promote there own beer. We got it as a package deal cruise the canal and Heineken experience. :/. I believe we paid a little under 40 euros for the two of us.
Funny place. Funny place if you like bear. You can discover history and production process, as well as do some activities. Recommend for people who like bear

Weird... But in a good way... A weird, good way.. Well unfortunately I can't actually drink beer... But surprisingly I still had a great time at the Heineken Experience! The exhibits were interesting and interactive and showed you how the beer was made... Then as you get further on it get more fun with interactive exhibits and even a bar at the end. Even if you're not interested in beer it's well worth a look!If you're looking to make some new friends just give out your beer tokens if you're not drinking... I watched a table of 4 sink 16 glasses as people kept on giving them drinks and I was impressed!
Even for people who don't like beer. We ate not that big fans of beer in general, but to see the process and try fresh beer- why not?!Enjoyed the history, taste and different gadgets in there!

Interactive and Fun. Easy to spend couple of hours wandering around. Simple content and a good selection of interactive components. Good way to get an understanding of how the brewing process works and have a few beers! Thanks

Fun and interactive. Spent about 2 or 3 hours here during our weekend in Amsterdam - for a non-beer drinker, I wasn't expecting to be terribly impressed, however thoroughly enjoyed learning about the history of the company, the brewing process, and taking part in all the interactive activities in the sponsorship area. I certainly have a new-found appreciation for Heineken!

Very entertaining!. This is a fun way to spend a couple of hours! As well as being packed with the history of the brewery, it is a fun and interactive tour with lots of things to keep you busy throughout!

A must see in an Amsterdam trip. Great experience in the Heineken Factory. Really interesting tour where they literally brew you like beer is brewed. In the end you get the chance to have a few of them so it's totally worth the time.

Fun and informative!. I personally don't tend to drink beer but I found the whole experience really interesting and there was lots of interactive things along the way which added to the fun! You get a taster drink part way through and then 2 more drinks at the end.. All included in the price! I enjoyed my experience here!!

Great Beer Experience . Ok, so it's the.original Heineken brewery, pretty neat! Volunteer for all the tastings! The beer here tastes nothing like in your country. When finished you get to enjoy some beers in there private brew pub.... if you are nice you will get more than the 2 pints they offer to everyone. ... we got all we could drink, woo whooooo!

Not great, overpriced. For the price you pay I expected a little more. Not that much in the way of actually seeing the beer being brewed and made. It was very quick for the whole experience (we were out in under an hour and we didn't rush) and felt like the people who worked there had no enthusiasm when talking about the beer. This may be because I am comparing it to the Guiness storehouse in Dublin which in my opinion is a lot better, more interesting and interactive. Also no where to sit at the end when you receive your drink (you either can have two small beers or one large beer, however the large is still less than the two small ones). All in all really not worth the money and a bit of a tourist trap.

For beer lovers. Unless you're into drinking beer or love looking into the production line of products you may find this a waste of money!However it is interesting, free beer, games rooms, information rooms and speeches by guides telling you about Heineken! Many good artefacts and even some horses!! Can bottle your own beer with your name on for €6.50 at the end! And a gift shop too with some cool things!Easily accessible by trams and in a great location to do other activities afterwards!

Special for beer lovers . To be honest I'm not a beer lover, but a friend of mine (who has already been in Amsterdam) insisted of visiting the Heineken experience. To be honest it was great to see all the procedure of beer production. The only minus is price, I think it's not worth that much.

Good tour. This is a good tour with lots of interactive fun. Staff are very friendly and helpful. The complimentary canal cruise after was a nice bonus and it was great to get a free ride into the city centre. Well worth a visit.

INTERESTING, GOOD FUN, AND GOOD BEER !!. visited here for the second time in January, after a visit some 4 years ago, and found it to be an enjoyable way to spend a couple of hours on a cold winters day- again !!An interesting, if a little self congratulatory tour includes a look at the history, the brewing process and the advertising campaigns associated with Heineken. Some fun interactions and tasters are also enjoyable.Your ticket price includes 2 beers in the bar at the end of the trip, which I have to say was the best tasting beer I had during my whole Amsterdam trip. coincidence ? probably not.Good fun and worth a visit.

It's fun even if you don't like beer. We don't really like beer (well, a mort subite is nice) but we could not pass on the icon of Dutch beer making. The experience is really fun with the interactive exhibits, from the rugby virtual kicking to the karaoke.

Professional, educational and end u. Well it's a tour. A tour of how the Heineken company was made. And then how beer is made. A whole replica of a factory for making beer is there. Then there would be hot girl telling you how beer is made at one bar. Then another hot girl would give you more information on beer and then u can one small glass of beer. You shall be then entering gaming area where you have to pay for trying most of the things..in the end is bar where u can exchange ur band for two glasses of beer or one glass of beer & 1 certificate. Then heikein boat can drop you in the middle. It's a part of one package . good for beginners. ;)
Day visit . Wasn't really expecting much but I really enjoyed it. Very interactive and surprisingly interesting. An added bonus free beer. It is worth a visit.

Well worth a visit!. One of the highlights of our trip to Amsterdam. The museum has lots of different levels with interactive aspects and a tasting session. It was very enjoyable and informative. You also receive two free drinks per ticket which can be tasted at the end in the bar. We really enjoyed this museum and would highly recommend.

Great Experience would recommend it too anyone!. Great place too visit and value for the money there is loads too do and they aim too take care of everyone who visits. Every question we had was answered well and we were offered plenty of free drinks, gifts and souvenirs. Very interactive place with loads to do and see. Would recommend it too anyone I have visited twice now and it seems to improve with each visit.

Fantastic!. Great few hours in the city and well worth €18. Suits all audiences and could not fault it at all. I would recommend booking with Tours and Tickets so you can get a few euros discount. We combined this with the ice bar and canal cruise and it only cost 81 euros for two people.
Great day!. My fiancé really loves his beer so this was a must! We both really enjoyed this and you get a couple of heineken's out of it too!! Really great day out!

This was our second best experience in Amsterdam!. You get a discount if you have I Amsterdam card which you purchase right across the Central Station. There might be a line but it's worthed. You see the real world of beer, smell the yucky ingredient lol, listen to its story, see horses, watch a brief film which is fun, get to taste 3 beers (beer-tasting session, a bar scene, and getting to fill out your own beer glass. ) Also there are rooms where you can play games, take selfies and later on watch yourself thru videos Heineken sends you. :)

It's mostly about the advertising. If you're looking for a fairly superficial view of the brewing process and the history of Heineken advertising through the years drop in for a visit. Good place to get out of the rain and kill some time.

Enjoyed the experience. Was a little skeptical at first as the ticket was priced at euro 17.50 and was wondering just how much experience can one get from an ex beer factory. Pleasantly surprised, the ticket price included 2 glasses of beer to be redeemed at the end and I definitely liked the whole experience. Got to learn some new things about beer making, history of Heinekken (they seem to be great employers).The highlight for me was the 'Brew You' experience where u stand on a platform that wiggles n jiggles and let's you experience the brew process. There is a simulation area that lets you try pouring beers and tell you how you fair, lots of photo oppurtunities and the 2 glasses of beer at the end are chill and fresh. Surely Worth a visit.

Worth a visit. We pre bought tickets so it was slightly cheaper at €16. This included 2 pints (1 if you want to pull your own pint, which was good fun). The tour gave you the history of Heineken and a brief summary of the brewing process. It was very interactive, and interesting and worth a visit. The staff were very friendly.
Nice beer musem. Heineken Experience is a fun and interesting museum about beer. The price is reasonable, around 10e and that includes few beers to drink during the visit!

Awesome . Lovely way to spend an afternoon. Really informative and a lot of fun. I enjoyed the different aspects of the tour. If you've been to the Guinness Store House tour then you will not be disappointed. They don't like you to take backpacks in and they like you to use the cloakroom, so maybe if you're travelling straight from the hotel then you could leave some stuff behind to save queues. Ticketing was easy, bought online to get a discount and just showed the passbook QR code on the phone. Souvenirs were great (and value for money), personalised glasses and beer bottles.

Great experience! Worth a visit.. This was a great tour. You really need to read everything and take part in all the activities to really appreciate it but definitely worth a visit and it is very interesting. Whilst the Guinness factory sticks to being traditional, Heineken has tried to appeal to the younger generation as well as all the history.

18 EUR very well spent. This was a great experience, the history of the company, the process to brew, touching, feeling and tasting the raw ingredients and intermediate product, and finally, the beer itself. The price of the ticket includes 2 drinks, and you can manage another drink or two during one of their demos... A must do when in Amsterdam

Brilliant, great fun and interesting! . Me and my boyfriend visited here on 15th Feb. This was more for my boyfriend than me however once we were in there I found it really interesting and fun! It was good to see how they make the beer and there was loads of different rooms and sections on the tour. I personally liked the 4D room, the make your own beer bottle and the photo booths. We also got 3 free drinks with our ticket! The gift shop at the end was actually reasonable priced for once. I would recommend pre booking your tickets to avoid queues.

Glad I went and not only for the free beer!. I wasn't sure about the Heineken Experience but decided to do it anyway and I am glad I did. Not only did I get numerous amount of free beer but I also had a lot of fun. You learn how Heinekien is made, the history of Heinekien, how to pour a pint, lots of games etc. I do highly recommend for all ages and all groups.

Well worth the 25 Euros. This is truly one of the most unusual tourist attractions that it has been my pleasure to visit. The tour starts with a short history of Heineken and how the company involved into the multinational conglomerate that it is today. You then experience how beer is made visiting parts of the original brewery and even the stables which are still home to some the horses that parade through the city. Finally your ticket includes 2 glasses of beer or soft drink alternative. We saw plenty of families on our tour, but of course they did not get to experience the glasses of beer. One tip. Try lunch on the roof, great views across the city.
Best thing we did in Amsterdam!. Great value for money, interactive experience, takes a few hours, and well worth it for the mini taster beer and 2 beers (1 pint) you get at the end!

So much fun! But pre-book!. First things first... even if you don't like beer this is a fundamental thing to do when in Amsterdam! But i'd advise pre-booking! Although you don't save any money from pre-booking, you still avoid the queues (when present).The history of Heineken beer and what ingredients go into it is very interesting. The tour itself is interactive and there are several ways that Heineken has had an impact/based products on sports out of the ordinary! You are given a wristband and you can swap the buttons on your wristband for either 2 drinks or 1 extra cold drink (Recommend the latter!). There is also a mini tasting session in the actual tour, too. The drinks area has such a good relaxed vibe and ambiance.After you do the tour, find someone dressed in a white jacket at the entrance, they'll give you a voucher to get something free from the brandstore! (A free canal shuttle away or a 15 minute walk!).Overall, a very, very enjoyable experience!

Great afternoon at the Heineken Experience. Spent our final afternoon here, great experience. Everything is quite new and well set up, you learn a lot about the brew and the history of the company. It was nice and relaxed and enjoyable. Make sure you remember at the end when you get to the bar that there is a rooftop area where you can get your comp drinks - through the doors in the gift shop and up! Great views of Amsterdam from the top

waste of time. buy your own beer. booked tickets here following a good recommendation. people had said they had spent 3 hours here as it was so interesting. it was the most boring thing in the whole. took us an hour and a pathetic excuse for a ride to find our way out. the best bit was the free drink at the end which you could've bought cheaper in a pub nearby in comparison to the price of the ticket.

Brilliant!. Loved this place a lot! Our hostel was the other side of Amsterdam so took a while to walk but when we got there it was wonderful! As soon as we walked in we were directed as to where the beginning of the tour was and we were given wristbands for our free drinks. The tour was self guided with lots of information available. Near the end there was a photo booth which was quite fun and was free, however there were a few other activities to do which were not free. All in all it was a great experience and I would highly recommend it!

Robson. A great experience had by the both of us!Quite a lot to see whilst in there, great interactive tour. Tasting of the water and barley which is two of the four ingredients to make Heineken! Also, you can pour your own beer and get a certificate which was fun! Lots to be seen around the place! Definitely worth a visit! I'd book in advance though if you are visiting....

Worth a Look. Make sure you buy your ticket from a booth rather than at the Experience as you'll save yourself a couple of euros. I'd never been to a brewery before so this was interesting and the games and bar area afterwards made it interesting for me.
Boring until the tasting 😄. I found this tour quite boring until we got to the beer tasting. Then the experience picked up and by the end and several drinks later I loved it

Worth a visit but expect queues. . Firstly, the queue was quite long for people that hadn't bought tickets in advance. However I am a genius and it only took me 2 minutes to buy tickets online while in the queue so we could walk straight in. It was busy inside and we found ourselves waiting in queues and not really knowing what they were for. The 4D 'simulator' had about a 25 minute queue and I'm not sure it was really worth it. At the end of the tour you can either get two 250ml glasses of Heineken or one 350ml glasses of 'Extra Cold' Heineken. All in all it was ok - but the House of Bols museum/tour was more enjoyable and a lot less busy!
one giant ad!. It felt like we were in one giant green Heineken ad! Yes, it was interesting to see how they make the beer, however other Brewery's are far more interesting!

Good beer,interesting tour. An interesting tour though pretty expensive.You can learn a few things about brewing process and about the beer ingredients,can view some old beer bottles,taste a glass of fresh beer,can "be part" of brewing process in a little cinema hall.What I liked the most was the free beer.One of the tastiest beers I've ever had!At the exit is an expensive souvenirs shop.
Fun way to spend a rainy afternoon. There has been a lot of thought and attractions added to this to make the entrance price more than acceptable. I would visit again if I was back in Amsterdam.

Top Exprience. I have to say that´s magic the way like Heineken make the visitors "feel" the experience. High tecnology avaliable during all the stage sof the visit, really creative wayt to explain a simple procedures: "how to make a beer?"It´s one of the different atraction in amsterdam which you have to wait on queue (not as anne frank or Van Gogh), but at least 30 minutes you will wait... but honestly, you will be impressed with what you will live inside.Audio explanations are available in many different languages, the entrance are around 20€ /person (2 drinks included) - the price depends if you will get the audio support or not).Highlights which make this visit unique i remark the room video experience, the rooms dedicated to the multimedia experiences (champions league, rugby or cycling) and of course, the last 2 rooms, one with big screens with heineken advertisments and the beer tasting room.you can spend there between 2 and 4 hours, without any problem... even good atmosphere to know know other visitors, have a chat, listen some music

Pleasantly surprised. I wasn't sure what to expect here, but I have to say it was a great way to spend an afternoon. The staff were so helpful, polite and informative on the tour. Lots of interesting and fun interactive pieces along the journey. Well done to Heineken !

An interesting and fun afternoon. I was unsure of this experience at first, I mainly went along as my fiancé wanted to go, however I ended up thoroughly enjoying it. From seeing how the beer was made, to meeting the horses who now help to advertise it, to becoming a beer (an interactive ride), to all the interactive games in the rugby and football rooms and finally to the tasting experience and the free beers at the end, it was all a very enjoyable afternoon!
Great!. Great place to visit in Amsterdam as it is not too intense, lots of fun and three free drinks during the experience too!

Interesting and well worth a visit . Would definitely recommend buying your tour tickets before visiting this place. We jumped off the red tour bus and noticed a massive que outside to get in then realised we had a fast track ticket so didn't have to wait thank god! Takes a good couple of hours to walk around and you get 2 free beers at the end and even get to pour your own pint. Pretty similar to the Guinness factory in Dublin. Great if you like beer
Cheers. We spent a couple of hours here one wet and cold afternoon. Pre buy tickets to avoid the queue. 3 beers included. Very interactive experience.

Heineken's not the best. . Been to Carlsberg in Copenhagen & Guinness in Dublin so thought we'd give it a go. It's o.k. a lot of razzmatazz not much substance. Would be improved it there was somewhere to eat with the samples even light snacks. I amsterdam card gives good saving but it would not be my top of the brewery visit list.

Very interesting tour! . Visited Amsterdam early February, on our last day we decided to do the Heineken Experience. I myself don't drink beer but my husband does so went on the tour for him. On saying that I really found the tour interesting looking at the background of Heineken and how it was started. I thought the tour was definitely worth the money and I would recommend it for the non beer drinkers also.
Great for beer lovers . I would recommend getting tickets in advance from a ticket selling shop (loads around town). You will save a couple of euros and you will skip the cue which was very long.
Interesting!. Good tour if you like beer and want to lear a few cool facts. If you have the time is worth doing it.

Excellent experience . I don't drink lager so really this experience was far more for my partner than it was for me however once I got there I had a very good time and although not converted to a lager fan I did have one (that I poured myself with expert barman Daniel). The tour itself was interesting the staff were friendly and knowledgable. I would certainly recommend this tour

very, very good value for money.. I have to admit, I had reservations about this attraction. I relented and I was glad I did. What great fun we had! Actually very very interesting, informative and full of interactive activites to try, including bottle your own beer, winning the champions league, learning how to taste beer, being brewed and at the end free beers. As we were leaving we were stopped by a staff member who invited us to join the tour boat. We were astounded that the tour still had more on offer! of course we went and it was a lovley way to end tour. Overall one of the best value for money attrations.
Worth a visit. Very interesting trip, drank plenty of Heineken over the years so good to see how's it's made. Great gift shop at the end.
Worth watching once. It's a beautiful experience to watch on how to make a beer,n they have some fun games to play as well,plus some fresh beer to taste,it's a must watch place

Not sure about all the hype. Buy your tickets in advance, otherwise there will be a very long line to buy them. That said, it is very very crowded once inside the 'experience'. You watch some videos, see the old factory, see some horses, learn Heineken history, learn how to toast with your beer, go int some sort of bottling simulator which was totally lame (and the wait for that was ridiculously long) and at the end you get your beer. The of course you are dumped out into the retail store. Perhaps if I was a college aged kid or in my 20's this would make more sense. I would rather go to a pub and find some great local beer to sample.

Great activity!. We've been to the Heineken Experience a few times. We love it! It's one of our favorite things to do in Amsterdam. We've taken family & friends. It's huge! Strollers aren't allowed. Quite a few stairs. Not suitable for small children. Very nicely done. If you can- see if the rooftop is open for drinks (save a couple tokens to drink). The staff is great!
Great tour worth the visit. just back from my 2nd visit to this place great fun and you get some drinks if its wet outside then kill about 3 hours in here well worth a visit

A must do while in Amsterdam. This was one of the highlights of our trip. Various satff on hand at different points to give you a detailed explination of the brewing process and interacive games throughout. We purchased our tickets before we went so were able to jump the queue which was very long. You get a wristband for 2 free beers and also a small taster on the way through the tour. The 6th floor bar gave some excellent views over Amsterdam city centre.

Great time n good experience . Very interesting place. Must go when visit amsterdam. Entrance fee Euro18 dollar with 2 to 3 glasses of beer. Worth the value. Few storeys with different themes and history of heineken. Went in the late morning to avoid the crowd which started in the afternoon. Have free cruise ride by Heineken after our tour around 1pm.

Long line go early! . We got there early it was an awesome tour. They give you bracelets for 2 free beer's per person. You can also make your own labeling on the beer bottle like your name etc. The gift shop of course is at the end of the tour. They also teach you how to pour and with that you get a free beer!! Enjoy

Lots of fun. We booked tickets and so skipped the queue on a rainy day. To be honest we didn't have particularly high expectations, we were more aiming to be in the warm for an hour. We had a great time though. The tour was fun, interactive and informative. Lots of photo opportunities and silly things to do. Would highly recommend.

Good day out! . Visited the Heineken experience and really enjoyed it, the simulator where you 'become a beer' was really good. When we arrived we had brought tickets beforehand in a shop in the centre and although the que was long they managed to get everyone in very quickly! Some of the photo machines did not work inside which was unfortunate as we didn't get a chance to use one. We paid €16 for a ticket and was defiantly worth it, you get a free taster beer and 2 tokens which gives you 2 free beers In the bar at the end. Would have liked to have kept my glass though. Was a good day would recommended if you are off to Amsterdam, easily accessible on the tram from the central station! :)
Worth a visit! . Definitely worth the visit. We spent 3 hrs in here. Views from the rooftop bar are pretty impressive especially at night.

Highly recommend!. My wife and I spent the weekend in Amsterdam and had pre booked tickets for this (glad we did as the queue was about an hour and we walked straight in)We were both a little unsure as thought it would be a simple walk through a brewery with the chance to taste a beer and aimed more at males. How wrong we were as you get to learn about not only the history but a chance to sample ingredients that go into it. Along the way it becomes more of and interactive experience and toward the end you get the feel you are in a bar/club with the free beer tokens you get!Lots of cool things going on inside and highly recommend it to anyone!!
Amazing. I really enjoyed the experience.Plenty to do all the way around and something for everyone! Well worth theMoney. Would recommend

Great visit. This place was great. An interesting self guided tour done in a modern and fun way. Certainly worth the 18 euros it cost. It took about two hours and included a few samples in the entry cost.
Amazing experience!!!! . Amazing absolutely loved it, even if you dont like beer its an amazing experience. Its so much fun and enjoyable and there is so much to do!
Not bad. I've visited here a couple of time with different people on trips to Amsterdam.Fairly informative but not a huge amount to do. Still worth a visit if you like your beer.

Great experience . Such a nice tour , around 1hr 30 minU get like 2 EXTRA FRESH free paints of beer if not more And some free memorabilia!It's worth the visit , different things to do ! U learn , drink and have fun during the tour ! I recommend this tour if u visit Amsterdam

Really cool visit, with beer included!. If you want to know the story of the famous green beer, this place is a must. During the tour they show you the history of heineken company, the old factory and then they teach you how to appreciate the taste of the beer, the bubbles, the color, the foam, etc. All this with some beers included!

A surprise hit!. This was one of four attractions we wanted to visit in our short visit to Amsterdam, and probably came with the lowest expectations. Maybe it was that reason, it was actually our biggest surprise hit of our trip.Going as fans of beer in general, rather than an advocate of the Heineken brand, we went along almost with the thought of 'well, we might as well visit while we're here'. The tour starts with the standard story of how lager is produced, but it's done in an interesting way. Then you turn a corner and find yourself in a stables looking at the real shire horses of the brewery - a nice twist and nod to their heritage.You then go through a cool little 4d experience, which is quite humorous, and you come out in a tasting room. We had previously been given a green branded wristband with 2 tokens for samples at the end of the tour - however we weren't asked for these here- leaving you thinking you've beaten the system. The smiley server gave a bit more history, and tested the group on a couple of beer related questions - rewarded with more free beer of course! Not knowing if the tour was about to end, you still have several more modern and high-tech room to visit with lots of interaction, engagement, and a chance to take some green screen photos and email them to yourself for free.Eventually, you end up in the 'real' free sample bar which has a really cool vibe with loud upbeat music, and lively friendly staff.In fact- a special mention here, all the staff we encountered from start to finish, without exception, came across happy, friendly, helpful, and as if they genuinely wanted to be there. I work in a high volume tourist attraction myself and know how hard this can be to attain - it really made the difference.Would recommend for all visitors to the city. If you have a spare couple of hours on your trip, try to make time for this.

A good laugh! . Great trip here with a canal trip & drinks included! Had a good laugh and not just a boring brewery tour! Also good that they don't force you to buy pictures & videos as you can email these to yourself for free! Got a personalised beer bottle & if you do the canal tour you get a free souvenir glass at the end!

Not as good as it's previous offering. Heineken experience is the modern day replacement for Heineken brewery visits. The brewery stopped production many years ago, but the visits lingered on.The Latest offering is a more expensive and Disneyland adventure, with typical Disney prices.Not impressed with the set up.Let's get back to the original concept.
Amazing!! . We loved everything about this!! It was our favourite day in Amsterdam! The vibe is amazing, staff are lovely and everything is so fun! Especially enjoyed the rooftop bar!
Interesting!. Very interesting insight into the Heineken history! Two free drinks on the price of entry! PS4 games in one area! Lots of other interactive things!
Poor. A long, drawn out, slow moving procession to finally get a beer at the final bar. Nothing particularly interesting or exciting along the way.
A Beer Brewery Tour. The short movie was fun. Make sure you visit the roof top bar. Buy your tickets online and go early to avoid the crowd.
Brill . Great day out, very informative on the Heineken company you can also personalise your own heineken bottle and pour your own beer. Staff very helpful.

Worth a visit . Price is reasonable for how long you spend in there and the free drinks you get.You see how the beer is made, advertisements and there is a lovely rooftop bar.At the end of the tour there are lots of fun zones where you can have photos taken and they email them to you for free.

Amazing drink discovery . Anybody who has been drinking beer will relish it more when they visit this place. Super amazing experience. Located in heart of city. Accessible by Canal, tram, taxi and cycle. You may require 1-2 hours.

Really fun afternoon, with beer included!. Really great afternoon here. Would advise purchasing tickets prior to visit (through tourist ticket offices to avoid queues). Very interesting story about Heineken and it's history. Great touch that beer is included in the tour (you get 2 tokens to use). Similar vibe to the Guiness Storehouse, Dublin. Definitely would recommend if you're in Amsterdam
Worth the visit!. Honestly simply said it's a must visit.. nothing and no words can describe this place. A visit back to your childhood.

Heineken . Good fun and value for money.
Definitely worth a visit if your in Amsterdam!
Nice pint of Heineken at the end which always helps

For people who are fun of Heineken or Beer. I won't recommend for family attraction since some won't be allowed to drink. In overall I think this attraction is OK, good to know story of Heineken but not worth of ticked if we don't get 2 free beers.

Entertaining experience. I had some time to kill one afternoon on a rainy day, so decided to check out the Heineken Experience. The tour is a little cheesy, but enjoyable and informative; I particularly enjoyed the samples at the end (but who doesn't, esp at a brewery?).I had the option of two samples of the "regular" Heineken, or one sample of the special version (iced? I don't truly remember). I just went for the regular ... mostly so I could have two samples. :PKind of a one and done experience - not one I'll likely repeat, or a "must do" per se, but an entertaining way to pass an afternoon, especially if the weather is poor.

Well done. My wife and I had to give this a shot and it was good. I was a little surprised at the price of €18 a person for a self walk brewery tour but it was good and I later figured you can get cheaper tickets at virtually every corner. Worth a visit if you like the beer!

Highlight of our visit!. We weren't sure what to expect with this but had heard it was good. Make sure to book tickets online before going to skip the queue. Absolutely fantastic - 5 stars is not enough! There was beer tasting, a ride, loads of games and a good history of the beer. We got our own beer bottled made but then lost it on our last night - we tweeted them and they sent us a new one through the post!!!! Great fun for all the family. Just brilliant.

Would recommend to go but not during the weekend or peak days.. When I first went on this tour I was so close to walking out due to the extremely long que's for everything. At one point the que was so bad everyone had to stand in the que for 45 minutes (while in the factory) to get through one section of the tour. The ending of the tour saved my opinion but would recommend to go during mid week.

history, fun and beer!. Really enjoyed our afternoon here. Went as a group of lads. Tour was informative and a lot of variety. Visual posters, displays, videos , a ride, tasting experience. As you go further along there are more interactive displays which were great fun. You could e-mail videos and photos of yourselves on some of the attractions. At the end of the experience there was a great bar where you can relax and enjoy two drinks (inclusive in the entry price). Overall it was good value and a great way to spend a couple hours in Dam.

Great tour. Really funny tour.
The ride bit is hilarious.
We paid €16 for the tour and two free beers. But we actually got 3 free. You get one mid tour.
Ample amount of free beer.
You can get personalised bottles made for €6.50
Go to the rooftop bar!
It's got amazing views

Was Fun. Is really an experience rather than some historical thing of beer. We learnt some beer making process, some ps4 football game to play with, as Heineken do the sponsership. Fun moving theater experience to be participating as making process of beer. Was fun, just abit queue tho we arrive quite late like 7ish .

Day trip out. My friends and I visited the Heineken Experience on the (8th Feb 2016). We paid for this attraction and the Ice Bar together and got discount for the ice bar. With this ticket we were also entitled to 3 free drinks, which were enjoyed by all. The tour allows you to explore the factory by yourself there are many photo opportunities to take and I found it interesting to see how the famous beer was made. Really recommend this tour as it can be enjoyed by all.

Very well done!. Heineken definitely has made visit to the brewery a unique experience.There are videos shown, beer tasting included can make bottle with your name on it... but more importantly, Heineken tastes just perfect!

A real laugh. Took my boyfriend here as I knew he would enjoy it. It is very commercialised and cheesy but so fun. We laughed a lot, loads of photo op's and the beer you get with your ticket is very nice. Gift shop has a lot of lovely bits and bobs. If you like beer you should enjoy this!

Excellent couple of hours spent. A great short visit for both beer and non beer drinkers. Very interesting explanations on how the beer is made and about their history.Make sure you either book in one of the excursion shops for 16€, or grab a voucher in most maps which will make it 17€ or full price is 18€.Included is two beers at the end and also a small beer mid way around the brewery.

It's not a museum of heineken, it's just a experience.... Even if you really love bear it's not a good place to go... we went there with online tickets at saturday afternoon and it was full of people inside! We need to wait a lot of time inside just to move around the building... you taste a normal heineken bear so the money only worth it because of the bear and the bottle-experience (when they truly make you feel a heineken bootle)

fqntastic!!. Fantastic place would definately recommend, being a women i thought id be bored coming here but there is something for everyone in the experience. Football, rugby, 4D cinema and so much more! Plus 2 free beers at the end ;). Would love to go back!!

Enjoyable experience!. Really enjoyable experience, no queue so went straight in. Considering I don't like the taste of heineken, I still had a good time! At the end when you are given two drinks, you can also have pepsi/lemonade instead of heineken which I thought was a good idea! Good value for money.

Interesting Tour & Couple of Beers Thrown In. Went with a friend to check out some of the history, was interesting, the guys doing the tour were really friendly & informative, you get a wristband with a couple of studs on it that get you a couple of small beers at the end of the tour. You do also get some smaller tasters in part of the tour when the staff talk you through the taste and how to drink it ! The bar at the end is pretty funky, the walls are all made of plasma tvs that depict different city skylines. Not a bad way to kill a couple of hours !

The most wonderful experience ever!. I booked in advance as i knew my partner would love this as part of his birthday gift, the staff were so helpful and polite and the experience was just amazing you get to play games see how the beer is made get a guided tour and a free drink! The gift shop was exceptional also

Good value for money . Visited, was a bit dubious as done a few brewery tours. For 11 euros, this is a good experience, with interactive activities and a large friendly bar area at the top. There is a simulation ride for you to be brewed into lager as well as all the usual memorabilia. We also caught the free Heineken cruise boat outside which took us all the to Rembrandt square and the shop where we got our free gift glasses as well.

Was ok. I'm sure there are more interesting places to visit if you have time to spend in Amsterdam.I wasn't really impressed with the Heineken Experience.Alot of fluff to make the visit longer.Did get a Heineken bottle with customised writing on it as a birthday present for my brother for 6 euros.Forgot I only had a cabin case so had to pay £21 to put the case in the hold. I think alot of people will be caught out after paying for the bottle that it can't travel through security.
Slick operation. Well done Heineken. I first visited this brewery 30 years ago and what progress Heineken have made in making this tour interesting to a non beer drinker.

Great fun but don't make me wait for beer. Lots to see and it's a good well rounded tour. But I would have enjoyed it way more if I was given a beer on entry instead of having to wait until the end. Yes this makes me sound like a disgusting alcoholic but let's face it, it is literally a piss up in a brewery.

Brilliant. Had time to kill on the last day of our trip and decided to visit the home of Heineken. Brilliant experience from start to finish. From being brewed in 4D to getting my own personally engraved heineken glass. Amazing tasting experience and well worth the time.. Book online to skip the Q using the far left door at the main entrance. 2 free drinks at the end too... Just do it!

Great fun. Visited on a Monday for my friends birthday (heard it can get quite busy on the weekends) and it was a superb experience. Lots of interactive sections and lots of tasting involved. Staff are great with a good sense of humour ;-) I especially loved the rooms towards the end of the tour and you can even print out pictures taken that day. If your looking for a freebie too make sure you ride the heineken canal cruise and you can get your free mini heineken glass. Loved it, great day out for everyone. (Maybe dont go if youre not very good with stairs, not sure if they have disability help) overall five star experience.

A lovely surprise . We decided to the tour cos the market close by was not open due to high winds. ..and it was a really lovely suprise as we really enjoyed it. .enjoyed especially the interactive aspects of the show. ..and of course the free beer :) would defintely recommend it as an attraction not to be missed when visiting Amsterdam...

Beer fans. If your a beer fan and would like to know more about heineken and what your drinking , this is the place to go, the staff are very friendly and open for questions , nice to buy some souviners for family

The beer museum of Amsterdam. So Amsterdam has museums for all sorts of things, you will enjoy this experience if you're in to Heineken. Im not a beer drinker but enjoyed learning about the history of beer making and the attractions such as 4D tour guide.... enjoy.

Heineken Experience. For 18 euro's you get around an hour and a half tour, very interesting, free half pints as your going around, around 4 all in all.Good fun in the interactive room with a rugby conversation machine and a rugby scrum pad monitoring the amount of pressure you can put in, and through to the next room a few PS4 console's, where you can stop briefly and half a game of Fifa against your mates, quality for the price and a good time killer, would recomend

Really interesting & kills an hour or two!. If you're interested in beer, go see it! It's really interesting to learn about how it's all made and the history behind the brand, we had no idea before hand. Good fun, got us out of the rain for a bit and got some free beer at the end - can't complain!

Real fun even for non beer-lovers. Went there on the last day of the year.we had to stand in line for an hour even if we already had tickets. But it was worth it! At the beginning i would add more interactive parts but it picked up nicely till the end of the experience. More information of the Heineken brand in the world would be n8ce too.We had great fun, thank you!

Brilliant even for non-beer drinkers . Highly recommended the Heineken Experience! I've been to Amsterdam twice and this was a highlight and I don't even drink beer! Included the ticket is a canal cruise, 2 drinks and a souvenir! 5 stars

Good experience . I visited the Heineken factory as I love my beer! Interesting place and a brilliant atmosphere inside. Also they have good games in there on how to pour the perfect pint. Also you see real horses as they still deliver the beer round Amsterdam in horse and cart which is I think is brilliant.A well worth visit.

Boring. If you're hesitant about going here and worried it might be boring, stick to your guns. After enduring an excruciating amount of fact boards you can take some lame pictures on bikes. Not sure what to class the mid section of the tour as; it consists of standing on a crate with a bunch of folk, getting water sprayed in your face. Accompanying this is a dated (annoying) movie about the beer process - which you have just read all about.You can't drown your sorrows with the three tiny beers provided. The whole place also smells really badly - of manure.
Piss up in a Brewery. A good two hours to keep you out of the pub. Lovely view from the rooftop bar. Bit of a bottle neck (ha ha) half way through but a good place to go in Amsterdam

Insightful. Pretty cool spot and was good to see how they made the beer. Alot of information on how to make the beer and the heineken at the brewery tastes alot better than in most bars believe me lolThe part where they make YOU into a beer was cool and the gift shop was dead on too even if i wasn't allowed my nickname printed on my beer because it was seen as not normal

Good fun!. I paid £18 for the tour and I have to say it was well worth it. While there are things to read and watch as you explore, the real fun is with all the interactive things you can try out. From learning how to pour the perfect pint to becoming a beer with the beer simulator (basically a mini fun fair ride) there is a lot to see and do that I think makes it much more interesting than other museums. Of course the 3 drinks included in the price is a nice bonus. All in all it took about an hour to see and try everything, give or take how long you take to enjoy your beers at the end :P
Fun day. Less like a traditional Brewery more like a adventure, with even a small theme park like ride at the end.

Great place to offload the rugby team for the start of a tour of Amsterdam!. The boys had worked up quite a thirst for adventure, and the coach bus dropped off all 39 rugby players in front of the brewery...so what to do next?!? Many of the guys took the tour and thoroughly enjoyed themselves!

If you're not into art museums . This is my third time to Amsterdam. Looking at the tractions and the things to do here include a lot of museums and art shows. If you want smthn different and a live visual experience then I totally recommend this tour. It was really nice and the price is just fair

Not worth the wait! . Very disappointed with this tour. They let far too many people in at once which made the tour slow and difficult to enjoy each section as people didn't want to leave the queue which had formed. We did get to enjoy our drinks in the 6th floor bar which had nice views over the city.

Fantastic experience . Value for money as there is so much to see throughout the entire tour. There is plenty of interaction throughout and you get the chance to pull the perfect drink at the end, if not you can choose on getting two free drinks!

LOVED IT !!. We went at the right time, no queue at all, but it was massive when we left !! All in all a interesting and fun tour with extras thrown in. You get to sample the beer at the end, which tasted better after learning the science behind it !! Well worth a visit, lots of interactive games to take part it, we really enjoyed it. Probably not fun for children though !

Amazing. It is a museum for heineken and the place is very nice and organizedThey will show you ingridients of the beer and the process of doing itSpecially the animations they do and the 7d film you watch bery niceWorth going there
Fun Times. I love doing brewery tours! This was a lot fun. Loved the ride and at the end of the tour you can purchase a bottle with a personal inscription for $6.00 USD.

We loved it!! . This tour is really fun and interesting unlike many tours we have been. This brings us back to the history of Heineken and explanation of how beer is made. Next, how it was being fermented and transported. Spoiler: they even have real horses in there to explain about the transportation. Next, teaches how to taste the beer with the whole tour group toasting in Dutch style together and downing a glass of beer. They are many games in there to try out. With virtual beer pouring to PS4 games eg,street fighter. And end of the tour, you get to redeem 2 more glasses of beer or 1 glass of extra cold beer. We had a really great time learning about the history and enjoying all the games. In addition Heineken is a great beer!! Lastly please arrive earlier. We reached at about 10.30am and there was a long queue forming when we left about 12pm.

Long lines, uninteresting tour. We went here on a Saturday afternoon. Big mistake. This is not a tour of a brewery, but a party. The staff seemed uninterested in their jobs. A lot of half drunk or high people. The beginning of the tour was interesting with historical facts, then the lines started. 45 minutes to go on a "brew ride" and then 15 minutes to get the complimentary beer. The Carlsberg brewery tour in Copenhagen and the Guinness tour in Dublin are much better. If you must go, go early.
Predictable But Still Fun. I wouldn't say it was out of this world, but it was fun. You get the full tour and learn the beer-making process. It's certainly a great rainy day event.
Stag do. Was a great experience and I think must place to visit if you have the time. It had so much more inside than you would think and don't forget it's Heineken, world's greatest drink.
Awesome. Amazing experience a must do, very reasonably priced and very friendly staff, you get a beer tasting lesson and a couple of free beers at the end

first half = learning, second half = partying. My husband is a beer buff and he loves the science behind how it's made, so we booked this tour especially for him. We booked a package that included a canal cruise, which began and ended right in front of the Heineken Experience. For convenience, that was wonderful.The first half of the tour is spent learning about how the beer is brewed. There's various employee stations along the way where they explain the process, and you're given nibbles and sips of the ingredients throughout the different stages. After this, there's a small "ride simulator" where a goofy guy in a video explains how the beer is packaged. The platform bounces around and you get sprayed with a little bit of water, which is kind of fun. Then you have a taste of the beer at the final employee station.After this, the tour is pretty much over. The rest of the Experience is product placement and games, and seeing all of the movies and sports that Heineken sponsors. There's a bar at the very end of the "tour" where you can get two beers (or one really cold one), and this area is full of college-aged kids. It's set up like a club, with dark lighting and bar music. It's fun, but we only stayed for about 20 minutes. It's not a make-it-or-break-it part of the tour.Like the rest of Amsterdam, the place is packed from Thursday through Sunday. Absolutely purchase a ticket ahead of time - the line to buy a ticket stretched for what seemed like forever. If you buy your tickets in advance, you skip this craziness.It's worth a visit, but don't expect it to be a super educational visit. It's called the Heineken Experience, not the Heineken Museum, for a reason.

Very interesting ... We were staying in the red light district and managed to just walk 5 minutes up the road, got on a tram which was only a couple of euros each and the journey was about ten minutes and drops you off right outside so getting there is easy! There was a huge que which was out the door when we arrived, luckily we had pre booked our tickets so we just walked straight to the front and straight in so I would 100% advise you pre book before you go. You can do this in any of the excursion shops dotted around the city.The whole walk round takes about an hour and as it was very busy there was a lot of walking a few steps and having to keep stopping. It was very interesting, you learn about how Heineken is made and also the history of the company. When entering you get bands which have 2 token attached and these can be traded in at the end in the bar for Heineken.. I am not a Heineken drinker so a little wasted one me :( Overall it is a good rainy day activity, I would say maybe enquire before hand before you go if you are not mobile as there are stairs and walking involved.Would recommend to others and Heineken lovers

Fun place to visit. Recommend to pre book as the que for walk in were really long.Once inside, you can move at your own pace. Lots of interactive things to keep you going, and informative staff. Bar area great at the end with free beers :)

"Warning" you will not come out sober. I think its completely worth the visit for the price you pay. At the factory tickets cost 18 Euro, but there are other vendors that sell the tickets for for as low as 15 Euro so look around and bargain! The ticket also comes with two free beers but there are plenty of opportunities to get more freebees inside and with all the sampling how could one not get drunk right? You can even become a certified pourer which i thought was a really cool experience. Over all its a must, is educational and a great hands on experience.

Fun place to visit in Amsterdam. We visited the Heineken Factory and had a really great day! You get a discount if you have the I Amsterdam Card. The price includes a couple of beers as well, which is fab! Only downside when we visited were the MASSIVE queues - but to be expected at such a touristy attraction.

FUN FUN FUN!. went with my husband, spent there a nice afternoon.lots of interacticve parts that make it so much fun. you can buy a ticket for 16 euro inthe Tourist shops around town (there the ticket is 18).at the end of the tour you get 2 1/3 beer . In conclusion definitely worth a visit!

Worth a Visit. While really not a fan of beer, me and my friend decided to visit Heineken Experience on our 1st trip to Amsterdam. It was interesting how they showed the beer making process, how to craft your own beer and you were also given 2-3 mugs of free beer to drink. Worth the visit if you're around the area. You get to personalized your name a Heineken bottle at an extra cost as well. Good to buy as gifts for your friends.

A highlight of our trip.. This tour is well thought out, with a wide range of fun ways to teach you about Heineken beer.The use of interactive technology combined with a super interesting family history it gives a well rounded appreciation for the local beer.With a beer to taste half way round and a couple of beers included at the bar at the end of the tour its a great way to start an evening.(On the tasting round, don't be shy, shout out the answers: it will win you beer!!)A final bonus, was there's a tour boat to give you a ride and a your back into the city centre. ..and yes, there's a bar on board!A highlight of our trip.

Exceeded expectations.. I expected a run of the mill brewery tour. At first, it has that feel -- you learn the history of the brand and such. However, soon after, there are tastings, pouring lessons, tons of fun picture opportunities, black lights, clubbing vibes, and a bar at the end. We got customised bottles.

It was a mixture of sight seeing and party. After hearing some good comments from my friends ,my bf and I decided to visit Heineken. But we didn't really know what to expect. We were so surprised and we had so much fun during the tour! It was like a friday night where you go to a bar or party.But it was also like a saturday afternoon where you visit a really cool museum. This is definitely a must visit place !!! No.1 on the list

Brilliant! . So much fun, and educational especially if you enjoy beer! €18 per head and you get 3 lots of beers, can't complain with that. Definitely recommend, and make sure you go to the roof top garden for the view of Amsterdam.

Not only for beer lovers. Didn't expected much before visiting Heineken Expirience, but i was positivly suprised. It's really an interresting expirience, and at the end you can make a bottle of Heineken with your own text on it.

Obvious Tourist Trap but Super Fun!. Although we're not necessarily huge Heineken fans, I have to say the tour is quite well done.Very informative but the technology and the experience that they've built made it engaging and interesting.The digital interactivity at the end of the tour was actually humorous, cool and impressive. It may seem silly but the bicycle ride was pretty funny. The bartenders that were hosting the tasting was obnoxious - but then again, so were the tourists that kept talking during his presentation. I actually recommend stopping by if you're in the mood for something fun.

Worth a visit if your in the area. Decided to pop in and have a look round and had a nice time.They have the usual up sell of exiting through gift shops and buy a bottle with your name on it but we generally had a nice time.Very informative, modern and nice beer at the end!Perfect for our day out whilst the weather was bad.Trip home on the Heineken river boat was a nice additional touch
Amazing!. The Heineken experience was amazing and I would recommended it to everyone,Staff were great and great selection of souvenirs

You have got to come here its brilliant. I pre booked this a few weeks previously and was glad I did as I got to skip the line which was quite long and it was quite cold out. We got the number 24 tram out there and it dropped us right at the door. The start of the tour I found quite boring as it was very like a museum of old stuff then as it progressed it got better and better. lots to see and do in there, pulling pints, playing playstation, taking pictures with fun backgrounds, a stimulator which was quite cool. we got two free drinks each and the tour lasted nearly three hours. Theres quite a cool Heineken shop there too which is reasonably priced. I would highly recommend but please pre book before hand

Amazing. I wasn't too sure what we were getting in to when we first went to the tour which is beside the museum square and relatively easy to find.The staff were so friendly and informative and I've never seen a museum with so much to do.It was incredibly interesting, fun and very modern which enthralled many of the visitors.It's a must do tour in Amsterdam especially if you like beer!

Good fun, interesting history. This was a bit of a last minute decision, and we're glad we went. The tour was interesting and informative. There's a "4D" ride which got us laughing. We even learnt how to drink beer properly - who'd have thought.Considering you get 3 small beers in the price the whole thing probably cost about a fiver. If you don't think that's value for money you've obviously got more Yorkshire blood in you than I have.Tip - they do a hand engraved glass for 8 euro's all in with a metal gift tin. Perfect Christmas or birthday present for the old man.

Really great place to go. Ignore all the bad review on trip advisor take it from someone posting a genuine review. This trip was great, lots to see and do while inside the place, staff were very welcoming and knowledgeable. You can't go wrong for €16 including two beers. Make sure to go if you are in Amsterdam.

Recommnded. Really cool museum. Not that the brewery interesting but itself, it is but all interactive exhibitions that what deserves the word "Experience". Interactive "We will brew you" is emulation of what happens when beer is brewed. All photo and video interactions are really good and recommended. After the experience the boat tour may be taken from the pier in front of museum

Ok brewery tour. Book tour through a ticket agency and saved a few Euros as combined with other attractions. Visited as my wife drinks Heineken. Largely self led tour which seems like an advertisement rather than tour. A few interesting points and a tasting session, two beers on completion. Done a few brewery tours and this one does not rank very highly. Would appeal more to younger visitors in their 20's

Way way WAY too expensive. I paid a full 17 euros (with 1 eu shortage) for this visit, and I still feel bad for doing it. I don't know why I did it. You get 3 beers and for the rest there's a kind of lame 'interactive' guided tour.

A lot of fun and very interesting. Really reccommend doing this tour, we went ealry on which I think was a good idea as there was a queue later on in the day. We bought our tickets at a booth and combined them with another trip.There are lots of rooms with fun activities to do as well as interesting information on the walls and videos of the history of the Heineken brewery. You also get a few free beers included.Make sure you go up to the top floor at the end to see the views.

Fun and knowledgeable experience!. Situating in a location easy to reach by public transport (bus no.16 and 24) or by hop-on hop-off bus and boat. An experience to remember. Revealing the history of Heineken company, the founder, the mysterious Heineken A yeast, all the ingredients and steps in brewing the more than 100 years of history Heineken beer... And even an interesting "Brew You Ride". Visitors aged more than 18 can even have free beer tasting experience. Ensure to content fans of Heineken beer!

100% go here if you like beer or not!. My boyfriend and I have just come back from Amsterdam and went here on a Friday around 1pm. We got straight in and bought our tickets there. We both had such a good time and really enjoyed the interactive parts and photo opportunities. The staff were very friendly, funny and knowledgable. We actually learnt a bit about beer and both learnt how to pull the perfect pint. You get two drink tokens but my boyfriend ended up getting 4 drinks all in all as if you get involved, the staff give you more. We definitely recommend this to anyone with a couple of hours to spare in Amsterdam.
