Difficult not to enjoy!. Worth a visit in Amsterdam. I think most people would find it difficult not to enjoy a visit here. Everyone working here is so friendly and enthusiastic. Place runs like clockwork.

Fun and interactive!. We booked tickets for Heineken Experience online via Trip Advisor and were glad we got the tickets in advance. We arrived just after it opened and still had to queue a bit to get in but that was because we were told you had to check in your coats and bags in the cloakroom, although once inside we saw many people with their coats and bags still with them! I like beer, but I prefer gin, but I didn't enjoy this place any less! It was a really good day out. As you walk through you learn about the history of Heineken and how it's all brewed which was pretty interesting. Then all the fun bits!! There's a 4D video thing which was funny and then lots of interactive rooms where you can learn to pour the perfect pint, be the DJ, star in a video and take some photos with random backdrops and learn how to drink a beer the right way! You are given a wrist band with 2 tokens that you exchange for 2 pints of Heineken at the end in the bar or 2 tokens to pour the "perfect pint" and get a certificate haha. Arrive early to avoid huge queues! When we got out the queue went all the way down the street!

Epic every time. . I've been here a few times and love it. We did the proper Heineken Experience and the Night at the Museum type visit. Both of which are super fun. The overall museums is an excellent experience into the history and family nature of Heineken itself. It has fun things to do once you are through the museum part/ history part. Then you are given two free drinks at the end.Good fun, spend two hours there.
Had a ball. I wasnt interested in going but my husband was. Ended up having a ball. The free alcohol was a good incentive lol but very entertaining for all. Would defs recommend

Great day out. As a bar worker I loved learning all about how the lager is made, as well as all the extra fun activities they have, plenty of friendly competition to be had in the sports section! Would definitely go again, definitely worth the money

Girl who hates beer. I went with my partner and we both loved it, despite me not liking beer the activities were varied and many. Staff friendly (April was doing the 'pour a pint' - very friendly and funny)

It's even good for beer haters. Perfectly honest I was a little skeptical when booking this as my boyfriend wanted to go but I really detest beer and thought it would be the most boring experience possible as it would just be about the history, however, to my surprise it was really fun and intersectional, even if you don't like beer I highly recommend it for all ages due to the fun we had
One experience you can't miss out!. One of the most interesting and best tours I've been on. Good interaction from the tour staff and we'll worth the money.

Very interactive in parts, quite busy. As one of the top attractions expect a crowd but your never left hanging around as you move through at your own pace. Good for all the family as it has a lot to do with the history and the relationship between the brand and various sports rather than just drinking. There is a demonstration of how to pull the perfect pint and a couple of drinks at the end. Worth a visit
SO much fun!. Great few hours experiencing lots of fun and learning about the beer brewing process. Would definitely advise pre-booking so you can skip the queues!

Interesting experience, worth the money, but all the waiting ruins the experience.... It was quite enjoyable and interesting to find out about Heineken (and get free drinks) but majority of the time spent there was waiting in queues. Regardless of all the queues, it was worth the wait and a recommended experience, overall.
Heineken experience . Fun thing to do with the family, and free drinks!! Get to do fun things on the experience, and free drinks!! If you love beer this is a must.

It is worth visiting it. This is the second time I'm visiting Amsterdam and I decided to visit this place. I must say that is really interesting as long as you enjoy drinking beer. There are some nice technological attractions there as well.

Expected much more.... Well, it's worth a visit but not sure if it is worth the line of 1,5-2 hours! Even when you pass the line in front, there is line inside... Up points for the "beer making" experience and playroom (although, there are lines there too).

Great experience. Must-do if in The Dam. I was recommended this by a friend, and decided to go. Me and my partner both really enjoyed it. I got to experience the proper way to drink a beer, and pulled the perfect beer at the 1st attempt. Then got sit + chill with more drinks in the open bar area.
Overall good experience

Great, even if you don't drink beer!. We visited this place and were wowed by our experience! Very interesting information about the history of Heineken and how it's made and many many interactive exhibits to try. Entry also includes 2 drinks in the price. Make sure you have plenty of time as there's so much to see and do. Definitely worth the time and cost!

Could be more free beer, but an overall great experience. Albeit extremely touristy, the Heineken Experience is well worth a visit (especially as a Heineken lover). The history and memorabilia is abundant and the 'be a bottle' section is really great fun, as is the large amount of interactive photo booths, karaoke, selfie-points and pulling the perfect pint machines. You are left to wonder at your own leisure which is nice, but there are also opportunities to learn about the beer making process (quick tip: during the quiz when you are given your sampler, get the questions right and you win more beer!). There are two bars at the end, make sure you specifically seek out the rooftop bar, it's much more roomy and makes for great views! Overall, a great few hours well spent!

Good experience . The entry cost 18 euros but if you purchase from tickets shop you get 2 euros discount. Try going when the museum opens u will find less rush It's takes all together 2 hours and u get 3 free beers. It's a great experience
It's good . Good spot really enjoyed it , time just flew, would definitely recommend doing it eps pulling my own pint of Heineken .

Worth a Stop. 18 Euro/person entrance fee -- gets you a tour, a quarter pint taste and a wristband with two buttons that your can turn in at the Tasting Room for two half pints. The tour is interesting (although somewhat disorganized). Tour guides are friendly and fun. Definitely worth a visit if you are in Amsterdam.Hint: Don't wait in line. Go to the cruise boat office located directly across from the entrance. They sell tickets for the same price (18 Euro) and with your ticket in hand, you can bypass the line and enter direction at Door 1.

Great fun. Went to the Heineken experience while in Amsterdam and it really was enjoyable and set us up for a good night back in town afterwards. I went with 3 friends to "tick a box" and was was very impressed with how interactive it was. While very informative for the first half of the tour it builds up to a very enjoyable second half with loads of games and interaction and of course the few beers at the end, which we ended up having a few more then the 2 on the ticket, not sure why but the girls behind the counter seemed happy to give out a few freebies.

Great on a rainy day. We visited on a wet day and it was the perfect solution. Very interactive and something for everyone. Included in your ticket is a couple of samples at the end which is nice. They also have a free canal boat ride back to the Heineken store in town which is lovely. Well worth a visit if you like beer.
Wonderful. I was wondering does it worth visiting the place - yes it is! You can learn the history of Heineken, taste the beer, you will be prepared like a beer :)) And much more

Great day out!!. We visited Amsterdam for a friends 30th birthday! I wasn't so keen to visit the Heineken museum but the boys in our group insisted! I am so glad we went because it was a really excellent day out!!! With your admission you get 2 free prints of beer or 1 pint of extra cold, which I thought was really nice and because we were in a group we got a complimentary nibbles box to enjoy with our beers, cheese, olives, chorizo etc. The museum is really interactive, with lots to do for both men and women. I would highly recommend a visit to the museum, its great value for money!!

We expected more.. I love Heineken beer, so this was a must stop on our Amsterdam trip. But in the end, we left with mixed feelings. Without 2 (actually 3) free beers and a free boat ride, it wouldn't be worth 16€ (prebook online!). Don't forget about the boat ride, leaves every hour. Still love Heineken though:)
Great experience . Was really a fun couple of hours. My 16 year old thought it was fantastic. Would definitely recommend
Worth a visit. I was surprised at how good this was. I don't know what I was expecting but it turned out to be interesting and fun - especially the interactive bits at the end

very interesting and fun. definitely book this in advance as you get to skip the queues. definitely book through tour guide too as they can get it cheaper than with the experience directly.wrist band is given on entry which entitles you to two free drinks at the end of the tour along with free tasters etc throughout. I do not drink so they were wasted on me but still an interesting tour and the interaction areas were very good.

Great experience . I'm a fan of Heinken and loved this experience.It cost 17 euro today per adult. This includes a free quarter pint and 2 half pints of heinken and a free wrist band.Well worth the experience. It takes about 2 hours in total from start to finish and there is a shop at the end where you can pick up cool merchandise. Would deffo go back again. Loads of games as well to take part in along the way.The horses are beautiful although it's a pity we can't get close to pet them. They are well maintained and their names are above their houses.

Amazing experience. Hey gorgeous staffs, never in my life put a long comment but after the third time I visited the place I turned my mind to write it down the adorable experience...I've been in Heineken experience amsterdam for 3 times. And I always recommended to my friend to visit this place...the first time I came with my friend from same country as me from Indonesia. it was so amazing the staffs is friendly and ya...I made new friends new connection because of Heineken experience...The second time I visited heineken experience with my good friend from United State with proudly I recommended the place again but it's quite boring..not so many people but the experience of heineken is still number one...end of the tour we got free boating to go to the other merchandise heineken outlet in Amstel area (if I'm not wrong)The 3rd time I came was with my another good friend,she's from Spain..as I wrote earlier I never get boring to recommended this awesome place...it was quite busy that time but still the staffs always touching and make us feel like in our base Camp...shout out for ROMAINE...he was really helpful and attractived..first time we asked him to take our picture in the entrance..the way he answered is really cool and he is really FRIENDLY...it's too bad when we are leaving couldn't find him...but I will be back again with my new other friends..!! And the rest is just speechless. ..good Job HEINEKEN EXPERIENCE STAFF....!!!!

Better than i thought!. The experience was easier to find than i expected and it right outside a tram stop which you can get from central station. The tour lasted longer than i expected and was more interactive, with lots of taste tests! which however good wasn't for me as i can't drink gluten however i knew this when i went to the experience. There is also a big shop at the end of the tour where you can get personalised glasses and bottles ect! Defiantly worth the money, however would maybe go a little later on in the day so you could carry on the night after all the free beer!

Good fun!. I prebooked in England before we travelled which enabled us to walk straight through. This was a very fun experience, and was much more interactive than I imagined. We ended up having a small glass of the beer for the tasting section, and then another 2 small glasses each in the bar at the end which I thought was good considering it was included!

Really enjoyable experience. Really good evening out at the Heineken experience, lots of small things to do, let's you take photos and send them to your email for free where other attractions you have to pay for your photos there. Get free drinks and the staff were very friendly.

Best visit so fad. I have been to the Heineken museum , 3 times and this was definitely the best visit. Always changing up their rooms and there were more interactive activities this time. Really interesting, really good fun. The Heineken in the bar at the end is the best you will ever taste. Cheap too! A must for anyone staying in Amsterdam.

Awesome, unexpected fun!. This place was so cool. Learnt the history of Heineken and how it's made. There are lots of fun things to do along the way.. even a beer pouring lesson. Then we took the free canal cruise into the centre of the city. I definitely recommend checking it out.

Just perfect. It was my first experience museum kind of thing. And i just love it. It was so amazing how they actually represent the production for us. I live the production process and it make me love Heineken. Personally Heineken wasn't a choice for me I never ordered Heineken if it wasn't my last choice. But after this experience i am sure it will be one of the top choices for me. You have to visit it. And don't forget to get your own bottles

First time visit.. Loved this from the first second to the last. We just turned up & got tickets with only a 5min wait. We visited on a Wednesday so maybe that helped. You get two beer tokens which gives you two half pints or one full pint at the end of the tour. All the guides speak perfect English & are very friendly & helpful. You get to see the full history of Heineken until present day. Great tour & great value for money.

Don't miss it. Great experience. It is conceptualized to give a full insight and make you lose yourself in it. Don't worry they made sure you don't get drunk but just a bit tipsy as all you get to drink are two three beers. It offers something for everybody: a bit of history, process of beer making, fun...I would repeat this experience definitely. Take Tour and Tickets peospect as you get coupons for discount with it. All hotels offer these for free. The discount you have is on average two euros.
Good experience . Visited this place on feb 14 Great knowledgable experience Fun on how they make the product Is good activity in Amsterdam during your stay

Enjoyed. We did this trip in the afternoon, I wasn't sure what to expect but I really enjoyed it, the walk around was good plus you learn how beer is made & where it comes from, I would recommend the little video ride, and also pay attention to what your told because u can win extra beer if you get the questions right. I found my husband and his friend in the football room in the PlayStation which would also be great for children if you take them round, you can also have you own bottle with something wrote on the front & there's more in the shop.
Great Tour. Thoroughly enjoyed this tour which lasts approx 2 hours! Top tip book tickets online before hand saves you a one hour que and a few euros
Better than what I thought. Worth a visit. You get to pull your own pints and drink during the experience. Shows you how they make it and how you actually taste the beer
20something spot. This is perfect for the 20something crowd, but not so good for the others crowds. For €18 you get a hokey tour and 0.5L of beer.
Unexpectedly great . We had a group ticket for Madame Tussauds Heineken and a canal tour the Heineken visit was amazing by far the best thing we hadn't expected it to be so fun.

Amazing day out!. Came here on the recommendation of a friend and we weren't disappointed. First 5 mins I thought were a bit tedious but as soon as you go on the "brew me" ride, everything there after is amazing. Excellent guides and the beer tasting in the star bar is tremendous.
Definitely recommend!!!!

Excellent !. Wasn't sure what to expect but this was fantastic, learn the history of the brand, how it's made, lots of tasting, horses, interactive experiences, pull your own beer, get funny photos taken, and enjoy a free boat road too!!
It's not expensive but prebook as it means your queue jump and it gets really busy!!

Beer Tour. Have been on a couple of tours and if this was my 1st one maybe it would have rated higher. There was a few interactive stations that explained the processing and showed the old brewery as it was when it was in production. This catered to the younger crowds and i wish we hadnt spent the 2 hours, could have done a more historical tour. Good Beer!

Fun!. We went to the Heineken experience for the second time (certain parts were shut the first time). It's interesting throughout and fun with lots of interactive things. The tasting part is good also. Don't forget to go on the boat ride at the end. Shout out to Mike the horse ;)

Brilliant and interactive!. Stayed in Amsterdam for 5days and this was the best thing we done. Staff were all nice and the tour was both interesting and fun with lots of interactive aspects.You learn about the family and how the company started and developed and grew. There is a football and rugby room as Heineken are sponsors, this have games you can play.There are horses in stables as these were used in the past. You can design your own bottle label if you wish and take pictures with different backdrops and email them to yourself on the machine.Loved the experience and would highly recommend it to anyone! Even if you don't like the beer like i do haha
Cool :). Special place recomended for every one to see who go to Amsterdam early morning is The Best time for visit (my experience ) :) The fresh beer just extra... Enjoy :)

Much better than I expected!! . I was reluctant about coming here, I visited the Guinness store house and thought here would be the same. Thankfully it wasn't, they spared no expense. They had a really funky room to enjoy your drink after leaving the tasting room. There was a simulator that showed guests what it would be like to be brewed and bottled at Heineken. They had rugby and soccer games, a boat ride down the canal and a complimentary glass. Well worth the €20

Wish I hadn't bothered!. If you really wish to know how beer is brewed, check it out on the internet. I visited Heineken Brewery 20 years ago and my memories then and very different to my experiences there this week. The staff need a rest (being almost aggressive at times) with one male staff member openly and constantly chatting females up and another throwing dirty water over me when cleaning. ENJOY RESPONSIBLY is the new catch phrase and less than 1x pint of beer served to you is scant recompense for the €18 entrance fee. You would be better off saving your money and buying a beer elsewhere. Wish I hadn't bothered!!

A lot of extravaganza for a lot of commercialism. First of all, a little spendy. Most of the displays and exhibits were very commercial in nature (and really geared toward the young set). I liked learning about the people and the history, but all in all.... a pretty forgettable experience.
Cool experience . Everyone had a great time. It took about 2.5 - 3 hours once we got in. Buying tickets online will save a huge amount of time. A really fun experience.
Loads of fun!. Great value for money, staff were exceedingly friendly, lots of fun and interactive things to do! The free half pints at the end were a lovely finish.

Heineken lovers museum. Very interesting insight to see the birth place of heineken and its original brewery premises. The virtual simulation ride was the best. Entry price includes 2 free half pints.
Avoid the queues to buy tickets and purchase online (or mobile). Ticket prices a couple euros cheaper online.

Super Fun experience. I went there with friends and it was beatifull to take pictures will all the beer antiques and heineken old bottles and brand marks, ALso it was super fun and the place is awesome If you want to have fun dont miss this

worth a visit in Amsterdam. I thought the entrance fee was a bit high but it worked out fine. The ticket includes self-guide tour, 2 sample beers at the end + 1 more for sampling together with staff, other people, and mayber +3 more if you sign up to get pouring certificate + and mayber even more if your fiend tries it and gives you the beer he/she practiced pouring. I felt the tour itself was weak since I've been to breweries where I had more fun and you can skip the audioguide since the same things are on the wall screens. We got some photos taken and emailed from photo booth. We also got the free canal tour to the brand shop and got souvenir beer glass. It's good to visit if you are in Aamsterdam for fun and good learing about their beer.

For beers lovers and even haters. However I trully hate beer, I enjoyed Heineken experience with my friends. i liked the 5D part when we were shown the process of beer production, my friends they really enjoyed having brewed their own beer with a certificate. Place to be in Ams.!

Loved it. I accompanied my husband and had a good time. Alot of interactive things going on which made it fun. Staff were very hype and friendly. We had 2 free beer at the lounge which was cool like a pub atmosphere. History of heneinken and brewing process were shared.we spent nearly about 2hrs in all.

Nothing special if you've been to a brewery tour before. The only reason why my family decided to go to this one is because our friends never been to any brewery tours before. Our first brewery tour was Coors in Colorado. Heineken brewery was no doubt bigger than Coors. They even have horse stables as part of the tour but the smell was strong too. I was kinda expecting that thru the years Heineken would have other flavors added to the original beer. Coors has, even Coca Cola has different drinks in their museum in Atlanta, GA. The only thing I like about this experience is your can personalize your beer bottle. Other than that- I'll pass :(
Great experience. . Possibly the best thing we done whilst we visited Amsterdam. Would highly recommend it's another of fun. And beer included.

Book in advance avoid the wating line.. Amazing tour of Amsterdams number 1 beer museum.The whole experience is what its called.Travel along the route of how the beer is made and markated.Enjoy the interactive experience of the brewing and bottling process.Enjoy tasting the beer and how it should be drunk.Then enjoy 2 beers in a relaxed atmosphere before you come back to reality and exit this amazing experience.Well worth the entry fee 16 euros pp.

An excellent experience. This is must visit! If your a beer expert, just like drinking it or not interested at all it's a really fun and interactive experience for everyone and not just a brewery with some old photos. It takes your through the history of the company, then onto how they brewed the beer and the different stages. There is an small simulator type ride, then a tasting experience followed by a lesson on how to draught your own beer. This is a really fun way to kill a few hours, and if you do get bored at least there's some PS4's to play on.
One of a kind. Interactive room is unbeatible experience.Great fun.What i like is the vibe staff is kind and you definetily get the whole bunch of positive experience.

Lots of fun. We had a very nice evening spent at Heineken Experience! Many things to watch and to taste! Thanks to organizers for a good interactive games! We really enjoyed making our own videos, pics and named bottles))

Beer!!!. Had an awesome time going through the beer experience and their 4D ride being inside a beer keg. Got the chance to pour a perfect beer and understand more about the golden drink we all love. Worth it for sure!

Brilliant for everyone!. I am by no means a beer drinking. Could quite easily say I hate it. But I still highly recommend The Heineken Experience. It was the old brewery so still has the equipment there. You get a wristband with 2 tags on that give you free drinks. Plus you get a small drink to taste and learn about the drink.I found the history of the beer really interesting.
Definitely worth a visit!!!. Amazing experience, lots to do and see. You can spend as much time here as you want and the staff are very friendly and helpful!! would definitely recommend a visit here

Exceptional value for money . Visited with a group of friends early January and we were all extremely pleased we did . Very good value for money with two free pints if Heineken at the end . ( I had a Pepsi but still had a smile on my face ) we even got a free canal trip to take us back to central at the end with a tour guide talking us through the sites as we glided by . Worth the trip .

Definitely worth a visit. Spent a great time on the Experience. (Purchased a tickets previously from Ticket office in centre, was a couple of euro cheaper that way.)Was interesting to find out how the beer made, even had a few minutes long cinema experience, as "following" a beer's way around a factory at the different stages on process. You can have 1-2 glass of beer in the taster room and later on as well, when you can practice beer pouring and receive a certificate of that. They have fun photo boots, football theme room with play stations you can play on. Lot to do for adults and kids can enjoy it too. (I would still refer for adults more likely.)

Not just a tour about Beer!. Very interesting to learn about how the beer is produced with a few little tasters on the way! Interesting marketing history and lots of interactive things to do i.e. taking photos on a green screen, filming videos and playing ps4 :D

Can't put Fun & MUST into one sentence, but this is a MUST DO FUN activity!!. Part art, part science, and loads of FUN - even if you don't drink, it's still impressive and you don't want to miss it. I read on other reviews that you end the tour with a boat trip to store, well that did not take place for us ( maybe cause it was a grey rainy day) but still, it was all I can ask for. P.S. I grabbed a free coupon from Central Station information office for a one Euro off normal ticket price ( that is 18 Euros) and the cashier applied coupon for both my sister and myself - no biggy here but was a lovely touch,

Incredible value for money . What a fantastic tour! We booked tickets for our group online - which gives you a saving of €2 per ticket and you don't have to queue on the day. Arriving at 10am on Saturday morning meant we had the place virtually to ourselves - I'd definitely recommend this time if you don't mind a pre-lunch pint! The tour itself was fun, engaging and interesting. The facility is super modern and features interactive photo booths, sports challenges, a 3D cinema ride and a karaoke experience. For €6 we ordered a personalised Heineken bottle at one of the "interactive" stations, for pick up at the end of the tour. Your ticket includes a visit to the tasting room and tokens for two full-sized beers at the bar. It ALSO includes a 30 minute canal boat cruise, which you should not miss!! Pick up a ticket as you leave the brewery and redeem it at the canal dock across the road. You'd pay at least €10 for a boat cruise alone so it's fantastic value! The boat drops you at the Heineken store in the centre of town. Save some pennies for this part, as there are a ton of cool (well priced!) souvenirs on offer. To top it all off.. our boat captain handed us a voucher for a free personalised Heineken glass with our name engraved on it, to be engraved at the store! All in all we spent over two hours on the tour, and were incredibly impressed by all the "extras" that came along with the €16 ticket. The ONLY thing that stopped me awarding this tour 5 stars were the poor horses kept at the brewery. Yes, they are gorgeous and very impressive to look at.. but they serve no purpose other than to be gawked at by tourists and generally looked VERY unhappy in their tiny stalls. The horses really didn't add anything to the tour and I'd love for the management to rethink keeping them cooped up here.
Was ok. It's a touristy place and didn't enjoy much.They forgot to give me my 2 bands (green bands) which is to be used to redeem beer. We had to argue at the bar for it.
Myst visit for the Story o Heineken . Great tourgreat productgreat locationmany sample 2 get one of biggest brands in the world so dont miss it same as Carlsberg in Copenhagen

Beer is good!. A bit of history, a bit of science and at the end a bit of beer. There are a few sections that are interactive therefore more fun with a group of people, but can still be done solo.Heineken is not a bad drop. In comparison to the Guinness brewery it was more modern and interactive, yet the Guinness display played more on its history and advertising.If you like beer, why not. Also located in a pretty fun part of Amsterdam with lots to do.
Really fun!!. No one can miss it, it does not matter if you drink or not beer, it is really fun for everyone and is highly recommended

a MUST do. We were not sure whether we should go or not at first, but then decided to go at the end, and it was amazing. I would highly recommend it, they have done so much effort to make it great and entertaining. highly recommended. but buy skip the line tickets, it really helps, we had to buy our skip the line tickets online on our cell just to get pass the long queue.

Beer knowledge at it best. I went two times and would go even more, it worth for non alcoholic drinkers! As an bioprocess engineer, the content was well done and explained in a simple way without making it vain, I approve and recommend it!
Killed a few hours. Plenty to do once you're inside. However it could become a bit boring after a while. Some of the photobooths were laughable.

Great walk around experience. Great walk around experience, a few steps but can do at your own leisure. A few interactive things to do and we were lucky as was not too busy so could have a go ourselves. Had a few glassed of heineken and got the taste, not sure why they don't have a bar and cafe to keep you there longer as they already have a captive audience. Would suggest the space that the horses take up is just a waste and replace with a bar and cafe to accomodate the modern world.

Loved it. We did the tour on Saturday afternoon. We where straight in and wasn't much queueing thankfully. The start of the tour was all about the history and how it all started, towards the end became fun. There was photo booth's, light shows, music ect! We loved it! Worth a visit

Great morning well spent! . This is a must for anyone who enjoys a glass or two of Heineken.
Lots of fun interactive things to do,
Give yourself about 2hours to really enjoy it
Definitely try and fit this in your trip
Good crack!. Would recommend a visit was good fun. Spent about two hours and enjoyed a few beers! Plenty of photo oppourtunities. Don't drink the wurt not nice at all.

Fu between museums . Very fun interactive display. You get three beers for the price of the ticket. In the beginning you go through a few rooms that explain the history of the company, next they explain, through a series of methods, the brewing method and you get to see, smell and taste the desperate ingredients+ see the way in which a factory looks. After this you go into a series of interactive displays where you can see heinken's involvement in sports and in Dutch culture. Finally you get to a bar where you can get 2 beers (the first you get between exhibits) and learn to pour from the tab. There is also a Heineken boat that takes you to the store for free- we went on it and it was, we considered, our little canal tour on the trip. Was very fun and different.

A bit of history and fun. Wait until you are the beer !! It's great fun.There is plenty to see and do. You will learn about Heineken from the beginning until now. In the testing area there is no lemonade. Are they scared the British will come over and put a top on their beers lol

Hugely surprised . I really thought ahh here we go,something purely for the other half but surprisingly no!I absolutely loved it and would even do it again!not only did we go on a tour and learn about Heineken but we got turned into a bottle of beer in a simulation ride,we bottled our own Heineken,got to see the horses,play games and I got to pour my own!there was tasting and free pints too!a brilliant gift shop where the staff were lovely.it was my 30th birthday and they couldn't wait to give me freebies.loved it!a must do!

Crowded and expensive.... Disappointed.... Heineken seem to be running this as purely a money making attraction, which is a shame as some good history and facts could have been in the limelight more! Crowded with queues and unfriendly/unhelpful staff.

A must do. The entry fee may seem a little high at first but in fact it's really worth it! You learn many thinks about the origin, history... And in addition you'll have much fun: you have many attractions during the tour and some of them are really unusual (like a simulated bottle in a moving room but I won't tell me to leave the surprise!).Really a must do.

A must do in Amsterdam. The brewing process was very interesting. The tour was interactive and you were able to participate in many activities. You learn how to view the quality of beer. How to drink a beer and you are taught how to properly pour a beer from the tap. Take the free Heineken canal boat ride after the tour. This takes you on the canal and explains a few additional pieces of information, allows you to have another beer, and surprise...a free Heineken glass. You are responsible for your transportation back to the factory or wherever you go next. We purchased the all-day canal pass, which worked out well.
Very good!. Really good experience and I would recommend it for anyone! It's really fun and you get free beers along the way. The atmosphere was really fun and it's not expensive.

Not just a brewery tour. If you want to avoid the queue to this then buy tickets at the cafe just opposite the Rijksmuseum, we were very glad we did! It was so entertaining, not just looking at how the beer is brewed, but also funny videos on the history of the brand, live demonstrations, the chance to stir some hops and shoot at a virtual rugby goal and play the scrum machine in the rugby room. The karaoke machine and the bar at the end were also great, awesome atmosphere, you've got to give it to the staff for being so calm and cheerful with so many people there, great experience.

Good afternoon fun experience . We loved the Heineken experience. Very interactive lots of photo opportunitys. Had afew free beers aswell. Pour yr own get a certificate and the mistake beers u pour too so worth doing for fun. Chill in bar at end good vibe. We then got a free boat over to their shop got free glass. And better still was righ nr icebar which was our nxt visit. Good fun afternoon.

Great attraction - well worth a visit!. The staff here are so lovely and the experience is definitely one to do if ever in Amsterdam. I visit this attraction every time I have been to Amsterdam (all with others who have not been previously) and every time I expect the same however it continues to surprise me! I thoroughly enjoy the visit and look forward to another again at the end of the month with another newbie.

Great afternoon out. I'm not a beer drinker so when this experience was suggested I was a little unsure as to whether i wanted to go or not. I ended up going and had a great time. We managed to get a discount off the tickets - vouchers can be found in most hotels. We walked around and found lots of interactive activities plus free photos and videos of you having fun. You get 3 half pints of beer included in the price. You should also go to the roof top bar as there's a great view of the city.

Heineken experienxe. For someone who doesn't drink beer I thought this would be a boring trip but was completely wrong. From start to finish the 'experience' is entertaining. It is good value for money and a perfect way to spend a quiet afternoon. There is lots of different activities within the museum, such as rugby try games and photo booths.

A Really Good Place To Visit. I thought this was great. Reading about the history of Heineken was very interesting and there are loads of little kool things inside! You can print a souvenir photo for €1. And you can put your name on a beer bottle for €6.50. Also if you get a chance listen out for the option to go to the 6th floor. You get a full view of the city from the top and also have the option to buy a burger and a beer. They were also giving out free cruise so take it if you haven't got anything planned. I'd defo recommend for anyone traveling to dam!
Best museum . The best museum at the world, free beer, and very very friendly staff, a lot of culture mixed with al lot of fun.Ps: at the end of the trip on the museum you can get a free boat tour!!

Well worth it. This was a great guided tour which finishes in a bar where you receive a complementary drink. You can also purchase your own personalised bottle of Heineken with your name on it as a souvenir
Fabulous . Everything about this experience is fantastic. DEFINATELY a must. Something for everyone. Make you own beer and have it specially named up.

Amazing Heineken history. What a experience, understanding the history of the beer, learn how is it made and learn the culture of Heineken. All worthwhile. Remember to download the Heineken experience app before heading there.

Great fun!. I am a local in Amsterdam, and if I have friends visiting from abroad, i take them to the Heineken Experience. Its a fun way to learn about how beer is made! You get involved in the process whilst walking though the museum. Price is lower if you buy the tickets online. strollers NOT welcome. these can be checked in at the cash register free of charge (as well as coats and bags). Price includes two free beers in the museum and a boat ride with the Heineken boat to Rembrandt square, where you can pick up some sort of goodie bag.

For beer lovers. it was a must visit for my friends while our visit to amsterdam . we bought tickets online. but once we enetered, it was a great fun even if you are not an beer lover . there is lots of crazy and fun stuff to do inside and of course you can have beer and relax with frineds .

Must do!. Been here with friends, the "museum" side is interesting (history of Heineken and stuff), but, the beer tasting experience, the draught beers at the end are the cherry on top.
It is worth the money...just the tour, no need for the audio or the VIP.

Fun of Beer!. Very well designed tour of old Heiken Factory. Includes fun and beer. I highly advice to go in around 17:00, so you can end up in the final stop of the tour having beer with the nice and cheerful crew singing loud. Nice one and recommended.
Very nice!. Great attraction. Fun fun fun. Very slow service at the rooftop bar but nice in general. Crowded of course but except.in the bar and shop we don t feel it during the tour.

Pretty fun. I went here knowing that I don't really like Heineken bier, however after sitting in their media room I like it more. The tour was cool, but seriously their media experience will brain wash you into loving the Budweiser of The Netherlands. Also they serve "Heineken extra cold" it still sucks, but its free, so cheers.
Super experience. Just cool as a nice bottle of Heineken... worth to visit. Prebooked ticket so got some discount. Nice cold pint at the end...

Great!. The Heineken experience was just down the road from the Rijksmuseum, so we strolled down to have a look.It's definitely worth a visit, as well as being informative, it's good fun as well and you actually learn quite a bit about the history of the beer as well as how to pour & enjoy it. We didn't bother going for the audio tour or VIP experience, and I'm quite glad too, all of the information throughout is in English.Great if you're a rugby or football fan as there is dedicated parts of the tour for this, plus other interactive bits as you go. Plus you get a couple of perfect beers at the end! Well worth a visit!
Brilliant. one of the best things to do in Amsterdam. very interactive, extremely interesting and highly entertaining. i would go back again.

Pointless tourist place. Wasted 16€ on a ticket to that pointless place you can learn in Vikipedia about.They show a bit of the making process in theory and at the end you get to pour yourself a not-warm-not-cold glass of Heineken (which is gross cause it's not cold..).

Didn't Really Fancy This But Loved It Once I Was There!!. I took my husband to Amsterdam for a birthday treat in December. Among other things, he wanted to visit the Heineken Experience. I wasn't too enthusiastic about going but went along after a lovely cruise along the canals, on a Lovers Cruise boat.We took a tram from the harbour near our hotel and within 10-15 minutes we were at the Heineken Experience. We had previously bought our tickets (recommended) so there was no need to queue.When we were shown to the start of the experience and we were a little disappointed thinking we would have to read all about it. But as the time went on we were enthralled by the presentations. There was an amazing Powerpoint type presentation of where it all began, giving us great detail in a light hearted way. Then we were put into a room and asked to hold the bar in front of us. On the large screen in front of us was a guy who told us we were going to be made into Heineken. He started to explain and demonstrate how it was made and we were in sprinkled water, it made us rock about and all sorts of things, just like a ride at Disneyland. It was such fun.We were then walked through where somebody demonstrated with hops and the other ingredients that go into it. We were walked through the old hops containers and saw the horses that used to pull the barrels. Then came the good part, we were taken into a bar and given a small glass of the beer. We were told how to drink it properly and told we could move to the other bar area and get our free drinks, which were part of the entrance fee. After our free drinks we then moved on into a type of amusement room. It was filled with video, photo and virtual games. It was a really fun end to the experience. There was, of course, a shop which had everything you could possibly think of to buy with a Heineken logo. We had a bottle engraved with our names and the date which was boxed for us to take home. They were kind enough to let us know we could not take it through passport/security, which we presumed anyway, but apparently people had had their bottles removed in the past.We were invited to visit the bar on the roof. We went up there and it was amazing. The views from the roof were fantastic but it was pouring with rain so we sat inside instead in a very comfortable and full of atmosphere bar. The music blasting was really good, lot of old school and we bought more tokens and quite happily sat there for another hour. I would highly recommend this tour,Foxyfox10

Better than I thought. Came here with a group of friends, I didn't think it was going to be interesting, but it was, you get about 3 free drinks whilst you are there and there is also a lot of things to do to keep you busy

Very Good,. I would reccomend to buy tickets before you are due to visit as the queue is huge, It was a very enjoyable experience, i especially liked the sport aspect, i think its very worth the money and it is a must see attraction in Amsterdam
Beer Making Experience. Its a fun interactive walk with loads of Live demonstrations about beer making process with a beer tasting at end. Just try it, you wont regret it.

Better than expected. This tour was very interactive both with staff giving talks on how to make beer and props including an hilarious 4D short movie experience, There was alot here which we did not expect so wont spoil it for you but didnt realise Heineken was involved in the Superbowl half time show.You get a complimentary wrist band with drinks tokens attached which you can exchange later for 2 small beers or 1 large ice cold beer which we opted for, There are opportunities to win free beers so listen lol, We had a really fun interactive 90 mins and think its worth every penny.The shop at the end sells everything at reasonable prices, Great staff, Great tour, Great price 10 outta 10.

Surprisingly Interactive!. My wife and I visited the experience on 10th January and were pleasantly surprised at how interactive the tour was. I've been to various brewery tours, wine tasting events and factory show rounds. While they have all been enjoyable, none of them allowed you to "be the beer" as it were.I recommend buying through the website, as you queue jump, practically going straight in.

Good value and good fun. Great place to spend a few hours and learn about this iconic brand in a fun interactive way. Ticket price includes 2 beers and a boat ride back to the centre of town. Well worth it!

Very enjoyable experience. Fun way of spending a few hours while learning something about this company. Plenty of information about its history, loads of interactive activities which were really fun, good beer.......what more do you need? Ended up taking the free boat ride up to their brand store, located close to the center of the city. Was very impressed with the friendly staff and how clean and well kept everything is. Definitely worth a visit.

Fun time with friends. The Heineken Experience is exactly what it sounds like, an experience. The tour was fun and very informative with great facts about both the company and the city itself. At the end of the tour there are photo both and other activities to enjoy, including the tasting room. The thing that most impressed me was the friendly nature of everyone that worked there. It was beyond the normal nature of an employee, the people were just that friendly. I felt it enhanced the whole experience. Make sure you get a custom bottle to take home and the gift shop is really fun. Enjoy and be happy.
Buy tickets online. This is a must! Very quirky tour and you get 2 drinks at the end while you take in the sights on their rooftop bar. Buy tickets online to skip the line!

A unique experience!. A great unique experience that is interesting as well as hands on.We purchased our tickets in advance in conjunction with the Ice Bar Amsterdam and it worked out cheaper.You begin by having a self guided tour of the history of Heineken and then you move onto the process of producing the lager.After that you go through a more interactive part of the tour where you can enjoy trying out and taking photos of all the things Heineken sponsor, for example Champions League Football.After being shown how to drink your beer correctly you are then able to have either two half pints or one extra cold pint of Heineken for free.The tour roughly takes about an hour and a half from start to finish but is good value, informative and fun.
Heineken experience. A great way to spend a couple of hours in Amsterdam! Even my wife enjoyed it and she knows nothing about beer!!!
Quite fun! I recommended!. Not that bad! An experience during the production and the export of Heineken with fun details! I think that the ticket it's not that expensive!

Great night out!. Going on a tour of a brewery sounds really boring but it was so much fun. The museum is very interactive and each section of the tour has something completly different to the other section. You get two free beers and more when you do the tester and MORE if you answer questions right in the tasting room so listen to how the beer is made :D

Fabulous day out. This is definitely worth a visit. The history of how the Heineken family came to set up the company and how the traditions are still continued today. Each room has so many facts it really is fascinating.

Worth a Visit. Go earlier in the day to bypass the queues! Tour starts off with history of the founder and his family and the accolades and accomplishments, have to say was quite surprised at the number of medals won but then not surprised at how Heineken is such a big brand now. They've worked hard to earn it!I thought we'd see a working current factory but it's only the original showing the old vats, etc. There's a cool stand on interactive ride with effects, and lots of funny interactive photo booths and videos as well as the museum, tasting bar, pour your own pint and a huge shop. And don't forget to go up in the lift to the cool rooftop bar, with DJ and a great view over the city!!

Really Enjoyable well worth doing. Enjoyed this a lot including the ride, the tasting, and the beers after. Cool place. Highly recommend as a couple of 34 year olds.. It was my misses birthday and she got a free mug too when we mentioned it ;)

Fun way to spend a few hours!!. Interesting to visit the place where the Heineken beer was founded. Lots of good information inside to keep it fun and interesting. Easy to spend a few hours here. After the tour you get 2 free beers in the bar. You can stay as long as you like. There was a long line to get in after we left so go early! Would definitely recommend a visit if your in the area!

Fun place to spend for an afternoon!. We went there with 3 other friends, great fun to see how does Heineken family make their beers worldwide!The best part is the 3 free draft beers, we were slightly tipsy and enjoyed the video/photo machine, we got the cute videos and photos immediately!

The legacy of Freddy Heineken. I'm more into speciality beers, but I consider Heineken as one of the best lagers available around the globe. Moreover, their impressive portfolio includes some of the best beers in the world. The Experience looks more like an overwhelming and interactive tribute in sound and vision to the marketing genius of Freddy Heineken. There isn't that much to experience for the serious beer lover. Anyway, not that bad, but more like a joy ride into a publicity spot.

Enjoyable and completely Entertaining!. Me and my boyfriend loved everything about this place. Staff extremely friendly and helpful! I'm not a beer drinker and only really went to say I was there but it ended up being one of my favorite things I did in Amsterdam. Full of interactive games like fifa, karaoke, and photo booths to keep you entertained. I even got a certificate for pouring a perfect beer! The bar is brilliant and the barmen are so happy and cheerful really sets the brilliant atmosphere! will recommend this to all of my friends! AMAZING!

Simply amazing. What great value this experience is!
Firstly I would recommend purchasing tickets in advance to avoid queues.
The tour was much more better and longer than I had imagined,
Very interactive with attractions to suit all ages.
I must note that this is much more than just a tour about how the beer is brewed.
Simply excellent!

Great fun, great tour. We came here last week expecting the usual standard tour fare but were really surprised just how good the tour was.The layout was great, giving you a history f the company and story of how it was founded. The beer making process is explained throughout the tour, with friendly, funny and helpful staff on hand to offer information, help and stories throughout the tour.The part where they explain, interactively, the brewing process was great and the tour just got better as you went around it.The interactive parts were good fun and this tour was unlike most brewery tours we have been on: it starts traditionally and then evolves into something more fun and inclusive.The price is good at 16 Euros and with this you get 3 free drinks included (one on the tour and two in the bar after). We didn’t need to wait long at the bar and if you fancy pulling a pint yourself you can. Overall a great, fun and an enjoyable experience with friendly, fun, helpful and informative staff and I would say this is a must-do if you visit Amsterdam.

Good fun!. I'm not personally a beer drinker myself but I do like Heineken so this was very interesting for me. It was good being able to see how the beer is actually made and the amount of effort that goes into making it, and also learning how to taste and smell the beer. Some very good interactive features as well such as pouring your own pint, photo booths, karaoke station and much more! It's a rather long tour but there's plenty to do. Plus we got some free drinks at the end so that rounded the tour off nicely!

Fun visit!. Again, I visited the Heineken Experience 10 years ago and it has definitely grown, but in a great way! My husband and I had such a fun time visiting! The copper container area was fun, the horses were fun. The interactive "ride" was fun, but strange. The first tasting was nice. 10 years ago, you only got a small pint glass in the entire visit. The big screens with commercials after the first tasting was exciting. The interactive areas were awesome, but we just didn't have enough time to hang out, in fact we barely had time to drink our free pint at the end. One downer was they no longer give away small pint glasses. I was told we could visit another store closer to downtown for the free glass. We did visit, but my husband forgot the vouchers and they were closed. Oh well. Overall, it was a great time at the Heineken Experience! We needed about 2-3 hours overall and we just didn't have that time.

It was okay.. . Came here with 4 friends. As I am not really very interested in beer, I didn't really appeal to me. It was interesting to see the barley, yeast and hops, and even have a taste. You have 2 free drinks at the end of the experience, but these were the best parts of the Heineken Experience for me.

Great value for money. Myself and my partner visited the Heineken Experience around 12.30 and walked straight in without queuing (when we walked past on other days there were quite lengthy queues.) We were pleasantly surprised by how friendly the staff were at the ticket desk (and all the way around the tour), where there was also a free coat and a bag check if you wanted. The self guided tour is fantastic, they have worked hard to convey the history of the family and the beer, with speakers and hands on exhibits as you go round, as well as modern elements too. We really enjoyed the trying session and the two beers which are included in very reasonable ticket prices. A great thing do for a couple of hours in a wonderful city....would definitely recommend it!

Good fun. Good cheap fun! For €16 each you get admission and two free beers. Was not expecting as much visitor participation. There are photo point, bottle makers, games, a ride and even a beer tasting/knowledge class included.

Great fun,. Had a good laugh here with my boyfriend. As well as it being informative, it was great fun getting invloved in the games and tasks they had. To top it off we had the opportunity to have a beer on the terrace with a view over Amsterdam and a bottle made with our name on it!

Great Value. Great value excursion (with the iamsterdam city card it's only €13.50) as you get entrance plus 2 beers. You also get a third as part of the tasting session. I don't particularly like beer however just visiting the brewery and learning about the company's heritage is interesting and it is all so interactive. We were there for a good 2.5 hours as there was so much to see!!

Pretty cool but not a must see.. I had heard about the Heineken Experience before and we received a discount voucher for it so we decided to go. There were a lot of people there so we had to queue, but it moved quite quickly. On the tour you see all of the different rooms of the old brewery and what they were used for, and even get to taste the beer at early stages of the brewing process. You then go on to learn about the different ingredients in Heineken and get to play a simulation game that teaches you how to pour a pint. At the end you are given a small glass of Heineken and told how to taste it, and finally you go through to the bar and can have either two small glasses or one large glass of Heineken. It was interesting and we enjoyed it, but felt it was more of a gimmick than anything. Fun thing to do on a rainy day, and you do get a drink out of it also!

A good giggle. The Heineken museum was good fun. It showed you how the we'r has been Brewer and how key ingredients make the unique taste. There is plenty of interactive stuff and best of all the tasting at the end!

The Notgoodeken Experience. This "experience" was the only terrible, tourist-trap like and tacky one that I had in Amsterdam, The Netherlands. It starts with the longest queue in the world, an extremely over priced entry then met by another queue as you enter into the "experience" itself. After this queue is a very pathetic attempt at a museum walk through with little to no actual history on Heineken. Instead, you find the tourists who are the ones holding up the queue, taking selfies with any object they see. Following this is a brief walk (still queuing) through a fake brewery with a testing of hops or barley or something (I can't remember, it was all very dull). Keeping up with the queue, you then walk past the horse shed which had filled the "brewery" with the sweet scent of horse excrement and hay so you now know what that awful smell was that started 10 minutes before. One big flight of stairs, and you have reached the queue of a life time, with nothing to do while you wait for a terrible 4D "experience" of the process of becoming a beer (oh, except more tourist taking vain selfies with Heineken advertisements). After MUCH waiting, you then enter the tasting room (finally, BEER! The reason you came) and then on to the actual bar, although they won't make it easy for you! Follow along floors and floors of thinly veiled subliminal advertising in the form of heinous Heineken games, photo booths and other tourist traps, before reaching the actual club type bar which is as classy as your hometown's night club on student night. -20/10. Do not do this! You could Google Heineken Beer, watch a video of a beer brewing and buy some better quality beer to enjoy at home which would end up being cheaper and more valuable than this whole "experience"!
I love beer.. A must visit if in AMsterDAM. Book tickets on line! It is about 2 hours or more since there is a bar you enjoy your free beers.
Best beer. I and my cousin was visiting Heineken Experience. If you come to Amsterdam this place you news to visit. Bought some nice souvenirs :)

Don't miss the roof top bar,. Loved this experience! You can take the tour at your own pace, facilities are available for non English speakers, or people with special requirements. Informative and a good way to while away a few hours. Don't miss the roof top bar, the views are amazing!

Well done tourist attraction. This is just a great big tourist trap. But it is so well done that it is pretty much worth the $28 euro for the 2 hours you will spend there. My teen actually took those corny green screen pictures. Let your inhibitions down have a break from strolling the city

Surprisingly nice outing. We went here with our Italian friends. At first I was a little sceptical because I did not have really high expectations.Yes, it is a museum to glorify the "quality" of heineken (I prefer Hertog Jan or Grolsch) but they have done it in a very nice way. Instead of simply showing the brewing process they try to give you an insight in all the different aspects of the company (from the history till the modern commercials) and in doing this they really give you a very nice couple of hours to enjoy with bigger and smaller groups.The staff is really good, the daughter of our friends did not feel good in the bar and they immediatly noticed and offered to help, and the atmosphere is very nice.For 16 euros (do not buy the ticket at the museum bot a some agents in the centre of Amsterdam, saves 2 euros) you have a nice time and 3 beers :-) what else could you want in live.

If you like combining beer and history, this place is for you. This is a Beer history museum. You either like it or not. The stories are interesting, and the exhibit items, photos and the "assembly line" are very cool.There are 2 guided parts that are fun as well.They offer cold beer as a nice bonus.

A nice experience. You get to learn how Heineken started and how to make your own beer. You also get 2 free drinks. There's a bar and entertainment center at the end of the tour. Ideal for a group of friends looking to have a good time! Highly recommend this!
Great. Staff are friendly and engaging. Got 5 free drinks and labelled my own beer. Had a laugh with partner. Maybe going around the actual production would of been better. But still worth a visit
Fantastic. Wonderful brewery and great tour. Lots of interactive items and beer tasting opportunities. Lines can be long if not arriving early

Well worth a look!. Not a big fan of beer in general but the whole exhibition was really enjoyable. Good balance of fun and facts and parts were also very interactive.. The Heineken was great too! Definitely worth the €17!

Well worth the visit. There is so much to do here from seeing how the beer is made to taster sessions and games rooms. They even had a mini club if you fancy a dance after. It's better to pre book tickets, there are plenty of tourist shops about that sell them. The queue was very long to buy tickets at the door.

NOT worth your money. 18 euro and in line for one hour.Finally inside the first part was okay. You get the history of Heineken, but that part only takes you about 5-10 minutes to go through.The rest is simply crap. A carnival for kids.If I wanted a circus, tivoli or playground I would have gone there and NOT to a brewery.Shame on you Heineken. This is a scam....

Great Time. The brewery has so many interactive aspects it is hard not to have a good time. The entrance includes free drinks at the end of the tour, taste testing, simulator, beer making processes and more...

Something different and interactive.. It was a good insight into the history and manufacturing of Heinekin beer. Very modern, fun and interactive. Worth the €16 entry fee as we got a free Heinekin canal cruise, 2 free Heinekin glasses and 2 free beers. Be aware they do blast you with loads of brand advertising. I would recommend this to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

A definite must . The Heineken Experience is a great way to understand the brewing process of Heineken (and to try beer). The self-guided tour is set really well. The first part offers a history of the Heineken company. One thing I particularly enjoyed was the 4D film of the process of producing beer, set in the perspective of the beer itself. I suggest to buy your tickets online in advance to skip the queue. Definitely recommended.

A total laugh. This was a very slick and impressive presentation overall, especially the moment we 'became a bottle of beer' (seriously, you have to do this!), plus the following explanation why one has to have a thick foam on beer (I never did get the science on this, and we Brits and Australians were castigated for not understanding...). Well, I get it now, but I'd say you just don't drink your beer quickly enough. The only downside was the 'experience' of drinking our 2 free beers. Look, it's not my age, but I do like to savour my beer with a conversation, absolutely impossible with the ear-bleeding disco musak in the background. Perhaps their idea to get rid of us, given how popular the place is. All the same, I'd say it's worth a visit. Also, a brilliant Indian restaurant round the corner!!
Insightful and Beer!!. Interesting history of Heineken and samples of beer. Tastes better than anywhere else you get Heineken. Worth the visit if never been and not bad price. Free WIFI also.

Nothing special. Very touristy. Nothing special. I expected more interaction and less reading however it proved to be quite an old school tour. There are some interactive screens and games at the end but it has nothing to do with the making of the beer or the brewery itself.

Make sure you pre-book!!!. We visited this attraction as it is my husband's favourite beer! After queueing for 2 HOURS in the freezing cold, we finally got inside, only to queue again at the ticket desk. The tour itself was interesting, it took you through the history of Heineken and the brewing procedure, and ended up with a 4D showing of how beer is made (this was another 40 minute queue) Finally, you got to sample the beer itself - 2 half pints per person which was very welcome after all the queueing. I did enjoy this attraction, but would probably have enjoyed it more if I hadn't spent half of the afternoon queuing - so word of advice PRE BOOK YOUR TICKETS ONLINE to avoid the queues.

Fun and interesting. A very nice very to spend a couple of hours, alone ore with friends. You'll get to know interesting things about the Heineken brand. Fun, nice. I would recommend to get tickets online to skip the line. You can also have a little discount online.
Really enjoyable. Booked our tickets online, so no need to queue. Really enjoyable experience, very interactive and fun. Great way to spend an afternoon in Amsterdam.

Nice way to spend a couple of hours. First thing - book your ticket in advance! We went online on our phone an hour prior and that helped us jump the queue. Heineken have done a nice job of telling the story, showcasing their immense marketing capability, and giving you the opportunity to have a drink (or 2!). They give you tokens that you can turn in for drinks - opt for the smaller size you will get more beer overall. Really nice views from the rooftop bar so it's worth visiting there. Only downside was that to get the free glass you had to wait for the boat or walk 30 mins. The boat isn't that frequent so you can still take your voucher to the official store - but something to keep in mind.

Great!. Great place, very nice staff on every floor, we heard and saw everything about the beer and its production. Its also very funy to use all their games, videos, take pictures of yourself and then to taste the beer, which is very good.

Very interesting and fun!. Me and my boyfriend have been to the Heineken museum twice now as we loved it! They have loads of information, interactive fun activities and free beer at the end! The staff are all really energetic and really explain things well. I learnt a lot about beer and I'm sure I will go again when I next visit Amsterdam. They also have nice souvenirs, I got my name engraved on a beer glass, really recommend visiting here

Great tour. Great tour with very enthusiastic staff. Great split between museum esque Heineken History and modern day stuff. The beer was also the best and very fresh. Alot more fun then expected with free digital souvenirs.
An unforgettable experience. I spent there the whole day,having fun, learning how to make beer and enjoying the drink at the end of the tour.

Quite pleasant experience. The tour of the museum was not boring at all, as originally thought. They explain the family tradition, the beer recipe and offer Heineken at the end of the tour. There's a social media area where you may take selfies and a couple of rooms with their most popular ads.

interesting & fun. an interesting insight into the production & history of Heineken. Not sure how interesting I was expecting this to be but they did well. You get a free beer at the tasting stage (and an extra one if you answer a question correctly) then you get 2 more at the end of the tour so I wouldn't recommend driving there. decent way to kill a couple of hours.

Just a bunch of advertising. I brew beer at home and really wanted to experience the brewery and its technical process along with the history of the name. They do a decent job describing the history of the Heineken family, and practically zero effort on how beer is brewed. After 15 minutes of that there is a a whole lot of demonstrating the power of the Heineken brand. Its a fun little tour for youngsters or people just looking to enjoy a bit of hooky advertising gimmickry. I won't say it is a waste of time, but more of a fun wacky beer related attraction. Not really all that interesting to someone who is a real beer geek. Oh, and there is a decent tasting event in the tour, to which you only try one beer and its the same one everyone has already tried, but teaches you how to assess a beer from a judging standpoint. It would have been nice to do it with a flight of beers in a range of styles produced by Heineken.

Unreal experience and had fun. This is very fun and enjoyable experience. Learning about the brewing is good, seeing the Heineken horses in comfort is a lovely thing and the simulator and the interactive areas make for a great tour. This is such an enjoyable place and a must see for beer lovers or anyone with an interest in drink in Amsterdam
Great Day Out. I don't like Heinieken but this was an enjoyable and fun trip out! Lots to see and do, plus two free drinks. What more could you ask for?Get there early to avoid the lines.

Beer brewed the way it should be. The Heineken experience is highly recommended when in Amsterdam. It provides a good overview of the beer making process and shows the equipment that was used when it was still an operating brewery. Entry also includes two tokens that can be used to exchange for two beers. Tip: just before that there is a beer tasting demo, answer the questions first and don't be shy, you can end up with at least 4 beers here.

Must for Beer Lovers!. It takes you through the entire history of Heineken, some fun activities and then obviously Beer tasting! You also get a chance to pour your own glass. At the end we got a complimentary boat ride to get back in the Centrum.Recommend to book tickets online to avoid the queue.

Buy the advance tickets.. I cannot believe that people would stand in line for hours to experience Heineken! Get the advance tickets. You will still have to wait for periods of time throughout the tour in order to progress to the various displays. It was informative and fun and surprising to see the horse stable. The bar was upscale and entertaining.

Great start to the day!. Had a fantastic day here with friends! We pre-purchased before going which was a big plus as the line was huge! It was so much fun learning about the beer, tasting the beer and having a laugh along the way. We all ended the tour by buying personalized heinekens for ourselves and as gifts for others. I would highly recommend to other travelers.

Expensive but worth it. At first it looks very expensive but you get a wristband as a souvenir, three beers inside (more if you answer the questions the bartender asks), a boat tour to their official store and a glass in the souvenir store. And besides getting all that, the experience in amazing to see, to all ages.
Great day out. Really enjoyable experience I highly recommend. There were games to play and fact to learn about the 'smiling e' there was even free beer to drink.

More like an arcade then brewery.. This place is very cool for guys and kids (I am serious). There is such interactive things to do from taking photos with backdrops to rugby training to a stimulated ride! The bar at the end is like a bar you would go to on the weekend with music and interactive pictures of the world. Before you leave get your ticket for the free boat cruise to the Heineken shop and get a free gift there!

Must Do!. The Heineken experience was really good fun.
You get to see how it was made, the ingredients, what events and sponsored stuff they have done and there is also a ride
You get free beer.
The rooftop bar was open which was apparently a rare occasion, it offered really good views of Amsterdam.

Heineken experience fun. Well what can I say about the experience apart from amazing! Third time in the dam and first time at the factory. It literally had something for everyone. Me and my girlfriend had such a good day. Learned a lot about the company and its history. Learned about distilling and brewing. Such a good laugh and would recommend to anyone over 18. All ages. Staff are so much fun.

Worth a visit. First a warning. Even if you book "skip the line" tickets, you will still have to queue - we waited around 30 minutes to get in, although the other queue would have been a lot longer.Once inside, it is a good, lighthearted experience. There is plenty of things to keep visitors, young and old, interested. It's reasonable value for money, with 2-3 glasses of Heineken included.

Fun Experience. We had a great time here, and we were able to learn about how the beer was made, go through the tour and at the end you can make your own bottle of beer with your name on it It is worth it for a visit to this place when in Amsterdam.
Not worth the price. Less than average attraction and all that. A moment of history, a moment in the old brewing rooms - attraction is aimed, perhaps, only on brand building.
Interactive museum. Book tickets online to avoid the queue. Interactive experience. Make funny videos & photos, get free beers.

Good Tour. Good tour, reminded me of the Coca-Cola museum in Atlanta. You get to see some old marketing materials, enjoy some interactive experiences and even get a Heineken bottle with a personalized message. The best part is the tasty beer! Worth a visit if in Amsterdam for the first time.

Had great fun at this place, we are now Heineken fans!. This is a great place to visit and we learnt loads about the way that Heineken beer is brewed and they were really generous with their samples and you get at least 2 free drinks at the end. There is also loads of interaction and you can personalise bottles; make photos etc, which is good fun. I would recommend this place to visit.

Worth its rating. This experience warrants it's rating as being one of the best in Amsterdam. The experience can be decorated as professionally put together from start to finish. Waiting outside in the rain did not deter the experience, and every angle of the Heineken Experience was well packaged. The highlight of the tour is the 4D video experience and glass of beer at the end of the tour. This was followed by a very modern bar setup where the drinking could continue. The day concluded with you being able to personalise a beer bottle with your name which was available instantly in the shop afterwards at a nominal fee. Well put together team.

Noisy with lots of kids running around. This was not that good of an experience for me. Lots of kids were running around and screaming. Museum was also over populated and crowded. The horse manure smell was also a little of putting. The beer at the end made up for all of the chaos though.

Don't have to like the beer!. Beer is like wine, like food, some you like some you don't. I don't like Heineken, but I enjoyed the Heineken Experience, informative and fun. A bit for the technical and all. Some fun sideshow games for participants, a trading lesson and two beers or soft drinks to finish off. Easy to get to, worth a try.

Nice but thats it... comeparing to another brewery i visited i was alittle disapointed. The heiniken beer experiance is more about the barnd marketing than the producing of the beer.
A nice experiance, but not more. I dont think it worth 18 euros.

Go to a pub instead. I came here last year in march with a friend. We spent 20-25 euros to go on the Heineken experience, which included two free pints and a sampling session. You will walk round and learn who invented the 'famous brew' and how it is produced today. There are some interactive activities too. When all this is over, be prepared to stand in a long queue to watch this 4d video of some guy going through the beer brewing process. If you haven't died from boredom at this point, you can finally sample the Heineken with a bartender guiding you on the professional way to do it - basically wine sampling. Whilst you wait for your group to finish, you can sit in this large room with loud music and trippy visuals. I actually found this to be the most enjoyable part of the experience. You can collect your free two pints at the end if you want to at a bar. Whilst I'm not a massive beer drinker, I kind of had higher expectations for this attraction. A lot of the information on the displays can be looked up on Wikipedia or Googled in a matter of seconds. I think most of the people there (in our group at least) were feeling the same and just wanted to get to the end. Nonetheless, it's worth doing if your bored and have nothing better to do.
Good Tour!. Brilliant tour within walking distance of the city centre or jump on a tram. Download the app and you can listen to a tour guide.

Fun experience. Very fun tour with lots of attractions . You get to hear about the brewing process and Heiniken's specialty in this field . Some history of the Heiniken family is also given . You get to drink few beers and learn some cool stuff like how to serve the beer correctly. Nonetheless, if you are a beer fan like myself and already visited a brewery in your life you won't see much you have'nt seen already .

Really enjoyable brand experience . Surprising and informative fun; way better than expected with historical elements and modern day brand fun! Enjoy a couple of the finest beers you've ever had along with simulations, pouring contests, selfie spots and all things Heineken.

Marketing Amusement Park. We enjoyed our heineken experience but noticed that the production process is not completely presented and more than half of the exhibition is devoted to the brand's marketing and not the beer itself. If you're ok with this you'll still have fun.

An experience. We enjoyed the experience to an extent but you're really just paying for the privilege of being advertised at for an hour, could do with a bit more history and transition into the Heineken we know today. Some good photo ops though.

Interesting experience . You learn a lot of interesting facts about the Heinekens past and present, also how it is made. It clever how they do it and that every Heineken is the same quality. Plus you get 3 free Heinekens, you get to create your own bottle with your name on it, if you like.

So much better than just a brewery tour!. We spent over 3hrs there - it was great. The brewery tour was interesting but there were so many other interesting brand elements to interact with relating to their music and sporting sponsorships. And then at the end we went up to the rooftop bar for burgers, beers and a live band.Definitely recommend buying the tickets online in advance so that you can skip the queue. We got there at 11:45am and the crowds were really manageable. When we left at 3:30pm the queue outside was getting pretty crazy!When we left they gave us tickets for a free canal boat shuttle that took us back into the city, where we got free souvenir beer glasses at the Heineken store. Those tickets just kept on giving
Was fun, but could be more beer. The tour is fun, but they beer tasting is very limited. But tickets in advance online. That works really well.
