Must visit!. It was really really interesting to know the history of heineken beer and the fact that it is their first factory. They have lot of activities to interact with people. We spent 2 hours there.

Great Day Out!. we visited Heineken on new years eve, it was great fun but I really recommend you pre book as the queues can get pretty long, we had to wait 30 minutes with pre-booked tickets so imagine how long it would be without, very interesting and great fun!

Great fun, interesting and plenty of BEER!. I've been here twice and loved it each time. The story of Heineken is told in an engaging and interactive way with plenty of tasters throughout.You get a wristband as you go in which entitles you to 1 extra cold Heineken or two regular Heinekens at the end of the experience. It'll also give you a free branded glass which you can pick up from the brand store a few blocks away.Definitely worth the money and a great way to spend a couple of hours.
Well worth a trip. Great attraction a must do on a visit to Amsterdam. I would definitely say get there early or pre book online tickets as it gets very busy from 12 o clock onwards.

Fantastic!. Very informative, had a great time walking round and learning the history of Heineken. very clean and well presented, my partner and i was very impressed and had such a fun time. they had a 'ride' which was a but silly but pretty funny although it was a 20 min wait. at the end of the ride we got a free half pint of beer.Once you reach the end you have the chance to have either one free ice cold pint beer or two half pints. Again we qued for at least 20 minuets. i suggest if you want to get tickets you do it online because the Que outside to get tickets is nearly all the way round the block.
A must for beer lovers . A great visit in the heart of Amsterdam to know how the international leading beer is made and it's History !!

Touristy but great fun for a couple of hours!. Depending on how fast you go and how long you stay for drinks after, the whole experience should take approximately 1.5 to 2 hours. If you get your tickets online, it's 2 Euros off the regular price. Some of the tourist passes also get you a discounted price, so do check.Despite being clearly a tourist attraction, Heineken does a pretty good job of being informative, entertaining and engaging with a good variety of different experiential elements throughout. At the end, you leave with a buzz thanks to a serving or two of cold beer (that comes included in your ticket price) and the happy, energetic inventiveness of the good people at Heineken.
Scary. Lots of people and a great ambiance. The best advice is to stay on the main streets and avoid the back roads. Lots of seedy characters.

Brilliant afternoon well worth a visit. What a brilliant afternoon we spent here we did queue for an hour to get it in but well worth every minute. The tour is great you learn quite a lot about the brewing process and there is an interactive section which is a lot of funThe tasting was good as was well and you get 2 free drinks.Would highly recommend but book before you go as its very busy
Good fun. Me and my mates visited here whilst on our trip abroad, worth the money for sure! They throw in a few fresh beers and take you on a little journey! Worth a visit.

Great fun!. My partner and I went a few days ago and had a great time at the Heineken Experience.We pre-purchased our tickets so only waited about 10mins to go in. We learned about the beer-making process, got to touch and see the old machinery and taste wort (the product in the early stages of the brewing process).You got to go in a brewing simulator which was fun and there were a whole host of other interactive activities to engage in. There was Dutch karaoke while riding a stationery bike, photobooths, PlayStation, beer-pouring simulator and more.Towards the end of the tour you got to enjoy numerous beers! It had a cool night-vibe space where you could drink your Heinekens. You could also learn how to pour a Heineken and earn your "Diploma" which was amusing and meant you got more beers!If you like beer, definitely do the Heineken Experience - it's lots of fun.

It's fun experience if you are with friends. I think it's nice to do it if you are visiting the Heineken country, it's nice tour and in the end there are some fun games so you will enjoy it a lot with having some drinks.I suggest you to take fast line ticket otherwise you will waste time just waiting in the line.

Expensive and boring . For us as a couple it was not a good stop over at the Heineken brewery. Maybe it's better if you join together with some mates to get some free drinks. Only the 'roller coaster experience tour' to let you feel how bear is feeling during brewing process was kind of interesting.
Great. Excellent place to visit, a must while in Amsterdam, make sure you allow at least 2 hours for this and make sure you book before going as the queues are crazy!!!

Great. I would highly recommend this trip if you like a beer. A wander round the old brewery interspersed with some interactive experiences.I would recommend buying tickets online in advance so you don't have to queue and save 2 euros!
Yobo Land. Sorry but this was boring and full of yobs. Go to a 300 year old pub and drink a beer, you'll get more value out of it. Disappointing to say the least.

Good Tour ! Worth a visit. We had time in the afternoon and stopped here to see the Heineken Brewery.We booked the Heineken Tickets over their Webseite directly and paid 16€ each including two drinks. We were able to skip the line as we booked in advanced and when you go in you get a wristband with the two tokens for the beer.The Tour all over is without a guide so you walk by yourself and explore how they brew the beer and what things are needed to brew beer and also what ingredients are needed.It is interesting and at almost the end you see a little movie in a small movie theater (it's 4D), not gonna tell you what happens but it's fun.It's worth a visit, best if it's rainy outside!

Book ahead !!. Came here after Christmas and the queues were very long. Luckily I had pre booked tickets and didn't have to queue. I found the tour interesting and enjoyable. There were games to play inside aswel as hearing how Heineken is made and about its advertising it was worth going to. You get tokens for 2 free drinks at the end both are not pints they are only small glasses. There is also an interactive game where one can try pour the perfect pint and you can also attempt to actually pull a pint at the end yourself or have one pulled for you. Much like going to the Guinness storehouse in Dublin visiting Heineken is worth going to in Amsterdam.

Excellent . Visited here on the 29th December 2015 during mine and my fiancées stay in Amsterdam. I would advise anyone going to visit the Heineken Experience to get tickets before arrival so that you get into the speedy que as we did not do this and had to wait for around half an hour to get in. The overall experience is excellent and great value for money.
Waste of time . Spend your time some other way, long queue for nothing..for the same price you can get better beers somewhere else
Great. If you're a Heineken drinker,you must go there and enjoy the experience of making the beer. You can make a bottle of Heineken with you name on it as a savonnier.

Cool experience . The first half of the tour was a bit boring, but the second part of the tour is really fun and more interactive. We did have tickets, but the queue was still long, but definitely moved faster than the queue for people that still needed to buy tickets.
Beer history. Nice place to spend couple of hours in rainy evening, get educated on beer making process and taste some while doing so. Loads of youngsters having fun here as well.

Not worth that much!. Definitely famous and as a tourist I felt like it was a "must" to visit this place but actually I have to say that I expected more. It is just to attract people but the price of 16/17 euros (depends on where you purchase the ticket) for a little tour about very little history and two beers it's a little too much!

Amazing value for money!. Was expecting just a simple rip-off sort of brewery tour, but just when we thought it was over (several times), there was more and more really cool stuff! Football and rugby sections, nightclub section, a little ride thing acting as you're getting brewed, history, beer tasting, explanation of process, see the horses, and a chance to pour your own, even a free canal ride to the Heineken Brandstore - it's all so good!

Great experience. We made an advance booking and used coupon to get a great value discount on tickets (as a group). Got a fantastic tour of the brewery which included a look at all the different processes and ingredients involved, a cinematic experience, 2 free beer samples and games/entertainment! Definitely worth visiting, even more so if you love your Heineken!

Oh dear!. Well to be fair it is billed as an 'attraction' not a museum, and I didn't expect much culture other than 'beer drinking', but even prepared with my low expectations we were VERY disappointed. The queue outside is only the tip of the iceberg, and you can minimise this by buying your ticket from a nearby 'ticket & tours' shop then join the pre-bought queue. However, once inside there are more queues...One crew member diverted us away from the 'History' section because it was too busy, so we missed that section altogether only to join another 45 minute queue for the 'Be a bottle of beer' 4D ride. There is nothing to do whilst in this queue and the in-house wifi is patchy so hard to alleviate the tedium. The 4D ride would probably be mildly amusing if there was no queue to do it but after a 45 min wait we were left with feeling a disappointing, Well, is that it?? On we go to the rest of the 'Experience', which again would probably be mildly amusing for a lads stag weekend but was so heaving with people most ppl were simply making for the bar and exit. If you plan to visit and see a long queue outside you would be well advised to spend your money on a pint of Heineken in a nearby Bar, watch a few beer adverts on YouTube, and use the extra time to enjoy the many other attractions Amsterdam has to offer. You won't have missed much here.

A must NOT in Amsterdam. There is absolutely no reason to do this tour while in Amsterdam. The queues are ridiculous and the Heineken Experience makes absolutely no attempt to cap numbers at a reasonable level.Once inside, you will learn nothing about the beer brewing process or Heineken as a brand. There are totally irrelevant 'filler' sections of the tour, including: the Heineken horses; a sad 'ride'; and all manner of light-filled displays. The Heineken Experience also makes it as difficult as possible to redeem your coins for drinks--which you may then drink in the most stale, uninviting surroundings afterwards.To summarise: you pay Euro18 to experience a Heineken marketing experience, followed by a few beers in awful surroundings. If you want to experience Dutch culture, go to a local brown cafe and spend your money on some interesting Dutch beers there. While you drink, read the Heineken Wikipedia page. You will be better off!

Great place. Enjoyed this as very interactive has fun elements like the cinema playing rugby on a simulated screen. Chances to do selfies and send the pictures to your e mail. Tasting the beer and a chance to drink two more at the end. See how the beer is made. Quite long irises even if you buy the queue hoping tickets there is still a queue. Wanted to buy a bottle with my name on but you carnt take them through the airport home as liquids and only have hand luggage ;(. Worth. Visit.

Favourite place. Ideal and highly recommended even if you aren't a beer drinker, you will like Heineken after this because it tastes so clean fresh and amazing here. Excellent value for money and the boat trip is well worth a crack as well. Would visit again 100%

Atrocious experience. The long queues and it being overpriced are the smaller issues, but once you are in, you are bombarded with big corporate advertisement. There is staff to explain you a few facts about brewing and beer drinking, but they just render their emotionless monologues at high speed to get as many people through as possible. At the end you can have your 2x25cl of the brew and enjoy them in a windowless room reminiscent of a shabby night club with sticky floors. This is definitely the worst brewery experience I have ever had. Many breweries do tours on the side to explain customers their love of brewing and demonstrate their human side, tradition and expertise, but not this one. This is a money making and advertisement exercise in its own right, highly impersonal and commercialised.

Great. Great value for money ! Book in advance to skip the que ! Self guided tour which I prefer means you can skip straight to the beer ! I learned everything I needed to know in the beer simulator ! Lol I think the ticket was €17 and included 2 medium beers and 1 small one ( more if u answer questions correctly ) there was fun things at the end which I thought were a great bonus ..photo booth etc and not overcharging even giving option of emailing to u free ! We got a free cruise up the river in the heineken brand boat and bottles of heineken were €2:50 onboard . It dropped u near the centre where u also got a free gift of an engraved glass ! Recommend !

The guys like this tour. It is a must for male travellers to stop at this iconic brewery and taste some freshly brewed beer, not to mention learn about the process of great brewing and the history of Heineken in the Netherlands. The tour is well run and informative and there are a couple of good photo ops. Staff is very friendly as well, overall a good value and worth a stop if you are a beer enthusiast.
Amazing experience. Value for money! Three beers and you're tipsy! Two of us went and enjoyed it! Came away with two engraved personal glasses! Only downside is the waiting.

Drinks at a price. If you have mobility problems, this tour is best avoided. There are lots of stairs to go up and down. The best part of the tour was at the start with an inter active video where you felt part of it.The promised two drinks was two halves of lager and I really expected more for the entry price.The history of brewing and the live animals was interesting but its over-rated, for the price. I really did not need to be taught how to pour a pint. Maybe they should show how to pour halves,!!!This is not an attraction for children

Rubbish . If you want to queue for an hour to go on a ride which is as exciting as getting diarrhoea, then this is for you. Otherwise save your money, go to a bar and sit in comfort while you drink a beer. G

Nothing special. Just we saw one room with old beer tank, 3-4 horses and one artificial room with a video on how they brew the beer., waiting 2 hour in line for these 2 silly things.They offer only very small glass of beer

Do you want to queue for an hour for a five minute Heineken advert?. There is literally nothing to do. You queue for the 'brew you' experience for about forty five minutes which turns out to be a five minute '4D' experience. I.e. A YouTube advert with a platform that moves gently. You get some beer at the end but you could save yourself time and money by just going to a bar and buying yourself a beer. Treat yourself and get something better than a Heineken. Like piss. I've queued for so long I've managed to download trip advisor app and rate this whilst sill queueing and using their wifi. Otherwise it's a tunnel to the gift shop and overpriced beer. Dear god I can't understand why anyone would do this having done it myself. Go and culture yourself with something else that Amsterdam has to offer. Only a one star because I can't rate lower

NICE EXPERIENCE. it was nice to see the growth of Heineken since it was established. They better add some more activities. the gift at the end (sailing) was very nice however we did not get any explanation

Heineken Experience . Would not recommend, just away to get you into the gift shop. A lot of contrived areas, no actual brewing at this site. I can see their commercials for free on tv, no need to pay to see them

Was much better 20 years ago. The perfect example of how marketing can screw things up. I had been there in 93 and loved it. It was truly how the factory worked. Now it is full of try to be cool branding and loat it's roots. A no go, time waste.

Great spot ...A must visit !!!. We spent almost 2xhours inside the first Heinken brewery…It’s an interactive museum with lots of fun and where you could learn lots of things!!! We really enjoyed it and we didn’t feel the time passing by. Very friendly and enthusiastic staff. Highly recommended and worth the money !!!!!!!!

Certified poorer and made our own beers!. We were just going there for the fun of having 2 free beers with the visit but there was more.They have the "brew you" experience which is like a 4D movie of about 5min. When you come out, they give you a glass and tell you how you should drink the beer. They have a spot where you can right your name on the bottles as a souvenir which i thought was amazing. They have a lot of game to play while you work your way to the end and then my favorite one, pouring a real beer. You give away your 2 free beer to have someone teaching you how to pour a perfect Heineken! Loved the experience
Must see attraction. Fantastic! Interactive and interesting displays. An excellent 4D experience where you go onto a ride/cinema and you get out through the brewing process as if you were a beer!

Fun and interactive. The Heineken experience is well guided by staff along the stopovers, with clear explanations on the brewery and processes. There are also fun and interactive segments where u can get to sample Heineken beer and take some photos at their photo booths

Refreshingly superb!. You should not leave Amsterdam without visiting and tasting one of the best beers in the world. Though I liked, Heineken Beer, I was not a big lover of it. It all changed after I visited the Heineken Brewery in Amsterdam. They take through the different levels of classic beer brewing and excite you with different shows and experiences. The beer tasted there was simply out of the world. You can also brew your own beer with your name printed on the bottle.

Decent enough!. This was a decent place to spend an afternoon. Fairly interesting and interactive, plus it ends with a couple of drinks and it's pretty different to most other tourist attractions in Amsterdam. Well worth a visit.

A bit over rated. In fact it is very nice and you can learn about brewing if you do not already know about it. But I am sure you can find much more interesting things to do in Amsterdam. It sort of repeats itself theoughout the tour.
Great Xperience!. Techy, interactive, fresh, fun & beer. We loved every second, great action.What else!? ;)Cheerz! Highly recommended!
proper experience. A must if you have any interest in beer or Heineken. A diverse experience which will keep you of the street for an hour or 2. Staff is amazing and beers taste good.

Fresh beer in the heart of the city. We came skeptic. But to our joy it turned to be a happy tour to the rhelms of the beer kingdom. It contains limited review of basic beer making and tons of fun through a 7 dimention movie and lots of games that have some relation to beer. And in the end a couple of Heineken beer drinks. A nice idea to fill the afternoon with. Only for beer lovers.
Good fun and good value. It's a fun place to visit and the company has clearly thought a lot about it. Good value with two, 0.25L drinks at the end. Loved the history as well

Fun Brewery Tour. This is an enjoyable experience; it was fun, interactive and well organised. This isn't just an average brewery tour and it's interesting to learn about the Heineken family and brewing techniques, plus there are samples included in the entrance fee.

Like it. Place where history and technology are meet. Interesting museum where you can touch to the history, play interactive games, make souvenirs and of course taste delicious beer. Must visit in Amsterdam

Very entertaining. It was an unexpected good surprise when me and my friends decided to visit the Experience just to get out of the rain. The exhibition is very well planned and entertaining, also contains lots is interactive spots, with the highlight for the course on drafting our own beer from the tap. And if you are nice enough and get the guys at the bars in a good mood, you might also get more beer than just those two included in the tickets... ;)

Expected more. The sports section was pretty outdated with data about the 2011 Rugby World Cup and nothing about this year's edition. It's interesting to know more about how your beer is made. Also you get two beers in the end at a bar.

PROST SOME MORE!. The Heineken Experience is exactly what it says: It is an experience! Heineken has really put in some proper effort to change a regular tour into something fun, interactive and different. This is not just another beer tour, this is actually fun. Without trying to give too much away, this is worth it. The experience is great, the people are friendly, and there are great beer to be drunk! PROST!

Good fun!. We went on Christmas Day. Had a great time. Really enjoyed learning more about the Heineken family and history. Also fun were the interactive pics and videos. And of course finishing up with a beer was fantastic.

Exceeded expectations! . We visited the Heineken Experience and were unsure what to expect. The experience was really fun and entertaining! Buy your tickets online before and you save money and skip queues. The ticket is valid for 1 year from the day of purchase! The ticket also includes a boat ride on the canal!

VIP Tour is the way to go. Went on the vip tour on christmas day and I have to say it was outstanding. Lars, our guide, was amazing and was able to answer all our questions. You get to go way more behind the scenes and the beer/cheese tasting was brilliant. We even got to try a brand new beer that has not been released. Can't fault anything! Best Christmas ever!

Much More Than Just The Beer. They do an incredible job in this of showing you the history behind the brand but lots of well done and interactive activities to keep things fun and energized. All the staff were really friendly and even my girlfriend who isn't a big beer fan enjoyed it. Definitely recommend it!

Interesting experience - not a must. I admire the Henkel company for creating such an iconic experience in an experience cluttered city like Amsterdam to compete with the most important landmarks like RLD and others.Good tour, informative, commercial and very touristy yet enjoyable

A place for enterprenurs. It a walk-though in the history of Heineken. For sure it is one of the top five attractions in Amsterdam but not a top three. The visit will help you learn how four generations of the Heineken family have launched, expanded, commercialized, and globalized the top beer industry of the world. Take you camera and proceed into the entrance. HINT! If you buy the ticket from the counter at the site you have to wait for a long queue but if, like me, you purchase your ticket in the city you will skip the very long queue. There lots of entertainments there apart from the history of the Heineken's legacy. There is also a mini training for "beer pouring" and on a successful pouring you will be awarded a certificate. In the souvenir shop you can buy glasses, jars, etc all with the logo and even you name engraved for free on the glass! It is easy to navigate your way if you stay in central Amsterdam.

Interactive place. We love how the History of Heineken was presented. It was interactive because there was a wide range of technological devices used. It was not merely a static museum.The area which you could redeem your drinks make you feel 'high', as if you were clubbing.Generally I enjoyed myself!Only wished I bought something for myself. Did not. Bought a beer glass for my friend which I could engrave name on it too! Ke a lookout for that.
Really good!. It was a good call for a rainy day in amsterdam! The experience is really worth your money and time! And by the end of the tour you get 2 beers

Much better than anticipated. Not sure what to expect but Heineken did a very nice job with this. Admission gets you two beers plus get your trivia right and you'll get an extra beer or two. Better with friends and geared towards the younger crowd but worth the try.
Full of frat boys. It's an alright museum/experience/thing, just be sure to experience Heineken propaganda at its finest. That, and it's full of lads pounding Heineken.

High camp! . I went on the tour of the Heineken factory 15 years ago, and I'm happy to say that very little has actually changed. The Tour is highly campy, not particularly exciting except for one virtual reality portion, and is rife with teenage Europeans looking to get inexpensive alcohol

Nice place to go. It's nothing really special but they have some interactive things to do such as fotos and videos sent to your email, a football and rugby sections where you can test your skills and at the end you get two beers at a really cool bar.

Better than expected. We came here on our last day in the city and I didn't expect very much due to not being a big beer drinker. The first part is quite slow, giving you a a brief history of the Heineken family and we thought it was going to be pretty boring throughout but it got better really quickly when we entered the main brewing quarters. There was lots of opportunities to try the different stages of the beer making process, with interactive activities stationed throughout where you can take pictures / videos and email them to yourself free of charge - we thought it was particularly good that they didn't even try to sell them to you but instead allowed you to email them straight away. The staff are wonderful and clearly love their jobs, they gave the place a lovely atmosphere. There are plenty of opportunities to win free beers in the first 'how to drink beer' talk, with you getting one and if you answer his questions then he will give you an extra one so you definitely get your value for money. You get given a wristband at the beginning with two 'tokens' on which you can either use at the bar or at a station where you can be taught how to pour the perfect pint of Heineken. I used both of mine at the latter due to not really liking the beer that much, where you get given a certificate to show that you can pour the perfect pint. The place is well done up, modern and enjoyable for all different ages. Would definitely recommend! Also, throughout the city there are lots of deals where you can get a few euros off the price. We booked online and paid £16 beforehand though.

I really hated it. I don't think I ever was at a such a boring time consuming experience.... You can't have a taste of almost nothing, the give you only 2 beers... 18 euro... The experience is slow... You get tired and the know that so the tell you that u get a prize if u go to their boat ride - of-course - they sell you the same beer for only 1.5 euro, and than take you to they're shop by offering a free price - surprise- the try selling you lots of items there to, well... I wold never ever recommend any 1 of going there... Such a shame for them.... We Hated every moment....

An excellent tour for all the family. The Heineken Experience is a very good experience. Look out for discount cards around the city, which save €1 per person (not a lot, but every little helps). Go lightweight if possible as the queue for checking coats is rather slow. Apart from that everything else is great. The tour is well planned, the staff are very helpful, and the free beer is great ! Look out at the end for the free boat trip back to Rembrandt Square, and be sure to pick up your voucher for a free gift from the Heineken Brand store (which is very close to the boat drop-off point) - we each got a free beer glass, and had it engraved for free.

Heineken tour. My hubby and I are heineken fans so we don't wanna miss this tour. Going here, we took tram 26 from central station. We have e tickets(online tickets) so we didn't experience the que. The tour was just average because we expected too much. I really can't point what it's lacking but if you just want beer, then this might work. But we appreciate the staff are wonderfully accommodating and fantastic on what they're doing. We didn't spend much time on the tour as if people at the tour was just like in a bar when we were at the "brewing your own beer" corner. Crowded and destructingly noisy

Beer lover excitement. This experience give a beer lover to feel small see and taste all the way a beer come to your throat.We see the history and the production with all ingredients .That give me a filling like I share it all when the drink comes in my mouth. At the end you get a very fresh beer and recommend to choose the -1Celsius degree it fantastic .

Great Surprise. We wasn't sure what to expect, but was pleasantly surprised. The experience covers learning about how Heineken was created, brewed, pull a pint and even the best way to drink it. They have some fun things to do while in there and overall a real surprise and a good couple of hours well spent.
very nice place !!!!. Very nice experience in Amsterdam,You can also see things from the past of Heineken and some the new Heineken stuff .also you can drink 2 free beers :)Really recommended

Had Lots of Fun. Once in a lifetime experience. Go there, learn how the beer is made (like you don't know :) ), listen to the staff's jokes which i found funny, drink their included-in-price Heineken's. To be honest me and my wife had a lot fun inside, just don't raise your expectations so much, its a fun brewery to visit, and that's it. Is it worth the money? Oh yeah.

Overly commercialised and lacking character. If you are just out of puberty and hooked on the stuff (beer that is) then this may well tickle you. But if you want a proper look at breweries and the process do not bother. The whole thing was tacky and like being inside a TV commercial. Everything seemed geared to you buying as much as possible in the inevitable shop at the end. Herded like sheep throughout I suspect the original founder would be turning in his grave at the site of this overtly commercial and slightly shallow look at his heritage.
Great tour. It was really interesting how the great amsterdam beer is brewed. The tour takes about 2 h and you can also taste at the end of the tour two glasses of cold heineken. It was really fun.
Not worth the visit. Just wanted to see a very important brewery...and ended in a place for publicity and merchandising oh Heineken. Didnt find it interesting

One of the top 5 things to do in Amsterdam . Me and my girlfriend visited Amsterdam in December and this was one of the best things we done whilst we was out there. We pre booked online before we got there so we didn't have to wait in a que even then it was only about 3 groups long if that. The attraction is not just walking around and looking at old artifacts it's very interactive as well. There are. Plenty of different rooms and each explain the different steps it takes to make the beer and all the different things that they do. There is also lots of tasting. I quite like owning things you would have in a bar so the gift shop is brill for all your needs. Just when we thought it was all over we then was given a free canal tour around the city and taken to the Heineken store on the other side of the city which was even better than we expected. all the staff where very friendly and helpful and also they moved around a lot so you saw the same friendly faces where ever you went. It's a must see event and would recommend to everyone

Great interactive fun!. Great interactive fun with the Heineken experience with a lot of visual and 3D experiential experiences alongside many acitivites and games you can be a part of! Each visit gives you 2 free drinks and a boat ride to the city centre as well! Definitely fun but perhaps a tad too long an experience. Beer was fresh and horses in the stables were treated well though so kudos on that for cruelty free measures.

Surprisingly Fun!. My husband and I expected this to be a typical tour where someone leads you around, shows you a couple of workers making the beer and then gives you a sample or two. It was much more than that. The first part was about the history. It was interesting, but then, the fun part came after your first sample. The experience became more interactive. There was a small ride about the process, a huge theater and then our favorite part, where they show you how to pour a perfect Heineken pint. The staff made it so much fun! What we thought would be a 30-45 min experience turned out to be 2 hours for us.

Gigi . I have been visited the Heineken Experience with my friends and was an amazing experience and good fun and definitely worth the money paid at the entrance. You get few beers complimentary and have free Wi-Fi to share your experiences.

So much fun :) worth a visit!. My fiance and I aren't beer drinkers but this experience was recommended so we went for it. Overall was a fab tour. You find out loads about the Heineken family how it began etc. You will walk around the museum yourself without a guide at your leisure. You can taste the ingredients used to make the beer as well as drink lots of the actual beer! There are lots of fun activities. . Ps4 . Football game, rugby.. dj and singing where you can be videoed and it emailed to you. You can also have your own personalised Heineken bottle made which was lovely. At the end of the museum we were walking out and were told it also includes a free canal trip to the Heineken store near the dam. We jumped on the boat..took about 15mins to get there then got given a free heineken glass each in the store.aWas a fun couple of hours!

So much fun and great value for money!!. If you are going to Amsterdam, you should definitely visit here. The tour is fun, you get three small (half pint) beers to try and there are so many different activities for you to do. One of my favourite parts of my stay in Amsterdam.

a great experience full of fun and taste. a great experience with lots of fun activities. You can lear history of heineken, taste beer in everg step and also you will enjoy the many interactive activities and games that this expirience offers. Defenetly recomended!

Avoid at all costs!. This attraction is a scam. You pay 18 euros to walk up interminable steps in a concrete building and to see next to nothing. You get two free beers at the end. Much better and cheaper to get your beers in a bar and escape the hardship. The shop is overpriced.

A Really Neat Stop in Amsterdam. It is a really neat place to visit. No beer is made there but it is a museum of the History of Heineken. You do get to drink some beer while you are there, and receive a souvenir bottle opener.

Great Experience. This has definitely got to be the best brewery tour! Great story and interactive experience. The best part is the "turn you in to a bottle" ride and of course, the beer! It's also fantastic value for money considering the price of beer and the fact that you get a free 20 minute canal cruise down to the Rembrandtplein to go to the Heineken shop and get a free gift! This time it was lovely little 250ml boxed Heineken glasses. We would definitely recommend a visit. Buy your tickets from one of the tour operators that offer a few euros off.

Loved it . Loved the tour! Went in not liking the stuff now I can't get enough of it, really interesting and interactive to all, great gift shop and really fun things to do the ought the tour, would highly recommend this tour to all how travel to Amsterdam
very cool. Not a usual brewery visit! They make it to a really special experience by using multimedia and by adding lots of games. So it's not a classical museum but lots of fun and information!
Worth to visit!. Having great time at Heineken Experience. Sure visit place at my vacation itinerary, no disappointed at all.
Nice experience of the history of Heineken. When you are in the city of Amsterdam please visit this museum. I live in Amsterdam city and had never visited this museum. I was impressed
Amazing . Amazing crew, amazing experience. You will enjoy every minute here. And come with money if you're a fan, cause they have a good store in the end of the tour.
Better in a group?. Not a bad set up and quite well laid up but not something that makes much sense as a solo traveler. Would be a fun way to start an Amsterdam pub crawl.

very interesting. Great way to spend a few hours. You can go through the brewery at your own pace and there are lots of friendly staff on hand if you have any questions. Great if you are interested in brewing!

A bit of fun!. Yes, this experience is a bit of fun... & educational in regards to beer brewing and what and how the Heineken family have been successful for many years.... As I said a bit of fun and the beer at the end is very satisfying.

Great experience . Visited in the afternoon, bit busy but was great! We got 2 free beers at the end. A lot to do whilst on the experience such as a simulator which was fun, photo booths and sporting activities! Great got children as well as adults! Would go again

Fun experience. Had a good time, fun and interactive tour. Tasted hieniken beer and learned how beer is made. The part that was a bit disappointing was that it's not an actual brewery but I still learned a lot.

A must see when in Amsterdam . Whether you enjoy beer or not, this wonderful tour provides the history behind Heineken and much much more. A walk through the old brewery, horse stables and wonderful shop are just a few of the things you'll see here. Everything is in English so no need for a special guide of you understand English.

Fun interactive experience. A great day out. Not a museum by UK standards but a thoroughly enjoyable experience. The emphasis is on learning through interaction.I Would think twice at taking children there.Do book online it saves you 2 euros per person and you jump the queue. Do leave your heavy coats in the free cloakroom. We were there for well over 2 hours. Do look for the representative after leaving the shop. You will get tickets for a free canal trip back to town and you also get a free glass thrown in.

The best attraction in Amsterdam. I will not describe the full experience as it may be a spoiler because surprises are all around in the tour. A very enjoyable way to spend two hours, to lern about the making of beer and even drink some. A tip for you all - at the end of the tour you can drink two glasses of beer in the bar or you can learn how to pour your own beer (and drink it) Dont miss the later...

Visited for a University Research Project. Visited yesterday with my University, the experience was amazing, in the evening there was no queues, and no waiting. The whole process went very smoothly, and the interactive process was interesting and engaging!
excellent value for money experience. excellent value for money experience, better than Guinness factory by a miletakes over an hour with drinks / samples included
Top Notch !. Supper fun and interactive, one of my favourite parts of Amsterdam. Good beer, and a fun way to kill a couple of hours. Plus you can buy a glass/bottle with your name on it!

Must-visit. Visitor's Center of Heineken was amazingThe training was pretty and interestingThe site is amazing and pretty neatGuidance how to pour beer was a nice experience.I, as one who does not like beerBeer was very tasty and easy.There are many attractions in the framework of the tourAnd there is also the option to send the pictures to your email.Overall the experience was very fun and enjoyed ourselves.

Well worth the money. I like beer so this was a must for me The tour is at your own pass and has plenty to do we both enjoyed the tour took us around 90 munutes Your see the history of the factory to start then see the brewing process then have some tasting and some interactive bits at the end you have 2 beers or 4 if the wife doesnt drink beer went down well

Vip tour!. We chose to do this expensive tour in cost of 49€ instead of 18€. You need to invite the tour before you arrive at 12:00 or 16:00. We were just 2 in the tour, Our guide - ryan, was great guy, very loyal to the company and with a lot of knowledge, we tasted 5 kinds of heineken beers - they also owned little brewries. And ate a lot of cheese with, we sat in vip rooms and visitted the roof as well and so all the amazing view. They also have horses and stables in the place for publicity. In the end they didn't leave us enough time to be in the fun part of the place, like karaoko, ps4 and more activities, and also in the shop.

A big beer ad only. poor labelling of brewing process, thousands of stairs, lots of multimedia advertising in your face, feel sorry for the horses locked in the building. The horses locked in stalls so tourists can stare at them and 2 old beer wagons. Waiting for 6 weeks holiday out of there for the year. Would be better served by being on the farm, and showing another multimedia film (about them towing the carts) instead.

Great fun, especially on a rainy day. Had a lovely time at the Heineken Experience. Very informative but fun at the same time. Buy your tickets along with the hop on hop off canal for a discount and full day out.

Fun fun fun. This is less of a museum and more of an interactive experience. Please note that they didn't let buggies through.Highlight for us included the old vats, the ride through making the beer, choosing a personalised Heineken bottle, fresh beer, the lounge etc.I wouldn't miss this if you are up for some fun.

Good experience!. Get to know how Heineken beer is brew. Know the history of how Heineken started and become a world well known brand. The self guided tour will take about 1.5hrs you will be provided with 2 glasses of beer at the end of the tour. A lot of interactive zones for young and old, the is photo booth for people to take pictures.

Best experience. If you go there with your friends this is the best place you should go and visit. You can learn the stages of beer making and have fun with your buddies and play games in the end. And you also can drink two beers on the house!

Brilliant . Visited the heineken experience a few weeks ago and I have to say it was brilliant. Very interactive and fun all the way through. The bar at the end has a great party atmosphere. Could have stayed all night but I think I'd have had to be carried home due to the free beer being dished out. One of the best things I did while in Amsterdam. Highly recommended.

Average. I did enjoy this tour but I felt like it was missing something. After going on tours of different distilleries I thought that this one lacked actual information about how Heineken was made, it did cover some history about the company but not much current information about how the beer is made so it wasn't very interesting. Overall the tour was abit of a laugh but I wouldn't recommend it to friends. The pints in the bar at the end were good though.
Just ok. Was expecting more but it's just a boring tour and you get a .3ml beer at the end. Having compared it to the Jameson factory in Dublin, it just wasn't what I expected.

A great way to spend a morning. . The Heineken experience is very interesting, from learning how it is brewed, to tasting it at each stage to the interactive activities that let you try it yourself the whole place is well thought out. And the staff are very informative and friendly. I really enjoyed my morning spent there.
Beautiful experience. It was a very good experience, you find out a lot about Heineken history and beer and at the end you drink at least 3 beers :)
interesting and informing. We have done that with 3 little children. for kids it is a little bit to long but still interesting and good. For adults much better.

Great experience. We went to Heineken Experience with an open view not expecting much however were delightful in our viewing. The interactive sets and booths really brought the experience to life and finishing with an ice cold beer certainly rounded the experience well. Would certainly recommend a trip here if your in Amsterdam

Just a nice experience.... Take Your time and look around, be sure not to miss anything. Look at video's in the old brewery thank.
At the end, be sure to find the way to the roof bar and enjoy the balcony wiev.

I like beer & I like this tour!. It's pretty much what you would expect out of a brewery tour with a few added extras which are fun to play with.Can't say too much about it without giving it away but if you are a Heineken lover like me then you will enjoy it.I will give one part away though as its kind of a tip. At one part of the tour there is a tasting area where they talk about the beer and then ask questions about what to look for in a beer. Now this is the part where you can earn yourself a few extra drinks for getting questions right.Answers are as follows- clarity (how clear the beer is)- head (stops the beer rusting)- bubbles (how bubbly the beer is)I think that's it, however I was slightly tipsy by this point so yea good luck and I hopefully you can get a few extra drinks along the way.

Heineken Beer Tour. Didn't love the tour - most of it is a virtual tour - so you dont really get to be a part of the beer making as such. I have been to the guiness brewery which gave a nicer feeling to it.

Favourite part of Amsterdam . The Heineken experience is as the name suggests an experience!From start to finish we had a super time. The exhibition is self guided but very entertaining. You can download the free Heineken experience app ( free wifi!) and this will guide you through the exhibition. The tasting part of the tour was great, fun and very easygoing, next we went onto the "brew you" ride which again was very entertaining. The next part of the experience was the interactive area which was exactly that, totally interactive, karaoke, Xbox, rugby games, something for everyone. Finally onto the bar, to redeem our 2 free drinks (so at least 3 small glasses in total) which was a great way to finish off before finally reaching the gift store!!A great visit even for those who don't like beer!!!
Museum with joy. If you are with your friends this is the place you should go and visit. You can learn the stages of beer making and have fun with your beer and games in the end.

So Much Fun. Yes, you get to drink beer while you here! The exhibits are fun and interactive. You get to see a lot of the history of the company and learn about the process of making beer. The staff are super fun and the beer is good! What more could you want!?

Beer time. I enjoyed the Heineken Experience and left having learnt a lot. The start of the tour had a lot of reading involved about the history. It was a lot to take in but it became a lot more interactive and fun towards the end. The 'making the beer' simulator ride was fun and I took a lot out of it. A bit pricey but a good experience overall.

Best experience. So much to do and see here. Well worth a visit. We purchased tickets online in advance which meant no queue. Such an interesting and fun trip. Greast to see how the beer is made. We also played the play stations, kicked rugby balls, played foosball. It was such a fun day out. 3 free beers and also a free canal trip.

Visit to the old brewery . This is the best brewery tour I have taken. No brewing is done here but the self guided tour takes you around the old site including the stables for the brewery Shires. The interactive display is excellent and the information given about the history of the family is well balanced. You can also down load the tour onto your phone which is in English. The displays are in English so you do not need an audio guide if you are able to speak English otherwise there is a charge. You can also get discounted tickets through City Sight seeing Amsterdam if you book a few attractions at once. You get three drinks whilst there and can send pictures and a video to an email for free. There are various opportunities for pictures as you are allowed a camera inside. However no back packs allowed in the tour but you can leave in a cloak room but note that the brewery take no responsibility for items. Make sure any valuables are taken with you. Leave at least 2 hours for this tour as there is so much to look at. Recommend this as a must visit whilst in Amsterdam.
Worth it. Kind of expensive for what it is, but still worth it. You can see they've put a lot of effort to make it enjoyable

A must do in Amsterdam . Recently visited here on a birthday weekend trip, was a little un sure if id like it as not a huge lover of beer, but my husband really wanted to go and glad he made us as was so much fun, u get to sample the beer and there is lots there to keep you entertained even if u don't like beer. Definitely worth a visit!!!

Fun and Informative. we loved the tour. Very interesting and fun. I wasn't expecting much but rather enjoyed the experience. It was better than I would have imagined. It was well spent time while in Amsterdam on vacation. I will probably go again when I go back to Amsterdam.

Boring at first but gets good. I was really bored at first - felt like i was just a number on a fast belt going round. But when ypu get to the interactive games it gets really good - there is a bike you and a friend can sit on and they email you the video of you going round various cities. Was good but i wouldnt go again.

Like Most Brewery trips - it's not a working brewery. Another example of a brewery themed visitor centre, Heineken ceased brewing in these premises years ago, so you don't even get the wonderful brewery smell. However, it's well presented, fairly expensive, and of interest if you have not seen a real live working brewery. Takes about an hour and a half of mainly A.V. displays and then of course you have the "tatt" shop selling generally the same souvenir's as you find in any visitor centre world-wide!There's a couple of delivery horses in a stable, but these seem long retired.

not worth the money.... It's true, with the ticket they gave me 3 very small (25cc) beers, but however not worth the money...Maybe is because I have been before at the "Guinness" to Dublin (a whole other story)The staff is a little rude and hurried and the contents are poor...

Fun! And tasty beers!. I read the recommendations on tripadvisor and booked tickets online (it's 2 euros discount plus you avoid the line). The visit was fun but I felt there was not enough information and there was no real guidance. All was videotaped and repeated over and over. You get free beer which you can drink in the end of your tour in the museum, in a Heineken bar with music - which was also fun. Overall - a fun not too sophisticated museum. I would recommend going to a bar for the price of the ticket...
Bit of fun!. It was an experience! Lots of different things to do and see. Maybe not for the older crowd. But it was fun never the less.

Fun Sunday afternoon. Fun way to spend a couple of hours after getting into to Amsterdam. I had Monday meetings and wanted to see some sites. The beer tour is as expected but the total experience was fun. It would not be my first stop in the city but worth the time and money.
Highly enjoyable . Really interesting and fun. Longer than expected so was a nice surprise. Got two free beers with the voucher you can pick up from tourist shops.

Waste of money and time.. I was in Amsterdam these days and I had a chance to visit the famous Heineken Experience thanks to two free tickets. Perhaps I had other expectations, but the whole tour was a huge disappointment to me and my partner. First of all because you do not learn anything and you do not get to really know anything about the history of Heineken and the production method. Second, because the tour is nothing more than an amusement park really idiot, with karaoke, selfie areas and screens of crappy Heineken 3d and stuff as if we were in a great commercial. The whole thing is very confusing, teens who cackles continuously and if you are over 25 you have the feeling of being out of place. You do not learn anything, and you come out with a big headache (and not because of the beer). There's a free 40cl beer at the end of the tour and that's it. 18 euro? Are you kidding me? Go and spend it better in a pub if you want.
Fun. This was so much fun! You begin the tour learning about the history of Heineken, you learn how beer is made and at the end there are lots of interactive activities. Really enjoyed this.

Great to visit.. Firstly, I would recommend prebooking tickets and getting the fast track. There were huge queues. The beginning of the tour seemed very boring, just looking at small writing the odd thing here and there. We thought at first wow what a waste of £15. However throughout the tour it got better and better and a lot more interactive. I love the mini ride, I think I laughed way more than I should. The beer tasting was great, the guide said for us all to drink like a 'bloke' which I thought was awesome as I am female and already down pints like there is no tomorrow. Even though it was busy, the activities were easily spaced out making sure queues were avoided.
Good tour. This is a good tour with some good interactive exhibits. Plenty of opportunity to sample the beer as well. A good brewery tour.

VIP experience!. Get the VIP experience service! Yes it's more expensive than the normal tour but you will have to taste 5 different kind of Dutch cheese and beers. You will spend almost three hours inside the browery. But when you will be back? Have fun and Cheers!Hicimos el tour Vip. Es el mejor, es mas caro, mas largo y necesitas mas tiempo pero ustedes tomaran 5 tipos diferentes de cerveza holandesa y queso. El borracho con barriga llena, es siempre feliz! Hay que darse un gustazo, coño!Abbiamo scelto il tour Vip. Ve lo consiglio. E' caro ma quando lo rifarete? Inoltre li vale tutti. All'interno del giro, vi fermeranno in una stanzetta dove proverete 5 tipi diversi di formaggio olandese e 5 tipi differenti di birra. Ubriachi e felici. Poi a pochi passi c'e' il Bulldog, per il tracollo finale... Auguri!

LOVE LOVE LOVE. This was amazing!!! Absolutely loved the Heineken experience! There was so much to look at and do! There was so many free gifts and activities to do! The staff were funny and friendly! One of the best attractions in Amsterdam
Worth Doing. I think the Heineken Experience is worth doing. It's fun and you get a few beers along the way. Lots of novelty things to do inside and you learn the process of brewing beer. Enjoyed it.

Better than expected. The Heineken Experience offers a small tour through the fabrication process and Heineken history, in which you can try the beer on different phases of production. You also get 2 free drinks, that can be either beer or non alcoholic soda. You will also find some interactive attractions, like how to pour the perfect pint, foosball, PS4, among others.If you like beer, this could be an interesting attraction.

Quite an experience! . Got to know more about Heineken beer brewery and history. From the tour, it is notable that they put great length to design this attraction to be interesting. Of course this is one of the Heineken marketing strategy. Nevertheless the visit was fun and interesting. Paid 13.5 euro for entrance with I Amsterdam city card. Normal price is 18 euro. The ticket includes two glass of beer at the end and one more small glass of beer during the tour. They also provide free canal ride back to city center.
Starts a bit slow but picks up . Initially I was a bit underwhelmed by the experience but it improves as you continue through the building.
Visit to brewery . Nice trip to brewery , I had to travel in tram to see the place , heart of city , Amsterdam central, although it was raining but worth place to see

Fun but gets a bit cheesy. This was a really cool thing to do while in AMS and it was really cool to learn about the history of the beer. It go a bit cheesy towards the end but overall was really neat.

Interesting and you get beer. Ive been to a few breweries but never had a tour. This place is well set up. You meander through old grain silos to begin with pictures and video. then history of the brand and the making of the beer.. All well explained. A tasting session at the end and you have some tokens if you want more.

Fun fun fun. Great way to spend a rainy afternoon! The good part is the fun and the beer. The "bad" part is the unique way they brainwash you. You enjoy every minute of it cause they are so good at it! Go, have fun! Heineken is good for you...

Tasty!. The staff at arrival were not very helpful, that may of been because they were very busy hording all the rest of the customer, We got a detailed experience of the history, some 4D experiences when we entered into a room and we were turned into a bottle of beer which was quite fun! Drinking a beer there is so much more tastier than anywhere else in the world it really is, when they give you the taste of the barley itself, you have a new appreciation for the beer. Don't be like everyone else, Do the pouring of beer , you get 3 tries You may not need them, All round still very much fun! I suggest you go do it, plus food is just over the bridge were you can sit drink more and eat and smoke. Good for all the family good for you and affordable, I will suggest you get the boat ride too! as it is right next door to the H. Experience, And you can get it cheaper if ordering both ! :)

Come do this!!!. One of the funnest things in Amsterdam, come see the history of this huge beer brand around the world. It is around 20 euros per person and included 2 free beers at the end of the tour.

Fun experience. This is a fun way to learn something about beer. It is highly recommended to book the tickets in advance so that one can avoid the queue. It is cheaper to buy a combined ticket for the canal cruise and Heineken experience.
my favorite beer. if you like Heineken its a must stop, tour guide takes you through the brewery its very educational. the museum was great also, at the end you get to try the freshest Heineken ever

Was a very nice break during our visit to Amsterdam. The Heineken Experience was a real treat to see It was nice to see the history and how the beer that I have drank all my adult life. They did a great job of setting up the tour and it was finished off with a fun night club like experience. As an added bonus we took the Heineken canal boat back to the heart of Amsterdam.

Great time all together! . The whole experience is great. It's great value for money as your ticket gets you some free beers too. The staff are wonderful all so smiley and helpful. Really interesting about the making of the beer and finish with a cold one :)

Not a Beer Drinker but a Fun Experience. We bought our tickets at a kiosk, so we didn't have to wait in line. We did have a brief Q to check our coats and my purse. I'm not a beer drinker, but did enjoy the interactive experience of the various displays. A fun experience for a younger, beer loving and party person. It wasn't very crowded until you get to the free beer lounge and that's where there was a real party going on.
Nice attraction . We bought tickets through the front desk at our hotel, it saves 2€ per person. Overall I would say that it was nice, but not amazing
Enjoyable . Really enjoyed the visit! Especially feeling how it is from the beers perspective!! We prebooked tickets online which makes it cheaper.
Great. Great value for money interactive experience. Would definitely recommend a visit. It was busy on the day that we visited but this didn't detract. The staff were very friendly.

worth the money. It costs 18 Euro but you get 3 beers out of it. you will know a little bit more about heineken beer history when you walk out. Near the exit is where you get to get your "official beers", a really nice lounge where you get to mingle with other people, I had fun in there.
Interesting. At the Heineken brewery you can find the history of the beer and a bit of the experience of making it.
Enjoyable. We did this the night we arrived, using the Holland Pass so skipped the Q. It was fun and interesting I would definitely say the Guinness Store House is better!!!

Overpriced for what it offers. The first part of the dxperuence is very interesting and you hear all about the history of the Heineken family and brewery. After that it gets boring. All adverts and silly gimmicky stuff.
Go there if u want to waste your money.. It's definitely overrated. There are many other places you can spend your money in a better way. It is not worth the price.

Great tour all round!. Loved the tour and how you can take your time going around there's no rush, the brew ride is a funny experience and the free beer is always a plus, would recommend to anyone going to Amsterdam!

Lots of fun!. Very interesting tour about brewing beer...you actually get brewed yourself! :) There is lot of attractions where you can take pictures and videos! You should buy your Tickets beforehand online, so you can skip the long waiting line outside!There was also a free boat cruise which took us back to the city center! We had lots of fun! And of course...the 3 free beers we got were really great as well! :)
Perfect must see. Fantastic experience, No1 beer in the world included, great story, unusual museum. Bring the good mood!

Great tour - Free beer. This was one of the highlights of the Amsterdam trip. Tour is self guided and you get a free beer at the end, how can you complain? Not as good as the Guinness factory in Dublin but Guinness > Heineken
Beer-y Nice!. An informative tour on how Heineken brews their beer.... the best part being the complementary beer that we get at the end of the tour! :)

Best place in Amsterdam . The best place in the city!!!!! The price is high for those whom euro is expensive now, but you can drink beer and learn more about the Heineken story. It's a must do. And you have lots of activities to do, photos to take and cheap things to buy at their shop. Go!!! You won't regret it!
Great Fun 110% worth the visit. Went here with my friends, cheaper to buy online but only by a few euros. Great experience. Cheap thing to do and a lot of fun. Deffo a must when visiting Amsterdam
Fun afternoon. Enjoyable afternoon learning about the history of the Heineken beer, how it's made and a tour of the old brewery. Great interactive experience with some sampling :-)

Great fun!. Was surprised to actually learnt a lot about how it is brewed, first half of the experience is very interesting! Second half is focused a lot more on just silly and fun things!Really enjoyed the experience, would highly recommend it :)

Complete experience. Heineken experience was a complete visit of the myseum which permits us to get to know how they make the beer, what are the key ponts and how it has become as successful as it is now. A really active visit with a large bariety of interactions and a some beer at the end in the Heineken bar where the atmosphere was really unexpected!

Beer Lover's Paradise!!!!. All things BEER. Here you walk through Heineken's history and what makes it the most recognizable beer in the world. If you love Heineken, even beer in general, this is a most place to visit. You learn about the brewery, the ingredients, history, sponsored games, and events, a 3-D theatre, and you end your tour with FREE BEERS. You can purchase customized Heineken souvenirs. Its worth a visit and if you love beer, you'll do yourself a favor with BEER, BEER, & BEER. Take a plunge into the Heineken world….

If you want a real beer experience stay away.. I need to start by saying, I have been a lot of beer tours. I live only 20 minutes from Golden where Coors has a free tour that includes beer so that is hard to beat. I went to the Heineken Experience with my mother who really liked it. For me, it was touring a bad club. You only talk about the beer for the first part of the tour (the bar experience is fun) and then then rest is just a show. I did like seeing the horses and being in the old brewery itself, but the rest was silly. Another pro is that you can take a free river boat tour at the end which we enjoyed. The boat ends at a Heineken store on the other side of town and they don't tell you where to go really. It was confusing but the boat ride was nice. If you like learning about beer, keep your 16 euros and go to a pub with a knowledgeable bar keep

Beer beer and more beer, however.... Such a great experience from the knowledge of the beer, tasting the beer, showing how it made and the marketing behind the beer. However, when it came to the end of the tour for our Heineken from the brewery and it was flat! Such a shame..

A fantastic fun time. Don't be fooled into thinking this is just another brewery tour / museum. Despite the experience detailing Heinekens origins and story this attraction is so much more. Crammed with fun interactive activities suitable for all ages,and staff who are extremely enthusiastic and knowledgeable this was a fantastic fun packed 3hours plus......even the gift shop is reasonably priced. What more can I say Fabulous!!

Fantastic afternoon out - must see. Extremely fun morning / afternoon out.It begins with history on the brewery etc etc and ends in a bar with free beer!! Enough said surely?!It is really interesting, the staff are informative and helpful, and there is PLENTY to keep you amused. A must see for everyone. 10 minute tram from Dam Square and a lot of nice bars / walks close by!

A great experience . For what you get to do and see the price is a bargin. It's very informative and there are lots of interactive things to do like riding around Amsterdam on a bike and playing PS4's in their Champions League room. These are just some of the highlights. I'd highly recommend everyone to go here if you're in Amsterdam.
Good fun. This was a great way to finish a day for us. There weren't many people when we were there and apart from learning about the beer, there are fun things to do. Well worth a visit.

Cheers for more Heineken!. My friends and I enjoyed the tour and free beers! Love the various activities prepared for the visitors, namely the photo booths, video recording, personalised heineken bottle, interactive games, and etc! Definetely, a must do experience for all tourists!

A disappointment. The tour is not very well organised. We bought the tickets online so did not have to queue for that but there are several bottlenecks during the tour where you have to queue for a long time, not really knowing what's next and how long it is going to take. Yes, you get your free drinks at the end but overall too much time queueing for what it is.
Loved it. Fun and informative couple of hours. Trained staff who know what they're meant to do. But buy your ticket in advance before going.

A great experience. Really glad we visited this while we were in Amsterdam. Its easy to get to and we did not have to queue up for tickets as we purchased them before going to it. Really enjoyed learning about Heineken and the couple of free drinks you get whilst in there made it more enjoyable. Its very light hearted and a great way to spend a couple of hours in Amsterdam. Tip- get the free Heineken canal boat offered in the shop at the end of the experience to get back into the centre of Amsterdam and you also get a free small Heineken glass for going on it!

A little overrated. . The first portion of the tour is great: you learn about the brand, the Heineken family, how it's made, etc. After that, it's all cheesy advertising. Sure, there's free (technically... the tickets ARE €16) beer, but don't set your expectations too high.

VIP tour is a must!. We took the VIP tour which cost about double the cost of the normal walk around tour. To be honest, I would suggest this option as you get a personal guide who shows you everything on the normal tour plus a tour upstairs in the private areas, a chance to stand on the roof to look at the city (bonus because everywhere is flat), a private non rushed tasting of 5 beers and cheeses in the haystack bar upstairs (on top of your 2 free beers) and a free personalized Heineken beer in a bottle and tube carrier (that normally costs 6 Euros 50 cent extra on the self guide tour). All this took us 4 hours. Rob our guide was very knowledgeable speaking excellent English and entertained us greatly. The interactive experience at the end of all tours is really good fun (especially as everyone is tipsy) with make your own videos and photos and learn to pull a pint properly lessons. Well worth a visit for any age group.

Great thing to do when it is raining outside . Absolutely great thing to do when it's raining outside. Very interactive and engaging tour around the history of Heineken. A beer is included after the tour which will taste absolutely great after the tour!

The worst experience you will have in amsterdam. The name is all wrong. Amsterdam is brilliant but don't waste your money or time here. They charge you 16 euros and the tour is pants, then when you get to the end of the tour they do everything not to give you your 2 free drinks. They just want your cash and don't care about customers. I didn't,t think that the beer was good either. Amstel is much better so it's a shame there is no Amstel tour.The name of this tour should be called "the worst experience you will have in Amsterdam".I intend to return to this great city, but I will not waste one second on this excuse for an attraction.

Interesting history of Heineken, too much advertising. The Heineken experience is located in the old brewery, very close to central and other attractions nearby (Rijksmuseum etc). It's worth the visit to get a little history of Heineken, see the brewing process and get two free beers at the end. I would recommend buying the tickets in advance online, since it is cheaper and you can go straight to the entrance. There was not a wait when we went, but I've seen long lines out the door. Expect to spend one hour to 90 minutes. The exhibits were interesting. However, the "brew you" part of the tour was a bit cheesy and we had to wait the longest. I wish there was a way to skip this part. Ticket price at the time of this review was 18 Euros, which includes the beer tasting. A bit too much advertising for Heineken beer in my opinion, but understand why they did this. At the end, it's all about marketing their beer.

When in Amsterdam. A tour through the life of beer in Amsterdam!!A look at brewing and a video of Heineken history followed by nibbles and trays of Heineken all consumed on a pretty much empty stomach lol !!!Have fun !!!
Beer, beer and more beer. It explains everything about Heineken I loved the history! Not going to give up all the details you should go find out for yourself!

Interesting but overpriced. Heineken experience is interesting, but the ticket is overpriced for what it is. The place is also overcrowded; you need to queue up 2 – 3 times at the tour pit stops and wait.

Interesting and nice. If you are in Amsterdam, you should definitely try to visit this place. If you have the Amsterdam pass, you will have an interesting discount in the entrance. You can also download the app for the tour guide (but if you speak English you would not need it). The best part is at the end...the Heineken experience room, the rooms with the sports and games and the lounge. Do not forget to purchase your souvenirs. You can buy your bottle carved with your name on it (but can not put it in the carry on if you are flying)
Nectar of goods. Just go there and enjoy. Fun, historical, educational, and you can drink in museum.:) Visit with your friends or wife, it is great place to visit if you don't want to go museum.

Quality Lads day out!. Been the Heineken factory twice and both times ive had a right laugh! Me and my mates went and it was a really chilled out interesting day. We brought our tickets from one of the many tourist shops near the town centre. We was abit sceptical about buying them there but trust me it makes life a lot easier.We got to the factory and the queue was going all the way down the road. but because we previously got our tickets we walked right to the front! We went in and started our tour. the tour is good and very interesting with little parts where a member of the Heineken team will be dotted around the factory explaining something or getting you engaged doing something. You get taught how to drink a beer 'Properly' and if you get the awnsers right to the questions you get extra beers! At the end you get 2 free beers of 'fresh' Heineken and if its a Saturday you get to drink them on the rooftop bar which is really cool! If its not Saturday theres a nice little bar downstairs where you can properly get hands on pouring your own pints! Ive been there twice and if someone asked me if I wanted to go again i'de do it! Be aware you'll probably walk out half cut! Enjoy
Got a little tipsy!. A good fun walk around. Learned about the beer & had fun pouring it. The end souvenir photos are fun too, and you email them to yourself which I think is a fab idea!

Despide the price, its so much fun!. Went with 3 friends and had a lot of fun! we took pictures, sang the Amsterdam anthem on a video (that you send to your email later), learned more about beer..a really good experience.Tip: check the hours the boat goes to the central store, so you'll get a free boat ride and get to pick your souvenir glass on the central store.
Heineken experience. Amazing experience, you get to know the process of brewing beer and also how to become a beer expert! 2 beers included!

Super fun time. Being honest here, and an American. I have never really tried a Heineken and I can say that now not only have I tried it (many times over on this trip now) but the experience just isn't your normal brewery tour. It is pretty dang cool. Very interactive and I actually learned something! You get to help in the brewing process a bit and really get into the history. I would suggest it for a couple hours of fun in Amsterdam.
Just great!. Really a nice tour. We choosed a VIP tour and it was fantastic. Really nice experience. At the end you have brewery shop.

Great spot if you like Beer. Great place to tour on a rainy day. Learn the history of the Heineken brand, see the Heineken horses, participate in sports that Heineken sponsors and have a few sample beers. Especially enjoyed the short ride as the life of beer.

It's Heineken!!. You have to go see this! I love Beer, but even if you don't, it's still cool to see. Old Copper Stills, Make your own Label and Bottle, many interactive displays and the best of all, the Tastings! You will have a great time!
Must try!!!. It's not about the free drinks or brewery tour. It's about all fun you can get there on your tour. Well worth a visit!!!

Amazing. My fav Beer is guinnes but me and husband wanted to live this experience.
Amazing.
Store of the family, really interactive.
We Played soccer and I won the uefa !!!
Beer included in the price, I had a cold one.
Bit drunk at the end but was really amazing!

More than beer. Probably one of the coolest places I've ever been to. You experience more than just beer. The rich history that is involved is just outstanding. Definitely in my top three things to do while in Amsterdam. Even if you don't like beer (though I don't know why you wouldn't), you'd have a grand old time still.

Lots to see and do. Really enjoyed my visit here back in August, there was lots to see and learn about Heineken but also lots of activities to take part in too. To top it off a free pint of beer at the end, definitely worth visiting if in Amsterdam!

Nice experience if you buy tickets in advance. It was good to get there and having the experience. But it was much better to skip the long lines because we had the tickets bought in advance. The weather was too cold and waiting outside would have been a disaster because the lines were not moving at all. Last group allowed to enter is at 7:00 pm, so go before that an separate like two hours. It was a fun experience!

Utter disappointment . From the moment we arrived the place was chaotic and disorganised. After queueing half an hour to drop our bags off as they're not allowed with you, we then started our tour with not knowing where to go as we were given no direction or help by the lack of staff. The tour was very basic and busy, we found ourselves waiting to go into each room with no idea what was happening or what we were looking at. We were then led into a busy room where we were to be shown a 'good movie' which turned out to be an onslaught of Heineken commercials .. ZzzzWe quickly left here and skipped most of the tour which only looked as dull as the rest, to then queue again for our bag which was another disaster. The staff were handing people the wrong bags and we overheard that several people had had their bags lost. Overall would not recommend this, a complete waste of time.

Great tour and great beer!. The tour was well done. We liked the interaction with the staff as they explained a bit of the beer in every section. There were fun little games you got to do along the way and it was all on your own paste. Better than we expected. Staff was friendly and very knowledgeable about their product. They give you a tasting during the tour and also 2 glasses at the end. The beer was so refreshing and so good. Definitely a must do when you're in Amsterdam, especially if you enjoy beer!
Best part of trip!. This was amazing, lasts very long which we loved! Theres so much to it, its so fun and its something everyone should do! The price is really reasonable

Very surprised this place was fantastic . Wasn't on my list of priorities but to be fair this was great. You have a mix of history, beer and a 2 year daughter running around. Loved the place, staff very friendly. May return sometime soon just for the bar !

Way more than I expected. I thought that this was a pretty fun visit to a small museum but wow was I wrong, it just goes on and on, the fun doesn't end. Well of course it does eventually but it was much longer than I thought. There are lots of fun things to do along the way and check out, there is even a place to play FIFA on PS4. Of course at the very end you get your 2 free drinks but there is so much more to it. My favorite part was helping one of the workers mix the hops and learning about the history of the company. Definitely one to have on the list, deserves it high rating.
cool place. Cool place where you can experience how heineken beer being made​​, of course drink lots of heineken beer.
Go!!! It's fun and there's beer!!. We did the VIP tour and it was worth it, behind the scenes and a beer and cheese tasting. The guides are super intelligent and friendly...we had a blast.
Amazing!!!. If you like beer you must live and enjoy the Heineken experience. Very informative fun and interesting. The best part os at the end. Beautiful bar. Great beer!!!!

Unexpectedly awesome. I skipped this last time I was in town, but this time I'm glad I didn't. As soon as we walked in you could tell you were going to have some fun, beer tasting or not.
