As you walk from room to room you are caught up in the history and the "coolness" of Heineken. You get to see how the bottles have changed, see some cool art installations, and see the famous Heineken horses. Being present for feeding time in the stable was a real treat. We were just standing there and then all the sudden the horse got really excited and started dancing around their stalls. Turns out the mad that feeds them was coming around the corner with lunch. By the end the tasting was the least stimulation part of the tour because we enjoyed the brand more than the beer. The Heineken Experience is hip, informational, and an all-around good time for almost any age.

Casual experience, some beer included. Nice place to visit and know its history within amsterdam and abroad, take special care to visit the pub at the end of the trip and grab some friends with you - to do the experience alone is kinda pointless
Great thing to do. IT was great, nice experience and good value for money. The trip wwas great and I really enjoyed the last beer at the end of the tour. thanks heineken

Nice old factory tour. A must for all beer lovers, it is a tour around their old factory, they show you how the beer is made and also how to pour your beer. At the end of the tour you will get a mini beer glass and 2 pints of beer to enjoy at the bar

A let down. My friends and I visited. We had prebooked tickets. The queue for tickets purchased on the day was around a half hour wait. The actual tour itself is very disappointing. We found it to be more of a big commercial for Heineken and not particularly informative. It consisted mostly of walking around reading things for yourself with no one to guide you through the exhibition. We didn't enjoy the experience at all and would have preferred to have spent the 18 euros per ticket on a few drinks in a local bar. Definitely wouldn't recommend

Is a cool automatic "tour"!!. everything is allready set up, so is very automatic some stuff is very dinamic but no to much. some of the staff was ok other was kind of rude maybe having a bad day who nkows. couple of free beers at the end wich was nice..

Great experience . Visited on a Sunday morning, arrived around 11:30 so queue wasn't too bad to get in.Nice warm welcome, cloakroom for bags/coats. The experience is very interactive and interesting, more like a museum than a working brewery but nonetheless very good.It includes the tasting of the beer at the end which was a good bonus! Allow around 2 hours for leisurely trip.Would recommend if in Amsterdam.

For the lovers of gold water!. If you love beer then ypu can not miss the heineken museum- brewery.The price is 16 euros if you book your ticket from the many sales offices in the center of amsterdam.The museum shows the history behind the person who made the famous beer and the stages to create a beet until the bottling and how to serve it.The price includes 2 glasses of beer But also you receive one more when you making the "testing" of the beer (smell see taste) and if you are fast and answer some questions that means more glasses of beer!!!If you want to brew your own beer (just printing a message at the bottle under the Heineken) it cost 6.5 Euros.

Interesting and good fun even for an Ale fan. This looked an average experience in some of the comments read but turned out to be good fun and quite interesting. The place is very entertaining and staff enthusiastic. Buy ticket before you arrive at the many tourist outlets as you can just arrive go past the queue and walk in. First part is about the history of the brand and is ok but the weakest part. But the interactive parts of the tour make it fun and you get carried away with the vibe. Of course there is some beer as part of the ticket and you finish with a shop with branded items. Some say not worth it but even as an Ale drinker I thought this was good fun and money well spent.

Beer. Would give 5 stars as interesting but to wait an hour in the freezing cold because they only have 2 cashiers is unacceptable. Otherwise really enjoyed it. All the fun attractions near the end are also great.
Fantastic place for Beer lover. I went there for this year holiday and went this beer museum. Always a nice place to visit for beer lovers

Heineken queueing experience. We were tempted by this place as a motherland of Heineken. Got here on Saturday afternoon. Thank god it wasn't raining! 1h15min wait just to get the tickets !!!!so you better get them earlier online or find a different attraction. This is not the end of your waiting. To get the first beer you need to be patient and queue for another 25 min inside.After all you get 2x 0.4 L or smaller they are deffinetely not regular beer sizes. Seriously you are not losing much if you've not seen this museum + you're saving £18 that you can spend on some high quality local beers which are amazing!! If, after reading this , you still went to see this museum , means that I did a bad job writing this review ...

Get tickets in advance or plan to queue for a long time!!!. Tram numbers 16 & 24 can drop you just outside this experience. On arrival I was surprised to see such a long queue waiting to go in, so was relieved to realise as we had already pre purchased our tickets we were able to go straight to the front and walk in. As you enter you are given a wrist band which entitles you to two small drinks (or one larger one) at the end of the experience. As you walk through you learn about the founder, the brewing process and have a simulator type experience ending with a small beer tasting, before moving on to a more interactive area. In this area you can type your own label to be put on a bottle (to be picked up in the shop at the end), take part in a Karaoke video cycling experience, practice pouring a beer and try out a number of other interactive experiences. At the end you join a noisy and busy drinking area where you can exchange the tokens on your wristband for your free drinks (don't rest your elbows on any of the surfaces as most are wet with beer!) and finally you exit via the shop where there are a number of Heineken souvenirs to tempt you into spending more of your money. We found we spent approx two hours there, so if you like beer it is worth a visit (however be warned there are no alternative drink options for non beer drinkers!)

Boring, overcrowded & dull!. Queued all the way through.. Couldn't see anything as they let too many people in at once.. Really, how many times can you describe how beer is brewed? Basically the "experience" is a queue to see some pictures, a queue to hear how water, malt, hops and yeast are used to brew beer, a fairly underwhelming ride and then a load of side shows about events Heineken sponsors (obviously the bit someone said "better tack a bit on the end here as it's as boring as hell this tour.."A couple of hours of my life I'll never get back... Lol..

Amazing experience . This is the place to be if you are a beer lover.They have many things to keep you interested in the whole process with the testers.Note: Do buy tickets from any of travel persons to avoid que at Heineken

Great way to spend a couple of hours. Enjoyed the heineken experience a lot. Wasnt expecting it to be interesting but was surprised. A lot to do and loads of interactive parts to it. The beers at the end are worth it alone

A must visit for beer lovers. The whole tour takes around 2 hours. The ticket includes 2 beers which you get at the end of the tour. They tell you the history of heineken and demonstrate how it is made. At the end you can take pictures and make karaoke video which they e mail to you.

fun but commercial. Yes, it was fun... but a little bit boring to hear many words about why and how "Heineken is the best beer in the world!". It is not an operating brewery. There are photos, videos, live explanations about beer making and interactive shows inside. The testing beer was very fresh but I cannot tell the same for the two complimentary small beers given at the end of the show. We bought the tickets from Tours&Tickets earlier so we could skip the line and had a 2 euro discount.

good experience . good experience on seeing how heineken is made and how it became so famous also lots to do and see and get a free taster session and either 1 big pint or 2 small half put to at the end with your wrist band

This is No Ordinary Beer Tour. I have been to many brewery and wine tours, but NONE like this one. This interactive tour is experiential with opportunities to make your personalized beer bottles, videos and sample some of the best beer in the world. Definitely something to do in Amsterdam

VIP tour recommended. We were a group of ladies visiting Amsterdam from Wales earlier this month. We did the VIP tour which was highly recommended. The staff were all so professional and we had an amazing time.
You know!. Worth a visit but it's even better if your invited as part of a special event with dinner in this famous old place!

great. did the Heineken tour,and it was very interesting if its your bag....you get a few samples beer which is good 3 to be presise, only I got four as I answered a question correct, so I had a good day...really it is very interesting and I would do it again.have fun.

Great fun for all!. This was a great couple of hours spent learning all about Heineken and beer making! My wife was sceptical about going with me as she has no interest in tasting or learning about beer, but she absolutely loved it. There's lots to see and do to keep you occupied and the time flew in. We thoroughly enjoyed learning how the pour the perfect pint, and of course drinking it too!

Great Experience. I always think brewery tours are going to be the same but the Heineken Experience was very different. We had a great time walking around learning the history behind Heineken in a fun way. Of course the beer was great! Heineken spent a lot of time creating a fun & meaningful experience.

One of the best attractions in Amsterdam. A must visit for beer lovers, The Heineken Experience is fun and makes a nice contrast from some of the historic attractions and museums the city offers. The only two things to add is that the two free beers you get at the end are not a full pint or 0.5 CL and they aren't poured that well, still this didn't spoil the experience. Also try and get to the museum early, the queues can get quite big towards the end of the day.

Amazing experience. I had initially booked this day out for the benefit of my boyfriend along with a pizza canal cruise in the evening and i have to say this was the best day we had by far, the Heineken Experience was interesting, quirky and was so much fun. I would go back again without hesitation!

Great insight. Very informative tour and plenty of activities to interact with. Best bit is the 2 beers at the end! It was pretty quiet when I went which allowed you to spend a bit more time with the staff to ask questions.

A must while visiting . A fairy good tour recommend paying attention thoughtout the tour as you do learn and understand the history of Heineken i enjoyed it that much i did it twice a few weeks apart and know my Heineken pretty well now

Much better than expected . I have to congratulate Heineken on the effort they have put into this 'experience'. There is so much more to it than just a boring factual tour. I won't give any spoilers - this is simply a must visit. Excellent gift shop too.

:). The Heineken Experience is a fun way to spend a couple of hours learning about how beer is made, with various things to do and see. Then you get to taste the Heineken in one section, and at the end you get two free half pints of it (or Pepsi if you don't like beer, or are driving).A good, fun experience with a reward at the end. Make sure to ask about the special extra at the end whenever you are in the shop.....i will say no more ;) Not many people know about it, but it involves a river boat.Highly recommended Experience :)

Definitely buy tickets before!. Great experience but definitely glad we bought tickets before as when we arrived there was a huge queue! Tickets can be bought from various ticket shops in Amsterdam usually for 2 euros cheaper too. When we first got in too many people had been let in so we moved very slowly round the first exhibits, once we got out into the open we got to see how the beer is made, see some horses, go on a ride, taste the beer and then there were a lot of great interactive activities such as photobooth and a video booth.Definitely worth a visit, but allow yourself plenty of time to go round as it is such a popular museum!

Good Fun. The Heineken experience is good fun, its informative, its priced fairly, and its a good way to kill a hour or two in Amsterdam, especially if its raining.  The history of, and process of making Heineken is explained without making things boring. There are plenty of fun things to do in the tour, like pulling pints and kicking conversions on a projection of a rugby pitch, and there is at least 2 free beers included in the price of the tour. There is also a free canal boat that brings you to the Heineken gift shop at the end. I would recommend to people to visit the Heineken experience.

Best for groups. Very commercial . I went through this alone and felt awkward since it's mostly geared towards large groups of young visitors. I think I counted 5 selfie stations and there were multiple photo booths, video game consoles, and promotional EDM videos. The experience was mostly interactive and the references to Heineken's history in the Netherlands were only in the very beginning. Felt quite comercial and lame overall. Probably my least favorite part of my trip.

Always a great day iut. This is a great way to pass a few hours in Amsterdam - complete with the fun of becoming a bottle of beer.This trip we used our beer tokens to get the opportunity to pull your own pint - great fun.

Great time!. I am not much of a beer drinker. This was still a fun experience. Think of it as a giant Heineken advertisement and just go with it, and you'll have a good time. Met some nice young men from Norway, which was helpful. We gave them our extra beer tokens. The ticket entitles the guest to 2 beers. We are 1 beer people. It was nice to be able to share and give the extra to guys who enjoyed beer.

Heineken Experience VIP tour is worth it. We visited our son in Holland (he is studying abroad) and wanted to do something fun with him while there...we visited the Heineken Experience (VIP) tour and had a great time...The VIP tour was worth the extra price...having a tour guide (Robert was excellent) and a small group (7 of us total), getting some extra behind the scenes info, access to other areas and an awesome private beer tasting was more than what we expected...this is definitely a tourist-laden attraction, something we usually try to stay away from, but the experience was truly a fun one and we would do it again if we go back to Amsterdam...the quality of the employees is exemplary, they are all so wonderful and have such great attitudes which is infectious...we had a great time here, learned a ton about Heineken and beer overall and spent some quality time with our college-aged son, who, by the way, had a great time as well!

Fun and interesting trip!. The heineken experience was one of our best things we done during our stay here. It was very easy to find and we thought it was a good price, including your drinks! Because we had pre book tickets we got straight to the front of the que, it did look long but it seemed to be moving. The staff there were very helpful to us at all times. It was a great tour telling you how they made the beer and the history behind it. It was fun and interactive all the way! There was lots of things to see and do there and we came out with some knowledge we didn't know before. I would recommend this 100% to anyone who wants to have fun.

Well spent couple of hours. We really enjoyed our visit here. If you plan to visit on a Saturday afternoon I would book your tickets in advance, the queue was massive. It starts off a bit cramped but gets better the further through you go. You get just over a pint of heneiken included in your visit, my husband was delighted he got all of mine too!
Awesome time. What a great way to experience a great beer. Not only was the museum itself incredibly entertaining, but the beer with admission certainly did not hurt!
Brilliant!!. Ticked every box and was above our expectations!!So entertaining and not just a boring museum, it really is an experience!

Well worth the time. Visited the Heineken experience and didn't regret a minute . The cast members (staff) are very informative and upbeat. The trip starts with the history of the Heineken family and heineken's early days told in an upbeat informative way - followed by a tour of the vats and machinery used in brewing plus tasting the wort and onto the bottling, the stables, leading up to a tasting session including why Heineken has bubbles! There then follows a Heineken experience re rugby, football with interactive exhibits along with an art section where you can draw with your arms and even practice pulling a glass of Heineken. There was an opportunity to do this for real- but only one pump was open which was a shame (Guinness) do this bit much better. This then leads onto the 2 free glasses - we asked about the upstairs bar and were escorted to the bar at the top of the building which had a 360 degree view of the city which was great.The only difficulty I found with the exhibits was the sheer number of steps you had to climb!
Really good. Really interactive tour. It is worth the visit.I can say I had some fun in here. And a couple of pints in the end :)

Great Fun. We got our tickets from our concierge and saved a few Euros it was about 15 Euro.We visited on a week day so it was really quiet we practically had the place to ourselves it was great. The tour was so interesting they vary it between someone talking, demonstrations, videos and beer, so I was hooked from the start. I love at the end there's some football interaction bits where you can make videos and take silly pictures which you can email to yourself for free!! Before you leave you get a free pint or two then you can visit the gift store. We Absolutely loved it and even made our very own beer bottle.I'd definitely go again

Interesting but overly touristy. For beer lovers it's definitely worth checking out as it's interesting to learn the history behind the Heineken brand. And it's always neat to learn how to pour the perfect beer. But it was very busy and a lot of the things in the experience are very gimmicky.
Great 2 hours spent . Great Experience - plenty to look at, few activities, shop, couple of drinks - would recommend if you are doing all touristy stuff!
Awesome time. This really was an experience. Probably one of the best things we did while in Amsterdam. Well worth the entry fee, and more than just a standard tour
Excellent . Very interesting tour. Not rushed, good value at €18. I enjoyed the tasting session near the end of the tour and included in the €18 is 2 drinks at the end of the tour

Enjoyed this. The start wasn't great, the place was jam packed through dimly lit rooms going up stairs and I felt very claustrophobic. However as the tour went on we were able to pass the slow people we were stuck behind and go at our own speed. It became much more enjoyable as you could part take in some activities. How ever there was a horse stables and staff were letting people in to interact with the horses however because we were not family of the crew members we were denied this opportunity. It then proceeded to more rooms with activities including making a customised bottle. It then finished with a ice cold pint. Glad I visited.

Worth a visit. Visited the Heineken experience during a 2 night break in Amsterdam! Although I'm not a beer drinker a few friends had said that it was worth a visit and I have to say they were right! So much to do while inside from the history behind the beer, ingredients, plenty of fun entertainment oh and a few free glasses of beer on the way.oh and a very reasonable price! Would defiantly recommend a trip here if you have time!

V.I.P tour. We arrived at midday and were greeted by our guide Sven. He was funny, extremely knowledgeable and polite throughout our tour. We had a great time and I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Amsterdam. Sven went above and beyond in making our experience special, he also recommended some local areas to visit which was great. Give him a promotion! To all travellers, pay the extra for the VIP experience, it was worth every penny!

Meh. Felt like I was in an advertisement for two hours. For the price we paid it wasn't worth it. You get 2/3 free drinks but that's about as interesting as it gets. I'm keeping my wristband from the tour on me as a subtle passive-aggressive reminder not to drink Heineken again in protest.

Great even for a non beer drinker!. I have to admit I do not like beer- never have probably never will. But my husband LOVES beer so I agreed to do this tour with him. I was actually very pleasantly surprised how much I enjoyed it. It is very educational on how the make beer and as a large variety of things to see and do. Overall was a great afternoon and my husband enjoyed his two beers and my two beers at the end!

Sooooooo good!. We were a bit skeptical at paying out 17 euro for this, but knew the free beer along the way would make it worth it's money a little bit more.It was so cool!!We got to see where they make the beer, the whole process, try the half-made product, hear about the history of Heineken and what it's done for The Netherlands.Seeing the history of their packaging and advertising was actually really interesting, and then I got to pour beer from a tap like a pro, and get a certificate for at.We then got a free Canal boat ride, with a history if the canals, and of the historic sites we passed, and at the other end, we got to go to their merchandise shop and get a free gift!Seriously, amazing value for money, really fun and interesting, the tour is so professional and slick. Highly recommend this, the most fun we had in Amsterdam!

Interesting but overrated . The museum is okay but when you have to wait for 10 min, 4-5 times just to get to the exhibits, it gets pretty boring pretty fast... Bear at the end makes up for it though. Still, a bit overpriced for what you get
Amazing!!. By far the best thing we done In Amsterdam.amazing value for money, genuinely interesting and central to everything else.
Good experienece. This is good place to get new experience into beer factory. You will be passing on all the stage and in addition to the good Heineken providing Nice environment for the tour.
Keeps you entertained over and over. This is a MUST when in Amsterdam. You will be entertained, probably will buy most unique souvenirs in Amsterdam and will drink beer. What can top that?
a beer lover's paradise!. Located in the heart of Amsterdam,a haven for beer lovers, the former brewery was active for over 100 years. It is now an interactive display. And only 18 euros.
Not Just the Beer. First visit in over 10 years and my has it changed. A very professional make over. The children 10-16 enjoyed it as much as we did even though they could not have a beer

Interesting. by visiting Heineken Experience you will get a detailed explanation of the manufacturing process and materials, see the history of Heineken and at the end of the tour you can also taste a beer. You can also receive pictures and videos sent directly to your email address.

Worth a visit. We got a deal with the tour company €29.50 for both the Heineken and ice bar which turned out to be very good value for money. It has a lot to see and do which keeps it fun and not boring. Overall a good experience that you have to do whilst in the area.
Great Brewery Tour. Great tour and you get 2 beers. very informative guides who know beer and show you how to drink it proper and enjoy every bit.

Interactive , fun and interesting. We got the Holland pass (medium ) and used one of the tickets for this attraction. Very interesting concept and lots of games, rooms and things to play with along the self-guided tour. lots of music and lights . My husband liked the tasting where he got an extra beer for answering a question right . The "be bottled " ride was interesting, nothing special but it was ok. At the end of the tour you get two beers or one extra cold (larger ) beer that is a little but more enjoyable. Gift shop is the way out, they have the usual merchandise you can get at any brewery attraction.

A very commercial experience. Don't expect to understand the beer brewing process, or what makes Heineken beer different from other beers, but you will drink at least half a pint of it, and have some fun along the way. Buy tickets in advance to save time and request a free boatride downtown at the end of your tour. It will take you from one giftshop to another, but you'll get to see Amsterdam from it's canals!

Exciting experience. I had previously been to Guiness brewery back in Ireland but to be honest Heineken experience was much better. The tour is really cool as you see every single step needed to make a "lekker" beer. Besides, the audioguide is really useful and you learn a lot about how this company managed to become one of the top producers worldwide. At the end, there are a lot of interactive games and places where you can take many pics while you drink two glasess of this famous dutch beer.I would really recommend to purchase the tickets before going there otherwise you will have to wait for long queues even though it's opened until 9 pm, so you have time

Interesting place to visit.... I recently took a friend here who was visiting Amsterdam. The tour is great, quits interactive and covers a lot more than just beer in an interesting way (marketing, distribution etc). Learn to pour a beer, and drink a few too :)

A fun afternoon . My husband and I spent a fun couple of hours at the Heineken experience. The tour is in English and was quite interesting. They give you a history of the brand and the Heineken family. The shop was full of all kinds of branded items although it was beyond me why anyone would want a Heineken bikini or hoodie.

Great experience. Me and my wife enjoyed to pay about 16€ and spent more than one hour there.They explain from the start to end making beer, this happens in different places, rooms, and we saw all machines. At the end they offer about 75cl of Heineken beer.and a small present.We bought some items from their shop.I think worth to visit for this amount. And If you like it, visiting "house of bolls and cocktails" also will be good for you.

Beer marketing. Done right.. I'm not a huge fan of Heineken beer itself, but as a marketer I am a fan of their sponsorship and how they market them self, and let's be honest, that's exactly what this 'Experience' is. But that is not a bad thing, it is a very well put together story of the origins of Heineken, how it's made, and of course the marketing surrounding one of the world's biggest beer brands.
Fun for beer lovers. The your is really good fun, the guides are knowledgable & take time to entertain you. The brewery is huge & has lots of history. I love a Brewer tour & really enjoyed it.
Not recommended. Very commercial: one big advertisement. unless you're a beerfan.... This is not Amsterdam, but big money.
Amazing. Its amazing i extremely love it its a well worth experience! Free beer and unique experience its a must do. , it was very interactive, fun, interesting.

THE Experience. I don't even like the Heineken beer, BUT, I looooooooved the place. It was very funny, I feel like a kid in Disneyland. You'll know how to tap correctly your beer, how to drink it (as it should be taught :P).
Tourist trap!. You are so much better off visiting De Prael. This place is horrendous. It's an overpriced tourist trap.

Nice place to visit (including free beer). Some history on Heineken beer. It's a self guided walk kind of visit and at certain stations there will be staff explaining e.g its manufacturing process. There are also games stations incorporated which is quite fun! Of course, highlight of the visit is the 2 free beer! Heineken beer served in the right temperature, what more could one asked for. (by the way, I'm no beer fan, but it taste really good!)
A true experience. It's really an experience! You'll know about their story, how to take your beer correctly from the tap and how to drink it too! And more things you have to go to discover...

Very fun . This is not just another museum in Amsterdam. It is called "experience" because there are many interactive videos and games, so it is not boring whatsoever. You get to drink a couple of cold Heinekens, BTW.

Busy But Fun For Large Groups. Great history as well as educational. Enjoyed the tour very much through the different rooms. Lasts about 1-1 1/2 hours depending on how busy it is. Avoid weekends and try to find line-bypass tickets. Then enjoy 2 with your tickets or Coke for the underage.

Not interesting . This place iş announced museum but just advertisement. İt can be organized better than this. Admission fee is 18 euro but you can not get your payment. I suggest you can spend your time other art vs activities museums

Fun tipsy afternoon . Centred mainly on several different ways of telling you the same story with rides, videos and short presentations by staff. You get a fair amount to taste and there is a free bar at the end to use your tokens. We were piddly by the end and feeling the love for Heineken. Definitely worth a trip.
Excellent- worth a visit! . Went for a friends Birthday, they treated us so well! One of the highlights from the trip, definitely worth a visit! Excellent!
Great Experience. The tour shows you the process of making beer and also has loads of fun activity and space to chill at the end of the tour. Need 2 hours to complete the tour and ease

Good . The Heineken experience was a rather good one, it's very factual but myself and my partner found this boring at times. There is a simulator ride incorporated at the end which is fantastic and rather fun. You get free beers. Buy tickets in advance rather than having to wait for them as the queues seem rather long.

Great FUN. Really enjoyed this experience, it was very interactive, fun, interesting. All staff friendly and answered any questions we had. The location around the back of the building has a wonderful selection of restaurant and bars.

Fun. Put it on your list. If you haven't been to a similar place, it's a must. We had the tickets from one of the many tour&tickets shops that are all over Amsterdam. It was cheaper and also we didn't stay in line to buy them. If you're not a heavy drinker, make sure you eat before going there. You end up drinking at least 2 beers ( staff is very funny and if you answer their questions you get more beer:). I think it's a very well organized experience overall with lovely little surprises - you can brand your own bottle, glass, pour your own drink and...drink some good beer. Yeah, you pay for it, but what's for free nowadays? Thumbs up Heineken. Had a fun couple of hours in there
Awesome. This is superb whether as a couple or with the lads/ladies!You won't believe what it is like until you experience it

Excellent. Worth every bit of money!! You got so much and more for your money!! Don't get the bottle you can personalise unless you can put it in the plane hold. We got a bit stuffed there as they don't tell you that you can't have it in hand luggage until you go to pick it up/pay

Fun and Interactive Experience. Chanced upon this place while walking down the streets and thought why not and pop in with friends. Did not have much expectations so I guess we were pleasantly surprised with the experience and the overall tour. Entrance fee is $18 euros per person and it comes with 2 free beers at the end of the tour. Initially thought it would just be a walk-through museum style experience but it was much more than that.Besides showcasing the company's long history, we were introduced to beer making as well as the different ingredients that makes the distinctive taste that beer has. There is a "ride" where for a few minutes we were taken on a tour on how beer was made. There are also many interactive booths that allow you to take pictures with the Champion Leagues trophy, with football players or a video of you cycling down the streets of Amsterdam and email to yourself. Next go on to bottle your own beer and create your personalised bottle for $6.50 euros. We were then ushered to a bar counter where we were taught how to drink beer the correct way. At the end of the tour is where we get to collect our 2 glasses of beer to wrap up the whole experience. The store is a must go as well where you can buy different beer paraphernalia as well as engrave your name and create your own beer glass for a fee of $8 euros. Overall it was a fantastic and enjoyable experience. I notice that there was quite a few negative reviews so I guess it is really up to the expectations that you bring into the Heineken Experience.
Informative and fun. Really enjoyed our selves. Lots of free beer. Good photo opportunities too. Would definitely return next visit to Amsterdam.
Good fun. Enjoyed this very much with the exception of the long wait to go on the simulation - think it was exceptionally busy that night though

nice roof top bar. Was skeptical before we went and I thought the worst initially. The first 20/30 minutes were very frustrating as we queued through a fairly pointless section of narrow corridors and if there was an exit here I would have left. Once we got into the main brewery it was more interesting. 30 minute que for a 4d cinema which was okay – bit of a novelty – but you wouldn’t que again. Tasting room was good. enjoyed pouring my own pint. And I enjoyed the bar on the roof as it was dark and a great view. Overall I enjoyed it but it was too busy and just a long line really.

Interesting and fun. We had s great time, 2st part of the tour was informative the later part more centred around interactive activities. The tour also includes 2 x small beers per person in the ticket price. Making it good value for money.

Fun experience. Looking at several negative reviews,I wonder if any of them came to the Heineken Experience just to "experience" and have fun! I am from Milwaukee and know a bit about beer and have been to several other breweries. This was not only an interesting presentation but entertaining! You go thru this at your own pace. At one point we went through the brewing process becoming our own beer. Very different and as I said quite fun! I would definitely recommend this!

Mediocre at best. Visited the Heineken Experience on Friday afternoon and it wasn't very pleasant at all, 15 minutes queueing to buy tickets and the tour itself wasn't anything special. Beer on offer was awful and very disappointing. Staff weren't much better either didn't feel like an experience felt like get in and get out thanks for your money. Heineken should really take some time to look at the Guinness Storehouse here in Dublin far superior and very well laid out unlike Heineken. I wouldn't recommend to friends and the price of stuff in the gift shop was astronomical. To sum it up find a decent bar in Amsterdam and get a pint in there.
Don't like Heineken but was a fun tour . Shows you how the company started, you get to see how there beer is made. Also get to taste, good experience.
Aaawwww yyyyiiissss. Really cool interactive tour. You get 2 tokens worth 2×0.25 beers at the end of the tour +1 other during the tasting. The shop at the end is a must visit. Cheers!

Ever felt too old?. This attraction wasn't one of our 'must see' in Amsterdam, but we thought it was worth a visit if we were close by and the queues weren't too bad. We did the Guinness tour and the Jameson tour in Dublin recently, which we enjoyed. This place, however, was like a Disney ride, very little history, no personal guides, it was all done by video, and the average age of the customers was about 20. The important bit of the visit for them was getting a selfie of themselves lifting the Champions League cup, or kicking a penalty in a rugby international, again the wonder of video. Maybe I should have read the reviews on Trip Advisor... If you're over 30, probably best to avoid.

Good fun. We thoroughly enjoyed this surprisingly fun visit. After the interesting bit including the start of Heineken, how the drink is made and the history of it's advertising, we had fun on video games and emailed a video of ourselves on a karaoke machine as well as a silly picture. We pulled a pint and enjoyed chatting to people from all over the world in the inclusive Heineken drink bar area. We collected our vouchers for the free glasses from the shop till and were taken on the free canal boat ride to their other shop near Central station. The guide on the boat was eloquent and gave another interesting version of the history of Amsterdam.
Fantastic!. One of the best tours I have been on! Very interactive with lots to do for adults and kids. The staff are amazing and very friendly. I would definitely recommend!!

Awesome for Heineken lovers!. Went here after doing the Amsterdam Marathon, it was awesome - incredible insight of how the drink all comes together. The free pint we had at the end was awesome too with a great atmosphere! Thoroughly recommended it. Good one to tick off!

Great attraction not just for Heineken drinkers!. There is a lot of thought went into this attraction and they have got a great deal going on! Firstly there is a walk through the with a small presentation. On to short virtual experience film on you going through the process of becoming Heineken very entertaining! There are free images, virtual games, videos to send to your e mail. Tasting session and how to drink it. Pull your own pint, label your own bottle, etc etc Then your 2 drinks at the end, with soft drinks if you prefer.Great tour!

Terrible. I live in Dublin and in fairness the Guinness's tour is much better, the quote to buy the ticket was maddnes, we had to wait 20 min and then inside was the same to can see the atrracction, we spend there almost 1:30 min and was terrible, is better to pay the amount of money to go to another place... I don't recommend this place at all

Perfect if you believe Heineken is the greatest thing in the universe. Throughout the whole "Heineken Experience" I was being led through a tasteless advertisement for heineken. Especially when I was given my first taste of the "best beer in the world" (mediocre at best) and led to a chamber of TV screens all projecting heineken commercials simultaneously. After trudging through the whole ordeal and arriving at the final, then-hopeful, attraction of getting "free" beer we had to stand and drink as there weren't enough places to sit. In fact, there were only about 25 seats and approximately 200 people drinking. The one redeeming quality of this experience was the table-football, gotta love table-football.Tl;dr: not an experience I would recommend. Ever.

A great, high energy tour.. The tour was not only highly informational, but very contemporary. Current club music was playing throughout, and the visitors were young and excited to be there. The displays were well done, with some of them being interactive. Of course, the highlight was the four free samples of beer that I was treated to. Not small glasses, either, but full size like you would get in a bar or restaurant. A wonderful experience.

Something for everyone. We had a great afternoon learning about the history of Heineken and the brewing process. Towards the end of the tour there are loads of games, photobooths and challenges related to different events sponsored by Heineken (our favourite part of the tour)! We also spent about 2 hours in the bar after the tour making the most of our 2 free drinks! We also had lots of people pass us their tokens on the way out so had much more than our fair share of free beer! Proost!

Fun and worth every cent spent. Excellent way to spend a couple of hours of your stay in Amsterdam and the price is good for the experience you get. Its isn't just a normal walk through museum... it is an actual experience where you learn about the Heineken history, then get the chance to taste stuff, play games, take a mini ride, take photos and videos, and drink beer. The staff are very friendly and all speak English well. Worth a visit even if not a beer enthusiast

Great experience. If you are a big beer enthusiast and want to discover the secret of Dutch beer, Heineken experience is a place to visit. I would recommend to buy simple ticket for 18 euro, because from my experience I headphones were not necessary. Stuff is explaining all details and principles of brewery. At the end of tour don't forget to get 2 glasses of beer in any bar inside.

The birth place of Heineken!. Other than Amstel river, red light district and canal walk, this place is truly a must visit tourist hot spot in Amsterdam! Fresh brew heineken beer and enjoying the smell of fresh brew beer! Highly recommend!
Great Stop.. We had a great time and the beer was amazing. At the end of the trip we all got 2 beers each. It's a fun stop for all age groups.

Brilliant !!. Went to this on Tuesday afternoon was brilliant experience!! I got my tickets in advance but they are so helpful it's very easy to get them there. If you like Heineken it's a wonderful place to be and I'm totally going back and taking my boyfriend next time as I think it's something everyone can enjoy . And it was surprisingly interesting too !! Fab few hours out

Neat!. This was a very fun informative experience. You learn about the history of the beer, how they make it, and play some interactive games. They finish the tour with 2 draft beers. I would recommend this if you like beer.

It's Like The Guinness Tour Only With Heineken And In Amsterdam. I think the walk through the city from the town centre to get to this venue was about as entertaining as the venue itself.You do get the history of Heineken Beer and you get a taste and 2 glasses which is good. I think they try and differentiate this tour by including a 'virtual' roller coaster type ride as you become a part of the beer which was ok but, like all good rollercoaster rides, you had to queue for about an hour.For a brewery tour it was ok.

Great stop off. Been on brewery tours before. Expected same from this. Was really different very informative well maintained building. We took audio tour very interesting samples along the way and simulator ride was good. 2 free drinks at end. Enjoyed

Can't help comparing to Guinness Storehouse. I couldn't help but compare it to the Guinness Store House in Dublin. This was a great experience but I didn't find it as interesting as one would expect. We got more free drinks than you're supposed to get, which is cool. Their explanation of the bubbles was interesting, too. I didn't know that! It's just one of those places you have to go!Don't forget the FREE glass when you're exiting the gift shop. You get a FREE boat up to the gift shop in the centre of Amsterdam.

Great experience! . Im not a beer lover but went here because my boyfriend wanted to. Was actually better than i expected! Quite interesting but also they had lots of interactive things on the way round incl a simulation ride. A "taster " halfway round (just an excuse for the 1st beer) at the end you have 2 beers per person (half pints) or you can have coke. Was money and time well spent, would suggest going even if your not a fan of beer

Good for couples. £16 each adult. Some of the information delivery could have been better- they didn't know some answers to questions we had which was really surprising. The interactive games and things to do were well thought out and fun. Overall it was a fun experience. You get 1 large or 2 small beers at the end as part of your admission- recommend you go at 5pm like we did so you can the go out afterwards.

Great couple of hours entertainment. Buy your tickets online before you go; you'll get a discount and you'll be able to skip the line when you get there - ideal.This isn't a guided tour but more of museum kind of thing with exhibits including information on the Heineken family, the history and the brewing process. It then moves into more of an entertainment experience with interactive exhibits, rugby and football themed rooms, activities and various novelty things to do. Oh, and a "ride" - all good fun!Your entry includes two small beers at the end of the tour and you also get one glass at the tasting "lesson" as part of the tour. By the way, when the barman asks questions, the first couple of people to shout the correct answer were given an extra beer so don't be shy!At the end, there's a bar where you can get your Heineken, either two 25cl standard beers or one 35cl extra cold beer.Great experience, well managed and pretty interesting too.

Amazing!. Am not one for beer or anything in that line and I expected just a walk around the place. Tops, 1hr and you are done. Was I wrong! It was made very interactive with a lot of games in-between. You get a wrist band on entry which entitles you to 2 free drinks plus to brew your own drink as well. My friends and I spent so much time there, we we're left with little time to visit any other place in Amsterdam on the day.I must say the fresh brews tasted pretty great. I am now a happy lover of Heineken beer! A good place to see in Amsterdam. You can get vouchers to get discounts on the entry tickets.

Very interactive and imaginitive. Much more than just a brewery tour! So many interactive displays, games, video. Excellent displays and makes you appreciate the company history. Of course, they also give you two free beers which was nice as they have a few different areas set up as lounges where you can sit and enjoy your beverage. Non alcoholic option as well. They also offer a canal tour upon exit which was nice. They are also suppose to have a burger and roof top all inclusive ticket but it wasnt available the day we were there.

Enjoyed every minute (and every drop). Heineken Experience was just brilliant! Must-see for all beer lovers and their friends. You will be introduced both history of the brewery and how the famous beer is being brewed. Furthermore you can try its taste along the journey and you can 'become' the brewing beer in the Beer Ride. The ticket includes up to 3 glasses of the great beer (Make sure you have a bite before you start your Heineken experience!). You can also take a picture of yourself in various photobooths and have them send to your email (free!) or have them printed out, write a personalized message on your bottle of beer, or get a personal engraiving on your brand new Heineken glass! If you are keen on learning how to pour the perfect glass of Heineken, you have a chance to do so at the last bar - and you get a certificate as well!Since the weather was nice while I visited, I also got to experience lovely view of Amsterdam from the rooftop of the Heineken Brewery. Simply great experience!

Something to do :). I don't drink beer so I gave my drinks to my partner meaning he got 4 & I got none . Only down side your given a choice of 2 small glasses or 1 pint free . Staff were friendly couple of sports themed areas . Overall it was OK a bit expensive considering a bit boring.

A little disappointing. Price was 16 Euros for entrance which included 2 beers at the end of the tour. I thought it was going to be a guided brewery tour (I should have done more homework) but it was more of the "experience" kind of thing. Upon entering, you are handed a bracelet with 2 buttons on it which are redeemable for your 2 beers. There is some then some information on the family, the tradition and the process but then it goes into more of an entertainment facility. They no longer brew beer here but you do get to see some of the equipment that was used in the brewery as well as the horses. They offer a tasting of Heineken which includes to fairly interesting information on the beer.After that, it is a lot of entertainment and ways to get more money out of you. There a places to buy pictures of yourself with superimposed backrounds, personalize a bottle, play games, learn to pour a beer correctly, a rugby room and some more stuff to which I didn't pay a lot of attention. At the end, you can redeem your buttons for some cold Heineken and your find out that your 2 buttons are worth two 25 cl beers or one 35cl extra cold beer. This room is crowded and hot with very sticky floors. Reminded me of my old fraternity house!All and all, I'm glad I did it. Not worth the E16 I paid (E18 if you get the tickets at the door) and wouldn't go again but was somewhat interesting. You should be able to at least take home one of the glasses!

Fun beer tasting and an old brewery tour!. We have visited the Heineken Experience twice now, on both of our recent trips to Amsterdam, several years apart. Having gone there in 2012 and having fun with another couple traveling with us, we knew it was something that we wanted to do again on this 2015 Europe trip, and that it would be a fun, easy-to-do, afternoon highlight, after being on an airplane for 14 hours all night, and being jet lagged. There is an admission fee. As you enter, you see the historical background of Heineken beer in displays, artifacts and old pictures. You see the massive old copper brew kettles, you see the Heineken horses in the stable, for pulling parade beer wagons. Later you get to go on a fun “ride”, where they take small groups into one of several “ride” rooms, that has a moving floor, and various fun and creative special effects, (mist spray, hot & cold effects, movement, various beer smells sprayed into room, etc.), and you go on a “ride”, as if you were some beer being brewed, from start to finish – it is a fun way to “Experience” the beer brewing process. Later, you get to sample and taste beer, with guidance from brewery staff, much like a wine tasting session. More exhibits and fun things to do, and then you end up in the tasting room, where your adult green rubber wristband entitles you to two full size glasses of beer. For two coupons, you can try their super cold iced beer, which was very tasty, and had ice all over the beer tap. The Hop-Off busses have a stop nearby. Overall, a very fun (adults) thing to do, while in Amsterdam.

worth a visit. We were 2 adults and 15yr old who visited here, wasn't sure if my son would like this but he enjoyed it. The price adult 17e child 12e. This also includes 2 drinks, minerals for the kids. There is a funny sort of ride show, which my son really enjoyed, there's a tasting room where your told about how to pour your drink and you get to test some beer here. The tour last about 1hr

More to it than you would think. The tour begins with a history of the brewery and includes an experiential explanation of the brewing process and a visit to the stables where shire horses are kept that were once used to transport beer. Later you will get the opportunity to view sporting memorabilia such as the champions league 2014 football and to test your skills at `kicking` a rugby penalty. The tour ends with beer included in the price of your ticket. Towards the end I found it a little claustrophobic with a bar experience being created but everyone else seemed to be having a good time.
What a wonderful experience. This was not only informative but fun. The way this tour has been put together makes it extreme fun. This is highly recommended.

Had an absolutely fantastic time here!. I wasn't fussy about going to Heinenken, I am not a beer drinker at all. But my sister wanted to go so we did. We had an absolute blast at this venue. It is extremely well done. I don't want to give away some of the surprises, but they have done a great job explaining how their beer is made, what makes it different and lots of history sprinkled in the mix. There are so many interactive things as well. I would highly recommend this. We spent three hours there and thoroughly enjoyed every minute.

Great day out.. Had a really good time here, spend a couple of hours walking around going through the process of beer making. Even have a stimulator that 'turns you into a beer' basically a walk through of the beer process but real good fun. Lots of free beer and chances to win more beer if you answer questions correct! Personalised beer bottles to be made for just €6.50. Merchandise store isn't too badly priced either! You can purchase engraved pint glasses there. Definitely worth a visit!

Amazing experience. It was an amazing experience. I read the previous comments, and as people mentioned, they never expected it to be really good. This tour includes the history of heineken, and beer tasting and a lot of infos about beers. Amazing crew, a must do! P.S: brew your ride was the best section in this experience.

Enjoyable way to spend an afternoon.. I was a solo traveler and wasn't sure about going, but it was an enjoyable way to spend the afternoon. The 4D theatre was a little cheesy, but I must admit it made me smile... the samples of Heineken also made me smile! The museum is interactive and there are a number of games you can play at the end. I enjoyed it as a solo traveler and can see how it would be a blast to experience with a few friends!

Best interactive 'brewery tour' experience. I've been on a few brewery tours, but this one is the best. It's not just following some guy employed to look like he is a brewer. You walk through the stages of its history & brewing process, then get taken through a next level experience of interacting with the brand. At the end you get to have a couple of free beers & their gift shop was well stocked to take home gifts for all beer & non-beer lovers.

Cheesy but great fun . It's a factory dedicated to the global conglomerate that is Heineken. You get a tour of the old factory, learn about the family behind it and of course get to try the beer, a few times. There is a lot of sycophancy as you would imagine and there is pro Heineken advertising everywhere. The horses seem to only be kept there for show now, they get a bit of holiday a year but otherwise don't do much to help the business bar advertising and are kept in stables otherwise. The games are fun, the beer making process is interesting (try the wort) and the beer tasting at the end is good. I've been three times in around 8 years and would go back again.

Interesting!. Lovely staff and really interesting, even if you don't like beer. Very interactive, definitely worth a visit but best to buy tickets from a "tours and tickets" vendor over there...we bought this and the ice bar for 30 euros. Oh and you get three drinks included!

Basically a big Heineken advert, but lots of fun!. I am not really a beer drinker but I really enjoyed this museum. So much to see and do - you can learn about the brewing process, play Rugby themed games, create your own videos etc. Plenty of good photo opportunities. There is a chance to sample some Heineken midway during the tour and at the end. Please note that the free drinks are quite small and not even half a pint. At the end of the tour, if you do not wish to purchase Heineken with your drink tokens, soft drinks are available instead. I nearly missed visiting here as Google Maps/TripAdvisor led me to believe that it was open until 19:30 or even 21:00 and the Heineken website wasn't working. The last entry is actually 17:30! It is close to the museums (Van Gogh, Rijksmuseum) so worth doing on the same day if you can squeeze it in!

Quite nice tour with entertaining activities. The explanations of how the Heineken beer is made aren't that informative in my opinion - thay should give more "scientific" information about the processes.Even though, the activities available afterwards are quite amusing, especially for groups of friends and perhaps families with children.You also get some glasses to try out the beer yourself.Don't know if it's totally worth the price of a ticket, but it is a nice experience so I would recommend a 2-4 hours visit.Pretty close to the city center.Anyway, if you choose to visit it - make sure you buy the tickets in advance (even few minutes before your visit in some shop or stand at the market), because the lines are pretty long and annoying if you don't.

Time to chill; Heineken Experience, if only the best will do!. Even if you do not like beer, the Heineken Experience is an amazing tour and extremely relaxing. Its value for money and you will be able to buy some great souvenirs on the way out. The beer making process is well explained and the entertainment is awesome. Don't miss it.

Wow!!. What started off as a boring museum (to what me and my friend thought was the whole experience turned out to be a fantastic interactive museum. We hadna barrel of laughs and would definitely do it again as we didn't have enough time.to.do everything.

It was interesting to see how the beer is made.. This could have been kind of cheesy, but it really wasn't. It had everything from seeing how the beer process works to and interactive 4-D theatre experience where you are the beer going through the process. After the tasting, I recommend using your two beer tokens for the extra cold 35ml beer instead of 2 25ml regular draft beers. The floor in the room where you get your beer (separate from the tasting you do earlier in the tour) is super sticky, noisy and crowded, so it really makes you want to get out of there.
Nice. Nice tour lot's of beer , if you don't like beer it's a waste of timeIt's also near Albert cuypmarket . A little bit long tour
Heineken Experience. . If you have a couple of hours to burn this is okay. Includes a couple of small beers, but okay is about it, really not much else to say.

Light hearted fun. After taking in few of the higher brow museums, this was a welcome bit of light hearted entertainment. Probably targeting the 18-24 crowd, this had something for old and young. My wife particularly liked the bit where you could take a picture of yourself in a copper brewing vessel and email it to yourself, included in the price. Her stupid pose was mailed to my account haha. There is a lesson in how to drink the beer, which is one free glass, and if you answer the barmans question before anyone else you get a bonus glass. At the end, you get another two glasses, so 4 in total if you're sharp. Good mix of traditional and interactive stuff, and a sneak peak at the shire horses. All in all good fun. Now what shall I do with that stupid picture?

Interactive experience. Fun history of Heineken Beer and the Heineken family. Interactive (you are turned into a beer!) with lots of games along the way. The rewards at the end - 2 Heineken beers included in the pricer of admission.

Typical brewery tour experience until the end. Having visited many breweries before, both large and small, this was a sure hit on the visit list. However, the brewery and beer making exhibit was typical and although flashy with Heineken advertising, it did not stand out. The best part was the Rugby and Football exhibits at the end (despite not being a particular fan of either) as they were interactive and fun. The World City bar at the end was a great atmosphere to enjoy a few drinks in with friends.

Great Experience. I thought this was going to be a run of the mill brewery/wine cellar type experience. However much to my surprise it was fantastic and fun, even for kids I think. You get to see every little bit of how they brew their beer and you actually get yourself bottled! Must do in Amsterdam for a bit of fun.

Better than expected. It is pretty much a glorified promotion for heineken! If you're expecting an historic and educational lesson, you'll be disappointed. Has a bit at the start but tour is mainly full of gimicy things like joke video and photo opportunities, playstations with Fifa, some interactive challenges (that can earn you more beer!) etc. You can get a certificate in pouring the perfect beer too at the end. We got lucky with the guy who was doing the beer pouring certificates 'for free' as the guy who took over after him started charging people their drinks tokens to do it! You get a small 15cl near the start of the tour, then either 2 25cl ones or a 33cl ice cold beer at the end, plus any extra from tokens you earned from some of the interactive stuff (plus an extra 25cl one you pour yourself if you get lucky and arent charged your tokens for it!)Something worth doing if you have spare time in amsterdam but wouldn't be urging myself to go back.
Fun!. The price to get into this place is excellent! €18 including 2 free drinks is great! I had loads of fun!
Good fun. Had fun but did not get to do everything as we ran out of time. The tour part is not that lo g but the games take a bit of time to go through

Superb!. I had no idea this tour would be so good. People had recommended it but I didn't realise what it entailed. I loved all the interactive parts of the tour and the simulator. We did this tour on the afternoon that we arrived in Amsterdam and it was the perfect time to do it as I felt it set the scene for the rest of the holiday. We left with a smile on our face as it was so much fun. Well thought out tour and the order of things was spot on. Brilliant!

Surpassed expectations. My partner was desperate to visit here on our recent trip to Amsterdam, I was also keen but not overly fussed. I am so glad we went!The trip was educational and interesting and also a good bit of drink!What I thought would be a quick hour, turned into 2 and a half hours as we were just mooching around looking at everything, and the tour gets better the further along you get.Also, I am never very impressed with gift shops, but we bought a load of things from this one, which was also reasonably priced!Definitely do this for an afternoon in Amsterdam, also a really good price for what you get.

Great experience!. I got off the No. 12 tram one stop after the Museum Plein. BIG mistake. I had to retract steps until I found the attraction after much walking. If you're coming from the Central Station or nearby take either 16 or number 24 trams and get off right next to the venue. The visit costs 20 Euros but I had a discount coupon for Euro 18. They put on a rubber bracelet with 2 small icons/plastic buttons. Turns out you can take them off and use those to quaff some more beer as you exit. Next time, I'll remember that for sure.The visit was very informative and entertaining.And Tasty!!
good experience. Exciting "factory" tour. If you visit, you can learn about the beer makeing, and too you can taste. Good oportunity for rainy day.

Fun! . This was better than I expected. I only went on my husbands insistence. The opening parts were a bit boring - went through the history of the family etc. But once it got to the 4-D ride, thats when the "experience" kicked in. What followed was beer tasting session, a football room, karaoke, games, a room that simulated a club - it was all fun from then!

Worth a visit. Bought this on a combined offer with pizza riverboat cruise.Very well presented and organised exhibition with the added bonus of free drinks.Interesting way to spend a couple of hours. Friendly smiley staff.Worth a visit on a rainy day

Interactive, interesting, worthwhile. We spent about 2hours here. Various parts to the visit, won't give anything away as that is part of the enjoyment. No need to drink lager to enjoy this but it will help.

Lots of fun!. Visited the Heineken Experience on a Monday afternoon in October and didn't need to queue for tickets. The entry fee includes two drinks at the end of the experience, as well as at least one during the tasting session (if you answer questions correctly during the tasting session you can get extras!) It was a really interesting and interactive tour and the staff were all really friendly and informative. I think this attraction would be interesting even if you don't like beer but obviously being a fan of Heineken is a bonus! There's lots to see and do and I'd definitely recommend this!

lots of interactive stations and education. This place was fun as well as educational. Lots of explanations on the beer making processes and history of the brand as well as a few opportunities to taste the product

It could only be Heineken . This tour is awesome! (If you are of legal age and drink responsibly *wink*). I'm not even a beer drinker but this tour really mixes fun and exploring into one. The tour is decently long but not too long and if you listen and answer questions correctly, you get free beers! You are also challenged to pour the perfect beer and they give you cute souvenirs for doing the tour. I thought this was really fun and so did alot of the people in the group. The people who work there are also incredibly friendly and knowledgeable and after you are done they offer you a ride on the heineken canal ride. Loved it!

More marketing than brewery. Was disappointed in the "experience" as it was really just one long commercial for Heineken. The staff were freindly, but didn't really seem to know much about the brewing process, we asked about hops and the only answer they could give was "we use the best hops in the world". Wouldn't recommend for anyone looking for a brewery tour.
Amazing. Amazing atraction for those who love beer. With easy access, you can know the beer production in a thematic factory. You should visit this spot.

ALOT of fun! Very interesting!. Me and three friends visited this attraction, recommended for me to do by my dad i thought I would give it a go. First off tickets were very easy to get, no big lines,lots of staff to help you out and if you get your tickets in the city centre you get a discount and a free drink!After receiving our wristband (with two tokens that allow you two free half pints or one full, obviously if your over 18 at the end of the tour.)You go down into a room that has a video playing a man is talking all about the history of HEINIKEN and it is very interesting its something you want to listen to its not all boring history! after going upstairs you can get your photo taken on some set which you can also email to yourself which is good as you get a souvenir without having to pay for it! You are able to see all of the old label, bottle and glass designs! being taken through the tour you get to seethe ingredients that make the beer (obviously not the secret ingredients!) you get to trip hops, they taste pretty strange but i personally liked them! you also get to try beer when not everything is in it which is strange but enjoyable! you also get to see the type of horses they used to transport things. there is also some games and entertaining devices upstairs,a DJ game, how pour a pint game different works of art,there was a football section when i was there but don't go on my word that things will be there when you go as HEINIKEN does change the attractions in their museum but that is good as you can keep going back and things will have changed! You also go on a mini ride, you go into a room which has stairs and platforms with bars you hold on to. and a massive screen in front of you a man speaks to you and you get the experience of what it feels like to "be a HEINIKEN bottle!" this is VERY fun there is lots of little things that happen in this but i do not want to spoil it I recommend you should go and try it yourself!At he end when you are all laughed out and want to relax there is a bar where you can trade in your tokens for drinks or you can give in your tokens where you can get a lesson on how to pour the perfect pint and get a certificate at the end saying you a certified pint pourer. It does matter if it take you the once or several times like it did for me!There is also a lot of extras in this, more free drinks, toasting together as a big group you can get a bottle with your name on it etc. The gift shops is very good! a bit pricy but it has some really lovely things in it, you can get some amazing souvenirs to bring home! and at the end on your way out you get a free gift! i got a half pint glass the last time and it was very lovely you also get to keep your wristband you receive on entry!The staff are all VERY friendly, easy to talk to and will answer any questions you have for them! there is also no need to book ahead as you can easily get tickets at the attractionI would recommend any one to got this and if you have been before go again! all the attractions change and it is always fun.

A Must Visit in Amsterdam. I really wasn't expecting it to be as entertaining as it was but was very pleasantly surprised. Tour is very informative and all the staff know their stuff. There is beer tasting during the tour along with an interactive short movie which was very entertaining. After the information section of the tour there are loads of games and interactive activities. We were short on time so had to rush through it so I would say definitely give your self at least 2 hours there so you have time to spent wandering around at your leisure and also to enjoy the very tasty beers at the end in the bar with great music. We went about 5pm on a Sunday and there was no queue and the Amsterdam pass gives a 25% discount. Very enjoyable and highly recommended tour.
Simply amazing. Genuinely one of my favourite memories from Amsterdam. The value for money is great! There's so much to do and see and the staff are so helpful! Would definitely recommend doing this

Enjoyable couple of hours with beer! . Despite the poor reviews we gave it a go, and actually we've enjoyed the tour. Book online and its €16 and they'll scan QR code on phone, so you can do it on their wifi! There is information about the family business, which I thought was ok, there's a guy explains (live) how the brewing process works. You can smell the hops and taste the barley if you want to. The 4D is good too, it's a bit of fun for a brewery tour - ok, experience, they don't brew here anymore. Who would be brewing in the middle of a city? It's 2015! Ends with their advertising, sponsorship, tasting & a couple of beers...

A Disney style experience rather than a brewery museum.. A very crowded 'Disney marketing' style event rather than the 'brewery museum' visit I was expecting. It's all about marketing - that's the theme throughout - it just happens that they market beer.That said, the experience is actually superbly done throughout - except at the end when you are routed to the bar area for the 'free' beers included in the price. The area was horribly crowded, far too small for the number of visitors, no room to move and hideously loud music thumping away over the crowd noise. Totally ruined the experience. Downed my two small beers too quickly to enjoy them and left.The souvenir shop as the end was very disappointing, overpriced, many things unpriced and the couple of things I might have bought were out of stock.If I had paid the full price for the 'experience' I would have been very unhappy, but I got a cheap ticket as part of a tour package so overall a reasonable couple of hours. I recently visited the Carlsberg Brewery museum in Copenhagen, personally I much preferred that as it was all about the beer rather than how it's marketed.

Pleasantly surprised. . We enjoyed this experience and the interactive nature of the the tour. I do not like drinking lager however the tour was informative and worth a visit. It was a bonus seeing the horses that were traditionally used to move the beer around the city

A good way to spend a couple of hours. I'm a massive Heineken fan so visiting here was a no-brainer, we've been to Amsterdam 4 times before but never got round to visiting so made a point this time around.It's a massive building steeped in history and quite impressive inside and out. The tour was well laid out and wasn't too marketing driven and provided lots of history and facts around the brand and the family. Enjoyed the bottling 4D tour thingy, a bit tacky but a great laugh and done with a bit of humour. Tasting was fun, had 2 free beer's and one while walking about. Loved seeing the old stills and tiling in the main brewing floor.We only did the normal 19 euro tour but didn't feel we missed anything and it wasn't overly busy on the Thursday we visited.

A must to visit. 2 hours well spent learning all about the Heineken history from the beginning to the present day.Really good interactive activities to do on you way round the tour.Best part at the end you can have a drinker two.
Consultant. Great value. We enjoyed the tour, the beer and the canal ride to the brand store. There were no long lines and they efficiently moved people through the tour. Great story.

Definitely worth a visit!. We came here as were in Amsterdam for 3 days. Was definitely worth if we had a great time.I would say buy your tickets before you come because we didn't have to join the bib queue.The staff are very good and very enthusiastic which we liked. You get some free beer and learn a lot.At the end there are lots of interactive play areas and they email you pictures straight away which was good.The only negative was waiting around to go on the ride which was quite awhile

It was a experience! . Gotta be done at some point! Liked the wobble floor thing! Wasn't expecting that ! (was a bit giddy at the time)you get a couple of tokens on a wrist band that you exchange for a couple of little pints o Heineken or both for a pint! They also give some weird shot that tastes what I can only discribe like.....farm water/cow piss

Tasty pints. Ended up here after getting lost Really enjoyed the tour, it's done in a way that ye don't need tour guides with a few interactive bits along the way and two pints at the end to top it off, would recommend

Too crowdy. Have been there 3 times already and I think that management of the crowd is getting worse because everybody can enter at any time, no blocked guides. This means you have to wait inside very often. Although we had a good time. The cinema is pretty impressive and the photos and games are great fun :) Prost

Wonderful experience. I went to the Heineken Experience in 2003 and had a good time. Going back in 2015 the experience is dramatically bigger and more comprehensive with Disneyland style interactive exhibits and even a simulator ride. Great value and the most informative and fun brewery I have been too. You get at least three beers as well, we both got four for answering questions at the tasting. Note that they stop allowing entries at 5:30pm, we had to return a different day.

Very interactive, informative and great fun. We enjoyed this 'experience' very much, it was fun, interactive at various parts of the tour. We visited in September and didn't have to queue at all, even though we had pre bought tickets. The staff were friendly and informative. The interactive screens etc had a good range of activities and photo opportunities. I would recommend this attraction to a wide age range too.

2nd time with friends. show my friends how nice heineken experience is but unfortunately its was packed and we had to wait a long time in lines, staff was nice and available from point to point for a chat to make sure ppl dont get to upset :)

Well Worth a Visit. Very good tourist attraction and well worth a visit for the history and interaction. Earphones with the history provided for non English speaking tourists.Free samples along the way, photo and video opportunities. Not busy the day we went and tour took approximately 2 and half hours, but may take longer if busier.

Entertaining! Got more than expected.. Bought tickets at Tickets & Tours office near Rijksmuseum. Got some discount because of combo flyer and tickets to Body Worlds. The Heineken Experience was so much more than just a visit to brewery and learning history of Heineken and beer brewing process. More than one option to make fun photos and video you may share directly from Heineken or send to your e-mail. Surprise gift at the exit from museum and free canal boat tour was a nice compliment from the house and well appreciated. Also this is brewery kids too have some attractions to try out and have fun. Boys who love football will certainly enjoy sport part at Heineken Experience. Realy enjoyed this one!

Bucket list item for home brewers. My wife and I spent spring break in Amsterdam and we walked all over the city, visiting all the tourist spots. We decided to visit the Heineken museum and thought it was really a lot of fun. It was like going on a school field trip but adult style, you get two free beers as part of the tour and a free Heineken glass at the end. The copper boil kettles make it all worth the trip, especially if you are a home brewer. This place should be on every home brewers bucket list.

Good experience. . Really good few hours out, we pre booked our tickets at a ticket and tour shop. Went straight through but as we got further on the queues were immense, waiting 10-15 for the simulators. The guy did explain though that they've had an extra 400,000 people visit in a year. Overall really good and a must do!
Awesome!. This is a fantastic attraction, where you can learn Heineken history, its brewing process, have lots of fun tasting beer at the end of the tour. It's an unmissable attraction in Amsterdam!

An exciting beer tour!!!. Me & my boyfriend visited here in October 2015. We pre-booked the tickets which is worth doing to avoid the queues for tickets! It is a very impressive building from the exterior and interior. Very interactive and interesting to learn about the heineken story - the origins up until the present day. The tour takes you through everything like a story. There are many fun interactive things to take part in including the brewing process, being able to try the beer before the hops are added. There is also a 'brew you' interactive ride- similar to a simulator experience where you are essentially "brewed" like a beer. This was fun! You can also design your own beer glass, get a free beer and learn how to drink it properly, playstation, experience rugby associations and many more! We had lots of fun using the interactive photo booth, made a interactive video and designed our own glass. Unfortunately we did not buy this as we were not allowed it in our hand luggage! At the end you get the choice of 2 small beers or one large ice cold beer! This was yummy and included in the ticket price, and were able to enjoy it in a cool surrounding! The shop was excellent with lots of souvenir gifts to choose from! We really enjoyed this and would recommend it to anyone visiting Amsterdam! A good experience :)

Interactive and fun!. As well as being an informative and interesting tour of the history and techniques of brewing Heineken beer. The experience offered plenty of interaction and fun along the way! As well as finishing up with some cold beers! Loved and would recommend the Heineken experience!

The highlight of our trip!. Booked tickets in advance to save queuing. Plenty to do and see. History of how the company was set up, then you're 'made into a bottle of beer!' This is an interactive part,so not good for people with back problems as there is a lot of juddering and jolting. There is beer tasting and you're taught how to savour the beer!
