The other interactive experiences include a photo booth and 'cycling video'.........totally hilarious!!! You can also email the photos and videos to your own email. As someone who doesn't like beer, I found this an extremely pleasant experience and would thoroughly recommend it. The staff are very pleasant as well. If it's your birthday on the day you go, show the staff proof (driving licence or passport) and you get a special tankard!
Must for beer lovers . Pretty cool place to understand how beer is made, Heineken's history, have fun, and drink chilled beer.. The tickets get you 2 beers at the end of the tour.

A pleasant surprise. My Husband basically dragged me to the Heineken ExperienceI had no intention on doing another boring beer tourBut WOW, It was an incredible , interactiveFun tour .The movie ride blew my mind If you come to Amsterdam, do not miss the Heineken experienceYou even get to sample the beer fresh

Fun, Fun, Fun. You need a break from all the art and museums that mean visiting Europe, I really enjoyed learning about the history of Heineken and how they position the brand around the world. I'm a football fan as well so it was nice to have that corner dedicated to the UEFA Champions League!
Great experience. Really good way to spend a couple of hours on a damp cold day in Amsterdam. The experience is fun, light hearted and very modern.

Nice brewery. If you're into beer, you will have see some breweries. Some of them are fantastic, like Guinness in Dublin, and many are boring. The Heineken experience is quite all right when it comes to breweries, but it's also just that: a brewery. So don't expect anything new behind the big facade.

Good laugh. My boyfriend wanted to visit the brewery I wasn't really fussed about going as I thought it was going to be boring. Well ended up having such a laugh after learning about making the beer got to see the Heineken shire horses then u could even brew your own beer and customise the bottle. Once u pass this section u come across the interactive section where it shows the sports that they have sponsored through the years sports memorabilia and you even have a chance to join in a scrum or kick the winning conversion or maybes you want to sit in the dug out of a football match or take a pic with the UEFA cup. You also get to taste a beer in a miniature pint glass before heading to the bar where you get two free drinks. Would highly recommend.

As expected... enjoyable!. Nothing to compare this too really but myself & my partner enjoyed this.. and she doesn't even like beer!Everyone's entitled to their opinion but I genuinely cannot understand how people rate things like this as 'terrible'.. What are you going in expecting? If you don't like beer or the risk of having to wait a few minutes to be served then stay away surely? Or maybe just never do anything remotely social. Book ahead to save cost, take in a bit of history about Heineken, and enjoy a couple of free beers!

Lots of fun, and the children loved it. We went with an 11 and 9 year old. A lot of the tour is interactive and there was more than enough to keep them entertained - including the video-ride (watch out for the water!). Very friendly staff too.
Good. It was good but I think a bit expensive. Especially if you compare it to other museums in Amsterdam. (I was under 18 and didn't experience the beer tasting but still payed quite a lot)

Great Value! Fun Day!. We faced a huge line at the Van Gogh Museum so ended up going here and what a great deal! We even got a canal trip! I would highly recommend this and be sure to get to the shop as well - by canal. Truly great value, great beer, not to be missed!

Lots of fun. We recently visited here on a little getaway trip and we all had a wonderful time.The tour was very good and informative and it was nice to be able to go it at your own speed.The ride in the room where u become a bottle of beer in the making was brilliant.Also enjoyed the photo booths ect and if course the bar at the end I would definitely recommend this to anyone going to Amsterdam x
Brilliant fun!. This was the highlight of our trip to Amsterdam! The best bit was the 3 FREE BEERS! Well worth a visit :)
Decent experience. You get to know a bit of history about Heineken family and how to make some good beer. I think the Beer tasting was the best part part of the visit.
Beer Drinker. Wasn't planning on visiting but glad we did great tour with a heap of hands on things and informative staff. Take a wallet full has you'll want to buy up in the shop

Excellent. Nice place to visit once you are in Amsterdam. Funny activities to do and very informative at the same time so everyone should enjoy it. Plus at the beginning you are given bracelets to get couple beers when the tour is finish. Highly recommended!!!
Heineken !!!!!!!!!!!!!. Nice place to spend your time. Is more than a trip is. You learn, have fun and DRINK heineken. Enjoy it :)

Perfect. You can download aplication and learn more about heineken. You will have a great time and fun:) its self guided but there is a lot of people to help you, explain you and make you taste;) I loved it:)
Loved it. We had a great visit here today. Realy enjoyed it you learn something new every day and today we learnt why you have a head on your beer 😊 good disco bar at the end

Great time. A brilliant exhibition. Starts off quite slow but after the ride it kicks in with interactive games and loads of photo booths to email yours self. The bar at the end of the tour is classy and gives you a kind of James Bond nightclub feel. I really enjoyed it Two thumbs up.

wow. faboluiosu experience
well worth it. free beer one of the highlights of our trip
very cheap for the tour
Informative visit. Excellent place to visit when the weather is not so good. Takes you through the whole brewing process and lets you sample the end product.

Funmy to visit. Not the best cultural experience ever...kind of a large marketing museum but still a funny place to visit on a rainy day. Funny activities to do and the tasting is of course nice...we should have a small souvemir inclused for this price...

A bit impersonal and commercialized. I personally expected more from the tour but it was a self-tour and it was just too dry. I appreciated the history but would have appreciated it more if there was an actual person to give us so history instead of a plackard with info and a computer screen. The best part of the tour was the end unfortunately...the end included our 2 drinks which were perfect and it ended leading us into the gift shop. Wouldn't recommend this tour if your looking for a personal tour.

A cool attraction. This place is huge. It didn't seem crowded and there was no line to get into the place. You start out going through exhibits learning about the history of Heineken. Then you go through a room that looks like a typical brewery with all the big vats and learn about how the beer is made. You get to smell the hops and taste the barley they use. You also taste the liquid once the barley is cooked up. They have some of the Heineken horses there in stables for you to see. I loved the Brew ride. It was like an attraction at Universal Studios. You stand up in a group and watch a movie that takes you through the brew process. But while you're watching the move you get jolted, sprayed with water and blown with air. It's pretty cool. You get to taste samples of the beer while a bartender teaches you about the color, bubbles and how to drink it. There is a part where you can order a bottle of the beer and you personalize the label. Then there are a few floors made up of rooms to do all kinds of activities...play video games, foosball, photos, and much much more. Then it all ends at the bar where everyone must just hang out because it was crowded. At the beginning of the tour you are given bracelet to get a couple of beers. This place was not only interesting but a lot of fun.

Better Than Expected. I wasn't expecting much going in but my partner was keen. We had a quick bite to eat at a small pub close by and they had discount cards for one euro off each so we paid 17e each. You definitely don't need the audio guide if you speak English. I was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't just a museum glorifying Heineken but was interactive too. It was a really good experience. Considering you get a few small glasses of beer too, it's not bad value. We chose to customize a bottle with our names which was 6.5e and is a nice token to take home.

A must for beer lovers. A great experience. very interactive. at the counter you can choose to buy a ticket for a guided tour or mosey through yourself. I did the tour with friends so we chose the latter.With your ticket you get a Heineken band with tabs that are exchanged for beers x 2 at the end of the tour...so don't lose them. Being a Sunday, it was extremely busy. We had to que for about 30 mins to get into the 4D bottling experience. I love beer, so this tour was totally worthwhile.

Intresting and Informative Day. Very informative and interactive tour. It was very busy, but it did not spoil the visit. Good to see how the nations number 1 beer, was made. After walking around and going through the different floors, end up with cold fresh beer, overlooking Amsterdam at the top of the building.
Excellent. Had an afternoon at the Heineken experience and would thoroughly recommend this trip! Staff were brilliant and the whole tour was excellent

Great rainy day activity!. We had a great time doing the Heineken experience! Get there in the morning before the crowds show up! Coat check is available free of charge. The tour was fun. Staff were funny. Lots of activities. 2 free beers at the end!

Fun way to drink a few beers.... We had a few hours to kill, so we decided to try the Heineken Experience. We found it to be a very enjoyable way to get some indoor time while it was raining. The whole experience is well done and you get a few beers in the bar at the end. I would recommend it to anyone looking to get a bit of history about the brand you'll see everywhere in the Netherlands.

INTERESTING. Me and a couple of friends decided to visit here on our annual trip to Amsterdam well worth a visit with a taster and 2 glasses of the brew included in the admission what more could you ask for after learning a bit of history about the brewery
So much fun!. I don't even drink beer much but I absolutely loved it here. Informative and interesting with fun interactive games to play on. Got three free drinks too :)

Very interesting but a touch pricey. A very informative tour, self paced and worth a visit, however some of the signage, in respect to additonal costs for items not included can be a bit of a surprise at the time, particularly the added costs for printing a bottle or printing a picture. Extra value could be added by gifting the glass that is used for the tasting. Overall a good experience, but dont be surprised if you spend the tour cost again ($18 Euro - single adult) in addons.

Fantastic Experience. We got our tickets from tour and tickets which means they are 16 euros each.The museum takes around 2 hours and eeac section has something good and interactive to good. The photo booth and sport zones were brilliant. Cant forget the free Heineken at the end.The gift shop wasn't over priced compared to some and overall it was a great experience, really worth a visit.
Cool place. A nice place to visit if you like beer. Learn a bit about the history and after take some cold ones and learn how to proper pour and drink heineken.

Great visit. We pre bought tickets at one of the many tourist attraction shops throughout the city. This saved waiting in any lines when we arrived. It's on the route of the red hop on, hop off bus, and is easy to get to.You get a walk through experience (many stairs!) showing you the history of Heineken and how it is made. There are various games and photo opportunities along the way, which were fun.At the end you can get two regular Heinekens or one extra cold Heineken. Not a big fan of lager myself but I did enjoy the experience all the same. Would recommend a visit, good indoor activity if the weather is not so good.
Must go see . Went here for a trip out and wow what a place learnt so much about larger and how it's made . Going back in Dec of so am sure I'll be heading back for another look .
Nice to have been there. An ok tour, nice to have done. Lots of people. Not so much about how to make beer, but we enjoyed it.

Great Time. My visit to the brewery was in march. My boyfriend is from the Netherlands and thought it would be a great time.We had so much fun. We went during the Week so it was not crowded at all. the gentleman who gave the explanation on the beer was very nice and professional. you get to take your time and enjoy everything. I never felt rushed. you get a complimentary photo.I decided to make my own beer bottle with my name. you do it on the computer and at the end of your tour you pick it up. you have two options. one, you can learn how to professionally pour beer or two, trade your chip in for another beer. my boyfriend opted for the beer and i opted for the professional experiences. you get a certificate with your name as well. awesome time, really enjoyed myself.
Free beer. I won an extra beer because I answered correctly... !!!! This place was very funny, it's interactive, I really the screen painting the movement of your hands. moved !!

Good experience . Awesome ! Lot of things to do inside. Great beer. I think that most of the people can find aomething they like inside. History . Industry. Sports. And much more ! You get a good time for the money u pay

Fun interactive parts. Was not sure about this I'm not really a beer drinker but my friend is. Went when they opened on a Sunday. No lines!! The evening before line out door and down the street. It started a bit slow but then we got to the part in a room where a group of you become a beer. Difficult to explain but lots of fun. There were many more interactive parts. How to do a virtual perfect pour was one of them. At the end lots of things in the gift shop to purchase.I recommend getting your tickets at a vendor just down the road. It will help you avoid the ticket line in front of the place.

Tourist trap unless you love Heineken .  Tourist trap. Unless you LOVE Heineken brand, this tour isn't worth the money. Take you through non working brewery then some displays. Tastings are just Heineken or... older Heineken.

Cool way to spend an hour or two. I dropped in just for the heck of it, not expecting it to be much. However, it turned out to be a pleasant way to spend an hour or two going through the history of Heineken, experiencing the beer making process, going through some motion movies and of course, the obligatory beer or two at the end of the tour. Not really a must see as far as I was concerned, but nonetheless, it would be great on a hot day!

It's a lot of fun..maybe too much fun. I really liked the tour, you can have a really good time here, drinking beer, learning about the procedure of making beer, and learn how to drink, and later pour one perfectly. At the beginnin it was very informative, but at the end it was all about having fun. I would have preferred learning much more about the making procedure, and the history, because I bet it has to offer so much more than what this tour showed. Nevertheless, it's an absolute must, but try to buy your ticket in advance, because the cue can get really, really long.

Wow. Wow this place is awesome must book although if like me on crutches at time it's full of steps not good if ur legs aren't workin only seen 1 lift allow I bombed in on a private party all was ok jus explained can't do all the stairs #still don't like beer after it if ur a drinker it's a must see

Surprisingly great fun. I booked the tour thinking it would be like your regular brewery tour. It was far from it. We went at 3pm on a Friday and walked straight into the tour. The start has the Heineken history, afterwards you go into the brewery with the large copper containers. On the day we went there was a choir which made the experience surreal! We got to have some hands on experience then went on the 4d experience. Again this made it fun! We were then given a half pint and discussed the flavours. There were interactive, very up to date technology stationed around the tour. We got to pour our own pint or you can just go to the bar and take your two pints. The best activity we did in Amsterdam and I'll recommend it to friends and family! Fantastic!

Fun visit. Really fun experience. Buy your ticket ahead of time to avoid the lines. They have fun things to do. We got two tokens so you could get two small glasses of beer or one large. You get more when you get the two glasses. You can buy Heineken products at the gift shop. You can learn to pour a glass of beer from the bar but there was a long line so we just got the beer.

The most fun brewery in town. The Heineken Experience is an absolute must-do in Amsterdam. They took us through a whole range of experiences from tasting the vorte, brewing it , adding the hops and even bottling it. Filled with photo booths, cycling photo videos and even a shor 10 minute 7D film , this tour was a great one and totally worth the entry !!

Good for a Beer. My friend and I visited the Heineken brewery during our trip and enjoyed the photo opportunity and beers at the end of the road. You'll learn the ends and out of the beer making process, your seemed clean and beer was cold at the end.Definitely more interesting to those that drink, but it is interactive if you must bring your kids. Plus, the store is great in case you just want to swing by and get some swag.
Neat tour. I went on a tour here. It was neat and something you should do if you don't have anything else planned. It was fun but not overwhelming.

FUN-tastic!. The Heineken Experience offers a fun and really informative journey into how beer is made and the history of the Heineken company! There is a lot of fun going on there. The staff is really nice and knows what they are doing! It's a bit pricey (18E) but! it's worth it! In the end you get to drink 3 beers, how bad could it be?

Heineken should stick to brewing beer. Long queues, hour long waiting and exposure to superficial shiny commercials. You will not learn much and instead of paying for a "taste" head to a pub instead and have a pint!Heineken should stick to brewing beer.
Fab time. Went in a group of 4 girls, I was the only one that really wanted to go but all of us had a fab time. Lots of interactive stuff to do, really interesting and a lot of Heineken to drink too.

I love it!. I love the experience they offered. You can get all the informations about Heineken's history, how Heinekens are made, and my favorite is the Brew Me Ride, its a 4D experience thats very cool. I really love this place and i dont even drink beers! There are many interactive games, with very friendly staff. Highly recommended.

Amazing . we and my partner was well excited to go back to Amsterdam to go to this place its massive and is a good 2 hour tour you go through how it's made ad how it was founded etc you get to create your own label on your bottle and you get tokens to get 2 small berets or one large or even put your own and the store is good added bonus we got a free Heineken boat ride to the brand store and got a free glass each well worth the monies and interesting
Good fun . People working are all very friendly.Quite reasonably priced at €16.3 small beers included. Wasn't too long to get in. My second visit and I'd definitely recommend.

Well worth the fee. I really like this beer so to get the real history is super. Old copper, Tasting Barley, smelling hops. Seeing the horses and so much interactive that the free beer is a bonus. Then the boat shuttle will take you for free about 30 minutes to another store with a disco. They think of everything.

A shambles. What a waste of time and money! Long queue times, even if you have pre booked your tickets. A very unprofessional video to start with, then no real information on how the lager is made....at the end it's a disco type room for 2 free small drinks...so dissapointed we wasted our time here

Good fun. The interactive things here make it a fun place to visit. Being only 18€ you get two free beers unless you answer a couple of questions right it could end up being a free visit virtually a very fun afternoon
A Must Do in Amsterdam. This was a fun brewery tour. Lots of things to see, games to play, and samples!I would highly recommend to locals and visitors alike. Very good time.

Fun. A good idea with lots of samples and interactive opportunities. Got tickets on a deal, maybe over priced when buying otherwise? Enjoy the bar at the end, it's a good atmosphere and look out for the boat ride they offer back to the merchandise store after your visit :)

Very interesting with lots of creative innovations. I am not a really artistic person that enjoys all the art museums all the time. I am glad I chose to visit the Heineken Experience. At first I was contemplating because it's cost 18 euros(slightly outta my budget) but then I did it and I am really glad I did! This place shows you how they make the beer, how it has transformed over the years and it allow you to customise your own heineken beer bottle for only 6.50 euros:) Besides, with that price I got 3 free fresh beer from the tap. It's worth it, I strongly recommend.
Great craic. The place is brilliant, lots of fun interactive things to do, had a blast, we were there a few hours and it was great craic.

Fun with friends. I loved this brewery tour. Have already been on the Guinness and Carslberg Brewery tour, but this was by far the best. Lots of interesting and fun activities to get involved in as you wander around and learn about the history of the company. There's a beer tasting section, and also you get two free beers at the end of your exploration of the brewery. You also get a free gift, but you need to take a voucher to their gift shop which is a good 10 minute walk away. But I loved my wee Heineken glass. Definitely recommend visiting.

Very Interesting. This is definitely worth a visit. It's far more than a boring walk round a brewery which I was worried it might be. At £30 for two it's not cheap but then there's more here to do and you get two drinks each at the end plus a tasting earlier. There's a fun little interactive ride as well.

Great day out. recently visited amsterdam on a bachelor party weekend, unlike most stag do's we wanted to actually remember something from the weekend. so we went to the heineken experience, it was very interesting learning about heinekens humble beginnings and the number of things to do where endless once we arrived there. including an interactive "ride" ill call it which was good fun. definitely a must in my opinion if your going to visit this wonderful city.

Too much money for nothing special. Me and my friends visited the Heineken Experience during our visit in Amsterdam, There was a queue of around 30'. When we entered inside we did not find anything special. Actually they say you just how they produce the beer,with which ingredients.And the secret of what makes Heineken beer so great guess what...it is secret. The two main reasons for the 1 star review is both the bad smell of the horses and that we had to wait plus 30' inside the building to experience the production of a beer,including our selves. That was not good at all. Waiting in the stairs and with a bad smell of horses,this is terrible combination!To sum up, 18 euro for this does not worth. With the same money you can visit more important museums in Amsterdam
Fun. It was fun. You can experience the production of Heineken yourself, and get to sample it. They also have many interactive/beet related activities throughout.
Fun and factual . Love the way they taught you about beer. Ill leave you yo find the surprise teachings.Was a group of us that went.Its abit away from the centre Got a tram to it.

Nice to check out if your a beer fan. It was an interesting tour where you get to learn about Mr Heineken and how he set up the company etc.. Even though the tours take place in the old (not used any more) Heineken factory you could still see the "old" tools they used to use when distilling/preparing the beer.At the end of the tour you get 2 Heineken beers (included with the price) and also another glass of beer "tasting" so that's 3 beers in all.I went there on a Saturday and I felt lucky to have bought the ticket in advance as there was like a 45-60 minute line to get in! Thus make sure you buy your tickets in advance and just skip the line :)

More Than A Museum. Out of all the things we did in Amsterdam, the Heineken Experience was one of our best memories. My boyfriend absolutely loved it, and despite being a coeliac who cannot drink Heineken (or other beer for that matter), I managed to find it exceptionally enjoyable. The only downside to my experience (and upside to my boyfriend's) was that every free drink - and there were many - my boyfriend got to have. This experience does have everything, from a ride where you are a simulated beer, to an exposition of Heineken's advertising and PR campaigns, to discovering how to pour the perfect pint. With many interactive games and different elements - it was a great time. Would definitely go again!
Very nice . I was with my friend there and we loved it, the tour was very interesting, we liked the tasting and we loved do draught beer.

A must when visiting Amsterdam!. I mean, why wouldn't you visit the Heineken brewery?I believe it was 20 Euro or so?It's a self guided tour and they let you check your back pack in the lobby.You can cruise through all the exhibits and learn a lot in about an hour. Plus you get 1 or 2 samples of ice cold Heineken.Would recommend! Also- it was a great way to kill an hour in the afternoon especially because it was almost 90F outside..

Fun and interactive. If you intend to visit then do book tickets online.We saved over 1 hour queue time just by buying our tickets on the app whilst in the queue!!Once inside the first part is all about the history, however it's really interesting and the horses are stunning! Unfortunately there is another wait for the second part of the tour, we waited an hour for the "ride your brew" element. Worth the wait as it is great fun- but do hold on tight!The last part of the tour is great fun and you can email videos and photos free of charge We also paid extra (6 euros) to bottle our own brew, with a personalised label. You also end up with 3 free drinks and a free glass, which you collect at the other store .Good value and great fun. Must see experience , one of our favourites during our trip.

A good place to visit!. I wanted to visit Amsterdam to go to the Van Gogh museum and my fella wanted to visit the Heineken Experience! As he came to the museum with me I had to go to the Heineken experience with him! I wasn't really looking forward to it to be honest but well it turned out to be a good morning out after all! Glad I went! There was lots of things to take part in. You get 3 glasses of Heineken as well!
Best brewery tour I've been on. Although Heineken is a really "commercial" beer, this was one of the best brewery tours I have ever been on.

A Great Time. So, if you like Beer and enjoy Heineken especially you'd enjoy this tour. Not only is it informative, but it's also fun. My friends and I spent a good 3 hours having fun and learning about Mr. Heineken. Even if you're short on time in Amsterdam, I would still recommend you check it out. You get to have 3 glasses of beer, to even taste the raw material it's made of. How to pour a beer successfully without spilling and much more.

fun with friends. Good attraction with friends. You get to know how did Heineken start and the beer process in a fun way. Plus, two beers! There is also a free boat that drops you at the Heineken shop (closer to the city center) after you've seen it,as it is a bit far away from the rest of the attractions; you can also purchase a beer there while going through Amsterdam's canals. Here's a tip: the flyer included a gift at the shop ;) So that was a nice and unexpected plus.
Good few hours... Visited during a 3nt visit to Amsterdam. ...i thought it was a bit boring at first but it got better as it went along

FUN EXPERIENCE. fun expirience to see the history of this beer the tour may take around 2 hours and they give a bracelet with 3 pins at the end of the tour you change the pins for beer and a souvenir glass

Excellent. I was really impressed about the whole history and the large brew kettles. The staff did not hesitate to explain the facts and to give us an answer to all our questions. I recommend the Heineken Experience to everyone who plans a trip to Amsterdam.

Prost to life . I was travelling alone to AMS and one of the things I enjoyed was the Heineken experience. The history of beer is explained over the years , it's history and the process of making and tasting the beer and you get to experience it by doing a beer tasting and 2 complementary beers.

Beer, Beer and more Beer !. this is a must visit during your stay in Amsterdam . a great experience on how famous Heineken beer is brewed and the history behind it plus the gift shop is exciting though ! enjoy your visit !
Fun Place. Interesting place where you can learn the history of Heineken and how to produce beer, with much interactivity and visual effects. In the end you still can enjoy some beers.

Interesting. The Heineken was a different experience. The beer making is common experience found all over Europe. But the way Heineken has done it is unique. Outstanding branding throughout the store, the 4D video to show the process and beer tasting at the end of the round! The horses in the experience, free boat ride to Heineken brand store and a complimentary souvenir makes it complete!

VIP tour was amazing!. The VIP tour was worth it! By passed the line, got to taste 5 beers and cheeses, as well as other bar food, all in addition to the 2 Heineken's at the end of the regular tour! Our guide was great and made the experience all the more enjoyable! Proost!
Fun activity. Funny activity in which we learn how beer is produced and was transported before. Loved the beer making simulation.
🍻. In the world of international beer brewer, heineken did there create a great experience, fun, entertaining and informative. Tips: buy your tickets online

If you love queueing then this is for you. If you come to Amsterdam don't come here. We spent more time queueing than actually walking around the place. If you are interested in the process of Heineken brewing then Google it, don't come here.
Awful. Don't waste your time in Amsterdam. Queue to get in, and queue after queue thereafter. Go to a bar in town and buy a decent beer instead
Brill!. Would certainly recommends anyone to go! Especially the beer lovers! It's worth the money and also educational! Lots to do and get involved in! :)

It was great....and i don't drink beer!!. A really good place to visit, especially on a rainy day in Amsterdam. My husband likes beer, i do not, however, the whole experience was fun.The movie experience/roller coaster was the best fun.The bar man at the end with the free drinks did laugh at me when i said i didn't like my beer and gave it to my husband!Really worth the visit, spend a minimum 2 hours here.

Fun time and yet informative. The tour is very informative, and gave me a better appreciation of what makes Heineken a special beer.There is a real emphasis on quality and consistency.Heineken spend plenty on sports promo.... Just wish they could sponsor my team - the Brisbane Lions Australian rules football club.

This is a must!. Expected this to be good and was not disappointed. Loads of interactive stuff to play around with and free beer! Probably best value for money attraction in amsterdam. Do not miss this experience when in the city.

awesome brewery, must see. We thoroughly enjoyed our trip to the Heineken brewery, there was so much to see and do. We had lots of beer tasting, had a personalised beer bottle with our names on, played lots of interactive games, also my fiance was shown how to pull a pint and then he got to pull his own pint too

Happy Husband. While visiting Amsterdam, we got off the Hop On Hop Off Canal Cruise and visited the Heineken Experience which made my husband's day! Even though I don't drink beer, it was a lot of fun to do this tour with my husband and lucky guy, got to drink all 3 of my beers which were included in the tour! Only took a couple of hours and my husband was very impressed with the whole museum and loved the history of how this brewery started so long ago. If you love Heineken beer, you must take the time out of your trip and visit this place...super cool!!
A must visit. Best presentation I have ever seen. Graphics are unbelievable, 2 glasses of beer at the end included.

Interesting visit. . Line was a little long outside but moved on really quick. Bit of history of the factory etc and some vats and horses. Bit of a line in the middle but the staff brought snacks around while we waited. Cool interactive area at the end before beers. A good time.

Great experience . Even for a non beer drinker this experience was amazing! A good 2 hours well spent and plenty of free beer for those who want it! It really felt like all of the staff wanted to be there and we're getting everyone involved! The simulator ride was great and tasting the beer along the way was both interesting and fun! I even personalised my own beer bottle! A must do!
Fun, informative and beer!. A fun way to see how Heineken is brewed. You get several drinks on you way round. Some are small glasses but it's a fun and informative for an afternoon...or morning!

Definitely recommend. We visited Amsterdam last week and had an amazing time. The Heineken experience was interesting and fun at the same. I am not the biggest beer fan but it was still very enjoyable. You are able to see how the beer is made for the first half of the experience and get to taste the beer before it is fully made ( do not recommend tastes awful). It is finished with a tasting session that lasts about 5 minutes where you are able to enjoy your beer afterwards. The activities that follow are the best part of the experience. There’s fifa available to play, photo booths, foosball, Wii rugby games etc. which you can play for as long as you like. At the end you can have either two free beers or one extra cold one (is the same temperature as the others) in the bar area. Overall a very good trip to go on and very good value for money!!

Fun Factory. My friends and I pretty much stumbled across the Heineken Factory while browsing the city. Thinking it would be a good idea, we bought tickets since the queuing was minimal. We even paid extra for the 'rooftop experience,' which turned out to be a huge let down.While the view was very pretty, there was nowhere to sit amongst the other crammed-in people, and so I couldn't relax and enjoy the food or drink.The Factory itself was very enjoyable. A unique experience that I would definitely recommend trying once. Although afterwards I simply couldn't stomach any more Heineken!

Its a must do thing in Amsterdam, how can you miss this!!. Its a place like if you leave out while in Amsterdam all your friends ridicule you!! You got to be here and mind you its really great experience actually great fun touring the site. Good place with friends and family.
Fun Tour. Very fun and entertaining tour. Plus you get to sample a Heineken as well. The aroma is out of this world.

Heineken Experience. Good fun but go early, the line up outside is a real pain.The ticket sale line seems to be deliberately slowed down, perhaps because they can only handle so many people inside.Good displays, good history on the beer and the owning family.Fun simulations, good explanations on the making of beer.The digital self pics at the end are good fun.

A nice surprise. I had been in Amsterdam before and had done most of the museums and main sites, so having sometime to kill I decided to do the Heineken experience. I am really glad I did. I think it is quite well done, with the right dose of info, interaction and gadgets. And you get three small beers and a small pretty glass as part of the visit. I would definitely recommend this to anybody wanting to do something fun and different from the typical sights of Amsterdam

time well spent. A great tour about the history and making of Heineken, the tour is very interactive and great fun. At the time of our tour it was not very busy but I can imagine at busy times the tour will take some time especially using the interactive exhibits. I recommend you purchase your tickets from a tourist information centre there is one near the experience, this will save €2 each per tickets and you can then miss the ticket office queue.On the wrist band there are 2 green button, your beer tokens don’t lose these, you will need them later on for your free beers. Overall really enjoyed the tour and all of the staff were very friendly and helpful. Time well spent

You've got to go to this. What more can I say!!Even as a champagne drinker this is definitely worth a visit and if you get chance to go on the rooftop definitely go for rge view (and the beer of course)

VIP tour is fun and includes a lot of beer. We took the VIP tour. Not having done the regular tour, it's hard to say whether this is worth the extra cash. You get a lot of beer samples (enough that we were noticeably tipsy by the end), you get to see certain areas that others don't, and you (along with the other VIPs) get led around by a tour guide. However, most of the areas are completely accessible to the non-VIPs, and because you're with a guided group, you may not get to spend as much time in them as you would otherwise. The tour ends with a beer- and cheese-tasting in a small room with a nice, old-timey saloon vibe. This part was fantastic and makes me lean toward suggesting the VIP experience, despite the sizable price difference. Overall, this was a great time, and a highlight of our time in Amsterdam. I give it 4 stars instead of 5 because I didn't think our tour guide was very good and the VIP passes are quite expensive.

History and advertising mix. This experience provides you with the history of Heineken, and an insight into the advertising world of promoting a major world wide product. The opportunity to taste it at the end is a welcome addition. We were also offered a canal cruise which was a added bonus.

EXCELLENT Experience! . I was really sceptical about making this visit as I'm used to visiting cities where I hear huge hype About "certain experiences" which don't necessarily come up to the level of the hype! However on a 2nd trip to Amsterdam with friends I did & what a great experience that was! Great intro to Heineken history followed by some great interactive activities both through technology & interacting with the staff! You can have engravings on bottles & glasses! Take lots of selfies with booth around, play on some wii-like devices & a lot of other things! Perfect for all ages !!
Fun and beer. Fun Fun Fun - enjoyed the information on the tour and then had a great time with family/ friends and the free beer at the end.

Was fun! . I personally don't drink beer but it was still fun. Lots of history and get to see the real stuff. Fun gadgets around. Also if you don't drink beer you can have some Pepsi. Can't complain! Stairs involved

Nice experience. if u haven't see a beer being prepared nice place to be ...awesome beer deals for ppl who drink..
Ppl who don't drink can avoid

Ok, 3 halves (sort of) lager for 16€.. Travelled here as a group of 3 women. It was ok, really middle of the road stuff, done it but wouldn't do it again sort of thing. It did feel very touristy and when I asked a specific question (trying to be clever) the 'crew member' didn't know the answer (I asked how they brewed Heineken light?)We purchased our tickets from a tourist information centre approximately 100 metres from the experience, this saved us €2 each and also we didn't have to queue. (I'd recommend this.)NB you are given a green wristband with 2 buttons on it. HOLD ON TO THIS as you pay for beer with these buttons later.The tour itself is ok, not rushed and you can walk round at your own pace and to be fair, it has made me appreciate the local brew a little bit more and I can now see the 'smiley e's' on a Heineken label!If you are a true beer lover or a brewer of your own ale, then it's worth a visit I'm sure.

Wow!!. Amazing place!! This was one of my favorites to visit your get tokens to use on two beers or a beer and a certificate after pulling your own pint of Heineken the staff make it really fun its a must!!

Great Fun!. A great tour about the history and making of Heineken. It's a really fun way to learn about the beer making process. Free beers at the end of the tour. All of the staff were very friendly and polite. Time well spent!

Soooooo busy! But great fun. We came here because my partner wanted to do this tour. In the end it proved to be a great activity for the two of us. we bought it in conjunction with the Ice Bar tour and it only cost us about 28 Euro I believe, which included two free drinks at each place, plus a third at the Heineken.You get to have a tasting with the staff, watch the beer made, see the Heineken horses (yes, there is a stable there!) and go on a 4D ride. The ride really held up the tour as they could only let a few in for each ride at a time, so we waited nearly half an hour there and to my knowledge it cant be skipped. However, the staff brought us snacks while we waited so that was alright

A must-a-visit attraction for beer lovers. This attraction is must-a-visit, because is a real interactive and immersive experience in the world of the Heineken beer. A very cool place, good for everyone (expecially beer lovers!).

Most Enjoyable Museum!. Heineneken Experience is the most reputable and wise marketing move for a beer brand. Factory and beer making steps are interesing, also the animations are enjoyable. Do not miss to go Heineken if you're in Amsterdam

Great experience!!!. Great experience visiting Heineken Experience!!! Especially you get free Beer inside, and if you answer their question correctly, EXTRA BEER!!! One of the question I'm sure they will ask is "what toast/cheers in dutch?" Answer? PROOST!!!!Tips, get Iamsterdam Brochure from one of the tour shop, inside got few attraction discount voucher and one of it is Heineken Experience!!!

Really Fun Experience. I did this on a whim and working in the liquor industry at home and visiting numerous breweries for work, I was expecting a similar experience. I am glad I was mistaken.The layout is very cool. You start from the very beginning and work your way up. I love to get the history and not just the fun come and drink beer aspect. All of the staff were very friendly and there is something there for everyone to appreciate, even if you don't like beer. Thankfully, I love beer.

A fun experience. A great tour about the history and make of Heineken. There're also a few interactive rooms and displays on its sponsorship and involvement with various activities and events. It's a really fun way to learn about the process, including a fun little film/attraction. Free beers are included when the tour ends in a little club. You can also take a free boat ride in the canal back to city centre and receive a free small beer glass. Definitely worth checking out.
Great experience . Paid 16 euro for a ticket. Very good value . Lots of fun, interesting. And a few free beers along the way
Fantastic interactive experience. This is a must, such a cool place, we spent three hours there and didn't want to leave except there was a free, 30 minute canal trip included, wonderful!

A place for beer lovers. The Heineken Experinece "museum" in Amsterdam is a place for the real beer lovers. You are able to see a nice film and to experience a piece of the history of beer making. Warmly recommended for males.

Great experience, lots of fun. This was a must on our trip to Amsterdam! There was lots to do throughout the tour including a mini 'ride' where you are a beer bottle, which was quite fun! Also, if you answer the questions in the beer tasting they give you extra beer, bonus :)The photo booths were really good, although I didn't buy the pictures as it was free to email them to yourself which I definitely recommend doing rather than paying €6 a picture!!Also got a voucher for a free gift (a Heineken glass) which they gave us on the exit and also a free ticket for the boat trip to take you to the Heineken storeVery good day out :)

Great fun, great value, great place. . This is by far the best brewery and beer tour I've ever experienced. The whole journey through the factory is informative, interactive and most of all fun. They make something I have little care for, Heineken, into one of the most enjoyable experiences of the holiday. The value for money is outstanding. For what you pay for the ticket you get about two pints, which basically pays for the ticket, you get a free bottle opener and if you go outside you get a free boat trip down the canal towards Dam Square. You can easily spend about 3 hours in this place and is great for all ages and walks of life. I've been four times myself and can't recommend it highly enough.
Fun experience!!. Fun time with beer, games and some history.Cool interactive experience for Heineken fan with free beer.

Stag do venue #1. Had a good time here. There is plenty to do and learn, but a great way to start your Amsterdam experience. Booked in advance, so saved on the tickets, and not at all difficult to get to.

Well worth a visit :) . Loved this place! Was so much more than I first imagined.. Lots of games and photos to do and take, the bike ride was hilarious. The little ride you go on as if you are beer is quirky and made the visit, the crisp taste of Heineken at the end was a bonus. 2 beers free and also you get one with a speech so all in all it's worth every penny you spend to get in. Lovely gift shop at the end and in a lovely area. Top marks! :) would definitely revisit

Cool place. I never really had a chance to see how beer was made though I don't mind a good drink at the bar. Here you get a chance to do that and you have a couple drink tickets at the end. (Yes, it's enough to actually get a decent drink).I would have liked to have seen the Heineken Experience showcase other brands they sell besides Heineken itself since the company owns hundreds of different drinks throughout the world.
Cool place. A cool place to visit especially if you are a Heineken fan. How can you not go? Just be quick on the answers at the beer tasting & you'll get extra beer!

Best interactive beer experience. This was probably the biggest beer tour we had ever done! There was lots of interactive activities to do along the way and lots of interesting facts we would probably do it again if we went back it was that good
For Fun Sake!. Good visit in case of you are interested to know the insides of Beer Production. Beer, ads and Games. It would be better if you can pre-book entry to avoid long queue.

Good spot . Some fun things to see/do. We bought tickets away from the actual place - saved €3 and no lineup. Inside there is a bit of history and a few videos. Some fun things like taking videos of yourself in Heineken commercials. You get a few free beers. Overall, not bad for €15.
Good fun. Surprisingly fun tour. Make sure to try the "Bike Ride" and save your free beer tokens for the roof top bar. Great for a stag do!

Old beer factory converted to a modern attraction. Nice tour of the original Heineken beer factory. All the history and process of making the beer is presented in a nice setup, and also some interactive games (beer pourer, kicking game, scrum game, bicycle video). Well worth the price.

Don't Waste Your Time. If a couple of tiny free beers is your thing, this is for you. It's hard to figure out what this is all about. There's a couple of empty copper vats and empty horse stalls, but not much else. There is some information about the history of the beer Company, but most of it is a waste of time. For some reason, they put you in a disco/disc jockey room, with no explanation of why you're there or how it relates to anything. At the end, you end up in a kind of bar with a wrist band giving you two free tiny beers, which you have to drink while standing in a loud obnoxious environment. Don't waste your time on this, just go to a bar and drink some Heinekens in a big glass.

Take a tour and get a couple beers while doing it.. It was interesting to walk through the brewery and see and hear interesting facts, and have an interaction with it all. You don't just have one beer but a couple with your tour; first, midway after you learn about the brewing process, then again as you are finished with the tour you have the option to have up to two 25mL beers or options of one learn to pour a draft experience, or one really cold 35mL. This was all full of great attractions and interactive facts. Take the tour that can last one hour or three...you get to move at your own pace. We had a blast.

Great attraction. Really good attraction, definitely right up any mans street. Can play fifa, get 'brewed and bottled', pour your own pint of heineken and then get 2 free ones at the end of the tour round! We got a combi ticket with the ice bar which made the attraction cheaper so this is good to do. As you're leaving have a look about for someone giving shuttle boat tickets - it's a free canal ride to the heineken brand store where you can get a free mini glass! Definitely worth a visit in Amsterdam!

Well worth the time and cost. Other reviewers have hit all the high points. Only thing I'll add is, going in, I thought the ticket price was a little high for a largely self-guided tour; however, when you factor in you get ~4 beers throughout, it's well worth it. Just go in the afternoon!
Good to visit. Interesting tour about the history of Heineken and how they make the beer. The bars at the end of the tour were quite busy and there is no where to sit.

Surprisingly fun!!. We didn't expect too much...at the beginning it was the family story, then you get an explanation about the beer production ,lots of lots of advertisement , some pictures of you and game time, and of course you get the chance to drink some beer... After all it's an advertisement for the family and the beer, so it's quite expensive to see an advertisement, but , after all, we all had good time!! Their boat tour at the end of the tour was surprising and fun.

Surprisingly good!. We bought tickets to this from a ticket office in Amsterdam city centre. The cost was €16 and was such a fun experience. The tour included the information about how Heineken was created but also includes some fun elements too!! You are given 2 tokens which entitles you to drinks but you can also win extra tokens along the way to get extra drinks of Heineken in the bars....if you like a tour with a difference with a drink included then this is for you!

Great fun and great beer!. My teenage daughter and I visited - it was good fun. During the 4D ride we became Heineken bottles, we saw their Shire horses, sampled their wonderful beer and enjoyed stunning views from their rooftop terrace. Their gift shop is good value and we came away with some great gifts.

Interactive tour ( with beer ). Its well worth the money , the full tour is in English so no need for any apps. Plenty of opportunity's for photos so have a camera .We finished off with a beer in the new bar on the roof . Stunning views of the city . Well worth a visit . The tour took around 2 hours so make sure you have time.

Hokey Fun!. Okay, admittedly, this is a multi-hour live commercial for Heineken beer. But it's so delightful!It starts with a fake hologram guy serving up beer at a bar and spewing history facts about Heineken. That was hilarious - followed by touring the beer vats, getting to taste the "hops", viewing the exquisite Heineken draft horses, becoming a bottle of beer, and best of all - the videotaped karaoke bike ride, which we got to keep as a remembrance. On the day of our visit, it happened to be my birthday. The staff gave me a birthday hat to wear and presented me with a Happy Birthday Heineken mug. We had a blast. And free beer at the end to boot.

Great experience . Been there a few times, a great original beer factory converted as a tourist museum. Two half pints are included in the price at the bar and another tasting quarter pint. Has its souvenir shop, free gift upon entrance, simulator and games

What a fun tour! . We had planned to visit the Heineken experience but were slightly put off by the not great trip advisor comments. Honestly don't be put off- this was money well spent! Not only do you learn a lot about Heinekens heritage and history, you also get to have a couple of pints AND you get to see all of the different sporting events that they sponsor. The interactive areas were really fun and it was cool that you could take a photo in a special booth and then email it to yourself as a memory of the day. Definitely worth a visit if you have a few hours free in Amsterdam. Also really easy to get to by tram (I am usually rubbish at public transport!!)

This is best advert which you have pay for!. This attraction is pretty nice to attend you will get explanation about how beer is made and various other facts on the topic! there is bunch of games in between excursion! Yes you will have couple free beers! That was really nice place to stay for a while! If you take some salty peanuts or chips with you you will enjoy it even more, since they provide only beer, and souvenirs.

A lot of fun and beer to drink too!. We visited here to hide from the rain and were pleasantly surprised by this experience! It begins with a history of the brand which is interesting. We discovered how the beer is made, with knowledgeable staff to answer your questions. I was amazed to see horses in their stables at one part of the museum and spoke to a young man who explained that the horses are part of the history but are kept for promotion purposes. Beautiful animals that are treated to a holiday in Scotland every year! We both enjoyed being a glass bottle and taken on a simulation ride. There are a whole lot of interactive experiences to take part in. Lastly a trip to the bar for 2 complimentary beers or Pepsi which is set up like a trendy bar. No visit is complete without a look round the souvenir shop which was well stocked with Heineken merchandise. We were glad it was raining........

Thought is was a bit pricey but worth it at the end!. A great review of the history of Heineken. Very fun and interactive and beer was great! Give you 2 1/2 beers on you visit.Go for a karaoke bike ride and send off to your friends
Great fun. A lot of fun for adults - virtual tour +++ and two beers on your ticket - they have a roof terrace - Come early to avoid que

A very nice experience!. This is one of the attractions I liked the most. It's a really nice experience! You get to learn how they make the beer and you get to feel what it's like to be a beer through a show with effects ,and also to take pictures of yourself on different backgrounds that has to do with Heineken's plant via digital machines. At the end you get to taste the beer, the ticket price includes 2 glasses of beer per person.

Best ever. This experience was by far the best ever. I recommend you taking this tour. We have a great time; very interesting to see the history behind Heinken beer. The tour is spoken in English only.

History, marketing, and drinking one of the world greatest beers. With the ticket you get beer tokens to enjoy at some of the bar within the tour. You learn about the ingredients, and the process and how it has evolved to supply the world with one of the best beers wold wide. Looking at the year you were born and the marketing from that year was amazing.

Unexpected!:). My husband and I thought we would squeeze in a visit before our walking tour around town.There was no line and we walked straight in.Initially there was a lot of history on the brand, and I thought that was all to it and then things just got better and better.Found out how Heineken is made, went through a beer simulation ride, and then topped it off with a whole bunch of interactive experiences. And of course a tasting! All staff were supper friendly and incredibly welcoming-which always rounds off an experience. Needless to say we had to run our walking tour!;)

So much fun and beer!. The Heineken Experience was so much fun! After hearing about how the beer is made and the history of the company, you're taken onto a "ride" in which you are the beer. Then you're fed with some of the good stuff itself. A little gimicky, at times it felt like we were in a Heineken advert, but definitely worth a visit. The bar at the end played good music and gave you two free beers.

Thrilling experience with Heineken. Heineken experience is one of the adventurous experience I and my husband had last month. The very details of Heineken making and it's origin was great. Liked the 3-d display of the story in d beginning. Its Heineken movie is really thrilling. It gave the real feeling of presence. The free 2 chilled beers r d treats to the entire journey.

Nice visit, good experience, fun activities.. I didn't have any expectations from this visit, but it turned out to be a fun one.You can get all the information you want about heineken beer, and beer in general. There is a lot of activities you can visit, such beer pouring contest, heineken & football relation, watch a simulation about the brewery and the process itself, create your own heineken bottle, and so much more.If you like beer and if you don't, the place is worth a visit.

Really worth the visit. This was a real good experience lots off information lots to do on your way around, videos and photo that can be sent to email, customised Heineken bottle. By the end of the tour you actually get 3 free beers this is worth the visit.

Nice experiance. The museume is nice, showing the history of the company. You can taste very fresh beer in the tour with explanation on how its made. In the end of the tour there is a bar with 2 free beers inclouding in the price of the museum ticket
Fun and Interactive. We were not 100% sure if we should spend the money and go but it was great and well worth it. Really interesting and fun.

A Waste of time and money. We got there for 10.30am when it opens and was 10 mins late opening, I thought we would have a guide walking us around and it was a video that you had to watch first.There was just not much to look at all the interactive things you have a go at none of them were working and the bar area where you had your free pint smelt like a dirty night club.Would never go back.
experience that is nothing but fun. a good way to spend a late afternoon in a light and fun full setting setting that totally focuses on just having a good time

Rainy Day fun. On our second day in Amstermam, it rained like the Apocalypse all day!!! We did a bit of googling and found the Heineken Experience. It's about €17 per person. It's a self guided tour and if you're interested in beer in general then it's a good way to spend a couple of rainy hours with a few free beers thrown in.

Heineken - A brand story well told. We researched and made a stop to this Heineken place! I must honestly say, it is marketing well done! For a non beer fan, I was impressed by the amount of details and history they put together to tell their brand story. At the end of the tour, you get to sample super ICE COLD beer, which was nice! It felt like we were clubbing in the late afternoon. A must try at least once when you're in Amsterdam, more so for the beer lovers!

Should get 6 stars. I'm not even a great Heineken beer fan but DO NOT miss this. Heineken is truly a marketing machine and this experience is one I'll never forget. There are twists and turns and surprises all along the way. I don't want to give anything away but this was a real highlight for me on my trip. Go see it even if you don't drink beer.

Fun and Touristy, A must do when in Amsterdam. My husband is a big Heineken fan so we had to visit the brewery. Most brewery tours are touristy and a little kitchy but the Heineken Experience was fun a good way to use up a rainy day. We enjoyed walking through the brewery and really enjoyed our glass of Heineken at the end of the tour. Do it if you have time and really enjoy Heineken beer.

Simply not worth it. First of all, you do not get to see the actual factory unless you pay more than double. It's fun but definitely nothing that is worth 18-20 euros, yes, you get 2 beers (regular, nothing special beers) in the end, something that can cost you 4 euros anywhere else, and the information they give you, you can absolutely read it in Wikipedia. But the worst part is that the they rush you all the time and don't give you time to really enjoy the experience. It's like you pay to be advertised. Skip this and enjoy a beer in a special place

Great way to spend a couple of hours-very interesting and fun!. We travel quite a lot and have been through several breweries. But this, by far,makes those others pale in comparison! We went early when they first opened to avoid the crowds. It's a self-guided tour with inter-active displays, people to tell you about the company and brewing process plus free samples along the way and at the end. You could spend as much time as you want and not be rushed. Another reviewer didn't like "the ride", but we thought it was fun. Believe me, it is Sooo much more than we expected. Definitely add to your "must do" list. You won"t be disappointed. There is so much information and hands-on activities and displays. In short, just go and see for yourself!

Great fun, not what I was expecting. This place is great fun, bit boring at the start just like a museum but half way through you have the place where you are "brewed" into a bottle of heiniken which is so silly and you can see the beautiful horse (although there was just one big horse out the back when I was there, I could see him though he was gorgeous!) and you of course drink the beer and learn how it is brewed ! and silly things along the way, give it a go I really loved it!

Great fun. This was a great attraction and lots of fun. Very informative and you get a glass of beer and to pour your own Pint at the end of it all. Interesting to see how the beer is made. Great gift shop too!

Brilliant. We visited the heinken experiece on my wifes 40th.we had a brilliant time.you get to pull your own drink and get a certificate.Also you ge to make your own label for your own bottle of heiniken.
Perfect for friends. This was so much more fun than we thought! Perfect for friends looking for something to do. Go early in the day to avoid queing.

Wow, Heineken is a hit!!! fun, popular, lots to see and do, free tastings! Pictures!!. We've toured Anheuser Busch in St Louis, Missouri, Coors in Golden, Colorado and small micro breweries in several places. We expected just another brewery tour, but there's so much to do near the end, the pictures, the games, the music and lights, made it so much more fun. Heineken really seems to cater to a younger trendy demographic, that's for sure. One thing, we did think the ride was pretty stupid and would have preferred to skip that but I'm not sure they let you. Overall, it was very fun and I picked up a few things in their gift shop.
Fun brewery to visit. Plenty of experiences and very low key. We had fun with some of the active exhibits. Get a few beers as well as a glass or a canal cruise

Worth the visit. Spent a good couple of hours here. Easily accessible and tickets reasonably priced. Pre booking is cheaper. Little tour shows how beer is made and the history or the beer. You get a few beers (make sure you answer the questions right, you'll get a couple of freebies!) as part of the ticket. 100% worth a visit.

Tasty, funny tour & quite interactive. We were there in August 2014, and I really liked the tour. It had all sorts of gimmicks on telling the history of the business and of the beer crafting process, but also passionate guides and activities you could engage in to better realize bits of this world (Heineken Beer). There was also a resting room, after the tasting process, where you could see current Heineken ads.I really enjoyed myself, and considering we were newly engaged, we also personalized a bottle with the details printed on the label (our names, the date). Loved it. We plan to drink that bottle for an anniversary - we're still debating which one :-)

absolute yes!. best museum in my life! tons of fun aand very good memories!i would recommend it for sure! even with children! So lovely time spent there!perfect, as was raining, and we spent awesome time. the most fresh beer which we ever drunk! And at the end we got a small boat trip, which was just a small cherry on the top.

Great tour! Don't forget to pour your own pint!. My two key tips:1) At the end there is a chance to either go to the left and have a pint, or go to the right and pour your own pint. I found pouring my own pint a great experience under the supervision of a Heineken staff member. You also get a certificate. 2)2) Go early to have a leisurely stroll and not have to wait to se things. We were there maybe an hour from opening and by the end of our tour it was getting fairly busy and crowded. Overall, for an occasional drinker I enjoyed this a lot more than I expected!

Converted to Heineken. Great fun well worth the cost. Very interesting and informative. It's all I drink now Great to see they make it interactive. Try the pint pouring stand not as easy as you think but great fun.
About what you would expect. This is all about the beer. They shuttle you from one room to another. Unfortunately this is not currently used as a factory.

perfect for rainy day. I really enjoyed the Heineken experience. We got our tickets from the concierge at our hotel so we did not wait on any lines. We were in and out in less than 2 hours. It was interactive, very Disney like. Our group of 6 adults had a very enjoyable
time.

Pleasant surprise. So much more than we expected! You get information about the history of the beer and brewery and have so much fun with all the effects and simulations. Great atmosphere at the bar at the end of the tour and you get two free beers there

Not just a brewery. Visited the Heineken Experience early so avoided the large crowds that develop.The queue was almost 100 metres long when we exited. We spent almost two hours looking at and being involved in many activities. Saw the brewing of beer, the stables and Clydesdale horses. There were many interactive games available. To finish of there was the opportunity to sample the product. This is in my opinion a good activity to involve the whole family.

Fun and worthy!. It's really a nice "museum" when you can know how Heineken beer is made. It's also fun and entertaining. You can get a free gift with the handband. The price was 16 euro when I visited.
Great and brings a smile to your face. Was expecting much but I thoroughly enjoyed it. Lots of facts and photos. Things to interact with. Worth it.

A Beer Lovers Must Do!. This attraction is well worth a visit if you are a beer drinker. Easily accessible by tram, it is a fantastic way to spend a few hours. The history of Heineken Beer is relayed in full detail. The guided tour is well planned and at the end you can have three glasses of different beer of your choice.

A highlight of my holiday. This is brand promotion at its best. If you're a lover of beer this is a must-do. And if you're not a beer lover, do this anyway, you'll be a beer-lover afterwards! From interactive pods to beer brewing instruction to the art of pouring the perfect draft, this experience will never be forgotten.

Interesting and informative. Myself and my friends decided to stop by the Heineken Experience because we had heard it was a must-do in Amsterdam. The tour itself is self-guided but there are guides on hand to fill in the blanks. The actual museum is well worth seeing, plus you get two beers at the end as well as a free gift.
An Experience. Very good, informative and funny. Answer the questions right and get free beer! Learn how to pull a pint of Heineken and get more free beer! Thoroughly enjoyed myself.

Good day out. I'd save this for a rainy/cold day as it's all indoors and we found it was a nice getaway from the cold November air. Was definitely worth a visit, but only once, no need to go again once you've been.
Great fun. Great tour with lots to see and do. Pre bought tickets so skipped the queue. Guides are excellent, and good at involving everyone.

I loved this Experience!!. It was a great way to learn how to brew; informative, funny & adventurous!! I couldn't imagine better. This also showed me that, how marketing efforts of a product can actually exceed the product.

Must see/do!. Visit here last week and was a great experience! Interesting to know how the beer is made and what it tastes like before all the main ingredients were added! Enjoyed that we had 3 free beers each and learnt how to do beer tasting! The simulation ride was a fun addition to the tour. Would recommend you give yourself 2 hours to do this tour. Very good!

Great. I adored this tour. You get informed on how they started heineken, including the smiling e, in the name. You complete a tour of all the stages to create the beer, and taste beer in every single step. you get 2 cups of beers, and they "Brew You" which is a very nice Disney Style "Honey, i shrunk the kids". It is a must do experience.
A lot more than you expect. It's not just a brewery tour. Very interesting and lots of games and photos to play around with. Really enjoyable for all ages.

Great fun. Very informative and good fun along the way.... Bought our tickets in advance from the website and skipped a big queue this way. Lots of interactive parts of the tour too, which is great.... And very much enjoyed a couple of free Heinekens along the way!

Had fun!. We got there having no expectations whatsoever. Turned out to be pretty fun and interactive.We were definitely entertained and we also learned about beer.Try going on the rooftop terrace for your two included drinks. The view is nice.

Great tour with even better samples. Great and informative tour with some fun interactive elements.Having been on many brewery tours before I had an idea of what to expect but hat being said the Heineken Experience is one of my favourites.Upon arrival your entry fee gets you a wristband with little buttons which pop off and act as drinks tokens in the bar area.The tour starts through the foundation and history before going onto the brewing process. Staff were giving out taster samples of Wort...a mixture used in making beer and which one of the worst things I've had in my mouth was a nice touch while going through the brewing process.I never realised that Heineken still had horses and as you pass through the stables a staff member talks about the role the horses had across the city delivering beer. Who knew they gave their horses 6 weeks holiday a year...There's an nice touch with Brew You ride where you are put into the brewing process to experience it first hand before moving through into the development of the Heineken brand.There's a beer tasting room which leads on to a small cinema type room showing the Heineken adverts over the years, interactive elements where you can try kicking a rugby ball between the goals, try your hand being part of a scrum, table football, ps4 fifa games, a challenge to try and pour the perfect pint etc. So lots to keep interest as you move round.No brewery tour would be complete without samples and the end of the experience takes you to the bar where for 1 token you can get 25cl Heineken for for 2 tokens you can get 35cl Heineken extra cold.Would recommend a visit if spending time in Amsterdam.

Fun!. Not a professional tour for brewers, but a great chance for tourists to taste a little beer and have a little fun.You get a couple of beers and don't miss the boat ride after the tour, they take you to their shop in the city center and you get a small Heineken glass. Recommended!

Proost !. Cool way to show a brewery - Tip 1 buy a skip the line ticket the lines are very long every day. Good history of this beer as well as being able to taste the barley and hops. Once you have seen the way the beer is brewed there is a tasting and then a cool interactive area covering Sports that Heineken sponsor i.e. Rugby WC and Footballs CL. Oh and you end with a couple of beers in the World bar - Proost

A great tour of this famous Brewery. The tour took us about two hours, very interesting background of how this famous beer is brewed, very well presented tour, and at the end of the tour we got to sample some of the beer

Nice experience . It was very rainy that day so we searched for indoor activities. This was a good solution. You can spand 2 nice hours in there. Make sure to order tickets beforehand to avoid the lines. You will get beers in the end of the tour.
Do the VIP tour. Fantastic experience, very interattive but if you can do it, do the VIP tiour we did and it was excellent live guide
Good, but not perfect.. Interesting on how is the beer making, but not that much for the ticket you pay. Also there are some funny activities at the end.

Great Museum / Tour. This tour is different than most 'brewery' tours as it is highly commercialized. They don't even brew there anywhere, but they've turned the original brew house into a giant museum / tasting center.The beginning part of the museum was very interesting, as it told the history of the Heineken family. The 2nd part of the exhibit they could have done without. There were a lot of hands on games, exhibits, etc. My husband was there 8 years ago and none of those games / exhibits were there then, so they are fairly new. They were interesting, but we breezed right through them since we just viewed them as a huge time suck (you literally could spend almost an entire day there if you played with everything). With your wristband that you receive at entry, you have an option to 'purchase' 1 or 2 beers with your tokens (depending on the size you want - the cost different token amounts) OR you could pour your own beer and receive a certificate for 2 tokens. We chose to pour our own; which was a lot of fun!We enjoyed the history, the beer pouring and of course the beer! :) You could get through the history / beer tasting in 1 - 2 hours, but plan on a half a day otherwise.

Interesting place to spend a couple of hours in Amsterdam.. We took in the Heineken Experience upon our visit to Amsterdam and spent an enjoyable few hours within the attraction.The tour is very interesting as you get to visit the old brewery where Heineken used to be brewed and you also get the opportunity to see how the brewing has changed over the years which can be seen via old videos, models and displays.There is an interesting exhibition on how the branding has changed over the years which we found very good.You can also sample free Heineken with vouchers obtained when you enter the attraction.There is a good Heineken shop where you can purchase various Heineken branded products and also limited editions bottles of Heineken.I would recommend this attraction to any visitor to Amsterdam

An enjoyable and fun experience!. A great "interactive" tour with a bonus of good beer and nice, friendly guides. You learn some intersting history about the founder and about the making of beer, while tasting, smelling and - having a good time!
Fun tour. Very interesting and informative tour detailing the history of the company and the brewing process. Lots of fun interactive exhibits too. We'll worth a visit

big marketing, little meaning. for me the biggest attraction was the Night watch painting where the "guys" drunk beer... really, Heineken is just about big noise. Everything is of course well organized and nicely decorated and the staff is very friendly. I would recommend to go only if you are a true Heineken beer lover.

Great Stop for Beer Lovers. My husband loves beer so we had to stop here me not so much. The tour actually was not bad at all but here is a tip we went to visit the IAMSTERDAM sign first and there is a restaurant that sells tickets a little cheaper to do the tour and you will not have to wait in line. Glad we did that because once we arrived the line for the heineken experience was wrapped down the block. But we just walked in since we had our tickets already. Yeah!! Some reviews said it was not worth the money. I would say this if you are from out of town such as us and you or your spouse loves beer then to me its worth it. Though I didn't drink any beer I enjoyed myself. By the way I have toured the Budweiser Plant and several other beer plants all over so to me this one fell in line with the others.

Was great!!. Expected a normal brewery however turned out to be much more.There was a ride to go on, photo booths, ps4, rugby games, free drinks, free glass if you go to the brand store. (Don't have to pay anything for it if been on the tour) and also a free canal trip to the brand store. Also got to learn about the way they make the beer and teach you how to pour the perfect Heineken drink. Not that expensive considering what you get out of it really! Also on a tram route for ease of access.

Interesting visit but don't bother queuing. Had a good day at the Heineken Experience, you come away having learnt alot bout the history of the company and the brewing process. They also make it very fun which is good. Two tips I would suggest -Dont queue. Book online and you can ignore the queue outside. Its also cheaper. We arrived outside saw the queue and just used our phone to book. The second is they have a rooftop bar through the shop which is worth the visit for your complimentary beer at the end. I thought that was better than the bars inside.

Heineken Experience. Not really much more than a regular brewery, but I will give it some credit because Its a better experience than your local brewery in your hometown. Basically a guided tour through the brewery, with a couple free beers at the end. Not a bad experience if your in the area and have a couple of hours free.

Heineken Paradise. This is a really great experience for both beer lovers, and non-beer lovers. You get to learn about the history, the process of making the beer, make your own personalized beer bottle, drink beer and drink more beer! Its got some really fun activities and photo booths, as well and the cute little shop where you can engrave beer glasses! I would recommend this to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Loved it!. Well worth a visit. You get your monies worth too with all the attractions and things you have to do inside. You even get your name put on full bottle of Heineken. It tastes so good it being from Holland and all.
Have a Heineken. It got off a little slow however the experience became fabulous. I would suggest this attraction to all. We had fun

Very interesting tour - both historic and modern.. It was a very interesting self guided tour - it was both historic and very modern at the same time.
