I feel this tour was appropriate for under-age children as there were many interactive parts of the tour and they offered sodas for those not old enough to drink beer. My suggestion is to get there early before the lines form.

Brewerish indoor fun park. Nice experience providing some facts about beer making not that much like a typical brewery tour as the experience hall is just for tour use, but “5D” film, postcard/video creating stands and bit of tasting as well even finding a place for tasting Heineken in Amsterdam is not so hard to do anyway
Boring . Not much to see or to do. Just a museum and not the actual brewery like other brands...Even as a beer fan i would pass

Be Heineken Beer! . Have you been role-playing that you were beer? Here in Heineken's museum, you can experience being a brewed and bottles in a 4d theatre... It was awesome! The museum was interactive with lots of sensorial experiences while learning about the beginning of beer brewing until the branding of Heineken, etc. The best part is you will learn a lot about drinking beer and pouring beer the experiential ways... You can get your certification on pouring beer, the right way! After this trip, i don't see beer or bartenders who pour beer the same way again!

Heineken. This is a nice experience for beer lovers. I liked it even thou I am not that much into beer. You will find out a little about the heineken history and also how the beer is made and distributed worldwide and much more.
Worthed every minute!. Had loads of fun and also loads of acyivities to do while havibg tour. Free beer in the end :) :) haha!!

Really good place to visit and drink a quite a few glasses of Heineken! . Bought a ticket via our hotel for €15 includes 2 drinks and a free glass but you end up drinking more.Learn the great history of Heineken which is still family run. Took us a Couple of hours to look round and drink but longer if stay and drink in the bar!
Great experience . Well worth doing the Heineken experience. had great fun, there are loads of activities to do throughout the tour, and the free beer at the end was perfect!!

Fantastic time - A must Visit Attraction. Not really fussed on Lager but the tour and the Heineken Simulator is great fun At least 3 drinks and more if you are fast enough to answer questionsIf they ever stop making Guinness I may look towards drinking HeinekenSo please go you will enjoy yourselfs

Must visit place in Amsterdam . This turned out to be an awesome experience which started with a tour of the brewery which was touristy in the beginning but ended with lots of fun. They also teach you how to pour beer like a professional bar tender and certify you too. It's absolutely fun and you get to try free freshly brewed chilled beer.

Fun times!. This is not your typical brewery tour. While they do show you the process of how their beer is made, the whole thing is much more about having fun. There are many interactive games with free photos and videos, a little cinema, music and sports-inspired games. It would be nice to be able to drink while playing the games but I assume they just can't risk people spilling everywhere.It's not widely advertised but they have a FREE boat that goes from the centre to the Museum. It's really worth doing! Our guide was super friendly and he made the experience great. You can also buy beers for 2.5Euros on board, which makes the ride even better. :)Without the boat tour, leave yourself a good 2 hours to enjoy the brewery. I would definitely recommend it.

Fab tour!!. We went to the heineken experience on a recent trip to Amsterdam. I booked as part of a trip for my boyfriend but really enjoyed it myself. It's both educational and fun! You'll learn about how they make and brew the beer as well as how they transport it and how to taste it etc. Really good, would recommend! Book in advance online (i think it's discounted), when we got there we saw a huge queue but were able to skip this and go straight in.

Don't visit on a Saturday!. Brilliant museum, however the queues INSIDE the experience were horrendous. For the brew ride, we had to queue for about 20mins to even get to the queuing area. Likely great at every other time, but try to avoid peak time at all costs, else you'll be very bored. It was also so busy for the 'Brew Ride' they couldn't fit us all on, so my boyfriend ended up half on the ride and half stood on the steps which rather damped the experience. On the plus side, the beer tasting element and the guide was fantastic.

Fun. You never know what's around the corner. I think we spent around 2 hours at the Heineken experience - learning about its history, brewing process, marketing and so many fun activities! The staff were very helpful and energetic. It's a very interactive museum.
Wonderful. So much fun. The displays and POS was inventive, interactive and cool. It is an experience not to be missed.

Worth a look. My dad worked for Heineken in the UK for 38 years so I had to go! A good way to spend a couple of hours but not a day. Great insight into brewing process and a couple of beers thrown in.

Fun experience and beer!. We were late so missed out on making our own beer bottle label and were ushered through the attractions swiftly but I can't hold this against them at all I just recommend you give yourself time to go through the whole thing. I found the experience wasn't necessarily very informative more focused on fun and beer drinking but fortunately I like fun and beer drinking so wasn't fussed. And maybe I was just rushing too much as we were late

A virtual reality beer experience. We debated for 5 days about whether or not to go to see the brewery and finally decided why not? What a great decision, probably the most fun you can have in all of Amsterdam. We laughed and laughed and had so much fun with all the things there are to do. It's just not beer (although you get 3 glasses free with admission). The virtual bike ride for two is so much fun, we are still laughing about me falling off the bike. Silly and so much fun! Do NOT miss this experience!

Fun all the way. Best thing to do in the morning when none of the museums open and have time in hand. One can see the basic beer making huge instruments used when it all started, taste it, experience in 4D, play games, also, you have the chance to be a certified beer pourer and of course your entry fee includes 2 glasses of beer. We enjoyed the whole trip!

Unbelievably Awful. The expectation - a tour around the Heineken brewery, checking out how the beer is made.The reality - the worst visitor attraction I've ever been to. It's just a selection of (terrible) games. They don't even brew beer on site! At the end you get 500ml of beer, although you'll have to queue. We couldn't get out quick enough.For €16, you'd be better off learning about beer by going to a bar and buying 3 pints.

great place to visit. Really enjoyed our visit here, lots to do and see and learn plenty of tasting so you need to like larger. its fun you get a hands on to pouring your own . great little shop as you leave not that cheap though to buy things. Get here when it opens to avoid long ques and waiting gets very busy.
Great tour . It was definitely more than I thought it would be. If you love beer you must go check it out. 3 free beers included with admission!

Best brewery visit to date!. I have visited quite a few brewery's in Europe and this is by far the best one I have been to. I spent over 2 hours here which surprised me as I thought it would be a quick visit. You can learn to pour your own beer, get a certificate and then drink your beer. You also get taste testing opportunities throughout. You can bottle your own beer and get your name out in it. The souvenir shop is reasonably priced, you can get engraved glassware which makes a nice gift. All in all a good experience!

Beer !!!!!. Wonderfully creative way to promote Heineken. Audio visuals, yeast tasting, beer tasting exercise, interactive games, a theatrical motion simulator (what and how it feels to be made a Heineken) and for the grand finale, 2 glasses of Heineken.

Fun thing to do. This attraction has a lot to offer. The Heineken Experience is part museum, part entertainment. You get a history lesson, brewing class and more. I admire Heineken brand for its consistency and its marketing prowess. The visit actually was very educative. The intricacy of brewing and history was enthralling. Its was loads of fun. Its basically a walking tour, with no tour guide. You can do it at your own pace. Stop and read about the things you're interested in and skip the ones you're not. But the best part is the beer that you get to taste at the end of the tour.

Heineken is love, Heineken is life. Do you want to spend your money having a couple of glasses of an alright beer, whilst being bombarded with propaganda.Because you should because Heineken is our lord saviour, I know that after being enlightened by the truth at this museum.

Excelent. If you like beer, and specially if you enjoy a cold Heineken this gonna a be a good place to visit. From the company history to technological stuff and off course some cold Heinekens to appreciate. I really liked it!

Must do in Amsterdam. This is one of things that you just have to do when you're in the Dam.Great fun, it was my 2nd time here but I still enjoyed it and the beer is just brilliant. Be sure to buy tickets online and skip the queue

Fun Experience . Obviously we done this trip for the beer but €16 is worth it as it's a fun experience and lots to get involved with. Lots of fun activities, you can pour your own beer and you learn how they make it.

All that is old is new again. I stopped here in 2006 on the way home from Afghanistan and had a good time. I went back this year and had a good time again even though the experience and tour is completely different than it was in 2006. Half the clientele was not old enough to get in in 2006, neither were half the staff. all in all a fun way to spend a few hours in Amsterdam.

Ok but not for me. Everyone asks if you've visited the Heineken Brewery when staying in Amsterdam so I thought it must be well worth the trip. At the end of the tour which lasted best part of 40 minutes you can claim your free Beer and Glass. I'm sorry to say I really didn't find the tour that interesting, infact I wish I'd gone somewhere else. On the plus side over the main road to the front of the building is a large shopping mall which has plenty of good Bars, one with live music, needless to say I did enjoy my trip out but not The Heineken Experience.
Amazing. I like so so so so much ı enjoy drink learn dance everything is avaliable and u can buy a special gifts (heineken bottle with ur name)

What's not to like you get your money back in need form.. It's a cool tour, get to see everything Heineken related. Including every movie the bottle has appeared in. Also at the end you get 2 'free' drinks, one way to look at it: take the drink prices off your entry price and then the tour is practically free. Hope you like Heineken.

Good experience . Enjoyed our time at the Heineken experience, a bit of education and a good laugh in the bar. And not to forget the nice cold beers, overall a good place to visit while you are in Amsterdam

Interesting - Great Beer!. Great tour of the original Heineken brewing facility and history of Heineken beer. There is a virtual ride where you become a beer bottle going through the filling and packaging process which is cool. You get free beer at the end. Lots of fun. Be ready to climb stairs, but an elevator was also available.

Funtastic. This was one of the best brewery visits ever. It was fun and informative not just a walk through and 'here's a beer' type visit. We had a great time. The staff were great and helpful and a few interactive bits and novelty photo/video areas made it fun. The tasting area was like a club when we were there. Busy but not top busy and definitely more inviting than a club. Get a bottle with your name on. Its took me a while to figure it out but I had to have one. I came back to heineken after trying other brews for a while and I'd say its the best. Probably is not a word I would use in the same sentence. The best.

Best brewery tour ever!. The first half of the tour is just like any other brewery where they tell you about the water and hops etc...but the second half was amazing. There were quite a few interactive experiences to be had. From a bike ride, to karoake, to kicking a goal in a football match to winning the FIFA cup. Loads of fun!The beer was very fresh and quite cold!
Great experience. This was real fun, me and my girlfriend went there and it was great. I would definitely recommend it to a friend or family.

Learning about beer in Amsterdam. I went to this tour mostly to know how it is, because living in The Netherlands and not having how to give an opinion to visitors it's started bothering me. At the end, it's an attraction of the city that many people are willing to go.My expectation was low. Actually it was better than what I expect, since there is possibility to learn about the history of the Heineken company and how they make their beer, as well as visit the first plant with the old equipments that they use to produce their beer in Amsterdam. It's possible to see the different bottles they had along the years as well as different labels. A film tells the history of the founders and the company until today and and they have also kinds of puppets to illustrated their history. One of the first attractions is a booth to take these pictures where you suppose to make strange faces. What they call the experience is not really special, since you go to a small room, in a small group and follow a film as if you were going to be inside the production of the beer and you fell some freshness during the production.There is possibility to try the beer in the middle of the tour and at the end, where you are (as always), getting out via a shop with all types of merchandise. Employees were friendly , making the tour agreeable.I went with one of my daughters and we actually had fun there.
Awesomeness. A cool vibe and young place. Funny and interesting to know the history of beer.fun place to visit, even as one who do not drink.
Great fun. This was such an j retesting experience and great way to spend a few hours. Very interactive museum with beer at the end, what more could you want!

Great place to see. Had a great time here. Educational and fun lol. You get a small free beer when they show you how heineken is supposed to be drunk. Then you get 2 free tokens to get more! Very friendly, polite people
Drink free!. The cost is average, depending on how much you want to spend. But it is a good experience to learn about Heineken process and you get to drink free! No drink for minors though. :)

Know the experience in Heineken. Skip the lines and buy your tickets online! They do not have a restricted time frame on when and what time to visit. It's basically a museum. Pose with the giant labels, huge brewery copper towers and of course the beer. In the museum you get to know the history of Heineken, the simple description of their unique brewing method, how to drink your heineken the proper way and there is even a spot where you can learn how to do your own beer tapping (certificate is included)They also have the Heineken boat cruise that brings you back to their store in the town. Do remember to claim your free glass upon arrival at the store!
Good Rainy Day Activity. Interesting history and brewery tour topped off with two glasses of Heineken beer. Some kitschy, interactive displays.

Fun tour of the Heineken brewery. If you are a Heineken lover, then this is a great tour, it is mostly computerized so it is at your own pace, no rush. Be sure to buy your tickets beforehand for discounts & avoid the lines. Overall good place to go if you have time to learn about Heineken.

They definitely make it an Experience!. Sure, this is touristy and commercialized and all self-promotion - but it's well worth the money to visit it. You learn about the history of Heineken, their brew-making process and all - but overall, they just make it such a fun and interactive experience. We had a great time.

HORRIBLE! STAY AWAY!!. Extremely poor. 16€ for a short walk through what are basically advertisements, nothing really informative, and the "ride" is the worst animatronic theater I've been in. You see no factory and no real beer production. Further, your "two beers" are 250 mL each. I found the instructions on tasting Heineken amusing, it's like being instructed on how to properly taste box wine.
Wooooow. After a long trip with beer drops in this tour and test Heineken Beer , I highly advise you to get The Heineken Certificate. It would be a great memory of your trip.

A must-do!. It's a really interesting tour, there's so much to see and learn. The guides are really well-informed, enthusiastic and they don't rush you through at all. You also get a couple of free drinks and a free gift (if you travel to the store in the city centre to pick it up). Definitely recommended!

Great time, Highly Recommended. I thoroughly enjoyed the Heineken Experience but beware, two free drinks does not mean two free pints! It is worth the money. I won't give away any spoilers so just take my word for it. Give a couple of hours to it and the shop is not over the top with their prices. The heineken canal boat is also good fun.
Beer me. This is a great trip in Amsterdam definitely worth a visit!! It's good to get shown how to pour the perfect pint

Beer included. I have been here twice in the past 2 years and loved it both times. There is a lot to experience here and I think they have set it all out perfectly. At the beginning of the unguided tour it is mostly about the history of the Heineken family and how the brand came about. Then you move on to how the beer is brewed and you get to sample the wort which is the bit before the brewing process. I won't giveaway too much but you also get to go on a ride, play fifa on playstation, have a go at being in a rugby scrum and have multiple samples of beer at their awesome bar which is fantastic! I would thoroughly recommend it.
Fantastic Trip. The Heineken Experience is well worth a Visit, Its really good to see how beer is Brewed, And taking the Ride and getting Spitted on with Beer from the Pumps.

A really great afternoon. The tour was interesting and interactive. The Brew You Ride was great and after starting the tour as someone who didn't like beer, I was enjoying my pint of ice cold Heineken by the end :)

Great Experience!. The Heineken Experience really is an experience to remember and well worth the money. I bought tickets online before arrival which meant we didn't have to queue for tickets and were more or less directed straight into the museum. It is incredibly well set out and very informative. I would say one of the best brewery experiences. There is a taster section in which you are shown how to taste the beer properly and also 2 free drinks at the end of the experience in a bar area. There is also the option to get a bottle with your name on and also engraved glasses from the shop which are done by a very talented lady. Would recommend if you are visiting Amsterdam!!

Fun for Adults and even non-beer drinkers!. I am not a beer drinker and I joined my partner in this tour and we had a ball! It was really cool, they have a really unique and fun way of sharing their history and the teaching you the appreciation of beer. I really think that this was my favourite activity that we did in Amsterdam. Don't miss it!

UNIQUE. We have visited this brewery 3 times with friends and are already looking forward to a new visit.This is not an ordinary brewery visit but a life long rememberence of funny and very entertaining obstacels during your at least 3 hours tour.Fantastic tour fo a rainy day but go not later than 2 pm. They supply you with enough tokens to spend an hour in the also superb bar.
Fun but could do more. Great tour. Good but could explain or show more about brewing and bottling processes. Lots about history. Big shop at end disappointing as feels exploitative.

Highly recommended. One of the best museums I've ever visited! full of interactive and fun things to do, the museum is a fantastic way to spend a few hours. With a little information on the company's history, the highlight of the tour was of course the beer tasting! Highly recommend if on a break to this stunning city.
Interesting interlude.. It's basically a walk-through of the history of Heineken. The interactive "ride" is amusing and it is worth getting the burger and beer deal with your entrance ticket.

Something to do but nothing special. I did the Experience in 2005 and just now, 2015. I think the quality has gone down drastically. There were a lot of cool videos and explanations of the brewing process but half of the exhibits have changed in the last 10 years and I could care less about the new exhibits. One was sustainability which is a great message but they just missed the spot. Then the rugby and European football room nobody was engaged except a few kids playing fifa on PS4. Then there was a room that could only cater 8 people with seats. I don't even remember what was in there. Maybe the adverts from past years. Anyways, it is something to do in Amsterdam that is relatively PG rated for this city. I don;t regret doing it but wish they made every room fun for everybody. On a side note, their staff was great and friendly.

Beer up!. It is actually quite fun. Disney-ish I would say, but with beer allowed!So just buy your tickets in advance to avoid the line outside! Even if you didn't have time to buy it, just buy through your phone as soon as you get there. You do not need to print the ticket and it is actually cheaper online.Tickets are not that cheap but nothing in Amsterdam is... but with this one at least you get 3 beers and a souvenir at the end. It is also interesting for those who work with marketing, as they have a lot of rooms about Heineken campaigns.

Better than other reviews!. Had an amazing time here with lots of interactive elements to the tour...the boat tour as an additional extra is included in the price. With enough time to drink 2 bottles on the way around but you can't take your bottles off the boat! Also don't get an engraved bottle if your only traveling with hand luggage as you can only have 100ml of liquid in your bags!

Highly recommended to all visiting Amsterdam. Myself and 3 friends visited here on a city break to Amsterdam. We had heard great things from others about this place and we were not disappointed. We learnt a lot about how beer is made and what made it even better was the fact that you got to taste it! It was obvious that the staff who worked there clearly loved what they were doing and put so much enthusiasm into their part of the tour. There was lots of interactive parts of the tour which were fun. It is worth the money and certainly for the beer at the end.
Cute. Cute little tour. Not very informative. The Brew you ride is kind of silly. The interactive part at the end is fun.
Nice.... Nice experience. But nothing more than that. Nice to see all the phases the beer go through but... not for everyone. A lot of walking and way too many people inside. Nice experience...

Great fun experience, well worth it!. We booked the VIP Tour this time and were lucky enough to get Ryan, a very knowledgeable fun friendly bloke. We got to see different parts of the venue not usually on show as well as taste 5 beers matches to cheese, great fun and what a way to learn.More beer after and a lovely gift from Heineken, personally labelled bottles to take home.

Best brewery ever . So many interactive things to do at the brewery which made the experience so much more enjoyable than other breweries I have visited. The simulation ride was particularly fun as were the rooms where you could take pictures with the green screens. The history behind the brewery was interesting and we enjoyed a great beer at the end

A great afternoon out!. If you're looking for things to do within Amsterdam this attraction is fantastic. You learn all about the history of Heineken with plenty of "samples" along the way. Very good value if you book in advance as well. Only cost €11.

Well worth a go!. The Heineken Experience did not go into how Heineken as a company got started or about the history of the company itself, and was much more about how beer is made. Being well-versed in the process I was hoping for more history about the company itself (kind of like what Carlsberg has done with their experience), and less about the making of the beer... That being said, the VERY cheesy video and interactive floor to explain how beer is made was hilarious and we all loved it. There are a lot of very interactive parts of the experience, as well as a video-showcase of Heineken in the media throughout the years. The staff were great throughout the experience as well.All-in-all it was well worth the money and definitely worth doing, but don't expect much about how Heineken was started.
Good fun. This was more fun than I expected. I'm not a great Heineken fan but enjoyed a couple of drinks and felt it was worth the money!
Great time.. Standard destination for a stag do. Good fun and learnt a few new fun facts (take a proper swig to get past your beers foam and keep it foamy, don't sip).

Fun Visit. I like how it is interactive. The games are fun and everyone is smiling from the fun. I was there for about 40 minutes, and that definitely was not enough time. I would recommend at least 1 1/2 hours for this visit.

Enjoyed the whole experience.. Really nice people here. Enjoyed going through the old brewery seeing how it all is made. Then onto the stables to see the draught horses and carriages still used each day. At the end of the visit you go to a bar and have your 2 free beers, then you leave!! Its like a bar you would like to stay at, everyone is happy, just 2 beers & you are gone. It's great.

First-Rate Experience. The Heineken Experience wAs really not a big priority for us to see, but the day was very cold and raining buckets, do we decided to give it a go. VERY HAPPY we did! If you are interested in how beer is made, the history of an established company, their marketing past and present, you will be pleasantly surprised by this self led tour! Truly was fun!
Great place to see. A great experience over all, about the ins and outs of how it's made to the industry they built from the fields too the distribution around the world.

Good fun, Good Value. We absolutely loved this 'museum' it was lots of fun. The entry price was 18 euros but every leaflet that we got had some sort of discount on it, the best one we found was on a map which got us 3 euro off each. It was a self guided 'tour' basically. You got 3 areas of talking really. you got 1 small drink in an area where they tell you about the drink and if youre quick they ask questions and get them right you get another drink so be quick. then at the end you can have 2 small drinks or 1 bigger drink or you can skip that and do a 'pour your own drink' session. there were lots of interactive areas as well which were fun. the only criticism we had was there wasn't actually a lot to do with making the beer itself but lots more of the advertisement and collaborations that the company have done. which was all very interesting but perhaps not what many people would expect. we decided to 'bottle our own beer' and you get to print your name or phrase on it and collect it at the end for 6/50 which was a nice take away. overall we really enjoyed it nd it took a good few hours when you dont rush around.
Creative, educating, awesome!. It was such an experience! You have to try it out! Really! You cannot miss it. Very friendly staff, interesting performances, nice beer...

Solid beer-filled entertainment.. The place is a good way to spend an afternoon, especially if A'dam weather is uncooperative for outdoor activities. Need to book in advance, otherwise a long line at the entrance. The experience is fun and somewhat educating, the beer is cold, so never a dull moment.
Tourist trap. I wouldn't bother with this one. It would be better if there are different beers we could try but Heineken is just 1 taste so the whole thing felt a bit stretched.

Def worth a visit . My wife and I throughly enjoyed the tour. It had everything that makes a good tour for a young couple being some history, interactive activities and beer. Well worth a visit of your in the area!

Very touristy, but nice if you like the brand. I liked the first historic part of the tour, but the seconden part was much more about soccer and going out. Nice touch: you can get a sertificate of you Learn how to serve the perfect glas of beer! You need 2 of the coins you got at the enterance to do it, and you get to drink it yourself.
Super fun and interesting!. This factory is amazing. It is very interactive-- and you get to sample the beer. It was interesting to learn about the brewing experience. Super fun!

Fun afternoon. Thought this was going to be your standard museum but they made it fun with interactive games and photo ops. We went with friends and actually had a pretty fun afternoon here. Buy your tickets ahead of time to avoid the lineup. Once you get your two included beers, you can head upstairs for a beautiful view of the city and a great rooftop patio! A bar (and I think a small hamburger/fries joint) is upstairs if you want to buy more drinks.

Great. Before you go make sure you collect a discount voucher from either your hotel. Admission with a discount is £16. you will be given a wrist band with 2 tokens which you can exchange for beers at the end of the your.The tour itself is really good starting with the history of Heineken, you will travel through the beer making process and finish with the current product development. Good day out!

Not your typical museum . Such a great way to spend an afternoon! Really interactive experience which just kept on going! Not focused on making you spend money on things such as photo booths was so refreshing. Free beer tasting and ability to experience everything at your own pace and go backwards and forwards was a big plus. Really visual and sensory. Would avoid Friday/Saturday if possible as it can get really busy - the queue was enough to put us off until Sunday! Also buy tickets online or in shops before you go, skips the queue!!

Somewhat interesting . The tour was somewhat interesting but it was mainly an expensive way to get a couple of Hienekens. We pretty much wandered through the now disused facility and looked at the Heineken story but could have been better.

Interactive and Interesting. Really fun and exciting experience for beer lovers and pioneers alike! To be honest I had no interesting in brewing however I was surprised how much fun I had in the end, not too mention a few free beers.

Good way to spend an afternoon. The Heineken Experience is easy to find although I would recommend booking online in advance to avoid the inevitable queues. The experience is self guided so there is no need to wait for a tour to start. The first part of the tour is particularly slow going, on the history of the brand. The second half of the experience is without a doubt better. There is the 4D beer experience, where you learn what it feels like to be bottled, learning how to drink a beer and then some interactive sections. There are sporting sections for their rugby and football sponsorships, an opportunity to pour your own pint and then finally cash in your tokens for your free beer. The gift shop at the end is a worth a visit as well.

Recommended. It was very nice to see the history of this beer... i loved their presentation about the heineken generations and how the brand was developed through the years... they have a pretty creative way of showing you how the beer is made.. "you go in a theater and be a beer" ...i recommend printing your name on a bottle,, i did it and it will stay a great memory of my visit

The fun just kept on coming!. Had the absolute best experience here! Everytime we thought that the tour was over, something new and even better popped up! Very interactive and captivating. Definitely worth a visit!

Very interesting for lovers of beer. Reasonably priced and highly interesting experience. We also got a total of 3 beers whilst on the tour which went down well! We went on a Saturday which meant the queues were slightly longer. If you're not a fan of queueing I'd recommend going on a weekday to avoid the crowds. This didn't detract from the experience, however. Still a thoroughly enjoyable couple of hours!

Fun interesting tour. The tour explains the history, brewing process and marketing of Heineken. It is quite interactive with plenty of photo opportunities. The price also includes a beer or two to drink. You also get the chance to perfect pouring your own pint. Staff are on hand throughout to answer any questions. We took 1 1/2 hours to go round. A good option if it is wet or cold outside.

Well worth it. Think we paid around £10-£15 pound for this can't remember but I only remember thinking that it's well worth it. You drink Heineken most of the round. It's a good laugh. You do learn a fair bit about the drink and then a roof top bar over looking Amsterdam with beer tokens. That'll do. 3 hours of cheap entertainment with the boys, also tip... There is a name a bottle personalised thing it was €6..... This kept the Mrs happy who wanted presents back from a lads holiday...... So think on

Hic Hic. Brilliant Morning we took our time going round, lots of interesting facts and staff were very friendLy ..lots of photo opportunity , even a simulator ride to show you from start to finish how the beer was made, great fun and great beer

Great experience . I think this is hard to go past if you are a beer drinker like all beer museums you will get your money worth in beer at the end. But apart from others it is interactive and good fun allow 2 hours
Definitely go see it if you like beer. Very nice tour, with some smaple testing and 2 beers at the end, lots of things to learn and see, if you're in Amsterdam go and have fun!!!

Great fun two hours!. This was one of the most enjoyable brewery tours I have done. The tour itself took us over two hours as there is so much to keep you entertained. Mixture of demonstrations, beer tasting, videos, self directed tour and getting to see all the equipment. Also includes two free beers at the end. Great atmosphere and I had loads of fun, would definitely recommend!

First thing we did.... The first thing we did when we went to Amsterdam. You can get discounted tickets at the "Hop on Hop off" bus tours. Bit slow at start, but got better as the self guided tour went on. Only downside is you only get 2 beers at the end...guess that's responsible service of alcohol for you. Would be interested in getting the VIP tour next time.

An experience for the younger generation. Be aware that this is not a working brewery, the experience is heavily geared towards the younger generation, I thought it was ok but the under 30's would probably think it was excellent.

A lovely day out!. Even though I don't particularly like beer, my partner does and he really enjoyed this day. It was really interesting to wonder around and see how beer is made and the history to Heineken! There was a lot of different interactions and speaches to listen to aswell which was good, not to mention the 4 beers you consume on tour! I think we payed 18€ for the tour so considering a beer is usually 4€ and you get a day out too, it is well worth the money! Just a walk along the canal from the Heineken experience is vondel park and the hard rock cafe! So you can make a full day out and see some other sites

Not the best experience.... I was really excited to go to the Heineken Experience as it had been recommended to me by friends, and because I'm a big beer fan. The experience was very disappointing however. The place itself was packed, and as they let everyone in at the same time it got particularly crowded in certain areas, meaning that you couldn't read the information or hear or see the videos. In terms of information and stuff to do it was very poor. There was a badly constructed simulation, very little information, and short presentations by quite rude and unpleasant staff. After enjoying a free drink, the rest of the 'experience' consisted of fairly empty rooms, which looked like a club in which there were a few games - most of which didn't work. Yes the two free drinks were enjoyable - but there was no where to sit and was definitely not worth the money! Could definitely be improved - and should be.

Nice break. This was a very enjoyable way to spend an afternoon. Using some neat animation/simulation the visitor is told the story of Heineken and also some of the science behind making beer. The entrance fee seemed high but glad we went and after we were finished the entrance fee seemed reasonable.

Best brewery history tour ever. I really enjoy this tour. It was a lot more that what I was expecting, considering that I have done a few brewery tours back in South Africa. This tour was simply "WOW" from the historical displays of how Heineken beer started to a simulation beer ride, Heineken sports involvement and how the brand is in over 190 country's around the world. This tour is a must for beer lovers.
Day trip. Both my brother and myself enjoyed this interesting tour with a light beverage on a rooftop bat overlooking Amsterdam to finish the tour.

Loved the interactive tour. Not really in the beer but the tour was fantastic. You get to see every stage of how they brew the beer. You get to taste it and can even buy a bottle with your name on it.
In Amsterdam? Love beer? This is for you!. I finally visited the Heineken Experience and I was not let down. Loads of fun facts and free beers and laughs.
Fun hour spent. Definitely worth your while. What a fun experience! Should not spend more than one hour though.Lots of beer, informative, very friendly staff, fun atmosphere, and great gift shop.

Fun place to go.. A nice place indoor to spend an hour or two, especially in a rainy day and you need a good reason for a bottle of beer. Here all things about Heineken and its product were clearly explained. many thing to interact with when you come here. The staffs were young, energetic and very friendly, with good English (big plus!). You also have your chance to create and bring your own Heineken bottle home with your name on it. Don't miss the free Heineken shuttle boat in the end when you come out of the building and receive a nice glass from Heineken.

Great Visit. Good fun, interactive and well organised. The first half is a bit boring, but gets better. A must when in Amsterdam. We got there early with no queue. When we left around 2 hours later, it was very busy. Would suggest getting there before 12.

Fun . I am not a drinker and not young, but this place was still fun. It is designed with the x-generation and millennia's in mind.. Selfie spots with great backgrounds, make your own bier label, a karaoke spot plus the history. Difficult for special needs.
Really nice experience! . It was the most fun museum in amsterdam! The all experience in making the beer, and the technology into, it was really fun, and final they gave us a canal tour:)

Don't buy a ticket on the door. Buy a ticket from a 'tours and tickets' vendor I got a €2 discount and queue jump- which saved me about an hour I think. The self-guided tour was interesting- including interactive elements (how to pour the perfect beer etc.). There also was a 4D cinema showing the brewing experience. This was the only thing I queued for (only 30mins or so).

Loved!. From the history of the Heineken brand, to how to brew the perfect beer, to how to taste beer properly, this tour was very fun and informative. Staff are easy to understand and extremely helpful; they eagerly answered any questions we had. Boyfriend did it for the second time, and enjoyed it just as much as the first. Would do again.

history of heniken beer. Very friendly staff who provided a very through tour of the history and making the beer. A interesting ride through the brewing process of beer. It was a wonderful way to spend an afternoon learning about beer.

Fun!. I was a little worried as some reviews were quite harsh however my friends and I had a blast. It's got a lot of historical value and a lot of drinking. You get to understand why the Heineken beer is so special. There's a few activities, a little ride and photo opportunities, plus more beer. The gift shop is really lovely, a lot of nice stuff in the shop and we got a voucher to get a free glass at the Heineken brand store just a few stops away. Overall a great time out.

Excellent way to spend a day. Went round this attraction, took around 2 hours, but, it's definitely something you never think about, it's very interesting to see the full process & experience pulling your own beer

Loved it! . We went to this museum one morning and we had already bought our tickets online so we just walked straight past the queues and straight into the museum. There's loads to see and lots of photo booths ect where you can take pictures and get them sent to your email! I would highly recommend visiting the Heineken experience it was a great day out and you got free beer at the end of your tour, what more could you want?

Heineken History. Great value for a couple of hours tour around Heineken Experience. Even if you are not a lager drinker, it is still interesting to learn about the origin of the Heineken Brewery. The bonus at the end is two glasses of Heineken lager!

Very nuce experience . This was a very nice experience all through. The staff are very friendly and nice and you get a quick lesson in how beer is made and go through the heineken history. My favorite part is when i got to be the bartender.
Great tour. So much fun, a must do in Amsterdam. They got it right with this tour. Go to the sky bar if you get a chance.

Good for a visit. We were interested in the history of the beer and and how it is made so we thought why not visit. It was interesting but the history was a little short in its telling and the present more than adequate. The views from the top bar are great and certainly going to to enjoy a beer. All in all it is worth the visit.
Well worth the money. Great way to pass an afternoon, even if you have no interest in beer. Interesting to find out the history of the company.

Nice Surprise!. My expectations were not very high from this visit - what could be so fascinating about the making of beer?It turned out to be a fun experience that included passing information in a lively way, interactive demos, beer tasting (of course...) and some fun games that actually made us laugh.Spilling beer on my lap only made everything funnier. We had a lovely afternoon :-)

Good enough but somewhat underwhelming. It's a nice place to visit but not really a must-see if you're in Amsterdam. It's not much different nor more interesting than other breweries and you don't really see actual beer production, only props and other gimmicks.There is one of those video rooms with dynamic, moving platforms that simulate the action taking place on the screen but this is no Disney or Universal ride. The effects and buzzes on the moving platform are oftentimes disconnected from the action so the whole experience becomes underwhelming.
Heineken Experience. It was fun but really not 18 Euro a person fun. Most beer tours in the US are free. We did wait an hour to get our canal cruise, that did make up for the high price.

A fun destination with an interesting twist.. Heineken is a very good beer to begin with but here you get to see the entire process of brewing. There is a fun ride where you get to play the part of a beer bottle. An interesting film shows how the Heineken label was branded in order to become a world wide product. Would highly recommend this attraction as a fun place to go.

Very Interactive and Fun!. We didn't expect much more than a factory tour, and were pleasantly surprised.The tour was well thought out, with a guide to everything you need to know about barley and hops in the beer production process. with an interactive movie featuring you as the brew! Lots of videos and pics which can be forwarded by email, and a great rooftop bar where you can grab a burger together with all the free beer tokens you get with the price of admission.Go for the extra cold Heineken, not commonly available in bars!

Quite the experience. . You can't go to Amsterdam and not go to the heineken experience, especially if you like to drink. Fun tour that takes you through several levels of the factory, you get to see cool artifacts and you get to learn the history of heineken. Our tour ended with a 3rd glass of beer atop the Heineken factory, overlooking amsterdam.....you really couldn't ask for a better time.

My favourite museum in Amsterdam!. A friend told me to come to the Heineken Experience. The first part was more about the history of Heineken and who founded it and when it was founded. Then you go on to discover how it is made, how they used to make it and how times have changed. Then you get to taste Heineken and learn how to drink it properly. There are loads of interactive things to do and it's just a great museum you never want to end! There is a great bar at the end where you can get a free drink and buy more if you wanted to! Safe to say I was slightly tipsy by the end . We went on the free boat trip at the end which was fabulous and the staff were enthusiastic and great with customers! We took a break at the souvenir shop and headed back. Where one of the female staff were talking to us about what it's like to live in Amsterdam. Since it is so different to where we live in England. She also recommended places for us to go over the few days we were there!

Good place to visit especially in the summer. If you haven't been to a brewery before this is a good place to start. The Heinken Experience takes you through the beer brewing process in a number of steps with videos, demos, etc. At the end of the tour you get 2 small Heineken as a sample. As the weather was nice outside we had the opportunity to go to the roof top bar which was a grea idea. You have a great view over Amsterdam sitting outside and enjoying your beer.

Fun for once if you have a few hours. If it's your first time in Amsterdam and you've done all in your list; then I would recommend going to Heineken Experience. It's fun and good pastime activity for tourists; but the city is so beautiful, I would definitely prefer walking around the canals if the weather is nice and the time is limited. However, if you have enough time in the city or the weather is not that kind, then definitely check it out. It's not the best beer you can taste in NL, but good marketing makes it all interesting. You can get a Heineken bottle with your name on it, which also makes a nice gift instead of the good old city magnets.

A great day. We went with some friends we met while touring and weren't expecting too much on this rainy day. To our delight it was fantastic. So much to see and experience. Some history, interactive areas, games area through to the brewing process, and so much more.
We had a fantastic few hours here and could have stayed longer.
Good fun. The Heineken Experience is good fun and value for money too, highly recommend visiting here. Staff are very nice and friendly.

Awesome place!. Popped in to this while we were in Amsterdam. Good value for money and even got a free canal trip from one of the sales agents in the shop! Lots of information and history in the making of beer. Very interactive throughout and you can do it at your own pace rather than being dragged round. Beautiful rooftop bar with some amazing views of the city.

Brilliant couple hours and value for money . Wasn't expecting it be so great. We walked through the "museum" and it became more and more apparent how much there was to see and do. Just when we thought it may be finished, there was more rooms of fun and games. A brilliant ride/stimulator where you become a bottle of beer, really fun and informative at the same time- for all ages. You can play virtual Football, rugby, pull your own pint, beer tasting, free beer and you can buy your own customised bottle. We wasn't expecting such a great couple hours but we was so wrong as we had a brilliant time. The staff was excellent, funny and informative. Thank you Heineken!

A great value and wonderful Experience. In a city where most everything comes across as overpriced, the Heineken Experience is a terrific value. Fortunately it's also a lot of fun.Admission includes a tour of the complex- no longer a functioning brewery, but made to look like one. There are plenty of interactive exhibits including a beer tasting, which includes one of three free Heinekens you are treated to along the way. You are free to spend as long as you'd like inside, which could easily take a couple of hours. A rooftop burger bar is a nice option if you're looking for a quick bite to eat.Perhaps just as solid as the tour is the canal boat ride that takes you to the brand's store in the center of the city- this is included in your admission and is not only a relaxing way to get back to the main part of the city but also eliminates the need to buy a ticket from another operator for a ride through Amsterdam's waterways. Once back at the store, you are under no obligation to leave the area- just collect your free Heineken glass and be on your way.Very highly recommended.
Heineken. A bit pricey but interesting.MAKE SURE you use your free beer tokens on the roof top! Not like us squeezing and queuing in the first bar.

Maybe too old for this.. If you are age 40 and below--this would probably rank higher. We were a little tired by the time we did this, thinking it would be a great late afternoon experience. The initial part about Heineken and beer is interesting. After that you do climb around five flights of stairs and they have some interactive experiences which we are really not interested in. You get one glass of beer during the exhibit and then two at the end but there is no place to sit and drink. Maybe just better to go have a great beer at a cafe! The younger crowd seemed to be enjoying everything.
Great way to fill a few hours. Was very pleasantly surprised at how much there was in this museum/attraction. Very well thought out and a great way to pass a few hours.

Great way to keep Dad busy. The Heineken Experience is a great tour for the guys in the group of your beer lovers. They offer discount tickets which we purchased at the big bus tour location. It allowed you entrance into the brewery and gave you two free beers while there. It was a neat experience and Dad really liked it.
Nice. Was a very pleasant surprise to see what a multinational can create for his imagine. very good the tour, interactive actions, some games too.. And of course beer...

Awesome experience. I really enjoyed this tour, it's not a full guided tour, you can take your time on each step of it. You get to know the history of the company, the whole process of brewing, you can play games and, of course, taste one of the most famous beers of the world. At the end, the Heineken Experience also offers a guided boat tour through the main canals of Amsterdam, from the old factory to the brand store. I totally recommend this tour.

An experience not to be missed!. We weren't expecting too much from a visit to the Heineken Experience but how wrong we were. We were blown away by this attraction. Lots to see and do, plenty of good interactive experiences with a free photo and vid thrown in for good measure. Soooooo pleased we went along.

Definitely worth a visit. Went there with my husband, very informative and funThey have games you can play and very helpful staff happy to answer all the questions you might have or take pictures of you.In the price there are 2 small beers or 1 medium size beer plus a little tasting beer during the experience, if you answer their question correctly you might bag an extra little tasting beer.(please note this are european size not uk pints)You will be able to get pictures and video souvenirs for FREE by sending them to your email address, very impressed with that as usually they overcharge for a picture on the touristic attraction.definitely recommended, buy your ticket online or just before you go there and you will save an extra 2 euro per person.

enjoyed it. being the only lady on a guys holiday can often be a tad boring. Luckily this tour was so interesting it didn't give me time to be bored.We got ourselves a discount booklet from the shop on Dam Square so we all managed to get a good price.The highlight was obviously the 2 free beers at the end. Amsterdam can be quite pricey for beer. Some places charge 10 euro for a large one so if you knock this equivalent off the price of the ticket its definitely great value entertainment.We do prefer drinking white beers whilst in the Dam but hey ho Heineken was good enough for us

Definitely a game of 2 halves. I was quite disappointed with the first part of the tour, which was largely a self-aggrandising promotion of how good Heineken would like you to think their product is.The second part however certainly picked up with interactive displays of Heineken's involvement in sport.You get 2 tokens on entry for drinks, which can be exchanged for an opportunity to pour your own 25 cl glass, or alternatively exchange them at the bar - get one 33 cl glass or two 25 cl glasses of beer. As they say, you pays your money and you makes your choice but I know what I would prefer!
Great experience!. Such a great place. So many different crazy things you wouldnt expect! Definitely worth a visit even if you don't like heineken!
Worth going. Was told by a friend that when in Amsterdam to go to the Heineken Experience, great fun and loads to do! Staff are so funny and friendly! Thanks guys!

Definitely worth a visit. . I love my beer. And I also love Heineken..so this place was the perfect visit. You get to learn the process from start to finish on how it's made..as you beer the whole way round! So how could I complain? Would recommend this to anyone in Amsterdam.

e. Its is quite commercial, and to be honest I don t see much in the Heineken beer,( I find the local brouwerij 't ij way better), having said that, If you like to have an interactive experience it is worth it. Specially if it is raining and you don feel like walking around the city, this can be a nice scape for a day. Don t forget to visit the rooftop and check out the view, (they also have a tasty burger over there)
Nothing special. This is not (and doesn't pretend to be) a working brewery and the 'experience' is heavily aimed at the younger generation. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone over 30 years old.

It's a fun tour.. If there's a big brewery in any city i visit ,i will if possible try to tour it or just go check it out.When we were in Copenhagen we done the CARLSBERG tour ,that was amazing and when we were in Amsterdam the HEINEKEN tour was a must go for my twin brother and i.We hopped the team down and before going we had a lovely meal in CAFE BERKOUT just by the brewery and then we made our visit.What a great time we had,it's fun ,hey but beer is fun,there's so much to see and do,the big brew vat's,the old cart's,the brewline,the cool set up of the brewery and the information we got was really good and informative.The two glasses of Heineken at the end of the tour were superb and all in all we had a great two hour's in here.It's very easy to get to ,jump tram 16 or 24 to stop STADHOUDERSKADE and you cannot miss the very impressive imposing brewery.Opening hour's are;Monday to Sunday,10.30am till 7.30pm.Great brewery tour and well worth a visit.

Lots to see/do. Went with my boyfriend when we visited Amsterdam in feb, definitely worth it! Lots to see and interesting to see how the beer is made. Lots of little things to get involved with, photo booths, bottle making etc and of course free beer! if you're in dam it's a must see!

great fun and great brand. If you want to know a little more about the Heineken Brand, this is a must visit when visiting Amsterdam. great interaction with visitors and ocourse you can tast the product ;)

Fun day out.. We visited the Heineken Experience on a Sunday morning first thing so it wasn't too busy. We paid for the tour and burger deal.The tour took us around 1hr 30mins and it was very informative. There are parts of the tour where you do certain activities which makes it more fun. The beer tasting was fun, if we answered the questions right we got an extra beer, I ended up with 3!!!!.The burger we got was served up on the roof terrace which had great views over the city. The burger was huge but also lovely.After we had finished in the brewery there was a free boat to take you through the canals (about 20mins) to the Heineken store so you can collect your free glass.Overall a good day out.

It's the Heineken Experience. One of the highly recommended places in AMS, Heineken Brewery is much more than a brewery - it's a complete experience. Your experience starts with a historic view of Heineken manufacture, goes through the process of manufacturing Heineken, then to some beer tasting, some quick photo places, a 4D presentation, and ends in a bar which serves you two drinks. You then take a ferry ride to the Heineken store across town, where you can shop for merchandise. More Heineken is available for purchase on the ferry, so plan this trip when you are in the mood for a whole lot of beer!
Better than expected. Great experience but the end of the tour (where the bar is) is too cramped, there is nowhere to sit down if its busy. Our feet stuck to the floor like at a dodgy nightclub

Beer...beer...beer!. Near other attractions as museums, canals, restaurants and shops. The brewery show how it is produced and bottle. And you do experience it for a cost. A major attraction on what to see in Amsterdam! Worth a visit!

Fun visit . My wife and I visited here a few days ago while on a a break without the kids. We really enjoyed it actually. I am not a big drinker if I am honest so I was worried it would bore me, but it was still interesting and fun. I was able to learn about how the beer is made and also get involved in some of the interactive things there such as the various activities and games. I do think these parts of the tour would appeal to families!Overall, we had a fun couple of hours and enjoyed our beers on the top deck observatory with a nice view of the streets below. Recommended.

Go on your birthday . The museum is very touristy and don't go if you are looking for a detailed education on beer making like it used to be. BUT if you are a marketing fan or are looking for something fun and interactive, it is a blaat. Go on your birthday and they will treat you like a king (at least they give you a silly crown).

Fun interactive experiance. The brewery tour itself was a pretty standard tour, it was nice to hear about the history of the Heineken brand. The tour gets interesting near the end with interactive games and a little film which was pretty fun. If you've been through enough brewery tours already, take the elevator by the gift shop up to the bar on the sixth floor. Its free to get to the bar and here you will find sweeping views of the city, an amazing burger and of course all of the cold and extra cold Heineken you can enjoy.
Worth a visit! . The Heineken experience is definitely a must see when you visit Amsterdam! Very friendly staff and interesting information about the history of the beer! Great value for money!

Go with friends! . Nice atmosphere! And good beer.
It's a place to visit with friends and enjoy the vibes.
Don't forget to use the voucher for 1 euro discount on the ticket price.

Do it. Ok so I've done brewery tour I know what goes into beer how it's made bla bla bla. The heniken experience is much more buy a ticket skip the que then enjoy the ride. there's quite a few things to do in there and a good bar at the bottom.

It's not a tourist trap!. Although on face value it seems like this would be something to skip whilst in Amsterdam but it's not - it's definitely worth checking out!
I really enjoyed the "experience" and the interactivity. They also give out a few beers so what's not to like??

Something for everyone. I really didn't expect this to be interesting but it was and so much more. The experience is varied, interactive, informative, fun and tasty too. The staff are enthusiastic and of course there's a gift shop.

Young, fun filled experience. I went in wondering how much can you really do only being a beer. Was so surprised. They take though the history and the making of the beer in a fun way, rather than factual. There is a lot of different rooms and things going on, from beer drinking, music playing and games. Do think it's for younger people and those who love beer. There is a lot of loud music at the end and if its not your thing you might get annoyed. For a group of young friend, don't miss it.

Not to miss. I thought it would be one of those simple experiences like we did in Scotland since this ain't an actual running brewery, but I was absolutely amazed by the entire experience. Starting from the history to the 4D experience. The games were also pretty good. Try and take a couple of other excursions with this to avail a good discount.

Funny experience. We are drinking beer,not necesary Heineken but we were curious to see the original story of this beer.I did not had too many expectations and that's why I liked it.Some stories/movies of foundators,some explanation about beer ingredients...A room where you "can"feel the entire process of making beer!!and finally the tasting.

"Proost". Purchase your tickets in advance and skip the queues at the museum. You can also get a discount to this and other tours in the ticket office opposite Centraal Station. The tour lasts approximately 2 hours and includes a maximum of 3 small beers. Beware, if you decide to pour your own and get a certificate you will only be able to get 2 beers!A fun your which includes a simulated experience which is a bit of fun!
Must see!. We had the best time at the Heineken Experience, it was great to see how enthusiastic all the staff were who work there. We definitely indulged a bit when we visited.

Heineken lovers!. Amsterdam is known for its Heineken bottles been everywhere and so if you wants to understand it better you have to go to the Heineken experience museum. You can race through it and be done in about a half hour or you can take your time enjoying The beer and the exhibits and you'll be happier. They even offered cute souvenirs after you are done but be careful if you were planning to fly home with them because the airlines will not allow you to bring the Heineken bottle of beer on the airplane.

Surprisingly enjoyed it!. I have done a fair # of beer/alcohol tours throughout the world, some are very interesting and some are just plain boring! We both really enjoyed the tour, found it to be a fairly interactive experience. I think for 6 Euro we got a Authentic Heineken bottle label made up (Scott & Meg Amsterdam 2015). And one gets 2 free glasses of beer at the end of the tour. As well one can get a FREE canal tour on their Heineken boat! I believe it can pick you up at their Central station (not to be confused with the big bus.train station) And it takes you to the factory, and can take you back as well. On the way back, they give you a coupon for a FREE small Heineken glass at their merchandise store. I did find the store somewhat lacking in cool merchandise, they could do a lot better! Overall we enjoyed the tour, and the free narrated canal tour.

Eh. I guess if you like Heineken and are young.. It's definitely suited and focused more toward the younger crowd with the games and loud blaring music. The ride was fun. Overall, I'd give it a miss the next time around.

Be prepared for noise and crowds and some fun!. Busy brewery tour but it was worth it for the 2 free beers at the end. Heinekin has a very long history and it was interesting to learn about it. We bought a combined canal cruise and brewery tour ticket online. One thing, the bar where you get your free beers has VERY loud music!

All round amazing experience . The title of this attraction speaks for itself it every possible way. From the start, you have the history, all the way to the modern day of the beer and how it is now involved all around the world. I won't go into too much detail, but I'll just say that it was a fantastic experience and my second time doing it. I will say, that on leaving, don't miss the opportunity to get your Heineken canal cruise token, which is included and will take you back into the centre of Amsterdam. I will return to this attraction again, as there were new features being added as we were touring. Highly recommend this experience.

just something you gotta do.... I was super excited going here. It's something you got to do when in Amsterdam especially if you love beer. Sadly though I left feeling disappointed. It isn't an active brewery. It is solely for tourism and has lost its soul. Part of visiting a brewery is to actually see it work and this isn't what you get. Rather modernized attraction with even a 4D type ride & all the sponsorship glory. Worth a visit I guess but don't expect too much.

Go for the VIP Tour. As a beer enthusiast, I was expecting the Heineken Experience to be fun but standard. I opted for the VIP tour and it was totally worth it. From the minute we entered, we were treated like true VIPs. Our guide, Daan, was incredible - attentive, knowledgeable, fun and made us feel like we were really seeing a part of the Heineken brewery that few get to experience. We were taken to a rooftop bar and brought our first beer, while we waited for the rest of the tour. As we had only 3 people in our group, it was a truly exclusive experience. We got to skip ahead of the main tour groups, were taken to a private room to taste various beers and cheeses, taken on a canal tour, given a personalized bottle and glass and felt important throughout the whole tour. Daan really made the difference in creating a highly personalized, VIP experience and I would definitely go back again.

Red star quality.. We really enjoyed the Heineken Experience it was both factual and fun and you got the equivalent of three beers thrown in which is a bonus.Give yourself a couple of hours so you don't have to rush and find out the history of this Global Brand.Excellent gift shop as well which wasn't too expensive.

Brilliant...FANTASTIC. THIS PLACE IS AWESOME! You get to see how beer is made which is probably a new experience for most people and the production line is pretty wicked.Beer tasting is an actual thing?! Hell yeah! We tried some beer and the staff within the experience i.e. the tour guides were all really enthusiastic about their beer (well who wouldn't be? lol) At the end of the tour you get 2 beers which was really nice!There's also a few Playstation 4 consoles within the tour which have FIFA 15 on them - so we got to fit in a few cheeky games of FIFA whilst on the tour.All in all, worth the €17 :)

European Vacation. If you enjoy beer stop to learn how it is made and marketed. The tour provides the history of Heineken and a lesson on beer making. It was a great experience and at the end of the tour you can get two beers to drink.

It's a PARTY!. I'm was never a fan of Heineken beer but after this experience I am digging the beer. The tour was so much fun, informative and exciting! The VIP on the top is a must! You see Amsterdam in a different light and the lounge is very hip. I would totally do this again and that's because I've also done the Guinness tour in Ireland, it's not as fun as the "Heineken Experience" two thumbs UP

Great tour. A great tour with alot to see. The interactive tour is really fun ! You get at least 3 half pints during the tour which are nice and I would recommend the roof top bar for your free drinks at the end ! (Especially if the weather is nice.)Would go again in the future !

Excellent. I heard this was a great tour so I expected big things. It lived up to the expectations and impressed on all levels. And at only €16 each, I think it was good value for money. This is not your traditional brewery tour: it is fun, interactive and very informative in a not so boring way. From the moment you step in the door, prepare to be amazed! Entrance includes 2 drinks at the end of the tour, but you also get a glass before that in a tasting session. Even if you don't like beer, give this place a visit, as it is a good experience.

Enjoyable and intriguing. I went there with my friends and we realy had good time there.You get 2 heinken beers to drink and a very cool "pub" they have inside.The atmosphere is good and you really learn about the beer.i think its a must in amsterdam.

A bit boring - could be so much more, but you get some beers included.. We were out walking and it looked as if weather was about to change so we headed to the 'experience' ... queue was about 30 people ... and around 10 mins. It started to lash down when we were queuing - (staff did offer free ponchos) and the queue became very long as many thought like us to head indoors until weather cleared.The first part is quite long & boring, just walking past certificates & medals and frankly, not very interestingThe 'brewery' part is non-functioning so the coppers are set up with short films shown on inner walls.Would have been nice in they had at least a microbrewery set up.There is a stables - but you are kept some distance from the horses - needs better arrangement. There are quite a large number of metal stairs to climb, some quite steep - so may not suit anybody less able bodied.There is a Disney style virtual ride which is quite well done.All commentaries both recorded and form staff are in English.You get to 'sample' one beer with a lesson in how to taste it, and 2 'buttons'; that get you 2 small glasses of beer at the tour-end bar or up on the roof top bar.The latter does have good views over Amsterdam, where should you with you can also buy a burger or extra beer tokens.If its raining outside then this may be worth a visit, however I found far too many displays of certificates & medals, doesn't hold the interest. It was OK ... but would not go again.

Worth the visit!. If you haven't been to a famous brewery in your entire life, you should see this. Though the intial experience of the staff explaining how their beer is made, can be boring, you get a chance to drink their beer! Yes! The Heineken beer.

Okay. The Heineken Experience Museum is okay. Good explanation of brand history. Brewery room is interesting. Can see stables from afar. The Bottling Your Own Beer and Champions League Room were not interesting but the rooms are cool and flashy. Perhaps we will try the VIP package next time as the tour lacked passion.

Best experience. This is a MUST!!! Worth the money and a great experience, me and my partner enjoyed this so much! Learn a lot about how it is made, lots of interactive things and tasting of beer of course!!

Great beer! (And I'm not a Heineken drinker). We booked the VIP tour and it was worth the time and money. Our guide Lars was phenomenal. He was very informative and professional. If you're having any second thoughts about doing the VIP tour - just go for it! Hopefully you'll get Lars as your guide. Can't recall the time I drank as much beer as I did during the tour. The beer tasted fresh and not watered down. At the end of the tour you get a small gift which is a bottled Heineken beer with your name on it. I think the biggest chunk of our tour was spent drinking different types of beer and eating various cheeses - which was great!
Must do!. A fun, informative and interactive wander through the history of Heineken. Even my wife who does not drink beer was impressed.

Excellent place to spend a full afternoon!!. Top place for a bit of a laugh, a couple of beers and great roof top views of Amsterdam! Staff great and very helpful. Got on a free Heineken Experience cruise on the Canal after the Brewery which was awesome. I've been here 3 times now and will be going back again, on my next trip :)

Fun as well as interesting! . I highly suggest making this a stop on your trip!Before you go thinking that its just a big bar/club with beer spewing from holes in the wall... it's not. Actually interesting to see the history, how the company grew and how they make their beer. The first couple rooms are a bit basic museum-like with displays of all the medals and certificates the Heineken family received. Can be interesting but if you are there for the party, the experience gets better after that. Has many different fun things that you would expect from a Beer Factory/Museum!Best time to go is the first 2 hours of opening. Did not have a line, wasn't crowded, and wasn't full of excited and drunk young adults looking to party.
Interesting isit. A must see attraction when visiting Amsterdam. Very professional set up and learning experience even to the younger generation.

Recommended!!!! . We went to. The Heineken tour with big expectations, that were definitely true!! The tour is interesting and fun, it combines both learning and experiencing. Every bit of it was great. At the end we went up to the roof bar which allowed us to have fine beer while watching the entire city. Then we visited the nice gift shop. We bought our tickets online in advance, and paid 32 euro
Great time!. Really interesting and you get the freshest pint you can get! I wouldn't bother with the audio headsets not really worth it and takes away from the overall experience.

the best beer i've tried in my life!. that's a very nice tour, they explain you all the processes how they make the beer and how to drink and taste it, while you do the tour they give you three small beers which are include in the price of the tiket. the taste of the beer is just amazing, you can feel the freshness of the beer and smell the barley in the air. it's a very nice experience to do if you go in amsterdam.

Fun and Interactive. I love this attraction! I would seriously do it all again!.I wasn't expecting much, but it was so much fun and lots to play with. Just to name a few- 4d simulator, playstations, rugby scrums, labelling your own beer, drinking beer!!We were shown up to the rooftop which had a live music and amazing views of Amsterdam.

Interesting and fun (and free beer)!. I really enjoyed my trip to the Heineken Experience. It was very interesting, well laid out and best of all fun! There are lots of interactive elements to the experience which make it very enjoyable like Brew You Ride and the rugby room. I also knew a lot more about the beer making process by the time I was leaving than I had when I came in! I would definitely recommend a trip to the Heineken Experience!

Geared toward the young. If you only have a few days and do not adore Heineken, than this may be just and average experience in Amsterdam. The brewery is historic. The is tour full of games and ads geared toward the young. The beer is tasty however.

As brewery tours go its ok. The experience sort of feels like an idea that was never fully realised. It's fun, fairly informative but lacks passion or excitement. The story of Heineken is fairly simple and straightforward, the informative bit is short and sweet then you find out how beer is made there is a small tasting space then on to the adds and commercials before you get to the grand finally and get your Heineken. The burgers are not worth it, we found them lacking. For a simple fun easy afternoon its ok. Some people had kids but it seemed a bit odd and there isn't much for them. There is big queue for this and they only had a one person processing tickets to keep the flow steady. Defiantly worth booking in advance.

Brew You!. A fun, interactive tour of the Heineken Factory. Not just the history but lots of interactive things to do as well. Plus great offers when booked online, you can get up to 3 free drinks! We had 2 + poured our own at the bar & got a certificate for a souvenir.

Excellent Tour!. My family (adults 25 and older) and I visited Amsterdam and our first stop was the Heineken Experience. To be honest, I thought it would be like other brewery tour I've taken: history of the company, how to make the beer, try samples, and you're out. My assumption was completely wrong and I was blown away by my experience. We had a lot of fun. The black light room, the chance to be a DJ, the 4D ride, "kicking" a soccer ball, and having a chance to pour our own beer... everything was GREAT! The woman that taught us how to pour the beer was full of energy and had us laughing the entire time. You could tell she loved her job. Everything about the tour was outstanding and I highly recommend it to others. I will definitely visit again the next time I am in Amsterdam. I wasn't a Heineken drinker before, but I am now.

Great value for money. Fun, interactive, interesting and great value for money! Two beers are included in the price, as well as a sample beer during the tour. I recommend having your beers at the rooftop bar (and getting a burger too)

A fun few hours. The heineken experience is similar to other brewery tours of its kind! It was an interactive and enjoyable experience! I turned up at 10.30 am which happened to be when it opened - this was a great time to arrive as queues were to a minimum! The only thing thats a negative would be the price seemed a bit steep for a self-tour!

Fun, but a lot of marketing.. More or less a commercial for Heineken, but still a fun experience. The beginning was definitely the most interesting with the history of the brewery, at the end it was more a show-off of the brand. All of the staff inside were informative and fun, that added to the experience. Tickets include two beers in the bar at the end of the tour.

Nice time. Just another great recommendation from TripAdvisors top things to do wile in Amsterdam. My girlfriend and i stopped at the Heineken Museum to check things out. At about 17€, you get a lot of bang for you buck. As soon as you walk in you are greeted by a really friendly member of the staff pointing you in the right direction. There was no line or que to get in so there is no need to arrive early and wait. Once you pay you receive a free souvenir rubber bracelet that has two buttons on it that are for 2 free beers at the end of the tour. The tour starts off with a video into the history of Heineken which is very informative. You glance past a lot of old heineken memorabilia. The tour takes you through 4 or 5 different rooms, ranging from the old brewery that has the old copper stills, to a room where you can play a dj in a room with black lights. You are able to see they boil malt and try different types if hops. At the end of the tour you are able to practice you beer pouring skills as you enjoy free beer. A lot of interactive stuff to keep you occupied.

Great time!!!. This place was a lot more than I expected. We went the same day we arrived in Amsterdam. I thought it would be something to kill a little time.
