There were so many different things to do. There was a lot of history the of Heineken, plus games, pictures, beer pouring and of course beer. I wish I would have gotten the name of the young lady that oversaw our beer pouring. She was great! She made it fun and you can tell she enjoyed what she was doing. We had a great time and drank quite a bit of beer. Would definitely do it again when in Amsterdam!!!

Genuinely enjoyable, not just naff and for tourists I promise!. I am a beer fan, so the Heineken Experience was a must-see while I was visiting Amsterdam. The Heineken Experience is a self-guided tour through the history of Heineken and all about how the beer is brewed, through to the modern day where it immerses you in the experience of the Heineken brand.The Heineken Experience does attract a lot of young tourists, and yes it is trying to sell you the Heineken brand throughout. But it's not just a gimmick - it's a fun experience, with plenty of information and interaction. For example, the horses that traditionally pulled the carts with the barrels, and the 4D 'ride' where you imagine being a beer bottle was good, light-hearted fun.Another good thing is that they are pleasingly generous with the beer! I think officially you should get 3 glasses of beer (which is plenty, and more than I might have expected anyway!) but I got handed an extra one by the staff too. So it felt generous and good value for the cost of the ticket.My main criticism would be that the only beer you can drink is standard Heineken. The Heineken company do make a few other, less known, varieties, but they were quite distinctly absent. That's in contrast to the Carlsberg brewery in Copenhagen, for example, where I definitely tried 3-4 different drinks out of a range.I do recommend buying your ticket online. I went during August, when even at an off-peak time there was a small queue to get in, but my online ticket meant I could skip it. So worth doing.
Stop, it's heini time!. Been here 4 times now. Becoming a bit of a tradition on our regular trips to Amsterdam. Experienced the rooftop bar on our latest visit which has beautiful views of Amsterdam.

Engaging and Interactive self-walking tour . Not just a boring museum that depicted the history and evolution of the brand and product just with visual aids. The different stations are engaging, fun and interactive, very different from another beer museum I've been to before. Worth a visit!

An interesting visit!. A good afternoon out culminating with two free beers on the roof top terrace overlooking Amsterdam and the canals.
Staff were friendly and helpful. The museum interesting and well thought out.

Self promoting gimmick. Was looking forward to going having not been to a brewery before but was disappointed when I left. Expensive to get in and not all that interesting nor fun really bar a few bits which were ok. 3 'free' schooner sized beers which tasted watered down to me and not poured well, just poured quick. The bar where you drank 2 of them was very dark and busy therefore nowhere to sit.All seemed a bit of a gimmick to help promote their drink, brand and make a bit of money in the process. A Cadbury World for grown ups if you like.I have since been to 2 other breweries (Purity, Two Towers) which are much smaller but their tours were much more informative, interesting and had more great drink during and at the end. Basically what I expected of a brewery tour.There are better things to do in Amsterdam so if you're visiting spend your precious time/money elsewhere.

Beery Good. Whether you like Heineken or not, the Heineken experience is fantastic! You take a self guided tour through the factory and there are plenty of activities to enjoy along the way. You can even personalize your own bottle of beer! Lots of fun and good value.
It's really an experience . I'm a marketer and I'm interested in advertising a lot. This experience tells a lot about how Heineken was brewed and branded. They even knew how to make it an experience.

Worth a Visit. First thought it would be same as a whiskey Distillery in case you have visited it.. But this experience was different, We never thought there would be such a big queue for the same.. Apart from the tour.. you get to taste the beer on the tour... Good thing about the attraction is you can take a memory home by buying a beer mug with your name on it..

Worth a visit . Definitely get your tickets in advance, the queue is not worth it! Once inside it's your standard walk around and read stuff but then it gets interactive! Make your own beer, practice your football and rugby skills and drink a Heineken! A visit to the roof bar is a must, the views over the city are incredible!

Good fun. It's actually quite interesting to walk around and see how it all works! They have a lot of original equipment in there in great condition.Unfortunately when we went a lot of he interactive parts of the tour were not working so we couldn't use them. The ones that did work didn't work particularly well. It is definitely in need of a bit of maintenance!!You get two tiny glasses of beer at the end of the tour (unless you answer some questions correctly in which case you might get a few more). The shop is quite good and worth a visit at the end too!

Cool place. We really enjoyed the interactive attraction they offered to us, you must stop by and enjoy it too, plus you get 2 drinks with every ticket and the view on the top bar is juts incomparable. Just timber to buy the tickets befor and you don't have to wait on line.
incredible beer experience. If you like beer, this is one of actrações that you can not miss , we learned about the joiner and always with a cold Heineken!! I recommend

Take the VIP Package. We chose to take the newly introduced VIP package.Well worth the money. Our guide, Jaap, was friendly, chatty and very well informed. He had much more information to give us than is available on the normal tour.The "experience" is super - some of the lighting effects are tremendous - no spoilers - go and see for yourself. The special beer and cheese tasting was superb. The Henri Willig cheeses matched to beers were excellent.Personally, I think the addition of bitterballen would have given the tasting the absolute Dutch touch. One nice point - we were a little early so the greeter guided us to the bar for a small beer while we waited.It was a really good tour and lots of fun. Highly recommended.

Interesting . Excellent tour can't fault it
Especially on a rainy day.
A must for all age groups.
The history and even the future of the products.
Fun experience. Excellent value and a fun experience, particularly for younger people (18 and up). It had quite a few interactive games and even a ride as we got make into beer.

Educational !. Came Here with my mum and we had alot of fun! All the little games and pictures you can do and get taken here are just fun! You learn how the beer is made, what makes it so special and makes you appreciate it a little but more , the staff here are very helpful and something that I found amazing is that they still use horses to deliver the beer around the centre of Amsterdam ! Which is just great and makes it that little bit better, keeping the original traditions , would definitively reccomend !
Tour. Outstanding. Must do for any beer enthusiast or lover of the beverage! Interactive and informative. Go there on your birthday and you get a nice gift too

Cheers !!!!. Great value for money. Well worth a visit and a lot more interactive than I thought it would be. Two free beers 25 cl included plus a 25cl taste on the way around the experience. Would have given it 5 stars if the free drinks reached the top of the glass !!!!
The boys loved it!. My 2 sons and hubby were happy they went - said it was a lot of fun! Interesting and informative. I went to the Van Gogh museum at the same time. Mom happy and boys happy :)

Excelent. If you like beer, this is a must place to visit in Amsterdam. The price you pay includes pretty much three glasses of heineken, plus you get to know a little bit more about how its made and its history.

Heineken Fun!!. I just loved it. I thought it was just going to be a marketing kind of thing, with just a few historical info, a couple of beers and a shop but I was wrong! They have created an Experience!! You get to enjoy heineken with all your senses, play games, learn a lot about the Heineken family, the beer Heineken and its making and it is endless. The moment you think that it ended, there is more! It cheers you up. I don't want to give details, you have to experience it. I would recommend it to everyone! Loved it!

I'll drink to the Heineken Experience!. A really enjoyable and educational visit. Even if you don't drink, it's worth a tour (you can have soft drinks at the end instead).All the staff were very friendly and happy, they took time to speak to you and were proud of working for Heineken.The tour is at your own pace, with a fair bit of walking and stairs. There are interactive parts to the tour as well, which is great for the kids.. big or small! For the Big kids (18+ years) you can learn how to pour a real pint and for the younger ones, you can do it 'virtually'. They also explain why you should always have a head on your lager.We all really enjoyed the tour. I'd go back again, as there is so much information that we didn't manage to take it all in.

Beer making experieince. One of the finest beer making companies, the tour of the factory is a very nice experience. It took around 1 hour for the entire tour. Beer lovers should definitely go and visit this factory.

Interactive experience !. Know about beer brewing without getting bored. All most all the section was interactive so that you dont get bored. The people were really nice . Lotta games + beer ! Must visit.
Gimmicky. If you know about the brewing process in general already, skip the tour and just head straight to the rooftop bar. You can enjoy a Heineken and get great views of the city!

not too sure. I think the underlying statement is if your interested in beer, go... If not definitely don't go! I went with my friends and didn't really enjoy it as i think it was a bit overpriced for what it was

Good local bear. We went to Heineken Experience at the end of July. We went there by bus and took off at the Station near by. It is also accesable with boat on Canal cruise on Heineken Experience station.We went there on Friday. There was no so much people. But we have bought our tickets via Internet, specially to avoid crowed, and the entry was 2 euros cheaper.First you walk through a sort of museum. Everything is supported by media (you can also use an app for your smart phone). After a short walk through the history, there is a man showing how the bear is made and after that you can also try the sweet mixture of bear. After that is a nice film, as you are in th middle of bear, with 4D effects, which we find is very fun. After that comes the bear teasting, and lots of fun stuff, including the picture making, football playing, so a lot of new tehnics involved,We found this experince very fun, but you can see that bear is no longer produced in this building. So it is just like any other tourist attraction.

Love the experience . This is an amazing experience, the staff is very happy and the all explanations are very good. All the areas are very beautiful and well decorated. The video of the "being a beer" it's very funny. At the end you have an offer of beer.

A must-do for explorers of the world!. Go there, smell the brewery, touch the vintage tanks and hear the story of Mr Heineken. This is not only a place for beer-lovers but also a place for people who want to learn how brewing is done. Through your visit listen carefully. If you do so, at the end of the visit, you can get yourself more beers that you have ever imagined!Have fun and say hi to Mr Heineken!

Good fun. Spent a couple of hours here and it was very informative and enjoyable way to learn the history and making of the iconic beer. Entrance fee includes a couple of glasses of beer as well as a glass (or more if you get the answers right) at the end. You get two tokens make sure you take them up to the rooftop to exchange for a fantastic view of Amsterdam with great photo opportunities.

Almost Free beers. A long walk through this to get to the beer. Make sure you answer the questions correctly after the ride and you get free beers. It was very much tailored to self-advertising of heineken but we knew that going in.
Great. Good attraction. Not to expensive either. Good demonstrations and history of Heinkein brand.Amazingly no ridiculous queues.Thumbs up from us

Fun, informative and some beer!. My wife and I have just returned from a weekend in Amsterdam and this was one of the places we visited; we thoroughly enjoyed it.Great fun, lots to see, a 4d show as part of the tour followed by a beer, intereactive parts of the tour, more to see then two more beers which can be redeemed against the two tokens buttoned onto the wristband handed to you on entry to the attraction. We headed up to the roof terrace to enjoy our beers and paid extra for a burger which was also great.Tip: Do book online, don't queue - cheaper and fast-track entry past the queues.Another note - the website says you need to print your tickets - you do not need to print them, you can save e-tickets to your phone and present your phone for the barcode to be scanned at the front desk.

Great heineken experience. My friends and i simply loved and heineken tastes excellent! I am a person who usually does not drink beer however heineken tastes so refreshing that i could not resist! Furthermore the tour takes about an hour but with the activities and shopping we spent around 3 hrs. I would suggest that you would order your tickets online so that you would not need to wait. Great work and experience overall.

Easy smooth tour . I've been on a number of distillery tours and this one has to be one of the better tours. I'm not even a fan of the beer but felt the tour was better organized and informative than others. They have a stand in "ride" where you get brewed by simulation. You get a small beer for tasting then you get two beers in the end. (Unless you choose 10 more cl and colder beer) . Buy your ticket online for 16€ instead of 18€ at the door. Happy travels!
Fun. It looks expensive at first sight, but you'll get some glasses of beers in return. You will spend a lot more at gift shop. They have nice things.

A real beer attraction!. I have been here due to the weather condition, and i discovered a real world beside the Heineken brand. You can touch with your hands the way in witch this factory has grown during the years, and see how the beer has made. There are also many fantastic attractions like the show with effects that represent how the beer has made, show that surrond you with real special effects. Strongly advisable expecially for young people.

A must.. Recommended by a friend. So glad I went, staff were all friendly.Which always makes a good visit. Found the whole experience really interesting. The gift shop was well worth a visit :) a couple of drinks thrown in as well.

Fun. My girlfriend and I decided to do the Heineken tour because, well, its a tour of the Heineken Factory! It reminded me a lot of the Coca-Cola experience in Atlanta. They give a lot of information on the history and what goes in to each bottle. There are interactive parts and tastings as you walk through. Glad I did it the one time, probably wont ever need to do it again. My favorite part was the Clydesdale stable on site!
A good afternoon. If you like to past time with friends , drinking beer and eating burgers , this is a place to go . İnteractive games are so fun

I expected much more. We were 3 friends and we thought it will be very special but we felt it was nice, a good place to go for a hour or two but nothing special. You see the place, history, not enough beer for you to make it feel worthy. It was nice but not more than that
Fun!. It's a good way to kill a couple of hourd with friends. Although not much in terms of substance. Felt slightly overpriced for what you get

Surpringly good fun. Didn't think this would be my cup of tea but I actually really enjoyed this. There's lots to do, like trying the beer, watching it get maid, 4D experience, sending photos home, and seeing the horses and machinery. It was on the pricey side, but so are all tourist attractions. Loved it but don't feel the need to go again as they cover everything and don't rush you.

Amusing. I'm not much of a beer-lover by any means but this was something I felt necessary to do while in the country. The words-on-plaque section at the beginning of the tour describing the history of the company didn't quite flip my switch, but the rest was great. It picked up for me when the gentleman described the process of making Heinekin and where different colors and tastes come into the mix, followed by the amusing video guide of "brewing yourself." The rooftop was a fun location to sit, talk, and watch the skyline so I can't complain.

Interesting, varied content and good beer. Be sure to get a discount voucher for this. Or a sightseeing trip that included entry.It starts of with the history of the brewery, followed by some theme-park entries, info on how they make Heineken and how you should drink it. At the end they focus on all events sponsored by Heineken.You will 3 small beers included, and can buy additional ones for 2,50. We sat on the roof of the building and had several beers in the good weather. We spent 3 hours there.

Worth the tour for any drinker. I did not enjoyed it personally as I anticipated. It is a self guided tour with some games during the tour. You can also have your name on a bottle of Heineken for around 7euros.You get two small glasses of beer at the end and you have a burger with it at an additional charge of 7.5 euros. I recommend you buy your ticket before getting there as the queue can sometime be long.
Heineken experience. Worth a visit. Free beer lots of things to keep you entertained including pouring your own pint. A 3D cinema. Pre book to avoid the queues!
Interesting!. Fun tour, lots of interaction from guides. Good history if you're interested in that; if not, some beers are included!

Heine-can recommend this!!. A great brewery tour, even for my girlfriend who doesn't like lager. Starts with a very interesting story of the history of Heineken. Followed by a guide to brewing with tasters en route and bottling. A funny interactive journey is then concluded with a 'how to drink' lesson. 2 drinks are included after this with loads of interactive games and amusement and Heineken sponsorship games. Can't stress how good this was. Book at an excursions shop for 2€ discount.

Great time with Friends! . Having visited the Guinness Brewery in Dublin many times, I was excited to visit Heineken. It didn't disappoint. You get a chance to learn some fun beer history and do silly things like take your picture with the Heineken Champions League Cup (digital version)! You also get TWO pints included in the price plus an additional tiny "pint" for tasting purposes. It's a great visit and lots to do. It's centrally located and worth the visit.

Worth a look around. We queued for 30 mins to buy tickets here on a Saturday afternoon which wasn't so bad, but you can buy tickets in advance at booths all over Amsterdam to save time. We wanted the €25 euro ticket that gets you an extra drink and burger in the rooftop bar. The burger and the roof bar were great, the tour itself is mildly interesting but mostly made up of Heineken adverts!

A little expensive . For 18€ each for a self guided tour we thought it was pretty expensive. Although we were sold on the fact that you get 2 free beers (hoping they were pints). The history of the museum and the brand was interesting and they did an ok job at keeping us entertained throughout. We learnt how beer is made and took some pretty funny photos.However, when we got to the free beer part, the terrace that they told us was open when we arrived closed early for the day so we were left enjoying our very expensive free beer in a dark, sticky and uninspiring bar in the basement. Which after our drinks conveniently lead us to the gift shop where you could buy overpriced Heineken things and get your name engraved in a glass or a bottle (if you're into that kind of thing). All in all it was an interesting trip but over priced for what you got. I'd recommend you visit, but try and get discounts online or through a tour operator. Took us 1.5 hrs.

Great afternoon in Amsterdam. A fabulous experience and a great afternoon. (Also available and suitable for children, who are free entry). A well organised interesting and informative tour, with a few beers along the way :-). I would recommend getting tickets before going at one of the many ticket outlets round Amsterdam or at the Heineken brand store by Rembrandtplein. You save 2 euros, and avoid what can be large queues. The tour comes with a free canal boat trip to the brand store. It is short but worth doing as well, especially if you are only here for the weekend and don't have time for a full canal tour. You can pick up the boat tickets at the exit of the tour. You also get a free beer glass at the brand store at the end of the boat ride.

Pint of larger and a packet of crisps!. This is well worth a visit! Not only if you enjoy lager and its evolution but the overall connection it has with sporting life. You can see the mechanics of the process, the overall pride of the produce with lots of sporting, computer interaction. There is a simulator which is quirky and of course the sampling!

If you have the extra time. I wasn't so impressed...I think it's nice experience, but nothing special. Cold, fresh Heineken is great, and the place also, but too many tourists and a little bit too pricey and overated. It was definetly a "Heineken experience"

Beers history has never been so fun! . This place is amazing. Every visit to Amsterdam is come here. Not just for beer lovers, people of all tastes can enjoy this tour. Plenty of interactive exhibits, this is more than just a museum. 3 free beers during the tour including showing you how to pour the perfect glass. Free gift at the end included in the ticket price. Bravo Heineken, this is definitely an experience not to be missed.

A must go place in Amsterdam. . If you've been to Amsterdam and haven't been for the Heineken Experience you've missed onto one of the most amazing place you could've been to. Worth every penny I paid and if I go back to Amsterdam I would definitely go back to the Cafe at the top of the Heineken Building.

Mostly an advertisement. The beginning part of the tour was just an advertisement for the beer. Later, however, we were able to see where and how they used to make it. There were a couple of clever, entertaining presentations, but we were disappointed not to be able to see the actual process. The free samples were a nice touch, but I wouldn't repeat the experience, certainly not to get the beer. It would be much less expensive to go to a pub and get our own.

Surprisingly enjoyable, very good layouts and loads of interactive activities.. Not a beer fan. But i can say this is far better than Guinness store here in Dublin. We really enjoyed the visit. There was a live band too at the top floor. This is so worth it for EUR16. I even enjoyed my free glass of Heineken - taste so fresh and light. Taste different from the bottled. If you have spare time (at least 2 hours) and budget, do this! You will be surprised too - you will enjoy this visit.

Really enjoyed . The Heineken experience turned out to be, together with the zoo, the best attraction we visited in Amsterdam.The tour is fun and very interesting, full of activities and nice tasting experience.The rooftop bar must be visited too!
Once in Amsterdam, you should go!. Awesome!!!!Good infrastructure, friendly staff and I had the chance to enjoy the city by boat, drinking Heineken!!!!

So worth the money!. Visiting in Aug 2015, on a sunny day, it was great fun, educational and so worth the money! You do the tour in your own pace, everything is in English and all the guides and staff speak Perfect English! I believe headsets with different languages are available. Games like FIFA, fussball, 4D simulator ride, goal shooting and scrum games throughout. Lots of photo opportunities and beer tasting is included. We booked the 'tour and burger' standard ticket for €25pp. This includes, the tour, half a pint of Heineken during the tour, another two half pints of Heineken (or Amstel, wine or soft drinks), a wristband (with the drink tokens on) and a FANTASTIC freshly bbq'd burger and another (half pint) beer! We had our beer(s) and burger on the roof terrace, with a beautiful view of Amsterdam, on stylish outdoor sofas, enjoying the sun! Overall, I would say very worth the money, and I would do it again (for the beers and burger!)

Great experience, even for non beer drinkers. My husband loves Heineken and I don't drink beer at all so my expectations were quite low. I was pleasantly surprised at how great the whole self guided experience has been put together. There are massive lines outside so it is probably best to prebook your tickets online, but the queue moves pretty quickly either way. Your entry also entitles you to get 2 free beers per person, and there is also a complimentary beer given at some point in the tour. Would definitely recommend it for the guys, and it's not too bad for the wives and girlfriends either.

What was there not to enjoy!. As a beer, lager, alcohol drinker, I just had to visit the Heineken Experience.
I really enjoyed wandering round, reading about the history of Heineken, the brand, the factory, the couple of included-in-the-ticket-price Heineken drinks and glasses.
Even if I wasn't a lager drinker, I think I'd have still found it interesting to walk round.
better than expected. worth a visit, you get a few beers as you walk round and the view from the top at the end of the tour is a must

Boring museum but great burger. It's not much of an experience, you walk thru rooms with videos being shown on screens and quite unorganised because you could reach while another group is half-way through the video. But we got 2 free beers (ask them for 2 because usually theyll give u only 1) and we tried a great burger on the room bar which was very nice.

Absolutely fabulous!. Heineken was mine and my partners favourite experience. There was so much to it. Not boring and very stimulating! We loved the free beer, the bottles you can customise for only 6.50 euros and the gift shop is amazing.Cant remember how much it was but we spent about 2-3 hours there and had a great laugh, the staff are brilliant and use beer to get everyone involved. Really informative too.A must see if you're in amsterdam!

Very Different and Unique. We visited on our last day of vacation. If using an I Amsterdam card, be sure to present before paying. There is a 25% discount. This experience reminded me of spending time at Universal Studios. You learn about the history of the Heineken's, learn about making beer and even get to visit the stables of the famous Clydesdale horses. The bracelet you buy at the entrance is good for two drinks. Just unsnap the button. There are areas that include commercials, disco bar, games, and 4D experience. There is also a tasting room where you learn how to use your senses on a recently made batch of beer.

Great afternoon spend. Definitely worth a visit if your in Amsterdam! The experience is great value for money! Tour takes you through the ages of Heineken and ends with beer tasting, what more would you want! Shop is also very good, worth also taking a trip to the shop nearly the centre. Overall very enjoyable experience
Awesome experience, will do it again.. Great price, awesome experience, fresh beer, nice people. If you are in Amsterdam, you must do this activity.
Fantastic must do tour. :) . Great experience, good fun and to top it off a couple of scoops at the end. Burger on the rooftop was decent and at €16 euros it's a must.

American style experience . Was a nice visit. Make sure to get your tickets ahead of time to avoid the line ups. We found it a.little too crowded but learned some great facts about beer and beer sampling.

Take The Rooftop Burger Option. There are discounted entry vouchers all over the place for here, like €1 off entry or something similar of you are really watching your budget. I highly recommend taking the rooftop burger option for €24. It was one of the best burgers I'd eaten for some time and for the small price extra, including another drink, it was well worth the money.The tour is fun for both beer and non beer lovers with things to entertain you as you go around. As with most top tourist attractions, encountering coach tours would make this unpleasant as you try to take everything in. Download the free tour app (free wifi) and listen to parts rather than have to read and it also asks you a quiz question in some sections.You get a small glass of beer half way round to demonstrate the correct way of drinking beer and then you exchange tokens at the end for more. You can either have 2 standard pints or 1 pint of extra cold (I'm a sucker for a cold one).As mentioned the burger was great and they had live entertainment up there who were really good.The shop has all things you could possibly want but might be worth waiting...(keep reading)Take the free boat transfer to their branded store, beer available to buy onboard, think it was €2.50 a bottle, and listen to techno remixes of the Beatles. There's a game you can play in the shop where you can receive discount vouchers of up to 20% and its free to play. You also get your free gift of 2 small Heineken glasses though I was disappointed that they were the small ones and not the modern Heineken logo. Would have loved a pint glass. If you pick up a boat leaflet for the experience shop and spend over a viewing amount you can get more glasses for free. Shop also has Amstel & Desperados merch. Fitting room available. Worth bearing in mind the shop is smaller than the experience one so less choice.

Interesting but expensive. You learn a lot about the history of Heineken and the family. Its also nice to see how the beer was brewed in the past. You can watch a short 4d film just before being told how you "should be drinking Heineken". You can also learn to pour the perfect beer from a tap. Finally end it off with a couple of free beers with your mates. In summary, quite fun but too expensive.
Well worth a visit. It's modern, informative and good fun. It's definitely worth going to when in Amsterdam for a short visit but pre book your tickets if you're going at popular times.
Fun and enjoyable!. I truly enjoyed this. Fun facts, how it was made, and some cool stuff. Of course the free beers that comes with it. Such an enjoyable experience.
Great Tour. Well worth the price, you get a decent amount of beer on this tour. There is a 4D ride, taste testing, and a decent amount of interaction.
loved it. one of the better brewery tours ive been on. shows all the history and awards with a decent size tasting at the end. worth the hour

Ok for a couple of hours. Yes it's a historic brewery tour with interactive experience. I am not personally a Heineken fan but I did enjoy the history part of the tour but that was over fairly quickly and moved into a Heineken marketing experience through the ages. The 4D experience was good and basically with the tour you get 3 mini pints with the tour ending in which can only be described as a nightclub bar. As this attraction is a busy one so there is no where to sit and enjoy your drink before you hit the expensive gift shop. One tip is the entrance tickets can be bought at a discounted price in combo deals around the city at the tourist sites.

Amazing trip. Had a lovely trip booked to the Heineken Factory even though I hate beer, I really enjoyed this trip and even poured a perfect pint and got myself a certificate! Its a must see if you are visiting Amsterdam!

Always a laugh. Perfect place to take friends who are visiting, plenty to see and the staff are very helpful, pay attention to the tour it may get you some free drinks at some stations! deffiantly worth the price :)

Avoid on Saturdays. It is a great place to go but can be very busy on Saturdays. The Heineken experience is one of the places you must visit in Amsterdam. The brewery is an impressive place and you get to see the process that makes a Heineken beer. The views from the roof top deck are incredible. All of the Heineken staff were telling everyone how great their burgers were the best in Amsterdam. To my regret I ordered a burger and didnt finish it. The burgers aren't very good, but I didn't go there for the burgers only beer...

Multiple attractions in one. Besides the beer and it tasting so good this attraction offers everything from a bit of history to the future, interactive and social to solo browsing as well as a complimentary canal cruise with a bit of history and subsidized merchandise, fully worth it.

Way better than expected. The tour was actually really fun (not just informative)
Great interactive games along the tour and cool sports section (what they sponsor such as the champions league)
And roughly 2 free pints (1 glass and then 2 more at the end)
**buy tickets outside it (from vendors) they're 2€ cheaper that way**

Enjoyable experience. We visited the Heineken experience early June which was great as there was literally no ques to get in.We took our time and got great value with this experience! If you want to get cheaper prices by a few euros or so make sure to ask your hotel if they have those discount vouchers.Additionally we were granted a free canals cruise to the Heineken shop where we picked up our complimentary Heineken glasses. Cheers Heineken

Loved it. Went here with friends I made whilst traveling. What a great day we had. If you can, buy your tickets online!! It saves you hours and hours in line! We got ours when we got there and saw the line, so were able to skip it entirely :)! Oh and before you go in, you can sign up for the Heineken boat as well, it's included but with limited seating! Once you come out of the tour it might be full. Great tour of how a Heineken is made and you get to do all kinds of interactive games and stuff. Don't forget to take a picture on a bike or record a music video in front of a windmill ;).

afternoon tour. called first on times open and was told 9 pm; and how much it cost; what they do not tell you is like i did arrive at 705 and they would not let me in as its a self guided tour that takes two hours ; i was very upset; so i just shopped the store and left

Wasn't of my best interest. I wasn't actually expecting much from this place...Maybe cause i don't drink beer :) They let u have a look on how barley is brewed and the progression of Heineken logo...U'll also have a chance to taste a fresh made beer.

worth a visit. The tour is a well-organized, funny and interactive. You can record a video while singing or take some funny pictures and send them by email. Nice to spend a few hours with friends, tasting a quite good beer.

Another brewery!. If you love Heineken it's a good go. You get three mini pints (one in the tasting education, two at the end). Only thing I had a complaint about was that there was no seating to chill out and enjoy your pints. They could've made big bucks if they connected it to a restaurant. Also, it wasn't that spectacular. Just another brewery haha.

A good experience. Educational, fun and tasty, that's what summarize this experience. Even though the shop items can be a little expensive but the entrance fee is totally acceptable. The entertainment is worth it.

Awesome!!. If you love a good beer, learning and having a good time, the Heineken experience is just for you. The history behind one of the most famous beers in the world is amazing, and the fact that after so many years the taste and recipe are the same. I recommend you go with a group, so you can participate in many activities together. You can also make your personalized Heineken bottle there too!

A fun, interactive experience!. This tour was really well set out, firstly taking you through the brewing process, before being able to walk through the areas were the Heineken was once brewed. This is followed by exhibitions on the brand itself and is a fun and interactive experience. There are many games and TV screens playing the vibrant party-like atmosphere that Heineken ads are renown for. The tour is completed by being able to enjoy 2 beers included in the admission price. Instead of getting the beers at the bar immediately at the conclusion of the tour, instead go up to the rooftop bar to enjoy the beers whilst overlooking Amsterdam from 6-stories up. Was a worthwhile visit.

Great Experience. I am not a fan of beer at all, but coming here was a great experience i enjoyed the entire tour!! My favorite part was creating my own Heineken with my name written on the bottle. I encourage anyone who visits amsterdam to come here. Buy your tour tickets in advance, the lines were extremely long but we got to walk right in since we had our tickets already.

Henieken Experience is A Good Time. Fun experience and a nice way to spend a few hours in Amsterdam. Much more fun if you go as part of a group because they have a number of activities that would be best if done with your buds. You could spend a lot of time here if your with someone that has a shared interest. The guides were very friendly and the gift shop had a lot of reasonably priced souvenirs and is strategically placed on the way out after you have had a few tastings..

Great way to spend a couple of hours. The Heineken Experience is a must for any visitors to Amsterdam. In the heart of the city, near to the museums, it offers an in depth look in to the history of a great company, with clear and concise commentary ... and a couple of drinks included in the price.Tickets for the Experience are available in advance from Tickets and Tours, or on the door, for between 16 and 18 euros.It is a great way to spend a couple of hours, and maybe pick up a souvenier if you wish, although there is no hard sell for this.

Great family attraction. Turned up about 3pm and got in straight away without pre booking. This was a real surprise as I thought my two boys 13&10 would get bored quickly . It was informative and interesting with lots of interactive things for kids and adults to get involved with. A great few hours spent here with a few cold Heinekens or juice for the kids to finish with. A real surprise and a must for all - even younger families.

Waste of time. Pleasant staff but thought this was really a waste of time. Loads of info about how great the founder was and how it is such a great beer but overall a bit Disneyfied for us. The final bit where there are interactive things to do in a nightclub sort of environment , well, I couldn't get out quickly enough. The young people there seemed to enjoy it all though so the Experience certainly has a place but not for me.

Great place to visit!. Book tickets beforehand from one of the many places around the city, it means you can skip the queues! You go around the museum and learn about how the beer is made and how the company began, get to see some horses and also taste the beer! The rooftop bar is amazing with a live bar at the end and burgers for sale if the weather is good!

Nice experience!. The "4D" experience was pretty good; an unexpected surprise! You go through the stages of how beer is made and you also get a taste of it at the end. There is a wide range of special effects and some games you can enjoy before having your 2 free beers at the end. For an extra cost you can label your own beer.

Nice experience but not a must. Ended there in a rainy day, looking for a place where to hide myself from the storm , I enjoyed the experience indeed. However, I have to say this is not something that I dare to consider or declare unmissable. I visited the Guinness Experience in Dublin and that something else. Although I spent almost two hours inside, the museum is nicely setup and staged. I would recommend to go for other museums in Amsterdam indeed.
Cheers to Beer. A good time, but a little touristy, but still worth it as the tour moved along quickly and was interactive.

Amazing place and Company. What a fantastic place , it was €16 , the staff are really friendly , as you walk through your taught how the drink is made, you get 3 tokens as you walk through to taste the larger , the even teach you how to drink it correctly

Not the best experience. Not a great experience at all, vast queue to enter, slow moving queue's most of the way through, some kind of ride/simulator broke down causing more delays, in the end we cut our experience short :(

Fun and interesting. Really good place, however my partner enjoyed it more than me as I don't drink beer! But it was entertaining and there was a lot of interactive activities and tour guides all the way through telling you about the history !

Boring. I read the reviews and went with an expectation that this would be along the lines of stupid fun. I was bored most of the time- with the pretend "history" and brew making lesson.
There was nothing worthwhile about this attraction. You can get better beer for less all over Amsterdam.

A fun experience for all ages. We visited the Heineken Experience in early August. We arrived at around 5:30pm and there was no queue! Everything was fun, we especially liked the 4D experience and games. The staff were friendly and really got you in the mood too. And you got to have 2 free beers in the end (you also get 1 glass in the tasting session). Children can choose coke if under 18. Overall I loved the experience very much and even my 60-year-old mum loved it too! We could not believe we spent more than 3 hours there!

Very nice experience. The Heineken experience is really funny, it's about the story of the company, the techniques of brewery and also the entertainments sponsored by Heineken. You will have several explanations about how to serve and how to taste a beer, and finally have two beers offered. Very nice experience!
My favorite brewery tour. This brewery tour is the best one I have been on. It is a multimedia experience and they keep serving you Heineken throughout the tour - what is not to love?

Disneyesque. It really is a rather glitzy, Disney-like tour, but worth it nonetheless. Lots of historical things in this exhibit. Lots of things to do and see. There are beer samples involved and I'll say Heineken is much better fresh from the brewery than it is stateside. Take the family, something for all.

Entertainment from a glass in every shape and form. Wanting to see as much that is traditional to this city we booked in for a midweek morning tour of this factory.The tour is a great mix of history and hands on technology to keep all the members of any family entertained....and there's beer!It's advisable to give yourself around 2 hours to get around this attraction, our daughter particularly enjoyed labelling her own bottle of beer via a computer programme, there was an additional cost for this but it's a nice addition to an already interesting tour, also the virtual ride is worth a mention too.....great fun.Get along and see for yourself, you get to try a beer in the tasting room before you go through to the bar, one bar you get one beer with a pouring certificate if you get it right, in the other it's poured and you get two.....it's a no brainer. Enjoy.

Average experience. The first part of the tour was quite uninteresting, unless you are really a huge fan of beer and want to know everything about how it is made. The "4D" experience was pretty good though, and was an unexpected surprise. Following that was finally drinking time. For 18 euros, on top of the tour, you also get around 3 small beers. Quite all right, I guess.

Amazing!!!. Such a great day out... The queues are short and there are plenty of staff there to answer questions.Once in there is so much to do...don't want to spoil anything by saying too much but it was awesome!You can easily spend all day there

Very good. We had a brilliant hour at the heineken experience. You get to see the stages of how the lager is made and you also get a taste of it at the end. Then the experience continues and has a wide range of special effects and games you can enjoy before having your 2 free drinks in the bar at the end :)
Extraordinary .... Its beyond tasting beer or knows the history of heineken , we really had great fun and it contains lots of things , so its a must if you are visiting Amsterdam.

Awesome Tour!. I love beer, my husband does not but even he enjoyed the Experience! Very interesting tour and at the end, we were able to enjoy our 2 free beers on the rooftop bar! Before you get your free beer, ask if the rooftop bar is open on the 6th floor. It was a gorgeous August day for us and awesome to enjoy our beers overlooking the city!

Lines within lines. Firstly there is massive lines outside, then inside you will find more lines as it is too crowded to go beyond one person at a time. Then you will find more lines. By the end on a hot day you realise that you don't even really like Heineken that much and you just spent 18€ on it.However I did not see the roof. Definitely can skip this tour if you are sitting on the fence.

AMAZING. We arrived in Amsterdam, checked in, and then headed straight to the Heineken Experience as a top priority. I had high expectations and they didn't disappoint. My girlfriend ended up loving the experience as well. We learned a lot about the history of the company, its great founder and his heirs, the brewery, and also all the sience behind it. Oh and we were very impressed by how caring they have been about their employees, the community and the environment. The staff there is awesome. Super friendly people, all of them great and a lot of fun. Joke around with them all you want. When you buy your ticket you are given a bracelet for 2 free beers. So we got one each... plud a third! I was joking with the guy at the till and he gave us an extra bracelet. During the visit you will stop by a place where they will give you a beer sample in a smaller glass and teach you about it. Then at the end you get to the bar with a cool bar feel to it and loud music, and that's where you use your bracelets to claim you free beers. So we claimed all of them, and I had to do most of the drinking. And get this... I went back to the bar to claim my last 2 beers and the guy at the bar gave me 3!! I thought I had died and gone to heaven. This is a MUST if you go to Amsterdam.
Just fun. If want something to do that fun and light harted you should go and you can drink you can spend a couple hours there there a spot there that they make you feel like a bottle being bottled
Plan your trip with some wait times. This is one of the stops in the hop on/off buses. This place can be very crowded as loads of people lined up outside to buy the tickets

Have to. This was fun, inexpensive and a must do. I am not a big bear drinker but the tour was great. They guides were fun and friendly and the free drinks did not hurt either. Def play the game at the store at the end and get your discount. O yea the boat ride tour was also a bonus.Overall great experience.
Best place to visit in Amsterdam. Spent there more than 3 hours. So great atmosphere - didn't even want to leave. Great time to start the day...or finish it. Probably will return

Very clever, very interesting.. Thought it would only be model of brewing process! WRONG! Very well put together "show/tour" (museum) with modern audio-visual and some interactive. Definitely worth a visit!

Boring and expensive . I would call this a marketing experience for which you pay a price to receive it. In my opinion, not worth it. There are plenty of better things to do in Amsterdam, and you can spend those 18e in any of this other activities. The only good point was that you get three beers, instead of two (6e/beer seems quite expensive though).

Fun excursion with beer!. I lived in Holland for a year and never did this. Then returned many times and still never did this. Then, one winter, over a short weekend, we went and had so much fun! So don't wait, just do it! You get a blend of history, beer, and drinking! What more could you ask for? Ok, well, you have the redlight to get that but do this one first.Cheers!

Torn. I can see what would make the experience really exceptional to many people. I did take away a few facts, I had a good day out and I enjoyed the trip. BUT I also hoped it would end sooner than it did, I got my free beers, eventually. I was bored almost all the time and I feel really bad with my honesty because you can see the passion and enthusiasm some people and the staff have for the product.I probably would go again if it was free, if your looking for a fun experience the last leg of the tour does get more exciting but the first half is a bit dull. Plenty of tours and ticket stalls selling discounted tickets and if you book both the Heineken and Ice Bar experiment together you get a small discount.

So much fun!. We - a family of 3 with a 19 year old - really enjoyed the Heineken Experience. Lots to see, do and learn. You can spend one hour or many hours. 3 beers included in the ticket price. Learn about beer, the history of Heineken and play in many interactive activities. We did eat the burgers on the roof top- I would suggest skipping that and getting lunch elsewhere!
Best part of my trip!. This place is more than just a tour. When it says experience they are very much correct.As the experience goes on each area gets better and better and ends with a high.

The Beer, and it's history....... Entering a factory, so famous, so wellknown, but not among the 5 most sold beers in the whole world. (Source: DrinksBusiness.com)We feel a little bit disappointed. Heineken, Probably the best name of all. Nice factory, great storytelling and a lot of history in the walls.

Interactive tour . It's a unique tour, it gets you involved but you don't have to. The 4D ride was a fun experience and getting to know the ins and outs of brewing Heineken was really interesting. Glad I did it!
STAY AWAY. Waste of$16. We tried to power walk the entire thing so we can get the 2 free glass of beeers.the entire tour is boring and useless. Just stay aawayy

Really interactive and real experience. It was a really interesting museum. I have been in real beer factorys but still this was fun. They not only show you how beer is made but they also show a lot about marketing and other heineken related activities. I gave only 4 because it openes at 10:30 and we had to wait there because we arrived at about 8 by train.
Waste of time.. It's boring and the drink itself is terrible. It has useless abd boring childish things to do inside. Very overpriced and unimaginitive.

Best beer. Best Heineken you will ever taste. Crisp, clean and fresh. Tour is a tad monotonous at the beginning, but fun with some activities at the end. The store is really overpriced though. Pity beer is not sold once your coupons are done.

great tour. Terrific experience and friendly staff made it a fun and informative tour. This was my husband's highlight of our trip. Your ticket for 17 euros gives you a rubber armband with 2 'pins' on it. Be sure to keep those on because at the end of the tour you get their great beer - & that is after the sample beer you get on the tour finale. I don't like beer but was able to drink it as it was not heavy at all.The tour itself shows the history of the company, the ingredients of their beer, & how it is brewed in the large vats, and even the special horses they used in the past have a stable but they are for display only nowadays.

Excellent experience . Brilliant experience x get cheaper entrance tickets before you go in you get 2 free drinks. Very interesting to see how the beer is made, friendly and fun. The beer is gorgeous too, take it upstairs to the sun terrace, brilliant views of the city.

The original brewery!. The Heineken Experience is a must if you're in town. It wasn't to packed, parking was easy and a full fledge tour is given. Moneys worth for sure and extra bonuses. Free samples ifebeer, first hand look at how the beer is made and the history of the name. Great souvenirs in the store as well. Memorable time!!
Fun for the family. It was fun! Seems like Disney consulted with them, but it's definitely an "experience" not just a brewery tour! My 14 year old liked it best of all of us!

I paid 18€ to watch Heineken adverts. If you like paying 18€ for one pint of cheap larger and to be immersed in an advert while told 10 times by a member of staff that Heineken is the best beer in the world, then you'll love this!It is just one enormous advert and focuses more on football and brain washing you by repeatedly saying that Heineken is the best beer in the world than on how the beer is made. There is however one room of interest which contains the large coppers and mash tun which as a brewer was interesting. After that there was a half hour que for a 6 minute film that was at best cringworthy. 18€ is the most I've ever spent on a brewery tour and this is by far the worst one I've ever been on. It has the least tasters, the longest ques and the most advertising as well as nothing actually being brewed on site.The staff members I spoke to also know very little about beer as when I asked what percentage alpha acids are in the hops that a staff member was handing round they asked what alpha acids were. Wish I hadn't gone and instead spent the money in a bar or bought some beer from a shop

If you like beer, don't go here. The Heineken experience was almost as disappointing as the beer itself - mediocrity in a can.For a meagre 18 euros you can explore this huge ad campaign, which includes a talk by staff who have absolutely no knowledge of beer, a visit to a completely obsolete stables, and a 20 min queue for a cringeworthy ride. However, if you're looking for a bar with a good beer selection (Heineken or Heineken), loud techno music and football memorabilia, this might be the place for you.

Take it or leave it. Not the experience I was expecting. While I did read the reviews I was still let down a little. The history, learning about the grains and hops and seeing actual vats that were used was interesting. I am not into interactive games or some of the other activities that I feel were geared toward younger people. My husband enjoyed it and that's what counts.

So much fun!. Although not a strong lover of beer this experience was incredible! Everything is interactive and there is so much to do! The shop at the end is very cheap in comparison to most places and they are very good quality. The interactive features of the experience are great for everyone and there are lots of opportunities for photos with the Heineken beers and logos. It is so much fun for all ages so defiantly worth a visit. You also get a free small glass which is a lovely momento.

Excellent tour and experience!. Wife and i grabbed some tickets and went over to the South canal belt to tour this fantastic brewery. The tour was good, the staff looked like they enjoyed talking to us and the displays were interactive and fun. We really enjoyed our free beers at the end of the tours. Only criticism was that it was so busy, but thats not really Heinekens fault! 5 stars!

Must do for every beer drinker!. I've been twice on this tour and enjoyed it each time. The building was used to brew Heineken but now is just a tour house. You get some history and get to drink some beer at the end of the tour.

AWSOME . By far my favorite brewery experience!! I liked it even better than the Guinness Factory. It seems a bit slow at the start but then becomes interactive and fun towards the middle end. You learn a lot but at the same time if it's not your thing they keep your attention with the activities and fun! Plus between 2-4 free beers if you play your cards right!

An amazing afternoon! A must do in Amsterdam!. We pre-booked our tickets so only paid €16 each. We arrived at 12.30pm and went straight in - no need to queue as we had our tickets. We were given a wristband with two tokens on it which are swapped for beer later.There are many displays about he history of Heineken and although production isn't carried out anymore, you can still see the equipment that was used before and also see the basic ingredients used. There are horses that are well looked after, they have a history of advertising the company.There is a small ride, where you are the beer being brewed! Very fun! Afterwards you are invited to enjoy your first Heineken. This is free and no tokens are exchanged here. There is a chill out lounge to enjoy your beer and then you go through the rest of the tour experiencing advertising, Heineken's place in rugby and football. There are also lots of activities of games, taking photos and videos and you are able to email them to yourself. You can also create your own label for your bottle of beer which you collect in the gift shop.There is also a virtual pouring game to see if you really can pour a beer! However, this was completely different to the real thing towards the end of the tour! The real masterclass costs the two tokens you are given and you get the chance to pour the perfect Heineken and drink it! You also get a certificate. If you don't want to do this, you can exchange your tokens in the bar next door and get two beers there.The gift shop has lots of lovely memorabilia and throughout the tour we saw directions to another Heineken gift shop where you can claim a free glass. We enquired about this and were shown details of the shuttle boat that is included in the ticket price. We went for this option and saw plenty of sights on the way.We got to the shop and had the chance to play an old Dutch game to get discount in the shop. I got 15% off to spend! We got our glasses and that was the end of the experience!My review may seem long, but we enjoyed every minute - even me and I am not a beer drinker, but I had 2 glasses! We spend 4 and a half hours here, so it's not quick visit, there is a lot to see and do - well worth the money!

A fun place to visit. Had a good time learning about the history of Heineken. It was an unguided tour so you can stay there as long as you want. Everyone received a "shot glass" size beer and was taught how to properly drink it. Later, two additional small glasses of beer were given for drinking. Had a choice of two small beers or one beer that you pour yourself "with supervision" and receive a certificate saying you are certified to pour beer. Keep in mind that the last admittion is at 7pm, so it's better to go early and buy the tickets at the tourist office to avoid the long line.

A good visit and excellent marketing. It's only when you get inside the experience that you truly realise how strong the brand marketing is. The experience itself is good value for a tour which takes around two hours end to end. If you pay the normal price of eighteen euros you get two small beers at the end of the tour. You get some good sights from the top of the building. There are parts of the tour that feel rushed and that could have had better led participation, for example when you're int eh main distillery they could have benefited from someone explaining the stages of distillation. The end product is fantastic and well worth it, the brand is strong and this is represented extremely well by the marketing department towards the end of the tour.

Truly an exerience. Heineken does a fantastic job of balancing the science behind how the beer is brewed and just enjoying beer. Every employee we encountered in the multi-room tour was very knowledgeable, professional and fun.I'd recommend this stop when you're in Amsterdam.

I like the beer drinking . I like the beer sipping, I like the beer walking, I like the beer talking, I like the beer testing, I like the beer brewing, I like the beer tour manager cause he hooked us up, I like the beer bottling, I like the beer making.

Absolutely the best thing in the city. We've been here with a friend and thought it'd be pretty boring but it turned out it was the best thing we've visited in the city. You get to see how they brew beer, get to taste it and even get brewed yourself...

Good afternoon out . This tour is one of the best I have been on. It's interactive, it's fun & you get a couple of drinks on the way which e everyone loves. For the price you pay its well worth a look around while your in Amsterdam

It was ok. A friend bought me tickets to the Heineken experience for my Birthday while we were visiting Amsterdam. It was an ok experience. I feel they really have tried to make it as interactive as possible but due to the amount of people, it was difficult to have a go on anything. I did come away with a bottle I made myself which is cool and the simulator ride is fun too.A good day but I wouldn't rave about it.

Absolutely fantastic!. It didn't really bother me whether we went here or not. But having been, it was absolutely fantastic! Not to be missed, great tour, lots of interactive tech experiences after the tour and of course, you get to taste the beer! Answer the questions correctly and you get free beer!
MUST VISIT. It is a must visit even if you are not a beer drinker. Tour of the history of Heineken, beer tasting, interactive stuff.

Do you like beer?!. If your answer is yes so please go there! Engaging experience: from the making process to the sponsorship for the UEFA CL. Nice experience, couple of gadgetry for free a chilled Heineken :)

Fun, Interactive Tour. The part of the tour that put it ahead of other brewery tours was the interaction. The Heineken Experience truly was an experience and is a must stop when in Amsterdam. Apart from the tasting, the actual tour had many fun and unique aspects, suitable for all ages. They have a 4-D experience where you learn how the brewing process takes place and feel the motion and ingredients as they get poured into the concoction. You also get the chance to play games and pour the best beer. Then you go through the usual brew tour samplings which were delicious as always.The difference between this tour than other brew tours was it was actually fun. There was learning, but there were also games and interactions involved. Very cool experience. I would definitely go back. The only downside is it is not directly in the city, so you will have to take some sort of transportation to get there.

Best Brewery Tour So Far. My wife and I have been on several brewery tours in Ontario, Canada (mostly microbreweries) but this is accurately named. This is quite the experience indeed. All exhibits and features are English and staff speak very fluent English and even teach you some Dutch. Highly recommend!
really good day. I wasnt expecting much to be honest but absolutely loved it. Very interesting with lots to do and see and free pints! Friendly staff and you get so much for the cheap entry price

A nice experience to share with your friend/partner :). With the iAMSTERDAM card, our entrance fee was EUR 13.50 each (25% off from normal entrance fee of EUR18).It includes either 2 regular draft Heineken or a bigger glass of EXTRA COLD Heineken.As we passed by the day before witnessing the longgg queue, we made sure to turn up at 11-ish am and when we arrived at 11:15h, there were already a small queue of about 20 people, we waited for about 10-15 mins.We were offered the option for a special price for a burger and fries for about EUR9 at the end of the tour when we got our tickets.There is a complimentary coat check in area beside the ticket counter.The whole HE (Heineken Experience) began with Heritage, their history etc...Then 'Quality from the start' where they show you the ingredients that goes in to making Heineken, the secret yeast that gives the unique Heineken taste remains a secret.We moved to the 'Brew room' and see the equipments used to the 'Stables' and then the 'Brew you ride' where they "brew" us :pNext was the 'Tasting bar', they gave us a small glass of Heineken for taste and they explained why it's important to skim the foam once you pour the Heineken into the glass.We went on to a section where you can learn to pour draft beer and you would get a certificate, you enter your name in a machine and it gets printed automatically, I did not know that you had to use the two small tokens on your wristband (entrance token) for this whole section as I was saving it for the EXTRA COLD beer so I told her I don't want to drink the beer but if she could give me the cool printed 'certified pourer' paper anyway? She just said no and told me I don't have to drink the beer but I have to give her the 2 tokens. PPFFTTT. I did not like this at all, this is the only bad experience I had during my whole trip in Amsterdam. I told her that in that case, forget it, she proceeded to throw away the paper cert with my name.Next on the agenda was the 'Bottle your own' section where you can customize Heinekens with your name, or anything you want printed on the Heineken bottle for about EUR10..I can't recall the exact cost.We went on to the 'Music' and 'Champions league' section where there were different rooms where you can take silly pictures/play games or just chill.Last part of the HE was the World Bar where I exchanged the 2 tokens on my wristband for one EXTRA COLD Heineken :)Last last part of course is the Heineken gift store.I just realized today that I was charged for 25 x Bottle Cooler Green Star instead of 5, this amounts to EUR 99. It's my mistake that I did not check before leaving as we got too distracted with everything! But still from the cashier's end, to overcharge a customer by 20?? That's a bit much. I rang them at the number provided on the receipt and by the third person that they've passed me to, a certain Mr. Akira Seriese took note of my complain and asked for my email and sent me an email directly and I provided a copy of my receipt and told them to check their cashier security camera footage to verify this nonsense and reimburse me. He replied swiftly after saying that he will "discuss this and get back" to me "asap".Noteworthy: We realized that we left our brolly in one of the rooms but can't recall what, the security working on that day of our HE tour (29th July 2015) at about 13:50h, he very kindly helped us and brought us back to the previous sections that we've been through to find our brolly, it was pouring when the tour ended and though we did not get our brolly back, the helpful and kind security man's action really made us feel so well taken care of.Shame we did not get his name, He is a gem in this company!
Worth a look. Worth a look around and get a few beers with your ticket with a ride inside but there was big ques when we was there

Heineken Heaven. I loved this place. Its a good visit for anyone, a great visit for a beer lover, and a MUST for a heineken fan. Actually quite a bit to do, you can be entertained for hours, or just do a quick tour.

Fun Day Out For Cheap. As there is so much to do in Amsterdam this place got over looked as one of the lower tier days out but we were wrong. It turned out to be one of the best days of our visit. For €18 (€16 if you book online) this is a great day out. I'm not a big beer drinker at all and I still had a great time at the Heineken Experience. The trip around the brewery is very informative and provides endless interactive aspects for visitors to get involved with. Simulators, beer tasting and plentiful activities for you go get involved with makes this a great day out for a good value for money. The fact you leave slightly tipsy is a bonus haha. The gift shop is very affordable. Im the not the type to buy from the gift shop but ended up buying a few cool customised bits from here and it was cheap. After you finish the experience they offer a free boat service which takes you close back to the centre. This is definitely the sort of place that will impress you if you aren't expecting much. If you have time I would 100% recommend the experience.

A fine history lesson for one of Holland's best known beers. I arrived at 2pm on a Sunday afternoon and it only took me 10 minutes queueing time to get my wristband and ticket (18Eu). The tour was interactive and fulfilling, I learnt about how to beer taste, what ingredients are included in the beer and how the brewing process occurs. Then to end it off with 2 beers is great! I would recommend to do this with a friend at least, but solo travellers will still enjoy (I just felt a bit lonely in the bar at the end, which probably says more about me than Heineken, hmm maybe I should drunk more...Maybe I'll save that for Central Amsterdam!).

Cool place. So I thought this place was a total tourist trap but figured how can I go wrong for 18 Euros including a couple beers. Plus I've always liked Heineken and this was my first time to Amsterdam. The tour was better than I expected. It was a little cheesy but also pretty entertaining. I even got an extra beer in the tasting room by being the first to answer a question correctly.

Great value for money.. Bought this as part of a combined canal cruise deal. This was a good trip out which took a couple of hours. It only cost around 15 euros and considering you get two free drinks and a taster drink on your way around, its well worth the money.You also get a free gift (small glass) but you have to get it from the heineken gift store which is in a different location (about 15mins walk away).Well worth the money...probably wouldn't take kids though and definitely not suitable for those who cant walk stairs.

Great fun. Thoroughly enjoyable with interactive demos, a 4d ride and ending off with a nice cool beer. What's there not to like. The street market around the corner makes the visit well worth the effort.

Worth visiting just once. It is interesting place with nice beer testing options. Do not expect to learn much about beer making of course.. But still you can get a bit flavor of how the process is.. At the end, the bar is ok and drink , drink and drink...:))

A fun day trip. This was our second time to the Heineken experience after many years and our daughter came with us this time. It is a fun interactive day out and sampling the drink is an added attraction if 18 yrs old or over. You learn about the history of Heineken and see how it is made which is interesting. They have added lots of interactive areas since our last visit which appeals to everyone. Worth a visit.

Trip . It was a really good experience. There was a bit if hassel getting our tickets, but that was sorted quickly. The tour was very good, lots of information and different parts to look round. There is free beer at the end, not much to do then but drink. Good experience learnt a lot and is really easy to get to, would highly recommend

Must visit! . What an experience! When doing this tour make sure you eat a full hearty meal beforehand, luckily my boyfriend and I did just that and we still left the tour tipsy. When receiving the tickets you are entitled to three half pints of Heineken at the end of tour, although that is not the limit to how much Heineken you can have. There are interactive games throughout the tour which can see you pour the perfect pint and receive a half pint, answer correct answers about the colour and the look of Heineken and again receive another half pint this continues throughout the tour. Of course you learn about the history of Heineken and where it's from as well. We really enjoyed ourselves and have recommended it to our friends who plan on visiting Amsterdam in the future.

Amazing, a must when in Amsterdam!. They say Heineken tastes the best when in the Netherlands and this is true! This experience is wonderful in that it is extremely informative about beer and the inner workings of the heineken brand but it also teaches you the best way to drink beer etc to ensure you enjoy beer fully from now on!This isn't a museum as I thought when I first arrived but rather there are museum like components but it can just be seen as a great friends day out. Between the foosball and scrum simulators in a group of friends or family a guaranteed great time! Even if you don't like beer I'm sure you will have a great time here!Do be remember that a lot of the people here will be drunk, so don't be surprised when people are falling over all over the place!We got a package ticket to allow us to do a canal tour and the heineken experience. This was definitely the way forward as for only 20 euros we got both those and a queue skip. This queue skip was definitely valuable as when you arrive the line can be extremely long, even with tickets. It will likely not be in the sun however so if you are prepared to wait you won't be too hot.

Fun way to fill an hour or so.. It is a typical brewery tour but still fun. Lots of old displays and English translations. Of course, beer at the end. They could use a little more seating so you can sit and enough your beer. It's nice you can buy tickets ahead of time and use them whenever you want.

Well worth the money- a must-do experience! . We were hesitant about the Heineken experience initially, thinking it would be a standard brewery tour, however it blew our minds with a perfect collection of information, photographs, interactive activities and of course Beer! The history of Heineken was relevant and engaging, the brewing process was explained thoroughly, the setting itself was modern and very well presented. there was fusball, beer tasting, play stations, photo opportunities, horses, and to top it off- a complimentary boat cruise along the canals to the Heineken Shop, with a free gift at the end! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Great experience. A good value for money attraction, loved it. Interesting to hear about the brewing process, but there are also interactive games etc to get involved with. Even the tables where you get your 'tasters' at the end are interactive. One tip when you go in the 4D ride stand at the front for best experience.

Unexpected gem in Amsterdam!. We visited here on a rainy day, and therefore did not experience the big queue. From the beginning, the Heineken experience did not disappoint. For any beer lover visiting Amsterdam, it is a must. The history behind it is okay, (maybe a little boring) but then it gets going to the whole science behind how the beer is made. You also get free beer in the price which is good. After the whole experience, there is a lot of fun to be had in the games rooms ect. Brilliant for anyone really, even kids (who obviously can't drink the beer included in the price!) Also very friendly and pleasant staff.
fun tour. Buy your tickets online and enjoy a fun tour in the Heineken museum. A lot of brand and Heineken family history, and different small events you can participate in.

Heineken Experience 100%. Funny but this was one of our highlights during our stay in Amsterdam. Buy tickets in advance and it will make it easier (no long lines). You get 2-3 free beers but most important the experience is very cool/hip and they know what they are doing

Excellent value for money. If you aren’t a lover of the art museums this is an alternative attraction to use to hide from the rain. It’s good value for money it was only €18 for two of us which included 2 drinks each at the bar. The history of the product & the Heineken family was very interesting as was the support the company gives sport. Make sure you take a trip on the free boat ride at the end of the tour and claim your free glass.

Best burger and beer price around. We did not do the whole Heineken Experience, but outside they advertised burger and a beer for less than 10 euro. You go up to the rooftop and have a wonderful view of the city. The beer was very good and the burgers too. Nice inexpensive quick lunch.
A crappy experience. very expensive entry of around 18 euro for a giant marketing campaign, no real value, nothing interesting and by far the worst "ride" I have ever been on

Must See for any Heineken Lover!. This attraction has a lot to offer! You get a history lesson, brewing class, and more modern rooms full of surprises. We received a wrist band with the purchase of our tickets and at the end of the tour you can trade in tokens on the band for free from the tap Heineken! It was delicious and very cold. Before we left the attraction we were given two free Heineken glasses to take with us as souvenirs! We had a great time!

Heineken PR at its best (worst?) Lot of hype, generous beer, a little insight.. Know up front that this a full-press marketing ploy . . and you're paying for it. You'll find out more than you ever want to know about Heineken family genealogy, business history andthe "secret" yeast. But if you're in the Heineken target demographic, you'll enjoy the beer (which you pay for with admission tix), the immersion in Heineken commercials, the unabashed merchandising . . . and rubbing elbows, rumps and other body parts with many people just like you.

Brillant! . Not a beer fan myself but went as my husband really wanted to go. He said out of all the factory tours he's been to this was by far the best one! We got a ticket from the tourist shops which was around 16euros and got two free beers. Had so much fun definitely worth a visit!

Cheers to Heineken Experience!!!. This was a wonderful experience. You are taken inside the brewery and shown entire process of manufacturing beer and the same is explained so very well that you enjoy it to the fullest. The hospitality is warm and friendly. The beer tasting session is too good. The fresh beer actually tastes so very good. At the end the option of taking personalized beer bottle (at some price) is also a good memento to keep. All in all a wonderful experience. Cheers to Heineken!!!

Good distraction . Buy your tickets before going, I'm glad I didn't have to wait in line. They blue the own trumpet a bit too much at the beginning but still pretty interesting. Enjoyed the beer tasting!

Experience for everybody.... ...even if you don't like beer! Well built exhibition and interesting live guides at some point. After you saw how they make it, and how it became famous and known in all the world, the best part - tasting - is coming ... And before you leave, you still have 2 more drinks to enjoy with your company in the music hall, next to the bar!

beer story. I had admired Heineken brand for its consistency and marketing prowess. Visit to Heineken experience actually was very educative. The intricacy of beer brewing and history of Heineken was enthralling. Beer lovers shld definitely visit
Loads of fun. This really exceeded my expectations! It is an interactive experience, with a 4D movie, games, tastings and information. Well worth the time and a lot of fun!

Well worth doing. This was my 6th trip to Amsterdam, and only my first time on the Heineken Brewery tour. It was loads of fun. It's a walking tour, with no guide, so you can do it at your own pace. Stop and read about the things you're interested in, and move past the things you're not. There's loads of fun things to do on the way round, and the bar you finish up in is a good laugh too.
