Fun Afternoon. We had a very fun and informative afternoon at the Heineken Experience. We learn about the history of the company and Heineken itself.
Surprising entertainment!. The Heineken Experience went above and beyond our expectations before entering the tour. We absolutely loved the "We brew you" experience!

Fun thing to do if you have extra time. Doesn't need to be on your "must see" list, but we found ourselves with a few extra hours and decided to give it a go. Definitely on the touristy side but fun, clean, fast-paced and informative. I don't even like beer but drank a full one of the "extra colds" at the end. With the tour ticket you can either have two regular beers or one "extra cold" at the end. If you are a non-beer drinker like me, get the "extra cold"- you might even enjoy it. Cheers!

If I could do the trip over, I wouldn't do this.... We bought online tickets for the reduced price of €16 (vs the normal 18). The online/advanced tickets were worth it because there was a longish line to purchase them, which we skipped.I was expecting a Heineken commercial, obviously, but this was a little too cool for school for me with lots of interactive Heineken exhibits and techno party music pumping. There was a "ride" and some fun places to take pictures. At the end you can get a large beer or two smaller ones. It's far from a horrible place, but with so much great stuff in Amsterdam I think there are better ways to spend your time as a tourist.

Great experience. It is a very fun and interactive museum. You learn a bit about the history of Heineken and you go in a 3D adventure about how to become a beer ;)It is appropriate for all ages, they have a nice gift shop and you get free beer, even though the entrance fee might seem a little bit high

Definitely worth the visit . Really interesting tour. Well thought out and worth the money. Learn how the beer is made, meet the horse who promote, learn how to drink it properly from the really friendly staff and of course drink it at the end. We learned how to pour a pint and got a certificate too.Then we got a free canal boat tour to take us to the shop. Tour guide was great!

Personalised beer ! . The Heineken tour was fab ! Not just for the guys may I add...! We got to see how the beer was made, listened to how the horses were used as transport, felt what it was like to be part of the process of making Heineken and then got the opportunity to personalise your own bottle of Heineken (pay extra) to take home but not before tasting the wonderful cold stuff...yum !

VIP Experience. Absolutley amazing. Roxanne or Rosanne was our tour guy and she was awesome..cute too! Highly suprised..tipsy as anything coming out of there today. Best experience in a long time. Id defo go back again for another tour with her. Amazing

Get to know the history of Heineken with some free beers. At Heineken Experience there is something for everyone. You can learn about the history of Heineken's evolution as a top brand, also you get to know how they brew. There are some fun activities and a very nice 3 D short film. But the best part is the beer that you get to taste inside :)
Fun!!. This was a super fun day out, its all really interactive and you can stay there for hours with all the activities, and at the end theres a bar- definitley worth the entrance fee!

Good fun . Went here on Friday for a couple if hours. It was a good laugh, interesting too. Enjoyed the talk on how they make the beer. The tasting session was very good also. There was a fun simulation movie. Loads of rooms. Then got 2 drinks at the end.
Interesting. First part of the tour was very interesting on the history and brewing technique. Second part was mainly marketing but had some fun bits. Got one sampler and two beers included.

Fun and free beer! . I think it was about €15 to go in and it was well worth it. About 5 mins in I thought it was going to be quite boring. But then the fun starts. I don't want to give it away but there are a few fun surprises and you get to pour your own beer if you like. Good light hearted activity.

Guys' heaven. It's hard for me to give Heineken Experience justice, as it probably has a different target group than me and my 30+ girlfriends, but I will still try to be objective :)First of all, it feels weird to give 2 hours of your time and pay 16 eur only to allow a company to advertise their product to you - as it is exactly what this place is: a huge, glowing advertisement. On the one hand it seems obvious, after all it's the HEINEKEN, not "just-your-ordinary-across-the-street-brewery" Experience, but it still feels weird when you are being convinced step-by-step that Heineken is actually the only sensible choice of beer in the world. And you pay good money for it. By the way, I am still not quite convinced anyway :)The place is organized in a fabulous way though and there is tons of fun things to do. I am sure a group of young guys going there before a stag night would be delighted: there's beer, some more beer, a bit of history, but not enough to get one bored, video games, another glass of beer, music, sports, some interactive games that we didn't fully get (not enough beer maybe?), and - to top it up - yes! You're right! Some more beer!I was slightly disappointed with how little attention was give to the very process of brewing. This part of exhibition could be better; all the elements are there, but lacking proper explanation or description.Quite disappointing, as all the old equipment is there waiting to be shown in full glory. I also didn't like the fact that horses are kept on display in the stables section: even though there is some distance between them and the visitors, I am not sure that the animals appreciate the noise made by swarms of tourists... Another annoying feature is that the Heineken Experience is obviously not satisfied with the already steep admission fee, but presents additional opportunities to get tourist money; I think that making a customized Heineken bottle or getting a short draft beer pouring lesson are nice features, but they should either be free of charge, or located in or around the store, instead of the place itself. I felt that if I paid for the ticket, all the attractions inside should be already covered by the fee.On a good side, Heineken Experience is well-organized and fun. Basically all aspects of Heineken business are covered, from beer production, packaging, advertising, to sponsoring of music and sport events that the brand is investing in. The place feels more like an adult playground than a museum and all in all I didn't regret visiting. It is also worth to mention the fantastic staff who were not only helpful and attentive, but also fun and friendly.All in all, not exactly my cup of tea, but not a complete waste of time either. But then again, I am a 30+ woman :)
Great Place to Visit. If your in Amsterdam make sure you visit the Heineken Experience and most of all buy the rooftop/burger option.

Nice Tour.... I came here by myself and not knowing or ever having tried Heineken before. The tour was fantastic. The employees are knowledgeable and the queue was only about 15 mins. And, while I found out I don’t actually like the taste of Heineken, I would still recommend it or go back if I ever went back to Amsterdam with someone who wanted to experience it.

Fun beery afternoon. I had a fantastic experience at Heineken although at first I had thought it was a mistake to visit. We had to queue for 35 minutes just to get in, the reason being that there was only one person selling tickets with three empty tills next to her. 18 euro entry. The beginning of the experience are information plaques on tiny gloomy walls in tiny rooms. We had to wait outside in the corridor before being able to enter these rooms as they were so crowded. However, I wonder if this is deliberate to make the following exciting activities even more interesting! We were very briefly explained the process of the beer making but I felt it was too brief and u informative. However, following the museum part was a stimulation activity -my favourite part of the experience. You are shown the experience of a bottle of beer from being created to being drank. Good fun! Immediately following this was a beer tasting directed by an energetic chap. You are given a glass of beer on entry and the guide taught us more about the beer and how best to enjoy it. FYI he also fires off quick questions for which correct answers are awarded by a beer. (The easiest question was at the end; 'what's my name' also rewarded in beer!) who also enjoyable. At this point I thought we had reached the end of the experience but instead followed on tons of different interactive activities. This has to be by far the most interactive place of interest I have ever visited. Great time, spent at least two hours in there and I had 4 glasses of beer for free, all in all a great time.
Awesome!!!. The heineken experience is one of the best things to do in Amsterdam. It provides you an opportunity to open your eyes to the otherside of the heineken business.

Interesting !. We enjoyed how much interactivity there was in the tour, it is a must do even if you don't like beer like myself. I particularly enjoyed the simulator ride thing, where you are a beer bottle I definitely learnt some information about the whole process. I would say it's a bit expensive but worth it.

Great tour, much more than expected. Great historic tour of Heineken but what really impressed was all the interactive exhibits as well. The staff were very engaging and the fresh beer is really really good!

Great afternoon spent. Brilliant tour, we thought the experience was finished once we entered the tasting are but we had another hour or so with interactive games and a fab bar area. Highly recommend it and I'd definitely return

Super interactive. The first part of the tour starts with a history of the brand and how they make the beer which is standard fare for a brewery tour but where it stands out is after this bit. The 4D ride is a really good addition, it's extremely fun. After this there is an interactive music and sports section where you can make music videos, pictures and play sports games. You then get a glass of beer whilst being talked through how to taste it before moving to the bar to have your 2 free drinks. Excellent value we spent a good 2 hours there.

Prost! Beer + Fun = Heineken. This was a pretty cool experience. Although I didn't much care for reading all of the placards about the history, the entire building was filled with different activities and things to see. I had such a fun time here- and even got a complimentary Heineken beer glass. The beer and staff are awesome.I even got a one-of-a-kind Heineken beer bottle made with my own lettering and choice of words on it.

What a surprise - good fun. wsa not looking forward to this cannot stand beer, but....... the history and processes are interesting then onto to some really fun stuff it was very good and i would recommend but wont spoil the surprise. Of course the beer awaits you at the end.

Amazing!. This was one of my favorite parts of my recent vacation with my sister. I am a beer lover but she is not... But even she had a total blast! This is not just another brewery tour, it's a fun, interactive experience! True to the reviews, just when you think you're probably done, there is more to do! Highly recommend!

Been before but still as good. Been here before in 2013 and came again with a different group. I thoroughly enjoyed myself again... The free drinks helped that too :)
The staff were all great and keep the atmosphere up!
Good little trip out although it was rammed and really hot inside!

Interesting, fun and with beers at the end!. My partner and I went on the tour and both had a great time, she is not a beer drinking as such but enjoyed it all the same. You can catch the sight seeing tour bus which drops you off nearby, price wise it is ok but not the cheapest. You can pay an extra €8.50 to have another small free beer and a decent burger on the rooftop which has a great view. A very good experience and glad we did it.
okay. The first bit was interesting about how the beer is brewed and the history etc. the second part was more a massive marketing exercise. Glad we went but would not return again.
Fabulous . So, u arrive at Holland, and the first thing u could think is, obviously, going to Heineken Experience!!!! It's fulled with marvelous stuff, activities, and beer for adults!

Cheers!. The tour introduces the history of the company in a simple informative way. You will learn about a passion & wealth that turns into art, science & marketing. You learn about A yeast developed a century ago which is still used today. The interactive multimedia is employed in high degree. So you smell, hear, move, jump& ofcourse taste during the process. This is making it easily worth the money. However, the performers & actors are on enhanced level of enthusiasm all the time. Very American style.Sometimes, though, keeping up with all activities can become complicated, like the lightstreak. I could not make it work out in 5 min.

Great value and good fun. Not a heineken fan but still found this a great attraction.Interesting history of the company and free drinks included, and get to walk around on your own at your leisure!Best part is the included free 30 minute boat trip to the heineken store at the end with a free small glass and no obligation to buy anything, you can even just ride the boat back, making it a 60 minute free trip on canals which many people pay to go on in Amsterdam.To those complaining it's like a heineken advert in there... It is the heineken brewery after all they aren't going to advertise other beers! Well worth the money especially if bought as a combo with another attraction like we did.

Not just for lager drinkers. Great fun for teens to adults. We booked online in advance (you don't have to specify a date) and then bypassed the queues.Allow a good couple of hours to go around, you get two tokens included in the entry price which you can exchange for samples of Heineken (or Pepsi) in the bar, or you can 'pour your own pint' and get a commemorative certificate. Lots of photo ops, you can email video messages back home and purchase custom items in the shop with your photo on. A good mix of the original factory fixtures and modern touches (similar to the Guinness Storehouse in Dublin, but on a lesser scale)

if you love the beer.... A very cool old factory! very good job on the designing of the tour! It gives you a rounded idea of how things started and worked through the years. There is some history about the beer and the family, love the 2 free COLD beers! drink responsibly ;) Loved the Clydesdale horses too!
Fun place and good museum!. An alternative museum with good atmosphere. Focus on experience and marketing of Heineken with a fun touch. Definently would recommend to visit.

Heineken Interactive Experience. A must see....very interactive experience.
Lots to see. Gift shop with etched glass beer mugs you can get customized.

Fun and interesting.. Recently visited with a Dutch friend who lives in Amsterdam .Though my friend not a big drinker , she enjoyed the history and interactive areas has much as me .Great fun and plenty to see and do .The funniest part is the process experience .Where you go through the virtual process .Gifts available and prices good .Afterward we followed the guide to the Heineken boat and had a boat ride of around 30 mins , great fun .Would recommend .

A good place for beer lovers. Me, my husband, and my friends came to this place last year. All of us love to drink beer so we think it's a good place for four of us to visit. Inside we can know how to make beer, the history of heineken, taste the beer, many games or attractions about beer, etc. In the last visited we got a Heineken glass for souvenir. You can order a beer bottle with your name on it also. Yupp... a must place to visit if you like beer while you are in Amsterdam!!

''obviouesly drink responsible''. yes after drinking and fill all-right in size 99 with the Heineken Experience, it is always seems like an never ending drinking responsible price does not matter after filling like 50foot rocking in paradise to your wish to be in places yes filling high and good...

Beer Lovers Disneyland. What a fun museum! I purchased my ticket ahead of time(you can do this all over Amsterdam, you won't have to wait in line and I believe I got mine for $17) I've been to other beer museums and compared to my other experience this was much more of a playground than the others. It was very interactive. Had a ride, a ton of games, photo-booths, places to make music videos, an area with a DJ. It was just a lot of fun. I really liked that you would get your own personalized Heineken bottle, I thought that was a nice gift to get for the beer lovers in my family. I could have probably spent a total of 3 hours here, but I was in a rush so I only spent about a hour. In the end, more than worth the $17!

NOT just a brewery...or a typical beer tour. It was more like a theme park. Hours of fun, ending with brilliant beverages. Very informative, nice high-tech rides and films. By far the best of the countless breweries we have visited on four continents.

Bad hygene.... Shocked to see how they are cleaning used beer glasses.. They literally put the glasses in soap and serving beer without rinsing it in the water.. So practically you are drinking some part of soap with beer... Its a shame

Brilliant experience. Spent a fab time in this museum- very informative with just the right balance of information and interactive stuff. Be sure to shout out the answers when you get to the bar mid way through for your first sample of a mini Heineken- there are freebies to be had!!A great few hours can be spent whether you are couples or a family as there is plenty of things to try out and have a play with- pulling a virtual pint, mixing decks and scoring a rugby try to name a few. Soft drinks as well as Heineken are available at the end of the experience.

Interesting.. The tour itself was ok. It was good to see how it is made & there are different stages of the process that you can sample. The building itself is cool. At one stage there is a wall & ceiling made out of empty Heineken bottles. It doesn't do anything that will blow you away really but it is a good brewery tour.

Worthwhile. For 18 euros I had high expectations for this excursion. The explanation of the beer creation is clear and interesting. Learning about the different industries that Heineken are involved in is fun. It is clear lots of money has been invested into the different activities, so there is plenty of stuff to do when going around. With 2 free drinks as well, I was impressed with the experience I had.

I line up for 3 hours,its worth to go!. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jM1zuJ2HzHcwatch the above video link before you go for the place. Very nice and fun with half day spending there for beer tasting, processing, packaging and dancing.You shouldnt miss this.

Interesting experience. Always better to book tickets online to avoid the queue. We really did not know what to expect once inside. It was truly interesting with some history on the Heineken brewery, the family etc. There is a beer tasting area (sounds strange but worth trying) and a beer brewing ride. Plenty of Heineken merchandise to chose from that comes with 2 free rounds of beer which one could experience on the roof top bar. Good visit for beer lovers and Heineken fans.

Beer Lovers Fun. If you are someone who doesn't like beer, this place isn't for you. Do not go. For all the beer lovers, this place is amazing. As soon as u enter, you get a waist band with buttons. (The buttons are for the free beers you get!) The tour basically takes you though:1) History of beer,2) How beer is made 3) A cool 4D amusement ride4) Crash course on how to drink (gulp) beer. Yes, you'll be surprised at what they tell u5) Certification on beer pouring (clean the glass, fill it up and serve) 6) Souvenirs - Lots of them. A filled beer bottle with your name on it, a glass with a message engraved, t shirts, caps, etc. Took us around 4 hours to complete the tour and was definitely worth a visit.
Poor value for money. Had read some good reviews on here for this attraction so went along but was disappointed. Very overpriced and crowded and certainly could not recommend it.

Great visit. I went with my boyfriend on our first day in Amsterdam. We pre booked our tickets so we didn't have to queue, we were able to print them out before we went so it was very easy. I have no love for beer what so ever, unlike my boyfriend, but there was many aspects to this experience that were fun and interactive which I very much enjoyed. There was information on the history of the brand, how it is made and lots of modern gadgets to play with. Overall it was a great experience and would recommend!
Very nice. Very nice place to visit. You can even make your own bottle with your name. It's nice. They explain the whole process of the beer. They show exhibition horses as well. Great in general.
amusement park for men. They give you a complete overview of the history making beer and link it capably in today,s.And they making it funny and light -hearted way.

Feel free to skip.... First of all It is a multimedia museum (not cheap one), Not a brewery.You have to tour the factory in groups, quite a lot of waiting between stops. The cost includes 2 beer or soft drinks.  As a museum it is quite boring - waste of time and money. Had a more enjoyable time by visiting a bar and drink your Heineken there......
Beer fun. 18 euros worth of fun. Learn about the history of Heineken while having fun and make a selfie movie.

Only go if you like Heineken and like being brainwashed!. My aunt and cousin wanted to come here, so we went along with them. We got it at a combined and reduced cost with another attraction. I am glad that we did not pay full price. It is not an active brewery but an overhyped homage to a poor product and it's advertising, with some lip service to the history of the brewery and beer making. Personally, I found it tawdry - the 2 drinks are for half pints only. There were some funky aspects and liked some of the older adverts and labelling, but on the whole I just found it to be one huge advertising campaign! Only go if you love the product. If not, do not waste your time or your money!

Starts off well, but quickly declines. This tour begins with some interesting information, but around halfway through the visit, it appears that the Heineken people struggled to figure out a way to justify the price of the entrance ticket. Once visitors pass the horse stables, the remainder of the tour is clearly meant to appeal to the younger teen and college crowd; it is jammed with electronic "tricks," that don't have any obvious connection to the history of the company, or even to the current day marketing of it. By the time visitors arrive at the rooms where the free beers are offered, it feels as though you've entered a frat party; the floors are so sticky, you actually peel your feet off of them, the tables are covered in sticky residual beer spills, the music is much louder and difficult to speak over, and many of the crowd are behaving in a typical frat party manner. The bathrooms, at least on the day we visited, were also filthy.My advice....rather than visit the museum, save your money, buy a six-pack of Heineken, and read about the history of the Heineken company while sitting in the comfort of your own home!
AWESOME. I've been here twice and it's great. Great value for money and so much to do. Friendly staff and the shop is great. I can't wait to go again

Worth the visit!. I'm a bit of a beer snob and don't usually drink Heineken but, when in Rome... That being said, the tour was quite entertaining and informative and I definitely recommend it for one of those rainy Amsterdam afternoons!

Fun for all. The tour was standard and not as informative as other tours I've been on but after the initial tasting you go through an area with varuous interactive games, video messaging etc which makes it something to do for all the family small and big kids alike. The tour finishes in the bar for final sampling with soft drinks for those that prefer. Good value. Fun time out.
Pick another brewery. Crowded place and not very exiting. Better to spend the money on one of the smaller breweries in the city. Or buy Heineken at a pub.

A break from the typical. Our family of one teen and one new adult enjoyed learning the history and processes of making beer, the history of Heineken and walking through the beautiful old brewery. I was surprised at the interactive sections beyond the giant mash and cooking rooms. There's even a "ride"!Probably not the most fun for those who don't like beer, but my non-drinking daughter had a good time with all the interactive exhibits. It was a nice break from the museums for everyone.

Should be FREE or they should PAY YOU to go through. This was just an extended commercial for Heineken. Some parts of the old defunct brewery are interesting like the brew house with copper kettles and stained glass windows, but the majority or the "tour" was just an ongoing advertisement for Heineken beer. It was too long and too expensive.

Great place to keep cool. Tour is self guided, has a brew yourself movie. Once you view movie you go onto beer tasting, then to games, then you can go to the lounge for two beers or get yourself a larger beer and a certificate for learning the proper way to pour beer
A place for fun. You can enjoy two cups of bear and have a place to rest in the final "bottle ride" destination. It is good to have fun there if you have time.

Great for the man in your life!. My partner had a great experience here and so did I. You do not need to be a beer lover to enjoy yourself in this museum. There is a historical section to the tour which brings interest to more than just beer enthusiasts.

What more to say? It's the meca of Heineken lovers!. It was my first visit to a beer factory and I haven't had a better experience than there. Very well done and organizated, you leave the place wanting to drink more! I went there with my brother in my first travel abroad and it was really amazing. I Want to go back someday!

Not a Typical Brewery. The rebranded Heineken Brewery is definitely fun to go to. We aren't crazy about beer but the experience itself was very enjoyable. Learning about the process of making the beer, the companies history and what makes it special was very interesting. The rest of the experience, such as games and an opportunity to sing, were lots of fun and very different from a traditional brewery tour.Unfortunately, some of the games weren't working and the final beer stop was a little to sticky for my liking. All on all, a good experience and something fun to see while in Amsterdam. You get two beers which were quite delicious and refreshing after a brutally hot July!

Must-do in Amsterdam :). A really cool but expensive place in Amsterdam. We really enjoyed our visit there and if it wouldn't be so expensive I would go there a second time. The staff is really cool and the different rooms with different attractions are really creative. It's interactive and you can take as long as you want to try things out. You get a wrist band with some kind of coins which you can use up on two normal Heineken or one special extra cold Heineken or you can take part in a tutorial on how to pour beer correctly (certificate included). There's another coin on the wrist band which you can use for free hHeineken beer glass in their store. It's not in the Experience itself but you can get on a free canal tour boat which takes you directly to the store. A small city tour is included ;) All in all I think it shows exactly the spirit of Amsterdam - free and openminded :)

Well worth a visit. Enjoyed the Heineken Experience immensely. Buy the ticket in one of the ticket shops dotted around the city for a discount. Whole visit took about 2 hours. Interesting and fun with 3 'medium' sized drinks included. Was a bit bemused by the lessons on proper pint pouring and the interactive pint pouring machine as all of the staff seemed to use a pint's worth of lager to fill a 300 ml glass. Overall won't change your life but fun nonetheless.

Freddy's Star. Correction his grandfather's star Gerrit who started the business at an age of 21. Amazing. The building is an industrial monument builded outside the city's borderline in those day's 1864. The museum offers you a trip by yourself what is nice because you can skip what you want. Also beer is offered inclusive the price what is nice. Good murchandise shop at the end but be carefull with the ' Killer Bikes' when you leave the building!

Very cool. The Heineken experience is one of the coolest things you can do in the center of Amsterdam. It's not a quick visit, a lot to see and a lot of small beer glasses to try :) There is even a DJ club area at the end for you to hang out while tasting your Heineken.
A great way to discover the heineken universe. You love Heineken beer, you have to go there to experience some amasing and original museum. You won't regret it !

Get to know the Heineken brand and get a little tipsy!. Its a short walkthrough about the history of Heineken and how they make their beer and why they are successful. The second part is by showing off, of course a lot of marketing but also a lot of activities like, playing some FIFA on Playstation. It all ends with two beers before heading to the free boat trip.

Excellent experience for someone who likes beer but doesn't know much. The tour is not long but very well-organised, 4D film was excellent. 3 cups of free beer, free city cruise tour to souvenir shop for a free beer cup! What else do you expect from a wonderful experience in Amsterdam during summer?

Not for grownups. This attraction was highly recommended (by adults!) but we found it more for the much younger set, loud and crowded, mostly an advertisement for Heineken plus laser lights. The age range that would really enjoy it are probably not old enough to drink!

Great tour, lots of fun. Four of us took the tour and really enjoyed it. Went at 1130, virtually no line ups so easy to go right on in. Lots of interesting information, exhibits are well laid out and there are interactive displays. Staff along tour route are very helpful and fun. All of them were students and really interested in their jobs. A nice touch is the "theme park" style ride that they have mid tour which was fun and unique. Beers at the end was nice as well as lots of Heineken products in the gift shop. This is a real fun and educational tour, great for kids. Saw many kids while there. If you have the time, don't miss it.

If you're looking for something to do.... Experience was kind of take it or leave it. Perhaps it's because I have been on many tours like this before, different micro breweries, the Jameson Distillery in Dublin, and this just did not seem to live up, but nonetheless of course I had a good time, I was on vacation! The tour itself is self-guided with a few points where staff is set to tell you a bit more in depth about the brewing process and the culture of Heineken - these parts are by far and away the best part of the tour. The "guides" were all very knowledgable and personable, they do a great job of telling you about the history and about the beer without sounding rehearsed or worn out. If I could've just done those parts of the tour I would've been just as happy as doing the other parts where you walk around as if it is a museum. The tour was extremely crowded when I was there, so I would HIGHLY, HIGHLY recommend you buy your tickets at one of the many tourist offices on your way to the brewery. Not only is it a few euros cheaper, it also lets you skip the line that snakes around the building. At the end you get two beers, along with one other beer that a guide will teach you how to properly drink while on the tour. So overall, for 16 or 18 euros it's definitely worth a visit, just don't expect to have your socks knocked off.

Cheers to Heineken!!!. Not a beer lover but thoroughly enjoyed this experience, the history behind the beer and special secret ingredient developed was interesting and presented in a fun interactive way.

What a great time!!!. What an awesome place!!! The beer is great but the brewery and all the amenities help make for an outstanding time. The bathrooms are clean. The staff are personable and helpful. But behind the scenes of the actual brewery take the cake. Highly recommended for a fun and relaxing time.

Must go experience . This for us one of our must see tours and worth every penny. Lots of information along the way and some suprises too. We thought we'd come to the end only to find lots more activities photo and video opportunities to have for fun. Well organised and what should have taken about an hour we thoroughly enjoyed the two hours we stayed for!

A nice ending of my trip in Amsterdam. My flight was scheduled in the evening, so I had some time for one or two places to visit. I planned to go to Muiderslot in the morning, but it rained, so I decided to go to Heineken Museum. The experience was awesome, worth the price of the ticket! Exhibition of the old stuffs of/about the funder, history of the company, facilities for and orientation about beer brewing, "brew your ride" experience (which I like most), beers, and other interactive cool stuffs! The souvenir options are of a variety. You can even have/design a beer of your own style. Remember to fill in the questionnaire if you got time cuz you can get a free little gift!

Great activity, glad we went. After some bad press and negative hear say we were slightly reluctant about going to the Heineken Experience, but after seeing so many signs for it we felt we should probably go! We weren't disappointed with a good tour of the old brewery and some informative and interactive parts along the way it was a nice tour, if not too crowded at certain points. The staff were knowledgeable and helpful whenever we had a question. Definitely recommend if visiting the city, if not for the free beers on the way round!
Awesome. Went here last year. Was such a fantastic day out. Best to get the free Heineken canal boat there from the Heineken shop.in rembraant sq.

Great way to spend a couple of hours. We really enjoyed our visit here (with our 2 kids). There was loads to see and do from the history of Heineken right through to the interactive stuff at the end. Just a brilliant way to spend a few hours. I had friends who had been in years gone by and they didnt rate it too much but they must have added loads to this since they visited as we couldn't believe we had spent so long in there!
heineken. great fun excursion, had trouble finding it! but well worth it , we got a free glass each, and the beer tasting is awesome, and a little boat trip in with the price, interesting and fun!

Great experience!. I had no desire to go to this museum :) ,but now I visited him again when I go to Amsterdam! So fun, great everything done seems like a miracle. When you buy a ticket you get a green bracelet and two tokens for free beers. The museum consists of several levels of rooms. In the lower room are real horses as the farm! :) In the second room of huge boilers which produced beer. There's room as a disco where there is a bartender who your free learning how to properly pour a beer without foam or that it does not spill out of the glass. Is so fun! Everything is clean and nicely decorated. You have the right to order a bottle of Heineken beer with their name and surname as well as a lot of souvenirs, T-shirts, hats, bags ... great experience and a great idea!

A must see in Amsterdam!. I visited with family. A highly interesting visit for both beer and non beer drinkers. This is a very well preserved Brewery and offers a very interesting history about Heineken. You can walk through the Brewery and see the equipment used for making the beer, you then go on to the tasting area, where you can sample the beer for yourself. You then walk through the stables, seeing all horses and old fashioned carts used to transport the barrels of beer. There is also a very fun interactive area near the end of the experience which is fun for all ages, not just children!You are best to go early as it does get busy. We were there for about 2 hours, which is enough time to have a leisurely walk round the experience. You might think €18 per adult is quite expensive, but at the end of the experience, we felt it was worth it. You get two drinks and a glass included with your ticket. A snack box is also given when there are four of you in a group. This is perfect for when you are sampling the beer while watching all the Heineken TV adverts.

Great tour for the price. Best thing I did in Amsterdam during my stay! I have also toured the Guinness brewery in Ireland and Heineken was much more interesting and entertaining. Plus, you get 2 free beers.
Fun and interesting. Heineken has really put some effort in to putting together a nice experience off course it's like a big commercial but still informative and entertaining. They have free wifi

So much fun. We loved it here, a tasting experience, a wander through the brewery and then into the bar with our sausages and cheese and gherkins (sounds hideous but really wasn't) and a loud bar in the dark. A unique and fun experience.

A must see in Amsterdam!. We were weary of what an experience of a beer brewing facility might be like, but this tour was fantastic. The information given was very interesting. There were a lot of great photo opportunities, and we enjoyed it thoroughly. The beer at the end is a plus, and if it is open, check out the rooftop restaurant.

Informative and very entertaining tour!. Visited the brewery during a three day trip to Amsterdam. We both found it very informative and entertaining. The staff have extensive knowledge of the history of Heineken, and you have several drinks included, which is a bonus!If you have the time I fully recommend a visit!

It has free beer!. A really fun visit. Loads to do, good for all ages as well! You see the original brewery, the horses that pulled the carts, can pour a virtual pint and it finishes with two free beers so what's not to love! Highly recommend to everyone!

Fun but commercial. Besides the fact that u pay enterence for a two hour commercial of heineken it was a fun tour. The overall experience was good, as you get all information though modern media such as little films and presentations. You have also the possibility to play some fun games. We enjoyed it!

What a hoot!. Loved that there was no ridiculous line to get in. You moved at your own pace through the tour (no workers pushing you through like other tours). So interactive and interesting, for men and women. And final stage... The bar with your drinks was a blast. Made it feel so light and fun. More seating would be great but it was awesome anyway.

Great experience.. The Heineken Experience is fantastic, and would be an enjoyable experience even if you aren't a beer lover. Very informative, and a lot of fun. If you are a beer lover, get the wrist band. The free beer is so worth it!

Great day out. Thought it would just be a brewery visit so wasn't expecting much. The multimedia start was excellent and nice to see exactly what happens when you brew beer. The place has been laid out really well and you get 3 free beers as well. There is a rooftop bar which is a great place to see Amsterdam from and a chance to buy more beers from as well. It was our luck that a band was playing called Deperados and we spent a great afternoon listening to a really good band. Really worth the money

Quite the Experience . The Heineken Experience was so much fun. It not only gives you the history behind Heineken, but it is also an interactive experience that made the experience hands on as well. It was definitely an experience I won't soon forget.

Love the Green!!!. Absolutely a blast for all adults !!! Interesting , educational, and fun! , it was less than 20 Euros admission, you can pay more for the VIP but we had a fantastic time exploring on our own at our own pace! Made videos and emailed them to friends and family , played games, road an awesome virtual ride and sipped on a bit of beer. The facility is huge!! There are elevators for those that have difficulty with stairs and there are allot of stairs to climb. Be prepared to stay for several hours there's much to see and do.. photo ops abound!!! Be there when it opens at ten it starts getting crowded around noon-1 and you may have a little wait on some of the interactive experiences. When you finish here walk around the corner a few blocks to the Albert Cuypmarket. Wear comfortable shoes and clothing

The Heinekin Experience. Very fun and informative place to visit, especially if you like beer. We are in our late 60's and loved visiting here. Only wishing more people our age were there. It was mostly much younger people, but I would still recommend it to anyone except children.

Dont miss this place!. One of the best experience in Amsterdam! A lot of fun , some good beers and good company can make a great day for you!in the final we book for a trip with the boat that was included in that price and was amazing to see Amsterdam like that!

Amazing!. I had a blast when I went to the Heineken Experience! Got to taste the delicious beer and got a cute free cup at the end of tour. You could also get beer bottles with your name printed on the front label. Over all I would definitely recommend this place to family and friends. I would also purchase tickets online, it will make your entry quicker. There was a long line when I went and by purchasing tickets online, we were able to walk right in.

Great interactive experience. We have visited many Brewery's across the world, this was a close second to the Guinness Brewery in Ireland.The Heineken experience Had more interactive features and the beer as coldWell worth a visit

Great time and food. I am a fan of Heineken, so my review is biased. Interactive, fun, creative amd enjoyable, the Experience is a must. As a business guy, they created the perfect fan atmosphere, exploring global branding, sports, entertainement and obviously, the taste. Do buy tickets in advance and, if the weather is good, get a burger ob the roof!
Big Commercial. This place was okay, but (as expected) it was pretty much a big commercial for Heineken. I am in my 40s, this would have been a better place to visit in my 20s.

its all abouth beer. the price to get in is whow! €18.- per Person - butinside your will see a lot of brew a beer. the last part of the tour is amazing. you got flushed down the brewery, get a beer tasting, two beers in the bar and a cool present at the Exit. all ofer all €18.- per Person is not small but it is worth it! cool experience!

Amazing!. I loved everything about this experience from learning all about the history, how its made to tasting it! You can also go on the Heineken canal boat trip at the end of the tour which was equally enjoyable especially with a bottle of Heineken to sip on at the same time! I would highly recommend doing this even if, for some weird reason, you don't like Heineken!

A must do.. I would definitely recommend taking the tour, its a walk through the history of the brewery and Heineken itself. A wristband will also entitle you to a few free beers (i say few because as you do, you try for plenty)

Great experience. I went here with my partner, and not being a beer drinker like him, I didn't know what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised- lots of information about Heineken and the staff were very knowledgeable. Looking at the brewing process was interesting, and there was heaps of interactive stuff to do. There's a ride where "you're the beer" and you can learnt how to pour the perfect beer. You get 3 free beers to enjoy there too which was nice. Worth the money!

Extremely entertaining. I liked the interactive experiences throughout and tasting the beer. We had fun and thought it was worth the price! You can take Heineken themed "selfies" throughout the self-guided tour. At the end we were offered a canal ride (free)...loved it!

Amazing Experience with the VIP Tour!. Took the VIP Tour instead of the normal one, got a very experienced guy (Jos) taking us along answering every question possible on the tour with some special access to the horse stables, yes we get to touch the horses, and we get to go onto the rooftop with some pretty amazing view of Amsterdam, before getting the exclusive beer tasting (from all 5 different breweries that Heineken owns), paired with cheese and snacks, and this is on top of the 2 beers you get with the normal tour, PLUS a personalised bottle of Heineken to the name of your choice included in the VIP Tour!Thank you Jos, it was a great experience! He definitely made the tour much more personalised and professional at the same time.By the way, the VIP Tour is a new thing, all the above for only 49euros and it's totally worth it! Get it before the price goes up. PS we told them it's very much underpriced.
Heinekenmazing Experience. Have you ever thought of Heineken, the amazing beer company's back story? Well there you have it Heineken Experience one of the greatest experiences of all time

Great if you like Heineken advertisements. I'm not sure what I expected but I left feeling like I'd spent too much money to watch advertisements for Heineken. It was a pretty typical corporate narrative "experience" (like the World of Coca Cola in Atlanta) with not much depth to what you can learn. In the end we wished we'd skipped it.

Pretty cool.. My husband and I went on a really HOT day (100*f) and while waiting in line they offered some free ice cream, which I thought was pretty cool. The tour is just like any brewery/distillery tour. But it's still neat to hear about it's beginning. The beer was great of course. I purchased a glass mug with my husbands name engraved in it, pretty neat souvenir.

Insightful and fun!. Really enjoyed the whole experience. We got to see and understand how one of our favourite beers gets made. And we got to taste as well!
Really enjoyed becoming a Certified Pourer where we got to learn how to pour the perfect Heineken from Tap.
Got there early and had little to no lines and crowds.

Fab time. Got here just before it opened but the queues went down really quick. I wasn't too impressed at the start where it felt like a corporate induction. It did get much better when you get to where they make (or used to) the beer. after that is the interactive section with a cool very interactive movie and some high tech fun.The staff are very friendly and you get to taste a glass or two.Well worth the visit.
Very amazing experience!!!. A great overview of how heiniken was created and made with extras! Definately worth the money! Also free beer what more do you want!!!

That is an Experience!. One of the top attraction in Amsterdam. I did not expect much, and I was greatly surprised. I learnt a lot about beer brewing, Heineken family and activities of their company. It was very interactive - one could smell, taste beer and its ingrediences in different stages of production, feel like being a beer (that was the best part - a movie during which you stay on a moveable platform and experience being a beer - will not tell more, try it yourself ;-) ). One can play games, take pictures, videos. There are even live horses there!With "I AMsterdam card" you get discount.

Fun break from the museums. Sadly, my teenage children and husband enjoyed this far more than any museum. I have to say it is pretty well done, the tour is interesting and lively and woke everyone up after the canal tour. Also good to do on a rainy day.
Very Interesting!. Really interesting and its a part of Amsterdam. Free Booze and you learn the history and background of the beer. Only need a couple hours and its a bit of fun!

There are many better things to do in town.. As I’m sure you know, the beer is bland and best served very, very cold, lest you taste it. On a blazing hot day, sat lazily in the sun, it'll do. This is not the experience they are offering.The tour is OK.But there are a lot of local, brilliant breweries and beers to try try: Ij Brewery, De Prael etc.

Great afternoon out.. The heineken experience was well worth the money. It took us about 2 hours to go around, and there was plenty of interactive activities to do. .along with a taster and a couple of free beers. (Soft drinks for people who don't drink) it was interesting and we'll set out and the staff were excellent. I would highly recommend it.

group of friends. well worth a visit. if you like a normal museum with a guide this experience will be different for you, it is a interactive journey through the museum and the history of Heineken. we really liked it and I believe this is the way many museums will do it in the future, we really liked it.
Awesome Time. One of the Highlights of the Trip . Liked it a lot , can easily send 2+ hours over here . Awesome beer & merchandize

Amazing. It was a little bit expensive, about €27, but I really like it. It's an amazing experience.
You could learn more about the criation of this magical beer

Very Interesting and Great for a group!. The entire tour was upbeat. We started in the long line with FREE ice cream cones and the guys serving were super funny. Once we entered we were able to do the tour at our own pace. Most of the people ran around us to get to the free beer so it was even better. We loved the interactive tasks we were given (help the brewer activities) and we loved being able to see the horses!! The history lesson on the Heineken family was short and sweet. I don't want to spoil anything but you get plenty of beer to try! TIPS: Get the cheese set BEFORE going in and having the beer. We regretted that! ALSO!! Get tickets before. Seriously. Don't wait in line. We almost got out of line and walked a block just to cut the long line. The ice cream helped us stay though :) You must do this if you're in Amsterdam!!! So much fun!!

Absolutely brilliant! . Would definitely recommend this place! The sheer history of the beer itself is outstanding and for the price you can't go wrong especially when you agree to the free canal tour at the end of which each person receives a free glass.
Fun tour. It's a fun little thing to do if your in the area and especially if your a Heineken lover. The tour is well organized and very well executed.
Save your money. Boring, save your money, have a more enjoyable time by visiting a bar and drink your Heineken there......

Really Interesting + A Few Tastes Throughout. I think the Heineken Experience was really fun, and super interesting. The people working g there are extremely kind. My friend hurt her foot before we got there, and one of the security guards noticed, went over to her, brought her to a room and wrapped her foot up. Then, throughout the tour they said to be sure we use the elevator when it is an option. So kind! There is a lot of fun information to learn, a 4D simulation that takes you group the brewing process, and the three tastes you get makes it all worth it. Some of the crowd is a bit (annoying) rowdy, but you can slow down your tour to get away from them if need be. Definitely something fun to do when you are in Amsterdam.

Must do in Amsterdam. If you love a beer it is probably one of the better tourist attractions to visit in the city! I was a bit sceptical before the visit that it would be a bit dull and had the potential to be but it was made great fun. Staff were fun and passionate about the tour and you got plenty of tasters on the way round.

Great couple hours fun. The tour itself was similar to other tours we have been on that produce alcoholic beverages. But what stood out was the experience elements of the tour. the rugby and football parts, the video and interactive parts
Far more fun and interactive than I expected. . I have been on a few brewery tours in my time and this one was certainly the best. Well designed, interested and interactive.

Greatest Brewery you will ever visit!. My friend and I had such such a fun time here. We made our own custom bottles, made videos/pics, and enjoyed the canal ride to the souvenir shop. It was cool learning how the beer was made and of course getting to drink it! Well worth the 16 euro!

fun & a little educational. The Heineken Experience is fun & a little educational. They do tell you a little about the history of the company & some of its marketing schemes & the beer making process. Many people go because you get 2 beers during the tour. We also got to see the Heineken horses who are always black with white legs. There were some very, very silly areas which were probably fun if you had been drinking before you got there! But, overall, we were glad that we went & we had fun. Really, I think I should say that it was a good "experience"!!

Must see for beer lovers !!. Heineken - the legendary Amsterdam beer. Here Ou'll experience how Heineken was created, from which ideas it originated and how it has grown to be the world's best brand! Very interactive and long, but never too long! We were very happy to have visited it and see Heineken now with completely different eyes, it was perfect!Visit Heineken's original brewerie, an opportunity not to miss!
Great fun. Really enjoyed the walk round. Informative and fun. The staff are really informative and would highly recommend a visit.

What's not to like ... It's a tour with beer included?. Really interesting tour round the old brewery and although it's a bit of a Heineken brain washing experience with a decent helping of free beer I had a great times didn't need encouragement to buy it.Top tip ... Take a friend who doesn't drink beer and you get to drink their beer at the end woohoo!

Must visit!!. great experience,you get to know the entire process of the beer!!interactive sessions while on tour.can click lot of pix,at the end of the tour u find yourself in a club like atmosphere where you can have 2 glasses of the freshly brewed beer.lovely experience.must visit for beer lovers.

Awesome day out. My wife and I timed are visit to the Heineken experience perfectly. There was no queue to get in, we decided to have the extended tour with a beer and a burger at the end.... OMG this was the best euros spend, the views from the roof with a beer and burger and the best. The tour itself was fantastic and very informative whilst being fun for all the family.

Nice!. Having seen the Carlsberg brewery in Copenhagen decided to check this out in Amsterdam.A short walk from the Rijksmuseum.The entire tour is fun with lot of interactive spots and even a 4D show!Got my certificate as a "certified pourer" which was cool.Also one can get a customised Heineken bottle as a good souvenir. Don't miss the free boat tour whose tokens can be collected near the exit. The boat drops you near the Heineken brand store where there are lots of things to buy and also a free Heineken souvenir.
Beer, need I say more?. Fun, interactive beer tour with a bar experience at the end. A must do while in Amsterdam. Also Heineken is much better over there!

Loved it!. This tour is very interesting and takes about an hour or so to do. You have an audio guide but also get to try beer at different stages and see what they do to make it. At the end you end up in a bar w two tiny glasses of beer to drink. Once you're out remember to take the Heineken boat (free) to go to their other store and get your free souvenir Heineken glass. Well worth the visit!!!
Worth the visit. I don't even like beer but found it interesting to learn about how it's made and the brand itself. It's definitely worth a visit since it's not that expensive.

The ultimate beer experience!. We initially thought it's going to be a bit boring perhaps, but my oh my - we were in for a surprise! It was so much fun doing the Heineken Experience. The tastings were amazing and the club room = out of this world. Read up on your beer and you might get an extra beer for answering correctly. Great gifts you can make and buy for family and friends. It's really a great, fun experience. Take enough time to enjoy all the games and other fun activities inside!

Lots of fun! . This tour begins by taking you through the beer making process and how Heineken was first born. The tour takes about 1.5 hours and allows you to drink two small glasses on the way. The tour has the ability to keep older and younger audiences entertained throughout. This experience is a lot of fun, and makes you appreciate Heineken that much more.

Not what I expected, but still fun. Brewing beer is a simple process and the Heineken Experience makes the most of it. Not detailed, but fun to do and there is always the lure of beer at the end. It was informative if you took the time to listen and interesting to learn the "correct" way to drink a beer. Not overly exciting, but good for a rainy day.

Great time! . We went on New Years Day! Got very lucky because there was not a long line. I def recommend you get there early because they do get busy quickly. It's really a full bells and whistles experience for visitors. I am a craft beer snob, so you have to leave that cap behind if you want to enjoy. However we spent several hours there and had a great time. The beer in Amsterdam tastes different from the Heineken we have back in the states. It's way better at the brewery.

Must do!. The experience was much better than we expected. It's not just a brewery but as innovative an experience as it can get. You can experience being brewed/ becoming James bond , a brewer and many more. It's very entertaining. Would highly recommend !

Overall a very enjoyable tour. The tour is very informative in setting out the history of the beer and the family itself. The first three quarters of the tour are excellent, you get to see the original features of the brewery and learn about the ingredients and get to taste the beer. You also get a 4D ride which takes you through the whole journey of brew to bar - prepare to get wet! There are lots of photos and old bottles etc. it's interesting to see how the branding and bottles have changed throughout the years. There is even a stable of still working horses although these are now only used for promotional work. You also get to design your own personalised label (extra 6.50 euros). The last quarter of the tour was a bit gimmicky with DJs, computer games, Heineken sponsorship and the like, most of which you cannot get near because of the amount of people there. You do get to practice your pulling technique though which is good fun. The experience is rounded off with a trip to the bar where you can either get two 35ml Heinekens or 1 large 50ml extra cold Heineken. When you consider how much you would pay for these a couple of streets away in the centre of Amsterdam, the tour is good value for money and a pretty good experience.

Brilliant - an absolute must!!. I dont even drink beer and I rate this as the top experience we had in Amsterdam. The tour is interactive, entertaining and stimulating. What a dynamic company!! So impressive

Quite good, bit pricey. If the tickets were slightly cheaper I'd up this to 4 stars. The bits about beer making were pretty interesting, and obviously the tasting room was good. Towards the end of the experience it all got a bit tacky, but still quite good overall.

Fun day at the Heineken Experience. Excellent tour even enjoyed the beer samples and learnt how to drink a beer very informative but also good fun.We also came back and did the canal trip which was interesting and gives you a completely different perspective of Amsterdam saw lots of places that we would have missed on foot there was a running commentary which was excellent booked these online before we arrived so no queues which was fab. Both well worth doing.

Pass unless you're desperate to fill your agenda with an indoor activity... My best advice for anyone planning to visit the Heineken Experience is to purchase your tickets online prior to arriving. This will save you €2 per person and help you jump ahead of the long line of people and straight into the experience.Unfortunately, this 'jump ahead' only helps you slightly as once you're inside you will be herded like cattle with the rest of the folks who have already entered. Since there are so many people allowed inside at one time, it is difficult to hear the information that is being piped in through loudspeakers about the history and view all of the artifacts against the walls. Once you've gotten through the historical part of the experience you hit a bottleneck (no pun intended) when you enter into a virtual reality experience and then become completely encapsulated in one giant Heineken advertisement for the rest of your journey ending in a giant souvenir shop - just like at Disney. The good news is you're given beer during this time - one small glass at the star bar and then after moving into a different area you are welcome to either two regular glasses or one extra cold glass of very crisp Heineken -- the highlight of the experience.The concept is cool, but with poor execution. It would be beneficial to allow less people in at once, perhaps selling tickets per time slot.

Great interactive tour!. Its certainly not your standard brewery tour. Although there is a lot of history behind Heineken, the tour is very modern and interactive. Still a lot of fun, and a must do if you drink beer!

Great fun. A lot of fun and very interesting.
Beer is beer, nothing different about the brewing process, but the history and the way they present it is a joy.
Lots of interactive fun to entertain everybody and a few cold ones at the end!
Well worth a visit

Amsterdam . Must see great visual on beer history and Heineken the best of the beer.
And 2 free beers at the end of tour

Heineken Brewery tour. The tour was worth every dollar spent. They show you how it started in the beginning. How it is processed and the time it takes to brew a good beer. The end you get two samples of their beer. You can also have a bottle made with your name on it.
Worth a trip if you have an afternoon to kill.... There's loads more things worth visiting in Amsterdam before the Heineken Experience, but if you have a spare afternoon it's worth a visit.
Drink of the gods. Cheap, ineteresting and you get a lot of beer. Perfect to learn more about the "drink of the gods" as an Indian tourist put it.

Great for Families with Teens. I hadn't been to the Heineken museum in over 20 years and went back with my husband and teenage girls. It had changed (for the better) and we all loved it! In addition to the overview of the history and beermaking process, there were several interactive exhibits, the horses that pull the wagons and much sports and advertising media displays which I loved. You get a tasting at the end (or cola if under 18) and we even bought some things in the shop. Very enjoyable.

Incredible. Green Square Bottles!. UAU, unbelievable place that you can see many many things of the history of heineken. Including the old square bottles that can be stacked and transformed in beautiful green wall. Many of the holand history is blended of heineken history. One of the places that you can not miss.

Beer at its best!. Great way to experience the original Heineken beer and learn it's history. Book the tickets ahead of time, online, it's a bit cheaper!Allow at least 1h for the visit. They give you a few beers so don't go there on an empty stomach :)

Average.... Second time I've visited and wasn't as good as I remember 10yrs earlier. Maybe my expectations were higher but since visiting many breweries before coming back I guess that's why I was disappointed. Definitely go but don't get too excited

Heineken tour. This is the modern factory prototype of Heineken. They show you how they select barley and all. You get to smell it before fermentation and get a shot of freshly brewed Heineken.
++ bonus .. You get a heineken glass for free.

Book online and do the Heineken cruise for a great afternoon!. Learn about the smiling "e"'s of Heineken branding, the process of brewing Heineken, and then you get to physically experience the process of of hops to beer! I've been here in both of my visits to Amsterdam, and it's just a fun activity to do with friends. It ends with some interactive games, photos, and of course, cold Heineken on draft -- doesn't get much better. When booking online beforehand, my friends and I saved 1 euro, and upon leaving, ask for a ticket to the Heineken cruise, which happens at the end of the hour. We took one down the canals and learned some brief history about Amsterdam, and it stops at the Heineken brand store if you'd like souvenirs and goods to bring home.

Great tour. The tour at the factory was fun and interesting. Cool people and great guides.The best part is that you get to taste fresh cold Heineken from the tap.One of the best beer experiences there are.Highly recommended

Really a lot of fun.....!!. Went on this tour because I thought it might be interesting. Not only was it interesting but it was a lot of fun. Right mix of staff and interactive displays. The staff is very enthusiastic and informative. The beer at the end is a nice touch. The only con I would have is if you are older the steps are a killer. Lots of steps.....!
Great experience!. Lots of fun and interresting things to do and learn about making beer! Very friendly and helpful staff.

Disneyland for Adults. An experience is exactly what it is. The content of this tour varies greatly. Some areas are reading and watching informative videos, others are interactive games and fun visual experiences. And of course the best part, beer included. I had an awesome time at the Heineken Experience, it's definitely something you want to check out when you're in Amsterdam.

A must visit when in amsterdam. As someone who doesn't like to drink beer I even enjoyed myself here. Learning about the history of the brand, being brewed into a beer myself (4d film) and even learning how to drink a beer properly. You get one free tasting beer around 200ml then Your wristband gets you two more or one Heineken ice cold. It was an interesting and interactive tour. There is a market (cryps albert I think) just up the road from here which is a good visit after!

Enjoyed just as much by the non-drinkers. Good tour with a variety of activities and experiences. Right amount of information, delivered both by displays and very friendly, enthusiastic employees and plenty of opportunities to ask questions. Interactive displays were very good and fun for children/teens. I don't drink beer and we had a thirteen year old with us but we all had a very enjoyable couple of hours at the attraction.

Heineken Experience. Great way to spend an afternoon before you head out to bars! Drinks are included with the entrance fee and it's a very interactive tour! (It includes a virtual reality ride explaining how Heineken is brewed as well as miniature nightclubs along the way). The staff know what they're talking about and there are some good photo opportunities that I always look back on and laugh at.

Must see Attraction!. The Heineken Experience is a must do attraction in Amsterdam! I'm not a big beer drinker but Heineken being the biggest beer brand in the world, a visit to understand the history and beer processing was very enjoyable! For under 20€ you get a visit that last well over 1h that also includes beer! Not to be miss!

A Must. An experience for beer lovers and non-beer lovers alike, visiting the Heineken Experience, gives you a detailed history of Heineken and how it came to be to what it is now.
The tour is self guided, and I would definitely recommend buying your tickets prior to arrival as it saves you from having to line up.
Fun and informative. Great tour, get to sample some beer and learn the history of Heineken. Also a great place to get some gifts for the folks back home.

Exactly what you would expect!. Good tour, starting with a walk around showing old photos and previous examples of the beer. You can see the vats the beer used to be brewed in and the horses that used to deliver it around the city. Most importantly there is a short tasting demo before moving into a 4D movie which is really good fun and different to usual displays. You finish off in the bar area which is modern and busy before moving into the shop!

Awesome!. I don't drink beer or any alcoholic beverage, but I had a great time here. Ot's definitely an experience, with friendly staff, very well structured, a lot of fun, interactive and modern. It's really an experience, indeed. at the end you can print you name in Heineken cups or bottles and enjoy a Heineken party at the bar. It offers a shop where you can buy anything from Heineken. A must see!

A must do. Loved this place! A must do when in Dam. We had so much fun here from learning about the process of making this beer to the numerous interactive things to do. And most importantly the beer tasting a great few hours spent here.

Great Time, A Bit Watered Down . Went with my two buddies and we loved it. The history, the brewing process were fantastic.Only thing I would say is that sheer volume of visitors causes low levels of staff attention, taking away from what could be a more personal and fascinating tour and learning experience. More of a museum than a full "experience"
A marketing gimmick... you have to pay for?. Long line to enter. Very underwhelming, very heavy focus on the Heineken brand as opposed to how a brewery works. Would not recommend.

Informative and Fun Interactive Things to do. Spent a couple of hours here walking round. Informative and good fun with lots of interative stuff to do. Staff lovely and friendly. Well worth a visit.Bought a ticket for €16 each in combination with a hop on hop off boat tour.
Great Time. We had lots of fun in the Heineken experience. Shared the history of the brewery end experience Heineken beer as fresh as it gets!

An amazing place to visit. We spent a couple of hours here learning about the history. They show you the history, then how to pour a beer properly. Then time for a taste or two. 2 beers are included with entry. This is no longer an active brewery but has a lot of equipment and history. The store seems to have reasonable prices and they offer a free boat ride into town to the Heineken store where you can wander around and walk back to you hotel, etc. Definite place to visit even if you are not a real beer lover. Enjoy.

Tourist experience. Went there with a mate while our wives went to the Van Gough MuseumWe found that half of the tour was about showing the history of the company with minimal information on the brewing processThe other half concentrated on marketing the products It is geared up for the younger generation to get them into the brand An average tour at expensive price for a true beer drinker
Heineken experience tour. Great tour, very interesting, never knew about the 3 smiling e's before. And didnt realise what a clever brand heineken is. Really enjoyed.

A nice experience for beer-lovers. We took the City Sightseeing boat to the stop closest to the Heineken Experience. We had not booked tickets in advance and had to queue - there was quite a long line by the door. Surprisingly the line moved quickly and the Heineken staff, on a regular basis, served something which I later found out was Bitterballen and mustard (tasty). The snack was very welcome as it was a cold and windy day outside and the bitterballen was nice and warm.The tickets for the Heineken experience is quite expensive, but you do get 2,5 beers throughout the experience which make it more worthwhile. When purchasing your ticket, you get a little bracelet with some tokens which you later use for the "purchase of beers".The museum part explains how Heineken started and became popular. It was fascinating to see how different people managed the company during their time. After this you move to where they show you how the beer is made, what the different ingredients are, etc. At one point you go out of the one building, and walk upstairs to upper floor. We were quite surprised to find a horse stable between the buildings. Once upstairs you go to a special Heineken experience. On the day we were there the queues were long, but we didn't wait for longer than 20 minutes to enter the special experience venue. It was a nice experience - similar to those 4D moving movie theatres. After that you can design your own beer bottle, take some pictures of yourself in different settings (for free). Then you get to a room where you get your first 0.5 beers where some ladies explain how to drink a beer, etc.There are also rooms with games, video clips, etc. Eventually you end up at the bar area where you can have your 2 free beers or soda if you don't want to drink beer. There is a souvenir shop when you finish. One of your tokens entitle you to a free gift as well, which is a free Heineken beer glass.Overall, we enjoyed the experience. Although a bit pricey, for a one-off experience we thought it was worth it. The staff was super friendly and helpful throughout.
GREAT TOUR. the tour was great, they changed it from 5 years ago for the better, lots to play with and interaction,

Just okay. There was certainly enough to kill time here, but nothing amazing. It had the generic explanation of the beer making process, it had lots of past advertising, then there were some strange things like a DJ booth set up that people could play with, and a camera that took a photo of the user to email to themselves to prove they'd been there. If you're lucky, it's possible to get more than the usual allocation of free beer at the end of the tour, but I found you need to be female and cute, and the bartender must be male.I also noticed a severe lack of staff apart from the bartender at the end. I've definitely had better brewery tours.

Interesting Tour. Nice place to go to if you have an interest in beer, the "ride" is enjoyable and the place wasn't too packed. Nice history about Mr Heineken as well and how the business came to be. Free beers at the end is a nice treat esp the extra cold one. Souvenir shop had a nice variety of items that werent overpriced as well as a chance to engrave a personalised glass.

A tourist-catcher experience. Didn't like it. lots and lots of advertising, few information (compared to a guided tour I made in Budweiser factory in the US) and crowds of people all around. It includes a stupid 4D movie called something like "Brew yourself" and ends in a bar with loud electronic music that made me feel I was in a hateful night club. If you like beer or the brand Heineken, do a favour to your travel budget: save the euros of the ticket and go straight to the store.

A very uninteresting tour. The only highlight is a couple of "free" beers. It is a tour geared towards young people, 18 to 20 years of age. Basically very boring. It should be free because it is just a promotion for Heineken. Not value for money.
Great. I don't like Beer but went along for the experience. Really pleased that I went had a great time it isn't just about the history of the brand. Well worth a visit

Review: Heineken Music Hall. WARNING: This review is about THE HEINEKEN MUSIC HALL, not the Heineken Experience. (Somehow, tripadvisor's website changed this on us!!! The Heineken MUSIC HALL is in a different area of Amsterdam and not physically close to the Heineken Experience at all!!!) OK, on with my review of THE HEINEKEN MUSIC HALL, (Arena Boulevard 590, 1101 DS Amsterdam Zuid-Oost, Netherlands+31 900 6874242) We stayed in old Amsterdam and took the metro from the train station directly to the Bijlmer Arena stop. It was an easy trip, much less expensive and time consuming than taking a cab. We came from the US to see Jackson Browne, so were pleasantly surprised at the sound quality; the acoustics were excellent. The Dutch crowd was SO quiet, it was really lovely to be able to actually appreciate the more quiet moments of the show. The seats were roomy but not each attached separately to the floor - they were attached to one another, so there was a lot of "bounce" with anyone beside you moving in their seats while enjoying the music. This was our only distraction tho, and not so horrible that I wouldn't go back. No food was offered there, not even snacks, so it was lucky we ate first. There was not much choice in restaurants so eat before you go or take what you get!! It's right next to the big Ajax Arena, so I'm sure there's more open when there is a soccer match in town, but it was like a ghost town on the Monday night we went. There is a little mall close by, but that closed at six and I'm not sure what was offered inside. I think the metro runs until midnight most nights (but check the schedule to be sure, don't trust me...)

So much to do!. Excellent! Had been recommended to go by others and it's definitely worth a visit! Great history behind the company, the layout is good and there are plenty of interactive things to do as well as a fantastic bar at the end where you get a few free Heinekens!
Gift shop is also amazing! It has everything!
Fantastic experience. This was a fantastic experience with so much to see and absorb. The movie experience was very interesting and the beers at the end very much appreciated!

Fun way to spend a few hours in the rain. It rained today, so we decided to do this tour. It was very interactive and kept my attention for most of it. It was a bit expensive, but you end up getting 2 1/2 beers out of it plus an activity. Overall glad we went, but if you only have a day or two in Amsterdam it's not a must see

Great afternoon fun. We visited the experience on Saturday 19th of june and had a great time. The two free beers helped and a small taster! The tour was fun and interactive in areas. Its good fun without becoming a bore. The little talk on how to drink Heineken was fun and becoming beer kept us entertained as did the beer at the end served by jurgen and pricilla . For sixteen euros each it was good. You get a free gift and a free shuttle boat back to the centre. Odele was an entertaining tour guide and waitress. it was a nice boat ride with complimentary drunk germans singing" theres no limits" so yeah go see it.

Nice Tour - Best Part is the Canal Boat Ride. I've been to a few brewery tours, so in comparison the Heineken Experience was just OK and nothing spectacular. The main reason I didn't think it was great, is because they make it to be a huge commercial and advertising for Heineken and how it's the greatest beer in the world and you shouldn't drink anything else. I'm not particularly a Heineken fan so maybe that was a cause for not enjoying the tour as much as others but you get 2 beers plus a small tasting for the price of your ticket. The champions league display was cool to see but there isn't much information or details on how the beer is brewed or the history of heineken that you would expect. I didn't even know Heineken owned Amstel until I got to the store and saw an Amstel t-shirt and I asked someone, which I think is info that should be part of the tour but it isn't.
