After the tour ends they give you a voucher to pick up your free souvenir glass, however the pickup location is at their brand store which isn't that close, but they provide a canal boat ride to the store right from the heineken experience which made the tour worth the cost. Since I didn't have a canal ride planned as I only had 2 days in Amsterdam, this free tour/ride as part of the heineken experience was definitely the highlight and an unexpected bonus of the tour. Note, that they Only take you to the store on a one-way trip, so you need to figure out a way back or to your next location on your own and I just ended up taking a Tram. Overall a decent tour, it would be a great tour if you like Heineken, I just wish they talked less about how great their beer was and were a little more humble and gave more facts about the history and brewing process. The canal boat ride was the best part of the tour even though it's pretty much unrelated to anything Heineken except that you can drink one on the boat. If you have a few hours available then this tour is worth it, but if you are on a time crunch I would skip this experience.

Not what it used to be. I visted here about 10 years ago and found the tour to be really great so I decided to visit again with my wife this time. We were quite disappointed. There was no real guided tour like last time and it was really over-packed with too many people. Rather than having people queue outside, it was completely packed inside. We ended up skipping most of it as it was quite uncomfortable. There was a huge queue to get the beers that are included so we gave our tokens to others and just bailed. Suggest to visit in the winter or early when it opens for a more pleasant experience. Without the insane crowds it would have been much better.

Visiting Heineken. We spent a good few hours here, the visitor experience is well organised. You are taught to pour a proper Heineken Pint, get to see the VATs, have a small theme park type experience to find out how the brew is made.
don't go if you are over 21. We paid 16 Euro for a Heineken commercial. They gave us two beers at the end. So, subtract that from the cost.
Not to miss on your Amsterdam visit. Very good over all. Que moved very fast. We enjoyed it. A little pricey but worth it. Free beer too!!!

Loved this tour. This tour was fantastic, you can casually make your way through and learn the history of Heineken at your pace.I did not find any part of the tour boring and once you get to the end you are given a couple of beverages to finish.I will be sure to visit here again.

Good tour. This is good value for money. It's an interesting tour and a lot of money has been invested to make it enjoyable.
The sport areas are good fun and full of the latest technology

Exceeded expectations!. Me and my girlfriend are backpacking and didn't know whether we could justify spending €18 each on what has mixed reviews.What we experienced was magnificent! The first part is vaguely interested but once you get to the brewing process and the brewing room that's where the fun begins. I particularly enjoyed the beer tasting and the stuff after that. There's a Champions League exhibit where you can play a game of FIFA against someone. Finally of course you get a free beer! 2 x 25ml standard Heinekens or 1 x 35 ml ice cold Heineken. I opted for the latter which I thoroughly enjoyed.

Strictly Average. A good thing to do in Amsterdam, you should definitely give it a try if your into your lagers. But weighing up everything, the price, the content, the length and the feeling I had afterwards I came to the conclusion that it was distinctly average. Maybe im being too harsh but I felt it needed more, and for less Wonga. Its well advertised like the disappointing Amsterdam dungeons and although it isn't quite as bad, it still doesn't jump out at you. But if your gunna take the 17 Euro plunge, you will likely enjoy drinking beer, learning about its contents and the brewing. Just be warned that the ride is not what you might expect and you don't actually receive that much beer, you get half a litre max. Side note: I saw people with children at this experience, and in my opinion I don't believe a Brewery tour is really suitable for children.If you are thinking about taking the kids, you might want to relook your parenting.

Could have spent more time here. This is much more than a exhibit showing the history of Heineken. There are many rooms with activities from a ride, to making a video, postcard, or your own personal bottle to name a few. I don't drink beer but the attraction was lots of fun for me as well. There are lots of stairs, but an elevator is available if you need it. Only compliant is I wish the floor in the room with the bar was a little cleaner, as my shoes were sticky for a while.

Wide range of activities and lots of one beer!. I have been on a fair number of beer experiences including some of the larger breweries. The Heineken has by far the most entertainment and put the most effort into the event. They even have an experience that is almost a "ride" where you get made into beer. The highlight is the canal cruise that takes you from the Experience to their store about a mile away. The fruits is included in the €18 price. You can find discount 1€ discount tickets around town. You can bring kids as they have a lot of football activities and photo ops.

Go if its the last place you haven't visited. Doesn't worth your time nor the almost 20 euro ticket at the end of tour you get 2 glasses of free beer as a compensation for a boring tour (if you consider Heineken as beer in 1st place)

Beer, beer and more beer!!!. This place was a lot of fun! Good to arrive in the afternoon and the ticket was included in the Amsterdam Card. We went through the express line so no wait!. From the moment we arrived it was lots of fun, from seeing how Heineken beer was started (history) to interactive rides, and two tasting! that was the best part. The Heineken Sub Zero is amazing! too bad we cannot buy that cold in the states! A nice break from visiting all the museums!

PROOST to Heineken. Really worth your time and money. Very organised and entertaining and educational tour, with lots of 'do it yourself' activities, right near the centre of Amsterdam, walking distance of the Rijksmuseum, suitable for couples, families with youngsters and singles will all enjoy it! Generous beer tasting included in the entrance price of € 18,50.

Great Brewery Tour!. I really enjoyed my Heineken experience tour as they really went into detail on how the beer was made. The history of how the Heineken came to be is also very cool. I'm personally not a Heineken fan, but the 2 free samples we got at the end made me feel better on how feel about Heineken beer!

Hmm - it is fun for a rainy day and well done. hmm - it was ok but i am not sure it is a must and possibly not worth the money. The tour is well laid out and a little Disneyesque in it presentation. There are a lot of interactive presentations but they either had long lines or were not working when we were there. i would say it is a good rainy day activity but not a must
Could be better. Well..., a bit interesting, and probably good for those who brew beer. But too much walking and too noisy "bar" in the end.

Great for the beer fans. A fun place to visit. Intro to what makes Heineken unique and the brewing process. Fun interactive games. You can pour your own beer from the tap at the end of the tour or let them pour you too small ones in a bar sort of atmosphere. Most of the people on the tour were just there for the beer but I learned something. It is in an old warehouse, very close to the other big museums and the iamsterdam sign. Be prepared for stairs (but they might have had an elevator - I didn't check).
Better than Guinness. I've been to Guinness in Dublin and I can affirm that Heineken Experience is better, more interactive and value for money.
Beer insight. Very informative, well presented and explained. Good way to spend an hour especially if raining.Did not like the price of entry, you only get 500 Mls for your 18 €

It's a must if you like a good beer. Beer fan? You can not miss Heineken Experience. You'll get to learn your way around 'the best beer in the world'. They will present you with the history of the brand, production of the beer, and the branding of the Heineken around the world.
For beer lovers. Great place to learn about the process of making beer from one of the largest players in the industry. People who don't like beer might not enjoy this though. I thoroughly liked it.

Waste of time and money. First impression of Heineken Experience: Looong queue to get tickets, around half an hour. At least we had bought just before on website.But also inside there were very crowed through the partly narrow visitor center. Worst in this respect: A 20 minutes queue with no explanation what to wait for. (Showed up that it was to get into a small cinema – well the film about beer making was ok funny.)Free wi-fi was advertised all over, but the network was so overloaded, that I never got online during my one hour visit.The problem with Heineken Experience is, that you 16-18 Euros to most of all see Heineken promotion: Their advertisements during times, a lot of sponsorships (football etc.) and a very self-glorification telling about their (family-)history.Not much is explained about beer making. It seems as if this facility is extremely afraid of boring people. The (only) highlight for me: to see the old (but not working) brewing building and equipment.This is waste of time and money – maybe unless you are 20-30 and want a small party (which is almost taking place at the final place with too many people, load music and sticky floor.) But it is an expensive way to get two small beers.

Fun and informative. We booked tickets along with a river cruise which offered 'jump the queue' tickets. We were glad to do this as when we arrived there was a long queue to get in which we were able to bypass (though it's not actually marked very clearly where those with advanced queue jump tickets go to get in so you literally have to push the queue at first to see where to go). The experience itself is much like any franchise factory tour, a bit of history, a few artefacts, hands on exhibits and even a 4d 'ride' which guides you through the brewing process. In all it took about an hour and a half of our time and at the end we could sample the beer (our wrist bands offered two complimentary drinks plus a free gift of a small glass). For me, who doesn't like beer, it was still a worthwhile interesting experience. I still wasn't necessarily won round to drinking beer but I appreciated the process and have it a good try! My only criticism was that the queue for the 4d ride was very long and the staff seemed a bit disorganised. The queue looked huge but it actually moved fairly quickly (people went into the ride in big groups per turn so it stopped and started) but I witnessed a lot of people walking away from the queue because they thought the wait would be too long. A simple explanation of the queue system and approximate wait times would mean visitors will know what to expect and will not miss this highlight by thinking the queue would take forever. In addition, I also loved seeing the beautiful horses however the stables staff were just stood around chatting to each other away from visitors so I didn't really learn much from this area despite thinking it would have been good to get closer to the horses and know a bit more. The stables were also at a distance so not really anything to interact with beyond taking a photo. It would have been nice to get closer and to find out more about how the horses worked with the brewery over the years and why they are still being kept in the building especially as it will likely cost a lot to keep them there.I would definitely recommend this if you are spending a weekend in Amsterdam!

A little flat.... Entry was quite pricey at 20EURO but it is a large attraction so we thought to give it a go. The tour is self guided which is good as you can explore at your own pace.There is a lot to learn, with the tour showing you the journey from field to pint, so it is very interesting if you drink beer. However, the atmosphere of the place was quite flat, and many people were walking round in silence. The bar at the end of the tour, where you get your free pint (they give you two tokens but 1 token only equates to half a pint), everyone seemed in a rush to leave.Although the content was good, I did not feel amazed at the end - hopefully a one off!

Could learn from Guiness!. After reading reviews expected better. Yes the history of Heineken was interesting, but the rest left me disappointed! Your tokens for your beer are for two small (quarter pint) beers or 1 extra cold larger beer. Yes you get a sample of the quarter size one in one of the rooms. Where you choose and use your tokens the music is blaring! Some of the parts were interactive and ok. Lots of stairs to manage so careful to those with walking difficulties. Shop was also disappointing and quite expensive and very confusing system for paying! Done Guinness brewery in Dublin and far better

Cool to see - would recommend it (especially if you are a beer drinker). This was a place I wanted to go to. It was a cool tour - mostly self guided. Interesting history of Heineken. Their little video presentation in which you go in the room for how beer is made was pretty funny and fun. At the end you get a small taste test where they share how to appropriately drink beer. Then you go to a room in which you think you are going to see something more but really you can just walk thru it - it was showing advertising videos and that was a waste of time. Finally you do have a wristband to get two more free brews before leaving.

More interesting things to do than this.. So we thought we would enjoy this tour...all i can say was it was ok. Interesting to see how beer is made. But its sort of like a magazine full of ads- not much content! Not really worth the price. You get one beer then must pay for the rest at the end of tour....Amsterdam is full of amazing tasting beer and Heineken isn't one of them. Their gift shop is ridiculously expensive. Why pay that much for something with their logos on?? We should actually be paid to wear their merchandise...not vice versa!

Great experience even for non drinkers. I am not a beer drinker myself but this place is amazing with so many different experiences and games to do. It is a self directed tour and it is so much fun. You learn to poor your Heineken and get a certificate after, they have many games to play and different displays to see. All together it is an amazing experience even if its a bit out of the city centre. I would recommend it.

The best tour in Amsterdam!. I am not a beer drinker and still loved the Heineken Experience! From learning about the brewing process, many interactive exhibits from being a DJ in a club to being beer being bottled, it was a blast for all in our group of aged 20-64. Then, included in the price of 18 Euro, you get a lovely city canal tour to the Heineken store right in city central. You get a free Heineken glass at the store where you can play games, take the boat back or stay in city center. Oh, did I mention all the beer tastings and lessons on how to correctly drink beer? There is a reason to keep foam on top!

Book in advance!. A good trip. But if u can u MUST book in advance and save urself standing in the MASSIVE queues outside at the weekend especially. Gives u an interesting insite into the background of heineken into the monster brand today. Of course its propaganda. Wat else u gonnae get!!!A good trip and a good beer

Beer meets Disney . Really touristy thing you have to do in Amsterdam. It was a fun interactive way to enjoy beer and a couple hours time. My wife and I had a good time a few beers we're included at the end.

Heineken ???. I feel we should have had a tour gudie to explain everything that was going on and the only good bit was the beer ride but rest was very boring and not worth paying into . could have tasted more samples and nothing was explained really

long queues for a couple of small beers. long queues to get in, queued throughout - but its good fun. The beer you get a the end isn't even 2 half pints, plus a small glass on the tour. The free gift was a glass. Despite this, it was good fun - there are some fun interactive spaces that are Heineken-themed. Do it if its raining. Ask what happened during world war 2 & the kidnapping of Freddy - their museum is strangely silent on these!
Beer!. If you like beer don't miss this tour. It's a great experience that's done really well considering how many people that cycle through there everyday. This is a must see!

Very commercialized but good. It had a neat "ride" where you get to experience the process of making Heineken beer. Got 3 beers with admission, one where they teach you how to drink it and two with bracelet at the end. Do yourself a favor and buy tickets from a tourist shop before you go - saves 2 euro a ticket plus you get to skip the huge line waiting outside to buy tickets!

Bad experience . Don't go here. It is a museum. Not a brewery. We had no idea. Thought we'd go through an old brewery and taste some samples. But it's just like a giant ad for the company. Everything is in English so you know no dutch person would ever go here. Boring.

Fun Experience; Not a Beer Experience. The Heineken Experience is a lot of fun, but it's really a big step removed from visiting a brewery. Like the Sam Adams Brewery in Boston, this is "where we USED TO brew beer a long time ago". They have added some really fun activities, but the real disappointment was in the overall message: "Heineken is perfect. There's no need to drink anything else -- ever." There is only one kind of beer available at the Heineken Experience -- regular old Heineken. We were told that it is the perfect beer. When we were given a sample to try, a lady in the group was humorously criticized for drinking it the wrong was. Then we were told the "right way" to drink "the perfect beer". In this age of craft brewing and beer variety, I found all of this to be off-putting. If there were anyplace on earth I expected to taste another kind of Heineken, or even an experimental Heineken, this was it. No such luck. If you want to spend a couple fun hours inside, this is a good choice. If you want t try some good beer, I suggest Brouwerij 't IJ
So much fun!. My husband and I really enjoyed this attraction. I've been to other "experience tours" for different brew houses and nothing compares to this one. It's interactive and fun!

Great Experience. Interesting tour, explains the history of the company and how they improved and now brew their beer. Towards the end there are a few games and activities you can play along with 2 free drinks.

Great way to spend a couple of hours. We have done many brewery tours in various countries around the world, but Heineken Experience is unique. This is done up like a self guided tour and has more of a museum type feel. Along the way you will see the beer process (something you expect), but then they also toss in some things along the way like a "ride" that you stand, watching a movie while the ground bounces you. They have a beer tasting along the way that you are told what to look for in a beer. At the end of the tour, you have two buttons on a bracelet which are good for two beers. At the end, on the day we were there, we had an extra white button that was for a free Heineken beer glass. All in all it was a fun experience. It may seem a bit pricey for a brewery tour, but it really does have more to see than the usual brewery tour. If you love Heineken, this is the place to be.

Great Experience, Especially if you are a Heineken Drinker. Tour is Informative andf very clverly done with a touch of humour, The staff are knowledgeable and Enthusiastic in there delivery, The tasting is well worth it, Overall If you are in Amsterdam Id recomend the tour. Easy to get there via the Hop on Hop of Bus system and Via Boat trip as well.
Educational, but not especially memorable. If you like Heineken beer and you are interested in how it's made it's worth a visit. If you just like the beer, go to a bar and don't pay to be marketed.

Great morning out. Great taste experience, and the history of Heineken is really well presented. In the end of the tour you can join a boat trip that's is worth it.If you buy your tickets in advance online, you can save some money and avoid the queue.

Stay for the boat tour. We were recommended to go to the Heineken experience by a friend who was really excited about getting a free glass. The tour itself was fun, cool features and very interactive. By the end though you don't feel like seeing a Heineken advertisement ever again. What we couldn't figure out was where this free glass was coming from until we left the gift shop and were offered free tickets for their boat tour and some vouchers. Take the tour. It's short and you get some fun facts about the city and its buildings and after you get a limited edition small beer glass. Made the price even more worthwhile!
Fun. Expensive, but worth it for the museum, champions league material, free beer at the end of the tour. The best moment is probably the ride on the heineken boat at the canal.

What Heineken experience?. Some serious advice. Save your 18 euro for a nice dinner or joint because the only Heineken experience you'll end up with this is one of major disappointment. Really all this is is Heineken bragging about how great they are. There is little to no substance in this tour at all. It is not a brewery in any sense whatsoever. Frankly it's a bit of a disgrace that they make you pay such a high premium to walk through what is what I can only describe as an interactive Heineken ad only to be handed a beer at the end when you could happily do so at a bar for a third of the price. Shame this is what Amsterdam has done with the once home of such an iconic beer!
Great day out. Was great as much better than I thought, great tasting experience and even a complimentary boat trip at the end of the tour on the Heineken boat,

Brilliant experience. Brilliant experience to do. It's quite fascinating at how it's all done and presented so well. Although the factory isn't in use anymore the smell and feel is still very much there. Loved the ride inside too really well thought out, also at the end you get the choice of a pint of Heineken or 2 schooners to enjoy at your leisure. Would recommend to anyone visiting Amsterdam even if your not a big drinker it's a brilliant insight.

Great Tour. Little tip, if the queue is massive then walk to the front, use the free Wi-Fi and book your tickets online. Then all you have to do is show them the screen and you get to walk straight in. This can save you 45mins when the place is really busy. Has a fun little ride, you get to learn how to drink beer, have a play helping to grind the barley beer and of course get to enjoy a few cold glasses in the funky bar at the end. At the end of the tour you get a free little Heineken glass as a souvenir. Would highly recommend for a visit.

meh. more of an annoying marketing scheme than a real brewery tour. we got 3 free beers, two of which were large glasses, but they were pretty chill about getting an extra beer or two. so the quantity of free beer outweighed anything else, but there were some cool parts.

YOU HAVE BEEN DOING IT WRONG. Let me first start by giving out some free advice: buy the tickets in advance. You will not only skip the GI-NORMOUS line, but it will pretty much put you at the front of the army of people touring the same factory as you. The tour itself is entertaining and actually lets you physically engage in some great activities. This includes the chance for some funny pictures, becoming certified in the perfect pour of a draft Heineken, custom Heineken bottles, the importance of hops, and HOW TO PROPERLY DRINK A HEINEKEN. The last part admittedly made me enjoy the beer more than ever before, go figure. You get to drink a couple of beers and then take videos of your inebriated self and pretend to DJ for the entertainment of all those around you. Definitely worth the money and would actually come again.

This is the best tour in Amsterdam. If you love beer, or having fun for that matter, you should check out the Heineken museum. The tour goes through how Heineken was developed and then how it was made. It ends with a tasting and a free gift as well.

Nice experience. It was a nice experience to visit this museum, where we can see how the beer was made on the Heineken first years. In the end of the visit there's the opportunity for drinking 2 beers included in the ticket on the Heineken's bar.

Worth seeing. 9th time visiting Dam and never once came here. This was my fiancé's first time to Dam hence why we visited - definitely worth seeing as I enjoyed the experience. Had a couple fresh beers on the way and even got myself a personalised glass! Would have got the personalised beer bottle but you cant take no more than 100ml on the plane! Met some wonderful people during the tour which was nice and even a couple who grew up where we live in London (they've since moved into the countryside) Would recommend.

Must do in Amsterdam. The Heineken tour exceeded our expectations. Was educational, entertaining and interactive. Very well done. All the employees were enthusiastic and fun. Takes about 2 hours and you get two beers at the end.

Great value for money. Fantastic way to spend an afternoon, good tour with 3 beers included and a gift at the end. Would recommend getting tickets in advance, which saves €2 and means you jump the queue. Would definitely go back for another tour.

Interesting visit. I am not a drinker but I do like the ocaccasional beer which happens to be Heineken , the brewrey was huge but was worth the visit, this was the 1st time I had been to a brewery. A lot of walking and standing but never the less very informative I did learn a lot.
Worth watching. Gives you insight of Heineken brewery, how it started and how it managed to gain popularity all across the globe. Lots of interactive programmes. Not to forget fee beer...

Mandatory stop. If you like beers, you've probably heard of Heineken. Better yet, you've probably tried it already - and as much as millions worldwide, you love it. This is their birthplace. The original brewery gave place to a huge museum, where you can learn a little bit more about the brand and how they came to be. Note of advice: the beer they pour here is most likely to be hundreds of times better than the one you can get in your country but, either way, use the 2 pins in your bracelet to go through a beer service certification - you will be able to drink the one you poured yourself.

Fun with Beer. Visited 26/515 with husband, Son and Daughter-in-law.This was our second visit to the Heineken Experience. We visited last year and it was so much fun we decided to take our Son/Daughter-in-Law round this year.It is cheaper to get your tickets from the Tour/Trip shops along Damrak than turn up and pay at the door.The tour starts off where you have to read Information Boards on the history/origins of this family business....yawn!....yawn!.But don't panic as within a few minutes it becomes interactive and the pace goes up a notch. The staff are very knowledgeable and all have a good sense of humour. There are quite a lot of interactive displays where you can taste the hops, stir the brew. You also get to see the famous Heineken horses in their stables. Really enjoyed the 4D journey of the beer. Also, lots of high tech interactive displays.On entry, you are given a rubber bracelet with two tokens that you exchange for two drinks at the end of the tour. Don't worry if you don't drink because you can have a soft drink instead.We spent approximately 2 hours walking round......good fun.
Great place to visit. Very enjoyable visit the staff are great and their talks are really imformative definitely worth a visit the beer is good too

Not a Heineken drinker but good beer. Tour was informative but I cared more about the beer and I was pretty impressed.I swear if it tasted like this in the U.S,I would drink it more.Wish they had the other brews but I was ok with the tour anyways and got a bottle with my name on it and the souvenir cup
A few beers!. Interesting tour of the former brewery, good graphics and audio. Learned how to taste beer! Hic! And had a free canal cruise afterwards.

Enjoyable even if you don't drink lager!. A group of 10 of us visited the Heineken experience so I had no choice but to go along and was pleasantly surprised. You end up with 3 free drinks - two at the end and one on the way round as they teach you about the lager and how to enjoy it properly. I don't drink lager but you can also exchange your tokens for Pepsi if other members of your group don't try and grab them off you for more lager! The bands they give you, you can keep as a nice little souvenir - they have three holes in as like people have mentioned below you used to get another drink or a free glass - this no longer happens and it is just the two free drinks at the end. The tour itself is very interactive featuring a "ride" (a simulator of sorts) and several opportunities to get involved. You can see if you can pour the perfect pint both via computer simulation and in practice, get any name/slogan engraved on a bottle, record a music video of sorts and have photos taken of yourselves in various Heineken themed situations. The shop you come out in at the end also has a good selection of products if you want a souvenir. Overall it was a relatively cheap, enjoyable way to kill a couple of hours that I would recommend.
A must when in Amsterdam. This is a must while in Amsterdam i`ve been here more than 5 times enjoying the film with the horses nice beer tastes x2 and a nice present at the end.

nice but can be a little boring. we bought tickets at tours&tickets which included 2 beers...
the tour at first was nice , but it got even better at the end i do recommend to purches the two beer deal cause it was fun

they dont give you pints here. OK so I was awarded 20 merits by her who is to be obeyed and was allowed to visit the larger factory . we caught a water taxi from grand central E 19 for 24 hours bus/boat to Stadhouderskade and took the tour around the factory cost E 16 .00 that is now defunct as it is only a museum to Larger its not a bad tour as brewery's are concerned but you only get apron 1litre of beer per person as her who is to be obeyed does not like larger I struck lucky i had 2litre In my experience of English Breweries you do get quite a bit more to consume but its not a bad tour every one speaks English in Holland basically because there own language is so bloody awful !! and a Dutch man told me that I of course agreed !

Free beer and mini souvenir Pilsner. If you do not have a lot of expectations coming here, you will be pleasantly surprised at how it all turns out. I believe the price for entrance is approximately 20€ for a largely self-guided walk through the facility that takes you through the brewing process...nothing really exciting, but during the tour you get a small beer tasting and the experience ends at the bar, where you get 2 free beers! Also, as you leave you are given a nice, boxed mini Pilsner to take home. So, it's really like you're paying for your beer and glass and the tour is just an added bonus. You also get a rubber bracelet that you can take home...they give it to you when you arrive with 3 little pegs attached that you redeem to get your 2 beers and Pilsner. I enjoyed my visit and would recommend anyone visiting Amsterdam to check it out.

BRING CHEESE AND CRACKERS. They gave u a bracelet to wear on your wrist. At the end of the tour u turn it in for 2 beers. During the tour they also have beer tasting. That's a total of 3 beers. You got to walk into differrent rooms to see differrent process of making beers. When you complete the tour,(after the 2 beers with cheese and crackers) B4U walk out the door, they'll give you a coupon and you boarded the cruise across the street to the Heineken river cruise. When u get off the cruise, they'll walk you to the gift store with ALL Heineken products. This is where u turn in your coupon for a free gift: A Heineken Glass. We bought some cheese and crackers B4 going into this attraction, so at the end we sat down(there are tables and bar stools) and enjoy the treats. some people Had Chinese food with beers.Just bring along your favourite snack to enjoy the beers.

interesting, not only for tourist. We live in Amsterdam, so we where tourists in our own town when we visited the brewery. It's nice, and the tour is only in English, not a problem for most Dutch people. It's entertaining, you learn something and you get free beer, well actually it's not real beer but lager. I don't like it at all, but that didn't matter at all after this experience
Fun and interactive. A fun tour. Towards the end has a bunch of interactive technological things to do. Not a bad deal when you consider 3 beers and a souvenir glass included.

VISIT THE HEINEKEN BREWERY ESPECIALLY IF IT IS YOUR BIRTHDAY. Visited Heineken Experience a couple of years ago and it just happened to be my birthday on that day - it was very interesting to learn about the making of the lager and then you are taken to a big hall for tasting the brew and also given nibbles. It was announced that if it was anyone's birthday that they should put their hands up and collect a free delf tankard which was filled up with Heineken and when empty to put it on head to have it refilled - very nice touch.

Fab even if you don't like beer . Although I don't even like beer, seems a bit of a stupid thing to go on if you don't but you'd be surprised. Great over all 'experience' from the beginning to the end, it was informative and interesting but fun! Leaning about the ingredients, seeing the distillation process and of course the indoor stables (really strange but cool) The staff were so friendly and spoke not only Dutch and English but many other languages! Many hidden surprises that really made the experience fun. And free beer made my boyfriends day! Fab over all experience even if not over the age of 18. Would highly recommend
Not a beer drinker. Someone recommend this as a good place to take the kids and it was. Lots of hands on or interactive things to do. It was fun but it didn't make me a beer fan.

Worth the money. You pay 18 euro for entry into the museum but it is totally worth it. You spend about two hours inside and the final stop is a bar, where you are treated to two free beers - you also get to do beer tasting along the way. A fun experience!

Fun interactive tour with lots of games, activities and photo opportunities. The tour lasts approx 1 hour. The tour is very interactive and lots of fun; the highlights for us were practicing pouring the perfect pint, the photo opportunities in the large cardboard cut outs and the PS4 games. There is also a ‘bottle yourself’ simulation, photobooths, horse stables, recording karaoke, photo opportunity with the winners trophy and emailed to yourself afterwards, and sampling raw barley etc etc. During the tour you get a half pint and 2 tokens for further drinks at the end (these can be half pints or cokes etc). You also have opportunity to get extra half pints if you shout out and answer the questions correctly in the tasting room. We enjoyed the canal tour afterwards in the Heineken boat, which had green tinted windows so you felt like you were traveling inside a beer bottle. You could buy Heineken on the boat, but we did not, having drank more than enough on the tour. I believe the boat runs on afternoons only, and takes approx 30 minutes to take you to the Heineken shop in the City Centre (or else this is a 15 minute walk). Apparently you get a free beer glass if you visit the shop after the tour, but we didn’t as ran out of time as it took a long while to dock the canal boat.You can book tickets online for 16 Euros each, which is cheaper than on the door, but if you don't want to commit yourselves to a schedule (like us) you can buy your tickets for 16 Euros each from the ticket shop on Museumplein – with the food stalls etc, next door to the Van Gogh Museum (5 minutes walk away).

Fun and Interactive Guide on Beer Making and Tasting. This is my second visit and I noticed new attractions are added in the premises. I really enjoyed how the tour within the building is at your own pace and also, the beers that came along with it. The staff there were friendly and entertaining. I really enjoyed the "beer tasting" session as well as the little ride that transforms one into a beer.I highly recommend this to any adults above the age of 18.

Fun Brewery Experience. Was a super fun tour. Includes a great ride explaining how Heineken is brewed, different rooms featuring interactive attractions and, of course, great beer! Would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

An unique and amazing experience.. Just to be clear, this is not a museum. The whole Heineken Experience is an advertisement, but it is a very successful and entertaining advertisement. So if you don't mind that it is selling the beer, I think you would have an amazing time. It is well renovated with games and beer brewing experience. You can take lots of photos with friends and family there, or just relax there and enjoy your beer. It costs around 15 euros but I can guarantee it is an unique and amazing experience.

Great day out. Fantastic day out with a history of Heineken, some hands-on interactive areas including a football dugout and Champions League theme, and of course a couple of tasters of Heineken. Also free gift on way out.

Beer101. We had a great time here. Our third time there with different friends who made the trip from Hawaii, the staff gave us extra wrist bands (worth 2 beers each) that you can redeem at the end of the tour. Mostly a history of Heineken and how it is made. But it really doesn't start until you see the short video, then they teach you how to drink the "less than a month old beer that is at icing temperatures" which is fantastic. Then more modern Heineken advertisements along the way and bam!! You end up at a nice Heineken green bar that's waiting for you to chug some beer. Like I said, we had friends that flew in from Hawaii and the staff even at the bar was kind enough to give us extra beer!! Free of charge!!! We felt the aloha!! We brought a lot of custom bottles to bring home as well. The gift shop is awesome!

Great tour with big crowds. The experience itself is a bit commercialized but it's still a good time! Be prepared for quite a crowd but the lines and masses move along at a good pace. Make sure you check out how the bottling process works and don't miss the picture opportunity of the building when you are arriving/exiting. The Heineken Experience is a fun one, full of good information and BEER!
Lighthearted, educational & fun. Good fun with interactive special effects, a couple if free beers and a gift at the end. Well recommended.

Fun with Beer!. When going to Amsterdam we always think Heineken so made plans to stop here. We found this to be a great experience for the value! Arrived around 11am on a Wednesday and was not very crowded. The first part of the experience tells you all about Heineken and how it became to be what it is today. Next you learn about the beer making process, bottling and etc. Then the interactive fun begins! The first is "brew you ride" which is an interactive video that takes you through the beer making process. Then after that it is up to you how much or little you want to do. We had a great time going to all the different rooms taking pictures, videos and enjoying the experience. My husbands favorite was the interactive D.J. Booth. Then at the end you get 2 free beers.You can make as much or little of the experience has you want. We found it to be fun and of course enjoyed the beer!

Lots of fun and good value. Lots to see and do in the Heineken brewery, and 3 drinks are included. It is €16 and tickets can be purchased elsewhere to skip queues. Good for families, preferably not young kids.

Commercial tour sponsored by your money. You will have more knowledge about beer making by having a look on Wikipedia.. and it is free. If you like to make a 1 hour queue in tiny corridors, to listen to agressive low-quality techno music and to get surrounded by flat TV/computers/video games and foot stuffs vanting Heineken for the price of 18 euros, go there. This is the ultimate self-financed commercial experience for the guena pig customers.
Good Fun. Loved this place, you get to learn all about the process of beer making and get to pull your own pint at the end.
Excellent!. Great ideia and excellent way to end our trip!Interactive museum/experience! Modern and history combined !Loved it

not worth the time or money. The best parts of this tour were the ones where they talked about the beer manufacturing process. Unfortunately this constituted less than 20% of the actual tour. The rest was basically an advertisement for Heineken consisting of videos, horses (?!), and a pointless multimedia "ride". I came here wanting a fun distraction as I was feeling a bit museum'd out after two weeks in Europe but instead I left feeling bored.At roughly 20 euros per person, there are much better ways to spend your time and money in Amsterdam.I will say that the staff here were great though. Well spoken in English and very friendly.

Overrated. I went to the Heineken Experience with high recommendations from friends but I was underwhelmed. It was far too busy and crowded which made me want to hurry through to the bar at the end. Maybe small tour groups would be more engaging? I sadly wouldn't rush back but it's not a complete waste of money I guess because you do get a few beers at the end.

Lots of fun, good value. Took longer to go through than I expected, which isn't a negative. Very clean a little Disney (ish) in its presentation, but if you like beer we received 5 beer each included in the price and liked the interactive portion of the experience.

A fun 'experience' for all. Im not a beer drinker, at all, despite this, I still wanted to visit the Heineken Experience (when in Rome!). Heineken is of course a dutch beer and a very well known brand, at the beginning of the experience, you are given a bracelet which has small tokens to take off which entitles you to 2 free beers (at certain points of the tour) and a free souvenir glass at the end of the tour. The first part of the tour takes you through Heineken history and how the brand became what it is today (it is also the location is the original brewery where all the magic started). You then go through the stages of brewing and how beer is made (you get a free beer at this point but no alternative if youre not a beer drinker). You then get to see their horses (assuming they arent out to pasture for their annual vay-cay), these are used purely for promotional purposes and make a few rooms of the experience smell of horse poo (not nice at all). Next is the 'brew you ride' which takes you through the experience of brewing beer, this is by far the best part of the overall experience, although it only lasts maybe 4 mins at most, expect to be shaken, heated, cooled, and slightly wet! Now comes the more modern side of the experience, there is a dj booth for pics, several interactive rooms for singing and playing around really (dont take it seriously, its not meant to be, enjoy yourself, have fun and most importantly, laugh, a lot!). You get your second free beer at this point (or if you dont drink a coke/fanta but be warned it will taste of Heineken!) and then the option to pick up your ouvenir glass on the way out. There are plenty of leaflets and vouchers available to get atleast 1euro off throughout Amsterdam and if you book via the website, then you can get 2 euros off! This is a fun attraction for those who arent looking for something serious or are planning on taking it seriously.

Value co-creation. I visited this attraction last week and my expectations have been exceeded. Here you can learn, or at least have an idea, about the entire beer supply chain and the production process. There is a lot of interactions such as the cinema 5D, the tasting, the certification for puring a perfect pint, the personalisation of our own bottle etc. I would recommend it to all beer lovers!!!

Fun for all the family. Family visit with 2 boys ( age 11 and 13). Plenty to do and see for everyone.Bit of history, brewing process, and advertising/marketing.No long queues midweek, so got to have a go on on all the video/picture games, beer pouring, DJ mixing, Fifa15, foosball etc etc.Finished with a few beers, and cokes. Recommended.

Too crowded and a waste of time and money. Ok, so we went there with our 2 year old, but even if it had been just my husband and I then I would have felt the same. As others have said, it was one big Heineken advertisement. There was not that much information about the brewing (although the vats room was my favourite part) and it was mostly a bunch of interactive terminals that you had to wait ages to actually use. We were also unable to get our free drinks as the wait was ridiculous and the people quing up to get their beers felt the need to trample all over our son! I guess the best advise I can give is to not take your toddlers there!

Total disappointment. A circus.. totally geared to the young demographic, get em hooked and drinking early seemed to be the running theme. Laser lights, computer games, big screen TVs.The first room with the old copper vats and beautiful led light windows was the only worthwhile part. The rest was a few pictures on the wall, and gimmicky games. Very disappointed we didn't experience anything about actually brewing the beer - other than watching a movie. Well we can get that on u tube for free.Half way through this side show were real horses in a stable - very odd. No explanation of why they were there other than a sign that horses have always been important to Heineken. They seemed to be put there as a token of something real and tangible that's lacking in the rest of the place.So to end it, we were looking forward to our 2 'free' BIG glasses of Heineken. We were told several times about these BIG glasses at the end, so we naturally assumed they were pints. The truth is, you get 1 pint of extra cold, or 2 glasses of regular.Most hotels in Amsterdam give out discount cards for 1€ off the entry price and 2 beers. They are worthless - you'll get the discount by just asking, and the 2 drinks are free anyway - you don't get another 2 free drinks with the coupon.And to get this free beer that you've waited an hour for and put up with all the circus stuff for? A very long slow queue at a noisy dark bar with flashing lights and sticky floor to get your 2 small glasses. There are no chairs, just a nightclub dingy atmosphere, everyone standing around shouting at each other to be heard over the music. It was horrible. We bolted our beers down and got out of there.There were no staff to answer any questions about the history on Heineken or how it's made. The staff that are there don't have time, as they do their bit and then move you on to the next show as there is another group right behind you. Coming from Australia where we drink Heineken all the time, this tour was supposed to be a highlight of our Europe trip. It has almost put us off ever buying it again!
Great for beer lovers!. Interesting tour of the Heineken history and brewing tradition, free beers included. Busy but not crowded, great giftshop.
A few stag doos. Went with my wife and we both enjoyed it. There was a couple of groups of lads being quite loud. Got a bit annoying but was still cool. Been there once, once is enough i think

If you a beer lover do not miss. This place takes you through the history of heineken beer. You can bottle your own beer with your name on it for around 10euros. Please bear in mind you cannot carry this in your hand luggage. The place also has some playstation games and interactive things to take your snaps. The store is also pretty useful

Interesting but a bit overdone. Was worth seeing but there were random rooms and games that didn't really make sense with the idea. I think it was a bit overdone but two beers included in the ticket price!

Worth a visit. Really wasn't sure what to expect but very much enjoyed the Heineken Experience, you'll enjoy the tour whether your interested in its history or how it's made or not, there's something for everyone. The staff are enthusiastic and there's plenty to see in there. You won't be disappointed.
Really interesting and fun. Informative, educational and fun, plus 3 beers included.When you look at the Heineken name think of the smiling 'e'

Always ask for Heineken in Uk now!. After visiting here i always ask for a Heineken in pubs wherever i go now, they actually made me prefer lager to cider! Nice place to go if you have time and cheap too, get complimentory drinks plus a free heineken glass!
Great place to visit.. Great value at only €18 entry including two drinks. Great tour with loads to look at, a good mixture of activities.

A must go experience!. We went to the heineken experience not really knowing what to excpect and we were surprised at how much we enjoyed our time. Exibits were really cool, explenations also and the whole vibe there was awesome. They really want their visitors to understand the process of making beer and appriciating it. We had a really good time!

Good Fun!. Loads of things to do in a family or friends here. Learn lots about the beer and its heritage. Really interesting. Catch the free boat at the end of your tour to the brand store as well that was a nice touch.

Not worth it!. A visit to the brewery wasn't as informative or worthwhile as one would expect. There are definitely far better ways to spend that kind of time in Amsterdam. The time and money spent are not worth it: treat yourself to many glasses of beer at a café with instead.

Enjoyable!. Easy to get to from city centre about 5 minute walk. Fun experience, free beer, a lot of facts and knowledge, a lot to see, a lot to do, the brew you ride is good, little activities along the way, drink tasting, good gift shop.
Great visit!! Really entertaining . Great visit to heineken museum. Lots if fun and interaction. Well worth the money and great experience. Best tour in amsterdam
Really enjoyable. This was great, well worth it. There's quite a lot to see and do there and a couple of beers included at the end
Good few hours. We really enjoyed wondering round the brewery. It's in a good location and there are tram and bus stops nearby. 4 free drinks are included. We had a great time.

Great experience excellent value for money!. Loved this experience!!! So much fun and only 18 euros!! Would really recommend! Exceeded expectations and at least 3 free beers. Shop is reasonably priced too.

Loved it! . As a young couple we really enjoyed our visit here! We bought tickets in advance and at 11.15am there was barely any queue anyway. We learnt snippets of information about Heineken; who invented it, when, how it is made, the ingredients that go into it etc. But there's so much more than this, there is a lot of interactive things to do which was great, my boyfriend particularly enjoyed attempting to teach me FIFA in 2 minutes! We took our time wondering round and were there for about 2.5 hours. It's certainly not the MOST factual of brewery tours, but we learnt something and most importantly had a lot of fun!

Interesting and worth a visit!. There was no waiting line, cheap tickets and a very interesting tour. The staff was friendly and funny. You get 2 free beer, and it tasted delicious ;) The tour had some funny surprises, and we weren't bored at all. Definetley to recommend! Great giftshop as well :)

Heineken tour. Was a great tour! Quite interesting and with two beers at the end as well as a tasting, it was quite good value for money (€18) Jump on the free Heineken boat for a quick trip up the canals after as well. Saves putting out money to do it somewhere else. This boat gives a quick tour before taking you to the merchandise store for your fee gift! brewery entry €16 euro if purchased from here and boat takes you direct to brewery.

Brewery at it's finest.. This is not a working brewery, but it was still interesting to go through. They spent a lot of money to make this brewery more than just that. Make sure to do the singing Karoake, that you can send to your email address to send to folks back home.

Heineken Experience a must in Amsterdam. Me and my wife enjoyed this attraction on our visit to Amsterdam, the old brewery, especially brewhall has been well preserved and even the wife found this interesting, the stables she really enjoyed how they look after the horses. There is a 4D show which was fun if not a little cheesy at times but fun all the same. Then there was the taste testing and the free beers what more can I say about that apart from not enough!. The only problem here was I thought I would get my wife's share but it turned out she liked Heineken too uh!A good experience and well worth a visit. The only downside really was that it was very crowded and a tour guide would have improved the experience although the staff there were very helpful and friendly. Go enjoy hic!

Interesting and tasty. We stopped at the Heineken experience on the way around Amsterdam on the hop on hop off bus. It was a very good brewery tour; the you brew 'ride' was a clever show. The guided beer tasting was good and there were 2 further glasses of beer included in the ticket.Definitely a recommended experience,

Touristy but worthwhile. Buy the tickets online or away from the venue to skip the queue which can be quite long. Download the app and use your earbuds to get the audio/visual enhanced tour. It's very tourist oriented - not really a true view into the inner workings like you get at some distillery/winery tours. There's even a 'ride' as part of the experience. Top it all off with a couple of 'free' Heinekens. Done.It's not a short walk from central station so buy a pass and take the street car.It is a short walk to the Rijkmuseum to line them up on your tour.

Very Interesting place. Great place if you are a Beer lover. It took about 1.5 hour to complete the path inside the factory. There was no line when we went inside.Loved the pictures which we got on bicycle. Not a cheap trip but they will give you two glasses of beer on your entrance fee.

OK. Wow....long queue. Very crowded as we went on a Saturday. Quite interesting to see how the beer was being processed. We had a glass of free beer given half way through. And towards the end of the tour, another 2 glasses of free beer each was given. After that, each was given a Henieken glass as a souvenir.

Mostly a tourist trap/advertisement. The visit to the Heineken museum was kind of a let down for me and the 3 friends I went with. The building itself has a nice 1850s industrial type architecture and visiting the old brewery wasn't too bad. The bad parts were mainly when we were waiting in line to see the "best part of the day" according to the staff there, after which we would get our first beer. That part was an underwhelming "4D" show followed by a guy who would give us a small glass of beer and toast to heineken then "drink it like a man". We were then herded to a small noisy bar with a sticky floor to get 2 beers included with the entrance which we drank quickly and left rather quickly.
Heineken Experience. Great time with friends. Nice attraction to visit, well paid money. After knowing about beer history, we were guided through a boat cruising.

Some interesting parts, but primarily a big advertisement and marketing experience. The Heineken people are advertising and marketing masters, no doubt. It was quite crowded and not the type of thing we normally do, but everyone seemed to be having fun. Having done other, more quaint brewery tours in Europe, this seemed a bit Disney-like to us. The employees were fantastic and friendly. We opted for the canal "shuttle" to their retail space after our visit. The boat ride was a very nice way to relax with a couple of beers while seeing the city.

Great Great Value! Do it!. We had a spare day in Amsterdam and chose to do this based on people's recommendations and reviews... Do it. Neither of us had an interest in Heineken or beer brewing but the experience just gives you one. It's a short walk from Museumplein and it's the big building with the brand across the top. €18 to get in and then you're left alone to self guide yourself through the experience. Posters, wall info, exhibits, actual brewery equipment, multi media rooms. As well as really enjoyable explanations from some top crew members. Roxi has top effort marks! It's all just ace. You can't help learning about it as you go along and it really is fascinating. A lot of things to interact with. Including the 'Brew You' ride which is extremely well executed! Free samples and then two free drinks at the end with every entrance fee. Really is a great place to experience! Also pick up a free glass from the brand store about 12 mins walk away. (Take coasters/wristbands). You can tell Heineken are a top notch, people orientated brand!

Heineken Experience; it's definitely worth it. Visited today late morning, booked through Tickets & tours using saving €2 each vouchers from within the leaflet (you need 1 leaflet per person) we picked up from the GVB ticket office opposite Central Station which contains several discount vouchers on the inside of the back two pages. Very informative, well thought out experience, self-tour apart from a few interactive elements early on you get a free beer tasting lesson, extra free beers if you can answer some simple questions plus there are some great used of technology to make the whole visit much more than your usual brewery trip. This included two or three free Apps in multi-lingual options plus a section where you are able to be super-imposed on a video of a band singing Tulips From Amsterdam either near a Windmill or on a canal boat, worth making yourself look silly as you can then email the video to friends, our daughters found it hilarious back home. At the end you then get 2x 25cl glasses of beer per person in a nice bar area plus great gift shop. On your way out the door you also get offered a free 30mins Heineken boat shuttle that takes you right to the Heineken brand store in town where for the pleasure of being taken there you get a free Heineken glass. Overall very good experience and we though great value. Would personally not take kids under say 15. Great for couples, family groups or friends. Thanks Heineken, a very pleasant 3hours and you could show a few others a thing or two about brand management !We would recommend.

a worthwhile experience. If you go to Amsterdam this is the place you have to visit. It s an interactive tour where you can find beer and learn about beer. All the people were nice and you can do different personalize things( like winning UCL, resolve sone mistery cases etc..). to be excelent i think that at the end they should give you 2 big beers not 2 small ones:)

An interesting visit. Not a cheap visit though I suppose they are factoring in the price of the beer. So not to be recommended if this is not your choice of drink. My son is underage so fortunately I wasn't charged for him. At the entrance there was mention of nonalcoholic drinks for him but nothing was offered.The ride was entertaining - even for son. So, interesting to see. Obligatory shop at the end was easy to miss.
Great!. Had a great visit! Loved the "ride" at the end! You can keep your wristband and just trade the small tokens clicked to it for beer. It's about a half an hour walk but there are trams etc.

Best Experience in Amsterdam. Having been skeptical about visiting the Heineken Experience due to not liking Heineken I was presently surprised by how much I enjoyed it. It's a fantastic and entertaining few hours learning how Heineken has progressed over the years and also an opportunity to have some free beer! We'll worth a visit!

Great Brew Tour. My husband and I (along with my in-laws) really enjoyed visiting "The Experience," mostly because it really is just that. Lots of interactive things to do (which I don't want to spoil too much....but I'll say that the RIDE was one of our favorite parts). The staff was friendly and helpful. We also paid a bit extra to have a burger/beer up on the rooftop after the tour. It wasn't a restaurant, more like showing up to somebody's picnic for a quick bite. We loved it!

"Worth Doing". I know what you're thinking and you are right. This is very touristy but hey you are a tourist. Why you should still go: two beers and a tasting. The tour is very interactive and you do learn about the history and brand. The beer does taste like watered down horse piss but hey its still beer.
Heineken. Very friendly staff and a relaxing and interesting interactive 3 hours with a good drink at the end. Non drinkers can have soft drink instead

super fun day!. the heineken museum was really fun! the entire museum is decorated in a very cool way, there are games everywhere and you learn about how the beer is made. you also get two beers at the end which is fun.

Amazing!. We werent sure what to expect on entering this but were absolutely amazed and had such fun aswell as lerning quite a lot. For 16 euros per adult ,this has to be the best entertaiinment . Started off a bit deep ,all about the heineken family and the building of the buisness and then became more hands on as you got further through the experience! Included a free boat ride after the experience and feeebie heinekens !! Well worth a visit and lots of fun!

Interesting . Didn't expect much based on the previous reviews. Was pleasantly surprised - good history of the company, beer making process and numerous interactive stations to keep visitors engaged. 2 free drinks included in the ticket price, and a 15 minute trek away to the other shop for the free gift (a glass)

A Great Experience. My wife and I had skipped the Heineken Experience a few years ago when we were in Amsterdam but decided to experience it during our recent visit. We bought discount tickets through our hotel. The whole Experience was much better than we ever expected. The first part after entering is the history of Heineken, kind of boring. Then you get on the "ride", a virtual reality experience of becoming Heineken Beer; wow, that's where the FUN starts! There are a few live demonstrations about the ingredients and another about beer color/foam then many interactive displays some which you can email to yourself. Of course they save the best part for last, serving you 2 complimentary beers!
Cool . I thought this was a really cool museum. We got there earlier in the day so we didn't have to wait in line..I was really cool to learn how beer is made.

Fun and economical!. We went on the tour because we knew it was a must to do in Amsterdam. The tour itself starts off a bit slow, just walking through the brewery, but then there is a fun little "ride" at the end and some samples (we had 3 small glasses). The best part is at the end you are able to take the Heineken boat to another location in the city. We thought it would be a quick ride but it was actually a pretty decent boat cruise. We were going to pay for one but this one was a bit shorter but just as good. And you could buy Heineken on board! Taking the boat made the cost of the tour a really good deal.

Bit Cheesy, Little Overpriced, But Fun. The Heineken Experience was, as I put in the title, a bit cheesy and overpriced in my opinion at nearly 40 euros for the two of us. We wandered through the exhibits on the founding of the company, which seemed to be a bit high handed in extoling the virtues of the founders (all three were geniuses with compassion for their employees and awarded medals of honor from various kingdoms according to the exhibits...which are not biased, I'm sure). Then on to see the old brewery, learn about the ingredients, see the old stables, enjoy the interactive "brew me" experience (something you have to see to understand), and finally go on to the tasting room where you are taught how to taste the beer. From there you can participate in various activities that you pay extra for, like having your name printed on a bottle, or just move onto the bar. I was disappointed in the bar, I have to say. There was not nearly enough seating and at that point I just wanted to sit down and relax and enjoy my "included" two drinks. Being pregnant, that was Pepsi and water for me, but hey, a drink is still nice. Instead, we gulped down our drinks so we could leave and find another place to sit. My husband learned how to pour beer and I got a cute video of him pouring like a real bartender that we enjoy.At the end of the tour we took the free shuttle across the city on a canal boat to the signature store to collect our "included" Heineken glass. This is the part of the tour that really upset me. As I was climbing the (steep) steps to get off the boat, the driver shoved me hard, and pointed to the tip basket. He did not seem to speak English and seemed to be indicating his displeasure that I hadn't added anything to the basket. My husband (walking ahead of me) had, but I guess that didn't register to him. He almost pushed me off the steps, something that I was afraid of for virtually my entire trip to Amsterdam as I navigated all those steep staircases while pregnant. I was shocked that anyone would consider shoving a pregnant woman off the stairs to be acceptable in the name of tips. We love our tips in America and even here that would be ghastly. I didn't tell my husband until we were a few blocks away because I knew he would be livid. All in, I won't reduce my rating of the overall experience based on one inappropriate person, but I hope someone somewhere reads these things and provides appropriate action to make sure this doesn't happen again. For those that plan to visit, I hope this doesn't stop you. There are likely to be many diligent boat drivers out there, just mind yourself when you go to exit just in case.

Follow the bubbles. Great family experience following the production of Heineken and learning a little of its history. Samples are included in the ticket price, though obviously only for those of age, children can enjoy coke instead.

Great fun! . Great fun! Amazing interactive areas and hugely informative. I loved the beer aswell (of course)! If you do plan to visit, I'll advise you to budget a little more than the cost of entrance fees though - along the way you'll be tempted to buy this and that, and it soon adds up!

Fun experience . Nice to know the history of this beer. Overall I am very happy to be here but some staff aren't friendly. No smile at all. And when I ask to take a photo with her/him (there are 2 bartenders in the bar), they refuse with no smile. Not so polite, huh?

A Fun Couple Of Hours. Having visited several breweries previously, the history and brewing process was not of much interest to me personally but would be to someone who has never visited a brewery. What I did like was the additional part of the tour and the novelty gifts. For example you could have a simulated photo holding the European Champions League trophy and email to any email address.. There was the opportunity to have a bottle of Heineken personalised at a reasonable price. A word of warning here though. If you have only taken hand luggage on your trip to Amsterdam you will need to check the luggage in as hold luggage as the bottle is in excess of 100 ml and will not be allowed through security. Alternatively you can drink the contents and put it in your hand luggage. There is also the opportunity to have your bottle or glass engraves. I found it fascinating watching the skill of the engraver putting the message on. It goes without saying that the tasting session was good.All in all it was a good couple of hours and didn’t break the bank.

Heikenen. This is a very comprehensive tour of the Heineken brewery. The facility is amazing and tour guides are engaging. You will see Heineken of the past and present. I enjoyed the beer pouring lesson where you get a nice certificate once completed. They have custom-made bottles with your name on the bottle for souvenir. If you love beer, you can't miss this tour!
Amazing. Super cool place! Worth the visit and they tell you all the history about beer and you get 3 beers for free at the end

Great day in Amsterdam!. The Heineken experience made my few days in Amsterdam that much better! Not only was the tour very interactive with a couple free drinks. At the end of the tour you can take a free boat ride across the city to get a free gift! It also dropped us off closer to our hotel which was perfect. Be prepared to spend a few hours there and leave with a little buzz.

Funny Amazing Experience. If you are in Amsterdam, you like fresh beer and want to have a funny moment , you have to go there. More than a museum of Heineken Beer History, you will spend an unforgetable moment, visiting the old factory with the copper vessels , the staff will explain the whole process with a degustation on the différents products in defferents stage of production, you will enjoy the movie room.in the end of the tour you will have some free beers and a nice gift shop. Tip: buy your ticket outside with a boat tour , you will have a discount of 4 euro

Interesting from the marketing aspect . It's a dull beer with a dull history, so to make an interesting museum is a challenge. The focus is consequently on the most interesting part of Heineken, namely branding. Quite expensive for what you get.

Fun. A fun way to spend a couple of hours on a rainy afternoon. Really enjoyed the first half of the tour, but felt the second half was more focused on finding different ways to encourage you to part with more money. Having said that I'd still recommend it.

The best experience of tour or attraction that I went to!. This place is a must if you like having fun while learning. The staffs are friendly, can speak good English, and will help you out if you have any questions. The hands on experience in making your own brew, including grinding the barley, malting and many other makes this very fun. You can also play video games, make your own videos or photos, and even have your name on a bottle or glass! The souvenir price is also affordable, and you even get free gift which is a small glass at the brandshop, and this is accessible with the FREE canal cruise to the city! If I can give this place 7 stars, I would!

Great Time!. This was so fun! It is very different then most of the brewery's i have been to. This one focuses more on the present day rather than what they did in the past (they do show you old Heineken bottles). Everything is very interactive. They even have the Heineken horses there. There are plenty of photo opportunities and photo booths. You even get a boat ride and a free gift with entrance. We had a great time.

A Fun Experience. A great tour of the old Heineken brewery, a great chance to see all the old machinery and learn about Heineken's history.I don't like beer but my husband loved this visit and I thought the tour was very good, appealing to both young and old alike.
Awesome gift. I Amsterdam city card offers free gift here. Interesting and if you know s Heineken fan, this is the place to buy a gift. The free gift is a glass souvenir of Amsterdam. Don't miss it.

Nice experience with fresh beer at the end. Showing how beer is made makes a lot of sense in Netherlands where most famous items are beer, cheese and weed. I just didn't understand why they show gigantic horses (maybe they are fed with barley after processed) but that was also nice. Most fun part is learning how to pour and drink beer :)

Worth your time if you like beer. They did an excellent job, making the tour of a storehouse a lot of fun. There was the explanation of making Heineken, but then there were a lot of interactive experiences. At the end you get a couple of beers that taste delicious. Be sure to check you coat and packages before you go in.

A cool experience . Cool to see the history behind Heineken. You learn about how the beer is brewed, the ingredients and they have many interactive things for you to experience. You get a tasting experience where they teach you how to taste beer, plus two beers are included in your ticket price. When we paid we saw people with 2 for the price of one vouchers - so it could be worth investigating where to get these as it saves you 18 euro. Only criticism is that there were a lot of people in there at once which made it hard to get around all the different things they had in there.

Happiness at Heineken. We thought it might be a bit cheesy based on some of the reviews, but it was actually a lot of fun and an interesting museum. Yes, there are much more culturally significant museums to see in the area, but if you like Heineken, want to learn about the interesting history of the company, and have a fun museum experience, definitely check it out. Tip: buy tickets in advance if you can, saves a couple of euros & a few minutes in line. Don't worry if you can't though, the line moves rather quickly.

Fantastic!. This is a great attraction. Buy your tickets before you go! Like all the main attractions in Amsterdam the queues for tickets at the door are horrendous, buying tickets before allows you to skip this but be prepared to wait for certain things when you get inside. It is a really well thought out attraction with details on the history of Heineken, the beer making process and even beer tasting. Lots of interactive exhibits and really friendly staff.
Fun and well organized. A nice, well organized tour in the old brewery, and you get beer at the end:-) Long queue so buy tickets before you go.
Fun and innovative. The Heineken experience is fun and informal. It was light in presentation and the beer at the end was great!

Gimme a beer!!. A fun tour to learn how beer is made, the history of Heineken and for some beer tasting. I took the canal hop on hop off to get there as it is one of the stops just a short walk away. I bought my tickets ahead of time to avoid crowds but there wasn't a problem getting in.

Well organized, lots of fun. First of all the price is right. 17 euros which includes three beers. The experience has several levels that includes the history, brewing process and tasting. There are several interactive stations as well as expert commentary.

Fun experience!. Recently in Amsterdam on a short city break, and on one of the days, we visited the Heineken Experience. It was was a fun afternoon, there were no long queues and it was reasonably priced. For the entrance fee, you get a tour and 2 free beers in the bar at the end. I would recommend purchasing an IAmsterdam card before you go to Amsterdam. This allowed us a 25% discount on the entrance fee for the Heineken experience (as well as unlimited use of public transport and free admission to other attractions). For a fun afternoon, learning a little history and enjoying many a beer, I would definitely recommend going here!
Awesome attraction!. Saw how the beer is made and how it is bottled. Awesome multimedia attractions. Really enjoyed the Heineken Experience and the bonus 2 glasses of beer :)

Fun for adults!!. Me and my boyfriend stumbled onto the Heineken experience while planning our Amsterdam trip. We both like a pint now and again so we went for it, we were super surprised that there was no que!! Once you start the tour it does seem a little crowded, but people start to disperse at there own time onto other things. There was a gentleman explaining the ingredients of Heineken he was very good with the audience. Then there was a ride which was a little bit of cheesy fun! Next you got a free taster and the staff where so kind and humble. On the way out we found a little lounge with Heineken promotions but it was nice to rest our feet after a bit. After we thought we was finished, there was loads of fun activities for adults. Then you get your own little Heineken experience if you want to write a name on a bottle for €6.50. Then you receive your free two tiny pints! If your just going for the free beer, I don't recommend. But the bar has a nice vibe with music and you cam pour your own if you like. There is an opportunity to take a boat to the Heineken Brand shop for free, where you claim a free prize.

Cool experience, but nothing outstanding. Interesting museum of Heineken, one of the biggest beer producers worldwide and an icon of The Netherlands. Its staff is very polite, kind and funny. There are some experiences that are interesting but in some cases could be more developed. The best, the tasting of this great beer.
Awesome!. Awesome experience!!! Staff are great all of them! We came to know some really great stuff about the beer!We really enjoyed, worth it for the money!!

Great experience. Learn about the beer, experience the brand! One of the most fun things in Amsterdam just gives you an appetite for beer. Includes 3 free beers and don't miss the included boat shuttle to/from the brandstore near Rembrandtplein. 30 minutes through the canals!

Great for families. We visited with some friends and two small children. It was full of interactive things for kids and also fun for adults. You were given wrist bands for beer at the end but the line was pretty long and the kids were done at that point so we didn't wait. Interesting and fun experience for everyone. We got a discount with the city card too. Would definitely go back.
Excellent. I dont drink, but I did really enjoy the Heineken experience. It was well paced, interactive and fun, and we were give extra beers with our Iamsterdam cards. Highly reccommended.

So much fun. Absolutely loved the Heineken Experience but felt it was more about the brand rather than the beer itself. However, I preferred this! We spent hours there, learnt how to pour the perfect pint and had a lot of opportunities to have our pictures taken and email them to family there and then. Wasn't too busy either

Exceeded My Expectations...And I'm a Certified Pourer!. Would recommend the Heineken Experience to anyone visiting Amsterdam. Wasn't sure what to expect outside of the normal history of hte company, beer-making process, etc, but the Heineken Experience offers so much more. Great tasting area...wonderful tie-in to the marketing/brand history of the product, you can learn to be a certified pourer, several interactive games throughout, customize your own bottle of beer and a very large gift shop. Well worth the visit and you get to drop back several beers as part of your admission...all worth the cost!! Highly recommend!

Lots of Fun for all people!. We visited the Heineken experience without any problems or long lines.. The experience has lots of fun activities to entertain. The only reason I did not rate this at 5 stars is because the tour does not have much information about their brew process which we liked to learn.Overall is a great day visit in Amsterdam!
