Avoid. Poor effort made on the "experience". Q's like you wouldn't believe and never learned anything about Heineken at all. Avoid

Less of a beer tour, more of a brand experience. Visited the Heineken experience with friends and overall it is a nice stop. First thing to note is that there are discounts for this visit in many of the tourist books, try to use them to get for bang for the buck. As for the experience it will guide you on the history of the brand, a very brief introduction to the brewing, and a glimpse at the marketing of the brand. At the end of the tour you get to taste some beers. Also this is a tour that you can do as fast as you like, from 20 minutes to a couple of hours.

It is part of the Amsterdam Experience. Go before 11 am and the lines aren't too bad. It is a bit pricey but you do get 3 beers (4 if you answer questions right). Here are the answers in the order they are asked: "amber", "hops", and "to keep the bubbles down". Lots of stairs so keep that in mind if you have any lower limb disabilities. Well laid out, educational, and fun.

Do not go here. If you're not like the biggest Heineken fan in the whole world - do not go here. There is nothing exept two small pints that you'll get there. It is really borring. We were early and it was not so crowded at all, but on the our way out there were like tons of people. Take your money and drink few beers somewhere else - almost 20 euros for big commerical ... it is really not worth it at all. Run away!

All about the experience. Second visit to the Heineken Experience in Amsterdam and it keeps getting better and better with each visit. Well worth the fee to get in - for those visiting, look in your hostel/hotel/apartment for minicards for the attraction, they can often get you a better discount than the various companies in the city offering cut price tickets.For your money you get to learn about the establishment and history of the brewery, the marketing, an insight into the production of the beer and about the drinking experience. Also - not to forget the free drinks (the amount depends on the type of beer you would like to drink). There is a giftshop at the end of the experience for all those wishing to purchase branded goods, and what some do not know about is the very informative boat ride through the city to the brandstore. This is a massive added feat of the entry to the museum, as the boat trip provided is better than some of the boat trips that go from Damrak (from my past experience).A great experience and well worth the fee - a must experience in Amsterdam for those of a legal drinking age.

Educational Fun. The staff were fantastic - so friendly and ready to answer any question that you shot at them.There was so much to learn about and not only are you told all about how Heineken is made, but you are given it's full history. It's so fascinating to walk through the original brewery and to see the process.There's lots of interactive areas to keep you engaged and interested: you can go on a quick simulator that shows you how Heineken is brewed. Afterwards you're given a talk all about Heineken, with a free beer to accompany. There are a few gaming areas and more activities, before you arrive at the "bar area" at the end: where you can redeem your two free pints at one of the bars, or pour yourself your own pint with a Certificate included, at the other bar. Pepsi/Pepsi Light is available to those who don't fancy a beer.Don't be shy: the staff were so friendly and great to talk to, and you can tell that they take a genuine interest in their job! A refreshing experience!

A fun experience, well worth a visit. I went as my friends wanted to and was pleasantly suprised how entertaining the experience was. A nice mix of history, tasting and mini 'ride' meant it avoided being too monotonous. Beer tasting and free gift were nice touches to experience.

Super fun, like a trendy Guinness factory. This place is really well laid out, full of information and beer. If you've ever been to the Guinness factory in Dublin, this is like a trendy, 21st century version of that. It has a 4-D video experience, PS4s, club atmosphere rooms, and more; plus you can pull your own pint if you're brave enough!

Heineken the beer i now like more. The Heineken Experience really was an experience, with the "brew you ride" and the history of Heineken and also tasting of the beer this was a rather enjoyable visit. Of course its a tourist attraction, but it wasnt too crowded either. The athmosphere and the museum itself was great. And if you want yourself an extra treat. Order the Burger at the ticket booth. This gives you a ticket to go to the roof of the Heineken experience and taste a heineken and a very very good burger. Right from the grill. It had great taste and a lot of flavour. Again if you love beer and want to learn more about Heineken i can recommend this place. :)

Good beer, great tour. It was a very worthwhile tour. It was smartly put together and informative. There is even an interactive part where you are the beer. It makes it very easy to understand how to brew. Plus the free beer at the end helped!

Worth visiting. A lighter side of a brewery, the film with heated lamps and water was so funny.You get a few beers and a couple of more if you can answer the questions asked. Liked it a lot, also the shop is good and you get a free canal cruise as extra, must try it.If you want to see how they really make beer, better to go to Spaten-Franziskaner or Beck's.Some of the girls working there don't have a clue about beermaking.

Interesting tour, free beer!. It was really cool to see the process from beginning to end as to how Heineken brews and bottles their beer. Not to mention the free small beer you get during the tour, and the two free large ones you get after! And you walk away with a free Heineken glass! It was something cool to do for a couple of hours, and really kept our interest the whole time.

best heineken i have had. they werent kidding when they said it was better than anywhere else.im not usually a fan of beer but the tour itself was quite informative and you get about 3 ice-cold heineken beers included in your tour ticket. definitely one for beer fans but even if youre not a big fan like me, you would still be able to appreciate it!

I enjoyed it and I don't even like lager. This was good. You got a free tiny pint and either a free second or a chance to learn how to pull the perfect pint (ideal liquid:head ratio).Tutorial and tour at the beginning about hops and fermenting and...all of that business.Funky little gift shop too!

A fun afternoon . My husband and I wanted to do the experience after reading the reviews and were not disappointed. It is a really fun few hours and interesting to learn of the history of the brand and the beer making process. Definitely recommend if the weather isn't great and you want something to do inside for a few hours. Good area to explore around it as well.

Good. Definitely buy your ticket online before you go. The queue was very long and we could go in immediately. It was something different from the other museums, the video explaining the process was very good and the tasting was nice. The bar at the end was overcrowded and very sticky, but other than that it was good.

Surprisingly Good. Went expecting an overly touristy attraction but found it very honest and enjoyable. all the information is short and catchy with plenty to do throughout your time there. the whole thing lasted a couple of hours by the time we had finished our two free pints at the end. I'd recommend going around opening, we got to wander through without the crowds but a massive queue had formed by the time we left.

Great experience. Having a fun experience here. Informative and people were helpful. Got free beer and small heineken glass goodies. The boat tour was entertaining. Lots of fun game. It is worth going.

Great afternoon. Really good museum/experience that lasts about 2 hours and ends in a free bar and a couple of pints. The old brewery is quite interesting and the 'experience brewing from the inside' ride is rather fun
impressive. I did not expect this before entering. be there early in the morning before the everyone else shows up. nice tour through the Heineken history.
A fun 90 minutes to look back at its history. Worth a visit! Spent 90 minutes on the tour and good fun plus a few beers at the end! Fun ride at the end before the drinking!
A Must visit. Probably the best thing we visited in Amsterdam. Takes you through how the beer is made, lots of interactive stuff.

Very fun and interactive . Had a great time at the Heineken Experience! Don't expect a tour guide but it's a really cool experience. You learn a little on how Heineken is made but really it's the activities along the way that makes it good, the DJ booth, sending video messages to family etc. overall was a really fun time

If you like Heineken, take this tour. Buy your tickets in advance for the Heineken Experience and walk right in bypassing the lines. I'm not a fan of their beer but the tour and movie were an enjoyable learning experience - you'll walk out saying, "I didn't know that."

What a letdown. My husband and I decided to visit this attraction having already sampled the Guiness attraction in Dublin. We found it rather mediocre and not as informative as it could have been. We were ushered round and given only brief information and the highlight was a simulated ride in which one was supposed to imagine being a grain of wheat to better understand the mechanics of producing Heineken? Far too gimmicky and not informative enough. A bit more thought needed before this becomes a worthwhile attraction

great visit. this was a lot of fun..you go thru the tour like you, 're the bottle of beer and what it expierences as it goes thru the bottling process...and of course a sample of beer and a souvinier glass!

Worth a visit. Went here with a friend few days ago. I heard it was a must do if you visit the Dam, so we booked our tickets and went... Have to say the staff are very capable and enthusiastic! You get a really good tour and two half pints are included in the price of the ticket! Also a chance to pull your own pint and get a very from it! Nice to see how it is all made and the real love that goes into Heineken family business! & the band you get is cool too!

Incredible Heineken Visit. I went alone and if I have fun by myself imagine with friends or in a group.Everything is well organice and very explicit. A lot of interactive information and games.Merchandising is amazing. Customer service is very good and you can taste the beers....Incredible time and of course I will return again!!!! Just go!

BEERRILLIANT. the experience was really good. it broke our day up a bit! Worth the little excursion. and we got 2 free beers out of it (result). Informative and would defo recommend if you're a beer lover, as it is interesting to know about how it is made.

Skip the "Experience" just go drink beer. This was TERRIBLE! Next to no information on the actual details of brewing. It's all flash and no substance.....and BIG LINES. And at 18 Euros per person to get in......just go drink on one of Amsterdam's fabulous patios. And you only get one pint of beer so it's not even like the tasting makes it worth it.
Don't go!!!. Unless you like paying 19 Euros (!!!) only to go through a one hour boring Beer commercial. Not interesting. Boring. Too expensive

Beer. Amsterdam. What's not to love. . So me and my partner went here for a wet day in Amsterdam not really sure what to expect. What we found was a really enjoyable day. The history of beer making and the layout of the tour was really interesting. Trying the beer and drinking the beer at the end made it even better. My partner who doesn't like the taste of beer even enjoyed it. Just meant I got her beer as well haha.

Great visit. Spent a couple of hours going through the old brewery. Very interesting with lots of interaction things to participate in. Lot of history on how this family firm has expanded over the years And of course you get to taste the finished product, all included in the price. We bought our tickets on the hop on/off buses which was a bit cheaper than at the door.

Green Experience ;). Anyway you will love it, you will love the huge old brewers, and the secret of the good taste, You have to enter the simulator,You will have a lot of fun there,Enjoying champions league partner, You will be a certified pourer, like I AM The store is awesomeThe gift is so niceThe beer is tastyYou will enjoy the video commercial hallIT IS A GRAT EXPERIENCE

Beer in Amsterdam. The experience was like going to a Disney attraction. We were able to see the beer making process, see the stables for the horses, experience what it is like to be processed into beer, with the floor moving and water spritzing on you. Then of course the tasting of Heineken.

Go before midday to beat the queues. We went in just before 12 and there was no queue. When we came out, maybe at 2pm, the queue was streets long! So go earlier in the day....Very informative and interesting. Lots of free drinks. Tasted hops and yeast- a new experience! Very interactive and keeps your attention.
Its Okay...... If you really have time to kill....by all means head down for the Heineken Experience but otherwise there are many more places in Amsterdam to visit and spend your time

Fantastic tour and attraction in Amsterdam!. The Heineken Experience is a mandatory attraction in Amsterdam! They show you the history of the brand, the process to produce the famous Heineken Beer is showed through a 4D cinema, where you get inside the beer production, the tanks, etc!You also can create a label to a Heineken Bottle with any word or phrase you want and get it in the end of the tour, customized to you! There is also a place for you to learn how to serve a perfect beer!Great attraction!

Go if you got time. It was good value for money with 2 and a half drinks but there's plenty more to do in Amsterdam and Heineken in Amsterdam is good anywhere. Oh and there is a 30 minute free canal your which was a nice surprise.

Excellant. We booked our tickets on line before we went, so no queing up when we arrived. They give you a wrist band which entitles you to 2 beers. Well worth a visit, interesting and you get round the brewery in about 2 hours approx. Well worth 16 Euros each. You get 3 drinks in total, the 3rd is only a small glass though. So worth a visit.

Worth the price of admission!. Although we aren't fans of the beer we really enjoyed learning about the process and we really enjoyed our time at the brewery! The trek to get the free gift was something we didn't do but we spent roughly 2-3 hours there on a rainy day! We purchased the IAmsterdam card and received a discount on our entry. It started to rain when we arrived at the brewery and they handed out ponchos! I thought this was a pretty cool thing for them to do. The line can get super long so I suggest heading out really early or just be prepared to wait.Overall, it was a great time! We would go back again if the weather is bad haha... again we are not Heineken fans but we enjoyed our tour of the brewery! Cheers!

Awesome . Cool tour of the Heineken experience with a couple of beers at the end of the tour .
Good tour of the history and tuff needed to make the beer. Tour was about 90mins long but worth the 16euros we paid each for it. About a 20-30min walk from central Amsterdam .
Could not get in. Enormous lines to get in the brewery. I think we were unlucky due to national holidays. Could not get in .
Not very impressive. Interesting to learn about how beer is made and what is the proper way to taste a beer. The rest of the visit is more of a huge marketing campaign than anything else.

Traditional brewery with a high tech ending. I had heard rave reviews from friends so was really looking forward to this. First buy you tickets at any of the ticket places, seriously anywhere, they are chalet and you beat the lines. Also download the app but do it in wifi. Once you have downloaded you think it's fine but then you open it and have to select your language which it then downloads. But it give you a commentary of the things you are walking through in the first half of the tour which is nice. You learn about the history of the company of the beer, and get some two free beers. Then the tour turns high tech with lots of opportunity to do since random things, like make a t shirt or make a music video, pull an imaginary beer. The high tech stuff didn't really grab me but I enjoyed the traditional brewery tour part.

Great beer . I am not a Heineken drinker but I'll tell you I visited this place twice on our trip and it was worth it the beer is nothing like you find in the states . Best part I got to take home a few glasses

excellent. We booked our tickets with the sightseeing company and saved a couple of euros each and skipped the queue. Well worth a visit. My friend and i accompanied our husbands and throughly enjoyed the experience. Very informative, fabulous interactive area and you get to sample the beer.A great way to spend a few hours.

Cool place but line too long. It is a nice place to visit and the 3 beers you receive plus the tour sort of justify the price. However the line was too long and 90% of the visit is basically advertising... But would still recommend it to someone who likes beer

In Amsterdam ? ...must visit. I think Heineken Experience is a must visit museum in Amsterdam . Infact its more of a hangout place than museum. We paid EUR 36 per person because we bought ticket at the museum itself , but one can discounted price if bought at "tours n tickets".The experience is unique in every sense. One gets to know about ingredients of Beer, way to enjoy your beer & above all get to enjoy free freshly brewed beers.there is so much enthusiasm in presenters which is visible from the way they keep you engaged in all the activities. I specially liked the room in which they " Brew you". one of its kind. i can say, best way to explain the brewing process by making you experience being brewed. Extraordinary!!After so much fun being brewed, you get to taste one of the finest beers in world.I can say the Bar area was the most crowded area in entire museum, for obvious reasons :D Its easy to reach Heineken museum by trams & buses from Amsterdam central station, hardly a 10 min ride.I'd say, its a lovely place & is a must visit.

In my element!. We bought tickets in advance online prior to our trip, this saved us a few euros and the Q's when we got there, if you like beer and the history behind it interests you this is excellent value for money and would strongly recommend it to anyone when in Amsterdam!
such a fun thing to do whilst in Amsterdam. Staff were great. Price is worth it, overall a great experience and worth taking the time to do it whilst there

Not a Brewery Tour but an entertaining experience. As some others have noted this is not a brewery tour. However, if you are interested in a bit of the history and some fun little things along the way then it's not a bad way to spend a couple of hours. Probably a little overpriced for what it is, but getting good fresh Heineken is a nice thing :)

Excellent experience!. Simply loved the whole experience! We spent 3 hours at the Heineken experience and it was worth while. You get the histoery of Heineken, how it is made and you get to drink a couple of beers. The interactive part is a lot of fun, there are games, movies, pictures and a lot of fun! Great for kids also!

Fun experience with beer. A fun and educational experience to learn about Heineken beer and its history. After the tour, you will get beer samples and also have a ton of interesting attractions (like being a DJ and photograph spots).

Beer + entertainment = fun.. Firstly, I cannot understand that there are any negative reviews of the Heineken experience. You get free beer at the end of it! My partner and I especially enjoyed the part where you go on the ride and "become the beer" - great fun.The staff were enthusiastic and genuinely happy.Highly recommend to anyone who even remotely likes a brewski or two.

Not worthwhile. Basically just a tour of the Heineken marketing department. Don't make the mistake of thinking this is a brewery tour - as there's nothing happening on site, nor that this is a museum - because you won't learn much worth talking about. Instead use the time and entrance fee to visit a few bars and enjoy the city. P.s. I'm genuinely concerned for the reviewer below (Ramzi S) who described this as the best experience on their trip to Europe. What appalling things happened to them on that trip?
lots of beer. This was fun and educational but still just ok. If you like beer and large free samples, you will like this.

Best Experience. One of the best experiences we had during our trip in Europe. it was really fun to go through the history of heineken beer.Many interactive activities within the tour. watching movies of heineken history, seeing different exhibits, how beer is made, watch a presentation of how to drink beer (which was really fun) and you can pour and drink your own fresh cold beers.We loved the idea of typing our names on a beer bottle and taking it as a souvenir.All in all, it was great and fun experience to go through. I highly recommend not missing it when you are at Amsterdam the next time.
Fantastic. A really interesting experience. Everyone who likes beer should give it a try. Nice and educational.

Fun. We bought our tickets before and had them printed so we skipped the line which was pretty long. The place has a place where you can check in a coat or even a stroller which was super convenient for us. It has interactive activities and overall I would recommend it but I don't think the long lines are worth it. If you plan a visit here make sure you buy your tickets before hand. Also, even though it is a beer factory, children are welcome and they enjoy it as well.
Beer tasting and interactive tour.. Many interactive experiences throughout the tour. History and chemistry. As expected, really liked the beer.Pricey but it does include 2-3 beers.

If we had to queue, we'd have been really disappointed. Having been to the Guinness museum, we found ourselves comparing this to its detriment. The initial information film was informative and well made....drawing you in to the story of Heineken. However, the experience really did rely heavily on technology throughout - other than an excellent presentation by a human in to why Heineken tastes as it does and the proper way to drink it (big sips, proudly, like a man!). After that, the experience really focuses on Heineken's marketing. Whilst some of the technology was good fun, it seemed to be irrelevant for us. If that kind of experience is important to you then this would be excellent - but for us, it was too focused on that!

Popular Brewery Tour!. Following our trip to Guinness in Dublin, we queued for an hour to gain access to this tour (Book it online to make it easier), and it was entertaining informative experience. First half a little boring, but the Interactive Bottling experience was good fun, and I have been teaching locals here regarding the pouring of a large foamy head being the secret to a good lager, to excellent results. Must get a few over-sized glasses though....

Must do, expect to go to the toilet a lot!. Offers a great history into Heineken the beer and Heineken the brand, with fun rides and lots of beer. Just stay a bit afterwards because finding a toilet outside is extremely difficult ;-)

get down there. A different type of half day out. Interesting tour, a couple of drinks thown in and a very good learning curve if you are interested in how they make the stuff. Good value at about 8 euros. Try it.
A great place to visitt.. A great place to visit, you get the whole history of the beer and tour the old factory.Did learn a lot and was good fun doing the tour with drinks included in the price.
A MUST in amsterdam. A long tour full of fun and surprises and free beer !in the end we also got a free canal tour and a souvenir beer mug.

Love Heineken!. If you love the beer and also want to have fun, this tour is definitely for you! The cost of the entry is 18€ and if you have a discount coupon 16€, with this price you receive 2 free beers and a souvenir beer glass, for sure is a very funny and interactive experience, since the origin of the beer until nowadays advertising!, I really love it!
Great morning sampling the beer!. Really worth while - especially if a large group of you - fun things to do whilst having a couple of Heinekens!

Fun few hours out in Amsterdam. Me and my boyfriend visited last year, when we were on holiday. It was a good way to spend an afternoon. A lot of fun and interesting things to see. We got quite a few free Heinekens so were both very happy. I also got the chance to learn how to properly pull a pint of Heineken and became a certified Heineken pourer, (complete with certificate!) We also got to keep our wristbands as a wee memento from our trip.

If you don't like beer, do this tour anyway.. A walk through the history of one of the most known beers in the world. There is even a 6d cinema inside where you can really feel how it is to be a Heinken's ingredient :) I paid 16 euros (bought the ticket in the Cobra bar), drank 4 Heinekens (1 for the tasting plus one for answering a question right, and two more for the tokens you are given once you buy the ticket), got a free Heineken's glass and a boat trip. 16 euros for all of this is a hell of a deal in Amsterdam (quite expensive town).

A bit of fun. A good History of the company with some old brewing equipment on show. There is a stand up video that shakes the floor, again, a bit of fun.You can pour your own Heineken or even bottle your own. Lots of interactive things to play on and at the end, 2 glasses of Heineken in the bar. Get to a table, its also interactive! ;)

Proost! (cheers in dutch). Enjoyed the museum as it showcases how a best beer in the world is fermented and made. Worth the entrance fee coz 2 free beer drinks are inclusive. It was indeed informative as they informed me the ingredient used (of course except the secret ingredient) in making this superb beer up to packing and boxing and it is also enjoyable as there are a lot of interactive games as you go along.Just before the end of the tour, I had a chance to have a certificate from Heineken being "bar tender" coz I have been taught how to properly pour a beer in a glass. FOR FREE. How cool is that? :-)Capping my visit is drinking the 2 glasses of beer and you are ready to say.....Proost (dutch word for cheers)Please don't forget your selfie stick and camera/mobile phones for more picture taking.Proost and enjoy life to the fullest.

Weekend visit . Great tour and good value. Definitely worth a visit in Amsterdam. I've been to another brewery where you had a guide take you around. I can appreciate here with the amount of visitors that just wouldn't work. Overall big thumbs up

Worth a visit but not amazing. As a veteran of multiple brewery tours (Sam Adams, Mansion Leffe, both Carlsberg factories) I feel I am well placed to comment on such things.Positives;First thing is first - the beer. I can honestly say there is a lot of hit air regarding the Heineken in Amsterdam being the best there is which is totally unfounded. I think it says more about 'other substances' consumed by such individuals aside from beer. The beer in this Museam is without a doubt the best Heineken I have ever tasted.There were some nice touches in the tour especially in regards to the technology aspect. Great light show through Heineken bottles, pictures as if you were lifting the Champions League, video clips as you look through the brewing containers.The tour can be done at your own pace with regular toilets and places to sit. Free cloackroom for coats and bags etc.There are also a lot of innovative tourist features which are definitely designed to take tourists money but are undeniably cool. Getting your own name printed on a full bottle of beer, Heineken glass, pour your own pint etc.The actual tour is good and informative, best section for me was regarding drinking the pint as it explained the purpose of having a good head on a beer.The tour also comes with a 'free' canal boat ride at the end which does admittedly take you to the second shop bit also close to the main streets. Heineken on the boat is 2.50 Euro for a 330ml bottle which is good value.Negatives;I paid 20 euros for the trip (direct through the Heineken website), which only included a couple of small drinks, there was no option to buy any more drinks either.From a value perspective this is on the extortionate side, particularly when compared to something like the Sam Adams experience which was free.To rub salt in the wound there were many vouchers offering the same tour for 16 euros with a free gift. The only real advantage of booking through the official website is that you can skip the ticket queue.The drinks system works by way of tokens, you get 2 of these which can either be used to buy a full pint of beer or to pour you own beer (with certificate) which is only half a pint ish. You do get one half pint for free but at 20 euros with no way to buy more drinks is very poor.Overall;I would recommend going just be mindful of what you will get for your money. The canal boat tour really adds to the value.Top tips;Shop around to get the best deal on entry tickets.In the second shop I played a game which earned me a percentage off a single purchase. Unfortunately my most expensive purchase (leather Heineken wallet) was made in the first shop so I was a bit gutted as they also had it in the 2nd shop.Plan your trip whilst the experience is near the Hard Rock Cafe the canal boat will drop you quite far away (although does offer a round trip). Best to go to HRC first and kill 2 birds with one stone.There are a couple of bars near by which are useful for killing time whilst waiting for the boat.

Value for money and good to keep your husband happy.... I had prebooked this visit thinking it would balance out with making my husband go round the galleries and museums. In the end we never got to the museums but did go to use our ticket for this as I'd already payed for it. I was glad I did, having paid only 16 euros online... For that you get a small tasting size beer, then at the end of the tour you can choose two small normal beers or one larger ice cold beer each, so as a couple we had the small ones then one big one for my husband. You also get a decent 30 min canal ride to the brand store, where you also get a free glass (at the moment it's a champions league glass) and for 1.50 euros they will etch your name on it. This part was where I thought it made it value for money.The beginning of the tour was quite dull. Initially there was a pretty cool virtual barman who told you the history of Heineken but it meant we already knew everything the following non-interactive rooms were telling us so we pretty much walked through these glancing on either side. There was a section where you could take those photos where you stick your head through a scene.The rest of the tour was pretty good, a 4d style screening where you are treated like beer getting bottled, with a moving floor and water and bubbles blown at you, (lasts about 8 min?). You can also play PS4 games, make a karaoke video, pull your own beer, be a DJ, and there are a couple of cool rooms to sit and soak up the atmosphere.One thing that was a problem was it was a one way entrance. My husband smokes and drinking beer in the bar at the end made him want a cigarette, but even though he had a wristband he couldnt go the few steps through the shop, smoke, and come back in, he would have had to walk right through the whole tour again to get back to me, so this could be something to be thought about.

Great experience and good value. If you visit Amsterdam make sure this is on your itinerary. It is very reasonably priced and you get a lot for your money! The tour is interesting and there are interactive things to do throughout you also get to drink beer! And it's all in the price you even get to pull a Heineken and get a certificate! And if that's not enough you get a free glass at the end.

Little of both. I am a beer person so a visit to Heineken off course had to Be done.there is boring parts and there is excellent like end when You feel You are in a big big bar.abs...worth a visit.very popular place to visit

You Have To Go!!. A friend recommended this to us before we left for Amsterdam and I was a bit sceptical as neither of us are big drinkers. However, it turned out to be one of our favourite things from the whole weekend! Lots to do and very entertaining. Starts with a walk through of how company started, the family history, etc. Saw the huge copper vats used for brewing. Missed the horses as stables were being refurbished. The ride through the brewing process was fun! There's a James Bond part, pull the perfect pint, Champions league, make a pop video, personalise your own bottle, there's loads!!Then of course you get your free taster and a lesson in how to taste it properly. Followed by another 2 free drinks in the lounge bar at the end. Fab!!

Don't bother. This was the only thing we did in Amsterdam that was a complete waste of time and money. I wish I had listened to some of the less than flattering reviews. Not much to see or do there. In contrast, we went to an actual brewery in Bruges that was very interesting. No need to go to the Heineken Experience just to drink beer.
Great attraction- well worth the entrance fee !. Having already visited the experience before I wanted to go back while visiting Amsterdam again & I loved it !!!

Fantastic visit. We visited the Heinekan Experience on my boyfriends birthday, the visit was so much fun and good value for money. Would definitely recommend visiting the experience, there was lots of interactive activities to take part in as well as a lovely bar at the end where you were provided with 2 drinks each.

Really good fun. Little boring to start off with, but once it starts to become more interactive with staff talking you through the brewing process it becomes a lot more fun. Left happy if not slightly tipsy.

Where beer is fun.. We have been to it twice. Both times we enjoyed the thrills of the beer maker. The exhibits have changed but the general concept is the same. We missed the horses this time because their stables were being refurbished. The lounge at the end is great place to meet people from all over the world. Must do in Amsterdam.

Fun and varied tour!. This brewery tour was a lot of fun and was well worth the $15 to take it. There were different stages of the brewing process along the way, and you even got to try the beer at it's very beginning stage. Then there were different rooms like ones for the Champion's league, James Bond, etc. At the end you got 3 free beers I believe. I would recommend anyone who likes breweries to check it out.

Fun Experience. Really fun experience. Takes you through the old brewery and then puts you out in a funky party. Would have been better if we liked Heineken beer, but we choked it down and had a good time.
Good tour to geth to know Dutch beer.. The tour is a bit expensive 18 euro a person.But If you like history and Beer than this is a nice experience.

Good Experience!. Heineken Experience is a must do if you're in Amsterdam! It takes about 90 mins for entire tour and it's well worth it! I love the brew ride and you finish your tour with couple of pints of Heineken! Must see!

Good beer drinking experience. We had the pass and we used our pass for the heineken experience. This is the first Factory of heineken in holland, Though they dont produce beers now here but they give you tours . And the tour was really good .Heineken is my favourite now . Thank you. :)The cool gifts you get at the end of your experience is a great souviner.
Good enough day out!. The start of the tour is not that good but the end is awesome :) Only 19 Euro if you and I discount voucher and its near the hard rock cafe!

This is not a brewery.. This is not a brewery tour. It's a weak attempt to explain how the beer is made. The girls doing the explanation are great, but you don't see the actual brewery. It feels more like a fun house than a brewery. It's not a brewery. We were disappointed.

18 Euro's worth of fun. If you're in Amsterdam this is something you can't miss out on. I learned a lot. My girlfriend who isn't even interested in beer said it was fun. You get two beers at the end of your trip which you can enjoy in their "club". The best part was making Heineken bottles with your own name.

Good to spend some time and drink some Heineken beer. Don't expect to see the factory of Heineken beer. You can see the old factory that is currently as a museum. There were a lot of activities such as how the beer is made, explaining the tips regarding how to identify a good beer. Also it was very nice that in the ticket entrance 16 euros it was included 3 beers, 30 min river tour with a boat and a printed picture as a memory. Also for 5 euros you can personalize your bottle of Heineken beer. Overall it was good if you go with your family / couple.

Quite Enjoyable. Well! Where do you go with 2 teenagers when you have couple hours to fill in & it's round the corner from where you're staying! It was informative & interesting - smell reminded us of Vauxhall brewery in Sunderland years ago when we were children! Thought they did good job of exhibits. Went or extra cold beer at end of tour - worth forsaking 15cl for a cold one!

Mediocre at best. I had to visit the the birthplace of Heineken but this experience sucked. I've been on others before and found this to be a shallow experience. The Brew You experience was gimmicky. The guy teaching us how to drink a beer was cracking sexual jokes, even with a kid in attendance. And lastly, you get 2 beers at the end, or 1 ice cold one. What a joke. You're basically paying to get advertised to. I'd still go for historical reasons but found it a bit lame.

Brilliant . Went here with my partner would recommend 100% really fun had an amazing time plus we got 3 free beers while we were there and free glass.. Will be on my list for things to do again on my next trip to Amsterdam worth the money !!

Overrated and overpriced. Funny thing--while we were standing in line to get in, some guys rode past on bikes yelling "It's (A word for feces which Trip Advisor won't let me write)! Don't bother!!!" Wish we had listened. To be fair, we were visiting Easter weekend and perhaps it's not always like this---but it's basically a brewery tour and if you've seen one, you've seen them all---there's some fun stuff at the end of the tour after your first tasting---but the rest was worthless. When we visited, we stood in line to get in--then you started the tour of the historic area, which was informative, but as there's no real line, people wander in and out and you can tour at your own pace. The trouble starts after the horse barn and before the "Brew You" experience---where we stood for over an hour with nothing to see and nothing to do.... I would say for the $15 it was about $10 too much. Don't pre-purchase a ticket--although it gets you in ahead of the others if there's a line---just go to the place and if there's no line and you've never seen a brewery, then go in---but for your $15 you can buy a lot more Heineken and you won't have to stand in line for over an hour waiting to drink it.
Great for group of friends who likes to drink!. It was an OK experience but probably not going to be on your top 7 of things to do here in Amsterdam!
Good for a laugh. Good for a wee walk round on your holidays.A few wee beers and the not to be missed make your own karaoke video which you can email to people you know.

Great tour very informative and of course great beer - souvenir glass great too.. Lots of walking. Some times hard to hear the guide. Tour works like a well oiled machine. Definitely, worth the time if you are a beer lover.
Great fun. Lots of interaction and the free beer was fantastic tooWell worth a visit especially if the weather is badbut a combined ticket for this and the pizza cruise

Great fun. It was a worthwhile experience. Lots of multimedia experiences and great demos of the beer production process. The price of 18 Euros include 2 free beers and the shop had an amazing range of Heineken goods.
Fun free beer. Worth a visit, lots of good interesting history, and like 3 free beers! lots to see and lots to do, is a great tourist attraction. but shop is very pricey!
Fun couple of hours. It is a good mix of history, information on the process of making the beer and interactive sections. I even learnt how to pour the perfect pint and got to test my skills.

Really enjoyable - not just for the drink!. We booked this as part of a deal with the 'Hop on hop off' city bus.The tour was really interesting - learnt a lot about the history of the drink and the drink itself.As part of the tour you get a taster session and then 2 drinks tokens at the end. Although we traded a token in order to draught our own drink - which was harder than it looked!! You do get a wee certificate for this!Staff very friendly and happy to answer any questions.I'd recommend this - a couple of hours is all you need to take the tour and enjoy your drink.

It was just alright. I went with someone who loves Heineken and was a bit disappointed. The concept is fun but they don't really tell you that much about how they brew the beer. They tell you what's in it ....anyway, it was fine, not great. Tons of fun merchandise if you're a fan.They offer a free beer glass (it's a small one) if you take their free ferry other to their "other" retail location. Waste of time - don't do it. Even if you love Heineken, tons of good options in main retail store. Don't fall for "more stuff in our bigger store".

Great experience. Great interactive experience. We decided to go fairly early - 11 am, and glad we did. When we got out at around 2.30pm, we saw a massive queue to try and get in. We enjoyed this experience so much!
Fab fun!. Loved this. Worth going. The experience of "being brewed" was fun! Also liked the tasting. All in, best brewery tour we have done.

AMAZING!. Read mixed reviews before going but this is something that I 100% recommend doing ! Excellent value for money ! Very interesting with lots of fun interactive things to do throughout the tour ! The staff are lovely and friendly and speak very good English! Several free drinks throughout as well as gifts! Don't forget to ask for the boat trip at the end because a lot of people don't know about this as it's not well advertised but is definitely worth doing! A half hour boat ride down the canal! Stunning !

One of the best things we did in Amsterdam!. Although a massive tourist trap, it is so much fun. We went right when it opened and had the whole place to yourself. If you don't like beer or heineken then this is not for you.... at the end you get to drink... ALOT. The free boat around the canals of amsterdam was awesome.

Grade "A" Yeast. Housed in the original first brewery, the Heineken Experience details every single history of its foundation right up to its current success. The inclusion of interactive areas, like the Champions League and others create good vibe for everyone, including the non alcoholics. Original brewery equipment and copper tanks, right up to engraving your personalised Heineken bottle will end with a great, if not wonderful experience.

Loved it!. We visited Amsterdam for a Hen weekend and fancied trying this experience I'm so glad we did! Despite not being a big beer drinker, I found the experience to be both fun and informative. There's lots of different parts to the experience and each part was great. The history of the brand is interesting and it was good to see where the beer would have been made in days gone past. My favourite parts of the tour were as follows:1. The beer tasting experience - listen carefully to the bar tender's chat as he gives out extra beer if you can answer his questions correctly. 2. Bottle yourself - the simulation is great fun. If you are in the front 2 rows, you may get wet!!3. Draught your own - exchange 2 tokens for a beer pouring lesson with a drink at the end or go straight to the bar and have 2 drinks poured for you. 4. The interactive zone where you can record some Dutch karaoke, take photos against a green screen or record a message to send home. All in all we had a great time and found it to be good value for money -especially as some beer is included in the price!

One of the better tourist traps in Amsterdam. While I normally enjoy but ultimately hate myself for liking this kind of place, the Heineken Experience bucks the trend of your standard tourist trap.You get a lot of experience for your money.Very interesting museum and 'experience' (considerably better than the Guinness Experience in Dublin, for example), plus the amount of free alcohol and general free stuff you get throughout makes the price even more reasonable. Two half pints of Heineken, and a nice Heineken glass as standard at the end of the tour - plenty of photo ops and a nice taster too.Think this is a must in Amsterdam.

much better when not hungover. not only a great history but also some great parts like pouring your own beer, the lights shows, the champions league memoribilia, but dont go with a hangover, the smell of beer will set your stomach off again

Better than expected. Great visit, saw how the place developed and became one of the leading world brands. Plenty of interactive stuff to do for young and not so young and you get to taste the stuff as well. Optional cruise to the Heineken shop thrown in as well from outside the brewery.

Heineken Experience Tour. We bought the tickets from the hotel itself and arrived there around 3pm. This was a worthwhile tour as we really enjoyed ourselves!! It lasted almost 2 hours and ended up with 2 free beers per person. And there are quite a few activities within the tour which you can participate in. Overall I would recommend this tour. And its beers for pete's sake so just do it!!!!

Better than Guinness Storehouse - but buy Tickets ahead of time!. I loved going to the Heineken Experience! But - DON'T GO ON A SATURDAY and try to go before 1:00 pm on any day! and ALWAYS BUY TICKETS ONLINE AHEAD OF TIME or face standing in a long, long line. The Heineken Experience has the standard "here is how we make beer" start, but has the added bonus of more historical company-related artifacts. Then takes you on a fun and interactive tour through the rest with taste testing and a good 4D Experience, like a disney ride that visualizes how beer is brewed. Heineken was a lot of fun and I liked it a whole lot more than I did Guinness, much more interactive and less overtly self promotional.

The Waiting Experience. The Heineken Experience is one of the most disappointing thing I have ever seen. First of all, you have to wait ages to get in there! There is a huge queue outside but only one register open. Great god...The "museum" itself is not so bad at first: a bit of history, brewing process, the vats, etc... Nothing special if you already visited another brewery though.Then it gets worse: you have to queue again for another 30minutes to get to see the "Brew You Tour", a movie with a moving ground. It goes on for five minutes, it is quite ok but it does look like a giant Heineken commercial... Then the rest of the museum is actually a huge commercial!!You get to have a degustation (yeah, degustating Heineken, what a joke), you can't even enjoy it at ease, since they almost chase you from the room. Or you can finish it in a room with a giant commercial displayed on many screens.There is a "bottle your own" part which costs 6€, a music part which is remotely useless as well as the sport part.In the end, you get the choice between two 25cl regular beers, or a 35cl "extra cold" beer which is a cold as the regular.A truly disappointing museum, I am not a fan of the Heineken beer (there are way better beers in the Netherlands) but I at least expected something more fun and big than this.Don't waste your time there.

Better than expected. This was quite fun! And be sure not to miss the boat trip (it takes you to the Heineken Brand Store, which you can skip) after the brewery visit. This was included in the ticket price, but was not so much advertised. Its a nice tour (app 20-30 min) on the canals and it takes you right into the City Center.

The highlight of our trip!. The Heineken experience was the highlight of our trip. We were there for about 3 hour and was so interesting and very interactive you can tell that a lot of money has been spent on it! I also thought that on reflection the cost of the experience was very good value for money! We bought a lot if souvenirs in the shop at the end including personalised beer bottles which are brilliant!!! This place needs to be added to the must do list!!!

A meek. Used the hop on and off canal barge, which is a fantastic price and let's you enjoy the best of Amsterdam . The Heineken experience is amazing, great price and fun!Very modern and visual interactive technology was a pleasant surprise! Much much more to this than just vats of beer!! Staff upbeat, and obviously enjoy working there. It's a great afternoon out and I will have it on my first to do trip when we return with all our children.
Not good enough. Every city has a tourist trap. Amsterdam has the Heineken experience. If you are after the "free" pints you should go to a nice bar. Nothing special and very disappointing.

More about the marketing than the beer. This is not a traditional brewery tour. Whilst you certainly learn about the history of the beer and see the original copper tanks and the shire horses that (still) deliver the beer, the interesting elements are all about the marketing, which, let's face it, Heineken is very good at. You'll get a fair share of beer and and an assault on the senses. Delightfully over the top.

A fun hour. We brought our tickets in the city and got the tram. We didn't have to queue which was great, as I think this seems to be a big problem normally (judging by the reviews!) I really wasn't bothered about going firstly, but my partner wanted to explore it. Ended up we both had a brilliant time, and found it quite informative. I really feel like they build up a story and then when you get to the end you see just how successful the brand is. I enjoyed the talk of how the beer is made and the 4D show was wicked! The drink tasting was fun as well. It was something different to do. I didn't fancy my beer afterwards, so had a soft drink instead. I would say don't expect that its crammed full of information, end of the day its the story of 1 beer being developed and expect an interactive ending of the tour with lots to do. We then walked onto the Vondelpark which was great. Overall, much better than anticipated!

Great afternoon!. I realised before attending that this is not an actual working brewery, but an exhibition. There was a bit of queuing outside, but not too bad. The exhibition is good to learn about the brewing process and history of the brand. There's lots of activities, displays and some hands-on stuff. Also there are displays with which you can take photographs, and machines to send e-cards with your picture, which are pretty cool. I enjoyed the tasting session, and two free drinks. After the tour, I was offered a free boat trip to the Heineken shop, where I also received a free gift (beer glass). Awesome!

a little strange. Visiting the Heineken Experience was genuinely great fun for a group of friends all in their 20s, however I can totally understand why some of the other reviews are less than complimentary. The experience itself is less about learning of the history and beer making process, as this part all felt quite rushed at the very beginning of the tour. After that, there were many rooms full of money spinners like 'take a picture of you with some bikes' or 'create your own personalised beer bottle' all of which were an additional cost. The room at the end was like a mini nightclub and it was nice to look at the pictures and chat to other people while we enjoyed our beers!I would recommend that anyone staying in Amsterdam pays a visit here. It's great fun, even if it's not what we expected.

Didnt deliver. Its a big building with some copper containers inside. After visiting the Guinness brewery i expected more. Concentrated a lot on connection to football. At the first beer testing stop we noticed children. It would have been thoughtful to supply them with soft drinks while adults tasted the product. I handed over my free pints to other people as i couldnt wait to leave the building. Its 90 mins of my life i wont get back again. Not worth the entrance money.

Something different . Fun and relaxed way to spend an afternoon. Stroll through at your leisure and learn as you go. You get a few fee drinks at the end which us a nice way to chill out. Would recommend.

A great afternoon. Visited with a group of friends during a weekend trip to Amsterdam.Had not initally planned to visit the Heineken experience but heard that there is a 25 minute boat trip included and thought it was a great deal for 18euros! This boat is not well advertised and can easily be missed if you do not know about it as it is after the walking tour of the brewery. We had to ask someone how to do get onto the boat - glad we did as it was a lovely shuttle boat trip down the infamous Amsterdam canals.The experience itself was also great. Very hands-on with lots to do and see even if you aren't a massive beer lover.Would recommend this experience but make sure you get the little boat too!

Good tour with a few beers at the end. Needed to kill a few hours in Amsterdam so we decided to check it out. Was a good interactive experience with a few beers at the end to top it off. Didn't take too long to get and the price was quite reasonable. Well worth the detour.

I was expecting a little bit more.... I've been to Amsterdam couple of times before but never had a chance to go to Heineken experience. As it is my favorite beer I thought I won't miss it this time. And well...I can't say I was really disappointed but I was expecting a little bit more. There is a lot about the history of a company which was quite interesting, the staff have a lot of knowledge, but all of that is about 4 rooms, then you can see the copper tanks where the brewing process was taking place and ...that's pretty much it. After that you'll queue for a little while to see a video where you are being brewed which is really cool and you going down to the bar where you can collect your 2 pints of heineken and of course buy a souvenir. It is ok to see but it isn't a MUST.

Awful . Awful, awful, awful. No experience and very little Heineken.
Take your money, find a nice bar and enjoy a few beers.
Two hours of my life I will never get back. I am struggling to workout what people enjoyed about this 'experience'.

Come thirsty, otherwise not really worth the price. Nice tour though I must admit I expected a bit more. They try to teach you about the beer production process, yet it's not that simple and even though you go pass visuals, you don't really capture what they trying to teach. Don't come only for the beer, it's worthless. If you want only beer, go to a pub near by.All in all, nice, yet not great.

Poor experience. This is relly not worth the bother. I think these people should visit the Bushmills experience in Aintrim to see what they could offer. Basically there is a queue, even for pre booked tickets, to go through a "virtual" brewery and then a 20 minute queue for the grand finale which is supposedly showing the experience of making a beer. Overall very disappointed with the experience. Luckily it was our last thing to visit as everything else in Amsterdam was good. DON't GO THERE

A blast to all your senses. I've been on A LOT of brewery tours, and while this is similar, it's also much more advanced technologically. Lots of interesting videos & interactive things to do. The club at the end was a little crowded, but we still got our free beer!

Real good fun . I visited here whilst on a City Break in Amsterdam. Tickets were on the pricey side at €18 but well worth it. I won't spoil the experience by saying what's there but I'd definitely recommend it to anyone who's visiting the city for a few days. Plenty to do and see and a great way to spend the afternoon.

Huge queues for very little.. So we just paid €15 euros for a short tour round a few rooms with uninteresting information, overcrowded with people just for a few half pints of Heineken! My advice, go to a bar as you will get better value for money that way!
Really fun activity!. Would highly recommend this as it is fun, there are a lot of different exhibits and I felt it was money well spent. Definitely worth a visit if you like beer!

"A very enjoyable experience!". Situated a few meters away from Museumplein, Heineken Experience is a fun visit with a very reasonable entrance fee of 18 euros (You can actually get a cheaper price if you have discount brochures). The price includes two beer tokens which can also be used to participate in a beer game, as well as a free gift souvenir. It is worth pointing out that the first few areas of the tour are not that engaging, especially due to the fact that they are too small for large groups of people. However, the tour gradually improves after the interactive screening of the brewing process, and culminates with a surprise twenty minute boat trip in the canals. I would suggest visiting the place in the morning around 10-11am as the place is less crowded and hence relatively quieter than in the afternoons.

Great self guide tour. If you have a Holland pass, you can use your gold ticket or get 20% price of ticket. There's an app and also wifi that will give you a more descriptive tour, but overall it's very self guided with a lot of history reads along the way. I've done the Guinness tour and found Heineken more informational. (Also gives you more beer, one small taster glass and two normal sized glasses). If you answer the guides questions in the tasting room, she will give you extra beer samplings. A lot of interesting, interactive technology along the way, all around a really cool tour.

HUGE QUEUES INSIDE. we got tickets online beforehand but still had to queue both outside (30 min) and inside (30 min) the factory. it was ridiculous. content is very old school and brief. beers were good but definitely not worth the wait and there are much better craft beers in amsterdam.

Fun Family Experience!. My husband wanted to visit this while in Amsterdam so I did some research to make sure it would be appropriate for our kids, 14 & 11, to go with us. It was not only appropriate but they enjoyed the experience as well! We bought the tickets for my husband & I at a restaurant near the Amsterdam sign for €16 to save the €2 because if you buy at the Heineken Experience they are €18 per adults. We did however have to get the kids tickets there. We arrived at 11 am and there were NO lines and only a small group of people inside the area. It was €44,50 for 4 of us (2 adults, 1 child, and 1 free child). Kids under 12 are free. You get a wristband that has to 'buttons' on it that you remove for 2 free drinks. For the adults you can get 2 beers, or if your like me and don't drink beer you can get 2 sodas. The kids get sodas as well. If you like beer you also get a small glass of beer in the tasting room so a total of 2.5 beers and if you answer a question right they will give you another beer. The experience has lots of photos, descriptions, and videos throughout. The horses are gone from the stables for renovations until April 30th. There is a 4D ride as well as several interactive games. You even get to sample barley (I never knew it tasted good raw) and hops. We were here an hour because there wasn't a whole lot of people there so we were able to see and do the stuff without waits. When we went back by at 6:30 pm there was a line out the door. After your done with the experience you will get a voucher for free gift from the Heineken Store. You can either take a free boat ride or walk the 15 mins. The boat ride is a 30 min ride through the canals, but only runs from 1 pm to 7 pm. It wasn't running when we finish just after noon so we came back later at 6:30 and found we'd have to wait until 7 pm so we just walked to the store. At the store you get a free mini beer glass, 1 per person. Overall we thought it was a neat experience and wasn't overpriced for what we got and it was something that we were able to do as a family, even for those of us who are not beer drinkers. Try to plan it when it's not crowded, like around opening, so that you can have easy access to everything.
Not impressed. Fine experience but nothing spectacular. Beer making simulation but beside that nothing worth mentioning.

Not the best brewery tour. First off if you don't like being in cramped little spaces with a lot of people crowding your personal space the beginning of this tour is not for you! My husband was ready to leave 5 minutes after we arrived! They kind of herd you like cattle up a narrow spiral staircase and small claustrophobic rooms that people will cram into you that is not pleasant at all. Finally it does let you into larger spaces but then you will jam up again at the "ride". The ride was a surprise and fun and the free beers were tasty but at times the tour had a disco kind of feel if you like that sort of thing. Definitely not the experience we were looking for in a brewery tour, if it's a pretty day outside, I would do something else!

Somewhat fun but not exactly a brewery tour. The "experience" is really just a self-guided tour through a series of rooms describing Heineken's history, advertising and branding throughout the years, and awards, followed by an interactive portion with photo/videobooths, games, and lounges. It was fun but I expected a little more description and insight into the company itself. There is very little explanation on the production, expansion, and distribution of the beer and brewery over the years.The tour ends with a bar where you can turn in chips to get two 25cl pours and then you shuffle into a gift shop with some interesting items. You'll be disappointed if you are expecting a real brewery tour - this is nothing like the craft breweries in the US. If you have several days in the city, it's worth an hour of your time to check it off your list, just manage your expectations.

Amazing! . We bought 2 tickets from a ticket and tours office in Amsterdam for a discount price of €16. We visited the factory at around 11am on Good Friday. No queue, walked straight in with our pre-bought tickets and was greeted by pleasant staff who gave us Heineken wrist bands with tokens to get free beer!The experience was great, with a small amount of history and lots of interactive things to do. The beer making process was explained and a chance to sample the hops/grains. There is even a stable area with horses - however this was closed when we were there. We got 3 free beers each, and you get to experience pulling one for yourself and get a fancy certificate in a box.When leaving the factory the queue had grown long with people queuing the length of the factory. If you want to skip this, go early!Overall amazing experience, a must do if you are in Amsterdam.

Extremely average. Overcrowded, waited 1.5 hours to get in, and then lines were forming other parts of the experience.The experience is not all that interesting, we were expecting a more interactive experience of beer making but instead it felt a little bit lile a massive marketing brainwashing of how awesome heineken is. You do get to have 2.5 pints of beer included in the price which was really the highlight of the experience after all this queing.

Nothing Interesting. I found nothing interesting in the tour.1. They will show you a video on how they make it, I expected a real experience.2. They will show you some old staffs which were use to produce Heinken in early days.3. They will give you 2 glasses of beer, which I guess is not the main attraction of the whole tour.4. Until you take the tour early morning you have to wait in a long queue for the video.To me it was nothing but waste of time.

Interactive, interesting and fun!!. Loved this place. Went in with little expectation, they say leave approx 1.5 hrs but we thought we would easily get through in less. As it was time passed quickly and I've no idea how long we were there but clearly we weren't rushing!!Definite recco a really pleasant surprise and loads of photo opportunities! Hope my review is useful? Please thumbs up is so?Ps. My tip1. Get the personalized beer bottle! Got one for dad who will love it!! If you cannot decide during the tour you can still do it at the shop at the end.2. Loads of photo opportunities get your phone fully charged- free wifi too3. Per book tickets and skip the queue... Which wasn't too bad anyway... Not compared to other things here (over easter)4. You get a boat trip round the canals and a visit to the shop for a free present. All for your 18e bargain!
Very very average.. This is my fourth brewery tour and by far the worst. Way too overcrowded. Much better things to do in Amsterdam

Beautiful view!. We went to the Heineken experience in a Saturday afternoon, so it was crowded. The visit is OK, but what I really enjoyed was the view of the roof bar.The number of people that can go upstairs is controlled and they don't advise all the public that this bar exists, only when the principal bar is very busy. So if you can, go there! There is an amazing view of the city, and you can drink your beer sit there!

About what you'd expect from such a commercial brand. I found the tour to be a bit boring and 'Disney' like. Probably better for young people, but some of the information was interesting. You get a couple beers included in the price so that isn't too bad. We also received a glass but had to go and find the brand store which is a slight hike from the Heineken Experience, but when you factor in the free beers and the glass it's not bad value. A bit of lining up after the tours got backed up which was a bi frustrating but the line do move along ok.

Not worth the money or time - Dont do it!!!!. Really a bad experience. Total rip off.18 Euros per person, and you will first have to wait in line for about an hour - just to get in and be disapointed. Only the first small part of the museum you will get the history about the Heineken. After that you will spend an hour walking SLOWLY in a long line around something that reminds me more of a canival or playground filled with stuff that has absolutly NOTHING to do with making beer or the Heineken history.Don´t do it - that´s my best advise.

Fun tour. I've been on a lot of brewery tours and this was one of the better ones. I liked that most of it was free walking instead of a huge guided tour. There are still guides explaining the brewing process but if you aren't particularly interested in a certain area, you can head to the next one. I'd recommend getting a ticket online to skip the huge line and it's a little cheaper. We bought ours with our phone while we were waiting and then skipped to the front. You get a free glass, 1 small beer during the tour, and either 2 more small beers and the end or 1 small one you can pour yourself from the tap with a pouring certifiate.

Worth the 18 Euro ticket. I really had a fun time at the Heineken experience. At the entrance you are given a bracelet with which you can get 2 free beers. It is quite long ans has interesting things to see and do. It starts with the history of the beer, with pictures and objects exposed. Then you can see how they make the beer and the processes and there is also a cool animated video that explains it. There is of course the area where you can get to drink a beer and a fun guy explains to you everything abou the it and how to taste it. There is also an entertainment area where you can take pictures and make videos and email them to you, an area related to football and other kind of things. There is a bar at the end where you can chill and drink beer with friends and the gift shop too.Really worth visiting and much fun, and best part there was no queue when I went there in the afternoon!

Complete waste of time & money. The tour begins and continues with the visitors being crammed down hallways and up staircases like sardines in a tin. While I give the company credit for its enginutiy in the construction of the stairwell, that holds +- 50 average persons at a time, the 20 minute wait on the stairs alone leaves much to frustration . One would think the concept of a popular tour attraction, in a extremely popular town, would leave room for this tour to expand to accommodate the high volume of visitors regardless of holiday weekends or not; sadly it is not so. the tour continued with well placed and interesting wall viewings, but the 'Penguins shuffle' of a pace of the tour left much to be desired considering the tourist congestion ended abruptly and began again spontaneously. A 45 minute wait for a 10 minute "interactive" video feature followed by leisurely activities clear through to the tourist shop to include two spots for beer tastings was good for most tourists but for me being as I said earlier crammed like a sardine left me drenched in beer instead of consuming it because of tourists bumping into me angling for a spot to stand, not sit, and guzzle their allotted rations. all in all that was the biggest 2.5 hour waste of my vacation I will never get back and NOT worth the 16€ I paid to be dumped alcohol on. I'd rather hit the Sam Adams breweries in Boston over this waste any day. at least that tour is free, quality, interactive and definitely worth the time
Great tour . Visited here whilst travelling around Europe. Great tour! Staff very knowledgeable and seem to enjoy their job. The beer is great, and lots of great things to see

Very interesting experience!. It was our last experience in Amsterdam after a long day of walking. We weren't expecting it to be so interesting. It took about 90 minutes and we had a lot of fun. We learned about Heineken history, drank some beers and took a lot of photos in the special rooms. It's a must try if you ever find yourself in Amsterdam. They feature also a boat trip along the canals and the last stop is at the Heineken souvenir shop in the center of the old city.
Cool but expensive. We didnot enter the Museum itself since the ticket price were too much expensive. We did visit the souvenir shop. The Museum in itself seems to be pretty cool and well visited.

What a fun way to spend the afternoon!. So much to do here! It has a museum, videos, tour of the brewery, soccer section, and a bar at the end! We got tickets through 'Tours and Adventures' which came with 2 free Heineken drinks. After our free drinks and the free samples, left the Heineken experience feeling great, and even a little tipsy.

Wonderful time and great free gift. Had a lovely time here and enjoyed the free gift after wards- they must have had so many people trying to take the glasses it was easier to just give a free one. However, these were quite reasonable in the shop to buy

Quality beer activity experience with lots of activities inside. Nice movies, exciting games, great ambience and atmosphere, good taste beer (of course Heineken), factory processes, small gifts. We had planned 1.5 hour for this visit, but it took 2.5 hours if our time. It is worth to drink, live and visit.

Educating, intoxicating & fun!. The Heineken factory is a lot of fun.There is a walkthrough museum and a "ride" where you become a bottle of Heineken which is a laugh. It really is worth doing, you get 2 free drinks and a free (small) Heineken glass which is nice.Visit the HEINEKIN FACTORY and the ICE BAR in the same day, it's so much fun in both and the constant flow of alcohol is always a winner. The alcohol in Amsterdam is very expensive and they don't serve proper pints. You get free drinks at both of these.Buy your tickets at TOURS&TICKETS (the red shops) as they only charge 16€ or it's 18€ at the actual factory.Also, if you buy your Ice Bar tickets at the same time, it's a lot cheaper :).

Who doesn't like Heineken.. Great visit, with a cloakroom to leave all your wet, heavy coats and bags. That way you can really enjoy the tour. Lots of interesting facts about the history and family background. Beautifully preserved main area with all the original features. Little snippets of audio and visual, and the idea of being in the making was fun. Of course at the end to sample the Heineken in a great area where you can pour your own was a real treat. Lovely atmosphere and no rush.
Amazingggg. First of all Leendert the guy who works there is great!all the workers are so nice and polite!i had better time there then "Madam Tuso"!!!Thanks for everithing!!!

we loved it. We were not sure what to expect but my daughter had chosen this and the icebar to visit on her 18 th birthday .I am so glad we did. From the beginning you can see the effort that has gone into this museum to be fun and informative.we loved the way there were photo opportunities everywhere .We enjoyed the 4 d ride then all the interactive games after that .My daughter even got to pull her own pint .We bought a glass and the lady engraved happy 18th on it so that is a good momento.You get really 3 glasses each of beer which is good .They even provide you with a 30 min canal cruise to pick up your free glass from their shop in Rembrandt square .We are amazed what fun you can have for the price we were there 3 hours and enjoyed every minute .

Pretty cool . I don't particularly like Heineken, but I am a beer lover and so I really enjoyed this. It was interesting to learn about the history. The guy who explained the ingredients was very good. Included in the price is the tour, three beers, a canal cruise, and a little souvenir glass. I thought that was pretty fair.

Great Fun. This was a great experience, particularly for 18 and up, there was plenty of free beer, a simulation, tour of the brewing facility, interactive computer games & a wee bar at the end.Really good fun

Fun/cool trip, not amazing.. Dont get me wrong...we had a lot of fun here, free drinks etc, and the interactive stuff was hilarious. You can send some e-postcards out for example. It was quite interesting and you can see how the brewery USED to be set out, but just remember its an 'experience' not a real life brewery. If beer is your thing, then you'll find this good. VERY busy, but everything moves quick.

Fun and cheap. well organized tour! all the phases of the beer process are explained. you get to have free beers during the tour and 2 at the end. the queue is quick and the staff is very helpful and friendly

Something different?. We just had this today, soething diffrent doesnt matter if your early or not line is fast, it's 16 euros include 2 free drinks, not bad it's worth it thry will show how the beer process & amazing part is.... Just buy a ticket thats the sutprise part, you can hang out make sure to have free drinks so good cold beer, ill recommend tjis 100%

Good fun and good value. The Heineken experience is something you must visit if you like beer. A great brand with a great history and some of the modern innovations are outstanding. The crowds were huge and we took about an hour to get in. This gave us less time to spend inside as we were on a time Schedule. Good fun with lovely beer at the end. Time needed - 2 hours inside.
a must. great place for young and old seeing the famous Heineken beer past and present you also get 3 free drinks included in the ticket price, good place to go if weather is not good

Really fun day for both beer lovers and haters alike!. Went with my fiance who loves beer even though I do not. What a great day. Good value too. Loved the museum experience, The ride, the tasting (well just getting to see his face light up at free beer), getting to pour my own beer (complete with certificate in a poster tube...apparently I couldn't have done it better!! :-D ), the 30 min canal boat ride ( that even had some unexpected commentary and the opportunity to have more beer...fiance was so happy) and to top it off a free glass as a gift! All for the same price or 1 euro or so more than the 75 min canal boat ride tour we took on another day... but it felt like we got so much more for or money! Would definitely recommend!

Global beer, global brand!. For the ones who like beer this is a must see place in Amsterdam. Even if you do not like beer it is also a good opportunity to see how they create a global brand, a global product, Heineken. Go there and live the experience!!!
Made me Love Beer!. Excellent and fun attraction, includes 4D cinema and beer tasting and the history behind the brand. Definitely worth a visit!

Great place to visit. My partner and I decided to go here and I must say it was brilliant lots to do and see and you also get 2 drinks and if you like a canal ride, they had a champions league section which was fantastic they had an Irish live band playing, the staff were lovely and very outgoing and spoke good English I would love to go back if we visit Amsterdam again.

a fun rainy day outing!. My sister and I decided to go without our parents, for they were not interested in going. When we got there around 12:30, there was no line outside, and a very short line at the ticket window. My family has a Holland pass, and we decided to not use our gold pass, which gets you in for free. We got discounted entry though, so it ended up being like 14.40 euro each. There is a lot to do here; there is the museum part, which details the history of Heineken family and creating the brand. There is a lot of interactive stuff to do here! We ground barley to make the beer, and stirred the barley mixed with water. There is a tasting room where they give you little samples of beer to try; I got two, because I answered a question properly about beer! There are plenty of places to take pictures and email them to yourself for free; my sister and I did that a lot! There is also a "ride", which is kind of like virtual reality, which we really liked! With admission, you get two free large Heinekens, as well as a free gift (a drinking glass). It was a very fun place to go, and definitely worth what we paid for!
Become a certified pourer!. For those who like beer, it is a must do! Reserve at least 2 hours for this incredible experience! It is not only a tour, you interact with it all the time! Nice!

10/10. was brilliant, even if you dont like beer you will still love it... lots of information and stuff to look and great stuff to interact with and free beer!! you can pull your own pint and with entry you get a free gift and two free pints. there is also a 4D ride thats hilarious!

Something a little different. Very enjoyable 90 minute experience. We had spent the previous two days at the Amsterdam museums/ palaces and this was a wonderful change of pace! The building itself is really beautiful especially the main brewing facility with its large copper kettles. The tour is cleverly executed with lots of impressive AV touches.
