The resulting experience is more like an amusement park experience vs a traditional tour. The Heineken promotions became a touch tedious towards the end, but would certainly recommend the tour.
Amazing experience. One of the best, if not the best experience we had in Amsterdam. The entire self-guided tour was fun with many unexpected surprises.

Hiccups !. A great place to visit.Very historical and very interactive.If you love beer you'll love this place,if you love sport you'll love this place,if you love beer and sport like myself you want to move into this place.Great demonstrations throughout and plenty of free Heineken.A must.

My wife drinks beer now because of the Heineken museum!. If you like beer and sport you will love this. If you are like my wife and didn't drink beer nor watch much sport but were interested in learning about the process of beer making, you will be converted just like her. Give it an hour or 2 to go through, enjoy a few beers included and learn about beer in a way you'd never imagine!
Wow, good fun. 10/10 to who ever designed this, really good fun, loads to see / do for all ages. Deffo pre-book, or you will end up in a big old queue.

Great experience. We had a great time here. It starts with giving you a history of Heineken followed by teaching you how it is made. One of the best bits was the interactive film where you are the beer (it makes sense when you're there!) pouring your Heineken at the end was lots of fun and a good way to finish. Would thoroughly recommend!

Good example of modern multimedia attraction.. If you ignore the fact that this is just one enormous advertisement for Heineken beer you can have a very enjoyable couple of hours.At first glance seems quite expensive at €18 but you do get a beer tasting and tokens for another couple if small beers at the end of the tour.

Such a fun day out!. I came with a few friends and we weren't really sure what to expect! It was so much fun! I would highly recommend this experience to others. So many interactive elements incorporated with the tour such as making your own videos to send to family and friends and the option to learn to pull the perfect pint! Me and my group of friends had a great time so much fun could have spent the whole day there.

Must Visit. First, if you have holland pass, it is a good place to visit. They walk you through the ingredients, then how it is being made, which is interactive. It is like one of those 4D rides you do. And then they give you lesson to be a certified beer drinker. Also you get 2 glasses in free , we bought one beer mug and had name carved on it all for 9 Euros. Accessibility is very easy and is also included in bus tour if you have holland pass with you.
Must go. Very interesting place. A must go place in Amsterdam. You can see how the beer is made, and experience it on yourself. Also there are free drinks offered.
A real experience!. A true experience in the Heineken old brewery. You can see all the steps in the making of a Heineken beer. Free beer in the end!

great fun. i have been in few different brewery (poland, czech republic, irleand) and i have to say that was my best experience so far!! great fun, especially unexpected 3D presentation :) i got my ticket online, save e2 and i was able to skip long line (friday afternoon). in price was 3 beers incuded as well (small one - not pint - but i woudl say normal size for holland), and 'photoboot' as memory - nice suprice. there was a stands with playstation and fifa for guys...and girls if they like to play some football :) generally i have to say that was worth the price and if im gonna be in amsterdam again i will definity do it again :) ps in the end of the tour we got our free gift - free heineken glass ;)

Woooooowwww!!!! :-D. I honestly dont know why there are people who say its not worth it. For ?17 or ?18 you get to know some of the heineken family history and how their beer brewing began. After that, they teach you how to enjoy beer like a pro. You get a fantastic VR experience and a tour of the old factory. Later they teach you hou to serve beer (Thomas was a really cool guy). Then they take you to a small boat trip (honestly I dont think youll need more than this in Amsterdam. The truth is that all boat rides are the same. Finally you are taken to the heineken brand store where you can buy your heineken merchandise and get a free gift.

Enjoyable and value for money . It is definitely a platform to promote and market Heineken, with the brewing process almost skimped over, but it is fun. Pouring our own drink and getting a free little glass completed the experience for me and my husband. It's worth it if you're looking for an indoor fun activity.

Great spot well worth a visit with great beer . Went to the Heineken experience with my girlfriend on 20/03/15, we purchased discounted pre paid tickets so skipped the queue. Its an interactive start and then you get told about the ingredients, history of the family and the beer . Then you go into the brewing room and then a beer tasting room for a little taste of the beer then you see how its bottled and then another interactive part which is fun and then the bar where you get two 1/2 pints as part of the deal which you can pour yourself if you wish , its a great trip for spending a couple of hours with great beer at the end well worth a visit

A huge heineken advertisement. This place really did feel like entering a huge Heineken advert- there were lots of interactive experiences that gave you the opportunity to upload pictures and even videos onto social media, with the Heineken logo in the background of course. Having said that, you could still do the activities without uploading the results, and most activities were pretty fun. For the price you don't get much beer (less than a pint and half) but you do get the chance to 'experience being a bottle of heineken' which was quite novel and you also get a free boat ride at the end to the Heineken brand store, where you don't actually have to buy anything so it's effectively a free lift into town. Expensive at full price and not a 'must see' if you're only in Amsterdam for the day, but if you're here for longer and have an iamsterdam card or similar discount, this is overall an enjoyable break from the more formal museums.

YOU HAVE TO GO HERE WHEN VISITING AMSTERDAM-. Absolutely loved the heineken experience TIP: MAKE SURE TO BOOK ONLINE AHEAD OF TIME TO AVOID EXTREAMLY LONG QUE!! If you book online like we did U get to walk straight in instead of standing outside in the cold for over an hour!! The tram from central station and DAM square goes here so it's easy to access , the whole experience is amazing , so much to do and see, really modern and interactive , so worth the price of the tickets , one of the best things you can do in amsterdam , you can get amazing personalized merchandise , you get free drinks and gifts , WELL WORTH GOING !!

Pretty cool museum, even if not a beer drinker. I personally don't drink beer, but my husband does so we went. I definitely recommend buying tickets online to avoid an hour + wait ( trust me, we waited that long in line). The beginning is a little lackluster but it picks up and is rather fascinating. It was a fun day!

Ideal for selfies!. Spent a pleasant couple of hours wandering around. Nicely busy, without having to queue too long (although the queue for "pour your own beer" was monstrous so we skipped that bit!). You learnt about the history of beer and the history of the brand.It is a photo lovers paradise! Particularly loved the photo booth and the "green screens" which allowed you to put your photo on a bike, Heineken star, football stadium etc.You got a free mini glass and some beer samples to take away which was nice.There are deals you can get on tickets from other retailers and hotels - we paid face value but could have got 2€ if we were a bit more savvy. Merchandise is expensive, but would be worth buying if you are a Heineken drinker!

Brilliant experience. With a very short time to spend in Amsterdam, we had to limit ourselves in the things we saw and did. I'm glad we included the Heineken Experience as one of our activities!Being Scottish I have visited many distilleries in the past, and many of them tend to be the same walk around type tour of old vats where drink is made. Aside from the obvious difference, Heineken being beer not whisky, the Heineken experience is utterly brilliant in it's interactive way of telling you the story of the companies past, the way they develop the beer, and they actually teach you how to drink it!!The beers all the way round were good too. A good value for money attraction with super friendly and helpful star.

Not worth the money. We attended the experience expecting a good tour but It was average at most. You find out how heineken was established but that's about it! There is a 'ride' which is nothing more than a hydraulic platform in which you get splashed with water and blasted with fans while you get shaken about! Boring! The whole thing was boring! Wouldn't recommend at all!

lots of fun. Visited with my husband. it was a quiet day so wasn't at all crowded. the staff were mostly lovely (apart from one girl looked a bit bored where the copper pots are) buy your tickets online and you will get a 2euros saving. very interesting tour and you get beers too :)

MUST SEE!!!!!!!! take time to visit. This was amazing experience. Download the app which is like renting the audio devices. They do have wi-fi throughout the brewery. Take at least 2 to 3 hours to visit, there are lots of games and photo booths inside to spend time with. Also at the end if you have time to spare take the boat ride which take you into town and still get a free gift after the ride.
best Heineken I had. Nice informative experience. Make sure you buy tickets in advance (online) so you don't have to wait in line.

Fun and interesting trip through Heineken land. Pre-booked our tickets online, so saved ourselves €2, for this you get entry, 3 free 25 cl drinks (1 at the tasting session/ 2 at the bar) and a free gift. There is also a free cloakroom to use as well. We downloaded the Heineken experience app, which acted as an audio/ video tour throughout the "museum" part of the tour. We felt this added value to the tour, as without it you where missing the back story of the items you were seeing. Throughout the tour there are lots of interactive things to do, however none of these can be done by anyone under 18 so wouldn't recommend this as a good place to visit with kids. Staff were also really friendly and enthusiastic about the brand and made you interested in what they have to tell you.

Where beer is made... :). We visited Hieneken Experience with a group of my friends when we ent to a Amsterdam.Rotterdam-The Hague trip in 4 day. It was one of the most pleasant "museum experiences" we had. I was not a fan of beer before, but this experience have rectified that "problem" of mine :)Simply, if you are in Amsterdam, whether you like beer or not, this is a must.

Adults play ground. Tired after a day and a half walking around the city, we had a few hours to kill. Decided to give it a go and certianly were not disappointed!Bought tickets at a torist spot and walked there from Dam Square (15 mins). We were able to put our coats in a cloack room before we started so we didnt have to carry them around. It started with the history, moved onto how its made and wondering round the life size hops. Then the fun started! We queued for around 5 mins to go into an interactive cinema area where we were made into the bottles, spayed with water, bubbles, heated up, shaken up etc. Then moved onto being able to personalise and purchase a bottle (6 euro cash or card payments). Then you moved from room to room where there was playstations set up to play football to learning how to pour a pint and how to taste the beer. Finally you hit the bar with interactive tables that move your beer matt whenever you put one of your 2 free drinks down.Left the experince wide awake wanting to buy go to a bar and get pint of Heneken.

A fun way to learn new things about beer in general and Heineken in particular. As Heineken is the only beer I ever drink, this was a must. It was busy but not as busy as the museums. There are a nice series of videos and displays telling you the history of the brand and how they make it. Toward the end you get a tasting which I found quite informative. Did you know you should always sip from beneath the head? If you don't, the beer will be bitter. The smell of REALLY FRESH Heineken is unforgettable. At the end you also get 2 free beers for good measure.
There's always something happening around a beer!. Very enjoyable couple of hours whiled away @ Heineken experience.. best factory tour I have been on...
It's a commercial. The tour was basically one giant commercial for Heineken. I expected it to be a lot more about the brewing process and to actually see a brewery, but it's quite the letdown.
total waste of time..... Queue to get in, queue for everything, get one small beer give, up find a bar, not worth it.........

Sweet Liquid . Got a great duo deal with canal boat trip too! Loved the factory, staff are very friendly & enthusiastic 😊 the lady who explained how to drink beer properly was very funny "Sweet Liquid" . Over all great experience, free beer & gift at the end just topped off a lovely day!

Great Experience. I love Heineken beer so was quite excitied for visiting this and it didn't disappoint me.Was great to learn more about the history of Heineken and there was plenty of interactive things to do along the tour to make you feel a part of it. Well worth a visit and was plenty of chances to sample heineken on the way round it. Always wanted a Heineken glass and now have several thanks to the gift shop

not bad value for a couple of hours entertainment. We had a few hours to spare and thought we would give this a go, it is pretty good for the money and they have some interesting activities, unless you are really obsessed with brewing the first half is a bit dull but it gets better to the end and they give you a couple of (half's) of beer , interesting rather than amazing,

Expected more!!. To much publicity, high tech resources, but poor contact with the production process and the actual sense of drinking beer. I`ve already visited many other smaller breweries and had better experiences.

Worth every cent!. My partner and I visited the Heineken Experience and loved every minute of it, what an amazing set up they have created. There was just the right amount of history, brewing explanations and interactive fun. Make sure you catch the Heineken canal boat to the brand store once you have finished at the brewery. While the brand store is good, the canal cruise is great fun, and the serve Heineken on board, obviously!

Not a beer drinker but still loved it. Myself and my partner visited here yesterday, we had a great time from stsrt to finish! I couldn't recommend this highly enough it had something for everyone from the history to making a pint from scratch to learning to pull a pint.. All the staff were extremely friendly and made the experience that much better! We will defo recommend this to family and friends!
A great museum-worth a visit!. With less than 24 hours in Amsterdam, I made this museum a must see. Tickets were a reasonable price.
Great experience. Had a fantastic time! Is truly a top notch tour and 2 free beers is certainly a bonus! Can't wait to return and show some more friends the ins and outs of there favourite beer

Interesting history of Heineken and fun interactive stuff. We arrived and were shocked by the queue outside, luckily I had internet on my phone so ordered tickets online, definitely order your tickets before going, especially during weekends, it also saves you a few euros! It starts off with a history lesson, followed by lots of interactive stuff! Don't forget there's a FREE Heineken Shuttle boat too, fills up quickly too, so might be better to get a ticket before entering the experience.
Interesting . A couple of well spent hours. Me and my boyfriend were very pleased with the visit and we learnt a lot in a fun way. Worth the price for all you get to see. :)

Dragged out and not worth it!. I was pretty dissapointed overall with the Heineken Experience. The start was pretty interesting, about how the business was started and the brand etc but after that I was bored to tears. There was hardly any infomation that explained where you were etc, we tasted a sample of two ingredients (think it was water and barley) which was revolting and lingered a long time! You were rushed through a lot of it and not given your free beers until the end, being able to walk through the actual exhibition with it might have been a better experience. Just stick their logo over anything and everything to drag it out... Overall I wouldn't say it was worth waiting in the huge line or paying full price - we booked online for two euros less per person and got straight in, otherwise I would have been even more annoyed! The boat trip to the Brand Store is included, get your tickets on the way out of the shop, and was handy as we were going to that area next. However, you couldn't see very much as the windows are tinted green and covered in stickers so not a replacement for a canal boat cruise but definitely the best part of the experience.

Yawn!!. Myself & partner picked this tour for the fun factory it would provide but sadly it did not delivery. We both enjoyed the beginning of the tour which was interesting, it involved the history of Heineken but that's where the fun stopped. This factory is no longer a working brewery unlike the Guinness storehouse in Ireland Which is. The guy at the ingredients counter was rude & showed no interest in what he was trying to explain & standing 40minute's for the " Heineken Ride" was tiresome especially for children & older visitor's. The only good thing about this tour was the "Free Heineken" was tasted good. Highly Recommend this tour for lads/men aged 18/30+
Awesome visit!. Great experience! I would recommend buying your tickets beforehand however as the line can get very long! With pre-bought tickets, you get right in!

Best museum EVER! . I'm not a fan of museums... But this is GREAT! Beer tasting, production making and free beer. Very interesting and a must visit. Go early, and highly recommend booking online cheaper and Queue jump.

worth a visit. The inclusive beers and atmosphere, was interesting to see that the heineken family are pro dutch contribution to society and the economy as a whole. Take my hat off the their success and the benchmarked grain that is still in use today to ensure the same taste throughout the years!

Brilliant Tour. I cannot recommend this tour enough. We paid 16 euros each for this tour as we booked it through Tours and Tickets in the town. The tour included a tour of the brewery, 3 drinks (One as part of a tasting session the other 2 in the Heineken bar), a free glass and a boat trip. Very informative and the beer was lovely.

Interesting at points. Tour was interesting at points but certainly not as engaging as it could have been. Not a tour for children as they would be bored to tears and essentially just a massive advert from beginning to end. I just don't think making beer is a very complex process and as such there isnt really much to say from their point of view.

Very pleasant and interactive. A very good description of the brewing process, with many fun moments. The tasting area was crowded but still ok, and with a nice vibe for the thirsty savy tasters!The interactive photo and video possibilities are a very nice addition!

Fun experience and some learning thrown in. The process of brewing beer is fairly simple so the Heinekin company have created something more to capture the imagination and get visitors involved. On the serious side there was good information about the history of the company and its development. Then there is beer tasting and plenty of interactive opportunities so you can post videos and pictures on social media if you are interested. Highly recommended but it is wise to buy tickets in advance fom on of the ticket agencies to avoid the queue!

If you like Heineken then go.. A good visit, you learn more about the brand and the progression of this household name, i have been on better brewery tours but this is something totally different. Worth the money as you get 3 beers and a free glass.

Cool experience through the brewery. I have actually visited twice before and enjoyed the second time much more because i was with different people and we took the time to look around and experience everything,for the 15€ we paid we got 3 beers all in, theres a mixture of watch and learn quick guide lessons thens theres lots of interactive guides which are fun. Plus you get to see some real horses which are cute. The whole experience is enjoyed at your own pace which is nice as you dont feel rushed and you can take everything in better then at the end you can chill in the bar area and redeem your beer tokens also at your own leisure no need to rush out for another group coming through, bar area was cool and lively nice music and seating areas, well worth a visit

Dam fine Beer. We went as a group of 8 the youngest 16years old the eldest 67 years old, he was in fact the main reason we went on the tour a birthday trip for the 67 year old ex Heineken worker.We did not buy the 16euros in advance tickets so we went early 10.20 am and only 16 other people were in front of us.Duly paid our 18 euros, and fun was had by all, adults and children could find things to do, from pulling a pint to pulling an attractive passerby to star in an interactive video, with a great Dutch backdrop, and music.The sampling of the different process made to produce this Dam fine beer with explantions, films and surprises, and gifts along the way, the canal boat trip for 1 hour, was a pleasant surprise.Great trip we passed a good 2 hours inside and could have stayed a bit longer as we did not do all of the Heineken Experiences on offer.

Mix of brewery and interactivity. One year to the day after visiting Carlsberg in Copenhagen, a nice visit to the Heineken equivalent. First part is history, the brewery and finally more interactive exhibits such as football games from champs league and virtual pouring a drink.Quite different from Carlsberg but just as enjoyable - beer not bad either!

Lager than life!. I'm not a great fan of lager but it was a very interesting tour of the old brewery. All the original equipment is still in the building and there's a lot to learn about the Heineken family and their modern approach to industrial relationships. Then free lager at the end!

Much improved. Went here 9 years ago and I am very impressed having visited again. The brewery is full of informative pieces and exhibitions. The tastings were good and the atmosphere quite fun. You also can get a boat ride around Amsterdam now in the Heineken boat. Probably worth the money even if you understand brewing (I have been to well over 10 breweries) but avoid if no interest in beer.

The coolest tour in Amsterdam. The Heineken Experience takes place in an old Heineken factory, you'll get to know how the beer was (and is made), the history of the company, see the first machinery used in the process, and watch several fun and interactive movies. Sound boring? This is just the first part, then you'll get to a bar were you'll be served some beer and they will teach you how to serve, conserve and drink your beer. After that theres the "bar" area, where you can retrieve the 2 beers included in your ticket price. If you want you can serve your own beer in a bigger glass and have a picture as a "certified beer pourer" (but that will get you your two tokens and only one beer). There are a lot of interactive games, pannels and lots and lots of videos. A great place indeed, my favorite in all AmsterdamIf you buy the ticket at a hotel you'll get a little souvenir (I got keychain, not sure if there's other kinds of souvenirs).

Beer. Beer and more beer , enjoy a walk down the life of beer being made from start to finish also plenty of testing plus a few free pints also games everythink for everyone well worth a trip ,,,,,,,,,,

Beer and information, a perfect combination. this attraction is worth a visit, good value for money, we purchased our tickets from a souvenir shop up the road from the attraction which were a couple of euros cheaper, well worth doing, the tour itself is very well laid out and informative, we didn't have to queue for hardly anything, it takes around three hours and keeps you entertained, the beer is an added bonus, i'm not a big Heineken fan but enjoyed this experience and so did my wife.

Well worth it. The tour is one of those 'standard Amsterdam' experiences and is busy but is well worth it. The tour covers all areas, the company history, how the beer is made, some interactive experiences, advertising and sponsorship history and some beer tasting.The tickets also include a ride back to the city on the Heineken canal boat/floating bar which is a short guided tour of some of the canals which was a nice bonus.

Very good experience!. Heineken Experience is defiantly worth to be visited. You get to learn the history, how it all started and then how the beer is made. There some parts where it was just fun, little stations all the way round to use and play with. Plus you get some bonuses as well-3 tokens on. 2 for free drinks and 1 to claim your free gift at the end of the tour.

Worth every buck. We got our tickets online which I believe was a couple of euros cheaper. On arrivalm you get a wristband with 3 tokens on. 2 for free drinks and 1 to claim your free gift at the end of the tour.You get to learn the history, how it all started and then how the beer is made. There was loads to do, things you wouldn't expect. They have lots of virtual things as well and get 'green screen' pics/videos made and sent to your email. We were there for about 2 hours in total and just didn't want to leave! All the staff were really nice, fun and energetic! Can't fault this place. Highly recommend going!

good experience!. i had a really fun day visiting this brewery!it does take quite a while to get round but theres no rush!quite informative and interesting in some parts and others, well it was just fun! little stations all the way round to use and play with.some beer tasting and a little speech, then towards the end transformed into a little bar where you could drink, chat and get souvenirs before leaving. its definitely worth doing while your in Amsterdam.

It was ok, nothing special though. I visited with my boyfriend as it's somewhere he wanted to see. We were a little disappointed as felt they could have shown more about how the beer is brewed. Yes, it has the history and the marketing, but nothing more really. There is a shaker plate at one point where you're the beer being bottled, then you get a taster of the beer and 2 glasses of either beer or soft drink. The best bit in my opinion was the shop - got 2 jackets for €20!
Tried some Heineken. The Heineken Experience was lovely. Had fun on the tour, making my own commercial and my specialized Heineken bottle. And of course, , did some beer tasting

skip it. The only reason I gave it one star was because I needed a rating to write the review. The crowds are huge and slow moving. If you've been to one brewery tour in your life time then you covered this one. It's mostly advertisement for Heineken. Which are neat in their own rite. But not the purpose for a brewery tour. If you want to get the shuttle boat over to the "Brand Store" for that free gift get your ticket right away. Because there are only so many seats available. And the walk is more like 30 minutes not like the 15 they advertise. All and all skip this unless you are A HEINEKEN LOVER.

Poor value. Unfortunately I was disappointed, I know its an advert for the company, but the price did not reflect any quality, lots of queuing, up and down stairs. Yes you get a couple of drinks....but if that's what your after then go to a bar, your get more for your money!

Not a bad place to visit. Myself and girlfriend visited it last Friday. Tour was interesting. We found it is very similar to Guinness store house in Dublin. I think ticket price is a bit to expensive, but over all it was great experience :)

fun. My husband and I are not really Heineken fans but this museum is fun. I was actually pretty happy we did this and to be honest this is a great deal for the price, they even took us on a canal ride.I can very easily recommend going here.

Surprisingly excellent!. Me nor my girlfriend was overly bothered about this tour but decided to give it a bash and was not disappointed ! It was surprisingly excellent ! It was fun and inventive and very well run ! The crew inside are informative and friendly folk! Would highly recommend this tour you will not be disappointed !

Well worth the money. Got out tickets through the ticket office in Dam Square 2 euro cheaper then if you buy at the place.We went quiet early in the day thank goodness as it got very busy.It was a fantastic tour loved it.Fun as well as informativea couple of drinks thrown in and a glass as a sovereign
good time. A good experience the history and freebie drink. but geared up for the younger traveler .staff very informative there is also a free photo booth at the end .

Great place to visit.. It was a very damp Thursday afternoon and what better way to spend a couple of hours than at this experience. The staff were friendly and fun. The experience was both interactive and a lot of fun.One element which surprised me was the very reasonable cost of entry and souvenirs. In the UK I'm convinced that the cost of everything would be double and the fun factor would be halved!Overall a really fun afternoon with a free beer or two thrown into the mix!

A must do. Had a great time at the Heineken experience in Amsterdam. Well worth the price of €17 pp. that allows you entrance two free drinks and free gift at the end of tour also free photobooth pics. A very interesting tour of how the drink is brewed from start to finish. You also enter a simulator where upon you become the bottle of beer goin through the different brewing stages to completion very entertaining. Also at the end of tour we were offered a free trip on the Heineken canal boat with tour guide informing us as we sat back enjoying the views from our riverboat.a most enjoyable attraction.

Real Heineken is actually good!. The best part of the Heineken Experience was the samples at the end. I could not believe how tasty and refreshing it was! It's so much better than the Heineken in the states. Overall, it was a great time and I highly recommend!

Amazing. The brewery. What kind of experience could be-ok, they have excellent beer.That was my thought before I entered in this Heineken world.I would be realy sorry if I have missed this visit. I do not want go to the details, but try it, you will for sure not regret. And for the end you have a free Heineken boat sightseeing!

Good day out. Visited on our recent trip to Amsterdam, great day out not overly expensive and you get some free beer in the bar which had a good atmosphere. They also offer a free short canal trip which we took advantage off.

great experience. Very interactive tour. You can spend a whole half day there, experiencing the way the Heineken brand was developed through time. Finally, You will drink a couple of beers that will make your day better in this amazing city.

Poorly done more about advertisement . Went to the the brewery with my fiancé looking forward to it but honestly a big let done constant advertisement and not enough about the brewery. You don't have a guided tour you literally walk around looking at advertisement . There is this stupid ride midway boring. One thing that a found was the exit . A am really disappointed with it which is unfortunate as a love the beer . This is solely speaking from my view mayby a family would enjoy it more there's FIFA and a couple of interactive things just not ideal for a couple

Best thing we did throughout the trip! . If you only have time to do one thing in Amsterdam, go to the Heineken Experience. You can spend a whole half day there, experiencing the way the Heineken brand was developed through time, how their beer is made and being immersed in all their different marketing campaigns today. Don't want to spoil any surprises so go and see for yourself!

A great experience. We enjoyed the Heineken experience. Great value for the money. Took you through the whole process of making the beer from start to finish. You also got the chance to taste the beer and ask any questions. Would recommend this tour to anyone visiting Amstradam

A good 'experience'!. We booked our tickets as a combined ticket with the Canal Cruise - see other review - and this saved us about 5€! The Heineken Experience was excellent. The guy on the desk was very friendly asking where we were from and encouraging us to take photos so we could tell everyone back home how good the tour was, so here goes.....You start off with the early information about how Heineken started. There are lots of things to read on the wall and then you stand in a room which is set up as a bar and the video is as if the barman is behind the bar talking to you. From there you move to an area where a guy tells you about the main ingredients of Heineken. Next you move to the actually brewing area where there are videos to watch, ingredients to stir, and other interactive displays. Next you move to the 'Brew You' ride - clever! Then you move to an area where you are given your first sample. Next there is lots more interactive stuff with reference to football & rugby sponsorship and other advertising features. Finally you move to a bar area where you can enjoy your last two samples. They did say that you can collect your free glass in their gift store close to Rembantsplein but when we arrived back in reception we were able to collect ours there.A very good 'Heineken Experience' and definitely recommended!
Realy cool day. Loved the experience. It was a lot if fun to learn the history of my favorit beer!! And the free beer was not bad!!!

A must to visit. Excellent visit to Heineken Brewery, well worth the 2 hours. Short trip by Tram to the Brewery. They take you through the entire process and the interactive part is well thought out and great fun. There is the story of the family and then into the huge vats. Only 16 Euros which includes the tour, 2.25 icy cold samples and the little glass as a free gift. So glad we did this one, it was brilliant and a nice walk back into Damrak if you so desire. Excellent value for money and well worth the experience.

Nice for the history; but a little lack luster. I will be completely honest, I went here to appease my brother who's a beer fanatic. The day we chose to go, however, was absolutely packed so you couldn't really see anything or take the time to admire anything. The gift shop was absolutely out of this world with how much stuff was packed in there and of course, "free" beer is always a plus. I highly highly HIGHLY recommend getting tickets in advance. The line when we went was almost around the corner!

Great Fun. Enjoyed the tour and learning about the brewery and how it is made. Can be a very large que so best advice is to pre-buy tickets from tour shops, you save 2 Euros and a 2 hour wait. You have a sample beer through the tour and then 2 beers at the end along with a free gift of a glass. there is a canal boat that runs back from the Experience at 4pm and 7pm to the centre if you are there at the right time.

Amazing!. Had such a fab time here. Would definitely recommend it! Lots of things to do and see as well as tasting the beer. I wasn't really looking forward to going beforehand as I am a non beer drinker but I thoroughly enjoyed it!

Do yourself a favor and visit!. An absolutely great way to spend a couple of hours in Amsterdam. A very interesting and exciting experience which goes right through the journey of the Heineken brewing company, process and product. A very reasonable price which includes two beers at the end as well as a souvenir.

Heineken. The Heineken Experience is a great attraction when visiting Amsterdam. If you enjoy your beer, and want to know more about it, but gave fun at the same time. Then definitely come!It is a self guided tour and so many cool things to see and do. Enjoyed the free beers at the end! Just wish I was told about the Extra Cold option when choosing mine!

Great value experience. Great fun first day in Amsterdam staring here with this great visitor attraction. 18 Euro includes tour, 2.25 pints and a free glass - short walk from Rembrandtplein or you can get a tram

Fun and informative. I loved the tour. They give you the entire history and explain each step in making it. Then you get to learn how to poor it professionally (they even give a certificate). At the end you get a free gift as well. Lots of fun.

top draw. Me and my partner was at a loose end for a day so we decided go on the Heineken experience and we wasn't disappointed! There is no expense spared by Heineken here, this took up several hours of our day and we enjoyed ever minute of it and a couple of cheeky beers along the way, you also get a free gift and boat trip at the end, theres no rush here just take your time and enjoy.
So much fun. Loved this place. One of my fave visits in Amsterdam. Definitely money well spent I think. Generous with the beer and the staff are brilliant. A must do!

Worth a visit. Great way to see about the history of Heineken. On your wristband you get two free drink tokens plus a free gift of a Heineken glass token. Good fun trying to pour the perfect pint. We got an extra drink as I answered a question correctly in the beer tasting room! Great staff, really friendly. Good fun!

I enjoyed it!. I did not go to Heineken Experience the first time I was in Amsterdam in 2014 but this time I went I it is a really nice attraction. If you are a beer lover and know about it you wmight enjoy even more. A place to go once but worth the ticket!Ps.: If you buy the ticket in the tourist place in front of Amsterdam Central Station you get 2 EUR discount.

Lots to see and do. This experience was better than I had expected. We paid around 20 euros each and with that you get two free drinks and a free small Heineken glass. I'm not a fan of beer so the tasting session was somewhat lost on me!There is great emphasis on how the beer is made and the processes it goes through. It is clear the owners have gone to great lengths to make the experience interactive and exciting. There are videos to watch - showing all the different heineken adverts, the process the beer goes through. A 'ride' that takes you through the making process. There is also a shop and bar.Overall worth a visit but it wouldn't be the end of the world if you had to skip it...

Really good ! . Really good experience. My boyfriend enjoyed it more then me, but overall it was really good. Plenty of photo opportunities, free beer, free photos free gift and a ride. Worth a visit if visiting Amsterdam! Tram from central station takes you practically outside the brewery!

For the Green Lovers!. I just love Heineken and if you also do love it, don't miss this fun experience. It is an educative, nice and (in the end) alcoholic journey.Don't forget to pour your own beer and get the certificate.

fun. I brought a group here while in Amsterdam and it was very enjoyable ,you get the whole story of Heineken and how its made and loads of fun stuff and a couple of drinks on the way out and a free glass.we bought a combined ticket for 26euro which gave us the Heineken experience and an hour canal boat trip which we got just across the road from the building .a great way to see Amsterdam and rest your legs ..
Great day out . Very informative, great free gift and a couple of free beers , superb tour which I would recommend and do again, what more can you ask for ?????

Fun Afternoon. We had a great time at the Heineken Experience. The first part of the tour is mainly historical. Then you line up to take the Heineken ride. My husband is not a lines person, but we waited and it was a lot of fun. It is a 4D experience and we felt it was worth the wait. After the ride, the Experience becomes less museum and more festive. There are demonstrations and free beer. Always good! At the end of the tour, there is an opportunity to purchase Heineken beers with a personal label and you also get a free gift! My only criticism, it was very unorganized getting your tickets. Might be that it was snowing and everyone was trying to wait inside. But it was crazy. Overall great afternoon!!

Really Enjoyable. We ventured in on a rainy December afternoon and enjoyed learning about the history of Heineken. Upon entering it was a little unorganised but as soon as we paid for our tickets, and dropped our coats, we enjoyed every second. The first part of the experience was dedicated to learning about the history of the company and how it has changed and grown thorough the years. After that you get to explore the brewing process and even get to see the Heineken horses. I really enjoyed how interactive the whole experience was, Heineken have really thought about how to keep their guests entertained, I especially loved the simulator experience. Finally you get to learn about how to pour the perfect pint of Heineken,and after this you can explore the history of Heineken marketing and a little about their involvement with the Champions League... And finally you get to enjoy a drink on the house in their fabulous bar, a great way to spend a couple of hours!! The tour isn't expensive and includes wristbands, drinks and a free gift, a must do!

Interesting . It's very interesting and full of information about the process and taste and how to drink beer. Lots of samples, and also the chance to get a beer pulling diploma!! Lots of interactive things to do and many photo opportunities! A good laugh!

Very good. Excellent day out...no queue when we went and very good value...€18 gets you entry...a free glass...and a free boat ride (even if the boat ride is in a boat with green tinted Windows so you can't really see out!)

Excellent day. For the price you get 3 drinks, a canal trip and a free glass at the gift shop. I really enjoyed it, staff were really nice. The building itself has an excellent layout and interesting facts about the history of Heineken. Easy to find as well.

Great fun. Was very busy when we went so the first part dragged a little as the queue funnelled through but once we were onto the main tour it was great fun - we enjoyed pouring our beers and were able to hang around for quite a while as you are free to go at your own pace. Nice atmosphere to the place and the staff we encountered were good.

Must do!. The Heineken Experience was amazing. it is around €16 but you get 3 drinks with this. 2 come with the wristband and then 1 is during the tour to teach you how to drink a pint. You also get a free 'gift' at the end. So it is completely worth it.I would advise to purchase your ticket before you get there in the 'Tours and Tickets' stores. You get to skip the queue then.

Boring. I have visited this place.However its a tour through the building, during this tour you are kind of bored.Waiting to get the Wowww, I would liked to see a bit more of their marketing strategy, and how they built this amazing company. Have been to the Grolsch brewery as well, and this was about the same.What I really missed, was a kind of history how Mr. Alfred Heineken built the company.How to brew beer is in every brewery the same, but heinenken has much more history that the rest, please adjeust, and make it more historical!!

Attractive Place. It is really a cool place to go. You receive a large cup as a souvenir in the end of the visit plus 2 cups of beer. The row to buy your ticket is really long and boring. But the staff members are so helpful .

Entertaining thing to do. If you run out of things to do in Amsterdam or have time to kill before your flight, this is a good option. Tour may take 1 to 2 hours and it is a nice historical experience. However, the price at Eur 16 may be for some a bit expensive for the actual value of the attraction. Staff is awesome.

Really good day out!. Pre-booked tickets; still had to wait in line but wasn't as long as the general admission queue.Good pace to the tour, had a bit of a hold up at the 4D experience but that is to be expected.The beer-tasting experience was particularly good; the staff were lively and engaging (with more beer awarded for correct answers!)Exchanged two tokens to pull my own half pint which was great fun! Alternative is to use two tokens for two half pints.At the end of the tour you get a free small beer glass. The gift shop is reasonably priced with beautiful engraving of glasses charged at €3 a piece.

Brilliant. Went last Thursday and thoroughly enjoyed it. It is definitely NOT a stuffy boring museum, but a combination of the history, brewing methods/technology involved and an interactive experience all in one. A great half day out for the whole family - thoroughly recommended.

Thoroughly enjoyed it!. Was a bit pressing at times but generally enjoyed the tour, we had no queue whatsoever and spent a good 1 3/4 hours in there. Would recommend personally but I can also see why it's not to everyone's liking.

FREE BEER!!!. A great experience for only €18!!!. A must see for the avid beer drinker. At the end of the tour, you'll be given tickets for a free boat ride on the canal, as well as, a free Heineken beer glass.

Surprisingly good. You might think this would be a tacky experience, like Disney for beer-drinkers, but the Heineken Experience was done really well. Download the app (using the free wifi!) and let it reveal more of the experience for you. The staff were very helpful, the exhibits were well-paced and imaginative, and the beer tasted great (of course)! Surprise yourself with how much you enjoy it :)

More than a brewery tour. This lived up to its billing as an experience - as well as the usual tour, there were lots of multimedia displays and other exhibits, together with a ride - which was unexpected and very enjoyable. Oh and of course there is free beer and also a free glass!

Beer included in the tour!. It was a nice tour, with some nice history of the place. Very interactive, but there was a fair few ques to actually get around the factory. However, having 3 free 1/4 ltrs made up for that i'd say!

Heineken experiences. The Heineken experience has been revamped and updated since our last visit in 2007, although substantial changes had been made it was still a very good and certainly worthwhile visit. A lot to do and see with very informative and most helpful crew (Staff) not to mention the sampling of the product ( very handy if your wife/partner is a non drinker-a double quota!)

Great fun and the right mix of education and entertainment. Although under 18s are not allowed to sample any of the beer, my 15 year-old daughter enjoyed the experience and learned a good deal about the Dutch culture and history. The story telling process is good and the history of the company is well structured using a mix of live demonstrations, clever video and fixed posters. The 'Heineken Ride' was very good as were the options to place yourself in a Heineken advert and send the postcard back home. I would recommend this to anyone but beware the long queues to get in.

Brilliant - free beer. Me & my boyfriend had the 'I am Amsterdam Card' which we received 25% discount on entry fee along with a free gift from the Brand Store (which was located separate to experience) A bit of history of Heineken, how it is made then goes on to the beer tasting plus 2 free 3/4 pints of beer at the end. There is a free photo booth & few interactive things to do including football related activities & a small 'ride' experience which shows how the beer is made..... something different. (nothing scary lol) Cool gift shop at end where my boyfriend could have brought the whole shop! Well worth a visit!
Great beer museum. After a trip on the production of beers, you can drink 2 delicious beers draft. The staff seems very happy to have you there.

If you have excess of time this is one place to see. Appear a very comercial initiative, not educative, not interesting. The big foccus is in sail Heineken article and beer. Little of the Hx of Heineken within one screen. Really if you are a true fan of this beer go ahead...

Fun!!!!. Fantastic interactive tour! Make sure you buy tickets online and PRINT them before you go...we bypassed a huge line and walked right in...but if you have minors that need to buy tickets you can't get those online. We had our 10 year olds (11&u are free), so we were able to use our online tickets and the very friendly greeter grabbed free ticket for the kids. The kids loved the tour too--it's full of games and activities that appeal to all ages. And free Heineken for the adults!

Involved visitor center. Much like the Guinness Storehouse in Dublin, they have clearly spent millions on this attaction, and the main focus is just seeing all the advertisements, marketing, packaging, and cool interactive exhibits along the way. Of course there are also beer samples and some parts with old brewing tanks, etc.

Touristic and fun. Being a beer fan, I was eager to visit this establishment. But from the start, my impressions went down. It is too much touristic and money making. It looked as a theme park to me.You start from the beginning of meeting Mr. Gerard Heineken, then with the ingredients and brewing process. Along you see old commercials, bottles, labels. Then you have a 4D experience in making a beer. After that you can make your own bottle (with your name on the label, extra paying), you have beer tasting with lessons how to smell and drink the beer. At the Champions League corner you can play football, live and on the game console. At the end you pour the beer on the machine and get a certificate and a glass as a gift.

Spend 1.5 hours of nice time. If you want something else than looking at paintings go there it,s worth your money.History of oldest family run beer company.You get to taste, feel beer and I bought a nice personalised bottle as great gift to take home.ps Don.t go on saturday between 14:00 -16:00.Bit crowded.

So Much Fun. The Heineken Experience blew my expectations out of the water. It was so much fun, very educational, and had so much more to do than just drink and learn about beer. That being said, it was certainly the best Heineken I've ever had. I'll return the next time I'm in Amsterdam

A brewery tour.. Reasonably well done for this sort of thing. But it is the type of attraction in Amsterdam that attracts heavy levels of testosterone imbibing beers while they wait to hit the Red Light District after dark.

Overpriced but interesting. We love brewery tours so I had pretty high expectations. The activities are cheesy, frankly better for 20 something's. There are several places for photo ops and I like that you move at your own pace. We used a discount and bought before we went but still rather pricey. There is a place where you can take pictures with lots of backgrounds that I thought was fun.

A must in Amsterdam. This is a must visit ,from the start to the end you are taken on a journey through the brewery and and constantly stimulated along the way with lots of interactive displays and at the end you are rewarded with BEER ! And a free glass.What's not to like ?

For Very young people. Good for family with kids just in case of bad weather. The tour is also interesting, in some way, but the time for waiting a short move concerning the Heineken story is really too much. The disco for young is funny. Finally, if you Have time .......

A great experience. A great visit and one that should not be missed if you are a lager drinker. Interesting to find out how lager is brewed and lots of interactive devices to make it a fun visit. Good value with 3 free drinks included. The simulator ride to show what happens in the brewing process is excellent. Two hours well spent. Also got a free glass gift to take away.
Have a free drink. Actually its a few u ears ago that I've been here. But, it's even better now! Make a tour and see how they make beer. At the end have a free beer.

Awesone experience... Anyone visiting Amsterdam shud not miss going for the Heineken Experience....It was heartening to see how a company is proud of their brand and how beautifully they are showing to the world....it has everything from games, displays of all kinds, experience of brewing beers and serving draught beers the correct way....I don't want to spoil it for others....All I will say it is a brilliant experience and everyone should visit....Cheers!!!...
Great fun. Really a worthwhile visit. I would go there again if we are in Amsterdam. They go the extra mile to make it interseting and I now have a Heineken with my name on it!

Good mornings entertainment. Was uncertain about visiting here but so glad we did. It was ineresting to hear the history of the Heineken family and of course the free samples are well worth it. We were lucky that the queue wasnt too long but it might be worth pre booking your tickets.
Very good place to bust. Good tour round,staff all very good,Heineken shop also very good and of course the beer also very good.

Yum, beer!!. Very lighthearted experience, book online so you can walk in and avoid the queue. We had a good laugh and enjoyed ourselves. We would drink Heineken anyway so the beer didn't go to waste as it did with a lot of people
Agreat experience. It was an interesting experience seeing all the processess. The factory is large and the beer was great
bEER!!. If you like beer you should visit the Heineken museum and have a good experience! You ll know some history, ear about production and have the opportunity to try a goood beer :)

A must for all Beer lovers. Great place. You can see the Dutch are proud of Heineken. Good run through in the history of the largest selling beer in the world and how it's made. The tasting was really well done and the young girl was brilliant with her Dutch accent!!
Heineken... wow. Well worth the trip, - give yourself lots of time - very interesting, well run and lots of different activities 'experiences'... Loved it and my free Heineken glass!
Great beer experience. It took us to finish the tour around 1.5 hours . There is good information about all beer process . Factory is huge and you can have a beer end of your tour . I really enjoy

BARGAIN!. We had such a great time here, for 16 Euros, you get your moneys worth! We had 3 free drinks, you get to play on a Playstation, make videos, take funny pictures, and chill in mood lighting with lounge areas. A must when going to Amsterdam. We were there for about 2 and a half hours!

Heineken Museum tour. Heineken Experience is more than museum tour.It is beer lovers must. Tour was great way to learn how beer is in our table. How they made it old time and how now.And how big part it is party, football ,food,taste, life.I was really impressed.Tour it self had many different part and they had plan well details. Fanny experience with some botlle beer.Jormaa:)
Overated. Worth seeing but didnt leave a long lasting experience. Very crowded at all times. Too much marketing involved. Nice pictures but nothing else...

Probably only worth it if you love the beer. I'm not actually an enormous Heineken fan, but I went because I like beer and I like breweries. I thought if a beer drinker came to Boston and didn't visit Sam Adams it would be silly, so I'd better go. It's not a bad tour, but it isn't special, and it's very expensive. As is the case with any brewery, you don't learn anything you can't online, and because it's so commercialized--unlike, say, the Sam Adams brewery in a residential neighborhood of little Jamaica Plain--it doesn't have the feel of a family run business. It just feels like a factory for the global-market beer producer that Heineken is.

Great Fun. The Heinkeken Experience is definitely worth visiting while in Amsterdam. It takes you through the history of the brand as well as process of making the beer. The experience includes beer tasting plus two complimentary drinks at the bar towards the end of the tour. The second part of the tour includes interracial games, photo booths, Dj set and many more and the best thing is you can email yourself the photos at the end. Highly recommending to purchase tickets before going there.

Fun experience. We really enjoyed the Heineken experience in Amsterdam. It cost €15 each as we had a discount map from the hotel. It was well worth the money and had something for everyone and included 3 glasses of Heineken throughout the trip. Once you finish the trip you are invited to go on a boat trip to Rembrant square to the Heineken shop to collect your free glass. We were really surprised by the boat trip it lasted about 30mins and gave a commentary about Amsterdam. Overall a great morning and experience.

Interesting. This type was OK. It wasn't the most exciting thing we did that day, but if you like beer it is worth it to do once. For the entrance price, you also get three glasses of beer and a free Heineken glass.

A disappointing experience . If you've ever visited a working brewery you'll be disappointed with the Heineken experience. Nothing in the place still works and there's only one type of beer to try, Heineken lager. The start of the tour starts out with some museum style exhibits but then in an attempt to liven it up the place goes full tourist trap. "4D" Beer ride, check, selfie areas, check, nightclub style bar, check, footballer cut-outs, check. Really not worth the hour queuing outside. Compared to the Carlsberg museum in Denmark this is severely lacking.

Good fun and free beer!. Not a big beer drinker but something I enjoyed along with my boyfriend, some fun aspects throughout and educational too. You cannot go wrong with free drinks to enjoy during the experience, and a token gift to take home with you as a souvenir. Recommend.

Really enjoyed this, a happy surprise. Not sure what I expected but I was pleasantly surprised. Great tour and good value. We especially enjoyed the free boat trip to the brand store (where engraving is cheaper if you want names on glasses!) we had a game of fooseball and interactive football.Tried a few beers in the tour, fresh and definitely could taste the difference. Overall a great few hours with lots of additional extras, especially the free photo booth!

Interesting exhitbition - poor customer service. We visited the Heineken experience after realising we had more time in the city than anticipated, and although the exhibits and information were interesting it was a bit disappointing. It seemed like most of the money I paid went towards numerous glasses of Heineken and was based on the assumption that anyone visiting the exhibition must be a heavy drinker, and like populating their homes with Heineken paraphernalia. The layout was particularly poor with not a single piece of information allowing more than two people to view it at a time, and the need for people to be released in groups following certain exhibits made this even worse. Having said that, during the main part of the tour staff were on hand to help and offer the odd factoid. One of the better parts of the tour was the simulation where you were given the chance to feel like a bottle of beer being made, and the opportunity to have your own message put on a bottle for a reasonable €6. We jumped at the chance to commemorate our trip, however having paid for our bottle we were then told upon collection that it was not suitable for flying home with us, meaning we would now have to post it to ourselves. Had we known this upon purchase, odds are we wouldn't have bothered. In fact the whole experience deteriorated towards the end of the tour with the attitude of the staff becoming rude and slow. We were made to feel like a number, in a very over crowded and poorly organised bar being rushed as we drank the drinks practically forced upon us.

LOVED THIS, SO MUCH ACTIVITIES TO DO, MORE THAN JUST A TOUR. Was surprised at this as done many beer factory tours but this was pretty special, even my 14 yr old loved it. This has been well thought out to really give you the overall fun experience. Would go back in a heart beat. They also have horses...a hidden surprise, you got to try this. Well located in the centre.

A place of two halves. It is worth a visit. The first half is an interesting tour with the history and explanation of the brewing and bottling process. Downhill from there onwards for me - a load of unnecessary computer stuff where you could design your on bottle label, or something, like that. A free glass with explanation on how to taste it, then downhill again into a very noisy area to drink your two free glasses of H. I drank one and gave my voucher way to someone else.What do I remember most about Heineken - the noise.Out via the gift shop with a free glass and bottle opener.

It's nice. To be honest, I had greater expectations, but the tour is good, the people is really nice and energetic, the videos are really good, of course the beer is really good, but I think there is so much to see in Amsterdam that this shouldn't be the place where you spend your first hours, go around, and whenever you feel that you have seen Amsterdam then you can go.

A must see!. My girlfriend and I visited the Heineken Experience for the first time in December 2014. We were both pleasantly surprised; I think my girlfriend more so as she doesn't even like beer!The experience is interesting without being tedious and in my opinion is great value for money. Included in the price of admission is a wristband that gives you 2 free pints of Heineken and a gift from the gift store.The tour is not led by members of staff so you are free to walk around at your own pace. This suits everyone, as they're free to do their own thing. There are many activities to do whilst on the tour e.g. beer tasting, beer pouring, interactive games etc.I highly recommend visiting the Heineken Experience on your trip at Amsterdam!

Hangover cure! . Really good tour. A good price at 18 euro bearing in mind you get 3 free drinks (beers in Amsterdam cost 5-8 euro). Loads of cool stuff and the staff were class. Free canal trip at the end with extremely cheap beer €2.50
a definate for visiting Amsterdam. So much fun, definitely worth the money! Drinks and a gift are also included. would recommend to anyone planning a visit to Amsterdam!

Made our whole trip awesome!. What an absolute blast! It was so much fun, and you actually did learn something (well I did anyways). Great staff, service. There was no fault at all. Love how they provided little photo/video booths to send to friends and family (and ourselves). This definitely made our trip!

a first person beer production. i was visiting Amsterdam with friends.
among the different attraction we visited Heineken experience it was GREAT
only issue we faced was the long line (understandable since it was on 31st December).
we purchased the tickets from a ticket office.
staff is very friendly and the interaction and "rides" are unique.
would definitely recommend and visit again.

Fun & Interesting Attraction.. Me and my friend went to this during our time around Europe. It was great, some small educating rides along the tour with of course Heineken to drink! We all had a good laugh and it was worth the money, not to mention we came away with personalized Heineken bottles! :) I found this one of the many more interesting things in Amsterdam.

Great Museum. I have been to alot of breweries and had alot of brewery tours.This is easily the best, combining old school attractions and facts with new technology.There is definately a different reason to go to Amsterdam than just cookies and windows.
Awesome day out..... Great adventure. You even get to pretend you are 'the beer'. Very clever. Free drinks at the end of the tour. You can buy some fantastic gifts like etched glasses etc..

So much fun!. We visited the museum yesterday and weren't entirely sure what to expect, but it was brilliant! The actual museum part and the history of Heineken is fascinating, but the real draw is just how interactive and fun each room is! From things such as mixing your own grains to the hilarious 'make your own music video' to the beer simulator, the attraction had us in stitches throughout our time there. Totally worth the money!
Must see. If you like drinking beer you should definitely visit Heineken Experience. It is fun, informative and you get a free gift at the end of the day. They also serve you free beer
A must for beer fans!. I don't like beer/cider and even I really enjoyed the tour. Informative and interactive. You get a fair amount of free pints along the way as well ;)

Disneyland of beer. visited this week and was amazed by the venue and exhibits. The staff were bright, well informed and friendly while the interactive displays were amazing. My favourite was the Tulips from Amsterdam karaoke while the DJ game was also fun. Definitely a good afternoon

Interesting, entertaining and great value. Myself and my partner visited the Heineken experience yesterday. It cost €18 each. For that you get to experience the whole tour, you get 2 drinks, a wristband, a souvenir Heineken glass and photos from a photo booth. Would highly recommend this tour when in Amsterdam! It's unique and fun! The staff are all excellent and very helpful and friendly! A must see in my opinion!
Great fun tour. For anyone who likes beer or has ever heard of Heineken the tour is a fun interactive trip around the old brewery and you get a few free beers along the way!

Great Experience . We visited here a couple of years ago, but thought we'd visit again.
We weren't disappointed as everything must be constantly revamped and changed as it was like visiting for the first time. Yes ok, some of the demonstrations are similar but would definitely recommend even if you've been before.
A must see!

Awesome Experience. You get two drinks free for included in the entry fee! This plus a digital ride where you can learn the entire process of making beer..you being the husk :) The Museum is a fun way to travel into the vast empire of brewery in Heineken. Nice place do visit for the great Heineken experience!

Amazing Time............ What an experience, cost us €16, you get 2 free drinks and you actually learn something.The staff there are amazing, very polite and very knowledgeable. A special thanks to Karin, who made our trip very memorable and had an amazing time. Towards the end of the exhibition, you will find a bar where you can get your free drink. The bar had live music, great atmosphere and friendly staff to talk to and take pictures with.Will go back again.Thank you!!!

Worth a visit!. Visited at the end of January so it was quite quiet. for €17 each you get a wrist band with tokens on, 2 to exchange for beers and 1 for a free gift but you have to travel 15 mins to the brand store to claim the girt so idk what it is. Would not recommend going when your really high.

Something different . Visted here as a couple , easy to find on entry you are given a wristband with three discs on two for free drinks one for free glass , lots of different themes on how beer is made champions league section and tasting area staff located throughout venue explaining different things about beer and how it is made well worth a vist and good value for money can get a bit hot so suggest you hang your coat up .

Crowded. Pre-booked tickets at our hotel because of long queues.Wouldnt come back. A bit boring. So many people inside that we walked in lines all the time. The best experience was the free beer at the end. Try the extra cold Heineken. WONDERFUL

Loved !!!. It was really a great experience.We can note that was everithing thinked to create a good experience and undertand about the history of Heineken.In the end we can consume 2 beers and there is a lot of souvenirs.Even my wife that do not drink beer, enjoyed and tryed a little.Price is ok. 15 euros.

Expectations were low, but was pleasantly surprised!. We went to Dublin last year and did the Guinness Factory tour, i personally thought this was amazing, so when the wife said do you want to do the Heineken one i was skeptical that it would be anywhere near as good the Guinness Factory, oh how i was wrong. Fantastic tour, very interactive and gives you a real feel of whats behind the famous brand. Very much worth the visit, 18 euros and 3 free drinks included you cant go wrong.
A must in Amsterdam. Who doesn't like an interactive tour where you get to drink beer (repeatedly), chat with great people in the staff and get a free Heineken glass?

Happy Heine'. Friendly and enthusiastic staff.Loads of interactive bits, included 4D experience. 3 free beers and a free glass.If you enjoyed the Carlsberg factory in Copenhagen, you will like this place even more.

Nice activity. We went to the Heineken experience‬, nice activity, showing the process of making beer, many interactive station + you get two beers and a beer glass.
overall, fun time for about 1 - 2 hours. worth a visit.

Very enjoyable experience. Visited the Heineken Experience on 29th January 2015 and paid 16 Euros by pre-booking direct with the Heineken site. On arrival we were greeted and given wristbands which give you 2 drinks as well as a taster drink you get on your way round the visit.Overall good value for money and interesting as well as several interactive type games and two free photographs to keep.At the end you get tickets to go on the Heineken boat which you get across the road and you get a free boat ride into the centre, where they take you to collect your free gift from their brand shop.Our free gift was a small Heinekn glassOverall an enjoyable experience.

So much fun! Made us enjoy Heineken!. My husband is a huge beer fan, craft beers are his thing. So we were surprised at how much we loved this interactive attraction. I wouldn't say it's a museum or estate brewery, it is the old brewery turned into an attraction.We bought our tickets online, saved a penny or two and skipped the line up (which was long) and headed off. We started off with great little bracelets including 2 tokens for drinks and one for our free gift with purchase (which ended up being a cute Heineken glass, collected at the end of the attraction). The staff were great and helpful in pointing us in the right direction. It was a little busy to queue through but we felt it was worth the wait. There was some neat information and picture chances, the attractions also gave an overall look at the brewing process, the Heineken history and the Heineken family. We tasted the beer with the tasting master, smelt the hops used, ground some barley, tasted the wart used and went through an interactive gallery for different ads/events Heineken sponsors. At the end you could opt to have 2 free beer or use two tokens to learn how to pour expertly and drink 1 beer! I had fun doing the later. There was a bar at the end where we met some neat people, and drank lots of beer! Tip: definitely for the young at heart! We had lots to drink and did a lot of random interactive games! Be prepared to have fun, and booze! Tip: children can be included in the fun, they have pop for those non drinkers. Tip: another tour booked online that saved money, bring your smart phone with the code and you're set. Tip: eat before you go, hit this after lunch, not to avoid the crowds, but to prepare you for the drinking ahead! Also bikes are a great way to get around, but not when you are too drunk, drink responsibly.

Different. We have been on a few trips round breweries but never anything like this, it was really entertaining and you get one beer during the tour and then 2 more beer and a free gift at the end, I would highly recommend this tour

Its a Fun Experience. Hi,Heineken Experience is a real good Experience and we had lots of fun inside it.Although its their Brand promotional work but they made it fun and enjoyable experience who visit it.And the Beer Pour training, Certification, 3d theatre, Beer Drinking, Free Beer, Photos etc.,which makes us feel good and enjoyable like Disco.

Great for teenagers, not so much for adults. This attraction is quite clearly targetted at adolescents and young adults. Past the first parts of the tour - history of the brewery and brewing process - it's all flashy, tacky and borderline-arrogant self-promotion. Having to *wait* in line to get into the "Brew You" ride without being able to avoid it - the "skip this ride" lane is only visible once you're almost done waiting - is ridiculous and insulting considering the "interest" of the ride (which you only realize afterwards). The tasting lesson was a nice, refreshing pause in the middle of a long, boring succession of clubbing, video-gaming and social networking activities.It's not necessarily a bad attraction but it wasn't for me. Parents should leave their teens at the Heineken Experience while they themselves go to the similar attraction House of Bols, about the history and making of Genever, which is a lot more about the product rather than the brand.

Loved it. I may be a bit biased as I love Heineken, but I was very impressed with this whole experience.The interactive part was great.Havin been to the Guinness storehouse in Dublin I found this far better value as well as being fun.Well worth a visit
Great Experience. Long queue to get in but it's worth it. Great experience to understand the history of Heineken. You get to try it and also to learn how to drink it with style.

You Cant Miss This One!. You would get drunk by the end of the tour:) Yes you heard it right. The tour price covers for all the drinks that are served during and after the tour and you also get a signature Heineken glass as a souvenir. The tour is amazing and very informative. The video at the start is very well articulated and gets you curious for whats next. The brewery experience is good where you can try your hands on making some beer. The overall experience is very enjoyable and is a must do if you are in Amsterdam.

Would be good if there wasn't so many people. We went on a Saturday afternoon, I'm sure this is one of the tours busiest times but we did not expect to have to wait in line for about 40 minutes half way through the tour for a rather poor "novelty theme park ride". It would have gotten 4 stars if it wasn't for the queue. 4.5/10 wouldn't tour again.

A nice insight to beer production!. Easy to pass a couple of hours strolling around the Heineken experience, lots of information on all processes of beer making to bottle, A couple of beer samples around the tour are included as is a souvenir photograph and beer glass, I won't spoil the tour with a turn by turn narration but i would say if your in town and have a few spare hours it's worth visiting !!

Best brewery experience. The Heineken Experience truly lilves up to it`s name - it is definately an experience. it`s very interesting and has everything from history you can read from posters on the walls to high tech modern activities and not to forget the possibility to learn how to be a certified beer pourer ;) I will definately reccomend a visit to the Heineken Experience when visiting Amsterdam.
Awesome!. Very awesome, funny and interesting to visit the factory of this delicious beer! :) The movie and the guides are very helpful and funny. Stay alert: Prost!
Stupenda!!!. worth the visit and the money..besides the experience you will have... there's two or three glass of heineken drinks included and free souvenir glass.. with free canal cruise.. ;-)

Good fun though very commercial. If you are a fan of this beer, you will enjoy the experience. We spent 1.5hrs here. It is quite expensive - €18 on the day or less if you buy in advance. There is a brief history of the beer, then into the small brewing room, followed by how it feels to be brewed ride, which is rather random! You get to taste the beer & then it is all about the marketing of the beer & very commercial. You get a wristband with tokens for your free beer in the bar & a gift. Staff were polite & they have a cloakroom for jackets/bags.

Meh!. I have not been in Amsterdam as a tourist for decades. On a recent trip my daughter joined me and wanted to go to the Heineken Brewery. So we bought tickets ahead of time - so glad we did the crowd was large!The last time I was here it was still a functioning brewery and the tour was great with beer afterwards. Now as an experience it is one large advertisement with beer afterwards. If you have any interest in the actual brewing part - skip this and visit other breweries. If you can put up crowds and superficial brewery experience then this is the place. Don't forget the gift shop on your way out!

Hyped-Up. Maybe it's because I'm not the hugest fan of beer...but i found this tour to be very overrated. I could have gone to a local brewery in America and have been just as entertained. Sure, they let you taste the barley and smell the hopps. But I cannot say I took away anything more interesting than that. You got to see the storage units, bottle your own beer (for 6 euro), and then play a bunch of somewhat bizarre video games in huge rooms lit up by green lights. It was so busy that there was a line to go into every single room, followed by every single attraction or game you passed. At the end, they gave you either 2 free beers, or one free "ice cold beer". Glad I saw it, but I would only recommend it for the beer-(very) enthusiast in your life.

A great 'experience'. The former Heineken brewery is now home to the Heineken Experience. This is a tour of the site, and takes you on an informative journey about how beer is made, how Heineken started (aged only 22!) and what makes Heineken different (it’s the ‘A’ yeast strain!).There was even a ‘ride’, where we went through the brewing process. This is a very popular attraction, having had more than 500,000 visitors last year.

Excellent Experience. After touring the Rijksmuseum we noticed the Heineken Experience was close by so we decided to give it a go. I am not much of a beer drinker, but I thoroughly enjoyed the Experience. It was very educational, interactive and fun. They even give you a boat ride on the canals if you want. I would definitely recommend.

Way more then just beer. When my husband suggested we go to the Heineken Experience I have to say I was a little skeptical. But when we started the tour, I immediately loved it. The whole tour took a good amount of time to complete and it was not nearly long enough. The experience is one part history, one part interactive museum and even one part bar! You see the entire history of the Heineken brand and even get to be a part of their current advertising. We even got a special bottle of beer engraved especially for us. I loved it. Tip: learn a little bit about the brand before you go and you have the chance to win an extra beer or two in the tasting room!

A Fun Testament to the Power of Marketing. This is more than a brewery tour. This is, as the name correctly suggests, an experience.
