Not only will you learn some historical elements of Heineken beer, but the museum/attraction that has been created is a genius stroke of Public Relations. It's fun. It's just plain and simple fun! By the time you get your first beer, you really want to drink Heineken. By the time you end up at the sampling bar to drink more beer, you want to be associated with Heineken. The bar exits, appropriately, into the gift shop. And by gosh, you want to buy anything with Heineken's name! This is marketing at its best, but it works, and it's fun. Loosen up and enjoy the ride.

Beer enthusiasts and home brewers stay away. Big advertising campaign . Had to wait for hours to get in even even in January.and after the ticket was bought before hand. Beer is not made here anymore its more of a shrine to tell you how great heinken is. it was a long time ago. The hops are fake the grains are old. The audio tour was about 15 minutes. The old brewery room was nice but after that it's just one big advertising campaign.

Great fun!. This was a great choice of attraction for our holiday and I'm very happy i went. Great price for an afternoon of fun! You won't be disappointed! Very interactive and interesting. Would definitely recommend a visit!!
The Willy Wonka factory feeling . The greatest attraction in Amsterdam! Value for the money.It's almost like being in the Willy Wonka factory, without the Umpa Lumpas.

Heineken Experience. I don''t drink beer very often, but this is a place that you have to visit.It was very interactive and fun. I drink two beers because they presented it very nicely and I couldn't refuse it. :) These guys definitely know how to advertise their product and make it attractive to their costumers. I recommend Heineken Experience to anyone, even if you don't like beer.

Great experience, lots of fun. Young couple visiting, it was a great experience. Learned a lot, lots of fun activities, 2 free drinks and a free glass. Was able to pour my own beer which was great fun. Really friendly staff. Would definitely recommend the Heineken experience.

Well worth the money. Me and my boyfriend went on 27th of December- paid €14 for the whole day trip and it was excellent! The activities to do during the day were good, and the beer tasting session was unreal! Would definitely recommend
Must see. We went there friday, no waiting, no lines, just pay and go inside and drink beer. Ticket price is 18€, and it includes three (3) beers and free gift from giftshop. Nice place!

Overpriced. You basically pay 18 euro to see some Heineken ads, learn that beer is made of hops, barley and yeast, and drink 3 Heineken beers. There are PS3 consoles setup to play FIFA, which some people may enjoy. There are all the different Heineken bottles in a row. Not much else. I did not enjoy it and can't see how others would, but each to their own I guess.

Enjoyed!. It's a definite advertising sort of experience, but we did enjoy it,, my daughter very much so. You get to taste beer, she loved trying the pour your own and getting her certificate. A fun afternoon. You get a couple of drinks and a free glass at the end.You can also get the canal boat which takes you on a trip around a few places before you end up at the shop in town. You have to get a ticket in the entrance before you cross the road to get the boat.

"Underpricedd"!. A highlight of the trip! You are able to stroll around the factory, learning the history of Heineken and how it's made. There's a simulation machine, beer tasting, a chill out room and you learn how to pour the perfect pint! There's also an opportunity to bottle your own beer and write what you like on it. Also whilst walking through there's plenty of fun little things to do in between rooms! Highly recommend to anyone!

Fun few hours. We visited the Heineken experience one afternoon. We had purchased tickets in advance to avoid any line, but we were able to walk right through. Some of the exhibits are a bit so so, but there is enough to hold your attention for a couple hours and make the entrance price worth it.

Definitely check it out. I've been to the Heineken experience twice in the last 3 years or so, its really cool. It sounds like a beer museum might not be the most fascinating of attractions, however there's so many activities and interactions its really worth it! Plus the free beer makes up for your entrance fee. Make sure you pick up a flyer from a tourist information spot to get a discount.

Nice experience! . I do not like beer in general, I never drink it...and I have to recognize that I visited this attraction due to my husband who was curios about this experience. Well...in the end I didn't regret it. It was very interactive and fun. I even drink a little bit because they presented it very nicely and I couldn't refuse it. These guys definitely know how to advertise their product and make it attractive to their costumers. I recommend Heineken Experience to anyone, even if you don't like beer.

Really enjoyed it!. Me and my boyfriend visited the Heineken Experience on the 17th of January, although it was a Saturday it wasn't too busy. We thoroughly enjoyed it even though he wasn't drinking much alcohol. We bought the tickets online before we went which was easier and only cost us about 12£. We didn't use the canal as it wouldn't arrive for another 40 minutes so just got our glass there. Would recommend this to anyone

Excelllent facility with free beer. The tour was self-guided, but the Heineken Experience did an excellent job of presenting the information through text, pictures, video, and interactive experiences. At points along the tour, there were staff members to explain key parts of the brewing process, take photos, or to teach you how to drink beer properly. At the end everyone was allowed two free beers or an opportunity to become a certified pourer.

Not a beer drinker but enjoyed it!. My partner loves beer - like most guys, I myself aren't a huuuuuge fan... But the Heineken experience was good fun, and made me appreciate and understand how to drink beer "properly"! The amount of beers you get throughout the tour is well worth the entry fee, along with a cute little Heineken beer glass u get complimentary! :)

Enjoyable couple of hours. I don't like or drink lager so normally wouldn't have gone here but it was husbands choice as part of his birthday weekend. However I found it interesting. There were different types of display, interactive points and a 'simulator'. Plus there were opportunities along the tour for husband to drink lager and at the end you exchange your two tokens for Heineken or Pepsi. We were also given a glass and a bottle opener each.It was a good afternoon, out of the bad weather, with some interesting exhibitions.
interesting. good experience, interesting to see the history of heinken, at the end of the tour there is some fun stuff to do including pouring your own pint and a nightclub with a live DJ.

Don't waist your money. This was the worst part of my Euro trip. If you are from America be prepared to be disappointed. Europe is still running off of the fumes of its once glorious beer days. This tour was like walking into a 1980's amusement park filled with antiquated "virtual experiences" and cheesy commercials. If you've never visit a brewery it might be a learning experience but if you've been to even Sam Adams or Coors this tour pailes in comparison. Long story short I felt like I paid 35€ to watch old commercials and drink a half pint of beer.

A great trip. Really enjoyed it. . The experience takes you through the history and brewing of heineken, and is made an 'experience' by being somewhat interactive along the way. For your 16 Euros (normally 18, but the 16 offer can be found most places by booking in advance and avoiding the queues), three beers (and the opportunity to become a certified bar tender by pouring your own perfect beer in front of a crowd) and a souvenir glass. Its good fun interactive and pkenty of great pictures to be had. We loved it.

It's Worth Visiting. The Heineken experience takes about an hour to walk through all it has to offer. From some readings to photo booths, and from drinking beer to sipping barley water, I recommend it to all beer lovers.

Great fun. Me and my partner visited the Heineken museum last Thursday on a mini break to Amsterdam. This was our favourite attraction. There are various things to do in there and chances to win free beer.
Now I know much more about beer. You can get a new look on the beer. If you like it, you have to visit it. My wife started to like beer after that:)

I was leery, but it was great. My 18 year old daughter and I took a trip to Amsterdam. Of course she was thrilled to be of legal age to drink in Holland. So I decided we would try the Heinken Experience. She's not that into museums, but when I said, "beer museum" she said, "let's go." I didn't expect much, but surprisingly, we both enjoyed it. Just enough history. Just enough beer. Just enough enthusiastic museum staff. It was a great choice.

Fun experience for a beer lover. The experience takes you through the history and brewing of heineken, and is made an 'experience' by being somewhat interactive along the way. For your 16 Euros (normally 18, but the 16 offer can be found most places by booking in advance and avoiding the queues), you'll get a printed photo, two beers (and the opportunity to become a certified bar tender by pouring your own perfect beer in front of a crowd) and a souvenir glass. Its good fun if you like beer, not so much if you don't. Simple as that really!

Outstanding!. Very well done - thoughtful, interesting, not overly tiring and a few free beers!Very much liked being able to customise a bottle of beer for just 6 Euros; kids loved the 4D Heineken ride.

Great fun!. If you go to Amsterdam you have to try this. There are different offers everywhere so book your tickets where you think it is cheeper. Don't drink beer before as there you have the chance to enjoy soo much beer for free (we were 4 adults and we had around 4 glasses each!!! ) There are competitions inside and you could win more free beer, also you could learn how to be a bartender and they could give you more beer and a diploma. The last free gift we had was a beer cup/glass that we managed to bring at home in our hand luggage.

Highlight of our trip!. We bought our tickets in advance from one of the tour outlets on the main street in Amsterdam & I would recommend doing that. Tickets were 16euros and with that you get entry, a souvenir glass, two glasses of heineken, a fun day out & a free boat trip back to the centre with snacks provided. There is also an option to buy drinks on board. It was our favourite thing about our trip, we learned a lot about the history and the making of the beer and were able to join in in a lot of hands on activities, such as pulling pints and interactive photos/videos and games. Couldnt rate it highly enough!

So much fun!. I wasn't sure what to expect from the Heineken Experience but it was definitely one of my favourite things I did in Amsterdam.You get a brief history of the Heineken brand before learning how beer is brewed - the staff are really knowledgeable - but isn't made boring by being overly technical and is instead made really fun through the interactive experience.After this you get told how to drink your beer at a beer tasting - which is really fun.The only downside of the museum comes after this which seems to be four or five rooms used simply to advertise the Heineken brand - and really serves no other purpose at all.We also got 2 beers on our way out, as well as a glass and a free shuttle canal boat at the end - so I definitely felt we got our moneys worth!

Enjoyable tour...... Heineken tour in Amsterdam not too far of a walk from tram. Great staff. At 17 euros a little much but you get a printed picture in attraction frame, a nice Heineken mini glass and 2 beers.

Fun experience. At times the experience was a bit underwhelming, the wait times annoying, the individual components a little hokey, but overall we had an enjoyable time. We learned some new facts about beer making, took some fun fotos & appreciated the beers at the end of the tour. A pleasant way to spend an hour or so.
Fantastic. Was a little aprehensive as im not a beer person but I absolutly loved this trip. Highly reccommend. Wont spoil it but worth it. even get a free gift.

Good. The Heineken experience gives an overview about the history of Heineken and how the brewery evolved throughout the years and with different managing generations.Interesting for beer lovers! At the end you get a beer tasting and 2 drinks at the bar. There are also nice places to take pictures. At the end of the Heineken Experience, you get mini beer glasses as a souvenir. You can also buy other souvenirs from the souvenir shop.Since we bought our tickets from the "Tickets and Tours" office, we didn't have to wait in the queue.
A must do. Buy your tickets before hand to skip the long line. Definitely worth it since you get a beer during the tour and two at the end! Fun hands on exhibits and cool to see how the beer is made.

Exceeded expectations. We visited here having not read too much about the experience beforehand. We were really impressed with this tour. These sorts of tours can often be boring but the Heineken Experience hit the mark with balancing facts and fun. Quite a few interactive things to do and it was nice to finish off the experience with a few beers and walk away with a free photo of us at the brewery. Another added bonus was the complimentary canal cruise that took you to the Heineken brand store. There is no obligation to buy and it was great to hop on and experience the canals of Amsterdam for free.

Another Brewery. Being in Amsterdam we had to go to The Heineken Experience, it was a little pricey but hey you're here! We read the story and took pictures and headed upstairs and we got the low down on the grains and then we headed to the next room and we got to try the "wort" (to us it was worth the price of admission) we had never tried the wort and we've been in quite a few breweries big and micro breweries so that was a treat! They took our picture and then we watched a movie and moved around a little the kids liked that part they were laughing and enjoying it! More displays and then into the beer room. I've never had such fresh beer and it was quite good! The store was a good time as we bought the bottle of beer and had our name put on it! Typical but it was a good time! Take it at face value and you will enjoy yourself! We had fun.

Beery good experience. Likes: Tour is good, informative and fun. The beer is good and souvenirs you get are really good.Dislike: The whole heineken experience is a big sales pitch "the best way to drink heineken is by taking the biggest sips you can possibly take" Its not much of a dislike but if I take there advice I will need to buy beers more quickly and at €7 a pint I would rather not. Gift shop is over priced!

Cheers! I mean Proost!. I wasn't expecting much from a brewery but I learned a little and had a good time. I thought the tour was a little long but then with beer served in the middle and at the end of the tour, you'll most likely have a good time. I took my boyfriend and he was very happy and not all moaning about another boring museum.

Tourist Trap. Had somewhat of an expectation for it to be a guided tour, but very average/tourist trap at best. Most interesting parts for me were the Heineken history and the brew room, but the rest were "fun stations". Not worth 18€ at all.

Very average.. I found the tour to be extremely boring although not sure what I expected from a brewery really. Have heard fantastic things about it so was quite disappointed...felt I had wasted my money to be honest, even if I did get two half pints of Heineken included in that price........

Heineken heaven. Travelled here in late 2013. Definitely a worth whole trip while your in Amsterdam. You get taught exactly how the perfect Heineken pint should be poured and capped. If you like Heineken, then you will love the Heineken here. The best you will have ever tasted. Great tour too plenty to see and do. You also get a free boat trip down through Amsterdam afterwards. Must do

Fun afternoon. The Heineken experience is a bit pricey, but to be honest, most attractions in Amsterdam are. Hardly anything has an admission fee under 15 euros. You'll have to get used to it and try stuff. We went on a rainy day as we thought would be a nice indoors activity. You can learn how beer is made, take some great photos and try some beer of course. You also can interact with quite a few things, like putting out your own beer, videogames... in the end you'll have tried 2 to 3 glasses of beer included in the admission fee, and you also get given a free gift, which is a cute retro small beer tulip (you can buy more at the shop if you wanna make a set) . You also get a free canal boat ride so they tAke you to their other souveni4 shop near mas amstel im not mistaken. Well free boat ride is Great! There is a guide which will show you around (the cheapest boat ride we've seen was worth 8.50 starting at central station) and you can learn more bout Amsterdam. Tip, check your Windows when choosing your seat and try to get a clear window rather than the green ones, or at least make sure it opens. Ours was green and locked so no pictures, unfortunately, but most people on the ride had better luck than us. It was worthy in the anyway.

Great!!. If you like the beer and you like heineken, I recomend. I was there with my friend and was great, you can see the exposition, video 4D, taste the beer, play with games and in the end you can drink 2 beers and they gonna give you at the heineken shop a gift :)
If you like beer, you will love this tour. This is a self guided tour with two Heineken beers at the end. It was interesting to see the old brewery and machines. Definitely would go again.

Interesting use of technology. Yes its a tour around an old brewery but they have made full use of modern technology to try and make it a fun interesting way to throw a few historical facts at you. If you like beer, football and computerised things then this might be the tour for you. My husband and teenage sons seemed to enjoy it.

Good overview of the brewing process and beer tasting. I'm not a beer drinker, but my son and I went on this tour. The minimum drinking age is 16.i enjoyed seeing the football/soccer advertisements and promotional displays, and learned that a head on a beer is good. You get 2 glasses of beer to drink at the end of the tour, but you get another glass in the tasting room. Be sure that you are ready to leave the tour area, as you cannot go back in once you are in the gift shop. 2-3 hours The free gift was a bottle opener at their other location near the Ice Bar. We walked there and had to figure out the map and streets.

Absolute blast!!. This place is awesome!! It is a must do in Amsterdam. The tour is self guided and really informational. The best part is they have all these fun things like a DJ booth, make your own video and a bar at the end of the tour where you can hang out and drink. It was so much fun!

Fun!Fun!Fun!. This place is really cool. In the beginning you learn the history and making behind the beer. You see the process the beer goes through and ingredients to make it. You get to sample beer and play a game to win more. At the end there is a cool bar were they give you 2 free beers. There also is an option to get a ice cold big beer for both tickets. It's beer and way colder if you like ice cold beer. Had a blast and would suggest it.

Great fun. I thought this attraction was excellent! It is admittedly a little pricey to get in at eighteen euros but I definitely think it's worth it.At the beginning you learn a lot about the company; how it started and you get to see all the different marketing they've tried since they started out. After that you learn about the beer and how it's made, you get to tour the brewery and you can have a photo taken with the silos then have it printed out for free. There's a simulator/ride thing as well as tasting sessions, interactive videos, video games, photo booths, the chance to pull your own pint and loads of other things to do and see.You get to drink Heineken as you go along and you can use tokens that come with your ticket to get beer in a bar near the end of the tour. As it finishes you also get a free Heineken tour glass to take home with you!It was Thought this was a really fun afternoon out on a rainy day in Amsterdam. Really well done and entertaining as long as you try out/embrace everything there is to do there!

Fantastic fun with tons of freebies!. I went on this tour with my boyfriend and wasnt expecting to have as much fun as him - but wow it is ace! There are constant interactive activities - i.e green screen photos, make a music video, make a photo postcard, play a bartender game, ps4 stations, DJ booth - all of which are completely free! The staff were all friendly and funny.I really recommend using the free shuttle boat to the gift shop - you get a scenic 25min tour with an informative (and hilarious!!) captain. This was great fun.My boyfriend enjoyed all the fre beers too.Definetly recommend!!!

I would give it 0 stars if the system allowed me. Unless you have the IQ of a thimble, avoid the Heineken Experience. This is the very definition of tourist trap. Firstly, don't be fooled by the historical appearance of the building. This is not actually a brewery but a building that has been reformed to be a large advertising centre for Heineken. You may think you will learn and witness how beer is made, but the majority of the self guided tour is all advertising and propaganda for the brand. In fact, one of the ways they try and 'educate' you of the process is the Ride. You line up to enter a room, where you stand on a platform to be assaulted with sprays of water and heating lamps in an attempt to simulate the experience of 'becoming a beer,' which may have worked if I was not older than 4.In regards to the interactive activities, a lot of them were various forms of advertising or ways to extort further money from idiots. I'm not sure how this "attraction" got so many positive reviews, inclusive of the praise regarding the opportunity to pour your own beer. It's a simulated game, with poor electronic feedback and the computer froze on us during our attempt to interact with it. The free beers were small pints, and given how cheap Heineken is in Amsterdam it doesn't justify the cost or the time wasted. As for the free gift, well it would be too easy if they would allow you to pick up the gift on site. Instead they make you go to another location which wasn't local. Even at the beginning of the self-guided tour, they admit that Heineken's success was due to advertising. Don't be a fool and give these scam artists more money.

Very Strange Experience. I'm not really sure what to say about this place! I guess if you like beer and especially if you like Heineken then it is worth a visit. I went along with my boyfriend as he was interested in checking it out. The first few videos explaining a little of the history were very cheesy and kind of laughable. It was cool to see the old label designs and different bottles through the years. You could also see the old brewing equipment and heard a little about the ingredients and how the beer is made. Then we got to the simulation where they 'turn you into a Heineken' which was completely ridiculous. You stood on a stepped platform watching the process of beer on a screen while being jolted around and sprayed with with water like you were on a fairground ride. Next came the beer tasting where you got half a pint to taste free of charge. The rest of the tour was largely advertising...videos of commercials and different events that were sponsored by Heineken. In one of the bars you could trade one of the two drink chips you were given upon entry to pour your own beer and receive a certificate to say you did so. Then in the bar opposite you could also trade your chips in for one or two beers or Pepsi if you preferred. There are several interactive spots where you can pay to make t-shirts with your picture or star in a music video as well as being able to buy a personalised bottle. Overall it was an okay visit. Perhaps not worth the money if you are not a fan but a bit of fun if you are.

Best brewery experience I've ever been to!. After reading reviews about the lines, we went the week after New Years as soon as it opened and it was perfect! No lines and excellent history of Heineken. There is a Disney-type ride, a game room, visual effects, fun for all ages! Bring the kids! It's more than just learning about beer and drinking...it's a true experience! I can imagine it would be frustrating if it was crowded and there were lines, but since we did it early, it was amazing. Highly recommended! The experience gives you a true appreciation of Heineken, it's history, it's brewing process, and it's taste. The staff knows a LOT about Heineken and beer in general and it's very interesting to talk to them! When in Amsterdam, definitely do this tour!

Fun experience . We went here on our second day of the trip, it was really interesting to see the vintage bottles and labels. The brewery itself is huge and you go through different stages of the brewery process which was cool! There's a funny little ride they put you on so you experience the process of being a beer bottle too. We then got to do some beer tasting and on our way out got two free beers and a beer glass to take home. There's lots of little bits and bobs along the way. Probably wouldn't go again as I think it's a one off type of thing, but good experience and a nice little memory to have.

Good experience in brewery. Very nice place to visit in city center of Amsterdam, you can see history of beer brewery, the process and modern Heineken, 2 beers included which is very good. In my opinion the entrance fee is a bit expensive 18 euros.
very nice. very nice experience, even if I don't usually drink beer :) book tickets in advance, to skip the lines

Exceeded expectations!. Very good experience! you learn about Heineken history , owners, brewery. you get to taste the beer (several times! ). we spent there around 2 hours! i would recommend to book tickets in advance to avoid the queues and arrive before midday. there is a lot too see and do once inside. some of it is very interactive! you even get a gift at the end. in my opinion it is a must once in Amsterdam!
Heineken Experience. Well worth a visit, the old brewery is now a real Heineken Experience, well presented, beer tasting and a free souvenir glass too. Go early to avoid large queues as very popular.

Was good but probably not worth 18 Euros.. was ok ... would not be missing much if you did not go. The beer was good though ! When we went they let a few too many people in, there was a traffic jam the whole way round and it was very hot in there !! It was good to tick it off the list though!Staff were very friendly and helpful and they have a real passion for their brand which is nice to see!

More of a Novelty than anything else. The tour itself is very well done and very interactive but I left feeling rather unsatisfied and slightly ripped off.It was too crowded, the tickets are quite expensive and the gift of a tiny Heineken glass at the end was average and I was so disappointed that the "customize your own Heineken glass" feature was out of order, especially as this was half the reason I went. (I promised my dad I would get a glass customized for him)

Great fun!. You don't have to like beer to go here. The museum was very interactive and informative and fun! There is a history of the Heineken family, you can see the old stoves, taste the ingredients, and even experience what a bottle goes through in the factory. At the end you get three free beers each - and are taught how to drink it properly. Lots of fun and well worth it.

Long lines outside, longer lines inside. First, make sure you buy tickets online or through your hotel beforehand. This will allow you to skip to front of the crowd waiting outside. However, that's the last line we skipped. As soon as we got in there was a crowd in every room - so much so that we couldn't even read the signs on the walls or see the demonstrations. Then you get funneled up a broken escalator to get your first "experience." We stood in line for at least 35 minutes to stand in the hokey "brew you" experience where the floor shakes and they spray water in the room. After you get through this, the tour opens up a bit and you get your first mini beer and can walk through a more interactive area. However, the first half waiting around in crowded conditions sort of killed the mood for the rest of the experience. You do get a decent amount of beer for the ticket price, but the brewery needs to do a better job of controlling the number of people flowing into the facility. Finally, my walking was limited to a recent injury and there are a lot of stairs. The elevators are not marked well or located along the natural path of the exhibits. It took an hour and forty minutes to get through with the crowds, but I would skip it the next time.

Beer beer beer!!. So amazing! The best beer tour in Europe! Heineken is one of a kind and the brand is so much more than just the best beer in the world! Very interactive and informative. Lots to see and learn while visiting the museum or as its called The Experience ! Even if you dont drink beer there's something for everyone here! And if you do enjoy a pint of the Golden brew well this is paradise for you!

If you Love beer..! Then this is the place to Be. This is a fun place to visit in between your tours in Amsterdam and am sure you will not regret.It will give you a great idea about beer manufacturing in a lovely and friendly atmosphere.The place is well organized and the Last part is the best when you feel like you are waling directly into a lively bar with a lot of people enjoying the ice cold beer.Souvenir's is great and many choices is available.Highly advisable to buy the tickets from tourist offices across the city so you can skip the line.
Beer lovers. For beer lovers it is mandatory to visit there. You will be able to follow the beer process and understand why Heineken has the same taste everywhere around the globe.

Nice/Worth your time!. Especially if you have never done this type of activity. The tour is very animated and hands on and at the end you get free beer! The best part is that the brewery is right in the middle of the town and getting there is super easy. Will definitely recommend it.

Good experience - look for discount vouchers . I don't like beer, but I found the actual experience quite interesting. It's definitely worth booking in advance or finding discount vouchers as at full price €18 it is quite expensive.I would also recommend downloading the app and using it has an audio tour through the experience.The day we went was very busy, but the crowd generally kept moving although there was a 10-15 wait for some aspects of the experience.As part of the price you get 2 glasses of Heineken or 1 glass of extra cold, as well as a sampler on the way round. You also get a free gift (a glass), however I would definitely suggest getting the free Heineken boat instead of picking up your free gift after the experience.To get the Heineken boat you need to get a free ticket after the experience. Then you board the boat just outside the building. On board they serve bottles of Heineken and soft drinks for €2.50 each and if you buy 4 you get a free snack pack.The trip last around 20 minutes and includes a mini tour of the canals you pass through. Then a short walk from where you dock is a Heineken brand shop with more merchandise and games to win a discount.

amazing!!. Amazing amazing experience, the best beer I've tasted in the world. so fresh and so good.. have introduced this place to a couple of friends who were in ams after me and they loved it.make sure you stay for the 15 min boat ride which is included in the price. i would also recommend drafting a beer (2 tokens worth) instead of spending it on another 2 pints cos the experience was really good. personalising your own Heineken was also another good souvenir.
Loved it. Really Loved this. Interactive, fun, great wifi, lovely beer, friendly staff who could speak english, free canal boat ride, worth the money! Wohoooo Heineken <3

Was better then I thought, I would recommend a visit if you have not experienced anything like this before.... My partner and I attended Amsterdam for a long weekend for his birthday. We booked this in advance of going.The staff where lovely and polite and helped us as we didn't know what we were doing or where to collect our tickets from.The whole tour was very interactive from start to finish and very much kept me on my toes and not just made me have a great experience but I also learnt a lot too. You could also take photos of the trip to keep as keep sakes and also get to pour some of your own drinks :-)Well worth a visit!

Worth visiting - book in advance. I really enjoyed our trip to the Heineken experience even though I don’t usually drink beer! We booked tickets in advance and then got there for about 4pm as we didn’t want to drink lager too early on in the day! The experience takes about an hour and a half and is thoroughly enjoyable. It was all very well organised and informative and you even get to try Heineken at certain points. You’re also given a free Heineken glasses at the end of the experience and you’re given 2 half pint tokens as well. There is an option to have pepsi for non-beer drinkers. I would recommend booking in advance though to avoid queuing and the disappointment of not being able to get in if it's full to capacity (which happened to a friend a few weeks before I went). It's also slightly cheaper if you book in advance.Overall I would definitely recommend as I thought it was a good thing to do for the price (€18 or €16 if you book in advance online).

Over-rated. We were staying close to the Heineken Experience so thought it might be quite interesting. But were disappointed.The experience is quite slick but lacks an in-depth look at the brewing process, probably because of Health and Safety rules. Nowhere near as interesting as visiting the Guiness Brewery in Dublin.Expensive for what it is - however if you do go, the experience ends with a canal trip which for us was the most enjoyable part.

Fun Place!. Heineken was fun. Tons of interactive activities, but it was a lot of sizzle and lacking substance. I am truly impressed with Heineken and the marketing strategy, however I feel they do this to cover up the average beer. Overall, we enjoyed the visit and the staff was very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful!

Worth the wait. A great way to spend a couple of hours. We queued for 2 hours only to be told that the place was full to capacity. We left disappointed and returned PM on a Sunday to see no queue. We're so glad we did, history, visual spectacular and a bee at the end. Take your Rijks Museum tickets for a free gift.

"Proost!". What an amazing experience! We were smiling throughout the entire tour. The entire walk through the brewery has an interactive model which meant that we became personally involved in learning about the history and development of Heineken. You do not have to be a beer drinker to enjoy the experience - but with at least three free beers and a free Heinken branded gift, gearing up for some beer drinking is recommended. Some of the experiences along the way included a presentation on how to drink Heineken correctly, how to pour a beer from tap and a "brew you" ride. Remember to bring some extra cash. One side note: the free Heineken gift must be collected from the brand store a few blocks away.

jolly good bier. It was new year when we visited so queues were long. We bought fast track ticket from ticket shop so worth doing this. Still took long time to get round as there were lots of visitors there and we had to queue for 40mins for a virtual ride that's included in the price. In saying this the staff were very talkative and helped pass the time. The ride was actually quite funny. Price includes a free drink which was much welcomed at the end as it was quite hot inside. Interactive games and night club setting appeals to the younger visitors. Good gift shop reasonably priced. Not really suitable for restricted mobility people

So much better than expected. Having been to many UK attractions such as Madam Tussauds and the London Dungeons, I expected the Heineken Experience to leave a similar bad taste in my mouth, and I expected to come out feeling a little bit robbed. How wrong I was. We have been in Amsterdam for New Year's Eve and booked the Heineken Experience for my husband's birthday whilst we were here. It was absolutely fantastic. Very interactive and interesting. I honestly don't understand the negative reviews here. You get 3 free beers and a free gift, there is a 'beer brewing ride' (you really do feel a little like what it might be like to be a bottle of beer!!!) and you can also learn to pull your own pint 'the Heineken way'. There are so many interactive stops along the tour, including photo stops where you can email yourself your pictures for free. It took 2 hours to go round the whole tour and it was worth every penny.

smiling e. most probably it is one of the best indoor place that you can see in Amsterdam! It is a bit like a museum explaining history of beer and how it is processed, a bit like a show and a bit like a bar! Experience is exactly the right word to describe it! You will have several fresh beers included in your ticket. And do not forget to attend free boat tour in the end! buying online ticket is highly recommended, you can skip the possibly long line, pay 2 euro less. Also you do not need to specify your entry date and time for the online ticket.

a good place to goto. I have been to this place loads of times and it changes a little bit everytime the staff are nice and friendly plus you get 3 free drinks include in the price of the ticket I would buy the ticket from a ticket office not the Heineken brewery as other places off discount. there is wifi in the area and you can take loads of pics plus there is a gift shop.

Great experience. We visited on New Years Day. The wait to purchase tickets was about 30 minutes, there was no wait if you purchased tickets online. We purchased tickets as we waited, changed lines, walked right in and saved 2 euros on each ticket on the process. The experience was interesting and there were so many things to learn and do. The tasting was great and so were the different entertainment aspects. Particularly enjoyed personalizing your own bottle. This would be fun with a group. The tastings alone are worth th cost of entry.Well worth the time and the cost.

Visited for the 2nd time with my college age children. Buy tickets on line in advance to avoid the wait in line. I visited on December 30,2014 at around 1:00pm. We did not have a long wait for the tickets but it was crowded with many visitors as this was over the holiday weekend. However once in side, the crowd is kept moving through the various displays and interactive features of the tour. There is a beer tasting at the end and of tour and of course the logo gift shop. A lot has changed since I last visited in 1978!
Better than expected. I was prepared for this to be a big Heineken ad, and to some extent it is but it is engaging, fun and informative. We and our kids enjoyed it equally.
Brilliant. That's an amazing "museum" :) Absolutely perfect place to get new infos about beer & making process."Cinema", tools, pics etc. ... and BEER :)

Worth the money , we enjoyed it. Visited as a beer fan and was sceptical at the €16 euro online cost BUT a very interesting tour with 'Ride' and 3 Beers and a free gift was more than worth it.Would definitely recommend it.Great Value for money.

If you have time and love beer, you should go. Definitely buy your tickets before you get there to avoid the long lines. The place was packed when we got there. We felt The Heineken Experience we had was rushed and different to the reviews we've read. It was still fun but could've been a lot better. The cruise was boring as we didn't have a guide to explain anything to us.
Beer! . Great tour and good value for money! Have done a few tours of breweries in Australia and nothing comes close to this.

Enjoyable, interactive short event. Overall a good experience. There's many things you can try out yourself and Heineken really gives you an experience. If you want to learn about beer or expect a great beer tasting then you will not be satisfied. In this tour, it's all about the well known Heineken and a little bit of history and the key to worldwide success, which is marketing.

Nice history and a great beer. That is something you can't skip on your plans when you visit Amsterdam for the first time. Besides the great beer, the Heineken family business has an interesting history. Take two hours of your travel to visit it and have fun.

Worst experience ever . The queues were so long, it took us 2 1/2 hours to get through this brewery.It wasn't possible to talk to the people because they were way to stressed...If u want to have a real Heineken experience, buy yourself a few bottles, go to the dam and sit there wit a few friends.Much better(and cheaper) than this tourist nap..

Loved it!. If you like beer, especially Heineken, this is great! You take the tour of how it's made and the history behind the family. I feel that it's reasonably priced for the experience. At the end of the tour you always get beer! There is also a boat tour at the end, it is included. The only thing about the boat tour is that it takes you to one side of Amsterdam but it doesn't take you back. However, you take canals and get a totally different view of the city. There is a tour guide that tells you a lot of really cool things! I highly recommend this. Some advice, go around lunch time, have a beer and then go eat a burger. It's the best!

Good for beer.. We booked online which I highly recommend to avoid the huge lines. The best thing about the tour was the 15 minute talk an employee provided about the making of the beer, and the free tasting and two free beers at the end. Otherwise it was rather pushy, we still had to line up during the 'tour' to move into the next few rooms and there was a whole lot of advertising in your face throughout. The bar was a bit to 2000s nightclub vibe for my liking.

Neat thing to do on a cold of wet day. With a winters day in Amsterdam we decided to visit the Heineken Experience. It tells the story of brewing Heineken beer. The tour includes the history, lots of how beer is made, tastings, tour of the old factory, lots of audio/video content plus a neat 'ride' as you follow the beer being made from start to finish. The tour ends with tastings. The experience lasted a couple of hours. Buy your tickets in advance to save time queuing 16 euro pp. we purchased ours at Tours and Ttickets.

Not what I Expected. For us, the Heineken Experience was a bit of a let down. We thought we would be able to tour the brewery and see how beer was actually made. While this is covered, it is mainly by video demonstration. The real experience is a marketing one where most of the exhibit is geared toward gimmicky marketing type exhibits. Nice beer at the end though, which is the best part of this tour by far.

A lowlight of my trip to Amsterdam.. Firstly I must point out that everybody else in my party of six very much enjoyed this attraction. I enjoyed the first half which was fairly informative using innovative demonstrations as well as talks by staff members. It is possible that I hated everything after the tasting as I don't like lager and had to wait forever when everybody else was enjoying their free Heinekens. This was mainly because of the confined space and unbelievably loud music spun by the DJ. There were also too many people in the interactive section after the tasting which made that section an unpleasant experience as well.

Good if you're into Heineken!. I'm not a big fan of Heineken so I was bored after a few mins but my partner liked it. There's also quite a good bit of Heineken given at the end which was nice. Was quicker than I'd expected it to be but I wasn't complaining as I was fed up after a while. Best bit was the " become a beer" its a simulation ride which was a bit of a laugh. They said we get free glasses at the end and then it transpired you have to walk 15 minutes to some other place to get them, that was a bit annoying, as if you'd be bothered doing that for a free glass! Worth it if you like Heineken, otherwise don't bother.

Well worth the money. Spent a good 2-3 hours at the Heineken Experience which IMO is definitely worth the entrance fee. You also get two pints of beer at the end of the tour and also get to try your hand at pouring a pint. If you do well you get a certificate. You also get a souvenir glass when you exit. There is also an option to use their free canal boat which takes you to and fro their other shop. Book online to save 2 euros on your ticket.

Awesome. We went there when it first opened in the morning. The tour is very interactive allowing you to smell and taste all of the steps in making the beer. At the end you get to enjoy 2 glasses of beer.

I love Heineken. I might be a little biased cause I have been drinking Heineken ever since I could remember. I loved reading about the history and were it all began, plus learning about exactly what makes it taste the same no matter where you are. The interactive part was lots of fun and every staff member seemed to crack jokes with our group which I enjoyed. A friend tipped us up about a little trick once your in the bar area at the end, so we ended up having a little more than 2 beers each :), let me know if you can work it out

Worth it.. We gave this a go whilst in Amsterdam for a short break after reading reviews.It's worth a visit but would recommend getting there early and pre-purchasing your tickets. We pre-purchased our online and walked straight past the huge line straight in. It's quite interactive and you'll learn the history of the beer and founders as you'd expect.Of course the beers and free gift are the best part though.

Good fun & great beer!. Visited here with my fiancé on a day trip to Amsterdam, we both really enjoyed the experience and felt it was good value for money. €18 included several beers and a free gift. The souvenir shop was also very reasonably priced and the staff were very friendly!

bad online ticket system. I ordered 4 tickets for Heineken Experience and paid by a credit card.They sent me pdf which does not seem to work at all. I can see it but if I try to save or print outthe barcode does not appear. And the ticket mentiones "Be arare! Tickets need to be printed! When you can not see the barcode please update your PDF REader or print the tickets from a different computer" I tried both Mac and Windows 8 computer but nothing worked. The fact they mention these comment suggests this happens often. I wrote to them to send me tickets I paid for in another way by email but so far no reply. This is just a lousy service of Heineken Experience. I'm now so upset I do not even feel like visiting the brewery any more. Maybe it does not worth visiting anyway.

One big marketing ploy. This was a so-so tour. It seemed more like a big marketing campaign to me. Two free beers come with the tour and there are many interactive parts. I wouldn't go back again, far too many other things to do in Amsterdam. Overall, not a bad tour, just nothing to write home about.

I love Beer!. One of the first things I did when I touched down in Amsterdam (and one of the main things I was looking forward to) was the Heineken Experience. I've been drinking Heineken for a long time and for many years, it was my favorite beer (I prefer more Belgium Ales now...) so it was a must that when I visited Amsterdam I stop here! The staff is great, the facility is awesome, you get to tour it and learn a few unique things about Heineken beer. They have a couple of interactive games you can do while there (like make a music video) and you'll get an opportunity to drink a couple free beers! If you like beer in general, you have to stop here when visiting Amsterdam!

superb tour in amsterdam!. it was lovely! for beer lovers, this is a must-to-see if you happen to be in amsterdam. a great occasion to revise the practice of brewing, to see how heineken it's made, and also to get 2 samples of this lovely drink

Simply wonderful. We decided to take the Heineken Experience all of sudden and trust me it was an amazing experience. EUR 16 for online booking and had a three regular glasses of beer inside or one regular and one ice cold heineken + gift (a small heineken glass). An amazing tour explaining how Heineken beer is produced, a number of interactive things and a lounge to click yourself for Heineken commercials. Truly worth it.

Fab!!. We visited the Heineken Experience in December as part of a weekend trip away. It was fab! It was really interesting and there is lots to do in there. For the price it is well worth it, you get three drinks and also a free gift at the end. Some of the things inside you are not expecting at all but it's all a lot of fun! All of the staff are awesome, they all found time to talk to us and help us out. A definite must visit if you're in the area!!

It is not only about beer. Heineken guys did to beer as Apple did it to phone. They made perfect experience even if you do not like beer. You will learn how company was established how beer is made learn how to taste it and then you can drink 2 glasses and enjoy in nice heineken commercials. When you take your clothes it is not over take a boat trip to other part of city and enjoy in guide enthusiasm.
Excellent and fun!!!!. Very instructional and amazing experience. We liked the visit and the possibility to have our bottle of Heineken with our name on it!!!

Surprisingly fun and interactive. I'm not a beer person. There are 2 (and a half) free beers with each ticket, but my boyfriend and I gave away 2 beers, so that goes to show how much of a beer person we both were. However, this was a surprisingly fun and in a strange way, educational, experience for us. There was the standard history of Heineken, but they also had staff explaining to us exactly how beer was made. There was a mini 4D simulator ride thingy, which was super cool. And then before you took your first small glass of beer, the staff explained to us certain cool things about beer I never knew. There were also under non-beer-but-Heineken-related interactive stuff like taking your own MVs, pictures, etc etc. Commercialised stuff, but fun. Most of the people there were young adults, probably just there for the free beer, but if you have time to spare, this could be one cool place to visit in Amsterdam. We bought the tickets at 16 Euros each from the tourist office (it's apparently 18 Euros at the main venue). Bought some bottled beers with my friends' names for souvenirs, and all in all, it was quite fun.

So so. If you have an interest in learning about how beer is made and how the brand grew this could be worth it. But if not, it is just one of those things that is thrown in with the bus tour. As a marketing strategy I think it is brilliant in order to build up the brand image but there are better things to do in Amsterdam than to spend an hour in a beer factory.

Heineken experience!. Very interesting and educational place to visit! Lots of interactive displays for kids to participate in! My suggestion is to buy your tickets for the Heineken experience, and if your time slot is 3 hours or so before you can get in, visit the market around the corner (i think it was called Albert Kuip) to pass some time!

Worth a visit . If you like beer and want a light- hearted museum break away from the art gallery this is a good choice. You can easily spend an hour or so and is very interactive. You also get complementary beer!

Great experience.. My partner and I had an excellent experience and enjoyed finding out in a fun and interactive way how Heineken is made. Well worth the money, receiving entry, souvenir glass and three glasses of beer. Although I am not a beer drinker myself it was interesting learning about the beer and I was able to get a soft drink with my free drinks.

Disappointed. I thought this would be more of a factory tour and it's not- it's more of a carnival/interactive adult area- almost like a Dave & Busters. The target audience, and the majority of the people on the tour, are in their early 20s. Some stuff was informative, but the interactive stuff was pretty boring. You do get 2 glasses of Heineken at the end, but overall, I think 18€ could be spent better elsewhere in Amsterdam.

Unexpected boat tour!. The price was too high, but as soon as the attraction started and went on we saw it was already worth it! Interesting to know more about the Heineken beer but also very good cause you have the rght to drink three beers and after a 30min boat tour throw the canals of Amsterdam. I loved it.

Good- But beware of the gift shop!. Its entertaining enough but at 18euro I thought it was expensive for a tour and 2- 1/2pints of beer.Also beware the gift shop!.....I dropped 50euro ($65) on a hooded sweat shirt only to find out that its 2 sizes smaller than what the tag says. - Yes every other shirt I bought of the same size in Amsterdam fit just fine; leave it to the most expensive shirt purchased to not fit!

Quite an Experience. My wife and I had taken the Heineken tour 45 years ago and liked it, so we decided to take it this time we were in Amsterdam. First of all, let me say that it's changed enormously in the last 45 years and mostly for the better. There are many rooms with interactive features and educational experiences. There's even a room with seemingly endless videos that are exciting, interesting, and well done. One even had Daniel Craig in it! Of course, there are the obligatory "free" glasses of beer and the exit through the gift shop. Tickets for the Amsterdam Experience were 25% off with our iAmsterdam passes.

A fun way to see the history of its beer. This was a great tour and very interactive. We went with my daughters who are adults, and it was lovely. Truly a fun time for any family. You'll drink at least three glasses of beer if you want...so enjoy the taste and experience the fun. We did!
Excellent. Great value, interesting, lots to interact with and see. Great friendly staff. Finished off with free beer and souvenir glass. Amsterdam can be expensive but this offers good value.

Just. Do. It.. Beer-lover or not, one must recognize the impact of this brewery on the world...The "experience" gives its visitors an inside look at the process that leads to the production of one of the world's best-known beers. The staff is very friendly and enhances the experience a great deal. The building itself--the old brewery, in essence--has been updated to make it user-friendly and easily accessible.All in all, a very "fun" experience that is well worth the euros...
Fun. Worth a visit, better than other brewery's I have been too. Book tickets online beforehand to save a little bit of money. Great to sample a freshly pulled beer.
Amazing. For 17 euros, you got the entrance to the experience which was really good, 3 drinks and a Heineken glass. Really good fun, you must go there!

The highlight of my entire trip. In my opinion, this museum is a "Must Do" when you are in Amsterdam. Informative, fun and there is a segment where to get to win free beer (Answer as many questions as possible!!).Valuable tip: Buy the tickets from the canal cruise booth nearby. You will save a few Euros.

Not a Tour...a true Experience. I live in Boston, and am very familiar with Sam Adams and Harpoon Tours. I have also done the tours for some other big American name beers. By far, the BEST EXPERIENCE you will have at a Brewery/Beer Tour. The Heineken Experience is exactly that. From the simplest things like History to getting a Certificate as a Master Pourer (you will get to pour your own beer), this relatively affordable attraction is well worth it. Remember, at the end, you can catch a ride (or walk) to the nearby hustling bustling district, where the Gift Shop it. There you show your pass to get your free Heiniken Glass. Well worth it!

Beer for free. Well. Of couse free was included in the ticket but still nice to be offered to taste different kinds of beer after the excursion. Do not miss the interactive movie room. Also a tip to buy tickets in advqnce in internet where they mightbe cheaper and no queue at the entrance. Well done.

Getting brewed and bottled!. Long queues in front of the Heineken building could not keep me out. Once inside the fun starts. Follow the tour at your own pace. Take lots of photo's, get brewed and shipped on the virtual tour. The tour takes you on a journey from the hops to the customer. Sip the freshly brewed beer and find out what the correct way is to consume beer. See the horses and beer wagons at stables. Ask for the full tour when booking at the entrance and experience the best burgers on the roof to be had. End up back at the beginning of the tour in the shop where you can get some TShirts and other memorobilia. A must do if you are a beer drinker.
Great fun!. The tour was fun! Although it wasn't an actual brewery is was great to see how everything was made, lots of interactive activities and the staff are great! It is good value for money!

Not like an english tour. The Heineken Experience is nothing like a tour around a british brewery. for one thing there is no brewing done on site. It is much more of an informative experience with great use of interactive electronic/computer equipment displays
Quality. Was a bit on the fence about trying this but it was by far one of the best attractions in Dam, good value for money Including a free boat trip and plenty of beer! Proost!

Cheesy, but Fun. We spend the day in Amsterdam last May. We drove up from Dusseldorf and, by the time we arrived and parked in Amsterdam, I desperately needed a restroom. The Heineken Brewery was right down the street. So, that's how we ended up there. Parts of it were rather cheesy (like they're trying to turn a historic brewery into Disneyland), but it was fun overall.... and they had a bathroom.

Beery beery OK!. It's fun place to go, more about Heineken than beer. You get couple of free beers as part of the ticket. Worth spending an hour or so. I am no beer connoisseur, but I liked the beer. Was nice to see the old brewery equipment.

Beeeeeeeeer!. Our visit started off a little rough as the queue up the stairs was long and hot. But then things got great. There is an interactive ride/film where you travel through the beer making process. They then teach you how to drink a Heineken properly followed by a giant room where their humorous advertising is playing on giant screens. It's a great place to take a break. Next up was various rooms with interactive games and displays. Some didn't work and/or we couldn't figure them out. The tour finishes with two beers. It was very enjoyable.
awesome. very cool and fun.a lot of interesting things, from history to beer making and beer tasting. you can make a bottle with your name on it which is nice.

Hic hic hurray Heineken!. There is so much more to a beer than what is there in the glass! And it is best understood by visiting the Heineken Museum and experiencing it. Though slightly costly entry fee, it is well worth the experience, especially the lavish number of beers bundled into the package:-) The history of the company, the process of brewery, the brand, the happy 'e' of Heineken and a 4d film are all part of the experience. The tour ends with tall glasses of the beer, and one is left truly overwhelmed by the experience. Must see in Amsterdam!

Best part of the trip!. Would absolutely recommend this to anyone visiting amsterdam- relatively cheap to visit and a number of drinks included as well as a free glass (can't complain!). There were a number of interactive things to do and overall it was a really enjoyable visit. Would probably peg this as the best part of our trip away!

An interesting place but a bit expensive. I attended an event at this museum a long time ago and so wanted to bring my wife to the place to experience it. The "museum" itself is the old Heineken brewery and the experience is well laid out to show you the history of Heineken. To be fair, there are a lot of little bits of reading on the walls about various aspects but people seem to congregate around the video presentations and then it's not that easy to read the panels when the place is busy.You go through the stables and old copper stills which was interesting and there is the "Brew you" 4d ride where you experience the brewing process from inside and that was very different.The final part of the tour is into a whole area where they're trying to get you to "digitally engage" with the brand. You can send virtual postcards to people and play FIFA games on Playstations but it didn't really appeal to me. We did learn how to pour the perfect pint and try it for yourself if you wanted - that was interesting. You also get to keep the pint and get a certificate.Overall it was an interesting diversion but I'm not totally convinced it's worth the money so look out for discount vouchers/etc to make it cheaper!

SO SO TOUR BUT BAD BEER. The tour was so so , the place is well organized, but the draught beer they pour there...it .is really disappointing! The foam head is not creamy, too much carbonic gas bubbles...a terrible draught! I went to Urquel tour in Pilsn, the beer is much better and the guide much more knowleadgeable....i have the impression that the Urquell tour is really about the beer, while the heineken tour is more about the marketing, brand, ambiance.....the beer is not really the focus of this tour.
A must. Love the way they presented the history. Very modern way and fun experience. They will teach you how to pour beer by tap. Which was interesting. Gift shop was bit expensive.

Touristy but still great fun!. Your read a lot of reviews on here saying that the experience was touristy and one big advertisement for Heineken! Well SURPRISE what did you expect!!! It is very touristy but great fun!I love beers of all sorts and been on various brewery tours to main and non-mainstream brewers and still really enjoyed the Heineken experience.Its big, brash and touristy but thats half the fun of it! You do get to learn about the history of Heineken and how the beer is brewed but the rest is very interactive and fun. Plenty of photo opportunities and places where for 6 euros you can personalise your own beer and and others where for free you can e-mail interactive pictures of yourself!Go there with an open mind your enjoy it i promise, all topped off with a few beers at the end!

Disappointing Experience. The Heineken experience started off well, with interesting information about the history of the brand.
Unfortunately the majority of the experience was a lot of advertising not so subtly being forced upon you.
Realistically you are just paying 18€ for two pints of beer! The boat trip was nice (although they are just taking you to their shop!)

Very Touristy. Skip this one if you are more than just a casual tourist who knows nothing about beer. The whole thing was very commercialized and the tour guides were not knowledgeable at all about the finer details of the brewing process. I have been to several breweries and this is my least favorite tour by far. By the way, they don't even brew beer at this facility anymore.
Not something special. It was a good experience especially for the beer lovers and also it's funny but not something special . It's also very crowded.

Good fun, the kids may have liked it better than the adults!. We had fun afternoon as family on this tour. The interactive displays kept the kids entertained from making there own email postcards, recording a new dj mix to becoming the ingredients in the beer making process and felling the 4D effects.The ticket also cover free transport on the Heineken canal boat, this boat runs every hour and provides a chance to view the canal homes.We would all come back again!
Don't lose your money!!. Definetly a loosing of time and money!Don't waste ur own!Don't need to pay 18 euros for 2 pints!Not even interesting or funny..stay away!

A fun experience for any beer enthusiast (and even those who aren't).. The Heineken experience is like a palace for beer lovers. The newly renovated "experience" is just that.... an experience. This is not your grandfathers "brewery tour". This is an extremely well done showplace of lights, sounds, smells, holograms, and special effects. This brewery was opened in 1867 and ran operations until the late 1980's's when a new brewery was built and opened outside of Amsterdam. This location opened in 1991 as a museum. Then in 2008, it opened what is now known as the Heineken Experience. You will start out on the main floor and make your way up... up... up and then work your way back down. The tour begins with a history lesson and you get to see the chambers that once held the hops for the infamous Pilsner style Dutch beer. Next, a hologram actor will begin to tell you the tale of Heineken. Walk up some curly stairs and you will see awards, medals, advertisements, glassware and the original deed and charter to the brewery. Then, you will get a nice 10 minute hands on lesson in how beer is made. You will also get to see the original vats and equipment in the brewing room (Hint: taste the wort that the brewer has available; this is beer before it is fermented). After this you will get to see the Clydesdale horses and carriages which still deliver Heineken in some parts of the city. Then, it is off to a short but fun "beer ride" where you are the bottle. Then a tasting and then off to exhibits on the Heineken Brand! Some may find this to be shameless branding... but, it is so well done that you won't know the difference. Next you will have your tasting of 2 pints of Heineken in the snazzy bar. You will get a bracelet with 3 tokens attached at the entry point; Two for 2 pints and One for 1 souvenir at their gift shop. I took the Heineken boat afterward (for free) to their store location to get my free mini-pint glass. The tour itself was very informative and well done. All in all this was a great tour and I highly recommend this if you find yourself in Amsterdam (this is located in the southern part of the city center/canal ring). It may pair well with a trip to Vondelpark afterwards for a picnic.

Good fun!. I have been to Heineken Experience 5 years ago with friend, and here I was again with my husband. Most of the things are the same, but maybe because it is Christmas season, the whole place looks more festive.The ticket is 18€ each and you get two free drinks (3 actually if you count the tasting session after the Ride presentation). You also get a token for a free gift (which you can claim at the entrance, ours is small branded glass). They now also have a free canal ride to their bigger brand store.There are multiple chances you can send yourself a souvenir picture. You can also place PS3 Football.

Heaps of fun. The story of the beer and brewing is interesting but the Heineken people have gone all out to make this an exciting experience. The entire place was fun, not to mention the included product and glass to take with you.The story of the company is told in many ways from the traditional museum approach to a well made animated film. There are also lots of fun things to do based on the same theme (interactive puzzle based on 007, play station, internet messages to friends).All in all a great time.

Its ok but you have to. It wasn't an unbelievable experience but I think that this is something everybody should do if you visit amsterdam. The most amazing thing was the create your own heineken bottle. That was really unique.
even as a tourist in my own city it was fantastic. Very nice entertainment and fresh beer and afterward a nice canal cruise.We liked it very much, and other friend will going too nw

Good Fun for All Types, Even the Non Henekin Drinkers. This was one I would recommend for people - you have a bit of a laugh as well as being educated in the art of henekin making. You get a free gift of a small glass & also 2 free drinks while inside. Tour takes about 1 / 2 hours - we enjoyed it.

Fun attraction. Yes, the beer is not actually brewed here but for the average person this is a fun experience and you get to sample some Heineken too! We really enjoyed it and if you don't have too high of expectations regarding "seeing an actual brewery in process", I guarantee you will enjoy the experience too. Staff was also great and extremely friendly throughout the exhibit which was nice to see!

A very good attraction. This is an interesting attraction which shows the process of brewing of this famous beer , the beer is not actually brewed on site ! I can only compare it to the 'Guinness Store House ' in Dublin and on balance this is the better of the two ! Much more 'interactive ' ! It's not a bad place to Spend a couple of hours !

Definitely worth the trip. This tour is worth it in the free beer and small glass you get for participating. At the end you can have your glass customized for something like 3 Euro. It makes for a really sentimental gift or trinket for yourself. The tour itself is interesting and nicely put together. I have done many brewery tours and I was not disappointed.

if you like this beer. If you like Heineken Beer, but you will not have much to see but a closed brewery, more like their own museum, you will not find any brewing being done and it is a bit over priced what you you will actually experience the only good thing I found was that it includes 2 small beers and a souvenir store to get some personalized gifts. I guess as any mayor brand this place is trying to capitalize on their brand and set this up for you to take a nice walk through their history but there is not much else to learn, the self photo and video booths are complicated to use and be sure to put your info correctly (which I did) because neither of us in the group got either the video or the photos or the video we took, that were available for free.
Interesting experience!. it was an amazing experience with entertainment and interactive stations, and fresh beer of course! great for a half day visit.

Tourist trap. As much as I like Heineken, this place was a big disappointment. I did learn some of the history of this fine brewery but the rest of the rooms at the attraction were over the top and somewhat irrelevant. I would have preferred seeing the actual brewery in operation. Thank god you get two free beers when you leave to dull the pain.

Four stars but only because of the canal cruise!. This attraction is usually 18 euros but you can get it cheaper (16 euros) at other outlets. We went on a quiet Wednesday afternoon and didn't have problems with queues or staff as others have had. The first part talks about the family-owned company and then you walk through a smelly large room with lots of empty vats, see the horses from afar and get to the simulator where you pretend to be a bottle of beer! After that you get to taste the Heineken! There are a lot of interactive activities and a bar / club area (very noisy) where you can get two more free drinks and then its into the shop.Included in the price are three smallish drinks, a free gift but best of all a canal cruise of around 25 minutes to Heineken's store in the City Centre. We travelled at 6pm so it was dark and got some excellent night-time photos of the City! In the store you play a game to get discount off any purchases as well as collecting your free gift.Overall though we did enjoy the Experience but make sure you go on the canal cruise to get your money's worth!

It's a great experience. This is a must to do when you visit Amsterdam. It is great value for money and the interactive stations are well worth a go. The bar and 2 free beers (included) in the ticket price go down a treat. I would highly recommend this attraction.

Waste of time and money. We paid 18 euros for one ticket fot nothing. We did not see anything interesting inside. We even could not drink our beers because of long lines. Find yourself something else to do.
Had a blast. Defiantly recommend going here, specially if you love your beer! Teaching you how to drink a beer 'properly' to fun & games, too a free gift and canal cruise. Had a blast!

Waste of money. The beginning of the tour was great. But then you hit the interactive part and it's a nightmare. At the end we were suppose to get two beers but the taps weren't working. The floor was soaked with beer and the place was packed. I never had to pay to tour a company before and its a scam! We left for fear of a fire not knowing how to get out. This is not a guided tour, your on your own!

An amazing trip through Heineken. Its a fresh museum with not only text on the walls but fun things to do. I would recommend this to everyone, except for families with children since you are going to taste the beer

Great Value Tourist Attraction. From start to finish this was a great experience. The staff are very pleasant and really enhance the visit. Included in the price are two beers a free gift and a canal boat trip. Make sure you visit as you will not be disappointed.

Beer!. Heineken have created a wonderful experience in their old Amsterdam brewery. Self guided, you wander around the life of their beer from start to finish and you get to sample some on the way round too. Its the usual mix of brewing equipment, beer displays and Heineken materials, well laid out and easy to navigate. You even get to see the old stables and cart horses, but thankfully for the horses, you view from behind glass.
Well worth a visit. We visited on a Monday, which was a good day to visit as the weekend queue was very long. We enjoyed the visit very much, particularly the complimentary beer!
Corporate. Didn't get past the foyer once I'd seen the cost just to tour a brewery. Better to try small, local breweries which are likely to be cheaper; unless you are a huge Heineken fan

I'd have given it 5 stars but I don't like lager!. Excellent way to spend a couple of hours in Amsterdam, thoroughly enjoyable and very informative and some free beer thrown in. If you do like lager then it's a must! 18 Euro per person to get in but there are discount vouchers everywhere which take it down to 16 Euro per person.

I love heineken. The tour explain the brewing process from start to finish and offer a few different tastings and the opportunity to watch historical Heineken adverts. The tour is in english and it s been very interesting but I am a huge Heineken beer fan
Great experience. Very well organised. Really enjoyed the experience. A must visit place in Amsterdam..!! Dont you really wanna know what you drink?? Bonus: Free drinks and souviniers too.. :P

Well done.... A great tour that allows you to experience their own homemade attractions (you're a hop being added to the brewing process), make a personalized beer bottle and have a few beers in their bar while your at it. All the while learning about their brewing process. Not a huge time commitment and no line when we went. Good fun!

For a cold or rainy day!. If it is too cold outside don't hesitate to visit the Heineken experience, it is a really nice and varied activity where you can learn, have fun, have a drink, relax. I am not a great beer drinker but I really appreciated this tour a mix of getting to know about the history, about the product and having fun with digital activities. If you are looking for something to do inside and of course you have already visited all the great museums in AMS then I would really go for this experience. Of course it could do without the shop at the end but it is part of the game isn't it!

If you love Heineken like i do, you'll love it too!!. The Heineken experience was a cool experience that you must not miss. you can see the process of beer brewing, you can have beers there included in the price of the ticket but you can also be part of some contests to win more free beers, like i did :)). you can also take a degree on beer pouring if you're good at it. there is so much to do there, so you lose the sense of time.

I didnt think it could be that much fun. When my boyfriend suggested we should go to the heineken experience, i werent sure if it was for me, since im not really into beer, but i agreed to give it a chance, as a once in a lifetime thing.... Surprisingly, it was a fun experience not only for him!The tour is fun, very interactive, nice people who want to teach about beer and are very patient, and ofcourse the movie and beer tasting!Most important tip-if you decide to go, buy the tickets at one of the many ticket offices around the city-youll save 2 euros and a long waiting line
A Must in Amsterdam!!!. Really, I know it seems like a very touristic thing to do but drinking beer is always a good idea. You can go as early as 11 am I think 6 Go!

Fun Experience!. This museum/ experience had a lot to offer. The museum part was interesting learning about the process of making beer and the family, but it wasn't long and didn't bore me. There are two places where you get beer and just get to lounge around (total of 3 beers included), so for the price it was worth it!

Brilliant. Loved thi place so much..would defo go back here! They show you how all their beer is made and you also get to make your own bottle and pour your own beer :) there is also xbox's and ps4's you can play inside here! Would recommend to anyone

Great place. It is a point to visit after a museum, the place is great, you will see the history of the beer and you can play with video and online games.. You can take a picture riding a Heineken bicycle!! And of course drink beer, the price is ok because you drink like 3 beers!! You heard music alive inside and then play a little with some games.

If you love beer. The Heineken Experience is extremely different from one may imagine it. It starts with a history of Heineken which includes different logos, bottles, etc. You then move on to learning how they brew their beer, see their historic horse stables, and even get brewed yourself. And obviously, you finally get to taste two glasses of fresh beer! Also, you can bottle your own beer with your name on it! There is a minimal charge, but it’s a worthwhile memorabilia. Quick tip-there is usually a long line to enter, but you can buy a ticket for a couple of € extra and get a faster entry! Also, most leading hotels have a discount coupon available!

An excellent brewery tour with a difference. Bought our tickets with the hop on bus so got a discount the tour is very informative and holds your interest .The interactive ride turning you into a bottle of beer is excellent and the beer tasting at the end rounds the trip off well.We got there early with no queues but as we left the queues were quite long.
