Well if you din't know how beer was brewed :)). Heineken has made sure that their old brewery continues to remain an important part of dutch history through this tour. But if you don't have time, give it a pass.
Just one day in Amsterdam. Very interesting place to visit. Plenty to do! You can't be bored for sure😁 got 2 drinks and small glass as a souvenir👍👍👍👍

Average at best. I liked the first part with the history and awards and also the actual replica of the brewery and the stables. It is worthwhile to go once but it is overpriced and overrated compared to other options in Amsterdam. I would not go back in a hurry. They had one person selling tickets for the longest time so it made for an unnecessary wait.

Worth a visit. 2nd time I have been on the Heineken Experience. We arrived about 11am on a weekday and we basically had our own individual tour. Changed since I went 2 years ago more features now and really good souvenirs. Reasonably priced and easy to get to via hop on boats or buses

Mediocre. At €18 for adults the experience is a little bit pricey for what you get. The staff were really great and so friendly but I just felt we were walking through mindlessly and there were no major stand feature . At the end you get two small glasses of Heineken or one large but the large wasn't even a pint. Worth a visit to kill an hour or two but there's cheaper and more interesting options around the city.
Great Experience. Loved this tour/museum! Lots of fun and very interesting... staff were chatty and informative throughout. Would definately recommend a visit whilst in Amsterdam.

Well worth a visit. Not being a beer drinker I was a little skeptical about taking the Heineken Experience trip but I have to say whether you're a beer drinker or not doesn't really matter!! I felt it falls into the "expensive to do" trips in Amsterdam if you're not a beer drinker but well worth a visit. Included in the €18 entrance fee are two small beers (or one pint) and a glass to take home. The journey as a bottle was great fun - you were transported onto the line (all done in a theatre) and take the journey from being brought into the factory to leaving the factory. Staff were extremely friendly, helpful and good fun.

Unexpected appearance of horses. During Heineken Experience, we experienced a lot of different emotions in 40 minutes. At the beginning, it seemed like an ordinary museum with the history of the beer. Then, we met the horses, which were named after the board members of Heineken. Afterwards, we became the beverages, like in Disneyland Paris' 3D Star Wars room. We took many pictures and had a lot of fun. We met the bartenders and watched a lot of Heineken commercials on our way to the store. It's for everyone at every age, but it would be better if we could come closer to the horses and listen to their story from a guide. Enjoy!
Nice experience. The experience is interesting, I learned how the beer is made.Heineken is a marketing example, to be studied.Nice boat ride afterwards.

Good fun for all. Went to Heineken experience on a Sunday evening and, despite the time of year, it was busy. Got discounted ticket rates through pre-booking (€16 rather than €18) and with the promise of 2 free beers and a free gift, we felt this represented value for money. The experience itself is split up into various sections: the history of the company, the brewing process, brand advertising and then the drinking. We had a lot of fun learning about the making of Heineken and, whilst the building itself is not a functioning brewery anymore, it is a very hands-on experience. The branding and advertising stuff wasn't to my taste, but I appreciate a lot of people found it fun for the photo ops. Would definitely advise people to do this tour if they have a reasonable amount of time in Amsterdam - it is probably the most inclusive brewery tour I know of.

Worth visiting. My husband loves Heineken so we were very excited we finally made it to Amsterdam to have Heineken here. The Heineken experience was pretty awesome. You got to see the beer making process, learn about the history of the company, and got to try the beer there. Staffs were all very helpful and fun. We had a great experience there!

Fun and Alcohol. What else do you need?. Learning about how Heineken is made is fun. In addition the "Experience" has many cool attractions and photo opportunities. Definitely worth your time.
The only downside to this attraction is the number of stairs...

Great visit with Attentive staff. Having visited this attraction it is one that I would happily do again when I revisit Amsterdam , I visited with my elderly Mom , The staff were great and arranged special access due to her disabilities , the facility is 100% disabled friendly .
Must for beer lovers. Must to do with utmost seriousness as during the beer tasting session your every right answer's to the question of the beautiful lady can earn you free beer servings each.

It is worth visiting. Here you can learn the history of Heineken, then you will find out how amazing Heineken is! It is no doubt a must-go place in Amsterdam, so don't hesitate to go when you in Amsterdam, it is really worth your visit!

Only for halfwits. Nice copper vats and nice horses (carefully screened off from the public like zoo exhibits.) no real in depth information about anything anywhere, reams of Heineken adverts that is all, and a beer. Great if you have the brain capacity of Homer Simpson, an insult to anyone else's intelligence. Avoid.
Awsome . Have never seen such an beer experience. Here you feel how proud they are on their products. It's not always clean but definitely a must go ...
Free beer . A1 loved it not what I expected but good fun left I little wobbly enjoyed the experience and the beer followed it up with a hard rock lunch
Nice touch of Heineken. If you want to see and hear more about your favorite beer you have to see this... Worth visiting,18 euro is entrance ticket

Hop To It. An interesting insight into the history of one of the world's most successful brands. With tastings, history lessons and interactive exhibits it's a very good day out. A few bits and bobs weren't working which was a shame, but overall a very impressive attraction.

Good fun, even for oldies. We were one of only two middle aged couples there, but we really enjoyed it. Slightly educational, slightly historical and lots of Heineken to drink. The staff take care to make it fun and include everyone. The canal trip at the end, was a great touch, we did it after dark, and it was a treat to see all the bridges lit up. Our only complaint was that the ball from the table football were missing......

Excellent attraction. Never been to a similar attraction, very interesting and kind of 'lively'. If you are bored with museums you should definitely try this out. You will not be able to drink all the beer being offered though... Give it a couple of hours.

Well done!. At first, I thought it was a tourist trap. But I was positively surprised by the Heineken Experience. Even if you don’t like beer, you should visit. They have a nice approach to the history of the brand, production, traditions and the presence of the Heineken brand around the world. And you can have a few free drinks and a free gift! I recommend the free boat tour over the canals.

Better than I thought!. I'm not a huge beer fan, and had fairly low expectations for the experience initially. But it was actually surprisingly fun! You get a tour of the factory, a "ride," there are horses, beer tastings, a exhibit on Heineken sustainability, and a really entertaining staff on hand to answer your questions. At the end there is a cool bar/beer tasting which was a cool experience. If you are looking for something else to do in Amsterdam I would say go for it!If you book online in advance I think you get 2 euros off the price (so 16 euros instead of 18 that you would purchase at the door). I believe you can also use one of the Holland day passes for free/discounted entry as well.

good day out. was a good little day out on the saturday, we went for a weekend away and fancied doing something abit touristy. Advice is to get your tickets beforehand though because the que was ridiculous to get in but we didnt realise for a good 15 minutes we could just walk up! was a good experience, however we felt that they tried to cram in as many bodies as possible.. was a laugh and the free beer was a bonus

Underwhelming. Its fun. lots of interaction to justify the 'experience' tag - but many not working, or not enough of each one to cope with the number of people. Quite a lot on football (playstation 3 fifa, whats that got to do with Heineken?) Free drinks (equiv to a pint) in the basement - with a DJ and no seats. My kind of thing when I was 20, not so much anymore. Its certainly overpriced. Yet out of 4 trips to amsterdam I've been 4 times. Each time I go I leave more underwhelmed than the last time. (and if I come back to amsterdam I'll probably go again, and leave moaning that I must be getting old).

Very entertaining and lots of fun!. I was very excited about this tour as I love Heineken and it is probably my favorite beer! The tour was a lot of fun and they do a good job at keeping you entertained so that you don't get bored! Lots of history, games, dancing, beer drinking and much more. When you enter you get a bracelet for two free beers and a free gift. There is a lot more to the tour but I won't ruin the surprise. Free coat check in the entrance was a plus, also there is a boat canal tour right in front of the building, during your tour you will be offered free entrance to a canal tour in a Heineken boat! So if you want to do a canal tour by boat, wait till your Heineken tour and you could go for free!

So cheap for it's value. We paid 18 euros for the ticket. We were with the four of us and we got a nice snack box with cheese, pickles, mustard and dried sausages. +1The museum was also nice, you have the historic and the modern part. There is also a 4d experience. +1It's great for football fans because there is an area dedicated to it. Heinken being the head sponsor of the Champions league we didn't expect anything else. With the entrance came a rubber band including 3 tokens: 2 for beer and one for a gift, which was a heineken glass. Goodies always +1 .You can also participate in the free Canal cruise with the heineken boat, which i highly recommend. In this you will get to see Amsterdam really close! +2After more or less two hours we had to hurry to our boat and we drank our ice cold 0,35l beers faster than we should haha. Then we got on our cruise. Just keep in mind that it's crowded most of the time. Overall the experience is TOTALLY WORTH IT.

Heineken Happiness. This expericence is well worth the money. Book in advance to save waiting as you can skip the queue. Staff are very friendly and helpful and there is alot to do during the organised walk through. There drinks at the end top this expericence off with a great atmosphere.

A bit goofy, but plenty of beer.. A survey of the history of Heineken beer and the beer making process. There is a "be the beer" segment straight out of Disney land . Staff is pleasant and well informed. Very generous servings of the beer that is part of admission ticket. You can also learn how to correctly pour beer. Limited audience for this place. I wouldn't bring children.

Well done experience. The experience uses technology in some very cool ways. You get two tastings and a gift with your admission. There is a special bar at the end where you can trade in both tastings for a bigger tasting that you get to pour yourself. Makes for a nice photo opportunity. Unfortunately it doesn't seem like beer is brewed here anymore so it's not a factory tour, but still worth the admission for any beer fans.

Its an "Experience". We were initially skeptical about going to this place as most of us weren't great beer fans. But this place is lot more than beer and its rightly titled "experience". We enjoyed ourselves a lot and got to know a lot of things about beer,Heineken history in a very very entertaining way. You can take tram 16 from Dam square and it will drop you right at the gate of the Heineken brewery.There are lot of multimedia interactive things during the experience that will keep you busy even if you aren't a great beer fan.Enough opportunities for photo-op.Keep at least 2 hours for this place
Lovers of Heineken, lend me your ears. If you like Heineken of just like beer in general this is a decent place to visit. My first brewery tour. Would do again

'Suprisingly Superb'. How can a brewery tour be so good - well it is when visiting the Heineken Experience in Amsterdam. A good value at 17 euros that gives you a free glass at the end of the tour, a canal boat ride and a couple of free beers. The 4D ride is amusing and informative so I'll not spoil it by saying any more. The staff really are enthusiastic and clearly enjoy working at the venue. The whole journey from entering to leaving the store in town after the boat ride is just really good fun.

True value for money and a great time!!!. This was by far the best thing to do in Amsterdam! Our experience cost 16euros(not 18) each as we purchased our tickets at one of the many main street ticket offices, this meant we skipped the lines at the door. The experience took roughly 2hours during which we were taken through a brief history of Heineken, the process of making the beer, a few tastings( 3 beers each or 3 pepsi's for kids), a 4D movie and an interactive experience. After this we paseds through the on-site shop to get to the exit where a man was standing off to the side discreetly handing out tickets for the free for the shuttle boat to the brand store(close to the city centre). The shuttle boat was brilliant with a detailed tour of the city( for free) and a chance to put our feet up after a few hours in the factory. On arrival at the brand store we collected our free gift(a collectors edition Heineken glass). Overall this experience was brilliant and cheap in comparison to what we both got out of it.

Beer in another dimension. The museum is really amazing. The staff is really awesome and enthusiastic. Each part in the museum has its own identity. The tour includes 4d projections, helping with the brew, learning how to be a professional pourer and receive a diploma for that, and sure drinking 2 to 3 beers ^^Highly recommandedCheers

Expect to spend more time than you think!. How much time can a beer tour take? Well, think again. The Heineken Experience is well worth the visit! It not only gives you the history of Heineken but also provides ample opportunity for you to be interactive in the experience. A fun experience with a few surprises you wouldn't think of! Beer tasting tips, and beer included at the end of the tour in bar - how can you beat that? Come away with unique personalized gifts for you or your friends. A great fun experience! I do recommend going in the morning so you finish before the tours show up. Enjoy! Cheers!

OK, but not special. If you like beer it's worth the trip, but the overall is a bit forced. There is one "ride" where you can pretend to be a batch of beer being bottled, but its very tame. The history of Heineken is presented in an amusing way, but it leaves much to be desired. If you're in the area, stop in but its not worth a detour.

Fun but a little expensive. My view of the Heineken Experience may be a little tainted but tours I have been on at smaller breweries. The tour was fun in parts and informative in others and I particularly enjoyed the part where your experience the brewing process from the ingredients point of view. On the negative side, it was very crowded, getting tickets involved some queues for us and I was not convince that I got real value for money.

Amazing!. The Heineken experience is a must stop on a visit to Amsterdam, not only you get some beer, you get also to learn part of the process of the making of heineken ; learn about the history of Heineken, get a beer tasting lesson and have an interactive experience of how the beer is made. The staff is also very friendly and are willing to assist and make the tour more enjoyable. Tip: try to buy the tickets before you get there or you might enjoy a little line to get in, specially on weekends.

Great Place for a beer lover... Even for others also. History of the popular beer, how it is made, achievements, their tradition...
The 3/4D movie on Heineken making is interesting..
Two beer comes complementary with your ticket, 2 from the demo... and I got 4 more for answering two questions.... :)
The beer tasted great... got a complementary beer glass too...

The most interactive museum in Amsterdam. This is a must for Amsterdam visit. You will learn for beer, make beer, drink beer, serve beer....be beer :), everything. You will even learn how to drink beer.

The place were it all started. This place been many years ago the mean factory were the Heineken Beer started. Today it's a Museum were they show you how the beer been made many years ago It's very nice to visit if you like beer or like history or you just want to know. And ofcourse you can taste beer here.

Better than expected. The Heineken Experience turned out to be better than expected! We didn't have high expectations going in, but in the end, we had a great time. They make it interactive and it doesn't go by too quickly (like some brewery tours). You also get beer along the way which made it even better!
Better than expected. A fun, and informative with out being boring story of Heineken. Staff make it fun for all, and free drink too. Best Heineken every had

Pretty good, but not worth the cash. Went to the Heineken Experience because it's a must do in Amsterdam. I don't regret going, but what you do get for €18 is perhaps not worthwhile. Although interesting, the tour is of course insanely commercial, and packed with people. The staff were very nice indeed, but I couldn't shake the feeling this was all an exercise to get us to gift shop rather than teach anything about beer. By all means go, but don't expect incredible things.

The Green Bottle Beer Experience. I was in Amsterdam for three day's and two nights and the Heineken Experience was one of the top 5 places my friend and I went to visit while we were there. Mind you we aren't even large beer drinkers, but this experience was still so much fun! The tickets are inexpensive and you receive two beers at the end of your visit! The tour is interactive and extremely visually appealing. Everyone who works there is extremely nice and very enjoyable to talk to. There are many tour packages that include the Heineken Experience so make sure to look out for good deals, because they are out there. None the less, make sure you check this place out before you leave Amsterdam!

One of my new Amsterdam favorites!. This place was fantastic and a must see if you are ever in Amsterdam, even if you are not a beer lover. There are so many things to learn about the Dutch culture and a little Dutch history on the tour. The artwork made out of the bright green Heineken bottles is simply breathtaking and a sight to see.

Business Traveller Woman Perspective. My expectation hearing its name was apparently settled to high. Some of equipment You can find in few cities where an in-house brewery is being combined with restaurant. On top few photos. Few films. And beer degustation .... but with symbolic amounts. In general very usual.

Good chillout. If you have some time left in Amsterdam you should visit Heineken Experience. You will learn some informations about Heineken itself, how the beer is made, learn how to drink a beer and you will taste one. Then you can go by boat to the brand shop which is good trip. We really liked it.
Fun & Interesting. This well worth a visit, very informative and fun. Worth getting free boat trip after too as you can take in sights & enjoy a cold beer.

So much to do here. Except for the tour that was very interesting, you will learn how to taste beer, how to pour good beer and how to drink it :). There are also several photos and videos you can take which are sent to your email for free! Also loads of games.
Good experience. It was a good experience to learn more about the beer industry, how the company established, it's growth, the production it's marketing and of course, free beer.

A good experience. We went here after spending the earlier part of the day pretending to be very cultured at the Van Gogh museum. We picked up some leaflets that gave us a bit of a discount so paid €17. We found this to be an interesting, fun and relaxed experience. Learning how to drink lager properly instead of like a girl was great. Getting a little bit drunk at the end was good, since not everyone in our group wanted all of theirs.As it was late and dark when we finished the tour, we asked if we could go on the little boat cruise the following day. We were told we could but needed to go back the following day. We did this and were able to take the 30 minute cruise to the brand shop. It took us to a part of Amsterdam we'd not yet been, so proved to be a good idea.Something we'd recommend to people but you need a good couple of hours.

Very average and busy. There is a reasonable amount of information at the start, when we got out of the firmentation rooms we ended up skipping the next big as the queue didn't move for over 20 mins. The rest was mainly related to the advertising and sponsorship of things. Not worth 16 euro

Interesting and lots of beer!. We visited this more so for my boyfriend than me but I did still enjoy it. Well worth a visit!There was lots of interesting facts and an interactive room too. You get beer whilst you're there, and at the end you receive a free gift. Included in the price is also a free canal trip at the end of the tour, so don't forget to pick up the tickets for that in the booth; saves you buying an expensive ticket for the exact same experience on another canal trip.

POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE. We were really looking forward to this...aware that the last entrance time was 5.30pm for the last tour, we arrived with 5 mins to spare, excited to take part. However, having stood for a few minutes waiting to be attended to at the ticket desk with no staff around, we went looking for someone to assist us, only to be told very firmly that the ticket office was closed and was cashed up !!We put forward our case to the manager that we were in fact standing waiting to be served before 5.30pm and therefore had every right to be allowed entry. Our discussion fell on deaf and very unhelpful ears, in fact he was totally disinterested and suggested we spend our money in the bar instead !....Where is the customer service ? To add insult to injury, we witnessed a group of businessmen gain entry behind us ????? Very disappointed and angry to be treated with such disregard.

Great fun!. Great experience. Much effort is put into place to ensure you have a great overall experience. There is a short tour , then a tasting where you receive a glass of beer. You are then able to bottle your own Heineken with a personalized message! There's great souvenirs to be bought. Heineken glasses with engravings are done in a few minutes. You also receive 2 free beers each and a free Heineken glass which has to be picked up from the Heineken brand store a few streets away.
Best beer in Amsterdam. Frendly Staff (Anne) and educational. Enjoyed the video simulator best. Lots to do that would suit all ages I think!
good place to visit. went on a college trip here for my travel and tourism classes, and it was a really enjoyable visit. They teach you a lot without it being boring
Brilliant!. We loved this!! Great value for money too! Very interesting and the simulator was very fun! Well worth a visit! We even got the free gift in the shop the next day!

Interesting Tour But Not a MUST Do.. I found this tour to be very informative and moved at a decent pace. You can set your own pace for much of the tour and can spend as much or as little time as you'd like. I really liked that about the Heineken Experience. There are also interactive exhibits at the end and a fun bar to sit and relax with friends. While I enjoyed the tour, I wouldn't consider it a MUST do while in Amsterdam. It's a fun tour but if you're crunched for time, you can skip it and not feel like you've missed out.

Had a blast! Lots of cool, interactive exhibits and beers included.. I had no idea what to expect of the Heineken Experience before I did it and I had a fantastic time. You learn about the history of Heineken and how it is brewed. There is a taster provided as well as two free drinks or you can pull your own beer and receive a certificate for it ( you receive a bracelet at the start of the experience and there are little clips on it. Two clips will get you a beer and the certificate or you can get two drinks). There are a bunch of interactive exhibits were you can be a dj, enjoy a football game, watch some Heineken ads, or play around with UV lights and cameras. It's €16 and you skip the line if you get your ticket from a ticket store in the city or €18 if you buy it there. You can also get a free Heineken glass as part of the experience at the brand store near Rembrandtsplein. It was a great experience and I spent well over 4 hours doing it but it all depends on how involved you get in the interactive exhibits.

A must do!!. This your is really worth doing. Excellent value for money and so much to see and do. You are able to walk around and see how the beer is made as well as the history or the making and company. Each person has 3 half pints included with the tour. (Two you get to pour yourself!) there are many interactive things to do along the way around the tour. Near the end you can make your own bottle with your name on it at a cost of €6. Each person receives a free Heineken glass. Also included in the tour is a boat trip along the canals where they tell you a bit about the history of the city. Really friendly knowledgable staff. We had a great time and would definitely recommend.

Fun brewery trip. Great way to spend two hours. What sets this aside from english brewery trips is the fun factor( you are not escorted round by some dull head brewer talking you through the fermentation process) With everything so expensive in Amsterdam 16 euro with a couple of beers at the end is good value. Ignore the bad reviews by numptys who moan otherwise you'd never go anywhereENJOY !!!

Really Fun Experience. Although it may be €18 ahead, this is a must do in Amsterdam. It's historically informative and they've really thought outside the box to keep us engaged in the experience. Video imaging and virtual moving tours along with an advertising chill out room, a whole floor dedicated to football and complementary glass of beer for beer tasting of course kept us wondering what was next. You can even personalise your own bottle for €6 each or get a glass engraved! €18 gets you your coat hung up if you wish, two pints of Heineken and a free gift and a most enjoyable couple of hours. We'll be back!

Heineken experience. This was a surprise ! By which I mean when 1st entering you see how beer is made the old way and brewed ! Then walking round the modern twists they put in to it ! We really enjoyed this well worth a try ! Watch out for tickets 16 euros pay 18 on the door ! This includes 1 1/2 pints at the end of tour

Great Value. I usually hate commercial tours, however this educational journey was a breathe of fresh air. The content of the tour, lessons learned, freebies, samples, team members, interactive social media technology, museum upkeep, memories for life. Great discovery.
Fun attraction. Enjoyed learning about how Heineken is created from barley to bottle. Complimentary glasses of Heineken at the end of tour!

Fun, Insightful And Free Beer!. After many recommendations from friends we visited the Heineken Experience during our weekend trip and was certainly not disappointed. We visited mid afternoon on a Sunday, it was a little busy, it might have been better to go earlier in the day. Tickets on the door are €18 each but we got them for €17 with a discount flyer that we picked up at various sight seeing stands around the city. The tour itself is self guided and has lots to get involved with. The free beer and the bar at the end are the very best bits! The whole experience was one of the highlights of our trips to Amsterdam. Definitely recommend.

Silly and Fun !!. Ah yeah this was great fun! you wouldnt do it a 2nd time though !!.. once is enough.....I cant remember the price... but once you get there you get your tickets and then off you go.. You get to ramble around the museum part... then your brought into the factory which was very interesting and you learn all about the history of Heineken.. the tour guide really knew his stuff.. you also get to have a "4D experience" which was very silly but fun .... it consists of a mini clip for you to watch on a projector and it tells you the story of how Heineken is made... "you then become the Heineken"...You will know what I mean if you do it - I dont want to spoil it !...Then at the end you get either a pint of Heineken or two glasses... I wouldnt have minded more alcohol but suppose im being greedy :-) one is enough !

Cheesy, touristy but fun!. Be sure to buy your tickets before from tourist booths scattered around the city to save a few euros on each ticket. There are various displays, videos, tastings and even a ride which tell you a lot about Heineken. A true family business! Yes it is touristy and a little cheesy, but that doesn't stop it being fun!

Not the cheapest, but a great way to spend an afternoon.. I haven't always been a beer drinker so I actually learned something. The entry includes a couple of half pints and there are a few other opportunities to have a drink or two. It was a fun day.
Excellent . Enjoyed seeing the history of Heineken. Staff are excellent and answer any questions you have about the brewing process. Lots of tech in the tour and a 4d ride.

Great fun!. I've been to several breweries, but this was by far the most fun and interactive. There was lots of info on the brewing process and the history of heineken, along with video & photo booths, a movie and even a ride! The staff were very friendly and helpful. I enjoyed every second of it.Definitely recommend.Book online for a discount.

Really good fun!. We went here during our trip as it was close to our hotel. We hadn't pre-planned it but ended up having a great time. Similar to the Guinness Factory in Dublin, you get to learn about the history of the brand and the Heineken family, the brewing process and then take part in lots of interactive features. You even learn how to pour the perfect (European) pint! Got some great pics from our time there, and had lots of fun! You even get a boat trip to receive your free gift at the end...
Great afternoon. Really good experience! A must do visiting Amsterdam. Staff were lovely and friendly and the gift shop was very well priced :)

Sensible Jolly Up !. We found this experience pretty good. Surprisingly we had no idea what to expect besides the obvious considering it was an alcohol based experience. Plesently surprised with the amount of history on display and the informative nature of the experience. Really happy with this tour and recommend it highly. It is very reasonable priced and the two free drinks topped it off nicely.

Good fun - worth going. This was good fun. We'd been to CadburyWorld in Birmingham, UK and this felt similar. Relentless promotion of the Heineken brand, but some enjoyable things to see and experience, and quite a lot of interactive things later in the tour. You get a couple of small beers at the end. If you're lucky, you won't get the extremely rude scowl and tutting we got from the bloke serving these given he misunderstood our 'order' (you get a choice between ordinary Heineken and the extra cold version).The other staff were good, but that bar guy needed something to chill himself, I felt.

Good lads visit but needs more beer. Went on a recent trip to my favourite European city and decided to visit the H experience, good fun, well laid out, a bit busy, needs more beer, therefore a bit expensive

This really is fun!!. If you ever have the luxury of going to Amsterdam then I can’t recommend this enough. It’s good fun and you get some cracking free gifts! We even purchased our own bottles with our names printed on to them for a keep sake. 5 stars from us! It’s brilliant to learn a little bit about the history behind your favorite Pint!! One for all the family I'm proud to say I can pull a better pint than my wife! Happy days
Fantastic fun !!. Went with a group of friends and had a blast , learn to pour the perfect beer and have fun in the photo booths !!!Brilliant afternoon !!

Interesting!. They make an experience out of thin air! Huge building where you can see not only how the beer is produced and what makes Heineken beer special, but also you ‘participate’ in the brewing of the beer ( rooms with interactive videos where beer foam is splashed onto you, shaking seats to simulate the transportation of the beer kegs and more). You can create a bottle with your name, send a video to your friends and play a lot of games with Heineken always at the very center!

A lot of fun. I was a bit worried about this place as I thought it would be overpriced and cheesy. However, I was very surprised as there is a lot of fun to be bad. I particularly enjoyed the beer simulation and the optional cruise you can go on. That and the 3 drinks actually made it very good value for money considering the price of beer in many places. I had an iamsterdam card giving me 25% off the full price so it is a good idea to look around as many places sell entry for a lot cheaper than the door.

Worth a visit. We got a barge tour to the Heineken brewery. The company offer this as part of the experience but we did it separately as we'd just been to Anne Franks house. €16 for a ticket which includes 2 drinks and a 'free' gift. The tour was good, included the history and explained the brewing methods.
Interaction design of attractions.... . Interaction with attractions here doesn't work very well. Old techniques I guess. Boring. Too much of an advertising trap.

Interesting few hours. I found this quite interesting even as I am not a huge beer enthusiast. They show how it's made, what goes into the branding and the marketting, and how they try to stand out from the other beer makers. Very interactive and lots to look at. Even on a very busy day they get you in quite quickly. Had a few delicious beers in there also
Maybe not worth the price. Worth particularly for interactive gaming and by the beer that help start the night. Maybe not worth the price (18 €).

One long ad for Heineken. Fine if your under 30 I think. It was Ok. Some would find the interactive section quite good fun - eg make your own video / personalised bottle etc etc. Just wasn't for me. Bar at the end where you get your free beer is a little cramped and tables could do with a more regular wipe. Maybe I'm getting too old for this kind of thing!

Interesting and fun... hic. Enjoyed being showed how lager is made and about the history , in a fun and clever way. Plenty to interact with and lager to drink as well.plus free boat ride, good value for money.

Different and great fun. The was different. Not just for blokes as some might think. It tells the story of Heineken in a fun way and there is plenty of entertainment. There is fun for all the family. Plenty to see and do. Activity based. Probably best to go around 10 or 11 am as it gets busy. It has a stiff entry fee but you do get 2 beers and a free gift. Thera are lots of photo opportunities for you to email and lots to do.

The Disneyland of Beer's Addicted!. The place is like disneyland for beer's addicted. There you learn all the beer process and history of the company. It's an interactive museum, so be prepared to play and drink!

A totally different experience. This is a must for all visitors to Amsterdam - it is a totally interactive experience, the bottle simulator was such fun! The staff were all friendly and spoke impeccable English. You don't even have to like beer, but it helps!

The most interactive museum ever. The heineken experience is a MUST VISIT if you go to Amsterdam. It's a few tram stops away from the central station, and there is just so much to see there. From the history of heineken, to the process. What makes it the best museum is that you get to participate in almost everything! From grinding barley, stirring barley, how to drink heineken right, to even "being the heineken in a bottle". 2 glasses of heineken is also given, plus a heineken souvenir. Honestly a very enjoyable experience. I would even visit again because it's so fun!

Good If Your the Right Age. This place was really informative, and very interactive, and very fun. The only issue is that if you are not of the drinking age, then all your doing is looking around, and there is not much interactive stuff for you to do. Other than this, an enjoyable place.

brilliant tour. I recently visited the museum in Amsterdam and it was a fantastic tour.It was very good value for money at 18 euros if you don't book in advance.If you book on line,then it only costs 15 euros and you will not have to queue up with the large queue outside but can be escorted to the other queue which is a lot faster .The tour is really good and the initial video has a surprise. Of course they had us sample some Heineken and a class in pulling a good pint.They had quiet a few interactive videos and photos which you should participate in.The day that i went,live music was playing and we all got to sample two glasses of Heineken and also got a free gift of a Heineken glass.i must say that it has been one of the best partially interactive tour i have ever been on.Enjoy

Wow..enjoyed it even as a non beer drinker!. This place is so unique and has the perfect blend of history and interactive activities that makes the entire experience memorable. One would expect the beer tasting as is common to any brewery visit, but the way they have been able to market the entire experience is remarkable. From being able to customise beer bottles, allow you to air on your own Heineken ads, experience how the beer gets made through a simulation...to viewing their ads from across the world. Keep aside at least a couple of hours to enjoy the place end to end. A must visit!!

Fabulous!. We really enjoyed our visit. We only went to pass some time in the afternoon but we thoroughly loved it. It isn't bad value as you get to sample the golden liquid (once with an official taster, and then a further two times at the bar!) and you come home with your very own limited edition free glass. It's interesting, it's fun and I'm so glad we went. I'd definitely recommend it.

Fun but aimed at a younger audience. Book before you go-discounts available at tickets shops in town and with I AMsterdam cardFun and some interesting background info (app is very interesting) in a striking building but the latter half is mostly video game type attractions and a V noisy bar to enjoy your free drinks Perhaps I was older than their target demographic (a number of stag events were in) but fun none the less; AND good beer!!!

Fun afternoon change from all the art. We visited here after lunch, having been to the Rijksmuseum. There are a lot of museums in Amsterdam, and most of them contain art. The Heineken Experience was the only museum we went to that included free beer! The tour lasts a good hour and is surprisingly varied and well organised. There are opportunities to see some of the major machines used to brew beer, a 'ride' through the brewing process, an opportunity to taste the barley and smell the hops, 3 free "half pints", a view of the horses still used in ceremonies today, an opportunity to pour your own drink, and a range of paid-for extras available (eg design your own bottle to take home). Recommended for all beer-lovers, even if, like me, you prefer real ale to lager.

Nice only if you have spare time .... A little too long experience (about an hour and a half) , a little too expensive (18 euros) . feels like an advertising for a beer . If you are a big fan of Heineken go for it ! you'll get a free cold beer at the end :-)

brilliant. this was a great experience...get to visit the brewery...there was a stimulation ride which turned you into a beer & see the journey...got 2 free drinks each in their bar as well as beer tasting & a free gift at the end which was a Heineken glass with Amsterdam on it...great afternoon
Well worth a visit . Nice couple of hours spent here.. 2 free pints each and a nice little glass. Came back to Rembrandt via the Heineken boat, took 1/2 hour down the canals with was lovely

Fun way to spend the afternoon! . My boyfriend and I went to learn about the beer brewing but loved the fun self paced tour that felt more like a party! Well worth the money to learn about the Heineken company and drink a few beers, which were included!

Interactive and Delicious. The Heineken Experience was a great way to start the Amsterdam adventure. This place gives you the history of the beer with an interactive tour that is fun. Learn about the founder and the family as well as the beer making process. Easy layout of the place allows you to move at your own pace. After the tour, enjoy a nice cold Heineken or two.

Expected alot more from one of my favorite beers. I had read other reviews and discovered that they were correct. It was more like a disney attraction than an intimate tour with a guide through something historic. We did it because we were in Amsterdam. I would'nt recommend it, I guess most will do it just to say they were there.

Great way to spend some time. My husband and I took the tour on an afternoon. It was a self guided tour so we could go at our own pace which was nice. Tour included a free gift for their 150 year anniversary. Would recommend to go once as an experience.

Great experience. The experience itself was fantastic, a real old to new with lots of information and stuff to see. All the staff were helpful and fun, with each staff member willing to answer any questions we had and showing us more than they needed too, lots of tastes and smells too! Would recommend to go see if your in amsterdam... Do it alongside the ice bar

Fun, Interactive, Informative, Intoxicating. The Heineken Experience was just that, an enjoyable, interactive experience that gave me a great insight into how the famous beer was made through every stage of its manufacture. It included 'rides', displays, a facility where your photo could be taken and immediately emailed to friends, demonstrations that you could try out, beer tasting and at the end two beers to enjoy in the bar area. A free gift was also on offer at the end (in my case a small Heineken beer glass.)Pros- it was fun and interactive- it was well set out- it included a free beer tasting- the entry ticket included two beers and a gift- there were great photo and video opportunities- a fast entry pass is provided with the Holland Pass- children were permitted, but only with an adult. They (obviously) can't have a drink.- kids will love it too because of the ride and interactive displaysCons- sometimes there would be hold ups as you moved from section to section- bar section gets crowded. It was not easy to find table space.- you might walk out a little inebriated. Not sure if that is a con.Well worth the visit.

Great experience and of course - beer!. This was surprisingly fun and my wife and I both really enjoyed it. They said it could take up to 90 minutes and it was close. It is not just about the beer it also about the Heineken brand and their marketing which is world famous. You do get to sample some beer half way through the tour and you get 2 glasses to drink at your leisure at the end of the tour. TIP: during the initial tasting the tour guide will ask you questions about beer – if you answer them correctly you get another tasting (I got one for answering hops). I didn’t learn too much about the beer making process as I am already a brewer, but the experience was outstanding. We saw the Heineken horses, a sporting venue where you could play games and my favorite was a theatre where you could watch uncut commercials from around the world at your own pace. This truly is an experience not just a brewery – massive gift shop at the end as well. I have been through the Guinness tour in Dublin and I think this is more interactive. Don’t miss it.

Extremely poor arrangent. Waiting lines from floor to floor and room to room could exceed 30 minutes whitout any seating options. So spending 40 minutes standing on the stairs is definitely an outstanding museum experience, but not the one I would recommend.

great value, better than guiness. you get a free gift and 3 free drinks plus it is very interactive with lots of fun things to do. It isn't a long tour as some can get a bit boring. The bar at the end has a great atmosphere.

Fun Experience!. I went the first time in January 2000 and repeated the trip this 2014 Spring. I must say the Heineken tour was better, but as with all things, it was updated, do not get me wrong, it was still very good now in 2014. Fun, colorful, interactive and so on! The gift shop at the end of the tour, I must say, improved greatly!!! Please allow yourself a good hour and a half to two hours for the tour. They have a fast-food restaurant at the top, which should be amazing, since the view is great from there! As a tip I would say: buy your tickets online, they are cheaper. Enjoy!

I don't even like Beer. This place is great and if you are in the 20 -40 something range you could spend hours upon hours here with lots of adult digital games. There is a room where you actually go thru the beer making process which is quite fun & informative. And after my tasting, I like Heinekin.

A good combination of learning and enjoying hollands famous brewery.. It is not the actual brewery where Heineken is produced, but it displays its appearance in a way where history and high technology is combined. You will get 3 small glasses of Heineken bear and one empty glass as a souvenir. Get your tickets online and save 2 EUR!

150th anniversary. I liked all of it. The history of the brewery, the family ownership, the shop! Oh, and the beer and gift included in the entry fee. Set yourself aside a couple of hours to see/do all of it.

Worth a visit. We visited the attraction whilst on a short break to Amsterdam. They said it takes 1-1.5 hours to get round which is about right, depending on if you stop to claim your free beers for which I guess you might be there a bit longer. Bit disappointed with a couple of things; the shire horses are in the yard but you are blocked by a glass wall which is a shame as I think being able to pet them would be nice, I guess there may be safety issues?! And also as part of the admission fee you are entitled to a souvenir glass...you have to go what felt like halfway across the city to claim it in another gift store! It wasn't easy to find with the map supplied and we almost gave up trying to find it.

Great experience. If you are a beer drinker this is a must visit.Learned things about beer I didn't know before.Highlights was the history and off course the beer tasting.Good to see the horses and the fact there is always a horse called "Freddie".

Terrific fun!!. I am not even a beer drinker, but wanted to try this in honor of my father, who loved Heineken! The tour was really fun and informative and the beer was delicious!!Really enjoyed the fun of learning how to pour beer properly, and learning the history of beer making.
Great Fun. Nice history of the Heineken Family and their brewing process. Of course, the best part was tasting the product at the end. Give it a go.

Fun experience. I'm not the world's biggest beer fan but the experience was really good!! and actually insightful. I do love to gain new knowledge on different things and that exactly what I was provided with through the museum. The staff were very friendly and there was hardly any queues. I would say it’s great for all ages (18+) and I would definitely recommend.

Highly recommended stop for your trip. I would highly recommend making a stop at the Heineken Museum. They share the history of the beer, you can see how it is made and they learn you to pour your beer properly. You definitely get value for money if you go on this trip. Afterwards you can also go on the Heineken boat (which is for free if you have a pass to the museum) and travel through the canals while they share some of Amsterdam's history with you. Set at least 4-5 hours apart for the whole experience.

Beers, beers, beers. My husband and I visited during our 4 day stay in Amsterdam. I was reluctant as I don't really like museum-type attractions or Heineken but I actually thought this was cool. There is a bit if line shuffling, as other reviewers have suggested, but such is the case with most popular attractions of this type. It really is an "experience". We bought our tickets at the Tours & Tickets office which gave us a worthwhile discount and a free key ring each. The experience includes videos, a cute little simulation ride and a look at the beer making equipment as well as a guided tasting. Afterwards you can enjoy 2 free beers - or learn to pour your own, in a funky little pub setting. You may also redeem a token on your wristband for a free gift - a Heineken souvenir glass - at the brand store which is a 15 minute walk from the brewery or you can take the complimentary boat shuttle. Allow 2 hours for the experience.

Very good. A must do in Amsterdam, we had a great time, could only be better if this were an active brewery but you still get the feel for how things were back in time. A really varied tour, lots for everything, plus the canal cruise at the end is good to, throw in a couple of included beers and it starts looking like pretty good value all up. Would recommend, even to non beer drinkers.

Perfect for youngsters. If you are a youngsters (18 or more) or have a young soul it is a cool place to go. If not, you will think it is a noisy place and nothing more. The beer fermentation process is poorly explanated, but for most of the visitors this is not what matters. Enjoy the experience of tasting the beer, watching the ads from many parts of the world, visiting the souvenir shop, listening some loud musics and having a fun time with friends.
Fun for beer lovers. Fun for the beer lovers with interactive experience, tasting, beer pouring class and more. Also a walk through the history of the Heineken beer.

A Great Interactive Day Out. A must go for everyone. Very interactive from start to finish and well worth the entrance fee approx. 18 Euros. You couldn't imagine so many different activities relating to brewing beer.Surprisingly entertaining.

Barrels, Beer,and Boats -A dam fine fun experience. we have been to a few attractions similar to this one, but this is by far the best , this is barrels of fun , you buy your ticket and get an armband which entitles you to a few free beers , you start the tour by learning about the history of Heineken through the years , you go through a brewing hall , and see the various stages of the brewing process , and of course this is thirsty work so you stop off for a beer , as a taster , there are plenty of old advertising posters , and graphics dotted around the building , you go and watch a short film , but this is more than a film because you are part of the brewing process , which is fun and very real , you get roasted and tossed around a bit and sprayed with a few drops of water , but don't worry it is safe , as you would expect there is a lot of visual things going on , of course , the various sports sponsored by the brewery , they have a bit of advertising relating to the 007 Films . They also have a stables with horses but due to the volume of people you don't get to seem them very well , which is understandable . You have an opportunity to sit on a bike and have a fun photo taken , you go into a large room with large screen tv's and the Celling is made up of thousands of green beer bottles , and a large wall of bottles also floor to Celling - time for a few more beers , this is where you had in your tokens of the armband , after that you can go into the Gift shop , which is well stocked but expensive , you can give in a token to collect a miniature Heineken beer glass ... Across the road is the canal boat in which you go on a short trip around part of the city which lasts 25 minutes , this is included in the price of your tour , the whole experience should not be missed and is well worth the price €18

Spent most of the time in queues . I've been to a few distilleries (whiskey and Guinness) and was looking forward to visiting the Heineken brewery. On arrival I was be greeted by someone who couldn't careless about people visiting the brewery. We were then be packed in small stuffy corridors where you will shuffle through. There is a area where you are shown how to taste a beer, however it was so busy a few people didn't get one and when we eventually managed to get his attention he would have to do the thing again to get a half pint to taste. Needless to say he didn't bother. At the end if you feel like queuing for another 20mins you can get a couple free beers.I wonder if they take the same care if their beer making process; pack as much through in as short a time as possible and don't care less about the quality or experience.

Very good but could be improved. The only reason this place gets 4 stars is because the Guinness tour in Dublin is comparatively much better. The staff here are very friendly and the building is wonderful, however it looks a bit aged when walking through, as if renovated a decade ago. A great trip none the less, a lot to see!

Great tour!. What a great tour! Completely worth the money! It is a huge museum with all the history of Heineken, quite interactive and you feel that you are actually getting inside Heineken's view. You can taste hop and barley, and then you taste the beer. The ticket also gives you two drinks after the tour and a gift. If you buy it online you save 2 eur and a lot of time. You can bottle your own beer, engraving your name on the bottle for 6 eur, and you can learn how to properly pour draught beer.Reserve at least two hours to do the tour, because it was much longer than I was expecting.
Okay. Probably a little over priced and not the best brewery tour i've been on. Couple of free drinks and some interactive games

Good fun. This was a lot of fun. if you like beer, then give this a go. When i bought tickets it also came with a 1 hour canal tour. Then when we finished the Heineken Experience, we were given a free canal ride back to the city centre.

Well worth a visit. Went here as a family.Even if you're not beer drinkers it is still an interesting visit.Well preserved brewery and interesting history about the family.Small stable area with horses.Bottle of beer ride was a bit over rated but the interactive area was fun. Lots of activities for all to enjoy. Adverts were fun to watch.Best advice would be to go early as it gets busy.We were there for two hours.Felt at the start that 18 euros, a bit dear but at end of this experience felt it was worth it.You get two drinks and a glass included.A snack box also when there are four of you. Had this with beer watching the story adverts.
It's was great. The place was very interesting. I sure that people will enjoy in this place. The place suitable for all family.

An equal balance of impressive and pointless!. So this place has obviously had some mega money chucked at it. The first third of the experience is fantastic - well preserved brewing equipment, well informed staff to interact with, samples of hops and things to try - pretty good.The rest is really, really pointless! Playstations with FIFA loaded on because Heineken once sponsored the World Cup, a 007 room because Heineken once sponsored Bond and a room where you can watch all the Heineken adverts on a constant loop. That's as well as the 'get your family's photo on a t-shirt' room and the 'star in a music video' room. They definitely ran out of things to justify the 16 Euros each! Don't even get me started on the '4D' rooms where they pretend you're being brewed. Go, if its raining and you've done Amsterdam's real attractions. The price is irrelevant really because of the free Heineken at the end! If you want something a bit more authentically Amsterdam though, the mile-long open air market about 3 minutes away from the Heineken Experience is ace. And free.

wonderful experience. You should go early so you will not need to wait in the queue or so...helpful and cheerful staff.You can customize your bottle of beer and record funny videos and photos...have fun :)

Very interesting. unfortunately we had not planned our five hours in Amsterdam to well and was not going to queue for three hours outside The Anne Franke museum in the pouring rain. So hopped back on the hop on/hop off sightseeing bus to the Heineken Experience. Luckily this was on a Tuesday and there was no queue to get in. Staff were friendly and helpful.My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed the interesting tour. We had to wait for about ten minutes to enter the room showing the entertaining film of the making of the larger beer.We had one sample of the beer with the young lady informing us how to enjoy the larger beer.We ended up in the bar where we were allowed to sample the larger beer once againAn enjoyable tour with very happy friendly staff

One big queue (and not just the entrance). I was really excited about going around the Heinekin Experience. ‘Being brewed’ sounded like a novel experience and I had heard about lots of other good interactive exhibits. However this experience was ruined…by the queue and not the queue into the building (we had already bought our tickets in advance). The whole experience was over an hour and a half of being stuck in line. We spent about 20 minutes queuing up an elevator only to get to the top and be told that we had another 25 minute of queue left and were given the option of skipping the ride. Our feet hurt by the time we had got past the main bottleneck, and we were in urgent need of refreshments (which we eventually got). Admittedly we went on a Saturday but still thought this was average. To summarise, lots of potential....but go when quiet and book in advance.

Would not go there, even if it was for free.. We went on a saturday, which of corse is the busiest day. But still. We were walking in lines for 2 hours, watching things. Everything was commercialised crap that i believe is a collection of stand material they use on various expos. At the middle there was a 45 minute line for a 10 minute movie about brewing beer. It seemed like someones high school project. After that, finally some beer. It's been a while since i had a Heineken, and believe me, the next I'll have is far longer into the future, if ever. The bar we came in to was smelling worse than a bar at 3:00, just with a much more sticky floor. Here we learned how to enjoy a Heineken, I would need a much longer class than that to make this happen.After 30 minutes of more cues and lines watching more expo stand material we got to the second bar, where we were suppose to get two beers each. By this time we were so tired from walking in a slow line for 2 hours, also the line to the bar was crazy long. The bar was smelly, to hot, music was way to loud, and the floor was sticky. We decided to pass on the beer, and get the h... out of there. The only thing Heineken makes that is worse than the beer is this attraction. I've been to many guided brewery tours, and i usually love them. This however, was the worst experience ever.

Average, too much advertising.... I was hoping for a bit more from the visit here, but was kind of disappointed. Being a home brewer myself, I was hoping to learn at least a little more than I already knew, but hardly any brewing topics were covered. The two free beers at the end were great though, and the free glass as well, but there was overall way too much advertising for my liking.

Cheesy experience. . I finally checked out the Heineken experience being Amsterdam a few days. Traveling solo. I would recommend going with someone. Video interactive. Staff is 50/50. Some are nice. Some are just overall bored or not friendly. I wasn't interested in half of what they were offering. I was more interested in the process and history of the brand and not all the cheesy side exhibits

Bit of fun and a drink or two as well. First off there are about a hundred ways to save a few € per person with vouchers from the GVB to flyers in hotels and so on - no need to pay full price.Second - while queuing for your ticket take a few seconds to use the free wifi and download the audio tour app - some of this repeats what is on the walls but there is extra info, videos and photos as well, either way you can our at your own pace.The tour is quite informative and yes of course it is a Heineken tour in their brewery run by them so you'll get advertised at but actually even that can be kind of interesting and fun, I never realised about the 'e's in the name (teaser!)There is an entertaining little 'experience' toward the end just before you are rewarded with your first finished beer tasting - at the end you get a little more as well. Worth a little time for a bit of fun and a break away from some of the very serious museums elsewhere in the city. And a chance to get a bottle with your name on!

Don't pass this up.. Beer lover or non beer lover this experience is way cool. The tour was informative and there was lots to see. The gift shop is top notch. Be sure to get an engraved glass its really cool. They also have a station where they teach you how to properly pour beer.

Amazing Experience !. Not a traditional brewery tour ! You can actually go through the process as if you are a bottle of beer. The giveaways you get as pictures and videos of yourself free of charge also add on the great experience. Buy tickets at the tourism office for discounted prices and you wont have to wait in the queue. Must do in Amsterdam

Very Short, Too Much Advertising, but Somewhat Interesting. If you run out of things to do in Amsterdam, i would recommend booking a tour. If you are only in town for a few days, do not waste your time. There are plenty of other activities to do.It was neat seeing the brewery and reading about the history of the brewery. Even if you read every blip of information and watch the short videos, the tour still seems extremely short for the amount of money spent. Before you get you small beers you have the option of a "brewing simulation". This was kind of lame and delays you getting your beer. Just as a heads up, they spray water numerous times on you. So if you do not want to get shot with water, do not go on this "ride". You spend more time trying to leave the brewery than you do actually learning about it. During this time they bombard you with Heineken commercials and extra items you can purchase. Such as putting your name on a bottle, taking a picture on a bike, etc.

Loved it.. I've been at the Heineken Museum on middle of September, was a really lovely experience, for sure you might wait long queus, but it worth when you're in. The entrance fee is €18.00, it includes the visit, the entertainment, two little glasses of beer and a little but nice gift. There's a lot of things you'll learn about the story and the way of making the Heineken beer, it was really nice to hear how the beer is process it and how they try to solve and get perfection day by day. Inside the museum you have cameras which will give you the possibility on getting photos in t - shirts, glasses or any souvenir they can do. You've a nice green area where you can take lots of nice and funny photos. I really enjoy the cinema area where you can watch all their promotions. The last part of the visit you'll really love-> beer time!!! As just they can do. At the end of the visit they give the small gift. Helpful and outstanding staff. Thanks for the experience.

Fun had by all!. Now for those in Amsterdam this may be super touristy but for our group of 4 this ended up being a very fun couple of hours and informative at the same time. So the tour is 17 Euros per person and it more than pays for itself based on the beer you receive and the souvenir glass you get. The tour kicks off with a walk throughout history of Heineken. It is very cool to understand the evolution and how true Heineken has remained true to its roots and beginnings. You are then taken to a room where a guide discusses how the beer is made and what makes it unique. You're then taste the base ingredients of the beer (fairly yucky) and see facilities similar to where the beer is stored. Then you go through a ride where you become the beer (cute touch) and finally arrive to the tasting. My big takeaway was how to correctly drink a beer and let me tell you, it makes a difference! I thought the tastings were going to be chinsy but that was not the case at all - they were very generous. Plus you can earn more beers by answering questions correct - very fun! We had a great time, drank great beer, and walked away with a new found appreciation for Heineken. Definitely worth doing.

You will make your own beer and have the bottle to proof it!. Easy to find, as the hop on hop off bus stops in front. There are a lot of stairs in the building and it is a very big complex.The tour was very informative and the beer...what can I say but smile!

great tour. Loved this tour. Fun and interactive, staff were nice and could answer questions. Lots about the history of the heineken family and the development of the factory. Vats, ingredients, stables, games and most importantly beer is all offered on the tour. Free gift at the end was nice too.

Refreshingly Brilliant. Was very optimistic about going to the Heineken experience because I honestly thought it would of been boring, but oh how I was wrong! The facts are straight to the point and make you want to listen! Refreshingly chilled pints of beer, learning how to pour your own pint and even a free gift at the end of it! Would HIGHLY recommend. Only thing I wanted to know badly is "the secret yeast" they use in their product! Some things are best kept secret!

Had a great time!. It is after all a tour of a brewery but with a twist. Whilst taking you through the tradition of brewing, the history of the brand, Heineken has also added very modern entertainment ideas to the experience. Like you can click pictures or create a video of yourself and email it your friends. There is a DJ console game, PS3 stands and AVs of theirs commercials. Ofcourse they had beer tasting. Overall, we did have a good time.

great experience. having been to Carlsberg in Copenhagen last year I wasn't expecting much from another beer factory.however fair play to Heineken - they have done this well. a full 2.5/3 hour experience with drinking includes a free gist and lots of activates to do. do get there early though as queues become very big midday onwards.

save your money have a beer at a bar or pub. Too many people in a disney type line over and over. No real info. Beer at the end but a zoo. Save your 18 euros and have a beer at a local pub better atmosphere.
Beer. Nice tour of the history and making of Heineken beer. Best is the end with the beer tasting. In the words of Homer Simpsom, " yuuummm beeeeeeer!"

Great time! . My partner and I really enjoyed this tour, a small price to pay for the entertainment possible. We were there for about 3 hours. We enjoyed the tasting, and chance to pour our own beer and get a certificate. Our experience was made by the excellent staff, multimedia experiences and atmosphere.
Loved this experience !!!. While we were in Amsterdam we went to this factory , at first i thought it would be boring , but I was wrong !!! I really enjoyed it!
Be aware rude staff. Lines and rude staff. It doesn't worth your time. Misleading gifts advertasing. I didn't like Heineken but now even less.

So busy. Long queues.. Am currently in a queue inside the Heineken experience, we paid our entry fee then have simply stood in a queue around the exhibition for well over an hour now. No seats to rest etc... We feel as though everything.good has just stalled, and now we're waiting time doing nothing. A remedy would be for the tour to offer drinks stop in the queue to keep are spirits up, instead of just seeing a long line snaking around. Very disappointing so far...

a brewry tour. This was our (3 couples) last day in Amsterdam and the end of a 3 week trip to Europe. We had gone on a 2 week River Cruise and had had a lengthy day of touring and a canal tour the day before, frankly we were tired and did not think we could appreciate the beautiful museums' art...we still had our hop on/off canal ticket for easy/informative transportation.... what better to do than drink beer. The tour was informative and fun....but if you are at the beginning of a trip spend your time enjoying city sites and museums.

Touristy but a lot of fun. This place has tons of tourists but it is set up well so that you don't feel overwhelmed by the crowds. I have been on several brewery tours (mostly microbrews) so it was cool to finally go to one of the big multinational breweries.The museum was interesting and had a lot of interactive exhibits along with museum style wall placards to read. I learned a lot about how beer was made and I was pleasantly surprised to learn about the great work culture that Heineken seems to promote.After visiting the museum and brewing sections of museum, they have the interactive zone that allows you to take a picture in front of a green screen to put on a shirt. My girlfriend and I did this and were happy with the quality of the picture and the shirt. There is also an interactive ride where you, the audience, are put through the brewing process. It's about a 5 minute video that you watch while standing up on a platform that vibrates with the corresponding actions on the screen. The conclusion of the tour is everybody's favorite I suspect. You get two tokens for Heineken beer. You can choose from two smaller glasses of Heineken beer or a slightly larger glass of a beer from a frosted glass. Even though you get less of a volume of beer for choosing the frosted glass variety, an ice cold beer really does hit the spot. Cheers and enjoy your trip here. Thanks Heineken for making it a great experience!

A must do - "we loved it". The Heineken Experience is definitely worth visiting while staying in Amsterdam, its not just a museum about Heineken there is loads of photo opportunity, tasting stations with loads of fun and interactive things you do yourself - like winning the world cup, starring in a music video, all of which can be emailed to yourself :-) it makes the experience really interactive and interesting, there is even a small ride where you see what its like to be beer!!. You can take videos and photos and of course you get to try the beer ;) One on the way round and then 2 at the end of the tour where there is also a DJ so you can stay as long as you want! **look out for people who do not drink and are not using the tokens on their wristbands if you are lucky you can nab yourself an extra couple pints :-)** The staff are very friendly with great English & I would definitely recommend going here one of the most fun parts of our trip! - Book tickets through the tours/guides shops much cheaper - pick up leaflets as they have discounts in them :-)

Very nice guide very informative. A group of 5 of us visited here and the group we were led around the "experience" with were made to laugh along the way while being told all about how Heineken has been brewed down the years and all about the Heineken experience true to the name. Very much recommended as a lot is learnt and you are made to feel part of the tour with some drinks at the end!

Entertaining brewery tour. The Heineken Experience is definitely worth visiting while staying in Amsterdam! It does not only teach you about the Heineken family, the way they brew their famous beer or what ingredients you need, it is also a fun place where you can do a lot of things yourself, which makes it even more interactive and interesting. You can experience what it feels like to be a beer yourself, you can take videos and photos and of course you get to try the beer ;) The staff is very friendly and fun and therefore I would definitely recommend going there!

beer!. Very interactive way of explaining how beer is produced. Never like Heineken till I visit this place. Had a taste of freshly brewed Heineken and got hooked instantly. I Am a Heineken fan now. :)

The highlight of our stay. I had planned to visit this place during my stay in Amsterdam and it turns out to be even more interesting and informative than I had expected. It is more than just a museum, the beer tasting and some other parts are interactive and the atmosphere is good. 16 euro for the visit is a great deal for money. Don't miss it if you visit Amsterdam.

Long Weekend. Absolutely fantastic!This was my first experience at a brewery and my partners third (he said this was the most informative and interesting!)When you first enter, you go through a 'Museum' of the history and making of the lager. Videos and interaction make this experience worth-while!Following this, you are moved into a 'room' which about 20 other visitors and stand on a platform which goes through the process of making Heineken (which moves and does the motions) which was an unexpected surprise! This also created a good atmosphere to the experience.Following this, everyone gathers around a 'Bar' where a bartender gives everyone 0.25ml of Heineken and you are shown the best way to drink, pour and experience Heineken - I never realised I was drinking lager the wrong way!Moving onto interaction, photos and experiences you are welcome into the Heineken Bars where you can pour your own pint (and receive a certificate) or drink your two free drinks which you are issued a wristband and tokens for at the start of your journey. You are also given a free 'Gift' which is a Heineken Pint Glass.Overall, this was a worthwhile and definite visit for anyone visiting Amsterdam. The free Heineken and gift made the experience worth the money! It's also now our favourite beer...

A must see !. You can't come to Amsterdam and not visit the Heineken Experience, especially if you've never done a brewery tour before. I loved the interactive displays. The Beer Ride. And I became a pro on how to pour the perfect draft beer, how to drink beer and when to know your beer is dead. Bring a list of your best friend and family email addresses so you can send them a email postcard from the tour.

Not just for the boys. Have been told that it was worth seeing and they wasn't wrong. It was interesting, fun and it was nice to see a family really believing in a Business. Some fun things to do on your way round and a cheeky beer or 2.

Very good experience, informative, fun and good value. My girlfriend and I found this to be informative and rather fun. We hired bikes for the day and had a couple of hours to kill before heading home, so decided to stop off here. It's more than just a plain old boring museum and definitely worth an hour or 2. You get to see the history of the brewery in the first section, you then move onto the 'experience' and fun parts of the tour. A particular highlight of mine, albeit small, was pouring my own Heineken. I found this to be good value for money especially if you have a couple of hours to kill, the location is also very close and convenient.

Good fun.. The brewery itself is an amazing sight, and the reputation for Heineken is defenitely well desrved, while they also make sure to run you through the history as well.It begins with a look at the past, and this part of the tour is a little underwhelming. Tv screens and old memorobilia.Then the real activities begin. First you are greeted by a staff member who explains the recipe and the process for brewing a Heineken. Then you go into the brewing room, with photo ops of you actually brewing possible, in this room you will also be able to taste phase 1 unfermented beer.Next comes my favorite part of the tour, which is an amazing 4D ride that promises 'you be the beer'. It will take you through the process in a fun and exciting way.Later you will go through the beer tasting, which is also a fun experience.The tour ends with some museum like rooms having some minor activities, which I also thought was underwhelming and outdated.Overall a fun expetience though, and you get two free drinks aling with entry.

Great experience!. This is a must stop if you are in Amsterdam and of course enjoy drinking beer. Tour is very informative and what we enjoyed was the ability to go at your own pace. Beer was great and the free gift at the end is a plus. Also very cool things to purchase.

Interactive Museum. There are brewery tours the world over but Heineken have gone the extra mile with an interactive journey as if you were part of the beer being made, along with various rooms teaching you about the family and history of this world famous beer. Along the way you are treated to 3 half's of Heineken and given instruction on how to pour and drink it correctly and at the end your free gift of a small Heineken beer galss

Excellent. A really interesting an interactive visit, not only do you do the basic stuff around the old brewery but there is a film where you are the product, great and like a theme park ride with you moving around!After this lots of interactive things to do which are really fun and my wife enjoyed doing too.You end up in the bar area for your 2 free drinks, in the Guinness brewery in Dublin this is at the top with great views, here it is on the ground floor but set up like a club with a DJ spinning sounds!

Interesting and interactive. Can definitely recommend for anyone visiting Amsterdam.My wife isn't really a beer drinker but even she loved the tour. Very impressed with how interactive it was, it really had something for everyone.The free gift and beers at the end were a welcome treat!
Fantastic. Love this place really good day out with plenty of beer... get to see how it's made and a good try afterwards it's brill

Well Done, Heineken!. Loved our visit! Lots of things to see and do and free beer at the end in a very cool bar. They also give you little Heineken glasses to take home with you. The price is decent and it is walkable from the center of town. Highly recommended!
Forgettable. This experience is nothing special. The tour is boring and the building is so hot that at times you feel as though you may melt. The "ride" is fun. The best part is the beer at the end.

Absolutely brillant. If your into your drink then you must go here while your in Amsterdam, the tour is around 15 euros which is fair enough since your get 3 half's of Heineken as part of your tour which if your was in a pub in Amsterdam would be around 10 euros anyways ! so you might aswell. the tour shows you how its made from start to finish, there's also quite a few interactive points during the tour as-well which is also cool. overall its definatley worth a go
