An example of museum. The Heineken experience managed to create a place where you can learn, enjoy and get drunk at the same place.The ticket cost €18. "that's expensive", you could think. Well, you'll see that it'll worth.First you walk through different rooms and watch movies and chat with staff members. You'll try the barley and the hop. Then you'll drink the mixture of barley and water. You will understand all steps in the process of brewery.After, you will enter in a room and will watch a 4D movie.Then you will drink your first glass of Heineken. A staff member will teach you how to drink in proper way (as we didn't know).In the end you will arrive in a bar. you have two options: 1) you can drink more two glasses, or 2) you can serve your own pint as a pro.The second option is very fun, cause you do all the process (clean the glass, draft the beer) and, if you do the 'star serve' you get a certificate.When you are satisfied with the beer, you get your gift (a small and cute beer glass).So, I guess that €18 is not that expensive.

Far better than expected. I have been on brewery tours before and they are on the whole, a little underwhelming. This place is completely different! Interactive tour including the heineken beer ride!
Music rooms, labelling your own bottle and live music make this a great place to visit, plus you get to beer included!

Prost Heineken! Excellent!. Well worth a visit and great value for money, plus you get to drink beer;-)!!
Get the ticket from the I Amsterdam Tourist shop. Slighter
Better discount.
Very interactive, great atmosphere

Eat first or you'll get drunk.... Arrived for the last showing of the day, the receptionist was blunt, and told us not to hang around inside the experience, as the bar shut at 1840. Luckily I've been to a few breweries, and ticked things off rather quick. There's a short ride, and a couple of interactive moments, including how to drink beer. Towards the end, you can trade your entrance tokens in for 2 small beers or a pint of extra cold Heineken, we acquired extra tokens and so drank extra beer. We were shouted at as one bar closed, and ushered into the shop. Good experience, worth doing for 18€.

If you've got spare time. My friend and I enjoyed this activity as you got a lot of free samples for answering questions. You are given a lot of information on how the beer is made which is interesting for some. I personally liked attempting to pour a pint because I had never done so. Not something I would rush to do but a nice activity for a relaxing day.

These guys surely know marketing. To turn an old distillery into a place where people will pay 15 euros to get indoctrinated about your brand is genius. You can easily spend a couple of hours inside this "experience" marveling about how a young man took a small little family distillery and turned into one of the top beverages companies in the world. Having access to ice cold beer (-2c) is also another motivation. A fun place to discover with friends.

Great Tour. I've been on several brewery tours and this was a good one for such a large brewer. You get to see the process, taste some beer and have a good time. There is a fee, and can be crowded depending on time but worth it anyway. Have fun and enjoy.

Have to do. This is one of those experiences that you have to check off the list when you visit Amsterdam. It's a bit commercialized, but to see the process of beer making and walk through the history was very enjoyable. Stay for awhile and enjoy a bunch of small beers after getting a picture taken on the Heineken wagon, you'll be happy you did.

really cool thing. you learn about history of heineken, they show you how the beer is made, you also "make" beer. there is a lot of interactive stuff, games and places to take photos with friends. you will get only one small beer and a small glass as a souvenir, so don't expect to drink much. 18€ is maybe a little too much for it, but for beer lovers I recommend
Educational and fun. If you enjoy beer, you must try it. It was a fun and relaxing experience. Very informative and entertaining. Can't leave out the great beer samples!!!

Much fun. I enjoyed very much this tour and I'm not a beer drinker, but the information is excellent and there are many activities to choose from, I went for the bottle of Heineken with my name, nice gift

OK but do not expect too much. Go for a drink.. In general, it's a Heineken 'Marketing' Experience. The core 'museum part', where you can see how the beer is/was made and learn its history is very short though. Makes sense to got there in the evening and have 'the' fresh beer (good one!) with friends in a pub at the end of the experience, as it is a significant part of the "experience" (two small beers included). And there is the price factor: it's short and quite expensive compared to other local attractions. At the end you can get a very small Heineken glass: it used to be a lovely 0,25 l glass in a can container (to take it home safely) but now it is only about 0,15 l and in a carton box - rather not something to enjoy your beer back home.

An Excellent Experience. Heineken and Beer lovers will surely find this interesting. We spent more than 4 hours inside this old Brewery, which is now renovated and converted to Heineken Museum. Here they take us through the history of Heineken, introduce to us the science of Beer making, old brewing equipment’s, also give us the opportunity to taste raw materials of beer. There is an excellent 4D ride of beer manufacturing, and at the end they will give us free vouchers to get beers. The vouchers are small buttons in a Heineken wrist band, three buttons /visitor. Two buttons can be used for getting beer from the counter and the third button is for a free Heineken beer glass, which has to be collected from their outlet approximately 2 Kilometers from this Museum. The staff at outlet informed that only less than 30% of visitors take the trouble to search and find the outlet and claim the Beer glass.

nice tour, decent beer. First, this is NOT a tour of an active brewery and for real brewers like myself was slightly disappointing in the simplicity. However,the building once was their brewery and some of the equipment is left. Lots of hype for Heineken, some silly games and mildly annoying "ride" but let's face it, the reason most people go is for the tasting room. So figure, 15 euro for 2 heinekens and gift glass. Its probably cheaper to drink at a bar.

Drinking In The Heineken Experience. I didn't know what to expect because I did zero research but just went along on being told I had a ticket and finding the time to go. The queue took me a little by surprise, since I was there on a weekday evening, but it moved fast enough. I was also a bit bummed that my battery was running low even as I got there but there is a socket in the entrance-way corridor so I charged up enough to embark on the experience and make use of the free wi-fi - which was the best thing about the entire evening.Within the first ten minutes I was clear in my mind that every company should do something like this. The tour is non-guided, which makes it less boring and allows you to speed up when you get to the bits you couldn't care about or to dilly dally over the ones that interest you.There comes a point where things are too awesome - like the video game section and the photography and video areas - but eventually you get to the part where there are a few free beers.If you're into beer quite much, string along a couple of non-drinking pals and take their coupons so you down more than the two free glasses that come with your 18 Euro ticket ;-)Just remember that immediately after the free beer you have to go through a souvenir shop that is somewhat more convincing in those circumstances...
Overrated marketing ploy. Rather than really explain the history of the brand, the Heineken Experience just takes you through rooms and rooms of marketing gimmicks.What a waste of time and money.

An experience we won't forget in a hurry.. We visited the Heineken Experience on our Valentines trip to Amsterdam. We actually wanted to go to the Rembrandt gallery, but got talked into purchasing a bulk ticket deal from a seemingly sweet but deceiving old man at the tourist information office. The deal was free tickets to the Rembrandt gallery and the "Bodyworks exhibition", which was equally as disturbing but that's a whole other story. The catch was you had to go to the Heineken experience to pick up the tickets for the gallery. So off we went. Arriving at the Heineken experience we discovered to our dismay a half an hour long queue which we suffered in the cold, thoughts of the Rembrandt tickets forcing us to stay in line. Eventually arriving at the ticket office at 5:05pm, we were informed the "deal" of the Rembrandt gallery finished at 5:00pm. Thank you Mr sweet but devious ticket man for informing us about that. So we thought "Well we're here now, may aswell do this. At least there is free beer.". After queuing for another 10 minutes among sweaty shuffling tourists passing by small amounts of information about the founders of Heineken and a few black and white pictures of beer paraphernalia, we arrived in the first area of this shameless, interactive, and pricey Heineken advert.The strong woft of what smelled like dirty farm animals was very pungent in this large hall filled with old beer drums. We were already pretty cynical and giggly by this poin, and couldn't see any beer so we decided to quickly walk through the section, where we discovered the source of the manure like smell.Even though the factory was disused for many years (if I recall correctly), that didn't stop the hosts of Heineken keeping 7 or 8 horses in little boxes, for tourists to gawk at, while perfuming half the "experience" with the sweet smell of country air. Apparently they were used for the beer at one point, although I bet the original horses didn't spend their entire time in solitary confinement like these poor things did.Next up, more queueing for us. For around 30 minutes we were promised by the staff we got to watch a movie about (surprise, surprise) Heineken! They were constantly assuring us we'd been there in 5-10 minutes. But like Steve McQueen in The Great Escape, we spotted a blind spot! We did a runner from our guards and managed to slip past the film into the next section.Beer! Finally some alcohol to numb our minds of this torture. We squeezed into a bar where a member of staff was talking about Heineken. I raised the glass to my lips, ready to taste the sweet nectar of this product that had been rammed in our faces for the last hour when we were told we musn't drink it until the talk was over. We abandoned the beer and left to the next section; a maze of different rooms about Heineken. It would have been easier to find your way out of Donald Trumps hair if you were a head louse. Eventually, after passing Heineken logo number 32,984, we arrived in what must be described as the climax of our experience..We found ourselves in a Heineken hell hole in the form of a grotty night club. This is where we discovered our wristbands had detachable buttons we could exchange for Heineken. So after waiting at the bar and exchanging our buttons for 2 very small, and very tasteless beers each, we headed to the dancefloor. This was captained by some wannabe DJ who was jumping up and down as he skillfully stopped one chart song and played another.So we decided to leave this place, as well as our beers (which by this point we had vowed never to drink again). We came into a gift shop that sold Heineken and Heineken accessories. We quickly exited the building almost crying with happiness and sadness that this violation of our intelligence had just happened, and never looked back.So in summary, if you would like to spend a few hours of your life in a building that smells like horse crap and looks like one big Heineken advert, and get to pay a ridiculous amount of money for the privilege, you will REALLY enjoy this experience. If not, stay well away, as getting high as a kite then throwing yourself in one of the freezing cold canals would probably be a more enjoyable way to spend your time.

average. The staff were very friendly but a lot of different things like the holograms were switched off so made things boring, the main pub area didn't even have its lights on, it seems if it is broken they do not tell you or fix it, not fair when paying so much for an attraction and things are not working !

Great experience. What a great experience, a really entertaining and interesting museum. I have nothing negative to say about this place just that it is to the south of Amsterdam central about a 20 minute walk, I recommend this place to everyone visiting Amsterdam

Third visit still fun. First time we visited since they made the changes lot more interactive things to do but the Dray ride will be missed and they still have the bottle run . All around great experience.

More than just a brewery. I went to this not expecting much but definitely was worth the trip! An interactive playground where you can learn about a lot more than just beer. They even have a 4-D ride where you can experience the production of beer from start to finish. It ends in a nice lounge area where you can get your free beer and just relax.

Brilliant. Well worth a visit, even if you're not too keen on lager! The 4D experience is great fun! Make use of the free shuttle canal boat which takes you close to Rembrandt Square. While you're waiting for the boat, visit the local market which is huge!
fancy. Great place, and interactive, see the story of a great local brand that has become global ... major attractions and close to drinking a Heineken

Worth visiting if it's a bit rainy and you love Heineken. As most others have mentioned, the Heineken experience is kind of like paying to be brainwashed only with tiny glasses of free beer. It wasn't too busy on a late September afternoon, but I'd still recommend getting your tickets in advance online. We visited just after the Rijksmuseum and so had had enough with history and legged it round to the bar, where you can exchange two tokens for two halves (?) of Heineken. You also get a tiny glass after going through the 'bottling experience', where you're told how to properly drink a pint. The final bar area was nicely done out, but let down by music that was too loud, a distinct lack of seating and a floor that was reluctant to let go of your feet. It's a good place to go if you want to say you've visited a museum, but would rather have spent the time drinking.
great. Had a great time. lots of good beer. nice attraction...we were 2 couples. have a good time.wen enjoyed he atmosphire and the beer...recoomended

top attraction. you learn about beer and the history of one of the best beer brands in the world in a very interactive tour. i always recommend this place to my friends that visit amsterdam. the price might be a little high, with 2 beers and a souvenir included but you also can buy combi tickets and save around 20%. the whole thing will take you around 2 hours + the time spent in the souvenir shop.i had a lot of fun both times i was were and i'm sure you will do the same.

Not sure why I went...don't care how beer is mase. Came with some friends...and can I start by saying there are better ways to spend €16 and 3 hours of your time when you're in Amsterdam. I enjoyed it because I was in good company and we had our own craic. The museum itself...the first part is about how the beer is made, the different stages, the history of the company and the family that own it. The remainder is mostly interactive fluff, maybe slightly enjoyable at the beginning, but after a few I just wanted my free pint!! You can queue forever to pour your own pint or if you don't particularly care who pours your drink move on and go to the bar where they are just lined up and waiting for you! Maybe if you're an avid beer drinker you would have an interest in this experience, I really like gin - but I don't give one hoot about the process of making it :) I wouldn't bother with this to be honest.

Must do for Beer lovers. It was a must do in our list, visited in afternoon and were there for an hour due to pressed on time, actually to enjoy the place you need to spend more time. The whole Heineken Experience is awesome. It is much more fun than the general museums, you learn the proceswhy how the beer is made. The history of the company, gaming areas are interesting. The stimulator ride with interesting story is enjoyable. Followed by beer tasting. You can get your name printed on the bottle etc. you even get a glass as souvenir. All in all great fun.
Beer can be interesting. The museum part in the beginning can be a bit boring, but it definitely gets better as you move through this old brewery.Good for a couple of hours activity.
Fun but not exceptional. If you put aside the fact that you are actually paying to get indoctrinated about a brand, you could have some fun ... a tip: trade two coins for the pourer certificate

Interactive experience. I was a little skeptical about visiting the Heineken experience as you wouldn't think a brewery tour was going to have this must interaction but I was wrong. There is an informative bit which shows you how they make the beer, process etc and an interactive simulator for you to go into before you get to the beer tasting area. You are given a free beer and several beer tokens to use in the bar area afterwards. There are interactive games on some of the floors described as an 'adults playground' before you reach the gift shop. If you collect a token from the end you can claim a free gift.

Museum with Beer!!!. The Heineken Experience is brilliant!!It's informative, interactive and more fun than most museums. Your entry fee entitles you to some free beers after the tour which can't be bad!!You get some history, told how to pour the perfect pint, info on how it's made and a look through the history of their advertising.One low point - While queuing for a ride in the museum one of the staff was ridiculously rude towards a guest who clearly didn't speak the same language. This staff members behavior really was appalling. He had the attitude of a roided-up nightclub bouncer, get a grip!!On the whole though, a great way to spend a couple of hours. I would highly recommend it to all.

Went for the beer. 3 of us lads went, was interesting things to do however had to que to do the cool interactive things even though it really was not that busy, got bored after 10 minutes and walked through to get the beer. Got 2 free beers plus a smaller sized taste testing beer.We then got on a free canal boat that takes you to the shop where we received a free gift. (small glass)The experience cost us €16, got tickets from local shop.
WOWOWOWOW. Really nice museum! Now I know (more or less) what I drink! really suggested!Bel museo! Ora so (più o meno) cosa bevo! davvero suggerito!
Fun with beer. A really informative and fun visit interspersed with the occasional glass of beer. Halfway through get turned into beer ride.

Way better than I was expecting!. Had a great time today. Enjoyed the simulator/ride and the interactive part of the brewery the best. Also the beer tasting and two beers included were fun. Apparently you have to walk 15 minutes to get your free gift but luckily there were some at the front desk when we were leaving. Otherwise we wouldn't have bothered. Would definitely recommend it.

Fun for about a 30 minute experience. You can walk at your pace at the beginning reviewing all of the information and pictures they have telling the story of Heinekin. There is a segment of the tour that's fun where you all gather in a room and have a simulated "experience" then follows the beer tasting, then you are given tickets to have 2 more beers before you leave. Its a fun time, but really you need less then an hour to enjoy the tour and beers afterwards.

Excellent Attraction That Lasts Hours!. Visited with two mates during a long weekend. A bit scepticle about spending time visiting a museum during a boozy weekend away but we were so glad we did. One of the most worthwhile trips in Amsterdam. It's informative, interactive and most importantly - it was a lot of fun. Be sure to take advantage of the return canal ride that leaves hourly. If you enjoyed the Guiness Storehouse Tour in Dublin you will definitely appreciate the Heineken Experience too!

amazing!!. Very nice and historic place, its shows you how they do the best beer in the world and you can do it yourself and drink it free :)its cleaned and close to the the center of Amsterdam.highly recommended.

Touristy but fun and the beer was great. My husband and I went on our honeymoon backpacking trip. The "experience" is more a reference to the fact that this is not a functioning brewery anymore, and has been converted into a museum/attraction based on the company, brand and beer. That being said, it is fun and informative. They've chosen fun and interactive ways to express the process of beer making and the history of the company.You get 3 beers total. One small to participate in a "tasting" where you get to take note of the taste and smell features of the beer, and then two "pips" to spend on either two beers at the end, or you can use both to pour your own perfect beer. I opted for the latter because I wouldn't be able to do much more sightseeing if I'd had 2 more beer in the middle of the day, and I got to experience pouring my own beer and a great photo op.

Well done beer exhibit!. Really nicely put together museum/tour of Heineken and all it's history. You get a small beer to learn how to properly drink a Heineken and if you answer the questions - you'll get another one! There are also two beers given at the end, where you can drink them in a club-like atmosphere (the music was a bit loud, but it was fun). Nice way to spend a few hours... maybe good before going out!

Super afternoon out.. Well worth a visit. Once inside you experience the changing face of Heineken. Still a family company. Lots of demonstrations and interactive areas. We got a bottle with our names on it and also enjoyed great hopitality in the bar area. Some great stuff in the shop too.

Absolutely the Best Experiences Ever....!. I'm not a beer drinker. However, I was amazed with the Heneiken Experiences Tour. Basically, the tour covered the History/ Founder of Heneiken, what is main ingredients making Heneiken Beer and the process on how to make the beer. Beside that, you wil also get 2 free beers and another beer for tasting. At the end of the tour, there is a corner selling souveniers. Well, it is quite interesting tour. Must visit if you are in Amsterdam!
Touristy but fun. Tour is an interactive exhibit with some staff giving explanations of the brewing process. They give you 3 beers in total. Fun way to spend an afternoon.

loved it and don't even drink beer!. So glad we did this, as was considering not to as i don't like beer. Abit slow to start with but then it gets interactive with a simulator, beer tasting and pouring and loads of little things to do around the brewery. You can personalise your own Heineken bottles and then collect them at the end. On your wrist band you get a free gift and free drinks. At the end when you enjoy your pints, you aren't rushed out or hassled so it was nice to relax and enjoy it.

Fun with friends!. My sister and I visited the experience on our girls trip. Since we were doing Amsterdam in only one day, we probably moved faster through it than we would have liked. Lots of cool old brewing equipment, tons of friendly staff doing various presentations. And of course, there's beer included in the experience. As far as I could tell, the whole tour is spoken and guided in English, which was great for us. The building is also very centrally located to other attractions, which makes it not out of the way at all. I defiantly would buy tickets beforehand, it will save you two euros and you'll get to bypass the line.

Must see in Amsterdam! . We went to the Heineken experience not expecting much but it was amazing and a must do if you are in Amsterdam! We got our tickets from the tickets and tourist shop in the street and saves 2 euro each plus skipped the line to get in. It's not a typical historical tour, it's interactive, creative and so much to do. You get 2 free beers at the end but it's more like 3 because you also do a tasting after the 'become a beer" ride. There is also a canal ride and free Heineken glass to keep and it is kid friendly also. The highlight of my trip!

Don't even think of it. This is a lame self guided 'tour' where you're just herded thorough various displays and video shows with the promise of two 'free' beers at the end. For 18 euro, you're better off having a real Heineken experience in a local bar or cafe overlooking an Amsterdam canal.
Amazing ,. If you like beer , see this , it takes you to to journey from history of beer , and how it manages now , really loved the experience , the sovereigns you can collect
A Must For Beer Fans. Really enjoyable informative fun time. The film was a bit childish. Purchased a couple of personalised Heineken bottles for my sons great gift idea if you ask me.

Would go again!. Great tour! Going round the older parts of the brewery, seeing where it was made was all informative. The whole attraction is really well run as a whole. Efficient despite how busy it was, helpful staff and loads to keep you interested throughout. It's a really interactive tour so there should be something that would interest everyone, as not every single exhibit appealed to me but enough that I felt it was worth the entry fee.There's a couple of add ons that you can pay extra for if you wish, such as a personalised beer bottle, but where there is extra cost it is clearly signposted.Of course there's the obligatory beer drinking, a half pint midway through the tour, and two more halves when you get to the end. Also a free glass to take home, and we also got a free boat shuttle to the city centre at the end, a great little extra.The only part I felt could be improved was the bar area at the end was full of loud music as if I were in a nightclub, despite it being mid-week and mid-afternoon. I realise it's not a pub and therefore they won't want to encourage people to stick around too long, but there was no quieter option to enjoy my beer, and I really would have appreciated one.

I don't even like beer!. I don't even like beer and in really enjoyed my day here! It was very interactive! It was fabulous value considering you get 3 beers in the included price! The weather was terrible during our stay in Amsterdam, if it had been sunny I would not have considered it. But after the experience I had, if highly recommend going rain, hail or shine! Oh, and you get a free gift at the end when you leave!
Informative tour of the Heineken Brewery. Interesting to find out all about the history of the brewery and the family. After the 2 hour tour was over I was pleased for my ice cold Pint!

Well Worth it. We travelled to Amsterdam between Sept 13 and Sept 17 and visited the Heineken Experience when we were there. It is well worth the money we paid to get in. It was a little crowded so if I went again I would recommend going early in the morning when they first open. The staff would worked here were very helpful and knowledgable about Heineken and it's history. It was a very interactive place, kept my attention the whole time. You also get 2 drinks and a free gift at the end. I also would recommend taking the Heineken River Boat Cruise offered at the end of your tour. It was a lovely way to end the tour, they leave from the Heineken Experience and you travel up the Amstel. Would def go again and would recommend to others to go when visiting Amsterdam.
Worth visiting. Quite busy but well organised and so easy to get around. I am not a heineken drinker and so was uncertain about visiting but it all seemed to be interesting enough.

passes the afternoon. really well laid out tour but feels as if all the space and large screens is just covering up that there is so very little to actually do on this tour; there's a museum first looking a few old bottles, followed by a mock-up brewery, then horses which is a lovely touch but they are hidden behind glass, then a 'ride' where you get made into a beer which is a bit of fun on the way then the rest of the tour is just a bunch of crap games and very small glasses of beer. The best bit is your free gift is all the way on the other side of town even though there is a gift shop right there? Unbelievable. Not worth the money so only go if you've got a few hours to kill.

What a experience!. This is very touristic, but yet very interesting! It was very good to know the history and production process of one of the most famous beers in the world. And their marketing is just something to appreciate.

Better than expected!. I've been on brewery tours before but this one was truly an "experience" Lots of fun interactive and history of the Heineken Family. Nice touch with the horse stables on site. Of course the freshest coldest Heineken at the end made it a perfect visit!

Nice day out. My boyfriend and I had a lovely time at the Heineken Brewery.It is a little way out of the city centre but a good excuse to jump on a tram. I would recommend eating before going this side of the city though as we found it difficult to find somewhere to have early lunch and ended up eating in a mediocre restaurant located to the rear of the brewery.We had a great day and there are lots of different activities and things to see throughout the experience. We got some lovely photos as well and thoroughly enjoyed the fresh lager (and I'm not usually a lager drinker).Once we had finished the experience we were given a token for a free gift from the gift shop (which is fairly out of the way) and were disappointed to find that we could only get a small bottle opener. I actually kept my token as I thought it was nicer on my wristband than the bottle opener!Walking back to the city from the brewery was a pretty walk.I would recommend if you are staying in the city for 3 or more days as there are lots of other lovely things to do and see in Amsterdam.

Outstanding. I think it´s is a very great experience also for those who like to drink beers. It was great to understand the begining of this company and also learn how to try some beers over there. An awsome tip is that there is a free boat tour after leaving the museum.
Good entertainment. Really nice the adventure al Heineken Experience, 2h of Tours with iOS application as guide. Chance to' buy customized bottles and glasses. Not to loose.

very enjoyable even for non heineken drinkers. Would recommend this as a must do when in Amsterdam. Not only do you get to learn about the history of the beer but also includes the meaning of the Heineken experience in terms of its association with music and sport. For the Heineken experience part they have games photo booths for example can interactively get your pictures taken with the champions league trophy and email the pictures to your own email address..Great value for money two free pints per ticket. Also if you buy your ticket out in the city before you turn up you can get a discounted ticket. Up there as one of the must fun places ive visited. I wouldn't mind going back to it on a return visit if my friends wanted to do it.
Make this stop a low priority. With so many other things to see and do in Amsterdam, this was too Disneyesque but the beer was good!

Fun & interesting. If you get there 30 minutes before opening during the week the wait time is minimal. Once inside, the experience starts! It is very educational and the staff make the tour and stops inside a lot of fun! Don't miss the opportunity to video yourself and friends! It rocks!!

Good but not great.. You are taken through the history of the Heineken brewery, you see how they used to make the beer (the most interesting and interactive part). You get one very small beer and a glass (to get to which you need to go to the Heineken store which is ~15 min walk from the brewery building). Basically, the whole thing is not focused on historical values or anything like that, but rather on making you buy stuff. Anyway, overall experience is good.

Heineken experience. best attraction in Amsterdam ! it costs 18 Eur but it is truly worth it. They explained the process of heineken beer. we made some beer tasting. The entrance fee includes 3 free beers and a free gift. The souvenir shop have worth it items. excellent experience !

Unexpected Gem. I grudgingly attended this with my partner who is a huge heineken fan! I drink beer but didnt find going to a factory appealing at all but was I wrong! Its soooo much fun all the different things you could do and the free beers are great too ;) I would definitely do this again I enjoyed it that much! A must when in amsterdam!

Absolutely great experience!. I never knew so much about beer until I stepped into the Heineken experience. Buy your tickets outside (e.g. tour agencies, websites) to get slight discount. Choose between 2 glasses (half pint) of beers or 1 half pint beer with a certificate as Heineken beer pourer. They have games, photo booths (& send them directly to your email), name printing on Heineken beer bottles, Heineken-ride learning experience on brewing process, etc. They also provide free river cruise to the central.We paid €16 per pax but we went home with a certificate as beer pourer & some interesting souvenirs. A must go!

Beer and Fun. This is a multi media beer brewing experience. It is fun if you are a beer drinker and a Heineken fan. The tour traces the history of Heineken beer and ends with a sampling of the product. The cost is E17-18. The tour takes about 1.5 hours. Beer is not made in this building but there is plenty on hand. Enjoy a slightly different attraction if you are in the area..
A Heineken Beer Drinker Must. It's all about beer brewing with a hip vibe/experience and of course some beer. If you've never been to a beer brewery this is a fun presentation.
Loved the movie intro. The tour was fun, starting with a very interesting movie on which I refrain from spoilersI smoked something before and it made the tour even better
Great fun!. Class experience!! Would really recommend that you go, great atmosphere. Loads of samples :))) really worth the money. If u can buy your ticket on line.

Great to do if you have the time.. Just got back from the Heineken experience. Had never seen a beer brewery before so this was a good experience. I'd gone alone and still enjoyed it. It will be great if you go with a group of friends. They give you a band which entitles you to two glasses of beer and a free gift which can be redeemed at the brand store. You get to know all about the tradition and craft of brewing and also about the Heineken history. The Brew Me ride was fun. There is a stable walk where you can see the stables of the Shire horses which still deliver beer in the city.Instead of taking your two glasses of beer, you have an option of pouring your own draft and get a certificate for it and the glass of beer that you poured. The certificate was a perfect souvenir to take back. You need to return the empty glass though. I bought the ticket from my hotel, so I paid € 16. The regular rate is €18. Go in the afternoon or around 4pm. It took me about 2hrs to do the whole thing, including enjoying my glass of beer and watching the different advisement that they play in a kind of lounge. All in all a good experience if you have the extra time in Amsterdam after all that museum trips.

Good to see, but not overly exciting. The Heineken Experience is good to see and do as a tourist and obviously as a beer lover, but it's not overly exciting. It was just a museum with a few glasses of beer thrown in with your ticket. The end when it was more lively, showing how Heineken is used throughout the world (e.g. Champions League football) and the bar at the end made the experience a bit more worthwhile. Only €18 and 3 beers included, in Amsterdam, you can't complain at that.

Great beer lesson. I am not a beer drinker but this was interesting and fun. Teach you about the history, how to drink beer. Also go to the top floor and good views if Amsterdam with a cold beer and BBQ

Good fun, lots to do!. Enjoyed this experience even though I don't like Heineken it was interesting to see the history! Lots of interactive things to do too! Definitely worth a visit if you want to try something different! Very light hearted and good fun!

A great bargain. This is a fun tour. They don't actually brew here anymore, but... you do get a couple of draft beers with the tour. The tour is fun. You learn about Heineken and Dutch beer (The Netherlands [Holland] is the 2nd largest beer exporting country in the world). The tour is done in a very light-hearted manner, and you get exposed to a lot of different aspects of Heineken, from the secret yeast, to the commitment to quality, to the support of science, and a glimpse into the generations of family dedicated to brewing beer.The folks you meet along the way know their subjects, whether it is brewing beer, pouring beer, or drinking beer. They can explain it and answer any questions (in any of several languages). They all also seem to be having fun doing it.At the end, you get a souvenir glass, but not there! You need to go to the souvenir shop a few kilometers away to get it, so... you get a short canal tour on the Heineken canal boat to the shop where you can stay, or take the boat back.There are so many things that are must see in Amsterdam that choosing is not easy, and few of us have the time to stay long enough to see them all. If you like beer (I do) than this is not one that you will regret taking the time to do.For contrast, it is also fun to visit a very small local brewery T'ij, located next to a windmill a couple of kilometers East of Centraal.Heineken is a Pilsner style Lager and T'ij (pronounced te eye) is mostly small-batch Belgian style ales. They are very different and they are both fun.
Excellent. I really recommend visiting Heineken Experience, It's not just history, it is fun and in the end, worth a lot.

A bit of fun. We did this as a random last minute attraction and was pleasantly surprised. Prebooked online and there was no queue so straight on with the self-guided tour. It was a good story from how Heineken grew through history, how they actually brew the beer and they still have the stables where they used to house the horses when delivering the beer locally.There are a few bit of fun along the way such as a 'you become the beer trip,' personalising your own bottle and there are some fun little games such a how to pour the perfect pint. There is also quite a lot to do with Football given they sponsor the UEFA Champions League.You do get various samples along the way as well as your 2 free drinks at the end and your free gift, which, as anticipated was a small, bit nice Heineken glass which you can have engraved for a few euros if you choose.

The Experience. An interesting tour of Heinek brewery, with interactive shows and explanations of how beer is made, ending with a few beers and a beer glass as a gift. Good way to spend 1 hour and a half there, as the tour takes. Worth a visit, as you will meet the history of Heineken beer and you will find interesting info about it.Kids under 18 are allowed, but they don't get the free beers :D

brilliant day out. they have really pushed the boat out and this makes you really appreciate the beer and branding not to mention you get a free taster and then a beer at the end of the trip and a free glass to take home, lots of other interactive things to do like the dj booth and plenty of good photo opportunities

Tour the brewery and drink beer!. My wife and I went to this tour. bought tickets in advance, and went on a tuesday. Really not much of a line. We got 2 free drinks, but also got plenty of plenty of free samples with before we got our free drinks. Fun place lots of photo opportunities and of course free beer! Wanted to have our own bottle made but the machines that did this didn't seem to be working. And I didn't know Heineken had there own horses there...learn something new every day.Good tour for the money...would recommend.

Worth the visit.. Bought our ticket online and saved a few Euros and didnt have to wait in the line to but tickets. As others have said its self guided but its still a fun thing to do when in Amsterdam.

Was ok. We went around maybe 10-11am on a weekday and got in no problem. However, upon leaving there was quite a bit of a queue. It wasn't a guided tour or anything, you just make your own way around. There are a few novelty things like being able to label your own bottle, pour the perfect pint and go on the simulator type of thing which gives a 5min overview of the brewing process by shaking the floor to simulate some of the processes and giving out bubbles and things - prob the best part. These things make the visit worthwhile. I'd go early to avoid the queue outside and inside as well, as queues were forming for each of the activities.

Go only if you really love beer. This museum is obviously focused on beer, but we found we really didn't learn anything that we didn't already know. It is a nice building and the samples at the end were nice but there are a lot of better ways to spend your time in Amsterdam than go here.

Fun to do. This was down the street from our hotel so we took the tour. We really had a fun time and learned much about the brewing process and Heineken's place in the industry. The tasting room was just what we needed after a long day.

Fun time even for a non beer lover.. This was great fun! I don't particularly like beer but my husband does. The self guided historical tour was interactive and with many photo opportunities. The Brew You was fun. The beer tasting demo was interesting and I gave it a try but beer is not my thing. We bought several items at the store including personalized pilsner glasses. It was worth the trip and we managed to find a store on the walk over that sold the tickets at a discounted price. Highly recommended. The bonus-on the way back to our hotel, we stopped at a quaint cafe for cappuccino and Belgian waffles.

Download the App!. Make sure you download the free app on your phone before doing the tour. They have free wifi at the brewery for you to use. It definitely helps walk you through the self guided tour. If you appreciate beer and history then you will enjoy this tour. You get 3 beers throughout the tour and and a free gift which was limited edition 25 cl beer glasses.

Great experience - do not skip.. :). This is a great presented bravery.. Interesting facts presented in very entertaining way..You will not bored there ..The 16 euros online price that we paid is best 16 euros i ever spend.. You will get access to museum, bravery, entertaining digital activities, well presented history and much more...including a gift, beer tasting and barge trip into the Heineken Shop which is another great experience...I highly recommend this place for anyone and everyone..It the one to do not miss while visiting Amsterdam..

A very American attraction. This was a really fun experience. We got to taste some great beer, there were a lot of fun interactive elements, but it was very crowded, so a bit difficult to enjoy everything. A lot of it was really commercial, just like what I would expect to see in he US. Nothing remarkably local. For the price, it was a good time, but nothing I would be dying to go back to again.

Overrated. It is, as others have pointed out, not a tour and also not of a brewery or really the brewing process, more the history of the people and branding behind Heineken. There are some good elements, the guided tasting was good and the ride had the potential to be, but mostly it was just kind of boring. I think it is intended for more the 'lads on tour' or people who are REALLY into Heineken. Didn't even finish the free beers because of the atmosphere in the drinking area. I wouldn't bother with this for the price (€18)

excellent!. i loved this tour! however i will advise ladies with large boobs (as i found out) hold them down when in the "bottle" experience!! lol such a good day with lots of things to find out and do and best of all at the end you get beer!! not too badly priced however the shop was! as always!!

Fab Experience!. I don't even like beer, but one of my best friends had been before and recommended it to me.I had an amazing time, the history, lots of free beer and free gift were well worth it!For an extra 3 euro you can have the free gift engraved (which I think is well worth it!)Worth the money and must do if you're in Amsterdam!

Interesting. The name might get you excited and yes if you are looking for free beer you might not be disappointed but if you visit Ams this is a must just like the red light district. Its a big con job but a very interesting one. Not boring even for a minute and the heineken folks have taken a lot of pains to keep you engaged. Worth a visit for 18 Euros
Fun tour!. Very interesting and entertaining tour!! The Heineken "Brew You" ride was a really cute bonus! We had a blast during this tour! Worth the money!!
Worth a visit!. If you want to know all about beer, you should not miss this. Plus, for huge beer fans: you can drink 2 or 3 beers with your ticket!
World of Heineken. One of the best beer experiences I had. Its a must do if you go to Amsterdam. You will learn about the history of Heineken and the secrets behind its success.

Cooking Lager. Self promoting as a "premium beer", this was the worst use of funds I'd experienced in years. I think you need under 18 to enjoy this even though alcohol is involved.You spend about 10 mins+ in a personal TV module looking at historical TV ads! (Wow, great, I got to watch adverts)... Very poor tour of the brewery itself with a pastiche of a stables where old horses are kept. Stinks like a pet shop with added manure.Queues, queues and more queues for everything. Your given a token when you go in for a "free" (yeah right) beer at the end. If you're prepared to queue even further, you may eventually get served after a multitude of adolescents.Almost entertaining thunderbirds type marionation representation of the current CEO and the way he met his wife. Expensive waste of time. Too many other good attractions in Amsterdam to waste time on this one.The main irritation is that you don't actually get to see the brewery, just the old bits which are no longer operational.You've been warned.
A must do. We learned a lot about the heineken beer and we had a lot pf fun with the different games and photobooth and the heineken tasting and the boat ride amazing
Tourist trap. Yes, there is beer here, but go to a nice brown bar in Amsterdam to have some instead. The Heineken Experience is light on history, heavy on ticket price.

Get a lot with what you pay. Came with wife on Sunday afternoon during eurotripWe got tickets from the tour and tickets tourist offices around town at a discounted rate of €13 ( think normally it's €16 or €18). The Heineken experience museum was a pretty fun adventure. The ticket you buy grants you the rights to tour the factory, get 2 drinks (or one ice cold drink), and a free gift ( a Heineken glass cup).  It's mostly a walking tour, where you get to walk through rooms of how Heineken started, how it expended, and how it became a global beer distributed/producer. Throughout the exhibits, there are a bunch of site seeing exhibits and a bunch of interactive ones as well ( where you get to play through interactive full body games, virtually dj, and ride on a Heineken ride). You also get a free drink after riding the Heineken ride. After walking and playing through a series of rooms and sections in the factory, they have a bar area that let's you learn how to pour and exchange your two green beer tokens for drinks. Afterwards you enter the gift shop and back to the front entrance (where you can exchange your third white token for a free gift - being the glass cup)They also had a free canal boat shuttle running every hour that ferries you to their branded store in another part of Amsterdam. All in all, for the discounted amount of €13, the whole experience was pleasant and fun.

Great Experience. I must admit I was a bit skeptical when I heard the Heineken experience was one of the best attractions in Amsterdam. However, I am so glad my friends and I decided to take the time to visit this place. As a business student and a fan of the global brand I found the tour through the brewery and the history of Heineken very interesting. The drinks you get included in the tour were very cold and fresh too which only added to the experience. There was also free boat trip waiting for us when we came out which then took us to the Heineken shop. This place is definitely worth a visit!

Fun!. Great fun for adults, very educational for anyone and shows you just how to drink beer in the correct way! Would recommend for anyone who is a keen drinker! The only downfall is that there should be more things which will allow the public to be able to join in more and to not have to pay for every activity that is available!

Great fun and very interesting!. We were hesitant to do this at first, due to the price. However, when you factor in the two beers you get, and also the free boat ride after the tour, it's not so bad at all.The museum is well-kept and fun, and the ride was great!Highly recommend to anyone visiting amsterdam.

Great Day Out. Before my boyfriend and I arrived in Amsterdam we were told that the we should avoid the Heineken Experience as it was overpriced, etc. However that person couldn't have been so wrong! We pre-booked our tickets before we arrived in the city and I'm so glad we did! We went around afternoon time and didn't have to wait in a queue at all. The full experience was really interesting as you walked around and discovered how the beer is brewed, then you get a free 1/4 pint to taste and they actually teach you how to drink the beer which was funny. You also get given a silicone wristband that has two token you can use for free beers at the end of the tour, it is only 1/4 pints though so don't expect loads! It is meant to be 1 token for a beer or 2 tokens to pour your own beer and get a certificate for doing so, although when my boyfriend and I poured the beers the man doing it was hardly taking any tokens and was letting people keep them for the bar in the other room and even at the bar they would give you like 2 beers and only take one token, so really you got a lot for your money (if you were pleasant enough to the staff of course, they don't like rude people)!I would definitely recommend this experience to ANYONE who visits the city it is so interesting and a good laugh!

Modern but traditional. Making beer is one of the oldest and one of the most traditional jobs in the world. Here, you have all that, but explained through a various modern, technologically advanced features. Very interesting and a lot of fun. Not JUST for beer lovers, but for everyone.

Nice experience. Price of one ticket for adults is 18€. Go early in the morning otherwise there will be a big queue. I recommend it :) The beer is good and the tour too. Then you can have the boat trip in the Amsterdam canals for free :)
Cold. Everything was very interesting. The beers were very cold and fresh. I liked the inter active displays.

Beer and a burger. After long day at Van Gogh and Riksmuseum, a walk down the street for a visit to the Heineken Experience for some beer. Ok, it is a commercial in action, but it was fun, even the campy "ride" where you are part of the bottling process. They had a deal which included a hamburger on the top of the building. Great view of the city and even better burger. On top of that the Heineken canal boat free ride. Fun way to end a day of sightseeing. And we were the oldest ones there and who cares.

This was fun. My husband and I are wine drinkers, although my husband will have an occasional beer. Heineken has never been his favorite. But the Heineken Experience was a great way to spend and hour. It provided information about beer making, as well as a surprise "ride." Admission also includes 3 small beers, and advise on how to drink it.

Unexpectedly interesting. Not being a lager lover I wasn't sure if I'd enjoy this experience but my son assured me it was good.He was right ,beer making is a fascinating process.The brewery is beautifully and creatively set out with so many interactive and unusual sections there is something to delight everyone. I still don't like the taste of beer though!

Really good afternoon!. Went with my partner, booked online so no queues. I'm not a big fan of beer but thought it was very interesting and the interactive parts were very fun! A personalised beer bottle is only 6 euros and makes a great present. Plus you get a total of 3 free drinks and a free glass so its good value for money!

A little bit of fun. went here around 11 a line had already formed but we went through quickly.We got a ticket with the rooftop burger,so off we went and learned all about how heineken started,we were put in a room and had the experience of how it felt to be a bottle,we got a glass of beer when we were done then went on to the next floor where we could have 2 drinks or 1 drink if you want to pull it yourself then at the end we were taken off to a lift and brought to the roof and got the biggest burger ever and a glass of beer,when we were finished you are given a small glass which you can take on the way out or get a trip in the heineken boat across the road to a heineken shop and collect your glass there, This is a good way of getting back up into the main shopping area.. A fun few hours

A lot of fun!. I'm not a big beer drinker, but as we were in Amsterdam we figured visiting the Heineken Experience was a must, and we were so glad we did! The whole tour was informative and fun, and all of the staff members were so friendly and highly entertaining at times! At the end of the tour you get two free drinks and a free gift, which is great. Book tickets beforehand to avoid queuing.
A Good Place To Visit In Amsterdam. This is good place to be. It is bit boring but people find it quite interesting. Specially 4D movie experience. And a Limited Edition Heineken Glass. Worth it.

Fun, but crowded. The tour is fun, and educational, but when I went it was crowded resulting in long lines at some attractions and a long wait to get into the theater. However the theater was worth the wait. The price is a little steep but you do get two beers. If you are looking for some fun between museums, this can be it.

good if you like beer. The Heineken Experience is not the brewery, but where it used to be and where everything started a great branding experience and a couple of free beers at the end of the tour, We got a chance to do a couple of free pictures and a short video from the free stands and picked a fee new tips on beer making and wart tasting, that always comes handy to teach people on how to drink beer

A fun afternoon. I don't like beer, but we saw how many good reviews on TA this place has had so gave it a go. Great fun from start to finish - games, loads of fun opportunities, a ride and beer tasting. We really enjoyed it!

More than just a brewery tour. I was amazed after the visit. Not knowing what to expect, the tour was exceptional. It's all walk yourself through style, just follow the signs. Plenty to read, watch and look at on the way through. Learning the history of the beer, the process and the brand. I've never been an this Heineken drinker, but this experience was certainly enlightening. You get at least 3 drinks on the tour, if you don't drink, I'm sure there'll be some young lads that'll take the tokens off your hand.At the end of the tour, you get a small Heineken glass to keep.

Superb attraction please visit. Very interesting place you will see and learn a lot of thing. There is a lot of interesting things to see. And at the end of tour you will have the opportunity to buy a beer bottle with your name on it...

great branding experience. I was expecting a tourist trap but was pleasantly surprised... make sure you go off peak to get the most out of it. Some great twist and turns (be a beer!) but I don't want to give too much away! A little expensive for entry but you do get several drinks along the way. Staff dealt well with a crowd that had about as much get up as a run over cat. Best to book in advance!

If you're going, get the burger as well. The Heineken Experience is no longer the brewery we visited back in 1983, but a museum celebration of the brand, history, brewing process, culture and advertising, similar to, but not quite as grand as Dublin's Guinness Storehouse. You are schooled into a proper drinking, and you can spend your 2 beer tokens to pour your own with a certificate or on 2 small beers or one large extra cold. If you hang out in the pouring classroom you might be able to score a couple of extra free beers as other people's pouring "mistakes" are offered to anyone around. After the tasting lesson take time to linger in the advertising lounge with sound surround as the commercials are like mini movies and surprisingly entertaining. We went for the extra Euros for the hamburger on the rooftop, which was well worth it - a loaded burger, small group, another beer, and great views. We should have planned ahead to time for the shuttle canal boat to the brand store for our free glasses. Missed it by a few minutes and walked. Even with the simplified map, we had to stop and ask for directions. The Experience is open late so you may wish to see something else earlier in the day. All in all, the experience seemed a bit pricey, but the Dutch have a saying that if you can jump over the horse, you can jump over its tail, so go for the burger, too.

Must do in Amsterdam. If you like beer, you must spend the 2 hours here. It costs 18 Euros per head per adult and it takes you thorough the history of the Heineken family and how the beer started. It takes you through the large barrels where the beer was made and the process. Then it has an awesome 4D experience of you becoming a beer. This is followed by beer tasting ( small glass of beer) followed up with 2 glasses of beer and a gift ( beer glass) in the end. A unique experience with history and beer !

Okay. The Experience tour was informative and enjoyable. There are neat, hip rooms to check out as well. My husband and I are beer enthusiasts and make our own at home. Other than the mediocre beer, it was a good hour to kill on our last night in Amsterdam.

Appeals to all. Despite not being a huge beer fan, I went to this attraction and was astounded. So much thought has gone into the Heineken Experience that other companies need to visit and see how to successfully macimise their brand identity. I learnt so much!

Really good. The tour is really interesting and you get to see how the business was built up. There are slightly cheesy points like when they 'make you into a Heineken' but apart from that it is really interesting. We paid the extra €7 to have a burger and another beer on the roof top which was well worth it with nice views.

Best to visit with friends or people willing to have fun there. It is a 2 - 3 hours entertainment if you play fuss ball, take pictures, make a music video, design a beer, drink some beer and so on. Afterwards you may take the boat trip on the canal but do not expect much from the guide to explain (or ours was more focused on other topics than offering info) At the end of the boat ride you will reach the Heineken store.

Much better than expected. The Heineken Experience is a must do for anyone who visits Amsterdam. It's not too pricey, with plenty of opportunities to get discounts around the city. It was a very fun 2 hours, even for those who don't drink.
Fun. A fun experience even for people who aren't beer or heineken fans... was all in all a fun tour with the family

pleasant. this was quite a nice experience...very interesting, interactive, a bit commercial, but overall entertaining; the tour takes about 2 hours, we received a free gift and free beers during the tour and at the end of the tour; a must do for each beer amateur.

Brilliant tour. I had no idea that there was so much to learn about Heineken! This was a similar setup to the Cadbury world in the UK, with plenty of video exhibits and historical artefacts to guide you along the story of Heineken and its family. There was an awesome little "ride" where you travel along the factory process being brewed into a bottle of beer! Was fun and a little silly! We had a wrist band given to us at the start of the tour which entitled us to a free glass of Heineken at the end of the tour, which was fab. There was an opportunity to see the ingredients that go into the beer, and have a proper taste with a guide telling you exactly how to taste the beer. The shop was pretty good, with a huge range of Heineken branded goods for sale. A fascinating tour that was actually really good value for money (18 euros per adult). Recommended!
A Must do in AMS. If you like Beer And experience, Here you get Both life and with Fun. It is a Must do cause it Shows You in an amazing simple And lifely Way how the Beer brewing Process Works.

One of the best in Amsterdam!. For those who love beer, it's highly recommended to visit Heineken Experience!I can give you a tip though how to experience Amsterdam cheap. You can purchase a Holland pass. This will save you a lot of time lining up to buy a ticket and will also save you money as well. Heineken Experience is not just drinking Heineken beer. We didn't expect this but we will visit there again when we come back.

Beers at the end were the best!! . Cool plAce to visit to experience beer making process. Strong smell of yeast all over. Good/fun things to do during tour and the beer at the end was very very fresh.

Excellent. This best thing we did while in Amsterdam. This cost us 16 euro each but it was worth every penny. So much to do and you get a free glass and two free drinks throughout the experience. I would recommend this to anyone.
Unexpected!. This was a really good tour! Loads more interactive than I was expecting and good value as you get 2 free drinks and a gift to take away with you! Nice little way to spend an afternoon.

Funny. It was fun. I mean, the tour itself it's just good, to know about the beer process and heineken history, but the funny part is to drink beer ! hahaAt the end of the tour you can pick 2 beers and there's like a "bar", good to meet people if you are young like we were.
great fun. im not a beer drinker but the heiniken experience was great fun , don't forget to take the canal cruice after
Fun. A mixture of learning, playing, watching & tasting beer. The staff all seemed to be enjoying what they were doing & this was a most enjoyable way to spend a couple of hours.

Without a doubt the most fun you'll have in Amsterdam!. We had been told by many people that this venue should be on our list of places to go, and we held it off until our second last day in Amsterdam. We had pre-booked tickets and luckily didn't have to wait too long to get inside. It was a little busier inside to start off with so we missed a few photo opportunities, but found lots more really interesting parts showing the family history and success of Heineken.Where it really got fun was when we were taught how to properly drink heineken, and we all got a sample drink which was fabulous! We then moved on and found a few other really cool interactive places and had lots of fun all round. Then we got to pour our own Heineken which was again lots of fun and we even received a certificate!We still had two tokens left for more drinks, and they that's the whole purpose of visiting the Heineken Experience right? Yes, but there were far more fun things like DJ Decks, Break the Case just to name a couple.This was by far the most fun we had on our trip and would highly recommend it!
Awesome experience. A well done way to discover the diffrent steps to creat the drink. Staff are welcoming with a big smile, dont forget to get your free Heineken boat trip at the end.

An Amsterdam cliché but worth it. An afternoon well spent! The museum section of the tour was really interesting (as a beer connoisseur) and you could spend over an hour in there quite easily. There is also a lot of entertainment (e.g. table football, FIFA games) in the UEFA Champions League section. The free beers at the end topped off and excellent afternoon in Amsterdam. 10/10 would recommend to anyone who likes beer.
Great value for money.. Great guided tour all in English! Interactive and free beer. Perfect! Great little bar at the end for a few beers and even got a glass to take away!

Not worth the effort.... It is very rare that I bother to give a negative review as I prefer to highlight positives, but I wish I'd read one like this before going.The Heineken Experience has a lot of great reviews so I thought it sounded like it was worth a visit. It wasn't worth the money or the time. A big room full of copper vats, a silly 'ride', the chance to pay for the privilege of having your name on a bottle ... Just didn't get into it at all. Unless you are really so desperate for a couple of glasses of beer I wouldn't recommend it...

Worth a visit if weather is bad or have some extra time.. This self-guided tour is worth a stop in Amsterdam. Well laid out and interesting features on the history of Heineken. Price of admission includes two beers - so essentially the tour/museum is free!

Amsterdam highlight. Definately one of our trip's highlights. The factory is very large and really feels like an actual factory, smells a lot like beer ingredients and even has stables full of horses which apparently are a big part of the brand's history. The part where you go in the little interactive amphetheater with the vibrating stands and the special effects is just great. Also there is a very nice cinema room where you can chill and watch heineken commercials on loop. Then ofcourse the bar where you can drink quite a lot of heineken with your ticket! What a great way to spend a day in Amsterdam.
Worth a see if you have some extra time. Incredibly touristy but it's with visiting. The free drinks at the end are good too. Would only do it once. Misha at the bar is the man

Not Cheap, But An Enjoyable and Interesting Experience. The entry fee was 18EUR in August 2014 when my brother and I visited the Heineken Experience, which includes a token for a free gift and 2 tokens redeemable at the end of the experience for a couple of beers or a novelty "Brewer's Licence" event and certificate.The experience itself is a self guided linear tour, with videos and various displays documenting Heineken's establishment as a leading beer producer and going into some depth about the brewing process. The displays and multimedia are all of a high quality and it was certainly an interesting tour - I especially liked the huge copper containers used for storing grain and brewing, which had been incorporated into the building.After having a look at the working horses, which used to pull wagons loaded with kegs of beer to local drinking establishments but these days seem to be used for promotional purposes only, we reached an area where we had to queue for 10 or 15 minutes - it wasn't at all explained, so we didn't really know what was going to happen and definitely could have used some additional signage! As a British person, queuing with people from all over the world is always an eye opener though, so at least that kept my brother and I entertained in the meantime.Once we got to the end of the queue, it turned out we were going to "Be the Beer", standing on some kind of hydraulic platform and then subjected to a "4D" show, where we were guided through the beer making process from brewing to bottling, whilst bubbles were pumped into the room, water was sprayed about (mostly onto the poor chap on the row in front of us!) and heat lamps cooked us a bit. Certainly not what we were expecting, but probably more enjoyable and amusing for it.After that, we got to drink a small beer (no tokens required!) and were told about how it should be poured and drank, as well as being offered the opportunity to ask the helpful staff members any questions.Following that, a raft of Heineken advertising gimmicks and strange optional multimedia activities were thrown at us as we descended the building again at our own leisure. Whilst some of the things on show were quite cool (one room had massive glass bottle ceiling, with some of the more amusing Heineken adverts on huge screens and plenty of seats to stretch tired legs!), others were a bit more tacky (posing with the world cup superimposed on a screen for photo opportunities) - but to each their own. It did feel a little like the brand was being shoved down our throats, but I guess that's part and parcel with a branded experience like this.Finally, we got to the point where the drinking tokens could be redeemed for either 2x25cl Heinekens, 1x35cl Heineken Extra Cold or 1x25cl Heineken and a quick tutorial on how to pour properly with a "Brewer's Licence" certificate. We obviously opted for the 2x25cl beer option to get our money's worth!The only thing left after that was to be spat out into the obligatory branded gift store, which we quickly escaped from before making our exit from the building and heading back towards our hostel.The free gift offered could only be redeemed at another Heineken store a 15 minute walk away, there was also a boat ride that would take you there, but it wasn't clear that this was included in the cost of the ticket so we ended up walking... but gave up when we couldn't spot it anywhere. Given that the free gift is just a Heineken branded key lanyard, it wasn't the end of the world.I'd certainly recommend giving the Heineken Experience a go, the staff were friendly and helpful at all times and most of the displays were very informative and quite interesting. Some of what was on offer felt a little pointless and the free gift should have been available on site in my opinion. The ticket also felt a little pricey for what it got you - but hey, that's just how tourist attractions go!

worst beer tour ever!!!. When we went the queue to get in and buy ticket was not so long, then going through the first part of the tour where you hear the history of the company and see some bits of the brew house is okay. But then you have to queue for ages to go into some silly interactive movie thing which is basically for 2 year olds. Then 5 minutes of beer tasting (one beer), which is okay. Then you get to go and get your free two beers which again okay but the bar area was really dirty and the floor and tables really sticky from old spilt beer, really bad. Do not waste your hard earned cash here, just go to a bar instead and rnjoy the city. Carlsberg tour in Copenhagen is way better. Every other beer tour we've done is better, way better.
Excellent. Very informative.Fun couple of hoursFree gift!!!Really enjoyed meeting the staff, they're very friendly.
Expensive, but good to visit once.. Enjoyable, however long and slow. 2 beers included in the tour and the staff were very cheery. Includes a river boat tour back into town.

Fun time..... Wasn't expecting too much from this tour, but after taking the tour, winning a few beers in the tasting area for answering some beer related questions, and the free canal cruise to their other store, all in all it was a very good time. Very interesting to hear the history and back story on Heineken, and you got a great feeling and look on how beer is made. Great part is near the end where you can sit down and rest and watch various Heineken commercials from the past. Well worth it!
had a blast !. great place, learned a lot, and also had fun with all of the interactive attractions around. thanks for the beers and the experience :)

Excellent Experience. Really good tour, very informative, plenty of beer to keep you going, and for €7 extra you get a rather hench burger and a beer on the rooftop overlooking the city. Beautiful.Afterwards there was then a boat trip included in the price which was optional, we chose to take part and enjoyed a beer aboard our cruise through the canals.

Nice visit to the original brewery. Funny and drinkable experience ;-) . You get an impression of the history of the Heineken beer, the family, the brewing process, also see the horses that brought the beer to the pubs...There is also an attration included where you experience how it is to become beer (you stand in a line with 3 other persons, ground below your feet moves a bit, a relaxed attraction, not a thrillride or anything like that). At the end there is a photoboot. You get coins for 2 drinks at the end and during the tour you also get a small beer to taste. Do visit as you like beer and don't understand why the Dutch like a good foam on their beer (it has a function!)  For people who read Dutch: discount via ticketveiling.nl is op dit moment mogelijk.

Great experience for fans of heineken and even for people who aren't. It seems to be a bit of a tradition now that on my birthday I should visit a brewery. Last year it was Adnams, this year it was Heineken.This visit was different to the brewery tours in the UK as the UK tours are more basic but in no way any less interesting. The Heineken experience is a lot more high tech and clearly has had a lot of money invested in it. There are lots of photo opportunities along the tour with one of the highlights being when you walk right through the stables where the horses are kept.Other highlights include the become the beer ride which is quite innovative and also of course the beer tasting itself. Not only do you get to have two drinks during the tour but you also get a free gift at the end.

The funniest experience I've ever had on a trip. The funniest experience I've ever had on a trip. They have quality. You can learn how to drink beer again :) You can brew your own beer, watch the funny and interactive movie about beer producing process and more. I suggest everyone to visit. Also you can buy some stuff from the store.

Worth a visit. Strange that people expect beer on tap, it's a good exhibit, explains the history and production of beer and there is a lot of interactive things to do, you get a free glass and at least 3 beers if you want. After you have finished visit the pancake house just over the river.

Got to do it I suppose, but total ripoff. This is a reasonable way to spend a couple of hours, but at 18 euros it is a total rip off - I guess it's a bit of a tourist trap. The interesting bit - about the beer production - could really benefit from people telling you about it. Fun bit at the end where you get to sample beer - but I left feeling a little underwhelmed. One of those places that you have to go to but at the end wonder why.
What an experience!. Incredibly well done with surprises at every turn. A must for the whole family. Everything from movies, holograms, to of course the beer tasting and more...

Good experience!. Yes, not bad. But, it could be better.I do recommend visiting this place. There are few activities inside which is nice.The video produced should remove the green screen so it could blend nicely with the foreground image.In general, good experience, and I do recommend you to visit. It's nice!

Not as good as expected!. wasn't much interaction & nobody to guide you round or to go over the process which would have been beneficial. Cool bar at the end which you can stay for as long as you want.

Pretty good. Having done a few whisky distillery tours this one starts very similarly to them. But once you have passed the history, this place rally comes into its own. The samples go down well too :)
Great fun for a rainy day!

Not bad!!. Pretty good tour, quite a lot of things to do but would have liked a little more about the history of the company and the expansions and their businessess. Dont buy tickets on the door, queues too long. Buy tickets before and go straight into the tour.

Awesome experience. Very original, funny and interesting experience. You will learn everything about how Heineken beer is made, also you will learn interesting facts about history of Heineken. Interactive content will keep you from getting bored throughtout whole experience. And of course you will have the oportunity to taste their beer.

What a great experience!. This was one of my favourite things to in Amsterdam!
Well worth the money, we first saw the Heineken Museum (History) followed by seeing where and how its made. We were brought into a room (I won't give away the funny surprise) Then followed by lots of beers!

A must see especially if your a beer drinker. We finally found this place ( after searching for a whole afternoon and not being able to find it) and was so easy no queue for tickets and straight in to start our visit. The tour was very informative and we enjoyed listening to how the lager was made. Great value for your money and two drinks free and a free gift of a glass. We also got a bottle with our own little personalisation on it for the cost of 6euros.

Great fun interactive experience. So glad we did this tour, never knew what a great company this is, family values and a man who knew how to look after his staff!! I would allow at least two hours for this tour as there is loads to do as you are walking around. It takes you right from the beginning of how the company was first started right throug to how the beer is brewed. Huge tanks show how the beer is made through the stages right through to how it is delivered to the customers. You get to try a couple of small beers and the guides tell you how it is brewed and why there is always a huge head on the beer which I never knew about. You can have your pictures taken on bicycles on a green back screen, play FIFA football, table football, be a Dj, learn to pour a beer and then finally receive your two free drinks at the end in the night club!!! What a great place to be..........

A family fun add to our trip!. Fun for all ages! We decided to visit here on our weekend to Amsterdam since we had a day of not great weather, so glad we did!! As soon as you walk in you can easily purchase tickets. Which was 18 euro each for adults and free for children under 18. With that price, the adults got a bracelet with little tabs for 2 free beers and a free souvenir which was a cute little Heineken beer glass. The kids got a bracelet with 2 tabs for 2 free sodas or water. There is also a counter to leave your coats, bags, strollers etc. free of charge which is nice! There are several floors to the walk thru, keeping in mind this is the location of the original Heineken Brewery. The whole exhibit is very interactive with videos and different memorabilia displayed throughout. They have the horses there with the Heineken delivery carriages to see. Although they are no longer used they still keep them as a tribute to their tradition. There is a neat little ride type video adventure where they show you how they make the beer with you being the beer, it was fun! There is also an area where you can record your own Heineken music videos and pics and email them yourself and everyone else!
