That was really funny!!There is also a dance room where you can be a DJ or play a interactive game.  There is the brewery room to see in person the process of making the beer and also taste the hops, barley etc. Its all so interactive and educational! You get to see a beer making assembly machine where you can actually pay 6 euro for you own personalized Heineken Beer Bottle. We did because we thought it was a unique, cheap souvenir. You also get to taste a Heineken beer in a tasting area where they actually give you a lesson on the beer and how to properly drink it for best taste. At the end you are in the fun bar area to get your free beers and sodas. There is also a gift shop as well. Our kids ages: 1, 4, & 11 had so much fun! I also have to say how kid friendly this place is and how amazing the staff is that works here. They were so great to try to include the kids and make it fun for them!

Such an awesome place to visit!. TOUR:To make the most out of the self guided tour, download the app for your Android or Apple device. The tour includes a bunch of Heineken's history which includes family stories, previous beer bottles, and past logos. There are also workers along the way that explain the beer making process. I had two highlights on the tour. The first is seeing the horses at the on site stable. The other is the interactive experience as if you're part of the beer making process. Do note that it is interactive with moving platforms. The end of the tour has more of the souvenir aspects to it. You're able to send free electronic postcards or bottle your own Heineken beer for you to bring home (for a cost of course).WHAT TO KNOW:*Free WiFi*Purchase tickets in advance: 16€ online, 18€ at door*Must be 18 to be served beer*Admission includes 1 beer halfway through the tour and either 2 regular beers or one ice cold beer at the end of the tour*Admission includes a small beer glass. You can personalize the glass with your name for 3€*On site merchandise store

Theme park for beer drinkers. I bought tickets in advance so bypassed ticket lines which were moderate at 4pm on a Tuesday afternoon and was able to walk right in. The ticket taker told us it was a self-guided tour using a wifi device but never explained we needed to download a special app, another visitor listening to the tour gave me that info. My iPhone would not allow the download because I had not gotten the latest update. 15 minutes into the tour I gave up trying and just followed the crowds, reading signs and missing a lot of good info. There is a simulated "ride" experience that was very cheesey and long lines for "learning to pour your own beer" experience. Three free beers were part of tour and a huge gift shop at the end to tempt you further. All in all, not worth the $20+ unless you are Heineken fan.
Lots of fun. We had a great time, it was lots of fun. Very informative and pretty cool. I would definitely recommend adding this to your itinerary.

Worth visiting. I'd read several good reviews before visiting, and was impressed by the tour, although I expected there to be a little more to it in terms of learning about the process of brewing the beer etc. The 2 free drinks were an unexpected bonus and the demonstration on the correct way to drink the Heineken was interesting. Overall a decent attraction, although making the tour a little more extensive would be good.
Nice place to visit. The tour was pretty informative. I am non-alcoholic but I still enjoyed the tour. Especially the 4D video.At the exit you have few entertainment zones which are also good.

Lots of gimmicks ... and lots of queues. I don't know if we were unlucky, but we visited here on a Saturday and it was stiflingly hot inside and the queues were horrendous.In fact, it was so bad we bypassed part of the attraction because the queue didn't seem to move for ages.There were lots of gimmicks, lots of things to do, but because of the queues all the way through we just got fed up and left.Not as well managed as i would have expected and no one was telling anyone how long you might have to wait at any stage.Promised a lot, but for us, delivered very little.

Really enjoyable. We had read the reviews, but thought this sounded great. Not really sure why there is so much negative reviewing. We loved it, light hearted and informative. Firstly if you have a smart phone you can get the app for the tour. There are lots of chances to have fun photos.. Information about how it's made and even every so often staff tell you about the beer. There were four of us and the none lager drinking member of the group had as good a time as any of us. We played the games, tried the beer and loved the fun - being brewed experience. Definitely worth the money, even more so if you book before you go, it's 2euros cheaper. The only thing we weren't convinced about was the size of the head on the beer! Each person had three glasses of beer, and a gift of a Heineken glass to take home. What is there not to enjoy? Would def recommend!!!!

Excellent place! Must visit!. We went here this weekend and we absolutely, thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We were in a group of 6 and had a fantastic experience.The museum/ brewery is so interactive and fun- Heineken have put a lot of effort into making this a brilliant place to have fun and learn about the beer and brand too.Every part of the experience is interactive and engaging. The staff are all really friendly and good fun too.At the end of the visit you can get a boat down to the brandstore to pick up your free gift. We never made it to the store but we thoroughly enjoyed the relaxing boat ride across town. Overall, I'd recommend this as a must visit attraction in Amsterdam.
Heineken Experience. We've been there on the 150 anniversary, it's was a nice experience,The old brewery is interesting still there is room for improvement.

Amazing! Went twice!. My husband and I took out kids to the Heineken Experience on our first trip to Amsterdam, and when we went back two years later, we took them (and my mother-in-law) again. They something for everyone, and it was truly a wonderful experience.

Waste of money, bit bizzare.. I was really looking forward to this experience, however it was terribly organised and staff were pretty rude and despite having ID proving im well over legal age to drink, I found female staff to just pick out random girls and just embarrass them during the experience questioning their age despite ID, this was not done to any male and should it have been any form of problem, they should check ID more securely on the door. However, during the experience I had no idea what was going on! Really empty, and well... strange. All you really got to see was empty copper distillers. I think it's been tried to be trendied up, however it was odd with djs in empty rooms with neon lights flashing, and horses in a stable outside as part of the experience. I just didn't get it, I thought it would be beer related. Not worth it!

Interesting but room for improvement. The first thing to say is that this is a very commercialised experience, which should perhaps be expected. The first part of the experience is about Heineken's history which covers the basics but lacks any real depth. The old brewery is interesting, especially the films projected inside the old coppers. However, the creativity perhaps goes too far at times as some display boards giving more detailed information about the brewing process would have helped. The second part of the experience is rather random yet also fun. The virtual 'ride' through the brewery was very novel, and other displays were interesting, yet I also had a feeling that the experience was basically a large queue for the 'free' drinks at the end. We had discounted tickets which we bought in advance through the Lovers Canal Tour company, but I do feel that the actual full entry fee is rather expensive for what's on offer.

Soon got going. The tour started off in quite a stuffy way, but soon picked up pace. By the end, you are fully immersed in the brewing process! The crew who guide you are excellent and outgoing and the number of things to do surprised me. Much more than your average brewery tour.
Bad experience . Very poor experience stood in small rooms packed no air con very expensive you don't see anything but old copper distillers.

informative and well organised. I thought this tour was good Covered thebasics of brewing for those who dont already know, my son enjoyed some of the tech interactive parts I think I paid 8.50 euros extra for a burger on the roof terrace with a beer,this was very pleasant I also hadnt expected the shuttle boat that was free if you wanted taken via the canals to the heineken store near the centre Overall an enjoyable time
Waste of Money. Made the mistake of going here on a Saturday. Very badly organised with throngs of people just following each other like sheep. Could not hear/see a thing.

Sorry! Spend your time somewhere else. You pay for the advertisement. I usually do not write negative reviews. To begin, Heineken is and was my favorite beer. So I looked forward to this attraction. We were encouraged to go here by my grandson. This attraction was absurdly expensive. It only was an advertisement for Heineken that you end up paying many euros to get loaded with many different forms of advertisements for Heineken. I have been to the Guiness Brewery in Ireland and Jack Daniels in Lynchburg. They were working facilities and interesting. Heineken was just an expensive tour from one ad to another. Then they gave you a glass of beer at the end of the walk through. A major disappointment.

Nice interactive exhibit, good beer and an awesome marketing/brand experience. I might be a suspect since I work in advertising and love beer (even though I wasn't a Heineker drinker before that), but I must tell you it's a very interesting break in a touring day in Amsterdam. The first part of the visit is an interactive walk-through a Heineken "factory" (even though beer isn't produced there anymore, the actual factory is a few km away), where you'll see the history of the Heineken family and how they created the business, as you walk through rooms decorated as pubs, factories and labs. You even get to proof beer and learn a thing or two about how you should drink it, serve it and enjoy it. The second part is a whole immersive experience in all Heineken marketing campaigns and brand assets, all connected to the internet, videos and social networks, and there you can be a part of all Heineken has ever made about soccer, the tv campaigns (the candidate, the visit, the party), and so on. Really interesting. Then there's a bar where you'll get some beer and a big shop with all things Heineken.

a good afternoon. This was a good brewery tour (although no brewing on site). Some of it was a bit "plastic" but the interactive bits were good and interesting. The tour guides were informative and as with all good brewery trips there was plenty of beer on the way round. It was a hot day so they even provided free water for everyone. Two drinks and a gift are included in the price, plus there are other opportunities to sample the beer on the way round. Add to that the free 30 minute canal trip to their brand store and it is a good value trip.
Great attraction . Would definitely encourage anyone visiting Amsterdam to make an effort to visit here. Very interesting and entertaining. I wouldn't recommend bringing children though.

Cool brewery tour. Not your typical European brewery tour experience. It's pricey, but it's a pretty lengthy attraction. There's even a "ride" where you get "bottled" - it's cheesy but the beer garden is worth it, and you might learn a few things too.

Even if you don't like Heineken, it's worth it. Very interesting and educating tour. No matter what you taste in beer is, the tour teaches you many things about beer which I did not know and makes you apperciate that cold one even more. Worth the trip and the time. Cheers!
joyful experince. A nice way of presenting beer. The experience has improved a lot from 9 years ago when I had visited the first time. You learn a lot about making beer but you also have fun.

Good campy fun. The Heineken Experience is a fun, campy trip through the process of brewing beer.It starts with a narrated trip through the history of the Heineken family, then get to see all the steps in brewing beer. The "Brew You" ride is a cheesy bit of fun, followed by the tasting room, where they show you the proper way to drink a Heineken. The viewing room with the comfortable couches and the constantly running ads is entertaining, and the Heineken activities are great including music videos, green screen pictures, and viewing chairs.Of course no tour is complete without a free drink at the end.When i paid I thought the entrance fee was a bit high until I realized everything you get for it. You get the tour, 2 free beers, all the fun activities, a free gift, and (if you chose) a canal boat ride. Great for a bit of good clean fun in the center of town.

Tourist trap!. Ok, I will admit it was cool to see where and how Heineken got its start. However, if you have seen one beer brewery you have seen them all. We decided that it was the M&M World of beer--cool if you enjoy that type of thing, but in our case our time and money would have been better spent elsewhere.

Good to pass the time in a rain storm.... We ducked in here during a downpour and spent a couple of hours. Much of the tour is self guided and well, fluff. There are some cool rooms where you get to see how the beer is really made and the equipment that used to make it. You also get a couple of beers at the end of the tour. You can probably get through this in under an hour if its not too crowded.

A must do. This was my 2nd visit to the Heineken Experience.It was as a remembered it, and it had also improved.The tour is fantastic and you get 2 beers included. I actually learnt some things about Heineken which I never knew about.Great value for money and a must do for all beer lovers.

Great experience! . Went with family and friends and had a great time, even my 12yr old enjoyed it...she didn't partake on the beer tasting but she brew me a beer and got to play with the interactive technology they have..fun times!

Excellent trip to Heineken Experience. Interesting - interactive experience.Great value for money with free drinks thrown in, chance to pour your own beer and have lunch on the roof overlooking Amsterdam.

Fun Rainy Day Retreat. We had a very wet thundery day during our visit and our hotel was close to the Heineken Experience so we thought it would be a good way to wait out the rain. Myself and my 18 year old daughter had a laugh. Entry includes a few free beers and a free gift (a beer glass).

Fun touristic attraction for young and old.. Located in the heart of Amsterdam, this is a nice touristic attraction. It's very commercialized of course so it is definitely not an authentic cultural experience, but it is a lot of fun.You get to learn about the Heineken brand and on the manufacturing of beer, a lot of opportunities to taste beer. A nice place to spend fun 2-3 hours. It's suitable for adults but also for children, although they may not enjoy the beer.Also very suitable for a rainy day in Amsterdam.The price includes a free boat trip in the canals of Amsterdam and it is certainly worth the trip if the weather is good.

Well worth seeing. In the heart of Amsterdam is the Heineken experience, and well worth a visit, see how the brewing process takes place, learn the history of the beer, enjoy 2 free drinks and learn the art of drinking it! You can even buy your own personalised bottle. Also has a well stocked gift shop with everything Heineken.

Ordinary. It was just some old beer bottles and a guy telling us how to drink a beer. Nothing else to see.
The only good thing was the shop.

Very expensive and uninteresting collection of branding and advertisments. I am quite upset that I have spent 18 Euros on this exhibition. It is not guided and certainly isn't a tour. The only human interaction is being told how to drink Heineken beer before being directed into another room that just shows you their recent TV advertisements.There is very little about making beer in the tour and even less to do with a working brewery. Throughout the tour you are constantly reminded about how great Heineken is and how it is the "best beer in the world". I suspect Heineken have something to hide as their was almost no detail on how this bland mass-produced beer is really manufactured and I can only assume that this is accepted within Holland through loyalty towards a Dutch brand and as a large employer to the Netherlands.Save your 18 Euros.

Fun "brewery" tour. Went there for an afternoon. Purchased wristband tickets for €18 (two drink tokens and a free gift) We got to learn a lot about the history of Heineken, how their company came to be, and the brewing process of their beer. I enjoyed seeing their original brewery facility and all the beautiful copper stills and the stables. Halfway though the tour we learned how to properly taste a beer and why the head on top of the beer is so important. Then got to play around in a interactive area where we took a free via email Heineken Experience photo. At the end of the tour we were given two options: two token for a large "extra cold" beer or two tokens for cold slightly smaller glasses. I forget the exact ounce sizes per glass but I know you get more beer for the two smaller ones. For our free gift you have to go to their flagship store which is a walk 15 min (or wait for their shuttle boat...runs once an hour if u can catch it) I thought it would be faster for us to walk, wrong choice...I had a hard time navigating because there are Heineken signs at every pub which made it a bit difficult to find and it took me twice as long as it should have. Once there we were greeted by friendly staff and given our complimentary Heineken glass. Overall I think it's a good value and would recommend to a friend.

Drink and be Merry!. This is a definite must do when visiting Amsterdam. I was very surprised how many interactive areas they have throughout the tour. It is not just drinking beer, it is much more. It starts out with a history lesson, then shows you the production of how to make beer. Then you go to a taste test section where you sample their product, Heineken beer. After that you go to a real cool interactive section where you can take photos and videos and email them to your family and friends from there. You are given tokens to redeem at the end of the tour for more beer at their cool bar. You can redeem a gift from their gift store but it is not located in same building.

fun and cute. It's my second time and it's kind of a cute expericence. make sure you buy your tickets on line to skip the line and save a few coins. The free gift is a very cute small Heineken glass. First and second time it's a nice attraction, it's very close to Albert Cuyp Market if you step out a bit dizzy from drinking :)

WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE. We went here the afternoon we arrived in Amsterdam and it proved to be a great afternoon. This is a self guided tour except for one or two places when you get the staff explaining the procedures. It caused no problem as everything was in English and there are clear dierections. You get to know the history of the Heineken Beer and how it was started by the family of the same name and how the recipe is kept a secret even upto now. You will see the brewing process from begining to the end and it was great fun combined with interaction and you can even try your hand in pouring the beer properly. If you passed the test you even get a certificate. There are two glasses of beer at the end of the tour added to the one you get during halfway of the tour. It is great fun and crowded just like a normal pub in England but quite relaxing with live entertainment to amuse you whilst having the drink. There is a souvenir of a beer glass and you get a free canal ride to the other side of the city where the souvenir shop is. So it was a free round trip of a boat ride which was a bonus and well worth the money.Tip:: If you have a Amsterdam Card you get a discount on the entrance fee.

LIVELY. What a fantastic experience, atmosphere was lively and fun. The ride was great. Three free beers included, shame we don't drink it :( plus a free gift (a lovely keepsake glass), thank God I didn't buy one first!Would go again and would definitely recommend.

Interactive and Funny Tour. We had great time at Heineken Experience Tour, you can see the brewing process in a very funny and interactive way. The Staff are friendly, you can find great souvenir ideas. I recommend to visit.

overpriced.. Went here for an afternoon. €18 entry money, keep it on your pocket. Typical tourist rubbish, history of Heineken family and brewery. At the end of the tour you get 2 small glasses of Heineken to drink and a very small souvenir glass which won't even hold a 1/2 pint. Expensive souvenir shop at the end. Disappointed.

Awesome!. It was interesting to know how beers are being made. You've got to know the family history, marketing strategies, recipes. Hands on to the processing and interactions with the system of it. Had fun things to do like taking pictures, games, dancing with the DJ. Most of all, we've learned how to drink beer properly! Of course, you've got 2 glasses of free beer!It's their 150th anniversary, got a souvenir glass for free. Only in Amsterdam.

good tour. the tour is worth the price and is informative and interactive. A guided tasting session, activities and the opportunity to drink beer finally in the old brewery is a unique experience. It may be worth buying the ticket online first though, and also you can download an app that allows you to navigate the tour freely.

How they make beer museum. Place is more than you may expect when your first enter here. Place has history phase but it's continues and continues..... BEWARE: entry fee includes free beer, but it's OK take other on soft drink.Place last part on old brewery and there has lots place to explore. Also there is realistic ride inside, one part is movie theater one part fun park. Museum store has lot thing to buy, you may visit there even later. Is OK take photos as much your like here. Want beer bottle with your own name ? OK, is possible hereWant test how easy is use beer pistol ? It's found here on virtual version. Place is REAL old factory / brewery so there lot's levels, walking is way to move here, no wagons. Some areas they don't like kids.

Excellent value for money. Having no interest in beer, I wasn't expecting much out of this experience. However, I had a really amazing time and was one of the favourite things I did. We saved €1 through a coupon, but even without this it is still excellent value for money as I had a fantastic 3 hours of fun, 3 small free beers and a free Heineken glass. I got this engraved for €3 at the shop too. It's a very interactive experience, although they do have lots of historical information as well. I still don't like beer, but if I did I'd drink Heineken! A must visit.

Fun times!!. I have been to a few different breweries. The Heineken experience is WAY more than just a brewery tour. It was a tour to show how beer is made, a museum to give the history of the Heineken label, an interactive area just for fun and of course, a place to drink beer and have a burger. I thought they did a great job of making it really fun! When it's all over, you can take the water taxi toward the center of town (free, but you must reserve your seat) AND get a free souveneir beer glass.

A must when in Amsterdam!. This is a great experience with some unexpected highlights but I won't spoil the surprise!You need at least 2 hours to do this and a bit more if you want to do the canal ride to the merchandise shop.You also get to taste the beer and then 2 free half pints in a cool bar at the end :)

Good visit. The Heineken "brewery" is not actually still active as a brewery. It is a former brewery that has been converted into museum with the focus on a lot of interactive exhibits. We were there on a pretty quite day which was good because we could wonder through at our own pace with not too much hassle. The history of the Hieneken brand as well as the beer making process is explained to a good level without being too boring. Included in the price is a beer tasting as well as two free beers at the end of the tour plus a free small glass, all included in the admission fee. It takes 1-2 hours for a visit.

Grab the Heine-ken Experience. The line to get in was not well coordinated and created some tension between visitors. Once in the venue, the history, the exhibits, the horses and the staff were all amazing! There is a lot to do and it is all very interactive.

A+ for beer fans, and an A for curious travellers. I am no beer fan - hate the taste, never been into the whole "how is it made" and have no idea what is the difference between a lager and a non-lager. I visited the museum with my mum (I was 16 at the time), and as the legal non-spirit drinking age in NL is 16, with my band I was given one beer (over 18s are given two beer tokens), which I promptly given away. The tour is interesting and captivating, even for a non-beer person, the inner workings of brewery, the fun trivia from company's story and the seed tasting was great fun. Definitely worth a trip, even with your non-drinking children - it's a cool museum, that puts otherwise boring manufacturing process in a fun perspective, plus, the beer lovers are gonna be in seven heaven.

get pre-purchased tickets to avoid long queue. We got our discounted ticket from the hop on hop off bus. When we get there, there's a long line in the entrance where we were able to skip since already have tickets. It was a good experience and beer tastes great (coming from a not-a-big-fan of beer). Tour includes free beers (3 glass) and a gift.
Where the air con at. Dude it's so fkn hot in here, how the hell do you have a multi billion dollar company but no air con!
Fabulous!. Great! Lovely staff, very informative presentation. So fun must go there! reasonable price at 15 euro. Got to pull our own pints and have lots of great memories there. GO GO GO!xx

Brilliant. We had a wonderful time here, well worth the €16.00 we paid, it was a very interesting tour and you got to learn a lot about the beer and why they leave a large head on the beer, I shall no longer complain in bars about that, also it wasn't too crowded the staff were all very pleasant and helpful, I loved to see the horses too., when we got to taste the beer I did think that at the one end you could get a certificate for pulling a good beer but that there was only one member of staff on at that end so there was a big queue could have done with a couple more staff , also Heineken We think you are missing out as we were having such a great time with the DJ that we thought we could stay here if they had a bar where you could pay for your beer but sadly you didn't so we had to move on.

Better than expected. Went to the Heineken experience as a last minute idea while in Amsterdam. Was recommended by some friends that had been. I would recommend pre purchasing tickets as we waited in line for over one hour to get in. The staff was very friendly and apologetic for the long wait. Once inside we found it to be a great experience, lots of history of the brewery and then they had many interactive stations. These were the most fun for me. How to properly pour a beer. Beer tasting and how to propely drink a beer. Overall very good. Lots of gift shops items available if that interests you.
Good fun. Entertaining and informative - good value. 2 free beers at the end and a free gift. Great if it's raining as it's all indoors...

Heineken Experience. Really enjoyable and great activity to do whilst in Amsterdam. Very friendly staff and quality customer service. They must really enjoy it! Very unique and a must. Booked tickets online, however turns out would have been cheaper to do book when in Amsterdam, still a bargain. Would go again!

A Great Time!. We had done the culture museums and today is was time for something fun...just the thing! It was raining as well and this was a perfect way to spend a couple of hours. It was very informative, the staff were all great, they manage the crowds well so it's not stifling. We bought tickets ahead of time with the Holland Pass which made it easy to get in. Got to sample the beer for free and have a personalized bottle made for 6 euros.Thoroughly enjoyable!

Must see attraction for Amsterdam. This experience was recommended to us by friends who had gone recently. As neither of us are fussed about beer, we didn't expect to enjoy but were greatly surprised and chuffed we went. Little tip, if you go by ferry or check your hotel and look for the little discount cards on the wall near reception as there is Heineken experience discount cards allowing €3 discount per person. Good value with discount. Overall really interesting and worth going. Loved the interactive parts and learning to pull a proper pint and tasting Heineken etc. All staff are excellent and knowledgable.

Well worth it. We had an amazing time here. Expect a queue but for us it wasn't too long. The experience itself was fun, informative and the staff were great. It took about 2 hours and included a beer to do the tasting, then two beers at the end and a glass to take home. We felt it was worth the money and highly recommend it.
A must see. What an experience!!!!! Very well done, a totally interactive experience. Staff was extremely friendly.

Beer good!. This is a fantastic way to spend a few hours in Amsterdam (especially if it's a cold or rainy day) and have a couple of beers (or more) into the bargain. Learn Heineken history and also how beer is made.

Cheers! !. Visited the brewery with my 2 sons aged 15 and 12. They enjoyed the whole experience without being able to sample the goods and were happy to personalise a bottle as a souvenir. Both being footballers they had fun with the fusbol and the PS3s. There was plenty of fun and 'being a bottle' was a laugh. Best brewery/distillery experience I've had and would recommend.

Great Time, Heineken. It was a rainy day in Amsterdam, so I decided to go into the museum. I was happy I went in, perfect way to waste a few hours. The tour itself had so many fun things to do. It had all the normal brewery processes you would expect, and the tastings during and after. There is a store near the end with a lot of souvenir's. The price was a bit pricey, but I am used to most brewery tours being free. But they had so many interactive events for us to do while inside the brewery, and a lot of culture related to Amsterdam. Definitely worth checking out, and drinking a Heineken!

Fun, active visit to a Cultural Landmark.. Ok, it is a brewery with a museum and tour to help people understand the history of the brand. Which is exactly what one would expect from the name. The tour takes you from the original brewers up to current day. There is usually a line to get in the doors.The tour is not as interactive as other places, but very enjoyable. You can see the brew kettles and learn how the beer is made, from start to finish. After the tour you can spend time in the "experience" which includes video games, pictures and other interactive events.The final part of the tour is the beer dinking section. You can learn (as if you don't already know!!) how to pour beer and do it "right". It all in fun and you can drin k your mistakes!!Worth the admission cost and time to visit.

Cool!. We did not know what to expect for this, and we were really happy to make it! You can take as many picturs as you want, the staff is friendly, you get two beers and a gift, and also you become a beer! Is really fun and I trully recommend this! FUN FUN FUN

Creative. Very creative and interactive way of telling Heineken history and production processes. Interesting to see how the family is still involved in the business. Nice tips from the beer tasting expert.Go with time if you are a beer fans, there are a lot of activities to do!

Fun!. A lot of people feel that this experience is too expensive, I don't. I fell that for 16 Euros you get a nice tours and free drinks. A few tips: - Buy your ticket online prior. you will save a few bucks and will not have to wait in the super long line at the ticket booth. - Once the tour is over and you get your 2 free beers, take the elevator to the last floor. they don't advertise but there is a very nice and large rooftop bar with a BEAUTIFUL view of the city. - Overall is a fun experience that took us about 2 hrs

The Heineken experience made us like Heineken a lot less… (and we like beer very much). Mostly an exhibit of Heineken advertisement and branding. Has very little to do with beer.This is one experience we could have done without.

For 25 years old and under.... My husband and I had heard good things about the Heineken experience attraction so decided to give it a try. We had a terrible time. The first part of the tour is one big commercial for Heineken, extolling the virtues of the Heineken family. Then there is a section on the beer making process which isn't all that exciting. Next a virtual reality "lite" experience ride where you stand in a small auditorium and they show a film where you are the beer being brewed, all the while the ground beneath you shakes a little to simulate different parts of the brewing or bottling process and you get sprayed with a little water. The last part were all types of interactive stations which, if you were under 25, would be fun (simulated beer pouring, making a music video, etc.). There are much more interesting things to do in Amsterdam.

Too expensive. The staff was really friendly, but overall the "Experience" was cheesy. It was a glorified brewery tour, which many breweries do for free. But here you pay 16Euro and don't get much more than the free tours. If you have done other brewery tours or tastings then save your money.

FUN AND BEER. Not too far away from museumplein the old factory of Heineken beer welcomes you and gives information about beer making and Heineken's history. But there are many atractions there (some interactive) so you will really have fun. Perhaps you think that the entrance fee of 18 EUROS is expensive. Have in mind that it gives you the opportunity to enjoy 3 small beers there, and also a souvenir present which you have to collect it from there other flag shop, nearby.

Heineken Experience. We went on a Friday afternoon and there was no wait time. We didn't have the city map with the coupon on it, so we just asked if we could have the discount anyways, and we got 3E off each 18E ticket. The tour takes you through the history of Heineken, how the beer is made (with a little ride where you're "made into beer"), a tasting, and then there's a few more activities before you end up in the lounge/bar area where you get 2 free drinks. There is a store on the way out, and you can also walk to the other Heineken store to get you're free present (a glass with the Heinken logo). At the beginning we though the price was a little steep; however after the 2 free drinks, the tasting, the free gift it and the length of the tour we didn't mind the cost.

Museum for adults with free beers.. We were expecting a grand museum with boring antiques but we were pleasantly surprised by the tour. Basically, they give you a rubber bracelet with pins on it, 2 for your 2 free glasses of beer. (Not really free since you paid for the tour) and one free gift at the brand store which unfortunately is a bit far from the Heineken Experience. You start out with a short introduction then you can get your pictures taken at their photo wall with wall props for effect. They have short video clips, a short walk around the halls, and a short wait before you get "brewed." I'm not going to spoil it for everyone but the tour got some great photo ops ideas and interactive games. At the end of the tour you get to enjoy your glasses of beer with other visitors and we get to meet some awesome peeps from the USA and Australia. All in all, a fun experience but definitely not for kids or those who don't like beer.

Pleasant surprise. Went with friends, the experience is staged in the old brewery, nice interactive, informative displays, free beer tasting, fun "ride" that takes you through the brewing process, comes with 2 beers, a canal ride to their souvenir shop to pick up your free beer glass. If you have two hours to kill in Amsterdam consider this spot. Cost is 15 with coupon.

Awesome attraction, good value and interesting.. This is much more than just a brewery tour. It includes the history of the company, the brewing process, interactive attractions, beer tasting, more beer, and if you want for an extra €7 a burger and another beer on the rooftop. It is extremely well designed and kept us interested throughout the tour. There is also a free gift included (varies by day but usually a bottle opener or glass), and you get 2 medium beers and a small beer on the way round. Normal admission is €18. Free WiFi throughout.

Heineken experience. Not really much of an expedience in brewing or making lager but a good way to spend a few hours, they have some good special affect in an entertainment room and a good bar, part of the entry included 2 x halves, but we also chose the burger option which we had after the tour, only about €6 more than the price of the entrance and it included an extra beer, and was a good way to meet other traveller and sit and relax in the roof with a good view of the city.

A museum of beer marketing?. Over the years, I have been to a few of these factory/museum places, with a great anticipation that your going to walk in they will shake you readily by the hand and you will over indulge on the products, and go home saying 'Wow! That was truly the place to visit when going to so and so' Unfortunately on every occasion you come out dazed and confused from all the history, the technical information, all the really 'cool' ways they advertised over the years, lots of stuff about who they sponsor, but at the end of the day, to me it just shows what suckers we are.Heineken has cornered the lager market for decades and through hard sale brainwashing and advertising that makes alcohol look witty, handsome and cool, when it is just a lager like every other lager in the world.This museum is testimony to the way they have flooded the market for years, I have also been to such like 'museums' in other parts of the world, and they are exactly the same, just a different brand name.There is a whole lot more to the beautiful city of Amsterdam than just the red light district, the 'coffee' shops, the sex shops, stag nights, Heineken brewery, sex museum, sleaziness etc, unfortunately very few people go beyond these things. Please do, you will have a truly great experience in probably the greatest city on earth!Talk to the locals, they all speak English, they'll tell you where to go, and it won't be where you think, and you'll have a great time, trust me. Danke well Amsterdam!
Tourist trap?. They show you how beer is brewed and you get to taste Heineken. Except for that it was not very interesting. Not a family thing. Expensive.

3rd times a charm!. This is my 3rd time to the Heineken Experience and every time it gets better! Yes its the same walking around but the interactive zone just gets better, highly recommend this to anyone visiting Amsterdam, if you want a laugh and some videos and pictures (for free) this is for you!
Worth visiting. If you are a beer lover, this is the place for you, however cost wise this is on expensive side. Like the way they explained hwo they maek beer.

Really fun museum - even if you dont like beer!. We went here for my partners birthday and I was pleasantly surprised! Being somebody who cant stand beer the museum was a lot of fun and I enjoyed every single bit of it. There definitely isnt a dull moment!

The most surprising yet amazing experience. Absolutely fantastic. Before we went to The Heineken Experience we didn't know what to expect, and seriously underestimated it. It was very interesting, with all the information you would expect from a museum but tailored to the process of making heineken beer in a unique way. Plus, since we were 18, we got a reduction of 7 Euros (at the time of visiting in July 2014).

That calls for a Carlsberg. What a total ripoff....18€ down the drain, and waist of time standing in line, like pigs waiting to be slaughtered.This is Amsterdam's answer to an amusement park, but I wasn't amused at all. When you get to the area where you get your "one free beer" don't wear your best shoes, the floor I dirty and is so sticky, that you hardly can't make it to the exit.

Expensive but great fun. I didn't even think I liked Heinken before visiting so obviously their marketing is spot on!The ticket is expensive but you get a tour of the history of the company, taught how to drink it properly, several rooms of interactive stuff that anyone in the family would enjoy, and a bar at the end to enjoy two free beers each.
Worth a visit. Great place to go. The staff were helpful and friendly. Interesting and fun experience, the rooftop and burger well worth doing and with a canal trip at the end. Highly recommend.

Ok experience, nice couple of drinks, overpriced for what you get.. Very expensive to get in to the museum, first 15 minutes is full of the history of Heineken. The interactive parts are fun but we're very short. You can brew your own personalised beer (at an extra cost!) gift shop is good and you can an engraved beer glass, which is surprisingly cheap! Wouldn't say it's a must see attraction when visiting Amsterdam!

A fun place, worth the visit. The Heineken Experience tour inside the old brewery lets the visitors learn about the process or brewing used by Heineken, includes a few stops to drink great cold beer and in addition to that - there are video games and many fun rooms inside the building. I think this tour is worth the visit and could be a nice way to spend the noon-afternoon time for travelers in Amsterdam.

Loved it!!. Quite different to Carlsberg Brewery in Copenhagen.Really well done, obviously catered to getting people to buy souvenirs, and mass advertising inside, but had a really good time! Price includes two small beers, as well as a third ("tasting" beer), and they had an easy quiz which correct answers were rewarded with another beer. Also got a free heineken glass, although we had to walk to another store quite a way to get it.Can look at, try and mix the mixture/beer at certain processes, which i think was missing from the carlsberg tour. Also had a 'ride' - fairly amusing.Overall, was really good value for money!!

Heineken is the greatest beer in the world...according to Heineken. The Heineken experience, begins with a brief annoyingly patronising tour through the history of the Heineken brewery, that has a few interesting facts hidden amongst the mass amount of rhetoric of how Heineken is the greatest beer in the world and is the greatest company ever to grace humanity. After that you see the old brewery room which is pretty boring.Then you see some horses in some stables through a pane of glass, before going though gimmick after gimmick, until eventually you get served two Heineken pints (but they're not real pints), and the person serving my drinks, didn't even laugh when I asked for a double vodka lemonade!?!?! LIKE WHAT.Anyway, its a pretty well paced experience, so if your in a very light hearted mood its ideal but there really is not much in it. I actually quite like Heineken.
Great fun!. We bought our tickets for this on the tourist bus and had a great time. There is loads to see and do and drink!Although not a fan of lager, I drank what was on offer and enjoyed it!
Nice visit. Neat to explore and see. Lots of interCtive visits and samples included with admission. Good for a break after art museums.

Interactive, Engaging, and Delicious!. One of the BEST experiences we had in Amsterdam was the Heineken Experience. To give you an idea of what you can expect:1) Audio-visual and interactive features throughout the museum. Everywhere you turn, you can find a video or interactive feature that teaches you the history of Heineken. It is incredibly engaging and really enhances the experience. From stirring your own hops to "becoming" a beer in a multimedia "ride," you will always be entertained during your visit. 2) Purchasing your tickets online in advance allows you to avoid waiting in line. We purchased our tickets ahead, and it saved us about 20 minutes of waiting. We were able to walk right into the museum. 3) Tasting time! As a group, you will experience your first Heineken taste then you will have time to spend in the tasting room. The bracelet that you receive upon entry will allow you two beer tastings. The museum was definitely a good value for the money.
Good fun. Well worth spending an hour or two here - the guides are very knowledgeable and are keen to take questions - with a tasting at the end !

Worth the visit. We had heard from friends that the brewery was worth the visit. We were pleasantly surprised of what a good time we had visiting. They have done a first class job putting the tour together. It was busy and they move you along fairly quick. There is alot for the younger ones to do with computers etc. We really enjoyed it. It was a nice break after sightseeing all day.

definitly should be on you itenerary. Its one of the best brewery museums I have visited. Its a mix of fun and knowledge. they show you how beer is made right from the raw ingredients. there is a beer tasting session where the expert explains some fun facts about Heineken. You can get your name printed on a Heineken beer bottle, excellent gift idea. You can also print your photo on a collection of T-shirts. very good value for money, 2 free drinks at the end of the tour. Cool gift shop.Try to avoid weekend, they can get very crowded.

Nice, make a visit. Heiniken experience is a must if you like this beer. Okey similiar to Guiness in Dublin. Anyway a good self tour with Heniken history and how the beer is made. At the end you get a big beer, I took a ice cold Heiniken, tasted very good.

Interactive for the Whole Family. I was not looking forward to another beer tour, but I must admit this one was incredibly interactive. The kiddos (of all ages) can enjoy the multitude of interactive games/videos while the adults get to enjoy a couple adult beverages. Learning how to drink the brew did make it much more enjoyable for me as well. I'm a wine drinker and seldom enjoy a brew, but when in Amsterdam you must drink some brew.

Yea, beer!. I didn't originally intend to do this, but went along with a friend I met on my trip. I actually really enjoyed the tour. The museum is really well done, and the tour is really informative. I'm not a big Heineken drinker (though I do love beer), and I found the brew from the Netherlands to be markedly more tasty than what we get here in the US. Overall, I'd do it again!

Great to check out with friends!. You pay fee of 18 euros for the admission, 2 beers and a souvenir glass. This place is very interactive and fun! They do not brew beer here but it's a great to learn about their brewing process.

Great fun and great value!. My husband and I completed the tour yesterday and were optomistic having read previous reviews.We thoroughly enjoyed it, the staff were friendly/knowledgable and there was lots of different aspects to it. Afterwards we took the shuttle boat up to the Heineken shop, which was a lovely way to see the city.

Worth a visit. We visited here on 12th July 2014. We didn't have to queue longer than five minutes to get a ticket and get inside the venue. You can pick up discount vouchers on maps etc whilst your out and about which knocks about a euro off the price per person. We paid 16 euro per person . You get 2 free beers whilst your going round which is good although it's less than half a pint. It was interesting and the brewing kettles were huge and worth seeing it was also good to see how thing have change through time. Your also supposed to get a free gift but it's a fifteen minute walk away from the museum and it's just a free small beer tasting glass so we didn't bother. The gift shop was brilliant at the end. It's definitely worth a look around

Beer contains 92% water!!. This was such a fab expereince! included in ticket price you get a full tour of factroy, play games related to beer, get to make your own beer, get photos/ wristbands etc as memorobilia. You also get to brand your own beer for someone, although we only had hand luggae so couldnt take it home for dad! A must see. Plus that 92% fact, guess where we learnt that ;) Enjoy!!

A must see!. This is certainly somewhere to visit on your trip to Amsterdam! I found it very interesting and there was lots of free beer to try! Not only are there things to look at, you have staff telling you how it is brewed in addition to various games, photo opportunities and even the chance to pay for a personalised beer bottle. They also offer a free boat trip to their Heineken store meaning you get to see more sights of Amsterdam. It was certainly worth the money and I would definitely go back again.

Great tour. Very worthwhile . Although no beer is actually brewed here anymore , it takes you through the process and the big copper kettles are gorgeous. You learn about how it all started and the family involvement up to present day. The brew ride is fun. Loved seeing the horses. Included in admission price is 2 free drinks and a gift of a glass . In the tasting room you get another free beer , and if you answer questions correctly maybe another as well. We'll worth a visit .

Fun day!! And free beers. Went here admit was raining in Amsterdam and had not much else to do we were not expecting much but had a laugh there are plenty of things to do and see and the free beers were a good additive too! We couldn't get the free boat ride back as there wernt enough seats but would of licked to have done that.

Quite disappointing. It was a waste of time and money. Place was overcrowded. There were few bottlenecks along the tour in which 150-200 people were crowded in a narrow corridor with no air and extreme temperature (just before the semi-interactive show). The beer, served in 2 locations along the tour, was the worst we drank in Amsterdam (and we mostly drank Heineken everywhere). The drinks given to the kids was too diluted to be called a soft drink. Really disappointing compared to the high price of the tour.

Not really what I expected but it was Ok.. I was expecting more of a brewery tour but this was more like a museum. They don't even make beer here anymore so it was a bit disappointing in that regard. Seemed pretty expensive for that it was. Not bad, but not great.

Worth the time. Was very interesting visiting the "brewery" and learning a little bit about how Heineken is brewed. The entire attraction was very well done.....lots of things to see and do. The BEST part was the icy cold Heineken you got at the end of the tour!

Fun experience. This was really a fun experience. Started with some history and with presentations on how the beer gets brewed, etc. Then it got really interesting with a quick beer tasting, interactive movie, 2 free beers and a free gift (ours was a free beer glass). Was great fun.

Different and enjoyable. My family and I visited the Heineken experience recently and thoroughly enjoyed it. It is more than just learing about brewing beer but also how the company was built up by the Heineken family from small beginnings to the global brand it is now - and we were able to taste a few samples.The only downside is that the 'free' gift included in the admission price involves a trip to another site - we didn't have time to do that so missed out. It seems unreasonable that the gifts can't be provided at the end of the tour.
Boring. A waste of time. The store is the only worthwhile part (unless you think drinking wort is wort 14 euro). House of bols is much better

Fun and Interesting. An interesting tour of Heineken's history. From the beginning to the brand building experience. There is an actual "ride" that demonstrates the brewing process that is a fun way to learn how beer is made. More interactive than other brewery tour I have experienced in the US. The last part focuses on building the Heineken brand. Overall a good experience.
Very Interesting. An experience not to be missed. From historical information to current information with loads of interaction to make it fun fun fun... oh and a few drinks to finish off with.

Do not waste your time. This is a very gimmicky tour. A big advertisement for Heineken. We walked through and had human interaction with 1 guide who described how to drink beer. That was it. Everyone talks about the free beer but in reality you are paying €20 for the admission ticket. Definitely not worth it. Better off going and buying a bunch of pints at a local pub.

Very good interactive brewery tour. This is a really cool brewery tour. There is a lot to learn, see and it is very interactive. The beers you get at the end are a plus, as well as the pretty chilled bar you drink them in with all the other people who have done the tour.

A must!!. In all honesty, we didn't really expect much from the Heineken Experience. We were pleasantly surprised!! Informative, interactive, funny, unexpected and to end, a couple of free drinks in a funky bar...with interactive tables! Well worth the price. Good value for money. Drank nothing but Heineken throughout our stay. Will be returning next time :)

Wow!. Definitely the best tourist attraction I visited in Amsterdam! Full of surprises (which I won't ruin) and great for all ages, lager drinkers or not! The atmosphere here is brilliant and even when you go on a busy day the queues move quickly and there's lots to see. Brilliant friendly staff and loads of interactive stations, definitey worth the price. Couldn't recommend more, loved it!!

Love it!!. This was a brilliant experience, unlike any brewery tour I've ever done!This was a much more relaxing activity than most on a Europe tour and the beer breaks with free beer was defiantly helpful! ( advice: take a friend who doesn't drink beer so you can drink there free ones!)

Fun tour!. We pre-booked this tour with Viatortours.com that combined this tour and a pizza/beer canal cruise ride. The Heineken Experience is more so a fun meuseum now (no beer is actually produced here), but it was really interesting to see. You get to see the ingredients they use, what the beer tastes like without certain ingredients, and then of course, you are given three free beers on the tour. Lots of pictures and descriptions of the company itself that takes you back to simpler times when the beer was produced. A few videos here and there. The 10 minute show half-way through the tour is worth the wait (a 3D type of viewing). I was kind of expecting more overall, but nonetheless, it was something different we have never done before!

An Experience But Very Much An Advertising Venture. Didn't know what to expect as we have never done a brewery tour before, it was enjoyable but also rather disappointing...The 1/3 middle of the tour is really enjoyable, you see the old copper vats that were used for brewing and find out all about the process, the history and the company however the rest of the tour felt like being in one big advertisement. The end is obviously a highlight with a wristband token you get a couple of small glasses of beer to enjoy - watch out for people passing straight through you can ask for their token and get another free round..Unfortunately the rest if the tour is a way of trying to make extra money from you by selling T-shirts, personalised beer bottles etc and trying to make sure you never forget the brand! Everywhere it's an advert, TV adverts on screens, comfy recliner chairs to sit and watch the adverts, a big screen cinema style room - to watch their ads, even when you get a beer at the end your surround by advert screens. It's a shame I feel a nun ranked experience would be better rather than trying to force it on to you but other than that a good experience.

Could have done without it. We spent a lot of money to not really see/taste/learn too much. The admission ticket includes a canal ride per availability; Although having nothing to do with the brewery, this ride was our favorite part of the experience.

Nice Tour, Seems to Have Lost the Flair Over the Last Couple of Years. Great way to spend an hour or two. For the price, you get one beer at the tasting and two beers in the cafe at the end of the self-guided tour though Heineken's intense marketing efforts.
Kids liked it and it was something good to do for a couple of hours.
Heineken Experience. Great day out - very enjoyable. Pre book to avoid the queue. Was quite busy at the bar but good atmosphere.

Worth doing but not best brewary tour. Did this with my fiance as part of our Amsterdam trip, it was a good price for the ticket and included a taster drink and two drinks at the end but we felt that the experience as a whole was lacking something. The tour covers a lot of space but is hardly filled with anything, it could include more videos of rescontructions and more history of the founders and the brand rather than filling the space with interactive sections that don't even work. Also, the ticket includes a free glass as a gift but it has to be collected from the Brand Store elsewhere in the city which took forever to find

yes i love this place. at first, i love heineken!! if you love the heineken, this is must be the place!!i used to work for brewery restaurant, i knew how to brew beer. but still, it was fun to know sll production line and history of heineken.it is definitely fun place to go if you love amsterudam and heineken!

Let Down experience. The price was too expensive for the experience of walking through this exhibit. Their marketing gimmick is good bit it's not worth the money for what they give you. You wait too long and not enough of a personal tour with real people. You have a few persons telling you some info about the beer but most of it is self reading. This is geared towards young people, but you can see some were disappointed.
Not Worth It. This is a fun time, however is really a good advertising and marketing place for Heineken. Save your money and enjoy the "free " beer at a little cafe somewhere else.
Propaganda made fun. Though full of propaganda and in your face..... We enjoyed it. Interactive and interesting.Beer tasting and last stop a beer with your tokens was a good way to end.

Great Experience. This was a lot more fun than I expected. Very interactive and informative, I thought it was good value for money. Couple of drinks at the end and a good atmosphere, well worth a trip.

Interesting displays and free beer included. Thoroughly enjoyed this tour - plenty to see, good information and a few good beers afterwards. History of the brewery was fascinating and the information given was delivered in an interesting and lighthearted way. Would recommend this tour

Very enjoyable experience. I've visited many breweries in my life and this was one of the most fun and the most interactive ones I've been to. A brewery of this scale and production, I compare to the Guinness Storehouse in Ireland and the Hoegaarden Brewery in Belgium. The Heineken Experience, is the clear winner of the three for the interactive experience provided. Besides learning of the brewery's history and brewing process, be treated to a short 4D (minus 3D screen) "ride", a tasting, two 25cl or one 35cl beers, and a free gift at the Heineken Store (in a different location) for only 15 euro (if I remember correctly, with a coupon). The gift was a limited edition 15 cl glass. Also be prepared to have a personalized bottle of beer produced for. 6 euro. Overall, a very enjoyable experience.

Now I love Heineken! (even more). This place is very fun and honestly I never tasted Heineken as good as I tasted it in that building. They're only suppose to give you a couple of free small beers but you may get a couple more and if you're with your girlfriend who doesn't really drink beer you will end up with lots. Lots of fun stuff to do throughout the experience and really worth it!

Great time. Travelled to here by canal bus, easy to find. Bought tickets online before going which makes easier to enter and avoid the queues. Start of tour looked a bit slow and usual dull tour but things changed with a few interactive experiences and beer tasting ,etc near the end. Don't wish to tell about everything as it spoils things a bit. Had good time in the bar later mixing with the other tourists etc. I certainly enjoyed it and would do it again when back in amsterdam.

Beer and other things to see and do. A little pricey at 18 Euro per person, but there facilities are nice. There are several interactive activities to do where you could spend time going through the museum and the staff does a good job of explaining the brewing process. You get one tasting for the price along with 2 smaller (.5 litter) or one larger (.75 liter) beer. Overall a good experience.

Brilliant Tour for Beer Lovers. This tour was amazing, I have done it twice now over the space of two years and it is still just as interesting as there is soooooo much to do... it has also changed slightly in a few rooms which is good as they keeping it fresh!Also there staff were great and liked a few jokes on the introduction to the beer sections. I would recommend this to any beer or history lover! Worth the money, the free drinks and free gift (which you get in their shop in the centre not at the factory.

Easily the best value in Amsterdam. Fascinating, interactive tour and lots of fun. Helpful and friendly staff and great beer. Learn all about Heineken's history and their beer making process. Cool gift shop. Don't miss this.

brilliant. we visited in a group of 4 friends and we found it thoroughly enjoyable. learning about the family history and the history of the beer. 2 free drinks and free canal boat ride and a free gift. would say its worth a visit

Must not miss in Amsterdam - it is more than the beer. Heineken has created something akin to a theme park at this old brewery location of theirs. The multimedia narration of their history, experiencing their beer making process, the interactive displays and screens, merchandise store make this a fun experience even without factoring in the beer tasting and beer drinking (2 pints) at the end. I recommend trading in the two free glasses of beer to get to properly pouring the perfect glass of Heineken which yields a nice little certificate. You are really only trading in one of the glasses because you get to drink the glass you just poured as part of this process. Watching the continuous loop of Heineken ads from all over in one of the rooms after the tasting is very entertaining.

Better than expected. I had very low expectations for this, but it was actually pretty enjoyable. Parts of the experience seemed aimed at teens, but seeing the brewing process, learning to pour as the Dutch do (incorrectly), the 3d experience, etc. were all a lot of fun.

Best tour I have been on!. The best brewery tour I have been on!This is definitely worth and visit and great value for money!The museum your is great, lots if interactive things to partake in! The staff were all friendly and helpful as well as very knowledgable.One place to make sure you visit on your Amsterdam tour. You also get heineken at the end what more can you ask for!

Really good. very entertaining experience. Some history, a look around the factory and then to the beer. They have really done some good things here. As part of the entrance fee you do great 2 drinks and a free gift of a small glass. To receive the glass you have to go to their other shop 15 minutes away to collect it. This seems strange as the shop contained nothing different to the shop at the experience itself. They do run a free boat on the hour to the shop. You can reserve a place on the boat or jump on if you get lucky. I fully recommend going and you won´t regret it.

Fun Time. yes, it is basically a Heineken commercial.. but they did a fantastic job making it a fun experience.. you do get an overview of the history of the family, a how-to on the craft of beer making but there is much more including a fun ride through the bottling experience.. and yes you do get to drink beer

Interesting and Good Fun. A lot of variety at this attraction. Caters to a wide audience from young to seniors. Staff are helpful and friendly. It was great to see the horsepower behind this fine brew!

Sooo Much Fun!. If you even just like beer a little bit, this is an absolute must! This place is amazing, so many levels, floors, information on beer, and even a club at the end of the tour when you get your free beers! We had a blast!

Nice experience for beer lovers. Heineken in Amsterdam is completely different than any Heineken you'd find in the U.S. The beers you get after the tour are some of the freshest in the city, which is almost worth the price of admission. The museum is nicely done. It's big and some parts cater more to sports fans, kids, etc. I loved all of the photo booths where you can have the photo emailed to yourself. My husband and I also enjoyed the "perfect pour" challenge (I won, for the record). And the tasting bar is nicely done with a DJ, lights, etc. Just a fun time.I think the best part is the boat from the museum to the brand store. It's like a bonus canal cruise with the cost of admission. The tour guide was great and you can purchase a Heineken to enjoy on the ride. Also a great way to get from the museum side of the city to the entertainment area, so plan accordingly!

Take the free boat tour !. Immediate access to the museum, no wait. We had tickets already and they came with a free boat tour thru the canals and then a free gift at the museum shop! As well as free beers. Great gift shop too.. Make sure you go on the 4D ride, what a fun attraction- worth a visit! After our museum tour, and walk by the beautiful horse & stables, we took a canal cruise and had some delicious Heineken and viewed the city frm the water! I'd def do it again :) 5stars
Sober experience. Similar to other venues in other cities but centrally located in an ancient brewery of Heineken's fame, it's quite entertaining and educative.

Go Visit. Good value for money and very interesting. Staff throughout are great & very knowledgeable. Exhibition is very well done and there's something for everyone. Heineken served exactly as it should be to finish experience. Worth seeing.

Not worth the money. This is more like a Disney ride than an actual brewery tour. If you do decide to go, get there early! We arrived around 10 am and walked right in. Friends went later in the day and the lines were out the door. The tour is 18 Euro, which is steep. You do get to sample the beer for "free" and there are some fun exhibits. You would be much better off just going to one of the hundreds of local establishments. They serve Heineken pretty much everywhere! The tour includes a "free" commemorative glass, but good luck trying to find the museum shop on the other side of town. it took us about an hour of wandering around before we happened to stumble across it. They give you a map, but it is very hard to follow. The glasses are cute, but for 18E we could have bought a case of beer and a set of glasses! There are better ways to spend your time and money in amsterdam.
Free Beer!. A good few hours of information, who knew what went into making beer! They even tell how to drink it properly!! And 2 glasses of beer at the end!

Enjoyed this more than I thought I would. The beer was good, the tour was very informative and the simulation ride/movie was a lot of fun too. If you like beer, this is a fun experience. I would go again with someone who has not been. Worth doing.

An oasis when it's hot. It was Just the thing when it was hot outside, and I know how to pour a beer, but it was fresh and included in the entrance price. For the beer buff you could have your own personalised bottle to take home along with the small Heineken glass, overall an ok tour with more to offer than most others in town.

Interesting for a beer lover ... maybe. I went as part of a business group for a team building experience. I guess it was successful in as much as we bonded in our desire to escape and move on to dinner. The tour is a worthy attempt to entertain and inform about the beer making process, but the problem is that the process just isn't that exciting. A 4D virtual reality experience based on the emotions of a "hop" as it turns into beer is a wonderful self parody. The target market seems to be the under 12's, which is odd since they can't enjoy the samples at the end of the tour. Staff are friendly, just don't expect this to change your life.

Heineken Experience is a must!. I only had 2 days in Amsterdam and was told that I had to do the Heineken Experience. I soon understood why it was a must as I was entertained for 3 hours straight! If you have the time you can easily spend 5 hours or more if you do everything they have to offer. It definitely turned me into a beer drinker!! Well Heineken to be specific!

Something different. My boyfriend had heard about this before we left for Amsterdam and decided we had to go. It's not the easiest to find and it's not a very distinctive building but once you are there, you're there. Entrance was a bit pricey but I think it was good value for money. You do see a lot and do a lot whilst you're there and get free beers at the end (give mine to my boyfriend and he was happy) - we were rushing a bit as we only had the day to see a lot of things in the city but it was definitely something I enjoyed. Glad I did it!
Fab!!. We had a lovely time wandering round the brewery leaning how Heineken is made and the tasting was even better :)

Real beer. It is a very well organized exhibition displaying history of the famous Heineken beer and offering various interactive experience along the way, together with beer tasting and even drawing your own beer! I was the most amazed by Heineken advertisement shown in a comfortable hall which looks more like a movie than ad!

So much fun.. The history of the factory is very interesting. You might expect a brewery to be dull but the whole experience is bright, cheerful and varied. It varies from old equipment to new and lively bar settings. It was nice to sit with other visitors over a free beer and chat at the end of the tour, and after there was a free canal boat which took you into the centre of Amsterdam at the end of the tour.

Brilliant day. Had such a great time at the factory, didn't think I would learn anything but I was wrong. Learnt alot about how to drink and taste it properly, everyone was so friendly and knew what they were talking about! Not sure if I should of ridden a push bike afterwards thou, but the factory visit is a must!

a solid attraction in amsterdam. i visited on a saturday in late june with 6 friends, it's €25 for the experience and includes extra drinks and an amazing burger on the rooftop, you can get a cheaper ticket without the frills.you get about 2-3 pints worth of beer and a free gift. the free gift is available in the official gift shop which you can get a free boat to which is a lovely canal ride from right outside the attraction which leaves on the hour every hour til about 6pm. the free gift is only a small heineken branded glass but the boat trip for free is worth it!you get to see the cisterns in which heineken used to be brewed in as well as experience being part of the brewing process with a ''ride'' where you feel the ground moving beneath you while you lightly splashed with water.overall, definitely worth a visit if you have 2 or 3 hours to kill.
Excited Experience. in this tour you can know the first Heineken factory in Amsterdam. Also you'll know the production proccess of Heineken beer. THe store after the tour is very interesting.
alright for youngsters. A bit disappointing was expecting a working brewery. Quite clever but gimmicky. Aimed at young adults.
Fun & interactive experience!. The tour was interactive, interesting and fun! And of course, the beer was awesome! It's definitely worth a visit if you're a fan of Heineken!

Just ok. This tour is ok but not outstanding. The bits of history included throughout the tour are interesting but overall the visit is not worth the money. You'd be better off stopping in a bar and just buying the beer. However, if you do the tour,the commemorative glass you get if you hike over to the other gift shop is a nice keepsake.

Spend Your Money at a local Cafe. Please use the price of this attraction to visit a local cafe. It's an advertising gimmic on a huge scale. If you want to hang with a bunch of twenty somethings in a bar with sticky floors you'll like it.
Fun Tour. Really enjoyed the tour, worth a visit. The club at the end was fun , and enjoyed the 2 free beers at the end!
Spectacular view. The tour was educational and the view from the top was spectacular. The free pint of beer was a plus.

This Place is Fun to Visit. After leaving here I gained a new respect for beer since I am not a beer drinker. It was educational as well as entertaining all in one place. They take you through a history tour of how Heineken all began with a video narration. Then onto a live overview of what it takes to make a beer (ingredients and fermentation process). You will go through a simulated video presentation and from there to a tasting of beer (the proper way to drink a beer). Then on to a cool lounge area where you can learn to pour beer from the tap or skip that and get a couple to drink and listen to some cool music liek you are in a night club. I got a monogramed bottle of Heineken for about 6 euros before heading to the gift shop where you can pick up all kinds of great souvenirs at modest prices. I suggest this tour even if you are like me and don't particularly care for beer. It could possible change your view.

fun time at the Experience. Heineken is one if my favourite beers so despite some people say that it's too "touristy", i really enjoyed the "Experience". You get a wristband that allows you 2 free beers st the end of the tojr, plus a free gift (Heineken glass). The tour itself takes you through the full history of the beer and gives background in why the Heineken family started making beer. There is also a taste testing part and if you were laying attention during the (self guided) tour, then you can get additional glasses of the golden beer. There may be better brewery tours in Amsterdam but if you're a fan of Heineken, you should go!

Interesting but too much standing and waiting. Sure if you are in town and the weather is kinda crappy it's not a bad way to spend a few hours but if you can't make it don't stress.Coolest thing I found was that you can also get your own custom printed Heineken bottle which is fairly cool souvenir to take home. Also you can do digital photos that you can email to yourself just a word of warming I recall it took several days or longer to arrive... could have even been weeks between when I took the photo and I got the photo message.Please not that I wouldn't advise going on a very busy or hot day as it's a little warm inside the building and you spend a lot of your time standing around in lines waiting to move to the next section.... the people flow between interactive parts could have been smoother.

Worth a look. I would not recommend going to this attraction alone, as I would have enjoyed the tour and the drinks at the end with some company. The other visitors all seemed to be early 20's and could not wait to get to the drinks.This attraction has lots of history and artifacts to explain the history of Heineken. I found the a/v part of the tour too much like an advert for Heineken. The experience part at the end was not fully working on my visit. The draught horses were out to pasture except for one token example. This company is very strong on branding, and many of the exhibits are about what events they sponsor around the world. I did enjoy the experience though, and bought the obligatory t-shirt reminder in the gift shop.

cool!. not a beer lover but it was fun touring around this brewery. the atmosphere was hip, you get to have free beers and have nice chats with the staff. they have a nice club at the end of the tour which was very cool. worth a visit!
Fun. Very good value for money,at only £15 it was well worth it,you get too sample the amber nector and receive 2 free beers,also a Heineken bottle opener and two Heineken glasses

Tourist trap, but fun. I would strongly recommend not going by yourself as I did. I think I would've had much more fun if there was a friend to enjoy all the interactive parts of the tour with. I wouldn't put this as a top priority, but if you have a few hours to kill it's fun to check out.

Typical brewery experience except you get to pull your own pint. You get to walk around the brewery, go on a ride and pull your own pint. There are a lot if sampling opportunities as well! You get a free beer glass as well once you've been on the canal boat shuttle.
Great atmosphere and worth a visit!. We had a really fun day at the Heineken experience, staff were lovely and it was just the right length as you're keen to get to the bar at the end 😋

Cool experience - not your average brewery though. I've done a bunch of Brewery tours and this one feels a lot more like an amusement park with the virtual reality ride and guided exhibits. You obviously get beer and it's fun but it's a bit over crowded and doesn't feel authentic at all. Fun, but not amazing. A little on the pricey side.
I got to pull my first pint . No queues, which I found surprising, good fun, informative and we got to two free drinks and a free Heineken glass
nice experience at the Heineken Museum. I had a fun time there. Like the way they engage customers in their story and activities. highly recommended!

Great Fun at Heineken Museum. What a great little museum! Did not expect to enjoy it as much as I did! They put a lot of thought and effort into this exposition and it shows! Very informative, interesting, interactive, diverse and just plain FUN! Museum experience like no other for sure. And you get 2 free beers. Would be also great for kids (minus the beer part :-) ). You could also pour your own bottle of beer and take with you as a gift. Check out this museum, you will not be disappointed!

Average experience, better things to do. I visited the Heineken experience because I've always liked the beer and thought I would learn something from it because of the trip adviser reviews. I found the tour a bit cheesy and cliche. The most interesting thing was the how to appreciate and drink beer at the end of the tour. Another reviewer before me (simzark) also found it average. Check simzark's review as its a very detailed description of the tour. I had the 4 free beers in the end and didn't bother with the free gift as it seemed difficult to find the place to redeem your white token. There are better things to do in Amsterdam then attend this
