Pretty good. You have to be a beer fan or appreciate beer to do this.We loved it. There were a few annoying hipster things in there to do like play station or create a film clip to a Dutch song. Either way as long as you go with it you'll have fun.They give you tokens for 2 beers and a free gift. However, with the free gift you have to walk to the gift shop which is streets away (about 2.5km) in a hidden area.Still you get a cool free glass :)

Fun Beer Tour. The Heineken Experience is well worth going to - even if you're not really into drinking beer. There are lots of interactive things to do, and you can easily while away a couple of hours. You are provided with 2 free beers, and get to drink them in a night club type area. If you're thinking this is just another beer tour - think again and go along.

Waste of time. I'd heard good things about this tour, it didn't live up to the hype at all. They march you around and show you the brewing process, the vats, the hops etc etc. nothing too interesting there. When you get to the end, they give you two tokens for two small beers and kick you out. Yawn. Skip it and go to the pub instead. - it's cheaper and you'll probably have more fun.

Good Fun with beer :). Everyone can enjoy this trip, even if they don't drink beer, as it's fun and informative, with a little special interactive trip through the brewing process. The horses were in the stables the day I visited, so that made it quite special as they are magnificent. And yes, there's beer. :)

Discount for buying tickets online in advance. I've already been to the Guinness Storehouse in Dublin, Ireland and the Coors Brewery tour in Golden, Colorado, so I wasn't too keen on attending yet another brewery tour. But my bf hadn't ever been on one, so we decided to check out the Heineken Experience together.Getting e-tickets online in advance saved us a couple of euros, so that was nice. When we arrived and showed the guy our printed tickets, he gave us one of those rubber wristbands with 3 little discs attached to it. Two of the discs were good for a free beer tasting during the tour, and the 3rd one was for a free gift... but the gift shop was somewhere far away not on the premises, so we didn't bother getting it.I'm glad I've been on other factory tours prior to this one, because I think the exhibits here weren't as nice. They tried to build in a lot of interactive elements with cranks to turn and buttons to push... but there were so many mechanical failures that like half the stuff wasn't working properly. Thank goodness I've already smelled hops before and have had a general education on how beer is brewed. :PWhat I did like though, was the beer tasting lesson in the middle of the tour. We each got a small glass to look at for bubbles underneath the surface (indicates freshness), and we learned that the best way to get the full flavor is to take big swigs... not itty bitty sips. My bf was so impressed that he kept talking about the proper way to drink a beer to all his friends for the next 3 months. :OThere was also a little kiosk for you to film a video message and send it via email, so my mother became the proud recipient of a cheesy video from me saying "Hi, mom!!" in a squeaky voice. LOL.I also hopped on to a fake DJ booth display and pretended to be a DJ. No idea how convincing I looked, but it was fun to mess around a bit. Photo op!!The area where we got the free beer at the end was set up like a cool bar, with tables and a live DJ spinning tunes. So awesome and hip! Their marketing gurus really did a good job in making them look super cool. You could try to tap your own beer, but since I'm already a Guinness Storehouse certified "perfect pint pourer" ;), I didn't bother to wait in line and instead went to the area where it was already pulled for you. You could get two regular beers, or exchange both tokens for one extra-cold, slightly larger glass of Heine. I got the 2 regulars, while my bf got the extra-cold. I tried a bit of his beer--and although you could notice the difference in temperature--mine was just fine, too. Besides, 2 is better than 1, eh? I'm not normally a beer-drinker, but I must say that the beer was refreshing and delicious! So all-in-all, it was a fun afternoon with a happy ending. :)

The Heineken is SWEEEET!!!. This is an experience you shouldn't miss. A great spend of about 2 hours. As a beer lover, what they explained wasn't exactly new to me but the way they did it was just fabulous.Very well organized and structured. The old brewery has been upgraded to a museum. A very interactive tour (not to forget the experience in a small movie hall with effects and animation where you're actually the beer bottle)And to top it all you've got free beer towards the end of the tour. And the taste of that was something I haven't had in a while.I highly recommend this tour.

Awesome time for a group of student travellers. 16 euros was a pretty good price for a group of 7 students like us. We bought our tickets in advance at a restaurant (Cobra Cafe near the Rijkmuseum) to avoid the line. Walked right in when we got there. Lots of interesting history about the company and the brewing process. They walk you through their process of creating the beer. They'll even teach you how to correctly pour the beer and drink it for the best taste. Ticket includes (2) 25cl beers, plus a smaller one for the instruction on drinking the beer. If you're lucky like we were, the guy distributing tokens will give you extras! Make sure to take the canal cruise to the Brand Store if you choose to go redeem your free gift (a glass). That was a blast!

Heineken Experience. The Heineken Experience was great. You really get your moneys worth. Very interactive, educational and fun. You get to walk through the museum, go on a simulator to "become a heineken", have free beer in the bar and more. Definitely worth visiting!

Good way to spend an hour or 2. Heineken is a good beer, and this is a good tour, the virtual beer making part and beer tasting being the highlight. We got the canal cruise included after the tour and got dropped off in the city centre which was handy, our guide on the boat was very helpful and even treated us to some free traditional nibbles when we bought a beer on the boat.

Not the best; not the worst. €18. No senior rate. Lots of walking looking at old Heineken ads. Lots of glorification of old Heineken family members. Lots and lots and lots and lots of stairs. The tour gets substantially better toward the end, so skip quickly through the first parts, and get on to the Disney-like movie, and the "learn to pour your own Heineken" bar.

Great experience!. This was a great experience! Learnt a load of new things included how to drink beer properly. Also the ticket game with a free beer (or two, depending on what you choose) at the end and I got my name written on a bottle and got a glass engraved - which is a great souvenir option. Would highly recommend it.

To busy. To busy to really enjoy. There was no space so people weren't stopping to read or look at the items. Everybody was walking through in single file and then we came to a queue. We had no idea what we were queueing for but were told we had to wait 30 minutes. They take you into a little room and you go through the bottleing process. After this you are taken to a bar where you get a free half pint and are told about how to drink it. That's where the beer part ends.The rest is all about football really. I understand it's called "experience" but I thought it was a beer experience. There was football tables and playstations and then lots of parts where you can customize a t-shirt or beer bottle (just looking for more of your money). You then get to the bar where you hand over a wristband and get 2 free half pints. The bar was packed.To get your free souvenir you have to go to the brand store. They offer a free boat shuffle to the store. We were in a hurry so personally didn't do this we walked instead. The store was quiet and of course after all that beer you're no doubt going to need a toilet! There was a toilet in the store but it was closed. Not worth the money. Like someone else said, just google the facts and buy a pint in a bar. There was also a free cloakroom service which was great as we had hand luggage. Probably best for a stag party or boys holiday.

Excellant- a hidden gem. This tour is very well priced for what you get, Enthusiastic staff who are friendly and welcoming. Teaches you a lot about beer brewing, with taste testing opportunities. You are thought how to pull your own pint, and given a certificate. Its very interactive with virtual games to be played. The merchandise store gives you a free Heineken glass. Be sure to avail of the boat ride of Amsterdam through the city- its included in the price!

Brilliant Day out - Loved it!. Well worth the 27 Euros it cost us (we had the I Amsterdam card which got us 25% off)! Included in this is a self guided tour of the old factory, a small ride where you become the beer, a tasting session (with beer included!), a wander through an interactive advertising area that was great fun! Some fantastic photo opps! before finishing in the lovely bar area where you can trade your two tokens for either two beers or the chance to pull your own and get a certificate with your drink. After you've enjoyed your beer you can then take a boat ride (all inc. in the price) to the brand store to collect your free heineken glass.Took us about three hours in total and was well worth the money!

An enjoyable attraction!. I have almost exhausted all attractions in Amsterdam and we are regular visitors but I overall thought this was worth a trip. Whether you like beer or not it is insightful and fun. Free drinks on the way round, pull a virtual pint all adds to the fun. Some of the marketing campaigns over the years was amazing to see the change of brand with moving times. We took a freebie river cruise afterwards and a bit sceptical but was really surprised. Overall worth the entrance fee when you compare with some of the others.

OK but not brilliant. To be honest, I don't know what all the fuss is about. Sure you get a couple of free beers at the end of the tour (after queuing for them for almost 10 minutes) but overall, the tour isn't a "must do" in my opinion. It is very crowded with tourists, no-one was really stopping to see the displays and it seemed that they were more interested in the free beer. Saying all that though, seeing the ads from previous years and the "future" of Heineken was pretty cool.
Russia meets Disney. Propaganda to get you to buy more Heineken. Just do some research online and drink a Heineken at a bar. There's history but almost no facts about how it is made. Save your money.

Overprice honky tonk!. Enjoying Heineken beer, we thought we would enjoy the tour with our family. Rather than teaching us about the history and msnufacturing, most of the tour involved watching tv ads, play station games, sending video messages, designing your tshirt and ordering personalized bottles. The rode was a bit silly but somewhat entertaining. The best part was pouring your own beer-- there was a long wait but it was worth the half hour. I would save the 18 euros and find a nice brown bar to enjoy your glass of Heineken instead.

Fun afternoon if you have spare time!. We chose this last minute and booked online. Worth it! Got free beer and a beer glass and canal ride so make sure you do that, it's worth the wait. It Is a bit gimmicky but it's good, especially if you are into beer and Heineken.

Enjoy the afternoon with Heineken!. What a riot! No, not a true brewery, per se, but the "experience" is just that. My husband and I had lots of fun together, laughing out loud and even learning a little! The beer was great, and we didn't think the price was bad for all the time we spent there. Lots to enjoy and see. The "free gift" is a run-around, but that didn't bother us.

A true experience in trying the real beer. Worth to go as the entry fees is just 16 Euro and you get 2 free freshly brew beer and 1 souvenir in return. Get your ticket online or at the tour tickets store in the town which you will see it everywhere. if you get the ticket at the door is 18 Euro. From a non beer drinker, I actually love Heineken! The best beer i have ever tasted before and it was a great experience learning how to taste a beer. The 2 glasses of true brew beer can actually get you tipsy!

Dont drink and drive. A very well laid out attraction great for all ages of 12 up . Get 2 free beers at the end and 1 other during the visit . if your interested in how its make bottled delivered than this is the place for you

Nice presentation with a couple of beers included. Entry cost E18 per person but we felt the cost worthwhile, even if we didn't play the interactive games and displays available (the young people were really in to those). Enjoyed learning about the history of Heineken and their brewing process.

Skip it - not worth the time. I"m not sure why this gets such good reviews. It wasn't awful but it just wasn't worth it. It is not even an actual brewery. I have visited the Budweiser plant where you actually see the brewery and beer being made but this tour is just plaques on the wall and replicas of the vats. Its more like a museum and definitely not a brewery. There is also an interactive movie that shakes a little but it is very amateurish. I had fun because I like the beer and the company I was with but would not recommend it. It would have been more fun to just go to a café and order a few Heinekens.

Interesting!. I booked this because of my husband. I knew this would be something that he would like to share with his friends and family back home. However, I didn't realise that I would have enjoyed the visit despite being a non-beer drinker.It was really interesting and I didn't mind that it took longer than planned. I even got myself a wrist watch at the brand store. They provide like 3 glasses of beer for each visitor and also a short cruise from the brewery to their brand store. If you have the money, please experience it.

Brilliant!. The Heineken Experience was certainly worth the visit! I am not a beer drinker myself but found the trip worth the time! Around the brewery, you are given 3 free drinks as well as a free gift. Would recommend this.
My husband didn't want to leave. So worth the visit, an amazing tour with all the bells and whistles... and great beer!Fantastic value for money, we'll be recommending this to all of our friends!

WHAT BLAST!. i went with my adult daughter on this trip and we both enjoyed it. Is the worth the money. So much fun. Make this the last tour of the day, it is about 2 hrs long so you can sit down and enjoy the beer they give you as part of the tour. There are many photo ops inside to order t-shirts and engrave your glasses. NICE!

Fun. It is my second Heineken experience in the last year. I returned with some friends and we were surprised to find new things that werent there the last time we visited. It is a great place to learn about the heineken brand and their history, and also a great place to have fun. You have to try all the devices, all the crazy things. The crazyer you are, better fun you'll have. If you are in Amstedam and you want to try also the canal cuises (you should!!!) you have a discount also for Heineken experience and for other museums and attractions.Have fun!

Fun!. We went at 645pm because they did not allow people to enter after 7pm (pretty sure this time is correct). Tip: get there earlier than we arrived, there is a lot of fun to be had and they were closing rooms on us before we had time to see everything. You get to see how the beer is made, have 2 free pints included with the tour, drink them in a cool bar, make commercials and take pictures that you can email to yourself, and we even got a beer glass as a free gift. Staff are fun, the beer flows, and the Champions League stuff is cool. Highly recommended.
Very cool!. It is very "touristy" I guess but it was really a lot of fun! I was with a friend and we met some other people there. The whole experience is very interactive, informative and tasty.

Really good but.... The experience was very fun but according to the adds it says that there supposed to be a short boat ride. The site is opan untill 09:00 pm but the last boat leaves on 07:00 pm. Last ticket was given on 06:45 therefore we missed it. Too bad that allthough there are still people comming in, they will miss part of the experience. Apart of that the tour is very nice

A fun experience. We explored the Heineken Experience for approximately 1 hour on May 19, 2014. It was a fun experience - we enjoyed the "Be the Beer" part of the tour where you're in a small theatre and you become the beer being made including fermenting, bottling, shipping and the case being opened at a party! Free beer samples afterwards, some interactive areas and you can watch some of the many commercials Heineken has made. A fun way to spend an hour!
Really nice!. With an affordable price (17 euros) to entry, you can enjoy a tour in the whole Heineken history and also for it process. In the end, you can drink a few beers in the bar.
Best attraction!. It was definitely the best attraction I visited in Amsterdam (except the girls and the coffee shops).

Surprisingly fun. Went even though not a big beer lover. It was fun and the beer tasted good. Recommend the tour. One thing that they should change though-you get a free gift-a Heineken glass-however, you collect it in a different location in the city-not close and we got lost. That was frustrating

A must do if you are in Amsterdam. Im not a Heineken fan or a beer fan... but a visit to the Heineken Experience has changed that. Now I am a fan of the brand Heineken. (Still not a big beer fan)Heinken refuses to call this place the Heineken Museum and insists it is the Heineken Experience and rightly so. It is just brilliant how Heineken has created an experience with the brand for the public at large (drinkers and non drinkers).Right from the history to the process of beer brewing, to advertising and marketing, experience zones around music, film and sport, there is something for everybody. You need a good 1.5 to 2 hrs to go through the complete experience. And it's definitely worth the time. My favourites were the Music and DJing experience, The James Bond movie game and most of all getting myself certified by Heineken as an official pourer (they even give you a certificate for that). Nothing more to tell... cause you need to go ahead and live the Heinken Experience.

A Must Do!. This was a unique tour /experience that has obviously had a lot of thought & planning put into it. Great value for money, fun & light hearted - just what you want from a beer tour + you also get a couple of free drinks!

A great day out for all. We visited in February. Tickets were €16 witch included two drinks and a boat trip down the Amsterdam canals to the heineken gift shop where there we were given a free branded glass. A essential for anyone visiting amsterdam

Lovely Experience indeed :-). we hit the place around 10 am in the morning which i thought was too early for a beer experience ! we were a group of 20 and we were able to get entry into the place quite easy ... in fact well before the crowed starts .... you are able to see a video of the history of heineken and how and what there beer stands for , making process etc etc .. there are quite a few experiences herein terms of old machinery used ( kids can try a few ), horse and stable of the old times used for the company, a simulated photo opportunity, a nice video of their support of UEFA & some match highlights ... the grand finale and my favourite was the beer serving test :-) ... i waited in a small queue and then went for the beet tapping and happy to share that got certified ... nice experience and then i polished off the beer glass and then 2 more :-) :-) ... this does make you happy early in the morning :-) .. LOL Shopping in the Heineken shop is quite good .... but expensive for the Asian currency / wallet :-) .. did pick a few memorabilia and will cherish the certificate that i got here

It's a brewery.. The Heineken Experience is a great tour for beer enthusiasts and for food lovers. The experience is a little costly however you do get a couple of mini pints by the end. Heineken must have spent a pretty penny to create the tour / experience, however they do have great advertising.

MUST DO!. We thought this might be a cool thing to do while in the area but had no idea how awesome it would actually be! The tour was inexpensive especially considering we got 3 beers each and the entertainment value was so much more than we had expected! Yes, you get to see the workings of how the beer is made and the history which we found mildly interesting but what we really enjoyed most was the entertainment and "experience". Definitely worthwhile to do while in Amsterdam.

"Great Brewery Tour”. I have read many bad comments about this brewery tour. So much that I was very close not to go. We decided to go early in the morning to avoid big crowd of people. So you can guess that I did this tour without barely any expectations.If you are planing to do the tour in advance, you could purchase your tickets on line. You'll save 2 Euros that way. If you don't have time to do it on line. Look inside souvenir shops near the Heineken Old Brewery because some of them sell tickets to make you save 2 Euros. It is 18 Euros at the door. It is opened every from 11 am. We were there at 11:15 am and I was surprised to see how many people were already doing the tour this early.The tour was very long and you get to see and do so many different things. (see many old Heineken posters, the old Brewery tanks, the "being" the beer experience, you can also bottle your own personalized Heineken, the first tasting, some games, play with a machine to see if you are a good beer pourer, you also get the chance to pour your first own beer as a bartender, before you walk outside there is another bar so you can get your second free beer and a huge souvenir shop).Very important! When walking outside of the Heineken Experience, there is someone at the door that will be asking you if you want to do a boat tour on board the Heineken Boat. Say yes! It is included in the price of the Heineken Experience Ticket. A small boat tour that takes you to the Heineken shop. That is where you'll get your free souvenir Heineken glass. The whole tour is in English!All of this for 18 Euros. If you want, you can have a lot of fun doing this brewery tour. A 18 Euros well spent! I'm glad we did it! It starts pretty well that day!!! We had a lot of fun!

Commercialized experience, light on history and brew-making process. This is very light on the history of Heineken and very heavy on trying to get you to buy personalized Heineken products. At the beginning of the tour, you learn a little about the Heineken family and the history of the company, but it is clearly meant to be promotional material: everything just paints the family in an extremely good light. After the historical part, you get to the brew-making process. Compared to other breweries, I felt this was fairly weak. There are meant to be some hands-on stations set up with employees doing demonstrations for people, but the employees were not involved at all – definitely not doing their jobs, so that made that part of the tour weaker than it could be. After learning about the brew-making process, you go through a series of rooms where you can make a bunch of personalized Heineken products. They are all darkly lit with loud music – it feels a little bit like a night club. Finally, at the end, you get two beers at the bar, which is also dark with loud music. We had fun, but overall, it is a very commercialized experience and you learn little about Heineken history or the company today.
Nice experience. we had a fun time there. You get 2 bears each.There are many little stations where you can take a funny picture, see commercials etc.
Awesome. Better than I expected, even my wife liked it.It is like a amusement park join a museum who join a bar.

My Heineken Experience. It was a dream becoming true, after so long enjoying Heineken beer, visit this place, "the birthplace" & check how work the process of making this great beer & etc was amazing.Looking foward to visit again Amsterdan &, 'course, have another heineken Experience!!!

Excellent - even for non beer drinkers. This was a really great trip for both my partner and I, even though she is not that keen on beer. The actual experience is amazing, learning a bit about the history of the beer and how it is family owned and then into the marketing strategy. All very cleverly done. And then for those that wish, a couple of wee beers at the end. Highly recommended.
Great for Beer Lovers. I am not the greatest fan of Beer but my partner is, but we both really enjoyed ourselves here, its really informative and interactive.

Even if you don't drink beer, it is an interesting experience. I am not a beer drinker, but decided to go anyway, and I had an interesting time. There are interactive displays and you learn about the process of brewing the beer as well. Worth checking out.

When in Rome......or Amsterdam. A must if you are in the area. The self guided tour was interesting, well thought out and not too long or heavy. The history or Heineken and the process of their beer making is all hands on and interactive. Be sure to shop about as lots of different tour operators and hotels offer competitive discounted rates via coupons. Enjoy the samples and drink at the end of the tour. The free gift is a miniature Heineken glass collected in a different district to the factory. An overall enjoyable experience.

Once in a lifetime experience!. We used our gold Holland Pass here. We learned a massive amount about the history as well as the meaning of Heineken here and our love for it just grew stronger after this tour. It was a self-directed tour and very interactive one too. Not to mention all those free games you can play as well as photos you can take and tasting of one pint of Heineken. You will be given a wrist band where you can collect either two pints of Heineken or you can learn how to pour a pint of Heineken plus get yourself a free pint. The wrist band can also allow you to exchange for one free gift - Heineken pint glass! This would be one of the must go list and one of the must do things in Amsterdam! Definitely worth our while and money!

Even if you dont like beer.... ...its a must see. The visit is very interactive and besides getting to know how beer is made, you go through the history of the Heineken company in a very cool way. It also has a lot of games and multimedia activities to do. In the end you get 2 free beers and a voucher for a gift in the Heineken Store in the Amstelstraat.

Fantastic, good value for money, lots of beer!. The Heineken Experience is fantastic! We got our tickets from an excursion shop just outside of the main shopping area near the Red Light District and got it in advance which qualified us for a discount price of 16 euros. I was initially sure about wanting to do this however as the rest of the group was I went along. When you arrive you start with a tour of how it all started, with voice overs in English and things written on the wall in English and Dutch, you then move onto looking at the actual machines of how the whole brewing process takes place. It’s brilliant as you get to take pictures in an apron and can actually mix the yeast process. You then go into a 4D room and it takes you on a small experience of how the whole process happens again, but this time it’s more practical and so more interesting. You then get to taste the beer and taught how to drink it best. The tour then takes you to another practical section where you get to make your own slogan by posing in front of a screen and also make a small video for a beer commercial. These are all additional should you wish to purchase it, however they give you the option to take your own photos and email the video to your email address. Alternatively you can have them printed on a glass or t-shirt at an additional cost. You also get the opportunity to brew your own beer and if you pass the test you receive a certificate and also get two small beers as a compliment included in the price. Once the inside tour is finished you can go on a free complimentary boat ride in the canel where you get dropped off near the merchandise shop to pick up your free gift which is a small beer glass. All this for 16 euros is absolutely phenomenal, it’s a good laugh, get free drinks and really good experience. Definitely worth every cent.

Use your 18 euro somewherelse. We went to this Amsteram attraction a couple of days ago. Must say i was dissapointed. So much commercials for Heineken that the tour should have been for free. Strongly overpriced, Been to 2 other Amsterdam local breweries which was a much better experience. Keep your 18 euros and go have a nice dinner somewherelse instead...

Good Fun. We went in a group of 6 and really enjoyed it. It was a good way to spend a couple of hours with some really good displays and interactive activities. Once you have seen it there would be no need to go again and if you only had a short amount of time I would say try to go to some of the other more individual attractions.

Everyone should do this!!. Heineken from the Heineken factory is probably my favorite beer in the world! I have been to 12 countries and have had hundreds of different kinds of beer and while I'm not the biggest fan of Heineken in the States, Heineken in Amsterdam is absolutely delicious!! The tour was great and this was my second time doing it and would do it in a heart beat if I ever make it back to Amsterdam!!
It was fun). I am not a big fan of beer, but we visited Heineken Beer museum with my colleagues. It's a very interactive museum. lot's of fun)

Heineken lovers unite!. This was an awesome experience, especially because I love Heineken! Starts off with historical facts, then the brewing process, then a view of the big bass casks, then a taste testing with beer appreciation. Then modern media tour and finally 2 drinks at the Heineken bar. It's a cool thing to experience. Definitely check it out if you have time.

Good fun. Second visit here and it has expanded and improved. A self guided tour, a taster of Heineken, then a ride on a simulator where you go through the beer making process, good fun. There are various inter active activities followed by 2 glasses of Heineken. You can also pick up a free gift in the shop.

Most fun "museum" I've been to!. We went to the Heineken Experience mid-afternoon on a Saturday, and had no trouble getting tickets or waiting in lines. The staff was extremely friendly, fun, and informative. The tour is very interactive, and there are a few large rooms towards the end that are filled with hilarious green-screens to play around with. Finally, tons of free beer and bar/club atmosphere at the end were a perfect way to top it off! Worth every penny.

Better than expected. I went along for the ride, as a non beer drinker I did not expect to much for me, but I did enjoy the history, the interactive sections and thought the whole place was really well done, yes very touristy but they should be proud of their product, it is enjoyed world wide. We bottled a beer and it will sit proudly in the pool room

Beer Lovers Must Visit. I don't think I'd need to go back here if I was in Amsterdam again but it was definitely a fun experience for the first time. I didn't take the guided tour as it seemed to be too slow for my pace.They have a great history section that chronicles the timeline of Heineken. They also have a sports section that is very cool for football (soccer) fans. It has a lot of interactive things revolving around the Champions League sponsorship.You can also become a certified "pourer". Haha. I have my certificate at home. Oh yes, and you can drink beer!

Touristy but enjoyable. This is purely one of those tourist trap attractions all about advertising Heineken & getting the brand name out there. Nevertheless, it is a fun experience!!! There is plenty to do and see. I did not expect to spend so much time here but my husband & I had a blast!

Excellent . We bought our tickets before we went and this was brilliant as we got to skip the queues. The whole experience was brilliant. You could spend a whole afternoon in here! There were tasters throughout the tour and as you didn't have a tour guide you can spend as much time as you like having a look. Two free drinks at the end in the bar add to the experience. Highly recommend this experience.

Great craic!. Didn't plan on going into the Heineken experience but a rainy day pulled us in. We didn't pre-book tickets but there was no queue and the price was reasonable enough. We spent 3 hours there, it was very fun, they even have a 4D experience which was good fun too :) They give you a bracelet when you enter with 2 tabs you can pull off it, and we were pleased to realise when we got to the roof top we were entitled to 2 free glasses of beer :) Good end to a great tour. Really enjoyed it and would definitely recommend it :)Star tip: It's fun spend an afternoon in there, don't limit yourself time-wise.

Very well put together!. A great experience, very short Q's and very interactive which made it fun. Although this is a self guided tour there are staff at every section to answer any questions you had.You were able to see every stage of the brewing process and there is even a 4D ride where you get to be a bottle of beer (don't worry if you don't like rides it's simply a stand up ride with a barrier in front of you to hold on to).There is lots to see and do and even 2 free drinks at the end of the tour and 1 during the tour. I was annoyed at the 'free gift' though which is a small glass but to actually get this gift you had to go to their brand store which is the other side of Amsterdam!? Not ideal...
Probably The Best Heineken In The World ;). Interesting tour, friendly guides, lots of photo opportunities and interactive games, but most importantly, you get to taste the best beer in the land.

Buy Your Ticket Online! Great Experience!!. You save 2 euro if you purchase your ticket online! This was and most unique brewery tour I've ever been on. They make the experience very interactive and fun. You can take pictures/videos for free at certain stations and email them to your friends or family. Plus your ticket comes with 2 free drinks (only 25cl each though).

fantastic. Took the kids 14 and 15 and the husband (40). enjoyed it from start to finish. all in English the guides seemed to love there jobs and were very informative. you mostly went around at your own pace could take photos and videos and lots of chances to muck around trying to serve a pint and playing on playstations and relaxing on couches laughing at old tv adverts. the been made into a bottle was a new experience even the very loud sweedish group we were with did not spoil it for us. the beer at the end was most welcome and the kids got pepsi. whilst not a fan of Heineken I really enjoyed the tour and so did the rest of the family.

If you love beer...this is for you. I was interesting. You get to see the whole beer making process. There are fun things to do an see while you're walking through the factory too. I can't drink beer because I have coeliacs so I couldn't sample anything. But the people I went with really enjoyed sampling. It took quite a long time to get through the whole factory. If you're short on time then it's not the best attraction. I would recommend this for people who love beer, are interested in how to make beer, and have a few hours to spare.

Interesting tour and super fresh Heineken. This was our first stop on our Amsterdam bachelor party adventure. The first part of the tour is history. The second is the manufacturing process. Both have interesting information and some neat video assisted bits. Some of the info you'll learn can benefit you in the next part where a Heineken rep serves you beer and teaches you the "correct" way to drink beer. Throughout his spiel, he'll throw in some Heineken trivia. And if you were paying attention and answer first... you get extra beer.Then you move into the commercial part of the experience. Media, games, photos t-shirts, postcards, customized bottles, you name it. Lots of ways to give them money. And finally a bar area where you can throw back a few more and hang with any new friends you've made on the tour.The staff was extremely friendly the entire way through. We had a great time. I don't really drink Heineken in the states due to it always tasting kind of "skunky". But here it was fantastic! Crisp and fresh.It was a great way to prime our group for the night ahead.

Lost its fizz... Flat now. This is the second time I've done this tour, the first time was in 2010. The 'experience' has gone way downhill since then. What was once an intimate, guided tour has been replaced by large crowds, very long lines (on the tour itself) and very little interaction with the guides. It is more of a self guided tour than anything else. They let WAY too many people inside, and on the limited occasions someone tried to explain things to us, someone in the crowd was always talking so loud it was very hard to hear. Very very touristy- I only suggest if you are bored and can tolerate very long lines.

The most imaginative and interactive experience I have visited.. Do not visit Amsterdam and miss this experience. The Heineken experience is interactive, educational, informative and will appeal to everyone. Entrance fees are 16€ and that includes multiple free glasses of beer!! Allow 2-3 hours for this experience and more if you want to relax in the bar area afterwards! There are endless photo opportunities and interactive experiences and Heineken send you all the photos and videos you make free of charge to your e-mail address. The gift shop is reasonably priced for any keepsakes and the admission fee includes a free glass for your collection.The Dutch should be very proud of this attraction it was awesome! I wouldn't hesitate to return.

Awesome. We were visting not expect too much but was really Good, the staff was very nice And gave us a lot of information about the factory also at the end we tried the fresh beer that I really liked. I can't waitto go back ...

Such a disapointment. It has been a while since I've been so fooled by an attraction. Simply, don't visit this stupid tourist trap which is a big waste of money. Lots of waiting for experiences that aren't nice or enjoyable, what so ever.The friends I was traveling with really wanted to go, I caved and spent the €18 at the door. Worst choice on this trip by far.

Great exhibition. We visited here not expecting much. We were in for a surprise. It was really great. The owners/management obviously put alot of effort into the whole experience and the people who showed us round were extremely interested in what they were showing us. The part where "we were brewed" was actually really quite fun and brought a smile to everyone's face.

Very nice, but designed for a younger crowd exclusively. We enjoyed the Heineken experience, but not nearly as much as "real" brewery tours we have been on in the past. The "Experience" is at the site previously occupied by the brewery which has long since moved to a more "industrial" location. This is a very good sales pitch with the usual very expensive self promotional merchandise. But they do provide a reasonable beer sampling included in the somewhat elevated price of admission.

Worth a visit. We had a nice time walking at our own pace through the tour. I would not have done the tour on my own, but my fiancee wanted to do it. I was pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed it. The best parts for us were learning how to drink a beer properly, learning how to pour a beer properly and then being "certified" as authorized pourers -- that was quite fun and we both received a nice certificate as a souvenir. The beer was delicious!

Beer. The Heineken Experience is very good. Makes a difference from the cultural sites in Amsterdam. Arrive mid afternoon, place is very busy, but big enough not to feel crowded. Tour takes you through the whole process very interactive and fun. Really enjoyed the experience. And the included beer was nice too. I may have been converted to beer. Excellent trip not to be missed.
Advertising gimmick. Most of this experience is Heineken tooting its own horn so unless you like Heineken I would say don't bother, especially for the 16/18 euro entrance fee.
Great trip through Heineken land. History of company and product. Hands on. Learned how to drink a beer. Apparently I've been doing it all wrong! Got two drinks at end of tour

Fun attraction in Amsterdam. Really enjoyed the Heineken Experience this past weekend while in Amsterdam. While it was a little pricey, our group made the self-guided tour fun and entertaining. The 4D "ride" was unexpected, but a fun twist. You get 2 tastings, one after the 4D ride and then at the end when you use your chips. Be advised that the "bar area" at the end is club-like, in that there is little seating, dark lighting and very loud music - but overall a fun time! The activities along the way were fun, and we were able to email the videos and pictures to have for future enjoyment. I will say, Heineken tastes soo much better in Amsterdam, and more so in the Brewery, than it does in the states, but after the #HeinekenExperience I am a fan! If ever in Amsterdam, would definitely do it again.

One of best things we did in Amsterdam. Amazing museum, so big and is a good half day trip :) and is in a lovely area so we walked to it. Very unusual museum but ideal as we went with another couple and they were not big museum goers...it was very interactive with lots to do. Great value for money, it was €18 for museum, taste of brew half way through, then a small pint at end to taste with staff and then 2 pints in the bar at the end. Some lovely people also gave us their tokens so we had 3 pints each ha ha There was also a little ride too, where you were the beer and got brewed...loved this!Would reccomend to anyone and would go again.

Really cool!. Totally worth the money! There was a self-guided tour, 4D ride, beer tasting, and other really cool stuff. And you get two free beers, who does not enjoy that! My favorite thing was the boat trip thou. I was really happy with that - seeing Amsterdam from canal.

Top 5 of our Amsterdam time. We had a blast at the Heineken Brewery. The self-guided tour is decent, but you need to make it fun for yourselves at times. Note - don't actually eat the hops and barley...they are kidding when they tell you about it!! There is a 4D 'ride' that you have to experience too - nothing crazy, but a cool addition to the tour. Make sure to stop at the photo kiosk and take/send a memory to your email address so you don't forget the journey. Your bracelet admission pass as two buttons on it - each getting you a beer at the end of the tour - make sure to keep those buttons and look for more! A huge group of older people weren't going to use theirs so we got another 20 buttons to share! Let's just say we left the tour feeling pretty good!
Amazing. This tour was really good it is worth every penny. We spent about 2 hours in here and I did not want to leave. They also have a free boat ride at the end.

Heineken: a great experience!. The hubby and I had a quick trip to Amsterdam and decided to stop in for the Heineken tour. Not too pricey and we love the beer so we thought it'd be worth a look.Very fun, great staff and the beer seemed better than what's in the stores. A full range of goodies in the gift shop. And it's worth it to splurge and use 2 tokens on the 1 colder larger Heine than 1 token on 2 of the regular normal temperature size!!

A MUST DO !!!. GREAT FUN WE LOVED IT :)you dont have to like beer to enjoy this :) lots of different fun things to do and see and along the way you learn bits and pieces. very relaxed easy walk around a beautiful building and the fun bits where great i became a hero and a dj even just for a short time it was very much enjoyed. great memories so if you find yourself in the wonderful city of Amsterdam put this on your list!!!

It's great and it sucks at the same time. Walking thrugh the old brewery of Heineken, seeing where the silo's where, seeing where the horses still are - yes, it's trip down mememry lane. The movie theatre in which you follow the production process as if you were a grain is quite brilliant, but also: it's all so Disney. The beer at the end of the tour is well-deserved but should be Star-Served - and it isn't

Totally worth a visit!!. As a Beer lover, its just a must do in Amsterdam. Heineken is one of the world most known brands with so much stories to tell. I can highly recommend it, it is a 2 to 3 hours action with a lot of fun. I was there with my female cousin who is not a beer drinker and she enjoyed it very much as well!

Relaxed and happy experience.. You are probably thinking: is this worth it? Well; if you have absolutely nothing with beer: maybe not. But otherwise: certainly. You will basically walk through a museum which is sometimes interactive. You can learn everything about the history of Heineken and can also learn something about beer in general. You will also see how it is made (but this you can also do at a tour at a micro-brewery). Besides that you will come in some nicely decorated and interactive rooms which challenge your senses. In the end you will also get 1 or 2 beers from your entry money. If you go there annoyed, tired or with skepticism: you will probably not get turned and won’t enjoy it. If you go in there happy, relaxed and with the idea to have fun for an hour or two; then the time will fly, you will see some nice things and in the end you will stand outside, happy and be amazed that the time flew by.Extra: if you like this: also check out the Bols-experience (the maker of the liquors like Curacao, dutch-Gin (Jenever) and the famous-in-the-US: Bols Vodka); also fun!
amazing. great fun and history..... got my personal name written on the bottle.... very good location and not very expensive

Free beer - free boat ride. I've read some of the reviews here but in due fairness while yes it's a marketing building for Heineken, the price you pay for the ticket and what you get back i.e. complimentary beer and a free boat ride cancels out whatever complaints one might have of the tour. Good only for fans of beer!
Great Experience. Very interesting experience, some interaction at the end you get two free drinks which you can either get from the bar or pour your own, great fun

great day!. i'm not a lover of beer but my boyfriend is so i went for his sake. i actually ended up really enjoying myself. you get to walk round the factory and learn the history behind the beer making process and the company. then the best part... free beer! over all a great couple hours and well worth doing if you are in amsterdam!

Just another brewery.... Yes there are some touristy things to do (it's very similar to Coca-Cola World in Atlanta), but def not worth 16 euros. We were rushed through the museum since we went 2 hours before closing and the boat trip was booked 30 minutes before it was meant to leave. The free gift isn't at the gift shop attached to the museum, but a "15 minute" walk (which ended up being 30 minutes for us). The museum itself was great for photo spots (just don't get stuck behind a large tour group). The free beer was nice but 2 small glasses of beer doesn't equate to 16 euros :( If you have lots of time in Amsterdam or are a die hard Heineken fan, the Heineken Experience could be for you. Otherwise, there are much better local pubs where you can people watch and enjoy a refreshing beer.
Fun experiense!. As a home beerbrewer this tour was one of the best we visited in Amsterdam.If was fun to see how they made it and also the history behind it all. Fun way to be a little cultural.

Didn't expect a brewery to be so much fun. Not only is the Heineken Experience fun, it is also educational for various reasons.So much to be learnt and enjoyed - and you get to sample some free beer at the end of your tour!

Shawn. Thought this would be a tour of a brewery and a good overview of beer brewing. This was only a small part of the tour however and it was very underwhelming. Mostly it was just a heineken advertising stint. You walk through the brewery quickly and then spend the next hour in sensationalist, flashy rooms with heineken logos everywhere. An example of this is walking through a room where playstation consoles are set up so you can play fifa. Nothing to do with beer brewing at all. I expected a bit of this but it was ridiculous here. That being said, there was a neat ride simulater where you followed along the process of beer brewing but thats the only interesting part really.

One of the best museums around!!. The Heineken is a very modern and interactive museum. It is filled with a lot of movies, real people explaining everthing, a 4D movie experience on becoming a beer, real horses, getting your official Heineken beer pouring certificate, good bar, free beer, free boat trip, free gift!
Very interesting and fun time for us and highly recommended!!

what experience?. I can't believe that we payed 16 euros for this. Went there with 2 hours before closing time, but they didn't want to let us in, saying that it's closed. When they noticed that we already have the tickets, they allowed us in but kindly asked us to hurry up a little bit. Well, hurring up a little bit ment that we constantly had to run from one room to the next one, with a cute blond girl constantly coming after us and telling us to go faster. And faster. And then even faster. In most of the rooms we couldn't even read all the informaton, as we were being constantly kicked out. And the included beers are just way to small to call them a beers. I definetely don't recommend this to any tourist, no matter how big Heineken fan you are. With that money you better go to a bar and have some real heineken beers.

Possibly not the best tour in the world. Long queues outsider, longer queues inside. Couldn't talk to the beer horses, was rather self congratulatory. Have written this review whilst bored using their wifi; will write a further review if I feel my experience improves!!

Biggest Tourist Trap in Amsterdam. Really way overpriced. 18 Euros...= approx. 24.00 US!Basically the whole thing cost us 8 bucks /beer :(It is pretty much set up as an "experience" vs a brewery tour, which was super disappointing for us. Mostly for young males/females under the age of 30, would really enjoy this. Lots of fun computer games and such, but very little info about the beer. We waited in huge lines for the Heineken Experience, was stuffed into "holding pens" like cattle, and head to butt on stairways and escalator .....and you just walk about on your own. It was nice to take your own time at each station. The highlight for us was seeing the draft horses, wagons, and stalls. At the end you are "rewarded" with some Heinie and some very, very overpriced souvenirs, if you have any money left. The tasting rooms WAS EVEN MORE CROWDED on both sides and was set up like a club. Fun, but too many people to enjoy. The live DJ was playing some pretty good music.recommendations: I wouldn't go. With all the time we wasted in lines, pushing to get beers, ect, it would have been better spent in the local small town pubs, which frequent through out Amsterdam. Don't waste your time, there is so much more to see in Amsterdam than this!

BEERRR!!!. Nice atmosphere in the FACTORY!Nice the corner where you have funny activity to do such as take crazy pictures in characteristic dresses, or play to be a DJ! Even won an EXTRA BEER simply answering that Heineken is the best Beer in the world! THANKS! Happy ending the boat trip after have finished the trip inside the factory!

Unnecessary. Overpriced, takes advantage of poor tourists not knowing further than that, you only get two beers and the staff was very rude. If you want good beer and friendly people, go to one of the other amazing breweries Amsterdam has to offer.

Good fun!. I myself am a fan of Heineken beer so I couldn't not go on the tour whilst staying in Amsterdam!No beer is produced on site anymore and the factory has been renovated to show how beer is/was made. This is really fun for anyone aged 15+, you get 2 glasses of beer throughout the tour and the whole thing takes about 2.5 hours.The staff are really good and enthusiastic and have the typical Dutch sense of humour.
A little bit overpriced. It is a nice experience, cool technology and a couple of beers are included but the entrance fee is a little bit overpriced.

So fun :). Have you ever used to feel like beer? Heineken brewery is that place where you can try to be it. You will be brewed in a small dark room, after what you will be able to taste two small beers that are included in your ticket price. There are a lot of interesting interactive rooms and relax zones. It' definitely place to visit.

Heineken brewery. A detail look into the Heineken's history with an extra portion of marketing and fun. Audio-visual and tasting experience, free beers and Heineken's glass as a gift included. It was a great time for us, we get more than expected and it worths the money.

Average museum but interesting. I personally would not have chosen to visit the brewery however it was on my partners list of things to do in Amsterdam. However, I did enjoy some parts of the museum, the ride in particular and the tasting, although I found other parts of the museum a little lacking in information
Atleast the beer tastes better than the 'experience'. Group sizes are too big, had to wait the whole way around and was really hot. Wouldn't recommend to anyone!

Don't miss this even if you're not a beer fan! . Don't listen to people who say this is "such a touristy thing to do". It is one of the best and most fun brewery tours I've been to. Complete with a walk through history, branding, seeing the actual brewery, sitting through an simulation of making beer, 2 free beers and you even get to bottle your own beer! It is very conveniently located near the museums so you can't afford to miss this.

Have a drink before you go!. So, here's a strange thing... A brewery tour with no beer! OK, I exaggerate a little, you get 150ml about half way around and two glasses at the end (though as we went as a group in the evening the bar and shop were closed by the time the tour ended). If you are familiar with the idea that beer is made from four ingredients, then you're not going to learn much. If you have a TV, play station and camera, then you're covered for most of the other exhibits (re runs of adverts, sponsored events and walls made out of bottles). All in all, a bit underwhelming. In probably comparing it to distillery tours I've done where the guides are knowledgeable and the products interesting and worthy of discussion, and this was just a pretty cool old building with some old equipment and silly exhibits where (spoiler alert) they reveal there is no art - just the same scientific chemical brew the world over. The food (if you are on hospitality) is very god though!

Its fun in a rainy day.. Its good. Not very good. If you are in the area and looking for a spot to kill time while the angry clouds pass by... The historical part was so so.The part with the ads was good.We forgot to ask for our gifts at the end of the tour (the white bead on the wrist band).

Best Brewery experience ever. What more could you ask for? A great place to visit and learn about the brew, friendly and knowledgeable staff, and on top that, FREE BEER. Take some time to enjoy the place. Well worth the 18 euro
Brilliant would go back again.. From start to finish we really enjoyed the few hours in the Heineken Experience. It was great value for money and I would highly recommend it.
What a surprise. We loved this, it was so much fun even for the non-beer drinkers. Loved watching the old Heineken adverts. So much to do in the building. Made us feel like kids again.

Not as good as we expected. It's a fairly average tour with little focus on the brewing process. You get an overview of the ingredients and a brief video/ride explaining the process but it doesn't contain as much detail as other breweries, such as Guiness in Ireland.That said, it is interesting and contains a fair quantity of interactive exhibitions, you also get 3x small beers.

Great experience, excellent beer.. Went to Amsterdam last Easter, me and my friends decided to try the Heineken experience, the prince is 18 euros, but it includes 2 beers at the end of the experience and also a beer after the 3D game. The boat that takes you back to city centre is awesome. Great value for your money.

Enjoyed every minute . I enjoyed every minute of the Heineken Experience tour and I don't even drink alcohol! My only recommendation is that you purchase your ticket online or at your hotel. It's likely a few euros less and you get to skip the long lines outside. Once inside, if you have a smart phone, you can connect to their wifi and download the Heineken Experience app. This prevents you from spending an additional 2 euros on a headset. All entrants receive a wrist band which allows you to get two free beers and a free gift (a nice-sized Heineken glass). Note that the free gift is NOT from the experience itself; it must be collected from the Heineken store on Rembrandt Square. The history of the beer is very interesting, you get to go on a simulated ride where you 'become the beer' and actually get hands on experience mixing brew and smelling hops/barley. You also get to sample the beer (a full glass) towards the end of the tour. Once you complete the tour, you go to this party scene where there is loud music and bars were you can use your wristband to get 2 more free beers. As the Experience a bit out of the way of the city centre, there is a shuttle Heineken boat that takes the Experience guests to Rembrandt Square (by way of canal) every hour for free! The canal tour lasts about 15-20 minutes and is beautiful. Beer is served on the canal ride (at a cost).
very cool place. loved it all! it was very interesting and entertaining.the gift shop is very cool- You can buy a Heineken glasses and they will inscribe your name and basically anything on it

Good, but not great.... The Heineken Experience is a cool place to visit. But, I wouldn't say you would not forgive yourself if you didn't get around to seeing it during a visit. It was fun, more like a museum. Towards the end it became a little redundant, but the beer in the basement and great music made up for it. There is a custom glass you get to take home with you, but it is not a the brewery, you have to walk 25 mins across town to get it.
Avoid weekend and rainy days. Avoid weekend and rainy days, otherwise you will spent time in queue and crowdy space. A different and interesting experience

Enjoyed this -. We wanted a cheap day out (ish) and wanted some beer.So we chose The Heineken Experience.Bought out tickets on the Amsterdam Tour Bus , so we went straight in. Very interesting tour of the Factory or "The Experience" - they show you the origins of Heineken and how it's a family Brewery still after 150 years or so. At the end of the tour you can get a pint of beer for free and a free gift which you have to go and get elsewhere for some reason, but there we are. Overall, I and my friend enjoyed the experience. Enjoyed sharing our Pints on instagram and other social media after the Tour , whilst drinking our Free Beers in the Bar area.

Interesting. Visited here while on a weekend break in Amsterdam. They need to organise their queue system better as it was not working well. Walking around was interesting although would have been nice to go outside and see the horses. Free beer was a nice touch but I think it is a bit much to offer you a free glass but you have to walk quite a way to another location to pick it up. Would have been better to be able to collect it at the experience. Worth the visit, the burgers on the roof top terrace were lovely but certain areas could do with a bit better organising.
Fantastic!. Worth every penny! Free beer and lots of wee things to do! Would return any day! Lots of opportunities to get a photo taken or even to get it on a tshirt!

Great Experience. This tour must be the best value for money in the city and also good fun. Apart from all the interactive experiences you get free drinks, a canal boat trip and a free glass.Don't miss it!
Fun tour. All in all, a fun tour to pass the afternoon. Strange to say but, it's a tour for the whole family. ;) I think cheesy is the best way to describe it.

Don't miss - FREE beer. Cost is €18 per adult but don't let that dissuade you. Well worth the visit. Interactive sets, tour of the brewery, even stop and see the famous Heinken Horses in their stalls! Plenty of photo opportunties. Spend a few hours walking around for the full experience and at the end, enjoy a free Brew or two with a free gift.

Great Experience. Very good fun attraction, and very informative about the company. The experience is quite large and has many elements to it, all topped off with a few samples of the beer!!! Worth a visit if you're in Amsterdam.

Brilliant fun. This was such good fun and there has been a lot of thought put into it. There was no queue and we were there for at least 3 hours. It was very informative about the history of Heineken, the family and the brand. Not at all boring - it was very interactive and loads of good photo opportunities too. Included in the price was a couple of beers at the end of the tour and a free gift. Very good tour and fun.
Good experience. Interesting - best bit was the experience of being brewed!! Fun and interesting hour and a half. A lot of advertising but a refreshing drink at the end. Enjoy!

Slightly cheezy but really fun!. I'm so glad we went to this! We were warned it is slightly cheezy (which it was) but that it was really fun (which it was). Very different for a brewery tour but they made it fun.

Yummy. So glad we went. I was never crazy about the beer, until the tour and now I really love it - it was fun photo ops, and interesting. I would skip the "ride" part next time, it was a LONG wait in line for a 10 minute movie that was so-so, and I would head straight to the fresh beers.

Lots of fun. Lots of fun and lots of beer. Its fascinating to know the story behind one of the best known brands of beer, as well as to drink it in the first brewery itself. Interesting even if you're not a beer fan!
Multi media experience. Very clever presentation of beer making. From the history of Heineken to the process to the celebration of the product. Oh an the beer was most enjoyable as well!
Great Tour. Enjoyed the tour - and the complimentary beer. Did not like the fact that we had to walk to another location to get our free beer glass - especially when there was a gift store on site.
Best musuem. Have much fun at the Heineken experience. An eye opening to beer brewery process and proper way of beer drinking. However is a

Fun, interactive museum - WITH BEER. If you drink beer and you go to Amsterdam. You'd be mad not to come here. A great informative and interactive museum, with opportunities to drink the famous brew along the way. You can also have a pouring lesson at the end and gain a certificate to brag up your newly acquired skills when you get back home. And then of course, have some more beer at the bar before you hit the souvenir shop.

very cool experience. I loved the tour, so funny and interactive. They show u the brewing process in a very funny and interactive way. Very nice staff, and they have the best souvenir ideas: u can customize a heineken bottle (its label actually) by adding something unique to you. Recommended to visit

Super funny. They entertain you all the time, telling you the history of Heineken, how to make beer, making you try it... It's an experience!
I lost all track of time completely!

A bit loud but reasonable value. Overall an interesting place to go. A lot of effort to make you feel you got value for money, which it did. However, our overall impression was that it was all geared to the under 25's with the video games and entertainment. We weren't interested in the 2 free drinks that came with the admission price because the area set aside to sit and drink them was playing very LOUD music. You couldn't talk to each other, it was like being in a disco. I've no problem with that but they could have created an additional quieter area to replicate being in a bar or pub. We weren't alone in feeling that way, as another couple found the music overpowering. There is also the offer of a free glass but you have to take a boat trip to their shop some distance away or make your own way there to get it. It felt like they were trying to keep you within their control with the offer of having fun on the boat to get your free gift. That wasn't mentioned when we bought the tickets to go there, so we felt that was a bit of a con just for a free glass.

Best Brewery Tour Ever. My friends and I were looking for something to do on a rainy day in Amsterdam. We all like beer, so this seemed like a natural. We were not disappointed! Everyone had a great time...there lots of activities to do at the brewery...the price includes two great beers...and it ended with a boat ride through the canals ending at their gift store downtown. Hint: save money and time by buying your tickets in advance from the concierge at your hotel.

Costly experience. We go there because my dad is a Heineken fans. The admission fee is too high, in return, it equipped many multi-media and animation inside the hall.The most enjoyable part is we can act as a bar tender and learn how to serve beer. Also, you will be taught the right way to taste and enjoy the beer.
Best interactive Museum in Amsterdam!. We had a great time there and met many friendly people: other guests as well as very openminded staff! Highly recommended

Enjoyable!. We decided to visit on a whim as we were booking a canal tour and were offered the canal tour for 12 euro cheaper overall if we booked another tour/museum etc So we thought as we had some time spare why not? So we decided on the heineken tour for a laugh. We paid around 16 euros each (pretty expensive but what the hell we're on holiday) We got inside and were given some wristbands for some free beer and gift (the gift being a bottle opener a 10minute walk away we didnt do it)So we walked around standard museum to start with and when we got to the end we thought it was over ? We felt ripped off but then realised there is more to this place. There is several places you can interact with computers and other items including taking your picture in different areas. All pretty basic but still a bit of fun! Then you are shown how to taste a beer again just a bit of fun. There is an interactive ride into how heineken is made and then shortly after there are several areas to wander around before you get to the bar. Now here you can have some beer if you have the wristband or if you like you can pour your own beer and get a certificate! I went for the latter just as it seemed it could be a bit of fun and a memorable moment.Overall i enjoyed my tour and would recomend it to anyone going to amsterdam!
Overrated eperience. I was on the whole a bit disappointed with our tour. It was just an average tour and below my expectations. Maybe I'm just not a beer person))

Interactive and interesting. If you are a Heineken fan then you should definitely visit this place. Lots of games you can play, tasting session and free drinks at the end...you can even pour your own pint if you want (but you lose a free drink if you do that so I would recommend not...).The staff were very friendly. The beer was good.Don't expect two free pints...its not...its like two half pints...or one 35cl of extra cold...and technically its not free because you've paid for the ticket...anyway...still interesting.
So much fun!. Everything inside are so interesting and fun which I think it worth the ticket! I will definitely recommend to my friends who is going to Amsterdam! :)
Fun. This was a fun stop, and I did learn a bit about the brewing process. It's a little bit pricy, but it includes three beers and a free glass, so it's not too bad considering that.

DIT Banter Society's Trip to the Heineken Experience. Mid April my college society, the Banter Society, and I travelled to Amsterdam on a mystery tour. Being in Amsterdam and being the Banter Society we figured it was necessary for us to stop by the Heineken Experience. Being a group, we reached out to them (Thanks, Lisa Kalkhuis!) seeking a discount and we more than delighted to receive one.On arrival, the staff were welcoming, excited, and patience with us, which was much appreciated as large groups can be hard to manage! The self guided tour is easy to navigate and crammed with excellent displays, tasting, and activities.Overall, the price was more than reasonable, the staff were exceptional and the visit was more than worth it. Its a must visit when visiting Amsterdam.

Interesting..but won't revisit. Its quite interesting and you will enjoy your time there of course they give out free beers which is fun for those who drink it!You should go but you can also skipthey need to clean the place though

Nice experience. If you like beer and you've never been to a brewery before this Experience is definitely for you. Even if you very on a brewery tour before Heineken Experience is very well and interesting organized.

Great fun!. My husband and I visited here on Kings Day. We were greeted with smiling and friendly staff and free orange crowns to wear! The tour was interactive and informative. We learned a few new things about the beer in the tasting room and had fun taking pictures in the other rooms. At the end we had our beers (free!) and picked up our free glasses. We had lunch on the roof and had an amazing burger and beer for only ?7. I think that might have been a Kings Day special. I'd be sure to leave at least an hour for this experience.
Lots of drinks. A throughly enjoyable trip taking you through the history of the company, lots of tasters and many opportunities to take photos
Nice experience. Been there with my friends. It was a really nice experience. Learning about Heineken history and drink some beers, what do you want more? ;)

Beer lovers - this is a must!. If you really like beer, you should definitely go! The Heineken Experience offers a tour of the old brewery, lots of Heineken history and a fun way to spend a couple of hours. The movie where you get to "be the beer" was funny. The rooftop bar has a spectacular view and the burgers went well with the beer.

A revisit from 25 years ago.. The Heineken Experience has changed dramatically over the years. I visited the actual functioning brewery what I was there last. It is now a display center with nothing functioning except the high tech displays. Long lines to enter can be avoided by purchasing tickets on line or through your hotel before you go. We are in our 70's now and in the minority. This experience is geared for young people with loud noise, videos everywhere and has no functioning processes that concern beer making on the premise. It was interesting to see and compare the differences from my initial visit. It, in spite of my observations, a very popular place for the youngsters. Have fun and drive carefully.

Even if you don't like beer. This is a very cool tour of all that is "beer". Very interesting, even if you are not fond of beer (like me) - not as commercial as you would think, and easily as nice as visiting vineyards or a distillery.

For a beer lover, this is the place to go.... Was in Amsterdan with an 8 hour lead time to get my connection flight. Took the time to visit this marvelous place... a big coincidence as Heineken is by far my favourite beer... definitely worth a visit... memorabilia, beer degustation, the "they brew you" experience, very interesting... recommend to all when there, particularly to the beer lovers like me!
Overpriced. liked the boat ride and beer best, The ride was awkward and funny, you will know what i mean when go.
Awesome. Just amazing. I never thought that a beer museum can be this fun and entertaining. It's an awesome experience!

AMAZING brewery!. SO much fun if you like beer! Very interesting, but fun at the same time. It's a really fun place, buy the tickets ahead of time and you save two euros and a line! They make it really fun, and you get two small beers with your ticket, and a free glass to take home!
Amazing!!. The best tour I took my whole trip. Such a good deal for your money, including a few beers, live music a few times a day & a boat tour around the canal. Lots of drinking & fun :)
Great Experience!. The Heineken tour was by far the best tour I took in Amsterdam! It was great and well worth the money! I would definitely do it again :)
So worth it!. We're a small group backpacking in Europe and have done a couple brewery tours before but this was our favorite by far! More than worth the price!!

Surprisingly fun and engaging . I thought it would be the usual food factory tour where you just sit and listen to someone talking about the brand and processes but the Heineken experience is surprisingly engaging and fun. I spent about 2 hours here learning about the brand and the exploring the process. I don't want to delve too much into what I did because I don't want to spoil the surprise for you.

It is a must !. very exciting experience. it was fun. 2 free beers and 1 glass as a gift. i was drunk at the end... proost!Buy the tickets on-line or at the ticket booths arround Amsterdam! it gives a good discount! and saves the waiting in the loooong line.

Good fun for a couple of hours. I've been on a few brewery tours in my time, so I learned nothing new about the process, but the story around the Heineken family and brand is interesting. There are some good fun parts to the tour including the 'be the beer' interactive experience and also the area where you can see the TV commercials, old and new, that have advertised Heineken over the years.There are probably more culturally stimulating things to do in Amsterdam, but if you've a couple of hours to kill, you could do worse

A good visit. Well worth a visit. Having been before some years ago i preferred the original visitor experience. Very trendy, flashy and disco like now but hey- they are catering for their majority clientele.

Well packaged commercial, but it's interesting. Besides the commercials at the beginning, I was pleasantly surprised by the 4D "ride" which transform you into part of the beer manufacturing process, complete with motion movement and water and bubbles. The final part of the tour offers 2 regular glasses of beer or you can opt to exchange for a glass of extra cold beer.Overall, it was a nice experience through this semi-guided tour.
Heineken Experience. A fun way to spend an afternoon... I try to go to as many brewery tours as possible when I am traveling. A great value.
Money grab. Treat you like garbage. They push you through. Tell you its a free boat ride then kick you off because you don't have a ticket. Do not go
Excellent. I my first trip to Hineken Experience - I liked it wery much. I don´t drink beer but this was must see and taste. Good and fun

Excellent Value. Excellent value for money. 15 euro which included tour, tastings, 3 drinks and a free glass as well as a 30 minute boat trip to the city centre. Plenty to do including interactive attractions.

Fun, educational and a little unexpected!. Having been to the Guinness exp in Dublin I thought it would be a similar trip but just a different drink! However, how wrong was I!?The Heineken Experience was fab - we hung our coats up and received wrist bands in just a few minutes having already pre-bought our tickets online at the hotel.Headed on through to see some class Heineken posters and hear about the story. This is is when I thought 'oh this will be the same old story you get in these sorts of places'.There was a museum feel to the place with some information sheets, artefacts and pictures establishing the history of the company.You could explore every part of the process and even got to see the stables and real horses that would have pulled the beer when off to trade in the carts.The walk around then got split up into meeting staff of the experience who shared knowledge about the beer. We got to touch, taste and try different elements of the beer at different points of the tour and it became a much more hands on experience. There was even a simulator ride which was really clever!I chose to use my 2 tokens on a 'pour your own' experience which is very memorable and great fun. Otherwise, you can spend your tokens on 2 Heineken drinks and sit in the bar listening to a live female singer. Completely up to you!Overall, a really fun couple of hours and I'm amazed how much I've learnt about beer!

Fun couple of hours. Really not to be taken seriously. After being culture vultures we went here and had a fun time. And some beer. We met Elvis to boot. Think it is very good value for money, there is even a canal boat that takes you back to the centre. Make sure you get a ticket for the boat from the concierge before you leave tho, it leaves every hour.

Brilliantly done!. Loved this place. Very interactive with lots of nice personal touches. Great free photo email and personalised bottles of Heineken to take home. Easy to spend a good 3-4 hours in here. Very informative and friendly staff. The 2 free drinks during the visit were much appreciated too!

Good place to start your trip. Excellent place to learn more about beer and Heineken. You can drink 2 half pint (or 1 pint) in the end of the tour. In the end you can also go to a boat tour in the Heineken Boat, and also win a gift.
Impossible not to go. This is A MUST GO EXPERIENCE! Interactive!! Interesting to be explained how they brew a beer by brewing you up!!!!!!!!!

Pretty cool. The free beer tasting alone made it worthwhile. The tour itself was just ok. Lots of new technology and interactive stops along the self guides tour. The highlight for me was the free boat ride through the city at the end of the building tour. Make sure to ask someone about it as it isn't advertised well. You get a nice ride and a free glass at the very end. We'd go again for sure.

Excellent for families. My husband and I went to the Heineken Experience because it was raining. What an entertaining, unique and modern way of portraying the history of Heineken. Very entertaining and interactive for young and older people alike. We liked the part where you could video yourself singing and could e-mail it to friends etc. The beer sampling was very popular for over 18s also the simulated effect where visitors were made into Heinkeken.There was lots of photo opotunities which everyone seems to like. A fresh and modern idea of informing how beer is made and bottled. Well done Heineken

It is what you make of it ..... I wasn't expecting much from this tour and felt it started off a little slow ..discussing the history of Heineken.
