By the end of the tour I was half cut, had spent 3 hours in the museum looking at all the quirky interactive things they had for people and had en excellent time doing so!Was pleasantly surprised at winning 2 beers in the quiz. Pay close attention on the tour and you too could blag some free beer :o)It costs 18 Euro to get into the museum but we paid 16 as there are money off vouchers in visitor guides etc. Keep an eye out for these to get some money off.

Good trip to fill a couple of hours. We visited here during my friends stag. 18 euro plus 2 free drinks and a free small Heineken glass. But you had to collect the glass from the branded shop which was a 15-20 min walk away, but worth it because you can get it engraved there for 3 euro if you want. It was quiet interesting learning the history and how the beer is made and all the staff were very knowledgeable. There are some playstations and DJ decks set up towards the end which was great fun with the boys. The bar at the end to get your drinks (1/2 pints) was really cool and a great place to enjoy ice cold beer. I would recommend a visit, plus it is perfect if you are going to do one thing in Amsterdam if you are on a stag.

Surprisingly Fun!. Let me get it out of the way at the onset: It is meant to be complete tourist cash grab. I went in not expecting much. But the time spent inside the brewery was good. The admission fee is high but you get 3 drinks and a glass (if you bother to walk across to the Heineken store after your time in the brewery). The history and origin of the beer is explained in quite an interesting way with a short time in simulator where they explain the brewing process. You will come out of the experience loving Heineken more than you ever have. The whole experience could take anywhere between 2-3 hours.

A lot of Fun surprisingly!. To be honest, I didn't expect much from this attraction/visit. But it was a lot of fun! It was obviously kind of cheesy and touristy, but they added in a few twists to make it fun and a little different. And the beer at the end was great. I actually ended up making some friends on the tour which was great. Fun thing to do!

More fun than expected!. After reading reviews of this attraction I was a little dubious as to what to expect but I was pleasantly surprised! At €18 it is quite pricey but that included your 2 hours entertainment and 3 drinks.The tour takes you through the history, the brewing process and the bottling process in a motion simulator then you have the opportunity to interact with several different games, green screens and adverts which was a lot of fun.You get a free gift (glass) which you have to go to the shop which is about a 15 minute walk away to collect but there is a free boat that runs to it.All in all this is a fun activity for all of the family and worth the €18.

Great experience. Visited the Heineken Experience the weekend of 5th April and it was a great excursion! From start to finish the staff were pleasant and informative. Obviously the best part was drinking the beer but every section was enjoyable. Also instead of having to go to the Heineken Store (which is not located at the Heineken Experience) a member of staff was at the entrance handing out the free gift. My only negative was there were not enough of the relaxing Heineken chairs to sample, and as they were incredibly comfortable nobody wanted to sacrifice their spot!

Great tour with great beer.. We visited as part of our week in Amsterdam. It was really interesting, fun and the staff very knowledgeable. Great beer tasting bar and if you get the weather try the roof top terrace, where you can buy a burger and another beer. Worth the money and a real treat.
Very intersting !. I liked to see Copacabana beach on the screen at the bar , the way the use to make beer and the horses. The draft is amazing !

A nice little all in one adventure!. We did this tour on a Wednesday evening around 530pm. This is the last tour admittance time. It's a little more informational now then it was in the past. You have quite a few photo ops and video ops. Don't miss these because they are free! You can record your videos on your cameras and even email them to yourself and others for free. You get a little lesson on tasting and a taste. Skip the round room that shows commercials, nothing happens here. Don't bother pouring your own beer but go straight to the regular bar and collect your beers. One of the cool things in the gift shop is the chance to engrave any glass product in their shop for for an extra €3. The last thing is the free canal cruise to the center of town to get your souvenir glass. It's a nice tour of the canals included in the price. Don't walk. If you like Heineken don't miss this!
Argh!. This place is just an enormous irritating advertisement and the worst part is that you have to pay 18 (18!) euro to visit it!

Fun. At first we thought it was a typical brewery experience, then it all changed. Very interactive and fun, the lady singer was fantastic! 1 tasting (smaller) beer and 2 beers included in the admission price. Great experience!

I couldn't wait to get out of there. I thought the first part was OK, a history of the company and it's founder. A little boring, I don't really care about the founder, or how significant the "A yeast" is. really the beer isn't all that good anyway. It's the Budweiser of the Netherlands.Then it went bad quickly. It turns into a Disney style experience. Wait in line to be herded into a "motion ride" that was pretty lame. A guy shows you how to properly pour and drink a beer, OK I liked that part. Sit in an oval room and watch their TV commercials, really why would anyone sit through that? Then into a series of money generating stations. Have your name printed on a bottle for €6, take a picture or video in front of a green screen, for €8, each. All in a nightclub style atmosphere. Not for me.All this leads up to your 2 free beers. Seems they make it intentionally difficult to collect the free beer. Everyone lines up in front of a bar. At the bar an employee had each person come behind the bar and pour their own beer, teaching the correct technique. If it's not right, dump it out and try again. So it was taking a few minutes for each person. We were about 40 people back in the line. I went up to see why the line was moving so slowly. After I saw the ridiculous process I bailed out. I don't want their free mediocre beer that badly. The 20-somethings in our group stayed, took them about an hour get get their beer.You are also entitle to a "free" gift, the catch is that you have to go to a different location to get it. There is a boat, but a long wait to get on it. The kids walked there (20 mins) away to collect a mini beer glass with the Heineken logo on it. So glad I bailed and didn't waste any more time there.The 'kids' liked it a little better than I did, but all in our group of 6, except one, thought it was a rip off. I hated it.

Pleasantly surprised. I started off thinking it was boring and a waste of time but those feelings were flipped by the end of the experience. I definitely enjoyed seeing the bottling process and understanding how it all worked. Being from the states, the beer definitely had bolder, crisper, taste to it which I thoroughly enjoyed. They give you a Heineken band and a couple cold ones on the house with the tour. Don't forget to stop by the picture and video booths and enter your email, it was cool to receive them in our email when we got back. You also get a chance to print a custom Heineken bottle, we did and I recommend it.

Good fun. A light hearted and fun way to learn about a great Dutch export. This was a very popular attraction and very busy when we were there, but this just added to the atmosphere. Your entrance fee includes three beers and a souvenir glass . You can also bottle your own beer with a customised label and have a glass engraved with your name. We laughed a lot with the friendly and informative staff and learned a lot about the process of brewing beer.

2nd visit in 7 years. The last time I was here was back in 2007. That time I enjoyed it so much, I thought I'd go back for another look. Glad I did, because a lot had changed in the 7 years since I'd been there. This is a must do experience if you are visiting Amsterdam. And even if you are not a lover of beer, go anyway because there are so many interactive you can do.
Fun day on a rainy day. good fun, even tough i dont like this beer and in the end it's just a big advertising center for Heineken i had some fun in it with Friends

Nice show. Heineken is one of the very famous beers all over the world and it is definitely worth to visit the brewery in Amsterdam. They make a nice show - especially i liked the "become a beer" show - they somehow simulate that you are the beer that is going through several processes. They do this with beamer, water, heating and moveable ground (like force feedback) In addition they also have nice souvenirs there. I took one bottle of beer with me with an original Heineken label and my full name on it. Very nice! :)The staff is also very friendly and in addition you can of course also drink 2 glasses of Heineken beer plus a small glass for tasting.The only thing they could improve is that they provide a personal guide.Worth a visit!!

Surprisingly great. We've done a couple of beer tours and enjoyed them, however this one stands out. After the initial history of Heineken and a beer tasting you think it's over....and it's not! It just gets better. You actually get to interact with what they have set up and it was great fun. Would recommend it to anyone just make sure you set aside a few hours because you get drawn in.

Fantastic Fun. We weren't really sure what to expect when visiting this attraction during our recent trip to Amsterdam but when we got here we had so much fun!Won't spoil it too much however we spent over two hours in this attraction and definitely got our money's worth by interacting with each area as intended.Would definitely recommend this place to visit. Would recommend pre-paid tickets and visiting in the late afternoon/early evening.

Good Experience!. Visited with a group of friends and was our first time visiting a brewery! A good experience if like us you have not visited the like before. Get to learn a lot about how Heineken is made and as part of the ticket (€17) you get a 1 large or 2 small beers and a free gift in a cool bar!

Recreational. This is a fun but excellentl tour to do while in Amsterdam. We booked this in a package through tours and trips in Amsterdam and this was possibly one of better ones. The brewery is easily accessed by taking tram 24 which stops directly outside the brewery. On arrival we were met by a tour guide who gave us a wrist band which entitled us to two free beers and a redeemable tag to collect a free gift at the end of the tour. They then took us through the brewery while being free to look at each process of the brewing as we went. We were then brought into a little cinema room where we viewed a short virtual movie before setting out to make and bottle our own beer wit personalised label. Along the way there were many interactive games to play and went tour finished we proceeded to the bar where our vouchers were exchanged for two beers each After browsing through the merchandise store we were then escorted across the road where the heineken barge picked us up and brought us on a half hour cruise of the canals around the city and they dropped us off at the heineken brand store just off Rembrandt square where we collected our free gift (a glass). The canal boat then took us back to the brewery again but we did not have to return If we choose not to. All in all it was fantastic value at approx 13 euro when booked in the package the tour and canal trip was definitely brilliant value for money. The whole experience lasted about 2.5 hours
Tasty beer.... Worth the visit. Nice small walk around and get some history behind Heineken. In the end you get to taste some beer in a nice atmosphere.

Great great great. It was first time for me to explore Brewery and this one is definitely worth it see. Very,very friendly and professional staff, interesting beer exhibitions ,history of Heineken etc.

Fun time!!. The place is very close to the Rijksmuseum. Since the entry is 18 Euro, exchange the last remaining gold coupon for the entry and it was worth it, esp with an option of 2 small or 1 large chilled beer at the end of the tour and a free gift... though expected the beer glass to be a bit more taller!! There are free lockers at the entrance to stow away all your jackets n bagacks. The tour is nice and well organised, brewing process explained and the fine aspects of beer and enjoing a beer. The 4D brewing experience is not to be missed and is the highlight of the tour. There are sufficient markers along the tour to inform where the free gift is available and wht time is the last boat ride. We missed the last ride, so did a stroll across the city, exploring and enjoin the sights to get to the Heineken Brand store... its fun and refreshing... Cheers!!
Good fun!. Great fun. Bar was a bit loud at the end but beer was good. Bit annoying that the free gift involved walking across town and wasn't what they told you it would be.
Great fun. Brilliant fun, lots of beer, only drawback, you have to travel to a different shop which is 15 min walk to collect your free glasses

It was ok. Was good to find out about the history of the beer but felt a little rushed, even though you can go at your own pace. The que for the included drink was very long with loud music blaring in your ear drums and for the free gift, you have to go on a treasure hunt across the city to find it. We gave up and went for lunch instead

Quite fun. We spent about 2 hours here. Its quite intereating if you want to learn about heineken
I recommend you buy your ticket from the city end and take thw ferry its 2? cheaper that way

Great beer and experience. This is a very enjoyable attraction, it is quite interactive and has various different things that you can try, like pouring the perfect pint and the 'bottling' experience. It's very good value for €16 (buy in advance or from a tours and tickets outlet) you get at least one small beer in the tasting room then another 2 at the end. A 30 min boat ride to the brand store is also included, where you pick up your free gift glass. Bottles of heineken for €2.50 on the boat is also great value. An enjoyable way to spend a few hours in Amsterdam!
Great Memory. Must visit. You will get more knowledge about how to make good beer.Also, there is free Heineken Beer after show finish. Taste of beer really great.

Really nothing to it.. Basically it's a walk thru commercial. Yes it has some interesting info and you get two .25 liter beers but it's so much wiser to spend your 18 euros on a very nice lunch in the Area. You won't miss anything if you doubt go.

Very Interesting!. You can spend as much time as you want going through this attraction. It is very interesting to learn the history of Heineken Beer. We had a limited amount of time, so we did not do it leisurely and take the 2 1/2 hours it could take, if you read everything and went through it slowly. We spent an 1 1/2 walking through, reading some exhibits, listening to all the audio and stopped for all the live demonstrations of how it is made. Your tour includes two beers, one during an educational demonstration and one at the end in their "very hep" bar. You can hang out there as long as you want. Ours also included a cruise, on the Heineken Boat, down the canal to take you over to the Heineken Store to receive a free gift. I also learned how to drink beer properly. I never have cared for it and found out why. They taught me the correct way and I had been drinking it wrong, which led to my dislike of it. I have a new appreciation for Heineken! =)

Good fun. Wasn't expecting much from this, but turned out to be a good laugh. Ticket price included a couple of drinks. Lots of interactive stuff inside, AND a boat trip is included in the price at the end of the trip!

Belated Review. Having done the Guinness factory tour in Dublin earlier this year I thought I would return and include a review about here. Although it was a few year back from what I recall it was a great afternoon out in which you learn a lot about how brewing beer/lager. As always with these tours the best part is the tastings. Great Heineken :-)

A lot more fun than expected. Plenty of interactive games and exhibits. Three drinks included and lovely clean surroundings. Can spend as long as you would like in the experience but probably allow one and a half hours.

Fun, Beer and Boat Tour....all bundled in one experience...... Heineken Experience covers a lot more than a brewery tour, like in this tour you get to know the history of establishment of Heineken beer and procedure of brewing a beer, a 3D movie experience of the beer making, fun area where you can be part of a song and learning of how to pour beer from fountain, Showcase of Heineken Advt movies shot in different parts of the world and cultures which is funny and interesting, session on how to drink a beer where you get to drink a beer and in the end you get another two glass of beer (at this juncture there is an option to switch two glasses to one big glass of extra cold beer which is maintained below -2 degree or switch them for one glass of beer and a certificate of Heineken certified pourer, though I preferred two glasses) and last but not the least you are given a free gift also which is to be picked from their another store located in central amsterdam. All included in the entry price of euro 18 you pay. I paid 15 after discount card of euro 3 I picked from my hotel. Do carry the discount card available at all hotels to avail the euro 3 discount. Further the experience include the fully guided Canal Cruise in Boat, which drops you to the central place in amsterdam near heineken store to pick your free gift. So you don't need to spend on canal cruise as well. The free gift they gave me was a beautiful beer glass though earlier they used to give a beautifully designed bottle opener. This entire experience is more than the value for money your paid. Kids are not allowed in this experience as the name suggest it's about beer and not the Teddy Bear. So if you like or love Beer just get set and go for this experience..... Hurrraaaah.....

Nice Experience. The Exhibit was very nice. I enjoyed the experience and the beer tasting and testing. My brothers where here last August and recommended it to me, so I booked via the internet, thus didn't have to wait in line and went straight through.

Better than Guinness. Recently visited Guinness tour in Dublin. Heineken experience in Amsterdam was a hundred times better, and more interactive. It pains me to say because I'm from Northern Ireland and love Guinness but Heineken experience was by far the best. A must do when in Amsterdam! Highly recommended!

for every one who appreciate a good beer. at a fair price you visit the place where magic is made, every step towards the production, and history how the owner made the brand one of the most well know in the whole world...besides, you can taste the sample and they have loads of interactions whiting the museum, like the add archive, or some games, for one who likes heineken you can spend a whole day there, and even if you don't like that much is a very nice place to spend some time...

Very nice experience. Heineken history, different experiences (learn to get a beer, how to drink a beer, feel like a dj, win the champions league, etc) and at the end you can drink two heineken beers :)

Godd but not great. Visited with my wife teenage daughter and son. No problems getting tickets and we gave our coats to a nice lady to look after (foc). Overall this really is for history buffs. Some interesting parts especially the interactive areas. The beer itself was excellent quality. The highlight was the canal cruise afterwards.

good way to spend 1-2 hrs. The tour is well organized and fun at times especially the 4D. It's a good way to kill 1-2 hours for €16 including 2 Beers…..You might be a little bit disappointed if you want to gain a deeper knowledge about the beer production. You also can Bottle your own Heineken Bottle @ €6 extra or engraving a Heineken glass for an extra €8.It`s a must if you love beer & you are in your 20`s/30`s….might be a bit boring for older people though!!

Interesting, educational, informative and FUN. This visit turned out to give us more than we expected. It is a complete experience, not only we got to know lots about breweries, it was not boring at any moment and we could amuse ourselves in the simulator and in the tasting. Very good experience!

Well worth a visit. A great combination of history from its beginnings right up to modern day - like sponsorship of the Europa Champions League Football. Very well executed and good value for money. Entry fee includes a couple of beers as well!
A touristy thing to do. Was a good afternoon and included in the price is a couple of beers.A very "touristy" thing to do but worth a few hours on a rainy afternoon
5 stars. We have spent there two hours and we were satisfied more than enough! It's great experience which I recommend ! For 18 euros you have a lot of fun, beer (free) and one gift (free).

2nd visit and enjoyed as much. We visited this attraction on our first trip to Ams about 10 years ago, heard they had changed the format of the tour, so went again, and was not disappointed, unlike the last reviewer there is lots to see and do, more than there used to be, Tip when doing the beer tasting section, get your answers in quick and loud you will "win" extra beer, one negative was the last section when you get your free beer, you have the choice of 2 standard Heineken or 1 extra cold, BUT they had run out of the extra cold, how could that happen !!!!!!, also you had to ask about the free gift, was not obvious where to get that and although this was indeed at another location closer to the centre, they laid on a free barge to get there, so not exactly a big issue. one last point on earlier reviewer, its hardly a waste of money when you get in the region of 10-12 euros of beer included in the fee (price varies dependent on where you bought one :) )
Brilliant. We really enjoyed this, staff are brilliant at there jobs and you get to drink lots of beer - would highly recommend visiting this

Worth a visit. Note - 25% discount with the Amsterdam card.We visited in the evening (last entry at 7pm) closes at 9pm.You take a tour around the brewery, to look at various machinery, play the 'pour a pint game', look at some beautiful horses and partake in a tasting session with some questions/answers thrown in.We ended up with two 1/2 pints in the tasting room whilst being involved in the q/a session followed by another 2 1/2 pints in the bar at the end.Had a free gift thrown in also - a Heineken glass (these were also for sale for 3 euro), we were given these at the door rather than having to walk to another premises to pick up as other reviews state.In summary a fun group outing.

Good exhibition. Although not a favourite lager of mine, we visited the Heineken Experience after having spent a good few hours in the Van Gogh Museum. Refreshment needed!I must say that this was one of the better tours I have been on and told the history of Heineken in an interesting fun way.What do you get for your money...the tour of the old brewery at your own pace; a taster of lager, followed by two further glasses of the stuff in the bar at the end of the tour; a boat ride along the canals to the Heineken gift shop where you are given a boxed Heineken glass.An all round good experience and well worth the fee of €17 each.

Surprisingly fun and pretty cool. I was not a beer fan and accompanied a group of guys at work but the place was really quite cool and there were a lot of fun things to do there. You also get a free beer at the end of your tour in a really fun club

Surprisingly good. I was not a beer fan and accopanied a group of guys at work but the place was really quite cool and there were a lot of fun things to do there. You also get a free beer at the end of your tour in a really fun club.

Very bad and expensive. 18 eur each for just suffer a Heineken marketing afternoon.Nothing to see really, and long queues to have the beers.Finally we skipped the beers to avoid loosing our time in addition to the money.Cherry on the cake: the promised small gift at the end of the tour. was only available if you visited the shop 3 km away! Totally unfair! I will avoid dtinking Heineken in the future, as I consider to have wasted 18 eur and two hours!

Interesting!!. I visited this a while back now, but I do remember that this museum is a museum unlike any other. It will keep you engaged in every last thing that is going on, there is live horses in the stables to visit, you can taste the brewed barley which goes into the making of Heineken lager.There was also the chance to practice pouring the 'perfect pint' at the end!NOTE: I did not visit April 2013, I think it was around March/April 2011

You have too!. We had no idea what to expect. We were told we had to go. So we did and we loved it. It's very interactive which is something I throughly enjoy. It has a lot of information and we had a great couple of hours. My advise would be to buy the tickets before hand saves you queuing up.
Awesome. Definately a must do, it was so much fun and a great experience. The beer of course is brewed there and so much different than in the US.

The surprise of our trip- amazing!. Myself and my boyfriend were looking forward to the Heineken Experience and it turned out to be so much more fun than we expected! It was honestly the best thing we did while in Amsterdam, for 17 euros it is a bargain! It is so interacrive with green screens to make little videos, a 4d bottling experience and a great little tasting lesson from the lovely staff! We particularly like getting a bottle printed with our names on for 6 euro amd recommend the free half hour boat trip from outside to the city centre brand store!!!

A must do. A great way to spend the day drinking beer and learning about it. I have been on a beer tour before but this is an 'experience'. While the tour was not very informative three free beers and a free gift at the end is always welcome. But it is quite informative about the process and you can also see the horses. The staff were great, very friendly and always helpful. Although if you do go to the brand store first you can get 2 Euros of the ticket price, but definitely a must do.

Great experience. Great to learn about the history of Heineken, even better to get a sample on the way though and a full size at the end. Great bar set up - very friendly staff, extremely friendly and welcoming

Great laugh. Great experience. I thought it was going to be boring to be honest but it wasnt at all. Best part you get 2 free pints in the bar and you get a chance to win 2 free small pints when a staff member asks you a question in the small group bar... so answer up. We won them all! The free boat ride was lovely aswell dont miss it!

Disappointment. More like getting bombarded with Heineken ads. Overpriced, really not much to see. After a brief beer history and info about production, you basically get bombarded with interactive Heineken commercial and promos. Not worth the time.

Great afternoon. This was a great couple of hours after spending time touring all the museums. I had expected your basic facility tour but The Heineken Experience is much more than that. Very upbeat, lots of interaction, lots of fun! Well worth the admission price.

Perfect!. This is perfect tool so if you are in Amsterdam do to miss this "factory"!! We were here for almost 2 hours and really enjoyed! there are real horses, James Bond train, Champions league and all other interesting things! very very nice and worth to pay appx 30 eur per person!

So Much Fun. We visited here while in the area for just one day. Luckily we got in ahead of the huge crowds that were lined up outside the building as we left. The tour is 18 euro (add half again for dollars) per person but you can look online for websites with prepaid discounts of 2 euro). This is what we did and got the combo brewery and canal boat tour. It does take around 3 hours depending on how much time you take in the brewery building. This is a self paced tour so you can go as slowly or quickly through the building as you like. You also get to sample two small glasses of draft Heineken and if you take the canal tour which is across the street with a timed ticket, they drop you off at their shop and you get a new small glass to take home. The boat tour is about half and hour and there is bottled beer for sale onboard for 2.50 euro. Heineken is very popular here and the tour gets packed so get here when they open at 11 a.m.
Girls. We loved every Min of this there's more too it than just tasting beer us 3 girls loved every min of it defiantly need to go !!!! "There's always something happening round beer"

What a surprise not what I had expected. Initially thought boring museum no not at all staff take coat and luggage free service , immediately your transported to a different world interactive and full of wonder and knowledge you can even have your name embossed and printed on your bottle it is then boxed in presentation box for abou t £4.50 opportunity to taste beer see things happen chat to staff loved the interactive show won't spoil it but great fun and clever system of band with 3Tokens on beers x two and gift included is free canal boat trip there and back to museum excellent value and good fun like willies wonka in Amsterdam thoroughly enjoyed it

A fun filled morning . We had a great time at the Heineken experience - informative but great fun. We were given 3 free drinks, so good value as well. We took our three month old with us - she was made to feel very welcome by all staff and we were able to lrave the pram in reception
Heinekin good fun. Really interesting tour and good to taste the beer too. Worh a visit and it does get very busy so you need to find out the best times to visit.
A must-do!. Outstanding tour! Learn about the history, how its beer is created, and see their worldwide brand in action. Must-do for anyone visiting Amsterdam!
Nice Experience! Must visit.. If you are a beer lover then this is a MUST VISIT, inspire of your love for beer this place offers some interesting information about Heineken.

awesome experience. if u have just 2 hours in amsterdam, definitely go to heineken experience. that was perfect exp. before go there, take a discount voucher from your hotel or hostel. it gives u 20% advantage. heineken experience tells you that how brew step by step. u spend two hours in there. but IT IS ALL WORTH IT.

Give it a go!. Really good, big experience that's very interesting if your a big fan of larger of not.
Takes a while to go round, interesting beer bottle experience, you learn something, 2.5 free pints and excellent, reasonably priced shop at the end!

A great laugh and experience. We bought tickets from a tour booth, it cost €16 instead of €18..We arrived and dropped off our bags and coat. We were given a wrist band with 2 free beer tokens and a white free gift token.The tour was good, we were shown videos, the factory were it was brewed and even turned into a bottle of Heineken.After the self guided tour you are given free reign off the games room and interactive photo booths. I gave my two tokens and pulled the pint and then drank it.It is good and worth a visit, you are also given a free glass from the heineken shop down the road.

High price, low value.. You get lots of information about history and development of the beer. The Exhibition is interactive, lots of videos to see and some things you can do on your own. Price is very high - 18€. In my opinion not really acceptable for that.

great fun, free boat trip. Entrance to the Heineken Experience is EUR18, you get a boat trip, beer, and a mini beer glass. The experience takes you through the history of Heineken, then you are on a 4D ride (if you are small go to the front)! The interactive games at end were also great as well. You can easily spend 3 hours here (including the 30 min boat trip, which leaves every hour. Check the departure times at the entrance before you start the experience) .

Brilliant!. We spent a whole morning here ... there's plenty of interactive areas, photo opportunities and interesting information. Just when you think you are reaching the end, there is another activity - some with great (unexected) 'added extras'! I won't spoil it for you all, but the 'be the beer' room is fab. For what you get for your money, this is definitely worth it - potentially hours of entertainment, especially if you like beer!

A Must-See!. I was taken here as part of my birthday present from my girlfriend and cannot recommend it enough! Really interesting and entertaining experience overall capped off with a great pint at the end. Go here!

Entertaining. The tour itself is rather expensive and focuses a lot on the brand. Would have been interesting to hear about the development of the Heineken group in general with all their brands.The tour is very touristy and a lot is just to keep people entertained and not very interesting. However, in the end you get 2 beers for free, a free 25 minute boat ride to the city center (departure every hour) and a free glas if you did the boat ride to the city center (where the brand store is located).

Boring.. This might be a bit better if you've never been on a brewery tour before. Spoiler - all beer is brewed the same way.Although in this case they don't even brew beer there anymore.There's hardly any interactivity. In fact the only interactivity is when you do the beer tasting.Otherwise, you learn a brief history of the company, then see medals the company has one. Then you see the old copper stills, which aren't used anymore. There are some horses, but you can't get close to them. After those you go on their motion platform ride where you go "inside" of the brewing process, which is ok. You then taste some Heineken with a guy who explains how to taste their beer. After tasting the beer, the rest of the tour is walking around looking at old Heineken adverts and sponsorships they've done over the years. You also get either 50cl of regular Heineken, or 35cl of Heineken Extra Cold. This free bar is drunk is a strange overly loud, club type setting. Very odd. You also get a token which you can trade in for a 'small gift' at the "Heineken Brand Store" which is about a 15 minute walk away (a bit further than the Flower Market). I was bored throughout.I'd never go again. I'd never suggest a friend went. In fact, I'd discourage it.The Guinness tour is much better
Had a great time. Had a great time in here there's just so much to do and you get 2 free drinks couldn't ask for more would recommend to everyone

Interesting and diverting. It was extremely interesting to learn about the brewing process and the history behind the family owned brewery. There were interactive parts to participate in, one can sample the beer a few times, and it is a great experience. Highly recommended

Great fun. Apart from being 30 years older than everyone else we really enjoyed this attraction. It was great fun. It's well organised with something for everyone. The brewery tour, a fun explanation of the process, interactive games, even a boat trip. Not forgetting 3 glasses of beer!!! Would recommend to all.

A bit commercial, but fun to see. The Heineken Experience, although commercialized and rather expensive (18 euros) is a fun way to spend an hour and a half. The tour portion, which is self guided, takes you through the beer brewing process. There is even a short motion ride, which shows you the brewing process from the "inside". There are a few stops along the way that allow you to take your picture superimposed on a bicycle in the canal, winning a football tournament, etc.The most enjoyable portion is the tasting area....the wristband they give you allows you two free beers. The atmosphere in the tasting area was a bar like setting, which was fun. The gift shop has clothes and Heineken items that are overpriced.Again, fun if you have some time to burn.

What an experience!. We loved the Heineken Experience not only for the history of the Heineken beer but it has also many fun, interactive games. We got the tickets on sale for 16€ from a local agency, The tour was cool and the staff were very friendly. Our favorite part was that you could pour your own beer with the bartender at your side and get a diploma for it. Very good experience and well worth the trip!

A MUST!!! . Maybe one of the best things to visit in Amsterdam!!! Great experience, super fun!! Many interactive games and beer of course!! Totally worth the 18?! After you finish get the shuttle boat outside that will get you to the heineken brand store for free!! Dont forget to buy something
Nice experience. We liked the Heineken Experience for the history about the Heineken Company and how to brew beer. Nice and friendly staff. And for tasting the good beer in end of the experience

very fun "experience". was great - and I don't even like beer! the tour was very cool, the guides were funny and the whole thing was incredibly interactive. Our favorite part was that you could make your own commercial and send it to your friends. Very good afternoon and well worth the trip!

Great Brewery tour. I loved the tour €18 for adults my 10 year old was free- my hotel gave out a €3. Coupon card so check with your hotel before you go ( online the tickets are €16 - we paid €15 with the hotel coupon) - you also get a free water taxi across town and a souvenir when you get to the Heineken gift shop- you can take the water taxi back to the Brewery for free!!! It couldn't be better:)
The best beer in the world...Nothing like a cold Heine!!!. I had a blast on this tour...I was on holiday in Europe for almost a month and did a weekender to Amsterdam...This is a must stop!!!

Nice, but expected a bit more. Nice Experience, some interactive options and in any case interesting to learn how Heineken is made, but will expect a bit more. One black dot is that in the price is included a free gift and when you arrive to the end of the activity and ask for the gift, they give you a map to go to another location, for sure a marketing initiative, even if they provide the transportation. Doesn´t look as a fare approach and at the end for what we saw, really few people take this option, so I cannot say that is a fake offer but ......

Good fun. If you are interested about how beer is made/brewed (especially if it's the Heineken way) then this is the place for you. I'm not sure it's suitable for kids as they would probably get bored and the last room you walk into is like a cheap nightclub. It's a bar which gives you a couple of free beers and then everyone stands in a dark room with club music and tries not to slip on or get stuck to all the beer on the floor.There's one 'ride' where you get shaken from side to side then sprayed in the face.It's really only worth the visit if you want to learn about the brewing process, how to drink beer (there's an actual lesson) and want a free beer.

Not mentioned in some of the guide books, but should be!. This is great, lots of fun. There's a beer theme obviously but the kids really enjoyed it too. Imaginative exhibits, modern, clean, interactive, funky. Very good value too. Staff were all very happy!

Great time, learning and tasting!. We purchased the tickets and at 18 euros each thought they were a really good price. The ticket included half a pint about half way through, and then either one pint, or two halves near the end. Everyone seemed to be having a really good time, and despite there being many stag do's, there wasn't anyone who was really drunk which was nice!You learn about the history of Heineken, the brewing process, and all importantly, making sure it tastes good!!!Would definitely recommend!!!

Great experience and definitely worth dropping in.. We really enjoyed the Heineken Experience. It is a very interactive, well-flowing (no bottle-necks, pun intended) tour that keeps your interest. You get a chance to use your different senses, and really experience the beer the way they want you to. I have been drinking beer for over 10 years, and I even learned a few things.

Awesome little tour. You learn the history of the beer. At the end they give you two buttons that you can either redeem for two beers OR give both in to pour our own draft beer. Also you can send video messages to your friends and family from this kiosk in one of the rooms! Worth the price and I did not wait at all.

interesting. heineken experience might be interesting for you if you love beer and also have no idea about it. if you have read any basic things about manufacturing process, it doesn't make a sensation. besides it is expensive.

Good fun and good experience. I went there with a couple of mates and honestly we had a good time and a good laugh. It wasn't too busy and the staff was smiling. We can taste a couple of beers at the end and we can even serve our own beer.

Surprisingly good. we had a really good time here, we spent about 2 hours walking round. its open late in the week too. it was interesting learning about the beer and getting to try some!! if you have a remote interest in drinking it would be good for you its very interactive you could spend ages in there. we weren't expecting much just and old brewery but it was high tech and captivating. at the end you have 2 tokens to use to get free beer you can have 2 small beers or learn to poor a true heineken and drink it for the 2 tokens. they even gave us a free glass too. definatly check this place out for some fun.

Fabulous Heineken Experience!. Fantastic interactive brewery tour - much better than I could have imagined! The tour includes the history of the brewery, the process of making their beer, and many fun effects & various interactive activities. Our group of 4 teenagers & 2 adults all loved it! Be aware that under 18's will NOT be served beer though - apparently the law changed in Amsterdam this Jan.

well worth the money!!!. A great day out we had, got to make our own dutch folk video, had a nice few beers, got a certificate for perfect pouring,would suggest this as one of the top things to do in Amsterdam!

Waste of Time/Euros. There was not too much to see, we had to then wait for a "ride" described as best part of the tour. This ride was standing on a board, holding on to a railing watching a video while being splashed with water. We waited 25 mins in a queue for it. Seriously, it was terrible.Throughout you are bombarded with advertising and there are some subconcious adverts too, such as showing you the brand, giving you a beer and playing positive "feel good" music at the end. You will queue a lot for attractions that are not that interesting and recieve tons of advertising forced at you. Plus you pay for the experience. We never got our free beer at the end as the queue was about 10-15 mins long to recieve it.

A Must See attraction - certainly NOT. I've done brewery tours before but this is not one to remember. The Heineken Experience in my opinion is overpriced, I managed to get a voucher to get 2 euros off but at 18 euros full price it's not fantastic value; granted there are two small beers included in the price but all the interactive things did not float my boat. In my opinion the whole place is gimmicky, tacky and touristy. It is simply massive self promotion - that is why it's a huge company and a brand name the world knows - but it is not something to write home about. Many people will find it fun, but there's so many other things in Amsterdam which will be a memory for life.

brilliant tour. myself and my wife did the brewery tour and we both found it extremely entertaining and very hands on, the staff were good fun and very informative. the only part of the tour that was a bit of a let down to us was that you couldn't get near the horses as the stables were behind glass screen shields.

Informative, interactive and Fun. The experience was very informative and I learnt lots about fermentation and yeast. It was also very interactive, there were lots of tings to do and I would say that it is fun for all the family, and not just lager drinkers. We went on a couple of things where it would take a photo and put it on a postcard and you could send it by email to one of your friends. You get 3 1/2 pint's of beer and children get 2 drinks. I would say, overall, it is fun for the whole family.

FUn, nothing you HAVE to see. It was a good way to kill a few hours while waiting to meet up with some friends. Interesting, not boring, and a few free beers. Wouldnt have been devestated if i had missed it, but definitely a good time.

A Walk with a beer at the end !. A couple of hours walk around the old brew house learning the trade of the master brewer apart from the secret yeast ! Excellent interactive attractions along the way.You are given a wrist band at the beginning of your tour to enable you to pour your own beer at the end or a soft drink, if successful you are given a certificate and get to drink your beer.Well worth a visit.
Great fun. This tour was great fun and interesting ,the whole building seems to have been turned over to it .It is very interactive and you get FREE lager ,also a canal ride is part of it .
loved it. Lovely experience, staff were super helpful and the beer was clear Golden nectar to a dry throat, will go again and spend a little more time exploring

Good fun. This was good fun. Lots of fun thigs to do as you go around seeing how the beer is brewed. Very interactive and gets you involed throughout the experience. Also get a few free beers on your way around. Highly recomend doing this.

Interesting and Fun!. This was one of my favourite parts of visiting amsterdam! The interactive areas and information kiosks were great not to mention the chance to pull your own pint (which I was great at!) and personalising a bottle to take home. Just beware if personalising a bottle, you cannot take it hand luggage unless you spill the contents out. I was happy to just have the bottle for keepsakes all the same. Great shop too!

outstanding experience. I liked it all in all .very nice, creative and enjoyable . they show you how did Heinekn start and the process and they have 3D showrooms they make you feel you are a drop of beer .. they explain to you the right way to drink it . you get out with two free drinks and two free gifts. they offer facilities where you can take photos or videos for yourself and send it free for your email.

Enjoying. If you love beer, than you will enjoy the full hour you experience inside. Every moment they succeed to get your interest. You are clarified about the beer process. Play games, watch 4d beer movie, and drink 2 beers inside a very well decorated bar.

Great value and really interesting. Shire horses were lovely - totally unexpected! Great experience and value for money, went on for a couple of hours and all very well organised and some beers at the end :)
Very interesting company experience . A good place to visit, nit only interesting to learn how bear is made and Heiniken works, but to taste fresh tap beer abd have a nice day.
A lot of fun, great value . Just got home from amsterdam and have to say Heineken experience was probably our favourite tour. Loads of fun and staff all great. Great value for money, do it

Great . We did a few trips an stuff whilst in Amsterdam but this one was the best by far you get three free drinks you get to see all the history of Heineken an loads of interesting things you can bottle your own beer an have your own script put on the bottle which wasn't expensive was a great day takes about three hours and the gift shop at the end altho a little pricey had some great things.

Value for money. Enjoyed the heineken experience very much, interesting, fun with pictures and videos u can email to yourself, free beer, wristband and free 1/2 hr boat trip to rembrandt square where they give u free gift from there shop. Bought some lovely gifts too, a bottle of heineken with a message on, be careful though, u cant take it in your hand luggage, but no problem drink the beer and then u can take it thru customs. Would recommend a visit to the excperience

Great for beer lovers...... ....and pretty good for non beer lovers alike as my wife,who reluctantly accompanied me can attest !.We got here via the hop on hop off bus on a wet February afternoon and walked straight in,no need to queue.The entry fee is €16 if you get a discount ticket from the HO-HO bus which is a bit more than other attractions but you get 2 free beers which must be about €5-6 worth so it's not that bad.The first part of the experience tells you the history of the Heineken family and the brewing process and was quite interesting for an older visitor like me ! (40+).You see the giant grain silos,copper brewing vessels and the horses used to deliver the beer,not sure if they still do or are just for show !After that you're taken on a virtual 4D ride where "you" are brewed,a bit cheesy but quite good fun and from then on it's basically a giant Heineken advert ! not really complaining but it's very much aimed at younger visitors,there's a room where you can show off your DJ'ing skills,play Champions league football on the Playstation and plenty of displays where you can make videos and take pictures to send to friends,you can even try your luck at pulling the perfect beer ! Finally you get your 2 free beers and it really does taste better than the Heineken you get here (UK),it's definitely stronger !Of course you exit through the gift shop where there is all manner of Heineken branded merchandise to part you with your euros !On leaving you are given a token to exchange at the Heineken brand shop near Rembrandt square for a free gift,we didn't take the free shuttle boat but instead found it on foot the following day.All in all the Heineken Experience is well worth sending a couple of hours on !

Amazing experience,must visit. We bought the tickets online as they were cheaper (€16), as you get there they have a cloak room so you can just leave all your staff there, they will give you a wrist band with 2 tokens you can exchange for a drink in the end. All the employees we met were just amazing,so friendly and helpful. It is not a place to get drunk as other mentioned, it is an amazing experience were you find out about the history of heineken,check out old bottles and logo's and just really understand the brand more. There some amazing spaces were you can spend time playing games or taking silly photos. They will give you a little beer in the tasting room and explain the big mystery why dutch people leave the foam on the beer. In the end you exchange the token from the wrist band for drinks. Upon exiting the gift shop a member of staff approached us asking if we would be interested in a free boat trip+gifts. She has given us free tickets for the 15 mins boat tour, which departed across the street and it took us to the heineken shop were we exchanged a white token for a free Heineken little glass. It was a very nice touch and ending to the experience. Really if you are in Amsterdam it's a must and worth every penny.

An enjoyable afternoon experience. We visited the Heineken experience during a cold afternoon in Amsterdam. It's a little way out of the main centre but you can easily walk in about 20 minutes from the Central Station or grab a tram from the centre or indeed a river boat!On arrival, all coats and bags are neatly stored out of the way and you are given a token for a free Heineken at the end of the tour. The museum is interesting to walk around and it's great to see the big brewing tanks, you can almost imagine what the factory was like when it was in full use.About halfway through the tour, you are shown how to pour the perfect beer and given a glass of Heineken. After this point, the tour becomes a little more comercial and a lot of the things on show are just Heineken branded products and sports products which became a little boring.However, you are then taken on a boat ride down to the Heineken store where you are given another beer and have the opportunity to buy a bottle on the boat which is a nice touch.We would definitely recommend the Heineken experience as a good afternoon out in Amsterdam and a must see, even for a long weekend trip to the city.

Very nice experience. The experience was very nice and informative. Since it was very cold we were laden with jackets, scarves and bags; Staff very kindly take all these from you for safe keeping and give you a token to collect later. It is very informative every step of the way. Staff are very friendly and helpful. There are some very entertaining games and loads of places to take pics :)
Such good fun!. The start was a little more factual but then it got really fun and the staff are just awesome! Must do!

Quite a fun place. Your ticket entitles you to 2 free beers and 1 free gift. Along the way, you'll get more free beers if you can answer their questions correctly. The tour was good fun, pretty informative on the Heineken brand and the crowd was very manageable when we visited in the late afternoon. Overall an entertaining experience, worth about 1-2 hours of your time inside. Go if you can afford the time in Amsterdam.

Somewhat dissapointed. I am possibly the wrong person to provide advice as I do not normally drink alcohol and certainly not beer, however I found the whole attraction somewhat boring with too much information about the process of making beer which most visitors just walked by. What was very popular was the bar where one can exchange the voucher to a small glass of beerr

Well worth the visit. I was lucky enough to visit early afternoon on a Sunday in January. No lines. No crowds. The tour is educational, informative, and entertaining. I tasted wort for the first time, enjoyed the simulator ride, and learned a lot about the history of Heineken. I'm a Guinness drinker and couldn't keep from comparing this tour to the Storehouse in Dublin. Its a close second which means its a very good tour.

Don't drink too fast!!. Heineken Experience is great fun - the simulator is new since our last visit. The beer is, as you would expect, tasty. Half way around the tour you are given a taste (about 1/3 pint of beer). Don't answer any of the questions is you expect to stay sober - correct answers are met with another beer. At the end of tour you have tokens for more beer and, of course, they have to be drunk. It ended very messily and when the cold fresh air hits - its worse. Enjoy.
Heineken Experience. It was a good tour, you get to practice pouring beer, make a custom beer bottle. The price is a bit much. But check it out anyways..

A Must. Picked up tickets for the Heineken Experience from a tour operator we stumbled upon who were advertising the tickets for €16 instead of €18 and, intriguingly, stated that the tickets would "skip the queues". Headed over to the brewery on a Saturday afternoon to be greeted with a massive mob for tickets which we were able to bypass thanks to having bought the tickets already, so not only did we save a little bit of money just picking them up earlier, but we also saved a considerable amount of time!The experience itself is great fun and very interesting. You learn not just about the history of Heineken and the sheer success it has enjoyed, but also about the brewing process involved while walking around a very beautifully preserved brewery, complete with a stable of Shire horses. There's interactive learning material, games, comfortable seats and of course, a few freshly poured Heineken's that go down a treat. Great experience and a must for anyone visiting Amsterdam, beer drinker or not.

FREE BEER! And a good laugh!. Besides getting 2 free beers included in your ticket price, this attraction really is good value for money. There was a smattering of history regarding the brewery but the emphasis seemed to be more on the advertising and marketing, which isn't necessarily a bad thing but I'm not sure what I actually learnt. There are a lot of really good fun interactive games and what not, and the tour is very well laid out. I also got the chance to learn how to draught the "perfect" Heineken, which was a laugh, especially if you've never pulled a pint before! I came away with two free beers, a certificate for my draughting "skills", a bottle with mine & my partner's name on it (only €6) and a sore face from laughing, so I really can't complain. Go give it a go, I'd say!

For Twenty-Somethings. If I was twenty-something, and I am not, I might give this a better rating. It's definitely geared towards young adults with an emphasis on interactive video/games with a smattering of history. If it wasn't the two free beers it would be hard to spend more than an hour there. If you are in your twenties and better yet, in a group of twenty somethings then it's a good way to kill 1-2 hours for 18 Euros. If you are a couple in your 40s or older or with your family...spend your Euros in a museum instead.

Excellent + take the boat ride. Me and my partner visited in February 2014. We loved it. We had all three beers which you are given when taking the tour and then even after we went and had another! There was lots of interactive speeches and machines. Although there isn't a lot to the beer making process to tell us we still had a really good time. An absolute must is to take the free boat tour after to their store. Its a free 25-30min boat tour with a guide giving really interesting information. We then got given a free glass at their store at the end. The boat ride at the end made it well worth the money we paid! It's inside as well so even better if the weather isn't behaving itself!

Tasty And
fun. I last visited here in 1982 when it was still an actual brewery. You still get to taste beer but they have a put a lot of fun twists on showing you the beer making process and the history and marketing of Heineken. Enjoyed the skyfall, champions league and marketing as much as the beer. Certainly worth a visit and expect to take 2 hours or so

Good way to spend a few hours. This is a really fun experience, it's interesting to learn about how beer is brewed, and of course it makes you thirsty for some Heineken! They give you a couple of beers at the end of the experience and overall its a nice way to spend an hour or two in Amsterdam.
Truly Experience. It was a really enjoyable, interesting visit in Heineken Experience. It's interactive, you can try tro draw off the beer. Projection is fun.

Good marketing idea!. The tour is more about the marketing idea of Heineken rather than the beer production. So you will be a little bit disappointed if you want to gain a deeper knowledge about the beer production. Anyway the tour is well organized and funny. You can even download as well an app (free of charge) to have a guided tour. In the price 18 € on site (16 € if you buy the ticket on line) are included two beers at the end of the tour and a gadget (to be picked up in the Heineken Shop in the centre of the city).The price in effect is a little bit expensive, if you think that the “Heineken experience” is more a marketing/advertisement tool of this company.
Fun. We went with a group of friends & even though we are not big drinkers this was an amazing tour! Would recommend it to anyone.

Again, fantastic experience!. I loved the Heineken Experience! There's so much to do in there, it's informative and fun! Took us 3 hours to get round the whole thing and I enjoyed every minute of it. A must for any visited in Amsterdam

Wouldn't recommend. Admission is expensive. It's not especially informative. At the end, you get two beers. Throughout the tour, you're promised free souvenirs. However, when you ask for the souvenir, you're given a map to some store somewhere else in Amsterdam. It didn't appear to be overly close.In reviewing comments, I see that several people mention a free boat ride. I have no idea where or how that was arranged. Guinness is less expensive and a much better experience.

It's really fun. Has a lot of fun attractions inside plus the possibility to send taken videos and pictures to your email which is cool. Bit pricy but we got extra beer for free :) The gift is also included in the price but the down side is that u have to go to shop to collect it which is 15-25 min walk or u can take shuttle boat which is every hour on the hour but if u take the last boat which departs 19:00 they not gonna wait for u they will just leave u there.

Heineken Experience rocks. What a great attraction you have in Amsterdam we thoroughly enjoyed our time there we enjoyed all the interactive applications there and of course the Heineken :) and on the plus side we also got a free trip on the Heineken canal boat at night . And a free souvenir glass to boot

Brilliant. The Heineken experience is great fun. The tour is great and really interesting and there's so much to do along the way. Plus with free beer along the way, you can't really complain! It was rude not to buy an engraved bottle as memorabilia in the shop at the end as well!
Fun Times. Alcohol is sometimes a fun time consumer, and this experience did not disappoint, fun times and even bought a T shirt and a personalised bottle. We enjoyed the tasting throughout the tour.

Great Fun!. I loved the Heineken experience from start to finish! There was loads to do from pulling your own pint to pretending the be a DJ! We had loads of fun and would recommend it...lasted about 3 hours (2 hours in the gift shop wanting everything!!)

Lot of fun and a free boat trip ;). In the end you really get an idea about the Heineken empire. You can have a lot of fun with games, videos, advertisement, movies!!! Also have the chance to have a small boat trip, between Heineken experience and the Heineken Store. You also can pour your own beer.Suggestion: Plan you visit carefully because in the end you can have a ride in the boat to return almost to city center!
Pretty Good!. A very well put together brewery tour. You get two beers at the end that are included with your tour ticket. My wife isn't a big beer drinker but she still really enjoyed it.

Interesting. We visited The Heineken Experience with some friends a while ago and really enjoyed it and thought it was good value for money as it included two half pints as you went round. The tour was very informative and fun with interactive sections. We would recommend this place as something fun to do while visiting the city.

Good times Had By All. Went with my Partner while on a weekend trip. I have to say I really enjoyed the trip, you get the interesting history of how the beer is made and how it came about. Then you have the up to date information with all the football stuff and interactive features.Had a good few drinks for the ticket price (16 euros each), we bought a few extras of glasses with our names on them for our memories. My partner even thought the trip was worth it which was a big plus.

A highlight of our holiday!. Went here with my boyfriend and had such a great time! We weren't expecting it to be so good. Buy tickets in a shop or online before hand to knock off a few euro. For 17 euro each we really got our money's worth. We got a mini beer during the tour, a wee 4d experience,two beers after, and a free half hour canal cruise that dropped us off at a Heineken store to collect a free glass! We also learned about the history of Heineken which was interesting also. It was such a day out!Yes, I understand the whole thing is a bit of a advertisement but whoever thought of it is genius!

Fun, interactive, never boring, topped off with beer and cruise!. Excellent value for money. Get to know the history of the beer, as well as many interactive features. The staff were enthusiastic and patient.The beer was lovely of course and then a canal cruise to the Heineken shop (can buy beer on the cruise!).

A must see for the beer lovers!. I went here with my fiancé And best friend on 5th of January, I am not into beer, but absolutely enjoyed the experience! There is so much to see and do, and a lot of interactive things. We got our names put on beer bottles for a keepsake. We enjoyed our 2 free beers and also the other free beers at the demonstrations. Definitely recommend coming here even for people who do not generally enjoy beer.

Wow! An Absolute Must!. I've done a few brewery tours in my travels, but this is probably the best yet! It's a self guided tour so you can take as long as you want, but it still has people at key points to give you more info on certain procedures and the company. We really enjoyed the interactive features of this tour, such as the brewing ride, and the room dedicated to Heineken's involvement in sponsorship of the Eufa Champions League, and also being able to watch several short films throughout. The tour is very well laid out, and continues to hold your attention, and that's not just so you get to the 2 free beers at the end either! I can't recommend this enough!

Awesome Beer, Awesome Fun. Me and my best friend love a few beers, so when in Amsterdam naturally headed to the Heineken experience...! Had loads of fun! It is all interactive, lots the drink and touch and take photos of- the staff were a lot of fun too, made the experience! the photo of us riding the Heineken Bikes through the canals is on my desk at work! lifelong memory...! (Also free canal boat back to the centre of town! cheers Heineken!)

2 Free pints of Heinenken, worth every penny.. There wasn't a huge amount to do here but what there was to see was interesting. However you can enjoy two free pints of Heineken at the end of tour, which automatically bumped the score up a couple of points.

Rip off. I found the Heineken experience which costed more than 15 euro (more than biggest museums) was a complete rip off. It doesn't have much data, information. I have been to the Guiness museum in Dublin, which was cheaper, better kept and a far better experience. The special Heineken beers at the end of the tour can be had in any bar around the city. I would not recommend going there at all.

Great fun day out. Wasn't really looking forward to this thought it was just a mans day out how wrong was I it was really great fun for all including kids and lots of interactive things to do plus the brew you ride was great fun

History of beer making and a Brand. A impromptu visit to the Heineken Brewery and turned out to be a pleasent surprise. It is interesting to walk round and learn about the beer but the sampling of ingredients, tasting and the interactive surprises make it all that bit more fun. The complimentary 2 beers at the end of it was a nice touch. I would recommend doing this tour.

Very Touristy. We did the tour because everyone said we had to, it was fun but very touristy and there is a part where you are take a "ride" in front of a green screen as they tell you the history of the company. There was over an hour line so we skipped it and got our 2 free beers.

Pleasantly surprised. I booked this tour mainly for my husband, and wasn't expecting much. I was very surprised at how well it has been done inside. The tour kept us occupied for 2 hours and we had a lot of laughs. The 2 beers at the end of it was a nice touch. I would recommend doing this tour.

Much better than expected a real surprise.. Me and my boyfriend visited today and was very pleasantly surprised, completely different to what we expected.
It is interesting to walk round and learn about the beer but the sampling of ingredients, tasting and the interactive surprises make it all that bit more fun.
Well worth the money and definitely a must see in Amsterdam.
Nice museum. A nice museum about the history of the brand, like the name says. Interaction, games all the time, a good mood with the clients and it ends with a beer tasting. I recommend it for sure!!

A mix. This is clearly part of their brand extension. A little bit too much, however they do a great job with it. It is very interactive and first class. If you are on a short lease with time then I would skip it. However if you have a couple of days it is a great stop.

Loads of fun. We did not expect too much from it, but we were pleasantly surprised. It was very interactive and gave you key insight of the Heineken Company. We would recommened going in a group to drink as much free beer as possible to make most of it.

Strongly recommended!. Very fun tour that learns all about Heineken beer starts from a small historic exhibition through the original rooms for preparing beers, a real bars with bartenders where one can have two beers and experience in preparing a beer by yourself, experience yourself as being a DJ, and in the last rooms you really feel as you are in the middle of an amazing big party...

going Dutch. This is the first brewerij that was opened by Heineken, the show the history of the company and there are 3 beers included in the admission ( you can also take a pop or water at the bars!). Fun place to go.

Had a lot of fun!. We are a family of four (2 adults and 2 children) and paid €36 for our entry into the Heineken Experience, which included 2 drinks each (beer/soda for the adults, soda for the kids). The first half of the self-guided tour was similar to a museum explaining the history of the Heineken company and the process of making beer. Audio guides are also available or an app was available for download. There were hands on stations - smelling and/or tasting the barley, the hops, the mash. All of the old production copper tanks were open for viewing and some had videos running in them to simulate how the vat was used. The draft horses also live there part of the year and we were able to see them, and learn a little bit about their history. The tour includes a 4-D ride of the beer making process which was hilarious and we wish we could have ridden it twice. After the ride, we were shown how to taste beer (which included another glass of beer in addition to the 2 included in our ticket price). After the ride, the museum turns more into a marketing display using videos, games, and interactive displays. You can also learn how to pour a draught of beer. Finally, we end up in a pub like atmosphere for our drinks with interactive video screen tables to learn more about Heineken around the world. There was free bag and coat check as well as wheelchair access.

Brew-tastic. An interesting tour explaining the origins of the beer and the process of brewing. Included in the price (for the over 18's) are two free drinks from the bar at the end of the tour. However, you can get soft drinks if you don't drink Heineken.Under 7's get in for free. Very interesting and fun.

Well worth a visit. Interesting 2-3 hours visit - liked the journey of a bottle!! We were advised how to taste the lager correctly, (given a little sample) then two further samples in the bar. They could do more to engage kids (esp. in the tasting - give kids a coca cola for example) would be my only minor criticism.

Better than expected. I really like the fact that this is place is set up more like a museum with exhibits rather than a guided tour. I hate guided tours. Though I know quite a bit about the brewing process and have been to several, I was able to skip most of that and go straight to the tasting. Afterwards they had some cool exhibits at the end such as a soccer one that I enjoyed. Overall not a bad deal and you get beer at the end!

I love it. We visited Heineken brewery with our friends last day in 2013. It took us around 1 hour finished with a lovely beer tasting. I recommend to take the extra ticket for the roof burger, it's just a yummi burger.

Value for Money. Its a real value for money trip inside the Heineken Experience. You get to know a little bit about the beer making process. And for 18 euros. You get 2 free beers (we go 2 more free) and a free gift (ours was a cooling glasses). We used the free boat ride to the Heineken stores to collect the free gift. So on the whole as I said. It was really great value for our 18 euros.

State of the Art Brewery Tour. We thoroughly enjoyed our tour of this iconic brewery. Tickets can be reserved online to avoid the long lines. Upon arrival guests are given a rubber bracelet with tokens that are used for samples and free gifts. Highlights of the tour (in addition to the yummy beer!) include a 360 degree room where you can watch classic Heineken commercials and a disc jockey game to spin tunes to a lighted Heineken sign made from beer bottles. Guests can even make custom labeled bottles to take home. Expect to spend a few enjoyable hours here.

A great experience!. I had a lot of fun on tour and they give you a lot of free samples. Something that I did not realize beforehand is that your admission not only includes the tour and beer samples, it also includes a boat ride on the canals which brings you from the brewery to a Heineken store on the other side of town. An added bonus is that sometimes you can find extra coins used for free samples on the ground because people will occasionally drop them and won't pick them back up which means more drinks for you ;)

Better than expected. It is a fun museum. You wouldnt get bored. You should plan to be there for about 90 minutes. You get two 250ml and one 150 ml beers during the tour. You can also get a free bottle opener if you walk to their brand store which is about a 15 minutes walk.

Interactive and Fun Experience. My Fiancee and I visited the Heineken Experience while in Amsterdam at Christmas and thought it was great fun!The tour around the brewery is informative and lets you appreciate the process on how its made.You then get the "make you into a beer" ride which is fun, then its onto the star bar where you will get your first beer and properly toast with all the other visitors beofre heading into the interactive part of the tour with everything from football style dugout seats where you can watch football, playstations, pour a beer testers and loads more.At the end of all of this you get to the bar where you can get another 2 small beers or a large "extra cold" one.All in all for the price the experience was great and would highly recommend anyone else to visit here.Tip: pick up Heineken Experience leaflets that you see around tourist information booths as they allow you a small discount on ticket prices

Great Fun. I don't particularly like beer but I really enjoyed the Heineken Experience. Yes, it feels a bit like a giant advertising tour but they are hardly going to promote other beers, are they?! The tour itself was quite informative, especially when the group was taught how to drink a beer. Don't take the whole experience too seriously, it's just a bit of light hearted fun.

nice. If you never knew how they get beer this place is recommended.Gift shop as all of them is overpriced.You can choose a normal tour or one that includs lunch, so it can be a good option if you looking to eat as well.
Different experience!. A short ride of the brewery process and branding of Heineken.Wonderful entertainment ride for friends and youth.

Skip the brewery - Get the "Heineken Experience" at a local bar.. We found the brewery tour too long, not that interesting, and self promoting. At every turn, your feel like your in a amusement theme park. By the time you get your free beer...that cost way too much via the admission price....you just want to get out of there and enjoy Amsterdam. When the tour finally ends, your dumped into their company store where you can't even pick up the free gift they offer. Your admission price includes a "e" bottle opener that is given at another store further away. Skip the tour and go have a Heineken at a local bar. They make great beer!
The stupidest thing . It is the stupidest place I have ever been in a trip!!! It's pure advertisement and you pay for it. Drink up your 18? beer in a pub! Have fun elsewhere!

Great experience but too much waiting time. I was at the Heineken Experience with my friends. We experienced this place where there were too many people and it made the experience worse. So don't visit it if there is a queue outside the building as it means there are total crowded.It all started well with a lot of facts and stories about Heineken. Later there were a lot of interactive stuff and of course beer tasting. Personally, the Heineken beer tastes much better here than on cans and bottles.

Fantastic experience.... Me my partner and cousin visited the heineken experience. It was great fun and we all enjoyed it. To be honest i was expecting a labrynth like place with pictures hanging on the walls with long texts next to each, but luckily it wasn't like that at all.Quite interactive and interesting place. Worth the ?16 (?2 discount when u buy the ticket from one of the shops on damrak)They give u a bracelet with 3 detachable buttons on it. U get a drink for 2 of them. At the rnd there is a free boat cruise to the 'brand shop' at every hour until 19 i think. U get a free gift when u give the third button there.
Interesting, interactive and great value for money.. Definitely worth a visit. Thought the boat ride to rembrantplien was a particular unexpected highlight
Awesome experience. I loved the Heineken beer testing. I think I had like 4 beers. It was awesome on what to look for and be a real beer conisseur.
a lot better than i thought it would be. a lot better than i thought it would be, i didnt know what to expect but it was very well done and thought out. plus you get free beer which is always a plus!

Certified heineken pourer!. My partner is a big glean of heineken, so it was a must on our to do list. It was a very interactive & fun tour. Alone the tour you can watch videos, learn the history of heineken, become a certified beer pourer and much more! Easy to find, just catch the tram there. You can even get a heineken bottle with your name printed on it and there is a cool heineken store at the end of the tour. By the way, you walk through the tour at your own pace and you get 3 free drinks!

I loved it!!. A MUST SEE, u get to see how beer is made, walk through the whole process and even brew yourself :)there are lots of cool souvenirs and the people are really nicebut don't buy the ticket from the factory itself...u should buy one from the airport or several "tickets" shops to get a cheaper price.There are also some package discount cards where you get to choose several attractions.

A great touristy brewery experience. We visited on December 27th 2013. Its touristy (of course it is....its a Heineken experience) but when you consider everything, it is fairly good value for money. The walking tour of the brewery lasts around 90-100 minutes. Lots of information about the history of Heineken, interactive "feel like a beer" ride, tours of the vats, and three free beers (One small and two half pints). Someone mentioned that this tour is all Heineken advertising - DUH! That's like saying you are going to Disney and not being offered anything to do with Mickey Mouse! Someone else mentioned it is expensive; it is at E18 but when you consider you get about a pint an a half of Heineken then its not so bad.
