All in all an interesting experience for a couple of hours that we enjoyed!

Good experience. The experience was more than I expected, particularly the Clydesdales and the interactive sections. A personalised label and three beers later, we also enjoyed the canal cruise and the commentary!

Interactive experience. This is a great place for grown ups to go. Very interactive and informative museum about beer, brewery and the Heineken story. Worth a visit but count on 2-2,5 hrs. Great beer tasting :)

Lot's of buzz about boring experience. Overall idea of branded museum sounds great. But Heineken experience was boring experience. The exhibition itself could be squeezed in 10 mins. So called 'Interactivity' is couple of spots to take pictures. Extremely overpriced ~18euro compared to other attractions/museums in amazing Amsterdam. We had a feeling that people visit the spot just because it's well known and you 'can't' miss it. Overall won't advise to spend time and money.

HEINEKEN :-). Really interesting, interactive and fantastic customer service. Well worth the short walk from the Park Hotel. The beer is fantastic and the museum is excellent. Be sure to ponder all the historical information. Didn't realise how much went into the beer making process, clearly the secret 'A' yeast creates the unique flavour. The museum is a must, even for non Heineken drinkers.

you cant help but love it. i can mention many negative aspects as the high price or the continuous advertisments, but dont fool yourself, you should go and enjoy the experience. not a museum at all, you learn very little about making a beer, some about the heineken brand but you will have a great fun time. at the end just enjoy your beers at the small bar. a small tip that made our visit even more worth it "if you go at the end of the day, there is a small boat that takes you a nice ride at the amstel river for 10-15 minutes" included in the price, that was a nice evening ride.

Great experience. This was a super cool experience for me. I was pretty high when I arrived and the guy at the counter definitely knew and we were just laughing at each other and I was already having a great time before even entering the experience! The staff was super cool and they all seemed to enjoy their jobs more than any other place I went to in Amsterdam. For 17 euros you get the experience along with a little 8oz beer with a story to go with it, then two beers at the end, plus everything else in between. The guy at the desk was a bro and gave me another token which made the experience even better. I was unaware of the canal ride at the end, but this alone made the experience even more worth it! The ride was slightly after the sun had set so it was a beautiful time to cruise through the city. The guide on the canal ride was a super cute Netherlands girl and I was able to have a great chat with her on the return ride when no one else was on it. She described how the staff changed roles a lot, so this kept them engaged and invested into their job, which I thought enhanced the overall experience knowing and seeing the staff care about what they do. I will probably never drink Heineken again, for it will never be as good as it was in the factory, but oh well... A decision you'll have to make for yourself..

A lot of money for a glass of beer!. If you really want to see every Heineken commercial ever made, albeit from an array of the best tv viewing chairs anywhere, or spend five minutes in the adult equivalent of a bouncy house, this is your attraction! You can also personalize a bottle of beer for six euros, or use their green screens to share a commercial with friends for ten euros. But really it's all just one big advertisement that you pay them for. Isn't it supposed to be the other way around? If you want to see commercials, go to a sports bar, drink cheap beer and watch tv. If you are searching for a 9 euro glass of beer, this could be the place!

One great big commercial. I'm very wary of the source of all the rave reviews I read on tripadvisor before deciding to go there. This was 90 minutes of non-stop commercials, with a little Heineken history along the way. The "ride" that has been mentioned multiple times is just plain silly and doesn't qualify as a "ride" under any definition of that word. Unless you want to pay too much (in time and money) for a couple of glasses of Heineken, I don't recommend it.

Great Brewery Tour. Although I have visited other brewery tours, the history of the Heineken Experience is at the top of the list. Great beer, interesting tour. Don't miss it if you have the time in this city.

Might as well go . Its an ok visit hour or so get a wristband with a couple of buttons which you exchange at the end for either 2 free beers or one larger extra cold beer. You also have a tasting of a small beer during the tour. Wouldnt go again but good to say you have been
Beer and more beer. Great experience, informative! Download the app before coming it helps throughout the tour! Free WiFi makes it easy to use! Quality experience!
Great!. This tour is fun and interesting. Lots of virtual things to do. You get about 3 drinks included too. We went on a Saturday and wasn't too overcrowded :)

Really Fresh Beer!. The tour is fun and interesting for those wanting to learn about the brewing process. Awesome tasting room. The only bad thing is that the beer is so wonderful because it is so fresh that it will spoil you when you drink it back home.
We loved it.. For beer lovers or not, it's a great place to visit. It gives you a tour around the brewery, and you get to taste a couple of beers in the end.
The best. It's a very nice place to visit, you can learn a little bit more about beer. There is a lot of attractions during the ride.

A great afternoon. This place is great. I was initially sceptical but they have done a great job in creating an engaging tour. The App available for the iPhone (and free wifi at the Museum) is a good free extra. The "be a bottle" ride is a nice touch with a few surprises. Anyone expecting two free "pints" at the end will be disappointed though. You get two drinks, but each one is only 25cl. All in all, a good afternoon though. And close to the other major museums for something a little different to art galleries and diamond museums!

Lots of fun.. The Heineken experience is brilliant.There is plenty going on, quite a bit of which is interactive. One such part is where you going in a room which then takes you on the life of a beer. (A sort of 4d experience when wind is blown at you and the floor moves etc)There is plenty of information on the history of the beer and the beer itself along with the whole process from the growing of ingredients to the drinking of the beer.There is even a section near the end where you can either get a pint or learn to pull "the perfect" pint using your tokens that you are given at the beginning.I went as part of two couples and everyone enjoyed it, one of the party isn't keen on beer (Which worked in my favor, getting a few extra tokens) but still enjoyed the experience none the less. There are plenty of opportunities to take photos as well to remember your time there.I have been twice now and still enjoy it there so I would definitely recommend this to anyone.

Bit of fun. I had heard stories of this place getting very busy, we went, bought our tickets in advance at a discount and found it to be pretty quiet.You get a wristband with a couple of buttons which you exchange at the end for either 2 free beers or one larger extra cold beer. You also have a tasting of a small beer during the tour. There are lots of interactive things to do, games, pouring a virtual pint.There is a gift shop at the end selling all sorts of stuff.You get the offer of a free gift but have to go to their store - a walk or a free boat trip away. We decided to go on the boat, which was actually very good, it was like being on a tour boat as sights were being pointed out. The free gift we got was an e shaped bottle opener.I wouldn't go again, but if you like beer and have the time it's worth a look.

:)). If you have the Holland pass, this is the right place to go, especially if you like to drink beer. The Heineken beer is offered for free as a sample. As soon as you get inside you are given the bracelets with some beer buttons, which you can redeem and change for 2 bottles of beer. You are also given the chance to produce a beer with your own name that you can buy for 6 Euros, very funny activity.

Interesting to visit, but not a must. Interesting place to visit, but in my opinion it is not a "must go" in Amsterdam. If you have time, it is a good place to go and learn the history behind the brewery.

Great fun and informative. Before this tour I actually wasn't a big fan of beer but now I'm a changed woman. The tour itself was interesting, really interactive with lots of different things to do and try. The staff really go into depth of how the beer is made and they show you how to spot whether a beer is going to taste good or not. You can learn how to pull the perfect pint with a courtesy certificate or just go straight the bar and get your two free beers, or soft drink if you would prefer. The experience was great, real christmas feel too with a lady bringing round free snacks in the bar, which was fab, lots of seating and great music. The only down side was your 'free gift' which isn't sold in the gift shop at the end of the tour, they do offer a free canal boat to take you there but we didn't bother.

A must visit when in Amsterdam. One of the must visit places when i Amsterdam. You start by getting a green wrist band with buttons attached to them (I got 4). Each of the buttons on the wrist band is equivalent to a beer glass. But during the tour, you end up having atleat 2 beers during the "how to serve Heineken" segment. Money well spent and in the end you come out tipsy and smiling. CHEERS!!!

Great way to spend an afternoon.. Went on cold windy day and spent a great day learning and enjoying the history of this fascinating company with lots of interactive and varied things to see and do. Plus every member of staff was wonderful and friendly.

Good fun & interesting!. Visited the Heineken factory on our first day in Amsterdam – great start to our trip! We went at about 12pm on Friday and hadn’t pre purchased tickets… other than the 2 euros each we could have saved, this was no big deal as there was no queue. It was good fun and the staff were engaging and very friendly. Only con is that the ‘free gift’ you receive, isn’t on site – you have to go about 15 mins away to collect it – but you can hop on their free boat outside.. we didn’t bother. We will visit again when we visit!

Learn about beers. A unique experience whereby guests were introduced to more than just the company that was founded and the Heineken beer was first brewed here.Guided tour with beer sampling where the bartenders are ready to teach you how to savour a beer the right way. So, when you step out of this museum, you also bagged with you some knowledge about beer serving and what to expect when you order a draft at a bar!!

Very entertaining. A great afternoon spent in the Heineken experience. Self guided tour in all languages through the entire Heineken process. There was a great 5 minute show where the audience is placed in a simulator room and become a beer. The tasting, relaxing room, drinks and games along the way made it worthwhile. We also took the free boat cruise back to Rembrandt square where you could pick up your free gift in the Heineken store. Would recommend a visit.
Good value for money . Pleasant experience. Very friendly knowledgeable staff. Says 2 free drinks, but you actually get 3. Even Santa's helper comes round with finger food. Well worth every penny.

I love Heineken. The Heineken tour is informative and interactive. The tour shows you the history of Heineken and it also lets you have some drinks, record some videos and perform other interactive events. I would recommend this place if you like Heineken beer.

Ok, but would not be rushing back to it!!. It was just ok. I mean 'yes' they invested lots on it; but I think it would be more suitable for a younger crowd (early 20s). A bit too much! I would rather spend my money sipping a nice dutch lager by the river, under the sun rather that with loads of tourist in a cramped place which is very VERY loud.

It's fun. Visited the Heineken Experience during my visit to Amsterdam. Parts of the company origins are interesting, and so is the way beer is made. They give you a general idea of how they create their product, and with all the interactivity through guides and machines it makes for a fun visit. It is quite commercial, and it's hard not to feel like a consumer when you're there, but the build up to getting a three cold enjoyable beers is worth it. It's quite a nice bar to just sit and chill in too. The free gift they offer at the end is pretty pointless because you have to go somewhere else in Amsterdam to claim it, but they have some nice gifts in their store. Despite the overwhelming marketing, overall it was an enjoyable experience, and one I'd recommend.

A great way to spend an afternoon in Amsterdam. After reading all the great reviews on the Heineken Experience on tripadvisor, my husband and I spent an afternoon at the Heineken Experience. Not being a big beer drinker, I was pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoyed the tour! The entire experience was very interactive and you get to learn about the history of the company. Their gift store was also great for picking up souvenirs for the beer drinkers in your lives!
OK. The experience is OK - very touristic...good to spend one hour and get a beer in the end, but there are better things to do in Amsterdam...

Honeymoon activity. Despite getting hopelessly lost we eventually got to the experience we really enjoyed it. The staff were really fun and even though it was a little pricey by the time we got round we thought we had good value for money.

You'd be wise to skip this. With all there is to see and do in Amsterdam, please don't waste your time here. It's essentially one long, big commercial for Heineken that you're paying 16 euros to see. Best of all, you're supposed to get a free gift with your entry, but they make you go somewhere else to get it.

Great experience, a bit commercial but fun all the same. Kept us well entertained for almost 3 hours without even noticing the time... Despite the commercial feel to it, the number of attractions and gimmicks for visitors is endless - from photo opportunities to a beer pouring academy. For me that was the main attraction, as well as the beer tasting, of course. Can't say the educational part was fascinating, but I enjoyed the little anecdotes, as well as witnessing the evolution of the Heineken logo over the years. Bottom line - Highly recommended.

Wonderful. The tour/experience/museum is fantastic. A friend and I went through the place with a hefty interest in Heineken beer anyway so to learn and see what we did was great. For beer lovers and even any slightly less interested parties, I would recommend.

Brouwery. Granted it is nnot the actual brewery anymore and it is catered to tourists. Even possibly a little too touristy. But, when in Rome.... I think it was a good experience. There is a little ride that takes you through being made and bottled as beer would be. Pay for your ticket (actually expensive I thought) at the counter when you walk in and get a bracelet to wear with charms on it. One green charm = free drink (you get two of them) and one white charm = free gift (later found out it was a cruise through the canal that we didnt take) It is self guided, with radios that transmit in 30 different languages. Everything is in English. Coat/bag chek if you want to. There is a lounge for hanging out with a drink, all lit up in green. Oppotunity to sit on a couch and watch commercials for Heineken. Social media kiosks throughout to tweet and facebook pics of yourself or to email. Stops along the way to taste, smell barley and hops. Look into the giant copper bins used to make the substances. Plus a tour through the stables to see the Shires (not to be confused with Budwesier's Clydesdales). Another piece of history scattered throughout. Would recommend going...if for nothing else, then the 2 free drinks at the end.

pandjryton amsterdam trip. Excellent attraction with a nice twist! Great service and well worth a visit.We learned a lot from this nicely presented brewery. I will look at Heineken in a different light now.

A must do attraction - Great throughout. We go here every time we come to Amsterdam. All the staff are excellent and interesting, the place is clean, modern, up to date and changes a little every time you come. I would highly reccommend doing this when you're in Amsterdam - you can learn about the past of Heineken and also can try some beer, and pour your own!

Amsterdam = Heineken. How can you not go to this museum when you are in Amsterdam? It was mainly college age or young adults there - but fun to walk through and see everything. They gave you some drinks and it was fun hanging out at the "bar" at the end of the tour. It felt almost like a club. It is touristy - but if we didn't hit it - we would have been wondering what we missed.

Try it. Although this tour is a little walk it is well worth going to.
Not only learning the brewing process and history there is plenty of interaction things to do.
Good few hours tour if you want to take it all in.
Give it a go you wont be disappointed. :))

Excellent.. Excellent.
The place is impressive due to its history, as it was delivered beer, as it is manufactured.
Was thought of great features and staff are working well animated.
Highly recommend.

Good but not great!. A walk through lots of machines that process raw materials into beer. The 4D experience is worth mentioning. Couple of free beers and a free gift if you visit a shop in another location (which we did not) included in your ticket. Recliner with ads, brief video of brand history at the beginning and the usual brand store at the end.Worth a visit.

Excellent. Deffo worth a visit while in Amsterdam!. Cant say much more than what others have said. The whole tour was really good. Plenty of this to see, do, taste and enjoy along with learning a few bits of history too. Fun for anybody who drinks. If you have a spare couple of hours before dinner this is ideal. Easy to get to and reasonably priced. Oh... you do get a couple of FREE BEERS!

A must do! . Took my girlfriend here while we were visiting Amsterdam and we both loved it even though she hates beer! Staff were good fun and spoke good English, very informative of all things beer and Heineken related.Got 3 free half pints with your ticket and saw the whole process of beer making from start to finish. Good experience and great thing to do in Amsterdam if you have time! 10 minute walk from Dam square.

Lots to do. Was a good museum to visit. Was a little pricey but had a variety of things to do and see on offer. Was great to read about the history of the Heineken brand as well as tasting the beer itself. It had a variety of exhibits and had a great gift shop with lots of different merchandise. Would definitely recommend.

Lots of Fun, beer and boat ride!. This place is awesome they have so many things to do, interactive and you can purchase a nice souvenir. We were surprised of the complementary boat ride we got, there is a Heineken official merchandise that this boat will take you to get a free souvenir from Heineken. The bar at the end of the experience was very entertaining and the bartenders were awesome! if you are a beer lover and enjoy a cold Heineken you can't miss this. Try the super chill minus something degrees Heineken draft at the bar!

Fun!!!. We love this place and take every visitor there. You get to find out about the history of the brewery and family, with the bonus of some interactive displays, replays of the best ads, record yourself singing some dutch songs and then email to yourself or others for free, finished with 2 beers and a free canal boat trip. Brilliant

A game of 2 halves !!!. Went to the heineken experience to kill a few hrs in Amsterdam and found it a bit of a mixed bag...the history part of it was somewhat slow if I'm being honest...found myself trudging through the building bored...Things picked up during the interactive ride which was fun...they also do a tasting session where you get taught how a proper glass of Dutch heineken is drunk - actually better than it sounds!!!Best part was the free samples at the end...your allowed several attempts to pull a glass of heineken and the staff member hermann was not only informative and helpful but also wasn't shy about handing out the beers everyone had pulled...Overall it's not perfect but for between 16-18 euro it's a fun way to spend an afternoon in Amsterdam...Recommended!!!

just another "experience". i've just been to the heineken exp and it was quite disappointed. first off the ticket is overpriced for what you actually get! 18 Euros for 2 SMALL beers, not pints, 0.25 CL beers! ive visited heaps of brewerys before and this one was the least interesting. of course there were a few cool things, like the 4d thing on the platform, but mostly you just walk through rooms who have nothing to do with the beer brewing process itself. when we entered the bar area to get our free beers we were greeted by a huge line of people, all waiting for they're beers. you get two small beers, which is a letdown. the other major issue is that you get a coin for a "free gift". well guess what? the heineken store for the free gifts is located 15 min AWAY from the actual heineken experience. who walks 15mins for a heineken bottle opener? not me. 2/5

Fun experience. Very entertaining, fun experience. Every aspect of the tour is engaging and fun, with a lot of interactive games/videos. The atmosphere is a lot more upbeat, friendly, and fun compared to other brewery tours. You get 2-3 free beers, along with the experience, is worth the price! You also get a free bottle opener, but you can only get it from the other Heineken brand store which is not near the actual factory. The store within this building is quite small, but there are still a lot of cool items to purchase.Your hotel will probably have a better discount than the one the Heineken website offers online. If not, then definitely pre-order your ticket for a discount. Free Coat Room!

An experience. Hello I've just been to Heineken Experience and I can honstly tell thats its not really worth it the 17Euro. I mean its kinda boring with the details first when you go through it but its fun when you get inside a room as you are the beer and there is sound/moving effects. You get to see how to drink a beer and you get to taste it thats one glass. Then you get two free glass to drink and thats the best thing in it. Another thing is you can play ps3 Fifa or PES. The thing thats was ehhh is that you get a free gift but you have to walk to the Brand Store which is 15 min walk away and its a bottle opener :/ I mean come on heineken. I think for the whole thing to be worth it just if they reduce the price from 17 to 10 Euro.

It is worth the experience. We had purchased tickets online so for us there was no queue just go to the lady she scans your tickets gives you Heineken wrists band and you are all set to go for the experience. At the welcoming entrance there was video information and after that there are different types of boards where you stick your head from the cutout and click photo. We loved that we click photos with every cutouts it was fun. We learned a lot about the history, brewing the different process it goes thru and The "Brew You" ride was really cool. I loved that the best. Nice set of entertainment inside like virtual games, video message and lounge where you can rest. For me it is worth it and I would recommend others also.

Interesting and Fun!. I honestly didn't have hugely high expectations for this place. I generally really like microbreweries, but we (my boyfriend and I, 25 y.o. Backpackers) decided to check it out. Turned out it was really fun and interesting. We learned a lot about the history, brewing, and their current marketing. Both of us left saying 'I had no idea Heineken was so cool!'. Both of us are interested in marketing, so we were intrigued by a lot of the information about marketing efforts throughout the years. If you will be offended by seeing a commercial or two during your tour you'll be put off by that. I was especially interested in their sustainability. As a skeptic I was seriously impressed by the whole tour overall.

Brewery tour beyond expectations. Thought this might be the typical brewery tour...but it wasn't. There was so much to see, hear and do throughout the whole experience. The types and usage of technology during the tour was fantastic. The "Brew You" ride was really cool. You can even bottle your own beer...well at least get your own label on it. The simulations and videos were great as well. Of course, tasting the beer and having a few in the bar (included in ticket price) was an added bonus. The staff were all friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Definitely worth checking it out.

Unexpected Surprise. We visited this place without any research and thought it was going to be just another brewery telling you how beer is made mixed in with a little bit of history, and a lot of drinking. We also didn't know it was going to cost €16 per person which we thought was very expensive for a sight. But after the whole experience, I gotta say it's ALL WORTH IT!!!.If you take your time going through all the rooms, you could easily spend an hour or two in the building. There's just so much to see and do. I particularly enjoyed the interactive brewing room. Visit the Heineken Experience website to see all the different parts of the building.The entrance fee includes 2 free beers (Heineken of course), a short canal cruise that takes you to the Heineken Store via the grand canal where you'll pick up a free bottle opener. The canal cruise has a guide that tells you a bit about the sights along the way. Save yourself a few euros and take this cruise first.

so much for so little!. having just done the guinness storehouse tour, i figured i knew what it was going to be like, and the beginning of the tour was your basic brew tour. but the rest was like a party! we had a blast! a 3d experience ride, video games, beer, lounge areas, music, more beer, virtual games, etc...so much fun! then a ferry ride up the grand canal....such a blast. it was a nice surprise!
Great fun!. My girlfriend and I both loved spending time here - this is a must on your Amsterdam tour! The staff were helpful, the number of ways of entertaining visitors made it 10/10.

1 Years Anniversary Trip. Was told to go to this place by somebody my wife works with and I wasn't disappointed. It was a very good guide through the beer making of Heineken. Loads to see and loads to do. Had a fab day there and got lots of pictures. The best part was pulling your own half and making your own bottles to buy.

Must see in this city!. Sorry... Heineken was definitely my favourite at all...But when you start to discover and understand the story behind it, it starts to change!You clearly understand how to prepare the beer since the beginning up to its arrival on the best bars in the world!Don't miss several great ads full of action and good humour!Furthermore, if you haven't done your cruise canal in Amsterdam, that's also a good opportunity as a grand finale!
Nice experience!. Nice to see the how's when and where of this lovely beer. Nice touch that the canal cruise is also part of this trip. Enjoyable and worth a look.

Great afternoon for €16. Nice welcoming entrance leading into bar type area with video information. Good fun taking photos with the different Heineken logos. Lots of information throughout the tour without being boring. Fun "simulator" type ride before you get to the tasting room. Games area can be as much fun as you want to make it, some of it does come at a price, ie photos. Price include two free drinks at the end of the tour and a free canal trip to the Heineken shop for a free gift with return journey if required. Nice way to spend a fun afternoon. The pint I had at the pub the next day didn't taste anywhere near as good as the ones at the brewery.

Exceeded expectations!. Me and my girlfriend (who doesn't like beer!) did this tour and we were unsure what to expect really!?The actual tour takes you historically from the start of Heineken to the final end product, historic pieces if interested and also lots of interactive opportunities like videos and photos which were free which is unusual on a trip like this, usually added price for these?!We had a great time learning about it all and was topped off with 2 free drinks each as well as an extra beer in the tasting section of the tour! Overall a great fun experience and for €18:00 each you can't complain, especially with 3 drinks included!

Worth the trip. It is an eye-opening experience understanding how Heineken brew their beer. The visit also allow you to understand their rich history. Along the way, you can have the option of taking the 4D show. We're glad we queue for it and not missing it. Inside, there also have an "appreciating beer" bar where heineken staffs are there to let you understand the freshness of the beer. Photobooths are avail inside with their heineken props. You can take the electronic beer tapper challenge too! For the entry price, you are entitled with 3 drinks and loads of fun! You can also enjoy the free boat ride till 1900 hrs.

Could have spent all day there!. Now I don't like beer - at all! So I wasn't massively excited about visiting the Heineken museum when my friend suggested it, but not wanting to be the one to say no I agreed to go along.I have to say I really, really enjoyed it, and would (and have) insist than anyone visiting Amsterdam takes the time out to visit this.It's got a bit of everything for everyone, you can see the beer making process, having a look around a history of Heineken and their advertising, look at the bottling process, and learn how to taste beer like a pro.I very much enjoyed it all, and there was something for everyone, even the chance to take a picture and send an e-card back home. The shop was great with loads of different nick-nacks for you to look through and you can also buy your very own personalised bottle of Heineken.The whole site is actually really big, so do put at least half a day aside to look around, but you could easily spend longer there.And to finish your visit of in the perfect way you're given a token for a free glass of Heineken ... well ... what else!

If have time worth trip . Went ad we had time on Sunday, not bad but not the best brewery I've been to...thought the games section was a waste of time...like Heineken advertising for other companies ie. FIFA & local televisions. Was good to get a taster, free boat ride & keyring/bottleopener but you should think for the cost €17 entrance fee

Fun little side trip in Amsterdam. I had zero expectations with this place. I mean, I don't like Heineken, so why would I go? Well it was a good decision that I ended up going. It was pretty interesting all around, and I even got hooked into watching the Heineken commercials in their little pod chairs. The beer was also very good. Who knew!

A lot more fun than expected. I was a bit reluctant to want to come here because I envisioned it being very "cheesy". I was pleasantly surprised. Make sure you take your time and enjoy it. There is lots to see and do and the best part is you get to a couple of beers at the end. Also after our tour we got to take ride in the heineken boat to the heineken store which was also a nice little surprise.

An adults playground!. I was really surprised how good this experience was. There is loads to see and do and the staff are really bubbly without being cheesy! Make sure you buy tickets in advanced to skip the queue. You can straight to the ticket barrier and watch as the people in the queue get jealous of your pre-booked tickets!

History, Marketing, Brewing and Drinking!. Whilst in Amsterdam this is a must place to visit. One of the top 10 things to do in Amsterdam.Really enjoyable 90 minutes spent walking around the Heineken Brewery Musuem. From the moment you walk in you get to understand the history of the brand. You're then exposed to the making of the brewing process of the world famous lager. Quick pit stop for a drink and education on why Heineken lager is brewed to the specific quality. Interactive and Marketing zone to show ever changing brand activities over the years. Finished with a couple of glasses of the famous lager at the end of the tour. Would recommend this tour to any age of individual...obviously over 18 year olds! Great value at only 18 Euros.

Not bad. This is an ok tour, learning how its made and why you should drink it a certain way was fairly interesting but they had a lot of pointless "attractions" aswell.
Overall its a little bit of fun but there are many other things in Amsterdam more worth your time than this.

Fun way to spend a couple of hours in Amsterdam.. From the friendly welcome to the beer prior to departure the Heineken experience was spot on.A great blend of education, product history and interactive fun make for a fun couple of hours in Amsterdam.The staff throughout were knowledgeable, friendly and answered questions with great enthusiasm.Kids (large and small) enjoyed the champions league zone with photo opportunities, the simulator was fun and interesting and the complimentary end of tour beer was served ice cold in a a great bar atmosphere with stunning wall displays constantly changing.And a water taxi to take you back into the city centre was a lovely way to finish the experience.

Excellent. Group of 5 went, really enjoyed it, a good learning experience and the beer OH MY GOD it tastes so much better as it's fresher than fresh. Buy a ticket with two free beers from the ticket shop for about 17 euro I think it was.

Absolue Fun Experience. Its a very well packaged tour giving you glimpse of the past when beer was brewed here at this site to the modern glitzy lounge and sportszone of the present day. Has been designed in a way that will keep even the non-beer drinkers interested all the while. Nice souvenirs and free beers end the experience on a perfect note

Great Experience ... Do not Do it in a Hurry !. Spent the better half on an afternoon here, luckily the queues were sparse. We were inside in a few minutes after the brief walk from the the tram stop. Felt the entry fee of 18 eur was a bit high, but was really happy with the overall experience. Highlights were seeing those gigantic brass beer tanks shining as if new and the video projection room where you are taken through the life of a glass of beer. Tips: 1. Budget atleast 2-3 hours, there are lots of places to chill out, interactive games, media pods.2. Do try the beer tapping competition, everyone gets a certfificate.3. They give this voucher at the exit for free boat ride to their mini shop near the opera house. We took it on another evening and was worth the time.

Fun and worth it!. Definitely worth it. I would recommend to anyone going there. It's not only a museum but also interactive with the staff that explains the beer making process all along. Plus you get 3 small beers included in the ticket.

Had fun and liked it. Very entertaining experience. You get a chance to learn more about beer in a very interactive way. In the trip you continue into a set of different interactive areas, were you do your own video, loads of funny pictures and have a laugh with your friends. And most important, you get a chance to drink 3 beers. Totally recommend it.
Really good!!. Was recommended to go for this tour and am glad we did!! Great tour, friendly staff and loved the 4D ride!! Definitely worth the visit.

Great brewery tour!. This was a really fun brewery tour that teaches you a lot about beer making. The staff are really energetic and knowledgeable. Admission gets you two free beers at the end (plus one during) and a free gift that you have to claim at their brand store that's a 20m walk away. Buy tickets online ahead to shorten your wait time.
Enjoy!!!!. Very pleasant time we had at Heineken Experience. It's worth a visit: very nice people and great fresh beer!

Enjoyable couple of hours. An enjoyable couple of hours spent out of the torrential rain.
The tour starts off as historic and educational but very quickly moves into blatant advertising, however it's good fun, don't expect too much and enjoy the beer.

Fabulous. Great place to visit. Loads of interactive stuff & good fun throughout. I am now a convert to Heineken! Take the free green boat to get your free gift too, took us to another bit of the city that we wouldn't have went to otherwise.

Nice. Overrated.. It's a nice tour with some nice exhibits.The beer tasting was nice, but without any more flavors than the default.Seems to attract many youngsters who just want to come for the beer in the end, which makes it look and feel like a crowded bar.If you are in the area, drop bye. Don't make a special effort for it.

Heineken....an experience. When we analyzed the various elements of this facility, we thought a lot of it was naff....but in all honesty we nevertheless enjoyed it and came away happy. It was more a marketing exercise by Heineken than a serious attempt at a 'factory visit'. It was gimmicky and quite clearly oriented toward young people. There was a brief but fun Heineken canal trip at the end of it. We finished up happy with the visit
Super fun. This tour was super fun and informative. We really enjoyed learning all about the beer making process, and the fresh samples were hands-down the most delicious beer we've ever had.

Absolutely awful experience.. We visited on a Saturday afternoon - summed up by a sentence made of these words - brewery, organise, up, piss, couldn't, a & inThe place was mobbed by a large party of rude, arrogant and badly behaved American students who seemed to think that the entire Heineken experience was for their benefit and theirs alone.The tour was poorly organised and the logistics were pathetic. A total waste of time and ?18.

Fun & Interactive. We loved the Heineken experience! The mix of history, fun games, interactive rooms & rides made for a really enjoyable few hours. Plenty of free beer as well as you make your way around. Really lighthearted & interesting to see the brand's progression throughout the years. Any fan of the odd tipple should not miss out on this.
Nice experience. The pity is they give you free gift in another store. You can use their boats for free however I would have to wait almost an hour to embark so I left w/o it. Maybe tomorrow...

Felt a bit brainwashed. Felt like the tour was a giant brainwashing scheme to buy/like heineken. Enjoyed the experience and the staff were exceptional just maybe would have liked to not felt so pressured into buying things. Beer was too notch!
Tasty....... Excellent tour and well put together and the beer tasted good also. Only negative is that your free gift cannot be collected at the Heineken experience.

Great fun. This was my second visit, & once again I had a brilliant time. The 4D ride is a good giggle, when you see the world through the beer being manifactured's eyes. The bars are busy but have a great atmosphere. The pods where you an relax & watch the Heineken ads through the ages are another highlight.

A wonderful tour. We loved the Heineken experience - it had a lovely atmosphere as you walked round. Lots in interactive things to do as well as seeing the kilns, dray horse etc. The staff were very good and you felt they were really enjoying their job. Loved the bar at the end where you got two glasses of beer.

Lots of Fun, Worth the Tour. We would definitely recommend the Heineken Experience. You get to see a lot of the old bottles, marketing posters, etc. along with brewing equipment. You also see the horses and the cart. You can stir the hops, taste the wort, and you get some real beer at the end (along with a lesson on how to properly drink a beer). There are also games (pouring the perfect beer, etc) and various rooms in which their are chill out spaces and commercials/ad campaigns running. We had a lot of fun there and would definitely recommend the tour to family and friends.
Good fun. Informative and entertaining but not particularly impressive. I prefer Guiness in Dublin. Make sure you buy the ticket beforehand to avoid the long line at entry.

Should visit if you are in Amsterdam. They were pretty informative about how they make the beer and other miscellaneous information. Such as what makes the beer bitter, it's how you drink it! It's a definate must visit.

get a few free beers. at the end of the tour you get 2 free beers and a free canal cruise which i guess makes the price of admission worth it. but the tour itself isn't that exciting or informational.

Great Brewery Tour. I've visited a few breweries including beer and whiskey and this is up their with the best!Really enjoyed the tour - it is guided to a certain extent but you also have free will to wander around various attractions and take your time. A few glasses of Heineken are included in the price and you get to enjoy these at the end of the tour in the bar.I really enjoyed the interaction section at the end and also watching the past Heineken adverts. The gift shop is also a good find - we made many purchases in here and I could recommend this as a source of good souvenirs to bring back to friends.A tip before going - we managed to book online and received a discount on the entry price! Thoroughly recommend the tour - you won't be disappointed!

A great afternoon out.. There's nothing to dislike, the experience offers lots to do, there's a few beers included and the tour is informative and interesting. In particular the staff are welcoming and knowledgable. As with all attractions the goal is on after-sales, but some of the material on offer is useful. The certificate for pouring your own is worth trying to get if you are in a group.

A great morning out... One of our stops on the Hop off and on bus.... we had already bought entrance ticketS and so went straight through... we went in the morning so wasn't overcrowded and had a great walk around. The 4d cinema was great, the hubby was really impressed!! When you take into account the cost of the 3 drinks you each get in the cost of the ticket it's not an expensive trip.

Paid to see advertisement. We went to this attraction because it was top rated in the hop on hop off bus list of attractions.It turned out to be all about how great Heineken is, their awards, their commercials, their sponsored sport events, their brand products.If you are a fan of Heineken and wanted more of the pitch to confirm your affiliation with Heineken, you will find lots of things here.The entrance fees included three beers which kind of pays for the entrance.For the skeptics, this is shallow, no difference than any other beers except for the hype.Decide which camp you are in before you go.

My wife hates beer and She loved the experience.. My wife doesn't like beer and she loved it!
Is is very nice attraction in Amsterdam. Very modern and you can have a lot of fun.
Very nice experience. Over our expectation. Show!
Flavio Maia

Excellent. A really good fun day out. History, beer, and a great time with friends.
I thought it was expensive at first. But after the experience, the drinks, and the atmouslere it was well worth it.

Definitely worth a stop!. Was there in October, no lines, not crowded, but not nearly empty either.
Very informative self-guided tour, outstanding use of technology throughout the exhibits!
Comes with two glasses of beer, plus a small glass at the end of the motion ride.
Really good to do as part of an afternoon spent around Rijksmuseum area.

Ok experience, not a must. Been there in october 2013. It is a 20-20 minute walk from the center. A bit expensive- 18? (can get 1-2? discount coupons at hotels etc ). It is like an amusement park ride, not really a tour in a brewry. You do get 3 small beers included (or 2 plus acrash course in pouring rhe beer). The free gift is a simple bottle opener to be collected at another location you have to sail to (didn't go there). Hope I helped tou decide!

Loved it!. Not at all what I was expecting but definitely worth the 18€. Very interactive and the guides had a great sense of humor. Loved the 4D show as a heineken beer bottle! A must see (get tickets ahead)

Great Time - lots to see and learn about. I went on a rainy day in December 2012 and had a great time. I do love beer and it clearly is a tourist attraction, some of the lines were long, but overall it was worth the visit. I drank enough beer to get a little buzz on, which is a requirement when a beer drinker visits a brewery, answered questions by the Heineken staff for more free beer, again a plus, and loved the sophisticated 3D beer making experience as well.This is one of my favorite memories of Amsterdam!

Loved it and I don't even enjoy beer. I enjoyed the Heineken Experience a million times more then I expected. The tour was very interactive and lead your from one room to the next with something new in every area of the old brewery. Heineken is a really nice Dutch beer and even though I never really drink beer still enjoyed it very much.We got a 25% discount with our IAmsterdam cards and you also receive a free gift - not wanting to miss out on a freebie we had to walk about 20min to their other branch which was a bit of a waste of time but at both venues there are a bunch of interactive things to do.They also have a 4D movie on how the beer is made which was amazing. the two free beers at the end are also a bonus but it would have been nice to have one at the begin of the tour instead of having 2 right after each other at the end.

quite a different brewery experience. the first half was the typical brewery visit kind of thing, you see the history, how it was made, people explain to you the processes and let you smell or taste the stuff. at the halfway point there was a bar to teach you how to taste beer; quite useful and interesting imo as I never really liked the taste of beer and the way they taught to taste the beer helped me dislike it less.then came all the interactive stuff. you got to play dj, pretend you're delivering beer on bicycles, star in a hilariously ancient music video etcetc. at the end of the visit you even get to fill your own beer from the tap and receive a certificate for that! (or you can just let the bar tender fill it for you. you get two instead of one for this)the brandstore wasn't located at the same place and was some distance away. there was apparently a shuttle boat bring people there but the frequency was so low we just didn't bother going even though we could redeem a free gift there. you could walk there i suppose, but don't bother if you're in a rush.tickets are a little pricey, but you can get a small discount if you buy them in your hostels (if they sell it that is)

great fun but lots of publicity. It was fun visiting Heineken Experience on the whole. But I just wondered why I paid so much to have only publicity for a beer which I don't even like so much :-(The good aspect of the visit are the 2 free drinks at the end of the visit... So better plan it in the afternoon.

Had a great time!. I stopped in here during my quick trip to Amsterdam and had a great time. It was a fun tour with beer included! The price was cheap and you go through the museum at your own pace, I would definitely reccomend!

The Heineken man can!. We pre-booked our tickets and got it a little cheaper. The tour was brilliant - very interesting and informative, plenty of free 'samples' along the way and brilliant interactive exhibitions/audience participation opportunities. We got lots of free goodies - including a Heineken bottle opener and a ride on the canal boat. It's a must-do when in Amsterdam! Proost! (Dutch for 'Cheers')
Must do in Amsterdam. It's a great tour with lots of information and interactive stops. Must do when you visit Amsterdam. Great souvenirs shop with excellent choices and great service.

How to advertise your company..... We thought we going to have an informative tour an old brewery but instead paid £12 for suffering the longest advert in order to get to the end be given two small glasses of beer we don't even like.

Great value! 2 beers are included in admission. The tour is interesting. The beer and the ambience of the lounges is great to linger and enjoy the beer, too! One cool spot is after the tasting room where you can take your tasting glass and sit in a darkened lounge where the amusing (and long versions!) of the Heineken commercials are playing. (The commercials actually make more sense when you can see the entire story behind them!) Well worth the price of admission.
A must do in amsterdam. We really Enjoy it. It is a brewery and beer museum/interactive entertainment site. We had a really good time. I recommend it. It is worth it.

Very good experience and Beer. Very interesting experience. Can view all the production chain of the beer, the history of the brewery.The giftshop includes many souveniers as magnents, towels, bootles with you name.

Loved it...and i don't even drink beer!!. Definitely well worth a visit. Heineken have put a lot of effort in to making this an excellent experience. You can go at your own pace which is good and then everyone gathers for some main attractions. There are also some good photo opportunities throughout the tour and ones where you can even make you own music video and then email directly to family and friends. You also get a few drinks included an the chance to pour your own pint with proper tuition.

More than just a beer tour!. Loved this tour! The tour has everything, which is a lot more than just a old factory which I expected. There are lots of photo opportunities with the logos through the years, explanation of how Heineken is made and demonstrated and a movie simulator to talk you through it step by step. The absolute best part of this tour is how it makes it personal to you...from custom bottles and glasses, free photos sent home and videos as well as a chance to dj on a Heineken decking station. All really reasonably prices considering they could have charged more for a souvenir. Font forget the free pints of beer!This is a must when in Amsterdam!

Not worth it. Entry fee is 18 euros, included is three small draft beers (25cl). The beginning of the tour is ok but the other half is just commercial, you pay to recieve Heineken comersials. An ok experience but only if you have to much money and nothing to spend them on.

Beer theme park. If you buy the Amsterdam card you get a discount on admission. You get a nice history of Heineken, fun picture opportunities, hands on experiences and there is even beer included! The "free gift" is about at 15 minute walk away and it is an inexpensive bottle opener - a disappointment.

A bit of a gimmick, but good fun. We enjoyed the Heineken experience. I loved the simulated ride, it was really well done. Everything is interactive and there's a few places to relax as well. You get a fair amount of beer on the tour and at the end too, they are very generous. Would have loved to make my own label if it didn't cost extra! You get a free gift (bottle opener) but you have to go to a different location in the city to relieve it - cheeky!

Really good fun. A great thing to do in Amsterdam, worth the admission fee also. We got to see a lot of the history about the brewery, as well as sampling beer! We also got a free boat ride afterwards which usually aren't cheap!

a good experience. Here you go through the process of making beer. The entry ticket is 18 euros which includes rwo beers and a free gift. They take you through various stages of making beer, how it all began, etc.

If you have time, do it!. This was a fun and interactive tour. Very interesting history on this brew! Lots of photo ops and the sampling is always fun! Then go on the hunt for your free bottle opener! It's a walk, but fun and more shopping when you get there!

New take on Beer. As a non beer drinker (I tagged along after my partner tagged along to some of my own interest museums) I really enjoyed this tour. The fresh beer given complimentary in the second last room was so fresh! Pumped into glasses , we were taken on a taste tour of this fresh brew. Much nicer than the2 free glasses you get afterward. Btw. You can takea cool drink ISO a beer.
Heineken. This attraction is so much fun. There are games to play, and a free video card and picture.You get two free beers on draft. I just had so much fun. Not to expensive.

Heineken Tour. This was an unexpected pleasure that exceeded expectations. Not your typical brewery tour. Plan for 2-3 hours at least - and you will probably stay more. Enjoy. There are stairs and did not seem very well for those with limited capabilities.

Very Well Done. We had a scheduled tour with a group of businessmen so we had a private tasting with appetizers in a "party room". Great fun; lots of different beers. The tour itself was very interesting and there was a lot to see and do.
Informative and fun visit. Very up to date technology wise with interactive features. Fun exhibits and the beer at the end is great, too!

all you wanted to know about beer but were afraid to ask.... elaborate tour of the historic brewery with lots of information...The 4D journey into the brewing process was interesting and well worth it...and of course plenty ice cold Heineken to drink is always a good thing...

Not your ordinary tour. The Heineken Experience is correctly named because it is so much more than a tour of a (former) brewery. It is both informative, interactive and participatory. You learn about the history of one of the world's best beers by "becoming the beer". There is even a type of "ride" that makes you part of the process. And the best thing is you end up in the tasting room, which is also very interactive. It is well worth the time and small cost.
Excellent Experience!!!. If you are a beer lover there is another Must to visit when you are in Amsterdam. Go and you will not be disappointed
Beer. Book in advance or you'll be waiting in line. We waited in line and it didn't take too long. We enjoyed it. You get to sample beer and of course they have lots of things for sale.

A great experience. A very good visit especially with the included beers to taste!!! Brilliant to visit in a group or as a couple. Information is presented in great ways and we learnt some great facts especially when they said that having a large head on a beer was a good thing - hooray finally I won't have the micky taken anymore for my beer pouring!!!!

Beer & Fun. Been before, book in advance online 13 euros each, a few free beers on the tour, top good couple of hours entertainment, mainly provided by 'gauche-americans in the bar at the end, great people watching,!

great fun. very touristic but it is fun. at the end of the tour you get 2 free beers which is good. They also promise you a gift but you have to go to another gift shop to get the gift, which leaves bad taste at the end. it is long tour 2-3 hours.

Great tour. This was a first for me - really interesting from an historical side, fantastic displays and really good to see the old coppers and of course the horses. They really impress the Heineken brand upon you but in a light hearted way. It gets busy as most attractions in amsterdam do but it's worth it.

Unplanned. We've done plenty of brewery tours and didn't plan on stopping here while in Amsterdam. After spending most of the day outside the weather turned to rain so on the way back to the hotel we figured we'd take the tour.Of course it's really a big advertisement for Heineken and can be a bit over the top. If you've never done a brewery tour it would be a good learning experience on the process along with the history of Heineken.It is worth noting that they do not actually brew beer at this location anymore.There were a couple of highlights that we enjoyed. Drinking wort was a special treat for us beer geeks. It's rare that a brewery lets you try some of the unfinished beer. Also, some fun photo ops. Lastly you'll get to have a couple beers in the cool bar at the end of the tour.

A repetitive and tiresome afternoon. The Heineken Experience that we had so much looked forward to turned out to be not much more than a 90 minute commercial - for which we paid 18 euros per person. It starts off with a detailed description of four generations of the Heineken family, with repeated reminders of how ethical, clever, and dedicated the whole bunch was. I think we got it the first time. They were/are real pistols, every one of them.We were then herded into another room to see the components of the beer in its various stages of manufacture and ended up in a cheesy virtual reality "experience" simulating being immersed in a gigantic vat of beer. (Disney has nothing to worry about.)Mercifully, the tour ends in a bar where each participant gets two beer. The management guarantees you won't stay too long savouring what you really came for, as the disco music is cranked up to Mach 3. Also, and of growing concern to the amateur tippler, there wasn't a bathroom in sight.The theme of the whole tour is the "excellent quality" of Heineken beer, which is certainly a given. (Why would you go on a tour if you thought it was slop?) However, they never stopped reminding everybody of that every few minutes. We figured that we paid about 25 cents for every time we heard the word "quality" in the presentation.Of all the tours our group took in Amsterdam, this was the only one in which it was more of a relief to end the tour than to begin. Obviously overpriced, the non-stop songs of praise about the family and the quality of the beer became overwhelmingly annoying.

Meh.... It's a lot of show, which is fun. They give you 2 free beers which is also good. They also promise you a gift but when I went to give my voucher to the lady in the gift shop she told me, that to get the gift, you needed to go to another gift shop entirely. That, I found very disappointing.

Touristy - but fun. Hey if in Amsterdam and you want to have some fun, this place is okay and value is okay for the samples you get. Gift shop is great and very decent prices considering if you have to buy the same stuff elsewhere. If the line is short do try it out.

NEVER LIKED BEER THAT MUCH!!. The Heineken experience is a very nice tour ou can do inside the Heineken brewery in Amsterdam.the location of the brewery is very close to Dam Square and easily reached by bike.Inside the brewery you get the chance to learn a lot about beer in general & Hineken specifically, you get to taste Heineken (3 glasses) and enjoy all the fun stuff and gadgets that are offered (Heineken ads, playstation room, UEFA room, gift shop with customized gift items).YOu can also enjoy dinner on the rooftop (additional cost).A very fun experience worth having :)
Simply Amazing. Went there last February, however ever since I've moved over to the Netherlands i have been non stop suggesting this as a place to go!! will definitely go again!!!

Beer Beer and more beer. The inside tour is just amazing, you get to see the whole process to beer making in an actual old brewery. And the best thing is that you get to drink lots of beer at the end !

Do it only if you don't have other programmes. The experience is not impressive... a brief history of Heineken is exhibited, these include movies, photos, etc. The operation is computerized, unlike the Pilsner experience in Czech, Heineken hasn't arranged a coach to lead the tour. You just get a basic understanding of how the beer is made. In view of the cost of euro 16 per person, I personally don't think it worths the price.

A good attraction. I say an attraction as that's what it is a good way to spend a couple of hours and a trip on the canal boat after is included intact that was one of the best bits to the experience!
Lots of Beer. Loved the tour & they give a good amount of free beer (at least 4 glasses). Great interactive area after the tour. It really caters to a younger crowd but we enjoyed it

Fun afternoon. The trip around the Heineken Experience was a fun few hours. The "learning" part was well presented and informative. The look at adverts and the inter active displays were interesting and the beer was fabulous!! Sadly no metion of The Heineken Cup!! I guess Rugby is not popular in Amsterdam. The boot trip at the end is a must.
Fantastic times!. I'm going to keep this short and sweet. I'd visit Amsterdam just to go to the Heineken Experience! It's so interesting to learn about brewing, and the development of the brand too.

Worth the money.... When we bought our tickets I did think they were a little pricey, however having experienced 'the experience' I do feel it is worth the price of the ticket - my husband & I had a fantastic time (the two drinks included at the end topped it all off nicely of course). I would also highly recommend taking the boat trip which is included in your ticket price. The young guy who took us down was hilarious and included some interested facts along the way. It takes you down to near Rembrandt Square & you can buy bottles of Heineken on board for 2.50 euros.

Interesting but.... The factual part was very interesting, showed the process from start to finish and even how to drink Heineken! However, then we progressed through various computerised gaming areas, football, disco music etc - all aimed at young people and since I am nearly 70, I'm afraid I found it rather boring but had to endure it as that's where the 'free' drinks were! I would say it was slightly overpriced and not worth a 15 minute walk to their city centre shop for a free gift of a bottle opener (didn't bother).

Classy Tour for a Classy Beer. How could you visit Amsterdam and not go to this brewery! A great informative experience of the history of the Heineken family/brewery. Is quiet central, only a short tram ride from central station and takes about and hour or just over to complete. There are a bunch of interactive activities which make is a little different fro your average tours. A number of stops with staff demonstrating various aspects of the brewing process and a short video tour with moving seating where they 'brew' you! And at the end...........free beer! Can't ask for anything better. A great gift shop is also at the end, the only off putting thing was the 'free gift' you receive, it is not obtained at the brewery or gift shop but at another shop down the road maybe 10mins away. All in all though a great experience!

A tiresome exercise in consumer brainwashing.. Do not go here if you are interested in anything other than a lowest common denominator experience. It is full of moronic 'activities' and fluffed up 'exhibitions' (such as the founder's honorary MBA degree in a glass case). You then have to line up for your paltry 'free' beers, which you in fact paid €17 for. This is the worst tourist experience in Europe.

Good fun. We've never been on a brewery tour before and weren't sure what to expect but gave it a go. We used our holland pass to get a ticket and there was no queue when we arrived around 3pm on a Tuesday. The tour is interesting as well as fun and a good length, you get a couple of free drinks and all the tour guides were really helpful and informative.

Nice - comparable to most beer tours. Got a free glass and some glasses of beer. Saw the factory. It was fun for our group of guys to go through and have some cold drinks for relatively low cost near downtown.

Brilliant !. I would advise to book tickets before you go, or look out for flyers with ticket discounts in before you purchase tickets. Queue to enter can be long but with pre-booked/paid tickets you can queue jump. Even without discount the experience is great value for money! There is so much to do, see and drink. Perfect for a wet / miserable day. Highly recommend doing this tour. We also did canal tour which takes you to their merchandise store which is a bit of a gimmick but we won a 10 Euro discount from the store and the store was right near our hotel.

So much fun!!. We have gone on brewery tours before - but none as fun as this one !! Lots of interactive optionswhich provided some good memories. And of course, a generous size of beer at the end of the tour!

A big advertising gimmick?. It's paying €17 for 2-3 hours to hear the Heineken corporate story. You do get free 2.5 pint beer plus do cool stuff like pouring your own draft, design your own t-shirt with your friends, engrave your own bottle, beer glass, DJ, games. Good for the young ones. You also get a free gift which is at their brand store ( not same place) - I got a Heineken bottle opener. There is a free hourly canal ride to the store or walk 15 mins.

Such good fun. This was such a good day. We were able to spend about 3 or so hours there. The perfect thing to do on a rainy day. It starts off with a number of rooms informing you about the history of the brand and how it is a family owned company. You get to see how the organisation has changed throughout the years. You then get to see the ingredients which go in to the beer and taste various ingredients. Then you go through the old brewing rooms. This was all really informative. There is also an interactive ride demonstrating how the beer is made (you get wet!) after this you get to have a couple of free drinks and are taught the best way to drink the beer. At the end there is an option to pour your own beer and a lot of interactive activities including videos, pictures and personalising bottles. Such a fun day! Would 100% recommend but would wait until 16y/o so you can make the most of the beer.

The Absolute #1 Best Thing to Do in Amsterdam. Smoke immediately before coming here.Take the tour slow. Suddenly, there's a beer in your hand. Continue the tour.Halfway through the tour, there's a comfty lounge you can rest and watch some recent Heineken commercials. Keep moving and you'll find beds with TVs built into them. Stay there for an hour and watch old Heineken commercials or rest your eyes.Get a second wind and make it to the end of the tour.Figure out how to get bottomless beers at the last bar. (It's easy. Just stand by the beertenders and ask politely.)So relaxing. And the Heineken is so much better here than anywhere else in the world. There is a small chance you might actually learn something, too.
Great fun.. Interesting and interactive tour good for beer drinkers and non drinkers. A great way to spend the afternoon.

Truly interactive!. Starting off as a classic exhibition it soon gets better and better. You will experience - yes! - what beer is made of (obviously there's a lot of water involved...) and, if you are a novice to it, also taste what it is like. A perfect half day out when visiting Amsterdam. Even the shop at the end is worth a visit as you can buy bottles engraved with every short text you can think of.
Must do. This is a must do in Amsterdam. If not, why even visit the city! The process isn't new. Same as any beer/ liquor/ wine tour you might take but you do get 2 beers with the entry.

Neat!. I used our holland pass to get into this attraction. I actually thought I would just pick the more expensive tours to get the best bang for my pass. I didn't know what to expect but it was as they advertise, "an experience". It was quite neat to review the history of the company and the scientific basis on which the company was founded on and not just some grandfather's secret recipe that was handed down. The family and company was way ahead of it's time in terms of supporting its staff in hard times and the humanitarian issues it has contributed. I actually did have a better appreciation for the Heineken label. I guess all their marketing worked but I did learn a lot about beer making that day. I even had my own personalized bottle made which I can keep to memorize this trip for years to come. I'm glad I went.

Nice but not a must. The brewery itself is a bit boring and doesn't seem as the main attraction. The other rooms that contains the cameras and other attraction as well as free beer are fun and amusing. It's a nice attraction, mostly for young people in big groups.

Very cool attraction. Heineken was founded in Amsterdam, and thus the factory has become a major tourist attraction in the city. Though a little outside the main city area, I would definitely recommend attending. Buying tickets at the door costs about 24 euros, and you have to wait in line. Not sure about buying online, but we bought ours through Sandeman's Walking Tours and it cost 17 euros and no waiting in line. With our ticket, we got 2 beers (either 2 half pints or 1 half pint that you get to practice pouring yourself) and a gift that turned out to be a bottle opener.This is a very cool attraction because of how engaging and interactive it is. There are a lot of cool things to do through the tour and Heineken has come up with some cool ways to teach the history of the beer to visitors, like a 4-D movie experience. There are DJ games, make your own music video stations, a stop to customize your own beer label, and more. We were here for about 2 hours, but if you take your time to experience everything the Experience has to offer you can easily spend longer. You get a chance to have a "tasting" lesson and at the end of the tour you can choose to enter one of two rooms - a lounge where you can claim your 2 half pint Heineken beers, or a room where you wait in line and can practice pouring the perfect half pint (you only get to drink 1, but I liked the experience of getting to pour it myself). The gift that came with our ticket could only be picked up at the Heineken brand store, which was a little annoying but fortunately it was on our walk home.Definitely worth checking out if you're in Amsterdam, and try to buy online or through Sandeman's to get a discount!

For the Young and Young at Heart. Heineken has always been associated with youth and vitality. I think I would have liked the beer more as a young person, but because of the higher cost in Canada, I have never actually tasted it before this tour. Since I prefer micro-breweries, I wasn't thrilled with the beer (it's quite weak, and only one flavour was offered to us). However, the tour itself is really worth a visit. For 18 Euro each (yes, I think this is quite expensive too for something that is free or a minimal cost in Canada, however the tour offers much more), my husband and I received quite the education in the beer-making process. As well, there was a lot of technology applied to one's appreciation of the beer. There were films and interactive displays which helped to keep people moving from station to station, as well as kept the fun atmosphere going. At the end of the tour, you go into a bar area which resembled some sort of disco complete with the coloured lights and everything. Most impressive to me was the staff throughout the place. They are a good group who really enhanced the experience.

A pilgrimage for a beer lover :). This is a hard to miss attraction in the canal town - Full of star wars like gadgetery to keep your senses enthralled. An educationally informative tour that will teach you all about the art of beer making ( and drinking).The entire tour is in a very nice campus and the tour ends with a 'brew your own blend' which is awesome.You can easily spare half a day indulging in this activity and leaving the tour in 'high spirits' is guaranteed !Highly recommended and suggested for the quintessential beer drinker.

Hi Tech Interactive Beer-Goggling!. If you visit the Dam, it's almost rude not to delve into at least one or two of the many sites, sounds and hedonistic pleasures on offer. To this end, a visit to the Heineken Experience (the beer with the smiley 'es') seems like a great combination - visitor attraction combined with partial inebriation!I went as part of a cultural outing with a group of discerning fellows to celebrate my forthcoming union with my other half. This attraction fitted in beautifully with the ethos - and my best man's partner, who made the arrangements, was highly amused to realise he had indeed managed to organise a piss up in a brewery!The attraction itself borrowed heavily from telling the story of the development and global success of Heineken through interactive and high tech gimmickry - best of which was an amusement park style cinema room complete with hydraulic platform that took and shook it's guests on a journey to 'be brewed' into a bottle of beer. There were rooms packed with giant, highly polished olde worlde copper brewing tanks (or kettles / vats...?). A passing view of stabled horses, games galore - including Dutch karaoke, a DJ challenge - a video bar surrounded by screens with glass topped tables providing magically appearing virtual beer mats wherever you placed your complimentary glasses of beer, which then span off to reveal a dizzying array of maps, location shots paired with the surrounding screens - one minute Holland, the next New York, Rio etc. A print your own label exhibit which delivers to you your own customised Heineken bottle - and several interactive screen games that would email whatever your achievement, message or design was to yourself - or whoever. Also naturally, it was interspersed with the usual museumesque paraphernalia of original equipment, adverts through the ages and more - a heady mix of new and old. And as part of the entrance price - you get beer. Two glasses of beer. Great fun - we spent 3 hours bouncing through everything they had to offer.Why only four stars? Unfortunately for all the glitz, glamour and gimmick - they were unable to solve one particularly outstanding issue - however proud they are of its commercial and global success - Heineken is just not the world's greatest beer! Apart from that - no complaints!Andrew

A must... Definately more than what we had expected. A tour which you can complete at your own pace, it seem never ending (in a good way)! this was well worth the price (which included 3 free drinks). Doing this in the late afternoon is advised! - And any girls with partners make sure you drag him to the American Apparel flea market after a few doors down after! Great discounts!!

Fun & uplifting experience. Very modern approach to a brewery tour. The brewery consist of different levels and each level is interesting. The tour shows the history of Heineken with a modern approach. Well worth it.

Interactive History of Heineken ends with a Rocking Bar. If you have extra time on your hands in Amsterdam, then add the Heineken Experience to the itinerary. It is by no means a "must-do," but it is a very well done exhibit with a ton of stuff to see and do. Bonus: a couple of beers are included with admission. The tour can be done at your own pace, choosing to see/read as much or as little as you want. Movies, presentations, and signs guide you through the history of the Heineken family and the beer making process. There are also several interactive stations where you can make a commercial, take your photo, learn to pour the perfect Heineken, and take quizzes. The tour includes a ride, which is more like a movie with a moving platform, but hang on; they'd never allow this in the states without a seatbelt!My favorite part of the experience was sampling beer straight from the factory; very fresh. The tour ticket includes two tokens. Each token is good for one beer. If you would like to pour your own beer with professional direction, that costs two tokens. Two tokens also buys a Heineken Extra Cold, which appears to come in a larger glass as well (the extra cold tap was broken so we got two regulars). There are two bar areas at the end of the tour to get beer, and both were packed with people chatting and enjoying a drink together.My only real complaint is what it requires to get access to the rooftop; the purchase of a hamburger and beer for 8,50 Euro. I would have liked the rooftop view of the city, but we had just eaten and weren't going to buy burgers just to hit the roof.Travel Tip: Tickets are 18 Euro each, but if you buy them online they are only 16 Euro. You don't have to buy for a specific day or time, just show up with your ticket printed or with the image on your phone and you avoid the line for tickets and get right in.

Very fun, interactive & informative . We had a great time and it was definitily more than what we expected. Fun interactive tour that you can so at your own pace. Was great to do on a Sunday night then to head out to dinner / drinks afterwards! Ended up getting about 3 drinks each too so is worth the $$ for the tour.
A must see. Dont miss this if you are in Amsterdam... a good blend of history, experience and of course a drink of Heineken...

Perfect experience!. There is a perfect experience for those who like beer and also for those that don't like! Is a perfect thing to do also very nice! The guides are awesome and the place interacts with the visitor.. The explanation is perfect and by the end there is a very nice bar to enjoy a cold heineken!

Interactive fun!. Had a good time at the Heineken Experience. Was initially reluctant to go as I don't drink beer but husband managed to convince me and in the end I was pleased as I had a genuinely fun couple of hours. There are about 3 beers thrown in with the tour, loads of interactive fun and there is one called 'the beer you ride' where you are put through the process of beer making from the dry ingredients right through to being drunk at a party!!
Great experience. Tour was phenomenal well organised and informative, lots of opportunities to take photos and interactive. Go visit and enjoy!
A must do. This is great value for money. A great interactive tour, u get free beer, get to pour your own beer and get a free gift. We really enjoyed the heineken experience!

Fun, informative & tasty. The tour starts with the history of the brewery & how Heineken is brewed, which is fascinating.The tour moves onto all the awards/ medals given to the Heineken family.Then all of the adverts that have ever been aired for Heineken & lots of gadgets & tech that promote the Heineken label.Then you get to taste the heineken drink.Finally the Heineken merchandise shop.Its all very hard sell on the Heineken label but in such a camp way that it isn't offensive.

Heineken Experience in Heineken Museum. Heineken Experience in Heineken Museum was very amazing and informative with great taste of Heineken beer. The visit to this museum was very intercative where you can come to know about beer, a lot . Price is one of the challenging factor I will recommend to visit this museum.

So much fun!. The Heineken Experience is not your typical brewery tour. It's interactive and informative, and never leaves you bored. There are some great activities, including a room full of television screens airing amazing Heinekin advertisements, a DJ'ing station, and a bar at the end where you can learn how to properly pour beer from a tap! I would recommend this to anyone who remotely likes beer.
