amazinggggggggggggg!! a must visit museum!. amazing exhibition! great people! see the first days of beer making and enjoy interactive activities! drink a litter of heineken beer! we took the extra lunch on the roof top - 6th floor - the best cheese burger in amsterdam! went out drunk up and extremely smiled!dont miss!!
Awesome!!!. Took a train to the brewery and once you go inside it smells of fresh Heineken Beer. It even had a spout with fresh made beer pouring out for anyone that took the tour of the brewery.

Marketing genius!. Whoever came up with this idea is a genius! So much fun! Photo ops, interactive fun, a "you are the beer" ride, horses, artifacts, and beer, beer and beer! I noticed a few young women here bringing their babies and young children -- not a good idea. Strictly a fun time for adults. Two beers included with admission, plus you get another in the tasting room. Lots to see and do here; I highly recommend this experience!

Beer, beer, beer!. Though somewhat pricey, this was a very fun experience; especially with friends! A group of us guys visited during a weekend and really had a wonderful time. They do give you many beers to savour, which definitely helps heighten the 'Heineken Experience'!

very interactive. It is very interesting to take part in this experience.. Heineken experience is a kind of interactive museum.. full of fun experiences. I've been there with friends but i guess it'd be a good experience to do in couples as well. It is better to buy ticket online but the queues are not very long. You may spend a bunch of hours living the heineken world.. learning the history of the brand.. and also learning the brewing process.. I really enjoyed this. Totally worth the money i paid.. (17€)

Turned out to be fun. At first I thought this was going to be a drag but it turned out to be interesting and fun especially the ride and the interactive room. You got a couple of free beers although I got an extra one as I answered a question right - result! Good atmosphere in there too.

Heineken. I really did not like this. It was quite boring. Most of it was just walking through the building looking at pictures and old ads and large copper containers. There was a section where they demonstrated the type of ingredients in the beer. There was another section that was like a virtual realty room where you were a bottle of heineken going through the brewing process. At the end they give you a couple of beers. So that was good. But I don't think it's worth it.

So much fun. You get a lot for your money here, the tour comes with 2 drinks included so how can you go wrong! Being my favourite beer, it had high expectations but this place was really cool, there's a lot of talks about how beer is made which might be boring for some, but the entertainment and interactive stuff is well worth it.

A must visit attraction!!. Definitely worth the visit! Plenty to see! Great staff who make the tour very interesting. The whole museum has been really well thought out and keeps your interest. The "ride" is great fun and a very clever way to finish the tour. Free Heineken on the tour is great too and the interactive part of the tour towards the end is great fun sending you tube video's and playing games. The merchandise is great you can personalize lots of things so this makes it better.

Something even if you don't like beer. My girlfriend doesn't like beer, but after convincing her to go here we actually had a good day out. It takes a good few hours to get round, and is quite interesting, with plenty of fun activities (such as sending family and friends a video of you singing dutch songs on a green screen.) Was expensive considering you only get 3 small beers (About 1 full pint if you put all 3 together) but it was fun and a good afternoon. It is better value when you drink your girlfriends beers.Top tip : Look on the floor near the bar for dropped tokens, you could probably get quite drunk for free if you were so inclined.

Interesting and informative experience. Knowledge is power, and despite the small scale of it I do feel educated after the Heineken Brewery Experience. I downloaded the app which went into the details of the Heineken process as I walked through the brewery. They even had interactional activities to participate in. If you have time why not include this tour as a bit of fun and increase your knowledge in Hollands local beer.

Top Tour. We only had a few hours in the 'Dam but we took the tour. I was here a few years ago and it's changed quite a bit, (for the good). Loads of history, modern\not so modern, more interactive stuff but more business orientated (less free drinks - more sales opportunities, but hey that's the way things go!) Well worth the time in the city.
Brilliant!. Great visit to the factory, would definitely recommend. Make sure that you get the free boat to the shop too!

Better than I expected.. We went to the Heineken experience because the museums were too busy and I was pleasantly surprised. It was an interesting tour, we didn't have to wait to get in and you get to drink the beer too. They have some cool merchandise as well if you are into that. Definitely worth a visit.

Fantastic!. Wow! Definitely worth the visit! Plenty to see! Great staff who make the tour very inter actual!! Lots of great extras! Free Heiniken on the tour also! Plus the Heiniken horses are a bonus! :)

well worth a visit. Dont miss out this, its well worth a visit I am sure you will love it. Lost to see & do inside & you even get a drink or two. you also get a free gift. Its takes about 2 hours to do but well worth it

Good museum - not so good beer. I love beer...I just don't like Heineken, and this brewery tour (like any brewery tour) touted their product as the best in the world. Meh...not likely. However, this place was worth the price at least and was fun if you just ignore the fact that it is one giant Heineken commercial. You get some free drinks along the tour and you get a free canal shuttle to the central part of the city where it is a short walk to the Heineken Brand Store where you receive a free gift (a bottle opener). For all you introverts out there...they try to engage with you in several parts of the tour, especially the canal shuttle where they make you play a trivia game, unless you sit at the stern on the outside.

its lot more than a brewery !. i was nt too fascinated by the brewery itself but other frolics make that place worth visiting !!The brew you experience and those extra glasses of beers very much appreciated. !

Not a must do - but a fun and interesting experience. Interesting trip around a former Heineken brewery. The tour is self guided however interactive - there are people to talk you through how beer is made, how to taste it alongside various smell and taste tests throughout. At the end of the tour you are presented with two half pints of Heineken (which you can either pour yourself or have poured by an expert) alongside lots of interactive activities such as sending a video/picture to friends, games, dancefloor etc. Good value for money.

Good fun. Most of this tour was very enjoyable but it does become a bit more a marketing exercise towards the end. Loved the horses, the ride where you get bottled and the tasting of course. We also got a personalised bottle. The shuttle boat to take you to the brandstore for your free gift was supposed to run every hour till about 6pm but when we came out after 2pm there was a handwritten sign to say the boat was finished for the day. We walked past the brandstore later and got our free bottle openers, which are very nice. The merchandise in the brandstore was actually a lot nicer than what was at the Heineken Experience itself.
Ideal for beer fans!. Really nice tour, very interactive and good atmosphere inside. In the end you can serve yourself a fresh glass of beer.Good value, especially but not exclusive for beer fans.

A lot more interaction but worse than 10 years ago. Having visited 10 years ago I looked forward to the full tour and free beers plus gift. I was amazed by the interaction for visitors however it's changed and it disappointed. The free gift is actually found in the Heineken shop based somewhere in the City. This is a ploy to get you to spend more. Very disappointing & staff off hand & unhelpful. I preferred my visit 10 years ago.

Lots of fun for an afternoon in Amsterdam. Second time we have done this tour - good value - very interactive - took their canal boat to another part of the city to get the free gift promised - was a beautiful afternoon and a nice ride. We took this tour several years ago and enjoyed it so much, we wanted to take it again.

Just payed 18 euros for an 1 hour long Heineken commercial. Ok, I did get 2 beers "for free". Besides that all I learned was what a wonderful company Heineken is and their fantastic company values. Yawn. Won't be going back anytime soon.
Must visit in Amsterdam. This is one of the best experience you can have in AMS specially if you love beer and if you love to know how it is manufactured. Its worth every cent you pay.

You need to do this!. I was there with a friend and we stayed about 5! hours hahaha The tour itself was great, there are a lot of things you can do, I liked the part where you ARE the beer best, it was kind of a 5D cinema :) when we came to the last station, where you get your free beer, we thought it doesn't look that nice there.. but we met soooo many people and somehow we got way more than 2 free beers before we walked out there xDafter the tour you get a free boat tour as well, was really nice too! We'd definately do it again!!

For beer lovers as well as brand lovers. Heineken is one of the world's most famous brands. This attraction is all about it's history and the art of brewing beer. It is not however, what you might expect from a brewery tour. The creators have spent much time on making this as the name says, an experience. Interactive, up to the minute multimedia displays and a celebration of the brand add up to a great attraction. Plus you get beer

Honestly the best thing to do in Amsterdam. The tour was fantastic. We have been to several brewery tours in the past, all of which have been interesting. The Heineken tour, however, is not simply a tour. It is a complete entertainment package. Make sure you pay attention to detail, like the tables where you use your cold beer as a mouse, and the hallway where the labels magically move out of your way on the floor. This was such a fun afternoon for us.

A really fun experience. More than just a beer brewery, you'll get to understand a lot of history as well as have fun at lots throughout different parts of the tour. With some beer tasting and tokens for another liter of beer, the price is well worth it. Make sure you go on the free boat ride which leaves on the hour afterwards to learn even more and enjoy the views down one of the many canals of Amsterdam.

AMAZING.. yes it is for the tourists but I thought the staff were amazing and the amount of free drinks you get!!!. If you did have a spare few hours in AMsterdam and really unsure of what to do I would recomment the Heineken experience, yes it is for tourists (you can tell this because of staff accents everyone spoke English) but and the amount of free drinks you get and the staff- it was just a nice few hours and nice few pints... Well Heineken started in the Netherlands/ Amsterdam it would be rude not to! (When they do the tasting experience.. if they ask you to guess a random number do it..)
had a blast. Learn about beer making; have freshly brewed heineken.... Damn I'm thirsty now !! :D Just keep this place on your to-do list and you're golden !
Loved it. If you are English and have visited Cadbury World.... it's the same. But with Heineken!!Great experience
Must do!. A great way to spend an afternoon. Lots of fun, tasting and experiences. Not to be missed as it offers much to see and do, great value.

Heineken Experience. Absolutely Wonderful Thing to do in Amsterdam!Would do again on another Trip to Amsterdam!Beautiful Location! - Friendly Staff! - Photo Opportunities! - Interactive Displays! - Lots of Great History! - Informative! - Free Beer!!!

Lots of fun!. I was a bit dubious about visiting the Heineken museum due to me not being a large beer drinker. However, the museum was very informative and fun, with lots of hands on activities and lots of free beer! You are given a wristband with 2 free beer tokens on, and you also get a 'masterclass' on how to drink beer, so that's 3 in total. What's more, you are given a voucher for a free boat ride on the Heineken boat. The boat stops at the Heineken store, where you can claim a free gift (we got 2 bottle openers). All in all, a great attraction.
Great time!. All the experience was great!! First some history, then a lot of fun, tech attractions, cideo, photos, games anf of course beer, finally a nice lounge with electronic music

Great place if you like beer (or even if you don't). This place features some really interesting ideas, you can brew your own beer, you can experience a 5d cinema that shows you the journey of the beer, part is also dedicated to heineken ads. You'll also get some souveniers, it's really nice, I definetely recommend this place

Excelent start for the Amsterdam happening. Start here your Amsterdam visit and you will taste the enthusiasm, the good humor, the sparkling mind and the conquering smile of the Dutch. Concentrated, funny, dynamic, ending with several beers and a boat-trip in the center of the city. You'll remember and tell the jokes you hear.

Pretty good afternoon if you like beer and the line for Anne Frank is too long.... Simple fun. Good way to spend a few hours if you're sick of museums and want some ligh-hearted fun. Bit pricey, though you will get two and half free beers. Opportunity to pour your own.

Thoroughly enjoyed it!. First of all this is not a brewery tour seeing a factory making beer it's an "experience" of how it's made and then lots of fun mixed in. Starts off quite standard learning about how beer is made and the history of the company. But towards the end the whole tour becomes more and more interactive with lots of fun things to do (especially with family or friends) - our group felt like big kids! The staff also added to the experience being very friendly and joined into our "banter".Suppose its not really worth it if you don't drink as you can get two (and a half) drinks included. We also took advantage of the free boat ride across the road afterwards which takes you to a Heineken shop elsewhere in the city.My only complaint was they do have a lot of cool things.. that they want you to pay for. We had a fantastic time and would definitely recommend to others.

Great Fun. Loved this,lots of interactive attractions and free beer ( well we had 4 each) the guides are informative and entertaining and we thoroughly enjoyed...top tip they do a guided tasting at one point and if there are beers left over they just throw them away..we asked and were given another each which we then took into the video room and enjoyed...

A MERE MARKETING STRATEGY, A MAGNEET FOR TOURISTS. We were given the tickets for free, that is the reason why we went to the heineken experience. It is a touristic "exhibition", created for tourists and merely and barely tourists. When you get in you are introduced to the history of Heineken with its founders who are portraided as heroes who saved Holland with the beer. After the introduction they bring you into a room where you are shown a video and there are some special effects and it's like you are the beer being pulled in the bottle. After that there is an interesting part: the process of producing bear, with a clear explanation of the ingredients, the process itself: that was the only interesting part. For the rest you are introduced to a variety of games such as "be the dj of a heineken night", tap your own beer etc. Another interesting part it's when you can watch all the commercials of heineken from the beginning until nowadays. I truly believe it's all a marketing strategy to make you drink a lot of beer and to make you believe Heineken is the best beer you can have in Amsterdam. Someone should write a dissertation on the marketing strategies in the HEINEKEN EXPERIENCE.. My suggestion: if someone gives you the tickets for free go, otherwise it's no worth spending euros just to see how good the Heineken beer tastes. Ah, included in the price 2 free beers and a gadget I was given a bottle opener with the "smiling e"

Quite an experience...well worth the visit. Make sure you buy tickets from any one of the GWK Travelex shops available in any Train Station to avoid queues and to get freebies with each ticket, more freebies after the heineken experience, 2 free beers, a beer tasting, the chance to pour your own pint and a free canal ride at the end to the Heineken Brands store a little further up the canals. The canal ride happens at certain intervals so might be a good idea to grab lunch and then head back to catch the boat ride.
It's an experience not a brewery. it's fun but not a brewery and they do want money for a lot of things. Great picture opportunitys inside. Great option if its raining.

For beer lovers...... honestly, just went here to buy some tee shirts which I never bought because the pricing was absolutely crazzzzzzzzzy. The tour is really for those who want to drink, but honestly you can drink everywhere in this beer friendly city!

Fun for all beer lovers!. This attraction is great fun. The main point of it is to learn about the process of making Heineken beer and to taste 2-3 glasses of beer included in your experience. I don't want to spoil it for everyone, but I will say it is worth the money if you are old enough to drink and taste their beer. You can also practice pouring a cup of beer at the end of the tour, if you wish. I recommend that you take a walk to the Heineken Experience, since it's a great walk along the canal to the building.

enjoyed it more than I thought I would. dragged here by my hubby! really fun and interactive - learnt lots about the making of Heineken beer but lots of fun and interactive things to do. Two free beers and a free gift (although you'll have to pick that up from a merchandising shop the other side of town) Well worth a visit!
Fun and exciting experience. It was such a great experience. My sister and I had alot of fun learning about the history and of course getting our free beers at the end hahaha.

A fun way to spend a couple of hours. The information was well presented and varied. It tells the simple story of the growth of this family brewing business. Heineken has tried their very best to add as many different features to their experience as possible and have embraced technology to help them achieve this. Yes it's just a huge advert, yes the price is a little steep but if you don't expect too much and accept it for what it sets out to be you should have fun. Loved the 4d ride and the James Bond mystery. The tasting session was well delivered and made fun. The room with the drinks at the end was a lot livelier than we expected and a good laugh. We visited at the end of the day when it was a little quieter, a good tip to follow.

Too expensive for almost nothing. Almost nothing to see, no process of making the beer. A guy telling a story, some old beer tanks, some free beers at the end, some rooms where you can take pictures, old bottles, mostly nothing fun. Maybe if I would have arrived earlier, the one place where they included the tourists into doing something was closed. Don't expect much, but that doesn't mean you wont have a few small laughs. The souvenir store is great and expensive and the souvenir you get for free when you visit, you take from elsewhere (i bet many give it up). I expected so much more from this popular place.

Good fun. Slick attraction (Entirely in English, too). Some fun interactive things to see and do, You get "brewed" get the chance to pour your own beer; see the dray horses, do a beer tasting, and so forth. Plus, at the end, you get a couple of beers included in the price, which, if you take their value off the ticket, means that it's not an expensive couple of hours worth of entertainment and education.Just a pity it's Heineken, which probably isn't the best lager in the world.

Experience a must. Very well presented the beer brewing process and you get a wristband with ticket(3 beer & gift from another location by boat trip).You get 4d experience and history of Heineken.It's a must do when you are in Amsterdam.Recommended.
nice but expensive. It was great - the visit is well-made, you learn, taste and have fun. However 18€ for the entrance is quite too much.

Highly recommend. You don't have to be a beer drinker to enjoy this experience. This independent tour is interesting and interactive and there is so much going on. The staff are dynamic young people who keep you entertained and the marketing of the brewery is excellent. Entrance is not expensive and worth every cent. Young and old, a place you must visit when in Amsterdam.

Brilliant!. Well to start with you get 3 free beers! Admittedly they are on the small side but you get 3 so that's good! There is even a little ride where you get "brewed" which was an unexpected but fun little addition to the experience.

If you like beer... . ... Or even if you don't, it's great to see the brewing process; you can even have a 4D experience, where the turn you from barley into beer. There's also some other interactive attractions.Recommend you get the e-ticket, so you get your free gift (quick walk or boar trip through canals will be required).
Great experience. It is fun to pop and have a look once your there cause there’s lot to see and enjoy and it’s worth the money

Its a complete Heineken advert..... Bearing in mind that their beer is pretty cr*p - the tour is good fun and gives an insight into the beer making process. You get a couple of 'free' beers included in your ticket price.

Let the Beer Flow. This is certainly one of the best brewery tours I have ever been on. If you enjoy exploring independently then the Heineken Experience will be right up your street. A fantastic interactive experience, because if you are anything like me then getting hands on is the perfect way of keeping interested & entertained! Great value for money & I would highly recommend the rooftop burger! We finished the tour by going to the Heineken Shop, which was across town, however they even offered a free boat trip! The shop itself is again another great experience, games to play & another excuse to try a Heineken! Thumbs up from me :)

brewery tour. This Is Disney meets Brewery. It starts off well, with a humorous introduction via video, with a cool tour of the facility. Then the interactive part starts, which has some neat things to do. However, regarding the beer at the end of the tour, there is hardy any place to sit and drink your brew. I guess they don't want you to linger, but it is exhausting to have to stand for so long after doing the tour. Also, it would have been nice(as they do on other brewery tours) to have you have the option to taste many different types of Heineken's beers( I know someone who works for this company and he says they are always working on new products). Heineken could actually profit from this endeavor, as they could have the tourists "rate' their beers and get an analysis, for free, of what the public prefers. Also, the price for this attraction is way too high.

Great Experience. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed the Heineken experience. It tells the history of Heineken, explains how lager beer is brewed, has a number of modern interactive tools (good for both the young and old!) and finishes with a sample of lager, or a soft drink instead. I recommend this experience.

Pour your own pint. It was an interesting couple of hours, but the end did feel like just a marketing exercise. Left pretty tispy though on the 'free' beer so cant complain. Was good fun pouring my own pint for the first time!

Interesting if you want to know about the beer.... Interesting if you want to know about the beer and its history, but really just another sort-of brewery tour in my opinion...with a focus on Heineken, understandably. They have tried to spice it up with a variety of activities and the staff are friendly and seem to know what they are talking about. The day we were there it was very crowded, so get there early. Ticket was part of package...not that expensive. Shop has lots of stuff for presents to take home to beer drinking friends.

Fun. It was actually really fun, and very interactive. Got to try a sample of beer, and shown how to drink it properly haha, if there really is a way. And then you get 2 tokens for free drinks, but 1 token is only for a half pint. You also get a token for a present at the end. You have to walk 15 mins to the Heineken shop though to get it! However, they offer a FREE boat ride every hour to the shop which is totally worth it. It's 18 euros, and I would say it's worth that.
Carlsberg was better. Well located but compering to the Carlsberg Museum is not that good. The tour is very short. You can feel like "one in a million"...

Go in a group. This is an excellent way of learning about the brewing process in general and the history of Heineken specifically. A lot of thought has obviously gone into the construction of this experience. It can be quite noisy at times and it was very crowded when I attended. Best suited to a younger audience, especially in the bar at the end of the trip. But overall, well worth doing.

Lots of fun, even for someone who doesn't drink beer!!. This was one of the highlights of our trip to Amsterdam, the whole experience is fun, interactive and interesting, their staff were knowledgeable and friendly. We pre booked our tickets using a discount code before we went, so no queuing either.
Be a bottle !!. If you visit you will understand my title.Good value and entertaining.You even get two beers per person included in the price currently 18.50 euros..
Great!!!. Very nice experience....lots to see from the beginning to the end.better to have the tickets in hand as there will be a lot of people waiting to go in.
Fun time. Fun time, learned about Heineken. I'm now a master pourer! Tour moves quickly. The beer is fresh and delicious.

fun for college age and beer lovers. They have done a great day making this an interactive tour. It is quite fun. You must be 18 to tour so don't bring the little ones. Buy your tickets online before you go and get an extra beer and no queuing. All ages were on the trip and there were a number of couples like us, but by far, the ones having a blast were the college age dudes. There are little places where you can see commercials through the ages, the alliances with certain sports, "become a beer". It is all done very well and points should be given to Heineken for how well they have put this whole tour together. We were also impressed with the part on stewardship that they presented. Very impressive indeed, but unless you are a beer drinker....you can give it a miss.

A little pricey, but good fun for all. Many breweries in the States run free tours so the cost of the tour seems a little much at first - but when you are already spending $5 on a glass of water, this doesn't seem like much of a stretch. The tour is fun, there is an app that helps guide you through things (if you want - otherwise not required), the old equipment is cool and in great shape, and there are plenty of reasonably well done videos that shed a little light on the Heineken history. Midway through, there is a Q&A session at a bar and if you quickly answer the questions, the bartender hands you another free beer. At the end, there is a bar and lounge area where you can cash in your beer tolkens for either two "standard" Heinekens or one "extra cold" version (go with the "standard" as they are nearly identical). Also, if you stop at any of the tourist stands that have fliers for the Heineken Exp, the price can be reduced to 15-16 Euro - so really you are looking at 7-8 Euro beers and a cool 90 minutes. Not bad at all.
Interesting but... It smells like BO and is full of arrogrant and angry groups of men. I wouldnt recommended it for families or couples unless you come from a trailer park.

Great Beer. The tour was well organized, presentation of company excellent. Of the different beer companies this one is worth taking time to do .,even if you do not drink Beer. A lot of planning and organization went into presenting this Experience from the beginning, to the horses to the cold beer a must for anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Great experience. Great place to visit with family (including teens). Interactive media, informative, fun, humorus! Older people or disabled people might find it a bit hard to walk through the complete show. High volume (if you bring small children).Legal age to drink beer = 16 years!

Interesting and reasonably informative. Thought the cost of 18Euros each a bit pricey but you could spend up to 90mins or more if you wished. Thought it was cleverly laid out for touring with enough "hands on" by employees and interaction between the reading all about how the Heineken brand started. Interesting experience being shaken like a beer and bottled, quite clever, the 3 free beers were plenty. Very geared to selling to the public with all sorts of clever gimmicks which would appeal to a lot of people.All in all we enjoyed the tour and if you are interested in the history of beer, worth doing.

Good fun.. Went here last week, very skeptical at first about this place, it was however quite good fun and well worth a visit.Quite expensive for the entrance but if your interested in beer and would like to know how it's made then this is ideal for you.Probably wouldn't go again now I've been but would recommend it to friends.

OK tour, a bit pricey.. It costs about 17 Euros, and you get 3 small beers at the end. You also get to know a little (quite basic) about beer brewing, as well as some games for fun. All in all it is quite pricey tour considering the value. At the end of the tour there is a shop, which is also a bit pricey, also a free canal boat tour to the shop in trhe centre (beers are 3 euros on the canal boat). All in all, considering this is a promotional deal, I think that the prices in the shop at least should be susidized to some extent (you can get t shirts etc at cheaper prices online). All in all an OK tour, but I think, considering this is a promotional tour promoting Heineken, and that many breweries do this for free today or at least cheaply, that this tour is a bit pricey.

Not worth the money. We paid 18€ apiece, over $23 in u s. dollars for this experience. We saw pictures in lots of rooms, the brewing process, the horses they use out back, and a couple samples of the beer. Too Much room spent on their advertising,endorsements they are involved in, and medals the Heineken family has won. I guess if you haven't seen a brewery before it might be interesting. You are definitely paying for the beer at the end.

Expected but great. Overall a nice experience. Beer lovers be minded that you will probobaly not learn anything new.
The new "brew me" attraction is a cool 4d movie great for kids.
For the price of the entry ticket you can get a ride in a boat back to the center of the city - great value choice.

Informative and fun. This was among the best things we did whilst in Holland. It's all at once a history lesson, a guide to brewing, a visit to the movies and a guide to tasting beer. It also features a number of interactive exhibits to play with. Was lots of fun and comes highly reccomended.

Great way to experience Heinekan!!. We had just arrived for the weekend and had this on our 'to do' list..
We felt it was a little expensive at first but soon changed our mind when we were handed beer!!!
Overall a great visit and would recommend it to anyone visiting.

Good laugh. There were four of us and we had such a fun time. Although it was very imformative it also had fun things to do from photo opertunities to pouring your own pint. Very good value for money. The boat was full for the day but we returned next day. Having a few 1/2 of Heineken set the pace for the whole evening. Well worth a visit

Why Not?. This place costs as much as a museum (18 euro), but you get beer throughout the tour and at the end. The people at Heineken have definitely used their marketing strengths to create a well-rounded experience, complete with tastings, demonstrations, rides, and bars. This is almost like a museum for grown-ups. You learn a lot--I learned that I've been drinking a beer wrong my whole adult life. And at the end, you get two beers at a vibrant bar that could almost pass for a real bar. The staff was very friendly and accommodating even though they see a lot of faces in one day. They all had high energy and weren't afraid to interact with guests! The only thing I didn't like was the promise of the free gift at the end. When we went to claim it at the gift shop, we were told we had to travel to another store (by ferry!) to claim our gift! We didn't have time so we left, but I feel like we weren't the only ones who missed out on the perk because of a lack of time!
Great fun. Great place to spend a few hours, really interesting and nice beer included in the ticket price. We did the tour along with a canal trip, perfect day in Amsterdam
Fun time!. Really good experience. We paid the €25 for a burger on the rooftop when we were finished. Very interactive and good way to spend the afternoon!

A Great Experience. I definitely recommend the Heineken experience. It was fun and informative about the process and history of Heineken's beer. You get 3 free half pints of Heineken and a free small gift with admission. You can get discounted admission rates with the hop on/hop off tour bus or other tour groups.

The highlight of our trip!. This was a brilliant trip and great value, receiving a wristband which gets you 3 half pints and a free gift. The beginning part, showing you the history of Heineken was a tad boring but there is so much to do afterwards... Get filmed doing Dutch karaoke, ride the Heineken bikes, record video messages, personalise your own Heineken bottle and much more.A great day for everyone, drinkers or not!

A tour, 3 half-pints of free beers and a free gift. If you had bought the I Amsterdam pass then the ticket to this brewery is discounted, which is kind of worth it because you get a lot of reviewers complaining about the steep ticket price. If you have one day in Amdam like what I had then don't miss this! They close late on weekends and we got in at 6.30pm for the unguided tour-they have very limited English guided tour, and who cares because by time you are done you're probably tipsy with all the free beer they give you. After you're done touring they group you and bring you in this room where this guide explains how the beer should be drank.Here are some TIPS:If you don't see bubbles rising to the top, then the beer is stale. If your beer is bitter then you're probably drinking it wrong. The correct way, well at least according to Heineken is to take a LARGE GULPS of beer, because the beer is smooth but the FOAM is the one that's bitter. If you drink your beer like you do your wine then it's going to be bitter. Also, you should raise your glass towards your lips, not you bending towards your drink. Your posture should be straight and the beer glass is the one bending to your mouthWhat I didn't like about this tour was that THE FREE GIFT was not collectible here but instead in a gift shop 3 blocks away so they try to RIP YOU OFF for the BEERS they let you.Make sure you don't throw away the rubber bracelet they give you when you buy the tickets, it has 2 buttons that's exchangeable for beer and soda (for underage kids) and a white button exchangeable for a gift at their gift shop which is 3 blocks away from the breweryThey have this room where you can take pictures with fancy beer backgrounds, print your face on a t-shirt, a small bar for you to enjoy the free beers (only exchangeable with the buttons attached to the bracelet) and purchase Heinekeen memorabilia at the gift shop after you exit the tour.The highlight of the tour is having a custom make beer bottle with your names on it, for 6 Euros
Fun!. Very good museum! Fun and curious. The souvenir store is excellent! Have a 4D movie inside so cool! You can drink and be a DJ. They have an audioguide in many languages.

Well Done!. Having visited several brand experience museums, this is by far the best designed and entertaining experiences.
Come in early and buy your burger on the roof voucher. Before 4PM.
If you are buying a customized beer bottle use your credit card in order to jump the queue.
Enjoy your beer

Something you have to do. I don't like or drink beer but this tour was really neat! Although I didn't drink the three free beers included in the admission price it was still worth it, not too crowded even though the weekend had a huge event going on. A little over an hour to get through.

A fun way to learn about beer. Really enjoyed this beer tour, was fun and interesting, and very young and trendy! Lots of little things to do along the way, plus 2 beers included at the end :) a must see!!

Interesting Tour & Free Bier. The tour gives a history of Heineken. You also see the horses that pull the Heineken coach. There are free beer (bier in Dutch) tastings at relevant times during the tour as well as a 4D movies experience.

Surprisingly good fun. We managed to kill 2.5 hr here including the rooftop lunch.
Lots of interactive stuff. Plenty of opportunity to try the product.
Recommended for sure.

Brilliant, informative and fun. Visited the Heineken Experience in August with my boyfriend. Fun interactive self guided tour, brilliant "brew you" ride, friendly staff, plenty of beer to taste. Be sure to get the Heineken canal boat to the brand shop, as its a mini cruise in itself and is guided by wonderful staff. It leaves every hour on the hour, get your free ticket from the shop inside the main experience. Bottom line: 16 Euros well spent, fun way to spend over 2 hours in Amsterdam

My type of musem . Everytime time i come to Amsterdam I have to come here. Really good even if u are not a beer drinker. I would recomend paying the extra to go up to the roof. Burger and a pint for reliativily cheap prices. A must see
They will get you drunk!. Interesting for beer drinkers and the best part is where they teach you how to pour and drink good beer! By the end of the experience you will be happy high!
Learning how to drink lager!. Great thought has gone into this exhibit. Entry could be cheaper but overall a fun experience. The souvenir shop is expensive for cheap T shirts

Not my favourite excursion in Amsterdam. Maybe I'm getting old (41), but this was not my favourite excursion in Amsterdam. I thought the 20 euro entry per person was a bit steep. Felt like we were rushed through the tour. The whole "experience" felt like it was one big marketing campaign.On the plus side are free beers, and a token to collect a free gift (at the Heineken merchandise store, which is a block away from Rembrandtplein in the main street). You can also get free tickets to take a canal cruise to collect your free gift. I felt as if the younger patrons enjoyed this more. If I had to do it again, I would take the money and rather buy more Heineken beers. That's my "experience", I'm sure a lot of people found it more enjoyable.

Informative and so much fun!. Loved it! The museum is located in the old Heineken brewery. Exhibits are well organized and information is well presented. We were warmly greeted at the door and staff were kind and helpful throughout the visit. The museum is interactive and a great deal of fun! It is very entertaining, like an amusement park for adults. It is good value for money. Worth it!
Great fun. Well organised and great fun. Tells you things you just didn't know about beer. Very well organised and the beer just tastes better in Amsterdam - worth the detour
Great. Loved it, tour great value for money and if you go on the little boat ride at the end too you get to see the city from the canal.

Doesn't worth 18€. I expected to see the actual making of their beer. Instead, there are some guys telling stories and a short videoclip that shows how the beer is made. Such a disappointment. This is not a factory tour! Besides that there are some unrelevant attractions which are not directly related to Heineken, such as some video games. At the end you get to drink couple of pints. It seems more suitable for fans only.

Much more than we expected. I have visited several breweries around the world, but the Heineken Experience in Amsterdam was much different and in fact an "experience". It gives you the history of Heineken and teaches you about their beer / business, while keeping you entertained. Plenty of interactive things to do at your own leisure (self-guided). Even my wife (who had zero expectations going in) really enjoyed the tour. Overall, a really pleasant surprise!

Great way of spending your time. This is an old brewery transformed into a multimedia museum, it is a little expensive but you won't be dissapointed, we spent there more than 2 hours and was very entertaining. Different technology resources help them to show their history and to have fun at the same time (earn your pourer certificate, bottle your own beer, etc.). I never saw something similar in any other city (maybe in Disney or Orlando they have, but I haven't been there yet).Recommended for young and old people... By the way, yes, they give you beer with the entrance fee!!

Great Morning out.. Went in sober with my fiancee... realised she didn't like Heineken... so as a true gentlemen had her free three pints as well as my own... woops.The museum of how heineken was formed was interesting... pooring the perfect pint was even more interesting and looking at how they make, bottle and test the beer was even better. Perfect half a day out if the weathers a bit rainy.

original way to explain about beer brewing. We were lucky enough to get a discount of 5 euro p.p., so I would recommand people to search for possibilities to get a discount like that, it will be worth it! The tour is interactive. It was a bit crowded, which made it a bit difficult to read every available sign, but still it was informative. The tour makes it clear that Heineken wants to be an international player in the beer field (which of course it manages already for decades) and it wants to be a hip and happening brand, but classy as well. I love the way they make moderate drinking cool!Also the dj room, the games, the 'brew you' experience, it's all good fun, entertaining but informative as well.Well done!

Too expensive. Only if you are a beer fan you wil like this. I think is a little bit expensive of what you receive. People there is very nice and motivated but is most of all like a Museum of Heineken. They share with you the history and all. The only thing that I like was the beer simulation experience (Kind of Orlando studio style) but nothing more. They promised a gift but you have to walk a bit to get it.

Unexpectedly amazing tour!. I went on this tour because my boyfriend wanted to but it ended up being the best tour of the trip! You pay 16 euros (if you buy from a trips and tours shop) and during the tour you get 3 glasses of heineken so you pretty much make your money back then! It's full of crazy things - dj rooms, dance machines, crazy seats, a ride and video and lil stories from the staff. You get a free gift at the end and a canal tour! You have to go here if you're in Dam! Even if you don't like beer or you're a kid - it;s amazing!
Pretty interesting experience for a heineken fan.. Great gifts store. Personalised bottles and glasses. Can visit when you have the time in amsterdam. Very interactive and enriching.

Good fun!. This is quite a modern brewery experience with lots of cool gadgets and games etc. to play with along the way. We had a really good time, learnt a few things and had a few beers. We definitely recommend a visit. Shouldn't take longer than an hour or 2. Well worth the money.
Loved it!. We loved this place - awesome place for beer lovers! Slightly expensive but very well organized and interesting. The whole experience is very informative and fun.

Overpriced for the "Experience". Paid 17 euros(had 1 euro discount) to go through the place without a guide. No real brewing takes place there as they show films, displays etc. At the end you receive 2 glasses of 25cl and 1 glass of maybe 15cl for tasting. For me I think your money can be spent better elsewhere.

Very Cool!. The entire walk through of the experience is fun from start to finish!From seeing how they brew the beer on a little ride to tasting some fresh Heineken of your own, its a MUST in Amsterdam! Cheers!

Disappointed. I found the Heineken Experience to be a big waste of money (18 euros) that was more of a marketing gimmick and ego-trip than anything else. Though 2 free beers is nice, it doesn't make up for the high price of admission and altogether uninteresting "experience"

Don't go there in the late afternoon. We arrived around 17h, thinking we would have plenty of time to enjoy the "Experience", as the website says it closes at 19h30. But almost immediately after beginning the tour, the staff started to rush us out because the museum was closing. It was extremely annoying and frustrating. We couldn't enjoy a room more than 2 minutes before being pushed out. Even the free beers at the end felt rushed.I understand the staff want to go home after a hard day of work, but they made us feel unwelcome.

more fun than you'd might think. This is a playful tour that tells the story of Heineken, the Netherlands leading beer and a favourite worldwide. It is the original old brewery that has been transformed into....well, a cross between a museum, a theme park and couple of bars (of course! what did you expect..!) A bit like Atlanta's coca cola experience but for grown ups and teenagers. Nice touches: experience how it feels to be a beer bottle, and for instance, the giant horses that are still kept in the stable to occasionally pull the antique horse drawn beer distribution carriages on show days.When in Amsterdam, the day will come you have seen enough art, enough historic buildings and war memoria, enough red light district etc and then it is time to have some uncomplicated fun here. Take public transport though - parking around here, although there is a parking garage, is a nightmare. Oh and if you don't like beer - don't go.

Nice place and I don't even like beer. Heineken is trademark for Netherlands and for Amsterdam and even though I don't drink beer, I really liked the one I've had while I was enjoying the experience.The experience is a walk through Heineken's history, both beer factory and family. Of course, everything is public oriented, but this is exactly what I expected. The staff is making sure that you get the right infos, liked their attitude and natural approach. The quick lesson about beer and how to poor it into the glass was really useful and I liked that we were asked where we come from, it was great to acknowledge how many people come there.I say, if you are in Amsterdam, go for it, it is a indeed an experience.

Heineken Experience ... Not to be missed. One of the best value for money experiences in Amsterdam... From the start to the finish it is well organised and informative which makes it educational and enjoyable.At the end you really enjoy those beers and appreciate the work that goes into it to make them........ Do not miss it.
FUNNY PLACE. If u go there in group... this may be a really funny and nice place to visit. Do not expect for free beers, but u will still be surprised...

Loads of fun. Definitely worth a visit, we went on a Friday and walked straight in we travelled passed it the following day and there was a lengthy queue, there is lots of interesting info on beer brewing and on how Heineken began, but there is a lot more to this experience, def worth a visit but try and avoid weekends.You will also have the opportunity to travel by canal to the Heinekin brand store, we really enjoyed this as the captain gave us some insight into the buildings we were passing and you will receive a free heinekin gift (a bottle opener).

A fantastic history of all things Heineken!. Any beer lover in Amsterdam will have tried a Heineken. So now you must go and see the history of Heineken and also how its made! This relatively inexpensive tour (around 20 euro's, includes two beers) is definitely worth doing!I really enjoyed the beer simulator that makes you believe you are in a pint as an air bubble! Great fun!Highly recommended!
enthusiasm of the visitors. I went several times with visitors to this experience. They all where very enthusiast about it. And really it is a good experience.

Years ago was much better. I’ve been to the Heineken Museum in 2004 or 2005: 5 Euros entrance + the “right” for 2 free draft beers at the bar at the end of the tour + a gift (a Heineken box with an Heineken glass for a small beer).It was fun and I would have been happy to go back with different friends or whoever wanted to go there (I was living in Amsterdam, for the records).Then they had few years of works so it was close. Now is all brand new, still nothing to see as before BUT 20 Euros (!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!) entrance, 1 or 2 beers and no goodbye gift.Outcome: I’ll never go back again.

€18 Euro Marketing Ploy. Went with my son (11 who was not allowed to drink) and nephew (16 who was). Found it to be a well-made marketing experience with a lot to see and beers to drink at the end, including a lesson in drafting your own beer, which is harder than it sounds. My nephew, who likes beer and whose idea it was to go, is still talking about it. As for me, paying €18 for what is essentially an high-tech exercise in brand marketing is, frankly, a little crazy. Look, if you feel for the brand, this is just fine. If you don't, it's very, very, very expensive for what it is.
Marketing highlight. Marketing highlight Not too much to see Totally overrated highlight in Amsterdam Go there to see how to make money out of nothing (= Beer) This is called marketing!

Worth the 18euro. I loved this we had 3 beers each and i had a nice buzz going on towards the end of the tour. Self passed tour it took us about 2 hours there is plenty to do and see while your in there the beer itself pays for the admission

For Dutch standards it was fun. Compared to the other so called 'attractions' in Amsterdam, this one was decent. As others have said it is quite infomercial - talking about how great their beer is (and really it is the best) and how the Heineken family started the business. The place is no longer a brewery as its turned into a 'beer museum'.I loved the 'Brew You Ride' with motion and some water splashed around. You actually get three free glasses of beer: 1 during the tour and two at the very end. You definitely do not waste your money going to the 'Heineken Experience'.

Easy accessible and fun place even for those who are not beer nerds. You will learn about the history of Heineken and how they produce the beer. A guy told us about how to make beer and also gave us beer yeast since my boy friend makes his own beer. A nice surprise! It's a bit playful were you can try to fill up a beer with a perfect foam Crown in a glass (without real beer unfortunately), but still fun. They also have a kind of corrousel where you are the beer. It is a nice place for those who are not beer nerds and just want to see and learn some more about beer, and of course you will get two beer after the tour.

A walk-through infomercial. We went to this attraction on the request of my two adult daughters. It consisted of a walk through various rooms, some with glitzy displays, which generally tell you how great Heineken beer is and how wonderful the owners are. Sure, at the end we got one or two beers, but they happened to be the least flavorful of the beers we had during our time in the Netherlands, Belgium, and Germany. One reason why I rate this so low is because later in the trip we went on a brewery tour in Bruges which was cheaper, more informative, included a nice view of the town, and had better quality beer at the end. I would suggest skipping this attraction and using the money for a nice meal in Amsterdam.

Had a good time. We decided to go for the Experience mainly because our plans were disrupted by a rainy day in Amsterdam. Extremely glad for the rain otherwise we would have missed this. You really get to see the beer and how it is made, with a beer tasting session where they teach you more about the beer and the correct technique to drink it. Increases your knowledge of beer in general. There are also a lot of displays such as a booth where you can watch old Heineken ads and pour your own beer, which was pretty awesome. Reasonably priced as well, and I would recommend this to anyone visiting Amsterdam with time to spare on their trip.
Brilliant, what a great experience. Was really interesting to learn about the processes used to make the beer, the whole history behind the brand and the chance to brew a glass of Heineken.

Nice experience especially for beer drinkers!. A supposedly short visit turned into a 3.5 hours tour for us as there was so much to see once we got into the building!We are both not beer drinkers but still find the tour very informative and fun. Of course you alsp get up to 3 glass of beer (of which 1 is a smaller glass during the beer tasting session) included in the package (i got an extra glass for correctly answering one of the staff's question).Apart from the tour of the old brewery, there was also an interactive 4d ride showing you how beer is made plus a whole heaps of interactive tech stuff to record videos, photos of your experience there. Overall, a pretty good experience and definitely recommended especially if you love heineken!

Great Fun. My boyfriend and I loved this self-guided tour and beer tasting. There was a lot of really neat information about the Heineken company and their history, as well as a lot of interactive displays. The beer sample you receive half-way through the tour is a lot bigger than I expected, and at the end you have the option of 2 regular beers, or 1 regular beer and a tap-pouring lesson, or one larger beer poured at -2C.The only thing I didn't like was that in order to get your free gift, you had to make your own way to the Heineken Brand Store, which is in another part of the city. Other than that, this was a great attraction.

Not bad. If you like beer, this is an interesting spot, however it is very commercial and you are blasted by advertising and the brand in all areas of the tour.If you can get over this there are some good aspects, like getting bottled and tastings.Reasonably priced, and worth a visit.

Good experience. Quite an interesting tour. only 16 euros. You get to walk round the brewery, lots of videos about the history to watch, they go through the process if making it, 4d experience which was fun, get 3 free beers in total, you also get a free canal boat road to there gift shop where you get a free gift

Fun for all ages!. I expected another ho-hum lecture on "This is how we make beer (wine, cheese, scotch, fill in the blank). I was most pleasantly surprised. The tour had something for everyone; young, old, drinkers, non-drinkers. Heineken does an outstanding job of making the mundane interesting and interactive. We paid 25 Euros each which included the tour and a hamburger and beer on the roof of the building. The hamburger was great and the views of Amsterdam were fantastic. Everyone back home makes fun as I rave about my Heineken Experience in Amsterdam but I recommend it to everyone.

Fantastic!. What a great fun place!!!I really reccommend it!Interactive, fun, free heinekin!!!! Then you get a ticket for a canal trip to their shop.Not clear we found this was included by chance, great canal trip with guide too!!

Not a big fan of beer when I went, but not I drink Heineken all the time! :). Can't really see where all the negative reviews come from. I think it was value for money and pretty interesting. Thankfully I went when it was pretty quiet, and my mates and I never had to wait for anything, just straight through, saw what he wanted to see, tasted the beer and really enjoyed the whole tour.The price is fair, like most attractions, except you get beer included! Brilliant! :)
Refreshes the parts...... Not just for drinkers. Very well set out telling it's history and how its made, plus you get free samples and a gift too.

Very average, just an expensive pub. I bought tickets online and just showed tickets on my smartphone, so that was easy.Found the tour boring, small, child like ride and everyone seemd gagging to get to there 'Free' drinks...........Save 32 Euros and go to a pub on the canal.

I don't even really like Heineken but loved the tour. If you like Heineken you will love this tour. If you don't like Heineken you will still appreciate the tour.I have been on many brewery tours and this was one of the best CISCO brewery on Nantucket is high on the list too. I don't even really like Heineken in the first place.So when you buy your tickets you get a rubber bracelet with three golf marker type things in it. Two are for a free beers and one is for a free gift that you can't get at the brewery but have to walk to get ( I didnt bother).The tour is self guided has plenty to see and really gets you pumped up to drink some beer. The tour incorporates a cool ride where you are treated like actual beer in the brewing process, you walk by actual stables with horses, learn about history of Heineken, grains, yeast, etcAt the end you find yourself in a cool bar area where you can get your free beer. If you turn in both of your markers at once your get bigger super icy beer. In the gift shop you can get various items engraved. We got several glasses but you can get bottles, etc.I would highly recommend this experience if you have time in Amsterdam. The House of Bols tour was also great.

A must if you like beer. For the cost of admission one gets a very entertaining and informative 1-hour infomercial with beer and a gift. We thoroughly enjoyed the hour and the gift shop was a great place to pick-up some souvenirs and gifts for those back home.

Great tour. It was a great tour! 18? unless you had the amsterdam city pass which gave you 25% off. It was a great swlf guided tour. Got to see the beer process, the horses, send e-postcards, and have some beers. The end of the tour was a bar and you either got 2 regular heineken beers, 2 pepsi soda's, or 1 extra cold heineken beer.If you want to take the boat ride to the gift shop to pick up your free souviner be sure to get your ticket just before you depart the bldg, they only have a certain # of boat rides per hr. we decided to wlak there later in the evenig and picked up our gift no problem.All in all very fun and easy to folloe tour! If you like beer highly recommend!
Really nice!. It is a really nice time! You will learn about how the beer is produced and finish in a really nice bar.

If you like Heineken you will love this!. A good attraction giving you technical knowledge on brewing etc and also humour with the 4D ride which is entertaining and factual.Lots of interesting information and also tuition on how to appreciate the beer.Some free lager aswell and a well stocked shop,Do get a personilsed bottle for the one you love!!

great experience. One of the coolest museums in Amsterdam with amazing staff. Special thanks to Roel (aka Finn on 14.07.13) for keeping up the spirits of three girls from France, Hungary and Latvia.My advice: come early, because there's a lot to see, and you wanna enjoy the full experience and your beer without any rush.

surprisingly good , very enjoyable. We went to this attraction last week and i was really surprised as to how good the tour was. it was really interactive and informative and there was loads of interesting things to do including pulling your own pint and a 4D ride of what its like to be bottled, really good.

Fun time. We visited the Heineken Experience on a Saturday at 11am. Because we bought the tickets in a Tours&Tickets store we didn't have to stand in line to get in - which wouldn't have been too bad as the place wasn't that crowded yet. When we left at around half past one, there was a long queue, however. The tour was very interesting and fun, we learned a lot about Heineken's history and got to taste the beer. I especially enjoyed getting the Beer Poured Certificate, the staff was really friendly. So, go early and have a meal before because there will be a lot of beer ;)

A must see.. Really enjoyed this. I'm not into beer but I found it really interesting. Lots of interactive stuff going on and an interesting history. You get 3 glasses of beer within the price and a free gift at the end - you do have to walk or take a free canal walk to the brand shop to get your free gift though.

Highly recommended!. This is a great way to spend some time in Amsterdam. It is an interactive tour - there are tons of things to see and do. There is an interactive 4-D "ride," you can mix your own music, put your pictures on Heineken tshirts, play foosball, watch tv in cool chairs - lots and lots to do! For adults and kids! There is a tasting room about halfway through, and at the end you can either get two pints of beer or you can pour your own and get just that one. You enjoy your drinks in a cool room at the end which shows views of big cities panoramically.You get a free gift in the town store at the end. You cannot redeem the gift at this store. And, they do offer a free ferry ride up to the store. We rode bikes to the Heineken Experience, so we didn't need the ferry ride. However, if you are staying in the center of town, you could coordinate it to see things on this end of town (Van Gogh, Vondel Park etc), then take the ferry back after the Heineken Experience, to avoid the long walk or tram ride back.

Very Dull !. Save some money , buy a case of Heineken and go on the Internet to discover more about the product if your that into beer ! This really felt like a primary school kids trip ! Only difference was that it ended with a visit to the Heineken bar in the museum for a couple of small beers from the most unorganised bar staff in Amsterdam .

So cool!. The Heineken Experience at the brewery in Amsterdam is awesome! I also visited the Guiness brewery in Dublin during the same trip and Heineken blew Guiness out of the water. The Heineken Experience was fun and very interactive, the staff members were funny and helpful, and the souvenir shop on site has tons of cool items for sale.

AMAZING!. We booked to do House of Bols and then decided to do the Heineken Experience as well as an after thought. Admittedly, the beginning of this tour didn't do much to excite us.. a lot of history and factual information about making beer and the history of the brand..not too exciting to be honest. However after the first part of the tour is over it gets better and better!! There is SO much to see and do here, you can go at your own pace and spend as much time as you want taking photos or making a video or being a DJ! There are a lot of hands on activities, from crushing barley to tasting wort and smelling hops. After all this is done you get the chance to "brew yourself" in which you follow the beer production from start to finish. Such a good idea and it's really well done and most of all, a lot of fun! After this you learn about tasting beer, the colour, what the bubbles are for and what the foam does, a lot of genuinely interesting information. And you get a free half beer "to sample". At the end of the tour there are 2 free beers and a free gift for everyone, the atmosphere in the bar at the end is good, everyone enjoys it and i'm sure most would recommend going! We did Heineken and House of Bols, and honestly, if you're only doing one, Heineken wins hands down!
Nothing special. The price is only worth for the boat trip at the and and the little gift. Not recommended, boring and not interesting

Drinkers' delight. If you like a lager or two - or are a Champions League fan - then this multimedia attraction will be right up your canal...A brief introduction to the Heineken brand and history leads into a huge array of interactive stuff with vibrating floors, video games and the chance to create your own bottle of the golden brew. It costs 18 euros for the tour or 25 if you include the burger and beer lunch on the roof terrace with views right across the city. It's actually a pretty good deal to include the burger if you're there around lunchtime as it's barbecued to order. If you change your mind during the tour and decide to stay on for the food then it costs 8.50 euros so best to book from the start...

Very worthwhile. Was very worthwhile, interesting and the staff were all very friendly. The whole museum is English. Got your money's worth for sure! Try to arrive before lunchtime as it tends to get a bit busier into the afternoons. Would recommend!

If you are in Amsterdam, you MUST visit it :-). A really nice place to visit, very well organize, price is good 13€ and you get to 2 beers. You go throw the history of the beer, and there is a 4D show. You will get the chance to take a lot of cool pictures. Enjoy...I did it! :-)

Highly recommend. Great experience. Takes a couple of hours, you decide your pace. We opted to include the rooftop burger which was very tasty and a nice end to the trip. Really interesting and lots to see.
(When you come down from tour lift cruise ticket before going to shop etc as limited spaces on boat.
Thoroughly recommend.)

Funny experience. Very very interesting, not common to find such approach in this business. It was interesting to find out the history of the brewery, taste (a lot :) of fresh beer, relax with mates, may be buy some souvenirs. Price is good, even gifts expected. As it is located almost in the city center - it is easy to find it. I can recommend that as a part of Amsterdam city tour.P.S. Gifts they give in another store in the center of the city - be aware - tricky thing! :)P.P.S. Interesing that they have restaurant there for groups and companies.

Loved it!. Enjoyed this very much! It was interesting looking around the brewery and learning about it's history. The tour took around 1.5 hours. It cost around 15 Euro to get in, but for that you get three Heinekens, a free gift, and a canal boat ride thrown in! Well worth a visit if you are in Amsterdam!

Enjoyable visit. Really enjoyed the visit! It was an interactive experience for a visitor: in addition to the usual board (words/pictures) exhibition on the history of the brand, there is: a photo stand to pose for photos with a giant logo (perfect for solo visitors!), simulation ride (in which one ‘feels’ the process of how beer is produced ), and a short session afterwards where staff explains how to appreciate Heineken properly. At the end of the visit, one can redeem the ‘buttons’ on your wristband for a glass of beer, and socialise/mingle with the other guests!

Really enjoyed this museum. like everyone else has said, you get to learn about the history of Heineken and how they are produced. you also get to sample beers, what's not to like!! the simulation ride thing at the end was clever and i thoroughly enjoyed it. shame that the free gift has to be collected from another building. although you can get the free shuttle boat to that location, we did not have time to go there.

Great experience. I was very undecided whether to go here or not as I don't drink beer and have no interest in it but am very happy I decided to go! There is so much fun things do inside as we'll as learn about the beer and try. We paid 5 euro extra to go up to the 6th floor and have a burger and a beer which was worth it as the view was amazing!

Thought I would hate, but quite fun. Not much of a beer drinker, and was told the tour takes 1.5hrs. Thought no way, but there is quite a bit to do, and the place is pretty big. Get a few beers along the way and enjoy. Good spot to get out of the rain or heat too...

We loved it. I loved Amesterdam and this "museum" was awsome, we had a guide visit to see where and how the beer was made, You have a "bar" where you can learn how to drink beer in a properly way and then you could stay drinking and listening the music ::) really nice :)it´s a place to come back it´s a good way to learn the origin of beer without feeling bored

Perfect!. Amazing place with lot of things to do inside there. I won 2 cups of beer. One that already was in the plan for everyone who visit and the other because the guy asked how to say "cheers" in german language... I answered around many people... "Prost!" :-))

Great place to advertise their product. I did enjoy the visit & I like Heineken but as the whole attraction is banging on about their product I think it should be free. I paid 12 Euros for 2 bottles of Heineken just to have them personalized these should be a lot cheaper. The attraction is not really suitable for children & they should make this clearer. Having said all this I am glad I went & it was quite interesting. It was a real pain trying to find the Heineken shop the other side of the city to claim my free gift in the end I gave up.

Superb tour!!!. As for me, they organized it perfectly - mix of Heineken history, information about ingredients, great number of funny activities and of course beer itself!!! I received Certificate of Heineken's draughtmaster!!! (after training and passing test, of course);)). Unforgettable experience!

Beer included in the tour. I've been a 2 other brewery tours and this one is by far the most interesting - ok, so there is only so much you can learn about the brewing process, but the tasting section was great, some people got two glasses instead of one ;-) also the tokens are great to use at the end of the tour. Was a great few hours and we came away feeling merry.

Awesome. ..you well not forget it. It is amazing experience. You will enjoy your time their. Don't bypass anything there you will enjoy alot in each part. And you can get heineken bottle with your name written on it.

Worth a visit!. The Heineken experience was a nice mix of learning and beer drinking! I'm not much of a beer drinker myself but it was interesting to see how beer is made and the history of Heineken. Great value for money too!
Heineken experience. A must go! I personally prefer Belgian brews but this place is just a lot of fun to experience. I wasn't prepared for the amount of entertainment this old brewery had!

Great Experience. It's worth it! we really enjoyed the whole experience. We learned a lot about beer making, but also had a very nice beer tasting. The interactive room was fun. We had a great time. We have been many times to Amsterdam, and this was the first time we visited a brewery. We ended there because it was raining and we were passing by, and decided to give it a try. What a great surprise!

Good Guy Heineken. For 15 Euros we experienced a fascinating museum, a 4D show where you saw the process of making the lager, a tasting 1/2 pint, 2 pints in a fun bar, many cool chill out rooms, a boat ride and a bottle opener. We all had a fantastic time. Allow a good few hours though as there is so much to do!

Very Enjoyable Tour. Went in with low expectations to this place as we had gone to other breweries and distilleries before, but I have to say I really enjoyed this tour. The interactive tour was very good and probably the highlight of the whole tour. Also the free glasses of Heineken that were included were gorgeous, but if you cant get of Heineken from the source, you never will. Would definitely recommend coming here to pass an hour.

If you like beer, get yourself here!. Great visit here, it's a short tram journey (could walk it) from the centre, we were greeted nicely and even got a free extra wrist band which entitled us to more beer. The whole "experience" was an enjoyable one and I would recommend doing it to anyone.

this one must experience ;). everyone must knw where their ancestors come from ;) so u cannot leave Amsterdam without an Heineken experience. its a half day affair (so dont leave it for the last minute) which opens at 11am - 5pm on weekdays and 11am - 8pm on Sundays. children are allowed.

Expensive Brewery Tour. The Heineken Experience is good--especially the experience when the visitor is put into the brewing process. This was a new for this visitor. The experience is very expensive (approximately $22) compared to complimentary or nominal fee brewery tours in the US. The 15 minute canal boat ride (do get a ticket in advance for the on the hour ride) to the Heineken store was enjoyable & a plus. For certain--the freshly made Heineken, on draft, beer is very good. Allow 2 hours as it is generally crowded.

CRAZY TOUR. in portugal people just ove a cold beer! understanding how Heineken works it's just unic! they will guide you through Heineken factories! and you'll feel like a beer ahahah nothing more cool than a good party with free beer to finish the tour! I really do love does basebal coats! save 60euros to buy one!

It's a must!!!. We went not expecting too much from the visit, and myself and my partner were blown away by the experience, we spend 3 hrs there and could have spent longer if we had the time. The trip included 3 drinks, and a trip on a canal boat into the middle of the city, we were taken to the brand store for a free gift but there was NO hard sell, just a very pleasant experience. Well worth the money, don't go to Amsterdam and not include this trip.
Lots of fun. Great way to spend a few hours. We learnt to pull a pint and enjoyed our drinks in the bar. Learnt how to drink beer properly on the beer tasting session.

Something fun to do after a day of walking. After a long day of walking and then more walking, the Heineken Experience was the perfect way to end our afternoon. You do not see any actual brewing, but the Experience walks you through the history of Heineken and shows you examples of the brewing vats, ingredients that go into beer and how to properly drink beer for the best taste. The tour includes a view (through glass) of the Heineken horses in their very clean stalls, as well as a cute, short video with some bumps and splashes. The last stop is a small bar area where you can enjoy your two free Heineken beers. Worth visiting for some fun.
Worth to visit, even twice as I have.. This is simply fantastic. You spend at least 3-hrs in there and you do not even feel them; lot's of things to see and do.

Not bad. Visited here during a holiday with friends, its not bad the best part was getting served a freshly pulled pint! I found this a bit of a let down to be honest, probably my expectations were too high. Not bad if your looking to kills a few hours but there is so much to do in amsterdam!

Interactive and great fun. Great experience! More than just a brewery tour. Very informative. Beer tasting and 2 complimentary beers at end if tour. Great tour through the makings of the beer and the company. Highly recommend and great fun and value for money. Perfect for a rainy day which we had!

Brewery experience. Good interactive experience. the instructor took special efforts to know from which part of the world had the vistors come & explained the components of beer in detail. Liked the horse a lot, they were really well maintained & groomed. The area with UV lights. bottles & games were nice. 4 D experience is not really worth the wait in the queue. Couple of beers at the end of the tour helped, it could have been nice if some titbits could have been made available (may be for a price).Certainly worth the price, especially if you book online (you could save some time by skipping the queue at the entrance)Also bought a nice looking beach bag at the branded store.

great beer was had here :). Good fun experience,great beer and great story of the families fight through history and how Heineken has endured the challenges to still be going strong today.I did this tour with a friend and at the start I wasn't that keen but once I walked through the doors the experience was awesome.
interactive and fun. The Heineken Experience was a good way to enjoy our last morning in Amsterdam. The beginning is a little blah but the last 70% or so was interactive and quite fun.

Fun but not worth the price. This was fun but not worth the price (18 euro) even with two .3L beers thrown in. The entire tour felt very rushed and had a club atmosphere that I was not expecting at a former brewery. The store at the end was probably the highlight.

Heinekin experience is ok !!!!!!!. We visited in the middle of summer and the queues were big but i think you can pre book online which i would recomend..the first part is good to see were all the large copper brewing pots are but the interactive rooms are more of a forced advertising campaign than a museum experience... Although the two heinekin beers you get at the bar is really nice ...we spent around 1 1/2 hours walking around steadily and then another 3/4 of an hour in the bar but this is really stretching it out a bit..at the end of the tour you can choose either a free gift or aboat ride.. I personally would take the boat ride as we opted for the free gift and ended up with a cheap pair of sunglasses...

Go if you don't like art museums. It's an interesting place... you get to know the process, and theres a really nice souvenir store at the end. They give you 3 free beers at the end of the tour. I would've like to see a bit more of the process and history of Heineken instead of all the merchandising expositions.

Bit pricey but good fun!. First of all - Don't bother with the multimedia headset thing if you are British! Waste of dosh as everything in English & Dutch. Your 18 Euro entrance fee does include three small beers & a somewhat crappy bottle opener as a free gift (this cannot be collected on site though - need to trudge to Heineken shop to get this .. map provided & 15 minute walk!)

Fantastic. I loved there. You can understand better the history of heineken in a old factory. The each period of the history. The cenarium is a mixe of the past and present. In the end you can savour a good beer to celebrate the travel in the history of Heineken

Well done Heineken!. Good plan to learn a bit more about the brand and brewing process mixed with simple but fun activities through your way to the bar! And take the shuttle boat to the store at the end of your visit!

Great alternative to the many other Arty museums. This museum offers a great alternative to the many art museums in Amsterdam, and you do not need to be a beer lover to enjoy it. You can go around pretty much at your own pace, with very basic information about the history of the brand and the beer. The visit offers many interactive features, including an app that you can download onto your own device and follow on the way round. Of course there is the chance to sample the beer. It can fill about two hours to go around and we felt it was worth a visit.
