For the youngsters!. I had been to the Heineken Experience a few years ago but a friend who'd visited recently said it had really changed since then. I have to admit I was a bit disappointed. Apart from a few extra lights and a bit of painting it wasn't that different from before. Also there seemed to be a lot more queing going on. This may have been down to the time of year I went. Went early December previously now went in mid-June. I was disapointed not to be able to see the dray horses close up. They never seem to say what time you can see them. One tip I'd give is use one of the discount vouchers. I used one from the GVB travel map that gives lots of discounts in it and got €3 off the admission price. You do get 3 Heinekens included in the admission and can also get a free gift but this is given out at a different location about 15 minutes walk away. I would say this is a good attraction if you are under 30 but probably not for anyone older. Just sample your Heineken in one of the nearny bars that abound in the area.

Fun with friends. Thoroughly enjoyed with friends. The experience is well worth the time if you enjoy interactive fun with a glass of beer to go with it. A nice change from your typical museum outing!

Mixed Emotions. The Heineken Experience was just "ok", a little bit pricey but drinks are included, you get 3 good glasses of beer. The motion ride half way through was a bit cheezy and so was the bar. Friendly staff and guildes though. Bit of a mixed review I guess.

Not worth it. This was roughly 22 USD. You get a free glass of beer at the end with the beer tasting...then you get an additional 2 at bar. We only drank the one with the tasting...The simulation of becoming a beer was a bit cheesy...There were some fun interactive things to do at the end - when we visited it was not crazy busy so were able to enjoy those - but on a busy day...it would be impossible to enjoy.Even if we drank the 2 additional beers not sure I would say it was worth it - maybe....

Waaaaay overpriced. This might have been ok if it wasn't €18 per person. You don't get your money's worth out of it. Keep in mind, you're drinking Heineken, which isn't exactly a gourmet beer. You get 3 complimentary beers, but they aren't full size. There are a lot of gimmicks like taking your photo in front of a green screen and emailing it to friends and other interactive exhibits like pouring a virtual pint. There is a "ride" but it's only impressive if you don't get out much. It's essentially just a video with a few special effects like bubbles and vibrations. The final room, where you drink the beer, has the vibe of a college dorm. The floor is extremely sticky from spilt Heineken. All in all, I didn't learn anything from the tour as it is a giant self-promoting commercial that I paid to watch. I would not recommend unless you REALLY like Heineken.

I don't drink beer but I still enjoyed it.. We visited as 2 couples and we had a great time. Even though I don't drink beer, I still was interested in the company and its history. I loved all the old memorabilia of Heineken and the stories of each Heineken family members to have led them to where they are today. The 2 bar men were also very good entertainers, taught everybody the 'art' of drinking Heineken and why the foam on the top is a good thing. There were many activities and personalised memorabilia you can get. Our friends bought a bottle Heineken with a personalised label on it. It was presented in a cool looking tube too as its packaging. The only negative thing I will say is that along with your ticket, you get 2 free drinks and a gift. At the end when you 'collect' your gift, you are asked to go on one of their boat rides to the other side of town to visit their brand store just to collect your free gift, which was a bottle opener. However, the boats run every hour, and it was already full when we finished our tour. Plus we didn't fancy spending the next hour waiting around or going the other side of town. Other than this, it was a fun visit, I bought my tickets online and it was slightly cheaper and I was cautious of the potential queue, but it turns out that there was barely a queue anyway. Will definitely recommend it to everyone.

Be amazed. I can't stress how cool it is. There are a lot of interactive stuff, you can send photos to your friends, post to Facebook, etc. They brew you inside a n-dimension theater. These guys are impressively creative. Definitively recommend.

Good fun!!. Bought the ticket online at 16 euros, its a good experience had plenty of fun especially with the video or picture you could take and it will be sent to your email, freshly brewed beer tastes so different from the can, wish i had a brewery sigh....anyway the guides were really friendly and took their time to explain everything ensuring nobody was left out especially during the beer tasting session.....the only downside was the que for the certificate on how to pour a perfect draft....i was waiting for half an hour but couldnt wait no more so i had to opt for the beers instead how sad...A must visit in Amsterdam!

A rather disappointing 'Experience'. The first 15 mins or so are ok getting to understand the beginnings of Heineken and seeing the old brewing area. After that it's all quite poor/gimmicky and the complimentary 3 half pints of beer don't make up for it. Rather expensive for what it is. We would have been better off going into one the real ale pubs in Amsterdam and reading the history of Heineken on a wifi connection whilst enjoying a few pints of good quality beer.

If you drink beer, you should come here then!. Pretty interesting place to visit. Along with the tickets comes with 2 beers and 1 free gift. To avoid queuing, buy tickets online and save 2 euros and time as well!

The most disappointing experience in Amsterdam. Went there, only to realize that we paid the outrageous fee of 17€ per person just to be captured audience in Heineken's self admiration hall.The tour is one long commercial, with no added value, in which the we the visitors play a passive role.
worth a visit. a great experience understanding the classic brand from malting to serving.Very professional and a great souvenir shop post the visit.2 beers included.. Cheers!!

Waste of money. The opening part of the tour featured two dutch tour guides explaining very poorly the brewing process, followed by a "ride" that explained nothing, followed by "experiences" ranging from - watching heineken adverts, paying a premium for a bottle with your own text on, watching more heineken adverts and finally partaking in some nintendo wii type "pull a pint" games that didn't work.36 euros and an hour of my life I'll never get back, so rubbish we didn't even stay for our 2 free token beers, which are 25cl by the way so don't get too excited...

Good day out. Great day out with lots of interesting facts about the history and future development of Heineken. There is an entrance fee of 16 euros per person, however, you do receive 2 free beers at the end of the tour as well as free taster beers too. In addition there is plenty to keep everyone occupied including children.A must do experience when in Amsterdam.

Great if you are under 30. Geared toward the younger crowd. Would have appreciated more facts and history, less hype. Actually enjoyed the global commercials which reflect what a truly world wide brand this is. Free gift offered requires a 20 walk across town. Free beer at end is nice, but tables And floor very sticky.
Fun-Tastic. Brilliant experience, I was very surprised, worth every penny, took so many pictures my phone battery died. This is amazing, everyone should experience this if in Amsterdam
Great value!. Got a great deal with a voucher from the hotel. Included a few beers and a free cruise back into town!
Did nothing for me. Kind of a vintage 1985 Disney experience. Traveling from room to room watching TV screens. Just not worth The admission.
Awesome must see!!. This was so much more than I expected I really enjoyed it here, good show good vibe plenty to see smell and if corse taste!! Well done great work Heineken land!!

A pleasant way to spend a couple of hours. A pleasant way to spend a couple of hours. Plenty of free beer, more than enough for me as I don't really like it. Went with my husband. Enjoyed the explanation of the brewing process and seeing the vats, equipment etc.

A fun interesting experience worth the value. A good experience to visit when you are in Amsterdam. The tours last for about a couple of hours and you get to learn the history of the company as well as receiving a wristband souvenior which entitles you to two free beers and a free gift. This could either be a bottle opener at one of their stores in the city or canal boat ride to the store. If you are not a drinker, then Pepsi is available instead. The experience is worth doing for the fun interactive experience.

Great fun and interesting experience. All in all the Heineken Experience was great fun and quite interesting. The tour guides were enthusiastic and best of all you get two free drinks & a gift. I would recommend taking the boat ride over the gift from the shop as we walked all the way to the shop only to find that we were given a pair of sunglasses.

More show than beer. If you spend more time looking for good beer than food, or brew your own beer, this is not the place for you. Yes, you get to see some old school stuff from the brewery, but it's mostly about the brand Heineken. Fun for the family, not the beer enthusiasts.

Great brewery tour - more like an amusement park than a tour!. If you don't mind spending at least an hour (or 2 like we did), and can stomach the extreme commercialism of the tour, this is a really fun, interactive and interesting brewery tour. You follow along a path through the giant complex, learning how the beer is brewed, seeing the old tanks/machinery etc, reading/watching some history of the Heineken company/family, get to play some computer games and interactive things, and go on a virtual 'ride' as if you're the barley being brewed... and of course finish off with a couple brews yourself! Now if you're a beer snob or purist this may not be attractive due to all the commercials and dumbed-down beer information, but if you're there to just have a fun time learning a bit about the beer it is a lot of fun. Tip - buy tickets online and print them - its a couple Euro cheaper and apparently lets you skip the queue. We showed up on a rainy afternoon midweek and there were very few people there, no lineup at all. But that may have been due to the weather. Location - it is a bit out of the centre, but close to RIjksmuseum, so if you're feeling a bit tired after a long museum visit and need something more high energy then swing by Heineken afterwards, that's what we did and it was a good combination!

Good fun. This is not a working Brewery like most tours you will go on, my husband and I described it as the Disneyland of brewery tours It is a bit like a huge marketing campaign for Heineken, but non the less it was fun and enjoyable few hours.The highlight was probably the ride where you become the beer or the part when they teach you how to taste and drink Heineken.I think even for those who are not a fan of beer or alcohol in general, it would still be an enjoyable experience.At the end you receive two free beers, plus the one in the tasting session, so all in all that is three free drinks. Alternatively there is also the option to pull your own pint
A must do when you are there. Beer Tasting, lots learnt, get to pour your own drink, well worth the money. Plus they have horses - mental although you don't get to stroke them.
Interested in beer?. Then yeah go for the heineken experience! Great fun go through alla the steps of brewing and learn about heineken history! Interactive and lots to see and do.

A fun tour with some interesting facts. A fun tour, a taster & two free drinks plus a gift... Lots of fun artefacts, from the history of the company. Worth doing, especially if its wet or you've a free couple hours.

Fun thing to do if you have time left. Read & watch here.. No one (at least not that I know of) says no to a couple of beers during a hot summer day. So why not combine those beers with learning about how this popular alcoholic beverage is actually produced and also get to know the history of one of the biggest "trademarks" out there. The Heineken Experience is a fun thing to do while in Amsterdam, especially if you have some time over or want to give some variation to your trip.The Heineken Experience is also presented in one of my travel videos around the world. This specific video also features other must-sees and do's in Amsterdam. You can watch this video on YouTube:http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9A_cGWXGjow

fun!. We have been here before a couple of times but our friends had not, there were some changes since we last visited and we felt it was not so good. However we enjoyed it and the boat ride back to Rembrandtsplein was a good addition
Heineken Experience. This was a great morning out in amsterdam. Staff were very friendly and helped to make our visit more enjoyable. The two free drinks at the end of the tour set us up for the day.

Good value for a couple of hours. Good experience when in Amsterdam with a few hours to kill, the pluses were the Become the Beer attraction, the tastings and sending a musical karaoke message home!On the minus side some parts seemed to be filling in between others, staff very friendly and all in all decent brewery tour, especially with the 3 glasses of lager and the free bottle opener when you walk to the Heineken Shop.

Pleasant surprise. Not a beer fanatic I thought I'd still give the brewery tour a try, and I'm so glad I did. Bought my ticket in advance to skip the queue, and on entry was given a token for a free gift, some free drinks and a free 15 minute canal boat ride. The tour was interesting - we walked round at our own pace and dropped in and out of the presentations by the staff. The 4D movie was the only part I had to tolerate, the rest I really enjoyed. It was great to do a proper beer tasting and there's plenty of interactive parts to the tour to enjoy.Completed the tour in an hour then went on the 15 minute canal boat ride to the gift shop to pick up my free gift.
Actually worth a visit...about 90 minutes. Good fun ,when i got bored ,new stuff turned up.All ages from 14 yearsDefinately pre book with an agent to solve the queue! €15 each

must visit. if you go to amsterdam, you should go to this museum, not only they give you 3 glasses of free fresh beers, but the experience is interesting to see, it's about the history of heinneken, how they make it, and the technology they had, a lot of fun games, you would like it
A BLAST !!!. Even my wife who is not a beer drinker loved it!! You even get 2-3 beers at the end to drink. Get a bottle with your names printed on it as a keepsake. You'll be glad you did.

More than expected. We were expecting a usual 'museum' experience but were pleasantly surprised! Without giving too much away, there's so much to see and do. We spent about 2.5 hours exploring.We paid 15 euro each and received 3 drinks of Heinekin and a boat ride. The entrance fee is 18 euro but we found a 3 euro discount voucher in the back of the transport map from the main tourist information point by central station - worth getting hold of prior to your visit. Would highly recommend for groups of friends!
Fun drinking.. For a person who doesn't really like beer, this was really an 'experience'. It brings you though how the beer is made and explains in a fun way how to drink and appreciate beer.
Great tour. A must see!!! You can't go to Amsterdam without going to the Heineken Experience. And don't forget to pick up your free gift at the end.

Really fun!. I had a great time here. Me and my friends learned a lot about how beer is brewed, had a great time, bought really cool souvenirs and got some amazing pictures. Is a really interactive experience, and it has a lot of different activities. My favorite ones, were the bar where they teach you how to pour your own beer and the huge and very comfortable lounge where you can sit relax and watch the Heineken commercials. The people are really nice and helpful and everything is really well designed. I really enjoyed it!!!

Enjoyable couple of hours. Interesting experience, you are left to walk around at your own pace in the main but there is a "ride" which was enjoyable and a quick guide on to how to appreciate your lager properly rather than just swilling it down. Slightly cheaper entrance tickets can be picked up at tickets and tours office in the city.

nice place. We had a great time in Heineken experience. We spent several hours there. After ending the trip, We took a free shuttle boat to the Heineken store where is in the city center. You don't have to walk there. The entrance fee is slightly high. It is still fair considering two or three beers and a small gift. Note that you might be able to find a voucher in either hotels or some tour information centers.

Bit of fun for a dull day.... We went here as something different to do on a dull cold day.... I didn't have high expectations, but we like a beer so thought it would be something new to do. At first I thought it was going to be a bit boring, but as you moved through it got more interesting and fun. It took us about an hour to go round the experience, ending with a fun movie experience which was a lot better than i had imagined, and then we were given some tips about drinking the beer to get the best of it. We were given a wrist band with tokens for two more beers at the end and a free gift at the Heineken brand store, which happened to be up the road from our hotel, so we popped in there and was given a free bottle opener... (Might have been good to do different gifts if there is a couple if you or a group) The store also had some games which we had a bit of fun playing..Worth a visit, especially if the weather is not good...

Good way to spend an afernoon. I had planned on going here when I first knew I was going to Amsterdam. If you're looking for a proper brewery tour this probably isn't for you, but I found it enjoyable. I mainly preferred the interactive parts of the tour. The 3d ride where 'you become the beer' was good, not great, but something a bit different compared to your normal brewery tour.I found this attraction good value for money considering you get a beer while walking round then you get another 2 beers at the end, plus the free gift when you go to the store. Throw in the free canal cruise, it's definately worth the money.

The best experience in Amsterdam. I liked this trip a lot. You pay 18 euro (16 if ticket is ordered in internet and printed), and see the whole beer factory with the process of beer production, 4d film about it, horse stable etc. You taste about 3 glasses of beer, learn to be a bartender, can make your own bottle of beer with your name on it (6 €). Also you have a free boat ride and a small gift at the end!

Always something new. I have been here every time I have gone to Amsterdam, which means 7 times! The beauty is that there is always something new which makes the tour even better then the time before. All staff is very helpful and the tour is very much interactive. Real value for money as you get a free gift a canal ride and 2 free drinks as well. Always return.

A must. Book online for €16 and no queues.. This was by far one of the best experience in Amsterdam. I dont drink beer so much but the tour it self was complete and very modern. Besides the fact that they offer you 3 beers they also give you for free a ride with the Heineken boat just in front of the building (ride on the canal that would worth €15 if u book with a regular boat company). If you buy and print the tickets online (or just go green and save them on your mobile) u'll only pay €16 and you'll get:- No queues - Almost 2 hours beer tour- 3 free beers- Boat ride in the canals- Free bottle opener at the end of the boat ride

Nice history of Heineken and interactive displays. I has a business meeting here, and after the meeting went to see the Experience. It tells you about the family history of the Heinekens and about the brewing process. This is NOT a working brewery,although they still make wort, which gives the brewhouse an authentic aroma and let's you taste unfermented beer. The are a lot of marketing and advertising gimmicks and at the end you can have a beer.

Far from free beer.... The travel guides let u believe that this place is a beer lover's heaven, but what is actually is, is a 18€ factory tour. One would be far better of by just heading to the old windmill De Gooyer and enjoying their authentic athmosphere there. Only the entrance fee to the Heineken tour is going to take your whole group to the happy fields.

Good visit, even for non drinkers. My husband really enjoyed this although he was dissapointed that you don't get many free samples. As a non drinker i thought i would be bored but actually it was quite good. The 3d experience was funny and there are some good 'extras' you can purchase like photos and bottle your own beer. We were there a good 2 hours all in all.

Funky. It is actually a funky visit - but quite informative as well - giving you the chance to learn about beer and the history of Heineken. Make sure you sing the song at the end of the tour and save a copy of the video; it will give you good laughs and a great souvenir of your visit to Amsterdam.

nice. This is a nice tour, but dont think is a bar and you will be super drunk after it, because is not like that, they will teach you the process to produce a beer, also the correct way to serve it and drink it-

Fun and Informative. I have never been a beer drinker, but friends wanted to check out the Heineken Experience. It was very interesting as the tour walked you through how beer was made, the importance of the ingredients, and the process. It gave me a new appreciation for quality beer. The tour was entertaining and informative.

Interesting & Enjoyable Visit. Really enjoyed visiting here. It's an informative tour and you get free beer at the end. Even my wife enjoyed it and she's not really a beer person. I particularly enjoyed the ethical aspects of how the company looked after their employees and the principles on which the company was founded. I also enjoyed seeing the horses, just a shame you couldn't get closer to them.

For beer fans. Self-guided tour starts with a history of Heineken and moves to a more party-like atmosphere. Includes a free gift, a canal cruise and free beer, of course! End your tour with a complete line-up of merchandise for the beer lover at the gift shop.

Great. Very informative and the whole process of beer making is well explained. There is oppurtunity to learn the beer filling technique and get a certificate. And free beer available too. Really a great experience.

One for the beer lovers. As a beer lover there was no way I could travel to Amsterdam and not visit the Heineken experience. I did a self guided tour through the brewery and it was quite interesting and informative. The brewery walks you through the history of Heineken so you get to see all sorts of old bottles, posters, commercials, etc. Of course you can also check out all the old brewing equipment and brewing instructions. There's a few spots where you can get a free beer but there were far fewer than I would have liked! I've toured through other breweries where they serve much more free beer. All in all it was a fun time.
Nice beer. Tour professional and informative and funRecommend and has much media to involve peopleGood beer tastes later and seems better than flavour in nz

Highlight of our trip. Purchased tickets in advance, well worth it. Fun to explore with older children, got to taste the beer before the hops are added and the final product; also included with the tickets was a canal cruise ride to the Heineken store, a free gift there, and two free beers (before leaving the main attraction) The bar area for the free drinks is set up like a club, towards the end of the tour theres many hands on activities for the drunken adults and children. :) I would go again!

Now I know how to drink beer. I am not really a beer drink, maybe why the low score - I would say good but not very good. It tells you about the history of Heineken and also gives you get a chance to taste it before the hops have been added. It is also one of the attractions that opened later. In one of the rooms you are shown how to drink beer - bring the beer toward you not the other way round. I was annoyed that the free gift was in a different location and also the free boat trip to the brand store ends early so I had to walk.

The best attraction in amsterdam. I never thought the Heineken experience would be that much fun. Kudos to the company for turning this old brewery into such a good experience. I won't spoil it for the readers, it's something that whether you're young or old must do.Plus they give you some free gifts :)

free beer!. Thought this would be a quick look but ended up spending a lot more time than we planned but it was quite fun. 2 free beers in the ticket. I would say more entertaining that informative, but we had been to breweries in Scotland before this.

Have some fun and get your Heineken. Good to go there when they open 11am- it gets busier and busier later on. For 18euro ticket you get a small beer during the tour and 2 beers after. There is a variety of activities and opportunity to take fantastic photos. We really enjoyed 4d show.
Worth your buck. Fun little place to visit while in Amsterdam. It's not mind blowing but you can learn a little while drinking some fresh beer! (You get 3)

A highlight of my Amsterdam visit. I had an absolute blast at the Heineken experience! A few tips: they have extended hours on Friday and Saturday, so they close later. They accept the credit cards that swipe (American cards). I ran into a lot of places in Amsterdam that only accepted credit cards with chips. The staff is very friendly and definitely encourage a party atmosphere. We spent about 2.5 hours here and really enjoyed all the interactive exhibits. You can send a photos to family or friends via email for free. The ticket was 18 Euro, but we made the most of the experience!

Proost to this tour. Had a great couple of hours walking about this former brewery, looking at the history of Heineken and how it is made. I found the staff to be the greatest asset here, they were really friendly and happy to answer all my questions. And it doesn't hurt having the freshest Heineken in town. Definitely worth a look in if you don't knd a brew

More than just a brewery tour. Great tour, verging on a multimedia experience. Lots to see and do, as well as finding out about the history of Heineken and getting to taste the stuff. Send photos and videos to your friends, get a bottle of Heineken with a message on the label that you choose, watch videos, play games etc etc. The staff interact with the visitors with such enthisiasm and humor tghat it suggests they are enjoying themselves as much as you. As well as the free beer, there is also a free canal boat trip to the Heineken Brand store to pick up a free gift if you want (I won't tell you what it is and spoil the surprise !!)We were lucky, as there were canal closures due to the Liberation Day celebrations, the 15 minute canal trip to the brand store turned into a 45 minute party canal tour to the brand store.Don't give this a miss because you think it is just a brewery tour......it is much more.

A fun stop if you're into brews. We purchased a Holland Pass upon arrival in the Netherlands and this was one of the attractions available. It was a fun couple of hours and was a well done self-guided tour with a couple of free Heineken at the end.

A total waste of time. We went to this exhibit expecting to see a brewery. Instead they had slide show and some old equipment. It may be a good place for the younger set as there seemed to be a sort of rock club atmosphere with a free beer . At a cost of 20 dollars we felt ripped off watching their commercials and learned nothing interesting.

A lot of Fun. We spent aprox 4 hours there as the museum was so engaging. There were several interactive features through out the museum. We tried pouring beer, sitting on the Heineken bikes, sent photos to our families. Overall it was fun! The only thing I wouldn't really recommend is getting your name labeled on the bottle - its 6 Euros and looks quite cheap. Its just a sticker placed on the bottle - if you are flying with carry on only you will need to drink the beer in order to bring the bottle on board. I would recommend getting your name or message engraved in a glass located in the gift shop which cost 8 Euros for the glass, engraving and tin to stick it in. The woman engraving the glasses was wonderful. I put my name and a heart and wanted 2013 on it, she suggested putting Amsterdam 2013 at the bottom - great idea. You get two free drinks or you can pour your own and get one drink. I would recommend pouring your own - it was so much fun trying to get it right. We even got certificates at the end saying we were experts in beer pouring. It was just a good time. There are several trams that take you beside the building. I know of the 24 & 16 - the 24 goes from Centraal station, not sure about the 16. The Amsterdam Famous Market isn't far down from the Heineken Experience.

Marketing Experience more than brewery. I did enjoy my Heineken Experience but it wasn't quite what I expected. I was expecting a brewery tour with lots of beer making demonstrations and discussions about the grand history of a historical beer brand. It was more about advertising, techno-music, lounges, TV commericals, and emailing Heineken themed photos to your friends. There was even a 4-D movie where they shifted the floor and splahed you with mist. So I didn't feel any smarter walking out of the tour but as least you get 3 small beers. There is a free shuttle boat that takes you to the Heineken brand store (10 min walk) at the end of the tour where you can pick up a free bottle opener. The shuttle works both ways so if you are staying close to the brand store you can ride the shuttle boat to the brewery also. The brand store is lcoated close to the ICE bar.

Tour of the Heineken story.. You buy your tickets on line to save the €2 for each ticket (up to 19 tickets). Print out your voucher or bring your phone to show the claim number on line. No need to line up if you have printed out your ticket voucher. Receive your bracelets with button tokens to be given in exchange for beer at the end of the tour. Walk through the tour at your own pace. The history is detailed and rather interesting. There is a virtual ride where "you" become beer and are brought from the start of the brewing process to the end of the shipping. There is a gift shop and then finally the part you have been waiting for... beer drinking. I recommend drinking the extra cold (larger glass) for two tokens rather than the not-so-cold smaller glass for one token each. It is the same beer but the colder one is much nicer and the large size is really the same as the two smaller ones. You can pour yourself a beer on one side of the bar or have the staff do it on the other side of the bar. (It costs more tokens to do it yourself - we could not figure out why). Be sure to make it clear which beer you want and be sure that the staff remembers that you gave your tokens. We saw several instances where the staff pretended not to get the customers tokens or said they did not give the right number of them. Seems silly but this is what was happening. Perhaps they were hinting for (additional) money? The gift shop is extensive and any type of Heineken goods are available there. Their is one additional white token that can be use to get a small gift from the other gift shop location which is about 15 minutes walk away from the brewery location. Maybe not worth the bottle opener gift to go so far out of your way unless you really have extra time.

Best Brewery Tour Yet. We had the opportunity to visit the Heineken Brewery and it was the best one we've seen yet. We've been to Coors in Colorado and Guinness (I think that was Ireland), but this one was pretty cool. It had "activities" like putting your picture on a shirt or customizing a beer label. It also had a place to watch old Heineken commercials. Plus...you got some free beer!We didn't go get the special present available because it was at another location. After all that beer we just went across to the Hard Rock Cafe and ate.

Great experience - forget about the free boat ride. We went here on our first day in Amsterdam and had a great walk round the museum. The staff were friendly and enthusiastic about the product which added to the trip. Lots of advertising but that is to be expected on a tour of a factory. Also loads of really cool photo opportunities and activities to try on your way round, such as the virtual pour your own drink and the be a bottle 4D experience.The free boat ride you are offered to the Heineken brand store is a bit of a waste of time as both of the times we tried to get on the boat it was full. It's only a short walk, but they sell all of the merchandise in the museum so there isn't really any need to go.

Give it a try. You know that when you visit such place, you bear the risk to fall in a touristic trap. But actually, I was positively impressed by this place. It is by far not comparable to other similar places like the Guinness brewery in Dublin. But still I found my visit to be worth its money and to be instructive. Indeed, I could not reconcile with the negative comments on the poor instructive level of this place. Maybe the people should take the time to read the boards with all necessary explanations and speak with the people who are giving demonstrations. Actually, the brewing principles are relatively basic and the same for all breweries. The secret for a beer to be different from an other one is actually … a secret and resides in the mixture, type and quantity of few ingredients! The only key differentiating factor between breweries is their marketing and this concept is very well developed and explained there. Also, a lot of boards do explain how the Heineken family or the brewery is different and a.o. was innovative in the social domain in the Netherlands. The only negative point is that none of the exhibition, information boards or even the audio tour is available in french. Additionally, they also offer you a mini boat trip to reach the Heineken shop. I considered this was a plus given that you are not “obliged” to visit this shop but can enjoy a mini cruise on the canal for free. Will probably not do it anymore but it was worth the test. Finally, given the 3 beers received to taste and the mini cruise, I believe the entry fee of 18 Euros is reasonable

You gotta be hear if you like beer. Enjoy the museum style, enjoy the simualtion and theater, enjoy taking photos, enjoy beer tasting activity and drink more beer if you have the fastest answers (which is I did =) ). Enjoy the heininken bar inside. This is a great experience and you drink at least 3 x 25cl beers. Much better than spending time at a regular bar and probably at same cost.

Fun, but expensive for being subject to marketing ;-). So we had some friends over for the weekend and decided to see something really Dutch, the original Heineken brewery.First the price: 18€... wow... expensive, hope it's worth it...So you start in a renovated building, going through different rooms and floors, and discover the history of the brewery. Nice. Then you can taste the raw product.Little walk via the horses stables, then up to a tasting... a tiny glass of beer where a guy tells you how you're supposed to drink it. Amusing :-)Then you get into some amusement area, where you can learn to tap a beer, or simply order some beers (you can get one or two beers with the entrance tickets).So nice to quickly visit, have a beer, but the full marketing bashing makes me think that this experience should be either free, or merely the price of the beer.

Fun with friends (a good way to start the day). We took a tour of the Heineken Brewery around 11:00am one day last fall and we had a great time. I read a previous review of someone who was disappointed about the ride... the brewery is a brewery, not an amusement park. I thought the museum/brewery experience was amazing. Some of the videos in those lounge-y green chairs weren't working so that was a bit disappointing but I feel like they've probably been repaired by now. At the beer tasting afterwards, since it was still early in the day a bunch of other people passed on their beer buttons... so for 3 twenty-somethings on a much needed vacation, it was the perfect way to start the day.

Not worth the 18 euro entry fee. There are so many better things to do in Amsterdam then spend your time in this so called brewery. Sure, you get a couple beers but the whole "tour" is more or less a waste of time. It tries to be a museum, but isn't that interesting and they throw a whole bunch of other gimmicky time wasters at you which are basically just glorified ads for Heineken. I don't really write negative reviews, but I've done free brewery tours which offer more than this. For the record, you do get a discount if you buy your tickets in advance (which I recommend, because there can be pretty big lines).
Rather interesting. Interestig tour, lots to read and look at, interactive bits that are good as well. You get to try the beer, yummy yummy. Overall good value for the over 18s!

disappointed visit. We had a voucher in our Amsterdam Pass which is why we went. The Heineken Experience seemed like a marketing programme to me. As you went around you looked into big vats, some showing about 30 seconds worth of information film.The ride was very poor for anyone who has been to any theme park rides.The demonstration of the lager was over very quickly, mind you the lager tasted good. But in the afternoon 1 small glass was enough.The IT section was good for young people and those that wanted to send experience to friends on facebook.You were then led into a Heineken branded shop. but your free gift could only be got from another venue the other side of the city.We then went to go on the boat trip, and it was full and was the last one, the boat takes you to an area which is a 15 minutes walk to get your free gift - a bottle opener - so we were told.So unless you want to get a couple of drinks, a bottle opener, and possibly a boat ride for 18 euros don't bother with the Heineken experience.

Fun & informative. Loved this place, even though you really don't get to see the brewing process. It was a good mix of history and interactive stuff. The bracelet was a bonus which had the 2 free beer buttons on it. Too bad they're doing construction right now b/c all my outside pics of the building have scaffolding all around them. If you haven't taken a canal crusie prior to going to the Heineken Exp. maybe you don't want to pay for one, because Heineken offer their own canal ride up to the Heineken store to gather your free gift. It's the same kind of glass boat all the other tour companies use.

OHHH WOW!!!!!. I'm a great lover of visiting Breweries and distilleries but this is something else. I don't want to say anything more. Just go and experience it for yourself as it is easily the best tourist attraction in Amsterdam [and has the tourism awards on display to prove it, 2010-2011 and 2012]. Only the Guinness Storehouse in Dublin can rival this as both stand head and shoulders above all the others I've been to. Buy your tickets in advance to avoid the queues and make this the first thing you visit.

Great Tour. Really interesting tour. I wasn't overly interested beforehand but I have to say it was a lot of fun and very informative. The whole place is really well done up , you can have fun making novelty videos and pictures as well as sampling the brew. Really good way to pass an hour or two.

Nice experience. This visit tells you how the Heineken beer is prepared starting from ingredients to how it it brewed.There is a short 5D movie showing the preparation to packaging which is quite interesting.On the way you get a glass of beer to taste and you can enjoy it in the relaxing lounge with beautiful music.You can click pictures or make videos with the Heineken and mail them straightway from there.At the end of the tour you get 2 glass of beer free along with the ticket.Nice experience in short.

Beer lovers. If you're a beer lover this is the tour for you. Definitely have to go and you should go to Heineken city as well. It was a great experience. I guess those who don't like beer will still enjoy the tour.

Birthday outing. Reduced price using the I Am Amsterdam Card which was good. Good fun experience - would of been nice to have an open air walk through the stables not as we had behind the glass wall. Got my bottle of Heineken labelled with my birthday on it and then purchased the etched glass in a tin to go with it. We enjoyed the couple of included beers would of stayed for longer if we could of then purchased more. The onsite shop had good stock but the 'free' gift had to be collected from their main brand store 15 minute walk away!!!Overall good attraction - if in Amsterdam again and it was raining I would go again.

Second time there. Me and my boyfriend came here last year and loved it but we forgot our camera that day so when we came back to Amsterdam this year we thought it was a must ! The tour is very big and there is loads of cool information and little games to play. Really is worth it !

Fun whatever your age.. I dragged three somewhat reluctant friends from a tour of the Rijks Museum to a tour of Heinneken.It was not only informative,but great fun.The staff were very helpful and the active participation- well! I got a certificate in pulling pints,was actively brewed,became a detective and a DJ.I also sent free videos of us singing,a talking postcard and went on a canal cruise.Two glasses of Heinekin,included in the tour,made sure the four of us(all rather middle aged ladies) have an afternoon to remember.

Interesting, but leaves you feeling like you missed something. You get 2 small beers included in the price of admission, but you don't get them until later in the tour. You also get a short beer tasting lesson in the middle. Everything you ever wanted to know about Heineken beer and more. They even have a section to watch vintage Heineken commercials. Best to go with a group of friends.

Multimedia!. The Heineken Experience WAS an experience. I really enjoyed it. Much better than the comparable Guinness Tour in Dublin. Heineken had many hands on games and videos you could make with your friends or alone and then send to your email or friends and family for FREE! Also 2 glasses of beer at the end and one pouring taster in the middle. Great fun for all adults. I would recommend to all and bring my friends next time.

learn how to drink beer properly. well worth doing the tour,you can buy your tickets anytime and do the trip straight away.Its a self guided tour.it takes about 2 hours (depending how you drink your 2 beers at the end).photo opportunities along the way to send photo's to your own email.quick lesson on how to drink beer properly..

Really gimmicky - not a real brewery. This might be fun if you are 18-21 years old but for an older crowd it's too gimmicky. I'm a winemaker/distiller so I like to visit places and learn about their process. This is not a brewery (not sure if they even call it that so my bad for assuming it was). Very little information about the process and instead there are a bunch of games to play. Felt like an amusement park. The beer was good of course. The cost was really high though, 18 euros for entry.
lovely experiance. Best experiance ever.and the free boat tour was excellent.lot of info about surrounding places.nice boat as well.

Very interactive, a must if you have time. The museum was very detailed and interactive. There are so many different things to keep you entertained. Loved the beer tasting class, the interactive ride that explains the brewing process, the random photo ops, and the impromptu bar @ the end.
Very Gold. Diferent. Interesting. A round 1.5 horas. Taje pi turresDiferent. Interesting. A round 1.5 horas. Taje pi turresDiferent. Interesting. A round 1.5 horas. Taje pi turres

Another beer tour.... If you like beer, go... If not... Use your time to do something else. It is very organized... They do a good job getting the crowds through... But if you have been to one brewery, you have been to all breweries. The free beer at the end is a plus... If you like Heineken.

Refreshing!!. Had great visit here. Worth buying your tickets in advance or using the advantage of fast track admission with the Holland Pass as the queue was quite long. It's also cheaper that way. Interesting tour and free beer to finish!! We also took advantage of the free canal trip to their Heineken brand shop which was great.

Enjoyed the experience. We went to this despite a few recent reviews saying not worth the visit. We spent about an hour walking round finding out the history of Heineken and would recommend the attraction. You get a taster and at the end you get 2 half pints or can pour yourself 1 pint so the decision is yours. Hope you enjoy your visit.
Amazing. Very nice experience, something that you must do in amsterdam! You can have 2 beers and one souvenir and the experience 'be a beer' was funny!

Only for the Heineken fan. This tour is a basic intro to the process of making beer and a lot of advertising for the brand. Not worth the long lines unless you really want to know to know all there is about the founder and go crazy for Heineken branded merchandise in the giftstore. Heineken is proud of its mass production and mass distribution, better to support a craft brewery.
A must see for beer lovers. Actually it was my second visit but the second time i enjoyed more and took mymtime.Nice tour and the shop at the end where you can buy glasses and souvenirs.

it was a lot of fun. this is a great way to spend a rainy day in Amsterdam, the staff is very friendly and you can take your time and walk through this former brew house. It is very large and there are all sorts of interactive items such as creating a t shirt, a video and also watching the history of their creative commercials over the decades. The two samples are also a nice way to end the event and then they offer you a free canal ride to the Heineken shop which is a nice way to see Amsterdam too

Fun afternoon visit. I wasn't expecting much from this excursion but was very pleasantly surprised. We booked this through viator on a boat cruise combo. Both activities were very enjoyable. The heineken experience is well laid out with something to see for all ages. This activity is self guided with demos along the way or an audio guide can be rented. Obviously it helps to be a beer drinker but the history of the company and ties to the country highlight not only the alcohol. The exhibit is interactive and fun to look at with artwork and advertising campaigns. A wristband is given at the start of the tour allowing two beers at the end or a single 'pour your own' experience with a staff member teaching the perfect pour. All the staff we encountered were knowledgeable and very friendly. Nice work Heineken!

Fun time, even for a Beer newbie. I'm not a huge fan of beer, im a 21 year old girl not a shocker. But this was an interactive fun experience. They kept you engaged the whole time, there were fun games, free beer and in the end i learnt something, i like my beer with few hops. Oh and the hot Dutch employees was a nice touch too.

Great experience, worth visiting. Thoroughly enjoyed the tour of the old Heineken brewery, the kids enjoyed the interactive exhibits, and the wife and I enjoyed the 4 beers we drank while touring the brewery. Well worth spending a few hours there. The tour displays all of the awards the beer has won and also turns you into a beer as you watch a 3D movie about how beer is made. The whole family enjoyed the tour, highly recommended.

Very well organised.... A real treat. You get a real sense of the history and family of the business and how they operate. Fully interactive tour whith some nift features. Two pints...(which turned into 4 because the missus doesn't like beer). They offer a gift...but you have to walk to a seperate builiding 15 mins away to collect it. Ten times better than the bols museum, which is essentially a ticket for a cocktail and two shots.

Great day out. Took this trip on the advice of the receptionist at the Amstel Botel.Great few hours and money well spent, you're given a free drink on every level, have a chance to go on a 4D ride and, best of all, it's self guided meaning you can go at your own pace.There's a shop at the end of the tour meaning you can pick up some Heineken goodies to take home. Thoroughly enjoyable visit!

Great marketing for Heineken!. The tour was enjoyable, the beer tasting was fun and the interactive sections allow the young and the young at heart to make there own Heineken experience. Worthwhile, especially if it is cold or raining in Amsterdam during your visit.

Well worth an afternoon here. We had a great time ,very informative and loved the beer 18 Euro and takes about 2 hours ,could have spent all day in the bar after the tour .You get 2 beer tokens for the bar ,but you also get beer on the tour .realy was a fun afternoon ,it was pouring rain outside so was very busy but well run and would highly recommend .

brilliant afternoon out. we had a lovely afternoon down at the Heineken Experience. The tram number 16 drops you off right outside all the staff are really friendly and helpful even when its double busy. lovely you can go round it at your own pace. would highly recommend.
Entertaining. The whole experience is very diversified and entertaining. They offer us lots of different things to do along, as watching 4D presentations, brew our own beer, try the beer,...

Fun and good value for money. We really enjoyed this place, informative and fun with a couple of beers and a free canal ride thrown in at the end! All the staff were super friendly and made the whole experience memorable. Cheers!!

Fun place. Decided to take the Heineken experience whilst in Amsterdam. Bought the tickets from one of the various ticket shops through out the town. Tickets cost 16 euros and included in the price you get 3 free drinks during the tour. It's a self guided tour so you get to look round at your own pace. Also included in the price you get a free gift which you have to claim at another shop in town. You can take the free canal trip if you want but these run on the hour, every hour but you can visit the shop and time with the voucher you get. Overall a good place to visit!
Love Beer!. Great tour to take! you get 3 beers while inside and a special gift if travel to the store downtown! We got a personalized heineken bottle opener made for a very reasonable price!

In a gadda da vida. If you like to have fun, learn and drink beer, you have got to do try the Heineken Experience. I am actually writing directly from the place and I just can't get enough. At the end you get to pour your own beer and to drink it! Totally a must in Amsterdam!

Like Heineken, you'll love the experience. We had a late afternoon flight and the our hotel was only 10 minutes walk from Heineken's old brewery. Disappointed that there was not much on the brewing side. I would agree that to get a real feeling of how beer is made, you need to visit a working brewery. We had bought our tickets in advance so we didn't have to queue. You get 3 drinks within the price of the ticket. An enjoyable way to spend an hour and half. You could certainly spend more time there if you were so inclined. I enjoyed the showing of the Heineken worldwide adverts. The shop was good. We got a small glass engraved with our sons name. They really rapped it well as it was going in our hab=nd luggage.

Family tour of henequen experience, great fun and very modern with all the gadgets!. Visited with husband and 7 and 9 year old boys. €18 per adult (but kids free 8 and under). Pure marketing! But very interesting. Staff were so nice and friendly. History of Heineken, the story, original factory, lots of mod cons and gadgets, so very up to date and funky for the kids. Talks about the beer and a couple of glasses at the end in an ice type bar more than a beer bar, but kept in theme. Little 'ride' making you into beer. Then a boat trip to the shop with a tour guide. Which finished it off nicely. It is quite expensive but the beers would cost €5 for 2 in a bar somewhere. Good spy game which you can upload onto Facebook. However, disappointly mine failed to upload properly, think this was a Facebook security problem more than museum fault?!

Well worth a visit. We had previously been on a brewery tour of the Halve Maan brewery in Bruges, and very much enjoyed it, and the beer at the end!This is a completely different experience, but we enjoyed it just as much. We booked online, so we didn't have to join the ticket queues, instead simply showing our QR codes and being given our bracelets, complete with beer and gift tokens!The start of the tour is very much like many other museums - a video guide to the history of Heineken (very interesting, and well presented), followed by a series of photographic introductions to family members at various stages of the Heineken process. So far, so good, but so far, so ordinary.However, beyond this, the experience became much more interactive. The process of brewing was explained by expert staff, and you were given the opportunity to taste the brew at different stages of the process. You get to see, if not meet, some of the horses that still pull beer drays around Amsterdam, and then get to the tasting room where you are given a beer (you don't need to give up any of your beer tokens for this) and taught how to taste it, the Dutch way!Beyond this, you experience a 4D presentation where you go through the whole process of brewing - very good, and complete with movement, heat, water, etc! And then a whole tranche of fully interactive rooms - computer games, photography and video opportunities, etc, before the opportunity to give up your beer tokens in exchange for glasses of Heineken. Wonderful!The final token on your wristband gives you the opportunity to visit the Heineken Brand store, in a different part of the city. To get there, you take a 15 minute or so canal trip, free, which gives you the chance to experience the city from the canals. The store itself is much as you would expect, with the free gift, mounted on a postcard, being very fine.The tour is available, without the beer, to children, and our 12 year-old would have enjoyed it if he had been with us, but I think that is more of an adult than a family attraction.

Good but too expensive. It's entertaining but for me it wasn't worth the money, €18 per person is way too much. If you want to learn about beer, find a small brewery in the center or in the nearby village, it will be cheaper and the experience will be more authentic. If you are a Heineken fan, then you'll enjoy it. You get 3 small beers per ticket. We should get a free boat ride to the Heineken brand store where we should get a free bottle opener but there was only one boat per hour with limited capacity. If we knew this we wouldn't hurry out of the museum.

The ticket price is only worth the 2 pints you get. Don't get me wrong, the "experience" is well accomplished, but it seems more for a cool vodka brand audience than for beer drinkers... At the middle of the tour I just wanted to get it done at get my drinks. The bar is very nice, you get 2 pints of beer, free wifi, you can hang out in there for a while...After that you can go to the store, prices are all right, we bought a glass that came inside a can, great for our luggage, it didn't break.

Great way to spend the day!. My boyfriend and I really enjoyed this self guided tour! Its super interesting and really makes you enjoy heineken! We had a blast and would definately return! Worth every penny. ?18 with two drinks, a taster drink and a bottle opener! Really, you pay for the experience!

Well worth a visit. I would recommend the Heineken experience to anyone visiting Amsterdam. Lots of information about the history of the brand, interactive guides, fusbal tables, free beer... what more could you want!

Good information about the history of Heineken. My mother and I joined the tour. The tour takes us around 2 hours to complete. During the tour we are able to taste 3 cups of Heineken beer for free. It was fun and interesting, getting to know how beer is made and what is beer made from.

Must See in A-Dam. After 6 visits to A-Dam over the years I finally went to the Heineken Experience. Should have went sooner! Great tour, everything is in English, ver informative, the staff were awesome, and there was even a little "interactive ride" towards the end of the tour. The 2 free beers were nice also! a MUST SEE in A-Dam. Also, we had a 7yr old with us that actually enjoyed this tour too!

we had fun. An enjoyable experience, topped off with plenty of beer tasting, whats not to like!You can even buy a bottle of Heineken with your own custom message printed on the bottle. 18euros each for entry, not too expensive and a good way to spend an hour or two.
Very expensive for what you see. I expected to see something more, when I paid 16 Euros. If you travel on budget do not waste your money here. They do not present anything you can't find online.

Fantastic tour with lots to do and see!. The tour takes around 2 hours to complete and is very interactive. You get to taste the beer at different stages and find out about the history of the beer and the Hieneken family in the process. For football fans there is a UEFA Champions League section with memorabilia and a few games to play. You get 2 free beers at the end of the tour and a free gift when you visit the brand store at the Rembrantplein. There is a shuttle boat which can take you there for free although I walked as it was a nice day! Overall a fantastic way to spend a couple of hours!

Fun tour for everyone. My friend and I decided to tour the Heineken Experience on the advice of friends, despite the fact that we're not big beer fans. The location is easy to find, and tours are self-lead, so you can spend as little (or as much!) time as you like exploring and learning. Heineken has made a fun experience for everyone, with a "ride," interactive exhibits, and speakers who explain the brewing process for those unfamiliar with how their favorite beer is made. The large copper kettles and a peek at some of the brewery's horses make for fun photo opportunities, as well. A tasting and a later opportunity to draught your own beer at the bar create opportunities to enjoy a brew with your friends,

Fun, but get there early to avoid the crowd. The Experience was educational and fun, especially fun with the free drinks at the end of the tour. We got a kick out of getting the "smiling E" bottle opener. Make sure you get there early enough to avoid the crowd. Anytime before 1pm should be ok, but definitely not after 1pm.
Good shop, not great experience. I have done the Guinness Tour which I think Aswan better, the queues here were way too long, life's too short to wait 29 minutes when you could be in a nice bar....

Certainly the better of my brewery tours !. Just a short and sweet review, its worth a visit if you have free time in Amsterdam ! You get a few free small beers too which is the important thing as an irishman !

a nice place to while away a couple of hours when it is cold outside ..... Not being much of a beer drinker I went into the Heineken Experience with not many expectations. Apart from some exhibits you can walk through the old distillerie (not a woking one anymore), see some of the Heineken Horses and learn about the Heineken brewing process as well as taste the beer. In the pretty steep entrance fee of 18 Euro you have 3 beers included, so with Amsterdam prices, that isn't a bad deal really. The giftshop is pretty good and has some original products. You can also name your own beer and get a personalised beer bottle. All in all, not a bad few hours.

Heineken Experience Fun But Lacking Real Beer Lover Experience. The Heineken Experience is a pleasant attraction that is fun, however it lacks the type of information and awe you get from a winery tour. I know beer and winemaking are different, but when I visit Italy, a good wine tour beats this experience 10x. The building is a mix between a souvenir shop, walk through museum, and a bar. It is primarily a self-paced museum with multi-media kiosks, visual displays, and some hands-on fun. You don't get to see beer being made, however there are some video clips that simulate the process. In the end, you get the feeling that it is just an excuse to sell Heineken novelty items. Each person gets two small beers included in the admission price. My 16 yr old son enjoyed the tour but for me it was just an expensive show and tell tourist trap.

VERY fun!!. It's a beer tour! I am not a beer drinker! But my husband really wanted to go!! I had a great time!! And he got my free beer! So his time was extra special. It's short and to the point, not at all dragged out. At the end you can go sit in their Heineken bar, where, yes, they only serve the beer. No big deal, as there are many places to go afterward to get what I like to drink. Had so much fun we actually went 2 years in a row!
Worth a visit. The Heineken experience was very interactive making the overall experience fun as well as being informative.

WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY. Together with 4 friends from South Africa, we visited on 31 March 2013. These were the highlights:1. Standing in queue for 50mins to get tickets @ EUR18 per person2. Once inside, we were met by mass of people stuck in a hall, no way of turning back and forced to wait another 60mins, all while there were NO update on what is going on. Once through the bottleneck you are once again met by yet another waiting period of 20mins to see a movie, but have the option to skip and move on.!3. Needless to say, we skipped the movie, only to be met by another stampede of people trying to grap a small glass of beer, no way of even hearing a presentation about beer tapping.4. Moving on just to get of of the place you have option to take picture and videos of yourself, but actually receiving these by email would be a miracle5. Cant remember much after that as all we wanted to do was to get out of the place. 6. Once in the giftshop, we wanted to exchange our white token for the free gift that is offered when you buy your ticket, only to find out you have to walk another 15minutes to fetch it!!! What a joke!!!7. Does Heineken actually think they promote their brand by this?? I dont think so.Even if the excuse was that is was their busyiest day in the year, why then allow so many people into the "attraction" At EUR18 per person it was a total waste for us which not only left us EUR108 poorer but also robbed us of 3,5 hours that we could have spend in Amsterdam :(

could have been better. I left feeling a bit underwhelmed, don't get me wrong it was an enjoyable experience but i felt it could have been better. It was a well put together attraction and the 2 beers are always going to be good. There is also a free canal boat trip at the end (if you can get on it)

Best of the European Brewery Tours!. Let me say that I've been on the Guinness tour in Dublin and the Jameson tour there, too and this is much better. You are guided along the way (people at the various stations) but it isn't a "guided" tour where you have to stay with a group. They have some fun photo cutouts for photo ops, some fun multimedia things were you can take a photo/video and send then to your friends via email, and of course the obligatory beer lessons and tastings. They have a need attraction/video where "you are the beer." Very well done. Nothing is overly crowded and it moves pretty quickly. You get an understanding of what a large worldwide brand Heineken is and all the things they support (sports, of course - but also environmental issues and sustainability.) This was my second time doing thins experience within the past year (different set of family members this time) and we took advantage of the canal boat to the other Heineken Experience/gift shop. At first you feel like you're being taken advantage of when they offer you a "free gift" at the other shop. But then you hear about the canal boat that leaves on the hour and gives a nice 15 minute boat ride - and yes they sell great tasting, perfectly cold Heineken on the ride. The free gift was substantial (a nice bottle opener in the shape of the smiling E) and the commentary was interesting. In fact, it was during the canal ride that we learned from the announcer that the Van Gogh museum was closed for renovations, but that a substantial number of pieces were moved to the nearby Hermitage museum so we were able to adjust our plans accordingly and see them while we were in the area. Really turned out to be a time saver as we would have spent the time we were in the museum seeing VG paintings just getting to the original museum which I mentioned was closed for renovation.We were even able to take the same canal boat back to the Experience which is a short walk from the IAMSTERDAM sign. It left on the :15 or so. Gift shop in both locations was good and staff there helpful.

Nt bad, not great. The experience was slow at first and quite crowded. I've toured many breweries in the past so this was a little lackluster however I ended up enjoying it. I wouldn't o it again but it was nice to do it once.
Amazing. The Heineken Experience proved to be an excellent value for money where you can see how Heineken is made, a short 4D show together with three glasses of Heineken.Well Done.
good and bad. first part of tour was good all about the history of beer making then it flet as is we were in a club! loud noisy and every opportunity to encourage you to spend more euros
An everlasting memory. the Heineken experience is very well organised and the interactive experiences made it more fun. Definitely enjoyed the beer and the atmosphere. Proost!!!!

Excellent Experience!. You get quite a lot for your money at the Heineken experience. It isn't a guided tour, but this means you can wander the exhibition at your own pace. The 'experience' video is amusing, and a tasting sessions follows on from this, plus you get two free half pints in the bar at the end plus a free gift (which you have to go to a different shop near rembrandtplein to collect). Overall very satisfied with the experience. It also smells amazing!
Had a blast!. Certainly stop by the Heineken tour if you're in Amsterdam. Very well put together and interactive. My friends had a great time here! Beer, fun and a boat ride!

A must visit in Amsterdam. Having booked our queue jump tickets through the hotel saving a couple of Euro we headed off on our visit. Easy to get to by tram. Really interesting, good fun and up to 3 free glasses of Heineken too. You can spend a lot on the extras but don't need to in order to enjoy yourself. Lots of restaurants in the square behind it too to soak up the alcohol!
Interesting and free beer!!. Interesting tour learning about the history of the company and how the beer is actually made, and you get two free pints at the end.

Amazing! Had a great time!. It was a really fun experience. We went there at noon, there was no queue. The museum is pretty and has many attractions and stuff to do. We spent there something like three hours. Highly recommended for groups of friends even if you aren't a beer lover.

Interactive and fun. The Heineken Experience is worth a visit whilst in Amsterdam. It's a self-guided tour which displays the history of the Heineken Brewery with more interactive displays as the tour progresses.The best bits of the tour are the interactive areas: i.e. singing "Tulips from Amsterdam" down the lens of a video then projected into a Amsterdam canal boat or having your photo taken whilst cycling down the Amstel river! Not forgetting the three free beers, of course!
Great place to visit.. We enjoyed our trip here, a bit pricey, but you get a free beer at the end. Allow 1.5 hours if you are really interested in the history.

Absolutely brilliant!. I really enjoyed myself here, it is really informative and interesting and well worth the admission money! You get a half pint size glass of freshly brewed Heineken at the tasting station (were a member of staff explains how the Dutch drink beer and how a beer should be drunk, the purpose of the head etc. and at the end of the experience you get either two small glasses of regular Heineken or you can get one small glass along with a certificate documenting you know how to pour a Heineken. I decided to be taught how to properly pour a Heineken and my partner chose the two glasses of Heineken, we also bought a ‘label your own Heineken’ as it was my partners birthday that day and we thought it would be a nice momento (it was only 6 euros and a lovely souvenir) we also got a free boat ride, on which a tour guide gave us a tour of the canals, to the gift shop. All in all a brilliant experience and would recommend it to anyone.

I love it. I went there with my boyfriend yesterday and it was so much fun! Despite drinking a lot of free beer, you get to see the process in which heineken beer is made. It was fun and worth every penny i paid! I also bought a customised beer bottle with our names engraved on it!

Heineken Experience. Fun and hands on day out. Learn all aspects of the brewery process first hand, plus you get the benefit of tasting the finished product at the end. Only problem is that it was very busy and we had to queue approx 30-40 minutes to get in. Well worth the wait though.

Well.... If you already know how the beer brew proccess works, Heineken Experience won't teach you anything new. The informations and history of the brand are easily findable in the internet without needing to pay 18? of entrance fee, what I found abusive. Ok, the prize includes two "free" beers and a motion attraction which is funny but short and not that much exciting as a roll coaster. In resume, it's a money machine... and I'm still waiting for the "experience"

Interactive brewery tour. The Heineken experience is an interactive brewery tour, history lesson on their brand and you get three drinks during the tour (all Heineken of course). It takes you through the early history, how the beer is made and shows you the old kettles and allows you to see the ingredients at different stages (classic brewery tour) and then takes you through some interactive aspects such as superimposing your pictures on various Heineken backgrounds, the coolest being a couple bikes with a canal background and allows you to email the, out for free, print them for €5 or buy a tshirt for €20. You can also see the Clydesdale horses although disappointingly, you can not get too close as there is a glass wall separating you from the seemingly open stable area. You get your first glass while you learn the proper way to enjoy it and two glasses in a setup resembling a nightclub setting at the end. They do have this cool interactive "ride", in which you stay stationary but the room and the floor moves back and forth as well as heat lamps and some light water spray simulate what it is like to be brewed, bottled and packaged as a Heineken beer. It was an interesting tour and I enjoyed it. Being from Dublin, I may be biased toward the Guinness tour but it was certainly enjoyable and the interactive components were certainly a nice touch.

Great experience. As a home brewer and beer lover, I jump at the chance for any brewery experience. Heineken has put together a fun and informative experience given the volume of people it has to accomodate. They do a good job of mixing fun and learning through the tour - you can learn the basics to the brewing process as well as touch, smell, and taste raw ingredients. The ability to taste the wort was a nice touch. On the beer drinking side, you get a small sample (probably 6 oz) at the tasting station - where an employee walks you through how to taste a Heineken (or any beer) and at the end of the experience you get either two 25 cL glasses of regular Heineken, one 35 cL of extra cold Heineken, or you can get one 25 cL along with a certificate documenting you know how to pour a Heineken.My wife and I bought one of the label your own Heineken bottles - you have the opportunity to put you name (or whatever you like) on a label which you collect down in the gift shop. We were surprised it was only 6 euro (March 2013) - obiviously pricey for a bottle of beer, but worth it for the novelty and souvenir.

Good fun!. Was a good day out :) bit expensive but was great to sit down for a few beers at the end and meet other people. Note to the heineken workers: watch out for all the people stealing glasses, merch etc !!

Yeah average really!. As mentioned already I thought we were going to see an actual brewery. It is expensive in my opinion probably not worth €18 but it was a good enough attraction & you kinda have to do it when in Amsterdam dont you? TOP TIP- Pre-book your tickets. We didnt & had to que for over an hour!!! Wont be doing that again!!!

was it worth the cue and the price - just barely. Spending Easter in Amsterdam we knew there would be a lot of people around and we did face long cues in most interesting museums and other attractions. The only long cue we decided to join was the Heineken Experience. Was it worth cueing for almost an hour and was it worth the almost 80 euros for our family of four. To be honest not really.It is hard to figure out the target audience for this "experience". There is nothing all that interesting for kids so they can't be the target audience. True beer lovers would probably want to know more about beer making and its history than what is shown and if you want to have three small glasses of Heineken you might as well enjoy them in one of the numerous pubs in Amsterdam. So if beer lovers are their target audience they're not doing very well.My overall rating is however as high as it is due to fact that our 20 and 18 year olds seemed to enjoy it - and didn't mind the price as they didn't have to pay ;) They did however agree on the fact that the 4-D experience was more of a joke than anything else. It didn't really tell you anything about beer making and as a 4-D experience the only thing that made it amusing was the fact that it was well below any similiar thing we've experienced.The next time I'll experience a Heineken experience is in a pub - because as a beer Heineken is OK.

Great value for money!. Would advise to book in a tours and tickets shop as you get 2€ discount! :) It is great value for money, you receive lots of information about how the conpany was founded and the advertisements. There is a tour of the factory, including seeing the old cart horses, an option to taste the different ingredients, a chance to grind your own ingredients, a simulation ride, 2 free beers and plenty more!!!! At the end you can take the free canal back towards town where the heineken shop is based. However be warned this leaves every oclock and does get busy!! So be there early! :)

'Dam good fun!. This is a great way to spend a long afternoon. A good mix of information, interactivity, photo ops, and old brewery artifacts as well as themed Bond areas, a mid tour beer tasting, a standing 3D experience and a plethora of games and challenges to pass the time. The brewery shop is over priced and the gift store is quite a walk away (20 minutes) but for your money, you get a free coat check, you certainly get entertained, and you get a free pint at the end for your efforts! Cheers.
ok but expensive. well organized and good experience, also if 18 euros are expensive for such attraction. Included a trip on boat.

Pay extortionate prices to be heavily advertised to and learn nothing!. I was thoroughly disappointed upon visiting the Heineken experience. Firstly I was under the impression upon entry that I would be visiting a working brewery - this is not the case. What this tour really is about is to pound the Heineken brand into you so hard that you walk away smiling and wanting another drink. There was nothing educational about this visit and I learnt nothing new about the brewing process (despite asking one of the individuals working there about it - he seemed to know less than I did) - Nor were you invited to learn anything about the bottling process (apart from a cheap diorama which gives you the opportunity to pay another 6 euros to get your name printed on a bottle) - apparently the brewery got moved 200km out of town around 50 years ago and therefore the actualy brewery is now just a tourist attraction where they constantly try to brain wash the hell out of you. One of the most eerie bits of the tour is just a room with maybe 10 pod like chairs which when sitting in you can watch all the latest up-to-date ADVERTS for Heineken (see photos). It was like some dystopian bullet-to-the-head brainwashing centre with no educational value but to "educate you that Heineken is the brand to buy" - If I have to spend time watching adverts, I expect to be compensated for it, not to pay 18 euros myself to go through a dreadful experience like that. I went to the Heineken Experience because I used to think Heineken was a decent lager (in fact it was my favourite lager as a youngster, i don't really drink it much anymore) - I came away feeling very betrayed and out of pocket - It is the kind of attraction that should be free since than pay for the '2 free beers' you get at the end (250ml - not even half a pint) simply by advertising to you so heavily (and at times subliminally) throughout. To put the nail in the coffin, to receieve the free key chain they promise you at the start of the tour, you cannot simply pick it up in the overpriced gift shop on the way out. Oh no. You have to walk 20 minutes into town to get to the 'Brand Shop' (or wait to the next hour, it was only quarter past the our when I left) to catch the boat (which is probably a 2 minute ride, with another 5 minutes walk).Shame on you Heineken - Unfotunately I will not be buying another beer from your company again after that charade. Very very disappointed and I feel very cheated
Great experience. Interesting to see how the company started and how they brew beer! Lots of interactive things to do as you go around. Def a good thing to do whilst in the city.
Great Experience. Great experience very informative and great fun, very busy when we went but we had pre booked tickets which i would highly recommend. a tasting and 2 free halts at the end!

Brilliant day out. lots of brilliant erchandise, and interesting with lots to do, a canal boat tour with a lovely guide and free beer! Contributed heavily on making the last day we had at Amsterdam the best day.

Real value for money. This attraction just kept giving!
