Make sure you buy your ticket before going as queues were long, although we were there over the Easter weekend, by buying them in advance we were able to walk straight in.It was a very busy afternoon but they kept you occupied, the bottle experience was fun and interactive and you get 2 free beers at the end - u really can taste how fresh it is! You also get a free e bottle opener and boat ride to the souvenir store from opposite the brewery when you've completed your tour.Boats leave on the hour and are only once per hour so best to get there at least 15mins before departure as it gets very busy.

Very commercial - Nothing special. It is more a waste of time. Good to go if you really have to waste 1-2 hours and you've been in Amsterdam for too long..Very, very marketing-oriented tour.. I was expecting to see more history or more beer making process, but ended up going through a whole gadget-oriented visit, with all kinds of commercial games and enterntainment..Don't expect anything special..Only good thing is to go there with some friends to drink 2 beers when you really walked for long time..

Heineken marketing tool. As with other reviewers I think this just a big marketing ploy, the only interesting bit was the reason for having so much froth on the top of the beer. It would be much more interesting if one of the mash tuns was still working. You have a 20 minute walk to get your free gift.

Very nice Visit !!. We visited Heineken museum during a boys weekend and really loved it !!The visit is really well organized and the different videos are awesome! Of course, at the end of the visit you get a nice tasting session :-)

This is one of my favorite breweries to tour. Heineken is a pride in the Netherlands and this brewery experience does it justice. The tour is a little expensive but it is worth the money. I have not been to another brewery who showcases their history, their beer, their beer making experience and their impact on the world in just a fun way. Plus you get to enjoy beer with your experience! I've been to this museum a few times and always enjoy it.

Waste of time. In our experience, going through the Heineken experience was a waste of time. Overpriced eventhough offering 2 glasses of beer. Focused on the commercial and playful aspect instead of focusing on the mechanism of beer production. Information provided could be easily googled - nothing additional/interesting shared during the tour. Guiness tour (located in Dublin) is far better for aprox the same price.

The Admission is basically the cost of the beers.... I am not sure what I was expecting when I went here, but it was not all that I had maybe hoped for. We walked through the museum, saw the place where the beer is made, looked/ tasted the ingredients of the beer, participated in the interactive part of the museum, learned how to actually drink a beer (haha but at least you got a free beer here), and then we got two more free beers and a free beer opener. We also got to go on the Heineken boat on the canal, which dropped us off by where the other Heineken store is in the city. It was a little expensive but then again, I feel like the beers and the gift were almost equal to the cost of the admission.

Self guided? For 18 euros?. Our first disappointment came when told that the tour was self guided. As you go through the first section there is a 'virtual bar' with film of a barman giving you a potted history of heineken. So far so good. Don't pass the chance of a photo opportunity just beyond that. Once up the stairs you go through various rooms with photos and facts on the wall that largely repeat what the virtual barman has already told you. A rinse and repeat moment for slow visual learners. Then a real life person stands behind a bar and gets you to smell a bowl of barley and asks you what colour the heineken beer is. Hmmm so far so elementary school. By the way, heineken is GOLD because gold is for winners, not yellow because yellow is the colour of, you know what!Next up you get to see lots of impressive copper stills/mash thingies, some of which have black and white movies playing on the inside wall. A guy was standing about giving mini samples and tidbits of info if approached, but there was very little human engagement until the proper tasting sessions. This was I suppose the one brief highlight in the whole experience, and the chap doing the talk gave us all a bit of a giggle when explaining why it is that a glass of beer served in holland has so much froth on top.Onwards we marched into the next room which was a dark chill-out lounge where slick adverts for heineken were played on the walls. Thrilling stuff. Next came the virtual ride; rather a lame affair based on a movie where you 'become the beer', though the staff leading us on to the platform mustered plenty of enthusiasm for what we were about to experience. If you've ever been to a theme park it ain't gonna impress you one bit.There were a few video-game-like distractions between the ride and the final two glasses of heineken, but I didn't fancy waiting in line at this point, albeit they looked like a bit of fun, especially if you are with a group of pals. Off for the two drinks we headed (included in price of ticket). After walking around for an hour you'd think there would be enough places for everyone to have a sit down at this point, but we were unlucky. Two heinekens were drunk standing up. At 18 euros per person entry fee you'd think they could afford more than a handful of chairs. This confirmed my thoughts that people with mobility issues would not fare well here.If by chance you finish your tour near the top of the hour, and the queues arent too long, then your ticket will also get you a boat ride from the heineken experience along the canal to their brand shop where you can spend more money and get a complimentary gift (wee bottle opener). We missed the boat.To be fair, there were younger people who enjoyed the tour. I've enjoyed a number of thoroughly entertaining guided tours of scottish whisky distilleries which were either free, or just a nominal charge. The heineken experience by comparison was a bit of a damp squib, but if you're new to this kind of thing maybe you'll like it. I regretted that I didn't just spend that 18 euros in one of amsterdams fabulous ale houses on something a lot tastier than heineken! I've heard that the House of Bols Cocktail experience is a lot more fun so thats where I'm going next time. Different strokes for different folks.Any tour is only as good as its guide. As it was a self-guided tour I only have myself to blame for the yawntastic heineken experience. I did a truly dreadful job and I won't be giving myself a tip or a recommendation!Don't let me put you off. I'm sure you would do a far better guiding job;)

A big advert for the Heineken family. It is quite expensive to access and the tour was quite short and did not teach you very much about the manufacturing process. Most of the exhibits simply tell visitors how altruistic the Heineken family are.The "ride" is a waste of time and I would suggest giving it a miss if there is a queue.The tastings were good and those providing tasting tips were very enthusiastic: it turns out that a large head on a pint of lager isn't an attempt to short change customers, but a way of preserving the delicate flavour of the Heineken!Worth a visit on a Monday when the other attractions are mostly shut.

Worth the visit. Tickets are a tad expensive on the door but there are cheaper tickets available from the tourist stores in the city centre. We paid 15€ instead of 18€ this way. It is a good interactive experience with 2 free beer tokens and a 3rd glass of beer when you do the tasting section. Staff are very friendly and engaging. Interesting visit and one we would recommend.

So much to see, surprisingly!. Didn't expect much but was pleasantly surprised. I'm not a fan of Heineken and I'm not a fan of beer either but I enjoyed this very much! It was very interesting to see how they make it and it's surprising to see that they made so many different, creative and interactive spaces for the visitors. Something different!

BEST MUSEUM EVER. Very interactive museum with lots to do, so well worth the entry fee you pay. You get plenty of free beer and chill in the different bars. You get to sing all in Dutch and film your own music video. There is beer making simulator which is good fun. Afterwards you can get a free boat trip to the merchandise store!

Nice experience, but a little bit expensive. You can see all the process to make the heineken beer in a cool way. It definently worth going there, but the price was a little bit expensive. Also you get only 2 small glasses of beer.

Very Enjoyable. Found this to be fun and enjoyable,Tour guides where all professional and we both learned alot about beer and how it is created, And of course the free sample at the end give it a plus.When booking,book online before you go,There was a long que when we arrived but we were able to skip it as we had already paid.

good for the beer lover. is a good place to go for the beer lover although you dont get much beer during the self guided tour but do get to see the history of heineken and how its made also get to feel what its like to be bottled like a beer.  has some good interactive games towards the end of the tour such as teaching you to pour the perfect pint of heineken.

Interactive Fun Day Out!. The Heineken Experience was relatively easy to find. It was very handy to leave our coats in the cloakroom and our tour started with an funny movie presentation on the wall.Then you follow through the tour from there at your own pace. It is a great day out, it is full of interactive areas such as trying to pull a perfect pint, experiencing what it is like to be the beer through the assembly line, making cheesy videos and of course sampling the beer itself. On the canal trip afterwards to the Heineken experience shop in the city centre, the tour guide on the boat was such a good laugh, he gave us a lot of history of the city and the canals and we got a bottle of Heineken for €2.50 each, in a special aluminium bottle which we could bring home with us. The staff are all really friendly. The whole atmosphere is fun and relaxed. The shop at the end is very good too, merchandise was not too expensive compared to similar places we have been, and getting two beer pitchers engraved with our names and a bottle of beer with our own personalised label was a perfect way to remember our experience. We spent about 3 hours there, and we returned later in the day to avail of the free canal ride to the shop in the city. I would highly recommend doing the canal trip especially if you haven’t availed of any of the other canal trips in the city. We found the ticket price to be excellent value.

Fun Afternoon. This was a fun afternoon, and really nice to get inside away from the cold winds for awhile. Really liked that they have a coat check at the door! We purchased our tickets online so had no wait to buy tickets. You get three small beers on the tour, so that was nice!

All round good experience. There were many elements to this experience which added up to good value for money. Firstly there was the history of Heineken, then a moving ride followed by a brief tuition on how to appreciate drinking the beer. Then came some IT gimmics. followed by the opportunity to sample a couple of freshly brewed glasses of beer.The tour ended with a boat trip with some interesting facts from a tour guide, back to central Amsterdam.

A place for fun and beer. Had very low expectations for what I thought would be just another brewery tour. This is not just a chance to see beer made. You are immersed in the Heineken impact upon Amsterdam, from major brewer, to the effect this had upon the surrounding population. There are many high-tech attractions and games, and you get to end your tour with two glasses of beer. Time well spent.
worth the visit. worth going here, splendid tour, find history, fun and adventure here, plus a beer or two, most enjoyable up to date present day tour, not just a museum

Good value for money, a bit of fun with a few beers. Lots of fun interactive displays and good value. The history of the place is also quite interesting. Admission price gets you 3 beers so not bad. We happened to arrive at 10:45am and opening time is 11am so were first through the door, and as we had pre-bought our tour tickets on-line, we were first on the tour. I'd definitely recommend pre-purchase of the tickets.

Fun Attraction. Visited here in March and spent an afternoon in here. The tour starts with history of Heinkein, followed by a walk through the brewing process(seeing the vats where the lager was first brewed). Then you are shown the Horses that pull the old fashioned Drays through Amsterdam follwed by a 3D experenice of how the lager is brewed. Then you have a taste of Heineken and then you go through various interaction areas. Then you end the tour with a lesson in pouring the perfect Heineken which you finish with a certificate. There is a shop there to purchase Heineken related merchanise. You also get a free gift of a Heineken bottle opener if you go on the half hour canal trip to the other Heinken Shop(this is free).This experience caters for all people even if you do not like lager because there are many things to learn and take part in.

Must-see while in Amsterdam!. I loved the way a tour is organized - they do it perfect! Starting from an intro-video, following with the ingredients tasting, movie watching (that one was amazing!) and entertainig!! You can even bottle a customized Heineken for you! A couple of beers to drink at their bar is also included in the ticket price!

If you like beer and your exploring Amsterdam I would definitely recommend. Was a good tour, lasts for around an hour and a half, the first part gives you the history and origin of Heineken Beer and also information on how it is made. They have a simulator ride there which is ok, and then you are able to pour your own beer (and drink it obviously). You actually get a few drinks during the tour and all for 15 euros which I paid for at a ticket office in Amsterdam Cantraal, it's a few euros more if you buy on the door and you have to queue which looked like it could take a while especially on the weekend. I would certainly recommend visiting this if you are exploring Amsterdam. Tram number 16 or 24 will get you to the Heineken brewery from Amsterdam Centraal

Be careful to not fall into the river. The Heineken Experience delivers exactly what it promises: a journey through the Heineken history and how they prepare their beer. They really thought of every aspects of the beer when designed the place: we can see old TV commercials, we can taste the beer ingredients, we can even see how the beer is prepared inside a simulator.The ticket guarantees two beers, a gift from the Heineken store not so far from there, and also the trip boat, from the Experience building to the store. I learned a lot about the beer process and had fun there.
interesting and fun. very good tour around the old brewery and finishes off with beer tasting in a clubbish like atmosphere :) loved it

Better than expected. Having been to the Guinness brewery in Dublin hopes werent as high, but you can say that if Guinness appeals to "the older daily pubgoing man" then Heineken appeals to a "younger beer enjoying (potentially to a large extent) crowd". Anywho, the walking tour was good and informative (and not too long). The 4D experience was good fun and with a cool tasting after (Note: Drink beer in LARGE sips to avoid just getting the foam; the "non beer drinkers" had an a-ha moment there) and good fun to see what Heineken has to offer besides just brewing (soccer etc.)Two free small beers in their own "bar" where the line seemed to always be present but when in it they quickly got the beers out so you didnt have to wait for long.Reasonably priced memorabilia and a free gift card if you were to go the the downtown Heineken gift shop (or whatever it was called).Book tickets online to save a few euros.For asthmatics and people allergic to horses; you will at one point have a short walk which goes alongside the "stable" with view of the horses, so make sure you bring whatever medicine needed. Although this is a very short time and shouldnt prevent you from going! :)

Fun way to spend an afternoon. Running out of things to do in Amsterdam, a friend recommended me to do the Heineken experience. It was awesome! 18 euro...you get to try beer that is not older than 3 days...you can taste the difference. Plus, you get 2 more beers included as well as a "free" bottle opener.the experience is quite interactive and it was fun. After doing everything inside took the boat that's included in the price that takes you to the brand shop where you get your free bottle opener. Good way to make the time go quick whilst having fun!
Fun. We had a great time here. All presented well and the staff were extremely friendly and a lot of fun. I think most people had more than the advertised two free drinks.

Lots of fun lots of beer and lovely boat ride!. I think this is a great place to go for an afternoon, the tour is great and the heineken boat at the end is a nice touch. Make sure you ask what time the boat leaves,althiygh inclyded in the price it runs every hour...A lovely touch though

great fun. we went to the heineken experience as a last minute decision so only had just over an hour, which was enough time, however, we could have spent much longer there! it was great fun and i would reccomend going to this! we went on the mini canal cruise to their retail shop by rembrantsplein afterwards, which was a great extra at no extra cost! just get there early so your not turned away, which many people were!

Time to enjoy the sites and a beer all in one.... We came across this in the centre of Amsterdam and fancied the chance to catch a beer. Well this was most interesting. The story of how the beer was brewed was interesting a I would recommend this to any beer-lovers. Oh and the free beers (included in the ticket price) are very tasty.

Enjoy the freshly brewed Beer... It is fun going through the brewery and see making of the beer right from the start to the end. It also includes a 4D show of the beer making experience (pregnant ladies not allowed).. You also get a chance to have a customised Heinken beer bottle with your name printed on it. Lots of merchandise to buy.

Lots to see and do. I don't particularly like beer, but I managed to drink it during this tour. There is lots to do here and is worth the admission fee. Amsterdam are excellent at museums and I found I wasn't bored at any point. I am not a big museum fan, but Amsterdam museums are very well set out with lots of hands on activities and not too much information to read, but you still feel like you learn everything they're trying to teach you.

History & Beer. Although reluctant, I bought advance tickets to the Heineken Experience prior to our Amsterdam adventure. Wow, was I surprised. As it turned out the brewery tour was fun, informational, and best off all included FREE Beer. What could be better? Go ahead and buy advance tickets on the Heineken Experience website and skip the long ticket line. The tickets are good for a year so you don't have to book a specific date. This is a very interactive tour and you can even take a ride in your beer (no kidding). Plan on spending at least an hour if not longer to get the most out of it. The ticket also includes a free short canal boat ride to the Heineken brand store where you get a free bottle opener. This is a very nice easy going break-a-way from all the other tourists sites in Amsterdam. Have a beer and enjoy.

Brilliant way to spend an afternoon!!. My husband and I visited here - his choice - I wasn't overly fussed if I'm honest but how wrong was I!!!We had a fantastic afternoon here and it was a great way to find out about Heineken!You get 2 free drinks and a bottle opener but you have to take the river cruise to get the bottle opener. Great way to end the experience and the beer was cheap on the cruise!! The bottle opener was worth getting!! Would def visit again!

Heineken Brewery. This place is a lot of fun! Especially if you like beer. There's a self guided tour, a virtual ride, beer tasting (the best part). You can even get a personalizes bottle of Heineken to take home. Well worth the price (which was pretty cheap).

Exellent fun interactive experience, well worth a visit!. My friend and I came straight to the Heineken Experience after we landed and checked in to our hotel, as it had been recommended. It was fantastic and so much fun! Probably the best thing we did in Amsterdam! A great inter active experience with lots of things to do and learn in a fun way. Would highly recommend to others. We hardly had to queue at all, fab gift shop.

More than a beer!. Its an awesome experience. Informative and fun. You get to see the journey of barley seed from farm to the ready product to drink. Lots to experience, so allocate at least 4 hours for this trip. You will be given 2 glasses of Heineken beer while on this trip so better not go empty stomach!

Great afternoon out. Me and my partner went here on a recent trip to Amsterdam and was thoroughly impressed. The staff were really helpful and in great spirits, the staff that were responsible for 'activities' or talks within the experience were excellent and really made the experience.The experience itself was a mixture of informative and fun, would highly recommend to anyone who is in Amsterdam looking for something to do.

Nice place if you have time. It is interesting to know about the history of beer made by this very old beer brewery. But the queues are long and you have to wait outside the building in the cold without any shelter and face the weather and the cold wind. Still people wait to have this heineken experience.

Well worth a visit. I didnt expect it to be as goog as it was but it really was fun.Defitately woth a visit .When we went to the Guiness experience in Dublin we were disappointed as it wasnt any where near as good.

One of the best attractions in the city. Unforgettable experience!It is an interactive way to understand all the history about this famous beer. The different activities that we make during the visit and also the videos which ones we can send by email for free is also a good idea to remember such a special moment. In the website we can have a small idea about it.For sure that it is one of the best places to visit in the city. I truly recommend.At the end we can drink two beers and then we can pick up our gift at the store.In short, the best way to realise what is heineken experience is visiting it.

Best 20 bucks for 2 spent on a interactive tour ever. If you have been on a beer plant tour before it starts out the same as any other. First is the history of Heineken with some video, props, and pictures. Then a photo op in a cut out. Up the stairs into the plant area to see the vats and how Heineken is made. You get to taste the hops or something that goes into the beer process. Have your camera ready, good faces after people taste the juice. Out the back to the stables to see the horses then up the escalator. You enter an area and get more info on the making of Heineken from a young man and you can ask questions. You then get into a Q for the ride part of the tour. The best way to describe it is like several rows that you stand in and a movie screen in front and they make you part of the process of making a Heineken from start to finish. You have a guide in the screen and he goes through the process. Its fun. Then you get to make your own bottle. I couldn't get it to work in English. If you can't get it to work don't worry they will make you one in the gift shop. Its a real cool gift and its like 5 bucks. Made one for my nephew he almost cried when he saw his name on a bottle of Heineken. Off to the tasting room where they explain how to properly drink a Heineken. Yes there is a proper way to drink Heineken especially for the ladies. They get into everything from the bubbles and the foam and you get to drink some Heineken what's not to like. You then enter the interactive play area, more photo ops with props and the pictures are sent to your email and you can share (free). All kinds of hands on stuff. The restrooms are just beyond this area. Now when you started the tour they gave you a rubber bracelet with 3 tabs on it. ( We got ours from our hotel and it was cheaper than at The Heineken Experience. After the restrooms you have an area you can use 2 tabs to learn how to properly pour a Heineken and get to drink it after you get it right. Its harder than you may think. Hint Timing on the Tap is key. You also get a certificate that says you did it. You may choose to use 2 tabs on 1 glass of uber cold ICE Heineken. That was my choice. Or you could have 2 glasses of regular Heineken. That is the conclusion of the tour. But wait now for the gift shop. All kinds of Heineken stuff in here, also your bottle pick up or order if you couldn't get it in English or your home language. I'm telling you it's a great gift for anyone. So after you get some great gifts you are walking out and going wait I have 1 more tab left. What is this one for. Well I will tell you. You can get a free ride on a boat which will take you to the Heineken store not far away or a free gift at the store. We wanted the free gift. So we walked to the store (Should of taken the S baun) it's about 1 mile away. Anyway the free gift is a post card with a metal E laminated to it. It's a bottle opener/letter opener. Didn't play with it until we got home. Second best gift I gave to someone. Just saying. You can't buy it so use your tab wisely. Oh yea the store sells mini Heineken's and some in flavors you can only get in Amsterdam. Another cool gift idea. Just make sure they are not in your carry on or TSA will be enjoying your gifts. I put mine in my socks in the center of my checked luggage and no problems. Hope you have as much fun as we did.

Worth a visit!. We had a fantastic day in the Heineken experience. We spent about 3 hours in the experience itself, plenty to see and do, with 4D cinema experience, canal boat trip. Great value for money!

How disney would run a brewery tour. If Heinieken is your favourite beer then this is for you. It is considered a must do for a first time visit to Amsterdam but once you're inside you could be anywhere in the world where bland lager is manufactured in vast quantities (although of course it isnt actually made here anyomre..). Best bit was getting a bottle with our names printed on it - and that cost extra. Mildly diverting for an hour. The little simulator ride in the middle was very average. There are much more interesting places to visit in this lovely city.

Value For Money. Entry price includes beer, a ride on a canal boat and a souvenir bottle opener. The "experience" itself is very educational -particularly if you want to learn how beer is made.
Allow for about a half hour after the self guided tour to visit the official brand store by canal boat and claim your souvenir!

A good day out. A slow start but the experience builds right up until you get to sample the delights, be sure to get the boat back after your trip, you get a cruise around the canals in the price of your ticket.

This ale fan was won over. As a keen ale drinker I put my differences with lager aside for couple of hours for the Heineken Experience. Although I'm usually more interested in smaller, less corporate breweries I had seen that this ranked among Amsterdam's must-see attractions and couldn't resist. Other reviewers and even visitors I overheard on the day compared the brewery to Willy Wonka's chocolate factory and this is what sprung to my mind as my girlfriend and I made our way through the 12-stage tour at our own pace. The different stages offer plenty of variety with something for everyone, whether you're interested in the history of the company, the brewing process in general or are just looking for a fun family experience. The tour starts with the story behind Heineken before you move on to see and taste the key ingredients and walk through the old brew room. The rest of the tour involves a tasting session in English, a 4D experience which takes you through the brewing process as if you were one of the ingredients (also in English) and some funny interactive video and photo opportunities which you can email to yourself or someone else. As well as the half pint you get during the tasting session (or more if you answer the guide's questions, correctly or not) you get two more half pints in the 'world bar' at the end of the tour. You're also encouraged to take a token to the Heineken store which is a short walk or free canal ride away, where you can pick up a free Heineken bottle opener. These are all nice touches and left me feeling that I had got my money's worth for €18, not to mention a little bit merry.I would recommend that brewery enthusiasts go with an open mind. While there is plenty of information and history at the beginning, it feels more commercialised and gimmicky the further along you go as you're bombarded with sounds, dazzling lights, Heineken adverts and interactive activities that are all about marketing and nothing to do with brewing, which you might find off-putting if you're not expecting it. Saying that, my girlfriend and I were impressed and would definitely recommend the Heineken Experience to couples and groups of friends who have a couple of hours to spare in Amsterdam and fancy something a bit different from the city's more traditional sights. The clue is in the name; it's not just a tour, it's an experience!

What to say.... The experience was okay, you gets free beer if that's your thing. Even better gift store....was the highlight for me.You get to put your name on a bottle, well maybe you would have better luck. As for me the machine broke down right before my bottle, was told would be up in 10mins, more like 30mins. Eventually had to leave without it.

Very nice attraction. I was looking forward to visit the place since I heard a lot about it from my friends. Though it was a long queue for visiting this place, we still enjoyed here. The price of the entry ticket is a bit on the high side but you can compensate with the beer being offered here. The video shown in the begining was informative.

A very well thought out attraction.. We thought the Heineken experience was really good, they have obviously invested a lot of time and money in it as there was loads of stuff to do. Although they don't brew the beer here anymore there were still the old equipment in place and loads of other, more modern things to see. Look for the vouchers on the leaflets (we found one in the hotel lobby) as this can take the price from 18 euros to 15, which is as a good saving.

Expected more of it. To be honest, I expected much more of Heineken. Even if it's my favourite beer... the experience was a bit "overrated": we had tickets purchased online, but still we had to wait more than 20+ minutes in the queue to the cloakroom (reason: 1 staff for all visitors).The exhibition is not bad, but somehow very divided... Didn't have a wow effect at the end.

This is an experience to be repeated. We arrived here after walking down from Anne Franks house. We left our coats at the cloakroom (free) and then bought discounted tickets, (we got a voucher from the hotel we stayed in), you are then allowed to wander around at your own speed. Initially you get to see a short video about how Heineken started out, a short walk through the history of the company and then the interactive part starts! There is a short educational lecture that shows you how to drink Heineken correctly, followed by the hard part was the practical (Proost). There were lots of interactive exhibitions but it would spoil the trip for you if i told you more.Well worth the money

suprisingly good time. I wasn't looking forward to this tour as much as i was the bolls cocktail experience as i'm not a fan of beer-but this tour explained why women enjoy beer less than men and a host of other things! It's of a good length and there are loads of interactive parts to the tour. I think my favourite part was getting to see the old cart horses who used to pull the beer through the streets of amsterdam. You of course get to taste the product at the end of the tour and i found it did taste better than before.

Must See In Amsterdam, Even If you Dont Drink Beer. We visited here on our first day in Amsterdam and it was so much fun learning how they made beer, what goes into it and the history behind the brand.They have alot of info, places you can test beer, barley etc, interactive pouring of a beer, labelling your own beers which we did, your own shirts etc.Then you get to ride on the boat up to the other shop with even more souveniers to purchase.Well worth the entry fee.

Touristy but fun. A fun way to see into the process of brewing beer for the average person. Full of interactive exhibits and punctuated with free beer, it is a fun way to spend a few hours. They also offer a free river cruise after the factory tour to give you the classic Amsterdam canal experience

Average, Overpriced Attraction. Pros:--Good staff--SOME interesting facts--The educational stations were engaging--Neat video machine to record and send videos to loved ones--Nice gift shopCons:--Self-guided tours with lots of uninteresting reading (and I'm a museum, tour lover)--Pricey for what you ++really++ get--Everyone is talking about the 'free' drinks--the drinks are not free--you pay the price for admission to walk around by yourself--the drinks are included in the admission! --We didn't get the mini-cruise or shuttle. They weren't running while we were there.--Sticky, overcrowded 'dance club' at the end,where you are forced to drink your 'free' drinks. Lots of people spilling their beer and not many places to sit and enjoy it.

Wonderful experience!!. "i am going to make you a beer", the Heineken-man said. We loved it! Also, they have horses as a part of the experience! Can you belive it!? I both like horses and beer, so this was perfect! We will be back, i promise! However, no place to park a stroller! So if you have small children, i would not recomend this place. Perfect for me as a single man this day!

Loved it & now love Heineken beer!!. We visited the Heineken museum as part of a 2 day city break to Amsterdam. We had heard from friends that this was a good fun tour so we decided to give it a go. We paid €15 each as we had a discount booklet given to us when we purchased our travel cards at Central Station. The tour itself was great fun and we loved the fact that there was so many interactive bits. Half way round you go on a little ride in which you get treated like a bottle of beer! It's better than it sounds - haha. Then you get taken into a room and given a small glass of Heineken while a bar man explains how it got its colour, fizz etc. Dont worry about how small the glass is as you get two more glasses at the end!! There was lots to do whilst taking the tour and I reckon we had been in there for a few hours by the time we had finished chilling out with our free beers in the bar at the end!!At the end of the experience you can either claim a free bottle opener or go on a canal boat ride. We took the boat ride as we thought this would be better and it was. We were very lucky with the weather and as it was such a beautiful day we sat outside on the boat with yet more bottles of beer!! The boat ride its self was nice and informative.I would recommend this for a good trip to take whilst in Amsterdam.Beer in not brewed here anymore though so please don't go thinking you will see beer being made as you will be disappointed!

Mouth watering experience. Well worth a visit, see how heineken is made for start to finish lots to do as you walk thought the brewery and at the end 2 free drinks and a free mini cruise to the brand shop where you receive a free gift.

I was suprised!. Being a girl travelling with two guys there was no way we weren't taking this tour but I was surprised how much i enjoyed it! Really great experience loved learning to poor a perfect beer myself, lots of fun photo opportunities through the tour and actually really informative, the system for getting your name printed on a custom bottle which was disappointing but we all had a really great time anyways! also made the effort to trip to the souvenir store to claim a free gift we got given from the factory, we biked there which wasn't easy but a really fun ride the store was so sick really flash set up. I Love heinken now!

Second visit and some new things to do. Seemed a bit dear at 18 Euros but you get a good tour, a sampling session part way round, some fun photo and video opportunities (which you can e-mail home) and then two drinks to finish. After that, you get a 10 minute free canal trip to the brand shop, with a bottle opener thrown in. All in, pretty good value

Interesting experience, mostly because of the interactiveness of it. My friends are Heinken fans (huge Heineken fans) and this was a must on our list. I can say that it was an interesting experience, but i was not blown away. They made the most of "how it's made" in terms of beer. The man explaining why this is the best beer in the world is the funniest! However, If you re not a heineken or a beer fan, you will find this dissapointing.

Worth the money. The museum is designed to be a really good experience. It's not a regular museum in which you just wonder around, look on objects or read info. That museum will stimulate your senses !! They let you feel, taste, smell and touch on almost each step of the beer makingMoreover, they let you taste their beer and they are very kind in that matter - you can drink at least 2 glasses without extra payment.

Interactive and fun. I wasn't expecting a lot (went here with my boyfriend as he's a beer lover.) but I found it to be great value for money (3 beers included!) and it was really quite interesting and all the interactive exhibitions made it a really great afternoon. Well worth a visit!

Worth a go. An interesting, informative and entertaining tour of the brewery. You can tell they are proud of their beer. You can do various interactive activities, including learning how to pour the beer properly, and best of all, you get to drink it!

Not bad. Heineken Experience is a place where you can spend your time after you've been tired with walking and visiting other museums. The attraction has a few visiting rooms and many interactive stands. 4D cinema I liked the most. You can get familiar with the process of brewing beer and buy some souvenirs at the exit. The entrance fee is 18 euros. Nevertheless, I must say that this is not "a must see" in Amsterdam.

Lots of fun!. Even if I am not a big fan of beer (yes, I am czech :D ) I enjoyed this tour very much, we had only one glass of beer and didnt try all of atractions but it was definititely worth to visit it.
Cool to see. Interesting about the history and scale of everything involved. Some nice free samples and couple of beers at the bar at the end. Quite expensive for what it is though

Fun. I have been on a hundred brewery tours and will continue till I see them all. Ha. I got a little beer glass and collectable tin after the tour and some samples. The savvy brewery tourist gets an extra sample!

Great experience. What at fun place and good beer too! Enjoyed the Heineken Experience much more than the Guiness Tour in Dublin. More things to do at Heineken. Make sure you label on your personal bottle of beer and take part in the videos.
This is a must. You will have a great time here. It is close to the Museum Quarter with lots of other attractions. Go behing the Rijks Museum to see many other attractions.

Mindly interesting and expensive. The Heineken experience is fine; you learn about the history of the brand and a few tidbits about how beer is made. They try hard to make the whole thing seem fun, but how much fun can brewing beer really be? You're basically paying €18 for them to advertise their brand and you get two small glasses of beer. I'd say it's more worth about €10. The beer is lovely, though.

Even If you dont like beer you should still try this experience!. Many people may be put off this experience if they don't like beer. However if you lik ehistory and just generally like having a good time you should try this experience. There is lots to do for fun and lots of good photo opportunities. You even get a few free drinks and a free gift! A great place to visit overall.

Good tour, educated staff and gorgeous Heineken!. We had a great time here, we bought tickets online so we could skip the queue and I’m glad we did as the queue was huge!!We got a tram from Amsterdam central station just because it was snowy and freezing cold otherwise we could have walked it in 10 or 15 minutes it depends how fast you walk!!Was interesting to see around the brewery and how the development of Heineken has changed. The staff are very educated in telling you how the beer tastes the way it does.The tasters are great. You get 3 free beers with your ticket. 1 beer when the guy pours your whole group a glass, then you all hold up your glass, say cheers in Dutch, look at the golden colour, the lovely bubbles keeping your beer fresh (my mouth is salivating!!)You get to take your beer into this chilled out green room where the whole ceiling is covered in green glass bottles.You can create your own label for a bottle of Heineken for €6. We would of done this but we couldn’t bring it home with us on the flight :)You also get a free gift and a free canal tour with this ticket but the free gift you have to travel on the canal tour to get it (the gift was a Heineken bottle opener) and we didn’t have the time to do this unfortunately.Then you go to the Heineken bar at the end of the tour and get to enjoy 2 complimentary beers each. Delicious!! :)The interactive ride through the beer production process was very enjoyable you get to “feel like Heineken”!!
Beer no longer made here.. We love Heineken, but the beer is no longer made here. Did not think this was a good value for video presentations and a couple of small glasses of beer.

Interactive, fun, entertaining, fascinating.. A great way to spend 17 euro (buy tickets @ tour agencies located in Dam Square, save 2 euro pp). Very interactive. 2 free beers included @ the end of tour and you are always learning something new. My partner who was skeptical going into the experience as she does not drink beer came out with a smile on her face and slurring speech. Good Day.

Visit the home of hieneken beer while in amsterdam!. Wanted to do an attraction while on a city break.....so why not one involving beer. Costing 18? per person, its ok value. You get out of the cold for 2 to 3 hours and get to sample beers. Best bits were the interactive ride through the beer production process, the chill area, understanding why the head of the beer is important and obviously the beer drinking. Would recommend if not done before.

Interesting experience. It is an interesting experience for the beer lovers and for curious people to know more about beer brewing. The ticket is a bit on the expensive side but it includes the consumption of beer inside the attraction. You can see mostly young peopel queing up to visit this place. Outside there is no protection for the people standing in a line it is rains or snows. So be prepared with your own stuff.

Very Fun!!. The service is good, they offer you a free cookies when you purchase the ticket, got locker for your coats and stuffs. One things was very surprise I spent almost two hours inside, you will know about the history of Heineken of course, and can make your own beers, taste the beers too.They have a bar area which is nice.Overall is worth it. I had a great time here.

Enjoyable. We are a family of four. Kids are 11 & 15. We were unsure if this would be a good tour for us. However it's done very well and the kids really enjoyed it. They get a soft drink instead of the beer Beer is allowed for age 16 up. It took us a while to find as we got lost but easy once you know how! There is a boat back to the Heineken brand shop where you can pick up a free bottle opener with your voucher. It goes on the hour- we weren't told this and missed it. So worth checking times. Pick up a voucher in your hotel for a little disciunt. Worth doing.

Under 18s only. This is a pathetic theme park for the most purile half wits. On no account should you waste 18 Euros if you have any genuine interest in brewing or beer. Save it and spend it in on a better brew in any one of the splendid bars this great city has to offer. There are no redeeming features to this ridiculous attempt at encouraging the imbibimg of Heinekin- I shall die of thirst rather than drink it after this experience.

De brouwerij. Heineken Experience is the great brewery experience. Even if you are not a beer fan, you should visit this place. This is not only a museum but a complete science tour. If the word science tour makes you feel bore, then do not forget that you would get a chance to taste barley water, you would get a crash course on beer tasting. You would understand some jargon like 'dead beer' etc..If you are a beer fan, this will teach you a new style of tasting beer. Ah ok.. now all this even seems boring then let me tell you would reach an area which is full of activities like taking up your video, photos with typical dutch back ground or along with cycle. At the end there is a lounge where you can click snaps with jazzy back grounds. I visited this place along with few friends. I liked it because I like museums and some of my friends like it because it was full of activities. All in all, this is a package for every one for every age or gender....cheers!

Fantastic!!. Well worth a visit, with your maps you receive on trams you get a 3euro discount, tickets include 2 drinks and a free gift. You also try 330ml of heineken before you get two free drinks. Fantastic affordable shop where we bought engraved glasses for 5euro
horror. the horror of drunk tourists screaming their lungs out and throwing up after visiting this horrible place

Good value good fun. Was good to go Round I'm not a beer or larger drinker either but enjoyed it
Get 1.5 pints of larger a free bottle opener as well
2 hours ish of going round really enjoyed it

Good Value!. Comparing this to our trip to Amsterdam's Icebar, Heineken comes out on top!
You can easily spend a few hours in here!
The freshly brewed heineken is delicious!
The 4D experience is great fun.
You can even get a canal trip thrown in.
Defo worth a visit!

Cheesy, but fun. It is a super cheesy tour but it is well done and very fun. You get two beers at the end so I don't know how anyone could come here and not enjoy that. The UEFA Champions League part was impressive to me. I could have spent hours there watching clips from Chelsea.

Wouldn't do again - but it was alright. I really liked making my own personalized bottle whilst going through. The tour itself is rather boring and I found myself just looking forward to leaving. You get a free key ring which is a good piece of memorabilia. Overall - has to be done but I wouldn't do it twice.

What's with all the bubbles?. Be forewarned -- if a college fraternity is starting the tour at the same time as you, I'd suggest waiting about 30 minutes. The Heineken Experience is full of fun and knowledge, detailing how beer is made and why the foam at the top does serve a purpose. Do not lean back on the bars during the short ride. Do sing along with the video, then choose carefully who gets a copy. Lastly, enjoy some of the best beer in the world the proper way -- with a big gulp! 18 euros per person at the door

Interesting and beer as well. Booked online so the price was cheaper plus no queues.Very informative and well set up.You can learn all the history at your own pace.Theres a virtual room which was fun and a room for tasting beer which was funnier because you get a small beer.Lots of interactive stuff to mess about with and at the end you end up at the bar for another free beer.I really like the way they have mixed the old and new stuff together.Well worth a visit.The beers not watered down as well :)

Great tour with plenty to drink. The Heineken Experience was a great attraction and since you can go at your own pace there is no rush to keep with the group if you find something particularly interesting. There are plenty of additional things to do alongside learning about the brewing process, such as pulling a virtual pint, creating your own beer bottle-label, etc. The wristband that you receive on entry entitles you to two free drinks (coke or Heineken) and a free-gift from the brand store which is a fair walk away. You can use that token on a canal ride to the store, but this means you don't get the free gift. Even for people that don't particularly like beer (I got double since my fiance hates it!) it is a really interesting experience that shouldn't be missed.

Heineken experience. We went to see this attraction. entry was €15 but we had vouchers from Amsterdam Holland card . Quick entry with vouchers and complimentary coat locker which was great as we had a lot of winter clothes as was cold outside. Def use coat locker . good experience on the visit . Colour taste etc explained while you are tasting a glass of beer. Very entertaining tour . What we enjoyed most was interaction with other visitors at bar at end where you get 2 drinks included in entry price. Some contributors say they got 2 pints- not on day we visited it was 2 glasses or 1 pint. My wife does not drink beer so I still got my 4 glasses. She got still water as well. There was also a free short cruise to Heineken store which we did not avail of. Worth a visit .
free drinks?. I am slightly biased as Heineken is my erstwhile employer but the venue has been updated recently and the small entrancefee is donated to UNESCO. The show is fun.

Modern and hands on experience. 18 Euro entrance fee and complementary cloak room. You'll get a wristband with free drink buttons and a free gift button. Pour your own virtual beer, take the 4D ride and get educated on how to 'taste' beer. Email your mates a singing video and a photo then enjoy your free drinks. You don't have get beer, you can use them to get soft drinks instead. To claim the free gift, take the Heineken canal ride which takes you to the other gift shop.
Great tour! Lots of Beer !. Great tour takes you into every step of Heineken brewery. Highly interactive. You can even brew your own bottle with your name on it.
Worth a visit. Some fun things to do and see as we'll as brewing history a lot of adverts on the way 2 free drinks and canal cruise to city made the visit worth while

Great Heineken Experience. This was a good refreshing break from visiting the museums. Upon entry there is a Complimentary cloakroom and the reception where you get your tickets and receive your wristbands. If you can get hold of a discount voucher entry can be reduced to £15 euros which i thought was a good deal.The tour is straight forward, you get to see how Heineken is made, get a free taster and have tokens for 2 drinks at the bar at the end. Soft drinks are available for non drinkers. There are Some interactive fun and games along the way, and places to sit and rest.The Gift shop is reasonably priced and they do engraving on glasses if you wish to purchase one.In addition, they also provide free shuttle on canal boat after your tour to take you to the large Heineken brand store.
Very good tour. Entrance cost us just 15 euro each. I have been to the Guinness storehouse in Dublin also and found that there was much more to do here.A must do for Amsterdam.

Great Craic. We called in thinking it would be a boring trek round and old disused brewery .. WRONG! really good fun, interactive. Poor your own pint, Brew your ride 4D experience, a couple of free wee cheeky beers and the chance to send a video message or photo home! Definitley worth it!

Great fun and excellent beer!!. Visited the heineken experience after hearing a lot of good reports. I thoroughly enjoyed myself! It was great fun, very etntertaining and quite informative. The experience is split up into several different sections and there is plenty of opportunity for tasting the beer too! There is a dedicated section on tasting and two drinks included in the admission price! There ias also a particularly fun 'intercative' area where you can take photographs and videos of friends and family in heineken themed Dutch scenarios! Trust me, it's fun!The admission price is 18 euros but we picked up a leaflet at our hotel which got is in for fifteen. Not bad when you think about what you're actually getting for your money! Visit and enjoy but go in the morning as it seems to get pretty busy later on!

Informative and good fun. I got a discounted entry fee thanks to the Iamsterdam Card. There's plenty to do and see at the brewery. It starts off with the history side of things, followed by the production and manufacturing of the beer, then a tasting and basically an exhibit of how Heineken have marketed themselves around the world. I got my own personalised Heineken beer with my name on the bottle for €6. It was a good fun tour and I think it's worth checking out if you have a couple of hours to spare.

Good afternoon out. Lots to keep me busythings to see,smell, play with and taste. I didnt expect to enjoy this so much. Everything in english and staff really keen to make sure we had a good experience. Definitely a great afternoon really glad i didnt miss this one

good to see. we went on this excursion via the hop on hop off bus, got a discount on the tickets too, we got to queue jump as we bought the tickets before (which i always recommend) we got 2 pints free with each ticket and then you get another pint while walking around.my husband enjoyed this experience.. not sure if it was because he got 5 pints (including mine to drink) very informative and more like a museum. we have been to the Guinness experience in Dublin and preferred that.there was also a stimulator ride, which was good.

One Giant Commercial - But Fun. Even though we enjoyed the exhibits and the ice-cold beer at the end, I kind of had a feeling I had paid good money to be marketed to. Still, it was fun, the displays were creative, and we were glad we went. Be forewarned that if you are over the age of thirty, you may feel a bit out of place - this seems to be a "must see" attraction for the young backpacker crowd.

Brilliant. I visited the brewery recently and had a great time on the Heineken Experience. I especially enjoyed seeing all of the old signs and advertisements down the years, as well as the Champions League room with signed shirts and other memorabilia and interactive machines which let you choose and watch your favourite goals in the competition. Pouring my own beer was fun, and as I achieved the 'perfect pint' I got another drink for free. I would definitely recommend the brewery if you want to spend a couple of hours learning about the history and tradition of Heineken and also experience new and innovative attractions that the brewery offers. The staff and guides were also excellent.

so-so. I was torn between giving this an "average" or a "very good".There is hardly any information available on any of the exhibits, so it's left to you to figure out what's what and why it was used pretty much. Staff members do periodically crop up, but that's to give you samples - we got to taste raw barley and hops, then barley in water, and then the finished product.The redeeming feature of this place is how bloomming lovely the Heineken is. I'm a real-ale drinker and normally wouldn't touch lager with a bargepole, but in this instance I'm glad I did. Ice-cold, and certainly the best tasting lager I've ever had.Staff were friendly, but as I say, there wasn't much information

Kind of corny. After being to multiple breweries and distilleries where the alcohol is actually made there, this was a bit of a disappointment. It was more of a fun house than a brewery in my opinion! Enjoyed the free beer at the end.

Love beer? Hate Beer? Enjoy Heineken. Well, I had a great laugh! I didnt think the missus would but you know what.. she did to! She is not a beer drinking, so I had her free samples, made it all the more fun :-) I had been on a brewery tour before and it was as dull as the product they were selling but this, much more fun, ok they are a big multi national brand but they talk about their routes and how it all came to pass, the initial rooms were really interesting to see if a little cheesy.As you walk through you are given samples of the different stages, I can only recommend to not try the mush of sugar and barley in the copper oven rooms, it is foul You get to "be the beer" on a 4d ride (which again is a bit corny and cheesy) but good fun all the same, then you get to go to a beer tasting room where you learn that big heads are quite a good thing.Next up is a massive room with a glass bottled ceiling showing adverts and then onto an interactive room, DONT BE SHY get involved, you could spend a long time in here in the various photo booths, dj hero-ing your butt off then emailing it all to yourself and then the last leg of the tour, the bar, this is where the free samples come in so save your tokens!my one tip for you: When you get in you get given a wrist band with 3 tokens on, one of these is for a free gift from a store down a canal somewhere, however if you buy your tickets from a tours and tickets place in town you get the free gift from there anyway (its a bottle opener) well worth a visit

It's a beer museum. Cute, corny, informative and worth the trip. Where else can you go to ride a "beer ride." Or learn how to pour a beer and why the plastic stick is dipped in water and run over the glass. Two free beers and tee shirts end the 20+ minute "experience."

Didn't drink before, now I do!. Was never really a beer drinker before but htis has converted me. The cost of a ticket is 18 euros but I'd say it was worth it. On paying you will get a ticket and a wristband. THe wristband will have 2 green buttons and one white. MAKE SURE THESE ARE THERE AND KEEP THEM SAFE! When it got to the point where you get to use them, I had noticed that one of the green ones was missing. Tour is very well planned. Started off with the history of the beer then onto the brewing. I found this very interesting and the smell of barley was amazing! There is a "Brew You" ride which was really fun and then you can customise a bottle for 6 euros. After all of this there is stuff about football and some games etc. Nearer the end there is a tasting session where they teach you to taste beer. Further on with your green buttons you can pour your own beer or do what we did and just take both to the World bar to exchange it for two beers.

Enjoy Beer , Fall in love with Heineken. Pick up a discount card if u can €18 is a tad expensive. Good break if you've been visiting museums. Complimentary cloakroom. It's a straight forward tour where u see how Heineken is made, get some free tasters and have tokens for 2 drinks at the bar at the end. Some interactive fun which along the way including photos and videos you can e mail home. Gift shop is reasonably priced and they do on the spot engraving on glasses if you wish. They also provide free shuttle on canal boat after your tour.

Ice cold beer... I'm in!. Had a blast on this informative and interactive tour. With entrance purchase you get a bracelet with a tab on it for a free beer at the end of tour. Everything throughout the "Experinece" was put together well and was really enjoyable. You get to taste a beer that's only 24 hours old and at end of tour you get your beer ( included in entrance fee) chilled to zero degrees, O my gosh was it refreshing! Had a great day and would highly recommend for a short day trip.

Worth checking out.. Well, the heineken museum is certainly worth checking out. The staff are great and really enthusiastic. It's not far at all from the main centre either so walking shouldn't be an issue. Yes, you do get a free beer at the end of the tour along with being taught how to appreciate & pour beer. Good fun. OH - there is also a simulator whereby you experience the beer process yourself!

Great. It was the best experience ever at Amsterdam.First of all if you buy the tickets at the museum , it is more expensive (18€)whereas you can buy the same ticket for (15€) at tour agents.It was an amazing experience, must-do activity! you can drink two beers and get a bottle opener from the brand shop where you are taken by boat for free!!Very warm staff and wonderful organization.

So Much Fun!. So, we're from San Diego, the #1 craft brew city in the country. Heineken - Meh, wasn't excited at all about this. After all, I've been to tons of brewery tours here in SD, I know how beer is brewed, blah blah blah. But I figured, we're in Amsterdam, might as well. Sooo glad we went. It really is an experience. Tons of history about beer in general and Heineken specific. You get 1 free taster where they teach you about how the beer should be poured and drank! Then you get 2 (or 3) tickets for beer at the bar in the end. There's an area with real taps and they will teach you how to pour the perfect Heineken pint and let you drink the beer after. It was such a good time, super interactive and fun.And for the beer snobs like myself, Heineken in Amsterdam tastes totally different from Heineken in the US. So don't dismiss it so quickly.
Have fun:)). It was so funny, that I felt myself like a teenager. Everybody came to have fun. Staff was so friendly and professional. I am not a beer trinker but still I recommend it.

interesting and interactive!. I went to the heinkeken experience with some friends on Sunday and we all really enjoyed it! We didn't wait long at all to get in- about 10mins including waiting in line for our tickets and for the free cloakroom. We found the museum interesting as there were so many different things to do! We learned about the history, had a beer tasting session, were able to take fun photos and enjoyed their 4D cinema. We paid €16 each as we picked up a voucher at one of the many 'Tickets and Tours' outlets in amsterdam city centre. Included were 2 free beers at the end. However, you also get a beer at the tastign session so you end up having 3 beers. We were also given extra as the friendly bar man accidently poured 5 instead of 4- they're not at all stingy with the beer! All the employees were young and very friendly as well as being informative.Another plus was the free gift offered if you go to the heineken brand store. Unfortunately we didn't have time to go however there was a boat running there every hour.Overall, a fun day out- especially if you're a beer fan! Would definitely recommend a visit! I went with friends however i also think my parents would've enjoyed it :)

I YOU LIKE FUN, THEN COME HERE!!. Such a great museum/experience! I don't know what all of the reviews were talking about being too crowded. My girlfriend and I went in around 1pm and easily cruised around with only a few people around. Great value for money too - 0.75 of great beer, a canal ride and a free bottle opener! We got another free gift for spending over (just) 50 euro in the gift shop!The staff were great - it was one employees first time presenting in english - he did great. Bumped into him in the bar where he recommended good places to go out and cool places to see!Had a great half of a day!!

Brilliant fun!. My boyfriend and I visited the Heineken experience on the strength of all the good reviews on Tripadvisor and were so glad we went. A really fun, interactive experience with free beer and great value for money. Great time!

Fun day out. Didn't really want to visit the Heineken experience, but my partner wanted to go. I thought it would be really boring and all about how to make beer. But I had a fantastic day out here, it was very interesting, very interactive, loads of things to do and to top it off you get free beer. Brilliant

Well Executed if a bit crowded. The "Heineken Experience" is worth going to if you have an interest in beer and popular culture, but the venue can be terribly crowded.The tour starts with a history of the Heineken brewery and how the brand evolved over the years. You can then walk through various parts of the old brewery and learn about the brewing process.The use of multimedia is quite impressive and very slick, though you'd need to be a big fan of Heineken to enjoy some parts of the tour.It's worth doing if you have the time, but it wouldn't be too high up my list of attractions in Amsterdam.My main gripe being that the beer tasting at the end of the tour is chaotic and the floors were filthy and sticky
Must visit!. We went there, 9 of us, without expectations, and we really enjoyed the 90 min tour. It is very professional, entertaining and very well served.

Great Experience. We had one day to visit the attrations in Amsterdam and the Heineken Brewery was one that we were glad we did not skip. Their marketing department gets 5 stars - it was informative, interesting, fun and interactive. I've visited many brewery tours and this one by far was the best.

Nice.. Very nice visit. You can spend about 2 hours and visit the Heineken Experience. There is some beer history and some explanations. At the end you can go to a bar and drink some beers. If you are in the city, I think it worth the visit.

my best experience. Heineken Experience is something u don't wanna miss during your stay in Amsterdam. They show you how the best beer (in my opinion) is made and how it used to be. As a fan of Heineken i must say i really enjoyed the beer in than place.There is a Heineken historical museum , bar , souvenir shop and many other cool facilities. The tour takes 2-3 hours and it was one of my best touring attractions in Amsterdam.

Just real beer experience!. The museum is really nice organized. You can smell, touch and taste ingriediens, have a look into large alembiks, listen to a lot of interesting stories of Heineken company and process of beer production. Exciting 4D movie about beer production at Heineken! Finally you can feel like bartender when make your own beer :-)

Heineken Experience - better than the Guinness Factory. We were pretty chilly (-6) and hungover on our last day in Amsterdam. We decided on the Heineken experience to get out of the cold. It was great. You do it at your own pace. We got to learn not only about the history, the brewing, the consistency of the beer. They also have interactive segments such as what it's like to be a Heineken bottle, tasting, their dutch/heineken version of sing star, loads of photo opportunity spots. At the end of their tour you chill out in the bar and get a couple of half pints. Coat check, 3 x 1/2 pints, boat trip down the canal (every hour to the souvenir shop), keyring were all included in the price. I found this one a bit more bang for your buck compared to the Guinness factory in Dublin.

The home of the smiley e. Tour lasted over 2hrs would have been longer, but we had to cut it short, went round by ourselves, so much to see and interact with. Lovely to see that they hadn't ripped out any of the original coppers.You can't miss or get away from the smell of the dray horses who looked immaculate in their stables.Amazing how there's so much over the 4/5 floors you cover

Good fun, well set up!. Did the Heineken experience with my partner and found it to be entertaining as well as informative. Plenty of interesting history behind the brand as well as viewing the brewing process which they have made interactive. The tour finished with a look at the marketing behind the beer. All in all a very well devised tour with plenty for everyone. You will need at least two hours to experience it all!

Worth a visit. We have been to a few breweries, we prefer the ones where there is a tour guide there to take you round but this is a self-guided tour. In saying that it is interesting and the ride is also good fun. Obviously the best bit is when you get to taste the lager, you get a chance to taste in the tasting room and then you have two free drinks at the end of the tour. You also get a free drink if you want to go to the brand store, though we didn't bother. All in all its worth going to.

Very Entertaining. It was a very good experience. I love to see old factories, historical places with reviews and movement. "Feeling like a bottle" was very interesting and we (me, my husband and our nephew) had a lot of fun. I didn`t expect to be so funny and interesting. The staff were very helpful and entertaining. We did everything that we were supposed to do, and we had a wonderful experience. I recommend.

Fascinating place to visit.. This is an amazing place to visit. It tells the history of Heineken, how it's made, all the awards it has won and then takes you through to the copper vats where all the different processes take place. There is a chance to see the Shire horses that pull the cart and then a chance to sample the goods. Free drinks are available along with a bracelet that holds the tokens for the drinks and a free bottle opener on a key ring, which is worth 6Euros on it's own. The shop at the end of the tour is expensive, but that is usual,but the whole experience was enjoyable. I recommend this experience; it's only a 10-15 minute tram ride away from the Centraal Station.

An entertaining morning.. We were lucky that it was quiet so we could take our time and play with all their interactive equipment. The Victorian brewing hall was interesting but it was rather disappointing if you really wanted to find out about brewing. Enjoyed the drink at the end.
Brilliant Experience. Brilliant experience all around, great tour, very friendly staff and time flew by, easily reachable by tram and nice lil noodle and wok place around the corner

Entertaining. I was less than thrilled about going to the Heineken experience but since I was with a group felt like I should just do it. I was quite surprised at how much I enjoyed this tour. Was quite informative on the beer making process and along the way there were fun things to do and see. Ended up being what I most enjoyed on the trip.

Good fun experience. First of all...I don't drink even Heineken but really enjoyed this experience! Best part was the video where you stand on a moveable platform...was a lot of fun! All things Heineken related...how they make it, ingredients and even real horses!!!! There was cool chair things, bikes, video making machines, DJ decks etc etc!! You get two beer sampling...which was wasted on me as I only took a sip!!!!! But even if you don't like Heineken its definitely worth a trip!

A Good Laugh. Sure it is one giant Heineken advert but it was interesting and informative even though they did end a description of a brewing process with "...and that's why Heineken tastes so great!" but this is what you would expect so it didn't diminish from the feel of the place. Also the inclusive drinks are very nice and fresh. I don't drink Heineken in the UK where I am from but in Amsterdam it does taste much better and is stronger. It would be a good place to go during the day before a night drinking as you can make a start with the included drinks. I really liked the staff as they would tell you the truth if you asked, one agreed with me and explained the reasons why Heineken tastes better in The Netherlands. Worth a visit though it should be cheaper (but subtract the price of the drinks and it is averagely priced for an attraction in Amsterdam.)

Well worth a visit. There was plenty to do there, you got 3 beers included in the ticket price. We were in a bit of a rush so we couldn't utilise the full range of things to do. We went round in about an hour, but you could allow 2 hours to do everything. I wouldn't recommend it for kids obviously, not sure if they even let children in!!!! It was very warm in there. The staff were very friendly and everything is in English. You don't need to have a love for beer to enjoy the experience.
Great Experience. A fun way to get to know the history of Heineken. At the end of the tour, try to draught the perfect Heineken. It's fun!

Should be ranked higher on Amsterdam's things to do.... My partner and I visited the Heineken Experiance in early Jan and it was a lot of fun. We had done a couple of brewery tours before it but this one was really interactive and was more of a beer theme park. My partner doesn't like beer but she really enjoyed this place. We made our own heineken label for a bottle, tasted the beer at different stages of brewing, poured our own beer, were both brewed in the brew-you experiance, played DJ and made our own dance video. Like I said, plenty to do and at a good price for how long you end up spending there. It's a bit of a way out from the centre of town but we hired bikes and were there in 10 minutes

Ashamed to be Dutch. Went with British friends and my Scottish husband. Everything that is being said in the negative reviews is right. What a dreadful rip off. One boring, giant commercial. It was very quiet, but if you wanted do the interactive stuff, there were still queues. And then the joke which is supposed to be a 'ride' where you are the beer, from brewing to bottling. In fact you stand on a platform which shakes about a bit while you watch a film. Pathetic. I was really embarrassed to have taken my friends there. TIP: spend the money on a guided city walk from specialtours, they are brilliant.

Just plain fun. This was a fun and interactive brewery tour. It showed the history of Heineken, how the beer is brewed, had some interactive displays and they teach you how to taste a beer. A pretty fun, light and relaxing afternoon. You get two free beers at the end of the tour and after that we needed a nap! Takes about 3 hours

Great tour, well worth a visit!. An excellent, good quality commercial brewery tour. Well worth a visit. There is great shop at the end of the tour selling loads of super Heineken merchandise. The location is a good walk from the centre, but not too far.

Kind of like Willy Wonka's Chocolate Factory, but for beer.. Was great fun, and the only thing our group of friends could agree on that we all enjoyed. An interesting story of the history of Heineken and the brewing process in the amazing renovated brewery. Throw in a 4D simulation of making beer, a tasting session and two beers at the end (or one if you pour it yourself) then you come out feeling like you had a really great experience. And there's a great pub just on the corner next to it so that you can continue being impressed by the best pint of Heineken you'll probably ever taste. At €15 with a leaflet, it is more expensive than many things in Amsterdam, however it is well worth it!

I recommend this, even if you don't like Heineken.. You get one really small beer and then two bigger at the end, but they were good. Didn't quite like Heineken before this, but they served them perfectly. The whole experience was good, but some stuff was just plain boring. I liked the 4d cinema. The boat is a bit of a fraud I think, because the next one didn't leave for 5 hours. But go here.

A surprisingly enjoyable afternoon and a must if visiting Amsterdam.. We were not planning to visit the Heineken experience during our stay, but found time especially. Am very glad we did. The price was a little higher than the other museums in Amsterdam, but can see why. The experience takes you through the company's history, the brewing process, a very entertaining film and packing process. With lots of modern interactive features throughout, including a beer tasting session!All staff were really friendly, and there were plenty of freebies, along with the opportunity to buy items from the shop.There is a shuttle boat to the brand shop on the hour and the tour guide made the journey informative and very entertaining.
Great fun!. You get plenty of free drinks and the tour is great fun and educational. Who hasn't ever had a Heineken? A really interesting story of how the brewery was founded!

Buy your ticket online. A quite interesting experience especially for beer lovers. Additional benefits apart from the tour itself were the free beers, free gifts (bottle opener and wristband), and a 15 minutes canal cruise. Buy your tickets online and save a couple euros.

More than just a tour!. We were pleasantly surprised with the Heineken experience! As a lover of a city break, I have been to many boring tours/museums. This certainly wasn't one of them - it offered a good selection of entertainment and education. Of course the free beer throughout was fantastic! There are lots of interactive activities which were great, I especially loved being a DJ!!!Highly recommended and definite value for money. I would strongly recommend preordering tickets online - we walked straight in, past a HUGE queue outside.
so funny. it was worth the price. funny stuff, funny people, great beer and 3D experience. well done Heineken!

One of the first to see!. If you are in Amsterdam you MUST go in! If you like a beer you muts go two times! :) With the ticket we got 2 free beers (plus two extra glasses to tasting) a original Heineken bottle opener and a free gift. After the 2.5 hours visit we got a lot of experience about: make, taste, draft and drink the beer...

Great tour for any beer lovers!. We visited this location very open minded, having done the Guinness tour in Dublin (which was amazing) and the Heineken experience did not disappoint, and surprisingly, was just as good. The location was easy to find (we went on the bus tour and this was one of the stops, which was directly outside the front door!) and well presented from the outside. We booked tickets through the "Tours and Tickets" shops which are dotted around the city and saved us a couple of Euros each. On buying our tickets, we were given a free keyring bottle opener, which was nice. When we arrived at the location, we were given another key ring bottle opener, along with our wrist bands which included tokens for our 2 free drinks, and a token for a free gift (yep, another bottle opener key ring!! who needs 3 of them each?!)The experience itself was educational, and gave a good insight into the Heineken company and it's values, as well as showing practical demonstrations of how the beer is brewed. You also get a 3rd small beer as part of a "tasting session", which is great fun and very informative, with a very amusing barman. (if you shout out the answers to his questions you get even more free beer!)The price was reasonable, and you got 2 free drinks plus a smaller 3rd, so you can't grumble given the price of drinks in the city centre! (average 6Euros a beer)Well worth a visit, I would thoroughly recommend this tour to anyone.

What did you expect?. Let's be honest, we all know these places are tourist traps, but we go anyway.Especially if beer is involved. It will cost a few dollars, but what the heck. The concept is a good one. A way to learn about the product, it's history and how it's made whilst having a bit of fun.
