We really enjoyed wandering around and the information from staff was interesting, you ca always learn something. Ending with the tasting, and lessons on how to drink beer. This is one all women should go to, it helps understand why they may not have enjoyed beer until now, but they can, ...take bigger drinks it tastes less bitter, good advice! But really, this was a bit of fun and a good way to kill a couple of hours.

Good day out and worth a look. Good day out and somewhere worth going if you like beer, but I felt like they had really spread things out and there wasn't quite as much there as there could have been. This could be because I have been to the Guinness Factory and so I had slightly higher expectations. Has the usual stuff - historic pics, pull your own pint, label your own bottle (extra cost), watch the old adverts. You get to see the horses but they are several metres away behind a glass screen. You do get a couple of beers out of it. There is also a 'ride' where you stand on a moving platform, however they crammed far too many in so was very difficult to fit on the platform. The river cruise they offer to the gift shop is good, especially if you time it right and see the city at dusk. Book online, it's cheaper!

Fun tour, but go when less crowded. I just recently went on this tour, and found it to be an interesting way to spend a few hours in Amsterdam. This is no longer an operating brewery, but the original remnants are still there to be explored. The historical aspects are interesting, with some interactive features on the beer making process. The tour is heavy on marketing as to be expected, but the staff makes it fun. I did not find the 18 euro fee to be out of line considering you receive a couple beers at the end and some small promotional gift (I received a bottle opener).All said, I was happy that I went. However I was there at an off peak time, so never waited on line long. I would not have wanted to be here at peak volume and would probably have a much different impression if I had. Truthfully it is not worth waiting on line for an hour or more, so recommend checking the queues before you commit.

Not a beer drinker but still fun. Visited the Heineken Experience on the final day of our TopDeck tour. The experience was a lot of fun, even for someone who is not a beer drinker. You learn the story of the Heineken family, see where the beer used to be made, go through the beer making experience in 4D, see the marketing behind the brand and learn what to look for in a beer. The e-experience of it all is a lot of fun - for tourists, there is free WiFi so you can check yourself in on Facebook to make your friends jealous that you are there. Two free drinks are included in the entry fee, which we thought was good value, as are the unique "experience only" gifts which you can get there - personalised beer bottles and etched glass steins. Most enjoyable, although we were there on a day that the Heineken people admitted was very quiet.

Ok but not brilliant . Visited a few days ago. Overpriced and busy. Not worth the ?18 entry fee. Staff were friendly but content inside was not the best. Personally I would not visit again and would not recommend. On a positive note I did receive 2x half pints of Heineken and 2x branded bottle openers.

great fun. i loved this place and my boyfriend loved it too. we got to pour pints that i was awful at. they give you free beers and it was over all a fun activity. def check it out. go early morning to avoid crowds.

An interactive experience. Definitely worth a visit - we had to queue for about half an hour to get in. It cost €18 to get in and you get a wristband, with three tokens (2 for beer, one for a free gift or a free trip on their boat to the shop, where you can redeem you free gift token) and a bottle opener. There are plenty of hands on exhibits and lots of chances to take photos.You follow one route around the museum, see how beer is made, go on a beer-bottling experience in a simulator, try some Heineken (of course) and have your own chance to learn how to pour the perfect glass. There's also the usual gift shop at the end, with a host of Heineken-branded stuff to take home - all in all, well worth a visit as it's a good mix of old and very new, with good interactive exhibits that will keep you entertained for probably 1 - 2 hours if you do everything.
if you like beer.... if you like beer you may find this interesting... the copper vats are amazing... a few small beers inculded in the ticket price... overall ok

Its nice. The heineken experience is nice. You get to tour through some history, and tips, but also you'll get to see the evolvement of the beer thoughout the years. A must...But try to the buy the tickets from the tour guide in order to avoid waiting in the queue

Lots to see, good value for money. Very interactive experience, plenty of information about the history of Heineken and the beer-making process. I thought it was good value for money, price included a couple of beers and a few bottle openers. Nice day out.Get the free shuttle boat to the Heineken store afterwards, even if you have no interest in actually visiting the store, it's a nice way to see the canals and the city of Amsterdam, although its a short trip.
For beer fans. Very interesting museum where you can see how beer is made. It also has some interactive games that you can have very much fun.

Good Attraction. The Heineken Experience was fun for our entire family. Even if you don't like beer this is a safe bet for everyone. It features not only how they make their beer, but the history of the company, even down to how the famous label we all know was created. The entire attraction is very entertaining and if I didn't know it was Heineken, would have thought Disney created it. At the end of the tour, you are taught how to pour beer from a draft. Not as easy as it looks and offered two complimentary beers also.A very cool gift shop is at the end of the tour.
Great cheap day out sampling beer.. Great interactive welcome into the world of heineken. Lots to see and free beer and gifts at the end.

nothing special. ticket is very expensive,basically u don't see much,is not a museum,is not a factory!! In fact, is a kind of marketing,it's all about promoting the brand,nothing much!! They are promoting their brand without spending anything!!
Amsterdam can offer much more than the Heineken Experience!!!is a waste of time and money

Disappointing. This is more of a marketing museum than anything else. 5 minutes was spent on the actual process of making the beer the rest was on the brand. Very disappointing....and not worth €17 each to get in, don't bother.

Not top of the list but this place is cool!. Went to Heineken experience in Sept 2012. Since we bought Holland Pass, we access the attraction using the pass. You will get 1 rubber band with 2 buttonsnto be exchanged with 2 glasses of beer.The trip was started with welcoming screen that explains how Heineken originated, continued with the stairs thatleads to the museum with collection of pints, glasses, bottles, coaster, etc. vintage items showed here.after the museum, we reached the "factory" with boilers, and real barleys are processed here. The scents of raw materials are very strong here. then you will pass by the stables and horses until younwill reach the interactive cinema on how the beer is produced. After that you may access the "photo and video studios" where youncan take pictures and video with green screen withnselections of background-windmills, canaals, boats. It is free to record our own music video and picture. the video and picture will be uploaded into the website and if ou wish to have the hi res or print the pic into shirt you can directly visit the store.They also showcased the champions league etc.Don't forget to visit the store on our way out

Not much to do. Paying to visit a large advertisment. Cost about £10 entry but you get "2 free" beers.Not all that much to do but walk round an unused brewery picking up bits about the history of the company which I wasnt all to fussed about as dont like Heineken. Place is full of advertisments and overpriced tourist tat.At the end of the tour you get to go on the Heineken "ride" which is nothing more than you standing on a moving floor and watching a 10 minute film on a projector. After the ride you get to the tasting session (20minutes of some clowns telling you how to test the drink smell taste slurp). From tasting you are free to sit in the bar and have your 2 "free" drinks which are tiny and the bars colour schemes make you want to leave as soon as possible.One last note is dont try the Heineken Ice Cold version as it costs twice as much taste the same and is only slightly larger.You also get a free bottle opener but you need to trek half way across amsterdam to get it so i assume not many are actually given out.

Well put together advertisement and educational trip. I'll start off by saying this was a fantastically put-together piece of marketing for Heineken.But I'll also say that this detracted in no way from a very fun and educational experience for a visitor.You learn abt the beer making process, and the history and heritage of this beer behemoth.The staff are entertaining and clearly seem to love their job - who wouldn't? And the fresh draught beers thrown in at the end of the visit don't hurt.I would certainly recommend this to anyone visiting Amsterdam

Very interactive. I wasn't sure what to expect, as I have been to other breweries that are boring, but this was entertaining. There is the expected stuff of telling you all about the beer and their processes and the history and taste tests. They also have lots of entertaining and interactive set ups, like the ride that 'bottles'you, opportunity to print a bottle with your name on it and you can make videos and pictures with themed backgrounds.

Awesome and i don't even like beer!. The experience takes you though the brewing process and introduces the heineken family. You then run through the corporate story. There is a mix of methods employed including a simulation thing and a property tasting. At the end we got a free drink, my girlfriend had the larger while i stuck the a pepsi. I would recommend buying tickets in advance as we had quite a queue to get in.

Lots of fun for the whole family (including the kids). Heinekin really took the time to make this a true "experience". It is clearly that they want to use this space to memorialize their brand - with good reason.The space is well laid out and very easy to get through at whatever pace you wish. You start off by going through a quick "memory lane" Then you get a live demonstration of the ingredients used in the brew - you can actually taste the ingredients (but stay away from the hops as my son found out). Afterwards you go through the old brewery area where you see how the beer was brewed. You can sample the mash while walking through the old oasts.They have a fun 5D experience where you become the beer that is being brewed. This is by no means a top-notch disney ride experience, but it is fun nonetheless and we appreciated Heineken taking the effort to put it together. Toward the end, you are brought in to a room where you can sample the beer and have a discussion with one of the hosts who explain the need for head in the beer, etc. You get two free drink tokens with your admission, and the last part of the experience is to go to a pretty cool series of "bars" that are playing music, etc. and you can just have a drink using your free tokens and enjoy the atmosphere.All in all, this was a fun way to spend a couple of hours on an otherwise, dreary, misty day. While this wouldn't rank up there with Anne Frank, it certainly is a fun time and highly recommended for people of all ages.

If you like beer, this is a fun visit. Fortunately, I found the Heineken Experience entertaining. It’s not a beer museum, it’s a Heineken museum. And it’s okay that they call it Heineken Experience because there are things that are really interactive and engaging.First you get what you would expect, history of the company, how beer is made, what are the ingredients, etc. But then, there’s a short film-ride where you experience what is like to “be the beer”, then you get to taste a small glass of beer along with an explanation that I found interesting and fun. You can finish your beer on the next room where you can sit and watch some Heineken commercials. Then you get to a room with a screen made of bottles and some other interactive features with dark light and digital effects.At the end, you can choose to serve your own beer where you take the other side of the bar and with the guide of a professional you get to pour and drink your own beer. Or you can choose not to pour and get two beers. I chose to pour my own beer and it was fun!You enjoy your beer in a nice ambience and then head out to continue touring Amsterdam.If you like beer, this is a fun visit!

Perfect for groups, gang of friends and beer enthusiasts. If your time in Amsterdam is limited in terms of # of days, I would not recommend this place. Instead, explore the charming canals, biking and other fun activities in the city. If you are staying for more than a week in Amsterdam, and have time, then it is worth the effort to visit this H-experience. Obviously, the company has to share its glorious and interesting history through multi-media. The process of making beer is interesting for the uninitiated. If you are with a group of friends, the last section of the experience can be fun with "disco" lights, music and of course, the free beer that comes with your paid entrance ticket. If you never took a canal boat tour, your ticket includes a free canal ride to the Heineken store to collect your free bottle opener. Again, it is not worth your time to do that if you already took a canal boat tour, or have limited time in your hands.

Excellent for beer lovers!. The Heineken Experience shows you every part of how to make a beer successful. It starts off with its history, production processes & marketing. Also you can enjoy the local Heineken. It also included entertainment area, a 4D show, nightclub area and games room area. We were visiting as a group of lads so it was quite an experience as we all love beer !

Worth a visit. Spent a couple of hours here one afternoon the tour is quite interesting and worth a visit. It explains the history and production of Heineken, with interactive opportunities to sample the beer.

Meh. Should you be at a loss for things to do for a couple of hours, I could think of worse things to do. At the end of the day this is advertising for Heineken with a couple of free beers thrown in. My basic issue is that however you dress is, Heineken just isn't that special a beer and its production is on masse. So therefore I'm not going to be convinced by its marketing that aims to sell you a lifestyle. I enjoyed my beer and enjoyed the stuff on the lead up to it and it passed the time.

Cheesy but fun. We had a fun time at the Heineken experience (I mean they serve you beer how could you not!). Its a little cheesy and there is a lot of promotional activities like getting your photo taken and emailing it to friends. But it does also provide a history of the iconic beer and the merchandise shop is huge. We also took the small canal boat round to the other brand store which was short, but fun and took us back closer to where we needed to go. If you want a more authentic brewery experience however, I would also head to Brouwerij't IJ - which is an active brewery housed in one of the few windmills left in Amsterdam.

This place had the right blend of tha past, present and future in brewery. As the title says, it's got it all. It has an extensive explanation of the history of the beer, merchandise area, entertainment areas, relaxation area, a nightclub/dancefloor/flash lights area, and of course actual bars where you can drink the genuine thing. I really enjoyed my time there.
fun experience. Good fun interactive experience on a day trip to Amsterdam. Great to see how it's all made and sample a couple of beers at the end too.

Great fun and history. Wasn't expecting much.... BUT!!!IT WAS GREAT FUN!.The fun begins the moment you walk in, where the history lesson starts.. There are lots of assistant to explain the beer making processes (in english) and you get 3 glasses of beer with the tickets. What's more, there is a free riverboat ride to the Heineken concept store.....

Expensive, gimmicky, but great beer!. If you're truly into the history of beer and specifically the history of Heineken, then this place would be pretty compelling. Otherwise, it's pretty gimmicky and only semi-interesting. If the price weren't 20 Euros, it'd be a great time, but for that price it doesn't seem like the best. I've had a much more entertaining time at the much simpler, but free and 100% guided tour of the Samuel Adams brewery in Boston where they gave you more free beer, a glass, and a rather inebriated tour guide to enthusiastically tell you all about beer and how it's made and why theirs is great. This one is just a self-guided tour and is more of an interactive museum with some free beer at the end.Overall, this was just so-so.

Must do!. Very fun and engaging. Worth every euro; the free beer throughout and at the end is a bonus. Tip: at the stage where you are taught how to properly sip a beer, answer any questions the bartender poses to the group and you may be rewarded with more beer!

Great Day Out. We had a great time at the Heineken Experiance, The staff were great at the made the whole exp more fun. We also got to sample the beer and pour our own. I also liked the fact that you could move around at your own pace. Plus they had plenty stuff to do once inside. worth a trip as a couple, group or family.

Great attraction! Even for non-beer lovers!. Great atmosphere and lots of fun. Has a cloakroom free off charge, and 15euros entry seemed reasonable! I learnt alot and never felt bored throughout. Very interactive and it seemed to make an effort with those who might not love beer. the staff throughout were eager to explain and make your trip more enjoyable! I advise the personalised beer bottle you can make - only 6 euros! makes a great presents, my friends loved them!Give yourself 2 hours and maybe a lunch break after!

Very worth while. This is well worth a trip to if you're in Amsterdam. It seems lot of effort & money has been put in to making this experience a fantastic trip. You get 2 free drinks in the bar at the end aswell as the odd one or two on your way round. And you recieve a free gift!
One Big Advertisement. Sure we learned about making beer, but the entire time we felt like we were being sold. It is meant for 20 year olds who want to dash through to the beer at the end.

It's a Great Experience. I am a beer lover and have travelled through europe enjoying in my opinion some of the best beer in the world. I have done the tours of other brewers but this one was very entertaining. Yes it is commercialized, but to keep market share it has to be. From the start of the tour it was very friendly and informative. Part of the tour is like a ride. A ride of being brewed, lots of fun. You learn about how the beer is made with good demostrations. At one point they take you to a bar and explain on how you should drink beer, yea! It is fun though. There is a place to print a label on a bottle of beer, I personalized one with my name and it sits in my bar. With admission you get a canal boat ride on the Heineken Experience boat where you can buy a beer and enjoy the scenery. The guys on the boat are fun and will explain anything you ask. If you take the boat up to the Heineken store you recieve a free gift. The day we were there it was sunglasses. All in all it was one of the best tours of this kind and a must to do in Amsterdam. Cheers!!

Don't bother!. The tour is quite interesting but towards the end it's very commercialised. I thought the beer in the brewery wasn't as good as it was in local bars, which is quite strange. Quite expensive but discounts are on leaflet stands in your hotel!

A Fun Way to Spend a Few Hours. Visited Heineken Experience in Dec 12 with Hubby plus 21 year old son and his friend; I am a wheelchair user and all I can say about the experience is that I wish all the tourist attractions were as wheelchair friendly! Brilliant access, a guide to help you through the experience, lift key and the ability to go under your own steam, as everyone else does, rather than to be ushered separately at an aides pace, rather than your own.On top of that, there are several interactive things to do, and at the end, a couple of drinks - soft drink alternatives available.Well Done Heineken and staff!

Really fun Experience!. This is the first brewery tour where they don't actually brew the beer there, it's more just an experience (thus, the name!). That being said, it was still a great time! You can still smell that famous brewery smell that I love, and they have a lot of the old brew kettles that make the tour fun. There are rides, many beer tastings, and lots of opportunities to send messages to the outside world of how much fun you are having inside the Experience! You can save 2 Euro on tickets if you order online and print your own tickets at home. Well worth it, lots of fun!

For all the beer fans out there. This is a really cool thing to do in Amsterdam, simply because you get to learn about how beer is produced, see the actual process, go through the history of Heineken, take part in a 4D experience, plus taste beer in a club-like atmosphere, see some really modern developments. You also get to make some funny videos on a green screen and have a pint pouring crash-course. It's generally quite entertaining and I would highly recommend this to everyone, especially if they are into beer.

not a must see but if you are a beer drinker you should go. quite expensive for what you get. Is nice that you can leave your coat free at the entrance. you get a beer included in the ticked but is not a big deal. you can see the old containers and barrels, personalize a bottle with your name ( you need to pay extra for this) overall was ok. but if you are not a beer fan you won't find it so interesting
fun thing to do. it was nice going there because you get to see the whole history and also how is made and you dont have to love beer to enjoy it
Really fun. Very fun with all kinds of props, from seeing the brewery equipment till a 4d experience being brewed and bottled, couple of beers, plus a canal tour. Worth the visit

Worth checking out. The tour is largely self-guided and fairly heavy on the marketing/branding and less about the actual brewing process. They have a lot of neat extras like custom videos and photos that you can email to yourself and friends. It's worth checking out if you're in the city for a few days.

Seriously surprisingly good. This was not what I was expecting at all. The price may seem a little steep at first but it is well worth it! The tour starts with a bit of history and an explanation of the ingredients and brewing process, then there is a fun 4D ride, tasting, exhibition of some quality ads, some amusing games and tshirt/video creating stations, all ending in a bar (then gift shop). You get 3 drinks (though one is mini) with entry. You can also customise your own bottle and buy a host of heineken-branded merchandise. There are ferries that will take you from the Experience to their main store where you can claim your 'free' (ie included in entry) gift - a bottle opener.Even if you're not that interested in beer it can be a fun couple of hours.

Must see.. The best 15 euros you can spend.We visited as soon as it opened in the morning, and on an empty stomach, so the free samples that you get on the way made the experience a little more interesting still.Lots to see, and lots of interaction, and the staff are so informative and cheerful, even first thing in the morning.The best part was the 'ride'.Very good. Make sure you go.

Worth a visit!. We went there unplanned as our canal boat cruise dropped us off there. The fee was €15, which I think is slightly lower than usually as we went in November but it includes 3-4 small pints of fresh and crisp Heineken. the whole brewery is very interactive, modern and interesting - not your average boring brewery experience! Staff are fun and helpful - even a beer lover will learn a new thing or two! The experience finishes off in a bar with free beers so a good start for a night out in Amsterdam!

If you like beer.... For beer lovers is a good tour. Of course, if you have ever done something similar, dont expect to be impressed. Still is a nice 1 hour tour and you get 3 glasses of beer and a bottle opner included in the price.

Nice experience. Nice way o spend an afternoon. Lots of activities all around the theme of Heineken. Nothing's beats drinking the beer of course. And don't miss the canal ride back to the brand store for your free gift!

A Fun Learning Experience. This was the best 'attraction' during our stay. I dont quite understand some of the negative reviews on this place. It's education, interactive and fun. You learn a lot about the brewing process, the history of Henieken, and the staff are very helpful, even though they're doing the same thing all day/week/year. There are many interactive 'games' you can play, we enjoyed the 'beer pouring' test and a simple must, is to do the 'Tulips From Amsterdam' video sing-a-long, which you can then email to yourself. Dont worry about looking silly, everyone does it! You are given a wrist band with a couple of tokens attached which gives you 2 beers at the end of the tour, however, the final fun thing to do, is to see actually how many different ways you can devise to obtain more 'free' beers. EG, "someone just took my beer off the table", pretending to drop your token in the pot, etc. We obtained 10 beers, which probably helped to increase our enjoyment!Please tick the box if you found this helpful, thank you.

Interesting cool place!. Lots of history.Good that we get to have some fun interaction.Walking quite a lot, should have more place to sit or more seats for people who stop to drink.Worth to pay.Recommended. :)
Nice fill of a couple of hours. I had a bike and a couple of hours. This was a great way to learn about the brewing process and what makes Heineken unique. I would recommend this to the right people.

One of the best brewery tours we've been on...... Highly recommend this attraction in Amsterdam, we both thoroughly enjoyed the few hours we had here. The staff were friendly and there was a good atmosphere throughout.We got there at the right time as when we went to collect our coats (the cloakroom is free of charge and is a nice touch) there were loads of people trying to get in. The beer is fab, the extras are fun and its not overcrowded. There's more to do than at the Guiness factory in Dublin. I'd highly recommend this place!

An excellent way to spend a few hours. I had heard a lot of good reviews about the Heineken Experience before going to Amsterdam and set some time aside to visit it. I was not let down. Having booked tickets beforehand, I was able to jump the queue and go straight into the museum. The first half of the museum focuses on the history of the Heineken brand and how the beer is brewed. You get to experience the beer at different points of the brewing process and you can even taste it before it's ready - not a pleasant taste, but good to know! Before learning how to taste beer, you experience being a bottle of Heineken inside a 4D ride, which was brilliant. The second half of the museum focuses on the Heineken brand now and allows for a great deal of interactivity, for example, you can be in a music video, you can be a Heineken DJ, or you can appear in the latest James Bond film! The experience ends with a free beer in the (very busy and crowded) bar, which tries to recreate the feeling of being in a club. A walk through the souvenir shop finishes off the experience well.Two important tips are to book tickets online and to leave your coat in the free staffed cloakroom at the beginning.

Good value and fun!. Entry was 17 euros each but we had 3 euro discount vounchers, with that we got 3 drinks throughout the tour and a really fun, enjoyable few hours! The place is full of interactive things to do and would be suitable for all ages, despite its theme! Highly recommended to visit, we had so much fun here!

Sublime Sunday Jazz Sessions. The Heineken Experience is best known for its interactive experiences about brewing and tasting beer. On the last Sunday of the month you can enjoy an intimate live Jazz Concert on the top floor overlooking Amsterdam and of course enjoy the taste of a Heineken Beer. Great setting, excellent artists and a cold beer makes this a great Sunday afternoon experience.

Heineken the magic is there. Great experience, if you visit Amsterdam a must, even if you do not like beer, you plan a visit. Interactive, beer culture, history of the greatest beer brand. Fun, by pouring your own beer. Great shopping and goodies, also boat trip included and beer tasting. Go for the heineken experience.

Fun place to go with a group. You have the opportunity to have three beers total with your admission. You get to walk through the process of making the beer, which is interesting to see. Toward the end, it gets very interactive. Heineken sponsors several sports teams. You can play video games and watch short clips or just skip it all together. You have the opportunity to speak with some employees and ask questions about the beer and the process.It can still be interesting if you aren't a beer lover. Save at least an hour for this stop.
Beerland.... A must for all beer fans.The brewery is huge and the tour is self guided, but along the way there is always someone to tell you a little bit of history.

Go there and become a fan. I didn`t like heineken so much, but after know the history and visit the interactive atraction, i become a fan. The place is a funny way to know the whole process of bier production. The people are nice and the bier is cold. You can play games, send messages to friends or just drink your biers, but you will like the visit.
Very good to induce you to the brand. Very good to induce you to the brand, unfortunately had no time to collect my free gift :( Must go in Amsterdam

Wonderful entertaining tour. Well worth the ticket price. You can get a discount off the ticket in most tour books. Ticket price includes at least 3 beers, a Disney-type ride (kinda hokey but fun) and lots of information about a very successful beer empire. Ticket price also includes a free canal ride ( wait until later in the day to take the ride, quite beautiful by night).

Well worth a visit. Not only do you get a very informative and interesting tour, you get two beers as well! The experience of 'being brewed' was very well done - go and see what I mean! Well worth a couple of hours.

A good exhibit!. This tour takes less than 2 hours to finish and the entire exhibit is a lot of fun. It is less than 5 min walk from leidseplein. I wouldn't recommend making special plans for this - but is a good detour!The videos, commercials, tasting and the brewery people make it a lot of fun!

A must do. Wasn't sure what to expect as we was taken in the back of a push bike quizzing round the streets but we had a brilliant time. Was a good blend of interesting and fun. There was a man asking questions about the beer, offering beers out and cracking jokes. The gift shop was conviently placed after the bar. After a couple of beers I wanted to buy everything! Brought some very smart, engraved glasses back home as presents. Thourghly enjoyed myself and there was a good bar across the road as well! What more could you want?

Fun and a great gift shop!. I don't drink beer but as part of my wifely-duties, I must sometimes do these kind of tours to please my husband! The brewery is a beautiful building, although the location is a little further out so be prepared for a decent walk. Amsterdam is so beautiful though so you will enjoy the scenery while walking over. We purchased our tickets online beforehand which meant we didn't have to wait in the long lineup - definitely recommended. The whole experience was really cool. Lots of different exhibits and everything is very interactive. You get to drink 3 beers (one in a tasting lesson and two at the bar at the end) so this is definitely good value for your money. Everyone we encountered throughout the experience was very friendly and knowledgeable. I especially loved seeing the horses, all named after board members! One big perk is the canal cruise to the Heineken Store at the end. By the time we finished our tour, it was early evening so the canals were all lit up. The free canal cruise not only took us back much closer to our hotel so we wouldn't have to walk but it was also narrated and educational. We had already done a canal cruise but this allowed us to see the canals at night - beautiful! The gift shop has a lot of fun souvenirs to bring back home and your entry bracelet gets you a free gift!
Heineken Experience. Excellent two hours. Great fun trip. 3 glasses of Heineken and a lovely 20 minute River Amstell trip at he end. Lovely. good value.Would advise book it before on iternet...

Worth for a visit. I visited Heineken Experience in early October, me and my friend enjoyed very much of it, modern design and many interactive games, the spotlight should be the 4D bottling, which u as a beer to see how a Heineken beer is made. Also at last to make my own bottle of beer with my name worth everything!!!

Fun for our group!. Three older teens and three moms went to the Heineken Experience at about 5:30 on a Saturday evening. The line getting in wasn't too bad and we had plenty of time to go through the whole "experience", including trying wort, and being "bottled" in the 4-D experience. All the folks working throughout the experience were very pleasant and knowledgeable. For English-speaking folks, this experience is first rate, as it appeared that it was all done in English. The gift shop had lots of Heineken-themed items. There were interactive things to do. All in all, a good 2 1/2 hours spent!

Well worth a visit. A brother of mine recommended visiting it and it was well worthwhile. Easy to get to with a short tram ride from the canal ring area. Entry price was 14 euro. Well laid out and it takes you through all the history of Heineken and then past equipment and vats and other machinery with explanations on the brewing process. Near the end of the tour there is a screening room for a short video with a platform (which you stand on) which moves in relation to what is being shown on screen. A beer is also included, and you have the opportunity to take photos and then you can email it to yourself and friends. I suggest allowing an hour minimum for the tour.

Worth a visit. Visited this place once with my friends and again with my family.The whole concept is very well implemented. I liked how they start with an impressive video show of a bartender telling you the story behind the brewery's establishment, followed by the brewing process complete with explanations from an actual staff.I also liked the beer-tasting bit where they educate you on how beers are supposed to be enjoyed.The highlight was the 4-D ride in a screening room. I thought that was really good fun and everyone I have been with have enjoyed it.They also did well to offer some unconventional souvenirs like letting guests record and send music videos and e-cards, and buy customised bottled of Heineken. All these make the experience truly unique and stand out.
nice. it was great , it was funny and it was a very nice experience to all who love beer , thank you heineken

Fun time at the Heineken Experience. We ended our Europe trip with a brief stay in Amsterdam, mainly to see the Anne Frank house. After visiting the Rijksmuseum we saw the Heinekin Experience and decided to go, on a whim. I think we were about the oldest (50's) people there, but we had as good of time as everyone else. Pricey, but Heineken has done a super job of mixing information, history, entertainment, and blatant brand marketing. Everything is in English. Good beer, good way to cleanse the palate after seeing sublime art.

informative. As expected it was more of another marketing effort from Heineken than a real tour. But we all have to admit that marketing was what made Heineken and that they are pretty good at it. It was informative, fun and with interesting staff.Gather some fiscount coupons at your hotel or in the tourist information center as 2 euros discount coupon will allow you yo get another at the end of the tour.
Nice. A nice walk in the pilsner beer world, with some "degustation" tips and a couple of beers included. Worth the time spent.

Beer = Awesome. I went to the Heineken Experience early September 2012. It was one of the few attractions that I went into while I was in Amsterdam and it was worth every penny. The experience as a whole was not only very informative but fun at the same time. There were many interactive parts on the tour which are fun to play around with. Definitely a must do for all beer lovers

Interactive and fun. I wanted to go to the House of Bols instead but my husband persuaded me to go and I have to say I enjoyed it much more than bols. It is informative, intreactive and funny and everything was really well thought-out. Even though I do not consider Heineken a great beer by any means, the whole experience was great fun, even if a bit heavy on the Heineken brand brainwashing side.

Experience this Amazing Brand. The Heineken Experience showcases the brand and of course the beer. You get to see how the brand has grown from a small family business to huge multi-national company.There are a few fun activities included in the price of entry, send photos from the Heineken Experience to friends and family, make dance videos, play a "James Bond" theme game (sponsors of the new Bond FIlm), and you can also get your own bottle of beer with label that says it was bottled by you (for 6 Euro) which is a great souvenir. At the end of the tour you get 2 free beers.Really enjoyed the experience and would recommend it to young and old alike.

Good learning experience.. Good learning experience to get to know more about my fav Heineken beer. The tour is interactive with excellent explanation using visual and audio aids. The 4D experience is wonderful where you are being brewed in a beer and there are effects of water splashed onto you and etc. Best of all you get to have complimentry drinks and learn how to appreciate it.

A decent experience.. I went to the Heineken Experience late Aug 12.I went just before opening time and I was pleasantly surprised. There was no real queuing time and i got it. The price was a steep 15 Euros but if you look at even at the pubs and restaurants nearby they all have vouchers given you a couple Euro saving i think it was. You do how ever get just over a pints worth in beer as well though.I did go on my own and without much of the crowd in the place.I was able to experience it at my own pace and use all the interactive displays without having to wait.Overall it was a good half a day out on my own =)Tip: Try getting there before the crowds and you will definitely enjoy it more.

Great fun. The fun thing about the Dutch museums are the interactive parts. This is no different. It is fun learning all about the guys who started Heineken as it is all done in a very short and quick version. you will not be bored at any given time during your tour. The part where you get to be "brewed" is hysterical fun and of course the learning of how to properly tap a Heineken is fun as well. The room where you can sit around and watch all the old Heineken commercials is a place where you could easily spend hours. All in all a great time. you should make sure to take at least half a day to do the whole thing.

A good way to fill a day. The best parts of this tour: free beer(!!); 15 minute guided boat tour between the factory and the merchandise store (where you collect your "free" gift - a bottle opener); seeing/smelling the ingredients of beer, and observing the facilities that were once used to make the beer. Aspects I didn't enjoy: I felt that I was being sold Heineken throughout, whereas I had hoped to learn a bit more about beer making in general - it is a very commercial feel.
great day out. all good here animals well cared for ,cafes good and reasonable prices definately visit again easy to get to

Branding at its best. As my wife started working for Heineken in Tanzania, we thought it would be great to visit the Heineken Experience to 'feel' the brand. And did we feel it! The journey was exciting, from early Heineken to current. The horse stables most impressive and the little showcase by the bartender was fresh. Not to forget the 'ride' were you are transferred into the brewing of Heineken. I was invited here but I think the cost is around 25 Euro's, including a couple of cold ones in the end. Better have a wallet full as there is this fantastic lady who will carve your name in a glass, Heineken glass off course! The merchandise for sale is just out of this world, truly amazing! If you are a beer lover, I highly recommend that you visit, after all, Heineken is the 3rd largest company in the world- not bad if you think that they only started with a small brewery years ago!Heineken, well done! 5 stars well earned!

Enjoyed. A good experience to see how beer is made. Excellent Demos and beer tasting sessions. Free beers were provided. fun things to try inside. the music area inside was good. exit shops was interesting too. Heiniken Merchandise was expensive though. A must visit for anyone travelling to Amsterdam.
Truly an experience. Must visit place when in Amsterdam. Specially in the Brew You Experience. Loads of information about Heineken shared during the visit.

Decent visit. Me and 3 good friends went to the Heineken museum on Saturday, Sept.08th 2012. We ordered online and paid 15 euros each. The tram stopped 100 meters away, and since we had pre-ordered, we didn't have to stand in line. The stuff presented was so-so interesting, some historical info, some displays and some funny-stuff that had pretty little with beer-brewing to do. Finishing the tour in the bar with 2 beers included, and last stop at the store. The store had some nice gadgets that were slightly overpriced, and all in all we left the facility feeling satisfied, but not more than that.
FANTASTIC. we stumbled on this slightly and thought we would give it a go. Glad we did, brilliant experiance and a few cheeky pints too :)

I don't drink beer. I don't drink beer, but I really wanted to go to the Heineken Experience. I just think it was a fun visit. I also enjoyed getting a personalized bottle of beer and some great glasses :-)

dont expect to get drunk here!. A very corporate afternoon out but have to say very enjoyable. Kept us entertained for a few hours and learned something too. Its very well laid out with lots of technology.Book tickets online to save some money. You get some sample size drinks, no pints here! We managed to sink in a few extra ones but despite what other reviews might say they give the sample beers with an iron fist and getting extra ones from them is quite difficult. Def worth a visit!

We has a good time!. It was my first beer experience, can't compare with anything else, and it was fun, although too commercial: nice stands every step offering to make a "heineken" photo or t-shirt for additional cost.. Too much advertising!
Well worth the money. Excellent tour, lots to see & taste! you can stay as long as you like, the tour is broken up into different sections. Loads of interactive stuff to do as well.

Great Fun!. Learning all about beer and then getting to pull yourself a draft? Awesome.
Negative? A bit too expensive for what you get.

It was an experience. This place is near the Rijksmusium, my daughter wanted to check it out. There is a small fee to get in that includes free beer. Once you enter they give you a green plastic Heineken bracelet with three buttons attached, two are for beer and the third is for a free gift that can only be used at their gift shop that is located near Rembrandts House. The free gift is a postcard with a bottle opener. When you enter the experience it seemed like a maze of pictures, movies and a sampling of beer (this was not part of the bracelet button). There was a bad 4-d lame presentation. Then at the end a fun bar where you could turn in your buttons for your tall cold glasses of beer.

You pay 17euros to get brainwashed. Literally.. This tourist trap is especially terrible... it is obvious that its meant to cater to young Americans who don't have anything to do. They try to play off the fact that you have to shell out so much money by giving you a total of 65cl of beer over the course of the tour (15cl + 25cl + 25cl). Almighty Heineken beer is exhalted and praised the whole way through, and they bombard you with commercials left and right. There is actually one spot in which you can lie down in a booth that encapsulates you, and you do nothing but watch commercials. If that's not the definition of brainwashing, I dont know what is. Just take a look at the attached picture that I took!Nobody within the tour ever says the truth, which is that most Dutch people think that Heineken is very overrated and indeed has no taste.

Great fun!. Visited Heineken Experience on a rainy Sunday afternoon & walked straight in without having to queue! Tour was interactive & interesting - great way to spend a rainy afternoon. Enjoyed 2 free heinekens at the end - but these were 25cl (not pints!). Bought tickets online in advance to save a few euros. Amsterdam canal cruises opposite offer a combination package (canal tour & heineken experience) which is cheaper! Got free bottle opener gift from heineken shop which is in Remembrantplein area.

Book online in advance to save money. Well worth a visit when in Amsterdam with lots to do, see and drink. The whole tour took us a couple of hours but we were entertained the whole time and got three drinks as part of the experience. The staff that speak and interact with you do so in English, including the boat ride back to the centre that came as part of the ticket.

Interactive!. I have been to Brugges Zot brewery prior coming to Heineken Experience, and Heineken is much better and more interactive. The beer tastes really "fresh" from there. Not only they taught how to appreciate the beer, see-smell-taste, they also taught how to draught a beer perfectly. And you get a faux "certificate" for that.Do get the Heineken glass and have it engraved. The big glass in a metal tin are priced at 8 euros. The free gift we got from the brandstore was a beer opener.

Great brewery tour. Impressed! I was supposed to have a meeting and due to a late cancellation I wanted to see something in Amsterdam and noticed this brewery tour which was something a little different. I have previously only done the Guinness and Tsingtao brewery tours as well as a few micro brewery ones. Got to say, Heineken were up there with the Guinness tour in Dublin (which is also great). You are allowed two drinks and a free boat ride with your ticket, you learn about the brewing process etc as you would with any tour. However, a good addition included a small ride experience that 'bottles' you as a beer as you are the beer being made, heated, checked and bottled and a section on football sponsorship and community work. Enjoyed the tour and it was relatively inexpensive.
Fun for the whole family.. Very interactive. But it will take you longer than the estimated one hour. It will take closer to 2 but worth the time spent.
Not as hokey as I thought. I was expecting a very commercializedexperience. It was actually very good. Learned how experts drink beer. And, the beer tastes really good there.

That´s all?. If all you aim is to get two Heineken beers for 17 euro go there.
Nothing interesting to see inside. Two brewing apparatus, horses stable and 4D attraction exciting only for 3 years old kids (not exactly the target). Ah, you can get a bottle of Heineken with your name on it. A souvenir your drunk uncle would kill for.

different. So if you get fed up with looking at paintings, ships and the other usual Dutch experiences then go on have a wander around the Heineken its all good fun and they do give you what equates to about 2/3rd of a pint of Heineken (did you know that the e's are smiling e's!!!!?) included in the price. After you have been you will so notice the number of heineken adverts - nothing like product placement!

no real substance. firstly we waited in the cold for 40 mins which wasn't much fun, We should have booked online but couldn't get the printer to work and it stated you MUST print in order to gain entry :( I would recommend booking online though because you save 2 euro AND you walk straight in.The H.E. it's self was ok, we learnt a little about the heineken family, how the basic ingredients are made into beer (we tasted the Wort too, very weird) visited the Dray horses and stood in line for 30 mins to go on a 4D ride(!) then had a beer tasting class followed by 2 more 25cl beers.We didn't take the free shuttle boat after as it only departs once an hour and we'd just missed one, but we did collect our free gift of a rather cool bottle opener.I would just rate this as average though because I felt their wasn't enough detail about the brewing or packaging/design - something which the Guiness Store in Dublin does so well. I had fun though and it was a perfect hangover cure!

But the beer tastes fine!!. For 17 euros you get access plus two beers, so can I please pay less and skip the beer since I'm not a hard-core drinker? This comes when the Anne Frank house charges you 9 euros only.On the plus side, there's a nice interactive feature, and a very nice and large store. You also get to engrave you name on a beer bottle, and go through a tasting tutorial. But I thought that I will watch a live fermentation of beer. Be aware that this is NOT a brewery. This is a homage/museum. Still, no place on earth I know of would educate you about beer in an hour time.Would still go if time went back.

A really fun, informative tour. I booked tickets online for this tour as it was EUR2 cheaper than buying on the door - it also meant you could skip the queue (although there wasn't one when we arrived, but there was when we left). I booked mostly for my husband, but once there we both thoroughly enjoyed ourselves seeing the whole process of beer making and the pride of the Heineken company in its heritage. It helps that they ply you with beer during the process and we had about 2 pints in all included in the tour as well as a free gift (it's a bottle opener). It takes about an hour and the end of the tour gets more and more interactive with lots of clever gizmos to play with. An excellent stop to avoid the rain and worth a visit whatever the weather.

Free Beer, need I say anymore. Well, its not free as it cost me €15 for the ticket, but they may as well be free. Also if you get chatting to the staff in the pour your own section you can get a couple more extras. Tour was fun, but I was there for the beer. Also got a nice gift of a bottle opening. We had 4 beers, maybe 5 beers each, a mini one during the tour and then also the bottle opener! It's Free beer when you look at it like that.Also the staff were very, very nice too.

Very dynamic. This place is extremely well used, is very dynamic and fun. I trully recomend a visit. At the end you can make a beer bottle personalized with your name.To offer as souvenirs is very funny and is not expensive.

Fun Beer Tour. A nice experience that is quite interactive and fun! The people working made it really enjoyable and the beers were a great touch at the end! My favourite part had to be the canal boat ride though. You can take it both ways as well if you need to get back to the area! Well worth the trip and very reasonable in price.

Well worth a visit. Thoroughly enjoyed our visit here. Plenty of information about the Heineken family and the brand. Enjoyed the interactive games and the overall experience. Two beers included in the entrance fee along with a few samples along the way. Would recommend a visit. Might be worth buying tickets online beforehand as we saw long queues when passing the brewery in the days after our visit.

Not the most action packed attraction. I sided enjoy visiting this but found out that it was rather dull in comparison to,other brewery tours. I would still recommend it pas the beer you taste at the end is the freshest and most satisfying beer I have had the pleasure to drink.

Definitely worth a visit!. Definitely worthwhile when you visit Amsterdam!
Fun morning and really interesting. Good for children too :)

A good way to pass an hour and a half on a cold day in Amsterdam. We had to queue in the cold for about 20 minutes to get in and would strongly advise that, if possible, you book on line before arrival and then you can miss the initial queue. Whilst I enjoyed the tour it is a historical brewery, not a worling one, but this does not detract from one's enjoyment. The one interactive experience I tried in the Champions League section did not work properly in that I was unable, despite several attempts, to watch the goal from this year's match between Barcelona and Spartak Moscow that I chose. Still this is a good way to spend an hour and a half for those who like a pilsner beer.

Good afternoon diversion. Great place to spend a couple of hours, especially if the weather is pour. Very well presented and up-to-date. Nice glassware and two beer tasting at the end. Fun stop even if you don't like beer.

worth a trip. the two beer bar at the end of the tour is a nice touch... a bit of history on the company, but not too much. quite interesting and a nice way to spend a couple of hours if the weather is bad

The best from Amsterdam. Even I'm not a beer drinker at all, it was my best thing in Amsterdam trip. Excellent staff, very friendly. Tour was interesting from the beginning to the end. Very modern type of travel through brand history. I really enjoyed this tour. Shop is great with various things from heineken.

Heineken Experience. We went to the Heineken Brewery not expecting to be able to access the attraction. My husband is a T12 paraplegic and this was a very old building. However, on enquiry, we were given a key to access the lifts and a chart detailing how to get around. If assistance was need, it was absolutely no trouble to the staff to provide it. I would not hesitate to recommend this to everyone, including wheelchair users.

Amazing! Entertaining and great value. This was probably one of the best things we paid for in Amsterdam. Many details from others below, but highlights and strong points for me were the fact that you really ambled round at your own pace. Didn't feel herded at all even when they do group you together at little moments throughout you then easily lose the crowd again. Learnt so much and in a really clear and interesting way. Really entertaining bits that managed to avoid being too cheesy, like when you go for a simulated "in a bottle" experience. Also many points along the way where you can just sit down and chill on some very comfy couches! Kept us amused for a good few hours, refreshed at the end with the included beer and got some very reasonable Christmas presents for hard to please men at the end! Really really great experience. I only wish all tourist designed attractions were done this thoughtfully and in such an engaging way...

A good beer buzz experience. The Heineken Experience was fun.....just good, old fun. I'm not overly interested in beer, I usually don't drink beer and never give beer a lot of thought, but this was really fun. We were there on a Thursday, early afternoon. The crowds were light.The tour was interesting, the staff was friendly and the exhibits were amusing. Whoever designed the experience has a sense of humor. I thought it was a reasonable value for the money. The boat ride was also a nice treat.
Worth Seeing. I admit I am not a fan of beer but I must say I did really enjoy this. It was really interesting to learn about the Heineken business. Well done!

Informative, fun, excellent tour, overall- A fantastic "Experience". I was very apprehensive while shelling out the ticket money, as I was a bit unsure about the Heineken Experience at the Heineken brewery in Amsterdam. I was given a wristband with three buttons, two for a 250 ml X 2 / 350 ml X 1 glass of beer and one for a free gift. The tour took us through the entire history of Heineken beer and the beer making process with some beer tasting along the way. There was a section where we got to see all Heineken ads (including a Hindi one !!!). We also got our name engraved on a bottle (for a price though). The crew was very cooperative and spoke very good English. The biggest attraction for me was the short boat ride to the Heineken free gift shop. The guide (Leonard, I believe) did keep us engrossed and made the boat trip very memorable exprience. The gift store and also the shop at the brewery are very well stocked and though the souveniers are priced a little on the higher side, one should definitely buy something to remember the trip. This is a must visit place. Recommended for everybody.

Great fun...informative and excellent value!. Having heard and read great things about the Heineken Experience we had high expectations and they were met and even exceeded! This experience can be enjoyed by all, young and old and even those who aren't really interested in or drink beer. It is clear that the companies philosophy for detail, perfection and people in its beer is also found here at the experience. Staff were genuinely enthusiastic to make the experience a fantastic one with them all having a clear pride in their work and an eye for detail. Many interactive exhibits along the way and just enough reading information so as not to get too bogged down in the details. Who ever came up with the idea of the experience is very clever and should be applauded. A great marketing tool but one which will pay off and provide its customers with a memorable experience. The beer tasting was generous with about 2-3 beers along the way. Clever personalised gift options throughout where you can pay as you go if you wish. If you don't want to pay for extras that's fine - you can email yourself funny pictures and video clips. The experience was extremely well thought out, efficient and very clean. I can imagine it gets busy but go early and avoid the crowds. It's worth it. The 15 minute boat cruise is a nice extra touch where they take you to the brand store where you can get a free gift. A large "e" bottle opener at the time we went. For €17 I can't recommend the experience enough. If you get a discount voucher in any hotel lobby it drops to €15 - even better!So what are you waiting for?

An informative, fun, self-guided tour.. I was stationed in Germany in the early '80's and visited Amsterdam several times. Each time, I tried to visit the brewery, I got lost and missed out. I made sure this did not happen again. I was actually in line with dozens others waiting for the doors to open, on a beautiful Sunday morning. While there is no actual brewing anymore in this building, this is where it all started. There are many wonderful displays, and artifacts that let you relive the history of this great beer. You can go as fast or as slow as you want, or even back track if you skipped a portion. There are some cool modern touches near the end of the tour, where you can email, video or a multitude of things. Of course, you can get all kinds of gifts, (personalized) and best of all you get to taste the beer. I recommend the "extra cold". They are very punctual so don't be late.

Great way to spend a few hours in Amsterdam.. A great modern tour of the Heineken brewery in downtown Amsterdam. For anyone that likes beer, this is amust do activity. The tour is a collection if history, instructional videos and beer tasting mixed in with fun interactive exhibits that bring the tour to life. The tour takes about 3 hours and is time well spent. Most people will love it.

Even if you don’t drink beer is worthy. I did not expect that much fun. Let’s be honest, brewery is not a rock science, but still interesting. I like beer, but not a fan. They were very clever in the way they built the experience; it uses a lot of multimedia and of course, drinking beer. My wife and I had a lot of fun.

#23? Should be #1!! This was epic!. Ok, if you love beer, do this tour. Its so cool! You get to see how its made, you get a visual ride, and you get to taste the beers and meet people at the end! You also get to play with some really cool equipment, like a Wii beer pourer, to see if you know how to pour a beer, and a DJ set. You can take your photo everywhere and email it to have it put on Heineken Merchandise too. They offer a free boat tour to their warehouse which was fun too, they even throw in another beer!

Surprisingly great!. I did not have high expectations as I don't really care about brewery tours. But this was great! It is as interactive as you want it to be and it's clear that Heineken has gone to great lengths to keep you engaged. There are numerous photo ops (which I love), horses and even an actual simulation ride! There is a whole room where you can be the star of your own movies, postcards and music videos that you can send to yourself or others for free. Plus there is beer at the end! You also get a boat ride (included in the price) to the Heineken Brand store! You can spend a few hours there and be happy about it!

Cool stop. We didn't do the tour but stopped by the store. There is a lot of heinkene stuff you can customize. We did the customization on a beer bottle. You can write up to 22 characters on the bottle.

Super worth it!. This was by far one of the highlights of our time in Amsterdam! We had a blast! We got our tickets in advance and walked right in. It was so fun. The whole thing is very interactive and you get 3 beers. The staff is great, and there are lots of photo opportunities which we all loved. I would definitely recommend it to others!!! And the free canal boat shuttle afterwords was totally worth it. We got an awesome ride, had a beer and got a great little tour!

Fun if you like beer. Simple tour on how beer is made and you get three small beers, but even better you get a free boat ride in the canals at the end of the tour. I would definitely recommend it if you're in Amsterdam.

After this "Experience" you will certainly understand beer!. Buy tickets through the site and avoid queues.The tour inside the old factory's cool to understand how to brewing, but I've been in a (in Pilsen in the Czech Republic) much more interesting and unforgettable.All the staff are very helpful and are always ready to help you.

A must for beer lovers. While not a true factory tour, the Heineken Experience is worth the price. The tour takes you on a step-by-step experience on how beer is made using a moving platform and special effects.The hands-on displays, demonstration of beer-pouring techniques, and of course, the free beer are all great.If you take your green rubber bracelet to the brand store via the free canal boat, you will receive a free gift.My only complaint was the rowdiness of some people because of the free beer.

Fun!. People kept telling me that this was too touristy for them. But who the heck are they??? I had fun! The history of Heineken is interesting and so is seeing how they used to brew. They show you how to properly drink a beer, also as an option, you can learn how to properly pour a beer (and then drink it). I recommend this. I had fun
Worth the visit. interesting story of how beer is made from hops to the bottle. Also they have a great fake dj turntable which is fun to play around on

Great fun. This is the brewery tour of the heineken brewery. They don't brew here any more but you can see the big vats the hops etc. was mixed in. Its a great mixture of info and fun. You go on a simulation where you are the beer! Lots of modern interaction to appeal to young adults plus a bit of football, they sponsor champions league. Also get lots of beer included in your ticket price! You can even have a go at pulling the perfect pint!

Go in a group and make it your own experience. For €17 maybe I was expecting more than I got, but I guess if you were in a group there's plenty more tailored to that than the lone tourist which you'd certainly enjoy. It provided an interesting history of the Heineken brand and gave you a glimpse of some of their traditional brewing methods, but the rest then became more of an advert for them than anything else - nothing wrong with that, but don't expect more! The free beers you get are a nice unique selling point - a small glass after the 4D experience goes down well and then either 1 x 35cl extra cold Heineken or 2 x 25cl regular at the end with the tokens on your wrist band round the visit off nicely, although in a group of friends or family you'd enjoy the bar at the end more than the rest.

A must see !. The Heineken Experience is a must see while in Amsterdam. The tour is on your own which is great so you can take your time and enjoy the brewery. It is very interactive throughout and the ride is fun. The tour offers two drinks at the end and a fun environment to enjoy your beer. There can be a line outside to buy tickets to get in. If you have a chance to buy online, I would recommend that.

They Almost Should Charge For Promotion. I paid a discounted price of €15.00 from the regular €17.00 with a hotel coupon. (Doesn't open until 11am.) For that I got 2 1/2 beer and the chance to be sold a lot of other things with Heineken on it. Way over price for what you get since it is just promoting their beer. Don't bother to go to the Heineken Brand Store afterwords either walking or waiting for a shuttle boat. For you trouble you get a gift of a bottle opener.

Good but expensive. We a party of 10, Two OAPs, three teens rest adults, went at about 1130 on a Sunday, no queue.Staff are excellent and helpfull and as with 99% of Dutch people spoke excellent english, infact the tours in english with all the signs in english tooIt was good to see but a lot of it is to do with how they advertise. I wouldnt go back but glad we have been.We didnt feel it was good value for the admission price even though we got three halfs of beer its still expensive.

The Heineken Experience. You can't go to Amsterdam without going to see the brewery, the tour include two drinks, for the beer lover, this is very ideal! The fascinating thing about it is, it's within the City Centre!
Interactive tour. This was not your boring walk and read. Lots of little activies as you toured and the best part ends at the bar where you get 2 beers!

Awfull experience!. We turned up the the Heineken experience at around 4pm on a Sunday and the queue was at the corner... the queue had been longer all day but we were told to come back at 4pm as it's quieter then! We didn't mind the queue as it was moving and the weather was good. To avoid the queue just book online in advance and you can go straight to the front - but you will need to print off your ticket. The brewery was so packed full of people the staff where having trouble keeping up, one member of staff (lookng a bit frazzeled) said that it was too busy and they couldn't cope!! We where rushed through the various areas (there was no map available), having to queue up again for 30 minutes to watch the 4D experience, with no staff to advise on wait time or if we could skip this part, a lot of other tourists got annoyed and there where a few heated words exchanged with various people. Due to the crouds they crammed people into the 4D experience so in the end it was a huge let down.Most of the interactive elements either had huge queues or they didn't work and once you got to the bar upstairs you had to queue yet again to get your free small beer. This part felt like you where in a dingy club, with sticky floors, standing room only and broken glass left lying on the floor and table tops. I am sure if you go when it is quiet and all the interactive elements are workjing and the staff are less stressed then this would be a good experience, but for 17Euros I should have stayed in the pub!!

Great fun!. Really interesting interactive, self-guided tour with lots to see, taste, smell and try. Two pints at the end of the tour plus a half-pint in the middle where you learn to fully enjoy a Heineken was included in the fee, and also a free, guide canal boat ride to their centrally located branded store. The guide here was very funny and they offered a possibility to buy a Heineken during the ride. Great value for money and a wonderful visit if you like beer, or history!

Well worth the novelty. So many interesting and interactive things to do on this tour - it was a blast! Every room was interesting and visually very amazing. Definitely would recommend going but do be prepared to spend money to get in and if you want any souvenirs. €17 entry. Free gift was a cool idea but turned out as a 15min walk to their off-site brand store to redeem a pretty basic bottle opener. A great experience but they definitely don't need all the money they try to bleed from you!

Be ready to walk and drink beer. This was a fun place to visit. You will be on a self guided tour of the space and will get to see a lot of how breweries used to be. At the end you will be able to get two free beers to enjoy.

A little too pricey for what it is. Thought we would give it a go as reviews ok. We paid €17 each would have been much happier if we had paid half of that. The walk through the tour was mostly pictorial with a brief explanation of the brewing process from one of the guides. My friend has mobility problems and we both felt the tour is not suitable for disabled visitors. Not a lot of opportunities to sit down.The videos and picture opportunities at the end is good. The bar was packed with not too many seats. You get a bracelet with two free tokens with a choice of Heineken or Pepsi. On the whole not too bad but pricey for what you get for your money.

Even if you don't like beer...worth a visit. Showed up around 1pm for the tour and there wasn't much of a line, be warned this place is huge and you could spend a lot of time there. I think we were there for easily 90 mins. You get a couple of free beer with the tour and there is a map that we got at a tourist booth with a discount on the tour if you can find it. Saved us 6 euros. They offer a 15min canal ride as well once the tour is over to get a free gift, the guys microphone wasn't working that well which kind of sucked because he had some interesting stuff to say but it was cool to get a short free canal ride in as well. I think the line ups get quite a bit longer as the day goes on, we went a bit later for the canal ride and the line up was pretty long.

Not what I expected, in a good way!. I went in expecting a normal brewery tour which included a quick look at their equipment a few free beers and that's it. The really designed this to be an "experience". While I am a much bigger fan of craft beers than mass produced yellow lagers, I am always up to try a fresh beer. I also homebrew so I am familair with the process and they did a fantastic job in showing you each of the ingredients and how they are used to make beer. They even had samples of wort to try so you can see what beer tastes like before it is fermented. They also have a 4D movie that shows you the entire process from beginning to end. Then several more floors of different things to do including learning how to pour a beer. I would highly recommend this and you can easily spend 2 hours there.
Brillant. So much more than just a brewery, it was amazing. Would go again. The 4D experience was the icing on the cake.

You must go!. This was awesome. Long walk from main train station. Recommend spending almost 2 hours there. You get to sample a glass during the experience and are given a wrist band to have 2 full drinks afterwards. We don't drink so we just watched the first sample demonstration and walked through the 2 bars at the end serving the samples. Lots of gifts to chose from. It was very warm in there and would recommend the coat check at front desk.

Great fun, educational and there's beer!. While in Amsterdam we decided this had to be a stop for us. I had no idea how vast this place would be! It took you from one room to the next, learning a we went. Very well thought out. It was fun and educational. As my photo's show - we had a blast! It's worth every Euro and we were able to stop twice and have a beer. Great exhibit to spend a couple hours in.

Great way to kill a couple of hours. I thought it was very interesting to learn not only about heneken but beer itself.It was €15 entrance but included two free pints in a funky bar afterwards. Sort of a mini club before you leave.And the tours alright, seeing the mixing pots and old heneken adverts. It's fun. Great way to kill a couple of hours in Amsterdam.

Heineken Experience. The Heineken Experience proved to be a very interesting place to keep out of the rain in Amsterdam!! The museum was well set out and easy to navigate. It kept our family 2 adults one 18 and one 16 amused and at the end the best bit was to try the beer.Great way to kill a few hours!!
Great insite into beer making. Better than what was exspected. Well worth a look around as there more in beer making than you may think with a few small rides and atractions inside and free beer.
Heineken you rock. The Heineken experiance was awesome so well done. From the very start right till the end when you pull your own beer.Worth every minute and euro.

Worth a visit. We decided to visit here as we had spare time on our trip. It teaches you about how Heineken is made and gives you a chance to pour your own pint, as well as receive 2 drinks at the end of the tour. Not ideal for children as they'd get bored!

Cheers! One of a kind beer experience for everyone. Beer lover or not, the Heineken experience is worth it.This place offers a lot more than a museum the reason it's called Heineken experience.You can also taste the beer for free in their cute bar and they have freebies given to those who visit the place.

Great attraction - Must See. We went here as a couple - paid €15 each with a €2 discount each by picking up a flyer in town. We really enjoyed it here and was the best thing we did. The staff are entertaining and make the experience worthwhile. From pulling your own pint to trying out DJ skills and a free boat ride up to town at the end. No faults whatsoever. Its made me into a Heinken drinker and i dont even like beer! We ended up spending nearly 3 hours here - great photo opportunities.

Brilliant - a must whether you like beer or not!. Excellent tour, both interesting and fun ! I never drank beer until I did this tour, (preferring a glass of wine instead), however I was shown how I should drink it and now I am a convert !

Awesome tour. Learning the history of a famous beer is always interesting. Heineken does a good job in marketing themselves even more via this tour. From learning how they brew to learning how to taste beer, it was really fun and interactive. If you're willing to spend more, watching the machine make a personalized beer bottle is pretty cool. They give you a couple of free beers towards the end which is always a plus.

Fun, fun, fun!. We must submit all positive feedbacks. Very much fun. But you need time (2hours minimum). The shop is a little bit expensive. The shuttle boat to the shop rides every hour. Ask for the next departure bevor drinking beer. We got rebate because we bought the tickets at tours&tickets at (15 instead of 17).

Just go for the drinks and pictures.. The museum aspect of this wasn't really that interesting. I kind of just walked through all of that. They have a bit of an interactive little ride kind of thing, well it can't really be called a ride you just stand on a moving platform pretty much. Anyway, the best part was taking pictures, great photo op moments and the free beers at the end. Overall you should just come here if you want to drink and take pictures lol

dont bother. Very disappointed. 20 bucks per person to get in, you get 2 beers that are 10 oz each. Forget about the chance of getting another, they run the place like its liquid gold. Oh yeah, you get a free boat ride at the end...only problem was they told us the boat was "full" you have to wait an hour to get the next one, OR... you can have a free gift instead! OK so lets walk back to the gift shop to get out free gift! Sorry again, the free gift isn't here at the gift shop, that would make too much sense, and we would actually have to give them out. You will need to walk 20 minutes to another location to get your free gift...but don't bother for the 50 cent bottle opener. Inside the "experience" the attractions are cheezey. Silly electronic games that people blow right past in the hopes of finding something really interesting which they never do,
Nice for teen agers.... boring for adults.. There is not much to see, just a bunch of pictures, a small tour of the brewing process, a couple of nice bars and a souvenir store..... that's it.

very good tour. Really enjoyed the heineken experience, learning about the making of the beer & getting to try heineken beer, im not a fan of beer but found the taste of heineken very refreshing. Only gripe is that 17 euros per person to visit was a bit on the pricey side

Not the usual brewery tour. History of Heineken that makes a change from the usual museum tours. From the brewing, being part of the brew in a 4D ride and interactive photo and video rooms to finally tasting the end product. Another good Amsterdam attraction

No van gogh then this is the place. It's about 17 euros each which include 2 free drinks, the tour last about 120 mins, and was my highlight of my trip ( I know very uncultured) but I did enjoy and the fact that my better half does not drink larger meant 3 beers for me! On a serious note there was some very good staff that were friendly and made the trip enjoyable, a few free IT things for you to do where you can record and send to yourself via email free. Would recommend especially if you bought a hop on hop off canel ticket. They stop there for 30 mins so it's a must do

Fun and Educational!. This museum offered far more than I expected. After having toured many breweries in the United States, I was just not expecting this one to be more fun than educational! The tour is full of interactive activities, including a 4D video and a lesson on how to pour and drink Heineken (or any beer for that matter). The free beer and gift were also a nice surprise. Our "gift" even included a canal ride from the museum to their store. During the 15-minute ride, we received lots of information about the city in general from the guide. The cost of the ticket compared to what you receive is very fair!Even after having been here, I would go back on my next trip to the city.
