Fun. A fun museum, very interactive and informative. Nice to know that Heineken has been such a responsible employer. Interesting and fun.

Typical tourist attraction but worth a visit.. 17 euros/ticket includes a boat ride to and from the brewery, tour of the old brewery/museum, 4D short movie experience, 2 pints freshly brewed beer tasting and finally a souvenir (bottle opener). It is worth visiting but may be not for everyone.

Something different in Amsterdam. Well, we've been to other beer factory tours and this one was pretty similar although it didn't show that much of the actual bottling, etc. There were some cool low reclining chairs/pods where you could treat yourself to tons of historic Heineken advertisements and there was the "be a bottle" experience, which although cheesy was also kind of fun. The beer was good though and that's what matters :)

Good time drinking beer and seeing how it was made. Was a good tour through an old brewery.
Pros : Free Beer, cool bar, interesting ride near the end
Cons: Somewhat pricey

Really fun experience. I have been here twice, once with my husband September 2011 and once with my mom in September 2012. My mom wasn’t sure if this is something she would enjoy but it ended up being one of her favorite things we did in Amsterdam, it is definitely different than your average brewery tour. Make sure you have at least 2 hours to go through the tour as there is a lot to see.

Would recommended to everyone!. My husband and I have been to a lot of breweries around the US, both small and large. We were a little worried about going to Heineken because it is pricey and we assumed it would be like every other brewery tour. IT IS NOT!! It is definitely not just a tour, it's an experience. The ticket includes the experience, tastings (2 pints!) and a token to take a boat to the store that's a few miles from the old factory. When you add everything together it is worth the price.

Not a bad way to spend a couple of hours. I thought that 17 euros was a little expensive, to get into this place but by the end I was fairly happy with the whole thing.You are taken on a journey through the history of this company and how they make the famous brew with a short 'brew ride' on the way and a couple of small beers at the end. If you wish, you can take the free, 15 minute boat ride, to their brand store where you do receive a small gift, as well. The whole thing is fairly light hearted and makes for a fun history lesson. Being a fan of Heineken beer, I think that it was worth it, personally but I do appreciate that it would not be to everyones taste

Excellent Place, Great Tour and Free Beer!!!. What a fantastic place to visit.Me and my partner visited last week and it was possibly the highlight of our Amsterdam Trip. The tour was very well presented, with friendly, helpful staff at every point. Some great interactive areas and a great laugh for people of all ages!Plus, you get two of the nicest glasses of Heineken you will ever taste at the end of the tour (and one half way through)!

Nice :-). Quite a nice "experience". Very professional and interesting tour inside the great Heineken company.I had quite a good time. Try to get some discount voucher before you go. You will find some in many hotels around Amsterdam.Nice to get 2 free beers at the end of the visit :-)

What a good time!. We visited in August 2012 and really enjoyed ourselves. The layout is very interactive, the staff friendly and helpful and of course, the few "cold ones" also helped!Best attraction? The simulation where you become a bottle of beer. Our group laughed a lot and although we were total strangers, quickly mingeld and had some great chats afterwards.One just has to make your own video. It is great fun and you can send ti to anybody you want to.WWell worth the money (although the shop is a bit expensive).
Interesting but pricey. Good information on history of Heineken but mostly just a commercial gor Heinekin product. The 2 beers offered where very small glasses in very loud and sticky

Not boring. I loved this museum, although a little too pricey for my liking- suppose you'd only go once though. Well worth a visit, I went on recommendation from a friend. 2 free beers at the end of the experience.
Very fun. It was so fun to be there with my friends. Very interesting and great atmosfere. Beautiful, music and history.

Fun experience. My husband and I are in our 60's but we had a fun time at the Heineken Experience. The beer making process was explained very well with many experienced staff explaining how it is done at the various stages and allowing hands on experiences. We enjoyed the various displays and photo opportunities and our Heineken beers. Freddy Heineken was a clever man.

They have their act together. This is an interesting visit if you want to know about beer and some of the interactive exhibits were unique. The horse stable is full of wonderfully large brewery wagon horses who respond to their names even though you are a long ways away.

Glad we did it !. Very organized tour, lots of fun, a little bit pricey, but ok. The admission fees gives you two beers free - and a little souvenir, that you have to go after another Heineken`s store to get.

Another brewery.... Because we live near Williamsburg, Virginia and have visited Busch Gardens and Anhueser Busch Brewery, the brewery tour was something we've done before. But Heineken stepped it up - toward the end of the tour they added modern technology. You are able to have your picture taken and emailed to friends right there, make a video, and more. At the end, you are given the "complimentary" two beers to enjoy. And...of course, you exit through the gift shop.

Great fun even if you don't like Beer. Friends recommended this but as I dont normally drink beer I wasn't sure I'd enjoy it. However I was completely won over. There's a brilliant mix of fun stuff to try and touch, interesting history, demonstrations, Multi media displays and the most fun was probably in the interactive photo/video room and the 4D "become the beer' ride. Your entry price also gets you two small beers at the end of the tour.

funny experience!. at the beginning you could think "yes, the standard promoting museum with photos and some videos" ... then you would be surprised! The museum is really big and you could make many activities (yes, drinking beer too) like making videos with your friends, games, tasting water & barley and other strange things! Try it! (you could have a free gift at the end of the visit, an Heineken bottleopener)

Cheers to a near perfect beer. As a visitor the Heineken experience is probably one of the less mundane thing to do in Amsterdam. As a resident its a commercial trap. You are given a dutch historic trip and a look into the production process (on video of course). With a special effects "ride". You get a drink beer workshop, at the end arrive to a bar with all the club like lighting effects and get your "complimentary" beer at perfect temperature. As for the option to go to their brand store, you could choose from a complimentary pair of shades branded heineken or a photo of yourself with cover of a magazine like effects. Didn't think going to the brand store was worth the walk. They really push buying their branded products at the Experience itself and at the branded store as well. All in all a pretty ok visit. Cheers! Proost!

Think twice. For 17 e you only get have a peint of beer & a lot of commercials! Some friends told me that if you come drunk to here its nice, but isn't strange? Anyway it's not all bad, but if you missed it or don't want to spend your money you can skip on this attraction!
Very nice. I like it a lot. The beer lover's paradise. Get the know where the Heineken was created, and how it was distributed in the early century.

A Beer experience!. Ensure to get your 2 euro entry coupon in one of the many tickets and attraction magazine! They are going to give you three tokens which you can use at the end of the self tour. The site information which included films, posters, interactive sites were Super! it provides you a great idea on the process of beer. The short movie is interesting and fun since now YOU will become a beer! There is a place in which you can e-mail a short video or pic!! If you really want to buy some items, use your third token for the store (located 15 min walk from the museum toward the city center).

Good value and fun. Tour was educational and fun, as well as including 2 beer tokens. You Got to hear about heineken through history, beermaking and advertisment of the brand through the years..Favorite parts were the interactive parts, such as virtual beer pouring and the ride was a bit of silly fun, we had a laugh, all topped off with beer at the end.

Cool!. It is a nice place to learn the history of one of the biggest beer producers in the Netherlands. You get some free beer and you can also win a glass if you answer some questions correctly!))) It was a nice experience.
Fun & beer. We had fun at the Heineken experience. besides learning about Heineken and how the beer is made there is a lot of fun and games to spend the time.

Only Ok. was a little bit disappointed, it was €16 entry fee. we were early so no Q's. staff were friendly through out the tour. On the tour we visited the copper stills, don't forget to cast an eye inside,along the way it was explained the different ingredients involved. we had the virtual ride that was good.little disappointed that the horses were in the stables and we had a view from the stairs. day were not on show. You get either two half glasses of beer pulled by the bar staff or one of the staff teach you to pour your own half pint but mainly pulled by yourself, if you pass you get a certificate. bit of a walk from our hotel so get the tram.

A must for everyone!. I've been here 3 times now and it never gets old. The first was before the refurbishment and it was completely different. It's 17 euros to enter but you learn a lot about the history of Heineken and the beer making process. There are loads of videos, pictures, information, old posters and adverts and so much more. You get talks in some of the rooms by a guide who then gives you some beer. There is an opportunity for you to make a personalized Heineken bottle, it isn't anything much for the price but could be a nice present for someone. I made one as it was my 21st. At the end of the tour you get two free beers at the bar. If you're really lucky like we were you might get some people at the bar not wanting their tokens and giving them out to the other visitors!!
Fantastic. The best way to describe this place is Cadbury's World but for adults. You also get 2 beers in the bar at the end of the tour. Thoroughly enjoyable.

You pay quite a bit for only a few beers.. I visited the Heineken Experience back in November 2011. I believe the entrance fee was 15 euros if you buy your ticket online, 17 if you purchase it at the door, and for that you get about a 45 minute mini-tour of the facility that includes a sort of amusement park ride and a look at their version of the Budweiser Clydesdales. They teach you how to drink a beer (like that's hard). After that, you get a choice of pouring your own glass of beer (one drink), or having the bartender pour it for you (you get two drinks). Mind you, these aren't very large glasses either. While every employee at the Heineken Experience is extremely congenial (I think they're all college students), the bottom line is that there are a lot of other places to see in Amsterdam that are worthy of your tourist dollars/euros.

A Must See Experience!. Why go to Amsterdam without doing the Heineken Experience? It was fun (the virtual ride through the brewing process was really cool), educational, and the bar at the end of the tour was very hip. I would recommend to anyone...

It is what it is.... Don't come here with expectations of cultural enlightenment and you'll enjoy it. It is what it is, a brewery, but also a fascinating insight into the art of sophisticated marketing. Very slick, a great laugh and a couple of beers at the end to round out the tour. Oh, and the chance to email your work mates at home a picture of you drinking beer at the Heineken factory. While they are working. Nice.

Waste of 17 E. Unless you are under 35 like to drink lots of beer, I would skip this. The tour was aimed more at the young crowd with interactive displays, making your own label, selling things with the name of the brand on them. The draft horses are housed there and it was interesting seeing them and the old machinery used. The rest of it I could have skipped.

A fun experience - must see if you're in Amsterdam :). If you like or don't like beer, you should definitely stop by the Heineken Brewery in Amsterdam. You get to see how beer is made and then they give you a tasting. You go through so many cool rooms - with movies, videoclips, and even a dance room where people take a moment to have fun. Then you can take pics of yourself and send it to your friends with a Heineken pic in the background. Finally, there's the gift shop where you can get a little souvenier to take home. Really fun place to be!! :) We loved it.
Ok. If you like beer then it's a great place to visit as you have quite a few complimentary beers :) you basically learn about the Heineken family and beer

Quite expensive, very limited!. The price is too high, for a walk through the museum and a small glass of beer served at the end of the tour. I would have expected a "wow" experience for that price and a brand as big as Heineken...

Amazing. I loved it , at first i thought it was a bit boring , but through it all , i thought it was great , especially when you got to the ride part off it , i would go back for sure , you get 3 free beers not the biggest off glasses but hey for 15 euros its alright i suppose.

Interesting to see how beer is made. Rather expensive, but nice to spend a couple of hours seeing how beer is made. Also, you are told about the history of Heineken breweries. You will end the tour at the bar, where you will be able to taste the beer (or a soda).

Start Drinking Early. Did the Noon tour and could not have had more fun. I am from the states and Heineken tastes 1000% better at the factory.... drinking Heineken fresh is the ONLY way it should go down... a must see for anyone who likes beer, drinking and history!
Very Interesting. Interesting and worthwhile visit. It was not a conducted tour therefore you had to be prepared to spend time reading the information. Sampling of the beer was very good.

Mied feelings. While it's time well spent, it's certainly not cheap. Also, a few boring sections were quickly skipped, leaving me with mixed feelings. I did however love the photoshoots, free beer and ads section near the end.

Very cool. Be the beer. It’s not really a brewery tour, and it’s not just a museum… it’s a whole experience. My sons visited, and they said it was one of the most interesting attractions. “It’s hard to explain. They have a motion ride where you are the beer. They heat you up and send you through various pipes and into the bottles.” You can buy your passes in advance on-line at heinekenexperience.com. If you get an IAmsterdam pass, you can get a discount at the door but not on-line. The IAmsterdam pass also entitles you to a free gift, though it’s a brief walk to get that. The Heineken Experience is pretty centrally located in Amsterdam, not far from the Rijksmuseum.

very interesting. it's a must when you visit amsterdam to go to into heineken experience it was very interesting seeing the history of the beer ,visiting the brewers to see how the beer is done and then in the end feeling like the beer in a moving movie

Very Interesting. We had a great time walking around this place and it was interesting to see the process it goes through. It is basically one massive advert for Heineken but who cares cos you get given free drinks at the end (which when you think about it you paid for in your ticket). Probably not a place I'd go back to as it's one of those places where once you've seen it once the 2nd time is going to be exactly the same but even so you still need to go see it.I would recommend going to one of the Tours & Tickets offices all around town if you do go as they only charge 15 Euro and when you get there you don't have to queue to pay.

Well Recommended. The Heineken Experience was a very interesting exciting way to find out about the history of Holland’s most famous brewers. During your visit you will get two drinks included in the price as well as a free canal cruise to the Heineken shop where you can receive a free gift.

Excellent Experience!. I never expected a 'brewery tour' to be such a entertaining and interactive experience, I was very impressed!I'd highly recommend visiting if you have an afternoon to spare in Amsterdam, and at $15 for the tour, a beer tasting & 2 beers in the bar afterwards it was well worth the money!The 'Be the beer' simulation is bit of a giggle and an imaginative way of explaining the brewing process.Only criticism is that the bar at the end of the tour could have more seating & a better queuing system.

Not your average attraction!!. Visited this exhibit and was extremely disappointed by the overall lack of content, excluding a couple of glasses of beer that was included in the price. Very much a self selling advertisement of the Heineken brand/name was a poor excuse for an admission price of 17 Euros per person. Definitely not worth the money in a city that has lot's more attractions at at least half the price!!

Fantastic. An absolute must when in Amsterdam, a very up to date interactive musuem that tells the history of Heineken in a fun way, learn how to pull the perfect pint , see how Heineken is made , see ads from down the years and lots more besides. Much better than I thought it would be and staff were fantastic and enthuastic without being over the top.
Awesome!. When are you ever given beer on a tour through a museum? Loved the experience, highly recommended, it was a lot of fun, well worth the 17 Euro

Kind of a borefest.. This was my first time taking a brewery tour and I wouldnt do it again. It was pretty interesting to learn about the history of Heinekin and seeing up close the steps it takes to make beer. The building is certainly nice looking and there is lots to see as well.But, towards the end of the tour it gets a bit lame. Theres an movie room where you see the process of making beer and they spray you with a bit of water and another room where you just watch Heineken commericals as well. Finally there's the last room where you cash your tickets for 2 beers. It really gets tiresome by the end and the nightclub vibe towards the end makes it feel a bit juvenile. Maybe we're too old to enjoy this place (mid 30's).A better Heineken experience would be to take your money and spend it on beers at the local pub.

Very interactive AND lots of good beer. What a fantastic way to spend an afternoon! I loved how interactive this was - I've never seen that in a brewery tour before. Very unique brewery experience for me. Plus, they served a fair amount of beer too! I was also impressed that they gave you a free gift if you went to their brand store - we got some nice sunglasses!

I finally have a taste for beer!. After 30+ years of being of legal age to drink, I finally enjoyed my first beer. I never liked the taste for beer, but I was in Amsterdam during a heat wave, and at the Heineken Experience --what better way to cool off? The view for drinking the beer is not nearly as nice as The Guinness Brewery in Dublin, but it was fun, and I am glad I did it!

A must do in amsterdam!. I thought this was really good! The price was reasonable and i loved the interactive elements of it. Of course the free beer was the high light! Loved the bar where everyone goes at the end and the 4d ride was funny!

If you can get over the fact that it's a giant advertisement for Heineken.... We purchased tickets online ahead of time to check it out. It was like a brewery on steroids, combining both traditional beer culture and 21st century elements with a "ride," where you get brewed like the beer, video displays, light shows, and, of course, lots of beer. A good deal, not the most cultural experience in Amsterdam, but it made for a fun afternoon with friends. Long line without buying tickets ahead of time

Fun. This is slightly expensive but lots of fun. They are lively and keep it going. Getting to taste the hops and then the beer, then able to have two drinks at the end was fun as we were sharing this time with friends. They have a ride "Be the Beer" that is just corney enough to be lots of fun, lots of laughs. Very enjoyable and educational.
Excellent. The Heineken Experience is worth a visit because is original and reflects the how the brand is sensible to communication and marketing really satisfied!

Nice, but seen better beer experience. It was a quick checkin to get the tickets and off we were in the building. A lot of concrete walls and stuff first - a little boring. Then we entered big room with brewing boilers etc. which was much more interesting. Then a ride on Heineken Experience, tasting beer, some fun with recording videos, photos and sending them to our friends -> to the bar for free 2 glasses/person and my wife doesn't drink beer -> so 4 for me :) And we were through! Expensive shop at the end, but we got 10% discount as we played rock/scissors/paper online game for like 30min to finally win and get the discount.Then we also went to the Heineken shop in the city (very near Rembrandt square) as you get a free gift with bracelet from Heineken Museum. We got free Heineken Sunglasses, good enough.Compared to example Guinness brewery in Dublin it was not so entertaining, but still worth a visit of course!

Worth seeing. A very informative trip very easy way to spend a few hours learning all the history of the brewery,interactive ride was good too and you get a few beers thrown in as well,staff very helpfulaiden was a great guy to get to know

Fun Experience. What I liked best about visiting the Henieken Experience was not the beer tasting samples as I 'm sure some would say that, but allowing visitors interact with video entertainment. They had a 4D presentation of how the beer is made and bottled. Was so much fun.

FUN, FUN, FUN. I did not believe that it could be so much fun going to a brewery and listening about how beer is made since i would rather drink it! However, we visited the Heineken and spend there 3 hours. There are a lot of fun activities. You get to know how to taste beer,learn the history of this brewing company, take pictures and do your own music video.I would recommend it!

Typical brewery tour. The experience was enjoyable enough, but apart from the simulator ride it didn't really have anything different to offer.The tour was self guided and we began about 10 minutes before the start of last tours. However, towards the end they came along and rushed us on, which seemed a bit unfair as the place was open for at least another hour, and we hadn't exactly been dawdling.The beers at the end were good and I was glad I did the tour, but it was nothing special really.The gimmick of giving you a token for a ferry ride to their shop in town or the option to walk and pick up a free gift there, is very clever. All they really want to do is get you there to buy more stuff! Good marketing ploy, though.

Like beer? You'll love this.. Definitely worth a stop when you're in Amsterdam, especially if you're a beer lover. You'll see Heineken Beer and advertising all over Holland, so you should definitely stop in here to get the full experience. Great way to spend a few hours.The tour is self guided and very interactive. Don't forget your camera, because there are lots of photo opportunities throughout. If you've never visited a brewery before you'll learn a lot about the process, and it's presented in a really entertaining way. If you're interested in branding or advertising, they show you how the brand developed as well as lots of really interesting advertisements from over the years. You'll get three beers over the tour, one done as a tasting and the other two in a bar setting at the end. We hung out in the bar area for about an hour afterward chatting with people from all over the world. Neat LCD tables and the walls were constantly changing to scenes from different cities all over the world. We ended up getting a few extra beers just by being there for awhile, and the staff were fantastic too.There is also an opportunity to have a custom bottle made with your name on it, comes in a nice tube and makes a great souvenir or gift for your friends back home.Lots of fun!

Worth a visit. Visited the Heineken Experience this weekend and wasn't really sure what to expect. I booked the tickets online in the hope of avoiding any inevitable queues on an August weekend and was glad I did - saved time and money. The initially few rooms were fairly standard history on how the family business started. As it got going it got better, more interactive and involved. There is plenty to see and learn and a good way to spend a couple of hours - not to mention the beer you get. What I learnt is that Heineken is a well oiled slick marketing machine!

A little pricey but worth a visit.. I wish we'd known about some of the visitor card that are availableto get a discount!Oh well, we really enjoyed the Heineken experience anyway and spent far longer in there than planned.It is a good 15 minute walk from Dam square but took a bike tuk-tuk instead which was great fun too.It is a very well designed, self-guided tour.Interactive bits all over the place which were great fun...didn't like the taste of the wort though...yuk!The simulator was great fun and obviously the beers along the way were greatly appreciated!We've visited the Guinness experience in Dublin too and i'd say that the Heineken experinece was better.Also, if you fancy it, the Bols museum is only about 5 minutes away from the Heineken if you want to combine the 2 like we did.
Great time. Well worth the time to learn, drink, view, drink, listen, drink and have fun. A comfortable way to spend 3 hours having a good time.

loved it. i would recommend this to anyone i hate beer but loved the experience. to begin with you go through the history of how it all started and begin to go through all the stages and years, seeing how they make it and also getting a free drink aswell. dont do what i done and forget the camera you will regret it forever.
Worth a visit. I liked the experience of being in the simulator. You were taken through the process of being the beer getting made.

Something fun to say you have done. This was a fun day out. Pick up the flyer from your hotel/hostel or info site which will save you 2 euro on entry. You get 2 free beers at the end although its really 3 as you get a free beer half way though. Its very interactive and the staff are really fun. There is a free gift if you go to the gift shop which is about a 15 minute walk away or you can take a free canal cruise to the shop.

A refreshing break from cultural tours. What a blast, want a fun thing to do with the teen agers [16 and over] or friends who are going blind from all that culture? Not only did it give you a healthy dose of history and the Dutch culture, there were all kinds of stoopid silly activities to do while doing the learning....and the beer was great! I see someone complaining about gifts in the reviews, but I just can't agree. I think the whole thing was alot of fun for the buck AND the free guided tour boat ride to their store was a lovely way to end the day. No one forces you to buy anything, however, if you are looking for a DUTCH gift to bring back to that special someone back home, the quality of their products is as high as their beer: great!
Loved the interactive feel. Fun things to see and touch! Loved the beer pouring machine that rated your pour! The 4D ride was fun. Of course, the beer tasting was the best part!!!

Heineken Experience. Nice experience.Gives the history of Heineken and how the beer is brewed quite good.There is a lot fun in it as well. Especially the cinema room that moves you like a barley and takes you throughout the processes of how you will be beer is really great fun.The beers at the end very fresh and lovely.Against all these, it is still very commercial and everything is about the Heineken ego. This is normal if you visit a brand attraction but being some humble would never hurt them.But still a good fun.
Loved every drop and minute of it.. My Boyfriend and I love all things beer so this was a wonderful way to end our term break before heading back to university. Besides, who doesn't like a beer tour?

Just some building. Well it was more of the beer experience,some interesting activities involved and the beer was awesome,it was a ripofff from the gifts I expected them to at least give you some souviniers after the awful viist but instead they make you walk halfway through the city for some lousy shades and some poto!!!Heineken you can improve the experience by offering some beers along the visit and as well save the best with some of your best souveniers and not selling them at rock high prices!!

A bit too touristy.... I would have given this 3 out of 5 if I hadn't already got Amsterdam's City Card, which gave me a discount on the Heineken Experience down to 12.75 euro from 17 euro. The majority of the tour is catered entirely to the tourist, and not to the beer enthusiast. It is full of flashing lights and games, some of which are fun, most of which are excessive.The 3 free small beers during and after the tour are nice, but the free gift is at another store, and it's between cheap sunglasses or a free printout of yourself on a fake Heineken magazine cover.

Over priced for what you get. Had fun but was was an expensive self directed tour costing 17 euros each. There are some fun activities to do which allow you to email a video of yourself traveling down a canal, on a bike, or a few other scenarios. Included are 2 small beers (.3liter each) and a canal ride to their factory store. Forget the free gift. That is a gimmick to get you to buy more merchandise. Good for a rainy day and die hard Heinken fans. Takes maybe an hour depending on how fast you can consume your beer. Their boat drops you off near Rembrandts house if you decide to take it.

Well Worth it!. This is a must to do when in Amsterdam. I was a little disappointed with the lack of information on the company after its foundation to the present day, such as marketing and different brands it founded, but it was still very worthwhile doing the tour. The highlight without a doubt was pouring my own drink at the end of the tour. Mine was perfect, my girlfriends not so much!

Fantastic, even for non-beer lovers!. I was really dreading walking around the Heineken experience! I don't have any interest or liking towards any kind of beer. I would have to be physically forced to have a beer!However, this was absolutely fantastic! I learned about the company, their hr practices, the marketing of the brand and how they brew Heineken! It was a great experience for me ..perhaps because I am a business student! There are old advertisements to watch, dutch songs to sing, plenty of photo opportunities and a shop to pick up some merchandise for friends/family.But seriously, I think there is something for everyone. A clear effort has been put into the experience of the brand.Heineken don't have me drinking their beer yet, but with a tourist attraction like this, I am sure they have converted others! Worth the entrance fee and your time!
The best museum which I have ever experienced. It was wonderful... all parts, 3D cinema, Heineken test, history, horses, advertising hall, games and music were the best ... I really enjoyed a lot.

Awful, do not waste your money. The tour round the museum itself was not too bad but the "experience" really let itself down by serving flat beer as the free drink after explaining why the bubbles were so important. The free gift cannot be collected from the museum gift shop but by crossing the city to the heineken brand shop. This is not wheelchair friendly and I would not recommend visiting as you like the beer will be left flat

Pretty fun. On the whole the experience was good. The interactive parts of the tour are good fun and most parts are interesting. It was a bit disappointing that you don’t actually get to see the actual brewing of the beer but it is still worth a visit. The taster’s samples of beer were a welcome part of the visit. Decent enough experience to put a couple of hours in. Free gift of sunglasses was a pleasant addition to the experience.
Fun and educational. Fun visit, learned the history of Heineken. Part of the tour is a small museum re: history of heineken, lots of interactive displays and great beer.

A unique and fun tour.. Found this to be very interesting, particularly the develop of the beer and company from it's beginning to the present. Educational in regard to the process of making beer. And the tasting part was fun.
Good experience. Very good muesum and very intresting. Reasonable entry charges and free beer!!. If you go to the cafe next door then you get discount admission

Fun even for non-beer drinkers. This was a fun experience. Its a self-guided tour that takes you through all the brewing stages. Also includes a "you are the beer" experience and several tasting locations. Almost as much fun as the Guinness tour in Dublin.

Must do. This is a must do if you are visiting Amsterdam. It's totally worth it for the money you spend. You get to drink 3 beers and receive a free canal tour. What more could you ask for?
It's a straight forward experience so you won't get lost, so if you like driking beer definitely check it out.

Brilliant!. As poor backpackers, this was excellent value. We easily spent a whole afternoon in here, it's so much fun! Lots of of interactive games, interesting stories and a 4D simulator which was fun. The free beer was an added bonus, there was a fair amount of it as well. Definitely recommend if you're in Amsterdam for a few days!
So much fun!. It was more than I would have expected from a beer tour...with the interactive games, the 4D show and the taste testing...I would definitely recommend that you check it out!

Fantastic!!. Really Really enjoyed my visit to the heineken experience from start to finish.Loved looking at the history and learned a lot of things about heineken i never knew.The 4D simulator was very good and enjoyed looking at the soccer part and the free pints at the end were an added bonus.I will definenly recommened it to all my friends and when i come back i wil be going there again.
Fab good fun. Son bought online for birthday well worth going. Very informative but not boring, good for everyone. Highley recommendedd
Great experience. â¬15 entry with discount politely bartered with the employee! Learn about the history of Heineken, and most importantly...drink.

A fun, can't miss Amsterdam experience. This tour exceeded expectations. It was fun, modern, and informative. The best part was, of course, the free samples. You get a half a beer in the middle of the tour where they explain how to properly drink a Heineken. This is more interesting than it sounds. At the end you get two free beers in the bar. There are two options. The bar on the right has pour your own taps to see if you can pour properly. This was fun, but drew a big line. The bar on the left was more traditional. The decor is very contemporary. We would have enjoyed staying longer and having a third beer each, but it didn't seem like you could do that. After the tour it is worthwhile to take the free shuttle over to the brand store. They don't really tell you where to pick up the shuttle. You have to go left from the exit, cross the canal and it will be on the right hand side. Our free gift vouchers were redeemed for aviator sunglasses. All in all, a fun 3 hours.

Great experience. The Heineken Experience was so much more than i expected. As well as showing you how its made there are lots of fun to be had. It's well worth a visit plus if you like Heineken there are a couple of free drinks to be had. Well worth a visit and good value for money .

OK but nothing special. Think this is for the younger crowd. Really just a walk round a now disused brewery. Ryan in the tasting bar was good craic and pored everyone a very small glass of Heineken which he 'taught' us how to drink but we were then shunted off before some of yes had finished. All glasses to be left behind. Your 'vouchers' for one extra cold or two small glasses are exchanged in a cold. Sterile bar with not enough seating. I went to the shop to browse the merchandise while my husband supped up, only to find no way back to the bar. I could see in but the one way gate stopped me getting back. No notice to let you know this would happen!! Toilets ok but nothing special and what is it about the Dutch that all toilet attendants in the Ladies are male??? Would not go again but then - not a beer drinker!!
5 Stars!. Very enjoyable! The whole set up is very professionally done and to top it all off you get a nice few glasses of Heineken at the end of your tour :)

Gotta just visit!. Going to Amsterdam without visiting the Heineken Experience is unthinkable. The Experience, which has recently re-opened after a major re-vamp outs you through the history of Heineken in a very interactive way. Enjoy your free beer, the beer pouring sessions, and a number of other activities which will keep you going. Spare a good two hours and make sure to take the free boat ride to the Heineken souvenir shop for your free gift (near Rembrandt plein). The gift is not really worth, but the free boat ride is :)
Great for a day out with friends. This is also a must see in Amsterdam and really shouldn't be missed, the only let-down is it's location which is a little inconvenient.

Awesome Time. This experience was like a wine tour and Universal Studios on steroids. After a leisurely walk through the brewery, a small tasting awaits. Then the video room takes you through the experience of being made into beer. Great fun! The larger tasting is at the end. Be sure to take the Heineken boat ride to receive your free gift. The photo booth is a lot of fun.

Great value for money!. This was a great afternoon of fun! I especially liked the 4d experience when you are brewed! There were lots of activities and hands on areas which appealed to different ages. And of course there were lots of opportunities for tasting! This was great value for money and it's a great idea to let you draught your own beer at the end! Well worth a visit!

Very Informative and enjoyable experience. Good day out, enjoyed the whole experience, and as far as Amsterdam goes, I thought it was a very reasonable price. Would reccommend it to anyone whose looking to kill a few hours with a light-hearted, yet informative tour.
A must. Used to not like beer, but now i freeking live heineken, one of a kind experience if you do or do not love beer

Alot of fun!. At first I thought it was a bit expensive, but it was actually worth it. You get 3 euros off if you use the coupon from the popular and free city map too by the way! Also, during the tour you have a chance to win an extra pint if you can remember the bartender's name in the first bar, so try and remember it! That's how I got an extra beer :)Enjoy! Proost!

Loved it. I really enjoyed walking around the Heineken Experience. It was the perfect mix of history and fun. Included in the price were beer tasting, 2 beers and a gift. They recommend you to take a boat to the brand store to pick up the gift but if you have to wait for more than 20 minutes and it is not raining you might as well just walk there. Ask for directions at the information.Over all I think this is a great place to go to. I walked there from the train station and it was not too far to walk and it was definitely worth it going there. I payed 15 euros for my entrance ticket as I had a voucher that gave me 2 euros off.
Nice, even crowded. Worth the money, nice 4D movie in the museum, dont miss it! You get two pints with the entry fee. Cheers

great fun. Its well worth the money, you can get up to 3 free drinks and a free gift. Its an interesting experience and not your average brewery tour.
There was a queue which was slow moving due to lack of staff on tills but worth the wait. Highly recommend it.
Very nice. Really nice self tour, two beers include and a 15 min bout tour free. Keep for a rainy day... Took an hour...

They sure know how to brew. Its an experience, which you have to experience!!!!!
You get to know reason for the froth in the beer, they way is supposed to be drunk and you can learn how to tap and serve ( you have an option to learn how to tap or get two bottles of beer)

Not worth the time. There are better things to do in Amsterdam, not that much free beer at the end and too many mundane facts throughout the tour. There are good parts but not worth the time or price. I’ve been to better beer tours in the States, most notably New Belgium Brewery in Fort Collins Co. This one just seems like a way to get your money.

A brewery tour is always worth a visit.. Did this on a Combi ticket with a canal cruise. Would suggest having lunch first as there are options to have up to three free beers. Very informative tour although the beer is not brewed on site. Could have spent longer on your if we had done everything on offer.
One of the best. We visited the Heineken experience by chance, glad we did as it really is worth a visit if only for the free gifts!! It really was outstanding and I would highly recommend visiting.

A must see in Amsterdam. Great tour. Very informative and friendly. A must-see in Amsterdam’. The staff took us through the whole brewing process and capped it off with a beer demonstration on how to correctly drink beer to get past the protective foam. Then, there was a bar where you could exchange two tokens for beer. A lot of fun. Great experience.

Still not a Heineken drinker, but really enjoyed!. Well worth a trip, even if you're not a Heineken drinker, which, incidentally, I'm not!Firstly, it's very easy to find, especially if you are on one of the hop-on-hop-off river boat tours. Secondly, I thought entry prices would be reflective of the popularity of the brand, but it was only €15pps, which gave you entry and also two full pints at the end of the tour in a pretty nice bar, where noone tried to rush you on (if you wanted them of course), and a taster glass about half way through, when you were taught how to drink Heineken properly. Even for non-beer lovers, it was really informative in terms of how it's made, and the branding and history behind it.Also definitely an appropriate venue for all ages - there are points of interest for kids, teens and adults.Would recommend!

beer and some. This place is great if you have a true appreciation for beer. It leads you through the various stages of the brewing process as well as the history of the Heineken brand.The opportunity to drink the beer was definitely a highlight but we thought it was a rip that you couldn't do a learn to pour and drinking in the bar instead it was one or the other. We chose to drink instead of learning how to pour. Handy location and staff very helpful and knowledgeable.

Great Great GREAT!!. Loved this place, so much to see and learn about how the beer is brewed and such, also has an interactive ride-type thing included in the price. Many fun interactive exhibits and with your wrist band you get 2 tokens for 2 free 25cl glasses of Heinenken, sadly I do not work well with drink so gave one to my friend and the other to an Aussie we met called Tom, he was pretty cool and let us gatecrash his tour plans. Worth seeing this if only for a couple of free beers haha ;O)

Heineken. Loved this place! I've been to a few Brewery Tours in the US and none have come close to this. It is not just a few rooms with big tanks and barley, they also have a ride where they "brew you", a bar where the bartender teaches you how to drink the beer the right way, interactive stations such as how to be a master pourer and make your own music video, AND you get 2 free beers at the end. We were definitely buzzed. We would have taken the free river cruise that they offered us but it ended up raining. We also sent a email postcard to our co workers. There was just so much to do! One of my favorite things in the city.

One of the best Brewery experiences. Although there is not a working Brewery to see the Heineken Experience does a great job of promoting its product in a fun way. My kids (8 & 11) had a great time too which is a good sign. Enough information on brewing process and the lovely old vessels are still there. Lots of modern stuff too like the 4D ride. Well worth the visit.

Heineken Yeah!. When in Amsterdam, do as the Dutch do and have a Heineken. The tour is great for young teens and adults. It encompasses more than just beer but the branding of a family business. Take the free boat ride to the store at the end of the tour.

Fun and neat, but a little to showy. We've been on a lot of brewery and winery tours around the world and the Heineken Experience is more like an amusement park than brewery. Its fun and you feel like you're in a rockstar in certain places, but we always love to see real breweries in action. This experience is just a bit too superficial at times.Pros:Send email videos and pictures to friends and familyLots of other interactive experiencesGenerous amount of free beer tastingFree gift at the Heineken shop"Be the Beer" ride was funCons:Too superficialNot a real brewery

Pay 17 euros to be brainwashed!!!. I was disappointed in this tour to say the least, the two glasses of beer at the end were not enough, once this was over i needed something a little stronger, it was over long, over priced, and a little dry. The best bit of the tour was for me the gift shop at the end... i bought some goods but the guy who said the whole thing was just one long advert was right, all the staff are bright trendy young things (i'm not old and decrepid my self just yet, at 35), the be a beer ride was on the tame side and by the end,... well lets just say i didn't rush out for a heiney... for enthusiasts only. Its not even a working brewery for gods sake. an expensive couple of drinks and a waste of a few hours
Live in the Beer. Best €17 I spent - a fabulous tour and brilliant use of interactive media

One of a kind, full of surprises, book online to save 2 Euros !. The experience is good, and truly unique. You get to drink one medium glass of beer during the tour, and 2 glasses at the end of the tour, all included in the ticket ! Quite a good deal ! The experience is pretty interactive, and full of creative club-like light displays and decorations at the end. A must go, just opposite the Stadhouderskade tram station ! Book tickets online to save 2 Euros !There is either a free Canal cruise from the attraction to the Heineken Brand store, or a free gift for you at the brand store. When I had visited, they let me had both the things, dont know how :). The free gift was a pair of sunglasses, which are not over the top, but ok to use as spares in case your main ones get lost or develop a crack :P !

Learning and fun. Having worked both at a brewery and a science centre this was a great combination. The rather simple and dull process of brewing was attractively presented in interactives and by a friendly staff. Heineken is not my favourite beer, but now my favourite brewery visitor centre.

Entertaining brewery tour!. I enjoyed this more than I had expected to! We visited as we had 25% off with the I amsterdam card, which saved us 10 euros between us. With entrance you get 2 free drinks and a free gift which made it even more of a good value attraction. Whilst walking around you learn lots of interesting facts and because there are lots of opportunities for interaction you never get bored. There is a 'ride' a chance to sample the drink, along with numerous games and photo points.A must visit if you're in the area! :)
excellent. excellent visit,good price,very clean and the final good bar

One long Heineken commercial. . .. . . . And you can't fast-forward your way out of it. That's how I felt at the Heineken Experience. You walk through this attraction and learn that the Heineken founder has basically won every award there is on earth, then they throw in a couple of live horses to make it look as though they still deliver the beer by old-fashioned wagons, then you are part of a "ride" where you simulate a bottle of beer being produced. Then the worst part of all -- a series of multimedia rooms that have nothing to do with Heineken except that the people in the media clips are holding Heineken bottles. I guess it's supposed to make you feel like drinking Heineken is a young, hip thing to do. After a couple minutes of this, I was quite annoyed. It's the kind of stuff I'd fast-forward through on tv. You do get 3 small glasses of beer during the tour (1 during a "tasting class" and 2 more at the end), and of course, you exit through the gift shop. All this for 17 euros. My advice? Spend your 17 euros at a nice pub instead and enjoy your Heineken (or whatever) in peace.

Good experience. Entry Price 15 euros , we got a voucher coupon from the hotel and hence paid 13 euros, good experience around a 1 hr tour around the place, after which you get a small glass to taste... Once you move towards the bar you get 2 more Beers Prost!!
Better skip. A bit disappointing overal. Way too touristy.Best thing at the end are the electronic tables

So much fun!!. I went with two of my friends and it was so much fun that we were just in a great mood for the entire rest of the day. The two and a half free beers we got might have had something a little something to do with that. It is VERY interactive and that was really great in my opinion. Really interesting as well and the World Bar is very neat... also great for some people watching as you drink the beers that your entrance price gives you. Probably no need to buy the tickets in advance online besides for the reduced price. There is normally not too long of a line. I have no negatives for it!

Use offers or coupons- do not pay full price. Worth a look if like me you drink, have drunk Heineken or like football or think you might not visit amsterdam again but use an offer you can find in the city as its not worth the full price. You can walk round in quick time but then get collard at the end to watch a simulator and then get a couple of free beers. You pay for the beer basically as the tour is lame

VERY WELL DONE. Usually these kind of experiences are very self-serving on the part of the company putting it on (as it should, I suppose). This is still somewhat that way, but it's really FUN and well laid out with cool activities and technologies to immerse yourself in. When you get done, you don't feel like you just got stroked for a bunch of euros with nothing to show for it. GO...

Don't go on an empty stomach!. Not fascinating exhibit-wise but I don't regret the 17euro admission. They don't give you unlimited access to the beer but you can get a fair amount of it. Glad to be able to say i was there.

I'll drink to this!. I visited this attraction while I was in town for a concert at the Ziggo Dome, and it was a fantastic way to kill two hours while it poured outside. My friends and I went on a Sunday, and although we got there about 5 minutes after they opened, there was already a long queue outside.The staff was friendly and knowledgeable, and they made sure that everyone (especially the little one that we brought along) had a good time. The exhibits are well thought out and provide a great narrative on the history of Heineken. Even if I didn't like beer, I'd still have been interested. There is an interactive portion where visitors are "made" into beer. The little one loved this! Toward the end, it IS a non-stop barrage of advertising and marketing before you get to the gift store. This was the only portion that was not up to par. The gift portion area is not well laid out, with too little space for all of the folks who are there to purchase or pick up their custom made items. Also, even though it was raining and cool outside, it was hot as balls in the gift store. A little air circulation - even if it isn't A/C - never hurt anyone.Overall, I had a really good time, and I would suggest this tour to anyone.

Nice experience. This is a nice place to visit, someone else said in a previous comment that it's about the Heineken brand & stuff, but that's the factory name, so of course it's all about Heineken, and they have with what to be proud - lots of interesting things to see inside, and there are a few guides who explain you various things during the visit.The entrance fee is not higher compared with the rest of the attractions, and actually for what you get - 3 small beers in total, plus the gift, it is actually a very good bargain.
Awesome stuff. Quite interesting and you get up to three free beers! also free canal cruise and gift!The beer was very fresh so thats another plus

Cool place to visit, but you better like beer.. Yes, it is a living, breathing advertisement for Heineken... But this is an education and fun tour about beer making. One of the cheaper bars in all of Amsterdam when you consider the admission price and the fact that you get two full beers at the end. Look for discount coupons from the various travel companies in the Centre City to save a few euros at the door.

Educational and fun - and you get beer. The Heineken Experience is a great way to spend 2 hours. It starts a little slow with a lot about the Heineken sons and all their accolades, but then is speeds up - and you are taken (very literally) through the process of beer making. You learn how to drink the right way, you get the reason for the head on the beer, and you can train tapping the perfect draught.

Amusement park for adults. This was a fun experience. It is a very interactive exhibit which brings out the kid in you. In the price is included 1 beer tasting, 2 free beers, a canal boat trip to the brand store and a free gift (sun glases). I only regret being on antibiotics and not being able to have the beer :(.

Better than we expected!. Through travel books we heard mixed reviews about the Heineken experience. We decided to give it a shot anyway, and I'm glad we did. The heineken experience is more than a tour, it is an experience. You learn about beer making, smell, touch and taste along the way! It is lots of fun! Every corner you turn there is a new activity and plenty of photo ops. You have the opportunity (for 6 euro) to get a personalised heineken beer bottle.Included in the admission price (17 euro) you get one small taster beer and a choice of one large extra cold heineken or two regular sized ones. You also get a free gift.To get the free gift you catch the ferry (which is also included in your admission price) 15 min down the canal. I didn't really care about the gift but I was interested in the canal ride. I'm glad we did it because you get a free little canal tour with a guide. Definitely worth it. There is a free cloak room. You can get a brochure from your hotel or tourist info that gives you discounted entry to the experience, just make sure you take one brochure per person :)
Great experience!. Very good experience! Take a tour - learn how they make your favourite (or 2nd favourite) beer. Includes a neat 4D theatre presentation and 2 or 3 small pints of beer! :)
A fun time with beer!. This is certainly a must visit attraction while in Amsterdam. It is a little pricey, but you get beers!

Like Disney for beer. Fun way to spend a few hours. Interesting to see the history, learn a little about beer making and see the old equipment. Interactive elements throughout. The turn-you-into-a-beer 4D experience is somewhat over-rated but fun nonetheless. If you sample and drink the beers that come with the entrance you'll recover the 15 Euro (with coupon) cost.
Lager or Larger,.. If you drink it, you may as well learn how it is made,And yes thats why its called Heineken " EXPERIENCE ".Walk Home.?.No I think I will get a taxi.!. Hic...hic...

Hein e ken Experi e nce !. A must do if you are in Amsterdam, especially if you are a first timer and like beer. I have been to several over beer tours in the US and Europe and this by far is the most fun of all the tours that I had experienced. Plus you get .75 liters of beer at the end and along with how to judge a beer for freshness and how to drink a Heineken beer the correct way. The tour is self guided but there are lots of videos and interactive displays and demonstrations to keep it moving. The experience is all about the party scene / feel and that is what makes the tour fun.
Good Outing, Good beer !. Its a great and interesting experience, with the possibility of having up to 3 free drinks. Prost !

AWESOME if you appreciate beer!!!!. I only had about two days in Amsterdam (when we went in 2010), but it was absolutely worth squeezing into our schedules. I love beer and wine tasting and this is a great way to get more education on the process as well as getting to taste the BEST Heineken you've ever had!! I'm now, a BIGGER fan of Heineken after my visit here. I'm going to Amsterdam again this year, and will spend about one week there, and this is DEFINITELY going to be in the agenda!!

More fun than we could imagine!. I visited the Heineken brewery while in Amsterdam with my mother and aunt. They were less than thrilled that this was my pick of attractions. We all ended up having a great time and it was much more than we would have imagined. We still talk about it!

More fun than history. Our expectations weren't high but we had a good time. It can't be compared to the Guinness tour, for history buffs. They are two very different tours. This tour is really aimed at the younger people.The free canal boat ride back to the company shop near Rembrandt Square was a nice surprise.

Similar to the Dublin Factory.... Quite a few different rooms, with an interactive one where you could mess about. You get a free beer at the end with an explanation etc, and then also two more free beers in the bar afterwards.It's worth a visit, especially if you want something to do during the day but aren't into the usual museums. Staff were nice, and spoke different languages.

Good, but not a must see. Interesting walk through of the old Heineken brewery with quite a few interactive experiences. The staff was nice and entertaining but overall for 22euro and 3 hours there are considerably better things to do in the city.

Very good. We spent two hours on the tour and enjoyed every minute. There's some information and history of the beer and brewery, a chance to taste the non-alcoholic beginnings of the beer, which is vile, and then you sample an actual beer, which has to be chugged back in a manly fashion, and not 'sipped like a girl'. There's also a fun interactive 'ride' where you become beer, virtual beer pulling and table football, which we played against another couple, and lost spectacularly to. Then at the end you get two more beers in the bar before you shuffle off to the gift shop. We loved it.

The Neineken experience. If you expect to know a little bit more on how to make a great beer like Heineken, don´t sail on this experience :-(We entered in the Heineken experience at 17:10 as we were told previously, the day before, it was the last visit of the day. (If you visit these atraction go after lunch as you will have to drink 3 beers :-)).The visit started with an introduction of the business family as it passed througt 4 generations since 1864 , staying now in Charlene de Carvalho (married to Michel de Carvalho-brasilian)Then they simple tell you about the four constituents of the beer, and passed to another room with some poor videos of some stages of the process.And apart of the imponence of the former brewery, as maintained some process equipments, the rest of the visit was very very poor. No one explained anything, and the young guy that accompanied us, was only worried of rushing ourselfs to the end, as it was approaching to his/ and everybodys leaving time.There were also several flashing bright rooms, but sincerely it was not at the level of the exquisite Heineken. We almost dind't had the time to take pictures ( as we heard " we have to go, the bar is going to close" that was the main speach). I suggest that employees should increase formation when relating to public, and to have time to see everything, i suggest non entrance after 16:00.The tasting of the beer it was ok, as there was a kute dutch girl that lived 3 months in Brasil, and speaked to us in portuguese /brazilian (can you believe that? impressive!!!) When leaving the Brewery there was a nice dutch guy we could coment on the visit, and actually he was delighted when we started to speak in Portuguese gastronomy (Sardines, pasteis de belem, portuguese red wine).On the next day , it was the 15 min. boat tour on the canal which saved the experience. a boat tour is always a great experience( the dutch have great luck) Tip- If you really decide to go, in the office where you buy the GVB card( ask for the free book which gives discounts in several amsterdam atractions) the final price will stay in 14 €/each entrance, comparing to the standard 17 €/each.

Expected More. I found the tour a little boring, there was some good information but overall I did not find it that great. They gave out some beer and you learned about the way in which it was made however, I found the ''4d experience'' to be a little drab. For those who like Heineken I'm sure you will like the bit of free beer!

You can't be in Amsterdam and not visit the Heineken Factory!. A very interesting place filled with history and great information about this delicious beer by far!!!... towards the end they show how to pour beer the right way in order to enjoy the flavour. Not to mention the free beer at the end, if you go in summer time like I did it's well needed.Also, the gift shop has many great suveneirs that are very light for the suitcase. It is walking distance from a very picturesc park and the huge iamsterdam sign where you can also take pictures to show off to your friends :))
If you love beer, you need to check it out.. First rate tour of the most famous beer in the world.
Experience the beer making. Heineken is internationally the most famous Dutch brand. Experience why.

Must see attraction for beer drinkers (and even non-drinkers). I went last week, absolutely brilliant. Admittedly it is a huge 3D advert for Heineken but it will make you appreciate beer a lot more. It is a bit pricey although comparable to other attractions in Amsterdam. However, there is always flyers about that will save you a couple euros, plus you get a couple drinks included. Also, ask in the shop about the free boat to the 'Brand store' where you can redeem the free gift token. It's a canal boat that departs opposite the Heineken Experience that will take you there. Please be aware that once you have visited the Heineken Experience, rode the Heineken boat and visited the Heineken Brand Store, you will have an overwhelming desire to only drink Heineken for the remainder of you stay in Amsterdam, or at least I did. The branding works, I guess. On a whole, the staff are very friendly and welcoming and make the whole (Heineken!) experience a good one.
Taste Fresh Beer. It's a place to learn the process of making beer and the history of it. you can have three 500 ml glass of fresh beer during your experience.It would be a nice journey.
Very good tour. This tour was one of the best ive been on. Very interesting

Interesting tour. Enjoyable tour. Some of the different interactive displays did not work and the rest were very crowded. There was 2 free drinks though! Educational. Note: don't try to walk to the Heineken store unless you have a lot of time and patience since it is a fairly long distance and hard to locate using the tourist maps!

Fun, interesting and sample a few free beers. This attraction I feel is well worth a visit and the cost. It as many attractions inside and is fun, interesting and well run. Do not worry if you do not drink beer as you can get a soft drink instead.
Great Fun. I learned a lot about Heineken beer and enjoyed a taste as well
Fun Experience.. My daughter and I enjoyed this very much. The beer is very cold and yummy.

Only 15 Euros, includes 2 drinks. Heineken really did a good job putting together this experience. And experience is the word for it, don't think you're going on a brewery tour. There are a lot of exhibits about the history of Heineken and the making of beer and a brief glimpse of their horses. Then you enter the more tech driven part of the exhibit starting with a interactive video of you being made into beer after which, is a tasting (in addition to the 2 drinks). After the tour you can get a voucher from the gift shop for the canal ride to their brand store. It departs every 30 minutes, and I had just missed one and didn't feel like waiting, but hey, it's a free canal tour and they give you a free gift at the store too.
Very Enjoyable!. Worth the entrance fee, and takes about 1 1/4 an hour in total.

Bit of fizzy fun. Really enjoyed our visit there. You get 2 drinks in with the entry price of 17 euros (or 15 euros if you buy them from the tour and ticket places throughout the city). Took us about 2 hours to do the tour and we thought it was well worth the money. You also get a ticket for a short canal ride to their other souvenir shop but we didn't use this as they only depart every hour and we'd just missed one. I would definitely recommend this tour.
For Beer Lovers Only. Extremely expensive and uninteresting-only of interest if you love beer and want to socialize with mostly 20 year olds

Nice surprises. Going through the Heineken experience includes beside visiting old factory's halls, also being in the manufacturing process as an oat grain (good simulation, their clip and your senses), being teached how to fill a glass of draft beer and getting a diploma with your name for doing it right, drinking cooled beer in an pub-like environment. Nice, very nice even for non-drinkers.

Good Times All Around. I've been the the Heineken Brewery multiple times and I always enjoyed it. The tour is appropriate for all ages too as they provide beverages and snacks that are appropriate for minors as well.

More than just a brewery tour. I am writing this as someone who doesn't like beer. I went with my husband and still had an enjoyable time. They have put effort into making it an interesting experience where you learn about the process of how beer is made. There are interactive displays and activities such as pulling a virtual beer. Entry includes a free beer that is given to you during a beer tasting explanation as well as 2 free beers in the bar at the end. They have some good Heineken merchandise in the shop too.

Informative, but sometimes...kitchy.. Heineken has done a great job of modernizing their museum and making it interesting to walk around in, all while imparting you with the knowledge of their beer making process. That said, it has a ton of displays that got kind of tiring by the end. Make sure to get the free gift! It is Aviator sunglasses, with a small Heineken logo on them. Nice for an inexpensive pair of sunglasses while traveling around.

Fantastic!!. We really enjoyed our Heineken Experience, the whole place was very interactive and of course the free beer was a great bonus. Plus you have a ride on a boat so you get the best of both worlds! Would recommend this!!
A beerdrinkers paradise?. Just a tourist trap. Not as good as other brewery visits for example in Copenhagen or Einbeck.

I was hoping more. It's just nice because you're in the first factory! There's nothing so interesting inside just some videos and that's all. The thing I liked most was the boat which gave us a lift to take our "free" gift.

Now, I love Heineken even more!. We dediced to experience the Heineken tour although my partner doesnt enjoy beer. You need to pay about 15Euros (if I can remember correctly) which entitles you to 2 glass of beer. It is a self guided tour. You can see all the previous Heineken packaging (bottle / labels), how they transformed from a small company to world class company. You can also view on how the beer is being processed. How to pour a glass of beer, which everyone think they are doing it right hehe. You can also record a video or snap a picture and email it to your friends. It was quite fun. The staff are well trained and professional. Towards the end, you will reach the merchandise store, lots of things to see.
Waste of Time. This was just an advertisement for Heineken. Only lovers of this beer would enjoy this experience. It was filled with American frat boy tourists.

A CHILLED OUT TOUR. Enjoyed the heineken experience it was interesting a little about how they make the beer but mostly about the history and the advertising .Included in the price you get a couple of beers and a short canal trip to where you pick up a gift (ONLY SOMETHING SMALL A KEYRING OR SOMETHING LIKE THAT) all in all a very good couple of hours .

Great value, awesome experience. This is one of the MUST SEE attraction of Amsterdam. The Heineken Experience includes lots of interactive activites including being brewed like a beer. With the ticket two drinks are included, plus an extra Heineken at the tasting bar and a complimentary gift. Totally worth it
Great experience. I went with my husband and as I do not drink beer I was not expecting much..BUT I enjoyed myself! It is great value for money and a interesting tour. The beer even tastes better!
Nice fun. The experience is very fun with kind staff.I recommend the shop, not very expensive and great items.

Learnt a few things about beer. We did not plan to go there but we gave it a try and were not disappointed. Entry is not cheap at €17 but you get to have 3 beers as well as a free gift. They have designed the visit to keep you interested... Enjoy the beer making journey and the tasting soon after....... No more as I do not want to spoil it for you!

Well worth the time. Have to say that I am glad that we took the time to go and see this experience.Firstly as I'm not a beer drinker, I thought that it would be waste of time but I couldn't be more wrong.The tour is self guided but it flows really well and towards the end after you are taken through the history of Heineken you get to be shown how to drink it properly.I myself actually came out loving it :)At the end of the tour you also get a boat trip to the Heineken store which is included in you ticket price. Thought this was a fab idea as you get to see the canals and learn alittle bit of its history.Give it a go as we certainly enjoyed it.

too expensive and not that interesting. I think it must just be me but I didn't find this tour very interesting. The fee is way to big. The inside has been well made but it was a little too Disney for me. Haven't been to this type of attraction before but won't be going again. I like beer but it doesn't take hours to explain how it is made.I think this is really just for lager boys. For them its probably great fun but anyone else don't bother.
Fun and Informative. Both my husband and teenage son really enjoyed this trip it is worthwhile and a creative way to show how this famous beer is made
Good fun. The heineken experience was good fun and interesting and the beer was gooooooooooooood.
Fun for the family. While this is a very commercial experience it was fun and offbeat from all of our touring. It flowed well and the activities were fun--the 4D ride was amusing.

Fun in a bottle. This is one of those stops that you sort of just have to do when you visit Amsterdam. It's mildly educational (re: brewing beer) and is well laid out. The "ride" where "you" are "brewed" is very cute though slightly silly. Of course you get a free beer which is always nice and I enjoyed seeing the horses, which I'm sure are just there for show and live quite a posh life. :) I'm glad we went and I would recommend. It's a bit of fun!

much more than a brewery tour!. Loved it, especially the 'ride' explaining the brewing to bottling journey' informative and friendly staff and stowed 3 suitcases securely for free which was unexpected!Shame you are not allowed to visit the stables which you get a tantalizing glimpse of, they are immaculate the horses looked magnificent.Enjoyed my drinks and learned lots without realising it, thanks :)

you better buy 4 beers than pay $20 for a boring beer story. We visited the place 2 days ago. and was told it was alot of fun at the hotel. the truth is far from fun. first of all they charge almost 20 entrance fee. that is pretty expensive. and the tour is really boring...you see some pictures and hear some boring stories,

Started good but faded away. To avoid big queues buy your tickets beforehand online or at other outlets. It certainly speeds up getting in. The start is quite good and interesting and a bit more space to take in the info as you go thro and the old brewhouse with the copperwork is well worth seeing on to the horses etc. Its later when you wait and queue for the ride etc things slow down. then on to the sample room which was fine the bit after seemed like filler to us and the experience started to lose its fizz like a flat pint! It was a bit later in the day we went in Saterday afternoon. Probably a time to miss with hindsight as there was what seemed like a few stag groups which seemed to spoil a it a bit as well. The one bar area closed as we came to it and everybody then crammed into the one area. Too crammed for comfort while holding your 2 glasses of Heineken and we did seemed a bit rushed at the end. Also the free gift couldn't be claimed in the Gift shop at the end of the tour but you had to get on a boat for a trip to another store. Sorry but this seemed too commercial and made the tour seem like a glorified commercial, which it is really i know. This just put us off at the end and we left without purchasing anything from the shop and that is unusual with me in particular, especially a beer shop. Maybe worth heineken looking at its policy at the end because we all felt let down at the end after a good start. This is reflected in our rating

Nice attraction. Beer connoisseurs and beer lovers alike will really enjoy this Heineken Experience Museum, very informative and just simply a real cool place to visit. Oh and the free beers aren't bad either! Some other reviewers have complained about the admission price, but you are getting 2 free beers along with the admission so there is nothing really to complain about.

Not expecting much but I really enjoyed myself. This was a Christmas gift for my husband; I booked the weekend away to Amsterdam as a surprise and decided we would use his gift also. I wasn’t expecting too much as I’m more of a wine drinker than a beer drinker...He was very excited being the hardcore Heineken fan he is. Started off with putting our bags and coats away safely with the staff (free of charge) then took ourselves around the tour (no tour guide) to see the history and changes throughout Heinekens time. There were lots of things to read and look at with fun pictures to be taken along the way. There is a tasting session where you are taught how to enjoy the beer to its full potential. A fun little ride where you are turned into a Heineken beer yourself (ha-ha this made me laugh....NOT what I was expecting!) Then you arrive at the Heineken bar where you are able to order two Heineken beers free of charge. You then proceed to the gift shop where various things can be bought and personalised things can be made (I bought a bottle of beer with our names written on it...Kind of goofy but I like it) So all in all its a fun interesting trip NOT JUST FOR MEN but for women also! I had a really great time and would defiantly recommend it to anyone else going – took us around 2 hours to do the entire trip.
Good experience. If you are a beer lover, you should make time to visit this place. Nice and informative. Although I found the ticket a bit expensive but still worth visiting.

Really enjoyable!!. The Heineken brewery was fantastic! You can wonder around at your own pace, the staff were lovely and there is alot of entertainment set up for you to play with - pouring your own fake beer!! You can also pour a real beer and recieve a certificate and enjoy your beer after or go straight to the bar at the end of the tour and receive 2 beers. The gift shop is great - they have a staff member engraving heineken glasses, so you can get a personal message on a glass for a reasonable price. The tour is priced well for the experience. This is definitley not a boring experience!

Heineken Experience. I have to start by saying this is something we were not going to do but I am so glad we ended up doing it! The place is really big so your tour can last as long as you want. Each room you can stay in awhile. They have a lot of fun things you can do like take a picture of yourself & send postcards by email, pretend your a DJ and spin, sing in a music video and more! You get a small sample where they ask you questions and if you get the right answer you get another free sample. After the whole tour you get to drink your two free beers in the bar area which is pretty cool. Also after that you can take a boat ride to another giftshop for a free gift. Now the gift was a keychain or something small like that BUT go for the boat ride!!

More of an experience than a tour. Although I prefer American craft beers, the Heineken Experience was well worth my time. I've been on many brewery tours and they're typically pretty boring. Heineken makes sure that you learn about the brewing process (water, hops, barley, yeast) while engaging visitors. The canal ride that's included was a nice extra and it kept us from having to pay more money to do something similar, but it's also rather quick and takes you to a branded store that was a waste of time.

Like being in a Heineken advert..... A fun visit to a brewery; you see the history of the company, how they make the beer and take a ride as if you are the beer being brewed. You get to watch Heineken adverts through the ages in various funky ways, you can take pictures and videos with Heineken themes and email them to your friends. You can (at extra cost) get a bottle of Heineken engraved with your name. You get to drink the beer. And at the end you get to spend lots of money on the Heineken products. Oh - and don't forget the free trip on a boat (takes 15 mins) to the Heineken brand shop to spend more money on Heineken goods. Is it a huge Heineken advert that you have to pay 17 euro for? Well yes - but I'm such a sucker for the Heineken name - I love it. Pity they didn't have the Heineken flip flops in my size - I really wanted them :(
Lots of fun. Went to a concert there and it was great! The experience was a fun change from the art museums. The beer was great!Grammy Sharon

Good tour - especially when it's raining.... The Heineken Experience is well presented. The history of the brewery and the production process are all included.
