It was great to enjoy the two free beers at the end of the tour.We had fun in the video room where we made a video and then emailed it to our family and friends.We took the boat ride (included with the entry ticket) back to the city center and went to the Heineken store. The free item was a Heineken dogtag, so don't waste your time unless you want to buy other souvenirs in the store.

wonderful experience. I've really enjoyed the brewery Heineken.The guided tour is very interesting, for sure there you can drink the beer which is much better than what is sold in other countries.Only thing: I think the the entrance fee is slightly higher.

Good fun. Easy to locate! Easy to enjoy! Well presented story of the beer and its place in Dutch history.The brewing process explained well and the stables a joy to watch.Good interactive guides and displays. Well done Heneken. Oh and did I mention samples of beer?
Interesting and unusual. Worth the visit though a bit expensive. Consider a full 90 minutes to visit all the different rooms.

Heineken Brewery. Visited in March 2011 and must say I was very surprised by how much I enjoyed my visit. The staff are very friendly and the whole experience is fun from start to finish. The best bit is of course the free beer along the way. I don't like beer but drank it and enjoyed it. Came out feeling slightly tipsy but had a great time and would recommend.

Excellent value for money. Excellent place and definatley worth going to visit. It's got a great attitude and the staff are really friendly and you can tell they like to be there. Also included in the visit, was a few glasses of beer, and very nice beer it is to. Also, it included a barge trip back into the city centre which was handy as we walked it to the centre. Again. worth visiting.

I Don't Like Heineken, BUT.... My wife and I visited the Heineken Experience in Amsterdam in June 2012. She hates beer, and I don't like Heineken, but the experience was really a lot of fun, and I would recommend it to anyone spending some time in Amsterdam. We enjoyed learing the history of the brand, walking through the process of making the beer, and then of course - taste testing! I drank my beers, and then my wifes (remember she doesn't like beer). As you might imagine, the Heineken I usually don't like got better the more I drank...My wife really enjoyed seeing the Heineken horses on site, and then we saw them pulling a Heineken beer wagon in the city later.How could you not enjoy doing something like this in Amsterdam?

well worth a visit if you like brewery tours. very interactive and innovative tour mixing the history of the brewery and brewing process with some hands on activities.3 small glasses of beer thrown in to the price of 17 Euroenjoyed the tour and they had some good specials on in the shop. 8 Euro for glass that can be engraved on the spot and you can also get a bottle printed with your name on it.

Really Nice Place to Look Round. A short walk around the canal from the Rijksmuseum or on the 16 or 24 tram route the place, which used to be the brewery is now a site dedicated to the history of the brand. The first part includes how the beer is made and the family behind it. The exhibtions include the equipment used to brew the beer, the shire horses used to pull the drays and a sort of bottleing plant. My favorite bits are the ride in which you get "brewed", the tasting and remember if you are asked what you are looking at then it's a "Heineken". The admission includes a small taster and then up to 500ml of the beer at the end. There is also a shop and now an offer of a boat trip to a larger shop.

Great afternoon!!. This is one attraction not to be missed!! A lot of fun, there's lots of interactive things to do. Loads of photo opportunities. It's very interesting to see the huge vats etc. The 'stand in ride' was a good laugh. The free beers were excellent. All in all, a good visit and would more than likely go again the next time we visit Amsterdam!
Good time. Entertaining, a bit touristy, kind of on the expensive side. Moves well, lots to see.
You have to go!. Brilliant! Not your everyday brewery tour! Enjoy and speak up to win more free beer when they ask you questions about the beer!

good, but let down by the free boat link. Really enjoyed the attraction itself, which was varied, interesting and had lots of interactive elements.The ticket includes a free boat ride to the Heineken store near Rembrandt Square and we really wanted to take this. We queued with 2 other groups at a sign on the canal branded as the Heineken Experience but unfortunately the boat left by another platform. As they are once an hour and we had a busy day planned we could not wait for the next one. Do ask where the correct platform is as it is not obvious

Surprisingly very interesting and great fun!!. This is a very informative place but great fun too!! Well worth the admission price (try to find a voucher for a reduced rate, ours was in our hotel lobby) Lots to see and do with many interactive games. And of course the beer tasting!! You also get another large beer at the end!! So again well worth the admission price.

Fun Place for Heineken Lovers. Spent 2 fun afternoon hours touring the Heineken Experience. Lots of information, photo ops, gifts and some delicious beer to top things off. A nice way to spend a few hours in Amsterdam, great for a rainy day.
Interesting and fun tour. I enjoyed the Heineken Experience. I thought it was a great combination of self guided and interactive displays. Excellent look at the history of this beer.

nice. The museum is a really great experience.This tour iis fun even if you dont like beer, you see and learn about beer,how beer is made and play with several interactive displays.The entrance fee to the Heineken Experience is:• € 17,00 at the entrance• € 15,00 for online ticket
A fun diversion. A fun diversion while in Amsterdam. Decent price and a few free beers afterwards. Linger around and you'll likely get a few more!
Different and amusing. Different than museums and churches, but very amusing and interesting. Slightly expensive though. But I recommend.

Great for College Students. The museum is a really great experience. The self-guided tour is really interesting, without overloads of information. All of the employees seem very happy to be there and ready to answer questions. The free beer doesn't hurt either! The tour would also be interesting for non-drinkers.
Fun!. This tour iis fun even if you dont like beer. You get to learn about the brewery, how beer is made and play with several interactive displays.

Way better than expected. I took my parents to the Heineken Experience and we were all very impressed with it - it made for a great afternoon out in Amsterdam.The exhibits were all very modern and clean, it was a good mix of informational and tactile and you get free samples as you go along...plus a lesson in how to drink beer properly!I think the best 'icing on the cake' was the complimentary canal boat ride at the end of the tour that takes you to their Heineken store. The store is fine but the boat ride is great!Would definitely recommend!
Good fun. Had a great time on the Heineken Experience and think it should be a must see for beer lovers. It is a fun and interactive museum.

Brilliant place to visit! Ensure you have plenty of time.. My first visit on a brewer museum. This was fantastic to know about from History of Heineken, how to make beer alongside with its marketing. World class and worth a visit. Only thing is we had short of time. Ensure you have plenty of time like 3 hours at least if you are beer fanatic.

Fun visit. I really enjoyed the Heineken Experience. I enjoyed the self guided nature of the tour and the fact you were free to do as you pleased. There were a few stag dos there during our visit and the atmosphere was very good. There is a lot of advertising but imo this is always going to be the case with these types of attractions. I have been to similar places in other countries but I think this was my favourite.

Beer, Beer, Beer!. So much fun! Its not a lie when they call it the Heineken Experience, the first part of this self guided tour is through the history of how the Mr. Heineken came to have his brewery and how it has become so famous today, after that every thing becomes interactive from being able to stir a mixture of ingredients before it comes beer to you your self going through the process of becoming a beer, then being able to taste test, making your own commercial and other interactive things and also have the opportunity to pour your own beer from the draft (its harder then it sounds ;) ). The gift store is not over priced which was nice I got two engraved beer glasses for 16€, not bad. It was a great experience and I recommend this to everyone!

A must-do in Amsterdam. You learn while having fun. You learn actually what marketing means and how to get people to love paying for your product. Heineken is world class at this.The tour is nevertheless entertaining. Tip: choose to get a licence for pouring beer instead of an extra cold-one. That's so much fun.

One of the must stops in Amsterdam. I don't know how anyone could not give this place a 5 star rating.I have been on a few brewery tours, and nothing compared to this. It's fun, interactive. There are guide that talk you through parts of the process. A fun brew-you movie that walks you through the whole brewing process.Free coat check at the entrance. It is 2e cheaper if you get tickets online(don't need to set date, useable anytime).2.5 pints of beer included in the tour. Nice gift shop at the end. I got an engraved pint glass that turned out great. You get a free boat ride to their other gift shop, which wasn't any bigger and had some different stuff (no engraving, some stuff not there that was at main experience). The 10%off reward from Facebook game is only useable at the experience. Free gift was a Heineken dog tag/name tag, or a photo from machine.Boat leaves on the hour, so we walked (missed it by a bit).Overall a great experience.

Fun but, a bit of a disappointment.. I had high expectations so maybe it's partly my own fault. Although I rated it average I would have gone as far as to say it was good. But to rate it very good would have been a stretch in my opinion. The tour is self guided and goes through the history of the Heineken family and the growth of the company as you walk from room to room. You do learn a bit about the beer making process which I found interesting. I would agree with reviewer Kris_from_Edm that it is very much "a series of beer advertisements" that you just paid 17 Euros to watch. You did get to sample a small glass of beer along the way as well as getting 2 more at the end of the tour. If you're a Heineken connoisseur (as I am) you'll still want to go there. I did like the free gift (Heineken bottle opener on a lanyard) that you can get if you go to the off site gift shop. They do provide the (canal boat) transportation which was pretty cool too. Like I said, I would have rated it good but not necessarily very good. But hey, I been there, done that, and got the t-shirt.

Great Experience. Everybody who is in amsterdam and likes the beer have to visist this tour. It is not a real factory visit, it is more a tour and promotion for Heineken but thay made it enjoyable. You can taste Heineken 0,25 l but if you are with girls or you are standing on a good place it can be 1 or 2 more 0,25 l and after the tour it is a chance to have tvice 0,35 l Heineken or one extra cold (i realy don't know what is good in it) and you can be a draftmaster or what, you can make your own glass of draft Heineken and there is a lot of people who make it bad, but there is a guy who halping you and you can trying and trying, what is bad goes on waste, but there is a few what you can gat if u see the production of the master and find out what noumber the helper thinking about between 1-10 :) It is fun and takes 2 hour if you wanna see all. Oh and don't forgat you can make your own beer bottle with your name on it, just be carefull because if thenetherlanders bad words like "kut" is in your name, the system won't lat you write it.

Fascinating Heineken Experience. I thoroughly enjoyed this interactive brewery tour. Being able to walk step by step through each of the brewing processes allows even a non-beer drinker to gain an appreciation of the 'art' of brewing. The tasting at the end is a great idea - especially the pop quiz with the chance to 'win' more Heineken. I also really liked the gift shop - good quality hats, shirts etc..

Well worth a visit!. Today myself and my family went to the museum. We had per bought tickets to avoid the line but there wasn't one anyway. The museum is really informative for people like me who know nothing about beer, it shows the process of how it is made and what goes into it. It also goes through the history of the heineken family. Everyone each gets two free beers and few smaller one as well. Or if you don't like the beer do what I did and give it to your dad haha. The staff were all really friendly and we had a good day :)

Not worth the price. I actually toured the Heineken Brewery about 9 years ago and it's change a lot since then. They have made it into one big marketing campaign and less about the beer and brewing process. For 17 euro you get 2.5 beers and a free gift for the gift shop that is a 10 minute walk or a free hourly ferry ride. The free gift used to be a small Heineken glass, but now they give you a Heineken dog tag. Overall it was ok, but there are probably better ways to spend 17 euro.
Good fun. Good fun between all these tourists. The 'Brew yourself' was fun. Good fun in the cafe at the end, getting some free beers!

Very enjoyable visit. It is a little pricy at €17 pp but that does include 1 small taster drink and a choice of 2 glasses of Heineken (33cl) or 1 ice cold Heineken (50cl). The tour is very informative and you can taste the wort and handle the barley and hops at various points of the tour which helps being it to life. The tour is good fun and you end in the bar for your drink at the end.If you are planning a boat tour of the canal there are boats leaving right outside the brewery (€14) and if you pre-book your Heineken and Boat tickets in the office there a combined ticket is €26.50 which is a nice saving on doing both separately

There are better ways to spend 17 euro in Amsterdam. Essentially a series of beer advertisements you pay to watch. There are a few cool things like the "4d experience" where you get sprayed with water a few times while standing on a moving platform, but it isn't that great. You get 2.5 glasses of Heineken on this tour, anyone really tipsy after that is a lightweight. I could make better beer mixing yellow food coloring with sparkling water! Also, most breweries will take you on a much more educational tour (about beer making) without the high cost. Spend that $17 on a canal tour on the main drag by centraal station and a couple of good Belgian Trappist ales, and skip this crap. Trust me.

Do you like beer.. I am sorry. I do not like most American beers, including those imported for American consumption. I grew up on Dutch, Flemish and German beers. Nothing in the US comes close. Even so, the Heineken experience is over the top. If you want to be knee walking drunk, take this tour and accept every glass they offer you. On the other hand, if you listen, you wil learn more about beer than you ever thought possible aand understand the differences between American beers and European beers. In addition, you will fully understand the attraction of small batch breweries in the USA.

Mediocre. Definitely overrated.. This tour would be great if you're out to have some mindless fun. It's a goofy attraction with little 'meat'. The 'museum' is basically just a PR exhibit for Heineken - Why Heineken is great, the letter the founder wrote to his mother, etc, etc. The 'how beer is made' part was so cheesy that it was actually hilarious, something you'd expect at Disneyworld. The 'make your own beer' thing is really just an opportunity to have your name on a beer can.Yes, you get two free beers at the end, plus an additional small one in a 'tasting room', but that's really all the place has going for it.It's not worth the time.

Fun visit. Enjoyed the tour, great beer! Thought the gift shop could be better. Lots of opportunities to buy personalized items, they all looked cheesy. We took they boat to the Heineken brand store and was not impressed, but did enjoy the free ride through the canals.
perfect choice. Everything was awesome. We have fun , drink our beer, make our own beer.

Parting money to listen to corporate drivel. We went on this tour expecting to be educated about the beer brewing process. Unfortunately, 80% of this tour is dedicated to showcasing the Heineken brand. If you enjoy paying money to watch Heineken advertisements, read about Heineken corporate history (which is probably available for free online) and learn about Heineken's new CSR initiative then this is the tour for you. If you are interested in beers - brewing, tasting, drinking - then give this a miss.

A little tipsy. Fabulous day out, was definitely worth the money. They show you how the brewing process is done, mixed with their own history, and also give you lots of glasses of Heineken throughout the tour, by the end of the tour both of us felt very tipsy! FABULOUS!

An Heineken Experience. It was great you start by learning about the founder then you tour the place to find out how it is made, Then you go into a 4-D experience which is great, then you can see the horses in the stables ten you get chance to try the beer you also get a chance to pull a pint you also get a wristband with tokens on it which you can exchange for a beer and a another token which you can exchange for a free gift at the Heineken Brandstore in town, you can even go to the store by boat free

Fun. Suffice to say, if any other guided tour ended up with me learning something as important as this, well I would still probably not be that smart, but I would know how to pour a perfect beer, how to savour the depth of the flavour, and how one of the best beers is made. A very nice way to kill a few hours with a great reward at the end.

Very Modern and Enjoyable Tour. 17e entrance may seem a bit pricey but it is a very good quality tour, very modern and it includes a couple glasses of Heineken through the tour. We did see large Q's to get in but best thing is to pick a quiet time. Also check any maps / brochures you may have, they might include a 20% discount for the gift shop

A Rather Enjoyable Experience!. My spouse and I spent a few hours at the Heineken Experience and it was rather enjoyable! It was interesting to learn about the history of Heineken, which we expected. However, it also gave us a few pleasant surprises. One example is that there was one point where we actually had the hands on experience of churning the beer so speak which was fun. We also enjoyed the "Brew U" simulation where you get to experience the brewing process as if you were the actual beer. We really enjoyed the fact that you got an idea of how the beer is actually made. If you are looking to kill a few hours, this is a great place to go!
Cool tour, worth the money.. Nice brand experience for those who like Heineken beer.

Great fun for a few hours!. We visited the Heineken Experience on Saturday, having pre-booked online. The museum is really interesting, charting the history of Heineken and how it is made, along with various interactive exhibits, such as photo opportunities, karaoke videos, and really comfortable TV pods. You also get two free drinks at the end! Highly recommended!

good. it was really good, smelt but good! ha. gives you a glance at how heineken is made. you get a virtual tour on this motion ride to its quite good.
well worth visiting though. its really enjoyable

Fun. My husband and I spent an afternoon here while we had some not so wonderful weather to contend with. The experience is much more fun than I expected it to be.We learned a lot about beer even though this is no longer a working brewery. There are also a lot of interactive things to do while walking through that made it even more entertaining. It doesn't hurt that at the end of the tour you get to drink. Also, pay attention on the way through because when you go to the tasting and they ask questions, if you get it right you get extra beers!

Even if you're not a big beer drinker - go!. I really loved it there. We pre-booked our tickets so we didn't need to queue. It is very interactive and you get a chance to take lots of pictures and videos whilst inside.The best part - the free beers at the end!!

So much more to a beer than meets the eye.... This was a lot of fun! The experience is interactive and rich in history. I learnt a lot about beer, how it's made, the right way to pour it and most importantly, the right way to drink it!The experience engages all the senses and exceeded my expectations. There is a lot of merchandise to buy and memories to capture.The only disappointment was that the emails we sent on the interactive tools did not reach our inboxes.Otherwise, a must-do when in Amsterdam!
Fun. Fun place to visit. The tour takes about 2 hours including free beer.
Fun tour. You can see how beer is made and at the end have a few at the bar. Tacky tour but fun.

Bad!. visitied the place a few days ago. and was told it was alot of fun at the hotel.the truth is far from fun. first of all they charge 17 entrance fee. that is pretty expensive. and the tour is really boring...you see some pictures and hear some boring stories...it's like a Beer Museum..and it's alot more boring then it sounds.and the worst thing....you only get around a 0.5L of beer!!!!!! i would have expected alot moredo not go therebad bad bad
I was surprised at the tour. It took an hour or so.. Fun tour. Pretty advanced displays and effects. Also samplesmduring and two beers after the tour. I would do it again.

Beer Experience with Great Service. I have to visit breweries on every trip I take (that is if there is one in the location I am visiting). Heineken is beer known around the globe and obviously you don't get that kind of reputation with great a great product and great service. This is a very nice place that makes sure you are satisfied before leaving. We got a personalized engraved glass that was completed within minutes of ordering by a very friendly staff. Great Experience from a great beer company!

Very entertaining. Visited here last week, while we were in Amsterdam for 5 days. We went early afternoon midweek.
I have to say we (4 adults) all had a good time. Liked the interactive stuff. Even had 2 beer even though i prefer wine, but it had to be done.
I thought the 17 euros was a fair price.

Great Place! Worth going to. We spent quite a lot of time there. Range of things to see and do, this is one of the places that should be seen in Amsterdam. And you get beer at the end! Friendly atmosphere.

Theme park style. More information and interactive games than I expected. Make sure you get one of the discount voucher that are floating all over own as it is definitely overpriced. Basically you are going on an advertising trip by heiniken, so it I'd not worth $17!

Great fun to see it from the inside. I've been to a few similar attractions all over the world and I think only Guinness Storehouse beats Heineken. Heineken Experience is very interactive and you won't get bored. Among others you'll see what it is like to be beer :) , learn how to pour proper draughts or get a free boat to other Heineken store. And of course finally get some booze :)

SOOOO MUCH FUN!!!. We missed this on our first trip to Amsterdam years ago as we just assumed it would be another boring tour of how they make beer. WRONG. We left laughing and happy (probably a little tipsy as well). This is a must see, must do.The beginning. Very friendly, happy, informative people checking you in. The ticket is a little pricey, I think it was 17 euros? But we did not mind as the guy told us it included a few beers, a boat ride at the end, and a free gift. We figured, 17 euros was worth it for the canal ride alone.We never expected what we encountered. Well, the first part was pretty normal. A funny little movie at the beginning which was v.v. cute. Then up some step reading lots of posters as we went up. Then, the brewery. Someone handing out tastings of I think it was the hops....we passed on that. All the machinery showing you how they make the beer. Then, the stables. We figured we were closed to being done at this point but not at all. After the stables, they had us queue up to go into these small rooms. We went in, they are mini movie theaters. Four of us in the first row, four in the second, etc. They were tiered up so everyone could see. The movie started and told us we were going to experience the beer making experience as if we were in the beer. It was wild....the floor started to move, they blew bubbles down on us...it was hilarious. We left that room and went into a room where you can sit and watch any and all commercial they have ever made.....some I had never seen and were quite funny (weird but in a funny way). Then several rooms of interactive games. You can be part of your own Heineken commercial and they will email it to you....v.v. funny. I forgot, they gave us a beer before we did this and told us how to drink it. After several rooms of interactive games, etc.....you come to the bar. There are two bars. It appeared the one was letting you pour your own. We went to the other one where they have pictures from all over the world in a video on the wall. When you put your beer (here they give you two more) down on the table, the table is a map of the world lit up. When you put your beer down, a coaster automatically appears. It just goes on and on with the silly fun. Then the gift shop. Then, the canal trip in the Heineken boat. About a 20 minute boat ride with a tour guide (you can also buy another beer!). The only down side is they drop you off in a neighborhood that was a little far from where we wanted to be...it is a nice neighborhood...but far from where we wanted to be. No worries, we just took the tram. They take you to their second gift shop at the end of the boat ride and the gift is a musical pen.....what else would you expect:). All in all, I would highly recommend and the boat ride was very relaxing and picturesque. They went beyond our expectations and we still laugh about it now....even when we watch the commercial we made!WELL DONE HEINEKEN!
Outstanding. You must go on the tour. It is so well done especially the area where the visitors are being bottled. Don't miss it.

Well worth going. Very good value (esp if you think it cost much the same as the rubbish Ice bar), well organised, planned out, very informative and then to top it all you get a few nice beers. Def go and see this. Its prob around 15 euros and it a nice walk there on a sunny day otherwise take the 16 or 24 tram...there is a carousel bar in the park opposite if you want to wait or chill afterwards. Then hop on a tram back to centre. Just remember if you buy the do it yourself printed heineken bottle (around £4) don't try and take it as hand luggage...DOH! had to hand it over. Felt v stupid and annoyed...should have drunk the beer beforehand!!!

cool experience with Heineken!!!!. so interesting to know when, how and how much beer is right for each person to have!!!! interesting all the way experience & tour, so much fun, and perfect people to explain how you drink a cool and right beer , letting u know if its flat or not and the best way to drink and enjoy it!!! very useful and interesting information via heineken brewery experience of holland! fantastic!!!!!!

Good Value For Money. This is great value for money, the toor takes about 2 hours at least and you can go round at your leisure. You also get free Heinekenor coke. Lots to see and do, fun for all the family.

Worth the time.... It takes about two hours to go thru a visit of the old beer brewery, the explanation of the brewing process, a tour of memorabilia and sponsorship and a couple of cold one ... and it is worth every single minute..

A Fun Experience. This has so many things to see and do with a rewarding drink at the end of it - it combines learning about brewing Heineken, novelty activities and a rewarding drink at the end. great for a wide range of ages - there is a soft drink option - and a great way to start an evening if you go late in the afternoon before closing.There's also a great souvenir shop!

Worth the price!. I didn't like the idea of spending €15 but when all was said and done, I really enjoyed it! Like a reviewer said below, we received 3 beers. There was a cool section where for just €5 you could personalize a beer bottle. HOWEVER, if you're planning on flying home and you only have a carry-on maybe consider waiting until you get to the gift shop and pick up an engraved glass for only €8.

Pretty good. The Heineken Experience is a decent place to spend an hour or two. It starts off as a pretty standard brewery tour. You see the history of the Heineken brand and how the beer is made. There is a seemingly endless maze of things to do and see including personalizing your own bottle and living through all sorts of Heineken commercials. Looing back though, I chose the Heineken Museum over one of Amsterdam's world famous museums and I probably regret it. Still, a must-see for those really into beer.

Very Surprising. What we thought would be a standard brewery tour greatly surprised us. The place is amazing, from making video's, posing in Heineken themed pictures, practising pouring beer and even having your own personalised bottle. Plus afterwards you can take a free canal boat ride to the seperate shop if you want to go to the otherside of the city. Well worth a visit.

Fun Way to See How Beer is Made. This is a fun location that shows you how they make beer in an entertaining way, they also have a ride simulation that shows you the entire process of making beer that I found to be enjoyable. Having said all that, if you are pressed for time this is NOT a must do and one could easily skip this location, plus the cost is kind of high, unless you really enjoy drinking beer (you get two beers at the end, plus one small beer on the tour) the tour is self paced so you can take as long or as short of time you want. They have many interactive displays and multimedia demonstrations. There is even a part where you can personalize your own bottle of Heineken beer (5 euros)

This is NOT "a Must see" attraction of Amsterdam.. It looks like a new and well maintained place. It is a guided tour so you have to tour the factory in groups. There is quite a lot of waiting to do between stops. It is really not cheap. However the cost includes 2 beer or soft drinks. Usually I love multimedia museums, but this one is quite boring In my opinion it is a waste of time and money. So if you saw all other attractions in town and you do not anything else to do go to the Heineken Experience
Brilliant. Well worth going to see definitely one of the best attractions in Amsterdam.Really large place so it didnt feel that crowded and loads to see.

Why beer foam is important. This was one of the funnest experiences ever. Can't believe I enjoyed paying to walk through a giant Heineken tradeshow. I loved learning how to pour beer; why the foamy head is critical; why the "e" in the Heineken logo mark is tipped. You can even send your friends a video of you singing in Dutch and personalize your own beer bottle or mug.
Amazing. The best thing to do in dam is this. you get the history the process of making the beer 3 free samples, Football section that was amazing.

Heineken Experience April 2012. I had the pleasure of visiting the Heineken Experience whilst visiting the glorious city of Amsterdam. We decided rather than get a tram we would navigate the streets and canals and walk there, which was pretty straight forward and only about 20 minutes from Central Station.We managed to get some discount cards on the way as well, which got us five euros off the admission price. These are available at most hotels and there are even some discount tour operators on the way that will offer you a similar deal.After paying our cash we got a wqrist band that entitiled us to two beers and a free gift. I wont spoil the actual experience, other than to say enjoy your time as a bottle of heineken! The ride is quite funny and the beer sampling is great!!
Well organised fun. Great beer tasting and amazing product marketing :)

Fun, informative and definitely worth a visit. It was raining really heavily and we didn't know what to do so thought we'd try the Heineken experience as we had a few hours to spare. Didn't really know what to expect here, however I was very surprised. I'm not really a drinker myself, but I thoroughly enjoyed this. Whilst learning all about Heineken and it's history and how it's made, there are tour guides in each of the sections explaining things to you in detail, giving you master classes and answering questions. You get to taste the beer in it's different stages of being made and as well as a class in how to taste Heineken, you are also given 2 free tokens, which entitle you to 2 free drinks at the end. If you didn't want to have the drinks, you could exchange these in to have a class in pouring the perfect pint of Heineken, which includes a certificate. There is also a simulator type of ride and a cool lounge to relax in for a bit after you've had your tasting session. Overall, a really fun, interactive and informative experience. Would highly recommend!

Not sure what the fuss is about. Don't really get what the fuss is about. It's a walking tour....of a big industrial room....turned into one giant advertisement for Heineken. I get it, they give you "free" beer. Still not worth the time.
Wonderful experience. Informative and a good experience. Prefer the older version though than the modern, both have their charms.
Superb. We tried the real taste of Heineken! Everyone at the museum was very friendly and it wasn't crowded like most of the other museums.

A fun interactive experience. 25% discount with the I Amsterdam card and you get 2 drinks and a free gift. Definitely worth a visit although it does get very busy and we had to queue for about 10 minutes to move onto the 'ride'. A very well thought out museum though with lots of interaction and good information. The staff were really good. And ending up in the bar with 2 tokens for drinks was good. Put you glass down on the interactive table - hours of fun!

Good attraction: Heineken Experience. We had a good afternoon at the H/E. There's plenty of history and interactive activities around the tour, plus a beer tasting and complimentary drinks at the end. After you've visited the museum you can use the Heineken canal boat to ride back to the city centre, which is good as it's a good 20minute walk from the main centre.
Great tour. Super place and very pleasant guides...especially the brewing experience in the video room

Why not do the tour?. Sure, there are better brewery tours out there, but we had a great time none the less. When purchasing our pricey tickets, the man asked where we were from and even told us what he knew of Ohio which was nice. We got to tour at our own pace, skipping things we didn't want to see and spending more time where we wanted. 2 small beers or 1 large are included, as well as a 'taste' that they show you how to drink. Our 'taste' was actually 2 additional small beers, so I think we got our money's worth by the end! There were many stations that were fun, including a photo area that was free to email to yourself, and a bottle personalizing area. I would recommend this 'experience'!

Get to draught your own pint. Ok, not quiet a pint, a half pint more like. Basically you get given a rubber braclet with 3 tokens on it. 2 for beer exchange at the end of the exhabition, 1 for a free gift at their brand store - which I don't think is worth the trip, our free gift was a pen that play music... drove me mad within 30 seconds! So the beer tokens - you can exchange them for 2 beers at the service bar, or exchange them for 1 beer at the self service bar where they teach you how to draught a perfect Heineken. Half way through the exhabtion you get a glass of beer anyway. There are lots of interactive facilities throughout where you can pretend to be brewing beer, take picture with their logo background, sing in a silly music video etc. It's all a bit cheesy and silly, but as long as you went in there in a playful light-hearted mood, you will have fun. For those who have trouble letting their hair down, they might find it boring. My folks (in their 60s) and I had a good laugh, posing, singing, jumping and draughting a perfect (half) pint!

Just plain Okay.. Basically you're not really learning anything about brewing, just seeing some history of the company, a slight 'how beers made' lesson. But the 'get brewed' ride is pretty funny, and the horses were cool too. The best part is the end, where you get to choose if you want to use your two buttons for beers, or learn how to pour a beer properly. I chose to do the pouring, because I never had before and you get a certificate. I ended up embarrasing myself pretty badly because I looked like a huge idiot, but it was still fun! The staff is really nice too.

It's Heineken!. By visiting the Heineken Experience, you have to expect to, well, only see its green bottles with its star around you. There is an exhibition on the history of the brewery, with its different bottles, lables and coasters. A short explanation about beer brewing is given, which is actually enough, since there isn't much mystery about it. You visit the old Heineken brewery site, with its beautiful copper containers. You get to see some of the living Heineken horses. And of course, you get to taste the beer!

Teenage boys enjoyed it!. We weren't expecting great things after reading previous reviews but were pleasantly surprised. There are various sections about their advertising and even a room that you are supposed to sit in and watch their commercials although we quickly walked past these! The brew yourself ride was great fun and the tasting was interesting. You get two beers included (3 if you include the tasting glass) which makes the entrance fee more reasonable. There is plenty of hands on stuff to do including designing your own label which is then put onto a bottle of beer for you to collect at the end of the tour (cost €5 but a nice souvenir). Our two 17 year olds loved it and enjoyed drinking beer legally which they can't do at home yet!

Best bit was the free boat ride back to the hotel..... Its a fairly middle of the road experience, there is no actual brewing going on there and there hasn't been for a long time. There is a short explanation of how beer is made and you get a brief history of Heineken but you do feel like they are trying to ram the brand down your throat. I particularly liked the cased 'advertisement of the year award' which looked impressive but when you looked closely had been awarded by a regional lions club branch! Also one of the Heineken family that is pictured everywhere looks like an evil version of Bobby Robson (imagine him as a cigar smoking bond villain) which was quite unnerving. Most of the building is dedicated to selling you Heineken, (there is a room done out like a nightclub that is just showing endless Heineken adverts etc) Which i suppose is what you would expect but I just felt it was slightly ott. You do get 2 beers and the end and also a small taster beer half way round which they use to explain why Heineken is so great. The best part of the trip for us was a free canal boat ride (complete with commentary) to the Heineken gift shop, which is located next to Rembrantplein which was next to our hotel, so saved us a 30 minute walk. Go if you like beer and fancy advertising, but i think there are better things to do in Amsterdam. We found quite a lot of reduced price admission tickets in hotel lobbies and on the side of those tourist maps which meant the entry price as 15 Euros so keep an eye out for those.

Refreshing. Enjoyable and educational - and a good blend of history/tradition and modern features. Tour ends with a sampling - and refreshments at the bar. Nice and entertaining museum/experience centre for those who are interested in beer. Centrally located in the city - takes 1 to 2 hours depending on how interested You are. -If You´re not so interested, You might wanna consider spending Your time in Amsterdam elsewhere. If Your especially interested there is also a giftshop where You can all sorts of labeled effects. Entrance fee € 17.

Brew you ride was funny. The heineken experience is really well layed out. The Brewing process is explained through the tour by the brilliant display and through some video points.The Brew you ride was the funniest one. Here, I went in as a human n came out as Beer :) And then tasted beer too! Cant get any better, can it? Beer lovers, it is paradise for you. But for teetotalers, Cola is still there for your rescue :)

I had a surprisngly good time.. It was a rainy day in Amsterdam, and my teenage daughter and I decided to go to the Heineken Experience on a whim. It was a lot of fun, though at 17 euros each, not cheap. But I would recommend it. The Heineken experience is a cross between Chocolate World at Hershey, Disneyworld, a brewery tour and a disco, all wrapped up in one. You start on a self-guided tour of the history of Heineken and its brand, which was interesting. Then you move into the old part of the brewery where they made beer until the 1980s and learn about how Heineken is made. Then there is a virtual ride where you are "brewed" into Heineken. This was actually fun. You stand in tiers in these 10m x 10m rooms that move and shake to correspond to what is happening to the beer in the movie being projected in front of you. Then, you exit into a tasting room where you are given a small beer (.25l probably) and learn how to taste the hops, barley and Type A yeast that make up Heineken. Then, you sit in a lounge and look at huge screens that show the latest (long versions) of Heineken commercials, can check out the new Heineken bottles under a black light, and relax in these futuristic couches and watch retro Heineken TV ads. Finally, you get to "holy grail" where you get two full sized Heinekens and hang out in a disco where you had the feeling that you were at an exclusive party. Finally, upon exiting you can take a free canal boat ride to Rembrantplein and receive a free gift at the Heineken product store. Though the free gift was cheesy (a squat little pen that plays music), the boat ride was fun. All in all, the Heineken Experience was more fun that I thought it would be, and I would recommend it if you like beer (and why would you be in Amsterdam if you didn't?) or if you are looking for an indoor activity with beer-drinkers.

A must see in Amsterdam. This is a must see in Amsterdam, even if the tour is more a commercial thing rather than a learning experience. Overall I must say it was very good. Enjoyed the three glasses (25 ml) of Heineken included in the ticket. Bad sides: could be more informative and less commercial, I felt being brain-washed at times!Top tip: 1. Buy the tickets online, it saves you 2 € per person and you don't need to wait2. If you spend a certain amount in the store (we spent 14 € in two) they will give you a free ticket for a boat tour sponsored by Heineken (lasting 10 minutes) departing opposite the Heineken Experience building - nothing special, but it's free!3. Don't ask for a Budweiser at the bar!

Great for a self-guided tour. Provided you like Heineken (both the beer and the company), this is a very interesting and engaging tour. It is self-guided, but does not suffer for it. There is lots to do and see, plus you have several opportunities to sample the beer in a group setting. Very innovative and entertaining tour. Not Amsterdam's must-see attraction by far, but I would recommend it to anyone who likes Heineken and has some extra time in Amsterdam.
Beer. A beer brewing tour with a fresh Heineken at the end...
husband and boys loved this. they said it was a really interesting visit - and husband and oldest grandson enjoyed the tasting!

was ok, a long heineken commercial that you pay for.. I must admit that I am not much of beer person.
It was a nice place, but it felt like a big long commercial for heineken.
I could have done better things at that time and with the money.
17 euro.
There are places to get a discount, look for the local coupon books, we found them too late.

Good experience. i have been in fevrier to this museum.
it is crowdy but i didn't have to wait too long, aroung 20 minutes
the museum si very nice, the multimedia room was great but the best part is at the end when you can try the beer :)))

Not worth the €17!. Being the philomaths we are, the Heineken museum was not originally mine and my boyfriend's first port of call. It was only after learning that the Van Gogh queue would last up to 45 minutes (I could have cried) that we reluctantly wandered away from an afternoon of erudition and artwork to one involving pints of dutch beer. Wouldn't really recommend this place to anyone who isn't looking to be herded like cattle when perusing a museum - we spent about an hour queuing inside as well! (To avoid the queues, always book in advance, usually via your hotel they sell tickets, or online.) The whole thing was very slow moving, and overall not really interesting learning about how Heineken is made unfortunately.Highlight of the trip: 2 free beers at the end.

Waste of time and money!. Having viewed my share of breweries during my travels, I thought I'd add Heineken to the list. At 17 euros, the price was rather steep...I mean, this is not the actual brewery, it's more like a museum. I didn't find the exhibits interesting. At the end you wait for the "4D" experience which was entertaining, but nothing to write home about. The best part of the "experience" was the beer tasting and the two free small beers at the end. Not worth 17 euros. I do not recommend this at all!!!!

Mildly informative, expensive advert for Heineken. I was hoping for at least some semi-working equipment as this used to be used commercially; however all that is left is some empty copper brewing vessels with projectors in them. The rest of the “experience” could be transported anywhere and be exactly the same.The largest part seems to consist of a number of rooms showing historic TV and print Heineken adverts, which while interesting, is not worth the high admission price.Go to a pub and watch Heineken adverts on your phone, you won’t be missing anything.

70 euros to watch classy advertising. My husband and I (both early 30s) went along to this. While the first 30 mins or so were interesting, we then just became people to whom Heineken wanted to shamelessly advertise their beer.For health reasons we couldn't go on the brew u ride. But there were no signs to say the ride wasn't appropriate for certain medical conditions until AFTER we had queued for 30 minutes to get to the front! Not impressed!Overall not worth the money. Slick? Yes. Eye catching? Sure. But coming out feeling you've experienced something new and unforgettable? Sadly no.

Excellent! A great afternoon if you enjoy beer!. This was a great place to visit, lots of history about the brand. The staff all spoke excellent English and were very nice.You get to taste the beer on the way round which was cool.Overall we had a lovely time.

Great Tour and Interactive Experience. If you like to know about beer, this is the place. What separates this one from other brewery tours is you feel part of the experience. Lots of interactive gadgets to play with, lots of videis to watch, commercials, etc. Great fun for the whole family. My 16 and 12 year-old sons enjoyed it was well, and since the drinking age in Amsterdam is 16, my son actually had his first beer! He liked it. My only diappointmnet is they only seved Heineken at the end and not some of their other brands, like Amstel and Fosters, both of which I like better than Heinekin. Still a must do!

Wonderful beer experience!. I personally really enjoyed the Heineken Experience. It is a little expensive but I still was glad that I went. I went with a group of friends, we are all between 19 and 22. Everyone really liked it, especially the part where they make you into the beer! We wandered around and realized that we had been in there for a few hours! Definite place to bring teenagers!

Beer is better than anywhere, but tour is touristy. The headline captures it all.. the beer at the end is fantastic nectar of the gods type stuff, but the overall experience is rather expensive to be shown some copper pots and a story you can better read on wikipedia.

Really good.. Went on a ferry trip 'Dutch dash' from Hull. Was only in Amsterdam for one day. Decided on the Heineken Experience as a friend had advised me it was great fun and good value. It cost us 15 euros each and lasted about 2 hrs. Was very interesting with a lot of visual effects and information. Also got 3 drinks of Heineken!!!! A free canal boat trip followed which dropped us off at the Heineken shop nearer the Centrum. This was an unexpected bonus as this gives you an alternative view of Amsterdam. You can get a tram to this as it is a long walk. Only cost us 2.70 euros. Good value.

For a mildly entertaining time . . .. Have been on other brewery tours that have been far superior (Sam Adams in the U.S., Guinness in Dublin). There were moments of mildly interesting information, but the cheesy jokes of the employees and the feeding frenzy at the bar at the end of the tour just added to a blah feeling. If you have never been on a brewery tour, then I would recommend it. If you have, then save the $17 Euros and just sit and drink a few beers.

Good for kids as well as adults. I knew I'd be interested in a beer production tour but was unsure whether my wife and children would enjoy it. It was the surprise of our visit to Amsterdam and a real success for my non-drinking kids. We booked other attractions in advance. The Heineken experience people said there was no need. Wrong!. Even though we were there for it opening at 11am, we had to wait for 30 minutes as they only had one till open. I'd recommend booking your tickets in advance. The tour does what you expect; good explanation of Heineken family history, beer production process and tasting of great quality, very young beer. I had thought 50 euros was a bit much for the family tickets, particularly when they are trying to recruit you to drinking Heineken, but actually it felt like not bad value overall due to the surprise elements included. There is a simulator ride which takes you through the beer production process which is good fun. There are a number of interactive experiences which the kids enjoyed; making a video of themselves singing, photographs in different poses, table football, a floor that moves as you walk on it and a game where they acted as a DJ in a night club. Included in your ticket is a free trip on a canal boat back into the city centre. So overall, a little pricey but a good experience for the whole family.

A must do for beer lovers!. This tour takes your through the old Heineken brewery and is excellently presented - great A/V effects, especially where YOU are actually "brewed" ....very informatice staff that explain the process of brewing to you as well as how you should drink beer right...yes, I found out that's why I never liked it earlier! There is a RIGHT way of gulping beer :) With 2 beers included with the entrance fees and a taster mug as well, its definitely worth a visit. Very interesting to see how a modest beginning created such a huge brand and to read about the family behind it!Highly recommended.

Best Brewery Tour Ever!!. Went here with a group of friends and we had an awesome time!There is so much value for the cost here. Alot of interactive activities throughout the tour. Self guided. We actually spent about an 1hr and 1/2 here and it was one of the highlights of our trip. 2 free beers are included and you can trade that in for a draft pouring class, where they teach you how to draft the perfect beer.

Heineken tour. really liked the fact you could walk around by yourself and not have to wait for a tour guide. really great tour and found it interesting could have done with more free beer! INformation was really good and the rooms were great as well.
AWESOME!!!. This is one of my FAVOURITE things to do and places to go in Amsterdam. I've been about 4 times in the last decade. Go for the tour, stay for the (free!) beer :o)

Very interactive. Really enjoyed the Heineken experience, lots to see, smell and taste. I would recommend this even if you are not usually a beer/lager drinker as we had non-drinkers in our group and everyone found this very fun and interesting.

good fun but go early!. This is worth a visit and it's good fun but be advised to go early. Buy your tickets online and visit when it opens. We went On St.Patricks Day and it was absolutely packed. That aside, you'll have a good time learning about the Beer making, history of the Company etc. and you have a free drink (or 2) included in the ticket price. The staff are friendly and well organised

Maybe I'm too old for this kind of tour.. OK. I'm 57. When alone while my husband was at a conference. I don't know what I was expecting, but I think this kind of tour is geared more to the "just started to drink crowd". I didn't really learn anything about the beer making process and we got to taste a 4 oz drink of beer. But I think most of the tour was for young people. The best part for me was seeing the Shire horses. They were beautiful.

Visiting the Heineken Experience. Liked: the overall experience, staff friendliness, detailed explanation, getting a certificate for preparing the perfect beer from the draft and drinking the free beer!!

16e very well spended. go there!. as all the attractions in amsterdam are a little bit expensive, i have to say it is warthy to pay the entrance to the Heineken Experience. it was fun, interesting, you can drink beer, learn something about heineken and beer in general. i defenitivly recomand it, not only to the fans on Heineken but to all that drink beer. 4D cinema is also an unique experience there, visit it and you will understand what i'm talking about

Interesting even for the ladies!. Very well presented history of brewing with user friendly commentary..even for non lager drinking ladies! Staff very friendly .Good interactive activities and of course the inclusive pint of Heineken at the end! Entrance free reasonable.Tip :not sure if it is only if you purchase something from the gift shop but we were offered a free canal ride across Amsterdam to the Heineken shop where you pick up a free gift of a bottle opener.Once we received that we went on our way.Useful if you are staying in central Amsterdam as the brewery is towards the outskirts.

If you like Heineken, go.. My husband is a Heineken drinker and I just acquired a taste for it recently since that was the only beer we had in the house! We were on the fence about visiting this but we did it anyways. It is a tourist trap. There is even a simulator ride!! We couldn't believe this was the most expensive tour of our trip 15 EU pp which includes 2 beers but you actually get 3. What we like about Heineken beer is that they have been brewing the same beer for many many years. I did find it informative and it was overall a fun time to spend an afternoon. I bought a T-shirt from there and I get compliments on it often. It's not common to see a dark green t-shirt with Heineken printed on it in the US!

Fun experience for beer fans.. If you like beer or are interested in the beer making process then it is a cool thing to do. You can get through it pretty fast I finished the tour in less than half and hour and I asked a bunch of questions. So you can stay as long or short as you want if you want to skip the videos. I am not a big Heineken fan, in the states it has quite a bitter aftertaste but the Heiniken extra cold they serve at the end is really good. It is not a real functioning brewery but has a lot of the old machines and vats that they used to use. You go through a video explaining some of the history and then move on through different sections where they tell you about the beer making process and the ingredients involved. I can see how this may be dry and boring for some, I on the otherhand enjoy asking questions about that kind of stuff. There is a little ride that is just a short overview of how they make Hieneken and is just okay. After the ride you do a tasting where they show you how to correctly pour a Heineken and look for the subtle nuances in the foam and glass. After the tasting you get 2 more beers in the lounge from the extra cold tap where the beer comes out 0 degrees C and is served in chilled glasses. This is probably the best part and for those who don't use your tokens and are beer drinkers you probably waisted a half hour. I had fun and enjoyed the 3 beers not bad for the price. If you don't like beer or Heiniken it is proably not for you though.

A great experience!! would definitely go again and would highly recommend.. Some college friends living or visiting here seem to be turned off by the price (15 euros) however, it includes a lot! The tour gives you 3 beers (1 small, 2 large) and a canal tour. bathroom and coat check is included. The whole thing is very modern and has a lot of entertaining things. One of my favorite rooms was a huge screen displaying all of the heineken commercials, and the ceiling was made of empty heineken bottles, it was cool! The beer was great, and staff was very friendly! Fun for all ages.
fun!. The tour is largely self guided, but the "ride" portion is loads of fun. And of course, beer tasting!
Best few hours spent in Amsterdam. I loved the Heineken Experience, it very interactive and great fun. The glasses of beer at the end were a plus too!

Way too commercial and not particularly informative. It's a slick and flashy presentation. However, for the scope of it, you don't learn all that much about the beer making process.You get to see a lot about the history of the Heineken company and it's advetising, but surprisingly little about it's product.

Beer tour. the first tour museum we took and 1 of the better ones in amsterdam,there is a free 4d ride included and 2 beers Small glasses.some intresting pieces of advertising and some fun emails you can make and send to friends.Also make a dj set which is quite good when played back when you get home.worth a visit.

Waste of time. It is a waste of time standing here in a long queue. Belgium has got a better beer history to follow. The number of beer sold in Belgium is far more than in Holland. I did not find it interesting.

Really touristy, but in a good way!. To be honest, I'm not a big beer fan, but the Heineken Experience was great!-Loved the 4D experience in which you watch a video about how beer is made, and then there are different special effects to which make you feel as though you are part of the beer-making process. For instance, when the bottles of beer were going down the conveyor belt, the floor beneath us was shaking as though we were bottles of beer going down the line.-Lots of interactive exhibits which kept me entertained-Included in the cost of admission are a beer tasting during the tour of the factory and then two additional beers at the bar at the end of the tour.
Enlightening. Interesting insight into the history of the brewer and how to get the best out of an ale. The old adverts brought back fond memories

21ST century brewing experience-Excellent. Heineken Experience Stadhouderskade 78,\ Amsterdam 1078AE, A very enjoyable experience, not just an old brewery, very 21st century, high computer interactive up to date , hollywood brought to Holland experience,you could spen a few hours or all day , unfortunately over 18 years old only.Time flys once you are inside.

Informative, fun and interesting!. Informative, fun and interesting. Experienced the history of Heineken, sampled ingredients and steps along the way, and of course the final product as well. Fun interactive displays along the way, unique gifts. Spent about 1 1/2-2 hours there.

Nice visit for beer lovers!. This was my second visit to Heineken Experience. As before we found a very well organized exhibition ,good explanations and two glasses (each) of very cold and fresh beer at the end. Not recommended for small child.

Highly commercialized beer tour. I enjoyed my hour or to here, but it was highly commercialized. There were commercial ads playing everywhere and it was more like a giant Heineken store than anything else. I couldn't even meet their draft horses because they were behind glass like at a zoo. At least at Carlsberg, you can meet and touch the horses, lol. It was like the Disneyland of beer/brewery tours. Worth the 15 Euros? I guess, I was on vacation, but if you are really into beer, like me, you are better off going to a smaller, more intimate brewery.

Amazing. Not a big heineken but got told by a family member to go, so I gave it a shot. I thought it was a great day out, only thing that was annoying was another group of tourists who had no respect for others but what can you do? I still enjoyed it, it amazing to see how the beer is made, the history and the drinks at the end just topped it off. Would love to go again.

Recommend. After getting wonderfully lost on our journey to, we finally found ourselves staring at the Heineken Experience across the street! It was well worth the journey there. I went with 4 girlfriends and we had a blast. It is definitley a fun time. Would be perfect for a rainy afternoon! And they give you a few ice cold heineys with the tour :-) I dont know if anyone would want to go here twice really, but you should definitley experience it once!

If you love beer and sausage - do never see how it's made. That's true for women, too :-) but that's another story...There are two good reasons not to visit this museum:First, if you like Heineken, you don't want to see the disgusting fluid what becomes the beer... And if you don't like - this experience won't make you a beer lover :-)Anyway, the exhibition is professional (as any advertisement :-)

Fun!. Living in a country where alcohol restrictions are quite tight, I really enjoyed the playful approach to beer I experienced here. Also I appriciated the very interesting serious part of the exhibition. A very interesting place!

Beer included!. The cost to get in was 16 euros per person which i though was quite steep for a start however you do get 3 beers each included so really the cost is reasonable. The 4D cinema was great and you could pour your own beer at the end if you wish.

Total Waste of Time!!!. Why was I charged 16 Euros to visit what is nothing more than a beer commercial? About 5 minutes is dedicated to beer making then the rest of the time is spent in cheesy media display rooms. I walked out and didn't even bother to redeem the two beer tokens they gave me.Do NOT waste your time on this crass commericalized tour!!!

fun times!. Hands down the coolest museum I've ever been too! Where else can you find a museum with a bar (free drinks!) in the basement and have your name on a Heineken bottle?! Not only that, they give a pretty good overview of beer- making :)

Great Place and Fun!. We went to Heineken on our Holand Pass, we got 2 beers, made our own movie and postcards, bought for USD$6.00 own Heineken bottle and took a free ride on by boat in the canal to their store. We thought the store was going to be a MEGA Store, is no big deal. We had a great time!

Nicely maintained old time brewery. Buy a ticket and visit this old time heineken brewery. Very informative tour along with enjoying a couple of beers included in the fee of the ticket. A nice experience.

Good Fun!. the brewery tour is good fun, different from lots of others i been to and a good laugh. whats outstanding is the friendliness of the staff and how they deal with a problem fast and efficient and with no fuss. (we had a problem with our pre booked tickets-no details as it might give people wrong ideas :-).

value for money. for a group of 4 people this cost us 60 euro. with this you get a wristband with 2 tokens, included in the price is a free glass of heineken at the end of the tour, you can also bottle your own beer for 5 euro,  there is an interactive experience, a dj experience and with your 2tokens you can learn to pour the perfect glass of heineken- then drink it!! or you can simply go and get served a glass at the bar. on the hour, there is a canal boat tour that is included, you need to get your free tickets from the gift shop. at the end of the tour, you enter another heineken shop, while there, show your wristband for a free gift,canal boat is enjoyable and a good way to get near to dam square!

A great way to pass a few hours. The Heineken Experience is very easy to get to via the tram system and for beer drinkers I could imagine it to be very informative and exciting however with myself not liking beer I didn't enjoy it fully. That is not to say that I didn't have a good time as me and my friend found that the staff were very friendly and the 3D ride along with the interactive camera experiences were very good!With your ticket you do get a drink of Heineken in the tasting room and then a further two drinks using your wristbands at the bar at the end of the tour.There is also the chance for you to have your own personal labeled bottle of Heineken for 5 Euro and a gift shop at the end to buy various Heineken merchandise. Overall, I would recommend this place on a trip to Amsterdam whether you enjoy beer or not!
Excellent attraction. Great tourist attraction and a great marketing tool for Heineken. Take the "brew yourself ride", it's not at all dangerous, despite the warning sign.
just ok. the heineken experience just wasnt wat we were expecting, it was a bit boring but it passed an hour and wasnt too expensive but the beer was good.

Exciting, fun-filled brewery tour. Heineken experience is definately worth a look. It is a very interactive museam with a mini ride in it. You will also get 2 drinks at the bar at the end of the tour, making the experience even more bang for the buck. It has a lot of historical items and models, but definitely the most fun is the tasting, the mini experience, the drinking and the interactive exhibition.

the perfect balance of. alcohol and education!What a treat this day out was, throughly enjoyable! GENUINELY RECOMMEND GETTING YOUR TICKETS ONLINE BEFORE YOU COME!!!! I don't recommend this because you save 1euro in the cost of the ticket, but more because it allows you to miss out the que at the ticket desk where the cashiers are about as much use as a chocolate fire guard. Me and my friend were stood in that que, in what appeared to feel like the same spot, for over half an hour whilst watching the people who has been online walk through the front door and straight in to the tour!Once your inside you are given a heineken wristband which entitles you to two half pints of heineken. This is called the virtual tour for a reason, not only because you are allowed to wander around so freely, sticking your head in big beer containers to look at whats going on inside and twisting nobs and levers every where, but also because this experience is about making you the beer and showing you how its made by cooking you, shaking you, spraying you with water and showering you in bubbles. I am sure by this point you have no idea what i am talking about but if you go, i promise you you'll think back to this review and think "now i know what he meant"!!! Dont worry you dont get wet!dotted around the museum are various tour guides explaining what your looking at, (perfect for me because i am not the accademic type, i don't like self managed learning, i would rater someone else explain it to me, or even better, show me whats happening). You even get a lesson on how to drink the perfect beer to maximize your enjoyment, Ladies i am gonna warn you now, you are not allowed to sip lol!!!a few novelty rooms made from bottles and a few "boys toys" gadgets like massive curved chairs you lie in and watch the built in tvs. Hell you can even star in your own heineken music video or tv advert! you can even add your name to a heineken label and buy a personalised beer. perfect souveniers!!!!this tour is done at your own pace, no rushing you through, well worth the money. treat yourselfFYI i hate larger and beer, still my favourite trip so far! perfect for adults and children!

Pretty cool. Overall pretty cool, the becoming a bottle was good...The beer test which is beer made on that same day is great - even explained why Heineken has a big 'head' on the drink. You then get 2 small glasses of beer at the very end. All staff were friendly and obviously spoke very good English.But it was still €16 per person, it's expensive for what it is. Am I pleased I went? Yes - Would I go again? No - simply due to price.
Great tour, but take a friend.. Very good brewery tour. Visited by myself but would have been better with a friend or with a group. Lots of interactive activities.

The best beer I have ever tasted. It is a great tour if you want to know more about the development of beer in Holland and mainly the development of Heineken. It has quite an expensive fee but in return you get 1 glass of beer during the tour and 2 bottles at the end. The glass of beer they give you during the tour is made in the same day at a factory close to Amsterdam and I have to say, it was the best beer I have ever tasted.
Well worth the money. Great interactive experience. Learn the history of heineken, become a bottle of beer and have a pint at the end. A good way to spend 2 hours or so.

worth going. + "Museum" well done! Lots of interactive things to do. Great, lively staff. In overall we liked it a lot.- One little minus. In the end of visiting, you can try to pour your own glass of beer (paing for the ticket you get 2 x 0,3l beers included in a price) or you can get them in a bar. We wanted to do the first but the queue was loooonnng. Well...

Quite fun. Although a big commercial marketing gig in favour of Heineken, its quite okey play to go. It will give you some insight to the Heineken history, train your beer tapping skills, see lots of Heineken beer commercial, and understand the brewering process. Last, but not least you will get some free beer (3 pints)- in tasting area and in the bar

Fantastic - I don't drink beer, but now I love Heineken. This was a really interesting, fun and interactive "experience".
They definitely know their stuff, I somehow feel a fondness for Heineken, which I'm sure was the desired effect.
You also get 3 glasses of Heineken, a free canal trip and a bottle opener, so it's pretty good value!

the best way to spend an afternoon no matter what your interests are. Just a quick review to say that this is one of the most interesting and interactive attractions i have been to in a long time. Even if you dont drink beer you will learn a lot and have a great time. I would however book in advance and que's can be quite long.
worldwide known brand. Want to know how the world famous beer is brewed? Go and visit the Heineken experiens and have a taste for free

FANTASTIC. We had previously been to the Guinness Factory in Dublin and had high hopes for this Heineken Experience - and we were not disappointed. At first, when we saw the price, we were a little shocked €16 each did seem a lot, but as we left (after have 2 pints and a taster free) and a lanyard each for answering a questionnaire and a Heineken bottle opener for going the the Heineken Shop afterwards. This is not to mention all the activities inside. The 4D experience was fantastic.We hoped it would be like the Guinness Factory in Dublin, which is fantastic - this was better. Worth the €16 price tag!!

Guinness Factory's Less Impressive Cousin. If I hadn't been to the Guinness Factory, I think the Heineken Experience would have been pretty cool. As it was, I was pretty underwhelmed by the "experience" and felt like I overpaid to have a pint of beer in a mid-day disco. It just felt pretty light on substance and pretty heavy on the glamor of Heineken. Marketing and bright lights over information about the beer making process. If flash is what you like, this may do it for you. If you wanted to know more about Heineken as a beer, this will let you down. If you put the money you spent on the ticket towards actual beer, you might do better with your investment. Also, it was a bit annoying that you had to pay for all of the little extras.

Excellent attraction. Visited this as part of our hop-hop off bus tour and we were not disappointed. A great fun attraction with a little bit of education on how Heineken is made and three free samples of the stuff as well. It isn't my favourite beer but when its cold and wet and golden that will do me fine. We visited with our two lads 11 &13 yrs and they had a blast as well. If you are heading to Amsterdam and planning more than a couple of attraction I suggest you look at getting a City Pass which saved us around 70 euros on the attractions we visited. You can order before you travel and collect at Centraal Station.
A giant marketing pich with free beer at the end. Talk about marketing. By the time you leave you will think the beer is the best in the world (try belgian instead)

Why do they come up with so many "e"s?. A happy jolly experience. From learning how beer is manufactured to how the company is established, I find the museum very intriguing and fascinating. Of course, with the two free beers and a name-printed bottle for 5 Euros, I enjoy the visit to the museum

Great fun,bad beer. Had a great time and the place is very interesting but they seriously need to improve the beers you get at the end. As an Irish bartender I have high standards when it comes to beer but I can honestly say it was the worst Heineken I have ever had! They served it in soaking wet glasses and it was as lively as water, sorry for the rant but it had to be said, otherwise it's an excellent visit

Great Fun. We went here after seeing reviews from others. 16E entry and it was great fun. At first I thought it was a bit boring, but there are loads of interactive things to do and it turned out to be great fun. We spent a good couple of hours here with a couple of beers at the end.

Even If You Don't Like Beer Its Fun. Let me start by saying i am not a fan of heineken beer but this is by far the best brewery tour i have taken and i have been on 7 of them around the world. This is just plain old fun.

random but fun in the end. to start with we thought we'd walked into a modern museum, then it turned into a bizarre 'live brewery' experience... but then, once we got in a bit further, we found the activities amusing and good fun. You get a couple of half pints for your troubles ;P and we were taught how to ENJOY a Heineken by a member of the staff... Watch the bubbles.Only go if you drink Heineken!Cloakroom included.

Don't go out of your way.. If you feel like you'll have missed out visiting Amsterdam without visiting this brewery, then by all means go -- we did have fun playing foosball and looking at some of the exhibits. However, it's really not worth going out of your way for the "Heineken Experience." It's a pretty standard brewery tour, but the location isn't particularly cool (this is far less interesting than the Guiness brewery in Dublin). To make matters worse, at the end your only reward is a Heineken, which you'll drink in a basement room lined with TVs that display vistas from Hong Kong, Manhattan, Rio, and Paris. Why nothing from Amsterdam? I would probably have skipped this side trip looking back. For a fun and interesting brewery, visit Daas Haavle Man (sp) a few hours away in Bruges!

great way to spend a few hours in Amsterdam!. i've been to this twice now, my first visit was 8 years ago and it's definately improved since then! You get to sample the beer and the ingredients on your way around too which is always good! went with my husband and we had a great time!

Great experience for first time to AMS. Very enjoyable and fun experience. I was alone and it was an entertaining experience, made me feel like I actually saw something in Amsterdam for the short time I was there. The flow of the tour is great, not a guided boring tour but you basivcally follow all the checkpoints and someone is there to greet and explain. So you can move faster or slower at your leisure.

Nice experience!. I have been to Amsterdam 3 times, the first two times for some reason I thought it would be waste of money to visit Heineken Experience, however the last time I realized I have been mistaken. There are many interesting parts of the museum, where you can learn about beer production and also many activities Heineken sponsored. There is an interesting part where you can watch advertisement videos of Heineken starting from 50`s, it is really interesting to see it as it doesn’t only reflect the history of Heineken but also the way the TV advertisements evolved. On top of all these, you get 2 glasses of beer in the bar and also a small glass of fresh beer. I would really recommend Heineken Experience to be visited if someone visits Amsterdam.

A fun place to visit. I thoroughly enjoyed this attraction. They have put loads of effort into making this a fun experience whilst still showing the history and practicalities of brewing. The two free beers at the end of the tour is a nice touch!

If your planning a trip to Amsterdam dont miss out on this!. I went with a group of mates who had already visited amsterdam and been here before and they told me that we had to go. We a had great laugh here, especially messing around with the interactive experiences such as the DJ game and Karaoke which even let you download videos of your performances for free from the internet afterwards. I definately left knowing a bit more about how beer is made and with a new appreciation for heinekan, fair play to the Heinekan Marketing/PR Team!

One of a kind!. I used a bus tour to get here and I was happy to see and shop things from it. It was a popular Brand of beer and items can only be bought here. My jacket was a higly-coveted item and Im so proud to have it exclusively. Lots of things to enjoy like the engraving service. Love it!
Interesting Experience. An interesting experience Specially the illustration movie theater where you can become one with beer, it is a must for all there beer fans.

I was surprised.... I didnt really want to spend my money on this tour but I was glad I did. it was the last museum/to Museum. ur of the day and we were tired and emotionally exhaused from the Anne Franke House, Dutch Restistance musuem, Jewish History...it turned out to be the BEST way to end the day. Heineken did a great job planning the tour. Hip, fun and it made you feel like you were at an amusement park with the "ride" at the end.
