Wish i could have spent more time. The Heineken Experience is only a short distance away from the tram stop and there is an awesome park just outside the attraction. Once inside it tells the story right from the beginning. I really enjoyed the ride which takes you through the process of making Heineken, but be warned, you do get a little wet! You must take your camera as there is a lot of pictures that need to be taken. Luckily there is not a tour guide so you can explore at your own pace. Towards the end you can get to try the Heineken :) Also, you get to star in your own video and you can upload it onto the Heineken website!I just wish i had more money to buy souvenirs though...

Enjoyable for twelve year olds.. With hindsight the 'Experience' in the title should have warned me. This tour attempted to be entertaining by removing any informative content about the brewing process whatsoever. We looked in some old brewing vessels, were interactively 'brewed' in a sound and light 'experience' (that word again) and given advice on how to 'taste' Heineken. Finally we were shepherded into a bar for our two complimentary drinks. This bar had music, and fusball tables. As I said great if you are twelve. But then you can't sample the product. In my opinion this was more about the Heineken 'Brand' than it was about informing. Maybe I was being told you're just too old for Heineken. That would make a great strap line for someone else - 'Drink XYZ cos you're too old for Heineken!!'
Love it!. It's so much fun! I'm glad we went there! Also, it's a marketing class: you'll leave the museum in love with Heineken, believe me.

16 € for a Pint of Beer. If this advertising-tour would be free like other brewerie-tours it would be ok. But €16 for hearing 20 times how great heineken is (and they only have this one beer) and getting some mediocre infos about brewing is not really worth it.The best thing in this tour is the two 2,5dl glasses of beer you get. But a Pint for 16 Euros is a little bit expensive I would say.

You'll develop an appreciation for Heineken.. This is something that has to be done when in Amsterdam. It's very interesting to learn about the development of the beer over time! Plus, you get to have a few on the tour!
a green experience. fantastic event, very entertaining and excellent young staff to show you around!The beer afterwards perfectly drafted tasted great!
beer bier piwo. if you like your beer then go here , lots to see and do and one of the best beers available at the end of your trip

Great place. We had pre- booked tickets which saved us money on the day and we were able to by pass the long queue outside.There will be something for everyone here and a great way to spend a few hours when in Amsterdam
Even if you Dont Drink Beer!. Visit this wonderful attraction, it is interactive and a lot of fun! You can spend hours here and it is interesting seeing how beer is brewed.

Its worth it even if you're not into Beer.. Fun experience that lasts around 1.5hours - take you through the history and brewing process of Heineken plus some beer tasting and a couple of free beers at the end.

Worth a visit!. Great place to learn about the history of Heineken. The tour is very interactive, the tasting bar was particularly good fun, and there's two beers included in the ticket price at the end of the tour.

Fun even for non Heineken lovers. The best bit was being a bottle and going through the process and along the conveyor belt. You even have a chance to pull a pint and get a certificate. Tickets can be bought online so you get to skip the queue.
A true EXPERIENCE. 15 Euro goes a long way with this interactive beer tour. History meets modern in this fun attraction.
Go to a traditional pub and spend your money on beer there. You can see Heineken commercials on TV and 16 euros will get you plenty of beer elsewhere.
Waaaay too busy. Overrated and too commercialized. For me it was a NO-GO
Great evening. We went to the last 1 at 5.30. It was very enjoyable. The Heineken is fab.... Loads to see in it

love beer: go there!. a nice journey inside the beer brewery process with some of the history of Heinekhen.. while moving inside you can register a video, ride an old horse-drawn carriage, and taste some free beer.. a suprise gift at the end of the journey completes the visit.. photos allowed as well as touching with your hands machinery and malt
Best 2 hours in Amsterdam. A must for anyone wanting to learn about the history of Amsterdam, beer and Heineken in a fun and interactive way.
fun and beers!. If you up for a little fun then you should go! Nice, interactive space. Free beers afterwards!
Too expensive. I found this a poor experience and the price is way off. I found the whole thing boring to be honest and I was 20 euro lighter after the experience.
Always a fun destination. the story of Heinekin and the family that runs the business...you get to learn a lot about the beer-making process, and then sample it---a must-do when visiting Amsterdam...
FUN!. My wife and I had a blast here. There is a lot of things to do and at the end you can have 2 beers (from the price of admission). Definitely worth checking out.

Had so much fun!. This museum is very fun and interactive. It will take over an hour to experience the whole tour so be warned. They give you the history of Heineken and let you touch smell and taste the ingredients. You get 2 beers and a bracelet. Loud music is fun, and you can take videos and photos to send back home instantly. It was a blast.

Bit disappointing. Costs quite a bit to enter and we definitely had fun. it was very busy, so not only did we have to queue to get in, but also most things inside the museum took a while to get through. I was expecting a bit more of a museum, though. there was a bit of history on Heineken but most rooms offered cheap, kind of boring shows or interactive gadgets. I was also hoping to learn more about how Heineken was able to create such a strong brand globally. Their advertising has been unique throuhgout the past decades but very little attention went to this. Highlight for me was seeing the brewing kettles and learning about the ingredients, as well as having a beer served at the Heineken bar. Amsterdam has many great sights to offer. If you are a bit cash strapped or don't have too much time, I would skip this one.

What fun!. This was just plain fun. After lots of art culture we decided to make a stop here and don't regret it. The tour is a lot of fun and well done. Definitely worth an hour or so of your time in Amsterdam - especially if you like beer.

Fantastic tour its a must do for Amsterdam.. This tour was one of the best parts of our holiday to Amsterdam. It went through the history of Heineken which was very interesting along with the brew you interactive tour which was great fun. The 2 bars after the tour had a great atmosphere, the tour came with 2 free beers but the bars were that cool I could of stayed all way and as expected the Heineken was excellent and the staff were also excellent.

Aimed at younger generation. Not that informative compared to other brewery tours but presented by and aimed at younger people - 2 drinks at the end in a bar that showed pictures of the world was obviously very popular as people stayed on. A good idea for anyone under 25.
Nice place. You can't miss this hall. Always with a great band or group. Acustic is just perfect. And Heineken is pretty available. Highly recommended !!!!

Fun couple of hours. Like any other beer tour I have been on. They tell you how they make beer then you get to sample at the end. Unfortunately, you are limited in how much you can consume. Fun if you have never done it before or on a rainy afternoon.
Interactive. A really interesting, informative and very fun experience. History of Heineken told in a very interactive way.

An experience not to be missed. Everybody coming to this highly advertised place to have a couple of beers. I think there should not be any ticket to visit this place. But if you like to drink beer then they should charge you for that. Not bad.
i recommened this. nice tour and great gadgets and good beer if you like it :D

Heineken the best. The heineken brewery is very interesting to visit, you can see the complete process.
Also you can taste the beer , very nice to taste the just brewed beer.
Nothing special. Mainly a drive to let you know how its operated, but not a lot of information is really useful. For €10, i wouldn't waste my time!

Best Brewery Tour. My entire family (husband and kids aged 18 and 14) loved the Heineken Brewery tour. We live in Belgium so we've been on many brewery tours. We've seen the Guinness Brewery in Dublin and by far the best tour we've ever seen was the Heineken tour. It is interactive and informative without being boring. We loved the 'Brew You' part of the tour which was like an amusement park ride even though you were just standing in one place.
Beer here.... Touristy, but I guess it can be interesting if you've never been to a brewery before.
Good fun. Well worth a visit on a lazy afternoon in Amsterdam...

Whole family loved it. Went with our family aged from 25 down to 6 years. We all absolutely enjoyed it - yes it's a tad glossy in patches but it was definitely fun. It was really interesting (does help that my older boys are all definitely beer drinkers) - loved seeing all the old Heineken adverts. Being able to get your own beer labels on bottles of Heineken, engraving glasses or just having a Heineken coaster (or green wrist band for my younger children) was highly entertaining - a great way to spend a few hours for all of us. This was our second visit to Amsterdam so maybe if I was short of time it wouldn't be my first pick but it was our 19 year old's birthday that day and this was on his wish list. Glad we did it! If you can, pre-order tickets on line because it did get really busy (even off peak tourist season) and it is slightly cheaper - unless you have children going with you as they don't do children's tickets on line.
cheaper to try in the pub. no, why, long cue, only one thing and no guides, would have been great with some personal thouch

fun. heineken Experience was great
me and my husbend had such a good time there
we laughed a lot

Must see in Amsterdam!!. The heineken experience is something that one must see when he / she goes to Amsterdam. You can either go there individually or the hop on hop off city tour bus takes you there as well.The entire process of how the company was evolved and the beer is brewed is explained here. The beer that you will consume here is freshly brewed and never more than 2 days old. This fresh beer tastes really amazing.You also get a chance to brew your own beer, which you can take it with you and has a personalized label.Don't miss it if you are a beer lover!!

Interesting. Interesting to see how its made, I dont usually drink beer but still found it interesting. The room at the end where you get your free beer was good and its fun trying to pour your own beer!!

If you like beer, it is a must, if you dont like beer, see it as well. It is a nice tour that attracts many people. Although generally the jokingly attitude among the visitors (many americans) is: "Let's get done with the tour and get to the beer", it is actually quite an interesting tour to take and it is something one can do if e.g. the weather is not too great to be outside.Yes, there is free beer at the end, but still with a bit of 'education' The 'bartender' tells about how to drink beer and why there is foam on it :-)

Get Brewed at the Heineken Brewery. After enjoying a Heineken at every meal while I was in Amsterdam, it only made sense to go see how the number one imported beer in America is made.Even if you are not a beer drinker, like my wife, you can still have an enjoyable time at the Heineken Experience (Discount in the I Amsterdam booklet). The entire brewery is very accessible for English speakers since English is the only language (I recall seeing) in the experience. All presentations are done in perfect no accent English (how do the Dutch do it?). You can purchase a number of fun Heineken souvenirs, bottle you own bottle, and don't forget the two Heineken Extra Colds at the end (cola for the kids). I've never done the Guinness tour, but I've heard this Heineken one is better. If you are stopping in Belgium during your trip through Amsterdam, stop by a Belgian brewery and compare how the smaller houses do it compared to the giants like Heineken.

Blah. I thought it was very underwhelming. You don't actually see all that much and the whole "VR" experience is dumb. It's still pretty good value because you get some free beer and a real Heineken glass.
Defintely a fun time!. Very nice and interactive tour! not to mention the drinks!
Worth a visit if you like beer. Aimed at people in the 20's and 30's But good education in to beer and how it is made. Some good interactive things and of course a free beer at the end.

Amazing!. Had such a fun time at the Heineken Experience, the 5min video when you are the beer is great!!As girly girls, me and my sister in law didn't think we would enjoy this but just went for our partners sake, but low and behold we loved it as well!Heineken was the best I've ever tasted (and I hate beer!!) and just a fun experience. Also nice and warm when its raining and windy outside!Great value for money!Tip: go earlier in the day for a quieter experience and no cues. Also it costs 16euro on the door but 15euro from the 'Tickets and Tours' for anyone who is desperate for a bargain!

Good fun. Excellent way to pass a couple of hours in Amsterdam. 16 euros might seem a bit steep but this includes a pint of Heineken and the exhibits are all modern and well worth seeing. All in all a good afternoon,
AWESOME!. Awesome place to go with friends/couple! You learn about bear and literally have a great experiense and if you´re cool enough you leave the place a bit drunk, lol.
An hour-long commercial!. the beer was good, but honestly this was one long commercial.

Not worth the money:(. We visited the factory on Sunday 8/1/12 expecting perhaps a full guided tour and way more access to the factory process. Even thou the staff were very nice the actual tour was rather disappointing. You simply followed the arrows, looking at posters and a few relics from the past. We were told about the ingredients of beer which was not as riveting. We were told how drink beer from the smallest beer glass I have seen. By the end of tour each person receives 2 small beers(middies) and a small one.  €32 for two to enter and 2 and a 1/2 drinks you get, the Heineken experience was disappointing and can definitely be missed on your trip Amsterdam.
Heineken. Like Heineken but this was a little touristy. Go early so you can avoid the lines. It is interesting if you have never been but probably would not return.

Great experience, fun and you can drink the beer!!. The experience was longer than I expected which was a good thing. It gave a brief history, displayed old labels, bottles, horse and carriage couriers, how the beer is made, how the beer should be poured and a final opportunity to drink the beer, how to drink the beer and you can learn how to draught your own heineken for which you get a certificate! Then finally, the obligatory gift shop.

Interesting if you have not visited a brewery before. good to visit with friends. A very well organised tourist attraction, expect a high entry fee. Some interesting elements and a good place to visit for a few hours if the weather is not so good

You have to visit this place.... Great day hadFriendly staff, made you feel welcome and answered any questions..Loads of different parts to the tour, how the beer is made, the horses, how to drink a pint, how to pour one, a championship league section were you could record yourself and friends playing table football and send it to others, and not forgetting 2 free beer..Would definetly reccomend a visit
si te gusta la cerveza si estas en AMSTERDAM,no podes dejar de ir. una experiencia para los fanaticos de las cervezas y no dejen de ir al bar de hielo otra buena aventura en esta ciudad

Interesting and good fun, with beer.. Gives you a good perspective on the history of the old Heineken Brewery.This is the original brewery building with the original coppers and other equipment in it. Some great early images and artefacts.With '4D' film show and entertaining staff ( admission bracelet comes with 2 buttons which you can exchange for small beers).Worth a visit and quite near the Rijksmuseum. Also a reasonably priced cafe opposite over the canal in the little park.
Do this one!. This was super fun and we had a blast - super great deals in the gift shop to bring home stuff for everyone on our list!

Nothing too special. A great idea but unfortunately, it is not something too special. One can walk around the old brewery and see how beer is made as well as have a taste (or two) of the Heineken today. For what you pay for it, I don't think it is worth it... if the price was a bit lower, I would send all my beer fan friends there, just to educate them a little.
Overpriced. Overpriced for what is not even a working brewery. Better off visiting a brewery in Yorkshire.

Worth a visit. For a brewing / beer museum, it was certainly interesting enough to be worth a visit. The bar area was full of loud and drunken guys, now that's not surprising in a brewing / beer museum I know, I only mention it as they were all Dutch and not English for a change!
FUN!!!!!. This is a great self-guided tour. Lots of picture opportunities and the COLD free beer at the end is well worth it.
WOW. Excellent experience. Lines were short so not too much waiting. 3D experience was amazing and the samples and information were excellent.

Nice. I find this pretty randomly - I was just walking around Amsterdam. Just when I saw it it started to be really windy so I've decided to go inside and I don't regret it. Factory allows you find out more about Heineken family, how their beer is done and few really nice examples of their marketing. Tour includes quite a few really funny moments :) At first place, 16 EUR seemed as little overpriced, but it include two buttons which can be exchanged for either two beers at bar so value is better. Alternatively, instead of ordering two beers you can draught your own - but you'll only get one beer. That's what I opted for and I don't regret it. You can drink beer at any time, but to draught your own? Plus, you'll get certificate :)
Recommended. Definitely worth the money. It was fun :) You get to do proper beer tasting and you can learn how to pour beer properly.
Who does not like beer? ;-). Standard brewery trip - tasting at end - worth an hour or two.

Had a blast time :-). Nice experience, learn both about the history of the brand as well as the making of it. Study and test yourself as a bartender :-) and of course the tasting at the end were the cherry...
Interesting. A pleasant visit to kill few hours and have few good beer!

Nice for a couple of beers at the end BUT huge wait for 4D Attraction.. Nice if you're intertested in how beer is brewed & made.
Didn't end up waiting for 4D attraction as there was over 60 minutes queue for this (NOT advised at time of entry) & queueing area was hot & claustrophobic!
Nothing wrong with the Heiniken but plenty of bars around to enjoy a few glasses without all the queuing......

Prepare yourself to be brewed!. It was a fantastic experience. I though the museum would be boring, like watching a bunch of old machines and lots of ancient pictures but it is more than that. Of course you see the aforementioned things but the museum explains thoroughly the company history, mission and vision and how they are immersed in all markets. It is quite interactive and you will have the opportunity to be brewed! I loved it!
You have to go here. No trip to Amsterdam would be compete without this adventure. Make sure you spend the time and do a video to send back to family and friends.
Good value for money. Good fun interactive museum, good value for money, very friendly staff and included in price are beers at various points throughout the tour.
Good for one time experience!. It was fun to see for one time experience. Enjoyed to know the history of Heineken and the process of preparation and games.

Beer in the morning.... Lots of marketing here, multi-media presentations, worldwide ads and branding, beer tasting and a sports bar at the end with 2 drink tickets. It was fast-moving, but after spending time in the spectacular museums in Amsterdam, this was a bit "light"... Would have been great if there was brewing there still, but operations moved out of city center to huge facilities. Look for $-off coupons in tourist pamphlets. Oh, see the Heineken Clysdales on the tour, also.
Waste of Time. Overpriced!!!!! Did a renovation and the price more than doubled when they reopened.
Two free beers!. We attended this for a lads afternoon... With beer tasting and a beer experience ride... finishing up with two free beers at the end was a good experience all round.

Interesting Tour. This was an interesting tour of the Heinekin beer history and brewing methods. A lot of smiling and a little Disney. Two glasses of Heinekin at the end. The average "tourists" were in their 20's and 30's and the noise in the drinking area at the end of the tour was deafening. Maybe I'm too old for that any more but it detracted from the overall experience.
Fantastic place and enjoyed every minute!!. We really enjoyed the experience!! Really interesting with a great friendly atmosphere!!! Great asset to Amsterdam, must visit!

Great for beer drinkers and tag-a-longers. While not a beer drinker I appreciated the attention to detail the staff paid to the Heineken experience. The 'be the hops' portion of the tour was particularly fun and well done. I didn't realize that the beer you drink here is two days old max-probably why this is the only time I drank more than a sip. The Heineken crew do a great job and go out of their way to make sure you have a great time. Be prepared to hang out at the bar/club area at the end-its too much fun to leave hastily.

If you don't have time for a REAL museum.... The Heineken Experience was interesting - you get to learn lots about the company and it's product. It is however, very commercial. If you're looking for something very authentic and dutch, this is not the place to go. If you want a couple free drinks and to stay out of the cold, it will EXCEED your expectations!
If you like beer. If you like beer, that is the palce which you must go. It was fantastic experience...
Great fun. We were there for about 2.5hrs could have been more! Free beer and you learned lots about making and selling. I would go back!
Brilliant well worth a visit. Value for money as we got 2 drinks each and the 4D experience was great
Good!. a good bit of fun! Video/wall of fame was great to send back to friends and obviously the drink at the end!

Good - not great. This was probably the 2nd best brewery tour we've been on - after the Anheuser Busch tour in St. Louis. The tour was informative and interesting, but they don't actually brew the beer here anymore, so it's lost a little bit of the authenticity. The marketing history is fascinating and I got to stir and drink some wort, which was fun. Plus there's free beer at the end. :)
Very interactive. We thought it a little pricey at first but definitely worth it and definitely a little drunk when we left.

Good tour. Good tour but the bar & souvenier shop at the end were both crowded & noisy. It was interesting to see the history of Heineken. A little pricy for the tour but you got 2 beers each at the end of the tour.

Not to be missed!. If you go go to Amsterdam make sure you go here! This is a great thing to do in Amsterdam. It took us about 2 hours to go round, it has loads of interactions and things to do it was great fun!! Every time we thought we must be near the end something else to do would happen - like being brewed! Definitely a worth going to, best attraction we went to. On top of this you get 3 free beers all for 15 euro!

great fun- even for a non beer fan!. My partner wanted to go to the heineken experience, and I'm not a massive fan of beer so let him drag me. It was actually really fun- interactive things to do, photo machines you can email pics to friends, create a video, go on a 'brew you' ride. Really good experience and on a rainy december day it was just what we needed!!

Seems like we paid to see a long advert. It wasn't particularly cheap, so I don't know why this is declared "free" in the TripAdvisor introduction. For your money you get a couple of tiny glasses of Heineken, and a ra-ra guide to the place, whooped up by the guides as if the people in the tour were bunch of excitable kids who've rarely been allowed out before.There were plenty of opportunities to spend more money on junk, we were taught how one is supposed to drink a glass of beer (as I said - we were all treated like children!), and shown mockups of the brewing process. It was kind of interesting (as breweries usually are), I'm not saying it was a complete waste of time and money. But it could have been cheaper, a bit more generous with the beer at the end, and a little less patronising. Having a young lady presenting it, 10-20 years younger than the average male there, while treating us all like children was a bit much.
Worth the time. More than a brewery visit with a lot of interation, history and of course beer!!

Lots of fun!. This is not to be missed! For a small fee, you get to tour the Heineken Brewery at your own pace plus they give you beer while teaching you about how it's made! Neat little gadgets and films along with an interactive exhibit that shows you what it feels like to be a bottle of beer! Plus their gift shop is great - get a mug engraved with your name on it!
Heineken Schmeineken!!!. Very friendly team. Informative and interesting.(Beer was also good!)

Superb experience, not only for beer lovers. Great modern museum, extraordinary journey into the world of Heineken Beer. The Heineken Experience is one of the best examples of how the 21st Century museum should look like. Its "user friendly" in every possible way. Attractions varies from advanced multimedia presentations to perceptible exhibition of production process, where they can touch, taste and smell all of the beer ingredients at every stage of brewing Heineken.At the end of the road a pint of freshly brewed beer awaits for the visitors in nice pub connected with memorabilia shop. And last but not least: this venue is MUST SEE for everyone connected with marketing and advertising! This is outstanding piece of brand storyteliing :)

Spent most of the day here, better than I thought it would be. We spent most of the day here and I was surprised at how fun it was. It was interesting to hear how the Heineken beer is made and it is quite an interactive tour. I would recommend it for beer lovers. For those who aren't too fond of beer I'm not sure what you would get out of it since the bonus of this tour is the 3 free beers, but if you were forced by a friend to go along I'm sure you would enjoy it on some level.
Enjoyable. Very good and interesting tour, friendly staff and well worth the money

Just Absolutely fun. It is a bit expensive 15 Euros , but seriously I have never had more fun in a museum before . The experience lasts 1h30 and every bit of it is entertaining and what makes it great is the staff! So passionate about the history and making of Heineken . every part is different making it very interesting especially the last one !!! The Heineken bar is just a pleasure at the end !Overall would recommend it for beer lovers !!!
Nice and fun tour. A bit expensive but worth a couple of hours.Nice multimedia stations that you can create your own images in funny Heineken settings.

The real deal in Amsterdam. This was the funniest experience in Amsterdam. 15 euro and 3 free beers (small) during the visit. Fair enough. It is interesting to see how beer is made and get some of the history of Heineken. You have interactive experiences to do during the tour which make the visit extremely funny and really pleasant. You should go with friends, you probably would enjoy it less alone, but I would still go. This is the place to go if you're in Amsterdam.

The time of my life. Everything was great and at the end you have two free glasses of beer I never had such am experience to visit a beer brewery. Everything is soo well explained and there is a gift shop at the exit:)

It's a cultural visit too. The visit to the Heineken shows again the particular care that this country has for the heritage. A carried out experience with the story of the factory but also many multimedia tools that makes the receipt for a good visit

Well worth a Visit. It was very interesting and explained thoroughly and the smells and the tasting is well worth it! Although I thought it was a little steep in admission charge, but you could spend hours there. The Ride is very amusing!! Shame you couldn't stroke the shire horses though.
Free beer!! Need I say more!. Heineken experience is great the staff are friendly and very enegertic!!! Plus you get free beer that is freshly brewed at the brewery itself! Worthwhile experience!
Well worth the visit. We enjoyed the tour and sampling the product. Nice movie show although tour not a lot different from other brewery tours we have done.

When It's raining.... The Heineken Experience is a nice place to kill 2-2.5 Hours.If your not keen on beer and you dont HAVE to know how it's made - skip it.On the other hand - a quick stop at a coffe shop before entering makes is the Heineken Funny Experience.
excellent. WE really loved our time there, even our 13 month old liked it. you get to drink 3 beers and live the whole process of beer making!!! totally recomend this.

Very fun.... I went with a bunch of friends for the Heineken Experience. It was a fun outing. There were lots to see and do at the brewery. Somewhat educational where all your senses are tickled. Just go with the flow, and be rewarded with ice cold beer at the end of the experience. Bring home a personalized bottle for EUR5.
Amazing. Its all fun. you get 3 free beers :) Great atmosphere and you can go through a your own pace. The 'ride' is fun too.

Bit disappointing.. The "experience" is slick but substance is lacking. I guess there's just not that much to say about Heineken so there's a lot of use of varying media to deliver the same few snippets over and over.

not different from other breweries. It was fun, good (fresh!) beer, lively, lots of people.. but if you already went to a few brewery trips you'll find it similar to any other brewery. I recommend it if yo have some spare time in Ams and never been to a brewery before. Otherwise go and have a beer in a nice pub!

Um, kind of ok, but feel I'm streching to make it to "average" rating.. A bit of a tourist trap, we had Amsterdam cards so didn't have to pay, but expensive I guess, only two and a half GLASSES, not pints even, of mediocre beer, and you learn very little about the brewing. This is the old Heineken brewery, so not brewing going on, just some old equipment with a few descriptions, then yes, like some have said, ALOT of Heineken marketing bs and adds! It is fun to do the music video things that email instantly to whoever you want, they are funny for friends at home! So go if you have a I Amsterdam card purchased, but do not linger, that's my advice.

Worth the money. This experience was lots of fun. There is lots to educate yourself on history and how the beer is made but you also get 2 half pints (0.25cl) beers and possibly more free depending. Cost 16euros pp.

Interesting but nothing special. OK, everyone knows that it´s made for tourists. This cannot be denied. So, don´t complain that it looks a bit fake. But overall I found it a nice experience. People were kind. Beer was plenty. Certainly better place than other pubs/breweries which were highly rated and that I found absoltely terrible. So, worth a visit if you do not expect too muc.

Great Time, Very Interesting. As someone who has traveled to Amsterdam several times and usually sticks to nice restaurants and museums, I was delightfully surprised by the Heineken Experience. This was the funnest, most interactive thing we did while we were in town. This "tour" provides a great history and insight into how the brewery got it start in the 1860s and how the product is made start to finish. I was most impressed with the philanthropy the Heineken family has engaged in since the brewery's inception. They were the first brewery to offer a retirement plan for their employees and when times were tough, they never layed off any emplyee. Instead, they offered early retirement options. The interactive nature of this tour is a great deal of fun and you even get a chance to enjoy the freshest Heineken you will every have in your life. I highly recommend the Heineken Experience.

A great afternoon out!. We stumbled across this by accident buy so glad we did! It cost 14 euros to get in and took us about 90 minutes to get round, and another half hour or so spent in the bar afterwards. There are lots of interactive displays, including making your own videos to send to friends as well as a 4D 'ride' which shows you what it's like to be a bottle of beer!There is a free baggage / coat check facility and several toilets dotted about, so they've really thought of everything here!The best part was the tasting and the tokens for two drinks in the World Bar at the end of the tour. Before I went here I didn't even like beer, but now I will definitely try a Heineken when I'm next out!

Well worth the visit. went here in april 2010, was very interesting to see how they make the beer, wasn't to expensive to go on it either. would make sure to go if ur in amsterdam. samples of heineken you get make it even better :D

It will be what you expect from a PREMIUM beer. It's a little bit of everything, history, informative, entertainment, and a bit of adventure. The best part, having a beer and completing the experience!
Impressive. Very well organised and value for money, really learnt something about brewing lager. I am now a convert to Heineken.

Good example of a brewery tour if you haven't done one before. Most brewery tours are pretty much all the same. The history, the process, what makes the brand so much better than others and then a tasting followed by the shop.Well... you pretty much get all of this, but in a modern set up with a few more interactive areas and some fun touches like photo taking with props that can be emailed to you, a HUGE theatre with video footage and historical events etc.Heineken do this really well so if youhaven't been on one before, this is a good example.Go for it!

Very well done - interesting, informative and a lot of fun!. Yes, it's a big advert for Heineken - but it's what you pretty much expect from the Heineken experience....We had a great time, there are a lot of fun quirky elements to the tour. Rides, a chance to try the ingredients and experiment with the brewing process as well as of course the opportunity to have a drink up to three times and be taught how to pull the perfect pint! Very well done and worth the entry fee.

Worth a trip!. It is a little marketing heavy, but it's all good fun and very well put together.Make the most of the tasting room beers, they had spares and were happy to distribute extras to the group ;)2 additional drinks at the end too, so by the time you take off the cost of the beer it's only 6 or 7 euro for a good hours walk round (in the dry!)

Ice cold beer. What's not to like? The tour was informative enough to be interesting but not boring. It didn't take too long. And at the end, you get to enjoy 2 glasses of cold or super-cold Heineken. Not a bad way to kill a little time.

Worth the Money. For 16 euro this was probably the best tour I took in Amsterdam. I like that you get 2 beers at the end of the tour and a smaller one in the middle of the tour. Watching the process was also fun. The souvenier shop was really reasonable on their prices as well.

Great way to spend an afternoon. If the weather is bad go to the Heineken. This is a really well presented attraction. the young guides who take you through the beer tasting are first class. They interact well with their audience. Very good linguistic skills , entertained everyone from the children to the adults and made it a fun experience. After you gone though the self guided tour of the old brewery you end up in the ultra modern bar where you can spend your beer tokens and spend as long as like over your drinks. as it was pouring with rain outside we spent a good 90 minutes in the bar but were never made to feel we should be moving on. the loud music in the bar may put off some older visitors but we soon got used to it.

Really nice experience. buy online your ticket it's cheaper and you avoid the queue.the experience was funny, first you read all the history of heineken, then the process how it's produce, and you have the 'brew you ride you', it's an interative room were you are the beer and you see the process in direct from the conception to bottle. furthermore, you have the tasting room where they explained which color a beer should have and how to drink it, the better part is at the end with the 2 drinks offers.

Really well presented. An interactive tour of an ex brewery might seem a little weird, but we thoroughly enjoyed a couple of hours here. The whole experience was cleverly thought out and executed, including a lesson in beer-appreciation and a couple of drinks at the end.The only thing we thought odd was that the whole event was in English. I know that it's a tourist thing, but if I were Dutch I would probably feed a little miffed!

The Heineken is the best I have ever tasted. I am a conosouir for fine wines and beer's I tried the amsteil Lite first it was sweeter in amsterdam, than in America... And the Heineken in the stainless steel Bottles kept the beer so cold.. and the tasted like no other beer... I have tasted... I want them to ship that beer to Hallandale Beach Florida...it is the best
It's Heineken man!. Very cool attraction. FYI - they don't allow strollers so leave the small kids at the hotel unless you plan on carrying them for an hour!
Must. If you like beer be sure to go! The tour is quite interesting and you get to learn quite a lot about beer brewery and how Heineken became so popular worldwide.

Definately worth every penny!!. Considering the cost of a pint of beer anywhere in Amsterdam, the admission entry paid for the beer in itself, possibly more!Myself and my partner truly enjoyed this attraction and would recommend it to anyone whether you have an interest in beer, breweries in general, or just for something a bit different from the normal, sometimes drab, museums!You are free to wander at your own pace, it has photo stops, displays very pleasing to the eye, and my favourite part - a lively "club" area with music and a chance to mingle with others.The gift shop was reasonable too!!I would allow yourself 2 hours for this experience - well worth it!!

Camp!!. Going in November has distinct advantages, no lines and no crowds inside. It was lots of fun being processed like a bottle of beer,learning how the beer is made, and tasting the beer. But the best part was learning how to pour the perfect glass of heineken

Must do if you like Heineken Beer. Great place ! Cool place and good information about All aspects of Heineken, Interactive experience, Awesome staff, couple beers included. Can't ask for more, very satisfied!

Cool place for beer lovers.. I have visited Heineken experience last weekend with my friends and everyone enjoyed a lot. It is a nice display of company history and the processes that take place to deliver one of the best known beers in the world. We have really enjoyed the brewing facilities with its original copper tanks and the opportunity to taste malted barley. That part of the tour is pretty cool.Rest of the tour is pretty average, lounge with what appears to be a Heineken commercials and some kind of interactive UN-entertaining lounge chairs. Beer tasting takes place later and I have to say that the performance of the instructors varies greatly and is quite inconsistent.(I have visited Heineken experience in the past)Every visitor gets 2 beers at the end of the tour, could be more if you ask me. The reason I am giving this excursion only 3 out of 5 is the bar area at the end of the tour. I was under impression that the quality of the beer is correlated to the cleanliness of the area it is served in and that bar was a disaster. Beer everywhere from the bottom to the bar counter. We have picked one of the later times to visit and the bar was in terrible condition. You can literally stick to the floor and I would not recommend leaning on any surface in the bar. Is it too much trouble to mop the floor and wipe the counters couple of times a day? Last part of the tour is the gift shop where the prices are pretty steep. I couldn't quite understand how can they charge so much for souvenirs with Heineken logo on it and items they usually just give away , when they should be the ones paying the customers to advertize their products. Overall interesting, a bit overpriced entrance (15 EUR online, 16 EUR cash) and very expensive gift shop.

Good fun. Did you know that the 'e's in Heineken brand name are actually smiling?! I learnt this and the reason I didn't like beer was that I had been tasting it all wrong for all these years! There is plenty to do here and really something for everyone. You see the horses (albeit through glass) , you have a little 4D how beer is made 'ride'. You can send and e-card, you can make a personalised label for a bottle, make a t-shirt, make a video etc etc. You get a small glass of Heineken to 'learn' how to taste plus 2 free at the end of the tour. You do come out feeling happy and a greater appreciation of Heineken

Always visit the Heineken experience when visiting Holland. If you love beer, it's the place to visit. I have been there at least 3 times and never got bored. The whole visit is really interesting and shows you all the different process. At the end of the visit you get a couple of cold freshly brewed beers.

Great experience. No need to buy your tickets for this attraction online. Just pay when you arrive, it seems to be much cheaper that way. The tour guides you a fast 10-15minute tour of the brewery, and then takes you to a huge room filled with tables. Everyone sits and they begin bringing you beer, cheese, crackers, and other snacks. They continue to feed you as much beer as you can drink for 1-1.5 hours. Great experience in Amsterdam and a nice way to start off your day before hitting up the Rembrandt House, Van Gogh Museum and Vondel Park.
Heineken experience. Well worth a visit. Great value for a great experience
Nice enough. Your basic turist attraction. I recommend the pub to the left from the main doors. good place to go after your two complimentary Heinekens.

The Best Commercial in Town. My wife wife and I were the oldest people in this place. It was mostly twenty somethings, but we had a good time. It is really an expensive beer commercial, but it is so well done I felt it was money well spent. Plus the explanations and exhibits, tastings and historical significance were very interesting. Plus you leave there really liking Heineken Beer.
Very well organised and interesting. plenty of alcohol throughout presentation and very interesting, great gift shop and we had very pleasant few hours here
Very good Museum. With you like beer, you need to know this place!Great experience and, in the end, drink a cold beer!

Cheaper to buy a few Heineken in the local pub. We went on a Saturday afternoon. There were 6 of us. The "brewery" history and info about Heineken was interesting but there were so many people around that we couldn't see many of the displays. As a result we hurried throu to get our "free" beer. We had a 45 minute wait for the main"attraction" which was a 4D movie about being a bottle of beer. I don't think even a 10 year old would have thought it was funny! When we got to the tasting area we were given a beer but ordered not to drink it until we were taught how to taste beer. The whole experience was a disappointment. Although we did get 2 glasses of very nice beer at the end.

Woohooo you actually learn here!!!. Great location, so much fun!! You actually learn how beer is made and the orgin of Heineken. The rooms within the bldg are great each room had something to offer its visitors. At the end of the visit you get two beers!!! woohooo

heineken experience. Had a great couple of hours learning how the lager is made and got to personalise a label on bottle of beer which was nice as it was my husbands 50th when we visited so its a nice keepsake,also got extra free beer for his birthday. Staff are really friendly. Please leave your coats in the cloak room at the start as it is very warm. All in all a good visit
lol cheap beer. you can "borrow: a green band from a person leaving the tour and save the 16e entry fee. So for that reason its great value.
Even if you don't drink, you should go. - Excellent combination of many different interactive experiences (taste, smell, sound, ...)
Our Hiney Experience. It was interesting and the beer was right on time.

good fun, little overpriced. If you love beer and want to know how its made come here, they have a great history, coming from the home of brewing, I already knew how it was made however it did not stop me wanting to visit. It shocks me who fast the beer is actually pumped out of the taps, couple of free beers, and basically one big advert for heineken€16 was a little steep for me but still had fun

Amazing EXPERIENCE. Loved it! They couldn't have set a better name for it: experience. At first it might seem a little slow (although still interesting), explaining the Heineken history and the brand evolution over time. You get to try or smell a few beer ingredients, you get to help the brewer, and so on. There's a very cool simulator called "Brew you ride: be the beer", there's an area to take funny heineken-related pictures (and even email them to your friends for free), there are a few lounges/chill-out areas... and in the very end, there's a bar where you get your 2nd and 3rd beer (or even soda, if you're not a beer fan).Allow 1.5 hours or even 2, to fully enjoy the "experience" without any rush.

Must see for beer Lovers... The tour is well managed, gives you a good overview and history of Heineken journey from the roots. The best part is ice cold beer which is available at the end. Its the best beer I have had!!!

A Fun Time. I was disappointed this was not a working brewery (I've been to Coors in Denver) but the overall experience was worth it. Good history of the brewery and the history of Heineken. Of course the beer at the end of the tour was also good. A little pricey, but I thought it was still worth it. Good for a rainy day, kids or when you just want something more interactive than a museum.

Get ready for a history lesson.. Although some of it is a little corny, the old brewery area was really cool. I would suggest getting a ticket ahead of time to avoid a cue, if the line is long and you haven't got a ticket. If you plan on taking a Canal tour, there is a place right across the street that will sell you both tickets together and you even get a small discount, you can take the canal tour first or Heineken Experience first.

A great experience. Insightful and very different to any tour I've ever taken before. Enjoyed the "Brew you" simulator, though the queue for that part of the attraction was frustrating as there was nothing else to see or do while waiting for your turn.

Very good. well worth a visit. The heineken experience is excellent and well worth the visit. I wanted to see this as i drink heineken all the time so i was always going to like it from that point of view but my girlfriend doesnt drink beer and she thought it was great aswell. They really get you involved on your visit and it was cool to see how its made and its involvement around the world. The 4d was funny and the taste of the beer in its home brewery is so good. We really enjoyed it.

FUN!. This experience was all about fun! Loved it, but would recommend that people buy their tickets online to avoid standing at the queue. They have a free cloakroom where you can leave your coats and belongings. It starts with some insights about the history of Heineken and how it all started, with showing us a little bit of old things like logos, pictures and letters. Then, you are shown the old factory, informed about the ingredients of the beer, and a detailed view of how it is produced. There is also a 4D movie included where you can feel like you are actually brewed and bottled like a beer bottle. There is a service where you can get a custom-made beer bottle with your name engraved on it, for only 5 euros. The ticket also includes two drinks, excluding the one given to you for the tasting part! It was a very fun experience.

Enterteining plan for a Sunday evening. The tram stopped very close to the Heineken experience. We were doubting between the Van Gogh Museum and the Heineken stuff. We didn't want to do something too "serious" so we went to for the second option. The Heineken experience itself was quite dissapointing. It's not bad but it's very similar to a huge marketing ad. It is only about a scene, but you don't see the beer making process in life. The tour was only oriented to sell the "Heineken" brand and to make you wish drinking a Heineken. So we could only think in having it finished as soon as possible and go for our Heinekens, which is quite stupid because you can get them much cheaper in any bar of the city.All in all, good if you don't have anything better to do.
Not Bad. Our 11 year old son enjoyed this tour - as there was alot of interactive things to do through this tour - was interesting and enjoyed sampling the beer at the end

Entertaining tour. The Heineken Experience was an entertaining tour that ended with sampling of Heineken. As far as brewery tours go though, I prefer ones that are more personal, informative and provide you with a choice of beers to sample. This tour relies more on various gimmicks and interactive exhibits. It's entertaining, don't get me wrong, but don't expect to learn a lot or have the opportunity to ask questions.

Pretty good museum. On entering the museum, the starting point takes you into an old style fake bar with a recorded film of a barman telling you how Heineken came about. It's done in an interesting and different way. You also go through the old brewery section & can taste some wart (unfermented beer). There are other things you'll see but I won't talk about those. Good trip for a museum. Much more interesting than the Van Gogh I thought.

If you like beer, brands and brainwashing, this is the museum for you!. The Heineken Experience is a one-of-a-kind tour through the history, values and ingredients that make up the Heineken Beer Brand. The tour was quick and the tasting was interesting, after that the interactive brand experience rooms were a little imposed I felt. But we enjoyed them nonetheless. You get three beers in total, one at the tasting and two at the end of your tour, so you're nice and ready to go shopping at the gift shop! It's a must-do in Amsterdam.
A good rainy day attraction. Check the opening times as it doesn't open very early. Buy tickets on line to avoid the queue. Allow a good couple of hours to look around.

Worth a visit when in Amsterdam. The Heineken Experience was an interesting and interactive way of learning a bit more about the Heineken Brewery and the history of Heineken. Whilst it was very busy when we were there we only had to wait for the 4D ride - and this was only about 10 minutes. The tasting session was interesting and obviously the 2 free drinks at the Heineken Bar at the end were a bonus! Definately worth a visit if you like Heineken, good value for money and there is a free cloakroom so you don't have to carry bags around with you.

A lot for a free beer. This is one of those things you think you HAVE to do. I won't say don't go but don't set your expectations too high. Except for a rock and rolling "ride" through the brewing process there is not much to recommend this attraction. There are lots of sights in Amsterdam that are a better use of your time.BUT, the beer IS good.
if u like beer u will love it, if u dont u wont.. very interactive, lots too see and do. lots of smels and even a 4d experience involved in the tour.
loved it. It was more then i expected! i made my own beer bottle got to taste beer and even got to learn how to pour it properly out of the tap. One of the best tours I've ever done.

Heineken Museum. We went on my partner's 50th Birthday and it was a brilliant trip. Very interesting and we loved the various interactive displays. The staff were well informed and friendly. The ticket price includes 2 glasses of Heineken in the lovely "World Bar" at the end of the self lead tour.
Fantastic experience. Very recommended , 15 min from centre via tram, at the end you will get 2 just made heineken

Cheesy but fun.. I finally visited the Heineken Experience after at least 20 trips to Amsterdam. Having read several reviews I knew not to expect a serious brewery visit. If you approach the experience as a fun, touristy lark you can have a great time. If you are visiting Amsterdam for your first time and are limited in time, postpone the visit until a future visit.
Well worth it!. Heineken sure knows how to do cool. Very well informed and polite staff.

I really enjoyed this. As an avid beer drinker and somewhat of a self proclaimed 'connoisseur' (ha ha), I found this a really enjoyable trip. I thought the whole process was explained very well and I particularly enjoyed the advertising and media centre. Its a huge premises and takes a while to get around. It is well worth it though.
Fun for Beer Lovers. Went in October of 2011. Price was great and included two beers & a fun tour. Remember to save the coupon given to you when you arrive as it can be used in the gift shop.

education, beer and fun. The Heineken experience takes you on a trip through the entire history of Heineken and brewing beer. Lots of variety in interaction within games, videos, advertisements, short workshops which teach you how to know it is a good beer, information about the history of Heineken and lots of interesting stuff. We went with school and unfortunately we didn't had enough time to see everything. Though we had a great trip and really enjoyed it. I advice everyone to visit when in Amsterdam, it's definitely worth it.
3 interesting hours. Lots to do, you could tell that they have spent a lot of money on it and put a lot into the experience.
Fantastic. Really great day out and good valueStaff brilliant (Storm)

Great experience. get to learn about the history of heineken whilst trying a few samples at the same time. Got a couple of good areas like the champions league bit as they have some memorabelia as well as the section where you get to see all the old adverts. The shop was expectedly expensive which was disappointed but for 15 euros and compared to a lot of other tourist attractions in amsterdam that are expensive. This is one of the better ones that offer value for money. make sure you claim the free gift from the heineken shop (which is at a separate location from this)

Not too much about the brewing process. I love Heineken beer and i didn't want to miss this one. It lacks some more demonstrations about the brewing process which is what i wanted to see. Anyway it is a must in Amsterdam and i'd recommend it to everyone.
interactive fun!. I am not a fan of beer and even I enjoyed myself! fun, informative and great value for the money. Had a really great time 4d experience was the best part!

So much fun!. My boyfriend and I had such a great time at the Heineken Experience. You get the history of the brewery and samples at the end in the world bar they've created. You can take photos and make videos to send to friends and family back home (I may have made a whole bunch of them). They also have a little video that teaches visitors more about beer and has a moving floor, bubbles and sprays you with water. It's just a really good time. You gotta go!
Great!. Really great visitor centre - nice drink at the end!

Full entertainment for beer lovers. The old brewery was transformed not exactly in a museum, but a place to have fun while discovering the history of Heineken. The building itself is nice and more so the section where the beer was brewed years ago. There's lot of entertainment as an 'experience' that makes you feel like a beer being brewed, and a DJ game. Not a place to really know about beer, but to have fun and a drink in the end.

your average touristy beer tour. it was your average touristy beer tour, much like guinness in dublin...it did have a few more cheesy pictures to take, which I liked, and they were able to give me a soda at the end of the tour instead of a beer.

My favorite thing in Amsterdam!. We had a wonderful time, they supply you with lots of free drinks on your way though and lots of historically interesting stuff to see and do as well. We loved it, don't miss this place!
A beer lovers dream come true!. Two free drinks (0.25l) at the end of the tour which was an experience! Commercial but very informative.
One of the best brewery tours. We've done the Carlsberg and Guiness tours as well as several other small breweries and this was probably my favourite. It is quite pricey but worth doing.
Fabulous Experience. A great Experience. Excellent value for money. We had a great time. Staff really friendly. Would highly recommend.
Best beer tour i have ever been on. If you like beer go on this tour. It had some really great features and activities. Tons of fun.

A well thought through experience.. Didn't think this museum would be for me because my visit was about art galleries, but it is such an informative and well planned experience which you can do at your own pace.Enjoyed every minute and felt that it was good value for money
Fun!. You learn a lot and they give you a lot of cool things! A must!!!

Great Entertainment, Still boring bier. A lot of fun to go through and enjoy everything but this experience is geared more towards 21-25 range. Lots of party atmosphere but still fun to experience. You get 2 free pints at the end. It tastes better here then in the States.

Better than the Guiness Factory (Dublin). Go!. It is not the cheapest thin to do, but it is probably just about worth it. You get a quarter pint to test, and a free drink at the end in a cool bar.You can learn as much as you want, or just wonder around and take some cool pictures. They have some great photo oppurtunities. There is a cool gift shop, and you can make your own Heineken bottle with your name on.There is also a cool video/simulation tour of how it is made, which is fun.

Best experience ever!. My friends and I went to the Heineken Experience and weren't too sure what to expect but we had an amazing time! The best thing about Amsterdam by far!The staff are so friendly and the tour is so interesting and interactive, from trying barley to table football and watching Champions League football, it was awesome!Definitely recommend it!

Better Than Expected. I thought this (expensive) tour would be like most other brewery tours but was pleasantly surprised to find an extensive, detailed, live and multimedia driven event. Yes, at the beginning there is a lot of history of the family including short movies, posters, pictures, etc. After that first section, though, it gets moving. Here are the main things I enjoyed:-handle barley and hops and learn about their secret yeast-explore the copper boilers, vats, etc. and taste some warm wort-talk to employees live about the exact beer making process-fun simulator about how beer is made-learn a bit of chemistry about beer making through history-official tasting with a person who explained how to pour beer, make the head, etc. -bar at end where you can either experiment pouring your own the right way (one beer) or just order up beer to drink (two beers)-make you own bottle machine where you get a real, full beer bottle with your name on the labelExpensive tour but well worth about 2.5 hours visit.
Very well done. Good tour of the old in town brewery. Well worth the price since you get about 2.5 beers and a well done tour of the historic Brewery.Tour is done in English only.
Great place to buy souvenirs. And also, have some beer. Make your own personalized bottle of Heineken.

Really Enjoyed it. Even though I don't drink beer , I loved the Heineken Experience. A great mixture of facts and fun. I even got to pull a glass of draught Heineken which my husband assures me was perfect :-)Well worth a visit.

Unless you love Heineken. Unless you love Heineken, I recommend coming here. I was never a big fan, but I thought I'd try it out to see if it tastes better from the original tap. Length of time is about a 2 hour self paced tour. Then they offer 2.5 classes of tasting. The total tour cost about 13 euros per person.

An advertising masterclass!. Well, I can see were the €16 entry cost goes...this is an all singing all dancing super glossy Heineken advert. But I've no real idea how the beer is made, but I know how to pour a beer and why the dutch leave a large head on top. You do briefly see hops, but overall it's based on the look of the museum rather than how the beer is made. The moving room that makes you feel like a beer bottle was an expensive gimmick. Overall i'd say save your €16 and buy 4 pints of the beer.

Neat, but not worth the cost. I would give the Heineken Experience a 4 or 5 but for the cost - 15 euros (almost $21!) was way, way too much for what amounts to an hour of advertising. There were a couple neat things, so if cost doesn't matter then I recommend it, but it wasn't as exciting as the cost would belie. And don't let the two free beers fool you into thinking it's not that expensive - they were less than a pint each.
First time visiting a brewery & loved it!. A great way to spend a few hours. Interesting to see exactly what goes into making beer and the 'proper' way to drink it.

Nothing to write home about. This was one of those optional things to do while in Amsterdam. The entrance fee includes 2 beers at the end of the tour. The whole tour was pretty mediocre, mostly a lot of reading about the history of the facility. The original brewery machines were cool and there were some horses, but otherwise, meh.
If you have time to kill. Frankly, there are other things to do in Amsterdam
a fun time. This was a fun way to spend a few hours. We enjoyed it more than we thought we would.
If you like beer..touristic stuff. They will show you how beer is made, there is a ride, and you will dring three glasses of beer.
MMmmmm beer. Great to see the way the beer was proccesed and made, plus the free beers at the end were great

Cool visit - good experience. How can you not visit the main beer company in Holland !!!!
Fun and interactive, beer tasting, good historical perspective and excellent staff.
Enjoy !

Rip Off !. A very expensive self-promoting experience. It was very boring, we thought we would see some actual production of the beer, but it was just static displays, all beautifully presented of course and with information displays, but it dragged you round and padded it all out. The 4 D theatre provided a bit of fun, but it was very expensive fun. So you got a small glass of free beer at the end, but it was very poor value for 17 euros each. We went to other much better attractions and museums for far less money. Don't be lured in. In fact we were so cross with ourselves for wasting all that money when we came out, that it has put us off Heineken.

Not worth it, not even close, especially bad for students. Went there, and at the end, felt totally ripped off. The price is $23.00, and for that you basically get two beers and watch ads for Heineken. The day we went they had trouble with one of the exhibits which meant that everyone waited in line for 1 hour with no air conditioner. People asked for their money back as they wanted to leave, but the manager on duty (an idiot with a waxed mustache) ended up making a bad situation worse, people were yelling, it was embarrassingly bad. A special warning to students given the price/value, spend your money on anything else. If you want to mwatch an ad for 45 minutes then be sold 2 beers for $23 to say you've been there, go ahead....but it's the least cool thing you'll do in Amsterdam

Interesting and fun. Interesting finding out the history for this famous product. Some parts of the tour are not very well organised, for example we arrived in the room where they tell you about the brewing process just as the guy finished, everyone moved on and we were left there wondering waht happens next. The "Brew You Ride" is laughable, and not in a good way. Overall expensive for what it was, even with 2 free beers at the end.

Lots of fun!. We visited on a Thursday afternoon and it was packed! We waited until the crowds cleared to start our tour so that it would be more enjoyable. There are lots of interactive exhibits and everything, I mean EVERYTHING, is in English. Two drinks are included at the end of the tour. Worth the visit.
A fun experience!. This was a fun place to visit. Very interactive witch made it more interesting. Many fun things to see and do. Well worth trying!

Great Place. Must've visited this place 5 times over the years and tehy keep changing it to make it interesting. Even with kids aged 9 and 11 it's still a very worthwhile visit. Younger kids are free too so that helps.Easy to spend two to three hours there, with beers included in the ticket price.Some not quite so interesting bits about the history of the company, but the beer making sections and interactive stuff is excellent. Maybe sometime I'll make it back for a 6th visit!

One of the best experiences in Amterdam if you in a group!. We were traveling in a tour group throughout Europe, and the Heineken Experience was not included on the tour, so we decided to go by ourselves during the free afternoon we had. It happened that 16 other people from the tour decided to join us and we went there in a big group of 20 people.It's a great experience, they fully explain you the whole process of beer making, the history and funny facts behind Heineken, and they have lots of interactive things to keep you entertained for hours if you like. You get to sample the beer firs on a room (small glasses) where the beer properties are explained, but at the end you get to a very big area that is set up like a nightclub where you can exchange two pins that are given with your access wristband. Visiting with 20 people were we all are friends, makes this a really fun experience. There is a music, lots of beer and a very fun atmosphere.It's something not to miss while in Amsterdam.

Good to see, but if you dont like beer, the free beer is a bit of a waste!. Was fun to go throught and see the process, the bars and areas to relax in were the best. At the end you get free beer at the bar. If you wait around long enought people will give you their extra token for free beer, so if you have time and like beer, stay and drink all afternoon!
GO. I went because my son wanted to go and thought it was going to be a ripped off, but SURPRISE I wasn't! It was fun and I don't even like beer!

HEINEKEN BEER. Last year I was in Holland for buisness trip and the company who invites me took me to the Heineken beer factory. Also its a museum. I think that they paid 15€ foe each and inside in the end of the tour you can drink 2 free beer. It was my first experince in beer factory and I took a great pleasure and learned how they make the beer. Also All of the information was well-presented and very interesting.We were surprised when we were bottled in the factory...Now I have 2 bottles with my name EROL.If you go to Holland dont forget to visit 3 places.First go to red light street.2 go to Heneken beer and take the tour about 2 hours Im sure you will thank me.And finally go the Madamme Tusseaud museum

Fun,Informative - and includes drinks!!. First - get one of the free City maps/guides - one is sure to have a 4 euro Discount Voucher in it. This will bring the entry charge down to 12 euro!! For this you will get, a 4D experience of being brewed and bottled, educated into how Heineken is made, plenty of interactive experiences and - 3 glasses of the golden liquid itself, oh and a cute Heineken wrist band.Although it is one of the major visitor destinations, there were 4 coaches outside when we arrived, it did not seem crowded. Ans, as the last 2 drinks are in the bar you can have non alcoholic drinks so even kids can enjoy.

A fun but informative experience. We visited the Heineken Experience on a Sunday morning. We found a discount card in our hotel's 'tourist information' area, giving us a 5% discount. I loved the old brewery with its huge shiny coppers, and the stained glass windows and other old artefacts, as well as the stables with the horses and horse drawn drays, which still get used (mainly for adveritising). The brewing process and history of Heineken were explained in a very informative way. There was no pretence that the beer is brewed in the same way today - the girl who told us about the ingredients used and the brewing process was quite clear in telling us it was now made at a large factory outside of Amsterdam.One great advantage was the fact that it was 'self-guided', which meant you could spend as long as you liked looking at things, or just walk past those that didn't really interest you - in our case the 'music video'. We did send an e-mail home though, which was free to do. I'm not sure which 20+ video one poster didn't like - I don't recall anything that was compulsory viewingBrewery tours usually involve you having to follow someone around and listen to their explanations, here you could read and take it in at your own pace. (Information is in English).The fact that you get 3 beers (one during the tour, when you get to look at the beer for colour etc, and 2 in the bar at the end) make it worthwhile - if you like beer of course. There are soft drinks available for those who don't drink or those under 18.Yes, there is a shop at the end of the tour, but every museum and 'tourist attraction' has a shop, why would this one be any different? You don't have to buy anything, just walk straight through!!One reviewer commented on the distance from other 'attractions' in Amsterdam. The simple answer is - get a one day tram card, or longer! There is far more to Amsterdam than Rijksmuseum etc, but thats for another posting I think!

Don't waste your time. We were visiting Amsterdam for 2 days and love brewery tours. We have been on many throughout the states and through Europe. A friend recommended this tour but unfortunately we cannot say the same. It was so very, very disappointing. While we thought going to the actual premises would bring us a thoughtful, historical tour, instead it was a self guided marketing failure. You wales through rooms where you you could make Heineken music videos or DJ. It was very long and you are forced to sit through a terrible 20+ minute video. Then, when you get to the tasting room, you feel like you were walking in a night club with very loud and obnoxious music. Yet, this was not the worst part-the worst part was being harassed by two marketing people from Heineken. They plead with you to take their questionnaire, indicating it will only take a couple of moments. This is a lie-they took my husband away for 35 minutes into a back room while they made me wait alone in the "night club". It was terrible-do not do this!!!! Overall, I would not recommend this tour to anyone that is serious about beer. Terrible!!
Fantastic. It was one of the most enjoyable attractions so far. It's fun and educational. I recommend it if like to drink beer.

Fun and relaxed. This is the best beer tour I've done. They keep the explanations pretty straight forward (they know you're just there for the beer) and there's a cute little movie - where I enjoyed pointing out that bike accidents were so common in Amsterdam that they even made the tour video! You get a few beers and then it's time to move on to dinner and a proper pub.

Pure Marketing Hype. I had really hoped this would be a big budget brewery experience akin to Dublin's Guinness Storehouse. The reality is that it is a relentless marketing push, for which you pay a premium price.The "experience" starts off with a brief history of the Heineken brewery, family and beer. You then go on to learn a bit about the production of the beer, before getting the chance to wander through the former brewhouse. After this, there is a "4D" experience giving the visitor a chance to be "brewed" before you head on to various opportunities to design bottles, t-shirts etc at an extra charge. The tour ends with a couple of cold Heinekens at the nightclub-esque bar.The positives: The staff are EXCELLENT. The people you interact with for the tasting, taking you through the brewing process do a truly fantastic job. They were enthusiastic, genuine and really added a lot to the experience. The tasting session was good fun and of course, the beers at the end were much appreciated!The negatives: The marketing is relentless. The whole thing feels so much like an advert, it's hard to take in anything without a pinch of salt. The final part of the "experience" is purely about selling extras, which after having spent a fair bit of cash to get in, wasn't particularly welcome. If you're a beer afficionado already, this place won't teach you anything new.All in all, it was a reasonable way to spend an hour or so, but didn't really justify the cost. Although the staff were excellent, the detail of the exhibits wasn't really enough to occupy someone who already has a good knowledge of beer and brewing.

Heineken what a great place. We visited Heineken as part of our get to know Amsterdam experience.We were not dissapointedRight from the time we entered we were entertained and informed by a very good presentation and hands on history of Heineken made even better by the great tasting beer.The beer tasting was in a very relaxing nicely presented bar with lots of oppurtunities for interaction with the displays.Then there was the souviner shop, I had a bit of a spendup on a large variety of items enough to suit everyones budget.Just a word of warning you can buy a Heineken bottle of beer with your name engrved on the bottle,Make sure you put this in your checked in luggage when travelling or it will be taken off you as you board the aeroplane, we were luckey we were able to check ours in after having it picked up on the xray.Would I reccommend Heineken to others yes it is possibly the best of the brewery tours we have done throughout the world

Not as interesting/good as hoped.. Not as good as hoped.Quite poor value for money.Nicely laid out but comparing to somewhere like the Guiness Store house in dublin, its quite poor.The 2 beers at the end were the best part (if you can be bothered to queue).

More than you expect. I strongly recommend the heineken experience. For what its about it certainly is much more than i expected. After walking through a small hisotoricaln exhibition which are placed under the old silos, you come to the old brewing mill, you then try an early product of the beer before hops and alcohol are added. You then pass the traditional and still in use horse stables, and later go on a simulator ride before trying some freshly brewed beer. After this you take a look into the commercial and sporting sections.which are kitted out like a trendy nightclub, theres plenty to do, make music videos, play dj hero, and table football. It also has.a very large sports display. Finally you are entitled to two beers in the bar at the end. It was a fantastic exprerience, and we even had a non drinker with is who really enjoyed it.

Awesome experience for anyone over 18!!!. I don't even drink beer and I really enjoyed this! I went with a good friend and we had the City Card and got a 25% discount to enter but it would have been worth it at full price. You learn the history of Heineken as well as some interesting things about the company present day. You learn about the brewing process and what makes Heineken unique and they also go over some of the things about pouring a beer properly, specifically of course, Heineken. There are some other fun things inside where you can take photos or send friends a video, you get two free beers (and another small one when you learn about pouring) with entry. You can personalize a bottle for a very cheap price as well. Totally awesome and will do again without a doubt the next time I am there!!!

boring and a waste of money. the best part is the 4d theatre and the beer. i read somewhere that this was supposed to be disneyland for adults. NOPE! it was very boring and so far from all the other attractions besides the rijksmuseum and the van gogh which were still a distance away. also when we went they forgot to give us the bracelet that gives everyone free beers at the end. when, at the end, we asked for them they gave us dirty looks like we were trying to steal from them. i wouldnt go again... go to a pub and have a heineken on tap its way better and you dont have to walk.

If it's raining..... If it's raining outside and you have seen absolutely everything else, then it's probably worth a visit. It's pretty commercial and a very clever marketing hype - and you can pay to extend their branding if you wish. The staff are friendly and well trained, but for a fraction of the cost you could enjoy 2 bottles of cold Heineken overlooking a better view of Amsterdam.

Enjoyed the experience and enjoyed the beer even more!. The Heineken Experience is a fun way to spend 1 - 2 hours in the outskirts of the city. It was very quick to get tickets which was good although they did charge 1 euro extra per ticket (which is understandable).There is a lot of history about the beer and how its made (obviously) but its worthwhile visiting. I took a few good photos and we all enjoyed ourselves. 1 thing that annoyed me was the fact that a few of the interactive parts of the tour were not working. There was an area that people could rest on a recliner and look up at a tv screen directly above them but they were all switched off.Overall its worth visiting and I think the team members worked brilliantly with the people.I would recommend it to anyone as a must do when visiting Amsterdam.

A great tour, educational, with beer as fresh as it can be. We visited the Heineken Experience and found it to be an excellent journey of how this excellent beer is made. I found out that all Heineken beer imported into the US is made in Amsterdam. Heineken beer is made in several other countries but the raw ingredients are shipped from Amsterdam to insure consistency no matter where you drink Heineken. The tour was self guided and included a tasting at the end. Very enjoyable and the right length.

Great fun, great value, freshest beer I've tasted...a must!.
